name: Justina Carson
polish: Kiedyś spotkania w firmie się ciągnęły, ale znaleźliśmy na to rozwiązanie.
english: Meetings in our company used to drag on, but we found a solution to that.
glossary: to drag on/a meeting/in our company/a solution to sth
translation: 1. Once meetings in the company were time consuming but we found the solution.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Jeśli wciśniesz mnie w swój grafik w tym tygodniu, zapłacę ci więcej.
english: If you fit me in to your schedule this week, I'll pay you more.
glossary: to fit sb in to the schedule/to pay sb
translation: 2. If you squeeze me into your schedule this week I will pay you more.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Kiedy wszedłem do biura, koleżanka wystawiała faktury.
english: When I entered the office, my colleague was making out invoices.
glossary: to make out an invoice/to enter the office
translation: 3. When I entered the office my friend was preparing the invoice.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Kogo jutro zastępujesz?
english: Who are you covering for tomorrow?
glossary: to cover for sb
translation: 4. Whom you are replacing tomorrow?

name: Justina Carson
polish: Na twoim miejscu podjąłbym się tego zadania.
english: If I were you, I would take on the task.
glossary: to take on a task
translation: 5. If I were you I would make a different decision.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Ta historia jest zmyślona.
english: The story's made up.
glossary: to make up a story
translation: 6. This story is make up.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Zostałem zwolniony po tym, jak wybuchła pandemia.
english: I was laid off after the pandemic had broken out.
glossary: to break out/to be laid off
translation: 7. I was fired after ourbreak of pandemic.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Nie powinienem był zalegać z rachunkami. Przepraszam.
english: I shouldn't have fallen behind with the bills. I'm sorry
glossary: to fall behind with the bills
translation: 8. I shouldn’t arrears with bills. I’m sorry.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Już się rozgrzałem. Możemy iść biegać.
english: I've already warmed up. We can go running.
glossary: to warm up/to go running
translation: 9. I’ve just warmed up. We can go to run.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Damy ci znać, jak już wyśledzimy złodzieja.
english: I'll let you know once we track down the thief.
glossary: to track down a thief/to let sb down
translation: 10. We will let you know once we track down the thief

name: Justina Carson
polish: Gdybyś nie poruszył tematu, szef nie zauważyłby, że jest problem.
english: If you hadn't brought up the subject, the boss wouldn't notice that there was a problem.
glossary: to bring up a subject/to notice that.../a problem
translation: 1. If you didn't broach the subject, the boss wouldn’t notice there is a problem.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Dlaczego schrzaniłeś to zadanie?
english: Why did you screw up the task?
glossary: to screw up a task
translation: 2. Why you screwed up this task?

name: Justina Carson
polish: Szefowa powiedziała, że przejmę ważny projekt.
english: The boss told me I'd take on an important project.
glossary: to take on a project
translation: 3. The boss told me I would take over the important project.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Zbyt długo rozważam opcje. Czas działać.
english: I've been weighing up the options for too long. It's time to act.
glossary: to weigh up the options/to act
translation: 4. Too long I’ve considered options. Time to act.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Klient twierdził, że product nie spełnia jego oczekiwań.
english: The client claimed the product didn't live up to his expectations.
glossary: to live up to sb's expectations/a client/a product
translation: 5. Customer said that the product doesn’t meet his expectations.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Czy zawsze zapinasz pasy, kiedy prowadzisz?
english: Do you always fasten up when driving?
glossary: to fasten up/to drive
translation: 6. Do you always strap in when you drive a car?

name: Justina Carson
polish: Zakończyłeś już spotkanie?
english: Have you wrapped up the meeting yet?
glossary: to wrap up a meeting
translation: 7. Have you finished your meeting yet.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Chcesz, żebym przejrzał te dokumenty?
english: Do you want me to go through the documents?
glossary: to go through documents
translation: 8. Do you want me to run through documents

name: Justina Carson
polish: Profesor pytał się mnie kilka dni temu, dlaczego jeszcze nie wykonałem tych badań.
english: The professor asked me a few days ago why I hadn't carried out the research yet.
glossary: to carry out research
translation: 9. Few days ego the professor asked me why I haven’t done the research yet.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Szybko przyzwyczaiłam się do krycia brata.
english: I quickly got used to covering for my brother.
glossary: to cover up for sb/to get used to doing sth
translation: 10. I quickly got used to cover for my brother.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Jutro jem obiad z moim szefem.
english: I'm having lunch with my boss tomorrow.
glossary: to have lunch with sb/a boss
translation: 1. I’m having lunch with my boss tomorrow.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Moi rodzice nie mieliby nic przeciwko naszemu związkowi, gdybyś miał stały dochód.
english: My parents wouldn't have anything against our relationship if you had a steady income.
glossary: to have a steady income/to have nothing against sth/a parent/a relationship
translation: 2. My parents wouldn’t mind our relationship if you had steady income.

name: Martin Hale
polish: O czym rozmawialiście, kiedy byłam w łazience?
english: What did you talk about when I was in the bathroom?
glossary: to talk about sth/in the bathroom
translation: 3. What were you talking about when I was in the bathroom?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Mam nadzieję, że zdążę na pociąg. To ostatni.
english: I hope I'll catch the train. It's the last one.
glossary: to catch the train/to catch the last train
translation: 4. I hope that I’ll catch a train. It’s the last one.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Jestem podekscytowana, bo jutro widzę się ze starą znajomą.
english: I'm excited because I'm seeing an old friend of mine tomorrow.
glossary: to see sb/to be excited
translation: 5. I’m excited because I’m seeing my old friend tomorrow.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Możemy porozmawiać, bo nie ma tu nikogo.
english: We can talk because there's nobody here.
glossary: to talk about sth
translation: 6. We can talk because no one is here.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Wczoraj marzyłam tylko o zrobieniu sobie drzemki.
english: I only dreamed of taking a nap yesterday.
glossary: to take a nap/to dream of sth
translation: 7. I only dreamed of taking a nap.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Do kogo się uśmiechasz?
english: Who are you smiling at?
glossary: to smile at sb
translation: 8. Who are you smiling at?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Następny weekend spędzam w moim rodzinnym mieście.
english: I'm spending next weekend in my hometown.
glossary: in your hometown/to spend next weekend
translation: 9. Next weekend I’m spending in my hometown.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Powinieneś być wdzięczny. Gdybym cię nie ostrzegł, dostałbyś mandat.
english: You should be grateful. If I hadn't warned you, you would've gotten a ticket.
glossary: to be grateful/to warn sb about sth/to get a ticket
translation: 10. You should be grateful. If I didn’t warn you, you would take a ticket.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Kiedy zmieniłeś zdanie?
english: When did you change your mind?
glossary: to change your mind
translation: When did you change your mind?

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Nie bądź tak pesymistyczna. Rozważyłaś już wszystkie możliwe opcje?
english: Don't be so pessimistic. Have you weighed up all the possible options yet?
glossary: to weigh up the options/to be pessimistic/an option/to be possible
translation: Don't be so pessimistic. Did you consider the all options?

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Dzieciaki się wygłupiały, kiedy weszliśmy do domu.
english: The kids were fooling around when we entered the house.
glossary: to enter the house/a kid/to fool around
translation: The kids were messing around when we enter the house.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Często byłem nawalony, kiedy byłem młodszy.
english: I was often wasted when I was younger.
glossary: to be wasted/...when I was younger
translation: I was often drunk when I was younger.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Powinieneś był wcześniej zgasić papierosa. Nie dostałbyś grzywny.
english: You should've put out the cigarette earlier. You wouldn't have gotten a fine.
glossary: to get a fine/to put out a cigarette
translation: You should ( in Anki I didn't find the word: zgasić papierosa) earlier. You didn't (I also didn't find: dostać grzywnę.).

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Mam nadzięję, że wrócisz do pracy do końca miesiąca.
english: I hope you'll come back to work by the end of the month.
glossary: to come back to work/by the end of the month/I hope that...
translation: I hope you will return to work by the end of the month.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Wieczorem idę na zakupy. Chcesz coś?
english: I'm going shopping in the evening. Do you want anything?
glossary: to go shopping
translation: I'm going shopping in the evening. Do you want anything?

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Kiedy ten pomysł został zaproponowany?
english: When was the idea put forward?
glossary: to put forward an idea
translation: When was this idea proposed?

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Musimy wyjśnić sytuację.
english: We have to explain the situation.
glossary: to explain the situation
translation: We need to dream a situation.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Dzwoniła wczoraj do mnie teściowa.
english: My mother-in-law called me yesterday.
glossary: to call sb
translation: My mother-in-law called me yesterday.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Kiedy ostatnio się widziałyśmy, moja najlepsza przyjaciółka powiedziała mi, że zerwie ze swoim chłopakiem
english: The last time we met, my best friend told me she'd break up with her boyfriend.
glossary: your best friend/to break up with sb/a boyfriend
translation: 1. When last time we saw each other, my best friend told me that she would break up with her boyfriend.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Nie sądzę, że przyzwyczaję się do noszenia sukienek. Czuję, że za bardzo się wyróżniam.
english: I don't think I'll get used to wearing dresses. I feel I stand out too much.
glossary: to stand out/to wear a dress
translation: 2. I don’t think I will get used to wearing a dress. I feel I stand out to much.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Może podjęłabyś lepszą decyzję, gdybyś rozważyła wszystkie czynniki.
english: Maybe you would've made a better decision if you'd weighed up all the factors.
glossary: to weigh up factors/to make a decision
translation: 3. Maybe you would make better decision If you considered all factors.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Obudź się! Nie słyszysz, że właśnie zadzwonił budzik?
english: Wake up! Can't you hear the alarm has just gone off?
glossary: to go off/to set an alarm/to wake up/to hear sth
translation: 4. Wake up! Don’t you hear that alarm just rang.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Spotkanie ciągnęło się jeszcze przez godzinę po tym, jak wyszedłeś.
english: The meeting still dragged on for an hour after you'd left.
glossary: to drag on/to leave
translation: 5. The meeting dragged on for another hour after you had left.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Już cię raz kryłem. Nie zrobię tego ponownie.
english: I've covered up for you once. I won't do it again.
glossary: to cover up for sb
translation: 6. I have covered you up once. I haven’t done it again.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Przyzwyczaiłem się, że żona narzeka na pracę, kiedy poruszam ten temat.
english: I got used to my wife complaining about her job every time I bring up the subject.
glossary: to bring up a subject/to complain about your job/a wife
translation: 7. I get used to that my wife complain about her job when I raise the topic.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Gdybyś ograniczył palenie, byłbyś zdrowszy.
english: If you cut down on smoking, you'd be more healthy.
glossary: to cut down on smoking/to be healthy
translation: 8. If you reduced smoke you would be healthier.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Zmieniłaś się. Kiedyś stawałaś w obronie swoich zasad.
english: You've changed. You used to stand up for your principles.
glossary: to stand up for your principles/to change
translation: 9. You’ve changed. You used to stand up for your principles.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Ostatnio musiałem odwołać tyle spotkań, że moi klienci zaczynają narzekać.
english: I've recently had to call off so many meetings that my clients are starting to complain.
glossary: to call off a meeting/to complain about sth/to start to do sth; to begin to do sth/a client
translation: 10. I've had to cancel so many meetings lately that my clients are starting to complain.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Jeśli teraz pozbędziesz się formalności, zaoszczędzisz dużo czasu.
english: If you do away with formalities now, you'll save a lot of time.
glossary: to do away with formalities/to save time
translation: 1. If you get away formalities now, you will save lot of time.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Gdybyś nie dała kosza swojemu dziwnemu koledze z pracy, byłabyś teraz w toksycznej relacji.
english: If you hadn't turned your weird colleague down, you would be in a toxic relationship now.
glossary: to turn sb down/to be in a toxic relationship
translation: 2. If you haven’t turned your strange friend down you would be in a toxic relationship now.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Kiedyś skarżyłem na moich kolegów za każdym razem, kiedy zrobili coś złego, ale wyluzowałem.
english: I used to tell on my friends every time they did something wrong, but I chilled out.
glossary: to tell on sb/to chill out/to do sth wrong/a friend
translation: 3.I used to complain to my colleagues every time they did something wrong, but I chilled out.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Gdzie jest dokument, o który cię prosiłem? Powiedziałeś, że go wydrukujesz.
english: Where's the document I asked you for? You said you'd print it out.
glossary: to print sth out/to ask sb for sth/a document
translation: 4.Where is the document I asked for?  You said you'd print it out.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Jeśli wszystkie moje plany się udadzą, w końcu będę mógł rzucić tę pracę.
english: If all my plans work out, I'll finally be able to give up the job.
glossary: to work out/to be able to do sth/to give up the job
translation: 5. If all my plans succeed, I will eventually be able to quit my job

name: Justina Carson
polish: Już wyniosłem śmieci, więc nie musisz mi o tym znów przypominać.
english: I've already taken out the garbage, so you don't have to remind me of it again.
glossary: to take out the garbage/to remind sb of sth
translation: 6. I've already taken out the trash so you don't need to remind me of that again.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Gdybyś się tyle nie wygłupiała, byłabyś traktowana poważniej.
english: If you didn't mess around so much, you would be treated more seriously.
glossary: to mess around/to treat sb seriously
translation: 7. If you hadn't been fooling around so much, you'd be taken more seriously.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Kiedy wróciłem ze Stanów, zorientowałem się, że podłapałem amerykański akcent.
english: When I came back from the US, I realized I'd picked up the American accent.
glossary: to pick up the American accent/to come back from the US/to realize that...
translation: 8. When I got back from the States, I realized I had picked up an American accent.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Ostatni pacjent wiercił się, podczas gdy przeglądałam jego dokumentację.
english: The last patient was fidgeting while I was going through his documentation.
glossary: to go through documentation/to fidget/a patient
translation: 9. The last patient fidgeted as I looked through his records

name: Justina Carson
polish: Szef wyszedł z pokoju, kiedy wciąż kończyliśmy spotkanie.
english: The boss left the room when we were still wrapping up the meeting.
glossary: a boss/to leave a room/to wrap up a meeting
translation: 10. The boss left the room while we were still finishing our meeting

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Obiecuję, że następnym razem będę się lepiej zachowywał.
english: I promise I'll behave better next time.
glossary: to behave/next time/to promise sb sth; to promise sth to sb
translation: I promise I will behave better next time.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Mam nadzieję, że omówimy twoje zachowanie.
english: I hope we'll discuss your behavior.
glossary: to discuss sth/behavior
translation: I hope we will discuss your behavior.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: W zeszłym tygodniu poprosiłam mamę, żeby poszła ze mną na zakupy.
english: I asked my mom to go shopping with me last week.
glossary: to go shopping/last week
translation: I ask my mom to go shopping with me next week.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Nie mam czasu. Idę jutro do lekarza.
english: I don't have time. I'm going to the doctor tomorrow.
glossary: to go to the doctor
translation: I don't have time. I'm going to the doctor tomorrow.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Nauczę się angielskiego, jak już zatrudnię profesjonalnego nauczyciela.
english: I'll learn English once I hire a professional teacher.
glossary: to hire sb/a professional teacher/once {2}
translation: I will learn English once I hire a professional English teacher.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Napiszę do ciebie, jak już będę mieć wolne.
english: I'll text you once I have a day off.
glossary: to have a day off/to text sb/once {2}
translation: I will text you once I will have a day off.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Policja przyjechała na miejsce zbrodni po tym, jak właściciel sklepu zastrzelił złodzieja.
english: The police came to the crime scene after the store owner had shot down a thief.
glossary: to come to a crime scene/to shoot sb down/a store owner/a thief
translation: Police arrived at the crime scene after that a shop owner killed a thief.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Na imprezie było dużo pijanych nastolatków.
english: There were many drunk teens at the party.
glossary: a teen/to be drunk
translation: There were a lot of drunk teenagers at the party.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Gdzie dorastałeś?
english: Where did you grow up?
glossary: to grow up
translation: Where did you grow up?

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Myślisz, że ci uwierzę?
english: Do you think I'll believe you?
glossary: to believe sb
translation: Do you think I will believe you?

name: Justina Carson
polish: Przepraszam. Musiałem coś pomieszać, kiedy wystawiałem dla pana fakturę.
english: I'm sorry. I must've mixed something up when making out the invoice for you.
glossary: to make out an invoice/to mix sth up/to be sorry
translation: 1. I’m sorry. I should mixed something up when I was making out invoices for you.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Powinnam była zwrócić się do ciebie o pomoc, kiedy jeszcze nie było za późno.
english: I should've turned to you for help when it wasn't too late yet.
glossary: to turn to sb for help
translation: 2. I should have asked you for help while it wasn’t too late.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Kiedy dotarłam na imprezę, koleżanki spytały mnie, dlaczego się nie przebrałam.
english: When I got to the party, my friends asked me why I hadn't dressed up.
glossary: to dress up/to get to a party
translation: 3. When I got to the party, my friends asked me why I didn’t dressed up.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Czy ty musisz zagadywać do każdej dziewczyny, którą spotykasz?
english: Do you have to chat up every girl you meet?
glossary: to chat up a girl
translation: 4. Do you have to talk to every girl you meet?

name: Justina Carson
polish: Chcę, żebyś w końcu przezwyciężył stres i skoncentrował się na projekcie.
english: I want you to finally get over the stress and concentrate on the project.
glossary: to get over a difficulty/to concentrate on sth/to want sb to do sth
translation: 5. I want to you finally overcome a stress and concentrate on the project.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Dlaczego znalazłeś wymówkę, zamiast powiedzieć mi, że jesteś zmęczony?
english: Why did you come up with an excuse instead of telling me you were tired?
glossary: to come up with an excuse/instead of sth/to do sth simply
translation: 6. Why did you find an excuse instead of telling me you're tired

name: Justina Carson
polish: Kiedy byliśmy dziećmi, mój młodszy brat mówił, że patrzę na niego z góry.
english: When we were kids, my younger brother said I looked down on him.
glossary: to look down on sb/a younger brother
translation: 7. When we were child my younger brother use to  say that I looked him down.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Dlaczego wszystko, co robisz, zawsze wychodzi?
english: Why does everything you do always work out?
glossary: to work out
translation: 8. Why everything you do always comes out.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Wypiłaś już herbatę? Naprawdę musimy się spieszyć.
english: Have you drunk up your tea yet? We really need to hurry up.
glossary: to drink sth up/to hurry up
translation: 9. Have you drank your tea yet? We really have to hurry up.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Za każdym razem, gdy czuję, że jestem obserwowana, panikuję.
english: Every time I feel that I'm being watched, I freak out.
glossary: to freak out/Every time.../to be watched
translation: 10. Every time, when I feel I am watched, I panic.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: W przyszłym roku kończę studia. Nie mogę się doczekać.
english: I'm graduating from college next year. I can't wait.
glossary: to graduate from college/can't wait
translation: I’m graduating from university/college next year. I can't wait.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Miałam nadzieję, że przemyślisz swoje zachowanie.
english: I hoped you'd think over your behavior.
glossary: to think over your behavior
translation: I hoped you would think over your behavior.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Dlaczego zalegacie z czynszem? Macie problemy finansowe?
english: Why are you falling behind with the rent? Do you have financial problems?
glossary: to fall behind with the rent/to have financial problems
translation: Why are you falling behind with the rent? Are you having financial problems?

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Obściskiwałeś się z moją koleżanką. Przyznaj to.
english: You made out with my friend. Admit it.
glossary: to make out with sb/to admit sth
translation: You made out with my friend. Admit it.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Podejmiemy się nowego projektu, jak ten będzie gotowy.
english: We'll take on a new project once the one is ready.
glossary: to take on a project/to be ready
translation: We will take on a new project when this it’s ready

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Powiedziałem ci, że przyprawy uwydatnią smak potrawy.
english: I told you the spices would bring out the flavor of the dish.
glossary: to bring out the flavor/a dish/spices
translation: I told you that spices bring out the flavor.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Czy ty myślisz, że ze mną wygrasz?
english: Do you think you'll win against me?
glossary: to win against sb
translation: Are you thinking that you will win with me?

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Nie musisz iść na randkę z tym gościem, jeśli nie chcesz.
english: You don't have to go on a date with the guy if you don't want to.
glossary: to go on a date with sb
translation: You don’t have to go on a date with the guy if you don’t want to.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Zostałem zwolniony po tym, jak wybuchła pandemia.
english: I was laid off after the pandemic had broken out.
glossary: to break out/to be laid off
translation: I was fired after the pandemic breaks out.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Dlaczego schrzaniłeś to zadanie?
english: Why did you screw up the task?
glossary: to screw up a task
translation: Why did you screw up this task?

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Kiedy wszedłem do biura, koleżanka wystawiała faktury.
english: When I entered the office, my colleague was making out invoices.
glossary: to make out an invoice/to enter the office
translation: When I came into the office, my colleague was making out an invoice.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Nie powinienem był zalegać z rachunkami. Przepraszam.

name: Agatha Olson

name: Agatha Olson

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Muszę wyjaśnić sytuację.

name: Agatha Olson

name: Agatha Olson

name: Justina Carson
polish: Wiem, że jest późno. Dlatego postaram się zakończyć spotkanie najszybciej, jak to możliwe.

glossary: to weigh up the options/to be pessimistic/an option/to be possible

name: Justina Carson

glossary: to freshen up/to feel better/a workout

name: Justina Carson
polish: Mimo że mój szef wie, że nie znoszę papierkowej roboty, chce, żebym przeglądała dokumenty.
english: Although my boss knows I hate paperwork, he wants me to go over documents.
glossary: to go over a document/Although.../to hate paperwork
translation: 10. Although my boss know that I hate paperwork, he wants me to

name: Justina Carson

polish: Nie chciałbym, żeby mój szef opieprzał mnie, gdy inni są wokół.

glossary: to pay the bills

polish: Kiedy wszedłem do biura, koleżanka wystawiała faktury.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Nie powinienem był zalegać z rachunkami. Przepraszam.
english: I shouldn't have fallen behind with the bills. I'm sorry

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Dzięki za podgrzanie jedzenia.
english: Thanks for heating up the food.
glossary: to heat up the food

name: Michael Stewart

translation: 4. If you fit me into the schedule I'll pay you more.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Muszę wyjaśnić sytuację.
english: I have to explain the situation.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Pójdę na siłownię, kiedy wyzdrowieję.
english: I'll go to the gym when I get better.
glossary: to get better/to go to the gym
translation: 6. I'm going to the gym when I'll get better.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Może wpadnę po pracy.
english: Maybe I'll drop by after work.
glossary: to drop by/after work

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Dlaczego próbujesz mnie wrobić?
english: Why are you trying to set me up?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Wiem, że jest późno. Dlatego postaram się zakończyć spotkanie najszybciej, jak to możliwe.
english: I know it's late. That's why I'll try to wrap the meeting up as quickly as possible.
glossary: to wrap up a meeting/to be late/as quickly as possible
translation: 9. I know it's late. That's way I'll try to finish the meeting as quick as possible.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Zbyt długo zadzierasz ze mną.
english: You've been messing with me for too long.
glossary: to mess with sb

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Na szczęscie syn przyzwyczaił się do wynoszenia śmieci.

glossary: Fortunately.../a son/to take out the garbage

name: Agatha Olson

name: Agatha Olson

name: Agatha Olson

name: Agatha Olson

english: I hope we'll discuss your behavior.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Odwiozę cię do domu, jak już zjemy kolację.
english: I'll take you home once we eat dinner.
glossary: to take sb home/to eat dinner
translation: 8.	I’ll drive you home once we have dinner.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Dlaczego nie chcesz, żeby twoje dzieci uczyły się angielskiego?
english: Why don't you want your kids to learn English?
glossary: to learn English

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Gdybyśmy przestali używać konserwantów, mielibyśmy więcej klientów.
english: If we stopped using preservatives, we'd have more customers.

polish: Wkurzyłeś się, kiedy zostałeś zwolniony?

glossary: to get mad/to be fired

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Powiedziałem ci, że nie będę cię krył.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Nie było wczoraj w sklepie żadnego klienta.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Gdybyś się tyle nie wygłupiała, byłabyś traktowana poważniej.

glossary: to take out the garbage

polish: Rok temu zacząłem uczyć się angielskiego.
english: I started learning English a year ago.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Dlaczego rzuciłaś angielski?

name: Michael Stewart

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Od godziny robię kolację.

glossary: to go through documents

polish: Kim jest ta dziewczyna, która dziś zastępuje sekretarkę menedżera? Nigdy wcześniej jej nie widziałam.

polish: Dopiłeś już swoją kawę do końca?

glossary: to drink up your coffee

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Nie chciałbym, żebyś popadł w nawyk.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Zawsze chcesz, żeby wszyscy ci współczuli.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Samolot odlatywał, kiedy pojawiliśmy się na lotnisku.

glossary: to track down a criminal/the police

polish: Musimy się lepiej poznać.

polish: W ten weekend robimy z przyjacielem parapetówkę.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Kiedy zdałeś sobie z tego sprawę?

polish: Jest wiele kursów, na które możesz się zapisać.

polish: Nie możesz się tak zachowywać.

glossary: to have sb over/to have your friends over/to clean up

glossary: to live up to sb's expectations

polish: Analizowałem raport, gdy mi przeszkodziłaś.
english: I was looking into a report when you interrupted me.
glossary: to interrupt sb/to look into a report
translation: 10. I was analyzingf the report when you interrupted me.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Dlaczego do mnie zagadujesz?

glossary: to chat sb up
translation: 1. Why are you talking to me?

glossary: to die out/a species

glossary: to be skillful/to take up the piano

english: Did you finally speak up when you got over your fear?
glossary: to get over your fear/to speak up

polish: Kiedy wszedłem do biura, koleżanka wystawiała faktury.

name: Jacob Brewer

english: Who are you covering for tomorrow?
glossary: to cover for sb

english: If I were you, I would take on the task.

name: Jacob Brewer

polish: Nie powinienem był zalegać z rachunkami. Przepraszam.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Już się rozgrzałem. Możemy iść biegać.

glossary: to track down a thief/to let sb down

polish: Dlaczego schrzaniłeś to zadanie?

name: Jacob Brewer

glossary: to wrap up a meeting

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Chcesz, żebym przejrzał te dokumenty?
english: Do you want me to go through the documents?
glossary: to go through documents

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Profesor pytał się mnie kilka dni temu, dlaczego jeszcze nie wykonałem tych badań.
english: The professor asked me a few days ago why I hadn't carried out the research yet.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Szybko przyzwyczaiłam się do krycia brata.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Już się rozgrzałem. Możemy iść biegać.
english: I've already warmed up. We can go running.
glossary: to warm up/to go running
translation: I've already warmed up. We can go running now.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Damy ci znać, jak już wyśledzimy złodzieja.
english: We'll let you know once we track down the thief.
glossary: to track down a thief/to let sb down
translation: I will let you know once we track down the thief.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Gdybyś nie poruszył tematu, szef nie zauważyłby, że jest problem.
english: If you hadn't brought up the subject, the boss wouldn't notice that there was a problem.
glossary: to bring up a subject/to notice that.../a problem
translation: If you hadn’t brought up the subject, the boss wouldn’t notice that there was a problem.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Dlaczego schrzaniłeś to zadanie?
english: Why did you screw up the task?
glossary: to screw up a task
translation: Why did you screw up the task?

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Szefowa powiedziała, że przejmę ważny projekt.
english: The boss told me I'd take on an important project.
glossary: to take on a project
translation: My boss told me that I will take over the important project.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Zbyt długo rozważam opcje. Czas działać.
english: I've been weighing up the options for too long. It's time to act.
glossary: to weigh up the options/to act
translation: I have been weighing options for too long. Time to act.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Klient twierdził, że product nie spełnia jego oczekiwań.
english: The client claimed the product didn't live up to his expectations.
glossary: to live up to sb's expectations/a client/a product
translation: The client claimed that the product didn’t live up to his expectations.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Czy zawsze zapinasz pasy, kiedy prowadzisz?
english: Do you always fasten up when driving?
glossary: to fasten up/to drive
translation: Do you always fasten your seat belt when you drive?

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Zakończyłeś już spotkanie?
english: Have you wrapped up the meeting yet?
glossary: to wrap up a meeting
translation: Have you already finished your meeting?

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Chcesz, żebym przejrzał te dokumenty?
english: Do you want me to go through the documents?
glossary: to go through documents
translation: Do you want me to go through the documents?

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Profesor pytał się mnie kilka dni temu, dlaczego jeszcze nie wykonałem tych badań.
english: The professor asked me a few days ago why I hadn't carried out the research yet.
glossary: to carry out research
translation: The professor asked me a few days ago, why I haven’t done this research yet.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Szybko przyzwyczaiłam się do krycia brata.
english: I quickly got used to covering for my brother.
glossary: to cover up for sb/to get used to doing sth
translation: I quickly got used to covering for my brother.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Kiedyś spotkania w firmie się ciągnęły, ale znaleźliśmy na to rozwiązanie.
english: Meetings in our company used to drag on, but we found a solution to that.
glossary: to drag on/a meeting/in our company/a solution to sth
translation: 1. Meetings used to drag on in the company , but we found a solution for it.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Jeśli wciśniesz mnie w swój grafik w tym tygodniu, zapłacę ci więcej.
english: If you fit me in to your schedule this week, I'll pay you more.
glossary: to fit sb in to the schedule/to pay sb
translation: 2. If you fit me in to your schedule this week, I'll pay you more.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Kiedy wszedłem do biura, koleżanka wystawiała faktury.
english: When I entered the office, my colleague was making out invoices.
glossary: to make out an invoice/to enter the office
translation: 3. When I entered the office, my friend was making out invoices.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Kogo jutro zastępujesz?
english: Who are you covering for tomorrow?
glossary: to cover for sb
translation: 4. Who are you cover for tomorrow?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Na twoim miejscu podjąłbym się tego zadania.
english: If I were you, I would take on the task.
glossary: to take on a task
translation: 5. If I were you, I would take on this task.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Ta historia jest zmyślona.
english: The story's made up.
glossary: to make up a story
translation: 6. This story is made up.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Zostałem zwolniony po tym, jak wybuchła pandemia.
english: I was laid off after the pandemic had broken out.
glossary: to break out/to be laid off
translation: 7. I was fired after the pandemic broke out.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Nie powinienem był zalegać z rachunkami. Przepraszam.
english: I shouldn't have fallen behind with the bills. I'm sorry
glossary: to fall behind with the bills
translation: 8. I shouldn't fell behind  with the bills. Sorry.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Już się rozgrzałem. Możemy iść biegać.
english: I've already warmed up. We can go running.
glossary: to warm up/to go running
translation: 9. I've already warmed up. We can go running.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Damy ci znać, jak już wyśledzimy złodzieja.
english: We'll let you know once we track down the thief.
glossary: to track down a thief/to let sb down
translation: 10. We'll let you know once we have tracked down the thief.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Gdybyś nie poruszył tematu, szef nie zauważyłby, że jest problem.
english: If you hadn't brought up the subject, the boss wouldn't notice that there was a problem.
glossary: to bring up a subject/to notice that.../a problem
translation: 1. If you didn't bring up the topic, the boss wouldn't notice that there is a problem.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Dlaczego schrzaniłeś to zadanie?
english: Why did you screw up the task?
glossary: to screw up a task
translation: 2. Why did you screw up this task?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Szefowa powiedziała, że przejmę ważny projekt.
english: The boss told me I'd take on an important project.
glossary: to take on a project
translation: 3. The boss said that I would take over an important project.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Zbyt długo rozważam opcje. Czas działać.
english: I've been weighing up the options for too long. It's time to act.
glossary: to weigh up the options/to act
translation: 4. I've been weighing up the options for too long. It's time to act.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Klient twierdził, że product nie spełnia jego oczekiwań.
english: The client claimed the product didn't live up to his expectations.
glossary: to live up to sb's expectations/a client/a product
translation: 5. The customer claimed that the product didn't live up to his expectations.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Czy zawsze zapinasz pasy, kiedy prowadzisz?
english: Do you always fasten up when driving?
glossary: to fasten up/to drive
translation: 6. Do you always fasten up when you're driving?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Zakończyłeś już spotkanie?
english: Have you wrapped up the meeting yet?
glossary: to wrap up a meeting
translation: 7. Have you finished the meeting?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Chcesz, żebym przejrzał te dokumenty?
english: Do you want me to go through the documents?
glossary: to go through documents
translation: 8. Do you want me to go through these documents?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Profesor pytał się mnie kilka dni temu, dlaczego jeszcze nie wykonałem tych badań.
english: The professor asked me a few days ago why I hadn't carried out the research yet.
glossary: to carry out research
translation: 9. The professor asked me a few days ago why I haven't done this research yet.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Szybko przyzwyczaiłam się do krycia brata.
english: I quickly got used to covering for my brother.
glossary: to cover up for sb/to get used to doing sth
translation: 10. I quickly got used to cover up for my brother.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Fabryka rozpcznie produkcje, jak już zarząd na to pozwoli.
english: The factory will go ahead with the production once the board allows it.
glossary: to allow sth/to go ahead with the production/a factory/the board
translation: 1. The factory will stay the production once the management board allows.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Zawsze chcesz, żeby wszyscy ci współczuli.
english: You always want everyone to feel for you.
glossary: to feel for sb
translation: 2. You always want everyone to feel sorry for you.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Dopiłeś już swoją kawę do końca?
english: Have you drunk up your coffee yet?
glossary: to drink up your coffee
translation: 3. Did you drink your coffee bottom up?

name: Justina Carson
polish: Mój lekarz rodzinny obiecał, że wciśnie mnie w grafik.
english: My GP promised he'd fit me in to his schedule.
glossary: to fit sb in to your schedule/a GP
translation: 4. My GP promised me that he would fit me into the schedule.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Zapisujesz to? Nie mam zamiaru się powtarzać.
english: Are you taking it down? I'm not going to repeat myself.
glossary: to repeat yourself/to write sth down; to take sth down
translation: 5. Are you writing it down? I'm not going to repeat myself.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Kiedy pogodziłaś się z rodziną?
english: When did you make up with your family?
glossary: to make up with sb/a family
translation: 6. When did you made up with your family?

name: Justina Carson
polish: Dlaczego twoim zdaniem ten raport wymaga analizy?
english: Why does the report call for an analysis in your opinion?
glossary: to call for an analysis/In my opinion...
translation: 7. Why do you think this report needs to be analyzed?

name: Justina Carson
polish: Mogłem podjąć się tej roli. Zarabiałbym teraz więcej.
english: I could've taken on the role. I'd earn more now.
glossary: to make money; to earn money/to take on a role
translation: 8. I could have took on this role.  I'd be earning more now.

name: Justina Carson
polish: W zeszłym miesiącu mi powiedziałaś, że ta praca cię wykańcza.
english: You told me last month that the job was wearing you down
glossary: to wear sb down/a job
translation: 9. Last month, you told me that this job was wearing you down.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Jeszcze rok temu bank utrzymywał, że wziąłem tę pożyczkę.
english: Only a year ago, the bank insisted that I'd taken out the loan.
glossary: to take out a loan/to insist that...
translation: 10. A year ago, the bank claimed that I had taken this loan

name: Justina Carson
polish: Nie musielibyśmy przekładać spotkań, gdyby szef się częściej pojawiał w pracy.
english: We wouldn't have to put off meetings if the boss showed up at work more often.
glossary: to show up at work/to put off a meeting/a boss
translation: 1. We shouldn’t have to postpone the meet if the boss showed up in the office more often.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Wrócisz do więzienia, jeśli będziesz zamieszany w narkotyki.
english: You'll go back to jail if you're mixed up in drugs.
glossary: to be mixed up in sth/to be mixed up in drugs/to go back to jail
translation: 2. You will come back to the prison, if you be mix up in drugs.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Kiedyś z każdym wchodziłem w konflikt, bo byłem głupi.
english: I used to come into conflict with everybody because I was stupid.
glossary: to be stupid/to come into conflict with sb
translation: 3.I used to get into conflict with everyone because I was stupid.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Przestępca trafił do szpitala po tym, jak postrzeliła go policja.
english: The criminal ended up in the hospital after the police had shot him.
glossary: to shoot sb/the police/a criminal/to end up in the hospital
translation: 4. The perpetrator was taken to the hospital after he was shot by the police

name: Justina Carson
polish: Od dawna mnie wkurzasz. To koniec.
english: You've been pissing me off for a long time. It's over.
glossary: to piss sb off/to be over
translation: 5.You've been pissing me off for a long time.  It's over.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Wykonałem jak dotąd dwa z trzech zadań.
english: I've carried out two out of three tasks so far.
glossary: so far/to carry out a task/one out of two
translation: 6. So far, I have completed two of the three tasks.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Kiedy wychodziłem z biura, zadzwonił do mnie klient i odwołał spotkanie.
english: When I was leaving the office, my client called me and called off the meeting.
glossary: to call off a meeting/to call sb/to leave the office
translation: 7. When I was going out the office, the client called me and cancelled the meeting.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Przyzwyczaiłem się już do zagadywania do dziewczyn.
english: I've already gotten used to chatting up girls.
glossary: to chat sb up/a girl/to get used to doing sth
translation: 8. I got used to chatting girls up.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Policja nie zastrzeliłaby podejrzanego, gdyby nie wyjął broni.
english: The police wouldn't have shot down the suspect if he hadn't pulled out a gun.
glossary: to pull out a gun/to shoot sb down/the police
translation: 9. The police wouldn’t shoot down the suspect if he didn’t take out a gun.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Myślę o odrzuceniu zaproszenia na ten ślub. Jakie jest twoje zdanie?
english: I'm thinking about turning down the invitation to the wedding. What's your opinion?
glossary: to turn down an invitation to the wedding/an opinion/to think about sth
translation: 10. I am thinking about turning down an invitation on the wedding. What is your opinion?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Jeśli teraz pozbędziesz się formalności, zaoszczędzisz dużo czasu.
english: If you do away with formalities now, you'll save a lot of time.
glossary: to do away with formalities/to save time
translation: 1. If you do away with formalities now, you will save a lot of time.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Gdybyś nie dała kosza swojemu dziwnemu koledze z pracy, byłabyś teraz w toksycznej relacji.
english: If you hadn't turned your weird colleague down, you would be in a toxic relationship now.
glossary: to turn sb down/to be in a toxic relationship
translation: 2. If you hadn't turned your weird work colleague down, you would be in a toxic relationship right now.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Kiedyś skarżyłem na moich kolegów za każdym razem, kiedy zrobili coś złego, ale wyluzowałem.
english: I used to tell on my friends every time they did something wrong, but I chilled out.
glossary: to tell on sb/to chill out/to do sth wrong/a friend
translation: 3. I used to complain about my colleagues every time they did something wrong, but I chilled out.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Gdzie jest dokument, o który cię prosiłem? Powiedziałeś, że go wydrukujesz.
english: Where's the document I asked you for? You said you'd print it out.
glossary: to print sth out/to ask sb for sth/a document
translation: 4. Where is the document I asked you for? You said you would print it out.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Jeśli wszystkie moje plany się udadzą, w końcu będę mógł rzucić tę pracę.
english: If all my plans work out, I'll finally be able to give up the job.
glossary: to work out/to be able to do sth/to give up the job
translation: 5. If all my plans are successful, I'll finally be able to quit this job.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Już wyniosłem śmieci, więc nie musisz mi o tym znów przypominać.
english: I've already taken out the garbage, so you don't have to remind me of it again.
glossary: to take out the garbage/to remind sb of sth
translation: 6. I've already taken out the garbage, so you don't need to remind me of it again.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Gdybyś się tyle nie wygłupiała, byłabyś traktowana poważniej.
english: If you didn't mess around so much, you would be treated more seriously.
glossary: to mess around/to treat sb seriously
translation: 7. If you hadn't messed around so much, you'd be taken more seriously.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Kiedy wróciłem ze Stanów, zorientowałem się, że podłapałem amerykański akcent.
english: When I came back from the US, I realized I'd picked up the American accent.
glossary: to pick up the American accent/to come back from the US/to realize that...
translation: 8. When I came back from the United States, I realized that I had picked up an American accent.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Ostatni pacjent wiercił się, podczas gdy przeglądałam jego dokumentację.
english: The last patient was fidgeting while I was going through his documentation.
glossary: to go through documentation/to fidget/a patient
translation: 9. The last patient was fidding while I was going through his documentation.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Szef wyszedł z pokoju, kiedy wciąż kończyliśmy spotkanie.
english: The boss left the room when we were still wrapping up the meeting.
glossary: a boss/to leave a room/to wrap up a meeting
translation: 10. The boss left the room while we were still finishing the meeting.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Kiedy ostatnio się widziałyśmy, moja najlepsza przyjaciółka powiedziała mi, że zerwie ze swoim chłopakiem
english: The last time we met, my best friend told me she'd break up with her boyfriend.
glossary: your best friend/to break up with sb/a boyfriend
translation: 1. The last time we saw each other, my best friend told me she would break up with her boyfriend

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Nie sądzę, że przyzwyczaję się do noszenia sukienek. Czuję, że za bardzo się wyróżniam.
english: I don't think I'll get used to wearing dresses. I feel I stand out too much.
glossary: to stand out/to wear a dress
translation: 2. I don't think I'll get used to wearing dresses. I feel like I'm standing out too much.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Może podjęłabyś lepszą decyzję, gdybyś rozważyła wszystkie czynniki.
english: Maybe you would've made a better decision if you'd weighed up all the factors.
glossary: to weigh up factors/to make a decision
translation: 3. Maybe you'd make a better decision if you had weighed up all the factors.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Obudź się! Nie słyszysz, że właśnie zadzwonił budzik?
english: Wake up! Can't you hear the alarm has just gone off?
glossary: to go off/to set an alarm/to wake up/to hear sth
translation: 4. Wake up! Can't you hear that the alarm clock just went off?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Spotkanie ciągnęło się jeszcze przez godzinę po tym, jak wyszedłeś.
english: The meeting still dragged on for an hour after you'd left.
glossary: to drag on/to leave
translation: 5. The meeting dragged on for another hour after you left.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Już cię raz kryłem. Nie zrobię tego ponownie.
english: I've covered up for you once. I won't do it again.
glossary: to cover up for sb
translation: 6. I've already covered up for you. I won't do it again.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Przyzwyczaiłem się, że żona narzeka na pracę, kiedy poruszam ten temat.
english: I got used to my wife complaining about her job every time I bring up the subject.
glossary: to bring up a subject/to complain about your job/a wife
translation: 7. I've gotten used to my wife complaining about work when I bring up this topic.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Gdybyś ograniczył palenie, byłbyś zdrowszy.
english: If you cut down on smoking, you'd be more healthy.
glossary: to cut down on smoking/to be healthy
translation: 8. If you had cut down on smoking, you'd be healthier.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Zmieniłaś się. Kiedyś stawałaś w obronie swoich zasad.
english: You've changed. You used to stand up for your principles.
glossary: to stand up for your principles/to change
translation: 9. You changed. You used to stand up for your principles.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Ostatnio musiałem odwołać tyle spotkań, że moi klienci zaczynają narzekać.
english: I've recently had to call off so many meetings that my clients are starting to complain.
glossary: to call off a meeting/to complain about sth/to start to do sth; to begin to do sth/a client
translation: 10. Recently, I've had to cancel so many meetings that my clients are starting to complain.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Kiedy ostatnio się widziałyśmy, moja najlepsza przyjaciółka powiedziała mi, że zerwie ze swoim chłopakiem
english: The last time we met, my best friend told me she'd break up with her boyfriend.
glossary: your best friend/to break up with sb/a boyfriend
translation: 1. Last time when we’ve seen each other, my best friend told me that she’d break up with her boyfriend.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Nie sądzę, że przyzwyczaję się do noszenia sukienek. Czuję, że za bardzo się wyróżniam.
english: I don't think I'll get used to wearing dresses. I feel I stand out too much.
glossary: to stand out/to wear a dress
translation: 2. I don’t think so I’ll get used to wearing dresses. I feel I stand out too much.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Może podjęłabyś lepszą decyzję, gdybyś rozważyła wszystkie czynniki.
english: Maybe you would've made a better decision if you'd weighed up all the factors.
glossary: to weigh up factors/to make a decision
translation: 3. Maybe you would’ve made a better decision if you would’ve weighed up all the factors.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Obudź się! Nie słyszysz, że właśnie zadzwonił budzik?
english: Wake up! Can't you hear the alarm has just gone off?
glossary: to go off/to set an alarm/to wake up/to hear sth
translation: 4. Wake up! Can’t you hear that alarm just rang?

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Spotkanie ciągnęło się jeszcze przez godzinę po tym, jak wyszedłeś.
english: The meeting still dragged on for an hour after you'd left.
glossary: to drag on/to leave
translation: 5. The meeting dragged on for an hour after you left.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Już cię raz kryłem. Nie zrobię tego ponownie.
english: I've covered up for you once. I won't do it again.
glossary: to cover up for sb
translation: 6. I covered up for you once. I won’t do it again.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Przyzwyczaiłem się, że żona narzeka na pracę, kiedy poruszam ten temat.
english: I got used to my wife complaining about her job every time I bring up the subject.
glossary: to bring up a subject/to complain about your job/a wife
translation: 7. I got used to that my wife complain about the job when I bring up the subject.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Gdybyś ograniczył palenie, byłbyś zdrowszy.
english: If you cut down on smoking, you'd be more healthy.
glossary: to cut down on smoking/to be healthy
translation: 8. If you cut down on smoking you’ll be healthier.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Zmieniłaś się. Kiedyś stawałaś w obronie swoich zasad.
english: You've changed. You used to stand up for your principles.
glossary: to stand up for your principles/to change
translation: 9. You’ve changed. You used to stand up for your principles.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Ostatnio musiałem odwołać tyle spotkań, że moi klienci zaczynają narzekać.
english: I've recently had to call off so many meetings that my clients are starting to complain.
glossary: to call off a meeting/to complain about sth/to start to do sth; to begin to do sth/a client
translation: 10. I’ve had to call off so many meetings lately that my clients start to complain.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Jeśli teraz pozbędziesz się formalności, zaoszczędzisz dużo czasu.
english: If you do away with formalities now, you'll save a lot of time.
glossary: to do away with formalities/to save time
translation: 1. If you do away with the formalities now you’ll save a lot of time.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Gdybyś nie dała kosza swojemu dziwnemu koledze z pracy, byłabyś teraz w toksycznej relacji.
english: If you hadn't turned your weird colleague down, you would be in a toxic relationship now.
glossary: to turn sb down/to be in a toxic relationship
translation: 2. If you wouldn’t turn down your strange friend from work you’d be in a toxic relationship right now.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Kiedyś skarżyłem na moich kolegów za każdym razem, kiedy zrobili coś złego, ale wyluzowałem.
english: I used to tell on my friends every time they did something wrong, but I chilled out.
glossary: to tell on sb/to chill out/to do sth wrong/a friend
translation: 3. I used to tell on my friends every time when they did something wrong but I chilled out.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Gdzie jest dokument, o który cię prosiłem? Powiedziałeś, że go wydrukujesz.
english: Where's the document I asked you for? You said you'd print it out.
glossary: to print sth out/to ask sb for sth/a document
translation: 4. Where’s the document I asked you for? You told me you’ll print it out.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Jeśli wszystkie moje plany się udadzą, w końcu będę mógł rzucić tę pracę.
english: If all my plans work out, I'll finally be able to give up the job.
glossary: to work out/to be able to do sth/to give up the job
translation: 5. If my all the plans work out I’ll finally be able to quit this job.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Już wyniosłem śmieci, więc nie musisz mi o tym znów przypominać.
english: I've already taken out the garbage, so you don't have to remind me of it again.
glossary: to take out the garbage/to remind sb of sth
translation: 6. I’ve already taken out the garbage so you don’t have to remind me about that again.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Gdybyś się tyle nie wygłupiała, byłabyś traktowana poważniej.
english: If you didn't mess around so much, you would be treated more seriously.
glossary: to mess around/to treat sb seriously
translation: 7. If you wouldn’t have messed around so much you’ll be treated more seriously.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Kiedy wróciłem ze Stanów, zorientowałem się, że podłapałem amerykański akcent.
english: When I came back from the US, I realized I'd picked up the American accent.
glossary: to pick up the American accent/to come back from the US/to realize that...
translation: 8. When I came back from the US I realized that I picked up the American accent.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Ostatni pacjent wiercił się, podczas gdy przeglądałam jego dokumentację.
english: The last patient was fidgeting while I was going through his documentation.
glossary: to go through documentation/to fidget/a patient
translation: 9. My last patient fidgeted while I was going through his documentation.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Szef wyszedł z pokoju, kiedy wciąż kończyliśmy spotkanie.
english: The boss left the room when we were still wrapping up the meeting.
glossary: a boss/to leave a room/to wrap up a meeting
translation: 10. The boss left the room when we still were finishing the meeting.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Kiedyś spotkania w firmie się ciągnęły, ale znaleźliśmy na to rozwiązanie.
english: Meetings in our company used to drag on, but we found a solution to that.
glossary: to drag on/a meeting/in our company/a solution to sth
translation: 1.	Meetings used to drag on in the company, but we found a solution for this.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Jeśli wciśniesz mnie w swój grafik w tym tygodniu, zapłacę ci więcej.
english: If you fit me in to your schedule this week, I'll pay you more.
glossary: to fit sb in to the schedule/to pay sb
translation: 2.	If you fit me in your schedule this week, I’ll pay you more.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Kiedy wszedłem do biura, koleżanka wystawiała faktury.
english: When I entered the office, my colleague was making out invoices.
glossary: to make out an invoice/to enter the office
translation: 3.	When I entranced the office, a colleague was issuing invoices.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Kogo jutro zastępujesz?
english: Who are you covering for tomorrow?
glossary: to cover for sb
translation: 4.	Who are you substituting for tomorrow?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Na twoim miejscu podjąłbym się tego zadania.
english: If I were you, I would take on the task.
glossary: to take on a task
translation: 5.	If I were you, I’d take up this assignments.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Ta historia jest zmyślona.
english: The story's made up.
glossary: to make up a story
translation: 6.	This story is made up.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Zostałem zwolniony po tym, jak wybuchła pandemia.
english: I was laid off after the pandemic had broken out.
glossary: to break out/to be laid off
translation: 7.	I was fired after the pandemic broke out.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Nie powinienem był zalegać z rachunkami. Przepraszam.
english: I shouldn't have fallen behind with the bills. I'm sorry
glossary: to fall behind with the bills
translation: 8.	I shouldn’t have made out the bills. I’m sorry.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Już się rozgrzałem. Możemy iść biegać.
english: I've already warmed up. We can go running.
glossary: to warm up/to go running
translation: 9.	I’ve already wormed up. We can go running.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Damy ci znać, jak już wyśledzimy złodzieja.
english: We'll let you know once we track down the thief.
glossary: to track down a thief/to let sb down
translation: 10.	We’ll let you know once we track down the thief.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Gdybyś nie poruszył tematu, szef nie zauważyłby, że jest problem.
english: If you hadn't brought up the subject, the boss wouldn't notice that there was a problem.
glossary: to bring up a subject/to notice that.../a problem
translation: 1.	If you hadn’t brought up a subject, the boss wouldn’t have noticed there was a problem.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Dlaczego schrzaniłeś to zadanie?
english: Why did you screw up the task?
glossary: to screw up a task
translation: 2.	Why did you screw up this task?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Szefowa powiedziała, że przejmę ważny projekt.
english: The boss told me I'd take on an important project.
glossary: to take on a project
translation: 3.	The boss said that I’d take over an important project.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Zbyt długo rozważam opcje. Czas działać.
english: I've been weighing up the options for too long. It's time to act.
glossary: to weigh up the options/to act
translation: 4.	I’ve been weighing the options too long. It’s time to act.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Klient twierdził, że product nie spełnia jego oczekiwań.
english: The client claimed the product didn't live up to his expectations.
glossary: to live up to sb's expectations/a client/a product
translation: 5.	The customer noticed that the product didn’t live up to his expectation.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Czy zawsze zapinasz pasy, kiedy prowadzisz?
english: Do you always fasten up when driving?
glossary: to fasten up/to drive
translation: 6.	Do you always fasten up while driving?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Zakończyłeś już spotkanie?
english: Have you wrapped up the meeting yet?
glossary: to wrap up a meeting
translation: 7.	Have you finished the meeting yet?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Chcesz, żebym przejrzał te dokumenty?
english: Do you want me to go through the documents?
glossary: to go through documents
translation: 8.	Do you want me to go through these documents?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Profesor pytał się mnie kilka dni temu, dlaczego jeszcze nie wykonałem tych badań.
english: The professor asked me a few days ago why I hadn't carried out the research yet.
glossary: to carry out research
translation: 9.	The professor asked me a few days ago why I hadn’t carried out this research yet.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Szybko przyzwyczaiłam się do krycia brata.
english: I quickly got used to covering for my brother.
glossary: to cover up for sb/to get used to doing sth
translation: 10.	I got used to cover up for my brother quickly.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Kiedy ostatnio się widziałyśmy, moja najlepsza przyjaciółka powiedziała mi, że zerwie ze swoim chłopakiem
english: The last time we met, my best friend told me she'd break up with her boyfriend.
glossary: your best friend/to break up with sb/a boyfriend
translation: When we the last time saw each other, my best friend told me she was going to break up with her boyfriend.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Nie sądzę, że przyzwyczaję się do noszenia sukienek. Czuję, że za bardzo się wyróżniam.
english: I don't think I'll get used to wearing dresses. I feel I stand out too much.
glossary: to stand out/to wear a dress
translation: I'm not sure that I get used to carrying on dresses. I feel I stand out too much.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Może podjęłabyś lepszą decyzję, gdybyś rozważyła wszystkie czynniki.
english: Maybe you would've made a better decision if you'd weighed up all the factors.
glossary: to weigh up factors/to make a decision
translation: Maybe you would make a better decision if you weighed up the all factors.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Obudź się! Nie słyszysz, że właśnie zadzwonił budzik?
english: Wake up! Can't you hear the alarm has just gone off?
glossary: to go off/to set an alarm/to wake up/to hear sth
translation: Wake up! Can't you hear that the alarm clock just rang?

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Spotkanie ciągnęło się jeszcze przez godzinę po tym, jak wyszedłeś.
english: The meeting still dragged on for an hour after you'd left.
glossary: to drag on/to leave
translation: The meeting dragged on for an hour after you left.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Już cię raz kryłem. Nie zrobię tego ponownie.
english: I've covered up for you once. I won't do it again.
glossary: to cover up for sb
translation: I covered up for you once. I won't do it again.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Przyzwyczaiłem się, że żona narzeka na pracę, kiedy poruszam ten temat.
english: I got used to my wife complaining about her job every time I bring up the subject.
glossary: to bring up a subject/to complain about your job/a wife
translation: I'm used to my wife is complaining about her job when I bring up a subject.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Gdybyś ograniczył palenie, byłbyś zdrowszy.
english: If you cut down on smoking, you'd be more healthy.
glossary: to cut down on smoking/to be healthy
translation: If you cut down on smoking, you would be healthier.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Zmieniłaś się. Kiedyś stawałaś w obronie swoich zasad.
english: You've changed. You used to stand up for your principles.
glossary: to stand up for your principles/to change
translation: You have changed. You used to follow your rules.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Ostatnio musiałem odwołać tyle spotkań, że moi klienci zaczynają narzekać.
english: I've recently had to call off so many meetings that my clients are starting to complain.
glossary: to call off a meeting/to complain about sth/to start to do sth; to begin to do sth/a client
translation: I had to call off so many meetings lately that my clients are starting to complain.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Jeśli teraz pozbędziesz się formalności, zaoszczędzisz dużo czasu.
english: If you do away with formalities now, you'll save a lot of time.
glossary: to do away with formalities/to save time
translation: If you do away with formalities now, you will save a lot of time.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Gdybyś nie dała kosza swojemu dziwnemu koledze z pracy, byłabyś teraz w toksycznej relacji.
english: If you hadn't turned your weird colleague down, you would be in a toxic relationship now.
glossary: to turn sb down/to be in a toxic relationship
translation: If you didn’t turn your weird colleague down, you would be in a toxic relationship now.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Kiedyś skarżyłem na moich kolegów za każdym razem, kiedy zrobili coś złego, ale wyluzowałem.

glossary: to tell on sb/to chill out/to do sth wrong/a friend
translation: I used to complain to my colleagues every time they did something wrong, but I chilled out.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Gdzie jest dokument, o który cię prosiłem? Powiedziałeś, że go wydrukujesz.
english: Where's the document I asked you for? You said you'd print it out.
glossary: to print sth out/to ask sb for sth/a document
translation: Where is the document I asked for? You said that you would print it out.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Jeśli wszystkie moje plany się udadzą, w końcu będę mógł rzucić tę pracę.
english: If all my plans work out, I'll finally be able to give up the job.
glossary: to work out/to be able to do sth/to give up the job
translation: If all my plans work out, I will finally be able to quit this job.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Już wyniosłem śmieci, więc nie musisz mi o tym znów przypominać.
english: I've already taken out the garbage, so you don't have to remind me of it again.
glossary: to take out the garbage/to remind sb of sth
translation: I have just taken out the garbage, so you wouldn’t remind me about that.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Gdybyś się tyle nie wygłupiała, byłabyś traktowana poważniej.
english: If you didn't mess around so much, you would be treated more seriously.
glossary: to mess around/to treat sb seriously
translation: If you didn't fool around so much, you would be taken more seriously.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Kiedy wróciłem ze Stanów, zorientowałem się, że podłapałem amerykański akcent.
english: When I came back from the US, I realized I'd picked up the American accent.
glossary: to pick up the American accent/to come back from the US/to realize that...
translation: When I came back from the US, I noticed that I picked up the American accent.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Ostatni pacjent wiercił się, podczas gdy przeglądałam jego dokumentację.
english: The last patient was fidgeting while I was going through his documentation.
glossary: to go through documentation/to fidget/a patient
translation: The last patient was fidgeting during I went through the documentation.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Szef wyszedł z pokoju, kiedy wciąż kończyliśmy spotkanie.
english: The boss left the room when we were still wrapping up the meeting.
glossary: a boss/to leave a room/to wrap up a meeting
translation: 10.The boss left a room when we were finishing the meeting.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Powinieneś był wcześniej zgasić papierosa. Nie dostałbyś grzywny.
english: You should've put out the cigarette earlier. You wouldn't have gotten a fine.
glossary: to get a fine/to put out a cigarette
translation: 1. The Police said yesterday they tracked down thief.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Nie chce, żebyś się do mnie zwracał o pomoc.
english: I don't want you to turn to me for help.
glossary: to turn to sb for help
translation: 2. Last year you were staying you had to cut down on smoking but you haven’t done it.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Co chcesz sprawdzić w internecie?
english: What do you want to look up on the internet?
glossary: to look sth up on the internet
translation: 3. We will make up for the delay once we have all the necessary materials.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Szef się mnie zapytał wczoraj, czy podejmę się nowej roli.
english: My boss asked me yesterday if I'd take on a new role.
glossary: to take on a role/a boss
translation: 4. I wish you will weigh up the pros and cons.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Nie odpuszczę, dopóki nie przestaniecie zdzierać z ludzi.
english: I won't let go until you stop ripping off people.
glossary: to rip sb off/to let go/people
translation: 5. The daughter promised not to freak out when another storm breaks loose.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Słyszałem kilka dni temu, że ten bank orżnął setki klientów.
english: I heard the other day that the bank had ripped off hundreds of clients.
glossary: the other day/to rip sb off/a client/hundreds of clients/a bank

name: Justina Carson
polish: Czy ty próbujesz zaprosić mnie na randkę?
english: Are you trying to ask me out?

name: Justina Carson
polish: Zacząłeś już zajęcia tańca?
english: Have you taken up dance classes yet?
glossary: to take up dance classes
translation: 8. The judge weighed up all evidences.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Uwierzyłem ci, kiedy mi powiedziałaś, że nie jesteś w nic zamieszana.
english: I believed you when you told me that you weren't mixed up in anything.
glossary: to be mixed up in sth
translation: 9. How many parts does the project consist of?

name: Justina Carson
polish: Dlaczego odwołałeś ostatnie spotkanie?
english: Why did you call off the last meeting?
glossary: to call off a meeting
translation: 10. Why do you cut down on meat? Its healthy.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Przyzwyczaisz się do rozgrzewania się przed treningiem.
english: You'll get used to warming up before a workout.
glossary: to warm up/a workout/to get used to doing sth
translation: 1. You wouldn’t piss me off, if you didn’t mess with me.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Kiedyś zalegałem z rachunkami, bo byłem bezrobotny.
english: I used to fall behind with my bills because I was unemployed.
glossary: to be unemployed/to fall behind with your bills
translation: 2. If you didn't get pissed off that often, kids wouldn't be afraid of you.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Boję się rzucić studia. Co powiedzą rodzice?
english: I'm afraid of dropping out of college. What will my parents say?
glossary: to drop out of college/to say sth
translation: 3. We are not interested in taking over the company.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Przeprowadzałem doświadczenie, gdy student wszedł do laboratorium.
english: I was carrying out an experiment when a student entered the lab.
glossary: a lab/a student/to carry out an experiment
translation: 4. My kids used to like to dress up, but they've grown up

name: Justina Carson
polish: Gdybyś nie zagadał do tej dziewczyny, nie dostałbyś kosza.
english: If you hadn't chatted up the girl, you wouldn't have been turned down.
