translation: 5.My team has to get used to ending meetings quicker.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Przekładasz spotkanie od kilku tygodni. O co chodzi?
english: You've been putting off the meeting for a few weeks. What's going on?
glossary: to put off a meeting
translation: 6. I have been cutting down my drinking for a long time. That's why I feel better.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Nasza firma zwolniła w zeszłym tygodniu kilku pracowników, ponieważ wystawili fałszywe faktury.
english: Our company laid off a few employees last week because they'd made out fake invoices.
glossary: an employee/a company/a fake invoice/to make out an invoice
translation: 7. If the pain doesn’t go away I will go to the doctor.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Zrelaksujesz się, jeśli weźmiesz kąpiel.
english: You'll wind down if you take a bath.
glossary: to take a bath/to wind down
translation: 8.You have issued three invoices so far.  You need to hurry up.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Na szczęście przeszliśmy już przez formalności.
english: Fortunately, we've already gone through formalities.
glossary: to go through formalities/Fortunately...
translation: 9. When I proposed a better plan, the previous one was approved.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Wyglądałabym młodziej, gdybym codziennie nakładała krem.
english: I'd look younger if I put on cream every day.
glossary: to look young/to put on cream
translation: 10. My aunt was making a will when she died.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Przepraszam. Musiałem coś pomieszać, kiedy wystawiałem dla pana fakturę.
english: I'm sorry. I must've mixed something up when making out the invoice for you.
glossary: to make out an invoice/to mix sth up/to be sorry
translation: 1. I’m sorry. I had to mix something up when I was making out an invoice for you.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Powinnam była zwrócić się do ciebie o pomoc, kiedy jeszcze nie było za późno.
english: I should've turned to you for help when it wasn't too late yet.
glossary: to turn to sb for help
translation: 2. I should’ve turned to you for help when it wasn’t too late yet.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Kiedy dotarłam na imprezę, koleżanki spytały mnie, dlaczego się nie przebrałam.
english: When I got to the party, my friends asked me why I hadn't dressed up.
glossary: to dress up/to get to a party
translation: 3. When I got to the party, friends asked me why I hadn’t dressed up.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Czy ty musisz zagadywać do każdej dziewczyny, którą spotykasz?
english: Do you have to chat up every girl you meet?
glossary: to chat up a girl
translation: 4. Do you have to chat up every girl you meet?

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Chcę, żebyś w końcu przezwyciężył stres i skoncentrował się na projekcie.
english: I want you to finally get over the stress and concentrate on the project.
glossary: to get over a difficulty/to concentrate on sth/to want sb to do sth
translation: 5. I want you to finally get over the stress and focus on the project.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Dlaczego znalazłeś wymówkę, zamiast powiedzieć mi, że jesteś zmęczony?
english: Why did you come up with an excuse instead of telling me you were tired?
glossary: to come up with an excuse/instead of sth/to do sth simply
translation: 6. Why did you find an excuse instead of telling me that you were tired?

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Kiedy byliśmy dziećmi, mój młodszy brat mówił, że patrzę na niego z góry.
english: When we were kids, my younger brother said I looked down on him.
glossary: to look down on sb/a younger brother
translation: 7. When we were kids, my younger brother said that I looked down on him.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Dlaczego wszystko, co robisz, zawsze wychodzi?
english: Why does everything you do always work out?
glossary: to work out
translation: 8. Why does everything you do always work out?

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Wypiłaś już herbatę? Naprawdę musimy się spieszyć.
english: Have you drunk up your tea yet? We really need to hurry up.
glossary: to drink sth up/to hurry up
translation: 9. Have you already drunk up the tea? We really need to hurry.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Za każdym razem, gdy czuję, że jestem obserwowana, panikuję.
english: Every time I feel that I'm being watched, I freak out.
glossary: to freak out/Every time.../to be watched
translation: 10. Every time I feel I’m watched, I freak out.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Przebrnę przez całą tę papierkową robotę, jak tylko będę w odpowiednim nastroju.
english: I'll go through all the paperwork once I'm in the right mood.
glossary: to go through paperwork
translation: 1. I’ll go through all the paperwork once I’d be in the right mood.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Kim jest ta dziewczyna, która dziś zastępuje sekretarkę menedżera? Nigdy wcześniej jej nie widziałam.
english: Who's the girl that's covering for the manager's secretary today? I've never seen her before.
glossary: to cover for sb/a secretary/a manager/to see sb
translation: 2. Who is that girl who covers up for the manager’s secretary? I’ve never seen her before.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Wiem, że jesteś bombardowana nowymi informacjami, ale wyluzuj. To nie aż tak skomplikowane.
english: I know you're being bombarded with new information, but chill out. It's not that complicated.
glossary: to chill out/to be bombarded with information/to be complicated
translation: 3. I know that you’re bombarded with information, but chill out. It’s not so complicated.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Powiedziałam szefowi, że to szkoda, że umniejszył znaczeniu moich wysiłków.
english: I told my boss it was a shame he'd played down the significance of my efforts.
glossary: to play down the significance of sth/It's a shame that.../a boss/an effort
translation: 4. I told my boss It was a shame that he played down the significance of my effort.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Wiem, że jest późno. Dlatego postaram się zakończyć spotkanie najszybciej, jak to możliwe.
english: I know it's late. That's why I'll try to wrap the meeting up as quickly as possible.
glossary: to wrap up a meeting/to be late/as quickly as possible
translation: 5. I know it’s late. That’s why I’ll try to wrap up the meeting as quickly as possible.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Kiedy rozglądałam się po sklepie, sprzedawczyni spytała mnie, czy potrzebuję pomocy.
english: When I was looking around in the shop, the assistant asked me if I needed help.
glossary: to look around/an assistant/to need help
translation: 6. When I looked around the shop, the saleswoman asked me if I need some help.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Czy wydrukowałeś wszystkie strony? Myślę, że niektórych brakuje.
english: Did you print all of the pages out? I think some of them are missing.
glossary: to print sth out/a page/to be missing
translation: 7. Did you print out all the pages? I think some are missing.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Nie bądź tak pesymistyczna. Rozważyłaś już wszystkie możliwe opcje?
english: Don't be so pessimistic. Have you weighed up all the possible options yet?
glossary: to weigh up the options/to be pessimistic/an option/to be possible
translation: 8. Don’t be so pessimistic. Have you already weighed up all the options?

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Poczujesz się lepiej po treningu, kiedy się odświeżysz.
english: You'll feel better after the workout when you freshen up.
glossary: to freshen up/to feel better/a workout
translation: 9. You’ll feel better after a workout when you freshen up.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Mimo że mój szef wie, że nie znoszę papierkowej roboty, chce, żebym przeglądała dokumenty.
english: Although my boss knows I hate paperwork, he wants me to go over documents.
glossary: to go over a document/Although.../to hate paperwork
translation: 10. Although my boss knows that I hate paperwork, he wants me to go through documents.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Kiedy ostatnio się widziałyśmy, moja najlepsza przyjaciółka powiedziała mi, że zerwie ze swoim chłopakiem
english: The last time we met, my best friend told me she'd break up with her boyfriend.
glossary: your best friend/to break up with sb/a boyfriend
translation: 1.	When we saw last time, my best friend told me that she would break up with her boyfriend.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Nie sądzę, że przyzwyczaję się do noszenia sukienek. Czuję, że za bardzo się wyróżniam.
english: I don't think I'll get used to wearing dresses. I feel I stand out too much.
glossary: to stand out/to wear a dress
translation: 2.	I don’t think that I’ll used to wearing dresses. I feel that I stand out too much.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Może podjęłabyś lepszą decyzję, gdybyś rozważyła wszystkie czynniki.
english: Maybe you would've made a better decision if you'd weighed up all the factors.
glossary: to weigh up factors/to make a decision
translation: 3.	Maybe you would have taken a better decision if you had weighed up all the factors.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Obudź się! Nie słyszysz, że właśnie zadzwonił budzik?
english: Wake up! Can't you hear the alarm has just gone off?
glossary: to go off/to set an alarm/to wake up/to hear sth
translation: 4.	Wake up! Don’t you hear that the alarm clock has just rung?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Spotkanie ciągnęło się jeszcze przez godzinę po tym, jak wyszedłeś.
english: The meeting still dragged on for an hour after you'd left.
glossary: to drag on/to leave
translation: 5.	The meeting dragged on for an hour yet after you had left.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Już cię raz kryłem. Nie zrobię tego ponownie.
english: I've covered up for you once. I won't do it again.
glossary: to cover up for sb
translation: 6.	I’ve already covered you once. I won’t do this again.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Przyzwyczaiłem się, że żona narzeka na pracę, kiedy poruszam ten temat.
english: I got used to my wife complaining about her job every time I bring up the subject.
glossary: to bring up a subject/to complain about your job/a wife
translation: 7.	I got used to my wife complaining about her job when I bring out this subject.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Gdybyś ograniczył palenie, byłbyś zdrowszy.
english: If you cut down on smoking, you'd be more healthy.
glossary: to cut down on smoking/to be healthy
translation: 8.	If you cut down on smoking, you would be more healthy.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Zmieniłaś się. Kiedyś stawałaś w obronie swoich zasad.
english: You've changed. You used to stand up for your principles.
glossary: to stand up for your principles/to change
translation: 9.	You’ve changed. You used to stand up for your rules.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Ostatnio musiałem odwołać tyle spotkań, że moi klienci zaczynają narzekać.
english: I've recently had to call off so many meetings that my clients are starting to complain.
glossary: to call off a meeting/to complain about sth/to start to do sth; to begin to do sth/a client
translation: 10.	I’ve had to call off so many meetings recently that my clients are starting to complain.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Jeśli teraz pozbędziesz się formalności, zaoszczędzisz dużo czasu.
english: If you do away with formalities now, you'll save a lot of time.
glossary: to do away with formalities/to save time
translation: 1.	If you do away with formalities now, you will save a lot of time.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Gdybyś nie dała kosza swojemu dziwnemu koledze z pracy, byłabyś teraz w toksycznej relacji.
english: If you hadn't turned your weird colleague down, you would be in a toxic relationship now.
glossary: to turn sb down/to be in a toxic relationship
translation: 2.	If you hadn’t turned your colleague from work down, you would be in a toxic relationship now.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Kiedyś skarżyłem na moich kolegów za każdym razem, kiedy zrobili coś złego, ale wyluzowałem.
english: I used to tell on my friends every time they did something wrong, but I chilled out.
glossary: to tell on sb/to chill out/to do sth wrong/a friend
translation: 3.	I used to complain about my friends each time when they did something wrong, but I chilled out.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Gdzie jest dokument, o który cię prosiłem? Powiedziałeś, że go wydrukujesz.
english: Where's the document I asked you for? You said you'd print it out.
glossary: to print sth out/to ask sb for sth/a document
translation: 4.	Where is the document I asked you for? You said that you would print it out.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Jeśli wszystkie moje plany się udadzą, w końcu będę mógł rzucić tę pracę.
english: If all my plans work out, I'll finally be able to give up the job.
glossary: to work out/to be able to do sth/to give up the job
translation: 5.	If all my plans go right, I’ll eventually can give up this job.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Już wyniosłem śmieci, więc nie musisz mi o tym znów przypominać.
english: I've already taken out the garbage, so you don't have to remind me of it again.
glossary: to take out the garbage/to remind sb of sth
translation: 6.	I’ve already taken out the garbage, so you don’t have to remind me of it again.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Gdybyś się tyle nie wygłupiała, byłabyś traktowana poważniej.
english: If you didn't mess around so much, you would be treated more seriously.
glossary: to mess around/to treat sb seriously
translation: 7.	If you didn’t mess around so much, you would be treated more seriously.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Kiedy wróciłem ze Stanów, zorientowałem się, że podłapałem amerykański akcent.
english: When I came back from the US, I realized I'd picked up the American accent.
glossary: to pick up the American accent/to come back from the US/to realize that...
translation: 8.	When I came back from the US, I realized that I had picked up the American accent.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Ostatni pacjent wiercił się, podczas gdy przeglądałam jego dokumentację.
english: The last patient was fidgeting while I was going through his documentation.
glossary: to go through documentation/to fidget/a patient
translation: 9.	The last patient was fidgeting while I was going through his documentation.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Szef wyszedł z pokoju, kiedy wciąż kończyliśmy spotkanie.
english: The boss left the room when we were still wrapping up the meeting.
glossary: a boss/to leave a room/to wrap up a meeting
translation: 10.	The boss left the room when we were still finishing the meeting.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Przepraszam. Musiałem coś pomieszać, kiedy wystawiałem dla pana fakturę.
english: I'm sorry. I must've mixed something up when making out the invoice for you.
glossary: to make out an invoice/to mix sth up/to be sorry
translation: I'm sorry. I must have mixed something up when I made out an invoice for you.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Powinnam była zwrócić się do ciebie o pomoc, kiedy jeszcze nie było za późno.
english: I should've turned to you for help when it wasn't too late yet.
glossary: to turn to sb for help
translation: I should have turned to you for help when it wasn't too late.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Kiedy dotarłam na imprezę, koleżanki spytały mnie, dlaczego się nie przebrałam.
english: When I got to the party, my friends asked me why I hadn't dressed up.
glossary: to dress up/to get to a party
translation: When I showed up at the party, my friends asked me why I didn't dress up?

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Czy ty musisz zagadywać do każdej dziewczyny, którą spotykasz?
english: Do you have to chat up every girl you meet?
glossary: to chat up a girl
translation: Do you have to chat up to every girl you meet?

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Chcę, żebyś w końcu przezwyciężył stres i skoncentrował się na projekcie.
english: I want you to finally get over the stress and concentrate on the project.
glossary: to get over a difficulty/to concentrate on sth/to want sb to do sth
translation: I want you to finally get over the stress and focus on the project.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Dlaczego znalazłeś wymówkę, zamiast powiedzieć mi, że jesteś zmęczony?
english: Why did you come up with an excuse instead of telling me you were tired?
glossary: to come up with an excuse/instead of sth/to do sth simply
translation: Why did you find an excuse instead of you telling me that you were tired?

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Kiedy byliśmy dziećmi, mój młodszy brat mówił, że patrzę na niego z góry.
english: When we were kids, my younger brother said I looked down on him.
glossary: to look down on sb/a younger brother
translation: When we were kids, my younger brother used to say that I looked down on him.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Dlaczego wszystko, co robisz, zawsze wychodzi?
english: Why does everything you do always work out?
glossary: to work out
translation: Why does everything you make always make out?

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Wypiłaś już herbatę? Naprawdę musimy się spieszyć.
english: Have you drunk up your tea yet? We really need to hurry up.
glossary: to drink sth up/to hurry up
translation: Have you already drunk your tea? Really, we need to hurry up.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Za każdym razem, gdy czuję, że jestem obserwowana, panikuję.
english: Every time I feel that I'm being watched, I freak out.
glossary: to freak out/Every time.../to be watched
translation: Every time when I fell watched, I freak out.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Przebrnę przez całą tę papierkową robotę, jak tylko będę w odpowiednim nastroju.
english: I'll go through all the paperwork once I'm in the right mood.
glossary: to go through paperwork
translation: I'll get through all the paperwork as soon as I'm in the right mood.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Kim jest ta dziewczyna, która dziś zastępuje sekretarkę menedżera? Nigdy wcześniej jej nie widziałam.
english: Who's the girl that's covering for the manager's secretary today? I've never seen her before.
glossary: to cover for sb/a secretary/a manager/to see sb
translation: Who’s that girl who is covering for the boss’s secretary today? I haven’t seen her before.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Wiem, że jesteś bombardowana nowymi informacjami, ale wyluzuj. To nie aż tak skomplikowane.
english: I know you're being bombarded with new information, but chill out. It's not that complicated.
glossary: to chill out/to be bombarded with information/to be complicated
translation: I know that you are bombarded with new information but chill out. It's not that complicated.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Powiedziałam szefowi, że to szkoda, że umniejszył znaczeniu moich wysiłków.
english: I told my boss it was a shame he'd played down the significance of my efforts.
glossary: to play down the significance of sth/It's a shame that.../a boss/an effort
translation: I told my boss that it was a shame that he played down the significance of my efforts.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Wiem, że jest późno. Dlatego postaram się zakończyć spotkanie najszybciej, jak to możliwe.
english: I know it's late. That's why I'll try to wrap the meeting up as quickly as possible.
glossary: to wrap up a meeting/to be late/as quickly as possible
translation: I know it's late. That's why I will try to end the meeting as soon as possible.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Kiedy rozglądałam się po sklepie, sprzedawczyni spytała mnie, czy potrzebuję pomocy.
english: When I was looking around in the shop, the assistant asked me if I needed help.
glossary: to look around/an assistant/to need help
translation: When I was looking around the store, the saleswoman asked me if I needed help.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Czy wydrukowałeś wszystkie strony? Myślę, że niektórych brakuje.
english: Did you print all of the pages out? I think some of them are missing.
glossary: to print sth out/a page/to be missing
translation: Did you print all the pages? I think some are missing.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Nie bądź tak pesymistyczna. Rozważyłaś już wszystkie możliwe opcje?
english: Don't be so pessimistic. Have you weighed up all the possible options yet?
glossary: to weigh up the options/to be pessimistic/an option/to be possible
translation: Don't be so pessimistic. Did you weigh up all the options?

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Poczujesz się lepiej po treningu, kiedy się odświeżysz.

glossary: to freshen up/to feel better/a workout
translation: You'll feel better after your workout when you freshen up.

english: Although my boss knows I hate paperwork, he wants me to go over documents.
glossary: to go over a document/Although.../to hate paperwork
translation: 10. Although my boss know that I hate paperwork he want me to go through documentation.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Nie wkurzyłbyś mnie, gdybyś ze mną nie zadzierał.
english: You wouldn't have pissed me off if you hadn't messed with me.
glossary: to mess with sb/to piss sb off
translation: 1. You wouldn’t piss me off, if you didn’t mess with me.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Gdybyś tak często się nie wkurzał, dzeciaki by się ciebie nie bały.
english: If you weren't pissed off so often, the kids wouldn't be afraid of you.
glossary: to be afraid of sb/to be pissed off/a kid
translation: 2. If you didn't get pissed off that often, kids wouldn't be afraid of you.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Nie jesteśmy zainteresowani przejęciem tej firmy.
english: We're not interested in taking over the company.
glossary: to take over a company
translation: 3. We are not interested in taking over the company.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Kiedyś moje dzieciaki lubiły się przebierać, ale dorosły.
english: My kids used to like dressing up, but they grew up.
glossary: to dress up/to like doing sth/a kid/to grow up
translation: 4. My kids used to like to dress up, but they've grown up

name: Justina Carson
polish: Mój zespół musi przyzwyczaić się do kończenia spotkań szybciej.
english: My team has to get used to wrapping up meetings more quickly.
glossary: to wrap sth up/to wrap up a meeting/to get used to doing sth/a meeting
translation: 5.My team has to get used to ending meetings quicker.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Od dłuższego czasu ograniczam picie. Dlatego czuję się lepiej.
english: I've been cutting down on drinking for a long time. That's why I feel better.
glossary: to feel good/to cut down on drinking
translation: 6. I have been cutting down my drinking for a long time. That's why I feel better.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Jeśli ból nie ustąpi, pójdę do lekarza.
english: If the pain doesn't go away, I'll go to the doctor.
glossary: to go away {2}/to go to the doctor
translation: 7. If the pain doesn’t go away I will go to the doctor.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Wystawiłeś jak dotąd trzy faktury. Musisz się pospieszyć.
english: You've made out three invoices so far. You have to hurry up.
glossary: to hurry up/to make out an invoice
translation: .You have issued three invoices so far.  You need to hurry up.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Kiedy zaproponowałem lepszy plan, poprzedni został już zaakceptowany.
english: When I put forward a better plan, the previous one had already been accepted.
glossary: to accept sth/to put forward a plan
translation: 9. When I proposed a better plan, the previous one was approved.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Moja ciotka sporządzała testament, kiedy zmarła.
english: My aunt was making her will when she died.
glossary: to carry out your will/to make your will/to die
translation: 10. My aunt was making a will when she died.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Policja twierdziła wczoraj, że wytropiła złodzieja.
english: The police stated yesterday that they'd tracked down the thief.
glossary: to track down a thief
translation: 1. The Police said yesterday they tracked down thief.

name: Justina Carson
polish: W zeszłym roku mówiłaś, że musisz ograniczyć palenie, ale tego nie zrobiłaś.
english: You said last year that you had to cut down on smoking, but you didn't.
glossary: to cut down on smoking/last year
translation: 2. Last year you were staying you had to cut down on smoking but you haven’t done it.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Nadrobimy opóźnienie, jak już dostaniemy wszystkie niezbędne materiały.
english: We'll make up for the delay once we get all the necessary materials.
glossary: the necessary materials/to make up for a delay
translation: 3. We will make up for the delay once we have all the necessary materials.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Chciałbym, żebyś rozważył wszystkie za i przeciw.
english: I'd like you to weigh up all the pros and cons.
glossary: to weigh up the pros and cons
translation: 4. I wish you will weigh up the pros and cons.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Córka obiecała, że nie będzie panikować, kiedy rozpęta się kolejna burza.
english: My daughter promised she wouldn't freak out when the next storm breaks out.
glossary: to break out/to freak out/a daughter
translation: 5. The daughter promised not to freak out when another storm breaks loose.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Dlaczego nie broniłeś swoich interesów, gdy właściel mieszkania próbował cię orżnąć?
english: Why didn't you stand up for your interests when the apartment owner was trying to rip you off?
glossary: to rip sb off/an apartment owner/to stand up for your interests
translation: 6. Why didn't you defend your interests when the landlord tried to rape you?

name: Justina Carson
polish: Nie powinnaś była wchodzić mi w drogę.

polish: Klient by nie zrezygnował, gdybyśmy spełnili jego oczekiwania.
english: The client wouldn't have resigned if we'd lived up to his expectations.
glossary: to live up to sb's expectations/a client/to resign from sth
translation: The client wouldn’t have resigned if we had lived up to his expectations.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Powiedziałam ci ostatnim razem, że nie będę cię więcej znosić.
english: I told you last time I wouldn't put up with you anymore.
glossary: to put up with sb/last time
translation: I told you last time that I wouldn't put up with you again.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Przepraszam. Musiałem coś pomieszać, kiedy wystawiałem dla pana fakturę.
english: I'm sorry. I must've mixed something up when making out the invoice for you.
glossary: to make out an invoice/to mix sth up/to be sorry
translation: 1. I’m sorry. I had to mix something up when I was issuing the invoice.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Powinnam była zwrócić się do ciebie o pomoc, kiedy jeszcze nie było za późno.
english: I should've turned to you for help when it wasn't too late yet.
glossary: to turn to sb for help
translation: 2. I shouldn’ve turned to you for help when it hadn’t been too late yet.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Kiedy dotarłam na imprezę, koleżanki spytały mnie, dlaczego się nie przebrałam.
english: When I got to the party, my friends asked me why I hadn't dressed up.
glossary: to dress up/to get to a party
translation: 3. When I got to the party, my friends asked me why I hadn’t dressed up.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Czy ty musisz zagadywać do każdej dziewczyny, którą spotykasz?
english: Do you have to chat up every girl you meet?
glossary: to chat up a girl
translation: 4. Do you have to chat up every girl you meet?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Chcę, żebyś w końcu przezwyciężył stres i skoncentrował się na projekcie.
english: I want you to finally get over the stress and concentrate on the project.
glossary: to get over a difficulty/to concentrate on sth/to want sb to do sth
translation: 5. I want you to get over stress finally and concretate on the project.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Dlaczego znalazłeś wymówkę, zamiast powiedzieć mi, że jesteś zmęczony?
english: Why did you come up with an excuse instead of telling me you were tired?
glossary: to come up with an excuse/instead of sth/to do sth simply
translation: 6. Why did you find an excuse insted of telling me that you were tired?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Kiedy byliśmy dziećmi, mój młodszy brat mówił, że patrzę na niego z góry.
english: When we were kids, my younger brother said I looked down on him.
glossary: to look down on sb/a younger brother
translation: 7. When we were kids, my younger brother said that I looked down on him.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Dlaczego wszystko, co robisz, zawsze wychodzi?
english: Why does everything you do always work out?
glossary: to work out
translation: 8. Why does everything you do always go right?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Wypiłaś już herbatę? Naprawdę musimy się spieszyć.
english: Have you drunk up your tea yet? We really need to hurry up.
glossary: to drink sth up/to hurry up
translation: 9. Have you already drunk your tea? We really have to hurry up.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Za każdym razem, gdy czuję, że jestem obserwowana, panikuję.
english: Every time I feel that I'm being watched, I freak out.
glossary: to freak out/Every time.../to be watched
translation: 10. Each time when I feel being observed, I’m in panic.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Przebrnę przez całą tę papierkową robotę, jak tylko będę w odpowiednim nastroju.
english: I'll go through all the paperwork once I'm in the right mood.
glossary: to go through paperwork
translation: 1. I’ll go into all this paper work once I’m in a good mood.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Kim jest ta dziewczyna, która dziś zastępuje sekretarkę menedżera? Nigdy wcześniej jej nie widziałam.
english: Who's the girl that's covering for the manager's secretary today? I've never seen her before.
glossary: to cover for sb/a secretary/a manager/to see sb
translation: 2. Who is the girl covering for the manager’s secretary today? I’ve never seen her before.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Wiem, że jesteś bombardowana nowymi informacjami, ale wyluzuj. To nie aż tak skomplikowane.
english: I know you're being bombarded with new information, but chill out. It's not that complicated.
glossary: to chill out/to be bombarded with information/to be complicated
translation: 3. I know that you’re being bombarded new information but chill out. This isn’t so complicated.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Powiedziałam szefowi, że to szkoda, że umniejszył znaczeniu moich wysiłków.
english: I told my boss it was a shame he'd played down the significance of my efforts.
glossary: to play down the significance of sth/It's a shame that.../a boss/an effort
translation: 4. I told my boss that it was a shame that he’d played down the significance of my efforts.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Wiem, że jest późno. Dlatego postaram się zakończyć spotkanie najszybciej, jak to możliwe.
english: I know it's late. That's why I'll try to wrap the meeting up as quickly as possible.
glossary: to wrap up a meeting/to be late/as quickly as possible
translation: 5. I know that it’s late. That’s why I’ll try to finish the meeting as quickly as possible.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Kiedy rozglądałam się po sklepie, sprzedawczyni spytała mnie, czy potrzebuję pomocy.
english: When I was looking around in the shop, the assistant asked me if I needed help.
glossary: to look around/an assistant/to need help
translation: 6. When I was looking around the store, a shop assistant asked me if I needed a help.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Czy wydrukowałeś wszystkie strony? Myślę, że niektórych brakuje.
english: Did you print all of the pages out? I think some of them are missing.
glossary: to print sth out/a page/to be missing
translation: 7. Have you printed all the pages out? I think that some of them are missing.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Nie bądź tak pesymistyczna. Rozważyłaś już wszystkie możliwe opcje?
english: Don't be so pessimistic. Have you weighed up all the possible options yet?
glossary: to weigh up the options/to be pessimistic/an option/to be possible
translation: 8. Don’t be so pessimistic. Have you already weighed up all the possible options?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Poczujesz się lepiej po treningu, kiedy się odświeżysz.
english: You'll feel better after the workout when you freshen up.
glossary: to freshen up/to feel better/a workout
translation: 9. You’ll feel better after the training when you refresh yourself.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Mimo że mój szef wie, że nie znoszę papierkowej roboty, chce, żebym przeglądała dokumenty.
english: Although my boss knows I hate paperwork, he wants me to go over documents.
glossary: to go over a document/Although.../to hate paperwork
translation: 10. Despite that my boss knows that I hate paper work, he wants me to look into the documents.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Dlaczego zalegacie z czynszem? Macie problemy finansowe?
english: Why are you falling behind with the rent? Do you have financial problems?
glossary: to fall behind with the rent/to have financial problems
translation: 1. Why have you fallen behind with the rent? Do you have financial problems?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Nie chciałbym, żeby mój szef opieprzał mnie, gdy inni są wokół.
english: I wouldn't like my boss to tell me off when others are around.
glossary: a boss/to tell sb off/others/to be around
translation: 2. I wouldn’t like my boss to piss my off when others are around.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Nie mogę się przyzwyczaić do zapinania pasów.
english: I can't get used to fastening up.
glossary: to fasten up
translation: 3. I can’t used to fastenning up.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Ostatnim razem, gdy rozmawialiśmy, wspominałeś, że chcesz wstąpić do wojska.
english: The last time we talked, you mentioned you wanted to go into the army.
glossary: to go into the army/to mention sth
translation: 4. Last time when we talked you mentioned that you want to go to the army.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Czy twój asystent wykonuje zadania na czas?
english: Does your assistant carry out tasks on time?
glossary: an assistant/to carry out a task/on time
translation: 5. Does your assistant do errands on time?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Gdybyś przejrzał dokumenty przed spotkaniem, nie spieprzyłbyś prezentacji.
english: If you'd looked over the documents before the meeting, you wouldn't have screwed up the presentation.
glossary: to look over documents/to screw sth up/to screw up a presentation
translation: 6. If you had looked into the documents before the meeting, you wouldn’t have screwed the presentation.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Kiedyś patrzyłem na ludzi z góry, ale się zmieniłem.
english: I used to look down on people, but I changed.
glossary: to look down on sb/to change
translation: 7. I used to looking down on people but I’ve changed.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Odświeżyłem się już. Możemy wychodzić.
english: I've already freshened up. We can leave.
glossary: to freshen up/to leave
translation: 8. I’ve already freshened up. We can leave.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Zapytałem się szefa, dlaczego nie poruszliśmy tematu podwyżki na spotkaniu zespołu.
english: I asked my boss why we hadn't brought up the subject of a pay-raise at the team meeting.
glossary: a boss/to bring up a subject/a pay-raise/a team meeting
translation: 9. I asked my boss why we hadn’t brought about the pay-rise subject during the team’s meeting.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Wiele dokumentów zebrało się na moim biurku, zanim się zorientowałam.
english: Many documents had piled up on my desk before I realized it.
glossary: to pile up/to realize sth/a document/on your desk
translation: 10. Many documents had been gathered on my desk before I realized.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Terroryści próbowali zdetonować bombę kilka razy, zanim powstrzymała ich policja.
english: The terrorists had tried to let off the bomb a few times before the police stopped them.
glossary: the police/to let off a bomb/to stop sb/a few times
translation: Terrorists tried to let off a bomb a few times before the police tracked down them.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Nie mam siły. Dzieciaki mnie już wykończyły.
english: I don't have energy. The kids have already worn me down.
glossary: to wear sb down/a kid/to have energy
translation: I don't have energy. Kids have already finished me off.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Będę czytać dalej, jak już przestaniecie gadać.
english: I'll keep reading once you stop talking.
glossary: to stop talking/to keep reading/last week
translation: I'll keep reading after you guys stop talking.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Kiedyś nie zapinałem pasów, ale to się zmieniło po tym, jak miałem wypadek.
english: I didn't use to fasten up, but it changed after I'd had an accident.
glossary: to have an accident/to fasten up
translation: I used to not wear my seatbelt, but that changed after I have an accident.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Naprawdę byś chciała, żeby ten gość zaprosił cię na randkę?
english: Would you really like the guy to ask you out?
glossary: to ask sb out/a guy
translation: Would you really want this guy to ask you out?

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Jeśli nie przełożymy spotkania, nie uda mi się dotrzeć.
english: If you don't put off the meeting, I won't make it.
glossary: to put off a meeting/to make it to a meeting
translation: If we don't reschedule the meeting, I won't be able to make it to the meeting.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: O której zadzwonił budzik?
english: What time did the alarm go off?
glossary: to go off {2}
translation: What time did the alarm clock ring?

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Szef się pytał w zeszłym tygodniu, czy przebrnęliśmy już przez wszystkie procedury.
english: The boss asked last week if we'd already gone through all the procedures.
glossary: to go through a procedure
translation: The boss asked last week if we had gone through all the procedures.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Dlaczego chcesz odrzucić tę ofertę?
english: Why do you want to turn down the offer?
glossary: to turn down an offer
translation: Why do you want to turn down this offer?

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Dzieciaki się wygłupiały, kiedy weszliśmy do domu.
english: The kids were fooling around when we entered the house.
glossary: to enter the house/a kid/to fool around
translation: The kids were fooling around when we walked into the house.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Podejmiemy się nowego projektu, jak ten będzie gotowy.
english: We'll take on a new project once the one is ready.
glossary: to take on a project/to be ready
translation: 1. We’ll take on a new project when this one is ready.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Zauważyłem błąd, kiedy przeglądałem wczoraj dane.
english: I noticed a mistake when I was going through the data.
glossary: to notice a mistake/to go through data/I've noticed that...
translation: 2. I noticed a mistake when I was looking into the data yesterday.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Czy policja wytropiła już przestępcę?
english: Have the police tracked down the criminal yet?
glossary: to track down a criminal/the police
translation: 3. Has the police already trucked down the criminal?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Powiedziałem ci, że nie będę cię krył.
english: I told you I wouldn't cover up for you.
glossary: to cover for sb
translation: 4. I told you that I wouldn’t cover up for you.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Na twoim miejscu nie rzucałbym szkoły.
english: If I were you, I wouldn't drop out of school.
glossary: to drop out of school
translation: 5. If I were you, I wouldn’t drop out of school.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Dlaczego zacząłeś zajmować się polityką?
english: Why did you go into politics?
glossary: to go into politics
translation: 6. Why did you go into politics?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Jeśli nie wystawisz mi rachunku, zgłoszę to.
english: If you don't make out a bill for me, I'll report it.
glossary: to make out a bill/to report sth
translation: 7. If you don’t make me out the bill, I’ll report it.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Kiedy ten pomysł został zaproponowany?
english: When was the idea put forward?
glossary: to put forward an idea

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Jestem zmęczona, bo właśnie ćwiczyłam.
english: I'm tired because I've just worked out.
glossary: to be tired/to work out
translation: 9. I’m tired because I’ve just worked out.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Powinnaś była odrzucić zaproszenie na ślub swojego byłego męża.
english: You should've turned down the invitation to your ex-husband's wedding.
glossary: an invitation to a wedding/to turn down an invitation/an ex-husband
translation: 10. You should’ve turned down the invitation to your exhusband’s wedding?

name: Jacob Brewer

name: Adam Hunt

english: My mother-in-law called me yesterday.

translation: 5. The mother in law was calling me yesterday.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Nie możesz wychodzić z łóżka. Masz grypę.
english: You can't get out of bed. You have the flu.
glossary: to have the flu/to get out of bed
translation: 6. You can’t get out of bed. You have a flu.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Myślałem, że wpadniesz jutro i napijemy się piwa.
english: I thought you'd drop by tomorrow and we'd drink beer.
glossary: to drop by/to drink beer
translation: 7. I thought you dropped by tomorrow and we would drink a beer.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Mąż odbiera jutro dzieci ze szkoły.
english: My husband's picking up the kids from school tomorrow.
glossary: to pick up the kids from school
translation: 8. My husband is picking up kids tomorrow.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Jutro omawiamy bieżące problemy na spotkaniu.
english: We're discussing the current problems at the meeting tomorrow.
glossary: to discuss sth/the current problems/at the meeting
translation: 9. Tomorrow at the meeting I will discuss current problems.

name: Justina Carson
polish: Gdzie jedziesz w tym roku na wakacje?
english: Where are you going on vacation this year?
glossary: to go on vacation/this year
translation: 10. Where are you going on the holiday this year?

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Policja przyjechała na miejsce zbrodni po tym, jak właściciel sklepu zastrzelił złodzieja.
english: The police came to the crime scene after the store owner had shot down a thief.
glossary: to come to a crime scene/to shoot sb down/a store owner/a thief
translation: The police came to the crime scene when the shop owner shut the thief down.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Na szczęscie syn przyzwyczaił się do wynoszenia śmieci.
english: Fortunately, my son got used to taking out the garbage.
glossary: Fortunately.../a son/to take out the garbage
translation: Fortunately, my son got used to taking out the garbage.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Rodzice pytali mnie, dlaczego chcesz rzucić studia.
english: My parents asked me why you wanted to drop out of college.
glossary: to drop out of college
translation: My parents asked me why you wanted to drop out the college.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Powiedziałem ci, że przyprawy uwydatnią smak potrawy.
english: I told you the spices would bring out the flavor of the dish.
glossary: to bring out the flavor/a dish/spices
translation: I told you that spices bring out the flavor of a dish.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Dlaczego bierzesz pożyczkę?
english: Why are you taking out a loan?
glossary: to take out a loan
translation: Why do you take out the loan?

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Wykład by się nie ciągnął, gdybyś nie zadawał głupich pytań.
english: The lecture wouldn't have dragged on if you hadn't asked stupid questions.
glossary: to ask stupid questions/to drag on/a lecture
translation: The lecture wouldn't have dragged on if you hadn't asked stupid questions.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Samolot odlatywał, kiedy pojawiliśmy się na lotnisku.
english: The plane was taking off when we showed up at the airport.
glossary: to take off/to show up at the airport
translation: The plane was taking off when we showed up at the airport.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Nie chciałbym, żebyś popadł w nawyk.
english: I wouldn't like you to fall into addiction.
glossary: to fall into addiction
translation: I wouldn’t want you to form a habit.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Zarząd mnie pytał, dlaczego zmiany nie przyniosły sukcesu.
english: The management board asked me why the changes hadn't brought about success.
glossary: to bring about success/the management board/a change
translation: The management board asked why changes hadn't brought about success.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Wydrukowałem już wypracowanie.
english: I've already printed out the essay.
glossary: to print out an essay
translation: I have printed out an essay already.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Jak ty znosisz swojego chłopaka?
english: How do you put up with your boyfriend?
glossary: to put up with sb
translation: How do you put up with your boyfriend?

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Muszę wychodzić. Mogłam nałożyć wcześniej krem.

glossary: to put on cream/to leave
translation: I need to leave. I should have put on cream earlier.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Zapomniałeś już o swojej byłej?

glossary: to get over sb/an ex

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Dzięki za podgrzanie jedzenia.

translation: Thanks for heating up the food

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Nie dostanę stypendium, jeśli uczelnia odrzuci mój wniosek.

glossary: to get a scholarship/to turn down an application
translation: I won't get a scholarship if the college turns down my application.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Moje rzeczy zajmowały niegdyś więcej miejsca.

glossary: to take up space/your stuff
translation: My stuff took up more space.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Dlaczego pogodziłaś się ze swoim byłym?
english: Why did you make up with your ex?

translation: Why did you make up with your ex?

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Właśnie odjechaliśmy.

glossary: to drive off

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Dalej czytałbym książkę, gdybym nie był zmęczony.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Nadrobimy stracony czas, jak już weźmiesz się do pracy.

translation: We'll make up for lost time once you get to work.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Jeśli teraz pozbędziesz się formalności, zaoszczędzisz dużo czasu.
english: If you do away with formalities now, you'll save a lot of time.
glossary: to do away with formalities/to save time
translation: 1. If you get rid of the paperwork now, you'll save a lot of time.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Gdybyś nie dała kosza swojemu dziwnemu koledze z pracy, byłabyś teraz w toksycznej relacji.
english: If you hadn't turned your weird colleague down, you would be in a toxic relationship now.
glossary: to turn sb down/to be in a toxic relationship
translation: 2. 2) If you ……………………., you'd be in a toxic relationship right now.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Kiedyś skarżyłem na moich kolegów za każdym razem, kiedy zrobili coś złego, ale wyluzowałem.
english: I used to tell on my friends every time they did something wrong, but I chilled out.
glossary: to tell on sb/to chill out/to do sth wrong/a friend
translation: 3. 3) I used to complain about my colleagues every time they did something wrong, but I …….

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Gdzie jest dokument, o który cię prosiłem? Powiedziałeś, że go wydrukujesz.
english: Where's the document I asked you for? You said you'd print it out.
glossary: to print sth out/to ask sb for sth/a document
translation: 4. 4. Where is the document I asked you for? You said you would print it.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Jeśli wszystkie moje plany się udadzą, w końcu będę mógł rzucić tę pracę.
english: If all my plans work out, I'll finally be able to give up the job.
glossary: to work out/to be able to do sth/to give up the job
translation: 5. 5) If all my plans work out, I can finally quit this job.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Już wyniosłem śmieci, więc nie musisz mi o tym znów przypominać.
english: I've already taken out the garbage, so you don't have to remind me of it again.
glossary: to take out the garbage/to remind sb of sth
translation: 6. 6) I’ve already taken out the trash, so you don't have to remind me again.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Gdybyś się tyle nie wygłupiała, byłabyś traktowana poważniej.
english: If you didn't mess around so much, you would be treated more seriously.
glossary: to mess around/to treat sb seriously

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Kiedy wróciłem ze Stanów, zorientowałem się, że podłapałem amerykański akcent.
english: When I came back from the US, I realized I'd picked up the American accent.
glossary: to pick up the American accent/to come back from the US/to realize that...
translation: 8. 8) When I came back from the States, I realized I …………..American accent.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Ostatni pacjent wiercił się, podczas gdy przeglądałam jego dokumentację.
english: The last patient was fidgeting while I was going through his documentation.
glossary: to go through documentation/to fidget/a patient

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Szef wyszedł z pokoju, kiedy wciąż kończyliśmy spotkanie.
english: The boss left the room when we were still wrapping up the meeting.
glossary: a boss/to leave a room/to wrap up a meeting
translation: 10. 10) The boss left the room while we were still finishing the meeting.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Zbyt długo zadzierasz ze mną.
english: You've been messing with me for too long.
glossary: to mess with sb
translation: 1. You've been messing with me for too long.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Nigdy nie przyzwyczaję się do zwalniania pracowników.
english: I'll never get used to laying off employees.
glossary: to lay sb off/an employee/to get used to doing sth
translation: 2. I'll never get used to laying employees off.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Powiedz szefowi, co zrobiłeś, bo jestem już zmęczona kryciem ciebie.
english: Tell the boss what you've done because I'm already tired of covering up for you.
glossary: a boss/to be tired of sth/to cover for sb
translation: 3. Tell the boss what have you done because I've already tired to cover up for you.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Twój wniosek nie zostałbym odrzucony, gdybyś złożył go na czas.
english: Your application wouldn't have been turned down if you'd submitted it on time.
glossary: on time/to submit an application/to turn down an application
translation: 4. Your apllication wouldn't have turned down if you had submited it on time.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Szybciej znajdziesz nowego pracownika, jeśli zawęzisz listę kandydatów.
english: You'll find a new employee more quickly if you narrow down the pool of candidates.
glossary: a pool of candidates/to narrow sth down/to narrow down a pool of candidates/an employee
translation: 5. You'll find a new employee faster if you narrow down a pool of candidates.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Ten hotel spełniał kiedyś wszystkie standardy.
english: The hotel used to live up to all the standards.
glossary: to live up to sb's standards/a hotel
translation: 6. The hotel used to live up to all the standards.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Nie musiałbym tak często sprzątać, gdybyś codziennie nie gościł swoich znajomych.
english: You wouldn't have to clean up so often if you didn't have your friends over every day.
glossary: to have sb over/to have your friends over/to clean up
translation: 7. I wouldn't clean up as often if you didn't have your's friend over everyday.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Spełniłem już wszystkie twoje oczekiwania. Czego jeszcze chcesz?
english: I've already lived up to all your expectations. What else do you want?
glossary: to live up to sb's expectations
translation: 8. I've already lived up to your's expectations. What else do you want?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Zginęła wczoraj jedna osoba po tym, jak na ulicy wybuchła bomba.
english: One person died yesterday after a bomb had gone off on the street.
glossary: on the street/to go off/a bomb
translation: 9. One person died yeterday after the bomb had gone off on the street.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Analizowałem raport, gdy mi przeszkodziłaś.
english: I was looking into a report when you interrupted me.
glossary: to interrupt sb/to look into a report
translation: 10. I was analyzing the raport when you disturbed me.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Dlaczego do mnie zagadujesz?
english: Why are you chatting me up?
glossary: to chat sb up
translation: 1. Why are you chatting me up?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Czy naprawdę chcesz, żeby ten gatunek wyginął?
english: Do you really want the species to die out?
glossary: to die out/a species
translation: 2. Do you really want the species died out?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Nie kupimy mieszkania, dopóki nie weźmiemy kredytu.
english: We won't buy an apartment until we get a mortgage.
glossary: to get a mortgage/to buy an apartment
translation: 3. We won't buy an apartment until we get the mortgage.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Na ostatnim spotkaniu szef mi powiedział, że mój projekt się wyróżnia.
english: My boss told me at the last meeting that my project stood out.
glossary: to stand out/a project/at the meeting
translation: 4. My boss told me at the last meeting that my project stood out.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Mogłem zacząć grać na pianinie jako dziecko. Byłbym teraz bardziej wprawiony.
english: I could've taken up the piano as a kid. I'd be more skillful now.
glossary: to be skillful/to take up the piano
translation: 5. I could've taken up the piano as a kid. I would be more sillful right now.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Czy w końcu się odezwałeś, gdy przezwyciężyłeś strach?
english: Did you finally speak up when you got over your fear?
glossary: to get over your fear/to speak up
translation: 6. Did you finally speak up when you got over your fear?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Dlaczego nie załozyłeś jeszcze kurtki?
english: Why haven't you put on a jacket yet?
glossary: to put on a jacket
translation: 7. Why haven't you put on the jacket yet?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Szef się mnie wczoraj zapytał, dlaczego nie zaproponowałem żadnego pomysłu na ostatnim spotkaniu.
english: My boss asked me yesterday why I hadn't put forward any idea at the last meeting.
glossary: to put forward an idea/at the meeting
translation: 8. The boss asked me yesterday why I hadn't put forward any idea at the last meeting.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Jakie obowiązki musisz przekazać?
english: What responsibilities do you have to hand over?
glossary: to hand over responsibilities
translation: 9. Which responsibilities do you have to hand over?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Powiedziałem ci, że nie będę cię więcej znosił.
english: I told you I wouldn't put up with you anymore.
glossary: to put up with sb
translation: 10. I told you I wouldn't stand you anymore.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Przyzwyczaisz się do rozgrzewania się przed treningiem.
english: You'll get used to warming up before a workout.
glossary: to warm up/a workout/to get used to doing sth
translation: 1.	You’ll get used to warming up before a workout.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Kiedyś zalegałem z rachunkami, bo byłem bezrobotny.
english: I used to fall behind with my bills because I was unemployed.
glossary: to be unemployed/to fall behind with your bills
translation: 2.	I used to fall behind with the bills because I was unemployed.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Boję się rzucić studia. Co powiedzą rodzice?
english: I'm afraid of dropping out of college. What will my parents say?
glossary: to drop out of college/to say sth
translation: 3.	I’m afraid of dropping out of college. What will my parents say?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Przeprowadzałem doświadczenie, gdy student wszedł do laboratorium.
english: I was carrying out an experiment when a student entered the lab.
glossary: a lab/a student/to carry out an experiment
translation: 4.	I was carrying out the experiment when a student entered the lab.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Gdybyś nie zagadał do tej dziewczyny, nie dostałbyś kosza.
english: If you hadn't chatted up the girl, you wouldn't have been turned down.
glossary: to turn sb down/to chat sb up
translation: 5.	If you hadn’t chat up the girl, you wouldn’t have been turned down.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Przekładasz spotkanie od kilku tygodni. O co chodzi?
english: You've been putting off the meeting for a few weeks. What's going on?
glossary: to put off a meeting
translation: 6.	You’ve put off the meeting for a few weeks. What’s going on?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Nasza firma zwolniła w zeszłym tygodniu kilku pracowników, ponieważ wystawili fałszywe faktury.
english: Our company laid off a few employees last week because they'd made out fake invoices.
glossary: an employee/a company/a fake invoice/to make out an invoice
translation: 7.	Our company fired a few employees last week because they’d made out the fake invoices.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Zrelaksujesz się, jeśli weźmiesz kąpiel.
english: You'll wind down if you take a bath.
glossary: to take a bath/to wind down
translation: 8.	You’ll chill out if you take a bath.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Na szczęście przeszliśmy już przez formalności.
english: Fortunately, we've already gone through formalities.
glossary: to go through formalities/Fortunately...
translation: 9.	Fortunately we’ve already gone through formalities.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Wyglądałabym młodziej, gdybym codziennie nakładała krem.
english: I'd look younger if I put on cream every day.
glossary: to look young/to put on cream
translation: 10.	I’d look younger if I put on cream every day.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Powinieneś był wcześniej zgasić papierosa. Nie dostałbyś grzywny.
english: You should've put out the cigarette earlier. You wouldn't have gotten a fine.
glossary: to get a fine/to put out a cigarette
translation: 1.	You should’ve put out a cigarette earlier. You wouldn’t have gotten a fine.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Nie chce, żebyś się do mnie zwracał o pomoc.
english: I don't want you to turn to me for help.
glossary: to turn to sb for help
translation: 2.	I don’t want you to turn to me for help.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Co chcesz sprawdzić w internecie?
english: What do you want to look up on the internet?
glossary: to look sth up on the internet
translation: 3.	What do you want to look up on the internet?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Szef się mnie zapytał wczoraj, czy podejmę się nowej roli.
english: My boss asked me yesterday if I'd take on a new role.
glossary: to take on a role/a boss
translation: 4.	The boss asked me yesterday if I took on a new role.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Nie odpuszczę, dopóki nie przestaniecie zdzierać z ludzi.
english: I won't let go until you stop ripping off people.
glossary: to rip sb off/to let go/people
translation: 5.	I won’t let go until you stop ripping off the people.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Słyszałem kilka dni temu, że ten bank orżnął setki klientów.
english: I heard the other day that the bank had ripped off hundreds of clients.
glossary: the other day/to rip sb off/a client/hundreds of clients/a bank
translation: 6.	I heard a few days ago that the bank had ripped off hundreds clients.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Czy ty próbujesz zaprosić mnie na randkę?
english: Are you trying to ask me out?
glossary: to ask sb out
translation: 7.	Are you trying to ask me out?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Zacząłeś już zajęcia tańca?
english: Have you taken up dance classes yet?
glossary: to take up dance classes
translation: 8.	Have you taken up the dance classes yet?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Uwierzyłem ci, kiedy mi powiedziałaś, że nie jesteś w nic zamieszana.
english: I believed you when you told me that you weren't mixed up in anything.
glossary: to be mixed up in sth
translation: 9.	I believed you when you told me that you weren’t mixed anything up.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Dlaczego odwołałeś ostatnie spotkanie?
english: Why did you call off the last meeting?
glossary: to call off a meeting
translation: 10.	Why did you call off the last meeting?

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Przebrnę przez całą tę papierkową robotę, jak tylko będę w odpowiednim nastroju.
english: I'll go through all the paperwork once I'm in the right mood.
glossary: to go through paperwork
translation: 1) I'll get through all this paperwork as soon as I will be in the right mood.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Kim jest ta dziewczyna, która dziś zastępuje sekretarkę menedżera? Nigdy wcześniej jej nie widziałam.
english: Who's the girl that's covering for the manager's secretary today? I've never seen her before.
glossary: to cover for sb/a secretary/a manager/to see sb
translation: 2. Who is the girl who is replacing the manager's secretary today? I've never seen her before.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Wiem, że jesteś bombardowana nowymi informacjami, ale wyluzuj. To nie aż tak skomplikowane.
english: I know you're being bombarded with new information, but chill out. It's not that complicated.
glossary: to chill out/to be bombarded with information/to be complicated
translation: 3. I know you're bombarded with new information, but relax. It isn’t so complicated.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Powiedziałam szefowi, że to szkoda, że umniejszył znaczeniu moich wysiłków.
english: I told my boss it was a shame he'd played down the significance of my efforts.
glossary: to play down the significance of sth/It's a shame that.../a boss/an effort
translation: 4) I told my boss it is a shame that he ………….

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Wiem, że jest późno. Dlatego postaram się zakończyć spotkanie najszybciej, jak to możliwe.
english: I know it's late. That's why I'll try to wrap the meeting up as quickly as possible.
glossary: to wrap up a meeting/to be late/as quickly as possible
translation: 5. I know it's late. Therefore, I will try to end the meeting as soon as possible.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Kiedy rozglądałam się po sklepie, sprzedawczyni spytała mnie, czy potrzebuję pomocy.
english: When I was looking around in the shop, the assistant asked me if I needed help.
glossary: to look around/an assistant/to need help
translation: 6. When I was looking around the store, the saler asked me if I needed help.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Czy wydrukowałeś wszystkie strony? Myślę, że niektórych brakuje.
english: Did you print all of the pages out? I think some of them are missing.
glossary: to print sth out/a page/to be missing
translation: 7. Did you print all pages? I think some are missing.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Nie bądź tak pesymistyczna. Rozważyłaś już wszystkie możliwe opcje?
english: Don't be so pessimistic. Have you weighed up all the possible options yet?
glossary: to weigh up the options/to be pessimistic/an option/to be possible
translation: 8. You don't be so pessimistic. Did you considere all the possible options yet?

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Poczujesz się lepiej po treningu, kiedy się odświeżysz.
english: You'll feel better after the workout when you freshen up.
glossary: to freshen up/to feel better/a workout
translation: 9) You'll feel better after your workout when you freshen up.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Mimo że mój szef wie, że nie znoszę papierkowej roboty, chce, żebym przeglądała dokumenty.
english: Although my boss knows I hate paperwork, he wants me to go over documents.
glossary: to go over a document/Although.../to hate paperwork
translation: 10) Even  my boss knows I hate paperwork, he wants me to review documents.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Zbyt długo zadzierasz ze mną.
english: You've been messing with me for too long.
glossary: to mess with sb
translation: For too long, you have messed with me.

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Nigdy nie przyzwyczaję się do zwalniania pracowników.

glossary: to lay sb off/an employee/to get used to doing sth

name: Agatha Olson
polish: Powiedz szefowi, co zrobiłeś, bo jestem już zmęczona kryciem ciebie.

glossary: a boss/to be tired of sth/to cover for sb

polish: Twój wniosek nie zostałbym odrzucony, gdybyś złożył go na czas.

name: Adam Hunt

name: Adam Hunt

name: Adam Hunt

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Dlaczego do mnie zagadujesz?

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Dlaczego wszystko, co robisz, zawsze wychodzi?

polish: Nigdy nie bierzesz pod uwagę moich sugestii. Czy w ogóle zależy Ci na mojej opinii?
english: You never consider my suggestions. Do you even care about my opinion?
glossary: to consider sth/a suggestion/to care about sth
translation: 7.	You never take into consideration my suggestions. Do you care about my opinion at all?

name: Alexandra King
polish: Na kogo zawsze głosuje Twoja matka?
english: Who does your mother always vote for?
glossary: to vote for sb
translation: 8.	Who does your mother always vote for?

name: Alexandra King
polish: Co sprawiło, że pomyślałeś, że kiedykolwiek mógłbym cię zdradzić?
english: What made you think that I could ever cheat on you?
glossary: to make sb do sth/to cheat on sb
translation: 9.	What made you think I could betray you?

name: Alexandra King
polish: Zawsze pędzisz. Może powinieneś nauczyć się jeździć.
english: You're always speeding. Maybe you should learn how to drive.
glossary: to speed/to learn how to do sth
translation: 10.	You always drive fast. Maybe you should learn how to drive?

name: Alexandra King
polish: Jak długo wkuwałeś do egzaminu? Ja nawet jeszcze nie zacząłem.
english: How long have you been cramming for the exam? I haven't even started yet.
glossary: to cram for the exam
translation: 1.	How long did you study? I haven’t even started yet.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Jakich zasad musi przestrzegać moja firma, aby otrzymać dotację?
english: What rules does my company have to comply with to receive the subsidy?
glossary: to comply with sth/a subsidy
translation: 2.	What rules does your company need to follow to receive a subsidy?

name: Alexandra King
polish: Jaki wpływ miał na Ciebie wypadek?
english: What impact did the accident have on you?
glossary: to have an impact on sb/an accident
translation: 3.	What impact did the accident have on you?

name: Alexandra King
polish: Nauczyciel miał kupić płótno. Jak mam teraz malować?
english: The teacher was supposed to buy canvas. How am I supposed to paint now?
glossary: canvas/to paint
translation: 4.	The teacher had to buy a canvas. How do I paint now?

name: Alexandra King
polish: Od czego zależy sukces?
english: What does success depend on?
glossary: to depend on sth/success
translation: 5.	What does the success depend on?

name: Alexandra King
polish: Nigdy mnie nie słuchasz. Jak mamy się komunikować?
english: You never listen to me. How are we supposed to communicate?
glossary: to listen to sb/to communicate
translation: 6.	You’d never listen to me. How do we communicate?

name: Alexandra King
polish: Zawsze pracujesz do późna. Nie zależy ci na swojej rodzinie?
english: You're always working late. Don't you care about your family?
glossary: to work late/to care about your family
translation: 7.	You always work late. Don’t you care about your family?

name: Alexandra King
polish: Mamy nadzieję, że nasz film pomoże społeczeństwu uświadomić sobie problem przemocy domowej.
english: We hope that our movie will help society realize the problem of domestic violence.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to realize sth/domestic violence
translation: 8.	We hope that our film helps society to become aware of a domestic violence.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Zawsze przeceniasz swoje umiejętności i później wpadamy w kłopoty.
english: You're always overestimating your abilities, and then we get in trouble.
glossary: to overestimate sth/to get in trouble
translation: 9.	You always overestimate your abilities and then we get into trouble.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Czego Twój ojciec nie pochwala?
english: What doesn't your father approve of?
glossary: to approve of sth
translation: 10.	What does your father approve of?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Nie musielibyśmy przekładać spotkań, gdyby szef się częściej pojawiał w pracy.
english: We wouldn't have to put off meetings if the boss showed up at work more often.
glossary: to show up at work/to put off a meeting/a boss
translation: 1.	We wouldn’t have to put off the meetings if the boss showed up more often at work.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Wrócisz do więzienia, jeśli będziesz zamieszany w narkotyki.
english: You'll go back to jail if you're mixed up in drugs.
glossary: to be mixed up in sth/to be mixed up in drugs/to go back to jail
translation: 2.	You’ll get back to prison if you mix up drugs.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Kiedyś z każdym wchodziłem w konflikt, bo byłem głupi.
english: I used to come into conflict with everybody because I was stupid.
glossary: to be stupid/to come into conflict with sb
translation: 3.	I used to come into conflict with every one because I was stupid.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Przestępca trafił do szpitala po tym, jak postrzeliła go policja.
english: The criminal ended up in the hospital after the police had shot him.
glossary: to shoot sb/the police/a criminal/to end up in the hospital
translation: 4.	The criminal ended up at the hospital after the police had shot him.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Od dawna mnie wkurzasz. To koniec.
english: You've been pissing me off for a long time. It's over.
glossary: to piss sb off/to be over
translation: 5.	You’ve pissed my off for a long time. It’s over.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Wykonałem jak dotąd dwa z trzech zadań.
english: I've carried out two out of three tasks so far.
glossary: so far/to carry out a task/one out of two
translation: 6.	I’ve done two of three tasks so far.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Kiedy wychodziłem z biura, zadzwonił do mnie klient i odwołał spotkanie.
english: When I was leaving the office, my client called me and called off the meeting.
glossary: to call off a meeting/to call sb/to leave the office
translation: 7.	When I was leaving the office, the client called me and called off the meeting.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Przyzwyczaiłem się już do zagadywania do dziewczyn.
english: I've already gotten used to chatting up girls.
glossary: to chat sb up/a girl/to get used to doing sth
translation: 8.	I’ve already gotten used to chatting up girls.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Policja nie zastrzeliłaby podejrzanego, gdyby nie wyjął broni.
english: The police wouldn't have shot down the suspect if he hadn't pulled out a gun.
glossary: to pull out a gun/to shoot sb down/the police
translation: 9.	The police wouldn’t have shot the suspect down if he hadn’t pulled out the gun.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Myślę o odrzuceniu zaproszenia na ten ślub. Jakie jest twoje zdanie?
english: I'm thinking about turning down the invitation to the wedding. What's your opinion?
glossary: to turn down an invitation to the wedding/an opinion/to think about sth
translation: 10.	I’m thinking about turning down the invitation for this weeding. What’s your opinion?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Fabryka rozpcznie produkcje, jak już zarząd na to pozwoli.
english: The factory will go ahead with the production once the board allows it.
glossary: to allow sth/to go ahead with the production/a factory/the board
translation: 1.	The factory will go ahead with the production once the management board allows it.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Zawsze chcesz, żeby wszyscy ci współczuli.
english: You always want everyone to feel for you.
glossary: to feel for sb
translation: 2.	You always want everyone to feel sorry for you

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Dopiłeś już swoją kawę do końca?
english: Have you drunk up your coffee yet?
glossary: to drink up your coffee
translation: 3.	Have you drunk up your coffee yet?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Mój lekarz rodzinny obiecał, że wciśnie mnie w grafik.
english: My GP promised he'd fit me in to his schedule.
glossary: to fit sb in to your schedule/a GP
translation: 4.	My GP promised that he’d put me in to the schedule.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Zapisujesz to? Nie mam zamiaru się powtarzać.
english: Are you taking it down? I'm not going to repeat myself.
glossary: to repeat yourself/to write sth down; to take sth down
translation: 5.	Are you writing it down? I’m not going to repeat myself.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Kiedy pogodziłaś się z rodziną?
english: When did you make up with your family?
glossary: to make up with sb/a family
translation: 6.	When did you make up with your family?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Dlaczego twoim zdaniem ten raport wymaga analizy?
english: Why does the report call for an analysis in your opinion?
glossary: to call for an analysis/In my opinion...
translation: 7.	Why do you think the report needs to be analyzed?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Mogłem podjąć się tej roli. Zarabiałbym teraz więcej.
english: I could've taken on the role. I'd earn more now.
glossary: to make money; to earn money/to take on a role
translation: 8.	I could’ve taken on the role. I’d earn more now.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: W zeszłym miesiącu mi powiedziałaś, że ta praca cię wykańcza.
english: You told me last month that the job was wearing you down
glossary: to wear sb down/a job
translation: 9.	You told me last month that the job…

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Jeszcze rok temu bank utrzymywał, że wziąłem tę pożyczkę.
english: Only a year ago, the bank insisted that I'd taken out the loan.
glossary: to take out a loan/to insist that...
translation: 10.	The bank….

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Przanalizowałem już raport, ale nie natknąłem się na nic interesującego.
english: I've already looked into the report, but I haven't come across anything interesting.
glossary: to come across sth/to look into sth/to look into a report
translation: I went through the report, but hadn’t come across anything interesting.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Czy ostatnie dochodzenie zostało odpowiednio przeprowadzone?
english: Was the last investigation carried out properly?
glossary: to carry out an investigation/to do sth properly
translation: 2) The last investigation  was property conducted?

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Podgrzałeś już jedzenie?
english: Have you heated up the food yet?
glossary: to heat up the food
translation: 3) Did you heat up the food yet?

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Dlaczego znowu mnie wkurzasz?
english: Why are you pissing me off again?
glossary: to piss sb off
translation: 4) Why are you pissing me off again?

name: Kate Roberts
polish: W zeszłym tygodniu nauczycielka powiedziała, że musimy wydrukować swoje prace.
english: The teacher said last week that we had to print out our assignment.
glossary: an assignment/to print sth out/a teacher
translation: 5. Last week the teacher said we had to print out theirs homework.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Na twoim miejscu zgasiłbym tu papierosa.
english: If I were you I'd put out the cigarette here.
glossary: to put out a cigarette
translation: 6. I would put out my cigarette here if I were you.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Nie mogę się przyzwyczaić do wynoszenia śmieci. Kiedyś robiła to moja mama.
english: I can't get used to taking out the garbage. My mom used to do it.
glossary: to take out the garbage
translation: 7. I can't get used to taking out the garbage. My mother used to do it.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Mogłem to zapisać, bo teraz nic nie pamiętam.
english: I could've written it down because I don't remember anything now.
glossary: to remember sth/to write sth down; to take sth down
translation: 8) I could write it down because I can't remember anything now.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Klient by nie zrezygnował, gdybyśmy spełnili jego oczekiwania.
english: The client wouldn't have resigned if we'd lived up to his expectations.
glossary: to live up to sb's expectations/a client/to resign from sth
translation: 9. The customer wouldn't give up if we live up his expectations.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Powiedziałam ci ostatnim razem, że nie będę cię więcej znosić.
english: I told you last time I wouldn't put up with you anymore.
glossary: to put up with sb/last time
translation: 10) I told you last time that I wouldn’t……

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Terroryści próbowali zdetonować bombę kilka razy, zanim powstrzymała ich policja.
english: The terrorists had tried to let off the bomb a few times before the police stopped them.
glossary: the police/to let off a bomb/to stop sb/a few times
translation: 1) The terrorists tried to let off the bomb several times before the police stopped them.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Nie mam siły. Dzieciaki mnie już wykończyły.
english: I don't have energy. The kids have already worn me down.
glossary: to wear sb down/a kid/to have energy
translation: 2. I have no strength. The kids have …….

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Będę czytać dalej, jak już przestaniecie gadać.
english: I'll keep reading once you stop talking.
glossary: to stop talking/to keep reading/last week
translation: 3) I'll keep reading after you stop talking.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Kiedyś nie zapinałem pasów, ale to się zmieniło po tym, jak miałem wypadek.
english: I didn't use to fasten up, but it changed after I'd had an accident.
glossary: to have an accident/to fasten up
translation: 4) I didn’t fasten up earlier, but that changed after I was in an accident.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Naprawdę byś chciała, żeby ten gość zaprosił cię na randkę?
english: Would you really like the guy to ask you out?
glossary: to ask sb out/a guy
translation: 5) Would you really want this guy to ask you out?

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Jeśli nie przełożymy spotkania, nie uda mi się dotrzeć.
english: If you don't put off the meeting, I won't make it.
glossary: to put off a meeting/to make it to a meeting
translation: 6) If we don't put off the meeting, I won't be able to make it.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: O której zadzwonił budzik?
english: What time did the alarm go off?
glossary: to go off {2}
translation: 7. What time did the alarm clock set an?

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Szef się pytał w zeszłym tygodniu, czy przebrnęliśmy już przez wszystkie procedury.
english: The boss asked last week if we'd already gone through all the procedures.
glossary: to go through a procedure
translation: 8. The boss asked last week if we had gone through all the procedures.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Dlaczego chcesz odrzucić tę ofertę?
english: Why do you want to turn down the offer?
glossary: to turn down an offer
translation: 9. Why do you want to turn down this offer?

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Dzieciaki się wygłupiały, kiedy weszliśmy do domu.
english: The kids were fooling around when we entered the house.
glossary: to enter the house/a kid/to fool around
translation: 10. The kids were mess around when we came in the house

polish: Jeszcze rok temu bank utrzymywał, że wziąłem tę pożyczkę.

polish: Nie wkurzyłbyś mnie, gdybyś ze mną nie zadzierał.
english: You wouldn't have pissed me off if you hadn't messed with me.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Gdybyś tak często się nie wkurzał, dzeciaki by się ciebie nie bały.
english: If you weren't pissed off so often, the kids wouldn't be afraid of you.
glossary: to be afraid of sb/to be pissed off/a kid
translation: 2. If you didn’t get mad so often, the kids wouldn’t be afraid of you.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Nie jesteśmy zainteresowani przejęciem tej firmy.
english: We're not interested in taking over the company.

translation: 3. We don’t interested in taking over the company.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Kiedyś moje dzieciaki lubiły się przebierać, ale dorosły.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Mój zespół musi przyzwyczaić się do kończenia spotkań szybciej.
english: My team has to get used to wrapping up meetings more quickly.
glossary: to wrap sth up/to wrap up a meeting/to get used to doing sth/a meeting
