name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Od dłuższego czasu ograniczam picie. Dlatego czuję się lepiej.
english: I've been cutting down on drinking for a long time. That's why I feel better.
glossary: to feel good/to cut down on drinking
translation: 6. I’ve cut down on drinking for a long time. That’s why I feel better.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Jeśli ból nie ustąpi, pójdę do lekarza.
english: If the pain doesn't go away, I'll go to the doctor.
glossary: to go away {2}/to go to the doctor
translation: 7. If the pain doesn’t go away I’ll go to the doctor.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Wystawiłeś jak dotąd trzy faktury. Musisz się pospieszyć.
english: You've made out three invoices so far. You have to hurry up.
glossary: to hurry up/to make out an invoice
translation: 8. You’ve made out three invoices so far. You have to hurry.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Kiedy zaproponowałem lepszy plan, poprzedni został już zaakceptowany.
english: When I put forward a better plan, the previous one had already been accepted.
glossary: to accept sth/to put forward a plan
translation: 9. When I would’ve put forward a better plan, the previous one already had been accepted.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Moja ciotka sporządzała testament, kiedy zmarła.
english: My aunt was making her will when she died.
glossary: to carry out your will/to make your will/to die
translation: 10. My auntie was making her will when she died.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Policja twierdziła wczoraj, że wytropiła złodzieja.
english: The police stated yesterday that they'd tracked down the thief.
glossary: to track down a thief
translation: 1. The police said yesterday that they tracked down a thief.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: W zeszłym roku mówiłaś, że musisz ograniczyć palenie, ale tego nie zrobiłaś.
english: You said last year that you had to cut down on smoking, but you didn't.
glossary: to cut down on smoking/last year
translation: 2. Last year you said that you had to cut down on smoking but you didn’t.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Nadrobimy opóźnienie, jak już dostaniemy wszystkie niezbędne materiały.
english: We'll make up for the delay once we get all the necessary materials.
glossary: the necessary materials/to make up for a delay
translation: 3. We’ll make up for a delay once we get all the necessary materials.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Chciałbym, żebyś rozważył wszystkie za i przeciw.
english: I'd like you to weigh up all the pros and cons.
glossary: to weigh up the pros and cons
translation: 4. I’d like you to weigh up all the pros and cons.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Córka obiecała, że nie będzie panikować, kiedy rozpęta się kolejna burza.
english: My daughter promised she wouldn't freak out when the next storm breaks out.
glossary: to break out/to freak out/a daughter

polish: Czym zwykle skutkuje takie zachowanie?
english: What does such behavior usually result in?
glossary: behavior/to result in sth
translation: 8.	What usually results in this behavior?

name: Alexandra King
polish: Mój mąż miał złożyć łóżeczko do kupy, ale był zbyt leniwy.
english: My husband was supposed to put the crib together, but he was too lazy.
glossary: to put sth together/to be too lazy to do sth
translation: 9.	 My husband was supposed to put the crib together, but he was too lazy.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Od jak dawna próbujesz wprowadzić swój pierwszy produkt? Chyba minął już rok.
english: How long have you been trying to roll out your first product? I guess it's been a year now.
glossary: to roll out sth
translation: 10.	How long have you been trying to launch your first product? it's been a year.

name: Monica Allen
polish: Jak długo już nalegasz? Nie rozumiesz, że tego nie dam?
english: How long have you been insisting yet? Don't you understand I won't give it?
glossary: to insist
translation: How long do you instist? You do not understand that I will not?

name: Monica Allen
polish: O której wylądował samolot? Nie miał przybyć później?
english: What time did the plane land? Wasn't it supposed to arrive later?
glossary: to land/a plane/to arrive later
translation: What was time the plane landing about? Not to come later?

name: Monica Allen
polish: Twoja partia miała mnie wesprzeć w następnych wyborach.
english: Your party was supposed to back me during the next election.
glossary: to back sb/a party/an election
translation: Your party was supposed to suport me in the next elections.

name: Monica Allen
polish: Nigdy nie pozwalasz mi chodzić na imprezy. Nie jestem już dzieckiem.
english: You never let me go to parties. I'm not a kid anymore.
glossary: to let sb do sth/to be a kid
translation: You never allow me to go to the party. I am no longer a child.

name: Monica Allen
polish: Jak długo zaprzeczasz prawdzie? Czy to nie najwyższy czas, żeby się z tym zmierzyć?
english: How long have you been denying the truth? Isn't it high time to face it?
glossary: to deny the truth/to face sth
translation: How long do you deny the truth? Is it not time to takie this?

name: Monica Allen
polish: Nikt nie kazał Ci wybrać tego kursu, więc przestań narzekać.
english: No one made you choose that course, so stop complaining.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to complain about sth
translation: No one has told you to choose this course, so stop complaining.

name: Monica Allen
polish: Miałem naładować komórkę, ale zupełnie zapomniałem.
english: I was supposed to charge my cell phone, but I totally forgot.
glossary: to charge your cell phone
translation: I had to charge my cell, but I forgot it completely.

name: Monica Allen
polish: Czym zwykle skutkuje takie zachowanie?
english: What does such behavior usually result in?
glossary: behavior/to result in sth
translation: What usually does this behavior result?

name: Monica Allen
polish: Mój mąż miał złożyć łóżeczko do kupy, ale był zbyt leniwy.
english: My husband was supposed to put the crib together, but he was too lazy.
glossary: to put sth together/to be too lazy to do sth
translation: My husband was supposed to put a cribb in the ponies, but he was to lazy.

name: Monica Allen
polish: Od jak dawna próbujesz wprowadzić swój pierwszy produkt? Chyba minął już rok.
english: How long have you been trying to roll out your first product? I guess it's been a year now.
glossary: to roll out sth
translation: How long have you tried to introduce your first product? I think that the year passed.

name: Monica Allen
polish: Do czego odnosi się artykuł?
english: What does the article refer to?
glossary: to refer to sth/an article
translation: What does the article refer to?

name: Monica Allen
polish: Dlaczego pozwoliłeś rodzicom rozpieszczać swoje dzieci?
english: Why did you let your parents spoil your kids?
glossary: to let sb do sth/to spoil your kids
translation: Why did you allow parents to hone your children?

name: Monica Allen
polish: Miałeś przećwiczyć scenariusz. Jak zamierzasz teraz wyjść na scenę?
english: You were supposed to rehearse the script. How are you going to go on stage now?
glossary: to rehearse the script/to go on stage
translation: You had to practise the script. How are going to get out of the scene now?

name: Monica Allen
polish: Zbyt często wychodzisz. To nie jest hotel.
english: You're going out way too often. It's not a hotel.
glossary: to go out/to do sth way too often
translation: You are going out too often. This is not a hotel.

name: Monica Allen
polish: Mój tata miał rozebrać te stare meble, ale nie miał czasu.
english: My dad was supposed to take this old furniture apart, but he had no time.
glossary: to take sth apart/to have no time
translation: My dad was supposed to rob these old farniture, but he had no time.

name: Monica Allen
polish: Jak długo bronisz przestępców? Nie czujesz się z tym źle?
english: How long have you been defending criminals? Don't you feel bad about it?
glossary: to defend sb/to feel bad about sth
translation: How long do you defend criminals? Don't you feel so bad?

name: Monica Allen
polish: Jak długo zlew jest zatkany? Powinniśmy coś z tym zrobić.
english: How long has the sink been stuck? We should do something about it.
glossary: to be stuck/to do sth about sth
translation: How long is the waste water blocked? We should do something about this.

name: Monica Allen
polish: Po południu miałam ściąć włosy, ale okazało się, że muszę odebrać syna ze szkoły.
english: I was supposed to have my hair cut in the afternoon, but it's turned out I have to pick my son from school.
glossary: to have your hair cut/to pick sb from school
translation: I had to cut my hair in the apfternoon, but it turned out that I had to pick up son from school

name: Monica Allen
polish: Co sprawiło, że wyprowadziłeś się z miasta? Myślałem, że lubisz swoją okolicę.
english: What made you move out of town? I thought you liked your neighborhood.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to like your neighborhood
translation: What caused you to leave the city? I thought you liked your surrounding.

name: Monica Allen
polish: Miałeś kosić trawnik. Kiedy zamierzasz to zrobić?
english: You were supposed to mow the lawn. When are you going to do it?
glossary: to mow the lawn
translation: You have mowed the lawn. When are you going to do this?

name: Justina Watson
polish: Kiedyś spotkania w firmie się ciągnęły, ale znaleźliśmy na to rozwiązanie.
english: Meetings in our company used to drag on, but we found a solution to that.
glossary: to drag on/a meeting/in our company/a solution to sth
translation: 1. Once meetings in the company dragged on, but we found the solution on it.

name: Justina Watson
polish: Jeśli wciśniesz mnie w swój grafik w tym tygodniu, zapłacę ci więcej.
english: If you fit me in to your schedule this week, I'll pay you more.
glossary: to fit sb in to the schedule/to pay sb
translation: 2. If you squeeze me in your schedule this week, I’ll pay you more.

name: Justina Watson
polish: Kiedy wszedłem do biura, koleżanka wystawiała faktury.
english: When I entered the office, my colleague was making out invoices.
glossary: to make out an invoice/to enter the office
translation: 3. When I came to the office my colleague was issuing invoices.

name: Justina Watson
polish: Kogo jutro zastępujesz?
english: Who are you covering for tomorrow?
glossary: to cover for sb
translation: 4. Who are you replacing tomorrow?

name: Justina Watson
polish: Na twoim miejscu podjąłbym się tego zadania.
english: If I were you, I would take on the task.
glossary: to take on a task
translation: 5. If I were you, I’d undertake the task.

name: Justina Watson
polish: Ta historia jest zmyślona.
english: The story's made up.
glossary: to make up a story
translation: 6. That story is made up.

name: Justina Watson
polish: Zostałem zwolniony po tym, jak wybuchła pandemia.
english: I was laid off after the pandemic had broken out.
glossary: to break out/to be laid off
translation: 7. I was fired after the outbreak of the pandemic.

name: Justina Watson
polish: Nie powinienem był zalegać z rachunkami. Przepraszam.
english: I shouldn't have fallen behind with the bills. I'm sorry
glossary: to fall behind with the bills
translation: 8. I shouldn’t default with my bills. I’m sorry/My apologies.

name: Justina Watson
polish: Już się rozgrzałem. Możemy iść biegać.
english: I've already warmed up. We can go running.
glossary: to warm up/to go running
translation: 9. I’ve already warmed myself up. We can go running.

name: Justina Watson
polish: Damy ci znać, jak już wyśledzimy złodzieja.
english: We'll let you know once we track down the thief.
glossary: to track down a thief/to let sb down
translation: 10. I’ll let you know when we trace the thief.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Czy są w tym mieście jakieś miejsca, które powinienem odwiedzić?
english: Are there any places in the city I should visit?
glossary: in the city; in town/to visit a place
translation: 1.	I hope we will discuss your behaviour

name: Alexandra King
polish: Gdzie jedziesz w tym roku na wakacje?
english: Where are you going on vacation this year?
glossary: to go on vacation/this year
translation: 2.	I am taking care of my youngest brother, tomorrow. Let’s meet on the weekend.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Mamy czas. Nie ma potrzeby się spieszyć.
english: We have time. There's no need to hurry up.
glossary: to have time/a need/to hurry up
translation: 3.	There are parents who let their children smoking.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że wrócę do domu dzisiaj, ale uciekł mi pociąg.
english: I hoped I'd come back home today, but I missed the train.
glossary: to hope/to come back home/today/to miss the train
translation: 4.	Did you back up the files,  yesterday?

name: Alexandra King
polish: Dlaczego tak zareagowałaś? Możesz mi to wytłumaczyć?
english: Why did you react like that? Can you explain it to me?
glossary: to react to sth/like that/to explain sth to sb
translation: 5.	why should I listen to you?

name: Alexandra King
polish: Mogłeś wcześniej zadzwonić. Powiedziałabym Ci, że nie ma mnie w domu.
english: You could've called before. I would've told you I wasn't at home.
glossary: to be at home/to call sb
translation: 6.	I will be tired when I finish a job.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Z kim wczoraj rozmawiałeś przez telefon?
english: Who did you talk to on the phone yesterday?
glossary: to talk to sb over the phone
translation: 7.	You have been pretending to be happy/ happiness for too long (dlaczego to be)

name: Alexandra King
polish: Idziemy dziś wieczorem na drinka. Pamiętasz?
english: We're going for a drink tonight. Do you remember?
glossary: to remember/to go for a drink/tonight
translation: 8.	I was sure that we would clarify situation.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Obawiam się, że nie dostanę tej pracy.
english: I'm afraid I won't get the job.
glossary: to be afraid of sth/to get a job
translation: 9.	We have to get to know each other better.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Z kim chcesz spędzić resztę swojego życia?
english: Who do you want to spend the rest of your life with?
glossary: to spend time with sb/the rest of your life
translation: 10.	I hope that you will spend more time with me.

name: Justina Watson
polish: Gdybyś nie poruszył tematu, szef nie zauważyłby, że jest problem.
english: If you hadn't brought up the subject, the boss wouldn't notice that there was a problem.
glossary: to bring up a subject/to notice that.../a problem
translation: 1.	If you didn’t bring up a subject, the manager wouldn’t notice a problem.

name: Justina Watson
polish: Dlaczego schrzaniłeś to zadanie?
english: Why did you screw up the task?
glossary: to screw up a task
translation: 2.	Why did you screw up the task?

name: Justina Watson
polish: Szefowa powiedziała, że przejmę ważny projekt.
english: The boss told me I'd take on an important project.
glossary: to take on a project
translation: 3.	The manager said that I’ll take on a task.

name: Justina Watson
polish: Zbyt długo rozważam opcje. Czas działać.
english: I've been weighing up the options for too long. It's time to act.
glossary: to weigh up the options/to act
translation: 4.	For too long I’ve been considering options. Time to act.

name: Justina Watson
polish: Klient twierdził, że product nie spełnia jego oczekiwań.
english: The client claimed the product didn't live up to his expectations.
glossary: to live up to sb's expectations/a client/a product
translation: 5.	The client claimed that the product doesn’t meet his expectation.

name: Justina Watson
polish: Czy zawsze zapinasz pasy, kiedy prowadzisz?
english: Do you always fasten up when driving?
glossary: to fasten up/to drive
translation: 6.	Do you fasten up when you are driving?

name: Justina Watson
polish: Zakończyłeś już spotkanie?
english: Have you wrapped up the meeting yet?
glossary: to wrap up a meeting
translation: 7.	Have you finished the meeting?

name: Justina Watson
polish: Chcesz, żebym przejrzał te dokumenty?
english: Do you want me to go through the documents?
glossary: to go through documents
translation: 8.	Do you want to that I go through documents?

name: Justina Watson
polish: Profesor pytał się mnie kilka dni temu, dlaczego jeszcze nie wykonałem tych badań.
english: The professor asked me a few days ago why I hadn't carried out the research yet.
glossary: to carry out research
translation: 9.	The professor asked me a few years ago why I hadn’t carried the research.

name: Justina Watson
polish: Szybko przyzwyczaiłam się do krycia brata.
english: I quickly got used to covering for my brother.
glossary: to cover up for sb/to get used to doing sth
translation: 10.	I quickly get used to covering up for my brother.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Dlaczego utrudniasz mi życie? Czy nie powinniśmy sobie pomagać?
english: Why are you making my life harder? Shouldn't we help each other?
glossary: to make sb's life harder/to help each other
translation: 1.	Why do you make my live? Shouldn’t we help each other’s?

name: Alexandra King
polish: Wkurzyłeś mnie rano. Myślałem, że wyrzucę cię z domu.
english: You made me mad in the morning. I thought I'd throw you out of the house.
glossary: to make sb mad/to throw sb out of the house
translation: 2.	You pissed me of in the morning. I thought I would throw you out of the house.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Moi rodzice zmusili mnie do chodzenia na treningi piłkarskie, kiedy byłem dzieckiem. Dlatego teraz tego nienawidzę.
english: My parents made me go to soccer practice when I was a kid. That's why I hate it now.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to go to soccer practice
translation: 3.	My parents forced me to go to soccer practice when I was a child. That’s why I hate it now.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Jak długo próbowałeś usunąć plamę? Czy myślisz, że zejdzie?
english: How long have you been trying to remove the stain? Do you think it will come out?
glossary: to remove the stain/to come out
translation: 4.	How long have you been trying to remove a stain? Do you think it will disappear?

name: Alexandra King
polish: Z czego zazwyczaj śmieje się twoja córka?
english: What does your daughter usually laugh at?
glossary: to laugh at sth
translation: 5.	For what does your daughter usually laugh?

name: Alexandra King
polish: Jak rzeczniczka skomentowała incydent?
english: How did the spokeswoman comment on the incident?
glossary: a spokeswoman/to comment on sth/an incident
translation: 6.	How does the spokeswoman comment the incident?

name: Alexandra King
polish: Kierownik zmusił mnie do podpisania dokumentów.
english: The director made me sign the documents.
glossary: to make sb do sth/a director
translation: 7.	The manager forced me to sign the documents.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Miałeś skomentować mój post. Zapomniałaś?
english: You were supposed to comment on my post. Did you forget?
glossary: to comment on sth/to forget about sth
translation: 8.	You had to comment my post? Did you forget?

name: Alexandra King
polish: Jakie środki podjął rząd, aby zapobiec epidemii?
english: What measures did the government take to prevent the epidemic?
glossary: to take measures to do sth/to prevent sth
translation: 9.	What measures does the government take to fight the pandemic?

name: Alexandra King
polish: Zawsze się lenisz. Zabieraj swój tyłek do pracy!
english: You're always lazing around. Get your ass to work!
glossary: to laze around/to get your ass to work
translation: 10.	You are always lazy. Get your ass to work!

name: Alexandra King
polish: Myślę, że odwiedzę cię w weekend, bo jutro wracam późno do domu.
english: I think I'll visit you on the weekend because I'm coming back home late tomorrow.
glossary: to visit sb/to come back home late
translation: 1.	I think I will visit you at the weekend because I’ll be back home late tomorrow.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Nie wychodź teraz z domu, bo jest zbyt gorąco.
english: Don't leave the house now because it's too hot.
glossary: to leave the house
translation: 2.	Don’t go out now because it’s too hot.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Zepsułam telefon mojej mamy. Nie wiem, co powinnam teraz zrobić.
english: I broke my mom's cell phone. I don't know what I should do now.
glossary: to break a cell phone
translation: 3.	I broke my mum’s phone. I don’t know what I should do now.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Nie mogę teraz rozmawiać, bo nie mam czasu.
english: I can't talk now because I don't have time.
glossary: to talk to sb
translation: 4.	I can’t talk now because I don’t have time

name: Alexandra King
polish: Kiedy wyjeżdżasz?
english: When are you leaving?
glossary: to leave
translation: 5.	When do you leave?

name: Alexandra King
polish: Mogłem zostać w domu, bo nie ma tu nic do roboty.
english: I could've stayed at home because there's nothing to do here.
glossary: to stay at home/to have nothing to do
translation: 6.	I could have stay at home because there is nothing to do here.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Gdzie byłeś? Nie mogłem cię znaleźć.
english: Where were you? I couldn't find you.
translation: 7.	Where have you been? I couldn’t find you.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Nie zapłaciłam rachunków w zeszłym miesiącu, bo nie miałam żadnych pieniędzy.
english: I didn't pay the bills last month because I didn't have any money.
glossary: to pay the bills
translation: 8.	I didn’t pay any bills this month because I didn’t have any money

name: Alexandra King
polish: Zawsze ci pomogę, bo jesteś siostrą mojej żony.
english: I'll always help you because you're my wife's sister.
glossary: to help sb
translation: 9.	I’ll always help you because you are my wife’s sister.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Byłam pewna, że spędzimy razem więcej czasu.
english: I was sure we'd spend more time together.
glossary: to be sure that.../to spend time with sb
translation: 10.	I was sure we would spend more time together.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Policja przyjechała na miejsce zbrodni po tym, jak właściciel sklepu zastrzelił złodzieja.
english: The police came to the crime scene after the store owner had shot down a thief.
glossary: to come to a crime scene/to shoot sb down/a store owner/a thief
translation: 1. The police came to a crime scene after the store owner had shot a thief dead.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Na szczęscie syn przyzwyczaił się do wynoszenia śmieci.
english: Fortunately, my son got used to taking out the garbage.
glossary: Fortunately.../a son/to take out the garbage
translation: 2. Fortunately, my son got used to taking out the garbage.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Rodzice pytali mnie, dlaczego chcesz rzucić studia.
english: My parents asked me why you wanted to drop out of college.
glossary: to drop out of college
translation: 3. My parents were asking me why I wanted to drop out of college.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Powiedziałem ci, że przyprawy uwydatnią smak potrawy.
english: I told you the spices would bring out the flavor of the dish.
glossary: to bring out the flavor/a dish/spices
translation: 4. I told you that spices will bring out the flavor of the dish.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Dlaczego bierzesz pożyczkę?
english: Why are you taking out a loan?
glossary: to take out a loan
translation: 5. Why are you taking out a loan?

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Wykład by się nie ciągnął, gdybyś nie zadawał głupich pytań.
english: The lecture wouldn't have dragged on if you hadn't asked stupid questions.
glossary: to ask stupid questions/to drag on/a lecture
translation: 6. The lecture wouldn’t have dragged on if you hadn’t asked stupid questions.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Samolot odlatywał, kiedy pojawiliśmy się na lotnisku.
english: The plane was taking off when we showed up at the airport.
glossary: to take off/to show up at the airport
translation: 7. The plane was taking off when we showed up at the airport.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Nie chciałbym, żebyś popadł w nawyk.
english: I wouldn't like you to fall into addiction.
glossary: to fall into addiction
translation: 8. I wouldn’t like you to fall into addiction.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Zarząd mnie pytał, dlaczego zmiany nie przyniosły sukcesu.
english: The management board asked me why the changes hadn't brought about success.
glossary: to bring about success/the management board/a change
translation: 9. The management board asked why changes hadn’t brought about success.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Wydrukowałem już wypracowanie.
english: I've already printed out the essay.
glossary: to print out an essay
translation: 10. I’ve already printed out an essay.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Jak ty znosisz swojego chłopaka?
english: How do you put up with your boyfriend?
glossary: to put up with sb
translation: 1. How do you put up with your boyfriend?

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Muszę wychodzić. Mogłam nałożyć wcześniej krem.
english: I have to leave. I could've put on the cream earlier.
glossary: to put on cream/to leave
translation: 2. I have to leave. I could’ve put on cream earlier.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Zapomniałeś już o swojej byłej?
english: Have you gotten over your ex yet?
glossary: to get over sb/an ex
translation: 3. Have you gotten over your ex yet?

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Dzięki za podgrzanie jedzenia.
english: Thanks for heating up the food.
glossary: to heat up the food
translation: 4. Thanks for heating up the food.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Nie dostanę stypendium, jeśli uczelnia odrzuci mój wniosek.
english: I won't get the scholarship if the university turns down my application.
glossary: to get a scholarship/to turn down an application
translation: 5. I won’t get a scholarship if the college turns down my application.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Moje rzeczy zajmowały niegdyś więcej miejsca.
english: My stuff used to take up more space.
glossary: to take up space/your stuff
translation: 6. My stuff once took up more space.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Dlaczego pogodziłaś się ze swoim byłym?
english: Why did you make up with your ex?
glossary: to make up with sb
translation: 7. Why did you make up with your ex?

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Właśnie odjechaliśmy.
english: We've just driven off.
glossary: to drive off
translation: 8. We’ve just driven off.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Dalej czytałbym książkę, gdybym nie był zmęczony.
english: I'd keep on reading if I weren't tired.
glossary: to be tired/to keep on reading a book
translation: 9. I’d keep on reading the book if I wasn’t tired.

name: Jacob Brewer
polish: Nadrobimy stracony czas, jak już weźmiesz się do pracy.
english: We'll make up for lost time once you get down to work.
glossary: to make up for lost time/to get down to work
translation: 10. We’ll make up for a delay once you get down to work.

name: Justina Watson
polish: Kiedy ostatnio się widziałyśmy, moja najlepsza przyjaciółka powiedziała mi, że zerwie ze swoim chłopakiem
english: The last time we met, my best friend told me she'd break up with her boyfriend.
glossary: your best friend/to break up with sb/a boyfriend
translation: 1.	The last time we sow each other, my best friend told me that se was going to break up with her boyfriend.

name: Justina Watson
polish: Nie sądzę, że przyzwyczaję się do noszenia sukienek. Czuję, że za bardzo się wyróżniam.
english: I don't think I'll get used to wearing dresses. I feel I stand out too much.
glossary: to stand out/to wear a dress
translation: 2.	I don’t think that I get used to wearing dressing. I feel that I distinguish myself very much.

name: Justina Watson
polish: Może podjęłabyś lepszą decyzję, gdybyś rozważyła wszystkie czynniki.
english: Maybe you would've made a better decision if you'd weighed up all the factors.
glossary: to weigh up factors/to make a decision
translation: 3.	Maybe you’d made a better decision if you considered all factors.

name: Justina Watson
polish: Obudź się! Nie słyszysz, że właśnie zadzwonił budzik?
english: Wake up! Can't you hear the alarm has just gone off?
glossary: to go off/to set an alarm/to wake up/to hear sth
translation: 4.	Wake up! Don’t you hear that the alarm clock has just rang?

name: Justina Watson
polish: Spotkanie ciągnęło się jeszcze przez godzinę po tym, jak wyszedłeś.
english: The meeting still dragged on for an hour after you'd left.
glossary: to drag on/to leave
translation: 5.	The meeting was dragging on by the hour yet after you had left.

name: Justina Watson
polish: Już cię raz kryłem. Nie zrobię tego ponownie.
english: I've covered up for you once. I won't do it again.
glossary: to cover up for sb
translation: 6.	I covered up for you once. I won’t do it again.

name: Justina Watson
polish: Przyzwyczaiłem się, że żona narzeka na pracę, kiedy poruszam ten temat.
english: I got used to my wife complaining about her job every time I bring up the subject.
glossary: to bring up a subject/to complain about your job/a wife
translation: 7.	I got used to that my wife complains about the work when I bring up the subject.

name: Justina Watson
polish: Gdybyś ograniczył palenie, byłbyś zdrowszy.
english: If you cut down on smoking, you'd be more healthy.
glossary: to cut down on smoking/to be healthy
translation: 8.	If you cut down on smoking you will be healthier.

name: Justina Watson
polish: Zmieniłaś się. Kiedyś stawałaś w obronie swoich zasad.
english: You've changed. You used to stand up for your principles.
glossary: to stand up for your principles/to change
translation: 9.	You changed. Once you stood you for your principles.

name: Justina Watson
polish: Ostatnio musiałem odwołać tyle spotkań, że moi klienci zaczynają narzekać.
english: I've recently had to call off so many meetings that my clients are starting to complain.
glossary: to call off a meeting/to complain about sth/to start to do sth; to begin to do sth/a client
translation: 10.	Recently I had to cut off so many meetings that my clients start complaining.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Przyzwyczaisz się do rozgrzewania się przed treningiem.
english: You'll get used to warming up before a workout.
glossary: to warm up/a workout/to get used to doing sth
translation: 1. You get used to warm up before a workout.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Kiedyś zalegałem z rachunkami, bo byłem bezrobotny.
english: I used to fall behind with my bills because I was unemployed.
glossary: to be unemployed/to fall behind with your bills
translation: 2) I fall behind on my bills because I was unemployed.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Boję się rzucić studia. Co powiedzą rodzice?
english: I'm afraid of dropping out of college. What will my parents say?
glossary: to drop out of college/to say sth
translation: 3. I'm afraid to drop out of college. What wil parents say?

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Przeprowadzałem doświadczenie, gdy student wszedł do laboratorium.
english: I was carrying out an experiment when a student entered the lab.
glossary: a lab/a student/to carry out an experiment
translation: 4. I was conducting an experiment when a student walked into the lab.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Gdybyś nie zagadał do tej dziewczyny, nie dostałbyś kosza.
english: If you hadn't chatted up the girl, you wouldn't have been turned down.
glossary: to turn sb down/to chat sb up
translation: 5) If you hadn't talked to that girl, you wouldn't have gotten …..

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Przekładasz spotkanie od kilku tygodni. O co chodzi?
english: You've been putting off the meeting for a few weeks. What's going on?
glossary: to put off a meeting
translation: 6. You've put off your appointment for several weeks. What's the problem?

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Nasza firma zwolniła w zeszłym tygodniu kilku pracowników, ponieważ wystawili fałszywe faktury.
english: Our company laid off a few employees last week because they'd made out fake invoices.
glossary: an employee/a company/a fake invoice/to make out an invoice
translation: 7. Our company fired several employees last week because they….. false invoices.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Zrelaksujesz się, jeśli weźmiesz kąpiel.
english: You'll wind down if you take a bath.
glossary: to take a bath/to wind down
translation: 8) You'll relax if you take a bath.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Na szczęście przeszliśmy już przez formalności.
english: Fortunately, we've already gone through formalities.
glossary: to go through formalities/Fortunately...
translation: 9. Fortunately, we've gone through the formalities.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Wyglądałabym młodziej, gdybym codziennie nakładała krem.
english: I'd look younger if I put on cream every day.
glossary: to look young/to put on cream
translation: 10. I would look younger if I put on cream every day.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Powinieneś był wcześniej zgasić papierosa. Nie dostałbyś grzywny.
english: You should've put out the cigarette earlier. You wouldn't have gotten a fine.
glossary: to get a fine/to put out a cigarette
translation: 1. you should have put out your cigarette earlier. You wouldn't paid fine.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Nie chce, żebyś się do mnie zwracał o pomoc.
english: I don't want you to turn to me for help.
glossary: to turn to sb for help
translation: 2) He doesn't want you to ask me for help.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Co chcesz sprawdzić w internecie?
english: What do you want to look up on the internet?
glossary: to look sth up on the internet
translation: 3. what do you want to check on the Internet?

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Szef się mnie zapytał wczoraj, czy podejmę się nowej roli.
english: My boss asked me yesterday if I'd take on a new role.
glossary: to take on a role/a boss
translation: 4. my boss asked me yesterday if I would take on a new role.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Nie odpuszczę, dopóki nie przestaniecie zdzierać z ludzi.
english: I won't let go until you stop ripping off people.
glossary: to rip sb off/to let go/people
translation: 5) I won't let go until you stop ripping people off.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Słyszałem kilka dni temu, że ten bank orżnął setki klientów.
english: I heard the other day that the bank had ripped off hundreds of clients.
glossary: the other day/to rip sb off/a client/hundreds of clients/a bank
translation: 6. I heard a few days ago that this bank was .... hundreds of customers.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Czy ty próbujesz zaprosić mnie na randkę?
english: Are you trying to ask me out?
glossary: to ask sb out
translation: 7. are you trying to ask me out on a date?

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Zacząłeś już zajęcia tańca?
english: Have you taken up dance classes yet?
glossary: to take up dance classes
translation: 8) Have you started dance classes yet?

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Uwierzyłem ci, kiedy mi powiedziałaś, że nie jesteś w nic zamieszana.
english: I believed you when you told me that you weren't mixed up in anything.
glossary: to be mixed up in sth
translation: 9) I believed you when you told me you weren't involved in anything.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Dlaczego odwołałeś ostatnie spotkanie?
english: Why did you call off the last meeting?
glossary: to call off a meeting
translation: 10. Why did you cancel the last meeting?

name: Alexandra King
polish: Nie będziesz musiała mnie odbierać jutro ze szkoły, bo śpię u koleżanki.
english: You won't have to pick me up from school tomorrow because I'm sleeping at my friend's.
glossary: to pick sb up from school/to sleep at your friend's
translation: 1.	You won’t have to pick me up from school tomorrow because I’m sleeping in my friend’s place.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Myślałem, że zjemy dzisiaj na mieście.
english: I thought we'd eat out today.
glossary: to eat out
translation: 2.	I though we would eat out today.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Mogłem wczoraj wydać mniej pieniędzy.
english: I could've spent less money yesterday.
glossary: to spend money on sth
translation: 3.	I could have spent less money yesterday

name: Alexandra King
polish: Nie ma nikogo w domu. Dlatego jest tak cicho.
english: There's no one at home. That's why it's so silent.
glossary: to be at home/to be silent
translation: 4.	There is nobody at home. That’s why it is so quiet.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Nie wiem, co powinienem odpowiedzieć.
english: I don't know what I should answer.
glossary: to answer a question
translation: 5.	I don’t know what I should answer.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Byłem pewny, że zrobisz swoją pracę domową.
english: I was sure you'd do your homework.
glossary: to do your homework
translation: 6.	I was sure that you would do your homework

name: Alexandra King
polish: W zeszłym roku nie pojechałem na wakacje, ponieważ nie miałem pieniędzy.
english: I didn't go on vacation last year because I didn't have any money.
glossary: to go on vacation/to have no money
translation: 7.	I didn’t go to vacation last year because I didn’t have money.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Zawsze znajdę dla ciebie czas, bo jesteś dla mnie ważna.
english: I'll always find time for you because you're important to me.
glossary: to find time for sb/to be important to sb
translation: 8.	I will always find time for you because you are important for me.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Nie mogę się skupić, gdy jest tak głośno.
english: I can't focus when it's so loud.
glossary: to focus on sth/to be loud
translation: 9.	I can’t focus when it’s so laud.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Gramy jutro mecz. Dołączysz do nas?
english: We're playing a match tomorrow. Will you join us?
glossary: to play a match/to join sb
translation: 10.	We are playing a match tomorrow. Do you join us?

name: Alexandra King
polish: Pojadę na wakacje, jak już oszczędzę pieniądze.
english: I'll go on vacation once I save some money.
glossary: to go on vacation/to save some money
translation: 1.	I’ll go on vacation once I save money

name: Alexandra King
polish: Dam Ci znać, jak już skończę pracę.
english: I'll let you know once I finish work.
glossary: to let sb know/to finish work
translation: 2.	I’ll let you know once I finish work

name: Alexandra King
polish: Muszę iść wcześnie spać, bo jutro robię prezentację.
english: I have to go to sleep early because I'm giving a presentation tomorrow.
glossary: to go to sleep early/to give a presentation
translation: 3.	I have to go sleep earlier because I’m doing a deck tomorrow.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Myślałem, że będziesz tęsknić za domem.
english: I thought you'd feel homesick.
glossary: to feel homesick
translation: 4.	I thought that you would miss home

name: Alexandra King
polish: Zadzwonię do ciebie, jak już będę w domu.
english: I'll call you once I'm at home.
glossary: to call sb/to be at home
translation: 5.	I’ll call you once I’m at home.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Wyjeżdżam jutro z miasta. Zadzwonię do ciebie, jak już wrócę.
english: I'm leaving town tomorrow. I'll call you once I'm back.
glossary: once/to leave town/to call sb
translation: 6.	I’m leaving town tomorrow. I’ll call you once I’m back

name: Alexandra King
polish: Mogłem się nauczyć na test.
english: I could've studied for the test.
glossary: to study for a test
translation: 7.	I could have studied for the test.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Odwiozę cię do domu, jak już zjemy kolację.
english: I'll take you home once we eat dinner.
glossary: to take sb home/to eat dinner
translation: 8.	I’ll take you home once we finish dinner

name: Alexandra King
polish: Oglądamy dzisiaj wieczorem mecz. Wpadnij.
english: We're watching a match tonight. Drop by.
glossary: to watch a match/to drop by
translation: 9.	We are watching a match tonight. Drop by

name: Alexandra King
polish: Co powiesz na poniedziałek? W weekend zajmuję się psami mojej siostry.
english: What about Monday? I'm taking care of my sister's dogs on the weekend.
glossary: on the weekend/What about.../to take care of sth
translation: 10.	How about Monday? I’m taking care of my sister’s dog on the weekend.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Czy są w tym mieście jakieś miejsca, które powinienem odwiedzić?
english: Are there any places in the city I should visit?
glossary: in the city; in town/to visit a place
translation: 1.	Are there any places in this city that I should visit?

name: Alexandra King
polish: Gdzie jedziesz w tym roku na wakacje?
english: Where are you going on vacation this year?
glossary: to go on vacation/this year
translation: 2.	Where are you going on the vacation this year?

name: Alexandra King
polish: Mamy czas. Nie ma potrzeby się spieszyć.
english: We have time. There's no need to hurry up.
glossary: to have time/a need/to hurry up
translation: 3.	We have time. There is no necessity to be in hurry

name: Alexandra King
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że wrócę do domu dzisiaj, ale uciekł mi pociąg.
english: I hoped I'd come back home today, but I missed the train.
glossary: to hope/to come back home/today/to miss the train
translation: 4.	I had hoped that I came back to home today, but I missed my train.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Dlaczego tak zareagowałaś? Możesz mi to wytłumaczyć?
english: Why did you react like that? Can you explain it to me?
glossary: to react to sth/like that/to explain sth to sb
translation: 5.	Why did you react like that? Could you explain me that?

name: Alexandra King
polish: Mogłeś wcześniej zadzwonić. Powiedziałabym Ci, że nie ma mnie w domu.
english: You could've called before. I would've told you I wasn't at home.
glossary: to be at home/to call sb
translation: 6.	You could have called earlier. I would tell you that I am out of home

name: Alexandra King
polish: Z kim wczoraj rozmawiałeś przez telefon?
english: Who did you talk to on the phone yesterday?
glossary: to talk to sb over the phone
translation: 7.	Who did you talk to by the phone, yesterday?

name: Alexandra King
polish: Idziemy dziś wieczorem na drinka. Pamiętasz?
english: We're going for a drink tonight. Do you remember?
glossary: to remember/to go for a drink/tonight
translation: 8.	We are going for a drink tonight. Do you remember ?

name: Alexandra King
polish: Obawiam się, że nie dostanę tej pracy.
english: I'm afraid I won't get the job.
glossary: to be afraid of sth/to get a job
translation: 9.	I am worry that I will not get this job.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Z kim chcesz spędzić resztę swojego życia?
english: Who do you want to spend the rest of your life with?
glossary: to spend time with sb/the rest of your life
translation: 10.	With who do you want to spend the rest of your life?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Kiedyś spotkania w firmie się ciągnęły, ale znaleźliśmy na to rozwiązanie.
english: Meetings in our company used to drag on, but we found a solution to that.
glossary: to drag on/a meeting/in our company/a solution to sth
translation: 1. In the past, meetings in the company were dragging on, but we found a solution for that.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Jeśli wciśniesz mnie w swój grafik w tym tygodniu, zapłacę ci więcej.
english: If you fit me in to your schedule this week, I'll pay you more.
glossary: to fit sb in to the schedule/to pay sb
translation: 2. If you put me on your schedule this week, I’ll pay you more.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Kiedy wszedłem do biura, koleżanka wystawiała faktury.
english: When I entered the office, my colleague was making out invoices.
glossary: to make out an invoice/to enter the office
translation: 3. When I walked into the office, a colleague was issuing invoices.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Kogo jutro zastępujesz?
english: Who are you covering for tomorrow?
glossary: to cover for sb
translation: 4. Who are you substituting for tomorrow?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Na twoim miejscu podjąłbym się tego zadania.
english: If I were you, I would take on the task.
glossary: to take on a task
translation: 5. If I were you, I would take on this task.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Ta historia jest zmyślona.
english: The story's made up.
glossary: to make up a story
translation: 6. This story is made up.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Zostałem zwolniony po tym, jak wybuchła pandemia.
english: I was laid off after the pandemic had broken out.
glossary: to break out/to be laid off
translation: 7. I was fired after the pandemic broke out.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Nie powinienem był zalegać z rachunkami. Przepraszam.
english: I shouldn't have fallen behind with the bills. I'm sorry
glossary: to fall behind with the bills
translation: 8. I shouldn’t have fallen behind on/defaulted on my bills. I’m sorry.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Już się rozgrzałem. Możemy iść biegać.
english: I've already warmed up. We can go running.
glossary: to warm up/to go running
translation: 9. I’ve already warmed up. We can go running.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Damy ci znać, jak już wyśledzimy złodzieja.
english: We'll let you know once we track down the thief.
glossary: to track down a thief/to let sb down
translation: 10. We’ll let you know when we track down the thief.

name: Justina Watson
polish: Jeśli teraz pozbędziesz się formalności, zaoszczędzisz dużo czasu.
english: If you do away with formalities now, you'll save a lot of time.
glossary: to do away with formalities/to save time
translation: 1.	If you do away with formalities now, you will save plenty of time.

name: Justina Watson
polish: Gdybyś nie dała kosza swojemu dziwnemu koledze z pracy, byłabyś teraz w toksycznej relacji.
english: If you hadn't turned your weird colleague down, you would be in a toxic relationship now.
glossary: to turn sb down/to be in a toxic relationship
translation: 2.	If you didn’t turn your weird friend down, you would be in a toxic relationship now.

name: Justina Watson
polish: Kiedyś skarżyłem na moich kolegów za każdym razem, kiedy zrobili coś złego, ale wyluzowałem.
english: I used to tell on my friends every time they did something wrong, but I chilled out.
glossary: to tell on sb/to chill out/to do sth wrong/a friend
translation: 3.	Once, I told on my friends every time when they did something wrong but I chilled up.

name: Justina Watson
polish: Gdzie jest dokument, o który cię prosiłem? Powiedziałeś, że go wydrukujesz.
english: Where's the document I asked you for? You said you'd print it out.
glossary: to print sth out/to ask sb for sth/a document
translation: 4.	Where is the document which I asked you about? You said you would print it out.

name: Justina Watson
polish: Jeśli wszystkie moje plany się udadzą, w końcu będę mógł rzucić tę pracę.
english: If all my plans work out, I'll finally be able to give up the job.
glossary: to work out/to be able to do sth/to give up the job
translation: 5.	If all my plans succeed, I can quit my job finally.

name: Justina Watson
polish: Już wyniosłem śmieci, więc nie musisz mi o tym znów przypominać.
english: I've already taken out the garbage, so you don't have to remind me of it again.
glossary: to take out the garbage/to remind sb of sth
translation: 6.	I already took out the garbage so you don’t have to remind me about that once again.

name: Justina Watson
polish: Gdybyś się tyle nie wygłupiała, byłabyś traktowana poważniej.
english: If you didn't mess around so much, you would be treated more seriously.
glossary: to mess around/to treat sb seriously
translation: 7.	If you didn’t mess around that much, you would be treated more seriously.

name: Justina Watson
polish: Kiedy wróciłem ze Stanów, zorientowałem się, że podłapałem amerykański akcent.
english: When I came back from the US, I realized I'd picked up the American accent.
glossary: to pick up the American accent/to come back from the US/to realize that...
translation: 8.	When I came back from the US, I realized I picked up the American accent.

name: Justina Watson
polish: Ostatni pacjent wiercił się, podczas gdy przeglądałam jego dokumentację.
english: The last patient was fidgeting while I was going through his documentation.
glossary: to go through documentation/to fidget/a patient
translation: 9.	The last patient fidgeted, once I went through his documents.

name: Justina Watson
polish: Szef wyszedł z pokoju, kiedy wciąż kończyliśmy spotkanie.
english: The boss left the room when we were still wrapping up the meeting.
glossary: a boss/to leave a room/to wrap up a meeting
translation: 10.	The Manager entered the room when we were finishing the meeting.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Czy nie mieliśmy wczoraj zapłacić pierwszej raty?
english: Weren't we supposed to pay the first installment yesterday?
glossary: to pay installment
translation: 1.	Whether  didn’t we pay an first installment, yesterday?

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Czy rozwiązanie sprawdziło się na dłuższą metę?
english: Did the solution work out in the long run?
glossary: to work out/in the long run
translation: 2.	Did the solution succeed in the long run?

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Z czego wynika Twoja pasja do języków?
english: What does your passion for languages stem from?
glossary: passion for sth/to stem from sth
translation: 3.	Of which your passion for languages stem from?

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Mój mąż zawsze chrapie. Rozważam spanie osobno.
english: My husband is always snoring. I'm considering sleeping separately.
glossary: to snore/to consider doing sth/to sleep separately
translation: 4.	My husband always snores. I am considering sleeping separately

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Zawsze siedzisz do późna. Nie możemy pójść razem spać?
english: You're always sitting up late. Can't we go to sleep together?
glossary: to sit up late/to go to sleep together
translation: 5.	You always stay up late. Couldn’t we go to sleep together.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Od jak dawna wynajmujesz mieszkanie swoim znajomym? Znasz ich dobrze?
english: How long have you been renting out the apartment to your friends? Do you know them well?
glossary: to rent out an apartment to sb
translation: 6.	How long time have you been renting out your flat to your friends. Do you know them well?

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Nigdy nie bierzesz pod uwagę moich sugestii. Czy w ogóle zależy Ci na mojej opinii?
english: You never consider my suggestions. Do you even care about my opinion?
glossary: to consider sth/a suggestion/to care about sth
translation: 7.	You never take my suggestions into consideration. Do you care about my opinion?

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Na kogo zawsze głosuje Twoja matka?
english: Who does your mother always vote for?
glossary: to vote for sb
translation: 8.	Who your mother always vote for?

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Co sprawiło, że pomyślałeś, że kiedykolwiek mógłbym cię zdradzić?
english: What made you think that I could ever cheat on you?
glossary: to make sb do sth/to cheat on sb
translation: 9.	What cause you think that I could ever cheat on you

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Zawsze pędzisz. Może powinieneś nauczyć się jeździć.
english: You're always speeding. Maybe you should learn how to drive.
glossary: to speed/to learn how to do sth
translation: 10.	You are speeding. Maybe you should learn how to drive.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Zbyt długo zadzierasz ze mną.
english: You've been messing with me for too long.
glossary: to mess with sb
translation: 1. You are messing with me for too long.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Nigdy nie przyzwyczaję się do zwalniania pracowników.
english: I'll never get used to laying off employees.
glossary: to lay sb off/an employee/to get used to doing sth
translation: 2) I will never get used to firing employees.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Powiedz szefowi, co zrobiłeś, bo jestem już zmęczona kryciem ciebie.
english: Tell the boss what you've done because I'm already tired of covering up for you.
glossary: a boss/to be tired of sth/to cover for sb
translation: 3) Tell your boss what you did because I'm tired of covering for you.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Twój wniosek nie zostałbym odrzucony, gdybyś złożył go na czas.
english: Your application wouldn't have been turned down if you'd submitted it on time.
glossary: on time/to submit an application/to turn down an application
translation: 4) Your application would not have been denied if you had submitted it on time.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Szybciej znajdziesz nowego pracownika, jeśli zawęzisz listę kandydatów.
english: You'll find a new employee more quickly if you narrow down the pool of candidates.
glossary: a pool of candidates/to narrow sth down/to narrow down a pool of candidates/an employee
translation: 5. You'll find a new employee faster if you narrow down your list of applicants.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Ten hotel spełniał kiedyś wszystkie standardy.
english: The hotel used to live up to all the standards.
glossary: to live up to sb's standards/a hotel
translation: 6) This hotel used to meet all the standards.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Nie musiałbym tak często sprzątać, gdybyś codziennie nie gościł swoich znajomych.
english: You wouldn't have to clean up so often if you didn't have your friends over every day.
glossary: to have sb over/to have your friends over/to clean up
translation: 7. I wouldn't have to clean so often if you didn't host your friends every day.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Spełniłem już wszystkie twoje oczekiwania. Czego jeszcze chcesz?
english: I've already lived up to all your expectations. What else do you want?
glossary: to live up to sb's expectations
translation: 8. I have already met all your expectations. What more do you want?

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Zginęła wczoraj jedna osoba po tym, jak na ulicy wybuchła bomba.
english: One person died yesterday after a bomb had gone off on the street.
glossary: on the street/to go off/a bomb
translation: 9. one person died yesterday after went off a bomb  in the street.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Analizowałem raport, gdy mi przeszkodziłaś.
english: I was looking into a report when you interrupted me.
glossary: to interrupt sb/to look into a report
translation: 10. I was analyzing a report when you interrupted me.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Dlaczego do mnie zagadujesz?
english: Why are you chatting me up?
glossary: to chat sb up
translation: Why are you chatting  me?

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Czy naprawdę chcesz, żeby ten gatunek wyginął?
english: Do you really want the species to die out?
glossary: to die out/a species
translation: 2) Do you really want this species to become ….?

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Nie kupimy mieszkania, dopóki nie weźmiemy kredytu.
english: We won't buy an apartment until we get a mortgage.
glossary: to get a mortgage/to buy an apartment
translation: 3. We won't buy an apartment until we take out a loan.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Na ostatnim spotkaniu szef mi powiedział, że mój projekt się wyróżnia.
english: My boss told me at the last meeting that my project stood out.
glossary: to stand out/a project/at the meeting
translation: 4. At the last meeting, my boss told me that my project stands out.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Mogłem zacząć grać na pianinie jako dziecko. Byłbym teraz bardziej wprawiony.
english: I could've taken up the piano as a kid. I'd be more skillful now.
glossary: to be skillful/to take up the piano
translation: 5. I could have started playing the piano as a child. I would be more skilled now.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Czy w końcu się odezwałeś, gdy przezwyciężyłeś strach?
english: Did you finally speak up when you got over your fear?
glossary: to get over your fear/to speak up
translation: 6) Did you finally speak up when you overcame your fear?

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Dlaczego nie załozyłeś jeszcze kurtki?
english: Why haven't you put on a jacket yet?
glossary: to put on a jacket
translation: 7. why haven't you put on your jacket yet?

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Szef się mnie wczoraj zapytał, dlaczego nie zaproponowałem żadnego pomysłu na ostatnim spotkaniu.
english: My boss asked me yesterday why I hadn't put forward any idea at the last meeting.
glossary: to put forward an idea/at the meeting
translation: 8) My boss asked me yesterday why I didn't come up with any idea at the last meeting.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Jakie obowiązki musisz przekazać?
english: What responsibilities do you have to hand over?
glossary: to hand over responsibilities
translation: 9. What responsibilities do you have to ?

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Powiedziałem ci, że nie będę cię więcej znosił.
english: I told you I wouldn't put up with you anymore.
glossary: to put up with sb
translation: 10. I told you I wouldn't put up with you anymore.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Gdybyś nie poruszył tematu, szef nie zauważyłby, że jest problem.
english: If you hadn't brought up the subject, the boss wouldn't notice that there was a problem.
glossary: to bring up a subject/to notice that.../a problem
translation: 1. If you hadn’t brought up the subject, the boss wouldn’t have noticed that there was a problem.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Dlaczego schrzaniłeś to zadanie?
english: Why did you screw up the task?
glossary: to screw up a task
translation: 2. Why did you screw up the task?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Szefowa powiedziała, że przejmę ważny projekt.
english: The boss told me I'd take on an important project.
glossary: to take on a project
translation: 3. The boss said that I would take over an important project.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Zbyt długo rozważam opcje. Czas działać.
english: I've been weighing up the options for too long. It's time to act.
glossary: to weigh up the options/to act
translation: 4. I’ve been weighing up the options for too long. It’s time to act.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Klient twierdził, że product nie spełnia jego oczekiwań.
english: The client claimed the product didn't live up to his expectations.
glossary: to live up to sb's expectations/a client/a product
translation: 5. The client stated/claimed that the product didn’t live up to his expectations.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Czy zawsze zapinasz pasy, kiedy prowadzisz?
english: Do you always fasten up when driving?
glossary: to fasten up/to drive
translation: 6. Do you always fasten up, when you drive?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Zakończyłeś już spotkanie?
english: Have you wrapped up the meeting yet?
glossary: to wrap up a meeting
translation: 7. Have you wrapped up the meeting yet?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Chcesz, żebym przejrzał te dokumenty?
english: Do you want me to go through the documents?
glossary: to go through documents
translation: 8. Do you want me to go through documents?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Profesor pytał się mnie kilka dni temu, dlaczego jeszcze nie wykonałem tych badań.
english: The professor asked me a few days ago why I hadn't carried out the research yet.
glossary: to carry out research
translation: 9. The professor asked me a few days ago why I hadn’t carried out this research yet?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Szybko przyzwyczaiłam się do krycia brata.
english: I quickly got used to covering for my brother.
glossary: to cover up for sb/to get used to doing sth
translation: 10. I quickly got used to covering up for my brother.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Kiedy ostatnio się widziałyśmy, moja najlepsza przyjaciółka powiedziała mi, że zerwie ze swoim chłopakiem
english: The last time we met, my best friend told me she'd break up with her boyfriend.
glossary: your best friend/to break up with sb/a boyfriend
translation: 1. The last time we saw each other, my best friend told me, that she would break up with her boyfriend.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Nie sądzę, że przyzwyczaję się do noszenia sukienek. Czuję, że za bardzo się wyróżniam.
english: I don't think I'll get used to wearing dresses. I feel I stand out too much.
glossary: to stand out/to wear a dress
translation: 2. I don’t think I’ll get used to wearing dresses. I feel that I stand out too much.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Może podjęłabyś lepszą decyzję, gdybyś rozważyła wszystkie czynniki.
english: Maybe you would've made a better decision if you'd weighed up all the factors.
glossary: to weigh up factors/to make a decision
translation: 3. Perhaps I could have taken a better decision, if you have weighed up all the factors.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Obudź się! Nie słyszysz, że właśnie zadzwonił budzik?
english: Wake up! Can't you hear the alarm has just gone off?
glossary: to go off/to set an alarm/to wake up/to hear sth
translation: 4. Wake up! Can’t you hear that the alarm clock has just rung?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Spotkanie ciągnęło się jeszcze przez godzinę po tym, jak wyszedłeś.
english: The meeting still dragged on for an hour after you'd left.
glossary: to drag on/to leave
translation: 5. The meeting dragged on for an hour after you had left.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Już cię raz kryłem. Nie zrobię tego ponownie.
english: I've covered up for you once. I won't do it again.
glossary: to cover up for sb
translation: 6. I already covered you up once. I’m not going to do it again.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Przyzwyczaiłem się, że żona narzeka na pracę, kiedy poruszam ten temat.
english: I got used to my wife complaining about her job every time I bring up the subject.
glossary: to bring up a subject/to complain about your job/a wife
translation: 7. I got used to that my wife complains about work, when I bring up the subject.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Gdybyś ograniczył palenie, byłbyś zdrowszy.
english: If you cut down on smoking, you'd be more healthy.
glossary: to cut down on smoking/to be healthy
translation: 8. If you cut down on smoking, you would be healthier.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Zmieniłaś się. Kiedyś stawałaś w obronie swoich zasad.
english: You've changed. You used to stand up for your principles.
glossary: to stand up for your principles/to change
translation: 9. You've changed. You used to stand up for your principles.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Ostatnio musiałem odwołać tyle spotkań, że moi klienci zaczynają narzekać.
english: I've recently had to call off so many meetings that my clients are starting to complain.
glossary: to call off a meeting/to complain about sth/to start to do sth; to begin to do sth/a client
translation: 10. I had to call of so many meetings recently, that my clients are starting to complain.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Jak długo wkuwałeś do egzaminu? Ja nawet jeszcze nie zacząłem.
english: How long have you been cramming for the exam? I haven't even started yet.
glossary: to cram for the exam
translation: 1.	How long time did you cram for the exam? I haven’t even started yet.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Jakich zasad musi przestrzegać moja firma, aby otrzymać dotację?
english: What rules does my company have to comply with to receive the subsidy?
glossary: to comply with sth/a subsidy
translation: 2.	What do the principles my company should comply with to receive a subsidy?

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Jaki wpływ miał na Ciebie wypadek?
english: What impact did the accident have on you?
glossary: to have an impact on sb/an accident
translation: 3.	What the impact had an accident on you ?

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Nauczyciel miał kupić płótno. Jak mam teraz malować?
english: The teacher was supposed to buy canvas. How am I supposed to paint now?
glossary: canvas/to paint
translation: 4.	A teacher had to buy a canvas. How can I painting now?

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Od czego zależy sukces?
english: What does success depend on?
glossary: to depend on sth/success
translation: 5.	From what the success depend on?

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Nigdy mnie nie słuchasz. Jak mamy się komunikować?
english: You never listen to me. How are we supposed to communicate?
glossary: to listen to sb/to communicate
translation: 6.	You have never been listening to me. How can we communicate?

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Zawsze pracujesz do późna. Nie zależy ci na swojej rodzinie?
english: You're always working late. Don't you care about your family?
glossary: to work late/to care about your family
translation: 7.	You are always working late. Don’t you care about your family?

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Mamy nadzieję, że nasz film pomoże społeczeństwu uświadomić sobie problem przemocy domowej.
english: We hope that our movie will help society realize the problem of domestic violence.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to realize sth/domestic violence
translation: 8.	I hope that our movie will help our sociality to realize a domestic violence problem.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Zawsze przeceniasz swoje umiejętności i później wpadamy w kłopoty.
english: You're always overestimating your abilities, and then we get in trouble.
glossary: to overestimate sth/to get in trouble
translation: 9.	You are always overestimating  your skills and we get into trouble later.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Czego Twój ojciec nie pochwala?
english: What doesn't your father approve of?
glossary: to approve of sth
translation: 10.	What  does your father disapproved?

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Jakiej muzyki zwykle słucha twój mąż?
english: What music does your husband usually listen to?
glossary: to listen to music
translation: 1.	What kind of the music does your husband usually listen to?

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Zawsze przeglądasz Facebooka, kiedy chcę z tobą porozmawiać.
english: You're always scrolling Facebook when I want to talk to you.
glossary: to scroll Facebook/to want to do sth/to talk to sb
translation: 2.	You are always scrolling  Facebook, when I want to talk with you.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Jaki temat omówiłeś dzisiaj w klasie?
english: What subject did you cover in class today?
glossary: to cover a subject/to do sth in class
translation: 3.	What topic did you cover in class today?

name: Camille Tyner
polish: O czym zarząd nie wie?
english: What doesn't the management board know about?
glossary: to know about sth/a management board
translation: 4.	What the management board don’t know about?

name: Camille Tyner
polish: W czym specjalizuje się uczelnia?
english: What does the university specialize in?
glossary: to specialize in sth
translation: 5.	What the specialization of the university is?

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Film był niesamowity. Był taki wzruszający. Dosłownie sprawił, że się rozpłakałem.
english: The movie was amazing. It was so touching. It literally made me cry.
glossary: to make sb do sth/literally/to be touching
translation: 6.	The movie was amazing. It was so touching. Literally made me cry.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Na co zwykle narzeka zarząd?
english: What does the board usually complain about?
glossary: to complain about sth
translation: 7.	What does the government usually complain about?

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Mój biznes miał prosperować. Przynajmniej taki był plan.
english: My business was supposed to thrive. At least, that was the plan.
glossary: to thrive
translation: 8.	My business had to thrive. At least that was a plan.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Jak długo wątpisz w nasz projekt? Myślałem, że w niego wierzysz.
english: How long have you been doubting our project? I thought you believed in it.
glossary: to doubt sth/to believe in sth
translation: 9.	How long time have you been doubting our project? I thought you believe on it.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Nigdy nie zabierasz mnie do restauracji. Czy w ogóle mnie lubisz?
english: You never take me to any restaurants. Do you even like me?
glossary: to take sb to a restaurant/to like sb
translation: 10.	You have never taken me into a restaurant. Do you like me at list?

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Nie musielibyśmy przekładać spotkań, gdyby szef się częściej pojawiał w pracy.
english: We wouldn't have to put off meetings if the boss showed up at work more often.
glossary: to show up at work/to put off a meeting/a boss
translation: 1. We wouldn’t have put off the meetings if your boss showed up at work often.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Wrócisz do więzienia, jeśli będziesz zamieszany w narkotyki.
english: You'll go back to jail if you're mixed up in drugs.
glossary: to be mixed up in sth/to be mixed up in drugs/to go back to jail
translation: 2. You will back to prison if you will mix up in the drugs.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Kiedyś z każdym wchodziłem w konflikt, bo byłem głupi.
english: I used to come into conflict with everybody because I was stupid.
glossary: to be stupid/to come into conflict with sb

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Przestępca trafił do szpitala po tym, jak postrzeliła go policja.
english: The criminal ended up in the hospital after the police had shot him.
glossary: to shoot sb/the police/a criminal/to end up in the hospital
translation: 4. A criminal ended up in the hospital after police  had shot him.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Od dawna mnie wkurzasz. To koniec.
english: You've been pissing me off for a long time. It's over.
glossary: to piss sb off/to be over
translation: 5. You pissed me off for long time. it’s over.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Wykonałem jak dotąd dwa z trzech zadań.
english: I've carried out two out of three tasks so far.
glossary: so far/to carry out a task/one out of two
translation: 6. I have completed two from three tasks.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Kiedy wychodziłem z biura, zadzwonił do mnie klient i odwołał spotkanie.
english: When I was leaving the office, my client called me and called off the meeting.
glossary: to call off a meeting/to call sb/to leave the office
translation: 7.  When I was leaving the of office, the client called me and call off the meeting.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Przyzwyczaiłem się już do zagadywania do dziewczyn.
english: I've already gotten used to chatting up girls.
glossary: to chat sb up/a girl/to get used to doing sth
translation: 8.  I’m get used to chat girls.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Policja nie zastrzeliłaby podejrzanego, gdyby nie wyjął broni.
english: The police wouldn't have shot down the suspect if he hadn't pulled out a gun.
glossary: to pull out a gun/to shoot sb down/the police
translation: 9. The police wouldn’t have shot the suspicious if he hadn’t  taken out his gun

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Myślę o odrzuceniu zaproszenia na ten ślub. Jakie jest twoje zdanie?
english: I'm thinking about turning down the invitation to the wedding. What's your opinion?
glossary: to turn down an invitation to the wedding/an opinion/to think about sth
translation: 10. I’m thinking about turn down an invitation to the wedding. What is your opinion?

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Fabryka rozpcznie produkcje, jak już zarząd na to pozwoli.
english: The factory will go ahead with the production once the board allows it.
glossary: to allow sth/to go ahead with the production/a factory/the board
translation: 1. The factory will start production once the board will allow on it.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Zawsze chcesz, żeby wszyscy ci współczuli.
english: You always want everyone to feel for you.
glossary: to feel for sb
translation: 2. You want always that everybody feel sorry for you.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Dopiłeś już swoją kawę do końca?
english: Have you drunk up your coffee yet?
glossary: to drink up your coffee
translation: 3. Do you drink up your coffee?

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Mój lekarz rodzinny obiecał, że wciśnie mnie w grafik.
english: My GP promised he'd fit me in to his schedule.
glossary: to fit sb in to your schedule/a GP
translation: 4. My GP promised me that he will fit me in his schedule.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Zapisujesz to? Nie mam zamiaru się powtarzać.
english: Are you taking it down? I'm not going to repeat myself.
glossary: to repeat yourself/to write sth down; to take sth down
translation: 5. Do write write down it, I’ll not repeat.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Kiedy pogodziłaś się z rodziną?
english: When did you make up with your family?
glossary: to make up with sb/a family
translation: 6. When did you make up with your family?

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Dlaczego twoim zdaniem ten raport wymaga analizy?
english: Why does the report call for an analysis in your opinion?
glossary: to call for an analysis/In my opinion...
translation: 7. why do you think this report needs to be analyzed?

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Mogłem podjąć się tej roli. Zarabiałbym teraz więcej.
english: I could've taken on the role. I'd earn more now.
glossary: to make money; to earn money/to take on a role
translation: 8. I could take on this role. I would  be earn more know.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: W zeszłym miesiącu mi powiedziałaś, że ta praca cię wykańcza.
english: You told me last month that the job was wearing you down
glossary: to wear sb down/a job
translation: 9. You told me last month, your job ….

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Jeszcze rok temu bank utrzymywał, że wziąłem tę pożyczkę.
english: Only a year ago, the bank insisted that I'd taken out the loan.
glossary: to take out a loan/to insist that...
translation: 10.  Until last year, the bank…..that I had taken the loan.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Mój współpracownik nigdy nie zwraca uwagi na szczegóły. Zawsze muszę poprawiać jego zadania.
english: My coworker never pays attention to detail. I always have to correct his tasks.
glossary: to pay attention to detail/to correct sth
translation: 1.	My co-worker never pay attention to the details. I always  have to correct his assignments.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Jak długo umniejszasz moje osiągnięcia? Nie będę już tego znosić.
english: How long have you been diminishing my accomplishments? I won't put up with it anymore.
glossary: to diminish sth/to put up with sth
translation: 2.	How long have you been diminishing  my achievements?  I will not put it up anymore.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Jak długo żujesz tę gumę? Weź nową.
english: How long have you been chewing this gum? Take a new one.
glossary: to chew a gum/to take a new one
translation: 3.	How long time are you chewing this gum? Take a new one.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Słyszałem dziś, jak moja córka mówi po angielsku, i to skłoniło mnie do myślenia. Może też powinienem zapisać się na taki kurs.
english: I heard my daughter speaking English today, and it made me think. Maybe I should sign up for such a course as well.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to hear sb doing sth/to sign up for a course
translation: 4.	I heard today, as my daughter talking in English, and this make me think. Maybe I should sign up for that course.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: O co prokurator okręgowy chce cię oskarżyć?
english: What does the district attorney want to charge you with?
glossary: a district attorney/to charge sb with sth
translation: 5.	What the district attorney want to charge you for?

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Powinniśmy teraz nosić maseczki w sklepach.
english: We are supposed to wear face masks in stores now.
glossary: to wear face masks
translation: 6.	We should wearing the face masks in stores now

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Jak długo tyle bierzesz? Ostatnim razem, kiedy się spotkaliśmy, było taniej.
english: How long have you been charging this much? The last time we met it was cheaper.
glossary: to charge sb
translation: 7.	How long time are you taking so much? Last time we met it was cheaper.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Od jak dawna chwalisz się swoim nowym samochodem? Czy nie widzisz, że wszyscy mają dość?
english: How long have you been bragging about your new car? Can't you see everyone's fed up?
glossary: to brag about sth/to be fed up with sth
translation: 8.	How long have you been bragging about your new car? Don’t you see everybody are fed up with it ?

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Dlaczego akcje Twojej firmy spadły? Czy coś się stało?
english: Why did your company's shares drop? Did anything happen?
glossary: to drop/a share
translation: 9.	Why did the share of your company drop down ? Anything has happened?

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Mieliśmy się zmieniać, nieprawdaż?
english: We were supposed to take turns, weren't we?
glossary: to take turns
translation: 10.	We had to take turns, weren’t we?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Jeśli teraz pozbędziesz się formalności, zaoszczędzisz dużo czasu.
english: If you do away with formalities now, you'll save a lot of time.
glossary: to do away with formalities/to save time
translation: 1.        If you do away with the formalities now, you ‘ll save a lot of time.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Gdybyś nie dała kosza swojemu dziwnemu koledze z pracy, byłabyś teraz w toksycznej relacji.
english: If you hadn't turned your weird colleague down, you would be in a toxic relationship now.
glossary: to turn sb down/to be in a toxic relationship
translation: 2.        If you hadn’t turned your odd colleague down, you would be in a toxic relationship now.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Kiedyś skarżyłem na moich kolegów za każdym razem, kiedy zrobili coś złego, ale wyluzowałem.
english: I used to tell on my friends every time they did something wrong, but I chilled out.
glossary: to tell on sb/to chill out/to do sth wrong/a friend
translation: 3. I used to tell on my colleagues every time they did something wrong, but I chilled out.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Gdzie jest dokument, o który cię prosiłem? Powiedziałeś, że go wydrukujesz.
english: Where's the document I asked you for? You said you'd print it out.
glossary: to print sth out/to ask sb for sth/a document
translation: 4. Where’s the document I asked you for? You said you would print it out.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Jeśli wszystkie moje plany się udadzą, w końcu będę mógł rzucić tę pracę.
english: If all my plans work out, I'll finally be able to give up the job.
glossary: to work out/to be able to do sth/to give up the job
translation: 5. If all my plans are successful, I will finally be able to give up this job.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Już wyniosłem śmieci, więc nie musisz mi o tym znów przypominać.
english: I've already taken out the garbage, so you don't have to remind me of it again.
glossary: to take out the garbage/to remind sb of sth
translation: 6. I already took out the garbage, so you don't have to remind me of it again.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Gdybyś się tyle nie wygłupiała, byłabyś traktowana poważniej.
english: If you didn't mess around so much, you would be treated more seriously.
glossary: to mess around/to treat sb seriously
translation: 7. If you didn't  mess around so much, you would be treated more seriously.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Kiedy wróciłem ze Stanów, zorientowałem się, że podłapałem amerykański akcent.
english: When I came back from the US, I realized I'd picked up the American accent.
glossary: to pick up the American accent/to come back from the US/to realize that...
translation: 8. When I came back from the US, I realized that I've picked up the American accent.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Ostatni pacjent wiercił się, podczas gdy przeglądałam jego dokumentację.
english: The last patient was fidgeting while I was going through his documentation.
glossary: to go through documentation/to fidget/a patient
translation: 9. The last patient was fidgeting, when I went through his documentation.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Szef wyszedł z pokoju, kiedy wciąż kończyliśmy spotkanie.
english: The boss left the room when we were still wrapping up the meeting.
glossary: a boss/to leave a room/to wrap up a meeting
translation: 10. The boss left the room, when we were still wrapping up the meeting.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Jutro uczę się na egzamin, ale możemy się spotkać, jak już skończę.
english: I'm studying for an exam tomorrow, but we can meet once I'm done.
glossary: to be done/to study for an exam/to meet sb
translation: 1.	I’m studying to the exam tomorrow buy we can meet once I finish

name: Alexandra King
polish: Nie pojechałem nad jezioro, bo obawiałem się, że się przeziębię.
english: I didn't go to the lake because I was afraid I'd catch a cold.
glossary: to go to the lake/to catch a cold/to be afraid of sth
translation: 2.	I didn’t go to the lake because I was afraid, I would catch a cold.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Przeprowadzę się, jak już znajdę nową pracę.
english: I'll move once I find a new job.
glossary: to move/to find a new job
translation: 3.	I’ll move one I find a new job.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Będę mieć więcej energii, jak już napiję się kawy.
english: I'll have more energy once I have some coffee.
