glossary: to have energy/to have some coffee
translation: 4.	I’ll have more energy once I drink coffee.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Poproszę o podwyżkę, jak już szef będzie z powrotem w biurze.
english: I'll ask for a pay-raise once my boss is back in the office.
glossary: to ask for a pay-raise/to be back in the office
translation: 5.	I’ll ask for pay-rise once my boss is in the office.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Jestem podekscytowana, bo jutro widzę się ze starą znajomą.
english: I'm excited because I'm seeing an old friend of mine tomorrow.
glossary: to see sb/to be excited
translation: 6.	I’m excited because I’m meeting my old friend tomorrow.

name: Alexandra King
polish: W przyszłym tygodniu zaczynam kurs angielskiego. Nie mogę się doczekać.
english: I'm starting an English course next week. I can't wait.
glossary: can't wait/to start an English course
translation: 7.	I’m starting an English course next week. I can’t wait.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Porozmawiamy, jak już będziesz gotowa.
english: We'll talk once you're ready.
glossary: to talk to sb/to be ready
translation: 8.	We will talk once you are ready.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Bałem się, że przegramy sprawę przez mój błąd.
english: I was afraid we'd lose the case because of my mistake.
glossary: to be afraid of sth/to lose a case/because of you/a mistake
translation: 9.	I was afraid we would lose the case because of my mistake.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Możemy przełożyć nasze spotkanie? Jutro przyjeżdżają moi rodzice w odwiedziny.
english: Can we put off our meeting? My parents are visiting me tomorrow.
glossary: to visit sb/to put off a meeting
translation: 10.	Can we postpone our meeting? My parents are coming to visit tomorrow.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Ile osób jest w Twoim zespole?
english: How many people are there on your team?
glossary: on the team
translation: 1.	How many people is in your team?

name: Alexandra King
polish: Możemy porozmawiać, bo nie ma tu nikogo.
english: We can talk because there's nobody here.
glossary: to talk about sth
translation: 2.	We can talk because there is nobody here.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Jest kilka książek, które chciałbym przeczytać do końca roku.
english: There are a few books I'd like to read by the end of the year.
glossary: a few/to read a book/by the end of the year
translation: 3.	There are a few books which I would like to ready till the end of year.

name: Alexandra King
polish: W artykule jest błąd. Popraw go.
english: There's a mistake in the article. Correct it.
glossary: in the article/to correct a mistake
translation: 4.	There is a mistake in the article. Correct it.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Jest jeszcze tyle rzeczy, których muszę się nauczyć na test.
english: There are still so many things I have to study for the test.
glossary: to study sth for a test
translation: 5.	There is so many things I have to learn for the test.

name: Alexandra King
polish: W tej grupie jest za dużo ludzi. Znajdę inną.
english: There are too many people in the group. I'll find a different one.
glossary: in the group/to find sth/different
translation: 6.	There are too many people in this group. I’ll find another one.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Jest kilka osób, które nie wierzą w moją historię.
english: There a few people that don't believe in my story.
glossary: a few/to believe in sb's story
translation: 7.	There are some people who don’t believe in my story.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Martwię się, bo nie ma na to stanowisko dobrych kandydatów.
english: I'm worried because there are no good candidates for the position.
glossary: to be worried/a candidate for the position
translation: 8.	I’m worried because there are no good candidates for this position.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Nie ma wątpliwości, że znajdziesz lepszą pracę.
english: There are no doubts that you'll find a better job.
glossary: a doubt/to find a job
translation: 9.	I have no doubts you will find a better job.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Na spotkaniu było kilka osób, które nie miały nic do powiedzenia.
english: There were a few people at the meeting that had nothing to say.
glossary: a few/at the meeting/to have nothing to say
translation: 10.	There were some people at the meeting, who didn’t have anything to say.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Policja twierdziła wczoraj, że wytropiła złodzieja.
english: The police stated yesterday that they'd tracked down the thief.
glossary: to track down a thief
translation: .The police claimed yesterday that they had tracked down a thief.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: W zeszłym roku mówiłaś, że musisz ograniczyć palenie, ale tego nie zrobiłaś.
english: You said last year that you had to cut down on smoking, but you didn't.
glossary: to cut down on smoking/last year
translation: 2) Last year you said you had to cut down on smoking, but you didn't.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Nadrobimy opóźnienie, jak już dostaniemy wszystkie niezbędne materiały.
english: We'll make up for the delay once we get all the necessary materials.
glossary: the necessary materials/to make up for a delay
translation: 3) We'll make up for the delay once we get all the necessary materials.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Chciałbym, żebyś rozważył wszystkie za i przeciw.
english: I'd like you to weigh up all the pros and cons.
glossary: to weigh up the pros and cons
translation: 4. I'd like you to consider all the …..

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Córka obiecała, że nie będzie panikować, kiedy rozpęta się kolejna burza.
english: My daughter promised she wouldn't freak out when the next storm breaks out.
glossary: to break out/to freak out/a daughter
translation: 5) My daughter promised don’t panic when the next storm breaks.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Dlaczego nie broniłeś swoich interesów, gdy właściel mieszkania próbował cię orżnąć?
english: Why didn't you stand up for your interests when the apartment owner was trying to rip you off?
glossary: to rip sb off/an apartment owner/to stand up for your interests
translation: 6) Why didn't you defend your interests when the landlord tried to rip you off?

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Nie powinnaś była wchodzić mi w drogę.
english: You should've stayed out of my way.
glossary: to stay out of sb's way
translation: 7) You shouldn't have gotten in my way.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Czy sędzia rozważył już dowody?
english: Has the judge weighed up the evidence yet?
glossary: to weigh up evidence
translation: 8) Has the judge considered the evidence yet?

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Z ilu części składa się projekt?
english: How many parts is the project made up of?
glossary: to be made up of two parts/a project
translation: 9. how many parts does the project consist of?

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Dlaczego ograniczasz mięso? Jest zdrowe.
english: Why are you cutting down on meat? It's healthy.
glossary: to be healthy/to cut down on meat
translation: 10. why do you limit meat? It is a healthy ?

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Nie wkurzyłbyś mnie, gdybyś ze mną nie zadzierał.
english: You wouldn't have pissed me off if you hadn't messed with me.
glossary: to mess with sb/to piss sb off
translation: 1. You wouldn't piss me off if you didn't mess with me.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Gdybyś tak często się nie wkurzał, dzeciaki by się ciebie nie bały.
english: If you weren't pissed off so often, the kids wouldn't be afraid of you.
glossary: to be afraid of sb/to be pissed off/a kid
translation: 2) If you didn't piss me off so often, the kids wouldn't be afraid of you.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Nie jesteśmy zainteresowani przejęciem tej firmy.
english: We're not interested in taking over the company.
glossary: to take over a company
translation: 3) We are not interested in take over this company.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Kiedyś moje dzieciaki lubiły się przebierać, ale dorosły.
english: My kids used to like dressing up, but they grew up.
glossary: to dress up/to like doing sth/a kid/to grow up
translation: 4) My kids used to like  to dress up, but they've grown up.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Mój zespół musi przyzwyczaić się do kończenia spotkań szybciej.
english: My team has to get used to wrapping up meetings more quickly.
glossary: to wrap sth up/to wrap up a meeting/to get used to doing sth/a meeting
translation: 5) My team needs to get used to finishing meetings faster.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Od dłuższego czasu ograniczam picie. Dlatego czuję się lepiej.
english: I've been cutting down on drinking for a long time. That's why I feel better.
glossary: to feel good/to cut down on drinking
translation: 6. I have been cut back on drinking for a long time. That's why I feel better.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Jeśli ból nie ustąpi, pójdę do lekarza.
english: If the pain doesn't go away, I'll go to the doctor.
glossary: to go away {2}/to go to the doctor
translation: 7. If the pain doesn't go away, I'll go to the doctor.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Wystawiłeś jak dotąd trzy faktury. Musisz się pospieszyć.
english: You've made out three invoices so far. You have to hurry up.
glossary: to hurry up/to make out an invoice
translation: 8. You've issued three invoices so far. You need to hurry up.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Kiedy zaproponowałem lepszy plan, poprzedni został już zaakceptowany.
english: When I put forward a better plan, the previous one had already been accepted.
glossary: to accept sth/to put forward a plan
translation: 9. When I suggested a better plan, the previous one had already been accepted.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Moja ciotka sporządzała testament, kiedy zmarła.
english: My aunt was making her will when she died.
glossary: to carry out your will/to make your will/to die
translation: 10. My aunt was making a will when she died.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Jak długo już nalegasz? Nie rozumiesz, że tego nie dam?
english: How long have you been insisting yet? Don't you understand I won't give it?
glossary: to insist
translation: 1.	How long have you been insisting? Don’t you understand that I don’t give?

name: Camille Tyner
polish: O której wylądował samolot? Nie miał przybyć później?
english: What time did the plane land? Wasn't it supposed to arrive later?
glossary: to land/a plane/to arrive later
translation: 2.	What time the plane was landed? Shouldn’t it arrive later?

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Twoja partia miała mnie wesprzeć w następnych wyborach.
english: Your party was supposed to back me during the next election.
glossary: to back sb/a party/an election
translation: 3.	Your party had to support me in the next election.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Nigdy nie pozwalasz mi chodzić na imprezy. Nie jestem już dzieckiem.
english: You never let me go to parties. I'm not a kid anymore.
glossary: to let sb do sth/to be a kid
translation: 4.	You never all me to go to parties. I am not a kid anymore.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Jak długo zaprzeczasz prawdzie? Czy to nie najwyższy czas, żeby się z tym zmierzyć?
english: How long have you been denying the truth? Isn't it high time to face it?
glossary: to deny the truth/to face sth
translation: 5.	How long have you been denied the truth? Is it the high time to face it?

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Nikt nie zmuszał Cię do wybrania tego kursu, więc przestań narzekać.
english: No one made you choose that course, so stop complaining.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to complain about sth
translation: 6.	Nobody forced you to choose this course, so stop complaining.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Miałem naładować komórkę, ale zupełnie zapomniałem.
english: I was supposed to charge my cell phone, but I totally forgot.
glossary: to charge your cell phone
translation: 7.	I had to charge my mobile cell, but have forgotten completely.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Czym zwykle skutkuje takie zachowanie?
english: What does such behavior usually result in?
glossary: behavior/to result in sth
translation: 8.	What is the result of that behaviour?

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Mój mąż miał złożyć łóżeczko do kupy, ale był zbyt leniwy.
english: My husband was supposed to put the crib together, but he was too lazy.
glossary: to put sth together/to be too lazy to do sth
translation: 9.	My husband had to put the crib together, but he was too lazy.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Od jak dawna próbujesz wprowadzić swój pierwszy produkt? Chyba minął już rok.
english: How long have you been trying to roll out your first product? I guess it's been a year now.
glossary: to roll out sth
translation: 10.	How long time have you been trying to roll your first product out? I think it has been a year already.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Przepraszam. Musiałem coś pomieszać, kiedy wystawiałem dla pana fakturę.
english: I'm sorry. I must've mixed something up when making out the invoice for you.
glossary: to make out an invoice/to mix sth up/to be sorry
translation: 1. I’m sorry. I had to mixed something up when I was making out the invoice for you.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Powinnam była zwrócić się do ciebie o pomoc, kiedy jeszcze nie było za późno.
english: I should've turned to you for help when it wasn't too late yet.
glossary: to turn to sb for help
translation: 2. I should turned to you for help, when it wasn’t too late yet.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Kiedy dotarłam na imprezę, koleżanki spytały mnie, dlaczego się nie przebrałam.
english: When I got to the party, my friends asked me why I hadn't dressed up.
glossary: to dress up/to get to a party
translation: 3. When I got to the party, my friends asked me why I didn’t dress up.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Czy ty musisz zagadywać do każdej dziewczyny, którą spotykasz?
english: Do you have to chat up every girl you meet?
glossary: to chat up a girl
translation: 4. Do you must chat up every girl you meet?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Chcę, żebyś w końcu przezwyciężył stres i skoncentrował się na projekcie.
english: I want you to finally get over the stress and concentrate on the project.
glossary: to get over a difficulty/to concentrate on sth/to want sb to do sth
translation: 5. I want you to finally get over the stress  and concentrate on the project.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Dlaczego znalazłeś wymówkę, zamiast powiedzieć mi, że jesteś zmęczony?
english: Why did you come up with an excuse instead of telling me you were tired?
glossary: to come up with an excuse/instead of sth/to do sth simply
translation: 6. Why did you come up with an excuse instead of telling me you were tired?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Kiedy byliśmy dziećmi, mój młodszy brat mówił, że patrzę na niego z góry.
english: When we were kids, my younger brother said I looked down on him.
glossary: to look down on sb/a younger brother
translation: 7. When we were kids, my younger brother used to say that I looked down on him.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Dlaczego wszystko, co robisz, zawsze wychodzi?
english: Why does everything you do always work out?
glossary: to work out
translation: 8. Why everything you do always works out?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Wypiłaś już herbatę? Naprawdę musimy się spieszyć.
english: Have you drunk up your tea yet? We really need to hurry up.
glossary: to drink sth up/to hurry up
translation: 9. Did you drink your tea yet? We really have to hurry up.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Za każdym razem, gdy czuję, że jestem obserwowana, panikuję.
english: Every time I feel that I'm being watched, I freak out.
glossary: to freak out/Every time.../to be watched
translation: 10. Every time I feel that I’m being watched, I freak out.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Jak długo już nalegasz? Nie rozumiesz, że tego nie dam?
english: How long have you been insisting yet? Don't you understand I won't give it?
glossary: to insist
translation: 1.	You promised to take care of the issue

name: Camille Tyner
polish: O której wylądował samolot? Nie miał przybyć później?
english: What time did the plane land? Wasn't it supposed to arrive later?
glossary: to land/a plane/to arrive later
translation: 2.	There are many people in my office who gossip.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Twoja partia miała mnie wesprzeć w następnych wyborach.
english: Your party was supposed to back me during the next election.
glossary: to back sb/a party/an election
translation: 3.	I think I will participate in the course.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Nigdy nie pozwalasz mi chodzić na imprezy. Nie jestem już dzieckiem.
english: You never let me go to parties. I'm not a kid anymore.
glossary: to let sb do sth/to be a kid
translation: 4.	Why did you slap me?

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Jak długo zaprzeczasz prawdzie? Czy to nie najwyższy czas, żeby się z tym zmierzyć?
english: How long have you been denying the truth? Isn't it high time to face it?
glossary: to deny the truth/to face sth
translation: 5.	I have been looking for a new job for a month.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Nikt nie zmuszał Cię do wybrania tego kursu, więc przestań narzekać.
english: No one made you choose that course, so stop complaining.

translation: 6.	Why did the teacher tall you off?

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Miałem naładować komórkę, ale zupełnie zapomniałem.
english: I was supposed to charge my cell phone, but I totally forgot.
glossary: to charge your cell phone
translation: 7.	I will ask your sister out once she came back town

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Czym zwykle skutkuje takie zachowanie?
english: What does such behavior usually result in?
glossary: behavior/to result in sth
translation: 8.	I will not show up at the meeting today because I am sick

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Mój mąż miał złożyć łóżeczko do kupy, ale był zbyt leniwy.
english: My husband was supposed to put the crib together, but he was too lazy.
glossary: to put sth together/to be too lazy to do sth
translation: 9.	You should do it on your own

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Od jak dawna próbujesz wprowadzić swój pierwszy produkt? Chyba minął już rok.
english: How long have you been trying to roll out your first product? I guess it's been a year now.
glossary: to roll out sth
translation: 10.	My husband is picking the kids up from school tomorrow

name: Alexandra King
polish: Nie powinienem był robić takiego bałaganu. Przepraszam.
english: I shouldn't have made such a mess. I'm sorry.
glossary: to make a mess
translation: 1.	I shouldn’t have made such a mess. Excuse me

name: Alexandra King
polish: Jestem głodny. Mogłem zjeść śniadanie.
english: I'm hungry. I could've eaten breakfast.
glossary: to be hungry/to eat breakfast
translation: 2.	I’m hungry. I could have eaten a breakfast

name: Alexandra King
polish: Mogłem biec szybciej. Zdążyłbym na pociąg.
english: I could've run faster. I would've caught the train.
glossary: to run fast/to catch the train
translation: 3.	I could run faster. I would catch the train.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Jechałeś bardzo szybko. Bałem się, że będziemy mieli wypadek.
english: You drove very fast. I was afraid we'd have an accident.
glossary: to drive/to be afraid/to have an accident
translation: 4.	You have been driving very fast. I was afraid we would have an accident.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Jutro jedziemy do centrum na zakupy. Chcesz coś?
english: We're going shopping downtown tomorrow. Do you want anything?
glossary: to go shopping/to go downtown
translation: 5.	Tomorrow we are going to the mall for shopping. Do you want anything?

name: Alexandra King
polish: Co się stało? Byłem pewien, że będziesz się trzymać planu.
english: What happened? I was sure you'd stick to the plan.
glossary: to happen/to be sure/to stick to the plan
translation: 6.	What happened? I was sure that we would be stick to the plan.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Moja najlepsza przyjaciółka wychodzi za mąż w przyszłym tygodniu.
english: My best friend's getting married next week.
glossary: to get married/next week
translation: 7.	My best friend is getting married next week

name: Alexandra King
polish: Nie pracuję jutro, więc możemy jechać nad jezioro.
english: I'm not working tomorrow, so we can go to the lake.
glossary: to work/to go to the lake/tomorrow
translation: 8.	I’m not working tomorrow so we can go to the lake.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że się zaprzyjaźnimy.
english: I hoped we'd make friends.
glossary: to hope/to make friends
translation: 9.	I hoped we would make friends

name: Alexandra King
polish: Ile osób jest w Twoim zespole?
english: How many people are there on your team?
glossary: on the team
translation: 10.	How many people are on your team?

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Do czego odnosi się artykuł?
english: What does the article refer to?
glossary: to refer to sth/an article
translation: 1.	What is this article regarding to?

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Dlaczego pozwoliłeś rodzicom rozpieszczać swoje dzieci?
english: Why did you let your parents spoil your kids?
glossary: to let sb do sth/to spoil your kids
translation: 2.	Why did you allow to spoil your children to your parents?

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Miałeś przećwiczyć scenariusz. Jak zamierzasz teraz wyjść na scenę?
english: You were supposed to rehearse the script. How are you going to go on stage now?
glossary: to rehearse the script/to go on stage
translation: 3.	You had to rehearse the script. How are you planning to go on stage?

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Zbyt często wychodzisz. To nie jest hotel.
english: You're going out way too often. It's not a hotel.
glossary: to go out/to do sth way too often
translation: 4.	You go out too often. It is not a hotel.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Mój tata miał rozebrać te stare meble, ale nie miał czasu.
english: My dad was supposed to take this old furniture apart, but he had no time.
glossary: to take sth apart/to have no time
translation: 5.	My dad had to take this furniture apart, but he hadn’t have a time

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Jak długo bronisz przestępców? Nie czujesz się z tym źle?
english: How long have you been defending criminals? Don't you feel bad about it?
glossary: to defend sb/to feel bad about sth
translation: 6.	How long time have you been defending criminals? Don’t you feel bad with that?

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Jak długo zlew jest zatkany? Powinniśmy coś z tym zrobić.
english: How long has the sink been stuck? We should do something about it.
glossary: to be stuck/to do sth about sth
translation: 7.	How long time has the sink been clogged? We have to do something with this.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Po południu miałam ściąć włosy, ale okazało się, że muszę odebrać syna ze szkoły.
english: I was supposed to have my hair cut in the afternoon, but it's turned out I have to pick my son from school.
glossary: to have your hair cut/to pick sb from school
translation: 8.	I had to have my hair cut afternoon, but it turned out, that I have to pick my son up from the school

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Co sprawiło, że wyprowadziłeś się z miasta? Myślałem, że lubisz swoją okolicę.
english: What made you move out of town? I thought you liked your neighborhood.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to like your neighborhood
translation: 9.	What made you to move out of town?? I thought you like your surrounding

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Miałeś kosić trawnik. Kiedy zamierzasz to zrobić?
english: You were supposed to mow the lawn. When are you going to do it?
glossary: to mow the lawn
translation: 10.	You had to mow the loan. When do you expect to do it ?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Przebrnę przez całą tę papierkową robotę, jak tylko będę w odpowiednim nastroju.
english: I'll go through all the paperwork once I'm in the right mood.
glossary: to go through paperwork
translation: I’ll go through all the paperwork as soon as I'm in the right mood.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Kim jest ta dziewczyna, która dziś zastępuje sekretarkę menedżera? Nigdy wcześniej jej nie widziałam.
english: Who's the girl that's covering for the manager's secretary today? I've never seen her before.
glossary: to cover for sb/a secretary/a manager/to see sb
translation: Who is the girl who cover for the manager’s secretary today? I’ve never seen her before.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Wiem, że jesteś bombardowana nowymi informacjami, ale wyluzuj. To nie aż tak skomplikowane.
english: I know you're being bombarded with new information, but chill out. It's not that complicated.
glossary: to chill out/to be bombarded with information/to be complicated
translation: I know you are bombarded with new information, but chill out. It's not that complicated.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Powiedziałam szefowi, że to szkoda, że umniejszył znaczeniu moich wysiłków.
english: I told my boss it was a shame he'd played down the significance of my efforts.
glossary: to play down the significance of sth/It's a shame that.../a boss/an effort
translation: I told my boss it was a shame that he played down the significance of my efforts.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Wiem, że jest późno. Dlatego postaram się zakończyć spotkanie najszybciej, jak to możliwe.
english: I know it's late. That's why I'll try to wrap the meeting up as quickly as possible.
glossary: to wrap up a meeting/to be late/as quickly as possible
translation: I know it’s late. That’s why I’ll try to wrap up the meeting as quickly as possible.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Kiedy rozglądałam się po sklepie, sprzedawczyni spytała mnie, czy potrzebuję pomocy.
english: When I was looking around in the shop, the assistant asked me if I needed help.
glossary: to look around/an assistant/to need help
translation: When I was looking around the store, the saleswoman asked me if I needed help.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Czy wydrukowałeś wszystkie strony? Myślę, że niektórych brakuje.
english: Did you print all of the pages out? I think some of them are missing.
glossary: to print sth out/a page/to be missing
translation: Did you print out all the pages? I think some are lacking/missing.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Nie bądź tak pesymistyczna. Rozważyłaś już wszystkie możliwe opcje?
english: Don't be so pessimistic. Have you weighed up all the possible options yet?
glossary: to weigh up the options/to be pessimistic/an option/to be possible
translation: Don’t be so pessimistic. Did you weigh up all the options yet?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Poczujesz się lepiej po treningu, kiedy się odświeżysz.
english: You'll feel better after the workout when you freshen up.
glossary: to freshen up/to feel better/a workout
translation: You’ll feel better after a workout when you freshen up.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Mimo że mój szef wie, że nie znoszę papierkowej roboty, chce, żebym przeglądała dokumenty.
english: Although my boss knows I hate paperwork, he wants me to go over documents.
glossary: to go over a document/Although.../to hate paperwork
translation: Although my boss knows I hate paperwork, he wants me to go through the documents.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Dlaczego dzwoniłeś wczoraj do mnie tyle razy?
english: Why did you call me so many times yesterday?
glossary: to call sb/many times
translation: 1.	Why did you call me so many times?

name: Alexandra King
polish: Z kim wczoraj poszedłeś na imprezę?
english: Who did you go to the party with yesterday?
glossary: to go to a party with sb
translation: 2.	With who did you go for a party?

name: Alexandra King
polish: Nie powinnaś była składać obietnicy, jeśli wiedziałaś, że jej nie dotrzymasz.
english: You shouldn't have made the promise if you knew you wouldn't keep it.
glossary: to make a promise/to keep a promise
translation: 3.	You shouldn’t have make a promise if you knew that you won’t keep it.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Jestem rozczarowana. Byłam pewna, że nie złamiesz obietnicy.
english: I'm disappointed. I was sure you wouldn't break the promise.
glossary: to be disappointed with sth/to be sure/to break a promise
translation: 4.	I’m disappointed. I was sure you would break it.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Ufam ci, bo od dawna razem pracujemy.
english: I trust you because we've been working together for a long time.
glossary: to trust sb/for a long time
translation: 5.	I trust you because we work together for a long time.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Możemy porozmawiać, bo nie ma tu nikogo.
english: We can talk because there's nobody here.
glossary: to talk about sth
translation: 6.	We can talk because there is nobody here.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Przeprowadzam się w przyszłym miesiącu na wieś. Nie mogę się doczekać.
english: I'm moving to the countryside next month. I can't wait.
glossary: can't wait/to move to the countryside
translation: 7.	I’m moving to the village next month. I can’t wait

name: Alexandra King
polish: Jest kilka książek, które chciałbym przeczytać do końca roku.
english: There are a few books I'd like to read by the end of the year.
glossary: a few/to read a book/by the end of the year
translation: 8.	here are a few books which I would like to read till the end of the year.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Mam nadzieję, że zdążę na pociąg. To ostatni.
english: I hope I'll catch the train. It's the last one.
glossary: to catch the train/to catch the last train
translation: 9.	I hope I’ll catch the train. That’s the last one.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Od miesiąca szukam pracy, ale nie ma interesujących ofert.
english: I've been looking for a job for a month, but there are no interesting offers.
glossary: to look for a job/an offer
translation: 10.	I have been looking for a job for one month but there are no interesting offers.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Nie powinienem był robić takiego bałaganu. Przepraszam.
english: I shouldn't have made such a mess. I'm sorry.
glossary: to make a mess
translation: 1.	I shouldn’t have made such a mess. I’m sorry

name: Alexandra King
polish: Jestem głodny. Mogłem zjeść śniadanie.
english: I'm hungry. I could've eaten breakfast.
glossary: to be hungry/to eat breakfast
translation: 2.	I’m hungry. I could eat a breakfast

name: Alexandra King
polish: Mogłem biec szybciej. Zdążyłbym na pociąg.
english: I could've run faster. I would've caught the train.
glossary: to run fast/to catch the train
translation: 3.	I could have been running faster. I would catch a train.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Jechałeś bardzo szybko. Bałem się, że będziemy mieli wypadek.
english: You drove very fast. I was afraid we'd have an accident.
glossary: to drive/to be afraid/to have an accident
translation: 4.	You have been driving very fast. I was afraid we would have an accident.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Jutro jedziemy do centrum na zakupy. Chcesz coś?
english: We're going shopping downtown tomorrow. Do you want anything?
glossary: to go shopping/to go downtown
translation: 5.	we are going to the mall for shopping, tomorrow. Do you want anything?

name: Alexandra King
polish: Co się stało? Byłem pewien, że będziesz się trzymać planu.
english: What happened? I was sure you'd stick to the plan.
glossary: to happen/to be sure/to stick to the plan
translation: 6.	What happened? I was sure you would be stick to the plan

name: Alexandra King
polish: Moja najlepsza przyjaciółka wychodzi za mąż w przyszłym tygodniu.
english: My best friend's getting married next week.
glossary: to get married/next week
translation: 7.	My best friend is getting married next week.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Nie pracuję jutro, więc możemy jechać nad jezioro.
english: I'm not working tomorrow, so we can go to the lake.
glossary: to work/to go to the lake/tomorrow
translation: 8.	I’m not working tomorrow so we can go to the lake.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że się zaprzyjaźnimy.
english: I hoped we'd make friends.
glossary: to hope/to make friends
translation: 9.	I hoped we would be friends

name: Alexandra King
polish: Ile osób jest w Twoim zespole?
english: How many people are there on your team?
glossary: on the team
translation: 10.	How many people are in your team?

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Policja miała się upewnić, że zostanę skazany za przestępstwo.
english: The police were supposed to make sure that I'd be convicted of the crime.
glossary: to make sure that.../to be convicted of sth
translation: 1.	Police had to make sure that I would be convicted of a crime.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Kiedy nauczyłeś się wyrażać swoje uczucia?
english: When did you learn how to express your feelings?
glossary: to learn how to do sth/to express your feelings
translation: 2.	When did you learn to express your feelings?

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Dlaczego zmieniłeś temat? Próbujesz coś przede mną ukryć?
english: Why did you change the subject? Are you trying to hide something from me?
glossary: to change the subject/to try to do sth/to hide sth from sb
translation: 3.	Why did you change the topic? Do you try to hide something against me?

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Z jakimi problemami musi się zmierzyć ofiara przemocy domowej? Czy wiesz?
english: What issues does a victim of domestic violence have to deal with? Do you know?
glossary: to deal with an issue/a victim of sth/domestic violence
translation: 4.	What kind of problems the victim of domestic violence have to face with? Do you know it?

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Dlaczego moja bluza z kapturem się skurczyła? W jakiej temperaturze ją prałeś?
english: Why did my hoodie shrink? What temperature did you wash it at?
glossary: a hoodie/to shrink/to wash sth at a temperature
translation: 5.	Why has my hoodie shrunk? In what temperature did you wash it?

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Co skłoniło cię do dołączenia do klubu? Dlaczego tu jesteś?
english: What made you join the club? Why are you here?
glossary: to make sb do sth
translation: 6.	What make you to join the club? Why do you here?

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Zbyt dużo pijesz. Pomyśl o swojej rodzinie.
english: You're drinking way too much. Think about your family.
glossary: to drink way too much/to think about your family
translation: 7.	You drink way too much. Think about your family

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Jak długo czekałeś, aż lekarz znajdzie dla Ciebie wolne miejsce?
english: How long have you been waiting for the doctor to find a free slot for you?
glossary: to find a free slot/to wait for sb to do sth
translation: 8.	How long have you been waiting until the doctor found free slot for you?

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Dlaczego były prezydent ustąpił? Czy było to związane z problemami finansowymi firmy?
english: Why did the former president step down? Was it related to the company's financial problems?
glossary: a former president/to step down from sth/to be related to sth/a financial problem
translation: 9.	Why the ex-president withdrawn ? Whether this was connected with the financial company’s problems?

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Jak ty to robisz? Co sprawia, że ​​czujesz się silny?
english: How do you do it? What makes you feel strong?
glossary: to make sb feel strong
translation: 10.	How do you do this? What make you feel strong?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Dlaczego zalegacie z czynszem? Macie problemy finansowe?
english: Why are you falling behind with the rent? Do you have financial problems?
glossary: to fall behind with the rent/to have financial problems
translation: Why do you fall behind with the rent? Do you have financial problems?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Nie chciałbym, żeby mój szef opieprzał mnie, gdy inni są wokół.
english: I wouldn't like my boss to tell me off when others are around.
glossary: a boss/to tell sb off/others/to be around
translation: I wouldn’t want my boss to tell me off when others are around.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Nie mogę się przyzwyczaić do zapinania pasów.
english: I can't get used to fastening up.
glossary: to fasten up
translation: I can’t get used to fastening up my seatbelts.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Ostatnim razem, gdy rozmawialiśmy, wspominałeś, że chcesz wstąpić do wojska.
english: The last time we talked, you mentioned you wanted to go into the army.
glossary: to go into the army/to mention sth
translation: Last time we had a conversation, you mentioned that you wanted to enter the army.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Czy twój asystent wykonuje zadania na czas?
english: Does your assistant carry out tasks on time?
glossary: an assistant/to carry out a task/on time
translation: Does your assistant carry out tasks on time?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Gdybyś przejrzał dokumenty przed spotkaniem, nie spieprzyłbyś prezentacji.
english: If you'd looked over the documents before the meeting, you wouldn't have screwed up the presentation.
glossary: to look over documents/to screw sth up/to screw up a presentation
translation: If you had looked through the documents before the meeting, you wouldn’t have screwed up the presentation.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Kiedyś patrzyłem na ludzi z góry, ale się zmieniłem.
english: I used to look down on people, but I changed.
glossary: to look down on sb/to change
translation: I used to look down on people, but I’ve changed.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Odświeżyłem się już. Możemy wychodzić.
english: I've already freshened up. We can leave.
glossary: to freshen up/to leave
translation: I’ve already freshened up. We can leave now.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Zapytałem się szefa, dlaczego nie poruszliśmy tematu podwyżki na spotkaniu zespołu.
english: I asked my boss why we hadn't brought up the subject of a pay-raise at the team meeting.
glossary: a boss/to bring up a subject/a pay-raise/a team meeting
translation: I asked my boss why we didn’t bring up the subject of a pay-raise at the team meeting.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Wiele dokumentów zebrało się na moim biurku, zanim się zorientowałam.
english: Many documents had piled up on my desk before I realized it.
glossary: to pile up/to realize sth/a document/on your desk
translation: Many documents piled up on my desk before I realized.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Kogo chcesz, żebym zaprosił na imprezę?
english: Who do you want me to invite to the party?
glossary: to invite sb to a party
translation: 1.	Who do you want me to invite for a party?

name: Alexandra King
polish: Wpadaj. Mój mąż gotuje w ten piątek.
english: Drop by. My husband's cooking this Friday.
glossary: to cook/this Friday
translation: 2.	Drop by! My husband is cooking this Friday.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Nie ma różnicy. Bierz, co chcesz.
english: There's no difference. Take what you want.
glossary: a difference/to take sth
translation: 3.	There is no difference. Take what you want

name: Alexandra King
polish: Mogłeś mi od razu powiedzieć prawdę. Nie zdenerwowałbym się.
english: You could've told me the truth at the beginning. I wouldn't have gotten mad.
glossary: to tell sb the truth/at the beginning/to get mad
translation: 4.	You could have told me the truth right away. I wouldn’t get nervous.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Co mi chciałaś powiedzieć na imprezie?
english: What did you want to tell me at the party?
glossary: to tell sb sth/at the party
translation: 5.	What did you want to tell me at the party?

name: Alexandra King
polish: W artykule jest błąd. Popraw go.
english: There's a mistake in the article. Correct it.
glossary: in the article/to correct a mistake
translation: 6.	There is a mistake in the article. Correct it.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Może pojadę taksówką. Zaoszczędzę czas.
english: Maybe I'll take a cab. I'll save time.
glossary: to take a cab/to save money
translation: 7.	Maybe I’ll take a taxi. I’ll save time

name: Alexandra King
polish: Co chcesz dostać na urodziny?
english: What do you want to get for your birthday?
glossary: to get sth for your birthday
translation: 8.	What do you want for a birthday?

name: Alexandra King
polish: Gdzie Ty wczoraj spałeś?
english: Where did you sleep yesterday?
glossary: to sleep
translation: 9.	Where did you sleep yesterday?

name: Alexandra King
polish: Stresowałem się, bo bałem się, że coś pójdzie źle.
english: I was stressed out because I was afraid something would go wrong.
glossary: to be stressed out/to be afraid of sth/to go wrong
translation: 10.	I was stressed because I was afraid something would go wrong.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Łatwo nam było zaspokoić potrzeby tego klienta, bo mieliśmy wszystko, czego chciał.
english: It was easy for us to meet this client's needs because we had everything he wanted.
glossary: to meet your client's needs
translation: 1. It was easy for us to meet the customer needs because we had everything he wanted.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Dlaczego udajesz, że płaczesz?
english: Why are you pretending that you're crying?
glossary: to pretend that.../to cry
translation: 2. Why are you pretending that you are crying?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Mama nie byłaby teraz zła, gdybyś nie rozlał kawy na obrus.
english: Mom wouldn't be mad now if you hadn't spilled coffee on the tablecloth.
glossary: to be mad/to spill coffee/a tablecloth
translation: 3. Your mom wouldn’t been angry now if you hadn’t spilled coffee on a tablecloth.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Byłbym wdzięczny, gdybyś powstrzymał się od robienia komentarzy.
english: I would appreciate it if you refrained from making comments.
glossary: to appreciate sth/to refrain from sth/to make comments
translation: 4. I would be grateful if you prevented self from doing comments.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Nie kłóciłbyś się teraz ze mną, gdybyś był trzeźwy.
english: You wouldn't be arguing with me now if you were sober.
glossary: to argue with sb/to be sober
translation: 5. You wouldn’t have an argument with me now if you were sober.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Poczekaj, aż będziesz miał wszystkie potrzebne informacje.
english: Wait until you have all the information needed.
glossary: to have all the information needed
translation: 6. Wait until you will have all the information you need.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Na twoim miejscu bym się nie czepiał. To może się obrócić przeciwko tobie.
english: I wouldn't nitpick if I were you. It can turn against you.
glossary: to nitpick/to turn against sb
translation: 7. I wouldn’t picked on at your place. It can turn on against you.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Mógłbyś teraz pracować, gdybyś naładował wcześniej laptopa.
english: You would be able to work now if you had charged your laptop earlier.
glossary: to be able to do sth/to charge a laptop
translation: 8. You would work now if you had charged your laptop earlier.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Jakich narzędzi potrzebujesz, aby ukończyć zadanie?
english: What tools do you need to finish your task?
glossary: to finish a task/a tool
translation: 9. What the tools do you need to complete the task?

polish: Myślałem, że zjemy dzisiaj na mieście.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Mogłem wczoraj wydać mniej pieniędzy.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Nie ma nikogo w domu. Dlatego jest tak cicho.

glossary: to be at home/to be silent
translation: It is nobody at home. That’s why is so quiet.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Nie wiem, co powinienem odpowiedzieć.
english: I don't know what I should answer.
glossary: to answer a question

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Byłem pewny, że zrobisz swoją pracę domową.
english: I was sure you'd do your homework.

name: Adrianne Nelson

glossary: to go on vacation/to have no money

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Zawsze znajdę dla ciebie czas, bo jesteś dla mnie ważna.

glossary: to find time for sb/to be important to sb
translation: I‘ll always find time for you because you are important for me.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Nie mogę się skupić, gdy jest tak głośno.
english: I can't focus when it's so loud.
glossary: to focus on sth/to be loud
translation: I can’t focus  when it’s so loud.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Gramy jutro mecz. Dołączysz do nas?

glossary: to play a match/to join sb

glossary: to pay interest/to forgot about sth

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Byłbym w stanie rozebrać to na części, gdybym miał klucz.

glossary: to be able to do sth/to take sth apart/to have sth

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Co próbujesz wynegocjować?

glossary: to negotiate

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Pana dokumenty nie zostałyby odrzucone, gdyby złożył je Pan na czas.

glossary: a document/to get rejected/to hand sth on time

glossary: to pay for sth/to terminate a contract/to do sth on time

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Jakich ludzi cenisz sobie najbardziej?

polish: Nie musiałbyś mi teraz przeszkadzać, gdybyś zapisał tę informację.

glossary: to disturb sb/to note down information

polish: Trudno mi było udowodnić swoją rację.

polish: Gdybyś gromadził dane w chmurze, nie musiałbyś teraz płacić za ich odzyskiwanie.

glossary: to store your data in the cloud/to restore data/to pay for sth

polish: Gdyby tylko nie było dzisiaj korków.

glossary: I wish that...; If only.../a traffic jam

name: Anna Patton
polish: Mój znajomy płaci za sprzątanie mieszkania.

glossary: a friend of yours/a friend of mine/to pay for sth/to clean your apartment

name: Anna Patton
polish: Kogo następnie będziemy operować?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Stracisz prawo jazdy, jeśli będziesz prowadzić po pijaku.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Byłem oburzony, kiedy zapytano się mnie w zeszłym miesiącu, czy kiedykolwiek wziąłem łapówkę.

glossary: to be outraged/last month/to take a bribe

name: Anna Patton
polish: Gdybyś nie popełnił tego przestępstwa, policja by cię teraz nie szukała.

glossary: to look for sb/to commit a crime

name: Anna Patton
polish: Klient żąda, żebyśmy zwrócili mu jego pieniądze.

glossary: to demand that.../a client/to refund sb's money

name: Anna Patton
polish: Byłam pewna, że spędzimy razem więcej czasu.

glossary: to be sure that.../to spend time with sb

name: Anna Patton
polish: Jestem głodny. Mogłem zjeść śniadanie.

name: Anna Patton

glossary: to move to a different city/to talk about sth

glossary: to happen/to be sure/to stick to the plan

name: Anna Patton

glossary: to read between the lines/to mean sth/a girlfriend

name: Anna Patton
polish: Twoja nauczycielka się mnie wczoraj pytała, dlaczego nie zrobiłeś ostatniej pracy domowej.

glossary: a teacher/to do your homework

name: Anna Patton
polish: Zauważyłem wczoraj, że pracownik mnie okradł.

glossary: to rob sb/to notice sth

name: Anna Patton
polish: Gdzie zaparkowałeś samochód?

glossary: to park a car

name: Anna Patton
polish: Gramy jutro mecz. Dołączysz do nas?

glossary: to play a match/to join sb

english: Could you focus on doing your homework?
glossary: to focus on sth/to do your homework

glossary: to have a problem with sth/a restaurant

name: Anna Patton
polish: Dołączyłbym do was, gdybym nie zapomniał kąpielówek.

glossary: to join sb/to forget sth/swim trunks

name: Anna Patton

glossary: to go off {2}/to keep doing sth

glossary: to learn English

glossary: to suffer from sth/an aunt

english: Who did you talk to on the phone yesterday?

glossary: to park a car/in front of the building/a possibility to do sth

polish: Zaspałem wczoraj do pracy, bo budzik nie zadzwonił.

glossary: to go off {2}/to oversleep for work/an alarm
translation: I fell asleep to work yesterday because the set alarm didn't go off.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Jeszcze nigdy nie byłam na innym kontynencie.

glossary: a continent

glossary: to have a lot of work/last week/to be afraid of sth/to meet the deadline

name: Anna Patton
polish: Idę jutro do banku, żeby założyć konto.

glossary: to go to the bank/to open an account/tomorrow

name: Anna Patton
polish: Mogłem wczoraj wydać mniej pieniędzy.

glossary: to suggest that.../to work overtime

polish: Dlaczego jeszcze nie zrobiłeś przelewu?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Nie byłbym w stanie teraz nic ugotować, gdyby ciocia mnie nie nauczyła, jak to się robi.
english: I wouldn't be able to cook anything now if my aunt hadn't taught me how to do it.
glossary: to cook/to teach sb how to do sth/an aunt
translation: I wouldn't be able to cook anything now if my aunt hadn't teach me how to do.

glossary: to do your homework/to have time to do sth

name: Anna Patton
polish: Co jadłeś wczoraj na obiad?
english: What did you eat for lunch yesterday?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Gdzie Ty wczoraj spałeś?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Jak znalazłeś tę pracę?
english: How did you find the job?
glossary: to find a job

name: Anna Patton
polish: Miałam nadzieję, że nie będę miała dzisiaj kaca.
english: I hoped I wouldn't have a hangover today.
glossary: to hope/to have a hangover/today
translation: I hoped I wouldn't have hangover today.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Kiedy się widzieliśmy ostatnim razem, myślałem, że powiesz mi prawdę.
english: The last time we met, I thought you'd tell me the truth.
glossary: to meet sb/finally/to tell the truth
translation: The last time we saw each other last time, I thought you'd told me the truth.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Czytałbym więcej książek, gdybym nie był ciągle zmęczony.
english: I would read more books if I weren't constantly tired.
glossary: to read a book/to be tired/to be constantly tired
translation: I'd read more books if wasn't constantly tired.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Myślę, że odwiedzę cię w weekend, bo jutro wracam późno do domu.
english: I think I'll visit you on the weekend because I'm coming back home late tomorrow.
glossary: to visit sb/to come back home late

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Nie wychodź teraz z domu, bo jest zbyt gorąco.
english: Don't leave the house now because it's too hot.
glossary: to leave the house
translation: Don’t leave the house now because it is too hot

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Zepsułam telefon mojej mamy. Nie wiem, co powinnam teraz zrobić.
english: I broke my mom's cell phone. I don't know what I should do now.
glossary: to break a cell phone
translation: I broke down my mom’s phone. I don’t know what should I do now.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Nie mogę teraz rozmawiać, bo nie mam czasu.
english: I can't talk now because I don't have time.
glossary: to talk to sb
translation: I can’t talk now because I don’t have time

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Kiedy wyjeżdżasz?
english: When are you leaving?
glossary: to leave
translation: When are you leaving?

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Mogłem zostać w domu, bo nie ma tu nic do roboty.
english: I could've stayed at home because there's nothing to do here.
glossary: to stay at home/to have nothing to do
translation: I could stay at home , because here is nothing to do.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Gdzie byłeś? Nie mogłem cię znaleźć.
english: Where were you? I couldn't find you.
translation: Where have you been? I couldn;t find you

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Nie zapłaciłam rachunków w zeszłym miesiącu, bo nie miałam żadnych pieniędzy.
english: I didn't pay the bills last month because I didn't have any money.
glossary: to pay the bills
translation: I didn’t pay bills last month because I didn’t have any money

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Zawsze ci pomogę, bo jesteś siostrą mojej żony.
english: I'll always help you because you're my wife's sister.
glossary: to help sb
translation: I always help you because you are my wife’s sister.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Byłam pewna, że spędzimy razem więcej czasu.
english: I was sure we'd spend more time together.
glossary: to be sure that.../to spend time with sb

name: Martin Hale
polish: Nie wychodź, dopóki nie skończysz raportu.
english: Don't leave until you're finished with your report.
glossary: to be finished with sth/a report

name: Martin Hale
polish: Nie byłbyś spłukany, gdybyś koledzy nie namówili cię na pójście do klubu.

glossary: to be broke/to talk sb into sth

name: Martin Hale
polish: Nie mogę się doczekać. Kiedy otwieracie?
english: I can't wait. When are you opening?
glossary: to wait/to open

name: Martin Hale
polish: Trudno mi było nie przeklinać, bo byłem naprawdę wkurwiony.
english: It was hard for me not to swear because I was genuinely pissed off.
glossary: to swear/to be genuinely pissed off

name: Martin Hale
polish: Nie przypaliłbyś jedzenia, gdybyś nie rozmawiał z kolegą przez telefon.
english: You wouldn't have burned food if you hadn't had a call with your friend.
glossary: to burn food/to have a call with sb
translation: 5. You wouldn’t burn food if you hadn’t talked to your friend on the phone.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Nie popełniałbyś tyle błędów ortograficznych, gdybyś czytał więcej książek.
english: You wouldn't make this many spelling mistakes if you read more books.
glossary: a spelling mistake/to read books
translation: 6. You wouldn’t make so many spelling mistakes if you had read more books.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Byłbym wdzięczny, gdyby przepisał mi pan jakieś leki.
english: I would appreciate it if you prescribed me some drugs.
glossary: to appreciate sth/to prescribe sth to sb
translation: 7. I would be grateful if you prescribed me some drugs.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Nad jakim projektem pracujecie?
english: What project are you working on?
glossary: to work on a project
translation: 8. What project do you work on?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Kupilibyśmy tę pralkę, gdyby była trochę tańsza.
english: We would buy this washing machine if it were a bit cheaper.
glossary: to buy sth/a washing machine/to be cheap
translation: 9. I would buy this washing machine if it was a little cheaper.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Nie musiałbyś iść teraz do bankomatu, gdybyś wcześniej wypłacić pieniądze.
english: You wouldn't have to go to the cash machine now if you had withdrawn money earlier.
glossary: to go to the cash machine/to withdraw money/a rate
translation: 10. You wouldn’t have to go to the ATM now if you had withdrawn money earlier.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Nie musielibyśmy płacić teraz odsetek, gdybyś nie zapomniał o ostatniej racie.
english: We wouldn't have to pay interest now if you hadn't forgotten about the last rate.
glossary: to pay interest/to forgot about sth
translation: 1.	We wouldn’t have to pay the interest now if you hadn’t forgotten about the last instalment.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Byłbym w stanie rozebrać to na części, gdybym miał klucz.
english: I would be able to take it apart if I had the key.
glossary: to be able to do sth/to take sth apart/to have sth
translation: 2.	I’d be able to take it apart if I had the key.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Co próbujesz wynegocjować?
english: What are you trying to negotiate?
glossary: to negotiate
translation: 3.	What are you trying to negotiate?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Pana dokumenty nie zostałyby odrzucone, gdyby złożył je Pan na czas.
english: Your documents wouldn't have gotten rejected if you had handed them on time.
glossary: a document/to get rejected/to hand sth on time
translation: 4.	Your documents wouldn’t have been turned down if you’d submitted them on time.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Nie musielibyśmy płacić za ten miesiąc, gdybyśmy rozwiązali umowę na czas.
english: You wouldn't have had to pay for this month if we had terminated the contract on time.
glossary: to pay for sth/to terminate a contract/to do sth on time
translation: 5.	We wouldn’t have to pay for this month if we’d terminated the contract on time.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Jakich ludzi cenisz sobie najbardziej?
english: What people do you value the most?
glossary: to value sb
translation: 6.	What people do you appreciate the most?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Nie musiałbyś mi teraz przeszkadzać, gdybyś zapisał tę informację.
english: You wouldn't have to disturb me now if you had noted down this information.
glossary: to disturb sb/to note down information
translation: 7.	You wouldn’t have to disturb me now if you’d written down the information.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Trudno mi było udowodnić swoją rację.
english: It was hard for me to prove my point.
glossary: to prove your point
translation: 8.	It was hard for me to prove my point.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Nie dostaniesz podwyżki, dopóki nie zaczniesz traktować swojej pracy poważnie.
english: You won't be given a pay raise until you start treating your job seriously.
glossary: a pay rise/to treat sth seriously
translation: 9.	You won’t get a pay-rise until you start to treat your job seriously.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Twoja firma by się rozwijała, gdyby twoi pracownicy nie byli cały czas bezczynni.
english: Your company would thrive if your employees weren't idle all the time.
glossary: to thrive/to be idle/all the time
translation: 10.	Your company would be developing if your employees wouldn’t be….

name: Alexandra King
polish: Ilu wspólników było na spotkaniu w zeszłym tygodniu?
english: How many business partners were there at the meeting last week?
glossary: a participant/a meeting/last week
translation: 1.	How many partners were at the meeting last week?

name: Alexandra King
polish: Do czego masz słabość?
english: What do you have a weakness for?
glossary: to have a weakness for sth
translation: 2.	To what do you have a weakness?

name: Alexandra King
polish: Jutro jem obiad z moim szefem.
english: I'm having lunch with my boss tomorrow.
glossary: to have lunch with sb/a boss
translation: 3.	I am eating a lunch with my boss tomorrow.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Jeśli zostanie przyznany mi ten kredyt, w końcu będę mógł przeprowadzić badanie.
english: If I'm granted the loan, I'll be finally able to conduct the study.
glossary: to be granted a loan/to be able to do sth/to conduct a study/finally
translation: 4.	If the mortgage would be admitted, I would conduct the research

name: Alexandra King
polish: Piłbym częściej herbatę, gdybym lubił moich sąsiadów.
english: I'd have tea more often if I liked my neighbors.
glossary: to have tea/often/a neighbor/to like sb
translation: 5.	I would drink tea more often if I would like my neighbors.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Trzymałbym się pierwotnego planu, gdyby sprawy nie wymknęły się spod kontroli.
english: I would've stuck to the initial plan if the things hadn't gotten out of control.
glossary: to stick to the plan/the initial plan/to get out of control
translation: 6.	I would be stick to the plan If the issues get out of control.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Nie rozumiem, dlaczego jesteś na mnie wściekły.
english: I don't understand why you're mad at me.
glossary: to understand sb/to be mad at sb
translation: 7.	I don’t understand why you are furious on me

name: Alexandra King
polish: Powinienem był dotrzeć na spotkanie z klientem na czas.
english: I should've gotten to the meeting with a client on time.
glossary: to get to a meeting/a meeting/a client/on time
translation: 8.	 I should have reached the meeting with the Client on time.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Kiedy się widzieliśmy ostatnim razem, myślałem, że powiesz mi prawdę.
english: The last time we met, I thought you'd tell me the truth.
glossary: to meet sb/finally/to tell the truth
translation: 9.	When we saw the last time, I was thinking you would tell me the truth.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Gratulacje. Właśnie usłyszałem wieści.
english: Congratulations. I've just heard the news.
glossary: congratulations/to hear the news
translation: 10.	Congratulations! I’ve just heard the news.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Detektyw pytał się mnie podczas przesłuchania, czy coś widziałem.
english: The detective asked me during questioning if I'd seen anything.
glossary: a detective/during questioning/to see sth
translation: The Detective asked me during the interogation if I had seen something.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Znudziło mi się jedzenie codziennie pizzy na obiad.
english: I'm bored with eating a pizza for lunch every day.
glossary: to be bored with sth/to eat a pizza/for lunch/every day
translation: I got bored about eating pizza every day for lunch.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie zdołalibyśmy ugasić pożaru, gdybyś od razu nie zadzwonił po służby ratunkowe.
english: We wouldn't have managed to put out the fire if you hadn't immediately called the emergency services.
glossary: to manage to do sth/to put out the fire/to call the emergency services/to immediately do sth
translation: We wouldn’t have been able to put out the fire if you didn’t call the emergency service right away.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Gdybyś zawsze dotrzymywał obietnic, dzieci by ci ufały.
english: If you always kept your promises, the kids would trust you.
glossary: to keep your promises/to trust sb
translation: The kids would have trusted you if you kept promises.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Gdybym mówił płynnie po angielsku, wyprowadziłbym się za granicę.
english: If I spoke English fluently, I'd move abroad.
glossary: to speak English fluently/to move abroad
translation: I would have moved abroad if I spoke English fluent.

name: Anette Gray
polish: O czym chciałbyś porozmawiać?
english: What would you like to talk about?
glossary: to talk about sth
translation: What would you like to talk about?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Zgodziłbyś się ze mną, gdybyś był świadomy pewnym faktów.
english: You'd agree with me if you were aware of certain facts.
glossary: to agree with sb/to be aware of sth/certain facts
translation: You would have agreed with me if you were aware some facts.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie musiałbym teraz odsiadywać, gdyby mój adwokat odwołał się od wyroku.
english: I wouldn't have to do time now if my attorney had appealed the court's decision.
glossary: to do time; to serve a sentence/an attorney/to appeal the court's decision
translation: You wouldn't have been in prison now if my lawyer apealed the cort decision.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Mój klient zażądał, żeby sprawa została oddalona.
english: My client demanded that the case be dismissed.
glossary: to demand that.../to dismiss a case
translation: My client ordered the case dropped.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie doprowadzałbyś zawsze ciotki do szaleństwa, gdybyś był cicho.
english: You wouldn't always drive your aunt crazy if you were quiet.
glossary: to drive sb crazy/an aunt/to be quiet
translation: You would have always aunt got fouries if you were silent.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Pojadę na wakacje, jak już oszczędzę pieniądze.
english: I'll go on vacation once I save some money.
glossary: to go on vacation/to save some money
translation: I’ll go on vacation once I save some money.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Dam Ci znać, jak już skończę pracę.
english: I'll let you know once I finish work.
glossary: to let sb know/to finish work
translation: I’ll let you know once I finish a job.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Muszę iść wcześnie spać, bo jutro robię prezentację.
english: I have to go to sleep early because I'm giving a presentation tomorrow.
glossary: to go to sleep early/to give a presentation
translation: I have to go to sleep early because I’m making a presentation tomorrow.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Myślałem, że będziesz tęsknić za domem.
english: I thought you'd feel homesick.
glossary: to feel homesick
translation: I thought, you would feel homesick.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Zadzwonię do ciebie, jak już będę w domu.
english: I'll call you once I'm at home.
glossary: to call sb/to be at home
translation: I’ll call you once I be in home.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Wyjeżdżam jutro z miasta. Zadzwonię do ciebie, jak już wrócę.
english: I'm leaving town tomorrow. I'll call you once I'm back.
glossary: once/to leave town/to call sb
translation: I’m leaving town tomorrow. I’m calling you once I come back.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Mogłem się nauczyć na test.
english: I could've studied for the test.
glossary: to study for a test
translation: I cought learn for a test.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Odwiozę cię do domu, jak już zjemy kolację.
english: I'll take you home once we eat dinner.
glossary: to take sb home/to eat dinner
translation: I’ll take you home once we eat dinner.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Oglądamy dzisiaj wieczorem mecz. Wpadnij.
english: We're watching a match tonight. Drop by.
glossary: to watch a match/to drop by
translation: We’re watching a mach tonight. You come over.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Co powiesz na poniedziałek? W weekend zajmuję się psami mojej siostry.
english: What about Monday? I'm taking care of my sister's dogs on the weekend.
glossary: on the weekend/What about.../to take care of sth
translation: What do you say on Monday? I’m taking care my sister’s dogs on the weekend.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Terroryści próbowali zdetonować bombę kilka razy, zanim powstrzymała ich policja.
english: The terrorists had tried to let off the bomb a few times before the police stopped them.
glossary: the police/to let off a bomb/to stop sb/a few times
translation: 1. The terrorists had tried to let off the bomb a few times before the police stopped them.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Nie mam siły. Dzieciaki mnie już wykończyły.
english: I don't have energy. The kids have already worn me down.
glossary: to wear sb down/a kid/to have energy
translation: 2. I don't have the strength. The kids have worn me down already.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Będę czytać dalej, jak już przestaniecie gadać.
english: I'll keep reading once you stop talking.
glossary: to stop talking/to keep reading/last week
translation: 3. I’ll keep reading once you stop talking.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Kiedyś nie zapinałem pasów, ale to się zmieniło po tym, jak miałem wypadek.
english: I didn't use to fasten up, but it changed after I'd had an accident.
glossary: to have an accident/to fasten up
translation: 4. I used to not fasten up, but that has changed after I had an accident.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Naprawdę byś chciała, żeby ten gość zaprosił cię na randkę?
english: Would you really like the guy to ask you out?
glossary: to ask sb out/a guy
translation: 5. Would you really want that guy to ask you out?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Jeśli nie przełożymy spotkania, nie uda mi się dotrzeć.
english: If you don't put off the meeting, I won't make it.
glossary: to put off a meeting/to make it to a meeting
translation: 6. If we don’t put off a meeting, I won’t make it

name: Margaret Usher
polish: O której zadzwonił budzik?
english: What time did the alarm go off?
glossary: to go off {2}
translation: 7. What time did the alarm clock go off?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Szef się pytał w zeszłym tygodniu, czy przebrnęliśmy już przez wszystkie procedury.
english: The boss asked last week if we'd already gone through all the procedures.
glossary: to go through a procedure
translation: 8. The boss asked last week if we had gone through all the procedures.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Dlaczego chcesz odrzucić tę ofertę?
english: Why do you want to turn down the offer?
glossary: to turn down an offer
translation: 9. Why do you want to turn down the offer?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Dzieciaki się wygłupiały, kiedy weszliśmy do domu.
english: The kids were fooling around when we entered the house.
glossary: to enter the house/a kid/to fool around
translation: 10. The kids were messing around when we entered the house.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Dlaczego dzwoniłeś wczoraj do mnie tyle razy?
english: Why did you call me so many times yesterday?
glossary: to call sb/many times
translation: 1. Why did you call me so many times yesterday?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Z kim wczoraj poszedłeś na imprezę?
english: Who did you go to the party with yesterday?
glossary: to go to a party with sb
translation: 2. Who did you go to the party with yesterday?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Nie powinnaś była składać obietnicy, jeśli wiedziałaś, że jej nie dotrzymasz.
english: You shouldn't have made the promise if you knew you wouldn't keep it.
glossary: to make a promise/to keep a promise
translation: 3. You shouldn’t have made a promise if you knew that you wouldn’t keep it.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Jestem rozczarowana. Byłam pewna, że nie złamiesz obietnicy.
english: I'm disappointed. I was sure you wouldn't break the promise.
glossary: to be disappointed with sth/to be sure/to break a promise
translation: 4. I’m disappointed. I was sure that you wouldn’t break a promise.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Ufam ci, bo od dawna razem pracujemy.
english: I trust you because we've been working together for a long time.
glossary: to trust sb/for a long time
translation: 5. I trust you, because we are have been working together for a long time.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Możemy porozmawiać, bo nie ma tu nikogo.
english: We can talk because there's nobody here.
glossary: to talk about sth
translation: 6. We can talk because here is nobody here.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Przeprowadzam się w przyszłym miesiącu na wieś. Nie mogę się doczekać.
english: I'm moving to the countryside next month. I can't wait.
glossary: can't wait/to move to the countryside
translation: 7. I’m moving to the countryside next week. I can’t wait.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Jest kilka książek, które chciałbym przeczytać do końca roku.
english: There are a few books I'd like to read by the end of the year.
glossary: a few/to read a book/by the end of the year
translation: 8. There are a few books which I would like to read by the end of the year.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Mam nadzieję, że zdążę na pociąg. To ostatni.
english: I hope I'll catch the train. It's the last one.
glossary: to catch the train/to catch the last train
translation: 9. I hope that I will catch the train. It’s the last one.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Od miesiąca szukam pracy, ale nie ma interesujących ofert.
english: I've been looking for a job for a month, but there are no interesting offers.
glossary: to look for a job/an offer
translation: 10. I’ve been looking for a job for a  month, but there are no interesting offers.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Zawsze się lenisz. Zabieraj swój tyłek do pracy!
english: You're always lazing around. Get your ass to work!
glossary: to laze around/to get your ass to work
translation: 1. You’re always getting lazy. Get your ass to work.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Półtora kilograma plus jeden kilogram równa się dwa i pół kilograma.
english: One and a half kilos plus one kilo equals two and a half kilos.
glossary: sth plus one/one and a half/two and a half
translation: 2. One and a half kilos plus one kilo equals two and a half kilos.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Dwanaście piątych podzielone przez dwa równa się sześć piątych.
english: Twelve-fifths divided by two equals six-fifths.
glossary: to be divided by two/to equal six-fifths
translation: 3. Twelve-fifths divided by two equals six-fifths.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Jedna czwarta razy dwa równa się jedna druga.
english: One-quarter times two equals one-half.
glossary: sth times two/to equal one-half
translation: 4. One-quarter multiplied by two equals a half.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Jedna ósma plus dwie ósme równa się trzy ósme.
english: One-eights plus two-eights equals three-eights.
glossary: sth plus two-eights/to equal three-eights
translation: 5. One-eighth plus two-eighths equals three-eighths.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Półtora minus jedna czwarta równa się jeden i jedna czwarta.
english: One and a half minus one-quarter equals one and one-quarter.
glossary: one and a half/sth minus one-quarter/to equal one and one-quarter
translation: 6. One and a half minus one quarter equals one and one quarter.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Cztery siódme podzielone przez dwa równa się dwie siódme.
english: Four-sevenths divided by two equals two-sevenths.
glossary: to be divided by two/to equal two-sevenths
translation: 7. Four-sevenths divided by two equals two-sevenths.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Dwie trzecie minus jedna trzecia równa się jedna trzecia.
english: Two-thirds minus one-third equals one-third.
glossary: sth minus one-third/to equal one-third
translation: 8. Two-thirds minus one-third equals one-third.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Jedna piąta razy trzy równa się trzy piąte.
english: One-fifth times three equals three-fifths.
glossary: sth times three/to equal three-fifths
translation: 9. One-fifth multiplied by three equals three-fifths.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Sześć dziewiątych podzielone przez dwa równa się trzy dziewiąte.
english: Six-ninths divided by two equals three-ninths.
glossary: to be divided by two/to equal three-ninths
translation: 10. Six-ninths divided by two equals three-ninths.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Dwa plus dwa równa się cztery.
english: Two plus two equals four.
glossary: sth plus two/to equal four
translation: 1. Two plus two equals four.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Dziesięć razy cztery równa się czterdzieści.
english: Ten times four equals forty.
glossary: sth times four/to equal forty
translation: 2. Ten times four equals forty.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Dwanaście podzielone przez dwa równa się sześć.
english: Twelve divided by two equals six.
glossary: sth divided by two/to equal six
translation: 3. Twelve divided by two equals six.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Siedem odjąć trzy równa się cztery.
english: Seven minus three equals four.
glossary: sth minus three/to equal four
translation: 4. Seven subtract three equals four.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Trzy razy pięć równa się piętnaście.
english: Three times five equals fifteen.
glossary: sth times five/to equal fifteen
translation: 5. Three times five equals fifteen.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Dwadzieścia siedem podzielone przez dziewięć równa się trzy.
english: Twenty-seven divided by nine equals three.
glossary: to be divided by nine/to equal three
translation: 6. Twenty-seven divided by nine equals three.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Dwa plus pięć równa się siedem.
english: Two plus five equals seven.
glossary: sth plus five/to equal seven
translation: 7. Two plus five equals seven.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Sześć razy cztery równa się dwadzieścia cztery.
english: Six times four equals twenty-four.
glossary: sth times four/to equal twenty-four
translation: 8. Six multiplied by four equals twenty-four.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Dwadzieścia podzielone przez dwa równa się dziesięć.
english: Twenty divided by two equals ten.
glossary: to be divided by two/to equal ten
translation: 9. Twenty divided by two equals ten.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Dwa razy osiem równa się szesnaście.
english: Two times eight equals sixteen.
glossary: sth times eight/to equal sixteen
translation: 10. Two times eight equals sixteen.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Cztery do kwadratu równa się szesnaście.
english: Four squared equals sixteen.
glossary: to be squared/to equal sixteen
translation: 1. Four squared equals sixteen.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Pierwiastek kwadratowy z trzydziestu sześciu równa się sześć.
english: The squared root of thirty-six equals six.
glossary: a squared root of sth/to equal six
translation: 2. The square root of thirty-six equal six.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Dwadzieścia dwa tysiące minus tysiąc równa się dwadzieścia jeden tysięcy.
english: Twenty-two thousand minus one thousand equals twenty-one thousand.
glossary: to equal twenty-one thousand
translation: 3. Twenty-two thousand minus one thousand equals twenty-one thousand.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Dwa przecinek sześć podzielone przez dwa równa się jeden przecinek trzy.
english: Two point six divided by two equals one point three.
glossary: to be divided by two/to equal one point three
translation: 4. Two point six divided by two equals one point three.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Minus trzy plus pięć równa się dwa.
english: Minus three plus five equals two.
glossary: to equal two/sth plus five
translation: 5. Minus three plus five equals two.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Dwa miliony razy trzy równa się sześć milionów.
english: Two million times three equals six million.
glossary: to equal six million/sth times three
translation: 6. Two milion times three equals six milion.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Jeden do potęgi dziesiątej równa się jeden.
english: One to the power of ten equals one.
glossary: sth to the power of ten/to equal one
translation: 7. One to the power of ten equals one.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Pięć do sześcianu równa się sto dwadzieścia pięć.
english: Five cubed equals one hundred twenty-five.
glossary: sth cubed/to equal one hundred twenty-five
translation: 8. Five cubed equals one hundred twenty-five.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Dwa do potęgi czwartej równa się szesnaście.
english: Two to the power of four equals sixteen.
glossary: sth to the power of four/to equal sixteen
translation: 9. Two to four equals sixteen.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Minus trzy minus dwa równa się minus pięć.
english: Minus three minus two equals minus five.
glossary: sth minus two/to equal minus five
translation: 10. Minus three minus two equals minus five.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Nie będziesz musiała mnie odbierać jutro ze szkoły, bo śpię u koleżanki.
english: You won't have to pick me up from school tomorrow because I'm sleeping at my friend's.
glossary: to pick sb up from school/to sleep at your friend's
translation: You won’t have to pick me up from school tomorrow, because I sleep at my friend.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Myślałem, że zjemy dzisiaj na mieście.
english: I thought we'd eat out today.
glossary: to eat out
translation: I thought we were eating out today. If were is correct - I used it because thought is in the past? Or it has to be are because it is referring to today?

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Mogłem wczoraj wydać mniej pieniędzy.
english: I could've spent less money yesterday.
glossary: to spend money on sth
translation: I could have spent less money yesterday.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Nie ma nikogo w domu. Dlatego jest tak cicho.
english: There's no one at home. That's why it's so silent.
glossary: to be at home/to be silent
translation: There is anybody at home. That is why it is so silent there.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Nie wiem, co powinienem odpowiedzieć.
english: I don't know what I should answer.
glossary: to answer a question
translation: I don’t know what I should answer.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Byłem pewny, że zrobisz swoją pracę domową.
english: I was sure you'd do your homework.
glossary: to do your homework
translation: I was sure that you would do your homework

name: Camille Tyner
polish: W zeszłym roku nie pojechałem na wakacje, ponieważ nie miałem pieniędzy.
english: I didn't go on vacation last year because I didn't have any money.
glossary: to go on vacation/to have no money
translation: I didn’t go on vacation last year, because I hadn’t got money.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Zawsze znajdę dla ciebie czas, bo jesteś dla mnie ważna.
english: I'll always find time for you because you're important to me.
glossary: to find time for sb/to be important to sb
translation: I will always find time for you because you are important for me.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Nie mogę się skupić, gdy jest tak głośno.
english: I can't focus when it's so loud.
glossary: to focus on sth/to be loud
translation: I can’t focus when it is so laud

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Gramy jutro mecz. Dołączysz do nas?
english: We're playing a match tomorrow. Will you join us?
glossary: to play a match/to join sb
translation: We are playing match tomorrow. Will you join us?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Wykres pokazuje znaczny wzrost sprzedaży w styczniu.
english: The graph shows a significant increase in sales in January.
glossary: to show a significant increase in sth
translation: 1. The chart shows a significant increase in sales in January.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Zgodnie z wykresem, przychody gwałtownie spadły w pierwszym kwartale.
english: According to the graph, revenue declined sharply in the first quarter.
glossary: According to.../to decline sharply
translation: 2. According to the chart, revenue plummeted in the first quarter.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Patrząc na wykres, można zobaczyć, że liczba klientów pozostawała stała przez cały drugi kwartał.
english: Looking at the graph, it can be seen that the number of customers remained stable throughout the second quarter.
glossary: to remain stable
