glossary: to engage sb in the conversation
translation: It will be hard for you to involved everyone in a conversation.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Kto mnie zastąpi, kiedy wezmę tydzień wolnego?
english: Who's going to replace me when I take a week off?
glossary: to replace sb/to take a week off
translation: Who will ……. me when I take a week off.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Będzie późno, kiedy dojedziemy do domu.
english: It'll be late when we get home.
glossary: to be late/to drive back home
translation: It will be late when we get  home.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Trudno mi wyciągnąć moje dziecko z łóżka.
english: It's hard for me to get my child out of bed.
glossary: to get your child out of bed
translation: It’s hard for me to get out my kid from bed.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Jakie teksty zazwyczaj musisz tłumaczyć?
english: What texts do you usually have to translate?
glossary: to translate a text
translation: What texts do you usually have to translate?

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Trudno mi się przeprasza za swoje błędy.
english: It's hard for me to apologize for my mistakes.
glossary: to apologize for your mistakes
translation: It’s hard for me to apologize for my mistakes.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Trudno mi się przeprasza za swoje błędy.
english: It's hard for me to apologize for my mistakes.
glossary: to apologize for your mistakes
translation: It’s hard to apologize for your mistakes.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Myślę, że wezmę udział w kursie.
english: I think I'll take part in the course.
glossary: to take part in a course
translation: I think I’ll take part in a course.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Ufam ci, bo od dawna razem pracujemy.

glossary: to trust sb/for a long time
translation: I trust you because we’ve been working together for a long time.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie powinniśmy byli się kłócić. To nie miało sensu.
english: We shouldn't have argued. It didn't make sense.
glossary: to argue with sb/to make sense
translation: We shouldn’t have argued. It didn’t make seans.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Zrobię pracę domową, jeśli będę miała czas.
english: I'll do my homework if I have time.
glossary: to do your homework/to have time to do sth

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jak długo wątpisz w nasz projekt? Myślałem, że w niego wierzysz.
english: How long have you been doubting our project? I thought you believed in it.
glossary: to doubt sth/to believe in sth
translation: How long have you doubted our project? I thought you belive in it.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Musisz spróbować być mniej zazdrosna.

glossary: to be jealous/more or less

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jakiego rozwiązania szukasz? Może będę w stanie ci pomóc.

glossary: a solution for sth/to be able to help

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jak długo zlew jest zatkany? Powinniśmy coś z tym zrobić.

glossary: to be stuck/to do sth about sth

name: Anette Gray

glossary: immediately/to call the police/to notice sth/a thief

english: You'll get used to warming up before a workout.
glossary: to warm up/a workout/to get used to doing sth

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Kiedyś zalegałem z rachunkami, bo byłem bezrobotny.

glossary: to be unemployed/to fall behind with your bills

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Boję się rzucić studia. Co powiedzą rodzice?
english: I'm afraid of dropping out of college. What will my parents say?
glossary: to drop out of college/to say sth

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Przeprowadzałem doświadczenie, gdy student wszedł do laboratorium.

glossary: a lab/a student/to carry out an experiment
translation: 4. I was carrying out an experiment when a student entered the lab.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Gdybyś nie zagadał do tej dziewczyny, nie dostałbyś kosza.

glossary: to turn sb down/to chat sb up

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Przekładasz spotkanie od kilku tygodni. O co chodzi?
english: You've been putting off the meeting for a few weeks. What's going on?
glossary: to put off a meeting

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Nasza firma zwolniła w zeszłym tygodniu kilku pracowników, ponieważ wystawili fałszywe faktury.

glossary: an employee/a company/a fake invoice/to make out an invoice

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Zrelaksujesz się, jeśli weźmiesz kąpiel.

glossary: to take a bath/to wind down

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Na szczęście przeszliśmy już przez formalności.
english: Fortunately, we've already gone through formalities.
glossary: to go through formalities/Fortunately...
translation: 9. Fortunately, we have already gone through formalities.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Wyglądałabym młodziej, gdybym codziennie nakładała krem.
english: I'd look younger if I put on cream every day.
glossary: to look young/to put on cream
translation: 10. I would have looked younger if I had put on cream every day.

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Co byś zrobił, gdybyś wygrał na loterii?
english: What would you do if you won the lottery?
glossary: to win the lottery
translation: 1. What would you do if you won a lottery?

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Jak usłyszałeś o roli?
english: How did you hear about the role?
glossary: to hear about sth

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Co myślisz o swoim poprzednim szefie?
english: What do you think of your previous boss?
glossary: to think of sb

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Co przyciągnęło Cię do tej firmy?
english: What attracted you to this company?
glossary: to attract sb/a company
translation: 4. What did atract you to the company?

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Jakie byłoby Twoje idealne środowisko pracy?
english: What would be your ideal working environment?
glossary: a working environment/to be ideal
translation: 5. What would be your ideal work enviroment?

name: Claudine Gross
polish: W czym jesteś naprawdę dobry?
english: What are you really good at?
glossary: to be good at sth

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Jak radzisz sobie ze stresem?
english: How do you handle stress?
glossary: to handle sth

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Dlaczego chcesz tą pracę?
english: Why do you want this job?
glossary: to want sth

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Podaj przykłady pomysłów, które wdrożyłeś.
english: Give examples of ideas you've implemented.
glossary: to give an example/to implement sth

name: Claudine Gross

english: Among the people you've worked with, who do you admire?
glossary: among people/to admire sb/to work with sb
translation: 10. Who do you admire within the people you worked with?

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Masz do nas jakieś pytania?
english: Do you have any questions for us?
glossary: to have questions for sb
translation: 1. Do you have any questions to us?

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Co wiesz o firmie?
english: What do you know about the company?
glossary: to know sth about sth/a company
translation: 2. What do you know about the company?

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Jakie są Twoje życiowe marzenia?
english: What are your lifelong dreams?
glossary: a lifelong dream
translation: 3. What are your life dreams?

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Co Ci się najmniej podobało w swojej ostatniej pracy?
english: What did you like least about your last job?
glossary: to like sth least about sth

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Jaki był najtrudniejszy okres w Twoim życiu?
english: What was the most difficult period in your life?
glossary: to have a difficult period in your life
translation: 5. What was your harders time in your life?

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Jaki jest najlepszy film, jaki widziałeś w zeszłym roku?
english: What's the best movie you've seen in the past year?
glossary: in the past year

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Opowiedz mi o czasie, kiedy musiałeś radzić sobie z konfliktem w pracy.
english: Tell me about a time when you had to deal with conflict on the job.
glossary: to deal with sth/to have to do sth
translation: 7. Tell me about the time when you had to coop with a conflict at work.

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Dlaczego złożyłeś podanie?
english: Why did you apply?
glossary: to apply for sth
translation: 8. Why have you applied?

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Jakie czasopisma prenumerujesz?
english: What magazines do you subscribe to?
glossary: to subscribe to sth
translation: 9. What newspapers do you subsribe?

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Jak Twoje doświadczenie przygotowało Cię do tej pracy?
english: How has your experience prepared you for this job?
glossary: to prepare sb for sth
translation: 10. Which experience have you prepared you to the job?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Na jakie wykłady chciałbyś uczęszczać?
english: What lectures would you like to attend?
glossary: a lecture/to attend sth
translation: What lectures would you like to take part in?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Kiedy nauczyłeś się wyrażać swoje uczucia?
english: When did you learn how to express your feelings?
glossary: to learn how to do sth/to express your feelings
translation: When did you learn express your feelings?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Co skłoniło cię do dołączenia do klubu? Dlaczego tu jesteś?
english: What made you join the club? Why are you here?
glossary: to make sb do sth
translation: What convinced you to join the club? Why are you here?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Myślę, że wkrótce zmienię pracę.
english: I think I'll change my job soon.
glossary: to change your job/soon
translation: I think, I’ll change my job soon.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Stracisz prawo jazdy, jeśli będziesz prowadzić po pijaku.
english: You'll lose your driver's license if you drive drunk.
glossary: to lose your driver's license/to drive drunk
translation: You’ll lose your driver’s license if you drive drunk.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Mam nadzieję, że nadrobisz pracę domową.
english: I hope you'll catch up on your homework.
glossary: to catch up on your homework
translation: I hope, you’ll catch up on your homework.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Poproszę o podwyżkę, jak już szef będzie z powrotem w biurze.
english: I'll ask for a pay-raise once my boss is back in the office.
glossary: to ask for a pay-raise/to be back in the office
translation: I’ll ask about pay-rise once my boss is back in the office.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jak możesz być tak naiwny?
english: How can you be so naive?
glossary: to be naive
translation: How can you be so naive?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Obiecuję, że podrzucę dzieci jutro do szkoły.
english: I promise I'll drop off the kids at school tomorrow.
glossary: to drop off the kids at school
translation: I promise I’ll drop my kids off at school.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jesteś świetna w wydawaniu pieniędzy.
english: You're great at spending money.
glossary: to be great at sth/to spend money on sth
translation: You’re great at spending money.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Dlaczego dzwoniłeś wczoraj do mnie tyle razy?
english: Why did you call me so many times yesterday?
glossary: to call sb/many times
translation: 1.	Why did you call me so many times yesterday?

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Z kim wczoraj poszedłeś na imprezę?
english: Who did you go to the party with yesterday?
glossary: to go to a party with sb
translation: 2.	Who did you go to the party with yesterday?

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Nie powinnaś była składać obietnicy, jeśli wiedziałaś, że jej nie dotrzymasz.
english: You shouldn't have made the promise if you knew you wouldn't keep it.
glossary: to make a promise/to keep a promise
translation: 3.	You shouldn’t have made a promise if you had known you wouldn’t keep it.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Jestem rozczarowana. Byłam pewna, że nie złamiesz obietnicy.
english: I'm disappointed. I was sure you wouldn't break the promise.
glossary: to be disappointed with sth/to be sure/to break a promise
translation: 4.	I’m disappointed. I was sure that you wouldn’t break the promise.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Ufam ci, bo od dawna razem pracujemy.
english: I trust you because we've been working together for a long time.
glossary: to trust sb/for a long time
translation: 5.	I trust you because we have been working together for a long time.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Możemy porozmawiać, bo nie ma tu nikogo.
english: We can talk because there's nobody here.
glossary: to talk about sth
translation: 6.	We can talk, no one is here.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Przeprowadzam się w przyszłym miesiącu na wieś. Nie mogę się doczekać.
english: I'm moving to the countryside next month. I can't wait.
glossary: can't wait/to move to the countryside
translation: 7.	I’m going to move to the countryside next month.  I can’t wait.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Jest kilka książek, które chciałbym przeczytać do końca roku.
english: There are a few books I'd like to read by the end of the year.
glossary: a few/to read a book/by the end of the year
translation: 8.	There are a few books, that I want to read till the end of the year.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Mam nadzieję, że zdążę na pociąg. To ostatni.
english: I hope I'll catch the train. It's the last one.
glossary: to catch the train/to catch the last train
translation: 9.	I hope I will catch this train. This is the last one.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Od miesiąca szukam pracy, ale nie ma interesujących ofert.
english: I've been looking for a job for a month, but there are no interesting offers.
glossary: to look for a job/an offer
translation: 10.	 I have been looking a new job for a month, but there are no interesting offers.

name: Maddie Ivy
polish: Nie powinienem był robić takiego bałaganu. Przepraszam.
english: I shouldn't have made such a mess. I'm sorry.
glossary: to make a mess
translation: 1.	I shouldn’t have made such a mess. Sorry.

name: Maddie Ivy
polish: Jestem głodny. Mogłem zjeść śniadanie.
english: I'm hungry. I could've eaten breakfast.
glossary: to be hungry/to eat breakfast
translation: 2.	I’m hungry. I could have eaten breakfast.

name: Maddie Ivy
polish: Mogłem biec szybciej. Zdążyłbym na pociąg.
english: I could've run faster. I would've caught the train.
glossary: to run fast/to catch the train
translation: 3.	I could have run faster. I wouldn have been on time for the train.

name: Maddie Ivy
polish: Jechałeś bardzo szybko. Bałem się, że będziemy mieli wypadek.
english: You drove very fast. I was afraid we'd have an accident.
glossary: to drive/to be afraid/to have an accident
translation: 4.	You were driving very fast. I was afraid that we would have an excident.

name: Maddie Ivy
polish: Jutro jedziemy do centrum na zakupy. Chcesz coś?
english: We're going shopping downtown tomorrow. Do you want anything?
glossary: to go shopping/to go downtown
translation: 5.	We are going shopping to the mall tomorrow. Do you want something?

name: Maddie Ivy
polish: Co się stało? Byłem pewien, że będziesz się trzymać planu.
english: What happened? I was sure you'd stick to the plan.
glossary: to happen/to be sure/to stick to the plan
translation: 6.	What has happened? I was sure that you would stick to the plan.

name: Maddie Ivy
polish: Moja najlepsza przyjaciółka wychodzi za mąż w przyszłym tygodniu.
english: My best friend's getting married next week.
glossary: to get married/next week
translation: 7.	My best friend is getting married next week.

name: Maddie Ivy
polish: Nie pracuję jutro, więc możemy jechać nad jezioro.
english: I'm not working tomorrow, so we can go to the lake.
glossary: to work/to go to the lake/tomorrow
translation: 8.	I’m not working tomorrow, so we can go to the lake.

name: Maddie Ivy
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że się zaprzyjaźnimy.
english: I hoped we'd make friends.
glossary: to hope/to make friends
translation: 9.	I was hoping that we would make a friends.

name: Maddie Ivy
polish: Ile osób jest w Twoim zespole?
english: How many people are there on your team?
glossary: on the team
translation: 10.	How many people are there in your team?

name: Adam Dollar
polish: Co się stało? Byłam pewna, że się pobierzecie.
english: What happened? I was sure you'd get married.
glossary: to happen/to be sure/to get married
translation: What happened? I was sure you would get merried.

name: Adam Dollar
polish: Mogłem napisać ten test z angielskiego w zeszłym tygodniu. Teraz nic nie pamiętam.
english: I could've taken the English test last week. I don't remember anything now.
glossary: to take an English test/to remember sth/last week
translation: I could take the English test last week. I don’t remember anything now.

name: Adam Dollar
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że żona będzie w dobrym humorze.
english: I hoped my wife would be in a good mood.
glossary: to hope/a wife/to be in a good mood
translation: I hoped that she would be in a good mood.

name: Adam Dollar
polish: Chciałem powiedzieć Ci prawdę, ale bałem się, że się zdenerwujesz.
english: I wanted to tell you the truth, but I was afraid you'd get mad.
glossary: to tell sb the truth/to be afraid of sth/to get mad
translation: I wanted tell you the truth but I was affraid you would get angry.

name: Adam Dollar
polish: Mogłam wydawać mniej pieniędzy na ubrania, bo muszę jeszcze zapłacić rachunki.
english: I could've spent less money on clothes because I still have to pay the bills.
glossary: to spend money on clothes/still/to pay the bills
translation: I could spend less money on clothes because I still have to pay the bills.

name: Adam Dollar
polish: Nie powinieneś był tyle pić na imprezie.
english: You shouldn't have drunk so much at the party.
glossary: to drink/at the party
translation: You shouldn’t have that much drink at the party.

name: Adam Dollar
polish: Nie mogę zasnąć. Nie powinienem był pić kawy tak późno.
english: I can't fall asleep. I shouldn't have drunk coffee so late.
glossary: to fall asleep/to drink coffee/late
translation: I can’t fall asleep. I shouldn’t have drink coffee that late.

name: Adam Dollar
polish: Pójdziemy na kawę, jak już będzie ładna pogoda.
english: We'll go for a coffee once the weather is good.
glossary: to go for a coffee/the weather
translation: We’ll go for a coffee once the weather is preaty.

name: Adam Dollar
polish: Pójdę spać, jak już skończę czytać książkę.
english: I'll go to sleep once I finish reading the book.
glossary: to go to sleep/to finish doing sth
translation: I’ll go to sleep onse I finish to read the book.

name: Adam Dollar
polish: Następny weekend spędzam w moim rodzinnym mieście.
english: I'm spending next weekend in my hometown.
glossary: in your hometown/to spend next weekend
translation: Next weekend I’m spening in my hometown.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Pojadę na wakacje, jak już oszczędzę pieniądze.
english: I'll go on vacation once I save some money.
glossary: to go on vacation/to save some money
translation: 1. I will go on vacation when I save some money.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Dam Ci znać, jak już skończę pracę.
english: I'll let you know once I finish work.
glossary: to let sb know/to finish work
translation: 2. I let you know as already I will finish work.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Muszę iść wcześnie spać, bo jutro robię prezentację.
english: I have to go to sleep early because I'm giving a presentation tomorrow.
glossary: to go to sleep early/to give a presentation
translation: 3. I have to go to bed early because I'm giving a presentation tomorrow.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Myślałem, że będziesz tęsknić za domem.
english: I thought you'd feel homesick.
glossary: to feel homesick
translation: 4. I thought that you would be miss house.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Zadzwonię do ciebie, jak już będę w domu.
english: I'll call you once I'm at home.
glossary: to call sb/to be at home
translation: 5. I will call you when I'm at home.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Wyjeżdżam jutro z miasta. Zadzwonię do ciebie, jak już wrócę.
english: I'm leaving town tomorrow. I'll call you once I'm back.
glossary: once/to leave town/to call sb
translation: 6. I'm leaving town tomorrow. I will call you when I'm come back.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Mogłem się nauczyć na test.
english: I could've studied for the test.
glossary: to study for a test
translation: 7. I could learn on the test.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Odwiozę cię do domu, jak już zjemy kolację.
english: I'll take you home once we eat dinner.
glossary: to take sb home/to eat dinner
translation: 8. I drive you as already we will eat a dinner.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Oglądamy dzisiaj wieczorem mecz. Wpadnij.
english: We're watching a match tonight. Drop by.
glossary: to watch a match/to drop by
translation: 9. We're watching a match today. You drop by.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Co powiesz na poniedziałek? W weekend zajmuję się psami mojej siostry.
english: What about Monday? I'm taking care of my sister's dogs on the weekend.
glossary: on the weekend/What about.../to take care of sth
translation: 10. What do you say about Monday? At weekend I'm taking care of something.

name: Caroline Bailey
polish: Miałem w zeszłym tygodniu dużo pracy i bałem się, że nie wyrobię się z terminem.
english: I had a lot of work last week and I was afraid I wouldn't meet the deadline.
glossary: to have a lot of work/last week/to be afraid of sth/to meet the deadline
translation: I had a lot of work last week and I was afraid that I would not meet the deadline.

name: Caroline Bailey
polish: Nie powinieneś był wspominać o naszych problemach na spotkaniu z szefem.
english: You shouldn't have mentioned our problems at the meeting with the boss.
glossary: at the meeting/to mention sth
translation: 2. You shouldn't have mentioned our problems in your meeting with the boss.

name: Caroline Bailey
polish: Przyjeżdżam jutro do Warszawy i zatrzymuję się u mojej koleżanki.
english: I'm coming to Warsaw tomorrow and staying at my friend's.
glossary: to come to Warsaw
translation: 3. I am coming to Warsaw tomorrow and staying at my friend.

name: Caroline Bailey
polish: Nie powinieneś był opowiadać tego żartu. Był niegrzeczny.
english: You shouldn't have told the joke. It was rude.
glossary: to be rude to sb/to tell sb a joke
translation: 4. You shouldn't have told this joke. It was rude.

name: Caroline Bailey
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że nic nie będę musiał dzisiaj robić.
english: I hoped I wouldn't have to do anything today.
glossary: to hope/today
translation: 5. I hoped I wouldn't have to do anything today.

name: Caroline Bailey
polish: Powinienem był spędzić zeszły weekend z rodziną.
english: I should've spent my last weekend with my family.
glossary: to spend time with sb/last weekend/a family
translation: 6. I should have spent last weekend with my family.

name: Caroline Bailey
polish: Nie powinienem był Ci opowiadać tej historii, bo jest zbyt prywatna.
english: I shouldn't have told you the story because it's too private.
glossary: to tell sb a story/to be private
translation: 7. I shouldn't have told you this story because it's too private.

name: Caroline Bailey
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że ci klienci zostawią większy napiwek.
english: I hoped the customers would leave a bigger tip.
glossary: to leave a tip/a customer/to hope
translation: 8. I hoped  these customers would leave a bigger tip.

name: Caroline Bailey
polish: Nie powinieneś był mnie okłamywać.
english: You shouldn't have lied to me.
glossary: to lie to sb
translation: 9. You shouldn't have lied to me.

name: Caroline Bailey
polish: Co robisz dziś wieczorem?
english: What are you doing tonight?
translation: 10. What are you doing tonight?

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Pojadę na wakacje, jak już oszczędzę pieniądze.
english: I'll go on vacation once I save some money.
glossary: to go on vacation/to save some money
translation: 1. I will go on vacation once I save money.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Dam Ci znać, jak już skończę pracę.
english: I'll let you know once I finish work.
glossary: to let sb know/to finish work
translation: 2. I will let you know once I finish my work.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Muszę iść wcześnie spać, bo jutro robię prezentację.
english: I have to go to sleep early because I'm giving a presentation tomorrow.
glossary: to go to sleep early/to give a presentation
translation: 3. I have to go to sleep early because I'm doing a presentation tomorrow.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Myślałem, że będziesz tęsknić za domem.
english: I thought you'd feel homesick.
glossary: to feel homesick
translation: 4. I tought, you would be missing home.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Zadzwonię do ciebie, jak już będę w domu.
english: I'll call you once I'm at home.
glossary: to call sb/to be at home
translation: 5. I will call you when I'm home.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Wyjeżdżam jutro z miasta. Zadzwonię do ciebie, jak już wrócę.
english: I'm leaving town tomorrow. I'll call you once I'm back.
glossary: once/to leave town/to call sb
translation: 6. I'm leaving town tomorrow. I will call you when I'm back.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Mogłem się nauczyć na test.
english: I could've studied for the test.
glossary: to study for a test
translation: 7. I could have learned to the test.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Odwiozę cię do domu, jak już zjemy kolację.
english: I'll take you home once we eat dinner.
glossary: to take sb home/to eat dinner
translation: 8. I will drive you home once we eat supper.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Oglądamy dzisiaj wieczorem mecz. Wpadnij.
english: We're watching a match tonight. Drop by.
glossary: to watch a match/to drop by
translation: 9. We are watching a match tonight. Drop by to us.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Co powiesz na poniedziałek? W weekend zajmuję się psami mojej siostry.
english: What about Monday? I'm taking care of my sister's dogs on the weekend.
glossary: on the weekend/What about.../to take care of sth
translation: 10. What do you think about Monday? I'm taking care of my sister's dogs on the weekend.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Co twoi byli koledzy z pracy powiedzieliby o Tobie, gdyby nie było cię w pokoju?
english: What would your former colleagues say about you if you weren’t in the room?
glossary: a former colleague/to be in the room
translation: 1. I don't know

name: Matt Xander
polish: Jak opisałbyś swój styl pracy?
english: How would you describe your work style?
glossary: to describe sth
translation: 2. How would you describe your work style?

name: Matt Xander
polish: Jak wyznaczasz cele? Przedstaw w skrócie proces.
english: How do you set goals? Outline the process.
glossary: to set your goals/to outline sth/a process
translation: 3. I don’t know.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Jaka jest Twoja największa słabość?
english: What is your greatest weakness?
glossary: your greatest weakness
translation: 4) What is your greatest weakness?

name: Matt Xander
polish: Co robisz w swoim wolnym czasie?
english: What do you do in your spare time?
glossary: your spare time
translation: 5) What do you do in your free time?

name: Matt Xander
polish: Kto był Twoim ulubionym menedżerem?
english: Who was your favorite manager?
glossary: a manager
translation: 6) Who was your favorite manager?

name: Matt Xander
polish: Opowiedz mi o sobie.
english: Tell me about yourself.
glossary: to tell sb sth
translation: 7) Tell me about yourself.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Jaka jest ostatnia książka, którą przeczytałeś?
english: What's the last book you read?
glossary: to read sth
translation: 8. What is the last book you read?

name: Matt Xander
polish: Z jakim typem osobowości najlepiej pracujesz?
english: What kind of personality do you work best with?
glossary: to work best with sb
translation: 9. What type of personality do you work best with?

name: Matt Xander
polish: Co motywuje Cię do pracy?
english: What motivates you to work?
glossary: to motivate sb/to work
translation: 10. What motivates you to work?

name: Matt Xander
polish: Jaka jest najtrudniejsza decyzja, którą podjąłeś w ciągu ostatnich dwóch lat?
english: What's the most difficult decision you've made in the past two years?
glossary: to make a decision
translation: 1) What is the most difficult decision you have made in the past two years?

name: Matt Xander
polish: Jaka jest najważniejsza rzecz, której nauczyłeś się w szkole?
english: What's the most important thing you learned in school?
glossary: to learn sth in school/the most important thing
translation: 2) What is the most important thing you learned in school?

name: Matt Xander
polish: Co jest Twoją największą mocną stroną?
english: What is your greatest strength?
glossary: your greatest strength
translation: 3. What is your greatest strength?

name: Matt Xander
polish: Jaka jest Twoja największa porażka?
english: What is your greatest failure?
glossary: your greatest failure
translation: 4. What is your biggest failure?

name: Matt Xander
polish: Jakie jest Twoje największe osiągnięcie poza pracą?
english: What is your greatest achievement outside of work?
glossary: your greatest achievement
translation: 5. What is your greatest success outside of work?

name: Matt Xander
polish: Jakie były obowiązki na Twoim ostatnim stanowisku?
english: What were the responsibilities of your last position?
glossary: your last position
translation: 6) What was the responsibilities of your last position?

name: Matt Xander
polish: Co lubisz robić dla zabawy?
english: What do you like to do for fun?
glossary: to do sth for fun
translation: 7) What do you like to do for fun?

name: Matt Xander
polish: Co chcesz robić inaczej w swojej następnej roli?
english: What do you want to do differently in your next role?
glossary: to do sth differently
translation: 8) What do you want to do differently in your next role?

name: Matt Xander
polish: Co lubisz robić?
english: What do you like to do?
glossary: to like to do sth
translation: 9. What do you like to do?

name: Matt Xander
polish: Jak przygotowywałeś się do tego wywiadu?
english: How did you prepare for this interview?
glossary: to prepare sb for sth
translation: 10. How did you prepare for this interview?

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Myślę, że odwiedzę cię w weekend, bo jutro wracam późno do domu.
english: I think I'll visit you on the weekend because I'm coming back home late tomorrow.
glossary: to visit sb/to come back home late
translation: I thing I’ll visit you on the weekend because I’m comming back home late tomorrow.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Nie wychodź teraz z domu, bo jest zbyt gorąco.
english: Don't leave the house now because it's too hot.
glossary: to leave the house
translation: Don’t leave the house now because it’s too hot.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Zepsułam telefon mojej mamy. Nie wiem, co powinnam teraz zrobić.
english: I broke my mom's cell phone. I don't know what I should do now.
glossary: to break a cell phone
translation: I broken up my mom’s phone. I don’t know what I should do now.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Nie mogę teraz rozmawiać, bo nie mam czasu.
english: I can't talk now because I don't have time.
glossary: to talk to sb
translation: I can’t talk now because I don’t have time.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Kiedy wyjeżdżasz?
english: When are you leaving?
glossary: to leave
translation: When do you leave?

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Mogłem zostać w domu, bo nie ma tu nic do roboty.
english: I could've stayed at home because there's nothing to do here.
glossary: to stay at home/to have nothing to do
translation: I could stay home because is nothing to do here.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Gdzie byłeś? Nie mogłem cię znaleźć.
english: Where were you? I couldn't find you.
translation: Where have you been? I couldn’t find you.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Nie zapłaciłam rachunków w zeszłym miesiącu, bo nie miałam żadnych pieniędzy.
english: I didn't pay the bills last month because I didn't have any money.
glossary: to pay the bills
translation: I didn’t pay any bills last month because I didn’t have any money.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Zawsze ci pomogę, bo jesteś siostrą mojej żony.
english: I'll always help you because you're my wife's sister.
glossary: to help sb
translation: I always help you because you are my wife’s sister.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Byłam pewna, że spędzimy razem więcej czasu.
english: I was sure we'd spend more time together.
glossary: to be sure that.../to spend time with sb
translation: I was sure we would spend more time together.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Jutro uczę się na egzamin, ale możemy się spotkać, jak już skończę.
english: I'm studying for an exam tomorrow, but we can meet once I'm done.
glossary: to be done/to study for an exam/to meet sb
translation: I am studying for the exam tomorrow, but we can meet once I will have finished.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Nie pojechałem nad jezioro, bo obawiałem się, że się przeziębię.
english: I didn't go to the lake because I was afraid I'd catch a cold.
glossary: to go to the lake/to catch a cold/to be afraid of sth
translation: I didn’t go to the lake because I was afraid that I would be sick.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Przeprowadzę się, jak już znajdę nową pracę.
english: I'll move once I find a new job.
glossary: to move/to find a new job
translation: I will move when I find a new job

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Będę mieć więcej energii, jak już napiję się kawy.
english: I'll have more energy once I have some coffee.
glossary: to have energy/to have some coffee
translation: I will have more energy, once I drink coffee

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Poproszę o podwyżkę, jak już szef będzie z powrotem w biurze.
english: I'll ask for a pay-raise once my boss is back in the office.
glossary: to ask for a pay-raise/to be back in the office
translation: I will ask for a pay raise, once  my boss came back to the work

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Jestem podekscytowana, bo jutro widzę się ze starą znajomą.
english: I'm excited because I'm seeing an old friend of mine tomorrow.
glossary: to see sb/to be excited
translation: I am excited because I am seeing an old friend of mine tomorrow.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: W przyszłym tygodniu zaczynam kurs angielskiego. Nie mogę się doczekać.
english: I'm starting an English course next week. I can't wait.
glossary: can't wait/to start an English course
translation: I am starting an English course tomorrow. I can’t wait for that.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Porozmawiamy, jak już będziesz gotowa.
english: We'll talk once you're ready.
glossary: to talk to sb/to be ready
translation: We will talk once you are ready.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Bałem się, że przegramy sprawę przez mój błąd.
english: I was afraid we'd lose the case because of my mistake.
glossary: to be afraid of sth/to lose a case/because of you/a mistake
translation: I was afraid that we lose the case because of my mistake.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Możemy przełożyć nasze spotkanie? Jutro przyjeżdżają moi rodzice w odwiedziny.
english: Can we put off our meeting? My parents are visiting me tomorrow.
glossary: to visit sb/to put off a meeting
translation: Could we postpone our meeting? My patents are visiting me.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Zasnąłbyś wczoraj bez problemu, gdybyś nie oglądał wcześniej horroru.
english: You would've fallen asleep without a problem yesterday if you hadn't watched a horror before.
glossary: to fall asleep/without a problem/to watch a horror
translation: You would’ve no problem fallen asleep if you hadn’t watched a horror earlier.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Nie miałem w zeszłym tygodniu rozmowy o pracę, bo rekruter miał grypę.
english: I didn't have the job interview last week because the recruiter had the flu.
glossary: to have a job interview/a recruiter/to have the flu
translation: I didn’t have job recruitment last week because a recruiter had an influenza.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Nie wpadłem jak dotąd na żaden pomysł. Chcesz mi pomóc?
english: I haven't come up with an idea so far. Do you want to help me?
glossary: to come up with an idea/to help sb do sth
translation: I haven’t had an idea so far. Would you want to help me?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Nie kłócilibyście się codziennie, gdyby twój mąż nie był taki uparty.
english: You wouldn't have an argument every day if your husband weren't so stubborn.
glossary: to have an argument/every day/to be stubborn
translation: You wouldn’t have an arque every day, if your husband didn’t be so stubborn.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: W tym roku daliśmy już trzy koncerty. Następny jest za tydzień.
english: We've already given three concerts this year. The next one is in a week.
glossary: to give a concert/this year/in a week
translation: We’ve given three concerts this year so far. The next one will be in a week.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Robiłem wczoraj pracę domową, popijając drinka.
english: I was doing my homework yesterday, sipping a drink.
glossary: to do your homework/to sip a drink
translation: I had been doing my homework yesterday sinking a drink.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Nie wydawałbym pieniędzy na niepotrzebne rzeczy, będąc spłukanym.
english: I wouldn't spend money on unnecessary things, being broke.
glossary: to spend money on unnecessary things/to be broke
translation: I wouldn’t spent money for unnecesary things beeing broke.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Zdecydowałem się już i to się nie zmieni.
english: I've already made up my mind and it won't change.
glossary: to make your mind/to change
translation: I already decided and it wouldn’t change.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Nie chcę, żebyś mi mówił, jak żyć.
english: I don't want you to tell me how to live.
glossary: to live/to tell sb sth
translation: I don’t want you to tell me how to live.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Wygrałem już przedtem podobną sprawę, więc może się pani czuć bezpiecznie.
english: I've already won a similar case before, so you can feel safe.
glossary: to win a case/a similar case/to feel safe
translation: I’ve won a similar case before so you can feel safe.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Nie będziesz musiała mnie odbierać jutro ze szkoły, bo śpię u koleżanki.
english: You won't have to pick me up from school tomorrow because I'm sleeping at my friend's.
glossary: to pick sb up from school/to sleep at your friend's
translation: 1.	You won't have to pick me up from school tomorrow, because I'm sleeping at my friend's.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Myślałem, że zjemy dzisiaj na mieście.
english: I thought we'd eat out today.
glossary: to eat out
translation: 2.	I thought we were going to eat out in town today.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Mogłem wczoraj wydać mniej pieniędzy.
english: I could've spent less money yesterday.
glossary: to spend money on sth
translation: 3.	I could have spent less money yesterday.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Nie ma nikogo w domu. Dlatego jest tak cicho.
english: There's no one at home. That's why it's so silent.
glossary: to be at home/to be silent
translation: 4.	There's nobody at home. That's why it's so quiet.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Nie wiem, co powinienem odpowiedzieć.
english: I don't know what I should answer.
glossary: to answer a question
translation: 5.	I don't know what to answer.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Byłem pewny, że zrobisz swoją pracę domową.
english: I was sure you'd do your homework.
glossary: to do your homework
translation: 6.	I was sure you would do your homework.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: W zeszłym roku nie pojechałem na wakacje, ponieważ nie miałem pieniędzy.
english: I didn't go on vacation last year because I didn't have any money.
glossary: to go on vacation/to have no money
translation: 7.	Last year I did’t go on vacation because I had no money.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Zawsze znajdę dla ciebie czas, bo jesteś dla mnie ważna.
english: I'll always find time for you because you're important to me.
glossary: to find time for sb/to be important to sb
translation: 8.	I will always find time for you because you are important to me.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Nie mogę się skupić, gdy jest tak głośno.
english: I can't focus when it's so loud.
glossary: to focus on sth/to be loud
translation: 9.	I can't concentrate when it's so loud.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Gramy jutro mecz. Dołączysz do nas?
english: We're playing a match tomorrow. Will you join us?
glossary: to play a match/to join sb
translation: 10.	We're playing a game tomorrow. Will you join us?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Na jakie wykłady chciałbyś uczęszczać?
english: What lectures would you like to attend?
glossary: a lecture/to attend sth
translation: What project are you working on?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Kiedy nauczyłeś się wyrażać swoje uczucia?
english: When did you learn how to express your feelings?
glossary: to learn how to do sth/to express your feelings
translation: What does usually management complain about?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Co skłoniło cię do dołączenia do klubu? Dlaczego tu jesteś?
english: What made you join the club? Why are you here?
glossary: to make sb do sth
translation: I would have stuck to the initial plan if the issue hadn’t got out of control.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Myślę, że wkrótce zmienię pracę.
english: I think I'll change my job soon.
glossary: to change your job/soon
translation: I should have got to a meeting with my client on time.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Stracisz prawo jazdy, jeśli będziesz prowadzić po pijaku.
english: You'll lose your driver's license if you drive drunk.
glossary: to lose your driver's license/to drive drunk
translation: Is there something I should know before I make a call?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Mam nadzieję, że nadrobisz pracę domową.
english: I hope you'll catch up on your homework.
glossary: to catch up on your homework
translation: I’ve been going to the gym for a year.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Poproszę o podwyżkę, jak już szef będzie z powrotem w biurze.
english: I'll ask for a pay-raise once my boss is back in the office.
glossary: to ask for a pay-raise/to be back in the office
translation: You’ve been avoiding me for a long time. I see it.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jak możesz być tak naiwny?
english: How can you be so naive?
glossary: to be naive
translation: Did you get mad when you’d gotten fired?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Obiecuję, że podrzucę dzieci jutro do szkoły.
english: I promise I'll drop off the kids at school tomorrow.
glossary: to drop off the kids at school
translation: I won’t be able to focus on the task until you shut down the music.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jesteś świetna w wydawaniu pieniędzy.
english: You're great at spending money.
glossary: to be great at sth/to spend money on sth
translation: You wouldn’t have been in trouble if you hadn’t lost your temper.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nad jakim projektem pracujecie?
english: What project are you working on?
glossary: to work on a project
translation: What project are you working on?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Na co zwykle narzeka zarząd?
english: What does the board usually complain about?
glossary: to complain about sth
translation: What does usually management complain about?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Trzymałbym się pierwotnego planu, gdyby sprawy nie wymknęły się spod kontroli.
english: I would've stuck to the initial plan if the things hadn't gotten out of control.
glossary: to stick to the plan/the initial plan/to get out of control
translation: I would have stuck to the initial plan if the issue hadn’t got out of control.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Powinienem był dotrzeć na spotkanie z klientem na czas.
english: I should've gotten to the meeting with a client on time.
glossary: to get to a meeting/a meeting/a client/on time
translation: I should have got to a meeting with my client on time.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Czy jest coś, co powinienem wiedzieć, zanim wykonam ten telefon?
english: Is there anything I should know before making the call?
glossary: to make a call/to know sth
translation: Is there something I should know before I make a call?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Od roku chodzę na siłownię.
english: I've been going to the gym for a year.
glossary: to go to the gym
translation: I’ve been going to the gym for a year.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Od dłuższego czasu mnie unikasz. Widzę to.
english: You've been avoiding me for a long time. I see it.
glossary: to avoid sb
translation: You’ve been avoiding me for a long time. I see it.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Wkurzyłeś się, kiedy zostałeś zwolniony?
english: Did you get mad when you were fired?
glossary: to get mad/to be fired
translation: Did you get mad when you’d gotten fired?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie będę w stanie się skupić na tym zadaniu, dopóki nie ściszysz muzyki.
english: I won't be able to focus on this task until you turn the music down.
glossary: to focus on sth/ to turn the music down
translation: I won’t be able to focus on the task until you shut down the music.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie miałbyś teraz problemów, gdybyś nie stracił panowania nad sobą.
english: You wouldn't be in trouble now if you hadn't lost your temper.
glossary: to lose your temper/to be in trouble
translation: You wouldn’t have been in trouble if you hadn’t lost your temper.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Twoje dzieciaki nie byłyby rozpieszczone, gdybyś dawała im na co dzień dobry przykład.
english: Your kids wouldn't be spoiled if you set a good example for them on a daily basis.
glossary: to be spoiled/to set a good example for sb/on a daily basis
translation: Your kids wouldn’t have … if you’d given them a good example every day.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Co kończyłeś? Ekonomię czy finanse?
english: What did you graduate in? Economics or Finance?
glossary: to graduate in Finance/to graduate in Economics/to graduate in sth
translation: What did you graduate? Economic or finanse?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Za co mnie aresztujecie?
english: What are you arresting me for?
glossary: to arrest sb for sth

name: Anette Gray
polish: Klient żąda, żebyśmy zwrócili mu jego pieniądze.
english: The client demands that we refund him his money.
glossary: to demand that.../a client/to refund sb's money
translation: The client demand that we get him back the money.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Moja córka nie miałaby teraz niskiej samooceny, gdyby nie była dręczona w szkole jako nastolatka.
english: My daughter wouldn't have low self-esteem now if she hadn't been bullied at school as a teenager.
glossary: to have low self-esteem/to be bullied/to bully sb/at school/as a teenager
translation: My daughter wouldn’t have had ….. if she hadn’t built.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Zeznałem w sądzie, że nigdy nikogo nie szantażowałem.
english: I testified in court that I'd never blackmailed anyone.
glossary: to testify/to testify in court/to blackmail sb
translation: I testified in the court I’d never blackmailed anyone.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Kogo powinieneś słuchać? Swoich kolegów czy mnie?
english: Who should you listen to? Your friends or me?
glossary: to listen to sb
translation: Who should you listen to? Your friends or me?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Na co czekasz?
english: What are you waiting for?
glossary: to wait for sb
translation: What are you waiting for?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Mój kumpel jest beznadziejny w podrywaniu kobiet.
english: A friend of mine is terrible at picking up women.
glossary: a friend of yours/a friend of mine/to be terrible at sth/to pick up women
translation: My friend is terrible at picking up women.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Byłem oburzony, kiedy zapytano się mnie w zeszłym miesiącu, czy kiedykolwiek wziąłem łapówkę.
english: I was outraged when I was asked last month if I'd ever taken a bribe.
glossary: to be outraged/last month/to take a bribe
translation: I was … when … last month, I had ever taken a bribe.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Możesz być z siebie dumny.
english: You can be proud of yourself.
glossary: to be proud of sb
translation: You can be proud of yourself.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie mam czasu. Idę jutro do lekarza.
english: I don't have time. I'm going to the doctor tomorrow.
glossary: to go to the doctor
translation: I don’t have time. I’m going to the doctor tomorrow.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Dlaczego nalegasz? Wiesz, że się nie zgodzę.
english: Why are you insisting? You know I won't agree.
glossary: to insist/to agree
translation: Why are you … ? You know I won’t agree.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Z czego wynika Twoja pasja do języków?
english: What does your passion for languages stem from?
glossary: to have a passion for sth/to stem from sth
translation: What is your language passion from?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jutro jem obiad z moim szefem.
english: I'm having lunch with my boss tomorrow.
glossary: to have lunch with sb/a boss
translation: I’m having lunch with my boss tomorrow.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Prezes by teraz z panią porozmawiała, gdyby nie była na spotkaniu.
english: The chairman would talk to you right now if she weren't at a meeting.
glossary: a chairman/to talk to sb/to be at a meeting
translation: The CEO would have talked to you if she wasn't at the meeting.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie zostałbyś pozwany, gdybyś bez pozwolenia nie ujawnił poufnych informacji.
english: You wouldn't have been sued if you hadn't disclosed confidential information without permission.
glossary: to be sued/to disclose confidential information/to do sth without permission
translation: You wouldn’t have sued if you hadn’t provided secret information.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Powinniśmy teraz nosić maseczki w sklepach.
english: We are supposed to wear face masks in stores now.
glossary: to wear face masks
translation: We should wear face masks in the stores.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jak rzeczniczka skomentowała incydent?
english: How did the spokeswoman comment on the incident?
glossary: a spokeswoman/to comment on sth/an incident
translation: How did … comment a …..?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Do czego masz słabość?
english: What do you have a weakness for?
glossary: to have a weakness for sth
translation: What  do you have a weakness for?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Zawsze przeglądasz Facebooka, kiedy chcę z tobą porozmawiać.
english: You're always scrolling Facebook when I want to talk to you.
glossary: to scroll Facebook/to want to do sth/to talk to sb
translation: You always browse Facebook when I want to talk to you.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jest wiele opcji, które możesz wybrać.
english: There are many options you can choose.
glossary: an option/to choose an option
translation: There are many options you can chose.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Dowiedziałem się o tym fakcie po tym, jak się rozstaliśmy.
english: I found out about the fact after we'd broken up.
glossary: to find out about sth/a fact/to break up
translation: I found out about the fact after we broke up.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Czy to ma dla ciebie znaczenie?
english: Does it matter to you?
glossary: to matter
translation: Does it matter to you?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Na imprezie było dużo pijanych nastolatków.
english: There were many drunk teens at the party.
glossary: a teen/to be drunk
translation: There were many wasted teengers at the party.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Gdzie Ty wczoraj spałeś?
english: Where did you sleep yesterday?
glossary: to sleep
translation: Where were you yesterday?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Dlaczego rzuciłaś angielski?
english: Why did you give up English?
glossary: to give up English
translation: Why did you give up English?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Zawsze pędzisz. Może powinieneś nauczyć się jeździć.
english: You're always speeding. Maybe you should learn how to drive.
glossary: to speed/to learn how to do sth
translation: You always drive fast. Maybe, you should learn how to drive?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Od miesiąca szukam nowej pracy.
english: I've been looking for a new job for a month.
glossary: to look for a new job
translation: I’ve been looking for a new job for a month.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Gdybyś nie był zapominalski, cały zespół nie musiałby teraz pracować.
english: If you weren't forgetful, the whole team wouldn't have to work now.
glossary: to be forgetful/the whole team/to work
translation: If you’re not forgetful the whole team shouldn’t work now.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Tak szybko jechałem na rowerze, że nie zorientowałem się, że przejechałem znak stop.
english: I was riding a bike so fast that I didn't realize I had run a stop sign.
glossary: to ride a bike/to realize that.../to run a stop sign
translation: I rode the bike so fast that I didn’t realize I ran the stop sign.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Ile osadzonych jest obecnie w tym więzieniu?
english: How many inmates are there currently in the jail?
glossary: a jail; a prison/an inmate/currently
translation: How many inmates are there in the prison now?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Widzę, że restauracja ci się nie podoba. Z czym masz problem?
english: I see that you don't like the restaurant. What do you have a problem with?
glossary: to have a problem with sth/a restaurant
translation: I see, you don’t like the restaurant. What have you problem with?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie mogę zasnąć. Nie powinienem był pić kawy tak późno.
english: I can't fall asleep. I shouldn't have drunk coffee so late.
glossary: to fall asleep/to drink coffee/late
translation: I can’t fall asleep. I shouldn't have had some coffee so late.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Zawsze znajdę dla ciebie czas, bo jesteś dla mnie ważna.
english: I'll always find time for you because you're important to me.
glossary: to find time for sb/to be important to sb
translation: I always find time for you because you’re important to me.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jak długo czekasz, aż lekarz znajdzie dla Ciebie wolne miejsce?
english: How long have you been waiting for the doctor to find a free slot for you?
glossary: to find a free slot/to wait for sb to do sth
translation: How long do you wait until the doctor finds for you a free place?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jestem pewna, że będziesz żałować tej decyzji.
english: I'm sure you'll regret the decision.
glossary: to regret sth/a decision
translation: I’m sure you’ll regret the decision.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nudziło mi się wczoraj w pracy, bo nie było nic do roboty.
english: I was bored at work yesterday because there was nothing to do.
glossary: to be bored/at work/to have nothing to do
translation: I was bored at work yesterday because there was nothing to do.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie będziesz musiała mnie odbierać jutro ze szkoły, bo śpię u koleżanki.
english: You won't have to pick me up from school tomorrow because I'm sleeping at my friend's.
glossary: to pick sb up from school/to sleep at your friend's
translation: You won’t have to pick me up from school tomorrow because I’m sleeping at my friend’s.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Obiecuję, że odwiedzę was w przyszłym miesiącu.
english: I promise I'll visit you next month.
glossary: to visit sb/next month/to promise
translation: I promise I’ll visit you next month.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Ilu wspólników było na spotkaniu w zeszłym tygodniu?
english: How many business partners were there at the meeting last week?
glossary: a participant/a meeting/last week
translation: How many partners were at the meeting last week?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Do czego masz słabość?
english: What do you have a weakness for?
glossary: to have a weakness for sth
translation: What are you weak for?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Jutro jem obiad z moim szefem.
english: I'm having lunch with my boss tomorrow.
glossary: to have lunch with sb/a boss
translation: I’m eating dinner with my boss tomorrow.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Jeśli zostanie przyznany mi ten kredyt, w końcu będę mógł przeprowadzić badanie.
english: If I'm granted the loan, I'll be finally able to conduct the study.
glossary: to be granted a loan/to be able to do sth/to conduct a study/finally
translation: If I get the credit, I will eventually be able to do the research.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Piłbym częściej herbatę, gdybym lubił moich sąsiadów.
english: I'd have tea more often if I liked my neighbors.
glossary: to have tea/often/a neighbor/to like sb
translation: I would drink tea more if I liked my neighbors.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Trzymałbym się pierwotnego planu, gdyby sprawy nie wymknęły się spod kontroli.
english: I would've stuck to the initial plan if the things hadn't gotten out of control.
glossary: to stick to the plan/the initial plan/to get out of control
translation: I would have stuck to the original plan if things hadn’t gotten out of control.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Nie rozumiem, dlaczego jesteś na mnie wściekły.
english: I don't understand why you're mad at me.
glossary: to understand sb/to be mad at sb
translation: I don’t understand why you are mad at me.

name: Martin Vance

translation: 1. I had much work last week and I was afraid I wouldn't meet a deadline.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Nie powinieneś był wspominać o naszych problemach na spotkaniu z szefem.
english: You shouldn't have mentioned our problems at the meeting with the boss.
glossary: at the meeting/to mention sth
translation: 2. You shouln't have mentioned about our problems at the meeting with the boss.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Przyjeżdżam jutro do Warszawy i zatrzymuję się u mojej koleżanki.
english: I'm coming to Warsaw tomorrow and staying at my friend's.
glossary: to come to Warsaw
translation: 3. I'm coming to Warsaw tommorow and I'm going to stay at my firend's.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Nie powinieneś był opowiadać tego żartu. Był niegrzeczny.
english: You shouldn't have told the joke. It was rude.
glossary: to be rude to sb/to tell sb a joke
translation: 4. You shouldn't have told the joke. It was rude.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że nic nie będę musiał dzisiaj robić.
english: I hoped I wouldn't have to do anything today.
glossary: to hope/today
translation: 5. I hoped I wouldn't have to do anything today.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Powinienem był spędzić zeszły weekend z rodziną.
english: I should've spent my last weekend with my family.
glossary: to spend time with sb/last weekend/a family
translation: 6. I should've spent the weekend with my family.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Nie powinienem był Ci opowiadać tej historii, bo jest zbyt prywatna.
english: I shouldn't have told you the story because it's too private.
glossary: to tell sb a story/to be private
translation: 7. I shouldn't have told you the story because it's too private.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że ci klienci zostawią większy napiwek.
english: I hoped the customers would leave a bigger tip.
glossary: to leave a tip/a customer/to hope
translation: 8. I hoped the clients would leave bigger tip.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Nie powinieneś był mnie okłamywać.
english: You shouldn't have lied to me.
glossary: to lie to sb
translation: 9. You shouln't have lied to me.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Co robisz dziś wieczorem?
english: What are you doing tonight?
translation: 10. What are you going to do tonight?

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Jutro uczę się na egzamin, ale możemy się spotkać, jak już skończę.
english: I'm studying for an exam tomorrow, but we can meet once I'm done.
glossary: to be done/to study for an exam/to meet sb
translation: 1. Tomorrow, I am studying for a test, but we can meet when I will have finished.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Nie pojechałem nad jezioro, bo obawiałem się, że się przeziębię.
english: I didn't go to the lake because I was afraid I'd catch a cold.
glossary: to go to the lake/to catch a cold/to be afraid of sth
translation: 2. I didn't go to the lake because I was afraid that I would catch a cold.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Przeprowadzę się, jak już znajdę nową pracę.
english: I'll move once I find a new job.
glossary: to move/to find a new job
translation: 3. I will move once I will have found a new job.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Będę mieć więcej energii, jak już napiję się kawy.
english: I'll have more energy once I have some coffee.
glossary: to have energy/to have some coffee
translation: 4. I will have more energy once I will have drunk my coffee.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Poproszę o podwyżkę, jak już szef będzie z powrotem w biurze.
english: I'll ask for a pay-raise once my boss is back in the office.
glossary: to ask for a pay-raise/to be back in the office
translation: 5. I will ask for a raise once my boss will have come back to the office.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Jestem podekscytowana, bo jutro widzę się ze starą znajomą.
english: I'm excited because I'm seeing an old friend of mine tomorrow.
glossary: to see sb/to be excited
translation: 6. I am excited because I am meeting an old friend of mine tomorrow.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: W przyszłym tygodniu zaczynam kurs angielskiego. Nie mogę się doczekać.
english: I'm starting an English course next week. I can't wait.
glossary: can't wait/to start an English course
translation: 7. I am starting an English course next week. I can't wait.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Porozmawiamy, jak już będziesz gotowa.
english: We'll talk once you're ready.
glossary: to talk to sb/to be ready
translation: 8. We will talk when you will have been ready.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Bałem się, że przegramy sprawę przez mój błąd.
english: I was afraid we'd lose the case because of my mistake.
glossary: to be afraid of sth/to lose a case/because of you/a mistake
translation: 9. I was afraid that we would lose the case because of my mistake.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Możemy przełożyć nasze spotkanie? Jutro przyjeżdżają moi rodzice w odwiedziny.
english: Can we put off our meeting? My parents are visiting me tomorrow.
glossary: to visit sb/to put off a meeting
translation: 10. Can we postpone our meeting? My parents are visiting me tomorrow.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Jaka jest różnica między kimś, kto jest świetny w swojej roli, a kimś, kto jest wybitny?

glossary: to find a difference between sth and sth/to be outstanding
translation: 1.	What’s the difference between someone who is best in his role, and someone who is outstanding?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Czy jesteś skłonny się przenieść?
english: Are you willing to relocate?
glossary: to be willing to do sth/to relocate
translation: 2.	Are you tend to move?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Z czego jesteś najbardziej dumny?
english: What are you most proud of?
glossary: to be proud of sth
translation: 3.	What are you proud the most of?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Czego szukasz w zakresie rozwoju kariery?
english: What are you looking for in terms of career development?
glossary: to look for sth/In terms of.../career development
translation: 4.	What are you looking for regarding your career development?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Dlaczego odchodzisz ze swojej obecnej pracy?
english: Why are you leaving your current job?
glossary: to leave sth/your current job
translation: 5.	Why are you leaving your current work?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Jakie są cechy dobrego lidera?
english: What are the qualities of a good leader?
glossary: to be a good leader/quality

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Gdzie widzisz siebie za pięć lat?
english: Where do you see yourself in five years?
glossary: to see yourself in a few years
translation: 7.	Where do you see yourself in five years?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Czy możesz opisać raz, w którym twoja praca była krytykowana?
english: Can you describe a time when your work was criticized?
glossary: to describe sth/to be criticized

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Jakie są Twoje oczekiwania dotyczące wynagrodzenia?
english: What are your salary expectations?
glossary: salary expectations
translation: 9.	What are your salary expectations?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Jak radzisz sobie z pracą z ludźmi, którzy cię denerwują?
english: How do you handle working with people that annoy you?
glossary: to handle sth/to annoy sb
translation: 10.	How do you deal with work with people who make you nervous?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Przygotuję się na spotkanie, jeśli będę mieć czas.
english: I'll get prepared for the meeting if I have time.
glossary: to get prepared for a meeting
translation: I will prepare for the meeting if I have time.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Na twoim miejscu nie chodziłbym spać tak późno.
english: If I were you, I wouldn't go to sleep so late.
glossary: to go to sleep late
translation: If I were you, I wouldn’t go to sleep that late.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Gdybyś nie popełnił tego przestępstwa, policja by cię teraz nie szukała.
english: If you hadn't committed the crime, the police wouldn't be looking for you now.
glossary: to look for sb/to commit a crime
translation: If you didn't commit the crime, the police wouldn’t look for you now.

name: Martin Vance
polish: O czym musimy porozmawiać?
english: What do we have to talk about?
glossary: to talk about sth

name: Martin Vance
polish: Dlaczego jest tyle głosów przeciwko temu kandydatowi?
english: Why are there so many votes against the candidate?
glossary: a vote against sb/a candidate

name: Martin Vance
polish: Kogo spotkałeś, kiedy wychodziłeś z budynku?
english: Who did you meet when you were leaving the building?
glossary: to meet sb/to leave the building
translation: Who did you meet when you left the building?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Zrobiłaś test ciążowy?
english: Did you do a pregnancy test?
glossary: to do a pregnancy test/a pregnancy test
translation: Did you do a pregnancy test?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Dowiedziałem się wczoraj, że mój szef pracował wcześniej w agencji nieruchomości.
english: I found out yesterday that my boss had worked at a real estate agency before.
glossary: a real estate agency/to find out that.../a boss
translation: Yesterday, I found out that my boss had worked in a real estate agency before.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Wszyscy się mnie wczoraj pytali, czy jestem zły. Nie wiem dlaczego.
english: Everybody asked me yesterday if I was mad. I don't know why.
glossary: to be mad at sb
translation: Yesterday, everyone asked me why I was mad. I don’t know why.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Często podróżowaliśmy z mężem, zanim urodziło się nasze pierwsze dziecko.
english: My husband and I had often traveled before our first kid was born.
glossary: to be born/a kid/to travel/a husband
translation: My husband and I often traveled before our first child was born. E4023

name: Agnes Parker

english: I think I'll visit you on the weekend because I'm coming back home late tomorrow.
glossary: to visit sb/to come back home late

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Nie wychodź teraz z domu, bo jest zbyt gorąco.
english: Don't leave the house now because it's too hot.
glossary: to leave the house
translation: Don't leave the house now, it os too hot.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Zepsułam telefon mojej mamy. Nie wiem, co powinnam teraz zrobić.
english: I broke my mom's cell phone. I don't know what I should do now.
glossary: to break a cell phone
translation: I broke my mom's phone. I don't know what I should to do now.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Nie mogę teraz rozmawiać, bo nie mam czasu.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Kiedy wyjeżdżasz?
english: When are you leaving?
glossary: to leave

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Mogłem zostać w domu, bo nie ma tu nic do roboty.

glossary: to stay at home/to have nothing to do

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Gdzie byłeś? Nie mogłem cię znaleźć.
english: Where were you? I couldn't find you.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Nie zapłaciłam rachunków w zeszłym miesiącu, bo nie miałam żadnych pieniędzy.
english: I didn't pay the bills last month because I didn't have any money.
glossary: to pay the bills

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Zawsze ci pomogę, bo jesteś siostrą mojej żony.
english: I'll always help you because you're my wife's sister.
glossary: to help sb
translation: I will always help you, you are my sister in law.

polish: Byłam pewna, że spędzimy razem więcej czasu.

glossary: to be sure that.../to spend time with sb

glossary: to pick sb up from school/to sleep at your friend's

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Myślałem, że zjemy dzisiaj na mieście.
english: I thought we'd eat out today.
glossary: to eat out

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Mogłem wczoraj wydać mniej pieniędzy.

polish: Nie ma nikogo w domu. Dlatego jest tak cicho.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Nie wiem, co powinienem odpowiedzieć.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Byłem pewny, że zrobisz swoją pracę domową.

glossary: to do your homework
translation: I was surre that you would do your homework.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: W zeszłym roku nie pojechałem na wakacje, ponieważ nie miałem pieniędzy.
english: I didn't go on vacation last year because I didn't have any money.
glossary: to go on vacation/to have no money

name: Adrianne Nelson

glossary: to find time for sb/to be important to sb

polish: Nie mogę się skupić, gdy jest tak głośno.

glossary: a former colleague/to be in the room

glossary: to describe sth

glossary: your spare time

glossary: a manager

glossary: your greatest strength
translation: 3. Co jest Twoją największą mocną stroną? What is your bigest stranger?

glossary: your greatest failure

glossary: your greatest achievement
translation: 5. Jakie jest Twoje największe osiągnięcie poza pracą? What is your biggest achivent apart from work?

glossary: to do sth for fun
translation: 7. Co lubisz robić dla zabawy? What do you like to do for fun?

glossary: to do sth differently

name: Matt Carpenter

glossary: to like to do sth
translation: 9. Co lubisz robić? What do you like to do?

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Jak przygotowywałeś się do tego wywiadu?
english: How did you prepare for this interview?
glossary: to prepare sb for sth
translation: 10. Jak przygotowywałeś się do tego wywiadu? How did you prepare for an interviev?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Pobraliśmy już próbki krwi i jesteśmy gotowi, żeby je zbadać.
english: We've already taken blood samples and we're ready to examine them.
glossary: to take blood samples/to examine samples

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Ta sytuacja nie wywarła na mnie żadnego wpływu.
english: The situation didn't have any influence on me.
glossary: to have no influence on sb/a situation
translation: This situation didn’t influence on me.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Nie mam dostępu do pliku. Możesz to sprawdzić?
english: I don't have access to the file. Can you check that?
glossary: to have access to a file/to check sth
translation: I have no access to the file. Could you check it?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Nasz syn nie pobiłby rekordu szkoły, gdyby pan go nie wspierał.
english: Our son wouldn't have beaten the school record if you hadn't supported him.
glossary: to beat the school record/to beat the record/to support sb
translation: Our son wouldn’t have beaten the school record, if you hand’t supported him.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Nie miałeś prawa, żeby przeglądać mój telefon.
english: You didn't have the right to look through my phone.
glossary: to have the right to do sth/to look through sb's phone
translation: You had no right to look through my phone.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Włóż zupę do lodówki. Nie chcesz, żeby się popsuła.
english: Put the soup in the fridge. You don't want it to go bad.
glossary: soup/to put sth in the fridge/to go bad
translation: Put on a soup to the fridge. You don’t want to go wrong.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Nie musiałbym teraz zwracać tych butów, gdyby na mnie pasowały.
english: I wouldn't have to return the shoes now if they fit me.
glossary: to return a product/shoes/to fit sb
translation: I wouldn’t have to return these shoes, if it had fitted me.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Dlaczego włączyłeś wczoraj muzykę, wiedząc, że śpię?
english: Why did you turn on the music yesterday knowing that I was asleep?
glossary: to turn on the music/to know sth/to be asleep
translation: Why did you turn on a music yesterday knowing I was sleeping.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Nie zamieniłem wczoraj z rodzicami ani słowa, bo nie miałem czasu.
english: I didn't have a word with my parents yesterday because I didn't have time.
glossary: to have a word with sb/to have time
translation: I didn’t have a word with my parents yesterday because I had no time.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Nie chciałbym, żeby zarząd zrobił się podejrzliwy.
english: I wouldn't like the management board to get suspicious.
glossary: the management board/to get suspicious
translation: I don’t want the Management Board became suspicious.

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Jaka jest różnica między kimś, kto jest świetny w swojej roli, a kimś, kto jest wybitny?
english: What’s the difference between someone who’s great in your role versus someone who’s outstanding?
glossary: to find a difference between sth and sth/to be outstanding
translation: 1. What technics and tools do you use to stay organized?

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Czy jesteś skłonny się przenieść?
english: Are you willing to relocate?
glossary: to be willing to do sth/to relocate
translation: 2. Which task was too hard for you?

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Z czego jesteś najbardziej dumny?
english: What are you most proud of?
glossary: to be proud of sth
translation: 3. What do you know about the industry?

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Czego szukasz w zakresie rozwoju kariery?
english: What are you looking for in terms of career development?
glossary: to look for sth/In terms of.../career development
translation: 4. What is your biggest worry?

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Dlaczego odchodzisz ze swojej obecnej pracy?
english: Why are you leaving your current job?
glossary: to leave sth/your current job

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Jakie są cechy dobrego lidera?
english: What are the qualities of a good leader?
glossary: to be a good leader/quality
translation: 6. What is your style of management?

name: Claudine Gross
