name: Anette Gray
polish: Kto mnie zastąpi, kiedy wezmę tydzień wolnego?
english: Who's going to replace me when I take a week off?
glossary: to replace sb/to take a week off
translation: Who will cover for me when I take a week off?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Mogłaś mnie wczoraj odwiedzić, skoro byłaś w mieście.
english: You could've visited me yesterday since you were in town.
glossary: to visit sb/to be in town
translation: You could’ve visited me yesterday if you were in town.

name: Anette Gray
polish: W ten weekend robimy z przyjacielem parapetówkę.
english: My friend and I are throwing a housewarming party this weekend.
glossary: to throw a housewarming party/a housewarming party/a friend/this weekend
translation: My friend and I are throwing a housewarming party this weekend.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Ile pokoi jest w tym mieszkaniu?
english: How many rooms are there in the apartment?
glossary: in the apartment/a room
translation: How many rooms are there in the apartment?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Trudno ci będzie zaangażować wszystkich w rozmowę.
english: It will be hard for you to engage everybody in the conversation.
glossary: to engage sb in the conversation
translation: It will be hard to … everyone in conversation.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jutro omawiamy bieżące problemy na spotkaniu.
english: We're discussing the current problems at the meeting tomorrow.
glossary: to discuss sth/the current problems/at the meeting
translation: We’re discusing the curent problems tomorrow at the meeting.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jechałeś bardzo szybko. Bałem się, że będziemy mieli wypadek.
english: You drove very fast. I was afraid we'd have an accident.
glossary: to drive/to be afraid/to have an accident
translation: You ride very fast. I was afraid we’d have an accident.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Otrzymałaby pani zwrot kosztów, gdyby wysłała nam pani faktury na czas.
english: You would have received the reimbursement if you had sent us the invoices on time.
glossary: to receive sth/a reimbursement/to send invoices
translation: You would’ve gotten the costs back if you sent us the invoice on time.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jeszcze nigdy nie byłam na innym kontynencie.
english: I haven't been to a different continent yet.
glossary: a continent
translation: I have never been to another continent before.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Moi rodzice nie mieliby nic przeciwko naszemu związkowi, gdybyś miał stały dochód.
english: My parents wouldn't have anything against our relationship if you had a steady income.
glossary: to have a steady income/to have nothing against sth/a parent/a relationship
translation: My parents wouldn’t have minded our relationship if you’d had a stady income.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie ma w tym artykule nic interesującego.
english: There's nothing interesting in the article.
glossary: in the article/an interesting article
translation: There is nothing interesting in the article.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie powinieneś był tyle pić na imprezie.
english: You shouldn't have drunk so much at the party.
glossary: to drink/at the party
translation: You shouldn’t have drunk so much at the party.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Z kim dzisiaj wychodzisz na miasto? Znam tych ludzi?
english: Who are you going out today with? Do I know those people?
glossary: to go out/to know sb
translation: Who are you going out with tonight? Do I know the people?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Gratulacje. Właśnie usłyszałem wieści.
english: Congratulations. I've just heard the news.
glossary: congratulations/to hear the news
translation: Congratulations. I just heard the news.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Obiecuję, że pójdę jutro do szkoły.
english: I promise I'll go to school tomorrow.
glossary: to promise sth/to go to school
translation: I promise I’ll go to school tomorrow.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Miałem wczoraj kaca.
english: I had a hangover yesterday.
glossary: to have a hangover
translation: I had a hangover yesterday.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Ostrzegałam cię, że będzie korek na autostradzie, ale nie chciałeś mnie słuchać.
english: I warned you there would be a traffic jam on the highway, but you didn't want to listen to me.
glossary: to warn sb that.../I've warned you that.../an accident/on the highway/to listen to sb
translation: I’ve warned you there will be a traffic jam on the highway but you didn’t want to listen to me.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Wieczorem idę na zakupy. Chcesz coś?
english: I'm going shopping in the evening. Do you want anything?
glossary: to go shopping
translation: I’m going shopping tonight. Do you want something?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Łatwo nam było zaspokoić potrzeby tego klienta, bo mieliśmy wszystko, czego chciał.
english: It was easy for us to meet this client's needs because we had everything he wanted.
glossary: to meet your client's needs
translation: It was easy to … because we had everything he needed.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jak zapłaciłeś za kurs?
english: How did you pay for the course?
glossary: to pay for a course
translation: How did you pay for the course?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Było kilka osób, które mi pomogły, gdy byłem w potrzebie.
english: There were a few people that helped me when I was in need.
glossary: to be in need/to help sb
translation: There were a few people who helped me when I was in need.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Chciałbym porozmawiać z tobą o odchudzaniu się.
english: I'd like to talk to you about losing weight.
glossary: to lose weight/I'd like to.../to talk about sth
translation: I’d like to talk to you about losing weight.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Widzę, co się dzieje. Kogo unikasz?
english: I see what's happening. Who are you avoiding?
glossary: to see sth/to happen/to avoid sb
translation: I see what happened. Who are you avoiding?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Mam nadzieję, że nie będę mieć jutro kaca.
english: I hope I won't have a hangover tomorrow.
glossary: to have a hangover
translation: I hope I won’t have a hangover tomorrow.

name: Anette Gray
polish: W moim biurze jest osoba, która naprawia komputery.
english: There's a person in my office who repairs computers.
glossary: to repair a computer/in your office/a person
translation: There is a person in my office who repaire computers.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Możemy przełożyć nasze spotkanie? Jutro przyjeżdżają moi rodzice w odwiedziny.
english: Can we put off our meeting? My parents are visiting me tomorrow.
glossary: to visit sb/to put off a meeting
translation: Can we put off our meeting? My parents are arraiving to visit me tomorrow.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Mój mąż sprawia, że ​​czuję się wyjątkowo. Zawsze upewnia się, że dostaję to, czego chcę.
english: My husband makes me feel special. He always makes sure I get what I want.
glossary: to make sb do sth
translation: My husband makes me feel special. He always makes sure I get what I want.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Wkurzyłeś mnie rano. Myślałem, że wyrzucę cię z domu.
english: You made me mad in the morning. I thought I'd throw you out of the house.
glossary: to make sb mad/to throw sb out of the house
translation: You made me mad in the morning. I thought I’d throw you from home.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Mogłem biec szybciej. Zdążyłbym na pociąg.
english: I could've run faster. I would've caught the train.
glossary: to run fast/to catch the train
translation: I could run faster. I would catch the train.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Na co narzeka tym razem nasza córka?
english: What is our daughter complaining about this time?
glossary: to complain about sth/a daughter
translation: What are our doughter complaining at?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Mój współpracownik nigdy nie zwraca uwagi na szczegóły. Zawsze muszę poprawiać jego zadania.
english: My coworker never pays attention to detail. I always have to correct his tasks.
glossary: to pay attention to detail/to correct sth
translation: My collegue never cares about details. I always have to correct his mistakes.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Czy ty mnie sprawdzasz? Myślałem, że mi ufasz.
english: Are you testing me? I thought you trusted me.
glossary: to test sb/to think that.../to trust sb
translation: Do you check me? I thought you trust me.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Dlaczego mnie wczoraj zignorowałeś?
english: Why did you ignore me yesterday?
glossary: to ignore sb
translation: Why did you ignore me yesterday?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że ci klienci zostawią większy napiwek.
english: I hoped the customers would leave a bigger tip.
glossary: to leave a tip/a customer/to hope
translation: I hoped the clients would leave a bigger tip.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Mogę porozmawiać z odpowiednią osobą, jeśli chcesz.
english: I can talk to the right person if you want.
glossary: to want sth/to talk to sb/the right person
translation: I can talk with the right person If you want.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Muszę zacząć jeszcze raz.
english: I have to start over.
glossary: to start over
translation: I have to start one more time.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie powinieneś był wspominać o naszych problemach na spotkaniu z szefem.
english: You shouldn't have mentioned our problems at the meeting with the boss.
glossary: at the meeting/to mention sth
translation: You shouldn’t have mentioned our problems at the meeting with the boss.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Dlaczego na świecie jest tyle głodu?
english: Why is there so much hunger in the world?
glossary: hunger/in the world
translation: Why is there so much hunger in the world?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Kierownik zmusił mnie do podpisania dokumentów.
english: The director made me sign the documents.
glossary: to make sb do sth/a director
translation: The manager … to sign the documents.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Porozmawiamy, jak już będziesz gotowa.
english: We'll talk once you're ready.
glossary: to talk to sb/to be ready
translation: Let’s talk once you’ll be ready.

name: Anette Gray
polish: W tej grupie jest za dużo ludzi. Znajdę inną.
english: There are too many people in the group. I have to find a different one.
glossary: in the group/to find sth/different
translation: There are too many people in the group.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Dam Ci znać, jak już skończę pracę.
english: I'll let you know once I finish work.
glossary: to let sb know/to finish work
translation: I’ll let you know once I finish work.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Następny weekend spędzam w moim rodzinnym mieście.
english: I'm spending next weekend in my hometown.
glossary: in your hometown/to spend next weekend
translation: I’m spending next weekend in my hometown.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Przed kim ostrzegali nas rodzice? Zapomniałeś?
english: Who did our parents warn us of? Did you forget?
glossary: to warn sb about sb; to warn sb of sb/to forget
translation: Who did our parents warn from? Did you forget?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jestem słaby w słuchaniu innych.
english: I'm bad at listening to others.
glossary: to be bad at sth/to listen to others
translation: I’m bad at listening to people.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Zarząd zapytał się mnie wczoraj, dlaczego przekroczyliśmy budżet.
english: The management board asked me yesterday why we'd gone over budget.
glossary: the management board/to go over budget
translation: The managment asked me yesterday why we overloaded the budget.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Byłbym wdzięczny, gdybyś wyświadczyła mi przysługę.
english: I'd be grateful if you did me a favor.
glossary: I'd be grateful if.../to be grateful/to do sb a favor
translation: I’d be gradeful if you do me a favor.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Na kim w zespole możesz polegać?
english: Who can you rely on on the team?
glossary: to rely on sb/on the team
translation: Who can you rely on in the team?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Żądamy, aby dyrektor szkoły ustąpił ze stanowiska.
english: We demand that the school principal step down.
glossary: to demand that.../the school principal/to step down
translation: We demend the school’s director … his position.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Zastanawiałem się jakiś czas temu, czy mi już wybaczyłaś.
english: I was wondering a while ago if you'd forgiven me yet.
glossary: I was wondering if.../a while ago/to forgive sb
translation: I was wondering some time ago If you had forgiven me.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie miałbyś teraz kłopotów, gdybyś nie próbował przekupić policjanta.
english: You wouldn't be in trouble now if you hadn't tried to bribe a police officer.
glossary: to be in trouble/to try to do sh/a police officer/to bribe sb
translation: You wouldn’t have been in trouble if you hadn’t tried to bribe the policeman.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Zapytałem się wczoraj mojego adwokata, czy złożył już apelację od wyroku sądu.
english: I asked my attorney yesterday if he'd appealed the court's decision yet.
glossary: an attorney/to appeal the court's decision
translation: I asked my attorney yesterday if he had applied the cort’s decision.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Z kim wczoraj wygrałeś?
english: Who did you win against yesterday?
glossary: to win against sb
translation: Who did you win against yesterday?

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Twoje dzieciaki nie byłyby rozpieszczone, gdybyś dawała im na co dzień dobry przykład.
english: Your kids wouldn't be spoiled if you set a good example for them on a daily basis.
glossary: to be spoiled/to set a good example for sb/on a daily basis
translation: 1. Twoje dzieciaki nie byłyby rozpieszczone, gdybyś dawała im na co dzień dobry przykład. Your kind woudn't be melt if you'd gave them the right example.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Co kończyłeś? Ekonomię czy finanse?
english: What did you graduate in? Economics or Finance?
glossary: to graduate in Finance/to graduate in Economics/to graduate in sth
translation: 2. Co kończyłeś? Ekonomię czy finanse? What did you finish? Economy or finance?

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Za co mnie aresztujecie?
english: What are you arresting me for?
glossary: to arrest sb for sth
translation: 3. Za co mnie aresztujecie? What are you aresting me for?

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Klient żąda, żebyśmy zwrócili mu jego pieniądze.
english: The client demands that we refund him his money.
glossary: to demand that.../a client/to refund sb's money
translation: 4. Klient żąda, żebyśmy zwrócili mu jego pieniądze. The clins demend you will get his money back.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Moja córka nie miałaby teraz niskiej samooceny, gdyby nie była dręczona w szkole jako nastolatka.
english: My daughter wouldn't have low self-esteem now if she hadn't been bullied at school as a teenager.
glossary: to have low self-esteem/to be bullied/to bully sb/at school/as a teenager
translation: 5. Moja córka nie miałaby teraz niskiej samooceny, gdyby nie była dręczona w szkole jako nastolatka. My doughther woudn't have low self estime if she woudn't had been buulied.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Zeznałem w sądzie, że nigdy nikogo nie szantażowałem.
english: I testified in court that I'd never blackmailed anyone.
glossary: to testify/to testify in court/to blackmail sb
translation: 6. Zeznałem w sądzie, że nigdy nikogo nie szantażowałem. I testified in court I've never treten anybody.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Kogo powinieneś słuchać? Swoich kolegów czy mnie?
english: Who should you listen to? Your friends or me?
glossary: to listen to sb
translation: 7. Kogo powinieneś słuchać? Swoich kolegów czy mnie? Who should you questoning? Your friend or me?

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Na co czekasz?
english: What are you waiting for?
glossary: to wait for sb
translation: 8. Na co czekasz? What are you waiting for?

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Mój kumpel jest beznadziejny w podrywaniu kobiet.
english: A friend of mine is terrible at picking up women.
glossary: a friend of yours/a friend of mine/to be terrible at sth/to pick up women
translation: 9. Mój kumpel jest beznadziejny w podrywaniu kobiet. My friend is terible in picking women.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Byłem oburzony, kiedy zapytano się mnie w zeszłym miesiącu, czy kiedykolwiek wziąłem łapówkę.
english: I was outraged when I was asked last month if I'd ever taken a bribe.
glossary: to be outraged/last month/to take a bribe
translation: 10. Byłem oburzony, kiedy zapytano się mnie w zeszłym miesiącu, czy kiedykolwiek wziąłem łapówkę. I was disgusted last mount when somebody asked me if i take illegal money.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Wczoraj przypadkowo skasowałam z komputera wszystkie pliki.
english: I accidentally deleted all my files from the computer yesterday.
glossary: to do sth accidentally/to delete a file from the computer
translation: I accidently removed all files from the computer yesterday.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Obiecuję, że jutro oddam ci pieniądze.
english: I promise I'll give the money back to you tomorrow.
glossary: to give sb back the money; to give the money back to sb
translation: I promise I’ll give you the money back tomorrow.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jeśli zostanie przyznany mi ten kredyt, w końcu będę mógł przeprowadzić badanie.
english: If I'm granted the loan, I'll be finally able to conduct the study.
glossary: to be granted a loan/to be able to do sth/to conduct a study/finally
translation: If I granded a loan I will can eventually to do research.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Gdybym ja tu rządziła, mielibyśmy rozsądne godziny pracy.
english: If I ruled here, we would have more reasonable working hours.
glossary: to rule/to be reasonable/working hours
translation: If I’m in charge of here we will have … work time.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie powinnaś wierzyć swojemu mężowi.
english: You shouldn't believe your husband.
glossary: to believe sb
translation: You shouldn’t belive your husband.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Myślę, że będziemy częściej wychodzić razem na miasto, bo przyszłym miesiącu przeprowadzam się do Warszawy.
english: I think we'll hang out together more often because I'm moving to Warsaw next month.
glossary: to go out; to hang out/to move to Warsaw/next month
translation: I think we will go out more often because I’m moving to Warsaw next month.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jaki temat omawialiście dzisiaj w klasie?
english: What subject did you cover in class today?
glossary: to cover a subject/to do sth in class
translation: What task did you discas in class?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Zaproszę twoją siostrę na randkę, jak już wróci do miasta.
english: I'll ask out your sister once she gets back to town.
glossary: to get back to town/to ask sb out/a sister
translation: I’ll ask your sister out once she gets back to town.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Miałeś kosić trawnik. Kiedy zamierzasz to zrobić?
english: You were supposed to mow the lawn. When are you going to do it?
glossary: to mow the lawn
translation: You were suposed to….. When do you plan to do it?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Rok temu zacząłem uczyć się angielskiego.
english: I started learning English a year ago.
glossary: to start learning English/last year
translation: I started learning English a year ago.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Kilka tygodni temu dowiedziałem się, że moja żona była już raz mężatką.
english: I found out a few weeks ago that my wife had already been married once.
glossary: to be married/to find sth out/a few weeks ago/a wife
translation: A few weeks ago I found out that my wife had been married already.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Już miałam wychodzić, gdy pojawił się szef i powiedział, że potrzebuje, żebym została godzinę dłużej w pracy.
english: I was about to leave when my boss showed up and said he needed me to stay at work an hour longer.
glossary: to be about to do sth/to leave/to show up/to stay at work longer
translation: I was ready to leave when my boss showed up and told me that he needed me to stay an hour longer at work.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Dlaczego znów wydałeś tyle pieniędzy na niepotrzebne rzeczy?
english: Why did you spend so much money on unnecessary things again?
glossary: to spend money on sth/unnecessary things
translation: Why did you spend so much money on unneeded things again?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Moje życie się zmieniło po tym, jak zostałem zwolniony.
english: My life changed after I'd gotten fired.
glossary: a life/to change/to get fired
translation: My life changed once I was fired.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Czytałbym więcej książek, gdybym nie był ciągle zmęczony.
english: I would read more books if I weren't constantly tired.
glossary: to read a book/to be tired/to be constantly tired
translation: I would read more books if I wasn’t constantly tired.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Gdybym w zeszłym roku więcej trenowała, byłabym teraz w formie.
english: If I'd worked out more last year, I'd be in shape now.
glossary: to work out/to be in shape
translation: If I worked out more last year, I would be in shape now.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Czy jest tu ktoś zainteresowany tym tematem?
english: Is there anyone here interested in the subject?
glossary: to be interested in a subject
translation: There is anybody here interested in this subject?

name: Martin Vance
polish: O czym przeważnie pisze prasa?
english: What does the press mostly write about?
glossary: the press/to write about sth/mostly
translation: What does the press often write about?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Jeśli teraz nie opowiesz mi o swoim problemie, nie będę w stanie ci pomóc.
english: If you don't tell me about your problem now, I won't be able to help you.
glossary: to tell about sth/to be able to do sth/to help sb/a problem
translation: If you don’t tell me about your problem, I won’t be able to help you.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Nieznajomy opluł mnie, kiedy przechodziłem przez ulicę.
english: A stranger spat at me when I was crossing the street.
glossary: to cross the street/a stranger/to spit at sb
translation: The stranger spitted me when I went across a street.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Trudno mi było stanąć na nogi po rozwodzie.
english: It was hard for me to get back on my feet after my divorce.
glossary: to get back on your feet/a divorce
translation: 1. It was hard for me to get back on my feet after divorce.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Na co narzeka tym razem nasza córka?
english: What is our daughter complaining about this time?
glossary: to complain about sth/a daughter
translation: 2. About what is complaining our daughter this time?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Czy ty mnie sprawdzasz? Myślałem, że mi ufasz.
english: Are you testing me? I thought you trusted me.
glossary: to test sb/to think that.../to trust sb
translation: 3. Are you checking me out? I thought that you trust me.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Nie zostałbyś pozwany, gdybyś bez pozwolenia nie ujawnił poufnych informacji.
english: You wouldn't have been sued if you hadn't disclosed confidential information without permission.
glossary: to be sued/to disclose confidential information/to do sth without permission
translation: 4. You wouldn’t have been sued if you hadn’t revealed sensitive information.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Grozisz mi? Mam nadzieję, że nie.
english: Are you threatening me? I hope not.
glossary: to threaten sb/to hope
translation: 5. Are you threatening me? I hope not.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Jakie auta są tu zwykle kradzione?
english: What cars are usually stolen here?
glossary: to steal sth
translation: 6. What cars are usually stolen here?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Nie obijałbyś się cały dzień, gdybyś podlegał mnie.
english: You wouldn't coast for the entire day if you reported to me.
glossary: to coast/to report to sb
translation: 7. You wouldn’t have messed around all day long if you reported me.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Kiedy skończysz poprawiać tę deklarację podatkową, przejrzyj dokumenty, które leżą na biurku.
english: Once you're finished with correcting this tax declaration, go through the documents that are lying on the desk.

polish: Nie ma różnicy. Bierz, co chcesz.
english: There's no difference. Take what you want.
glossary: a difference/to take sth
translation: It isn't different. Take what you want.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Idziemy dziś wieczorem na drinka. Pamiętasz?
english: We're going for a drink tonight. Do you remember?
glossary: to remember/to go for a drink/tonight
translation: We’re going for a drink. Do you remember?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Moi znajomi jutro wpadają. Kup piwo.
english: My friends are dropping by tomorrow. Buy beer.
glossary: to drop by/a friend/to buy sth/to drink beer
translation: My friends are dropping by tomorow. Buy a beer.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Czy twój mąż często pracuje po godzinach?
english: Does your husband often work overtime?
glossary: to work overtime/a husband
translation: Does your husband work overtime often?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Z kim wczoraj poszedłeś na imprezę?
english: Who did you go to the party with yesterday?
glossary: to go to a party with sb
translation: Who did you go to the party with?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie spaliłam jeszcze twoich rzeczy, ale za chwilę to zrobię.
english: I haven't burned your stuff yet, but I'll do it in a moment.
glossary: to burn sth/your stuff/in a moment
translation: I didn’t burn your stuff yet but I’ll do it in a moment.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jestem pewien, że mnie nie zawiedziesz.
english: I'm sure you won't let me down.
glossary: to let sb down
translation: I’m sure you won’t let me down.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Czy nie mieliśmy wczoraj zapłacić pierwszej raty?
english: Weren't we supposed to pay the first installment yesterday?
glossary: to pay an installment
translation: Were we suposed to pay the first part?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jak zwykle dojeżdżasz do pracy?
english: How do you usually get to work?
glossary: to get to work
translation: How do you usually commute to work?

name: George West
polish: Czy nie mieliśmy wczoraj zapłacić pierwszej raty?
english: Weren't we supposed to pay the first installment yesterday?
glossary: to pay an installment
translation: Weren’t we supposed to pay the first installment yesterday?

name: George West
polish: Czy rozwiązanie sprawdziło się na dłuższą metę?
english: Did the solution work out in the long run?
glossary: to work out/in the long run
translation: Did the solution work out in the long run?

name: George West
polish: Z czego wynika Twoja pasja do języków?
english: What does your passion for languages stem from?
glossary: to have a passion for sth/to stem from sth
translation: What does your passion for languages stem from?

name: George West
polish: Mój mąż zawsze chrapie. Rozważam spanie osobno.
english: My husband is always snoring. I'm considering sleeping separately.
glossary: to snore/to consider doing sth/to sleep separately
translation: My husband is always snoring. I consider sleeping separately.

name: George West
polish: Zawsze siedzisz do późna. Nie możemy pójść razem spać?
english: You're always sitting up late. Can't we go to sleep together?
glossary: to sit up late/to go to sleep together
translation: You always sit late. Can’t we go to sleep together?

name: George West
polish: Od jak dawna wynajmujesz mieszkanie swoim znajomym? Znasz ich dobrze?
english: How long have you been renting out the apartment to your friends? Do you know them well?
glossary: to rent out an apartment to sb
translation: How long have you been renting an apartment to your friends? Do you know them well?

name: George West
polish: Nigdy nie bierzesz pod uwagę moich sugestii. Czy w ogóle zależy Ci na mojej opinii?
english: You never consider my suggestions. Do you even care about my opinion?
glossary: to consider sth/a suggestion/to care about sth
translation: You are never considering my suggestions. Do you even care about my opinion?

name: George West
polish: Na kogo zawsze głosuje Twoja matka?
english: Who does your mother always vote for?
glossary: to vote for sb
translation: Who does your mother always vote for?

name: George West
polish: Co sprawiło, że pomyślałeś, że kiedykolwiek mógłbym Cię zdradzić?
english: What made you think that I could ever cheat on you?
glossary: to make sb do sth/to cheat on sb
translation: What made you think that I could ever betray you?

name: George West
polish: Zawsze pędzisz. Może powinieneś nauczyć się jeździć.
english: You're always speeding. Maybe you should learn how to drive.
glossary: to speed/to learn how to do sth
translation: You’re always speeding. Maybe you should learn how to drive?

name: Adam Dollar
polish: Nie będziesz musiała mnie odbierać jutro ze szkoły, bo śpię u koleżanki.
english: You won't have to pick me up from school tomorrow because I'm sleeping at my friend's.
glossary: to pick sb up from school/to sleep at your friend's
translation: You won’t have to pick me up from school tomorrow becacuse I’m sleeping at my friend.

name: Adam Dollar
polish: Myślałem, że zjemy dzisiaj na mieście.
english: I thought we'd eat out today.
glossary: to eat out
translation: I thought we will eat out today.

name: Adam Dollar
polish: Mogłem wczoraj wydać mniej pieniędzy.
english: I could've spent less money yesterday.
glossary: to spend money on sth
translation: I could have spend fewer money yesterday.

name: Adam Dollar
polish: Nie ma nikogo w domu. Dlatego jest tak cicho.
english: There's no one at home. That's why it's so silent.
glossary: to be at home/to be silent
translation: There is anybody at home. It’s the reason why it’s so silent.

name: Adam Dollar
polish: Nie wiem, co powinienem odpowiedzieć.
english: I don't know what I should answer.
glossary: to answer a question
translation: I don’t know what I should answer.

name: Adam Dollar
polish: Byłem pewny, że zrobisz swoją pracę domową.
english: I was sure you'd do your homework.
glossary: to do your homework
translation: I was sure that you would do your homework.

name: Adam Dollar
polish: W zeszłym roku nie pojechałem na wakacje, ponieważ nie miałem pieniędzy.
english: I didn't go on vacation last year because I didn't have any money.
glossary: to go on vacation/to have no money
translation: Last year I didn’t go on vacation because I didn’t have money.

name: Adam Dollar
polish: Zawsze znajdę dla ciebie czas, bo jesteś dla mnie ważna.
english: I'll always find time for you because you're important to me.
glossary: to find time for sb/to be important to sb
translation: I always will find time for you because you are important to me.

name: Adam Dollar
polish: Nie mogę się skupić, gdy jest tak głośno.
english: I can't focus when it's so loud.
glossary: to focus on sth/to be loud
translation: I can’t to focus when there is so loud.

name: Adam Dollar
polish: Gramy jutro mecz. Dołączysz do nas?
english: We're playing a match tomorrow. Will you join us?
glossary: to play a match/to join sb
translation: We are playing amatch tomorrow. Will you join us?

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Co się stało? Byłam pewna, że się pobierzecie.
english: What happened? I was sure you'd get married.
glossary: to happen/to be sure/to get married
translation: 1. What happened? I was sure you would get married.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Mogłem napisać ten test z angielskiego w zeszłym tygodniu. Teraz nic nie pamiętam.
english: I could've taken the English test last week. I don't remember anything now.
glossary: to take an English test/to remember sth/last week
translation: 2. I could have passed the English test last week. I don't remember anything now.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że żona będzie w dobrym humorze.
english: I hoped my wife would be in a good mood.
glossary: to hope/a wife/to be in a good mood
translation: 3. I hoped my wife would be in a good mood.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Chciałem powiedzieć Ci prawdę, ale bałem się, że się zdenerwujesz.
english: I wanted to tell you the truth, but I was afraid you'd get mad.
glossary: to tell sb the truth/to be afraid of sth/to get mad
translation: 4. I wanted to tell you the truth, but I was afraid you would get mad.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Mogłam wydawać mniej pieniędzy na ubrania, bo muszę jeszcze zapłacić rachunki.
english: I could've spent less money on clothes because I still have to pay the bills.
glossary: to spend money on clothes/still/to pay the bills
translation: 5. I could have spent less money on clothes because I still have to pay the bills.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Nie powinieneś był tyle pić na imprezie.
english: You shouldn't have drunk so much at the party.
glossary: to drink/at the party
translation: 6. You shouldn't have drunk that much at the party.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Nie mogę zasnąć. Nie powinienem był pić kawy tak późno.
english: I can't fall asleep. I shouldn't have drunk coffee so late.
glossary: to fall asleep/to drink coffee/late
translation: 7. I can't fall asleep. I shouldn't have drank a coffee so late.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Pójdziemy na kawę, jak już będzie ładna pogoda.
english: We'll go for a coffee once the weather is good.
glossary: to go for a coffee/the weather
translation: 8. We'll go for coffee once the weather is nice.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Pójdę spać, jak już skończę czytać książkę.
english: I'll go to sleep once I finish reading the book.
glossary: to go to sleep/to finish doing sth
translation: 9. I'll go to sleep once I finish reading the book.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Następny weekend spędzam w moim rodzinnym mieście.
english: I'm spending next weekend in my hometown.
glossary: in your hometown/to spend next weekend
translation: 10. I'm spending the next weekend in my hometown.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Dlaczego znów wydałeś tyle pieniędzy na niepotrzebne rzeczy?
english: Why did you spend so much money on unnecessary things again?
glossary: to spend money on sth/unnecessary things
translation: Why did you spend so much money for unnecessary things again?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Myślę, że odwiedzę cię w weekend, bo jutro wracam późno do domu.
english: I think I'll visit you on the weekend because I'm coming back home late tomorrow.
glossary: to visit sb/to come back home late
translation: I think I’ll visit you on the weekend because I’m coming back home late tomorrow.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Możemy porozmawiać, bo nie ma tu nikogo.
english: We can talk because there's nobody here.
glossary: to talk about sth
translation: We can talk because there is no one here.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Na czym jesteś taki skupiony?
english: What are you so focused on?
glossary: to focus on sth
translation: What are you focused on?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Leżelibyśmy teraz na plaży, gdyby nasz lot nie został odwołany.
english: We'd be lying on the beach now if our flight hadn't been canceled.
glossary: to lie on the beach/to cancel a flight
translation: We’d lie on the beach now if our flight hadn’t been cancelled.

name: Anna Patton
polish: W tej grupie jest za dużo ludzi. Znajdę inną.
english: There are too many people in the group. I have to find a different one.
glossary: in the group/to find sth/different
translation: There are too many people in the group. I’ll find another.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Nie wygramy sprawy, jeśli nie będziesz zeznawał.
english: We won't win the case if you don't testify.
glossary: to win a case/to testify
translation: We won’t win the case if you don’t testify.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Jestem dobry w robieniu bałaganu.
english: I'm good at making a mess.
glossary: to make a mess/to be good at sth
translation: I’m good at making mess.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Ostatnim razem, kiedy rozmawiałyśmy, mówiłaś, że potrzebujesz mojej porady.
english: The last time we talked, you said you needed my advice.
glossary: to need sb's advice/The last time we talked.../to say sth
translation: The last time we talked, you told that you needed my advice.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Po tym, jak zrobiłeś zupę, wszyscy rzygaliśmy.
english: After you'd made the soup, we all threw up.
glossary: to make soup/to throw up
translation: After you made the soup, we all ….

name: Anna Patton
polish: Dlaczego dzwoniłeś wczoraj do mnie tyle razy?
english: Why did you call me so many times yesterday?
glossary: to call sb/many times
translation: Why did you call me yesterday many times?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Jakie są opcje?
english: What options are there?
glossary: an option
translation: What are the options?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Ryzykujesz swoją pracę, kłócąc się ze swoim szefem.
english: You're risking your job arguing with your boss.
glossary: to risk your job/to argue with sb/a boss
translation: You risk your job arguing with your boss.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Dlaczego jest tylu ludzi, którzy żyją w ubóstwie?
english: Why are there so many people who live in poverty?
glossary: to live in poverty
translation: Why there are so many people who live in poverty?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Bałem się, że przegramy sprawę przez mój błąd.
english: I was afraid we'd lose the case because of my mistake.
glossary: to be afraid of sth/to lose a case/because of you/a mistake
translation: I was afraid we would lose the case because of my mistake.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Jeszcze nie zabrałem się do pracy.
english: I haven't gotten down to work yet.
glossary: to get down to work
translation: I haven’t gotten down to work yet.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Przed czym próbujesz mnie uchronić?
english: What are you trying to save me from?
glossary: to save sb from sth
translation: What are you trying to protect me from?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Nie mogłem wczoraj spać, bo wypiłem filiżankę kawy przed pójściem do łóżka.
english: I couldn't sleep yesterday because I'd drunk a cup of coffee before going to bed.
glossary: to sleep/to go to bed/to drink a cup of coffee
translation: I couldn’t sleep yesterday because I drank a cup of coffee before going to bed.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Czy jest osoba w twoim życiu, na której możesz polegać?
english: Is there a person in your life you can rely on?
glossary: to rely on sb
translation: Are there a person in your life who do you can rely on?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Mogłem zostać w domu, bo nie ma tu nic do roboty.
english: I could've stayed at home because there's nothing to do here.
glossary: to stay at home/to have nothing to do
translation: I could’ve stayed at home because there is nothing to do.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Od miesiąca szukam pracy, ale nie ma interesujących ofert.
english: I've been looking for a job for a month, but there are no interesting offers.
glossary: to look for a job/an offer
translation: I’ve looking for a job for the month, but there are no interesting offers.

name: Anna Patton
polish: O czym rozmawialiście, kiedy byłam w łazience?
english: What did you talk about when I was in the bathroom?
glossary: to talk about sth/in the bathroom
translation: What were you talking about when I was in the bathroom.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Nie mogę zasnąć. Nie powinienem był pić kawy tak późno.
english: I can't fall asleep. I shouldn't have drunk coffee so late.
glossary: to fall asleep/to drink coffee/late
translation: I can’t fall asleep. I should’ve drank coffee late.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Czy jest coś, co mogę polepszyć, żeby być bardziej wydajnym, gdy się uczę?
english: Is there anything I can improve to be more efficient while studying?
glossary: to improve sth/to be efficient/to study sth
translation: Is there anything I can improve to be more efficient while I’m learning?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Jeśli teraz nie opowiesz mi o swoim problemie, nie będę w stanie ci pomóc.
english: If you don't tell me about your problem now, I won't be able to help you.
glossary: to tell about sth/to be able to do sth/to help sb/a problem
translation: If you don’t tell my about your problem, I won’t be able to help you.

name: Anna Patton
polish: W czym jesteś dobry?
english: What are you good at?
glossary: to be good at sth
translation: What are you good at?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Nie ma nikogo w domu. Dlatego jest tak cicho.
english: There's no one at home. That's why it's so silent.
glossary: to be at home/to be silent
translation: There are no one at home. That’s why is so quiet.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Może pojadę taksówką. Zaoszczędzę czas.
english: Maybe I'll take a cab. I'll save time.
glossary: to take a cab/to save money
translation: Maybe I’ll go by taxi. I’ll save time.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Byłem pewien, że przytyję, ale za mało jadłem.
english: I was sure I'd gain weight, but I ate too little.
glossary: to be sure/to gain weight/to eat too little
translation: I was sure I would gain weight, but I ate too little.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Będę mieć więcej energii, jak już napiję się kawy.
english: I'll have more energy once I have some coffee.
glossary: to have energy/to have some coffee
translation: I’ll have more energy once I drink coffee.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Może kolega nie skopałby ci tyłka, gdybyś nie rozsiewał plotek.
english: Maybe your friend wouldn't have kicked your ass if you hadn't spread gossip.
glossary: to kick sb's ass/to spread gossip
translation: My friend would’t have kicked your ass, if you hadn’t spread gossips.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Stresuję się, bo w przyszłym tygodniu jadę za granicę, a nie mówię dobrze po angielsku.
english: I'm stressed out because I'm going abroad next week and I don't speak English well.
glossary: to speak English well/to go abroad/next week
translation: I stress out because I’m moving abroad next week and I don’t speak English well.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Gdybym tylko mógł otworzyć teraz prezenty.
english: I wish I could unwrap the gifts now.
glossary: I wish that...; If only.../to unwrap a gift
translation: I wish that I open gifts now.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Wynajmowałem mieszkanie z kolegą, zanim kupiłem własny dom.
english: I'd been renting an apartment with a friend before I bought my own house.
glossary: to rent an apartment/your own house/to buy a house
translation: I rented an apartment with my friend before I bought my own house.

name: Anna Patton
polish: O czym chciałbyś porozmawiać?
english: What would you like to talk about?
glossary: to talk about sth
translation: What do you want to talk about?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Nasza rozmowa była skoncentrowana na wyjaśnieniu sytuacji.
english: Our conversation was focused on explaining the situation.
glossary: to be focused on sth/a conversation/to explain the situation
translation: Our conversation was focused on explaining the situation.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Nie zdołalibyśmy ugasić pożaru, gdybyś od razu nie zadzwonił po służby ratunkowe.
english: We wouldn't have managed to put out the fire if you hadn't immediately called the emergency services.
glossary: to manage to do sth/to put out the fire/to call the emergency services/to immediately do sth
translation: We wouldn’t have been able to estinquish the fire if you hadn’t called the emergency services right away.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Nie miałem tego na myśli. Nie powinnaś była brać tego osobiście.
english: I didn't mean it. You shouldn't have taken it personally.
glossary: to mean sth/to take sth personally
translation: I didn’t have it in my mind. You shouldn’t take it personally.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Jeśli nasza firma otworzy nową filię, wszyscy zrobimy się zajęci.
english: If our company opens a new branch, we'll all get busy.
glossary: to open a new branch/a branch/to get busy
translation: If our company open the new branch, we’ll all get busy.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Boisz się przegrać sprawę?
english: Are you afraid of losing the case?
glossary: to be afraid of sth/to lose a case
translation: Are you afraid of losing the case?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Nigdy nie zamykałem drzwi na klucz, dopóki ktoś nie włamał się do mojego domu.
english: I'd never locked the door until someone broke into my house.
glossary: to break into a house/to lock the door
translation: I’ve never locked the door untill somebody robbed in me house.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Jest możliwość, że zostanę zwolniony.
english: There's a possibility that I'll be fired.
glossary: a possibility/to fire sb
translation: There’s a possibility I would be fired.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Myślę, że będziemy częściej wychodzić razem na miasto, bo przyszłym miesiącu przeprowadzam się do Warszawy.
english: I think we'll hang out together more often because I'm moving to Warsaw next month.
glossary: to go out; to hang out/to move to Warsaw/next month
translation: I think we’d go out more often together because I’m moving to Warsaw next month.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Zdziwiłem się, kiedy żona mi powiedziała, że chce się wyprowadzić.
english: I got surprised when my wife told me she wanted to move out.
glossary: to get surprised/to move out/a wife
translation: I was surprised when my wife told me she wanted to move out.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Jestem rozczarowana. Byłam pewna, że nie złamiesz obietnicy.
english: I'm disappointed. I was sure you wouldn't break the promise.
glossary: to be disappointed with sth/to be sure/to break a promise
translation: I’m dissapointed. I was sure you wouldn’t break the promiss.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Gdybyś była bardziej nieustępliwa, byłabyś w stanie udowodnić swoje racje.
english: If you were more persistent, you'd be able to prove your point.
glossary: to be persistent/to prove your point/to prove sth
translation: If you were more outstanding you’d be able to prove your point.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Pojadę na wakacje, jak już oszczędzę pieniądze.
english: I'll go on vacation once I save some money.
glossary: to go on vacation/to save some money
translation: I’ll go on vacation once I save money.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Ile osób jest teraz w kawiarni?
english: How many people are there at the coffee shop now?
glossary: to be at the coffee shop/now
translation: How many people are there in the coffee shop now?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Myśłałem, że zawieziesz mnie do domu. Nie chcę brać taksówki.
english: I thought you'd take me home. I don't want to take a cab.
glossary: to think/to take sb home/to take a cab
translation: I thought you would give me a ride home. I don’t want to take a cub.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Kiedy dotarłem do domu, żona już wyszła.
english: When I got home, my wife had already left.
glossary: to leave/to get home/a wife
translation: When I got home, my wife had already left.

name: Maddie Ivy
polish: Kogo chcesz, żebym zaprosił na imprezę?
english: Who do you want me to invite to the party?
glossary: to invite sb to a party
translation: 1. Who do you want me to invite to the party?

name: Maddie Ivy
polish: Wpadaj. Mój mąż gotuje w ten piątek.
english: Drop by. My husband's cooking this Friday.
glossary: to cook/this Friday
translation: 2. Drop by. My husband is cooking this Friday.

name: Maddie Ivy
polish: Nie ma różnicy. Bierz, co chcesz.
english: There's no difference. Take what you want.
glossary: a difference/to take sth
translation: 3. There is no difference. Take what you want.

name: Maddie Ivy
polish: Mogłeś mi od razu powiedzieć prawdę. Nie zdenerwowałbym się.
english: You could've told me the truth at the beginning. I wouldn't have gotten mad.
glossary: to tell sb the truth/at the beginning/to get mad
translation: 4. You could have told me the truth immediately. I wouldn’t be nervous.

name: Maddie Ivy
polish: Co mi chciałaś powiedzieć na imprezie?
english: What did you want to tell me at the party?
glossary: to tell sb sth/at the party
translation: 5. What were you trying to tell me at the party?

name: Maddie Ivy
polish: W artykule jest błąd. Popraw go.
english: There's a mistake in the article. Correct it.
glossary: in the article/to correct a mistake

name: Margaret Ford

glossary: to find out about sth/to be eligible for sth/to be eligible for insurance

polish: Obiecuję, że w przyszłym tygodniu odbiorę dzieci ze szkoły o czasie.

polish: Jestem naprawdę zajęty, więc nie sądzę, że uda mi się spotkać z tobą po pracy.

translation: 2. I'm really busy. I don't  think so I'll meet you at work.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Jesteś zazdrosny, bo ja jadę na ten wyjazd, a ty nie możesz.
english: You're jealous because I'm going on the trip and you can't.
glossary: to be jealous of sb/to go on a trip
translation: 3. You are jealous beause I'm going on a trip and you can't.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Spotykam się jutro z nowym klientem, więc muszę się przygotować.
english: I'm meeting a new client tomorrow, so I have to get prepared.
glossary: to meet sb/a client/to get prepared
translation: 4. I'm meeting new client tomorrow, so I have to prepare.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Wczoraj przypadkowo skasowałam z komputera wszystkie pliki.
english: I accidentally deleted all my files from the computer yesterday.
glossary: to do sth accidentally/to delete a file from the computer
translation: 5. Accidentally, I deleted fills from the computer yesterday.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Poczułam się rozczarowana, kiedy nowy menedżer powiedział mi, że jest żonaty.
english: I felt disappointed when the new manager told me he was married.
glossary: to feel disappointed/a manager/to be married
translation: 6. I felt disappointed when new manager told me that he is marrige.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Myślę, że powinieneś być bardziej cierpliwy wobec swoich dzieci.
english: I think you should be more patient with your children.
glossary: to be patient with sb
translation: 7. I thnk you'll be more patient with your children.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Znów boli mnie głowa. Muszę iść do lekarza.
english: I have a headache again. I have to go to the doctor.
glossary: to have a headache/to go to the doctor
translation: 8. I have a headache again. I have to go to the doctor.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Nie musisz iść na randkę z tym gościem, jeśli nie chcesz.
english: You don't have to go on a date with the guy if you don't want to.
glossary: to go on a date with sb
translation: 9. You don't have to go on date with this guy if you don't want to.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Nie powinieneś jeść słodyczy. Są niezdrowe.
english: You shouldn't eat candy. It's unhealthy.
glossary: to eat candy/to be unhealthy
translation: 10. You should't eat sweets. It's unhealthy.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Dlaczego do mnie zagadujesz?
english: Why are you chatting me up?
glossary: to chat sb up
translation: Why are you chatting me up?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Czy naprawdę chcesz, żeby ten gatunek wyginął?
english: Do you really want the species to die out?
glossary: to die out/a species
translation: Do you really want this species to die out?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Nie kupimy mieszkania, dopóki nie weźmiemy kredytu.
english: We won't buy an apartment until we get a mortgage.
glossary: to get a mortgage/to buy an apartment
translation: We won’t buy an apartment until we take out a mortgage.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Na ostatnim spotkaniu szef mi powiedział, że mój projekt się wyróżnia.
english: My boss told me at the last meeting that my project stood out.
glossary: to stand out/a project/at the meeting
translation: In the last meeting, my boss told me that my project was standing out.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Mogłem zacząć grać na pianinie jako dziecko. Byłbym teraz bardziej wprawiony.
english: I could've taken up the piano as a kid. I'd be more skillful now.
glossary: to be skillful/to take up the piano
translation: I could have taken up the piano as a child. I would be more skilfull now.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Czy w końcu się odezwałeś, gdy przezwyciężyłeś strach?
english: Did you finally speak up when you got over your fear?
glossary: to get over your fear/to speak up
translation: Did you finally speak up when you got over your fear?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Dlaczego nie załozyłeś jeszcze kurtki?
english: Why haven't you put on a jacket yet?
glossary: to put on a jacket
translation: Why haven't you put your jacket on yet?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Szef się mnie wczoraj zapytał, dlaczego nie zaproponowałem żadnego pomysłu na ostatnim spotkaniu.
english: My boss asked me yesterday why I hadn't put forward any idea at the last meeting.
glossary: to put forward an idea/at the meeting
translation: My boss asked me yesterday why I didn't put forward any idea at the last meeting.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Jakie obowiązki musisz przekazać?
english: What responsibilities do you have to hand over?
glossary: to hand over responsibilities
translation: What responsibilities do you have to hand out?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Powiedziałem ci, że nie będę cię więcej znosił.
english: I told you I wouldn't put up with you anymore.
glossary: to put up with sb
translation: I told you I wouldn't put up with you anymore.

name: Maddie Ivy
polish: Czy są w tym mieście jakieś miejsca, które powinienem odwiedzić?
english: Are there any places in the city I should visit?
glossary: in the city; in town/to visit a place
translation: 1. Are there any places in the city which I should visit?

name: Maddie Ivy
polish: Gdzie jedziesz w tym roku na wakacje?
english: Where are you going on vacation this year?
glossary: to go on vacation/this year
translation: 2. Where are you going on vacation this year?

name: Maddie Ivy
polish: Mamy czas. Nie ma potrzeby się spieszyć.
english: We have time. There's no need to hurry up.
glossary: to have time/a need/to hurry up
translation: 3. We have time. There is no need to hurry up.

name: Maddie Ivy
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że wrócę do domu dzisiaj, ale uciekł mi pociąg.
english: I hoped I'd come back home today, but I missed the train.
glossary: to hope/to come back home/today/to miss the train
translation: 4. I hoped that I’ll come back home today, but I missed the train.

name: Maddie Ivy
polish: Dlaczego tak zareagowałaś? Możesz mi to wytłumaczyć?
english: Why did you react like that? Can you explain it to me?
glossary: to react to sth/like that/to explain sth to sb
translation: 5. Why have you reacted like that? Can you explain me that?

name: Maddie Ivy
polish: Mogłeś wcześniej zadzwonić. Powiedziałabym Ci, że nie ma mnie w domu.
english: You could've called before. I would've told you I wasn't at home.
glossary: to be at home/to call sb
translation: 6. You could have called earlier. I would have told you that I wasn’t at home.

name: Maddie Ivy
polish: Z kim wczoraj rozmawiałeś przez telefon?
english: Who did you talk to on the phone yesterday?
glossary: to talk to sb over the phone
translation: 7. Who did you talk to over the phone yesterday?

name: Maddie Ivy
polish: Idziemy dziś wieczorem na drinka. Pamiętasz?
english: We're going for a drink tonight. Do you remember?
glossary: to remember/to go for a drink/tonight
translation: 8. We are going out for a drink tonight. Are you remembring?

name: Maddie Ivy
polish: Obawiam się, że nie dostanę tej pracy.
english: I'm afraid I won't get the job.
glossary: to be afraid of sth/to get a job
translation: 9. I’m afraid that I won’t get the job.

name: Maddie Ivy
polish: Z kim chcesz spędzić resztę swojego życia?
english: Who do you want to spend the rest of your life with?
glossary: to spend time with sb/the rest of your life
translation: 10. Who do you want to spend the rest of your life with?

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Dlaczego dzwoniłeś wczoraj do mnie tyle razy?
english: Why did you call me so many times yesterday?
glossary: to call sb/many times
translation: Why you called me so many times yesterday?

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Z kim wczoraj poszedłeś na imprezę?
english: Who did you go to the party with yesterday?
glossary: to go to a party with sb
translation: Who was with you on yesterday party?

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Nie powinnaś była składać obietnicy, jeśli wiedziałaś, że jej nie dotrzymasz.
english: You shouldn't have made the promise if you knew you wouldn't keep it.
glossary: to make a promise/to keep a promise
translation: You should’t promise if you know that you can’t deliver it.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Jestem rozczarowana. Byłam pewna, że nie złamiesz obietnicy.
english: I'm disappointed. I was sure you wouldn't break the promise.
glossary: to be disappointed with sth/to be sure/to break a promise
translation: I’m disappointed. I was certain that you will not break a promise.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Ufam ci, bo od dawna razem pracujemy.
english: I trust you because we've been working together for a long time.
glossary: to trust sb/for a long time
translation: I trust you, because we work together for a long time.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Możemy porozmawiać, bo nie ma tu nikogo.
english: We can talk because there's nobody here.
glossary: to talk about sth
translation: We can speak, becouse we are alone here.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Przeprowadzam się w przyszłym miesiącu na wieś. Nie mogę się doczekać.
english: I'm moving to the countryside next month. I can't wait.
glossary: can't wait/to move to the countryside
translation: I will move to the village next month. I can’t wait.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Jest kilka książek, które chciałbym przeczytać do końca roku.
english: There are a few books I'd like to read by the end of the year.
glossary: a few/to read a book/by the end of the year
translation: There are a few books, which I want to read until the end of the year.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Mam nadzieję, że zdążę na pociąg. To ostatni.
english: I hope I'll catch the train. It's the last one.
glossary: to catch the train/to catch the last train
translation: I hope I will catch the train. It the last one.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Od miesiąca szukam pracy, ale nie ma interesujących ofert.
english: I've been looking for a job for a month, but there are no interesting offers.
glossary: to look for a job/an offer
translation: I’m looking for new job since month, but there are no interesting offers

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Moja mama przeszła w zeszłym roku na emeryturę.
english: My mom retired last year.
glossary: to retire/last year
translation: 1. My mother retired last year.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Mógłbyś teraz pracować, gdybyś naładował wcześniej laptopa.
english: You would be able to work now if you had charged your laptop earlier.
glossary: to be able to do sth/to charge a laptop
translation: 2. You would've worked now if you had charged your laptop before.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Do jakiej restauracji chcielibyście dzisiaj iść?
english: What restaurant would you like to go to today?
glossary: to go to a restaurant
translation: 3. What restaurant would you want to go tonight?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Miałem wczoraj kaca.
english: I had a hangover yesterday.
glossary: to have a hangover
translation: 4. I had a hangover yesterday.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Dowiedziałem się wczoraj, że mój szef pracował wcześniej w agencji nieruchomości.
english: I found out yesterday that my boss had worked at a real estate agency before.
glossary: a real estate agency/to find out that.../a boss
translation: 5. I found out yesterday my boss had worked at real estate agency before.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Nie zostałbyś pozwany, gdybyś bez pozwolenia nie ujawnił poufnych informacji.
english: You wouldn't have been sued if you hadn't disclosed confidential information without permission.
glossary: to be sued/to disclose confidential information/to do sth without permission
translation: 6. You wouldn't have beed sued if you hadn't revealed confidential data without permission.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Gdzie byłaś? Byłem pewien, że pojawisz się dzisiaj na spotkaniu.
english: Where were you? I was sure you'd show up at the meeting today.
glossary: to be sure/to show up at the meeting/today
translation: 7. Where were you? I was sure you would show up at the meeting today.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Jest wiele kursów, na które możesz się zapisać.
english: There are many courses you can sign up for.
glossary: to sign up for a course
translation: 8. There are many courses which you can sign up.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Jutro jem obiad z moim szefem.
english: I'm having lunch with my boss tomorrow.
glossary: to have lunch with sb/a boss
translation: 9. My boss and I have lunch tomorrow.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Dlaczego dzwoniłeś wczoraj do mnie tyle razy?
english: Why did you call me so many times yesterday?
glossary: to call sb/many times
translation: 10. Why did you call me so many times yesterday?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Na co zwykle narzeka zarząd?
english: What does the board usually complain about?
glossary: to complain about sth
translation: 1. What do the management board usually complain about?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Jak zwykle dojeżdżasz do pracy?
english: How do you usually get to work?
glossary: to get to work
translation: 2. How do you usually go to work?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Jaką masz dla mnie ofertę?
english: What offer do you have for me?
glossary: to have an offer for sb
translation: 3. What offer do you have for me?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Od miesiąca szukam nowej pracy.
english: I've been looking for a new job for a month.
glossary: to look for a new job
translation: 4. I've been looking for a new job for a month now.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: O czym rozmawialiście, kiedy byłam w łazience?
english: What did you talk about when I was in the bathroom?
glossary: to talk about sth/in the bathroom
translation: 5. What did you talk about when I was in the bathroom?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Kiedy się dowiedziałaś, że nie będziesz się kwalifikować do ubezpieczenia?
english: When did you find out that you wouldn't be eligible for insurance?
glossary: to find out about sth/to be eligible for sth/to be eligible for insurance
translation: 6. When did you find out you wouldn't be eligible for insurance?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Dam Ci znać, jak już skończę pracę.
english: I'll let you know once I finish work.
glossary: to let sb know/to finish work
translation: 7. I'll let you know once I finish work.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Zamknij się. Cały dzień gadasz.
english: Shut up. You've been talking all day.
glossary: all day/to talk/to shut up
translation: 8. Shut up! You're talking all day.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Gdybyś nie był zapominalski, cały zespół nie musiałby teraz pracować.
english: If you weren't forgetful, the whole team wouldn't have to work now.
glossary: to be forgetful/the whole team/to work
translation: 9. If you weren't forgetful the whole team wouldn't work right now.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Gramy jutro mecz. Dołączysz do nas?
english: We're playing a match tomorrow. Will you join us?
glossary: to play a match/to join sb
translation: 10. We're playing a match tomorrow. Will you join us?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Jak długo umniejszasz moje osiągnięcia? Nie będę już tego znosić.
english: How long have you been diminishing my accomplishments? I won't put up with it anymore.
glossary: to diminish sth/to put up with sth
translation: 1. How long do you play down the significance of my achievements? I won't stand it anymore.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Myślę, że założę dzisiaj sukienkę.
english: I think I'll put on a dress today.
glossary: to put on a dress
translation: 2. I think I'll put on a dress today.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Nie byłbyś spłukany, gdyby koledzy nie namówili cię na pójście do klubu.
english: You wouldn't be broke now if your friends hadn't talked you into going to a club.
glossary: to be broke/to talk sb into sth
translation: 3. You wouldn't have been broke if your firends hadn't talked you into going to the club.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Jak rzeczniczka skomentowała incydent?
english: How did the spokeswoman comment on the incident?
glossary: a spokeswoman/to comment on sth/an incident
translation: 4. How did  the spokeperson comment on the incident?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Do kogo należy ta komórka?
english: Who does the cell belong to?
glossary: to belong to sb/a cell phone
translation: 5. Whose is this cell phone?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Jestem pewna, że będziesz żałować tej decyzji.
english: I'm sure you'll regret the decision.
glossary: to regret sth/a decision
translation: 6. I'm sure you'll regret your decission.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Musimy działać. Masz jakiś pomysł?
english: We have to act. Do you have any idea?
glossary: to act/to have an idea
translation: 7. We must act. Do you have any idea?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Jak długo już nalegasz? Nie rozumiesz, że Ci tego nie dam?
english: How long have you been insisting yet? Don't you understand I won't give it?
glossary: to insist
translation: 8. How long have you insisted yet? Do'nt you understand I won't give it to you?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Jechałeś bardzo szybko. Bałem się, że będziemy mieli wypadek.
english: You drove very fast. I was afraid we'd have an accident.
glossary: to drive/to be afraid/to have an accident
translation: 9. You were speeding. I was afraid we'd have an accident.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Obiecuję, że następnym razem będę się lepiej zachowywał.
english: I promise I'll behave better next time.
glossary: to behave/next time/to promise sb sth; to promise sth to sb
translation: 10. I promise I'll behave better next time.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Detektyw pytał się mnie podczas przesłuchania, czy coś widziałem.
english: The detective asked me during questioning if I'd seen anything.
glossary: a detective/during questioning/to see sth
translation: During the ……. the detective asked me if I had seen anything.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Znudziło mi się jedzenie codziennie pizzy na obiad.
english: I'm bored with eating a pizza for lunch every day.
glossary: to be bored with sth/to eat a pizza/for lunch/every day
translation: I got bored eating pizza for lunch every day.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Nie zdołalibyśmy ugasić pożaru, gdybyś od razu nie zadzwonił po służby ratunkowe.
english: We wouldn't have managed to put out the fire if you hadn't immediately called the emergency services.
glossary: to manage to do sth/to put out the fire/to call the emergency services/to immediately do sth
translation: We wouldn’t put out the fire if you hadn’t called emergency services.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Gdybyś zawsze dotrzymywał obietnic, dzieci by ci ufały.
english: If you always kept your promises, the kids would trust you.
glossary: to keep your promises/to trust sb
translation: If you always kept promisses the children would trust you.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Gdybym mówił płynnie po angielsku, wyprowadziłbym się za granicę.
english: If I spoke English fluently, I'd move abroad.
glossary: to speak English fluently/to move abroad
translation: If I spoke English fluently I would move out abroad

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: O czym chciałbyś porozmawiać?
english: What would you like to talk about?
glossary: to talk about sth
translation: What would you like to talk about?

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Zgodziłbyś się ze mną, gdybyś był świadomy pewnym faktów.
english: You'd agree with me if you were aware of certain facts.
glossary: to agree with sb/to be aware of sth/certain facts
translation: You would agree with me if you knew some facts.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Nie musiałbym teraz odsiadywać, gdyby mój adwokat odwołał się od wyroku.
english: I wouldn't have to do time now if my attorney had appealed the court's decision.
glossary: to do time; to serve a sentence/an attorney/to appeal the court's decision
translation: I wouldn’t have served a sentence if my lawer had appealed the sentence.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Mój klient zażądał, żeby sprawa została oddalona.
english: My client demanded that the case be dismissed.
glossary: to demand that.../to dismiss a case
translation: My client required to dismiss the case.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Nie doprowadzałbyś zawsze ciotki do szaleństwa, gdybyś był cicho.
english: You wouldn't always drive your aunt crazy if you were quiet.
glossary: to drive sb crazy/an aunt/to be quiet
translation: You wouldn't always drive your aunt crazy if you were silent.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Zapytałem się wczoraj mojego adwokata, czy złożył już apelację od wyroku sądu.
english: I asked my attorney yesterday if he'd appealed the court's decision yet.
glossary: an attorney/to appeal the court's decision
translation: I asked my attorney yesterday if he had appealed the court’s decision.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Nie zapłaciłam rachunków w zeszłym miesiącu, bo nie miałam żadnych pieniędzy.
english: I didn't pay the bills last month because I didn't have any money.
glossary: to pay the bills
translation: I didn’t paid the bills last month because I didn’t have any money.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Z kim wczoraj poszedłeś na imprezę?
english: Who did you go to the party with yesterday?
glossary: to go to a party with sb
translation: Who did you go to the party yesterday?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Gdzie spałeś zeszłej nocy?
english: Where did you sleep last night?
glossary: last night/to sleep
translation: Where did you sleep last night?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Nie będziesz musiała mnie odbierać jutro ze szkoły, bo śpię u koleżanki.
english: You won't have to pick me up from school tomorrow because I'm sleeping at my friend's.
glossary: to pick sb up from school/to sleep at your friend's
translation: You won’t have to pick me up from school becuase I’m sleeping at my friends.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Wujek by nie utonął, gdyby nagle nie dostał skurczu.
english: My uncle wouldn't have drowned if he hadn't suddenly gotten a cramp.
glossary: to get a cramp/to drown/suddenly/an uncle
translation: The uncle wouldn’t have .. if he hadn’t gotten a … suddenly.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Nie miałbyś nieświeżego oddechu, gdybyś palił mniej.
english: You wouldn't have bad breath if you smoked less.
glossary: to have bad breath/to smoke
translation: You woldn’t have bad breath if you had smoke less.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Właściciel firmy zapytał się mnie w zeszłym tygodniu, czy odsiadywałem kiedyś wyrok.
english: The company's owner asked me last week if I'd ever done time.
glossary: the company's owner/to do time; to serve a sentence
translation: The company’s landlord asked me last week if I had ever served a sentence.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Obawiam się, że nie dostanę tej pracy.
english: I'm afraid I won't get the job.
glossary: to be afraid of sth/to get a job
translation: I’m afraid I won’t get the job.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Za co mnie aresztujecie?
english: What are you arresting me for?
glossary: to arrest sb for sth
translation: For what are you arresting me?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Nigdy nie płaciłem żadnych rachunków, dopóki nie wyprowadziłem się z domu rodziców.
english: I'd never paid any bills before I moved out of my parents' house.
glossary: to pay your bills/to move out of your parents' house
translation: I had never paid any bills until I moved out from my parent’s house.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Zepsułam telefon mojej mamy. Nie wiem, co powinnam teraz zrobić.
english: I broke my mom's cell phone. I don't know what I should do now.
glossary: to break a cell phone
translation: I broke my mother’s phone. I don’t know what I should do now.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Dlaczego winisz mnie za utratę pracy?
english: Why are you blaming me for losing your job?
glossary: to lose your job
translation: Why are you blaming me for loosing your job?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Myślałem, że będziesz tęsknić za domem.
english: I thought you'd feel homesick.
glossary: to feel homesick
translation: I thought you would miss your home.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Kiedy zaczynasz nową pracę?
english: When are you starting the new job?
glossary: to start a new job
translation: When do you start a new job?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Kogo zaprosiłaś na ostatnią imprezę?
english: Who did you invite to the last party?
glossary: to invite sb to a party
translation: Who did you invite for the last party?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Tak szybko jechałem na rowerze, że nie zorientowałem się, że przejechałem znak stop.
english: I was riding a bike so fast that I didn't realize I had run a stop sign.
glossary: to ride a bike/to realize that.../to run a stop sign
translation: I was driving so fast on my bike that I didn’t mention I’d run the stop sign.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Nie dostałbyś mandatu, gdybyś nie przekroczył dozwolonej prędkości.
english: You wouldn't have gotten a ticket if you hadn't been speeding.
glossary: to get a ticket/to be speeding
translation: You wouldn’t have gotten a fine if you hadn’t limited the allowed speed limit.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Słyszałam wczoraj, że wygrałeś zawody.
english: I heard yesterday that you'd won a competition.
glossary: to win a competition
translation: I heard yesterday you had won the competition.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Nieznajomy opluł mnie, kiedy przechodziłem przez ulicę.
english: A stranger spat at me when I was crossing the street.
glossary: to cross the street/a stranger/to spit at sb
translation: The stranger …. when I crossed against the street.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Ile produktów jest na magazynie?
english: How many products are there in stock?
glossary: a product/in stock
translation: How many products are in the warehouse?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Jest kilka książek, które chciałbym przeczytać do końca roku.
english: There are a few books I'd like to read by the end of the year.
glossary: a few/to read a book/by the end of the year
translation: There are few books I would like to read until the end of the year.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Powiedz mi, w czym się specjalizujesz.
english: Tell me what you specialize in.
glossary: to specialize in sth
translation: Tell me what are you specializing in.

name: Anna Patton
polish: O czym była twoje ostatnia książka?
english: What was your last book about?
glossary: a book about sth
translation: What your last book was about?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Ile pokoi jest w tym mieszkaniu?
english: How many rooms are there in the apartment?
glossary: in the apartment/a room
translation: How many rooms are in the apartment?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Policja by nas nie aresztowała, gdybyś nie zachowywał się podejrzanie.
english: The police wouldn't have arrested us if you hadn't behaved suspiciously.
glossary: to behave suspiciously/to arrest sb/the police
translation: The police wouldn’t have arrested us if you had behaved suspiciously.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Będziesz zdrowszy, jeśli rzucisz palenie.
english: You'll be healthier if you quit smoking.
glossary: to quit smoking/to be healthy
translation: You’ll be healthy if you throw away smoking.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Zadzwonię do ciebie, jak już będę w domu.
english: I'll call you once I'm at home.
glossary: to call sb/to be at home
translation: I’ll call you once I’m at home.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Uważasz, że obywatele mieliby coś przeciwko, gdyby premier ustąpił ze stanowiska?
english: Do you think citizens would mind if the prime minister stepped down?
glossary: a citizen/to mind/the prime minister/to step down
translation: Do you think the citizens would mind if the premier stepped down?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Jakie są kierunki na tej uczelni?
english: What programs are there at the university?
glossary: a program/at the university
translation: What are the programms at the University?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Nad czym pracujesz?
english: What are you working on?
glossary: to work on sth
translation: What are you working on?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Oblałeś ostatni test, bo się w ogóle na niego nie uczyłeś.
english: You failed the last test because you hadn't studied for it at all.
glossary: to study for a test/to fail a test/at all
translation: You failed the last exam because you didn’t study on it at all.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Co chcesz dostać na urodziny?
english: What do you want to get for your birthday?
glossary: to get sth for your birthday
translation: What do you want to get for your birthday?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Obiecałaś, że zrobisz mi dzisiaj włosy.
english: You promised you'd do my hair today.
glossary: to promise sb sth; to promise to sb/to do your hair/today
translation: You promissed you would do my hair today.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Obiecuję, że odwiedzę was w przyszłym miesiącu.
english: I promise I'll visit you next month.
glossary: to visit sb/next month/to promise
translation: I promiss I will visit you next month.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Czy są jacyś inny ochotnicy?
english: Are there any other volunteers?
glossary: a volunteer
translation: Are there any  volunteers?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Ojciec by cię nie opieprzył, gdybyś nie podsłuchiwał jego rozmów.
english: Your father wouldn't have told you off if you hadn't eavesdropped on his conversations.
glossary: to tell sb off/to eavesdrop on a conversation; to listen in on a conversation
translation: You dad wouldn’t …  you if you hadn’t listen to his conversation.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Byłbyś w formie, gdybyś zaczął uprawiać jakiś sport.
english: You'd be fit if you took up a sport.
glossary: to be fit; to be in shape/to take up a sport
translation: You would be in shape if you started doing any sport.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Mogłam wydawać mniej pieniędzy na ubrania, bo muszę jeszcze zapłacić rachunki.
english: I could've spent less money on clothes because I still have to pay the bills.
glossary: to spend money on clothes/still/to pay the bills
translation: I could’ve spent less money on clothes because I have to pay my bills yet.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że się zaprzyjaźnimy.
english: I hoped we'd make friends.
glossary: to hope/to make friends
translation: I hoped we would make friends.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Wpadaj. Mój mąż gotuje w ten piątek.
english: Drop by. My husband's cooking this Friday.
glossary: to cook/this Friday
translation: Let’s drop. My husband is cooking this Friday.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Czym się interesujesz?
english: What are you interested in?
glossary: to be interested in sth
translation: What are you interested in?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Próbuję uciec od picia kawy.
english: I'm trying to escape from drinking coffee.
glossary: to drink coffee/to escape from sth
translation: I try to escape from drinking coffee.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Nie powinienem był Ci opowiadać tej historii, bo jest zbyt prywatna.
english: I shouldn't have told you the story because it's too private.
glossary: to tell sb a story/to be private
translation: I should’ve told you the story because it was too private.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Co kończyłeś? Ekonomię czy finanse?
english: What did you graduate in? Economics or Finance?
glossary: to graduate in Finance/to graduate in Economics/to graduate in sth
translation: What did you graduate in? Economy or finanse?

name: Anna Patton
polish: O kim rozmawiacie?
english: Who are you talking about?
glossary: to talk about sb
translation: What are you talking about?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Dostaniesz grzywnę, jeśli nie zapłacisz podatku na czas.
english: You'll get a fine if you don't pay your tax on time.
glossary: to pay your tax/to get a fine
translation: You will get a fine if you don’t pay the taxes on time.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Marzę o założeniu własnej firmy.
english: I dream of setting up my own company.
glossary: to dream of sth/to set up your own company

name: Anna Patton

glossary: to handle sth/to annoy sb

polish: Miałem nadzieję, że żona będzie w dobrym humorze.

glossary: to stay at home/to have nothing to do

name: Anette Gray
polish: Oglądamy dzisiaj wieczorem mecz. Wpadnij.

name: Kate Long
polish: Nie powinieneś był mnie okłamywać.
