name: Anette Gray
polish: W przyszłym tygodniu zaczynam kurs angielskiego. Nie mogę się doczekać.

polish: Od godziny robię kolację.

name: Gabriel Ryan
polish: Muszę wyjaśnić sytuację.

polish: Powinnaś zadzwonić do swoich rodziców.

polish: Nie powinnaś wierzyć swojemu mężowi.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Zadzwoniłem do rodziców, kiedy dostałem nagrodę.

glossary: to eat dinner with sb

glossary: to brag about sth/to be fed up with sth

glossary: to play a match/to join sb

glossary: to let sb do sth/to spoil your kids

glossary: to be able to do sth/to charge a laptop

english: What music does your husband usually listen to?

polish: Zawsze przeglądasz Facebooka, kiedy chcę z tobą porozmawiać.

english: What subject did you cover in class today?

glossary: to know about sth/a management board

polish: W czym specjalizuje się uczelnia?

glossary: to specialize in sth

polish: Film był niesamowity. Był taki wzruszający. Dosłownie sprawił, że się rozpłakałem.

glossary: to make sb do sth/literally/to be touching
translation: 6.	The movie was amazing. It was so touching. It literally made me cry.

name: George West
polish: Na co zwykle narzeka zarząd?

glossary: to complain about sth

polish: Mój biznes miał prosperować. Przynajmniej taki był plan.

glossary: to thrive
translation: 8.	My business was supposed to prosper. At least that was the plan.

polish: Jak długo wątpisz w nasz projekt? Myślałem, że w niego wierzysz.

glossary: to doubt sth/to believe in sth

glossary: to take sb to a restaurant/to like sb

polish: Jak długo wkuwasz do egzaminu? Ja nawet jeszcze nie zacząłem.

translation: 1.	How long have you been cramming for an exam? I haven’t even started yet.

glossary: to comply with sth/a subsidy

glossary: to have an impact on sb/an accident
translation: 3.	What influence had an accident on you?

name: George West
polish: Nauczyciel miał kupić płótno. Jak mam teraz malować?
english: The teacher was supposed to buy canvas. How am I supposed to paint now?
glossary: canvas/to paint
translation: 4.	A teacher had to buy a canvas. How am I supposed to paint now?

name: George West
polish: Od czego zależy sukces?
english: What does success depend on?
glossary: to depend on sth/a success
translation: 5.	What does success depend on?

name: George West
polish: Nigdy mnie nie słuchasz. Jak mamy się komunikować?
english: You never listen to me. How are we supposed to communicate?
glossary: to listen to sb/to communicate
translation: 6.	You are never listening to me. How are we supposed to communicate?

name: George West
polish: Zawsze pracujesz do późna. Nie zależy ci na swojej rodzinie?
english: You're always working late. Don't you care about your family?
glossary: to work late/to care about your family
translation: 7.	You always work late. Don’t you care about your family?

name: George West
polish: Mamy nadzieję, że nasz film pomoże społeczeństwu uświadomić sobie problem przemocy domowej.
english: We hope that our movie will help society realize the problem of domestic violence.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to realize sth/domestic violence
translation: 8.	We hope that our movie will help society to realise the problem of domestic violence.

name: George West
polish: Zawsze przeceniasz swoje umiejętności i później wpadamy w kłopoty.
english: You're always overestimating your abilities, and then we get in trouble.
glossary: to overestimate sth/to get in trouble
translation: 9.	You always overestimate your skills and then we get in trouble.

name: George West
polish: Czego Twój ojciec nie pochwala?
english: What doesn't your father approve of?
glossary: to approve of sth
translation: 10.	What does your father disapprove of?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Myślę, że dzisiaj będę pracował po godzinach. Co powiesz na czwartek?
english: I think I'll work overtime today. What about Thursday?
glossary: to work overtime/to meet/today/Thursday/What about.../to think
translation: I think I will be working after hours today. How about Thursday?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Myśłałem, że zawieziesz mnie do domu. Nie chcę brać taksówki.
english: I thought you'd take me home. I don't want to take a cab.
glossary: to think/to take sb home/to take a cab
translation: I thought you would take me home. I don’t want to take a cab.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Idę jutro do banku, żeby założyć konto.
english: I'm going to the bank tomorrow to open an account.
glossary: to go to the bank/to open an account/tomorrow
translation: I am going to the bank tomorrow to create an account.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Skup się na sprzątaniu pokoju.
english: Focus on cleaning the room.
glossary: to focus on sth/to clean a room
translation: Focus on cleaning up your room.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Musisz pamiętać, że jest wyjątek do tej zasady.
english: You have to remember that there's an exception to the rule.
glossary: to remember sth/an exception to the rule
translation: You have to remember that there is an exception to the principle.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Chciałabym, żebyś wygłosił przemowę na konferencji.
english: I'd like you to give a speech at the conference.
glossary: to give a speech/at the conference
translation: I wish you would give a speech at a conference.

name: Martin Vance
polish: W tej grupie jest za dużo ludzi. Znajdę inną.
english: There are too many people in the group. I have to find a different one.
glossary: in the group/to find sth/different
translation: There are too many people in the group. I will find another.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Powinienem był od razu cię zwolnić. Nie zasługujesz, żeby tu być.
english: I should've fired you right away. You don't deserve to be here.
glossary: to fire sb/right away/to deserve sth
translation: I should have fired you right away. You don’t deserve to be here.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Kiedy zaczynasz nową pracę?
english: When are you starting the new job?
glossary: to start a new job
translation: When are you starting your new job?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Interesuję się gotowaniem.
english: I'm interested in cooking.
glossary: to be interested in sth/to cook sth
translation: I am interested in cooking.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Gdybym w zeszłym roku więcej trenowała, byłabym teraz w formie.
english: If I'd worked out more last year, I'd be in shape now.
glossary: to work out/to be in shape
translation: If I trained more last year I would be in shape now.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Rodzice się mnie pytali, czy wziąłem w końcu kredyt.
english: My parents asked me if I'd finally taken out a loan.
glossary: to take out a loan/finally
translation: My parents asked me if I had taken out a loan eventually.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jak długo bronisz przestępców? Nie czujesz się z tym źle?
english: How long have you been defending criminals? Don't you feel bad about it?
glossary: to defend sb/to feel bad about sth
translation: How long have you been protecting the criminals? Don’t you feel bad?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Dzięki za skończenie zadania na czas.
english: Thanks for completing the task on time.
glossary: to complete a task
translation: Thank you for finishing the task on time.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Byłbyś bardziej zaangażowany w swoje obowiązki, gdybyś był na prowizji.
english: You'd be more engaged in your duties if you were on commission.
glossary: to be engaged in sth/to be on commission
translation: You would be more interested in your duties if you are on …

name: Anette Gray
polish: Rozważasz inne możliwości?
english: Are you considering other options?
glossary: to consider other options
translation: Do you consider other options?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Kiedy ostatni raz widział pan ofiarę żywą?
english: When was the last time you saw the victim alive?
glossary: to be alive/a victim/to see sb/When was the last time...
translation: When did you last see the victim alive?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Mój mąż miał złożyć łóżeczko do kupy, ale był zbyt leniwy.
english: My husband was supposed to put the crib together, but he was too lazy.
glossary: to put sth together/to be too lazy to do sth
translation: My husband was suposed to put together the bed but he was too lazy.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jeszcze tego nie przemyślałem.
english: I haven't thought it over yet.
glossary: to think sth over
translation: I didn’t think it over yet.

name: Anette Gray
polish: O której wylądował samolot? Nie miał przybyć później?
english: What time did the plane land? Wasn't it supposed to arrive later?
glossary: to land/a plane/to arrive later
translation: When the plane grounded? Wasn’t it supposed to be later?

name: Eve Miles
polish: Miałem w zeszłym tygodniu dużo pracy i bałem się, że nie wyrobię się z terminem.
english: I had a lot of work last week and I was afraid I wouldn't meet the deadline.
glossary: to have a lot of work/last week/to be afraid of sth/to meet the deadline
translation: 1.	I had a lot of work last week and I was afraid that I wouldn’t meet the deadline.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Nie powinieneś był wspominać o naszych problemach na spotkaniu z szefem.
english: You shouldn't have mentioned our problems at the meeting with the boss.
glossary: at the meeting/to mention sth
translation: 2.	You shouldn’t have mentioned our problems during meeting with your boss.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Przyjeżdżam jutro do Warszawy i zatrzymuję się u mojej koleżanki.
english: I'm coming to Warsaw tomorrow and staying at my friend's.
glossary: to come to Warsaw
translation: 3.	I’m coming to Warsaw tomorrow and staying with my friend’s.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Nie powinieneś był opowiadać tego żartu. Był niegrzeczny.
english: You shouldn't have told the joke. It was rude.
glossary: to be rude to sb/to tell sb a joke
translation: 4.	You shouldn’t have told this joke. He was rude.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że nic nie będę musiał dzisiaj robić.
english: I hoped I wouldn't have to do anything today.
glossary: to hope/today
translation: 5.	I was hoping, I wouldn’t have to do anything today.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Powinienem był spędzić zeszły weekend z rodziną.
english: I should've spent my last weekend with my family.
glossary: to spend time with sb/last weekend/a family
translation: 6.	I should have spent with my family last weekend.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Nie powinienem był Ci opowiadać tej historii, bo jest zbyt prywatna.
english: I shouldn't have told you the story because it's too private.
glossary: to tell sb a story/to be private
translation: 7.	I shouldn’t have told you this story because it’s too private.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że ci klienci zostawią większy napiwek.
english: I hoped the customers would leave a bigger tip.
glossary: to leave a tip/a customer/to hope
translation: 8.	I was hoping, these customers would leave a bigger tip.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Nie powinieneś był mnie okłamywać.
english: You shouldn't have lied to me.
glossary: to lie to sb
translation: 9.	You shouldn’t have lied to me.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Co robisz dziś wieczorem?
english: What are you doing tonight?
translation: 10.What are you doing tonight?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Wybrałam właściwego nauczyciela.
english: I chose the right teacher.
glossary: a teacher/to choose sth/the right teacher
translation: I chose the right teacher.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Piłbym częściej herbatę, gdybym lubił moich sąsiadów.
english: I'd have tea more often if I liked my neighbors.
glossary: to have tea/often/a neighbor/to like sb
translation: I would more often have tea if I liked my neighbors.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Dlaczego nauczycielka cię opieprzyła?
english: Why did the teacher tell you off?
glossary: to tell sb off/a teacher
translation: Why did the teacher tell you off?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Właśnie czytałem o zostawianiu napiwków.
english: I've just read about leaving tips.
glossary: to read about sth/to leave a tip
translation: I’ve just read about leaving tips.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jeśli nasza firma otworzy nową filię, wszyscy zrobimy się zajęci.
english: If our company opens a new branch, we'll all get busy.
glossary: to open a new branch/a branch/to get busy
translation: If our company opens a new branh, all of us will become busy.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Czy to się często zdarza?
english: Does it often happen?
glossary: to happen
translation: Does it happen often?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Myśłałem, że zawieziesz mnie do domu. Nie chcę brać taksówki.
english: I thought you'd take me home. I don't want to take a cab.
glossary: to think/to take sb home/to take a cab
translation: I thought you would take me home. I don’t want to take a cap.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Kiedy dotarłem do domu, żona już wyszła.
english: When I got home, my wife had already left.
glossary: to leave/to get home/a wife
translation: When I arived home my wife had left.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Trudno mi było udowodnić swoją rację.
english: It was hard for me to prove my point.
glossary: to prove your point
translation: It was hard to prove my point.

name: Anette Gray
polish: O której zwykle zaczynasz pracę?
english: What time do you usually start work?
glossary: to start work/What time...
translation: What time do they start working?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jutro uczę się na egzamin, ale możemy się spotkać, jak już skończę.
english: I'm studying for an exam tomorrow, but we can meet once I'm done.
glossary: to be done/to study for an exam/to meet sb
translation: I’m studying for an exam tomorrow but we can meet once I finish.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jak długo próbujesz usunąć tę plamę? Czy myślisz, że zejdzie?
english: How long have you been trying to remove the stain? Do you think it will come out?
glossary: to remove a stain/to come out
translation: How long have you been trying to remove the … ? Do you think … ?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jakie problemy są w twojej firmie?
english: What problems are there in your company?
glossary: a problem; an issue
translation: What problems are there in your company?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Dlaczego zaparkowałeś tak daleko od galerii?
english: Why did you park so far away from the mall?
glossary: to park your car/to be far away from sth/a mall
translation: Why did you park a car so far from the mall?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nieznajomy opluł mnie, kiedy przechodziłem przez ulicę.
english: A stranger spat at me when I was crossing the street.
glossary: to cross the street/a stranger/to spit at sb
translation: A stranger spit at me when I crosed the street.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Pana dokumenty nie zostałyby odrzucone, gdyby złożył je Pan na czas.
english: Your documents wouldn't have gotten rejected if you had handed them on time.
glossary: a document/to get rejected/to hand sth on time
translation: Your documents wouldn’t have been rejected if you placed them on time.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Wyjeżdżam jutro z miasta. Zadzwonię do ciebie, jak już wrócę.
english: I'm leaving town tomorrow. I'll call you once I'm back.
glossary: once/to leave town/to call sb
translation: I’m leaving town tomorrow. I’ll call you once I get back.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Dam ci znać, jak już skończę pracę. Będziemy w kontakcie.
english: I'll let you know once I finish work. We'll be in touch.
glossary: to let sb know/to finish work/to be in touch
translation: I’ll let you know if I finished work. We’ll be in touch.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jaką masz dla mnie ofertę?
english: What offer do you have for me?
glossary: to have an offer for sb
translation: How offer do you have for me?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Gdzie jedziesz w tym roku na wakacje?
english: Where are you going on vacation this year?
glossary: to go on vacation/this year
translation: When will you go on vacation this year?

name: Adam Dollar
polish: Pojadę na wakacje, jak już oszczędzę pieniądze.
english: I'll go on vacation once I save some money.
glossary: to go on vacation/to save some money
translation: I will go on vacation once I save money.

name: Adam Dollar
polish: Dam Ci znać, jak już skończę pracę.
english: I'll let you know once I finish work.
glossary: to let sb know/to finish work
translation: I will let you know once I finish work.

name: Adam Dollar
polish: Muszę iść wcześnie spać, bo jutro robię prezentację.
english: I have to go to sleep early because I'm giving a presentation tomorrow.
glossary: to go to sleep early/to give a presentation
translation: I have to go to sleep early because tomorrow I’m making the presentation.

name: Adam Dollar
polish: Myślałem, że będziesz tęsknić za domem.
english: I thought you'd feel homesick.
glossary: to feel homesick
translation: I thought you would feel homesick.

name: Adam Dollar
polish: Zadzwonię do ciebie, jak już będę w domu.
english: I'll call you once I'm at home.
glossary: to call sb/to be at home
translation: I will call you once I am home.

name: Adam Dollar
polish: Wyjeżdżam jutro z miasta. Zadzwonię do ciebie, jak już wrócę.
english: I'm leaving town tomorrow. I'll call you once I'm back.
glossary: once/to leave town/to call sb
translation: I’m leaving city tomorrow. I will call you once I am home.

name: Adam Dollar
polish: Mogłem się nauczyć na test.
english: I could've studied for the test.
glossary: to study for a test
translation: I could have studied for a test.

name: Adam Dollar
polish: Odwiozę cię do domu, jak już zjemy kolację.
english: I'll take you home once we eat dinner.
glossary: to take sb home/to eat dinner
translation: I will call you back once we eat a dinner.

name: Adam Dollar
polish: Oglądamy dzisiaj wieczorem mecz. Wpadnij.
english: We're watching a match tonight. Drop by.
glossary: to watch a match/to drop by
translation: We’re watching a match tomorrow. Let drop by.

name: Adam Dollar
polish: Co powiesz na poniedziałek? W weekend zajmuję się psami mojej siostry.
english: What about Monday? I'm taking care of my sister's dogs on the weekend.
glossary: on the weekend/What about.../to take care of sth
translation: What about on Monday? On the weekend I’m taking care of my sister’s dogs.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Grałeś w weekend w gry?
english: Did you play games on the weekend?
glossary: to play games/on the weekend
translation: 1. Did you play games on the weekend?

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Nauczyciel miał kupić płótno. Jak mam teraz malować?
english: The teacher was supposed to buy canvas. How am I supposed to paint now?
glossary: canvas/to paint

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Nie powinnaś wierzyć swojemu mężowi.
english: You shouldn't believe your husband.
glossary: to believe sb
translation: 3. You shouldn't believe your husband.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Dzwoniła wczoraj do mnie teściowa.
english: My mother-in-law called me yesterday.
glossary: to call sb
translation: 4. My mother in law called me yesterday.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: W czym specjalizuje się uczelnia?
english: What does the university specialize in?
glossary: to specialize in sth
translation: 5. What does the university specialize?

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Kiedy zdałeś sobie z tego sprawę?
english: When did you realize it?
glossary: to realize sth
translation: 6. When did you realize that?

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Jak możesz być tak naiwny?
english: How can you be so naive?
glossary: to be naive
translation: 7. How can you be so naive?

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Chciałabym pracować jako sędzia w przyszłości.
english: I'd like to work as a judge in the future.
glossary: to work as a judge/a judge/in the future
translation: 8. I would like to work as a judge in the future.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Mam dość tego projektu, bo pracuję nad nim od kilku miesięcy.

glossary: to be fed up with sth/to work on a project
translation: 9. I'm fed up with this project because I've been working on it for few months.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Zauważyłem wczoraj, że sąsiedzi kupili nowy samochód.
english: I noticed yesterday that my neighbors had bought a new car.
glossary: to buy a new car/to notice sth/a neighbor
translation: 10. I noticed yesterday that my naighbors bought a new car.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Zrobię pracę domową, jeśli będę miała czas.
english: I'll do my homework if I have time.
glossary: to do your homework/to have time to do sth
translation: 1. I'll do my homework if I have time.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Z kim wczoraj rozmawiałeś przez telefon?
english: Who did you talk to on the phone yesterday?
glossary: to talk to sb over the phone
translation: 2. Who did you talk to on the phone yesterday?

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Nie wygramy sprawy, jeśli nie będziesz zeznawał.
english: We won't win the case if you don't testify.
glossary: to win a case/to testify
translation: 3. We won't win the case if you don't testify.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Powinnaś być ze mnie dumna.
english: You should be proud of me.
glossary: to be proud of sb
translation: 4. You should be proud of me.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Jestem podekscytowana, bo jutro widzę się ze starą znajomą.
english: I'm excited because I'm seeing an old friend of mine tomorrow.
glossary: to see sb/to be excited
translation: 5. I'm excited because I'm seeing an old friend tomorrow.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Często byłem nawalony, kiedy byłem młodszy.
english: I was often wasted when I was younger.
glossary: to be wasted/...when I was younger
translation: 6. I was often wasted when I was younger.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Rok temu zacząłem uczyć się angielskiego.
english: I started learning English a year ago.
glossary: to start learning English/last year
translation: 7. I started learning English a year ago.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Ostatnim razem, kiedy rozmawiałyśmy, mówiłaś, że potrzebujesz mojej porady.
english: The last time we talked, you said you needed my advice.
glossary: to need sb's advice/The last time we talked.../to say sth
translation: 8. The last time we talked, you said you needed my …..

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Obiecuję, że nie zrobię nic głupiego.
english: I promise I won't do anything stupid.
glossary: to do sth stupid
translation: 9. I promise not to do anyting stupid.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Jak długo wątpisz w nasz projekt? Myślałem, że w niego wierzysz.
english: How long have you been doubting our project? I thought you believed in it.
glossary: to doubt sth/to believe in sth
translation: 10. How long you doubted our project? I thought you believed to him.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: O której zwykle zaczynasz pracę?
english: What time do you usually start work?
glossary: to start work/What time...
translation: 1. What time do you usually start work?

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Zbyt dużo pijesz. Pomyśl o swojej rodzinie.
english: You're drinking way too much. Think about your family.
glossary: to drink way too much/to think about your family
translation: 2. You drink too much. Think about your family.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Zawsze przeglądasz Facebooka, kiedy chcę z tobą porozmawiać.
english: You're always scrolling Facebook when I want to talk to you.
glossary: to scroll Facebook/to want to do sth/to talk to sb
translation: 3. You always check Facebook when I want to talk to you.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Może pojadę taksówką. Zaoszczędzę czas.
english: Maybe I'll take a cab. I'll save time.
glossary: to take a cab/to save money
translation: 4. Maybe I'll drive taxi. I'll save time.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Byłem pewien, że przytyję, ale za mało jadłem.
english: I was sure I'd gain weight, but I ate too little.
glossary: to be sure/to gain weight/to eat too little
translation: 5. I was sure I would gain weight, but I didn't eat enough.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Nie wiem, co powinienem odpowiedzieć.
english: I don't know what I should answer.
glossary: to answer a question
translation: 6. I don't know what I should answer.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Mam nadzieję, że zdążę na pociąg. To ostatni.
english: I hope I'll catch the train. It's the last one.
glossary: to catch the train/to catch the last train
translation: 7. I hope I can catch the train. It's the last one.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Muszę dowiedzieć się prawdy.
english: I have to find out the truth.
glossary: to find out the truth
translation: 8. I need to find out the truth.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Jak długo próbujesz usunąć tę plamę? Czy myślisz, że zejdzie?
english: How long have you been trying to remove the stain? Do you think it will come out?
glossary: to remove a stain/to come out
translation: 9. How long have you been trying to delete the stain? Do you think it will delete?

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Mogłeś wcześniej zadzwonić. Powiedziałabym Ci, że nie ma mnie w domu.
english: You could've called before. I would've told you I wasn't at home.
glossary: to be at home/to call sb
translation: 10. You could have called earlier. I would have told you that I wasn't home.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Po tym, jak zrobiłeś zupę, wszyscy rzygaliśmy.
english: After you'd made the soup, we all threw up.
glossary: to make soup/to throw up
translation: 1. After you made a soup, we all threw up.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Zrobiłeś wczoraj kopię zapasową plików?
english: Did you back up the files yesterday?
glossary: to back up files

name: Greg Hardy

There are still next ten. I had finally finished all of my tasks yesterday because I didn’t have any meetings.

name: Greg Hardy

polish: Jeden z moich pracowników poinformował mnie wczoraj, że trafił do szpitala.
english: One of my employees informed me yesterday that he'd ended up in the hospital.
glossary: to end up in the hospital/to inform sb
translation: One of my workers informed me yesterday, he had ended up in the hospital.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Nie oblałbym testu na prawo jazdy, gdybym nie próbował wyprzedzać innego auta.
english: I wouldn't have failed the driving test if I hadn't tried to overtake a different car.
glossary: to overtake a car/to fail a driving test
translation: I wouldn’t have failed the driving license test, if I hadn’t tried to overtake the other car.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Poproszę o podwyżkę, jak już szef będzie z powrotem w biurze.
english: I'll ask for a pay-raise once my boss is back in the office.
glossary: to ask for a pay-raise/to be back in the office
translation: I’ll ask about the pay-rise once my boss will be back in the office.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Zwolnię cię. Zobaczysz.
english: I'll fire you. You'll see.
glossary: to fire sb/to see sth
translation: 1. We are eating out tonight.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Dostaniesz awans. Cieszysz się?
english: You'll get promoted. Are you happy?
glossary: to get promoted/to be happy about sth
translation: 2. An old friend wrote to me yesterday.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Jutro omawiamy bieżące problemy na spotkaniu.
english: We're discussing the current problems at the meeting tomorrow.
glossary: to discuss sth/the current problems/at the meeting
translation: 3. You should be proud of me.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Jutro zamawiamy jedzenie.
english: We're ordering food tomorrow.
glossary: to order food
translation: 4. You shouldn't forget yourself.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Wybrałam właściwego nauczyciela.
english: I chose the right teacher.
glossary: a teacher/to choose sth/the right teacher
translation: 5. We can't start from the beginning because we don't have time.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Wczoraj zamówiłam pizzę.
english: I ordered a pizza yesterday.
glossary: to order a pizza
translation: 6. I hope you'll catch up on your homework.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Muszę wyjaśnić sytuację.
english: I have to explain the situation.
glossary: to explain the situation
translation: 7. I promise you'll be passed next year.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Powinnaś zadzwonić do swoich rodziców.
english: You should call your parents.
glossary: a parent/to call sb
translation: 8. We need to discuss the situation.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Nie możesz mnie okłamywać.
english: You can't lie to me.
glossary: to lie to sb
translation: 9. I'm going shopping tomorrow. Would you like to join me?

name: Matt Xander
polish: Nie powinnaś wierzyć swojemu mężowi.
english: You shouldn't believe your husband.
glossary: to believe sb
translation: 10. My mother in law called me yesterday.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Czy nie mieliśmy wczoraj zapłacić pierwszej raty?
english: Weren't we supposed to pay the first installment yesterday?
glossary: to pay an installment
translation: Didn’t we have to pay the last installment yesterday?

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Czy rozwiązanie sprawdziło się na dłuższą metę?
english: Did the solution work out in the long run?
glossary: to work out/in the long run
translation: Did the solution work ….line.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Z czego wynika Twoja pasja do języków?
english: What does your passion for languages stem from?
glossary: to have a passion for sth/to stem from sth

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Mój mąż zawsze chrapie. Rozważam spanie osobno.
english: My husband is always snoring. I'm considering sleeping separately.
glossary: to snore/to consider doing sth/to sleep separately
translation: My husband is always snoring.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Zawsze siedzisz do późna. Nie możemy pójść razem spać?
english: You're always sitting up late. Can't we go to sleep together?
glossary: to sit up late/to go to sleep together
translation: You are always staying late. Can’t we go to sleep together?

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Od jak dawna wynajmujesz mieszkanie swoim znajomym? Znasz ich dobrze?
english: How long have you been renting out the apartment to your friends? Do you know them well?
glossary: to rent out an apartment to sb
translation: How long have you been renting the flat your friends? Do you know them well?

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Nigdy nie bierzesz pod uwagę moich sugestii. Czy w ogóle zależy Ci na mojej opinii?
english: You never consider my suggestions. Do you even care about my opinion?
glossary: to consider sth/a suggestion/to care about sth
translation: You never considered my suggestions. Do you care about my opinion?

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Na kogo zawsze głosuje Twoja matka?
english: Who does your mother always vote for?
glossary: to vote for sb
translation: Who is your mother usually voting for?

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Co sprawiło, że pomyślałeś, że kiedykolwiek mógłbym Cię zdradzić?
english: What made you think that I could ever cheat on you?
glossary: to make sb do sth/to cheat on sb
translation: What ….. to think that can I ever cheat on you?

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Zawsze pędzisz. Może powinieneś nauczyć się jeździć.
english: You're always speeding. Maybe you should learn how to drive.
glossary: to speed/to learn how to do sth
translation: You are always speeding. Maybe you should learn to drive.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Co się stało? Byłam pewna, że się pobierzecie.
english: What happened? I was sure you'd get married.
glossary: to happen/to be sure/to get married
translation: What happened ? I was sure you’d get married.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Mogłem napisać ten test z angielskiego w zeszłym tygodniu. Teraz nic nie pamiętam.
english: I could've taken the English test last week. I don't remember anything now.
glossary: to take an English test/to remember sth/last week
translation: I could wrote the English test last week. I don’t remember anything now.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że żona będzie w dobrym humorze.
english: I hoped my wife would be in a good mood.
glossary: to hope/a wife/to be in a good mood
translation: I hoped that my wife would be in a good mood.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Chciałem powiedzieć Ci prawdę, ale bałem się, że się zdenerwujesz.
english: I wanted to tell you the truth, but I was afraid you'd get mad.
glossary: to tell sb the truth/to be afraid of sth/to get mad
translation: I wanted to tell you the truth but I was afraid that you would be mad.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Mogłam wydawać mniej pieniędzy na ubrania, bo muszę jeszcze zapłacić rachunki.
english: I could've spent less money on clothes because I still have to pay the bills.
glossary: to spend money on clothes/still/to pay the bills
translation: I could spent less money on clothes because I still have to pay the bills.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Nie powinieneś był tyle pić na imprezie.
english: You shouldn't have drunk so much at the party.
glossary: to drink/at the party
translation: You shouldn’t have drunk so much at the party.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Nie mogę zasnąć. Nie powinienem był pić kawy tak późno.
english: I can't fall asleep. I shouldn't have drunk coffee so late.
glossary: to fall asleep/to drink coffee/late
translation: I can’t fall asleep. I shouldn’t have drunk coffee so late.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Pójdziemy na kawę, jak już będzie ładna pogoda.
english: We'll go for a coffee once the weather is good.
glossary: to go for a coffee/the weather
translation: We’ll go for a coffee once the weather is good.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Pójdę spać, jak już skończę czytać książkę.
english: I'll go to sleep once I finish reading the book.
glossary: to go to sleep/to finish doing sth
translation: I’ll go to sleep once I finish reading the book.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Następny weekend spędzam w moim rodzinnym mieście.
english: I'm spending next weekend in my hometown.
glossary: in your hometown/to spend next weekend
translation: I’m spending next weekend in my hometown.

name: Kate Long
polish: Nie powinienem był robić takiego bałaganu. Przepraszam.
english: I shouldn't have made such a mess. I'm sorry.
glossary: to make a mess
translation: 1. I shouldn't have done that mess. I'm so sorry.

name: Kate Long
polish: Jestem głodny. Mogłem zjeść śniadanie.
english: I'm hungry. I could've eaten breakfast.
glossary: to be hungry/to eat breakfast
translation: 2. I'm hungry. I could eat breakfast.

name: Kate Long
polish: Mogłem biec szybciej. Zdążyłbym na pociąg.
english: I could've run faster. I would've caught the train.
glossary: to run fast/to catch the train
translation: 3. I could run faster. I would catch the train.

name: Kate Long
polish: Jechałeś bardzo szybko. Bałem się, że będziemy mieli wypadek.
english: You drove very fast. I was afraid we'd have an accident.
glossary: to drive/to be afraid/to have an accident
translation: 4. I drove very fast. I was afraid we would have an accident.

name: Kate Long
polish: Jutro jedziemy do centrum na zakupy. Chcesz coś?
english: We're going shopping downtown tomorrow. Do you want anything?
glossary: to go shopping/to go downtown
translation: 5. We are going to the mall for the shopping tomorrow. Do you want anything?

name: Kate Long
polish: Co się stało? Byłem pewien, że będziesz się trzymać planu.
english: What happened? I was sure you'd stick to the plan.
glossary: to happen/to be sure/to stick to the plan
translation: 6. What happened? I was sure you would stick to the plan.

name: Kate Long
polish: Moja najlepsza przyjaciółka wychodzi za mąż w przyszłym tygodniu.
english: My best friend's getting married next week.
glossary: to get married/next week
translation: 7. My best friend will get married next week.

name: Kate Long
polish: Nie pracuję jutro, więc możemy jechać nad jezioro.
english: I'm not working tomorrow, so we can go to the lake.
glossary: to work/to go to the lake/tomorrow
translation: 8. I won't work tomorrow so we can go to the lake.

name: Kate Long
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że się zaprzyjaźnimy.
english: I hoped we'd make friends.
glossary: to hope/to make friends
translation: 9. I was sure we will become friends.

name: Kate Long
polish: Ile osób jest w Twoim zespole?
english: How many people are there on your team?
glossary: on the team
translation: 10. How many people is on you team?

name: Eve Miles
polish: Nie powinienem był robić takiego bałaganu. Przepraszam.
english: I shouldn't have made such a mess. I'm sorry.
glossary: to make a mess
translation: 1.	I shouldn’t have made such amess. I’m sorry.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Jestem głodny. Mogłem zjeść śniadanie.
english: I'm hungry. I could've eaten breakfast.
glossary: to be hungry/to eat breakfast
translation: 2.	I’m hungry. I could have breakfast.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Mogłem biec szybciej. Zdążyłbym na pociąg.
english: I could've run faster. I would've caught the train.
glossary: to run fast/to catch the train
translation: 3.	I could run faster. I would be on time for the train.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Jechałeś bardzo szybko. Bałem się, że będziemy mieli wypadek.
english: You drove very fast. I was afraid we'd have an accident.
glossary: to drive/to be afraid/to have an accident
translation: 4.	You drove very fast. I was afraid we would have an accident.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Jutro jedziemy do centrum na zakupy. Chcesz coś?
english: We're going shopping downtown tomorrow. Do you want anything?
glossary: to go shopping/to go downtown
translation: 5.	We are going to city center for shopping tomorrow. Do you want something?

name: Eve Miles
polish: Co się stało? Byłem pewien, że będziesz się trzymać planu.
english: What happened? I was sure you'd stick to the plan.
glossary: to happen/to be sure/to stick to the plan
translation: 6.	What happened? I was sure you would stick to the plan.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Moja najlepsza przyjaciółka wychodzi za mąż w przyszłym tygodniu.
english: My best friend's getting married next week.
glossary: to get married/next week
translation: 7.	My best friend is getting married next week.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Nie pracuję jutro, więc możemy jechać nad jezioro.
english: I'm not working tomorrow, so we can go to the lake.
glossary: to work/to go to the lake/tomorrow
translation: 8.	I’m not working tomorrow, so we can go to the lake.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że się zaprzyjaźnimy.
english: I hoped we'd make friends.
glossary: to hope/to make friends
translation: 9.	I hoped we would make a friend.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Ile osób jest w Twoim zespole?
english: How many people are there on your team?
glossary: on the team
translation: 10.	How many people are in your team?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Kiedy brałem prysznic, wpadłem na świetny pomysł.
english: When I was taking a shower, I came up with a great idea.
glossary: to take a shower/to come up with sth/to come up with an idea
translation: When I took the shower I came up with an idea.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Na szczęście łatwo było ofierze zidentyfikować napastnika.
english: Luckily, it was easy for the victim to identify the assaulter.
glossary: to identify sb/an assaulter
translation: Fortunetelly it was easy for the victim to identify …

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie możemy zacząć od początku, bo nie mamy czasu.
english: We can't start over because we don't have time.
glossary: to start over/to have time
translation: We can’t start over because we don’t have time.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Robiłeś pracę domową, kiedy chodziłeś do szkoły?
english: Did you do your homework when you went to school?
glossary: to do your homework/to go to school
translation: Did you do homework when you were in school?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Zawsze pracujesz do późna. Nie zależy ci na swojej rodzinie?
english: You're always working late. Don't you care about your family?
glossary: to work late/to care about your family
translation: You always work late. Don’t you care about your family?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jak długo tyle bierzesz? Ostatnim razem, kiedy się spotkaliśmy, było taniej.
english: How long have you been charging this much? The last time we met it was cheaper.
glossary: to charge sb
translation: How long have you been taking? Last time we met was cheaper.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Dlaczego akcje Twojej firmy spadły? Czy coś się stało?
english: Why did your company's shares drop? Did anything happen?
glossary: to drop/a share
translation: Why your companie’s …. drop? Did something happen?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Dlaczego wyjeżdżasz? Czy coś się stało?
english: Why are you leaving? Has anything happened?
glossary: to happen/to leave
translation: Why do you leave? Did something happen?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Czym zwykle skutkuje takie zachowanie?
english: What does such behavior usually result in?
glossary: behavior/to result in sth
translation: …. such as behavior?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Zajmuję się jutro młodszym bratem. Spotkajmy się w weekend.
english: I'm taking care of my younger brother tomorrow. Let's meet on the weekend.
glossary: to meet sb/on the weekend/to take care of sb/a younger brother
translation: I’m taking care of my younger brother tomorrow. Let’s meet on the weekend.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Dlaczego mnie spoliczkowałaś?
english: Why did you slap me?
glossary: to slap sb
translation: Why did you slap me?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie powinienem był cię słuchać. Nie miałeś racji.
english: I shouldn't have listened to you. You weren't right.
glossary: to listen to sb/to be right
translation: I shouldn’t have listened to you. You aren’t right.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Gdzie koncertujecie w weekend?
english: Where are you giving a concert on the weekend?
glossary: to give a concert
translation: Where are you … this weekend?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Spotykam się dzisiaj z jednym z moich klientów, żeby wyjaśnić sytuację.
english: I'm meeting one of my clients today to explain the situation.
glossary: to explain the situation/to meet sb/one of your clients/today
translation: We’re meeting one of our clients today to explain the situation.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jakich ludzi cenisz sobie najbardziej?
english: What people do you value the most?
glossary: to value sb
translation: Which people do you value the most?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie musielibyśmy płacić za ten miesiąc, gdybyśmy rozwiązali umowę na czas.
english: You wouldn't have had to pay for this month if we had terminated the contract on time.
glossary: to pay for sth/to terminate a contract/to do sth on time
translation: We wouldn’t have to pay for the month if we had canceled the contract on time.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jakiego podejścia wymaga to zadanie?
english: What approach does this task require?
glossary: an approach/to require sth
translation: What aproach does the task require?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Znów boli mnie głowa. Muszę iść do lekarza.
english: I have a headache again. I have to go to the doctor.
glossary: to have a headache/to go to the doctor
translation: I have headeigh again. I have to go to the doctor.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Powinnaś zadzwonić do swoich rodziców.
english: You should call your parents.
glossary: a parent/to call sb
translation: You should call your parents.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie możesz mnie okłamywać.
english: You can't lie to me.
glossary: to lie to sb
translation: You can’t lie to me.

name: Anette Gray
polish: W zeszłym tygodniu poprosiłam mamę, żeby poszła ze mną na zakupy.
english: I asked my mom to go shopping with me last week.
glossary: to go shopping/last week
translation: I asked my mother last week that she would go shopping with me.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Moje życie się zmieniło po tym, jak zostałem zwolniony.
english: My life changed after I'd gotten fired.
glossary: a life/to change/to get fired
translation: My life changed after I got fired.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Przygotuję się na spotkanie, jeśli będę mieć czas.
english: I'll get prepared for the meeting if I have time.
glossary: to get prepared for a meeting
translation: I’ll get prepared for the meeting if I have time.

name: Anette Gray
polish: O czym była twoje ostatnia książka?
english: What was your last book about?
glossary: a book about sth
translation: What was your last book about?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Może wpadnę po pracy.
english: Maybe I'll drop by after work.
glossary: to drop by/after work
translation: Maybe, I’ll drop by after work.

name: Anette Gray
polish: O czym musimy porozmawiać?
english: What do we have to talk about?
glossary: to talk about sth
translation: What do we need to talk about?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jakiej muzyki zwykle słucha twój mąż?
english: What music does your husband usually listen to?
glossary: to listen to music
translation: What music does your husband listen to?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie powinieneś był opowiadać tego żartu. Był niegrzeczny.
english: You shouldn't have told the joke. It was rude.
glossary: to be rude to sb/to tell sb a joke
translation: You shouldn’t have to tell the joke. It was rude.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Wujek by nie utonął, gdyby nagle nie dostał skurczu.
english: My uncle wouldn't have drowned if he hadn't suddenly gotten a cramp.
glossary: to get a cramp/to drown/suddenly/an uncle
translation: Uncle wouldn’t have drawn if he hadn’t gotten a cramp.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Gdybyś mnie posłuchał, nie skończyłbyś w szpitalu.
english: If you'd listened to me, you wouldn't have ended up in the hospital.
glossary: to listen to sb/to end up in the hospital
translation: If you had followed my advice you wouldn’t have ended up in the hospital.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Na co się patrzysz?
english: What are you looking at?
glossary: to look at sth
translation: 1.	What are you looking at?

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Nudziło mi się wczoraj w pracy, bo nie było nic do roboty.
english: I was bored at work yesterday because there was nothing to do.
glossary: to be bored/at work/to have nothing to do
translation: 2.	I was bored at work yesterday because there was nothing to do.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Mogłaś mnie wczoraj odwiedzić, skoro byłaś w mieście.
english: You could've visited me yesterday since you were in town.
glossary: to visit sb/to be in town
translation: 3.	You could visit me yesterday since you were in town.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Obiecałaś, że zrobisz mi dzisiaj włosy.
english: You promised you'd do my hair today.
glossary: to promise sb sth; to promise to sb/to do your hair/today
translation: 4.	You promised you would do my hair today.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Z kogo się śmiejesz?
english: Who are you laughing at?
glossary: to laugh at sb
translation: 5.	Who are you laughing at.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Miałam nadzieję, że nie będę miała dzisiaj kaca.
english: I hoped I wouldn't have a hangover today.
glossary: to hope/to have a hangover/today
translation: 6.	I hoped I wouldn’t have hangover today.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Nie miałem tego na myśli. Nie powinnaś była brać tego osobiście.
english: I didn't mean it. You shouldn't have taken it personally.
glossary: to mean sth/to take sth personally
translation: 7.	I didn’t mean that. You shouldn’t have taken this personally

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Jestem pewien, że schudnę do lata.
english: I'm sure I'll lose weight by summer.
glossary: to be sure/to lose weight/by summer
translation: 8.	I’m sure I’ll lose weight by summer.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Nie powinniśmy byli się kłócić. To nie miało sensu.
english: We shouldn't have argued. It didn't make sense.
glossary: to argue with sb/to make sense
translation: 9.	We shouldn’t have argued. This did not make sense.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Stresuję się, bo w przyszłym tygodniu jadę za granicę, a nie mówię dobrze po angielsku.
english: I'm stressed out because I'm going abroad next week and I don't speak English well.
glossary: to speak English well/to go abroad/next week
translation: 10.	. I’m stressed because I’m going abroad next week and I don’t speak English well.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Jest możliwość, że zostanę zwolniony.
english: There's a possibility that I'll be fired.
glossary: a possibility/to fire sb
translation: 1.	There is a possibility that I will be fired.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Byłem pewien, że przytyję, ale za mało jadłem.
english: I was sure I'd gain weight, but I ate too little.
glossary: to be sure/to gain weight/to eat too little
translation: 2.	I was sure I would gain weight, but I ate not enough.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Jest jeszcze tyle rzeczy, których muszę się nauczyć na test.
english: There are still so many things I have to study for the test.
glossary: to study sth for a test
translation: 3.	There are so many things I must learn for the test.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Nie powinienem był cię słuchać. Nie miałeś racji.
english: I shouldn't have listened to you. You weren't right.
glossary: to listen to sb/to be right
translation: 4.	I shouldn’t have listened to you. You were wrong.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Obiecuję, że odwiedzę was w przyszłym miesiącu.
english: I promise I'll visit you next month.
glossary: to visit sb/next month/to promise
translation: 5.	I promise to visit you next month.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Nie powinnaś była dzwonić do mnie tak późno. Moja żona była w domu.
english: You shouldn't have called me so late. My wife was at home.
