name: Kate Roberts
polish: Zrobiłabym panu teraz zastrzyk, gdyby się pan tak nie trząsł.
english: I'd give you an injection now if you didn't tremble so much.
glossary: to give sb an injection/to tremble
translation: 9) I would give you a shot right now if you weren't shaking so much.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Nie dostalibyśmy zatrucia pokarmowego, gdybyś umiał gotować.
english: We wouldn't have gotten food poisoning if you could cook.
glossary: to get food poisoning/to cook
translation: 10. we wouldn't get food poisoning if you knew how to cook

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Czułbym się teraz źle, gdybym wyrzucił te stare ubrania, zamiast oddać je na cele dobroczynne.
english: I'd feel bad now if I'd thrown out the old clothes instead of giving them to charity.
glossary: to feel bad/to throw away your clothes/to give sth to charity
translation: 1. I would feel bad now if I threw old clothes away instead of ….them to charity.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Gdybyś rzeczywiście miał odrę, miałbyś również wysypkę.
english: If you really had measles, you'd also have a rash.
glossary: to have measles/to have a rash
translation: 2) If you really had measles, you would also have a rash.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Miałaś w zeszłym tygodniu lekcję angielskiego?
english: Did you have the English class last week?
glossary: to have an English class/last week
translation: 3) Did you have an English lesson last week?

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Rzuciłabyś mnie, gdybym cię nie przeprosił?
english: Would you have broken up with me if I hadn't apologized to you?
glossary: to break up with sb/to apologize to sb for sth
translation: 4) Would you dump me if I didn't apologize to you?

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Nie uderzyłbym cię w twarz, gdybyś mnie nie sprowokował.
english: I wouldn't have punched you in the face if you hadn't provoked me.
glossary: to punch sb in the face/to provoke sb
translation: 5. I wouldn't have hit you in the face if you hadn't provoked me.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Co chcesz, żebym ci powiedział?
english: What do you want me to tell you?
glossary: to tell sb sth
translation: 6. what do you want me to tell you?

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Gdybym pościelił dziś rano łóżko, mama by się na mnie nie wkurzyła.
english: If I'd made the bed this morning, my mom wouldn't have gotten mad at me.
glossary: to make the bed/this morning/to get mad at sb
translation: 7) If I had made my bed this morning, my mother wouldn't be mad at me.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Nigdy nie ćpałem i nie pochwalam tego.
english: I've never done drugs and I don't approve of it.
glossary: to do drugs/to approve of sth
translation: 8) I've never done drugs and I don't approve of it.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Zwykle ćwiczę, słuchając jednocześnie muzyki.
english: I usually exercise listening to music at the same time.
glossary: to exercise/to listen to music/at the same time
translation: 9. I usually exercise while listening to music.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Gdybyśmy przestali używać konserwantów, mielibyśmy więcej klientów.
english: If we stopped using preservatives, we'd have more customers.
glossary: a preservative/a customer
translation: 10. If we stopped using preservatives, we would have more customers.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Dostaniesz grzywnę, jeśli nie zapłacisz podatku na czas.
english: You'll get a fine if you don't pay your tax on time.
glossary: to pay your tax/to get a fine
translation: You’ll take a fine if you don’t pay the tax on time.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jaki wpływ miał na Ciebie wypadek?
english: What impact did the accident have on you?
glossary: to have an impact on sb/an accident
translation: What influence did the accident have on you?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Do czego odnosi się artykuł?
english: What does the article refer to?
glossary: to refer to sth/an article
translation: What does the article relay on?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Moja najlepsza przyjaciółka wychodzi za mąż w przyszłym tygodniu.
english: My best friend's getting married next week.
glossary: to get married/next week
translation: My best friend is getting married next week.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jutro jedziemy do centrum na zakupy. Chcesz coś?
english: We're going shopping downtown tomorrow. Do you want anything?
glossary: to go shopping/to go downtown
translation: We’re going shopping downtown tomorrow. Do you want something?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Zwolnię cię. Zobaczysz.
english: I'll fire you. You'll see.
glossary: to fire sb/to see sth
translation: I’ll fire you. You’ll see.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jakie sukienki zwykle szyjesz?
english: What dresses do you usually sew?
glossary: to sew sth/a dress
translation: Which dresses you usually saw.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jesteś zazdrosny, bo ja jadę na ten wyjazd, a ty nie możesz.
english: You're jealous because I'm going on the trip and you can't.
glossary: to be jealous of sb/to go on a trip
translation: You are joules because I’m going on the adventure and you can’t.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie wygramy sprawy, jeśli nie będziesz zeznawał.
english: We won't win the case if you don't testify.
glossary: to win a case/to testify
translation: We won’t win the case if you don’t testify.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie miałbym nic przeciwko, gdybyś wyraziła swoje zdanie.
english: I wouldn't mind if you expressed your opinion.
glossary: to mind/to express your opinion
translation: I wouldn’t mind if you expressed your point.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Obiecuję, że w przyszłym tygodniu odbiorę dzieci ze szkoły o czasie.
english: I promise I'll pick up the kids from school on time next week.
glossary: to promise/to pick up the kids from school/on time/next week
translation: I promise I’ll pick up the kids from school on time this week.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Wczoraj zamówiłam pizzę.
english: I ordered a pizza yesterday.
glossary: to order a pizza
translation: I ordered a pizza yesterday.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Dlaczego udajesz, że płaczesz?
english: Why are you pretending that you're crying?
glossary: to pretend that.../to cry
translation: Why do you pretend you cry?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jest jeszcze kilka wiadomości, na które muszę odpowiedzieć.
english: There are still a few messages I have to reply to.
glossary: to reply to a message
translation: There are a few messeges I have to answer.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Muszę chronić swoje dzieci.
english: I have to protect my kids.
glossary: to protect sb/a kid
translation: I have to protect my children.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Niełatwo nam zrobić wrażenie na naszej szefowej.
english: It's not easy for us to make a good impression on our boss.
glossary: to make a good impression on sb/a boss
translation: It’s not easy to impress my boss.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jutro zamawiamy jedzenie.
english: We're ordering food tomorrow.
glossary: to order food
translation: We’re ordering food tomorrow.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Będzie późno, kiedy dojedziemy do domu.
english: It'll be late when we get home.
glossary: to be late/to drive back home
translation: It will be late when we arrive at home.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Do kogo się uśmiechasz?
english: Who are you smiling at?
glossary: to smile at sb
translation: Who are you smiling at?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Myślałam, że się tym zajmiesz.
english: I thought you'd take care of it.
glossary: to take care of sth
translation: I though you would take care of it.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Byłam pewna, że wyjaśnimy sytuację.
english: I was sure we'd explain the situation.
glossary: to explain the situation
translation: I was sure we would explain the situation.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Zrobię pracę domową, jak już będę mieć dostęp do internetu.
english: I'll do my homework once I have access to the internet.
glossary: to have access to the internet/to do your homework/once {2}
translation: I’ll do my homework once I have access to the Internet.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Gdzie planujecie jechać tym razem?
english: Where are you planning to go this time?
glossary: to plan to go somewhere
translation: Where do you plan to go this time?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Co sprawiło, że pomyślałeś, że kiedykolwiek mógłbym Cię zdradzić?
english: What made you think that I could ever cheat on you?
glossary: to make sb do sth/to cheat on sb
translation: What make you thought I would cheat on you …

name: Anette Gray
polish: Musisz przyznać, że mam rację.
english: You have to admit that I'm right.
glossary: to admit sth/to be right
translation: You have to admit I’m right.

name: Anette Gray
polish: W zeszłym roku pracowałem jako stażysta. Dużo się wtedy nauczyłem.
english: I worked as an intern last year. I learned a lot back then.
glossary: to work as an intern/to learn sth/back then
translation: I worked as an intern last year. I learned a lot back then.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Spotykam się dzisiaj ze znajomymi. Nie czekaj.
english: I'm meeting my friends today. Don't wait.
glossary: to meet your friends/to wait for sb
translation: I’m meeting with my friend today. Don’t wait.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Myślę, że dzisiaj będę pracował po godzinach. Co powiesz na czwartek?
english: I think I'll work overtime today. What about Thursday?
glossary: to work overtime/to meet/today/Thursday/What about.../to think
translation: I think I’ll work overtime today. What about Thursday?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie możesz unikać odpowiedzialności.
english: You can't avoid responsibility.
glossary: to avoid responsibility
translation: You can’t avoid responsibilty.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Odwiozę cię do domu, jak już zjemy kolację.
english: I'll take you home once we eat dinner.
glossary: to take sb home/to eat dinner
translation: I’ll take you home once we eat dinner.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Kogo chcesz, żebym zaprosił na imprezę?
english: Who do you want me to invite to the party?
glossary: to invite sb to a party
translation: 1. Who you want me to invite to the party?

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Wpadaj. Mój mąż gotuje w ten piątek.
english: Drop by. My husband's cooking this Friday.
glossary: to cook/this Friday
translation: 2. Come in. This Friday my husband cook dinner

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Nie ma różnicy. Bierz, co chcesz.
english: There's no difference. Take what you want.
glossary: a difference/to take sth
translation: 3. There is a difference. Take what you want

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Mogłeś mi od razu powiedzieć prawdę. Nie zdenerwowałbym się.
english: You could've told me the truth at the beginning. I wouldn't have gotten mad.
glossary: to tell sb the truth/at the beginning/to get mad
translation: 4. You could tell me the truth immediately. I wouldn't be mad

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Co mi chciałaś powiedzieć na imprezie?
english: What did you want to tell me at the party?
glossary: to tell sb sth/at the party
translation: 5. What would you like to tell me at the party?

name: Justina Stanley
polish: W artykule jest błąd. Popraw go.
english: There's a mistake in the article. Correct it.
glossary: in the article/to correct a mistake
translation: 6. There is a mistake on the article. Correct it.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Może pojadę taksówką. Zaoszczędzę czas.
english: Maybe I'll take a cab. I'll save time.
glossary: to take a cab/to save money
translation: 7. Maybe I will go by taxi. I will save my time

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Co chcesz dostać na urodziny?
english: What do you want to get for your birthday?
glossary: to get sth for your birthday
translation: 8.What do you want to get for your birthday?

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Gdzie Ty wczoraj spałeś?
english: Where did you sleep yesterday?
glossary: to sleep
translation: 9. Where did you sleep last night?

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Stresowałem się, bo bałem się, że coś pójdzie źle.
english: I was stressed out because I was afraid something would go wrong.
glossary: to be stressed out/to be afraid of sth/to go wrong
translation: 10. I have been stressed because I was afraid that something goes wrong

name: Anette Gray
polish: Gdybyś była bardziej nieustępliwa, byłabyś w stanie udowodnić swoje racje.
english: If you were more persistent, you'd be able to prove your point.
glossary: to be persistent/to prove your point/to prove sth
translation: If you were more … you would be able to prove your point.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Mama nie byłaby teraz zła, gdybyś nie rozlał kawy na obrus.
english: Mom wouldn't be mad now if you hadn't spilled coffee on the tablecloth.
glossary: to be mad/to spill coffee/a tablecloth
translation: Mum wouldn’t have been angry now if you hadn’t spilled coffee on the tablecloth.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jaką zabawkę chcesz dostać na urodziny?
english: What toy would you like to get for your birthday?
glossary: to get sth for your birthday/a toy
translation: What a toy do you want to get for your birthday?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Przeziębiłem się w weekend.
english: I caught a cold on the weekend.
glossary: to catch a cold/on the weekend
translation: I caught a cold on the weekend.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Poczekaj, aż będziesz miał wszystkie potrzebne informacje.
english: Wait until you have all the information needed.
glossary: to have all the information needed
translation: Wait until you have all the information needed.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Słyszałem dziś, jak moja córka mówi po angielsku, i to skłoniło mnie do myślenia. Może też powinienem zapisać się na taki kurs.
english: I heard my daughter speaking English today, and it made me think. Maybe I should sign up for such a course as well.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to hear sb doing sth/to sign up for a course
translation: I heard my douther speak English and it convide me to think. Maybe, I should sign up for such a course.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jestem pewien, że się pojawię na imprezie.
english: I'm sure I'll show up at the party.
glossary: to be sure about sth/to show up/at the party/I'm sure that.../to show up at the party
translation: I’m sure I’ll show up at the party.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Mam nadzieję, że będziesz spędzał ze mną więcej czasu.
english: I hope you'll spend more time with me.
glossary: to spend time with sb
translation: I hope you’ll spend more time with me.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Mam nadzieję, że zdążę na pociąg. To ostatni.
english: I hope I'll catch the train. It's the last one.
glossary: to catch the train/to catch the last train
translation: I hope I’ll catch the train. It’s the last one.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Od zbyt dawna udajesz szczęśliwego.
english: You've been pretending to be happy for too long.
glossary: to pretend to be happy/for too long
translation: You’ve been pretending to be happy for too long.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Dlaczego skłamałeś, gdy cię kilka dni temu pytałam, czy spałeś z moją kumpelą?
english: Why did you lie when I asked you the other day if you'd slept with my friend?
glossary: to lie to sb/the other day/to sleep with sb
translation: Why did you lie when I asked you a few days ago if you slept with a friend of mine?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Boisz się przegrać sprawę?
english: Are you afraid of losing the case?
glossary: to be afraid of sth/to lose a case
translation: Are you afraid to lose a case?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Gdybyś gromadził dane w chmurze, nie musiałbyś teraz płacić za ich odzyskiwanie.
english: If you stored your data in the cloud, you wouldn't have to pay for restoring them now.
glossary: to store your data in the cloud/to restore data/to pay for sth
translation: If you gathered data in the cloud you wouldn't have to pay for the recovery.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Gdybyś tylko znał prawdę.
english: I wish you knew the truth.
glossary: I wish that...; If only.../to know the truth
translation: If only you knew the truth.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Do czego odnosi się artykuł?
english: What does the article refer to?
glossary: to refer to sth/an article
translation: What refere the article to?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Czy mógłbyś się skupić na robieniu pracy domowej?
english: Could you focus on doing your homework?
glossary: to focus on sth/to do your homework
translation: Could you focus on doing your homework?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Gdyby tylko to było możliwe.
english: I wish it were possible.
glossary: I wish that...; If only.../to be possible
translation: If only it would be possible.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Sugeruję, żebyśmy wyszli wcześniej.
english: I suggest that we leave earlier.
glossary: to suggest that.../to leave earlier
translation: I sugest we’ll leave elier.

name: Anette Gray
polish: W naszym miasteczku nie byłoby teraz tylu bezrobotnych ludzi, gdyby ostatnio nie zamknęła się jedna z największych fabryk.
english: There wouldn't be so many unemployed people in our town if one of the biggest factories hadn't recently shut down.
glossary: an unemployed person/to be unemployed/in our town/a factory/to shut down/recently
translation: There aren’t so many unemployed people if the one of biggest factory hadn’t closed.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Marzę o założeniu własnej firmy.
english: I dream of setting up my own company.
glossary: to dream of sth/to set up your own company
translation: I dream about setting up my own company.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Dlaczego dzwoniłeś wczoraj do mnie tyle razy?
english: Why did you call me so many times yesterday?
glossary: to call sb/many times
translation: Why did you call me yesterday so many times?

name: Jack Russell
polish: Z kim wczoraj poszedłeś na imprezę?
english: Who did you go to the party with yesterday?
glossary: to go to a party with sb
translation: Who did you go to the party with yesterday?

name: Jack Russell
polish: Nie powinnaś była składać obietnicy, jeśli wiedziałaś, że jej nie dotrzymasz.
english: You shouldn't have made the promise if you knew you wouldn't keep it.
glossary: to make a promise/to keep a promise
translation: You shouldn’t have made a promise if you knew that you wouldn’t keep it.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Jestem rozczarowana. Byłam pewna, że nie złamiesz obietnicy.
english: I'm disappointed. I was sure you wouldn't break the promise.
glossary: to be disappointed with sth/to be sure/to break a promise
translation: I’m disappointed. I was sure you wouldn’t break your promise.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Ufam ci, bo od dawna razem pracujemy.
english: I trust you because we've been working together for a long time.
glossary: to trust sb/for a long time
translation: I trust you because we have been working together for a long time.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Możemy porozmawiać, bo nie ma tu nikogo.
english: We can talk because there's nobody here.
glossary: to talk about sth
translation: I can talk, nobody's here.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Przeprowadzam się w przyszłym miesiącu na wieś. Nie mogę się doczekać.
english: I'm moving to the countryside next month. I can't wait.
glossary: can't wait/to move to the countryside
translation: I'm moving to the countryside next week. I can’t wait.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Jest kilka książek, które chciałbym przeczytać do końca roku.
english: There are a few books I'd like to read by the end of the year.
glossary: a few/to read a book/by the end of the year
translation: There are a few books, which I would like to read by the end of the year.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Mam nadzieję, że zdążę na pociąg. To ostatni.
english: I hope I'll catch the train. It's the last one.
glossary: to catch the train/to catch the last train
translation: I hope to make my train. This is the last one.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Od miesiąca szukam pracy, ale nie ma interesujących ofert.
english: I've been looking for a job for a month, but there are no interesting offers.
glossary: to look for a job/an offer
translation: I’ve been looking for a job for a month, but there aren't any interesting offers.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Kiedy się dowiedziałaś, że nie będziesz się kwalifikować do ubezpieczenia?
english: When did you find out that you wouldn't be eligible for insurance?
glossary: to find out about sth/to be eligible for sth/to be eligible for insurance
translation: When did you find out that you would not be qualified for insurance?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Kiedy brałem prysznic, wpadłem na świetny pomysł.
english: When I was taking a shower, I came up with a great idea.
glossary: to take a shower/to come up with sth/to come up with an idea
translation: When I was getting a shower, I got a great idea.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Gdybyś była bardziej nieustępliwa, byłabyś w stanie udowodnić swoje racje.
english: If you were more persistent, you'd be able to prove your point.
glossary: to be persistent/to prove your point/to prove sth
translation: If you were more tenacious, you would be able to prove your point.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Kiedy przypomniałaś mi, że zostawiłam klucze w samochodzie, poczułam ulgę.
english: When you reminded me I'd left the keys in the car, I felt relieved.
glossary: to remind sb sth; to remind sth to sb/to feel relieved
translation: When you reminded me that I left the keys in the car, I felt relieved.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Powinieneś być wdzięczny. Gdybym cię nie ostrzegł, dostałbyś mandat.
english: You should be grateful. If I hadn't warned you, you would've gotten a ticket.
glossary: to be grateful/to warn sb about sth/to get a ticket
translation: You should be grateful. If I didn’t warn you, you would get a ticket.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Zdziwiłem się, kiedy żona mi powiedziała, że chce się wyprowadzić.
english: I got surprised when my wife told me she wanted to move out.
glossary: to get surprised/to move out/a wife
translation: I was surprised when my wife said she wanted to move out.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Jeśli coś mi się nie spodoba, po prostu będę się trzymać od tego z daleka.
english: If I don't like anything, I'll simply stay away from it.
glossary: to stay away from sth
translation: If I don’t like anything, I just will stay away from it.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Jeszcze nigdy nie byłam na innym kontynencie.
english: I haven't been to a different continent yet.
glossary: a continent
translation: I’ve never been in a different continent yet.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Dlaczego na świecie jest tyle głodu?
english: Why is there so much hunger in the world?
glossary: hunger/in the world
translation: Why there is so much hunger in the world?

name: Martin Vance
polish: O co walczysz?
english: What are you fighting for?
glossary: to fight for sth
translation: What are you fighting about?

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Czy są w tym mieście jakieś miejsca, które powinienem odwiedzić?
english: Are there any places in the city I should visit?
glossary: in the city; in town/to visit a place
translation: Are there any places which I should visit?

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Gdzie jedziesz w tym roku na wakacje?
english: Where are you going on vacation this year?
glossary: to go on vacation/this year
translation: Were are you going on vacation this year?

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Mamy czas. Nie ma potrzeby się spieszyć.
english: We have time. There's no need to hurry up.
glossary: to have time/a need/to hurry up
translation: We have time. We don’t need to hurry.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że wrócę do domu dzisiaj, ale uciekł mi pociąg.
english: I hoped I'd come back home today, but I missed the train.
glossary: to hope/to come back home/today/to miss the train
translation: I hoped I would back today, but the train ran away.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Dlaczego tak zareagowałaś? Możesz mi to wytłumaczyć?
english: Why did you react like that? Can you explain it to me?
glossary: to react to sth/like that/to explain sth to sb
translation: Why you reacted like that? Can you explain me this?

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Mogłeś wcześniej zadzwonić. Powiedziałabym Ci, że nie ma mnie w domu.
english: You could've called before. I would've told you I wasn't at home.
glossary: to be at home/to call sb
translation: You cought call me earlier. I could told you, that I was out.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Z kim wczoraj rozmawiałeś przez telefon?
english: Who did you talk to on the phone yesterday?
glossary: to talk to sb over the phone
translation: With who did you talk one phone yesterday?

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Idziemy dziś wieczorem na drinka. Pamiętasz?
english: We're going for a drink tonight. Do you remember?
glossary: to remember/to go for a drink/tonight
translation: Are we going for drink tonigh? Do you remember?

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Obawiam się, że nie dostanę tej pracy.
english: I'm afraid I won't get the job.
glossary: to be afraid of sth/to get a job
translation: I’m fearing that I don’t get this job.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Z kim chcesz spędzić resztę swojego życia?
english: Who do you want to spend the rest of your life with?
glossary: to spend time with sb/the rest of your life
translation: With who do you want to spend the rest of your life?

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Obiecuję, że w przyszłym tygodniu odbiorę dzieci ze szkoły o czasie.
english: I promise I'll pick up the kids from school on time next week.
glossary: to promise/to pick up the kids from school/on time/next week
translation: I promise I pick up children from school on time next week.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Jestem naprawdę zajęty, więc nie sądzę, że uda mi się spotkać z tobą po pracy.
english: I'm really busy, so I don't think I'll manage to meet you after work.
glossary: to be busy/really/to manage to do sth/to meet sb/after work
translation: I’m really busy, I don’t think I could meet with you after work.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Jesteś zazdrosny, bo ja jadę na ten wyjazd, a ty nie możesz.
english: You're jealous because I'm going on the trip and you can't.
glossary: to be jealous of sb/to go on a trip
translation: You’re jealous becaouse I’m going for a trip and you can’t go.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Spotykam się jutro z nowym klientem, więc muszę się przygotować.
english: I'm meeting a new client tomorrow, so I have to get prepared.
glossary: to meet sb/a client/to get prepared
translation: We are meeting new client tommorow so I should prepare.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Wczoraj przypadkowo skasowałam z komputera wszystkie pliki.
english: I accidentally deleted all my files from the computer yesterday.
glossary: to do sth accidentally/to delete a file from the computer
translation: I accidentally deleted all files on computer yesterday.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Poczułam się rozczarowana, kiedy nowy menedżer powiedział mi, że jest żonaty.
english: I felt disappointed when the new manager told me he was married.
glossary: to feel disappointed/a manager/to be married
translation: I felt disappointed when the new manager told me that he is married.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Myślę, że powinieneś być bardziej cierpliwy wobec swoich dzieci.
english: I think you should be more patient with your children.
glossary: to be patient with sb
translation: I think you should be more patient for your children.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Znów boli mnie głowa. Muszę iść do lekarza.
english: I have a headache again. I have to go to the doctor.
glossary: to have a headache/to go to the doctor
translation: I’m having headache again. I should go to the doctor.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Nie musisz iść na randkę z tym gościem, jeśli nie chcesz.
english: You don't have to go on a date with the guy if you don't want to.
glossary: to go on a date with sb
translation: I don’t have to go on date with this guy if you dont want to.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Nie powinieneś jeść słodyczy. Są niezdrowe.
english: You shouldn't eat candy. It's unhealthy.
glossary: to eat candy/to be unhealthy
translation: You shouldn’t eat sweets. They aren’y healthy.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Fabryka rozpcznie produkcje, jak już zarząd na to pozwoli.
english: The factory will go ahead with the production once the board allows it.
glossary: to allow sth/to go ahead with the production/a factory/the board
translation: The factory will go ahead with the production once the management board allows it.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Zawsze chcesz, żeby wszyscy ci współczuli.
english: You always want everyone to feel for you.
glossary: to feel for sb
translation: You are always wanting everyone to feel for you.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Dopiłeś już swoją kawę do końca?
english: Have you drunk up your coffee yet?
glossary: to drink up your coffee
translation: Have you drunk up your coffee yet?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Mój lekarz rodzinny obiecał, że wciśnie mnie w grafik.
english: My GP promised he'd fit me in to his schedule.
glossary: to fit sb in to your schedule/a GP
translation: My GP promised to fit me up into the schedule.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Zapisujesz to? Nie mam zamiaru się powtarzać.
english: Are you taking it down? I'm not going to repeat myself.
glossary: to repeat yourself/to write sth down; to take sth down
translation: Are you writing it down? I’m not willing to repeat myself.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Kiedy pogodziłaś się z rodziną?
english: When did you make up with your family?
glossary: to make up with sb/a family
translation: When did you make up with your family?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Dlaczego twoim zdaniem ten raport wymaga analizy?
english: Why does the report call for an analysis in your opinion?
glossary: to call for an analysis/In my opinion...
translation: Why in your opinion does this report call for an analysis?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Mogłem podjąć się tej roli. Zarabiałbym teraz więcej.
english: I could've taken on the role. I'd earn more now.
glossary: to make money; to earn money/to take on a role
translation: I could have taken on this role. I would be earning more now

name: Margaret Usher
polish: W zeszłym miesiącu mi powiedziałaś, że ta praca cię wykańcza.
english: You told me last month that the job was wearing you down
glossary: to wear sb down/a job
translation: Last month you told me that this job was wearing you down.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Jeszcze rok temu bank utrzymywał, że wziąłem tę pożyczkę.
english: Only a year ago, the bank insisted that I'd taken out the loan.
glossary: to take out a loan/to insist that...
translation: Until a year ago, the bank maintained that I had taken out this loan.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Czy są w tym mieście jakieś miejsca, które powinienem odwiedzić?
english: Are there any places in the city I should visit?
glossary: in the city; in town/to visit a place
translation: 1. Are there any places in the city which I should visit?

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Gdzie jedziesz w tym roku na wakacje?
english: Where are you going on vacation this year?
glossary: to go on vacation/this year
translation: 2. Where will you go to the holiday these year?

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Mamy czas. Nie ma potrzeby się spieszyć.
english: We have time. There's no need to hurry up.
glossary: to have time/a need/to hurry up
translation: 3.We have time. There is no need to hurry up.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że wrócę do domu dzisiaj, ale uciekł mi pociąg.
english: I hoped I'd come back home today, but I missed the train.
glossary: to hope/to come back home/today/to miss the train
translation: 4.I hoped, that I come back today, but I missed the train

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Dlaczego tak zareagowałaś? Możesz mi to wytłumaczyć?
english: Why did you react like that? Can you explain it to me?
glossary: to react to sth/like that/to explain sth to sb
translation: 5. Why are you react like that? Could you explain it to me?

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Mogłeś wcześniej zadzwonić. Powiedziałabym Ci, że nie ma mnie w domu.
english: You could've called before. I would've told you I wasn't at home.
glossary: to be at home/to call sb
translation: 6. You could call earlier. I would tell you, that I am not at home.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Z kim wczoraj rozmawiałeś przez telefon?
english: Who did you talk to on the phone yesterday?
glossary: to talk to sb over the phone
translation: 7. Who you talked by the phone?

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Idziemy dziś wieczorem na drinka. Pamiętasz?
english: We're going for a drink tonight. Do you remember?
glossary: to remember/to go for a drink/tonight
translation: 8. We go for a drink today evening. Do you remember?

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Obawiam się, że nie dostanę tej pracy.
english: I'm afraid I won't get the job.
glossary: to be afraid of sth/to get a job
translation: 9. I am afraid, that I don't get this job

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Z kim chcesz spędzić resztę swojego życia?
english: Who do you want to spend the rest of your life with?
glossary: to spend time with sb/the rest of your life
translation: 10. With who you want to spend the rest of your life?

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Pojadę na wakacje, jak już oszczędzę pieniądze.
english: I'll go on vacation once I save some money.
glossary: to go on vacation/to save some money
translation: I will go on vacation once I have saved money

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Dam Ci znać, jak już skończę pracę.
english: I'll let you know once I finish work.
glossary: to let sb know/to finish work
translation: I will let you know once I have finished my work

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Muszę iść wcześnie spać, bo jutro robię prezentację.
english: I have to go to sleep early because I'm giving a presentation tomorrow.
glossary: to go to sleep early/to give a presentation
translation: I have to go sleep early because I am presenting tomorrow

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Myślałem, że będziesz tęsknić za domem.
english: I thought you'd feel homesick.
glossary: to feel homesick
translation: I thought you would miss home.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Zadzwonię do ciebie, jak już będę w domu.
english: I'll call you once I'm at home.
glossary: to call sb/to be at home
translation: I will call you once I am at home

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Wyjeżdżam jutro z miasta. Zadzwonię do ciebie, jak już wrócę.
english: I'm leaving town tomorrow. I'll call you once I'm back.
glossary: once/to leave town/to call sb
translation: I am leaving town  tomorrow. I will call you once I come back home.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Mogłem się nauczyć na test.
english: I could've studied for the test.
glossary: to study for a test
translation: I could learn for a test

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Odwiozę cię do domu, jak już zjemy kolację.
english: I'll take you home once we eat dinner.
glossary: to take sb home/to eat dinner
translation: I will drive you home once we have finished dinner/ we have dinner.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Oglądamy dzisiaj wieczorem mecz. Wpadnij.
english: We're watching a match tonight. Drop by.
glossary: to watch a match/to drop by
translation: We are watching match tonight.  Drop in.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Co powiesz na poniedziałek? W weekend zajmuję się psami mojej siostry.
english: What about Monday? I'm taking care of my sister's dogs on the weekend.
glossary: on the weekend/What about.../to take care of sth
translation: What about Monday? On the weekend I am taking care of my sister’s dog

name: Peter Kane
polish: Powinniśmy zostawić napiwek.
english: We should leave a tip.
glossary: to leave a tip
translation: We should leave a tip.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Mogę zorganizować imprezę, ale musisz mi pomóc.
english: I can have a party, but you have to help me.
glossary: to have a party/to help sb
translation: I can organize a party, but you have to help me.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Musimy porozmawiać o Twojej przyszłości.
english: We have to talk about your future.
glossary: to talk about sth/the future
translation: We have to talk about your future.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Chcę założyć własną firmę, ale mam za mało pieniędzy.
english: I want to start my own company, but I have too little money.
glossary: to start your own company/to have too little money
translation: I want to set up my own company, byt I have not enough money.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Spóźniłam się na autobus. Muszę wziąć taksówkę.
english: I missed the bus. I have to take a cab.
glossary: to miss the bus/to take a cab
translation: I was late for the bus. I have to take a taxi.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Mogę jechać z Tobą na imprezę, ale nie chcę pić.
english: I can go to the party with you, but I don't want to drink.
glossary: to go to a party/to drink alcohol
translation: I can go with you at the party, but I don`t feel like drinking.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Ta gra jest dla mnie ważna. Chcę ją wygrać.
english: The game is important to me. I want to win it.
glossary: a game/to be important to sb/to win sth
translation: The game is important to me. I want to win it.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Musimy trzymać się planu.
english: We have to stick to the plan.
glossary: to stick to the plan
translation: We have to keep the plan.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Potrzebuję pomocy. Musisz mi wyświadczyć przysługę.
english: I need help. You have to do me a favor.
glossary: to need help/to do sb a favor
translation: I need your help. You have to do a favor for me.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Na jutrzejszym spotkaniu powinieneś wspomnieć o problemie.
english: You should mention the problem at tomorrow's meeting.
glossary: to mention sth/a problem/at tomorrow's meeting
translation: You shoukd mention the problem at tommorow`s meeting.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Pasażerowie nie skończyliby w szpitalu, gdyby kierowca nie musiał ostro hamować.
english: The passengers wouldn't have ended up in the hospital if the driver hadn't had to slam on the brakes.
glossary: a passenger/to end up in the hospital/a driver/to slam on the brakes
translation: Passengers wouldn’t have ended up in the hospital if the driver didn’t have ……

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Ludzie by cię lubili, gdybyś przestał wyciągać pochopne wnioski na ich temat.
english: People would like you if you stopped jumping to conclusions about them.
glossary: to jump to conclusions about sth
translation: People would like you if you stopped jump into conclusions on them.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Nasza rozmowa była skoncentrowana na wyjaśnieniu sytuacji.
english: Our conversation was focused on explaining the situation.
glossary: to be focused on sth/a conversation/to explain the situation
translation: Our conversation was focused on explaining the situation.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Zaoszczędzilibyśmy pieniądze, gdybyśmy zarezerwowali bilety z wyprzedzeniem.
english: We would've saved money if we'd booked the tickets in advance.
glossary: to save money/to book tickets in advance
translation: We would have saved money if we had booked ticket early.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Ojciec by cię nie opieprzył, gdybyś nie podsłuchiwał jego rozmów.
english: Your father wouldn't have told you off if you hadn't eavesdropped on his conversations.
glossary: to tell sb off/to eavesdrop on a conversation; to listen in on a conversation
translation: Father wouldn’t have screwed you up if you hadn’t listen in on his onversations.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Żądam, aby zostały podjęte odpowiednie kroki.
english: I demand that the appropriate steps be taken.
glossary: to demand that.../to take appropriate steps/to take steps
translation: I demand to appropriate steps be taken.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Może kolega nie skopałby ci tyłka, gdybyś nie rozsiewał plotek.
english: Maybe your friend wouldn't have kicked your ass if you hadn't spread gossip.
glossary: to kick sb's ass/to spread gossip
translation: My friend wouldn't have kicked your ass if you didn't spread gossips.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Żona się mnie pytała kilka dni temu, czy kiedykolwiek ją zdradziłem.
english: My wife asked me the other day if I'd ever cheated on her.
glossary: a wife/the other day/to cheat on sb
translation: My wife asked me a few days ago if I had ever cheated on her.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Z czego się śmiejecie?
english: What are you laughing at?
glossary: to laugh at sth
translation: What are you laughing at?

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Nie miałbyś teraz kłopotów, gdybyś od czasu do czasu brał swoich rodziców na poważnie.
english: You wouldn't be in trouble now if you took your parents seriously from time to time.
glossary: to be in trouble/to take sb seriously/from time to time
translation: You wouldn't have troubles now if you listened to your parents from time to time.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Chciałbym obejrzeć film z rodziną.
english: I'd like to watch a movie with my family.
glossary: to watch a movie/with your family
translation: I would like to watch a movie with my family.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Chciałbym zmienić wkrótce pracę.
english: I'd like to change my job soon.
glossary: to change your job
translation: I would like to change my job soon.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Chciałbym wyjść na miasto i napić się drinka.
english: I'd like to go out and have a drink.
glossary: to go out/to have a drink
translation: I would like to go out, and drink a drink.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Chciałbym przeczytać w ciszy książkę.
english: I'd like to read a book in silence.
glossary: to read a book/in silence/
translation: I would like to read a book in silence.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Chciałbym za rok mówić płynnie po angielsku.
english: I'd like to speak English fluently in a year.
glossary: to speak English fluently/in a year
translation: I would like to speak English fluently in a year.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Chciałbym pojechać na wakacje samochodem.
english: I'd like to go on vacation by car.
glossary: to go on vacation/by car
translation: I would like to go on holidays by car.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Chciałbym dostać nowy telefon na święta.
english: I'd like to get a new cell phone for Christmas.
glossary: to get a new cell phone/for Christmas
translation: I would like to receive a new phone on Christmas.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Chciałbym cię zrozumieć, ale nie umiem.
english: I'd like to understand you, but I can't.
glossary: to understand sb
translation: I would like to understand you, but I can`t.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Chciałbym w tym miesiącu zaoszczędzić trochę pieniędzy.
english: I'd like to save some money this month.
glossary: to save some money
translation: I would like to save some money this year.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Chciałbym założyć swój własny biznes.
english: I'd like to set up my own business.
glossary: to set up your own business
translation: I would like to set up my own business.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Dlaczego dzwoniłeś wczoraj do mnie tyle razy?
english: Why did you call me so many times yesterday?
glossary: to call sb/many times
translation: 1. Why you called me so many times?

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Z kim wczoraj poszedłeś na imprezę?
english: Who did you go to the party with yesterday?
glossary: to go to a party with sb
translation: 2. With who you went to the party yesterday?

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Nie powinnaś była składać obietnicy, jeśli wiedziałaś, że jej nie dotrzymasz.
english: You shouldn't have made the promise if you knew you wouldn't keep it.
glossary: to make a promise/to keep a promise
translation: 3. You shoudn't have made a promise if you knew that you woudn't keep it.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Jestem rozczarowana. Byłam pewna, że nie złamiesz obietnicy.
english: I'm disappointed. I was sure you wouldn't break the promise.
glossary: to be disappointed with sth/to be sure/to break a promise
translation: 4. I'm dissapointed. I was sure, you woudn't break a promise.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Ufam ci, bo od dawna razem pracujemy.
english: I trust you because we've been working together for a long time.
glossary: to trust sb/for a long time
translation: 5. I trust you beacuse we've been working together for a long time.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Możemy porozmawiać, bo nie ma tu nikogo.
english: We can talk because there's nobody here.
glossary: to talk about sth
translation: 6. We can talk beacuse no one is here.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Przeprowadzam się w przyszłym miesiącu na wieś. Nie mogę się doczekać.
english: I'm moving to the countryside next month. I can't wait.
glossary: can't wait/to move to the countryside
translation: 7. I move to the countryside next month. I can't wait.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Jest kilka książek, które chciałbym przeczytać do końca roku.
english: There are a few books I'd like to read by the end of the year.
glossary: a few/to read a book/by the end of the year
translation: 8. There are a few books which I'd like to read by the end of the year.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Mam nadzieję, że zdążę na pociąg. To ostatni.
english: I hope I'll catch the train. It's the last one.
glossary: to catch the train/to catch the last train
translation: 9. I hope I catch a train. This is the last one.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Od miesiąca szukam pracy, ale nie ma interesujących ofert.
english: I've been looking for a job for a month, but there are no interesting offers.
glossary: to look for a job/an offer
translation: 10. I have been looking for a job for a month, but there aren't interesting offers

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Jak długo wkuwasz do egzaminu? Ja nawet jeszcze nie zacząłem.
english: How long have you been cramming for the exam? I haven't even started yet.
glossary: to cram for the exam
translation: 1.	How long have you been studying for the exam? I haven’t even started yet.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Jakich zasad musi przestrzegać moja firma, aby otrzymać dotację?
english: What rules does my company have to comply with to receive the subsidy?
glossary: to comply with sth/a subsidy
translation: 2.	What rules my company has to follow to get the donation?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Jaki wpływ miał na Ciebie wypadek?
english: What impact did the accident have on you?
glossary: to have an impact on sb/an accident
translation: 3.	What did the accident influence you?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Nauczyciel miał kupić płótno. Jak mam teraz malować?
english: The teacher was supposed to buy canvas. How am I supposed to paint now?
glossary: canvas/to paint
translation: 4.	The teacher was supposed to buy a canvas. How am I supposed to paint now?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Od czego zależy sukces?
english: What does success depend on?
glossary: to depend on sth/a success
translation: 5.	What does success depend on?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Nigdy mnie nie słuchasz. Jak mamy się komunikować?
english: You never listen to me. How are we supposed to communicate?
glossary: to listen to sb/to communicate
translation: 6.	You’re never listening to me. How can we communicate?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Zawsze pracujesz do późna. Nie zależy ci na swojej rodzinie?
english: You're always working late. Don't you care about your family?
glossary: to work late/to care about your family
translation: 7.	You’re always working late. Don’t you care of your family?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Mamy nadzieję, że nasz film pomoże społeczeństwu uświadomić sobie problem przemocy domowej.
english: We hope that our movie will help society realize the problem of domestic violence.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to realize sth/domestic violence
translation: 8.	I hope that our movie will help society to realize the problem of home violence.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Zawsze przeceniasz swoje umiejętności i później wpadamy w kłopoty.
english: You're always overestimating your abilities, and then we get in trouble.
glossary: to overestimate sth/to get in trouble
translation: 9.	You’re always overestimating your skills, and then we get in the trouble.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Czego Twój ojciec nie pochwala?
