english: What people do you value the most?
glossary: to value sb
translation: What kind of people do you value the most?

name: Yvonne West
polish: Nie musiałbyś mi teraz przeszkadzać, gdybyś zapisał tę informację.
english: You wouldn't have to disturb me now if you had noted down this information.
glossary: to disturb sb/to note down information
translation: You wouldn’t  have to disturb me now if you’d written down that information.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Trudno mi było udowodnić swoją rację.
english: It was hard for me to prove my point.
glossary: to prove your point
translation: It was hard for me to prove my point.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Nie dostaniesz podwyżki, dopóki nie zaczniesz traktować swojej pracy poważnie.
english: You won't be given a pay raise until you start treating your job seriously.
glossary: a pay rise/to treat sth seriously
translation: You won’t get a pay-raise until you don’t treat your job seriously.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Twoja firma by się rozwijała, gdyby twoi pracownicy nie byli cały czas bezczynni.
english: Your company would thrive if your employees weren't idle all the time.
glossary: to thrive/to be idle/all the time
translation: Your company would be expanded if your employees weren’t idle all the time.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Przygotuję się na spotkanie, jeśli będę mieć czas.
english: I'll get prepared for the meeting if I have time.
glossary: to get prepared for a meeting
translation: I will prepare for the meeting if I have time.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Na twoim miejscu nie chodziłbym spać tak późno.
english: If I were you, I wouldn't go to sleep so late.
glossary: to go to sleep late
translation: I wouldn't go to bed so late if I were you.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Gdybyś nie popełnił tego przestępstwa, policja by cię teraz nie szukała.
english: If you hadn't committed the crime, the police wouldn't be looking for you now.
glossary: to look for sb/to commit a crime
translation: If you hadn't committed this crime, the police wouldn't be looking for you now.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: O czym musimy porozmawiać?
english: What do we have to talk about?
glossary: to talk about sth
translation: What do we have to talk about?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Dlaczego jest tyle głosów przeciwko temu kandydatowi?
english: Why are there so many votes against the candidate?
glossary: a vote against sb/a candidate
translation: Why are there so many votes against this candidate?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Kogo spotkałeś, kiedy wychodziłeś z budynku?
english: Who did you meet when you were leaving the building?
glossary: to meet sb/to leave the building
translation: Who did you meet when you left the building?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Zrobiłaś test ciążowy?
english: Did you do a pregnancy test?
glossary: to do a pregnancy test/a pregnancy test
translation: Did you take a pregnancy test?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Dowiedziałem się wczoraj, że mój szef pracował wcześniej w agencji nieruchomości.
english: I found out yesterday that my boss had worked at a real estate agency before.
glossary: a real estate agency/to find out that.../a boss
translation: I found out yesterday that my boss used to work at a real estate agency.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Wszyscy się mnie wczoraj pytali, czy jestem zły. Nie wiem dlaczego.
english: Everybody asked me yesterday if I was mad. I don't know why.
glossary: to be mad at sb
translation: Everyone asked me yesterday that I was angry. I don't know why.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Często podróżowaliśmy z mężem, zanim urodziło się nasze pierwsze dziecko.
english: My husband and I had often traveled before our first kid was born.
glossary: to be born/a kid/to travel/a husband
translation: My husband and I traveled often before our first child was born.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Kiedy wróciłaś do miasta?
english: When did you get back to town?
glossary: to get back to town
translation: When did you come back to town?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nigdy nie bierzesz pod uwagę moich sugestii. Czy w ogóle zależy Ci na mojej opinii?
english: You never consider my suggestions. Do you even care about my opinion?
glossary: to consider sth/a suggestion/to care about sth
translation: You never consider my sugestions. Do you care about my opinion at all?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Od dawna tu pracuję.
english: I've been working here for a long time.
glossary: to work
translation: I’ve been working here for a long time.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Dlaczego powinienem cię posłuchać?
english: Why should I listen to you?
glossary: to listen to sb
translation: Why should I follow your advice?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Obiecuję, że nie zrobię nic głupiego.
english: I promise I won't do anything stupid.
glossary: to do sth stupid
translation: I promise I won’t do nothing stupid.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Co mi chciałaś powiedzieć na imprezie?
english: What did you want to tell me at the party?
glossary: to tell sb sth/at the party
translation: What you wanted to tell me at the party?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Czy ty mnie okłamujesz?
english: Are you lying to me?
glossary: to lie to sb
translation: Are you lying me?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie ma powodu, dla którego powinieneś rzucać pracę.
english: There's no reason why you should quit your job.
glossary: It's the reason why.../a reason why.../to quit your job
translation: There is no reason why you should leave your job.

name: Anette Gray
polish: W tym miesiącu jest kilkoro nowych klientów.
english: There are a few new clients this month.
glossary: a client/this month
translation: There are a few new clients this week.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Pozwę cię. Zobaczysz.
english: I'll sue you. You'll see.
glossary: to sue sb/to see sth
translation: I’ll sue you. You’ll see.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Niestety nie mogę ci polecić żadnego interesującego filmu.
english: Unfortunately, I can't recommend any interesting movie to you.
glossary: Unfortunately.../to recommend sth to sb/an interesting movie
translation: Unfortunetly, I can’t recommend you any interesting movie to you.

name: Anette Gray
polish: O czym zarząd nie wie?
english: What doesn't the management board know about?
glossary: to know about sth/a management board
translation: What about the management board don’t know?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Kogo chcesz, żebym zaprosił na imprezę?
english: Who do you want me to invite to the party?
glossary: to invite sb to a party
translation: Who do you want, I invite to the party?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Gdzie jedziesz w tym roku na wakacje?
english: Where are you going on vacation this year?
glossary: to go on vacation/this year
translation: Where are you going on vacation this year?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Obiecuję, że następnym razem będę się lepiej zachowywał.
english: I promise I'll behave better next time.
glossary: to behave/next time/to promise sb sth; to promise sth to sb
translation: I promise I’ll behave better next time.

name: Anette Gray
polish: O co prokurator okręgowy chce cię oskarżyć?
english: What does the district attorney want to charge you with?
glossary: a district attorney/to charge sb with sth
translation: What the ………. want you ….?

name: Anette Gray
polish: W czym jesteś dobry?
english: What are you good at?
glossary: to be good at sth
translation: What are you good at?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Z jakimi problemami musi się zmierzyć ofiara przemocy domowej? Czy wiesz?
english: What issues does a victim of domestic violence have to deal with? Do you know?
glossary: to deal with an issue/a victim of sth/domestic violence
translation: What problems, a victim of home violence have to deal with? Do you know?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Mogłeś wcześniej zadzwonić. Powiedziałabym Ci, że nie ma mnie w domu.
english: You could've called before. I would've told you I wasn't at home.
glossary: to be at home/to call sb
translation: You could've called before. I would tell you I’m not at home.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Dlaczego nie pojawiłeś się na ostatnim spotkaniu?
english: Why didn't you show up at the last meeting?
glossary: to show up at a meeting
translation: Why didn’t you show up at the last meeting?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie musielibyśmy płacić teraz odsetek, gdybyś nie zapomniał o ostatniej racie.
english: We wouldn't have to pay interest now if you hadn't forgotten about the last rate.
glossary: to pay interest/to forgot about sth
translation: We wouldn’t pay the interest now if you wouldn’t have forgotten about the last …

name: Anette Gray
polish: Twój zespół byłby bardziej efektywny, gdybyś wiedział, jak motywować ludzi.
english: Your team would be more effective if you knew how to motivate people.
glossary: to be efficient/to motivate sb/a team
translation: Your team would be more effective if you know how to motivate people.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Wczoraj znalazłam korepetytora dla moich dzieci.
english: I found a private tutor for my children yesterday.
glossary: to find a private tutor/a private tutor/children
translation: Yesterday, I found a private tutor for my kids.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Czy jest tu ktoś zainteresowany tym tematem?
english: Is there anyone here interested in the subject?
glossary: to be interested in a subject
translation: Is there anyone who is interested in the subject?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Będę bardziej surowy następnym razem. Obiecuję.
english: I'll be more strict next time. I promise.
glossary: to be strict/next time/to promise sth
translation: I’ll be more strict next time. I promise.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie wchodź. W pokoju jest bałagan.
english: Don't enter. There's a mess in the room.
glossary: a mess/to enter the room
translation: Don’t enter. There is a mess in the room.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Na twoim miejscu bym się nie czepiał. To może się obrócić przeciwko tobie.
english: I wouldn't nitpick if I were you. It can turn against you.
glossary: to nitpick/to turn against sb
translation: If I were you I wouldn’t … . It can turn against you.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Obiecałaś, że zrobisz mi dzisiaj włosy.
english: You promised you'd do my hair today.
glossary: to promise sb sth; to promise to sb/to do your hair/today
translation: You promised, you would do my hair.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie zapłaciłam rachunków w zeszłym miesiącu, bo nie miałam żadnych pieniędzy.
english: I didn't pay the bills last month because I didn't have any money.
glossary: to pay the bills
translation: I didn’t pay the bills last month because I didn’t have any money.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jestem pewna, że kiedyś mnie zrozumiesz.
english: I'm sure you'll understand me one day.
glossary: to understand sb/one day
translation: I’m sure you will understand me once.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Miałem w zeszłym tygodniu dużo pracy i bałem się, że nie wyrobię się z terminem.
english: I had a lot of work last week and I was afraid I wouldn't meet the deadline.
glossary: to have a lot of work/last week/to be afraid of sth/to meet the deadline
translation: How many coworkers were at the meeting last week?

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Nie powinieneś był wspominać o naszych problemach na spotkaniu z szefem.
english: You shouldn't have mentioned our problems at the meeting with the boss.
glossary: at the meeting/to mention sth
translation: What do you have a weakness to?

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Przyjeżdżam jutro do Warszawy i zatrzymuję się u mojej koleżanki.
english: I'm coming to Warsaw tomorrow and staying at my friend's.
glossary: to come to Warsaw
translation: I'm eating lunch with my boss tomorrow.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Nie powinieneś był opowiadać tego żartu. Był niegrzeczny.
english: You shouldn't have told the joke. It was rude.
glossary: to be rude to sb/to tell sb a joke
translation: If I had been granted a loan, I'd be able to conduct the test finally.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że nic nie będę musiał dzisiaj robić.
english: I hoped I wouldn't have to do anything today.
glossary: to hope/today
translation: I'd drink tea more often if I liked my neighbors.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Powinienem był spędzić zeszły weekend z rodziną.
english: I should've spent my last weekend with my family.
glossary: to spend time with sb/last weekend/a family
translation: I'd stick to the initial plan if cases hadn't gotten out of control.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Nie powinienem był Ci opowiadać tej historii, bo jest zbyt prywatna.
english: I shouldn't have told you the story because it's too private.
glossary: to tell sb a story/to be private
translation: I don't understand why are you mad at me.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że ci klienci zostawią większy napiwek.
english: I hoped the customers would leave a bigger tip.
glossary: to leave a tip/a customer/to hope
translation: I should reach the meeting with my client on time.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Nie powinieneś był mnie okłamywać.
english: You shouldn't have lied to me.
glossary: to lie to sb
translation: When we met last time, I thought you would tell mi the truth.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Co robisz dziś wieczorem?
english: What are you doing tonight?
translation: Gratulations. I've already heard the news.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Mam nadzięję, że wrócisz do pracy do końca miesiąca.
english: I hope you'll come back to work by the end of the month.
glossary: to come back to work/by the end of the month/I hope that...
translation: I hope you’ll come back to the office by the end of the month.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie będę taki przepracowany, kiedy skończy się sezon.
english: I won't be this overworked when this season ends.
glossary: to be overworked/to end
translation: I won’t be overworked when the season is finished.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie powinnam była na ciebie krzyczeć. Musiałeś czuć się rozczarowany.
english: I shouldn't have shouted at you. You must've felt disappointed.
glossary: to scream at sb; to shout at sb/to feel disappointed
translation: I shouldn’t have screamed at you. You should’ve felt disappointed.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Powinieneś być wdzięczny. Gdybym cię nie ostrzegł, dostałbyś mandat.
english: You should be grateful. If I hadn't warned you, you would've gotten a ticket.
glossary: to be grateful/to warn sb about sth/to get a ticket
translation: You should be gradeful. You would’ve gotten a ticket if I hadn’t warned you.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Klient dodzwoniłby się do nas, gdyby szefowa uaktualniła nasze dane kontaktowe.
english: The client would have called us back if boss had updated our contact details.
glossary: a client/to call sb back/a boss/to update contact details
translation: The client would’ve reached us if the boss updated our contact data.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Powinieneś przeczytać przynajmniej jedną książkę w miesiącu.
english: You should read at least one book a month.
glossary: to read a book/once a month/at least
translation: You should read at least one book a month.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Zapisałem się w zeszłym tygodniu na zajęcia z hiszpańskiego.
english: I signed up for Spanish classes last week.
glossary: to sign up for Spanish classes/last week
translation: I signed up for Spanish classes last week.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Moi rodzice zmusili mnie do chodzenia na treningi piłkarskie, kiedy byłem dzieckiem. Dlatego teraz tego nienawidzę.
english: My parents made me go to soccer practice when I was a kid. That's why I hate it now.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to go to soccer practice
translation: My parents forced me to be going to soccer training when I was a kid. It’s the reason why I hate it now.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Zamknij się. Cały dzień gadasz.
english: Shut up. You've been talking all day.
glossary: all day/to talk/to shut up
translation: Shout up. You’re speaking all day.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Pracujesz jutro z domu czy musisz iść do biura?
english: Are you working from home tomorrow or do you have to go to the office?
glossary: to work from home/to go to the office
translation: Are you working from home tomorrow or do you have to go to the office?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Policja nie zatrzymałaby cię, gdybyś włączył światła.
english: The police wouldn't have pulled you over if you'd turned on the headlights.
glossary: to turn on the headlights/to pull sb over/the police
translation: The police wouldn’t have pulled you over if you had turned on the headlights.

name: Anette Gray
polish: W przyszłym tygodniu jadę za granicę. Podlejesz kwiatki?
english: I'm going abroad next week. Will you water the plants?
glossary: to water plants/to go abroad/next week
translation: I’m going abroad next week. Will you water the plants?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Powinieneś trenować więcej, żeby być w formie.
english: You should work out more to be in shape.
glossary: to work out/to be in shape
translation: You should train more to be in shape.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jak długo wkuwasz do egzaminu? Ja nawet jeszcze nie zacząłem.
english: How long have you been cramming for the exam? I haven't even started yet.
glossary: to cram for the exam
translation: How long have you been studying for an exam? I didn't even start.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Chciałabym, żebyś wygłosił przemowę na konferencji.
english: I'd like you to give a speech at the conference.
glossary: to give a speech/at the conference
translation: I’d like you to give a speech at the conference.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Dawno cię nie widziałam. Musisz wpaść w tym tygodniu.
english: I haven't seen you for a long time. You have to drop by this week.
glossary: to drop by/for a long time/this week
translation: I haven’t seen you in a long time. You have to drop by this week.

name: Anette Gray
polish: W pewnym momencie zauważyłam błąd.
english: At some point, I noticed a mistake.
glossary: At some point.../to notice a mistake
translation: At some point, I noticed a mistake.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Idziemy dzisiaj wieczorem na imprezę. Szykuj się.
english: We're going to a party tonight. Get ready.
glossary: to get ready/to go to a party
translation: We’re going to a party tonight. Get ready.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Gdzie dorastałeś?
english: Where did you grow up?
glossary: to grow up
translation: Where did you grow up?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jakie doświadczenie ostatnie przeprowadziliście?
english: What experiment did you last run?
glossary: to run an experiment
translation: What last experiment did you perform?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Dlaczego jest tylu ludzi, którzy żyją w ubóstwie?
english: Why are there so many people who live in poverty?
glossary: to live in poverty
translation: Why are there so many people who live in poverty?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Od czego zależy sukces?
english: What does success depend on?
glossary: to depend on sth/a success
translation: From what does success depend?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jakie środki podjął rząd, aby zapobiec epidemii?
english: What measures did the government take to prevent the epidemic?
glossary: to take measures to do sth/to prevent sth
translation: What … took the government to prevent the pandemic.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jakie teksty zazwyczaj musisz tłumaczyć?
english: What texts do you usually have to translate?
glossary: to translate a text
translation: What text usually do you have to translate?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Co pieczesz? Ładnie pachnie.
english: What are you baking? It smells nice.
glossary: to bake/to smell
translation: What are you baking? Nice smell.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Miałam nadzieję, że przemyślisz swoje zachowanie.
english: I hoped you'd think over your behavior.
glossary: to think over your behavior
translation: I hoped you’d think over your behavior.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie musiałbyś iść teraz do bankomatu, gdybyś wcześniej wypłacić pieniądze.
english: You wouldn't have to go to the cash machine now if you had withdrawn money earlier.
glossary: to go to the cash machine/to withdraw money/a rate
translation: You wouldn’t have to go to the ATM now if you had taken money earlier.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Mój biznes miał prosperować. Przynajmniej taki był plan.
english: My business was supposed to thrive. At least, that was the plan.
glossary: to thrive
translation: My business supossed to work. At least, there was such a plan.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie ma takiej zasady.
english: There's no such rule.
glossary: a rule
translation: There is no such rule.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie mogę się doczekać. Kiedy otwieracie?
english: I can't wait. When are you opening?
glossary: to wait/to open
translation: Can’t wait. When is the opening?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Szef zasugerował, żeby nasz zespół został dzisiaj po godzinach.
english: The boss suggested that our team work overtime today.
glossary: to suggest that.../to work overtime
translation: My boss suggested our team worked overtime.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Rodzice zasugerowali, żebym się wyprowadził. Sądzą, że powinienem dorosnąć.
english: My parents suggested that I move out. They think I should grow up.
glossary: to suggest that.../to move out/to grow up
translation: My parents suggested I move out. They think I should grow up.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nauczycielka zasugerowała, żebym poszła na studia.
english: My teacher suggested that I go to college.
glossary: to suggest that.../a teacher/to go to college
translation: The teacher suggested I go to college.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Kogo następnie będziemy operować?
english: Who are we going to operate on next?
glossary: to operate on sb
translation: Who next do we operate on?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Gdybyście wystawili fakturę na czas, pieniądze byłyby już na waszym koncie.
english: If you'd issued the invoice on time, the money would already be in your bank account.
glossary: to issue an invoice/on time/in your bank account
translation: If you had made an invoice on time the money would’ve already been on your account.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Boję się stracić pracę.
english: I'm afraid of losing my job.
glossary: to be afraid of sth/to lose your job
translation: I’m afraid of losing the job.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Sugeruję, żebyś zrobił swoją pracę domową dzisiaj. Jutro nie będziesz miał czasu.
english: I suggest that you do your homework today. You won't have time tomorrow.
glossary: to suggest that.../to do your homework/to have time to do sth
translation: I suggest you do your homework today. Tomorrow, you won’t have time.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Doktor nie odpowiedział, gdy go wczoraj zapytałam, czy zbadał już pacjentkę.
english: The doctor didn't answer when I asked him yesterday if he'd examined the patient yet.
glossary: a doctor/to answer a question/to examine a patient
translation: The doctor didn’t answer when I asked him yesterday if he already examined the patient.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Opowiem ci historię o okłamywaniu ludzi.
english: I'll tell you a story about lying to people.
glossary: to tell sb a story/to lie to sb
translation: I told you a story about laying people

name: Anette Gray
polish: Gdyby nasza firma chciała być przyjazna dla środowiska, przestałaby przeprowadzać testy na zwierzętach.
english: If our company wanted to be environment-friendly, it would stop conducting tests on animals.
glossary: a company/to be environment-friendly/to conduct tests on animals
translation: If our company wanted to be enviroment friandly it would stop conducting tests on animals.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Dlaczego skłamałeś, gdy cię kilka dni temu pytałam, czy spałeś z moją kumpelą?
english: Why did you lie when I asked you the other day if you'd slept with my friend?
glossary: to lie to sb/the other day/to sleep with sb
translation: 1. Dlaczego skłamałeś, gdy cię kilka dni temu pytałam, czy spałeś z moją kumpelą? Why did you lie to me when I asked a while ago if you slept with my friend?

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Boisz się przegrać sprawę?
english: Are you afraid of losing the case?
glossary: to be afraid of sth/to lose a case
translation: 2. Boisz się przegrać sprawę? Are you affraid to lose the case?

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Gdybyś gromadził dane w chmurze, nie musiałbyś teraz płacić za ich odzyskiwanie.
english: If you stored your data in the cloud, you wouldn't have to pay for restoring them now.
glossary: to store your data in the cloud/to restore data/to pay for sth
translation: 3. Gdybyś gromadził dane w chmurze, nie musiałbyś teraz płacić za ich odzyskiwanie. If you stare data in cloud you wouldn't have paid for get it back.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Gdybyś tylko znał prawdę.
english: I wish you knew the truth.
glossary: I wish that...; If only.../to know the truth
translation: 4. Gdybyś tylko znał prawdę. If only you know truth.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Do czego odnosi się artykuł?
english: What does the article refer to?
glossary: to refer to sth/an article
translation: 5. Do czego odnosi się artykuł? What to reffer the article?

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Czy mógłbyś się skupić na robieniu pracy domowej?
english: Could you focus on doing your homework?
glossary: to focus on sth/to do your homework
translation: 6. Czy mógłbyś się skupić na robieniu pracy domowej? Can you focus on doing homework?

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Gdyby tylko to było możliwe.
english: I wish it were possible.
glossary: I wish that...; If only.../to be possible
translation: 7. Gdyby tylko to było możliwe. If only it would be posible.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Sugeruję, żebyśmy wyszli wcześniej.
english: I suggest that we leave earlier.
glossary: to suggest that.../to leave earlier
translation: 8. Sugeruję, żebyśmy wyszli wcześniej. I sugest that we live erlier.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: W naszym miasteczku nie byłoby teraz tylu bezrobotnych ludzi, gdyby ostatnio nie zamknęła się jedna z największych fabryk.
english: There wouldn't be so many unemployed people in our town if one of the biggest factories hadn't recently shut down.
glossary: an unemployed person/to be unemployed/in our town/a factory/to shut down/recently
translation: 9. W naszym miasteczku nie byłoby teraz tylu bezrobotnych ludzi, gdyby ostatnio nie zamknęła się jedna z największych fabryk. We wouldn't have so many unpolyed in our town if the one of the biggest fabric woudn't be closed a while ago.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Marzę o założeniu własnej firmy.
english: I dream of setting up my own company.
glossary: to dream of sth/to set up your own company
translation: 10. Marzę o założeniu własnej firmy. I dream about start a comapny.

name: George West
polish: Mój współpracownik nigdy nie zwraca uwagi na szczegóły. Zawsze muszę poprawiać jego zadania.
english: My coworker never pays attention to detail. I always have to correct his tasks.
glossary: to pay attention to detail/to correct sth
translation: 1.	My coworker never pays attention to details. I always have to correct his tasks.

name: George West
polish: Jak długo umniejszasz moje osiągnięcia? Nie będę już tego znosić.
english: How long have you been diminishing my accomplishments? I won't put up with it anymore.
glossary: to diminish sth/to put up with sth
translation: 2.	How long have you been playing down a significance of my achievments? I'm not going to stand it.

name: George West
polish: Jak długo żujesz tę gumę? Weź nową.
english: How long have you been chewing this gum? Take a new one.
glossary: to chew a gum/to take a new one
translation: 3.	How long have you been chewing the gum? Take a new one.

name: George West
polish: Słyszałem dziś, jak moja córka mówi po angielsku, i to skłoniło mnie do myślenia. Może też powinienem zapisać się na taki kurs.
english: I heard my daughter speaking English today, and it made me think. Maybe I should sign up for such a course as well.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to hear sb doing sth/to sign up for a course
translation: 4.	I heard my daughter speaking English today and it made me think. Maybe I should also take up the course?

name: George West
polish: O co prokurator okręgowy chce cię oskarżyć?
english: What does the district attorney want to charge you with?
glossary: a district attorney/to charge sb with sth
translation: 5.	What does the district attorney want to accuse you of?

name: George West
polish: Powinniśmy teraz nosić maseczki w sklepach.
english: We are supposed to wear face masks in stores now.
glossary: to wear face masks
translation: 6.	We should wear masks in stores now.

name: George West
polish: Jak długo tyle bierzesz? Ostatnim razem, kiedy się spotkaliśmy, było taniej.
english: How long have you been charging this much? The last time we met it was cheaper.
glossary: to charge sb
translation: 7.	How long have you been taking that much? Last time we met it was cheaper.

name: George West
polish: Od jak dawna chwalisz się swoim nowym samochodem? Czy nie widzisz, że wszyscy mają dość?
english: How long have you been bragging about your new car? Can't you see everyone's fed up?
glossary: to brag about sth/to be fed up with sth
translation: 8.	How long have you been bragging about your car? Don’t you see that everybody’s fed up with that?

name: George West
polish: Dlaczego akcje Twojej firmy spadły? Czy coś się stało?
english: Why did your company's shares drop? Did anything happen?
glossary: to drop/a share
translation: 9.	Why did your company’s stock drop? Something happened?

name: George West
polish: Mieliśmy się zmieniać, nieprawdaż?
english: We were supposed to take turns, weren't we?
glossary: to take turns
translation: 10.	We were supposed to take turns, weren’t we?

name: George West
polish: Jak długo już nalegasz? Nie rozumiesz, że Ci tego nie dam?
english: How long have you been insisting yet? Don't you understand I won't give it?
glossary: to insist
translation: 1.	How long have you been insisting? Don’t you understand that I won’t give you that?

name: George West
polish: O której wylądował samolot? Nie miał przybyć później?
english: What time did the plane land? Wasn't it supposed to arrive later?
glossary: to land/a plane/to arrive later
translation: 2.	What time did the plane land? Wasn’t it supposed to arrive earlier?

name: George West
polish: Twoja partia miała mnie wesprzeć w następnych wyborach.
english: Your party was supposed to back me during the next election.
glossary: to back sb/a party/an election
translation: 3.	Your party was supposed to suport me in the next elections.

name: George West
polish: Nigdy nie pozwalasz mi chodzić na imprezy. Nie jestem już dzieckiem.
english: You never let me go to parties. I'm not a kid anymore.
glossary: to let sb do sth
translation: 4.	You are never letting me go to the parties. I’m not a child anymore.

name: George West
polish: Jak długo zaprzeczasz prawdzie? Czy to nie najwyższy czas, żeby się z tym zmierzyć?
english: How long have you been denying the truth? Isn't it high time to face it?
glossary: to deny the truth/to face sth
translation: 5.	How long have you been denying the truth? Isn’t it the highest time to face it?

name: George West
polish: Nikt nie zmuszał Cię do wybrania tego kursu, więc przestań narzekać.
english: No one made you choose that course, so stop complaining.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to complain about sth
translation: 6.	Nobody forced you to choose the program, so stop complaining.

name: George West
polish: Miałem naładować komórkę, ale zupełnie zapomniałem.
english: I was supposed to charge my cell phone, but I totally forgot.
glossary: to charge your cell phone
translation: 7.	I was supposed to chargé my cell-phone, but I completely forgot.

name: George West
polish: Czym zwykle skutkuje takie zachowanie?
english: What does such behavior usually result in?
glossary: behavior/to result in sth
translation: 8.	What does usually result such a behavior in?

name: George West
polish: Mój mąż miał złożyć łóżeczko do kupy, ale był zbyt leniwy.
english: My husband was supposed to put the crib together, but he was too lazy.
glossary: to put sth together/to be too lazy to do sth
translation: 9.	My husband was supposed to put a crib toghether, but he was too lazy.

name: George West
polish: Od jak dawna próbujesz wprowadzić swój pierwszy produkt? Chyba minął już rok.
english: How long have you been trying to roll out your first product? I guess it's been a year now.
glossary: to roll sth out
translation: 10.	For how long have you been trying to launch your first product? Probably, a year has passed.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Nie wychodź, dopóki nie skończysz raportu.
english: Don't leave until you're finished with your report.
glossary: to be finished with sth/a report
translation: Don’t leave until you finish the report.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Nie byłbyś spłukany, gdyby koledzy nie namówili cię na pójście do klubu.
english: You wouldn't be broke now if your friends hadn't talked you into going to a club.
glossary: to be broke/to talk sb into sth
translation: You wouldn’t be broke if your friends hadn't persuaded you to go to the club.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Nie mogę się doczekać. Kiedy otwieracie?
english: I can't wait. When are you opening?
glossary: to wait/to open
translation: I can’t wait. When are you opening?

name: Yvonne West
polish: Trudno mi było nie przeklinać, bo byłem naprawdę wkurwiony.
english: It was hard for me not to swear because I was genuinely pissed off.
glossary: to swear/to be genuinely pissed off
translation: It was hard not to    because I was really pissed off.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Nie przypaliłbyś jedzenia, gdybyś nie rozmawiał z kolegą przez telefon.
english: You wouldn't have burned the food if you hadn't had a call with your friend.
glossary: to burn food/to have a call with sb
translation: You wouldn’t have burnt if you hadn’t talked to your friend on the phone.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Nie popełniałbyś tyle błędów ortograficznych, gdybyś czytał więcej książek.
english: You wouldn't make so many spelling mistakes if you read more books.
glossary: a spelling mistake/to read books
translation: You wouldn’t make so many spelling mistakes if you read more books.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Byłbym wdzięczny, gdyby przepisał mi pan jakieś leki.
english: I'd appreciate it if you prescribed me some drugs.
glossary: to appreciate sth/to prescribe sth to sb
translation: I’d grateful if you prescribe me some drugs for me.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Nad jakim projektem pracujecie?
english: What project are you working on?
glossary: to work on a project
translation: What project are you working on?

name: Yvonne West
polish: Kupilibyśmy tę pralkę, gdyby była trochę tańsza.
english: We'd buy the washing machine if it were a bit cheaper.
glossary: to buy sth/a washing machine/to be cheap
translation: We’d buy this washing machine if it were cheaper a bit.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Nie musiałbyś iść teraz do bankomatu, gdybyś wcześniej wypłacić pieniądze.
english: You wouldn't have to go to the ATM now if you had withdrawn money earlier.
glossary: to go to the cash machine/to withdraw money/a rate
translation: You wouldn’t have to go to an ATM now  if you’d withdraw money earlier.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Czułbym się teraz źle, gdybym wyrzucił te stare ubrania, zamiast oddać je na cele dobroczynne.
english: I'd feel bad now if I'd thrown out the old clothes instead of giving them to charity.
glossary: to feel bad/to throw away your clothes/to give sth to charity
translation: 1. I would feel bad now if I threw away those old clothes instead of gave it back.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Gdybyś rzeczywiście miał odrę, miałbyś również wysypkę.
english: If you really had measles, you'd also have a rash.
glossary: to have measles/to have a rash
translation: 2) If you had measles, you would also have a rash.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Miałaś w zeszłym tygodniu lekcję angielskiego?
english: Did you have the English class last week?
glossary: to have an English class/last week
translation: 3. did you have an English lesson last week?

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Rzuciłabyś mnie, gdybym cię nie przeprosił?
english: Would you have broken up with me if I hadn't apologized to you?
glossary: to break up with sb/to apologize to sb for sth
translation: 4. would you have dumped me if I hadn't apologized to you?

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Nie uderzyłbym cię w twarz, gdybyś mnie nie sprowokował.
english: I wouldn't have punched you in the face if you hadn't provoked me.
glossary: to punch sb in the face/to provoke sb
translation: 5. I wouldn't have hit you in the face if you hadn't provoked me.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Co chcesz, żebym ci powiedział?
english: What do you want me to tell you?
glossary: to tell sb sth
translation: 6. what do you want to tell you?

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Gdybym pościelił dziś rano łóżko, mama by się na mnie nie wkurzyła.
english: If I'd made the bed this morning, my mom wouldn't have gotten mad at me.
glossary: to make the bed/this morning/to get mad at sb
translation: 7. If I had made my bed this morning, my mother wouldn't have been pissed at me.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Nigdy nie ćpałem i nie pochwalam tego.
english: I've never done drugs and I don't approve of it.
glossary: to do drugs/to approve of sth
translation: 8. I've never done drugs and I don't approve of it.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Zwykle ćwiczę, słuchając jednocześnie muzyki.
english: I usually exercise listening to music at the same time.
glossary: to exercise/to listen to music/at the same time
translation: 9. I usually exercise while listening to music.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Gdybyśmy przestali używać konserwantów, mielibyśmy więcej klientów.
english: If we stopped using preservatives, we'd have more customers.
glossary: a preservative/a customer
translation: 10. If we stopped using conservants, we would have more customers.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Gdybyś naprawdę chciał schudnąć, jadłbyś mniej słodyczy.
english: If you really wanted to lose weight, you'd eat less candy.
glossary: to lose weight/to eat candy
translation: 1. If you really wanted to lose weight, you would eat less sweets.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Możesz mieć problemy z sercem, pijąc kawę kilka razy dziennie.
english: You can have heart problems drinking coffee a few times a day.
glossary: to have heart problems/to drink coffee/a few times a day
translation: 2) You might have heart problems by drinking coffee several times a day.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Płacąc podatki, możesz spać spokojnie.
english: Paying your taxes, you can sleep peacefully.
glossary: to pay your taxes/to sleep peacefully

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Chcesz, żebym jeszcze raz spojrzał na te dokumenty?
english: Do you want me to take a look at the documents once again?
glossary: to take a look at sth/once again/to take a look at a document
translation: 4. would you like me to go throught  the documents again?

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Nie wyrzuciłabym tej bluzki, gdyby nie wyblakła.
english: I wouldn't have thrown out the blouse if it hadn't faded.
glossary: to throw sth out/a blouse/to fade
translation: 5. I wouldn't throw this blouse away if it wasn't faded.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Nigdy wcześniej nie badałam pacjenta sama.
english: I've never examined a patient alone before.
glossary: to examine a patient
translation: 6. I have never examined a patient alone before.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Wyglądając przez okno, zauważyłam, że twój syn pali papierosa.
english: Looking out the window, I noticed your son smoking a cigarette.
glossary: to look out the window/to notice sb doing sth/to smoke a cigarette
translation: 7. Looking out the window, I noticed that your son was smoking a cigarette.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Biegnąc wzdłuż ulicy, zauważyłem bezpańskiego psa.
english: Running down the street, I noticed a stray dog.
glossary: to run down the street/to notice sth/a stray dog
translation: 8. Running along the street, I noticed a stray dog.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Czy wy uprawialiście wczoraj seks? Wydawało mi się, że was słyszę.
english: Did you have sex yesterday? I thought I heard you.
glossary: to have sex/to hear sb
translation: 9. Did you guys have sex yesterday? I thought I heard you guys.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Nigdy nie wierzyłam, że twoja siostra będzie dobrą nauczycielką.
english: I've never believed your sister will make a good teacher.
glossary: to make a good teacher
translation: 10. I never believed that your sister would be a good teacher.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Kogo chcesz, żebym zaprosił na imprezę?
english: Who do you want me to invite to the party?
glossary: to invite sb to a party
translation: 1. Who do you want me to invite to the party?

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Wpadaj. Mój mąż gotuje w ten piątek.
english: Drop by. My husband's cooking this Friday.
glossary: to cook/this Friday
translation: 2. You drop by. My husband's cooking this Friday.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Nie ma różnicy. Bierz, co chcesz.
english: There's no difference. Take what you want.
glossary: a difference/to take sth
translation: 3. There is no difference. Take what you want.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Mogłeś mi od razu powiedzieć prawdę. Nie zdenerwowałbym się.
english: You could've told me the truth at the beginning. I wouldn't have gotten mad.
glossary: to tell sb the truth/at the beginning/to get mad
translation: 4. You could have told me the truth at once. I wouldn't be upset.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Co mi chciałaś powiedzieć na imprezie?
english: What did you want to tell me at the party?
glossary: to tell sb sth/at the party
translation: 5. What did you want to tell me at the party?

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: W artykule jest błąd. Popraw go.
english: There's a mistake in the article. Correct it.
glossary: in the article/to correct a mistake
translation: 6. There is a mistake in the article. Correct it.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Może pojadę taksówką. Zaoszczędzę czas.
english: Maybe I'll take a cab. I'll save time.
glossary: to take a cab/to save money
translation: 7. Maybe I'll  take a taxi. I will save time.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Co chcesz dostać na urodziny?
english: What do you want to get for your birthday?
glossary: to get sth for your birthday
translation: 8. What do you want to get for birthday?

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Gdzie Ty wczoraj spałeś?
english: Where did you sleep yesterday?
glossary: to sleep
translation: 9. Where did you sleep yesterday?

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Stresowałem się, bo bałem się, że coś pójdzie źle.
english: I was stressed out because I was afraid something would go wrong.
glossary: to be stressed out/to be afraid of sth/to go wrong
translation: 10. I was stressed because I was afraid that something go wrong.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Dam ci znać, jak już skończę pracę. Będziemy w kontakcie.
english: I'll let you know once I finish work. We'll be in touch.
glossary: to let sb know/to finish work/to be in touch
translation: 1. I will let you know, when I finish work. We will be in touch

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Mam dość tego projektu, bo pracuję nad nim od kilku miesięcy.
english: I'm fed up with the project because I've been working on it for a few months.
glossary: to be fed up with sth/to work on a project
translation: 2. I have had enough of this project, because I am working on it couple months.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Ostrzegałam cię, że będzie korek na autostradzie, ale nie chciałeś mnie słuchać.
english: I warned you there would be a traffic jam on the highway, but you didn't want to listen to me.
glossary: to warn sb that.../I've warned you that.../an accident/on the highway/to listen to sb
translation: 3. I warned you, that it will be traffic jam on the highway but you didn't listen.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Myślę, że będziemy częściej wychodzić razem na miasto, bo przyszłym miesiącu przeprowadzam się do Warszawy.

glossary: to go out; to hang out/to move to Warsaw/next month
translation: 4. I think that we will go downtown more often, because I'm moving to Warsaw.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Nie powinnam była na ciebie krzyczeć. Musiałeś czuć się rozczarowany.
english: I shouldn't have shouted at you. You must've felt disappointed.
glossary: to scream at sb; to shout at sb/to feel disappointed
translation: 5. I shouldn't scream at you. You should feel disappointed

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Przez trzy miesiące w liceum pracowałam jako kelnerka.
english: I worked as a waitress for three months in high school.
glossary: to work as a waitress/in high school
translation: 6. I worked as a waiter for three months

name: Justina Stanley
polish: W pewnym momencie wierzyłem, że wrócimy do siebie.
english: At some point, I believed we'd get back together.
glossary: At some point.../to get back together
translation: 7.At some point I believe that we come back each other

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Jakie problemy są w twojej firmie?
english: What problems are there in your company?
glossary: a problem; an issue
translation: 8. What kind of problem are there in your company?

name: Justina Stanley
polish: O kim rozmawiacie?
english: Who are you talking about?
glossary: to talk about sb
translation: 9. Who are you talking to?

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Gdzie zostawiłeś kurtkę?
english: Where did you leave your jacket?
glossary: a jacket/to leave sth
translation: 10. Where did you leave jacket?

name: Jack Russell
polish: Kogo chcesz, żebym zaprosił na imprezę?
english: Who do you want me to invite to the party?
glossary: to invite sb to a party
translation: Who do you want I’ll invite to the party?

name: Jack Russell
polish: Wpadaj. Mój mąż gotuje w ten piątek.
english: Drop by. My husband's cooking this Friday.
glossary: to cook/this Friday
translation: Drop by us. My husband is cooking this friday.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Nie ma różnicy. Bierz, co chcesz.
english: There's no difference. Take what you want.

translation: There isn't a difference. Take whatever you want.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Mogłeś mi od razu powiedzieć prawdę. Nie zdenerwowałbym się.
english: You could've told me the truth at the beginning. I wouldn't have gotten mad.
glossary: to tell sb the truth/at the beginning/to get mad

name: Jack Russell
polish: Co mi chciałaś powiedzieć na imprezie?
english: What did you want to tell me at the party?
glossary: to tell sb sth/at the party

name: Jack Russell
polish: W artykule jest błąd. Popraw go.
english: There's a mistake in the article. Correct it.
glossary: in the article/to correct a mistake
translation: There is a mistake in the article. Correct it.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Może pojadę taksówką. Zaoszczędzę czas.
english: Maybe I'll take a cab. I'll save time.
glossary: to take a cab/to save money
translation: Maybe I’ll ride by taxi. I’ll save my time.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Co chcesz dostać na urodziny?
english: What do you want to get for your birthday?

translation: What do you want to get for your birthday?

name: Jack Russell
polish: Gdzie Ty wczoraj spałeś?
english: Where did you sleep yesterday?

translation: Where did you sleep yesterday?

name: Jack Russell
polish: Stresowałem się, bo bałem się, że coś pójdzie źle.
english: I was stressed out because I was afraid something would go wrong.
glossary: to be stressed out/to be afraid of sth/to go wrong
translation: I was stressed because I was afraid that something would go wrong.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Wynajmowałem mieszkanie z kolegą, zanim kupiłem własny dom.
english: I'd been renting an apartment with a friend before I bought my own house.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Kilka tygodni temu dowiedziałem się, że moja żona była już raz mężatką.
english: I found out a few weeks ago that my wife had already been married once.
glossary: to be married/to find sth out/a few weeks ago/a wife
translation: A few weeks ago I found out that my wife had already been married once.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Już miałam wychodzić, gdy pojawił się szef i powiedział, że potrzebuje, żebym została godzinę dłużej w pracy.
english: I was about to leave when my boss showed up and said he needed me to stay at work an hour longer.
glossary: to be about to do sth/to leave/to show up/to stay at work longer
translation: I was already going to leave when my boss showed up and said he needed me to stay an hour longer at work.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Dlaczego znów wydałeś tyle pieniędzy na niepotrzebne rzeczy?
english: Why did you spend so much money on unnecessary things again?
glossary: to spend money on sth/unnecessary things
translation: Why did you spend so much money on unnecessary goods again?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Moje życie się zmieniło po tym, jak zostałem zwolniony.
english: My life changed after I'd gotten fired.
glossary: a life/to change/to get fired
translation: My life changed after I got fired.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Czytałbym więcej książek, gdybym nie był ciągle zmęczony.
english: I would read more books if I weren't constantly tired.
glossary: to read a book/to be tired/to be constantly tired
translation: I would read more books if I wasn't constantly tired.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Gdybym w zeszłym roku więcej trenowała, byłabym teraz w formie.
english: If I'd worked out more last year, I'd be in shape now.
glossary: to work out/to be in shape
translation: If I had trained more last year, I would be in form now.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Czy jest tu ktoś zainteresowany tym tematem?
english: Is there anyone here interested in the subject?
glossary: to be interested in a subject
translation: Is there anyone here interested in this subject?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: O czym przeważnie pisze prasa?
english: What does the press mostly write about?
glossary: the press/to write about sth/mostly
translation: What does the press mostly write about?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Jeśli teraz nie opowiesz mi o swoim problemie, nie będę w stanie ci pomóc.
english: If you don't tell me about your problem now, I won't be able to help you.
glossary: to tell about sth/to be able to do sth/to help sb/a problem
translation: If you don't tell me about your problem now, I wouldn't be able to help you.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Nieznajomy opluł mnie, kiedy przechodziłem przez ulicę.
english: A stranger spat at me when I was crossing the street.
glossary: to cross the street/a stranger/to spit at sb
translation: A stranger spit at me as I was crossing the street.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Musimy pozbyć się dowodów.
english: We have to get rid of the evidence.
glossary: to get rid of sth/evidence
translation: We have to get rid of the evidence.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Chciałem wyjaśnić Ci sytuację, ale Ty nie chciałeś mnie słuchać.
english: I wanted to explain the situation to you, but you didn't want to listen to me.
glossary: to explain the situation to sb/to listen to sb
translation: I would explain you the situation, but you didn`t want to listen to me.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Powinieneś założyć kurtkę, bo jest zimno.
english: You should put on a jacket because it's cold.
glossary: to put on a jacket/cold
translation: You should put on the jacket because it`s cold.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Powinienem zaoszczędzić trochę pieniędzy, jeśli chcę kupić nowy komputer.
english: I should save some money if I want to buy a new computer.
glossary: to save some money/to buy a computer/a new computer
translation: I should save some money, if I`ll want to buy a new computer.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Nie chcę dzisiaj nic robić. Chcę odpocząć.
english: I want to do nothing today. I want to take a rest.
glossary: to do nothing/today/to take a rest
translation: I don`t want to do anything today. I want to rest.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Chciałem pouczyć się do testu, ale nie mogłem się skupić.
english: I wanted to study for a test, but I couldn't focus.
glossary: to study for a test/to focus on sth
translation: I would learn for the exam, but I couldn`t focus.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Możemy iść na spacer, ale najpierw musimy zjeść obiad.
english: We can go for a walk, but we have to eat lunch first.
glossary: to go for a walk/to eat lunch/first
translation: We can go for a wolk, but first we have to eat lunch.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Chcę jechać do centrum, żeby spotkać się ze znajomymi.
english: I want to go downtown to meet my friends.
glossary: to go downtown/to meet your friends
translation: I can go downtown to meet my friends.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Idę dzisiaj na imprezę. Muszę zrobić sobie włosy.
english: I'm going to a party today. I have to do my hair.
glossary: to go to a party/to do your hair/today
translation: I`ll go to a party today. I have to style my hair.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Musisz dzisiaj zapłacić rachunki.
english: You have to pay the bills today.
glossary: to pay the bills/today
translation: You have to pay the bills today.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Nie musielibyśmy płacić teraz odsetek, gdybyś nie zapomniał o ostatniej racie.
english: We wouldn't have to pay interest now if you hadn't forgotten about the last installment.
glossary: to pay interest/to forget about sth/an installment
translation: We wouldn’t have to pay interest now if you didn’t forget about the last rate.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Byłbym w stanie rozebrać to na części, gdybym miał klucz.
english: I would be able to take it apart now if I had the wrench.
glossary: to be able to do sth/to take sth apart/a wrench
translation: I could divide it into parts if I had a key.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Co próbujesz wynegocjować?
english: What are you trying to negotiate?
glossary: to negotiate
translation: What do you try to negotiate?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Pana dokumenty nie zostałyby odrzucone, gdyby złożył je Pan na czas.
english: Your documents wouldn't have gotten rejected if you had handed them in on time.
glossary: a document/to get rejected/to hand sth in on time
translation: Your documents wouldn’t have rejected if you had filed them on time.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Nie musielibyśmy płacić za ten miesiąc, gdybyśmy rozwiązali umowę na czas.
english: You wouldn't have to pay for this month if we'd terminated the contract on time.
glossary: to pay for sth/to terminate a contract/to do sth on time
translation: We wouldn’t have to pay for this month if we terminated the contract on time.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Jakich ludzi cenisz sobie najbardziej?
english: What people do you value the most?
glossary: to value sb
translation: What people do you value the most?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Nie musiałbyś mi teraz przeszkadzać, gdybyś zapisał tę informację.
english: You wouldn't have to disturb me now if you had noted down this information.
glossary: to disturb sb/to note down information
translation: You don’t have to interrupt me now if you wrote this information.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Trudno mi było udowodnić swoją rację.
english: It was hard for me to prove my point.
glossary: to prove your point
translation: It was difficult to prove my right.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Nie dostaniesz podwyżki, dopóki nie zaczniesz traktować swojej pracy poważnie.
english: You won't be given a pay raise until you start treating your job seriously.
glossary: a pay rise/to treat sth seriously
translation: You wouldn’t take a pay-rise as long as you didn’t treat your work seriously.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Twoja firma by się rozwijała, gdyby twoi pracownicy nie byli cały czas bezczynni.
english: Your company would thrive if your employees weren't idle all the time.
glossary: to thrive/to be idle/all the time
translation: Your company would develop if your employees didn’t be inactive all the time.

name: Kate Long
polish: Kogo chcesz, żebym zaprosił na imprezę?
english: Who do you want me to invite to the party?
glossary: to invite sb to a party
translation: 1. Who would you like to invite to a party?

name: Kate Long
polish: Wpadaj. Mój mąż gotuje w ten piątek.
english: Drop by. My husband's cooking this Friday.
glossary: to cook/this Friday
translation: 2. Drop by. My husband is cooking this Friday.

name: Kate Long
polish: Nie ma różnicy. Bierz, co chcesz.
english: There's no difference. Take what you want.
glossary: a difference/to take sth
translation: 3. It doesn't make a difference. Take what you want.

name: Kate Long
polish: Mogłeś mi od razu powiedzieć prawdę. Nie zdenerwowałbym się.
english: You could've told me the truth at the beginning. I wouldn't have gotten mad.
glossary: to tell sb the truth/at the beginning/to get mad
translation: 4. You could me tell the truth right away. I wouldn't get nervous.

name: Kate Long
polish: Co mi chciałaś powiedzieć na imprezie?
english: What did you want to tell me at the party?
glossary: to tell sb sth/at the party
translation: 5. What would you like to tell me at the party?

name: Kate Long
polish: W artykule jest błąd. Popraw go.
english: There's a mistake in the article. Correct it.
glossary: in the article/to correct a mistake
translation: 6. There is a mistake in the article. Correct it.

name: Kate Long
polish: Może pojadę taksówką. Zaoszczędzę czas.
english: Maybe I'll take a cab. I'll save time.
glossary: to take a cab/to save money
translation: 7. Mayby I'll take a taxi. I'll save time.

name: Kate Long
polish: Co chcesz dostać na urodziny?
english: What do you want to get for your birthday?
glossary: to get sth for your birthday
translation: 8. What would you like to get on birthday?

name: Kate Long
polish: Gdzie Ty wczoraj spałeś?
english: Where did you sleep yesterday?
glossary: to sleep
translation: 9. Where did you sleep yesterday?

name: Kate Long
polish: Stresowałem się, bo bałem się, że coś pójdzie źle.
english: I was stressed out because I was afraid something would go wrong.
glossary: to be stressed out/to be afraid of sth/to go wrong
translation: 10. I was stressed out because I was afraid it something would come wrong.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Często podróżowaliśmy z mężem, zanim urodziło się nasze pierwsze dziecko.
english: My husband and I had often traveled before our first kid was born.
glossary: to be born/a kid/to travel/a husband
translation: 1. We traveled a lot with my husband before we had our first child.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Nad jakim projektem pracujecie?
english: What project are you working on?
glossary: to work on a project
translation: 2. In what project are you working on?

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Nie musisz iść na randkę z tym gościem, jeśli nie chcesz.
english: You don't have to go on a date with the guy if you don't want to.
glossary: to go on a date with sb
translation: 3. You don't have to go on a date with this guy if you don't want.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Powinnaś mnie lepiej traktować.
english: You should treat me better.
glossary: to treat sb well
translation: 4. You should tret me better.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Nie pracuję jutro, więc możemy jechać nad jezioro.
english: I'm not working tomorrow, so we can go to the lake.
glossary: to work/to go to the lake/tomorrow
translation: 5. I'm not working tomorrow, so we could go to the lake.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Wynajmowałem mieszkanie z kolegą, zanim kupiłem własny dom.
english: I'd been renting an apartment with a friend before I bought my own house.
glossary: to rent an apartment/your own house/to buy a house
translation: 6. I rented apartment with a friend before I bought my own house.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Słyszałem dziś, jak moja córka mówi po angielsku, i to skłoniło mnie do myślenia. Może też powinienem zapisać się na taki kurs.
english: I heard my daughter speaking English today, and it made me think. Maybe I should sign up for such a course as well.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to hear sb doing sth/to sign up for a course
translation: 7. I heard how my doughter speaks English today, and it ...... me think. Maybe I should also sign up for a course like this.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Dlaczego nie skończyłeś ostatniego projektu?
english: Why didn't you finish the last project?
glossary: to finish a project
translation: 8. Why didn't you finish the last project?

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Mieliśmy się zmieniać, nieprawdaż?
english: We were supposed to take turns, weren't we?
glossary: to take turns
translation: 9. We were supposed to change, .......?

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Film był niesamowity. Był taki wzruszający. Dosłownie sprawił, że się rozpłakałem.
english: The movie was amazing. It was so touching. It literally made me cry.
glossary: to make sb do sth/literally/to be touching
translation: 10. The movie was amazing. It was ............. .......... it made me cry.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Jestem naprawdę zajęty, więc nie sądzę, że uda mi się spotkać z tobą po pracy.
english: I'm really busy, so I don't think I'll manage to meet you after work.
glossary: to be busy/really/to manage to do sth/to meet sb/after work
translation: 1. I'm realy busy so I don't think I'll be able to meet you after work.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Przeprowadziłem się kilka lat temu.
english: I moved a few years ago.
glossary: to move/a few years ago
translation: 2. I moved a few year ago.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Powinienem był się ciebie pozbyć, zanim narobiłeś problemów.
english: I should've gotten rid of you before you made trouble.
glossary: to get rid of sb/to make trouble
translation: 3. I should have gotten rid of you before you made trable.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Idziemy dzisiaj wieczorem na imprezę. Szykuj się.
english: We're going to a party tonight. Get ready.
glossary: to get ready/to go to a party
translation: 4. We're going to a party tonight. Be ready.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Nie mam czasu. Idę jutro do lekarza.
english: I don't have time. I'm going to the doctor tomorrow.
glossary: to go to the doctor
translation: 5. I've no time. I'm going to the doctor tomorrow.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Jestem pewna, że kiedyś mnie zrozumiesz.
english: I'm sure you'll understand me one day.
glossary: to understand sb/one day
translation: 6. I'm sure you'll understend me sometime.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Co się stało? Byłam pewna, że się pobierzecie.
english: What happened? I was sure you'd get married.
glossary: to happen/to be sure/to get married
translation: 7. What happened? I was sure you'ld get maried.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Powinnaś zachęcać dzieciaki, żeby się rozwijały.
english: You should encourage your kids to develop.
glossary: to develop/to encourage sb to do sth
translation: 8. You should encourage kids to develop yourself.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że się zaprzyjaźnimy.
english: I hoped we'd make friends.
glossary: to hope/to make friends
translation: 9. I hoped we'll make friends.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Nie jestem pewien, czy dobrze cię rozumiem. Co sugerujesz?
english: I'm not sure if I understand you well. What are you suggesting?
glossary: to be sure/to understand sth well/to suggest sth
translation: 10. I'm not sure I understend you correct. What are you suggest?

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Policja miała się upewnić, że zostanę skazany za przestępstwo.
english: The police were supposed to make sure that I'd be convicted of the crime.
glossary: to make sure that.../to be convicted of sth
translation: 1. The police were to make sure I'll be …..... of a crime.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Zawsze pracujesz do późna. Nie zależy ci na swojej rodzinie?
english: You're always working late. Don't you care about your family?
glossary: to work late/to care about your family
translation: 2. You always work late. Don't you care about your family?

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Jutro idę na zakupy. Chcesz do mnie dołączyć?
english: I'm going shopping tomorrow. Do you want to join me?
glossary: to go shopping/to join sb
translation: 3. I'm going shopping tomorrow. Would you like to join tp me?

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Gdzie koncertujecie w weekend?
english: Where are you giving a concert on the weekend?
glossary: to give a concert
translation: 4. Where are you giving a concert on the weekend?

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Jakich narzędzi potrzebujesz, aby ukończyć zadanie?
english: What tools do you need to finish your task?
glossary: to finish a task/a tool
translation: 5. What tools do you need to complete the task?

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Myślałem, że będziesz tęsknić za domem.
english: I thought you'd feel homesick.
glossary: to feel homesick
translation: 6. I thought you'd be homesick.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Obiecuję, że podrzucę dzieci jutro do szkoły.
english: I promise I'll drop off the kids at school tomorrow.
glossary: to drop off the kids at school
translation: 7.  I promise to drop the kids off at school tomorrow.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Przeprowadzę się, jak już znajdę nową pracę.
english: I'll move once I find a new job.
glossary: to move/to find a new job
translation: 8. I'll move once I find a new job.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Dowiedziałem się wczoraj, że mój szef pracował wcześniej w agencji nieruchomości.
english: I found out yesterday that my boss had worked at a real estate agency before.
glossary: a real estate agency/to find out that.../a boss
translation: 9. I found out yesterdey that my boss worked at the real estate agency before.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Dzięki za skończenie zadania na czas.
english: Thanks for completing the task on time.
glossary: to complete a task
translation: 10. Thanks for completing the assigment on time.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Myślę, że założę dzisiaj sukienkę.
english: I think I'll put on a dress today.
glossary: to put on a dress
translation: 1. I think I'll put on a dress today.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Mam nadzieję, że nadrobisz pracę domową.
english: I hope you'll catch up on your homework.
glossary: to catch up on your homework
translation: 2. I hope you'll catch up on your homework.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Czy jest coś, co powinienem wiedzieć, zanim wykonam ten telefon?
english: Is there anything I should know before making the call?
glossary: to make a call/to know sth
translation: 3. Is there anythink I should know before I call?

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Zawsze przeceniasz swoje umiejętności i później wpadamy w kłopoty.
english: You're always overestimating your abilities, and then we get in trouble.
glossary: to overestimate sth/to get in trouble
translation: 4. You always ….....  your skills and later we get into trouble.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Piłbym częściej herbatę, gdybym lubił moich sąsiadów.
english: I'd have tea more often if I liked my neighbors.
glossary: to have tea/often/a neighbor/to like sb
translation: 5. I'd drink tea often if I like my neighbors.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Robiłeś pracę domową, kiedy chodziłeś do szkoły?
english: Did you do your homework when you went to school?
glossary: to do your homework/to go to school
translation: 6. Did you do your homework when you went to school?

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Nie musiałbyś iść teraz do bankomatu, gdybyś wcześniej wypłacić pieniądze.
english: You wouldn't have to go to the ATM now if you had withdrawn money earlier.
glossary: to go to the cash machine/to withdraw money/a rate
translation: 7. You wouldn't have to go to the cash machine now if you withdraw money earlier.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że ci klienci zostawią większy napiwek.
english: I hoped the customers would leave a bigger tip.
glossary: to leave a tip/a customer/to hope
translation: 8. I hoped the custommers would leave you a bigger tip.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Masz zapalniczkę?
english: Do you have a lighter?
glossary: a lighter
translation: 9. Do you have a light.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Na czym zależy twojemu synowi? Jeśli to odkryjesz, będziesz mógł go zmotywować.
english: What does your son care about? If you discover it, you'll be able to motivate him.
glossary: to care about sth/to discover sth/to motivate sb
translation: 10. What does your son depend on? If you discover this, you could motiwate him.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Musimy wyjśnić sytuację.
english: We have to explain the situation.
glossary: to explain the situation
translation: 1. We've to explain the sytuation.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Mój biznes miał prosperować. Przynajmniej taki był plan.
english: My business was supposed to thrive. At least, that was the plan.
glossary: to thrive
translation: 2. My business was supposed to prosperity. At least that was the plan.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Mój mąż miał złożyć łóżeczko do kupy, ale był zbyt leniwy.
english: My husband was supposed to put the crib together, but he was too lazy.
glossary: to put sth together/to be too lazy to do sth
translation: 3. My husband was supposed to put the bed ….., but he was too lazy.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Obiecuję, że odwiedzę was w przyszłym miesiącu.
english: I promise I'll visit you next month.
glossary: to visit sb/next month/to promise
translation: 4. I promise to visit you next month.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Oglądamy dzisiaj wieczorem mecz. Wpadnij.
english: We're watching a match tonight. Drop by.
glossary: to watch a match/to drop by
translation: 5. We are watching a game tonight. Come in.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Mogłeś mi od razu powiedzieć prawdę. Nie zdenerwowałbym się.
english: You could've told me the truth at the beginning. I wouldn't have gotten mad.
glossary: to tell sb the truth/at the beginning/to get mad
translation: 6. You could've told me the truth right now. I wouldn't have been nervous.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Dlaczego winisz mnie za utratę pracy?
english: Why are you blaming me for losing your job?
glossary: to lose your job
translation: 7. Why do you blame me for my losing job?

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Nie kłóciłbyś się teraz ze mną, gdybyś był trzeźwy.
english: You wouldn't be arguing with me now if you were sober.
glossary: to argue with sb/to be sober
translation: 8. You wouldn't be argue with me now if you had been sober.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Dlaczego utrudniasz mi życie? Czy nie powinniśmy sobie pomagać?
english: Why are you making my life harder? Shouldn't we help each other?
glossary: to make sb's life harder/to help each other
translation: 9. Why are you complicaiting my life? If we are shouldn't help eachother?

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Nie możesz unikać odpowiedzialności.
english: You can't avoid responsibility.
glossary: to avoid responsibility
translation: 10. You can't avoid responsibility.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Dlaczego dzwoniłeś wczoraj do mnie tyle razy?
english: Why did you call me so many times yesterday?
glossary: to call sb/many times
translation: 1. Why did you call me so many times yesterday?

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Z kim wczoraj poszedłeś na imprezę?
english: Who did you go to the party with yesterday?
glossary: to go to a party with sb
translation: 2. Who did you go to the party with yesterday?

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Nie powinnaś była składać obietnicy, jeśli wiedziałaś, że jej nie dotrzymasz.
english: You shouldn't have made the promise if you knew you wouldn't keep it.
glossary: to make a promise/to keep a promise
translation: 3. You shouldn't have made a promise if you knew you wouldn't keep it.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Jestem rozczarowana. Byłam pewna, że nie złamiesz obietnicy.
english: I'm disappointed. I was sure you wouldn't break the promise.
glossary: to be disappointed with sth/to be sure/to break a promise
translation: 4. I'm disappointed. I was sure you wouldn't break your promise.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Ufam ci, bo od dawna razem pracujemy.
english: I trust you because we've been working together for a long time.

english: I hope you'll do the shopping today.
