name: Anette Gray
polish: W artykule jest błąd. Popraw go.
english: There's a mistake in the article. Correct it.
glossary: in the article/to correct a mistake
translation: There’s a mistake in the article.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Szef zasugerował, żeby nasz zespół został dzisiaj po godzinach.
english: The boss suggested that our team work overtime today.
glossary: to suggest that.../to work overtime
translation: The chief suggested today that our team will stay after houres.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Rodzice zasugerowali, żebym się wyprowadził. Sądzą, że powinienem dorosnąć.
english: My parents suggested that I move out. They think I should grow up.
glossary: to suggest that.../to move out/to grow up
translation: The parents suggested that I should move out. They think I should grow up.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Nauczycielka zasugerowała, żebym poszła na studia.
english: My teacher suggested that I go to college.
glossary: to suggest that.../a teacher/to go to college
translation: The teacher sugested I would go to a collage.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Kogo następnie będziemy operować?
english: Who are we going to operate on next?
glossary: to operate on sb
translation: When we will reparie next time?

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Gdybyście wystawili fakturę na czas, pieniądze byłyby już na waszym koncie.
english: If you'd issued the invoice on time, the money would already be in your bank account.
glossary: to issue an invoice/on time/in your bank account
translation: If you invoice on time the money would be on your account on time.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Boję się stracić pracę.
english: I'm afraid of losing my job.
glossary: to be afraid of sth/to lose your job
translation: I'm affraid to lose a job.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Sugeruję, żebyś zrobił swoją pracę domową dzisiaj. Jutro nie będziesz miał czasu.
english: I suggest that you do your homework today. You won't have time tomorrow.
glossary: to suggest that.../to do your homework/to have time to do sth
translation: I sugested that you should do your homework tonight because tommorow you won't have time.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Doktor nie odpowiedział, gdy go wczoraj zapytałam, czy zbadał już pacjentkę.
english: The doctor didn't answer when I asked him yesterday if he'd examined the patient yet.
glossary: a doctor/to answer a question/to examine a patient
translation: The doctor didn't anserw when I asked him if you treat a pacient.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Opowiem ci historię o okłamywaniu ludzi.
english: I'll tell you a story about lying to people.
glossary: to tell sb a story/to lie to sb
translation: I will tell you a story about lying to people.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Gdyby nasza firma chciała być przyjazna dla środowiska, przestałaby przeprowadzać testy na zwierzętach.
english: If our company wanted to be environment-friendly, it would stop conducting tests on animals.
glossary: a company/to be environment-friendly/to conduct tests on animals
translation: If our company woule like to be friendly to the envorioment they wouldn't carry out animal tests.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: W ten weekend robimy z przyjacielem parapetówkę.
english: My friend and I are throwing a housewarming party this weekend.
glossary: to throw a housewarming party/a housewarming party/a friend/this weekend
translation: My friend and I are doing a housewarming party this weekend.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Nie martw się. Pomogę ci z problemem.
english: Don't worry. I'll help you with the problem.
glossary: to worry/to help sb with a problem
translation: Don’t worry. I’ll help you with the problem.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Jest ciepło na zewnątrz, więc nie musisz zakładać kurtki.
english: It's warm outside, so you don't have to put on a jacket.
glossary: warm/outside/to put on a jacket
translation: It’s warm outside, so you don’t have to put up a jacket.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: W zeszłym tygodniu poprosiłam mamę, żeby poszła ze mną na zakupy.
english: I asked my mom to go shopping with me last week.
glossary: to go shopping/last week
translation: Last week I asked my mom, that she’d go shopping with me.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Niedługo poznam dziewczynę mojego syna.
english: I'm meeting my son's girlfriend soon.
glossary: soon/to meet sb {2}/a son/a girlfriend
translation: I’ll meet my son’s girlfriend soon.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Wczoraj znalazłam korepetytora dla moich dzieci.
english: I found a private tutor for my children yesterday.
glossary: to find a private tutor/a private tutor/children
translation: I found a tutor for my kids yesterday.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Obiecuję, że tym razem będę miła dla twojego męża.
english: I promise I'll be nice to your husband this time.
glossary: to be nice to sb/to promise that.../this time/a husband
translation: I promise I’ll be nice for your husband that time.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Niestety nie mogę ci polecić żadnego interesującego filmu.
english: Unfortunately, I can't recommend any interesting movie to you.
glossary: Unfortunately.../to recommend sth to sb/an interesting movie
translation: Unfortunetly I can’t recommend any interesting movie for you.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Musisz spróbować być mniej zazdrosna.
english: You have to try to be less jealous.
glossary: to be jealous/more or less
translation: You have to try to be less jealous.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Powinieneś trenować więcej, żeby być w formie.
english: You should work out more to be in shape.
glossary: to work out/to be in shape
translation: You should train more to stay fit.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Zatrudnilibyśmy pana, gdyby miał pan więcej doświadczenia w tym obszarze.
english: We'd hire you if you had more experience in this area.
glossary: to hire sb/to have experience in sth
translation: We’d hire you if you had more experience in this area.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Nie będę w stanie się skupić na tym zadaniu, dopóki nie ściszysz muzyki.
english: I won't be able to focus on this task until you turn the music down.
glossary: to focus on sth/ to turn the music down
translation: I won’t be able to focus on this task until you turn the music down.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Nie będę z tobą rozmawiała, dopóki mnie nie przeprosisz.
english: I won't be speaking with you until you apologize to me.
glossary: to speak with sb/to apologize to sb
translation: I won’t talk to you until you apologize to me.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Jaką zabawkę chcesz dostać na urodziny?
english: What toy would you like to get for your birthday?
glossary: to get sth for your birthday/a toy
translation: What toy do you want to get for your birthday.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Nie zapomniałbyś o spotkaniu, gdybyś dodała je do swojego kalendarza.
english: You wouldn't have forgotten about the meeting if you had added it to your calendar.
glossary: to forget about sth/a meeting/to add sth to your calendar
translation: You wouldn’t have to forget about a meeting if you’d added it to your calendar.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Niełatwo było mi namówić żonę na wzięcie kilku dni wolnego.
english: It wasn't easy for me to persuade my wife to take a few days off.
glossary: to persuade sb to do sth/a day off
translation: It wasn’t easy to persuade my wife to take a few days off.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Nie będziesz grał w żadne gry, dopóki nie posprzątasz.
english: I won't be playing any games until you clean up.
glossary: to play games/to clean sth up
translation: You won’t play any games until you clean.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Nie będę taki przepracowany, kiedy skończy się sezon.
english: I won't be this overworked when this season ends.
glossary: to be overworked/to end
translation: I won’t be so overworked when the season is over.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Dlaczego nalegasz? Wiesz, że się nie zgodzę.
english: Why are you insisting? You know I won't agree.
glossary: to insist/to agree
translation: Why do you insist? You know, I won’t agree.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Trudno nam będzie to zmierzyć, bo nie mamy odpowiednich narzędzi.
english: It'll be hard for us to measure it, because we don't have the right tools.
glossary: to measure sth/to have the right tools
translation: It will be difficult for us to measure it  because we don’t have the right tools.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Kogo chcesz, żebym zaprosił na imprezę?
english: Who do you want me to invite to the party?
glossary: to invite sb to a party
translation: 1. Who do you want me to invite to the party?

name: Eve Miles
polish: Wpadaj. Mój mąż gotuje w ten piątek.
english: Drop by. My husband's cooking this Friday.
glossary: to cook/this Friday
translation: 2. Drop by me. My husband is cooking this Friday.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Nie ma różnicy. Bierz, co chcesz.
english: There's no difference. Take what you want.
glossary: a difference/to take sth
translation: 3. There is no difference. Take what you want.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Mogłeś mi od razu powiedzieć prawdę. Nie zdenerwowałbym się.
english: You could've told me the truth at the beginning. I wouldn't have gotten mad.
glossary: to tell sb the truth/at the beginning/to get mad
translation: 4. You could tell me the truth right away. I wouldn't be nervous.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Co mi chciałaś powiedzieć na imprezie?
english: What did you want to tell me at the party?
glossary: to tell sb sth/at the party
translation: 5. What did you want to tell me at the party?

name: Eve Miles
polish: W artykule jest błąd. Popraw go.
english: There's a mistake in the article. Correct it.
glossary: in the article/to correct a mistake
translation: 6. There is a mistake in the article. Correct it.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Może pojadę taksówką. Zaoszczędzę czas.
english: Maybe I'll take a cab. I'll save time.
glossary: to take a cab/to save money
translation: 7. Maybe I'll take a taxi. I will save time.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Co chcesz dostać na urodziny?
english: What do you want to get for your birthday?
glossary: to get sth for your birthday
translation: 8. What do you want to get for your birthday?

name: Eve Miles
polish: Gdzie Ty wczoraj spałeś?
english: Where did you sleep yesterday?
glossary: to sleep
translation: 9. Where did you sleep yesterday?

name: Eve Miles
polish: Stresowałem się, bo bałem się, że coś pójdzie źle.
english: I was stressed out because I was afraid something would go wrong.
glossary: to be stressed out/to be afraid of sth/to go wrong
translation: 10. I was stressed because I was afraid that something would go wrong.

name: Eve Miles
polish: W ten weekend robimy z przyjacielem parapetówkę.
english: My friend and I are throwing a housewarming party this weekend.
glossary: to throw a housewarming party/a housewarming party/a friend/this weekend
translation: 1. This weekend my friend and I are throwing a housewarming party.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Nie martw się. Pomogę ci z problemem.
english: Don't worry. I'll help you with the problem.
glossary: to worry/to help sb with a problem
translation: 2. Don't worry. I will help you with the problem.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Jest ciepło na zewnątrz, więc nie musisz zakładać kurtki.
english: It's warm outside, so you don't have to put on a jacket.
glossary: warm/outside/to put on a jacket
translation: 3. It's warm outside so you don't need to wear a jacket.

name: Eve Miles
polish: W zeszłym tygodniu poprosiłam mamę, żeby poszła ze mną na zakupy.
english: I asked my mom to go shopping with me last week.
glossary: to go shopping/last week
translation: 4. Last week, I asked my mother to go shopping with me.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Niedługo poznam dziewczynę mojego syna.
english: I'm meeting my son's girlfriend soon.
glossary: soon/to meet sb {2}/a son/a girlfriend
translation: 5. I will meet my son's girlfriend soon.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Wczoraj znalazłam korepetytora dla moich dzieci.
english: I found a private tutor for my children yesterday.
glossary: to find a private tutor/a private tutor/children
translation: 6. I found a private tutor for my children yesterday.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Obiecuję, że tym razem będę miła dla twojego męża.
english: I promise I'll be nice to your husband this time.
glossary: to be nice to sb/to promise that.../this time/a husband
translation: 7. I promise that this time I will be nice to your husband.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Niestety nie mogę ci polecić żadnego interesującego filmu.
english: Unfortunately, I can't recommend any interesting movie to you.
glossary: Unfortunately.../to recommend sth to sb/an interesting movie
translation: 8. Unfortunately, I can’t recommend any interesting movie for you.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Musisz spróbować być mniej zazdrosna.
english: You have to try to be less jealous.
glossary: to be jealous/more or less
translation: 9. You had to try to be less jealous.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Powinieneś trenować więcej, żeby być w formie.
english: You should work out more to be in shape.
glossary: to work out/to be in shape
translation: 10. You should train more to stay in shape.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Nie musisz mieć wyrzutów sumienia.
english: You don't need to have remorse.
glossary: to have remorse
translation: 1. You don't have remorse.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Zerzygałam się na ostatniej imprezie. Żenada.
english: I threw up at the last party. Pathetic.
glossary: to throw up/at the party/to be pathetic
translation: 2. I threw up at the last party. Embarrassment.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Obiecuję, że następnym razem będę się lepiej zachowywał.
english: I promise I'll behave better next time.
glossary: to behave/next time/to promise sb sth; to promise sth to sb
translation: 3. I promise to be better behave next time.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Nie możesz się tak gapić na ludzi.
english: You can't stare at people like that.
glossary: to stare at sb
translation: 4. You can't stare at people like that.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Wczoraj lekarz przepisał mi leki przeciwbólowe.
english: The doctor prescribed me painkillers yesterday.
glossary: a doctor/to prescribe sb painkillers
translation: 5. Yesterday my doctor prescribed me some painkillers.

name: Eve Miles
polish: W przyszłym roku kończę studia. Nie mogę się doczekać.
english: I'm graduating from college next year. I can't wait.
glossary: to graduate from college/can't wait
translation: 6. I am graduating from university next year. Can't wait.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Powinnaś mnie lepiej traktować.
english: You should treat me better.
glossary: to treat sb well
translation: 7. You should treat me better.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Dziś wieczorem nie ćwiczę. Muszę odpocząć.
english: I'm not working out tonight. I have to rest.
glossary: to work out/to rest
translation: 8. I'm not exercising tonight. I had to rest.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Musisz przyznać, że mam rację.
english: You have to admit that I'm right.
glossary: to admit sth/to be right
translation: 9. You have to admit I'm right.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Jestem pewien, że się pojawię na imprezie.
english: I'm sure I'll show up at the party.
glossary: to be sure about sth/to show up/at the party/I'm sure that.../to show up at the party
translation: 10. I'm sure I'll be at the party.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Moja mama przeszła w zeszłym roku na emeryturę.
english: My mom retired last year.
glossary: to retire/last year
translation: 1. My mother retired last year.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Nie wierzę. Znajomi znowu mnie wystawili.
english: I can't believe it. My friends stood me up again.
glossary: to believe sb/to stand sb up/a friend
translation: 2. I don't believe it. Friends stand me up again.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Dawno cię nie widziałam. Musisz wpaść w tym tygodniu.
english: I haven't seen you for a long time. You have to drop by this week.
glossary: to drop by/for a long time/this week
translation: 3. Haven't seen you for a long time. You have to come this week.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Nie możesz unikać odpowiedzialności.
english: You can't avoid responsibility.
glossary: to avoid responsibility
translation: 4. You can’t avoid responsibility.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Nie możesz się tak zachowywać.
english: You can't behave like that.
glossary: to behave
translation: 5. You can't behave like this.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Nie idę z wami jutro na imprezę. Pracuję na nocną zmianę.
english: I'm not going to the party with you tomorrow. I'm working the night shift.
glossary: to go to a party with sb/to work the night shift
translation: 6. I'm not going to a party with you tomorrow. I work the night shift.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Nie będę w stanie pojawić się w weekend, bo pracuję.
english: I won't be able to show up on the weekend because I'm working.
glossary: to show up/to work on the weekend/to be able to do sth
translation: 7. I won't be able to show up at the weekend because I'm working.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Mam nadzieję, że nie będę mieć jutro kaca.
english: I hope I won't have a hangover tomorrow.
glossary: to have a hangover
translation: 8. I hope I don't have a hangover tomorrow.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Musisz mnie przeprosić.
english: You have to apologize to me.
glossary: to apologize to sb
translation: 9. You have to apologize to me.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Pozwę cię. Zobaczysz.
english: I'll sue you. You'll see.
glossary: to sue sb/to see sth
translation: 10. I'll sue you. You will see.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Jutro uczę się na egzamin, ale możemy się spotkać, jak już skończę.
english: I'm studying for an exam tomorrow, but we can meet once I'm done.
glossary: to be done/to study for an exam/to meet sb
translation: Tomorrow I am learning for the exam, but we can meet once I finish

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Nie pojechałem nad jezioro, bo obawiałem się, że się przeziębię.
english: I didn't go to the lake because I was afraid I'd catch a cold.
glossary: to go to the lake/to catch a cold/to be afraid of sth
translation: I didn’t go to the lake because I was afraid that I catch a cold.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Przeprowadzę się, jak już znajdę nową pracę.
english: I'll move once I find a new job.
glossary: to move/to find a new job
translation: I will move once I find a new job.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Będę mieć więcej energii, jak już napiję się kawy.
english: I'll have more energy once I have some coffee.
glossary: to have energy/to have some coffee
translation: I will have more energy once I drink a coffee

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Poproszę o podwyżkę, jak już szef będzie z powrotem w biurze.
english: I'll ask for a pay-raise once my boss is back in the office.
glossary: to ask for a pay-raise/to be back in the office
translation: I will ask for pay-raise once my boss come back to work.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Jestem podekscytowana, bo jutro widzę się ze starą znajomą.
english: I'm excited because I'm seeing an old friend of mine tomorrow.
glossary: to see sb/to be excited
translation: I am excited because my friend and I are meeting tomorrow.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: W przyszłym tygodniu zaczynam kurs angielskiego. Nie mogę się doczekać.
english: I'm starting an English course next week. I can't wait.
glossary: can't wait/to start an English course
translation: I am starting an English course next week. I can’t wait for that.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Porozmawiamy, jak już będziesz gotowa.
english: We'll talk once you're ready.
glossary: to talk to sb/to be ready
translation: We will talk once you are ready.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Bałem się, że przegramy sprawę przez mój błąd.
english: I was afraid we'd lose the case because of my mistake.
glossary: to be afraid of sth/to lose a case/because of you/a mistake
translation: I was scared that we failed the case because of my mistake.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Możemy przełożyć nasze spotkanie? Jutro przyjeżdżają moi rodzice w odwiedziny.
english: Can we put off our meeting? My parents are visiting me tomorrow.
glossary: to visit sb/to put off a meeting
translation: Could we postpone our meeting? My parents are visiting me.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Czy są w tym mieście jakieś miejsca, które powinienem odwiedzić?
english: Are there any places in the city I should visit?
glossary: in the city; in town/to visit a place
translation: 1. Are there in the city any places which I should visit?

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Gdzie jedziesz w tym roku na wakacje?
english: Where are you going on vacation this year?
glossary: to go on vacation/this year
translation: 2. Where are you go on vacation in this year?

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Mamy czas. Nie ma potrzeby się spieszyć.
english: We have time. There's no need to hurry up.
glossary: to have time/a need/to hurry up
translation: 3. We have time. There is no need to hurry up.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że wrócę do domu dzisiaj, ale uciekł mi pociąg.
english: I hoped I'd come back home today, but I missed the train.
glossary: to hope/to come back home/today/to miss the train
translation: 4. I hoped that I would come back home today but I missed my train.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Dlaczego tak zareagowałaś? Możesz mi to wytłumaczyć?
english: Why did you react like that? Can you explain it to me?
glossary: to react to sth/like that/to explain sth to sb
translation: 5. Why are you reacted like this? Can you explain that to me?

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Mogłeś wcześniej zadzwonić. Powiedziałabym Ci, że nie ma mnie w domu.
english: You could've called before. I would've told you I wasn't at home.
glossary: to be at home/to call sb
translation: 6. I could have called earlier. I would tell you that I'm not at home.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Z kim wczoraj rozmawiałeś przez telefon?
english: Who did you talk to on the phone yesterday?
glossary: to talk to sb over the phone
translation: 7. With who are you called to on the phone yesterday?

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Idziemy dziś wieczorem na drinka. Pamiętasz?
english: We're going for a drink tonight. Do you remember?
glossary: to remember/to go for a drink/tonight
translation: 8. We're going to the drink tonight. Do you remember?

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Obawiam się, że nie dostanę tej pracy.
english: I'm afraid I won't get the job.
glossary: to be afraid of sth/to get a job
translation: 9. I'm afraid I won't get the job.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Z kim chcesz spędzić resztę swojego życia?
english: Who do you want to spend the rest of your life with?
glossary: to spend time with sb/the rest of your life
translation: 10. With who are you want to spend the rest of your life?

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Na co się patrzysz?
english: What are you looking at?
glossary: to look at sth
translation: 1. What are you looking for?

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Nudziło mi się wczoraj w pracy, bo nie było nic do roboty.
english: I was bored at work yesterday because there was nothing to do.
glossary: to be bored/at work/to have nothing to do
translation: 2. I was bored yesterday at work because there was nothing to do

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Mogłaś mnie wczoraj odwiedzić, skoro byłaś w mieście.
english: You could've visited me yesterday since you were in town.
glossary: to visit sb/to be in town
translation: 3. You could visit me yesterday If you were in the city

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Obiecałaś, że zrobisz mi dzisiaj włosy.
english: You promised you'd do my hair today.
glossary: to promise sb sth; to promise to sb/to do your hair/today
translation: 4. You promised me that you do my hair today

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Z kogo się śmiejesz?
english: Who are you laughing at?
glossary: to laugh at sb
translation: 5. Who are you laughing to?

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Miałam nadzieję, że nie będę miała dzisiaj kaca.
english: I hoped I wouldn't have a hangover today.
glossary: to hope/to have a hangover/today
translation: 6. I hoped that I won't have hangover today

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Nie miałem tego na myśli. Nie powinnaś była brać tego osobiście.
english: I didn't mean it. You shouldn't have taken it personally.
glossary: to mean sth/to take sth personally
translation: 7. I didn't mean that. You shouldn't have took this personally

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Jestem pewien, że schudnę do lata.
english: I'm sure I'll lose weight by summer.
glossary: to be sure/to lose weight/by summer
translation: 8. I'm sure I'll lose weight by summer

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Nie powinniśmy byli się kłócić. To nie miało sensu.
english: We shouldn't have argued. It didn't make sense.
glossary: to argue with sb/to make sense
translation: 9. We shouldn't have argued. It didn't make sense

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Stresuję się, bo w przyszłym tygodniu jadę za granicę, a nie mówię dobrze po angielsku.
english: I'm stressed out because I'm going abroad next week and I don't speak English well.
glossary: to speak English well/to go abroad/next week
translation: 10. I'm stressed because I'm going abroad next week but I don't speak English well

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Myślę, że dzisiaj będę pracował po godzinach. Co powiesz na czwartek?
english: I think I'll work overtime today. What about Thursday?
glossary: to work overtime/to meet/today/Thursday/What about.../to think
translation: I think I'll work after hours today. How about Thursday?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Myśłałem, że zawieziesz mnie do domu. Nie chcę brać taksówki.
english: I thought you'd take me home. I don't want to take a cab.
glossary: to think/to take sb home/to take a cab
translation: I thought you would drive me home. I don't want to take a cab.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Idę jutro do banku, żeby założyć konto.
english: I'm going to the bank tomorrow to open an account.
glossary: to go to the bank/to open an account/tomorrow
translation: I'm going to the bank tomorrow to open an account.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Skup się na sprzątaniu pokoju.
english: Focus on cleaning the room.
glossary: to focus on sth/to clean a room
translation: Focus on cleaning your room.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Musisz pamiętać, że jest wyjątek do tej zasady.
english: You have to remember that there's an exception to the rule.
glossary: to remember sth/an exception to the rule
translation: You have to remember that there is an exception to this rule.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Chciałabym, żebyś wygłosił przemowę na konferencji.
english: I'd like you to give a speech at the conference.
glossary: to give a speech/at the conference
translation: I'd like you to make a speech at the conference.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: W tej grupie jest za dużo ludzi. Znajdę inną.
english: There are too many people in the group. I have to find a different one.
glossary: in the group/to find sth/different
translation: There are too many people in this group. I will find another one.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Powinienem był od razu cię zwolnić. Nie zasługujesz, żeby tu być.
english: I should've fired you right away. You don't deserve to be here.
glossary: to fire sb/right away/to deserve sth
translation: I should have fired you immediately. You don't deserve to be here.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Kiedy zaczynasz nową pracę?
english: When are you starting the new job?
glossary: to start a new job
translation: When do you start a new job?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Interesuję się gotowaniem.
english: I'm interested in cooking.
glossary: to be interested in sth/to cook sth
translation: I'm interested in cooking.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Dziś wieczorem jemy na mieście.
english: We're eating out tonight.
glossary: to eat out/tonight
translation: We’re eating out tonight.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Napisała wczoraj do mnie stara znajoma.
english: An old friend of mine texted me yesterday.
glossary: to text sb/an old friend of mine
translation: The old friend of mine wrote to me yesterday.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Powinnaś być ze mnie dumna.
english: You should be proud of me.
glossary: to be proud of sb
translation: You should be proud of me.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Nie powinieneś się zapominać.
english: You shouldn't forget yourself.
glossary: to forget yourself
translation: You shouldn’t forget yourself.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Nie możemy zacząć od początku, bo nie mamy czasu.
english: We can't start over because we don't have time.
glossary: to start over/to have time
translation: We can’t start over because we don’t have time.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Mam nadzieję, że nadrobisz pracę domową.
english: I hope you'll catch up on your homework.
glossary: to catch up on your homework
translation: I hope, you catch up on your homework.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Obiecuję, że awansujesz w przyszłym roku.
english: I promise you'll get promoted next year.
glossary: to get promoted/next year
translation: I promise you will get promoted next year.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Musimy wyjśnić sytuację.
english: We have to explain the situation.
glossary: to explain the situation
translation: We have to explain the situation.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Jutro idę na zakupy. Chcesz do mnie dołączyć?
english: I'm going shopping tomorrow. Do you want to join me?
glossary: to go shopping/to join sb
translation: I’m going shopping tomorrow. Do you want to join me?

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Dzwoniła wczoraj do mnie teściowa.
english: My mother-in-law called me yesterday.
glossary: to call sb
translation: My mother in low called me yesterday.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Na co się patrzysz?
english: What are you looking at?
glossary: to look at sth
translation: What are you looking at?

name: Jack Russell
polish: Nudziło mi się wczoraj w pracy, bo nie było nic do roboty.
english: I was bored at work yesterday because there was nothing to do.
glossary: to be bored/at work/to have nothing to do
translation: I was bored at work yesterday because there was nothing to do.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Mogłaś mnie wczoraj odwiedzić, skoro byłaś w mieście.
english: You could've visited me yesterday since you were in town.
glossary: to visit sb/to be in town
translation: You could have visited me yesterday while you were in town.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Obiecałaś, że zrobisz mi dzisiaj włosy.
english: You promised you'd do my hair today.
glossary: to promise sb sth; to promise to sb/to do your hair/today
translation: You promised you would do my hair tonight.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Z kogo się śmiejesz?
english: Who are you laughing at?
glossary: to laugh at sb
translation: Who are you laughing at?

name: Jack Russell
polish: Miałam nadzieję, że nie będę miała dzisiaj kaca.
english: I hoped I wouldn't have a hangover today.
glossary: to hope/to have a hangover/today
translation: I was hoping I won’t have a hangover today.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Nie miałem tego na myśli. Nie powinnaś była brać tego osobiście.
english: I didn't mean it. You shouldn't have taken it personally.
glossary: to mean sth/to take sth personally
translation: I didn't mean it. You shouldn't have taken this personally.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Jestem pewien, że schudnę do lata.
english: I'm sure I'll lose weight by summer.
glossary: to be sure/to lose weight/by summer
translation: I’m sure I’ll lose weight by the end of the summer.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Nie powinniśmy byli się kłócić. To nie miało sensu.
english: We shouldn't have argued. It didn't make sense.
glossary: to argue with sb/to make sense
translation: We shouldn’t have argued. It didn't make sense.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Stresuję się, bo w przyszłym tygodniu jadę za granicę, a nie mówię dobrze po angielsku.
english: I'm stressed out because I'm going abroad next week and I don't speak English well.
glossary: to speak English well/to go abroad/next week
translation: I’m stressed because I’m going abroad next week and I don't speak English well.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Policja twierdziła wczoraj, że wytropiła złodzieja.
english: The police stated yesterday that they'd tracked down the thief.
glossary: to track down a thief
translation: The police claimed yesterday that they had tracked down the thief.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: W zeszłym roku mówiłaś, że musisz ograniczyć palenie, ale tego nie zrobiłaś.
english: You said last year that you had to cut down on smoking, but you didn't.
glossary: to cut down on smoking/last year
translation: Last year you were saying you had to cut down on smoking, but you didn't.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Nadrobimy opóźnienie, jak już dostaniemy wszystkie niezbędne materiały.
english: We'll make up for the delay once we get all the necessary materials.
glossary: the necessary materials/to make up for a delay
translation: We will make up for the delay once we get all the necessary materials.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Chciałbym, żebyś rozważył wszystkie za i przeciw.
english: I'd like you to weigh up all the pros and cons.
glossary: to weigh up the pros and cons
translation: I'd like you to weigh up all the pros and cons.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Córka obiecała, że nie będzie panikować, kiedy rozpęta się kolejna burza.
english: My daughter promised she wouldn't freak out when the next storm breaks out.
glossary: to break out/to freak out/a daughter
translation: My daughter promised not to freak out when the next storm breaks.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Dlaczego nie broniłeś swoich interesów, gdy właściel mieszkania próbował cię orżnąć?
english: Why didn't you stand up for your interests when the apartment owner was trying to rip you off?
glossary: to rip sb off/an apartment owner/to stand up for your interests
translation: Why didn't you stand up for your interests when the apartment owner tried to rip you off?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Nie powinnaś była wchodzić mi w drogę.
english: You should've stayed out of my way.
glossary: to stay out of sb's way
translation: You should have stayed out of my way.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Czy sędzia rozważył już dowody?
english: Has the judge weighed up the evidence yet?
glossary: to weigh up evidence
translation: Has the judge weighed up the evidence yet?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Z ilu części składa się projekt?
english: How many parts is the project made up of?
glossary: to be made up of two parts/a project
translation: How many parts is a project made up of?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Dlaczego ograniczasz mięso? Jest zdrowe.
english: Why are you cutting down on meat? It's healthy.
glossary: to be healthy/to cut down on meat
translation: Why do you cut down on meat? It's healthy.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Mogę Ci pomóc, ale musisz mi zapłacić.
english: I can help you, but you have to pay me.
glossary: to help sb/to pay sb
translation: I can help you, but you have to pay me.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Nastaw budzik. Musisz jutro wcześnie wstać.
english: Set the alarm. You have to wake up early tomorrow.
glossary: to set the alarm/to wake up/early/tomorrow
translation: Set the alarm. You have to wake up early tomorrrow.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Chciałem zjeść śniadanie, ale nie miałem czasu.
english: I wanted to eat breakfast, but I had no time.
glossary: to eat breakfast/to have no time
translation: I wanted to eat breakfast, but I didn`t have time.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Powinieneś mi powiedzieć prawdę. Zasługuję na to.
english: You should tell me the truth. I deserve it.
glossary: to tell sb the truth/to deserve sth
translation: You should tell me the truth. I deserve it.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Możemy iść na drinka, ale musimy wziąć taksówkę.
english: We can go for a drink, but we have to take a cab.
glossary: to go for a drink/to take a cab
translation: We can go for a drink, but we have to take a cab.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Chciałem zrobić sobie drzemkę, ale nie mogłem zasnąć.
english: I wanted to take a nap, but I couldn't fall asleep.
glossary: to take a nap/to fall asleep
translation: I wanted to take a nap, but I couldn`t fall asleep.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Przyjechałem do Warszawy, bo chciałem się z Tobą zobaczyć.
english: I came to Warsaw because I wanted to see you.
glossary: to come to Warsaw/to see sb
translation: I arrived to Warsow because I wanted to meet you.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Mogę zrobić prezentację na dzisiejszym spotkaniu.
english: I can give a presentation at today's meeting.
glossary: to give a presentation/at today's meeting
translation: I can make a presentation at the today`s meeting.

name: Peter Kane
polish: W przyszłym roku chcę się przeprowadzić na wieś.
english: I want to move to the countryside next year.
glossary: to move to the countryside/next year
translation: I want to move to the countryside next year.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Mogę się spóźnić, bo jest duży ruch.
english: I can be late because the traffic is heavy.
glossary: to be late/heavy traffic
translation: I can be late because there is heavy traffic.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Przed kim ostrzegali nas rodzice? Zapomniałeś?
english: Who did our parents warn us of? Did you forget?
glossary: to warn sb about sb; to warn sb of sb/to forget
translation: Who parents warned us about.Did you forget?

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Jestem słaby w słuchaniu innych.
english: I'm bad at listening to others.
glossary: to be bad at sth/to listen to others
translation: I am weak at listening to others.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Zarząd zapytał się mnie wczoraj, dlaczego przekroczyliśmy budżet.
english: The management board asked me yesterday why we'd gone over budget.
glossary: the management board/to go over budget
translation: The management board asked me yesterday why did we cross the budget.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Byłbym wdzięczny, gdybyś wyświadczyła mi przysługę.
english: I'd be grateful if you did me a favor.
glossary: I'd be grateful if.../to be grateful/to do sb a favor
translation: I would be grateful if you would do me a favor.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Na kim w zespole możesz polegać?
english: Who can you rely on on the team?
glossary: to rely on sb/on the team
translation: Who can you relay on in the team?

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Żądamy, aby dyrektor szkoły ustąpił ze stanowiska.
english: We demand that the school principal step down.
glossary: to demand that.../the school principal/to step down
translation: We demand that the school principal resign.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Zastanawiałem się jakiś czas temu, czy mi już wybaczyłaś.
english: I was wondering a while ago if you'd forgiven me yet.
glossary: I was wondering if.../a while ago/to forgive sb
translation: I was wonder some time ago if you had forgive me.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Nie miałbyś teraz kłopotów, gdybyś nie próbował przekupić policjanta.
english: You wouldn't be in trouble now if you hadn't tried to bribe a police officer.
glossary: to be in trouble/to try to do sh/a police officer/to bribe sb
translation: You wouldn’t be in trouble now if you didn’t try to bribe the policeman

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Zapytałem się wczoraj mojego adwokata, czy złożył już apelację od wyroku sądu.
english: I asked my attorney yesterday if he'd appealed the court's decision yet.
glossary: an attorney/to appeal the court's decision
translation: Yesterday I asked my lawyer if he had already appealed against the court sentence.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Z kim wczoraj wygrałeś?
english: Who did you win against yesterday?
glossary: to win against sb
translation: Who did you win yesterday?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Muszę się skupić na szukaniu lepszej pracy.
english: I have to focus on looking for a better job.
glossary: to look for a job/to focus on sth
translation: I have to focus on looking for a better job.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Dostaniesz grzywnę, jeśli nie zapłacisz podatku na czas.
english: You'll get a fine if you don't pay your tax on time.
glossary: to pay your tax/to get a fine
translation: You will get a fine if you don’t pay a tax on time.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Rzuciłbym pracę, gdybym musiał pracować po godzinach.
english: I'd leave my job if I had to work overtime.
glossary: to leave your job/to work overtime
translation: I would leave a job if I had to work overtime.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Ostatnim razem, kiedy rozmawiałyśmy, mówiłaś, że potrzebujesz mojej porady.
english: The last time we talked, you said you needed my advice.
glossary: to need sb's advice/The last time we talked.../to say sth
translation: Last time when we had a conversation, you said that you would need my advice.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Kiedy ostatni raz widział pan ofiarę żywą?
english: When was the last time you saw the victim alive?
glossary: to be alive/a victim/to see sb/When was the last time...
translation: When did you see a living victim for the last time?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Policja nie zatrzymałaby cię, gdybyś włączył światła.
english: The police wouldn't have pulled you over if you'd turned on the headlights.
glossary: to turn on the headlights/to pull sb over/the police
translation: The police wouldn’t have stopped you if you had your lights turned on.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Nie spaliłam jeszcze twoich rzeczy, ale za chwilę to zrobię.
english: I haven't burned your stuff yet, but I'll do it in a moment.
glossary: to burn sth/your stuff/in a moment
translation: I haven’t burned your things yet, but I will do it in a moment.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Czy jest możliwość zaparkowania samochodu przed budynkiem?
english: Is there the possibility to park a car in front of the building?
glossary: to park a car/in front of the building/a possibility to do sth
translation: Is it possible to park my car in front of the building?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Dowiedziałem się o tym fakcie po tym, jak się rozstaliśmy.
english: I found out about the fact after we'd broken up.
glossary: to find out about sth/a fact/to break up
translation: I found out about the fact after we got broken up.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Powiedz mi, w czym się specjalizujesz.
english: Tell me what you specialize in.
glossary: to specialize in sth
translation: Tell me what you specialize in.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Czy nie mieliśmy wczoraj zapłacić pierwszej raty?
english: Weren't we supposed to pay the first installment yesterday?
glossary: to pay an installment
translation: 1. Were we not supposed to pay the first installment yesterday?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Czy rozwiązanie sprawdziło się na dłuższą metę?
english: Did the solution work out in the long run?
glossary: to work out/in the long run

name: Martin Hale
polish: Z czego wynika Twoja pasja do języków?
english: What does your passion for languages stem from?
glossary: to have a passion for sth/to stem from sth

name: Martin Hale
polish: Mój mąż zawsze chrapie. Rozważam spanie osobno.
english: My husband is always snoring. I'm considering sleeping separately.
glossary: to snore/to consider doing sth/to sleep separately
translation: 4. My husband always snores. I consider sleeping separately.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Zawsze siedzisz do późna. Nie możemy pójść razem spać?
english: You're always sitting up late. Can't we go to sleep together?
glossary: to sit up late/to go to sleep together
translation: 5. You always sit late. Can’t we go to sleep together?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Od jak dawna wynajmujesz mieszkanie swoim znajomym? Znasz ich dobrze?
english: How long have you been renting out the apartment to your friends? Do you know them well?
glossary: to rent out an apartment to sb
translation: 6. How long do you rent the apartment for your friends? Do you know them well?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Nigdy nie bierzesz pod uwagę moich sugestii. Czy w ogóle zależy Ci na mojej opinii?
english: You never consider my suggestions. Do you even care about my opinion?
glossary: to consider sth/a suggestion/to care about sth
translation: 7. You’ve never considered my suggestions. Do you care about my opinion at all?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Na kogo zawsze głosuje Twoja matka?
english: Who does your mother always vote for?
glossary: to vote for sb
translation: 8. Who has your mom always voted for?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Co sprawiło, że pomyślałeś, że kiedykolwiek mógłbym Cię zdradzić?
english: What made you think that I could ever cheat on you?
glossary: to make sb do sth/to cheat on sb
translation: 9. What made you think that I could ever cheat on you?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Zawsze pędzisz. Może powinieneś nauczyć się jeździć.
english: You're always speeding. Maybe you should learn how to drive.
glossary: to speed/to learn how to do sth
translation: 10. You always run. Maybe, you should learn to drive.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Dlaczego dzwoniłeś wczoraj do mnie tyle razy?
english: Why did you call me so many times yesterday?
glossary: to call sb/many times
translation: Why did you call me so many times yesterday?

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Z kim wczoraj poszedłeś na imprezę?
english: Who did you go to the party with yesterday?
glossary: to go to a party with sb
translation: Who did you go to the party with yesterday?

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Nie powinnaś była składać obietnicy, jeśli wiedziałaś, że jej nie dotrzymasz.
english: You shouldn't have made the promise if you knew you wouldn't keep it.
glossary: to make a promise/to keep a promise
translation: You shouldn’t make a promise, if you knew that you wouldn’t keep it.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Jestem rozczarowana. Byłam pewna, że nie złamiesz obietnicy.
english: I'm disappointed. I was sure you wouldn't break the promise.
glossary: to be disappointed with sth/to be sure/to break a promise
translation: I’m disappointed. I was sure that you wouldn’t break the secret.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Ufam ci, bo od dawna razem pracujemy.
english: I trust you because we've been working together for a long time.
glossary: to trust sb/for a long time
translation: I trust you because we’ve been working for a long time.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Możemy porozmawiać, bo nie ma tu nikogo.
english: We can talk because there's nobody here.
glossary: to talk about sth
translation: We can talk because is nobody here.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Przeprowadzam się w przyszłym miesiącu na wieś. Nie mogę się doczekać.
english: I'm moving to the countryside next month. I can't wait.
glossary: can't wait/to move to the countryside
translation: I’m moving to the countryside next month. I can’t wait.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Jest kilka książek, które chciałbym przeczytać do końca roku.
english: There are a few books I'd like to read by the end of the year.
glossary: a few/to read a book/by the end of the year
translation: There are a few books which I would like to read by the end of the year.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Mam nadzieję, że zdążę na pociąg. To ostatni.
english: I hope I'll catch the train. It's the last one.
glossary: to catch the train/to catch the last train
translation: I hope that I cach the train. It the last.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Od miesiąca szukam pracy, ale nie ma interesujących ofert.
english: I've been looking for a job for a month, but there are no interesting offers.
glossary: to look for a job/an offer
translation: I’ve been looking a job for month but there aren’t interesting offers.

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Czy są w tym mieście jakieś miejsca, które powinienem odwiedzić?
english: Are there any places in the city I should visit?
glossary: in the city; in town/to visit a place
translation: Are there  any places in this town I  should visit ?

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Gdzie jedziesz w tym roku na wakacje?
english: Where are you going on vacation this year?
glossary: to go on vacation/this year
translation: Where are you going on holiday this year ?

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Mamy czas. Nie ma potrzeby się spieszyć.
english: We have time. There's no need to hurry up.
glossary: to have time/a need/to hurry up
translation: We have time. There is no reason to hurry

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że wrócę do domu dzisiaj, ale uciekł mi pociąg.
english: I hoped I'd come back home today, but I missed the train.
glossary: to hope/to come back home/today/to miss the train
translation: I hoped I would came to home back , but my train missed

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Dlaczego tak zareagowałaś? Możesz mi to wytłumaczyć?
english: Why did you react like that? Can you explain it to me?
glossary: to react to sth/like that/to explain sth to sb
translation: Why did you react like that? Can you explain it to me ?

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Mogłeś wcześniej zadzwonić. Powiedziałabym Ci, że nie ma mnie w domu.
english: You could've called before. I would've told you I wasn't at home.
glossary: to be at home/to call sb
translation: You should call me later . I would tell I’m not at home

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Z kim wczoraj rozmawiałeś przez telefon?
english: Who did you talk to on the phone yesterday?
glossary: to talk to sb over the phone

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Idziemy dziś wieczorem na drinka. Pamiętasz?
english: We're going for a drink tonight. Do you remember?
glossary: to remember/to go for a drink/tonight
translation: We are going to drink tonight . Do you remember?

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Obawiam się, że nie dostanę tej pracy.
english: I'm afraid I won't get the job.
glossary: to be afraid of sth/to get a job
translation: I'm afraid I won't get this job.

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Z kim chcesz spędzić resztę swojego życia?

glossary: to spend time with sb/the rest of your life
translation: Who do you want to spend the rest of your life with?

name: Matt Xander
polish: Moja mama przeszła w zeszłym roku na emeryturę.
english: My mom retired last year.
glossary: to retire/last year
translation: 1. My mother retired last year.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Nie wierzę. Znajomi znowu mnie wystawili.

glossary: to believe sb/to stand sb up/a friend

name: Matt Xander
polish: Dawno cię nie widziałam. Musisz wpaść w tym tygodniu.
english: I haven't seen you for a long time. You have to drop by this week.
glossary: to drop by/for a long time/this week
translation: 3. I haven't seen you in a long time. You must come by this week.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Nie możesz unikać odpowiedzialności.
english: You can't avoid responsibility.
glossary: to avoid responsibility
translation: 4. You can't avoid responsibility.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Nie możesz się tak zachowywać.
english: You can't behave like that.
glossary: to behave
translation: 5. You can't behave like this.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Nie idę z wami jutro na imprezę. Pracuję na nocną zmianę.
english: I'm not going to the party with you tomorrow. I'm working the night shift.
glossary: to go to a party with sb/to work the night shift
translation: 6. I'm not going to the party with you tomorrow. I'm working the night shift.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Nie będę w stanie pojawić się w weekend, bo pracuję.

glossary: to show up/to work on the weekend/to be able to do sth

name: Matt Xander
polish: Mam nadzieję, że nie będę mieć jutro kaca.
english: I hope I won't have a hangover tomorrow.
glossary: to have a hangover

name: Matt Xander
polish: Musisz mnie przeprosić.
english: You have to apologize to me.
glossary: to apologize to sb
translation: 9. You have to apologize to me.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Pozwę cię. Zobaczysz.

glossary: to sue sb/to see sth
translation: 10. I will sue you. You will see.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Dlaczego dzwoniłeś wczoraj do mnie tyle razy?
english: Why did you call me so many times yesterday?
glossary: to call sb/many times
translation: I found out a few days ago my wife had been married once.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Z kim wczoraj poszedłeś na imprezę?

glossary: to go to a party with sb
translation: I was leaving when my boss appeared and told me he needed I would stay at work one hour longer.

name: Adrianne Nelson

english: You shouldn't have made the promise if you knew you wouldn't keep it.
glossary: to make a promise/to keep a promise

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Jestem rozczarowana. Byłam pewna, że nie złamiesz obietnicy.
english: I'm disappointed. I was sure you wouldn't break the promise.
glossary: to be disappointed with sth/to be sure/to break a promise

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Ufam ci, bo od dawna razem pracujemy.

glossary: to trust sb/for a long time

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Możemy porozmawiać, bo nie ma tu nikogo.

glossary: to talk about sth

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Przeprowadzam się w przyszłym miesiącu na wieś. Nie mogę się doczekać.
english: I'm moving to the countryside next month. I can't wait.
glossary: can't wait/to move to the countryside

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Jest kilka książek, które chciałbym przeczytać do końca roku.
english: There are a few books I'd like to read by the end of the year.
glossary: a few/to read a book/by the end of the year

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Mam nadzieję, że zdążę na pociąg. To ostatni.

glossary: to catch the train/to catch the last train
translation: If you don't tell my about your problem now, I won't be able to help you.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Od miesiąca szukam pracy, ale nie ma interesujących ofert.

glossary: to look for sb/to commit a crime

glossary: a vote against sb/a candidate

glossary: to meet sb/to leave the building

name: Anna Patton
polish: Zrobiłaś test ciążowy?

glossary: to do a pregnancy test/a pregnancy test

name: Anna Patton

glossary: a real estate agency/to find out that.../a boss

name: Anna Patton
polish: Wszyscy się mnie wczoraj pytali, czy jestem zły. Nie wiem dlaczego.
english: Everybody asked me yesterday if I was mad. I don't know why.
glossary: to be mad at sb
translation: Everyone asked my yesterday if I was mad. I don't know why.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Często podróżowaliśmy z mężem, zanim urodziło się nasze pierwsze dziecko.
english: My husband and I had often traveled before our first kid was born.
glossary: to be born/a kid/to travel/a husband
translation: We traveled often with our husband before I gave a birth to our first child.

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Nie musisz mieć wyrzutów sumienia.
english: You don't need to have remorse.
glossary: to have remorse
translation: 1. You don't have to remorse.

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Zerzygałam się na ostatniej imprezie. Żenada.

polish: Obiecuję, że następnym razem będę się lepiej zachowywał.

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Nie możesz się tak gapić na ludzi.

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Wczoraj lekarz przepisał mi leki przeciwbólowe.

translation: 5. Yesterday a doctor prescribed me painkillers.

name: Sergius Birch
polish: W przyszłym roku kończę studia. Nie mogę się doczekać.

translation: 6. I'll finish college next year. I can't wait.  /  I'm going to finish college next year. I can't wait.

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Powinnaś mnie lepiej traktować.
english: You should treat me better.
glossary: to treat sb well
translation: 7. You should treat me better.

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Dziś wieczorem nie ćwiczę. Muszę odpocząć.
english: I'm not working out tonight. I have to rest.

translation: 8. I won't workout tonight. I have to rest.

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Musisz przyznać, że mam rację.

translation: 9. You have to agree I'm right.

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Jestem pewien, że się pojawię na imprezie.
english: I'm sure I'll show up at the party.
glossary: to be sure about sth/to show up/at the party/I'm sure that.../to show up at the party
translation: 10. I'm sure I'll come at the party.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Nie musisz mieć wyrzutów sumienia.
english: You don't need to have remorse.
glossary: to have remorse

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Zerzygałam się na ostatniej imprezie. Żenada.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Obiecuję, że następnym razem będę się lepiej zachowywał.

name: Agnes Parker

polish: Wczoraj lekarz przepisał mi leki przeciwbólowe.

glossary: in the city; in town/to visit a place

name: Kate Long

polish: Miałem nadzieję, że wrócę do domu dzisiaj, ale uciekł mi pociąg.

english: Why did you react like that? Can you explain it to me?
glossary: to react to sth/like that/to explain sth to sb
translation: 5.	Why did you react like that? Could you explain me that?

name: Kate Long
polish: Mogłeś wcześniej zadzwonić. Powiedziałabym Ci, że nie ma mnie w domu.

glossary: to be at home/to call sb

name: Kate Long
polish: Z kim wczoraj rozmawiałeś przez telefon?

glossary: to talk to sb over the phone
translation: 7.	Who did you talk over the phone to?

name: Kate Long
polish: Idziemy dziś wieczorem na drinka. Pamiętasz?

translation: 8.	We’re going for a drink tonight. Do you remember?

name: Kate Long
polish: Obawiam się, że nie dostanę tej pracy.
english: I'm afraid I won't get the job.

translation: 9.	I’m afraid I won’t get the job.

name: Kate Long
polish: Z kim chcesz spędzić resztę swojego życia?
english: Who do you want to spend the rest of your life with?
glossary: to spend time with sb/the rest of your life
translation: 10.	Who do you want to spend the rest of your life with?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Mój współpracownik nigdy nie zwraca uwagi na szczegóły. Zawsze muszę poprawiać jego zadania.
english: My coworker never pays attention to detail. I always have to correct his tasks.
glossary: to pay attention to detail/to correct sth
translation: 1.	My colleague never pays attention on details. I always have to correct his tasks.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Jak długo umniejszasz moje osiągnięcia? Nie będę już tego znosić.
english: How long have you been diminishing my accomplishments? I won't put up with it anymore.
glossary: to diminish sth/to put up with sth
translation: 2.	How long have you been downgrading my achievements? I won’t tolerate it any more.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Jak długo żujesz tę gumę? Weź nową.
english: How long have you been chewing this gum? Take a new one.
glossary: to chew a gum/to take a new one
translation: 3.	How long have you been chewing this gum? Take the new one.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Słyszałem dziś, jak moja córka mówi po angielsku, i to skłoniło mnie do myślenia. Może też powinienem zapisać się na taki kurs.
english: I heard my daughter speaking English today, and it made me think. Maybe I should sign up for such a course as well.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to hear sb doing sth/to sign up for a course
translation: 4.	I heard today how my daughter spoke English, and it made me think. Maybe I should sign up for such a course as well.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: O co prokurator okręgowy chce cię oskarżyć?
english: What does the district attorney want to charge you with?
glossary: a district attorney/to charge sb with sth
translation: 5.	What does the district prosecutor want to accuse you of?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Powinniśmy teraz nosić maseczki w sklepach.
english: We are supposed to wear face masks in stores now.
glossary: to wear face masks
translation: 6.	We should wear masks in stores now.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Jak długo tyle bierzesz? Ostatnim razem, kiedy się spotkaliśmy, było taniej.
english: How long have you been charging this much? The last time we met it was cheaper.
glossary: to charge sb
translation: 7.	How long have you taking so much? Las time when we met it was cheaper.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Od jak dawna chwalisz się swoim nowym samochodem? Czy nie widzisz, że wszyscy mają dość?
english: How long have you been bragging about your new car? Can't you see everyone's fed up?
glossary: to brag about sth/to be fed up with sth
translation: 8.	How long have you been bragging about your new car? Can’t you see that everyone is fed up?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Dlaczego akcje Twojej firmy spadły? Czy coś się stało?
english: Why did your company's shares drop? Did anything happen?
glossary: to drop/a share
translation: 9.	Why did your company’s stocks drop down? Did something happen?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Mieliśmy się zmieniać, nieprawdaż?
english: We were supposed to take turns, weren't we?
glossary: to take turns
translation: 10.	We were supposed to change, weren’t we?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Zatrudnilibyśmy pana, gdyby miał pan więcej doświadczenia w tym obszarze.
english: We'd hire you if you had more experience in this area.
glossary: to hire sb/to have experience in sth
translation: We would hire you if you had more experience in this area.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Nie będę w stanie się skupić na tym zadaniu, dopóki nie ściszysz muzyki.
english: I won't be able to focus on this task until you turn the music down.
glossary: to focus on sth/ to turn the music down
translation: I won’t be able to focus on this task until you turn the music down.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Nie będę z tobą rozmawiała, dopóki mnie nie przeprosisz.
english: I won't be speaking with you until you apologize to me.
glossary: to speak with sb/to apologize to sb
translation: I won’t talk to you until you apologize me.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Jaką zabawkę chcesz dostać na urodziny?
english: What toy would you like to get for your birthday?
glossary: to get sth for your birthday/a toy
translation: What toy you would like to get on birthday?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Nie zapomniałbyś o spotkaniu, gdybyś dodała je do swojego kalendarza.
english: You wouldn't have forgotten about the meeting if you had added it to your calendar.
glossary: to forget about sth/a meeting/to add sth to your calendar
translation: You wouldn’t forget about the meeting if you added it to your calendar.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Niełatwo było mi namówić żonę na wzięcie kilku dni wolnego.
english: It wasn't easy for me to persuade my wife to take a few days off.
glossary: to persuade sb to do sth/a day off
translation: It wasn’t easy for me to convince my wife to take a few days off.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Nie będziesz grał w żadne gry, dopóki nie posprzątasz.
english: I won't be playing any games until you clean up.
glossary: to play games/to clean sth up
translation: You won’t play any games until you won’t clean up.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Nie będę taki przepracowany, kiedy skończy się sezon.
english: I won't be this overworked when this season ends.
glossary: to be overworked/to end
translation: I won’t be so overworked when the season ends.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Dlaczego nalegasz? Wiesz, że się nie zgodzę.
english: Why are you insisting? You know I won't agree.
glossary: to insist/to agree
translation: Why are you insist? You know that I won’t agree.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Trudno nam będzie to zmierzyć, bo nie mamy odpowiednich narzędzi.
english: It'll be hard for us to measure it, because we don't have the right tools.
glossary: to measure sth/to have the right tools
translation: It will be difficult to measure for us because we don’t have appropriate tools.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nasz zespół wygrał jak dotąd jedną nagrodę, ale pracujemy nad tym.
english: Our team has won one prize so far, but we're working on it.
glossary: to win a prize/so far/to work on sth/a team
translation: Our team won one award so far but we’ve been working on it.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Śnił ci się wczoraj koszmar?
english: Did you have a bad dream yesterday?
glossary: to have a bad dream
translation: Did you have a nightmare yesterday?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie byłbym w stanie teraz nic ugotować, gdyby ciocia mnie nie nauczyła, jak to się robi.
english: I wouldn't be able to cook anything now if my aunt hadn't taught me how to do it.
glossary: to cook/to teach sb how to do sth/an aunt
translation: I wouldn’t be able to cook anything now if my aunt didn’t teach me how to do it.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie bolałyby cię plecy, gdybyś nie siedział codziennie przed telewizorem.
english: You wouldn't have back pain if you didn't sit in front of the TV every day.
glossary: to have back pain/to sit in front of the TV/every day
translation: You wouldn’t have back pain if you don’t sit in front of TV every day.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Płacilibyśmy mniej, gdybyśmy wynajęli mieszkanie razem.
english: We'd pay less if we rented an apartment together.
glossary: to rent an apartment
translation: We would pay less if we rent an apartment together.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Ryzykujesz swoją pracę, kłócąc się ze swoim szefem.
english: You're risking your job arguing with your boss.
glossary: to risk your job/to argue with sb/a boss
translation: You risk your job if you argue with your boss.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Gdybym przeszła teraz na emeryturę, musiałabym codziennie siedzieć sama w domu.
english: If I retired now, I'd have to sit at home alone every day.
glossary: to retire/to sit at home
translation: If I retire now, I would have to sit at home alone every day.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Dołączyłbym do was, gdybym nie zapomniał kąpielówek.

glossary: to join sb/to forget sth/swim trunks

name: Anette Gray
polish: Z kim chcesz, żebym porozmawiał?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Gdybyś prowadził własną firmę, miałbyś więcej problemów.
english: If you ran your own company, you would have more problems.
glossary: to run your own company/to have a problem
translation: If you have your own company, you would have more problems.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Detektyw pytał się mnie podczas przesłuchania, czy coś widziałem.

glossary: a detective/during questioning/to see sth

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Znudziło mi się jedzenie codziennie pizzy na obiad.

glossary: to be bored with sth/to eat a pizza/for lunch/every day

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Nie zdołalibyśmy ugasić pożaru, gdybyś od razu nie zadzwonił po służby ratunkowe.

glossary: to manage to do sth/to put out the fire/to call the emergency services/to immediately do sth

name: Matt Carpenter

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Gdybym mówił płynnie po angielsku, wyprowadziłbym się za granicę.
english: If I spoke English fluently, I'd move abroad.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: O czym chciałbyś porozmawiać?
english: What would you like to talk about?

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Zgodziłbyś się ze mną, gdybyś był świadomy pewnym faktów.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Nie musiałbym teraz odsiadywać, gdyby mój adwokat odwołał się od wyroku.

name: Matt Carpenter

name: Matt Carpenter

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Mogłem napisać ten test z angielskiego w zeszłym tygodniu. Teraz nic nie pamiętam.

glossary: to take an English test/to remember sth/last week

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że żona będzie w dobrym humorze.

name: Camille Tyner

glossary: to tell sb the truth/to be afraid of sth/to get mad

polish: Nie mogę zasnąć. Nie powinienem był pić kawy tak późno.

glossary: to fall asleep/to drink coffee/late

name: Camille Tyner

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Pójdę spać, jak już skończę czytać książkę.

glossary: to go to sleep/to finish doing sth

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Jestem głodny. Mogłem zjeść śniadanie.

polish: Miałam nadzieję, że nie będę miała dzisiaj kaca.

polish: Nigdy nie wziąłem łapówki.

name: Greg Hardy

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Mogłem napisać ten test z angielskiego w zeszłym tygodniu. Teraz nic nie pamiętam.

glossary: to hope/to come back home/today/to miss the train

name: Eve Miles
polish: Dlaczego tak zareagowałaś? Możesz mi to wytłumaczyć?

name: Eve Miles

name: Eve Miles
polish: Muszę chronić swoje dzieci.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Nie powinieneś udawać, że mnie słuchasz.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Ja piję dziś wieczorem. Ty prowadzisz.

glossary: to work as an intern/to learn sth/back then

polish: Nie mogę wejść do pokoju. Jest zamknięty.

name: Eve Miles

glossary: to be strict/next time/to promise sth

name: Eve Miles

glossary: to work as a judge/a judge/in the future

name: Eve Miles

glossary: to worry/to stand sb up

name: Eve Miles

name: Eve Miles
polish: W pewnym momencie zauważyłam błąd.

glossary: At some point.../to notice a mistake

name: Eve Miles
polish: Muszę dowiedzieć się prawdy.

translation: 3. My friends are dropping by tomorrow. Buy a beer.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Obiecuję, że pójdę jutro do szkoły.

translation: 4. You shouldn't pretend to be listening to me.

polish: Pójdę na siłownię, kiedy wyzdrowieję.

glossary: to get better/to go to the gym

name: Eve Miles
polish: Przeprowadzam się w przyszłym miesiącu.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Nie mam czasu. Idę jutro do lekarza.

translation: 7. I can’t enter the room. It’s closed.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Byłem wściekły, kiedy żona mnie okłamała.

translation: 8. I'll be more strict next time. I promise.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Myślę, że założę dzisiaj sukienkę.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Odświężę swój angielski, kiedy będę miał więcej czasu.

name: Eve Miles

name: Eve Miles

glossary: to take care of sth

name: Eve Miles
polish: Od godziny robię kolację.

name: Eve Miles

polish: Muszę dowiedzieć się prawdy.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Pójdę na siłownię, kiedy wyzdrowieję.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Byłem wściekły, kiedy żona mnie okłamała.

polish: Od roku chodzę na siłownię.
english: I've been going to the gym for a year.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Nie możesz wychodzić z łóżka. Masz grypę.

glossary: to have the flu/to get out of bed
translation: 10. You can't get out of bed. You have a flu.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Nie będziesz zadowolona, kiedy przeczytasz tę wiadomość.
english: You won't be happy when you read the message.
glossary: to be happy/to read a message
translation: You won’t be glad when you read this message.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Gdzie planujecie jechać tym razem?
english: Where are you planning to go this time?
glossary: to plan to go somewhere
translation: Where are you planning to go this time?

name: Yvonne West
polish: Widzę, że trudno ci utrzymać kontakt wzrokowy.
english: I see that it's hard for you to keep eye contact.
glossary: to keep eye contact
translation: I see, it’s hard for you to keep eye contact.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Gdybym ja tu rządziła, mielibyśmy rozsądne godziny pracy.
english: If I ruled here, we'd have more reasonable working hours.
glossary: to rule/to be reasonable/working hours

english: Your marketing actions will be more efficient when you understand your target audience.
glossary: to be efficient/marketing actions/a target audience

name: Yvonne West
polish: Jakiego rozwiązania szukasz? Może będę w stanie ci pomóc.

glossary: a solution for sth/to be able to help
translation: What solution are you looking for? Maybe I’ll be able to help you.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Łatwo ci to mówić, bo nie masz dzieci.
english: It's easy for you to say this because you don't have kids.
glossary: to have kids
translation: It's easy for you to say that because you don't have children.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Nie musiałbym tu teraz siedzieć, gdybym złożył wypowiedzenie na koniec miesiąca.

glossary: to sit/to give notice

name: Yvonne West
polish: Niełatwo nam zrobić wrażenie na naszej szefowej.

glossary: to make a good impression on sb/a boss

glossary: to explain sth to sb
translation: When you have time will you explain me how it works?

polish: Jak długo wkuwasz do egzaminu? Ja nawet jeszcze nie zacząłem.
english: How long have you been cramming for the exam? I haven't even started yet.
glossary: to cram for the exam
translation: How long have you cramed for the exam? I haven’t started yet.

english: What rules does my company have to comply with to receive the subsidy?
glossary: to comply with sth/a subsidy
translation: What rules have to…..  my company to get subsidy?

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Jaki wpływ miał na Ciebie wypadek?
english: What impact did the accident have on you?
glossary: to have an impact on sb/an accident
translation: How did the accident affect to you?

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Nauczyciel miał kupić płótno. Jak mam teraz malować?
english: The teacher was supposed to buy canvas. How am I supposed to paint now?
glossary: canvas/to paint
translation: The teacher had to buy …. How can I pain now?

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Od czego zależy sukces?
english: What does success depend on?
glossary: to depend on sth/a success
translation: What does success depend on?

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Nigdy mnie nie słuchasz. Jak mamy się komunikować?
english: You never listen to me. How are we supposed to communicate?
glossary: to listen to sb/to communicate
translation: You never listen to me.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Zawsze pracujesz do późna. Nie zależy ci na swojej rodzinie?
english: You're always working late. Don't you care about your family?
glossary: to work late/to care about your family
translation: You are always working to late. Don’t you care about your family?

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Mamy nadzieję, że nasz film pomoże społeczeństwu uświadomić sobie problem przemocy domowej.
english: We hope that our movie will help society realize the problem of domestic violence.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to realize sth/domestic violence
translation: I hope that our movie will help society aware ……….. problem.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Zawsze przeceniasz swoje umiejętności i później wpadamy w kłopoty.
english: You're always overestimating your abilities, and then we get in trouble.
glossary: to overestimate sth/to get in trouble
translation: You always …………your skills and we were in trouble late.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Czego Twój ojciec nie pochwala?
english: What doesn't your father approve of?
glossary: to approve of sth

name: Jack Russell

glossary: a possibility/to fire sb

glossary: to be sure/to gain weight/to eat too little

name: Jack Russell
polish: Jest jeszcze tyle rzeczy, których muszę się nauczyć na test.
english: There are still so many things I have to study for the test.
glossary: to study sth for a test

name: Jack Russell
polish: Nie powinienem był cię słuchać. Nie miałeś racji.
english: I shouldn't have listened to you. You weren't right.
glossary: to listen to sb/to be right
translation: I shouldn’t have listened to you. You weren’t right.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Obiecuję, że odwiedzę was w przyszłym miesiącu.
english: I promise I'll visit you next month.
glossary: to visit sb/next month/to promise
translation: I promise I’m visiting you next month.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Nie powinnaś była dzwonić do mnie tak późno. Moja żona była w domu.
english: You shouldn't have called me so late. My wife was at home.
glossary: to call sb/a wife/to be at home
translation: You shouldn't have called me so late. My wife was at home.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Byłam w szoku, gdy zauważyłam, że na moim koncie nie ma pieniędzy.

glossary: to be in shock/to notice sth/in the bank account/money
translation: I was shocked when I noticed that there was no money in my account.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Nie ma takiej zasady.

glossary: a rule

name: Jack Russell
polish: Spotykam się dzisiaj z jednym z moich klientów, żeby wyjaśnić sytuację.
english: I'm meeting one of my clients today to explain the situation.
glossary: to explain the situation/to meet sb/one of your clients/today
translation: I’m meeting one of my clients today to explain the situation.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Powinienem był się ciebie pozbyć, zanim narobiłeś problemów.

glossary: to get rid of sb/to make trouble
translation: I should have gotten rid of you before you made problems

polish: Nigdy mnie nie słuchasz. Jak mamy się komunikować?

glossary: to listen to sb/to communicate

polish: Zawsze pracujesz do późna. Nie zależy ci na swojej rodzinie?

glossary: to work late/to care about your family

name: Martin Hale
polish: Mamy nadzieję, że nasz film pomoże społeczeństwu uświadomić sobie problem przemocy domowej.

polish: Zawsze przeceniasz swoje umiejętności i później wpadamy w kłopoty.

polish: Czego Twój ojciec nie pochwala?

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Miałem w zeszłym tygodniu dużo pracy i bałem się, że nie wyrobię się z terminem.
english: I had a lot of work last week and I was afraid I wouldn't meet the deadline.
glossary: to have a lot of work/last week/to be afraid of sth/to meet the deadline

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Nie powinieneś był wspominać o naszych problemach na spotkaniu z szefem.
english: You shouldn't have mentioned our problems at the meeting with the boss.
glossary: at the meeting/to mention sth

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Przyjeżdżam jutro do Warszawy i zatrzymuję się u mojej koleżanki.
english: I'm coming to Warsaw tomorrow and staying at my friend's.
glossary: to come to Warsaw
translation: 3. I am arriving to Warsaw tomorrow, and I’m staying at my friend’s.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Nie powinieneś był opowiadać tego żartu. Był niegrzeczny.
english: You shouldn't have told the joke. It was rude.
glossary: to be rude to sb/to tell sb a joke
translation: 4. You shouldn’t have told this joke.It was naughty.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że nic nie będę musiał dzisiaj robić.
english: I hoped I wouldn't have to do anything today.
glossary: to hope/today
translation: 5.I hoped that I didn’t  have to do anything today.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Powinienem był spędzić zeszły weekend z rodziną.
english: I should've spent my last weekend with my family.
glossary: to spend time with sb/last weekend/a family
translation: 6.I should have spent last weekend with my family

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Nie powinienem był Ci opowiadać tej historii, bo jest zbyt prywatna.
english: I shouldn't have told you the story because it's too private.
glossary: to tell sb a story/to be private
translation: 7. I shouldn’t have told you this story because it is too private.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że ci klienci zostawią większy napiwek.
english: I hoped the customers would leave a bigger tip.
glossary: to leave a tip/a customer/to hope

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Nie powinieneś był mnie okłamywać.
