glossary: to lie to sb
translation: 9. You shouldn’t have lied to me.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Co robisz dziś wieczorem?
english: What are you doing tonight?
translation: 10.What are you doing tonight?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Od godziny rozważasz wszystkie za i przeciw. Zdecyduj się.
english: You've been weighing up all the pros and cons for an hour. Make up your mind.
glossary: to make up your mind/to weigh up the pros and cons
translation: You have been weighing up all the pros and cons for an hour. Make up your mind.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Zapomniałam już o tobie.
english: I've already gotten over you.
glossary: to get over sb
translation: I’ve gotten over you already.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Gdybyś założyła tę czarną kieckę, to by uwydatniło co w tobie najlepsze.
english: If you put on the black dress, it would bring out the best in you.
glossary: to bring out the best in sb/to put on a dress
translation: If you had worn that black dress, it would have brought out the best in you.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Podgrzewałem jedzenie, kiedy wysiadł prąd.
english: I was heating up the food when the power went off.
glossary: to go off {4}/to heat up the food
translation: I was heating up food when the electricity went out.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Bomba by nie wybuchła, gdyby policja nie schrzaniła roboty.
english: The bomb wouldn't have gone off if the police hadn't screwed up the job.
glossary: to screw up a job/to go off {3}
translation: The bomb would not have went off if the police had not screwed up the job.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Czy możesz skupić się na wykonywaniu zadania?
english: Can you focus on carrying out the task?
glossary: to carry out a task/to focus on sth
translation: Can you focus on carrying out a task?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Kiedy przezwyciężyłem swój strach, dziewczyna wyszła już z baru.
english: When I got over my fear, the girl had already left the bar.
glossary: to leave the bar/to get over your fear
translation: When I got over my fear, the girl had already left the bar.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Przyzwyczaiłem się do sprawdzania słów w słowniku, kiedy pisałem artykły po angielsku.
english: I got used to looking up words in the dictionary when I wrote articles in English.
glossary: to write an article in English/to look up a word in the dictionary/to get used to doing sth
translation: I got used to looking up words in the dictionary when I was writing articles in English.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Jeśli dostanę wypłatę na czas, wybiorę droższą opcję.
english: If I get paid on time, I'll go for the more expensive option.
glossary: to go for sth/to get paid/on time
translation: If I get paid on time, I will choose the more expensive option.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Kiedyś chodziłem do łóżka z każdą dziewczyną, którą poznałem, ale się ogarnąłem.
english: I used to hook up with every girl I met, but I got a grip on myself.
glossary: to hook up/to meet sb {2}/to get a grip on yourself
translation: I used to hook up with every girl I met, but I got a grip on myself.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: W ten weekend robimy z przyjacielem parapetówkę.
english: My friend and I are throwing a housewarming party this weekend.
glossary: to throw a housewarming party/a housewarming party/a friend/this weekend
translation: My friend and I are doing the house-warming party this weekend.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Nie martw się. Pomogę ci z problemem.
english: Don't worry. I'll help you with the problem.
glossary: to worry/to help sb with a problem
translation: Don’t worry. I will help you with the problem.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Jest ciepło na zewnątrz, więc nie musisz zakładać kurtki.
english: It's warm outside, so you don't have to put on a jacket.
glossary: warm/outside/to put on a jacket
translation: It’s warm outside, so you don’t need to wear a jacket.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: W zeszłym tygodniu poprosiłam mamę, żeby poszła ze mną na zakupy.
english: I asked my mom to go shopping with me last week.
glossary: to go shopping/last week
translation: I asked my mother last week to go to do shopping with me.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Niedługo poznam dziewczynę mojego syna.
english: I'm meeting my son's girlfriend soon.
glossary: soon/to meet sb {2}/a son/a girlfriend
translation: I will get to know my son’s girlfriend soon.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Wczoraj znalazłam korepetytora dla moich dzieci.
english: I found a private tutor for my children yesterday.
glossary: to find a private tutor/a private tutor/children
translation: I found the tutor for my children yesterday.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Obiecuję, że tym razem będę miła dla twojego męża.
english: I promise I'll be nice to your husband this time.
glossary: to be nice to sb/to promise that.../this time/a husband
translation: I promise that I will be nice for your husband this time.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Niestety nie mogę ci polecić żadnego interesującego filmu.
english: Unfortunately, I can't recommend any interesting movie to you.
glossary: Unfortunately.../to recommend sth to sb/an interesting movie
translation: Sadly, I can’t recommend any interesting movie for you.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Musisz spróbować być mniej zazdrosna.
english: You have to try to be less jealous.
glossary: to be jealous/more or less
translation: You have to try to be less jealous.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Powinieneś trenować więcej, żeby być w formie.
english: You should work out more to be in shape.
glossary: to work out/to be in shape
translation: You should work out more to be in good shape.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Nie chowałbym wobec ciebie teraz urazy, gdybyś mnie nie ośmieszyła wczoraj przy znajomych.
english: I wouldn't hold the grudge now if you hadn't ridiculed me in front of my friends yesterday.
glossary: to hold a grudge against sb/to ridicule sb/in front of your friends
translation: I wouldn't hold a grudge against you now if you hadn't made fun of me in front of your friends yesterday.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Mój znajomy płaci za sprzątanie mieszkania.
english: A friend of mine pays for cleaning his apartment.
glossary: a friend of yours/a friend of mine/to pay for sth/to clean your apartment
translation: My friend is paying to cleaning the apartment.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Właściciel firmy zapytał się mnie w zeszłym tygodniu, czy odsiadywałem kiedyś wyrok.
english: The company's owner asked me last week if I'd ever done time.
glossary: the company's owner/to do time; to serve a sentence
translation: The company owner asked me last week if I had ever served a sentence.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Nie byłbyś teraz przepracowany, gdybyś odpoczywał w weekendy.
english: You wouldn't be overworked now if you took a rest on weekends.
glossary: to be overworked/to take a rest/on weekends
translation: You wouldn't have been exhausted if you had rested on weekends.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Wynajmujący zapytał się mnie wczoraj, czy zrobiłam już przelew.
english: The landlord asked me yesterday if I'd made the transfer yet.
glossary: a landlord/to make a transfer
translation: The tenant asked me yesterday if I had made the transfer.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Z ilu części składa się projekt?
english: How many parts does the project consist of?
glossary: to consist of two parts/a project
translation: How many parts are the project made up of?

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Na co cierpi twoja ciotka?
english: What does your aunt suffer from?
glossary: to suffer from sth/an aunt
translation: What is your aunt suffering from?

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Profesor pytał się mnie kilka dni temu, czy napisałem już wypracowanie.
english: The professor asked me the other day if I'd written the essay yet.
glossary: a professor/the other day/to write an essay
translation: A professor asked me a few days ago if I had already written the essay.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Gdyby tylko nie było dzisiaj korków.
english: I wish there was no traffic jam today.
glossary: I wish that...; If only.../a traffic jam
translation: If only there were no traffic jams today.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Ciotka się mnie pytała, czy skończyłam już studia.
english: My aunt asked me if I'd graduated from college yet.
glossary: an aunt/to graduate from college
translation: My aunt asked me if I had already finished the studies.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Dam ci znać, jak już skończę pracę. Będziemy w kontakcie.
english: I'll let you know once I finish work. We'll be in touch.
glossary: to let sb know/to finish work/to be in touch
translation: 1. I will let you know when I'm finished a job. We will be in touch.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Mam dość tego projektu, bo pracuję nad nim od kilku miesięcy.
english: I'm fed up with the project because I've been working on it for a few months.
glossary: to be fed up with sth/to work on a project
translation: 2. I'm fed up with the project, because I have been working on it for several months.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Ostrzegałam cię, że będzie korek na autostradzie, ale nie chciałeś mnie słuchać.
english: I warned you there would be a traffic jam on the highway, but you didn't want to listen to me.
glossary: to warn sb that.../I've warned you that.../an accident/on the highway/to listen to sb
translation: 3. I warned you that would be a traffic jam on the freeway, but you wouldn't listen to me.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Myślę, że będziemy częściej wychodzić razem na miasto, bo przyszłym miesiącu przeprowadzam się do Warszawy.
english: I think we'll hang out together more often because I'm moving to Warsaw next month.
glossary: to go out; to hang out/to move to Warsaw/next month
translation: 4. I think that we will go out together more often, because I'm moving to Warsaw next month.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Nie powinnam była na ciebie krzyczeć. Musiałeś czuć się rozczarowany.
english: I shouldn't have shouted at you. You must've felt disappointed.
glossary: to scream at sb; to shout at sb/to feel disappointed
translation: 5. I couldn't have shouted at you. You must have been felt dissapointed.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Przez trzy miesiące w liceum pracowałam jako kelnerka.
english: I worked as a waitress for three months in high school.
glossary: to work as a waitress/in high school
translation: 6. I worked as a waitress in high school for three months.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: W pewnym momencie wierzyłem, że wrócimy do siebie.
english: At some point, I believed we'd get back together.
glossary: At some point.../to get back together
translation: 7. At some point I belived that we would be back together.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Jakie problemy są w twojej firmie?
english: What problems are there in your company?
glossary: a problem; an issue
translation: 8. What problems are there at your company?

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: O kim rozmawiacie?
english: Who are you talking about?
glossary: to talk about sb
translation: 9. Who are you talking about?

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Gdzie zostawiłeś kurtkę?
english: Where did you leave your jacket?
glossary: a jacket/to leave sth
translation: 10. Where did you leave a jacket?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Jak długo już nalegasz? Nie rozumiesz, że Ci tego nie dam?
english: How long have you been insisting yet? Don't you understand I won't give it?
glossary: to insist
translation: 1.	How long have you been already insisting? Don’t you understand that I won’t give it to you?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: O której wylądował samolot? Nie miał przybyć później?
english: What time did the plane land? Wasn't it supposed to arrive later?
glossary: to land/a plane/to arrive later
translation: 2.	What time did the plane take off? Wasn’t it supposed to be later?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Twoja partia miała mnie wesprzeć w następnych wyborach.
english: Your party was supposed to back me during the next election.
glossary: to back sb/a party/an election
translation: 3.	Your party was supposed to support me in the next election.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Nigdy nie pozwalasz mi chodzić na imprezy. Nie jestem już dzieckiem.
english: You never let me go to parties. I'm not a kid anymore.
glossary: to let sb do sth
translation: 4.	You never let me go to parties. I’m not a kid anymore.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Jak długo zaprzeczasz prawdzie? Czy to nie najwyższy czas, żeby się z tym zmierzyć?
english: How long have you been denying the truth? Isn't it high time to face it?
glossary: to deny the truth/to face sth
translation: 5.	How long have you denied the truth? Isn’t it the high time to face it?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Nikt nie zmuszał Cię do wybrania tego kursu, więc przestań narzekać.
english: No one made you choose that course, so stop complaining.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to complain about sth
translation: 6.	Nobody forced you to choose this course, so stop complaining.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Miałem naładować komórkę, ale zupełnie zapomniałem.
english: I was supposed to charge my cell phone, but I totally forgot.
glossary: to charge your cell phone
translation: 7.	I was supposed to charge the cell phone, but I totally forgot.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Czym zwykle skutkuje takie zachowanie?
english: What does such behavior usually result in?
glossary: behavior/to result in sth
translation: 8.	What usually results such a behavior?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Mój mąż miał złożyć łóżeczko do kupy, ale był zbyt leniwy.
english: My husband was supposed to put the crib together, but he was too lazy.
glossary: to put sth together/to be too lazy to do sth
translation: 9.	My husband was supposed to fix the bed, but he was too lazy.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Od jak dawna próbujesz wprowadzić swój pierwszy produkt? Chyba minął już rok.
english: How long have you been trying to roll out your first product? I guess it's been a year now.
glossary: to roll sth out
translation: 10.	How long have you been trying to launch your first product? Probably it’s been already a year.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Zmarnowałem godzinę, czekając na ciebie na zewnątrz.
english: I wasted an hour waiting for you outside.
glossary: to waste your time/to wait for sb/outside
translation: I wasted an hour waiting for you outside.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Leżelibyśmy teraz na plaży, gdyby nasz lot nie został odwołany.
english: We'd be lying on the beach now if our flight hadn't been canceled.
glossary: to lie on the beach/to cancel a flight
translation: We would’ve lay on the beach if our flight hadn’t been cancelled.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Dobrze się wczoraj bawiłaś ze znajomymi?
english: Did you have a good time with your friends yesterday?
glossary: to have a good time
translation: Did you have fun with your friends yesterday?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jak dotąd policja zatrzymała jedną osobę podejrzaną o dokonanie kradzieży.
english: So far the police have detained one person suspected of committing the theft.
glossary: the police/to detain sb/to be suspected of sth/to commit theft
translation: The police detained one person so far who was suspected of theft.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie byłbyś teraz spłukany, gdybyś nie imprezował w zeszły weekend.
english: You wouldn't be broke now if you hadn't partied last weekend.
glossary: to be broke/to party/last weekend
translation: You wouldn’t have been broke if you hadn’t partyed last weekend.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Łatwiej byłoby mi dojeżdżać do pracy, gdybym mieszkał w mieście.
english: It would be easier for me to commute to work if I lived in the city.
glossary: to commute to work/to live in the city
translation: It would be easier to commute to work if I live in the city.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Mogłybyśmy ćwiczyć razem, gdybyś też się zapisała na zajęcia z jogi.
english: We could exercise together if you signed up for yoga classes too.
glossary: to exercise/to sign up for yoga classes
translation: We would excersice together if you sign up for yoga classes.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Dlaczego nie chcesz, żeby twoje dzieci uczyły się angielskiego?
english: Why don't you want your kids to learn English?
glossary: to learn English
translation: Why don’t you want your childern learn English?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Zrobiłabym panu teraz zastrzyk, gdyby się pan tak nie trząsł.
english: I'd give you an injection now if you didn't tremble so much.
glossary: to give sb an injection/to tremble
translation: I would do an injection to you now if you don’t tremble so much.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie dostalibyśmy zatrucia pokarmowego, gdybyś umiał gotować.
english: We wouldn't have gotten food poisoning if you could cook.
glossary: to get food poisoning/to cook
translation: We wouldn’t have gotten food poisoning if you had known how to cook.

name: Maya Cook
polish: Myślę, że odwiedzę cię w weekend, bo jutro wracam późno do domu.
english: I think I'll visit you on the weekend because I'm coming back home late tomorrow.
glossary: to visit sb/to come back home late
translation: 1.	I think that I will visit you on the weekend because I am coming home late tomorrow.

name: Maya Cook
polish: Nie wychodź teraz z domu, bo jest zbyt gorąco.
english: Don't leave the house now because it's too hot.
glossary: to leave the house
translation: 2.	Don’t go outside now because it’s too hot.

name: Maya Cook
polish: Zepsułam telefon mojej mamy. Nie wiem, co powinnam teraz zrobić.
english: I broke my mom's cell phone. I don't know what I should do now.
glossary: to break a cell phone
translation: 3.	I have broken my mom’s phone. Now I don’t know what should I do.

name: Maya Cook
polish: Nie mogę teraz rozmawiać, bo nie mam czasu.
english: I can't talk now because I don't have time.
glossary: to talk to sb
translation: 4.	I can’t talk right now because I don’t have time.

name: Maya Cook
polish: Kiedy wyjeżdżasz?
english: When are you leaving?
glossary: to leave
translation: 5.	When are you leaving?

name: Maya Cook
polish: Mogłem zostać w domu, bo nie ma tu nic do roboty.
english: I could've stayed at home because there's nothing to do here.
glossary: to stay at home/to have nothing to do
translation: 6.	I could have stayed at home, I have nothing to do here.

name: Maya Cook
polish: Gdzie byłeś? Nie mogłem cię znaleźć.
english: Where were you? I couldn't find you.
translation: 7.	Where have you been? I couldn’t find you.

name: Maya Cook
polish: Nie zapłaciłam rachunków w zeszłym miesiącu, bo nie miałam żadnych pieniędzy.
english: I didn't pay the bills last month because I didn't have any money.
glossary: to pay the bills
translation: 8.	I didn’t pay bills last month because I didn’t have any money.

name: Maya Cook
polish: Zawsze ci pomogę, bo jesteś siostrą mojej żony.
english: I'll always help you because you're my wife's sister.
glossary: to help sb
translation: 9.	I will always help you because you are my wife’s sister.

name: Maya Cook
polish: Byłam pewna, że spędzimy razem więcej czasu.
english: I was sure we'd spend more time together.
glossary: to be sure that.../to spend time with sb
translation: 10.	I was sure that we would spend more time together.

english: I think I'll visit you on the weekend because I'm coming back home late tomorrow.

translation: 1. I think, that I'll visit you at the weekend, because tomorrow I'm coming home late.

polish: Nie wychodź teraz z domu, bo jest zbyt gorąco.

translation: 3. I broke my mom's phone. I don't know what I should do now.

polish: Gdzie byłeś? Nie mogłem cię znaleźć.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Nie zapłaciłam rachunków w zeszłym miesiącu, bo nie miałam żadnych pieniędzy.

translation: 8. I didn't pay my bills last month, because I didn't have any money.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Zawsze ci pomogę, bo jesteś siostrą mojej żony.
english: I'll always help you because you're my wife's sister.
glossary: to help sb
translation: 9. I will always help you, because you are my wife's sister.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Byłam pewna, że spędzimy razem więcej czasu.
english: I was sure we'd spend more time together.

translation: 10. I was sure, that we were going to spend more time together.

name: Kate Long
polish: Dam ci znać, jak już skończę pracę. Będziemy w kontakcie.
english: I'll let you know once I finish work. We'll be in touch.
glossary: to let sb know/to finish work/to be in touch
translation: 1.	I’ll let you know once I finish work. We’ll be in touch.

polish: Mam dość tego projektu, bo pracuję nad nim od kilku miesięcy.
english: I'm fed up with the project because I've been working on it for a few months.
glossary: to be fed up with sth/to work on a project
translation: 2.	I’m fed up with the project because I’m working on it since a couple of months.

polish: Ostrzegałam cię, że będzie korek na autostradzie, ale nie chciałeś mnie słuchać.
english: I warned you there would be a traffic jam on the highway, but you didn't want to listen to me.
glossary: to warn sb that.../I've warned you that.../an accident/on the highway/to listen to sb
translation: 3.	I’ve warned you that would be a traffic jam on the highway but you wouldn’t listen to me.

name: Kate Long
polish: Myślę, że będziemy częściej wychodzić razem na miasto, bo przyszłym miesiącu przeprowadzam się do Warszawy.

polish: Nie powinnam była na ciebie krzyczeć. Musiałeś czuć się rozczarowany.
english: I shouldn't have shouted at you. You must've felt disappointed.

translation: 6.	I’ve worked as a waitress in high school for three months.

name: Kate Long
polish: W pewnym momencie wierzyłem, że wrócimy do siebie.
english: At some point, I believed we'd get back together.

translation: 7.	At some point, I’ve believed we would get back together.

polish: Jakie problemy są w twojej firmie?
english: What problems are there in your company?
glossary: a problem; an issue
translation: 8.	What problems in your company there are?

name: Kate Long
polish: O kim rozmawiacie?
english: Who are you talking about?
glossary: to talk about sb
translation: 9.	Who are you talking about?

name: Kate Long
polish: Gdzie zostawiłeś kurtkę?
english: Where did you leave your jacket?
glossary: a jacket/to leave sth
translation: 10.	Where did you leave the jacket?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Po tym, jak zrobiłeś zupę, wszyscy rzygaliśmy.
english: After you'd made the soup, we all threw up.
glossary: to make soup/to throw up
translation: After you made the soup, we all threw up.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Czy jest coś, co mogę polepszyć, żeby być bardziej wydajnym, gdy się uczę?
english: Is there anything I can improve to be more efficient while studying?
glossary: to improve sth/to be efficient/to study sth
translation: Is there anything I can do better to be more productive while I'm learning?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Zjadłabym dużo więcej na weselu, gdybym nie przeszła na dietę parę dni wcześniej,
english: I would've eaten much more at the wedding party if I hadn't gone on a diet a couple of days before.
glossary: a wedding party/to go on a diet/a couple of days
translation: I would have eaten a lot more at the wedding if I had not gone on a diet a few days earlier.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Mimo że kolega powiedział, że jego pies nie jest niebezpieczny, bałam się go pogłaskać.
english: Even though my friend said his dog wasn't dangerous, I was afraid to pet it.
glossary: even though/a friend/a dangerous dog/to pet a dog
translation: Even though a friend said his dog was not dangerous, I was afraid to pet him.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Gdybyś nie był zapominalski, cały zespół nie musiałby teraz pracować.
english: If you weren't forgetful, the whole team wouldn't have to work now.
glossary: to be forgetful/the whole team/to work
translation: If you were not forgetful, the whole team would not have to work now.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Jeśli nasza firma otworzy nową filię, wszyscy zrobimy się zajęci.
english: If our company opens a new branch, we'll all get busy.
glossary: to open a new branch/a branch/to get busy
translation: If our company opens a new subsidiary, we will all get busy.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Dlaczego zaparkowałeś tak daleko od galerii?
english: Why did you park so far away from the mall?
glossary: to park your car/to be far away from sth/a mall
translation: Why did you park so far from the mall?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Tak szybko jechałem na rowerze, że nie zorientowałem się, że przejechałem znak stop.
english: I was riding a bike so fast that I didn't realize I had run a stop sign.
glossary: to ride a bike/to realize that.../to run a stop sign
translation: I was riding my bike so fast that I didn't realize I had run over the stop sign.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Widzę, że restauracja ci się nie podoba. Z czym masz problem?
english: I see that you don't like the restaurant. What do you have a problem with?
glossary: to have a problem with sth/a restaurant
translation: I see you don't like the restaurant. What do you have a problem with?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Powiedziałem mamie, że poszedłem do lekarza, bo chciałem ją uspokoić.
english: I told my mom I'd gone to the doctor because I wanted to calm her down.
glossary: to go to the doctor/to calm sb down
translation: I told my mother that I went to the doctor because I tried to reassure her.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Nie będziesz zadowolona, kiedy przeczytasz tę wiadomość.
english: You won't be happy when you read the message.
glossary: to be happy/to read a message
translation: You won’t be happy when you read the message.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Gdzie planujecie jechać tym razem?
english: Where are you planning to go this time?
glossary: to plan to go somewhere
translation: Where are you planning to go this time?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Widzę, że trudno ci utrzymać kontakt wzrokowy.
english: I see that it's hard for you to keep eye contact.
glossary: to keep eye contact
translation: I see there is hard to you to keep an eye contact.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Gdybym ja tu rządziła, mielibyśmy rozsądne godziny pracy.
english: If I ruled here, we'd have more reasonable working hours.
glossary: to rule/to be reasonable/working hours
translation: If I managed here we would have the resonable working hours.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Wasze akcje marketingowe będą bardziej wydajne, kiedy zrozumiecie swoją grupę docelową.
english: Your marketing actions will be more efficient when you understand your target audience.
glossary: to be efficient/marketing actions/a target audience
translation: Your marketing campaigns would be more efficient if you understood your target group.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Jakiego rozwiązania szukasz? Może będę w stanie ci pomóc.
english: What solution are you looking for? Maybe I'll be able to help.
glossary: a solution for sth/to be able to help
translation: What a solution do you find? Maybe I can help you.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Łatwo ci to mówić, bo nie masz dzieci.
english: It's easy for you to say this because you don't have kids.
glossary: to have kids
translation: It’s simple to say for you because you don’t have children.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Nie musiałbym tu teraz siedzieć, gdybym złożył wypowiedzenie na koniec miesiąca.
english: I wouldn't have to sit here now if I had given my notice at the end of the month.
glossary: to sit/to give notice
translation: I wouldn’t sit here now if I put the notice at the end of the month.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Niełatwo nam zrobić wrażenie na naszej szefowej.
english: It's not easy for us to make a good impression on our boss.
glossary: to make a good impression on sb/a boss
translation: It’s not easy to make an impression to our boss.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Kiedy będziesz mieć czas, wytłumaczysz mi, jak to działa?
english: When you have time, will you explain to me how it works?
glossary: to explain sth to sb
translation: If you have time will you explain to me how does it work?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Nie odkryłem jeszcze swojego powołania.
english: I haven't found my vocation yet.
glossary: to find your vocation
translation: I haven’t discovered my vocation yet.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Nie musiałbyś teraz płacić za to badanie, gdybyś miał ubezpieczenie.
english: You wouldn't have to pay for the examination now if you had insurance.
glossary: to have insurance/to pay for sth/an examination
translation: You wouldn’t have to pay for the examination if you had insurance.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Zauważyłem wczoraj, że sąsiedzi kupili nowy samochód.
english: I noticed yesterday that my neighbors had bought a new car.
glossary: to buy a new car/to notice sth/a neighbor
translation: Yesterday, I noticed that my neighbors had bought a new car.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Do kogo należy ta komórka?
english: Who does the cell belong to?
glossary: to belong to sb/a cell phone
translation: Whom does this cell phone belong to?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Kiedy postanowiłeś, że będziesz mieszkał za granicą?
english: When did you decide you'd live abroad?
glossary: to decide that.../to live abroad
translation: When did you decide that you would live abroad?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Mama będzie zła, jeśli nie posprzątam pokoju.
english: My mom will be mad if I don't clean up my room.
glossary: to clean up your room/to be mad at sb/a mom
translation: Mother will be angry if I don’t clean a room.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Wyszedłem już ze sklepu, kiedy zadzwoniłaś.
english: I'd already left the store when you called me.
glossary: to call sb/a store/to leave a store
translation: I had left a store already when you called.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Ile osadzonych jest obecnie w tym więzieniu?
english: How many inmates are there currently in the jail?
glossary: a jail; a prison/an inmate/currently
translation: How many prisoners are there in prison currently?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Wujek by nie utonął, gdyby nagle nie dostał skurczu.
english: My uncle wouldn't have drowned if he hadn't suddenly gotten a cramp.
glossary: to get a cramp/to drown/suddenly/an uncle
translation: An uncle wouldn’t have drowned if he hadn’t gotten a cramp suddenly.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Dzięki za skończenie zadania na czas.
english: Thanks for completing the task on time.
glossary: to complete a task
translation: Thanks for finishing the task on time.

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Moja mama przeszła w zeszłym roku na emeryturę.
english: My mom retired last year.
glossary: to retire/last year
translation: 1. My mother retired last year.

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Nie wierzę. Znajomi znowu mnie wystawili.
english: I can't believe it. My friends stood me up again.
glossary: to believe sb/to stand sb up/a friend
translation: 2. I don't believe. My friends ___ me again.

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Dawno cię nie widziałam. Musisz wpaść w tym tygodniu.
english: I haven't seen you for a long time. You have to drop by this week.
glossary: to drop by/for a long time/this week
translation: 3. I haven't seen you for a long time. You have to visit me this week.

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Nie możesz unikać odpowiedzialności.
english: You can't avoid responsibility.
glossary: to avoid responsibility
translation: 4. You can't avoid responsibility.

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Nie możesz się tak zachowywać.
english: You can't behave like that.
glossary: to behave
translation: 5. You can't behave like that.

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Nie idę z wami jutro na imprezę. Pracuję na nocną zmianę.
english: I'm not going to the party with you tomorrow. I'm working the night shift.
glossary: to go to a party with sb/to work the night shift
translation: 6. I'm not going to the party tomorrow. I'm working the night shift.

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Nie będę w stanie pojawić się w weekend, bo pracuję.
english: I won't be able to show up on the weekend because I'm working.
glossary: to show up/to work on the weekend/to be able to do sth
translation: 7. I won't be able to come at the weekend because I'm working.

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Mam nadzieję, że nie będę mieć jutro kaca.
english: I hope I won't have a hangover tomorrow.
glossary: to have a hangover
translation: 8. I hope I won't have a hangover tomorrow.

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Musisz mnie przeprosić.
english: You have to apologize to me.
glossary: to apologize to sb
translation: 9. You have to apologize me.

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Pozwę cię. Zobaczysz.
english: I'll sue you. You'll see.
glossary: to sue sb/to see sth
translation: 10. __. You'll see.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Jak długo już nalegasz? Nie rozumiesz, że Ci tego nie dam?
english: How long have you been insisting yet? Don't you understand I won't give it?
glossary: to insist
translation: How long have you been insisting? You don’t understand that I won’t give you this?

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: O której wylądował samolot? Nie miał przybyć później?
english: What time did the plane land? Wasn't it supposed to arrive later?
glossary: to land/a plane/to arrive later
translation: What the time did the plane land? Wasn’t he supposed to come later?

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Twoja partia miała mnie wesprzeć w następnych wyborach.
english: Your party was supposed to back me during the next election.
glossary: to back sb/a party/an election
translation: Your…. …………………..next vote.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Nigdy nie pozwalasz mi chodzić na imprezy. Nie jestem już dzieckiem.
english: You never let me go to parties. I'm not a kid anymore.
glossary: to let sb do sth
translation: You’ve never let me go to parties. I’m not a child.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Jak długo zaprzeczasz prawdzie? Czy to nie najwyższy czas, żeby się z tym zmierzyć?
english: How long have you been denying the truth? Isn't it high time to face it?
glossary: to deny the truth/to face sth
translation: How long have you been ………… the truth?......................

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Nikt nie zmuszał Cię do wybrania tego kursu, więc przestań narzekać.
english: No one made you choose that course, so stop complaining.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to complain about sth
translation: Nobody …… to choose this course so stop complain.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Miałem naładować komórkę, ale zupełnie zapomniałem.
english: I was supposed to charge my cell phone, but I totally forgot.
glossary: to charge your cell phone
translation: I was supposed to charge my cell phone, but I…. forgot.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Czym zwykle skutkuje takie zachowanie?
english: What does such behavior usually result in?
glossary: behavior/to result in sth
translation: What usually ………… such of behavior.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Mój mąż miał złożyć łóżeczko do kupy, ale był zbyt leniwy.
english: My husband was supposed to put the crib together, but he was too lazy.
glossary: to put sth together/to be too lazy to do sth
translation: My husband was supposed …………., but he was to lazy.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Od jak dawna próbujesz wprowadzić swój pierwszy produkt? Chyba minął już rok.
english: How long have you been trying to roll out your first product? I guess it's been a year now.
glossary: to roll sth out
translation: How long have you been trying to …………you first product? ……………..

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Mój współpracownik nigdy nie zwraca uwagi na szczegóły. Zawsze muszę poprawiać jego zadania.
english: My coworker never pays attention to detail. I always have to correct his tasks.
glossary: to pay attention to detail/to correct sth
translation: My coworker never pays attention on details. I always have to correct his tasks.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Jak długo umniejszasz moje osiągnięcia? Nie będę już tego znosić.
english: How long have you been diminishing my accomplishments? I won't put up with it anymore.
glossary: to diminish sth/to put up with sth
translation: How long have you …………. my achievements. I won’t …. anymore.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Jak długo żujesz tę gumę? Weź nową.
english: How long have you been chewing this gum? Take a new one.
glossary: to chew a gum/to take a new one
translation: How long have you been …… this gum. Take a new one.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Słyszałem dziś, jak moja córka mówi po angielsku, i to skłoniło mnie do myślenia. Może też powinienem zapisać się na taki kurs.
english: I heard my daughter speaking English today, and it made me think. Maybe I should sign up for such a course as well.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to hear sb doing sth/to sign up for a course
translation: I heard my daughter speak English today, and it ……… to think. Maybe I have to sing up for the same course too?

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: O co prokurator okręgowy chce cię oskarżyć?
english: What does the district attorney want to charge you with?
glossary: a district attorney/to charge sb with sth
translation: What the ……….. wants to accuse you about?

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Powinniśmy teraz nosić maseczki w sklepach.
english: We are supposed to wear face masks in stores now.
glossary: to wear face masks
translation: We should wear the face masks in stores now.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Jak długo tyle bierzesz? Ostatnim razem, kiedy się spotkaliśmy, było taniej.
english: How long have you been charging this much? The last time we met it was cheaper.
glossary: to charge sb
translation: How long have you been taking? Last time we met it was cheaper.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Od jak dawna chwalisz się swoim nowym samochodem? Czy nie widzisz, że wszyscy mają dość?
english: How long have you been bragging about your new car? Can't you see everyone's fed up?
glossary: to brag about sth/to be fed up with sth
translation: How long have you been ………… your car? Don’t you see that everyone are fed up?

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Dlaczego akcje Twojej firmy spadły? Czy coś się stało?
english: Why did your company's shares drop? Did anything happen?
glossary: to drop/a share
translation: Why……………….  Did something go wrong?

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Mieliśmy się zmieniać, nieprawdaż?
english: We were supposed to take turns, weren't we?
glossary: to take turns
translation: We were supposed to change. Weren't we?

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Jakiej muzyki zwykle słucha twój mąż?
english: What music does your husband usually listen to?
glossary: to listen to music
translation: What kind of music does your husband usually listen to?

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Zawsze przeglądasz Facebooka, kiedy chcę z tobą porozmawiać.
english: You're always scrolling Facebook when I want to talk to you.
glossary: to scroll Facebook/to want to do sth/to talk to sb
translation: You are always go tr….. Facebook when I want to talk to you.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Jaki temat omawialiście dzisiaj w klasie?
english: What subject did you cover in class today?
glossary: to cover a subject/to do sth in class
translation: What kind of topic did you discuss at class?

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: O czym zarząd nie wie?
english: What doesn't the management board know about?
glossary: to know about sth/a management board
translation: What the management board doesn’t know about?

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: W czym specjalizuje się uczelnia?
english: What does the university specialize in?
glossary: to specialize in sth
translation: What does the university specialize in?

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Film był niesamowity. Był taki wzruszający. Dosłownie sprawił, że się rozpłakałem.
english: The movie was amazing. It was so touching. It literally made me cry.
glossary: to make sb do sth/literally/to be touching
translation: The movie was amazing. It was so ………

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Na co zwykle narzeka zarząd?
english: What does the board usually complain about?
glossary: to complain about sth
translation: What does usually the management board complain on?

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Mój biznes miał prosperować. Przynajmniej taki był plan.
english: My business was supposed to thrive. At least, that was the plan.
glossary: to thrive
translation: My business ……………. At least that was the plan.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Jak długo wątpisz w nasz projekt? Myślałem, że w niego wierzysz.
english: How long have you been doubting our project? I thought you believed in it.
glossary: to doubt sth/to believe in sth
translation: How long have you doubted in our project? I thought that you believe in it.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Nigdy nie zabierasz mnie do restauracji. Czy w ogóle mnie lubisz?
english: You never take me to any restaurants. Do you even like me?
glossary: to take sb to a restaurant/to like sb
translation: You never take me to a restaurant. Do you like me at all?

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Dam ci znać, jak już skończę pracę. Będziemy w kontakcie.
english: I'll let you know once I finish work. We'll be in touch.
glossary: to let sb know/to finish work/to be in touch
translation: I'll let you know when I finish my work. We’ll in touch

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Mam dość tego projektu, bo pracuję nad nim od kilku miesięcy.
english: I'm fed up with the project because I've been working on it for a few months.
glossary: to be fed up with sth/to work on a project
translation: I get  tired  of this project because I've been working on it for a few months.

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Ostrzegałam cię, że będzie korek na autostradzie, ale nie chciałeś mnie słuchać.
english: I warned you there would be a traffic jam on the highway, but you didn't want to listen to me.
glossary: to warn sb that.../I've warned you that.../an accident/on the highway/to listen to sb
translation: I warned you that there would be a traffic jam on the highway, but you didn't want to listen to me.

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Myślę, że będziemy częściej wychodzić razem na miasto, bo przyszłym miesiącu przeprowadzam się do Warszawy.
english: I think we'll hang out together more often because I'm moving to Warsaw next month.
glossary: to go out; to hang out/to move to Warsaw/next month
translation: I think that we will go out together more often, because next month I am moving to Warsaw.

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Nie powinnam była na ciebie krzyczeć. Musiałeś czuć się rozczarowany.
english: I shouldn't have shouted at you. You must've felt disappointed.
glossary: to scream at sb; to shout at sb/to feel disappointed
translation: I shouldn't have to scream  at  you.You should feel disappointed

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Przez trzy miesiące w liceum pracowałam jako kelnerka.
english: I worked as a waitress for three months in high school.
glossary: to work as a waitress/in high school
translation: For three months in high school, I worked as a waitress.

name: Theresa Fine
polish: W pewnym momencie wierzyłem, że wrócimy do siebie.
english: At some point, I believed we'd get back together.
glossary: At some point.../to get back together
translation: At one point I  believe we’ll get back together

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Jakie problemy są w twojej firmie?
english: What problems are there in your company?
glossary: a problem; an issue
translation: What  problems are  in your company ?

name: Theresa Fine
polish: O kim rozmawiacie?
english: Who are you talking about?
glossary: to talk about sb
translation: Who are you talking about?

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Gdzie zostawiłeś kurtkę?
english: Where did you leave your jacket?
glossary: a jacket/to leave sth
translation: Where did  you leave your  jacket  ?

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Kogo chcesz, żebym zaprosił na imprezę?
english: Who do you want me to invite to the party?
glossary: to invite sb to a party
translation: Who do you want I to invite to a party?

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Wpadaj. Mój mąż gotuje w ten piątek.
english: Drop by. My husband's cooking this Friday.
glossary: to cook/this Friday
translation: Come in. My husband is cooking this Friday.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Nie ma różnicy. Bierz, co chcesz.
english: There's no difference. Take what you want.
glossary: a difference/to take sth
translation: There is no difference. Get what you want.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Mogłeś mi od razu powiedzieć prawdę. Nie zdenerwowałbym się.
english: You could've told me the truth at the beginning. I wouldn't have gotten mad.
glossary: to tell sb the truth/at the beginning/to get mad
translation: You could tell me the true for now. I wouldn’t get mad.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Co mi chciałaś powiedzieć na imprezie?
english: What did you want to tell me at the party?
glossary: to tell sb sth/at the party
translation: What did you tell me at the party?

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: W artykule jest błąd. Popraw go.
english: There's a mistake in the article. Correct it.
glossary: in the article/to correct a mistake
translation: It is an error in the article. Correct it.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Może pojadę taksówką. Zaoszczędzę czas.
english: Maybe I'll take a cab. I'll save time.
glossary: to take a cab/to save money
translation: Maybe I’ll go a cab. I’ll save some money.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Co chcesz dostać na urodziny?
english: What do you want to get for your birthday?
glossary: to get sth for your birthday
translation: What do you want for your birthday?

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Gdzie Ty wczoraj spałeś?
english: Where did you sleep yesterday?
glossary: to sleep
translation: Where did you sleep yesterday?

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Stresowałem się, bo bałem się, że coś pójdzie źle.
english: I was stressed out because I was afraid something would go wrong.
glossary: to be stressed out/to be afraid of sth/to go wrong
translation: I was stressed because I was afraid that something would go wrong.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Na czym jesteś taki skupiony?
english: What are you so focused on?
glossary: to focus on sth
translation: What are you focus on?

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Nie byłbyś wrakiem, gdybyś nie ćpał przez ostatni rok.
english: You wouldn't be a wreck if you hadn't done drugs for the past year.
glossary: to be a wreck/to do drugs/for the past year
translation: You woudn't be a wreck if you wouldn't have junk all year.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Przygotuj się na wstawanie wcześnie rano.
english: Get prepared for getting up early in the morning.
glossary: to get prepared for sth/tp get up early
translation: You should be preapre to get up in the morning.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Mój chłopak się mnie pytał, dlaczego go okłamałam.
english: My boyfriend asked me why I'd lied to him.
glossary: a boyfriend/to lie to sb
translation: My boyfriend asked me why I lied to him?

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Gdyby ludzie na co dzień dbali o środowisko, wiele gatunków by nie wymarło.
english: If people took care of the environment on a daily basis, many species wouldn't have died out.
glossary: to take care of the environment/the environment/on a daily basis/a species/to die out
translation: If people would care for the environment everyday, many species wouldn't die out..

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Zamówiłbym teraz frytki, gdybym nie był najedzony.
english: I'd order French fries now if I weren't full.
glossary: to order French fries/to be full
translation: I'd now order fries if I wasn't full.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Uważasz, że obywatele mieliby coś przeciwko, gdyby premier ustąpił ze stanowiska?
english: Do you think citizens would mind if the prime minister stepped down?
glossary: a citizen/to mind/the prime minister/to step down
translation: Do you think citizens would mind if the prime minister stepped down?

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Żądamy, aby prezes został pociągnięty do odpowiedzialności.
english: We demand that the president be held responsible.
glossary: to demand that.../the president {2}/to be held responsible
translation: We demand that the president be held accountable.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Gdybyś umiał czytać między wierszami, wiedziałbyś, co twoja dziewczyna ma na myśli.
english: If you could read between the lines, you'd know what your girlfriend meant.
glossary: to read between the lines/to mean sth/a girlfriend
translation: If you could read between the lines you would know what your girlfriend means.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Nie dostałbyś mandatu, gdybyś nie przekroczył dozwolonej prędkości.
english: You wouldn't have gotten a ticket if you hadn't been speeding.
glossary: to get a ticket/to be speeding
translation: You wouldn't be fined if you didn't speeding.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Kilka tygodni temu dowiedziałem się, że moja żona była już raz mężatką.
english: I found out a few weeks ago that my wife had already been married once.
glossary: to be married/to find sth out/a few weeks ago/a wife
translation: 1.	A few weeks ago, I found out, that my wife had already been married once.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Już miałam wychodzić, gdy pojawił się szef i powiedział, że potrzebuje, żebym została godzinę dłużej w pracy.
english: I was about to leave when my boss showed up and said he needed me to stay at work an hour longer.
glossary: to be about to do sth/to leave/to show up/to stay at work longer
translation: 2.	I was about to leave when my boss showed up and said that he needed me to stay an hour longer at work.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Dlaczego znów wydałeś tyle pieniędzy na niepotrzebne rzeczy?
english: Why did you spend so much money on unnecessary things again?
glossary: to spend money on sth/unnecessary things
translation: 3.	Why did you spend so much money on unnecessary things again?

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Moje życie się zmieniło po tym, jak zostałem zwolniony.
english: My life changed after I'd gotten fired.
glossary: a life/to change/to get fired
translation: 4.	My life changed after I got fired.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Czytałbym więcej książek, gdybym nie był ciągle zmęczony.
english: I would read more books if I weren't constantly tired.
glossary: to read a book/to be tired/to be constantly tired
translation: 5.	I would read more books if I wasn’t tired all the time.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Gdybym w zeszłym roku więcej trenowała, byłabym teraz w formie.
english: If I'd worked out more last year, I'd be in shape now.
glossary: to work out/to be in shape
translation: 6.	If I had trained more last year, I would be in shape now.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Czy jest tu ktoś zainteresowany tym tematem?
english: Is there anyone here interested in the subject?
glossary: to be interested in a subject
translation: 7.	Is here anyone interesting in this subject?

name: Agnes Banks
polish: O czym przeważnie pisze prasa?
english: What does the press mostly write about?
glossary: the press/to write about sth/mostly
translation: 8.	What does the press usually write about?

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Jeśli teraz nie opowiesz mi o swoim problemie, nie będę w stanie ci pomóc.
english: If you don't tell me about your problem now, I won't be able to help you.
glossary: to tell about sth/to be able to do sth/to help sb/a problem
translation: 9.	If you don’t tell me about your problem now, I won’t be able to help you.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Nieznajomy opluł mnie, kiedy przechodziłem przez ulicę.
english: A stranger spat at me when I was crossing the street.
glossary: to cross the street/a stranger/to spit at sb
translation: 10.	 Strangers spat on me when I was passing the street.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Obściskiwałeś się z moją koleżanką. Przyznaj to.
english: You made out with my friend. Admit it.
glossary: to make out with sb/to admit sth

name: Matt Xander
polish: Muszę chronić swoje dzieci.
english: I have to protect my kids.
glossary: to protect sb/a kid

name: Matt Xander
polish: Moi znajomi jutro wpadają. Kup piwo.
english: My friends are dropping by tomorrow. Buy beer.
glossary: to drop by/a friend/to buy sth/to drink beer
translation: 3. My friends are coming over tomorrow. Buy a beer.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Nie powinieneś udawać, że mnie słuchasz.
english: You shouldn't pretend that you're listening to me.
glossary: to pretend/to listen to sb

name: Matt Xander
polish: Ja piję dziś wieczorem. Ty prowadzisz.
english: I'm drinking tonight. You're driving.
glossary: to drink alcohol/to drive a car
translation: 5. I'm drinking tonight. You are driving.

name: Matt Xander
polish: W zeszłym roku pracowałem jako stażysta. Dużo się wtedy nauczyłem.
english: I worked as an intern last year. I learned a lot back then.
glossary: to work as an intern/to learn sth/back then
translation: 6. I worked as an intern last year. I learned a lot then.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Nie mogę wejść do pokoju. Jest zamknięty.
english: I can't enter the room. It's locked.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Będę bardziej surowy następnym razem. Obiecuję.

glossary: to be strict/next time/to promise sth
translation: 8. I will be stricter next time. I promise.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Chciałabym pracować jako sędzia w przyszłości.
english: I'd like to work as a judge in the future.
glossary: to work as a judge/a judge/in the future

name: Matt Xander
polish: Nie martw się. Nie wystawię cię.
english: Don't worry. I won't stand you up.
glossary: to worry/to stand sb up
translation: 10. Don't worry. I won't expose you

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Moja mama przeszła w zeszłym roku na emeryturę.
english: My mom retired last year.
glossary: to retire/last year

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Nie wierzę. Znajomi znowu mnie wystawili.

glossary: to believe sb/to stand sb up/a friend
translation: I don’t believe. My friends set me up.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Dawno cię nie widziałam. Musisz wpaść w tym tygodniu.
english: I haven't seen you for a long time. You have to drop by this week.
glossary: to drop by/for a long time/this week
translation: I didn’t see you for a long time. You have to drop in this week.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Nie możesz unikać odpowiedzialności.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Nie możesz się tak zachowywać.

glossary: to behave

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Nie idę z wami jutro na imprezę. Pracuję na nocną zmianę.
english: I'm not going to the party with you tomorrow. I'm working the night shift.
glossary: to go to a party with sb/to work the night shift

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Nie będę w stanie pojawić się w weekend, bo pracuję.

glossary: to show up/to work on the weekend/to be able to do sth

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Mam nadzieję, że nie będę mieć jutro kaca.
english: I hope I won't have a hangover tomorrow.
glossary: to have a hangover
translation: I hope I won’t a hangover tomorrow.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Musisz mnie przeprosić.
english: You have to apologize to me.
glossary: to apologize to sb
translation: You have to apologize me.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Pozwę cię. Zobaczysz.
english: I'll sue you. You'll see.
glossary: to sue sb/to see sth
translation: I sue up you. You’ll see.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Trudno mi było udowodnić swoją rację.
english: It was hard for me to prove my point.
glossary: to prove your point
translation: 1. It was hard for me to prove my point.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Dlaczego zarwałeś noc? Nie mogłeś uczyć się rano?
english: Why did you pull an all-nighter? Couldn't you study in the morning?
glossary: to pull an all-nighter

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Dlaczego udajesz, że płaczesz?

glossary: to pretend that.../to cry

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Dlaczego próbujesz mnie wrobić?
english: Why are you trying to set me up?

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Dziś wieczorem jemy na mieście.
english: We're eating out tonight.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Powinieneś trenować więcej, żeby być w formie.
english: You should work out more to be in shape.

translation: 6. You should train more to be in shape.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Do czego odnosi się artykuł?
english: What does the article refer to?
glossary: to refer to sth/an article

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Mąż odbiera jutro dzieci ze szkoły.
english: My husband's picking up the kids from school tomorrow.

translation: 8. My husband is picking up the kids from school tomorow.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Interesuję się gotowaniem.

glossary: to charge sb

name: Greg Hardy

glossary: to call sb/many times

name: Greg Hardy

glossary: a vote against sb/a candidate

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Wkurzyłeś mnie rano. Myślałem, że wyrzucę cię z domu.
english: You made me mad in the morning. I thought I'd throw you out of the house.
glossary: to make sb mad/to throw sb out of the house

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Musisz mnie przeprosić.

translation: 1. You need to apologize to me.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Ja piję dziś wieczorem. Ty prowadzisz.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Dawno cię nie widziałam. Musisz wpaść w tym tygodniu.

polish: Pójdę na siłownię, kiedy wyzdrowieję.

name: Greg Hardy

glossary: to work from home/to go to the office

name: Greg Hardy

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Mam nadzieję, że mnie nie zarazisz.

name: Greg Hardy

polish: Jeśli coś mi się nie spodoba, po prostu będę się trzymać od tego z daleka.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Miałem wczoraj kaca.

name: Greg Hardy

polish: Jest książka, którą musisz przeczytać.

name: Greg Hardy

glossary: to work as a waitress/in high school

name: Eve Miles

name: Eve Miles
polish: Gdzie zostawiłeś kurtkę?

name: Eve Miles
polish: Mam nadzieję, że omówimy twoje zachowanie.

english: Did you back up the files yesterday?

name: Eve Miles
polish: Dlaczego powinienem cię posłuchać?
english: Why should I listen to you?

name: Eve Miles

translation: 6.I will be tired when I finish work.

name: Eve Miles

name: Eve Miles
polish: Byłam pewna, że wyjaśnimy sytuację.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Musimy się lepiej poznać.

glossary: to end up in the hospital/to inform sb

glossary: to bring up a subject/to notice that.../a problem
