english: I quickly got used to covering for my brother.
glossary: to cover up for sb/to get used to doing sth
translation: I fastly got used to covering up for my brother.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Ilu wspólników było na spotkaniu w zeszłym tygodniu?
english: How many business partners were there at the meeting last week?
glossary: a participant/a meeting/last week
translation: How many coworkers were on the meeting last week?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Do czego masz słabość?
english: What do you have a weakness for?
glossary: to have a weakness for sth
translation: What do you have a weakness for?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Jutro jem obiad z moim szefem.
english: I'm having lunch with my boss tomorrow.
glossary: to have lunch with sb/a boss
translation: I'm eating lunch with my boss tomorrow.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Jeśli zostanie przyznany mi ten kredyt, w końcu będę mógł przeprowadzić badanie.
english: If I'm granted the loan, I'll be finally able to conduct the study.
glossary: to be granted a loan/to be able to do sth/to conduct a study/finally
translation: If I was granted a loan, I'll be able to conduct test finally.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Piłbym częściej herbatę, gdybym lubił moich sąsiadów.
english: I'd have tea more often if I liked my neighbors.
glossary: to have tea/often/a neighbor/to like sb
translation: I'd drink tea more often if I liked my neighbors.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Trzymałbym się pierwotnego planu, gdyby sprawy nie wymknęły się spod kontroli.
english: I would've stuck to the initial plan if the things hadn't gotten out of control.
glossary: to stick to the plan/the initial plan/to get out of control
translation: I'd have stick to the initial plan if the cases hadn't gotten out of control.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Nie rozumiem, dlaczego jesteś na mnie wściekły.
english: I don't understand why you're mad at me.
glossary: to understand sb/to be mad at sb
translation: I don't understand why are you mad at me.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Powinienem był dotrzeć na spotkanie z klientem na czas.
english: I should've gotten to the meeting with a client on time.
glossary: to get to a meeting/a meeting/a client/on time
translation: I should have reach the meeting with the client on time.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Kiedy się widzieliśmy ostatnim razem, myślałem, że powiesz mi prawdę.
english: The last time we met, I thought you'd tell me the truth.
glossary: to meet sb/finally/to tell the truth
translation: When we met last time, I thought you would tell me the truth.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Gratulacje. Właśnie usłyszałem wieści.
english: Congratulations. I've just heard the news.
glossary: congratulations/to hear the news
translation: Congratulations. I've already heard the news.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Nie powinienem był robić takiego bałaganu. Przepraszam.
english: I shouldn't have made such a mess. I'm sorry.
glossary: to make a mess
translation: I shouldn’t have done such a mess. I am sorry.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Jestem głodny. Mogłem zjeść śniadanie.
english: I'm hungry. I could've eaten breakfast.
glossary: to be hungry/to eat breakfast
translation: I am hungry. I could have eaten a breakfast.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Mogłem biec szybciej. Zdążyłbym na pociąg.
english: I could've run faster. I would've caught the train.
glossary: to run fast/to catch the train
translation: I could have run faster. I would be on time for a train

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Jechałeś bardzo szybko. Bałem się, że będziemy mieli wypadek.
english: You drove very fast. I was afraid we'd have an accident.
glossary: to drive/to be afraid/to have an accident
translation: You drove very fast. I was afraid that we would have an accidence

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Jutro jedziemy do centrum na zakupy. Chcesz coś?
english: We're going shopping downtown tomorrow. Do you want anything?
glossary: to go shopping/to go downtown
translation: We are going down town tomorrow. Do you want anything?

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Co się stało? Byłem pewien, że będziesz się trzymać planu.
english: What happened? I was sure you'd stick to the plan.
glossary: to happen/to be sure/to stick to the plan
translation: What happened? I was sure you would follow the plan.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Moja najlepsza przyjaciółka wychodzi za mąż w przyszłym tygodniu.
english: My best friend's getting married next week.
glossary: to get married/next week
translation: My best friend is getting married next week.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Nie pracuję jutro, więc możemy jechać nad jezioro.
english: I'm not working tomorrow, so we can go to the lake.
glossary: to work/to go to the lake/tomorrow
translation: I am not working tomorrow, so we can go to the lake.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że się zaprzyjaźnimy.
english: I hoped we'd make friends.
glossary: to hope/to make friends
translation: I hoped that we would became a  friends.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Ile osób jest w Twoim zespole?
english: How many people are there on your team?
glossary: on the team
translation: How many people are in your team?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Jakiej muzyki zwykle słucha twój mąż?
english: What music does your husband usually listen to?
glossary: to listen to music
translation: 1. What music does your husband usually listen to?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Zawsze przeglądasz Facebooka, kiedy chcę z tobą porozmawiać.
english: You're always scrolling Facebook when I want to talk to you.
glossary: to scroll Facebook/to want to do sth/to talk to sb
translation: 2. You always look through Facebook when I want to talk to you.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Jaki temat omawialiście dzisiaj w klasie?
english: What subject did you cover in class today?
glossary: to cover a subject/to do sth in class
translation: 3. What subject did you discuss in the class today?

name: Martin Hale
polish: O czym zarząd nie wie?
english: What doesn't the management board know about?
glossary: to know about sth/a management board
translation: 4. What the board management doesn’t know about?

name: Martin Hale
polish: W czym specjalizuje się uczelnia?
english: What does the university specialize in?
glossary: to specialize in sth
translation: 5. What does university specialize in?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Film był niesamowity. Był taki wzruszający. Dosłownie sprawił, że się rozpłakałem.
english: The movie was amazing. It was so touching. It literally made me cry.
glossary: to make sb do sth/literally/to be touching
translation: 6. The movie was incredible. It was so touching. It literally made me cry.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Na co zwykle narzeka zarząd?
english: What does the board usually complain about?
glossary: to complain about sth
translation: 7. What does the board management usually complain about?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Mój biznes miał prosperować. Przynajmniej taki był plan.
english: My business was supposed to thrive. At least, that was the plan.
glossary: to thrive

name: Martin Hale
polish: Jak długo wątpisz w nasz projekt? Myślałem, że w niego wierzysz.
english: How long have you been doubting our project? I thought you believed in it.
glossary: to doubt sth/to believe in sth
translation: 9. How long have you doubted our project? I’ve thought that you believe in it.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Nigdy nie zabierasz mnie do restauracji. Czy w ogóle mnie lubisz?
english: You never take me to any restaurants. Do you even like me?
glossary: to take sb to a restaurant/to like sb
translation: 10. You’ve never taken me to the restaurant. Do you like me at all?

name: Maya Cook
polish: Nie będziesz musiała mnie odbierać jutro ze szkoły, bo śpię u koleżanki.
english: You won't have to pick me up from school tomorrow because I'm sleeping at my friend's.
glossary: to pick sb up from school/to sleep at your friend's
translation: 1.	You will not have to pick me up from school tomorrow because I am sleeping at my friend’s.

name: Maya Cook
polish: Myślałem, że zjemy dzisiaj na mieście.
english: I thought we'd eat out today.
glossary: to eat out
translation: 2.	I thought we were going to eat out today.

name: Maya Cook
polish: Mogłem wczoraj wydać mniej pieniędzy.
english: I could've spent less money yesterday.
glossary: to spend money on sth
translation: 3.	I could have spent less money yesterday.

name: Maya Cook
polish: Nie ma nikogo w domu. Dlatego jest tak cicho.
english: There's no one at home. That's why it's so silent.
glossary: to be at home/to be silent
translation: 4.	There is no one at home, that is why it is so quiet here.

name: Maya Cook
polish: Nie wiem, co powinienem odpowiedzieć.
english: I don't know what I should answer.
glossary: to answer a question
translation: 5.	I don’t know what I should answer.

name: Maya Cook
polish: Byłem pewny, że zrobisz swoją pracę domową.
english: I was sure you'd do your homework.
glossary: to do your homework
translation: 6.	I was sure that you would do your homework.

name: Maya Cook
polish: W zeszłym roku nie pojechałem na wakacje, ponieważ nie miałem pieniędzy.
english: I didn't go on vacation last year because I didn't have any money.
glossary: to go on vacation/to have no money
translation: 7.	I didn’t go on vacation last year, because I didn’t have money.

name: Maya Cook
polish: Zawsze znajdę dla ciebie czas, bo jesteś dla mnie ważna.
english: I'll always find time for you because you're important to me.
glossary: to find time for sb/to be important to sb
translation: 8.	I will always find time for you because you are important to me.

name: Maya Cook
polish: Nie mogę się skupić, gdy jest tak głośno.
english: I can't focus when it's so loud.
glossary: to focus on sth/to be loud
translation: 9.	I can’t focus when it is so loud here.

name: Maya Cook
polish: Gramy jutro mecz. Dołączysz do nas?
english: We're playing a match tomorrow. Will you join us?
glossary: to play a match/to join sb
translation: 10.	We are playing game tomorrow. Will you join us?

name: Alexandra King
polish: Kiedyś spotkania w firmie się ciągnęły, ale znaleźliśmy na to rozwiązanie.
english: Meetings in our company used to drag on, but we found a solution to that.
glossary: to drag on/a meeting/in our company/a solution to sth
translation: 1.     Meetings in the company used to drag on, but we found a solution for it

name: Alexandra King
polish: Jeśli wciśniesz mnie w swój grafik w tym tygodniu, zapłacę ci więcej.
english: If you fit me in to your schedule this week, I'll pay you more.
glossary: to fit sb in to the schedule/to pay sb
translation: 2.     If you fit me into your schedule this week, I'll pay you more

name: Alexandra King
polish: Kiedy wszedłem do biura, koleżanka wystawiała faktury.
english: When I entered the office, my colleague was making out invoices.
glossary: to make out an invoice/to enter the office
translation: 3.     When I entered the office, my friend issued the invoices

name: Alexandra King
polish: Kogo jutro zastępujesz?
english: Who are you covering for tomorrow?
glossary: to cover for sb
translation: 4.     Who are you replacing tomorrow?

name: Alexandra King
polish: Na twoim miejscu podjąłbym się tego zadania.
english: If I were you, I would take on the task.
glossary: to take on a task
translation: 5.     If I were you I would undertake this task

name: Alexandra King
polish: Ta historia jest zmyślona.
english: The story's made up.
glossary: to make up a story
translation: 6.     This story is fictitious

name: Alexandra King
polish: Zostałem zwolniony po tym, jak wybuchła pandemia.
english: I was laid off after the pandemic had broken out.
glossary: to break out/to be laid off
translation: 7.     I was fired just after the pandemic had started.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Nie powinienem był zalegać z rachunkami. Przepraszam.
english: I shouldn't have fallen behind with the bills. I'm sorry
glossary: to fall behind with the bills
translation: 8.     I shouldn't have been in arrears with the bill. I'm sorry

name: Alexandra King
polish: Już się rozgrzałem. Możemy iść biegać.
english: I've already warmed up. We can go running.
glossary: to warm up/to go running
translation: 9.     I warmed up. We can go running

name: Alexandra King
polish: Damy ci znać, jak już wyśledzimy złodzieja.
english: We'll let you know once we track down the thief.
glossary: to track down a thief/to let sb down
translation: 10.  I'll let you know once we find the thief.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Gdybyś nie poruszył tematu, szef nie zauważyłby, że jest problem.
english: If you hadn't brought up the subject, the boss wouldn't notice that there was a problem.
glossary: to bring up a subject/to notice that.../a problem
translation: 1.     If you hadn't brought up the topic, your boss wouldn't have noticed that there was a problem.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Dlaczego schrzaniłeś to zadanie?
english: Why did you screw up the task?
glossary: to screw up a task
translation: 2.     Why did you screw up this task?

name: Alexandra King
polish: Szefowa powiedziała, że przejmę ważny projekt.
english: The boss told me I'd take on an important project.
glossary: to take on a project
translation: 3.     The boss told me that I would takeover an important project.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Zbyt długo rozważam opcje. Czas działać.
english: I've been weighing up the options for too long. It's time to act.
glossary: to weigh up the options/to act
translation: 4.     I was thinking through options for too long. It's time for acting.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Klient twierdził, że product nie spełnia jego oczekiwań.
english: The client claimed the product didn't live up to his expectations.
glossary: to live up to sb's expectations/a client/a product
translation: 5.     The customer claimed that the product did not meet his expectations.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Czy zawsze zapinasz pasy, kiedy prowadzisz?
english: Do you always fasten up when driving?
glossary: to fasten up/to drive
translation: 6.     Do you always fasten belts when you drive?

name: Alexandra King
polish: Zakończyłeś już spotkanie?
english: Have you wrapped up the meeting yet?
glossary: to wrap up a meeting
translation: 7.     Have you finished the meeting already?

name: Alexandra King
polish: Chcesz, żebym przejrzał te dokumenty?
english: Do you want me to go through the documents?
glossary: to go through documents
translation: 8.     Do you want me to take a look on this document?

name: Alexandra King
polish: Profesor pytał się mnie kilka dni temu, dlaczego jeszcze nie wykonałem tych badań.
english: The professor asked me a few days ago why I hadn't carried out the research yet.
glossary: to carry out research
translation: 9.     The professor asked me a few days ago why I hadn't do this research yet

name: Alexandra King
polish: Szybko przyzwyczaiłam się do krycia brata.
english: I quickly got used to covering for my brother.
glossary: to cover up for sb/to get used to doing sth
translation: 10. I used to hide my brother fast

name: Alexandra King
polish: Kiedy ostatnio się widziałyśmy, moja najlepsza przyjaciółka powiedziała mi, że zerwie ze swoim chłopakiem
english: The last time we met, my best friend told me she'd break up with her boyfriend.
glossary: your best friend/to break up with sb/a boyfriend
translation: 1.     The last time we saw, my best friend told me that she would have broken with her boyfriend

name: Alexandra King
polish: Nie sądzę, że przyzwyczaję się do noszenia sukienek. Czuję, że za bardzo się wyróżniam.
english: I don't think I'll get used to wearing dresses. I feel I stand out too much.
glossary: to stand out/to wear a dress
translation: 2.     I don't think that I will use to wearing dresses. I feel that I outstand too much

name: Alexandra King
polish: Może podjęłabyś lepszą decyzję, gdybyś rozważyła wszystkie czynniki.
english: Maybe you would've made a better decision if you'd weighed up all the factors.
glossary: to weigh up factors/to make a decision
translation: 3.     Maybe you would make a better decision if you considered all the factors.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Obudź się! Nie słyszysz, że właśnie zadzwonił budzik?
english: Wake up! Can't you hear the alarm has just gone off?
glossary: to go off/to set an alarm/to wake up/to hear sth
translation: 4.     Wake up! Can't you hear that the alarm clock just rang?

name: Alexandra King
polish: Spotkanie ciągnęło się jeszcze przez godzinę po tym, jak wyszedłeś.
english: The meeting still dragged on for an hour after you'd left.
glossary: to drag on/to leave
translation: 5.     The meeting went on for another hour after you left.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Już cię raz kryłem. Nie zrobię tego ponownie.
english: I've covered up for you once. I won't do it again.
glossary: to cover up for sb
translation: 6.     I've already covered you once. I won't do it again.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Przyzwyczaiłem się, że żona narzeka na pracę, kiedy poruszam ten temat.
english: I got used to my wife complaining about her job every time I bring up the subject.
glossary: to bring up a subject/to complain about your job/a wife
translation: 7.     7. I have become accustomed to my wife complaining about work when I bring up this topic.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Gdybyś ograniczył palenie, byłbyś zdrowszy.
english: If you cut down on smoking, you'd be more healthy.
glossary: to cut down on smoking/to be healthy
translation: 8.     8. If you reduced smoking, you would be healthier.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Zmieniłaś się. Kiedyś stawałaś w obronie swoich zasad.
english: You've changed. You used to stand up for your principles.
glossary: to stand up for your principles/to change
translation: 9.     You've changed. You used to stand up for your principles.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Ostatnio musiałem odwołać tyle spotkań, że moi klienci zaczynają narzekać.
english: I've recently had to call off so many meetings that my clients are starting to complain.
glossary: to call off a meeting/to complain about sth/to start to do sth; to begin to do sth/a client
translation: 10.  Recently, I have had to cancel so many meetings that my clients are starting to complain.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Jeśli teraz pozbędziesz się formalności, zaoszczędzisz dużo czasu.
english: If you do away with formalities now, you'll save a lot of time.
glossary: to do away with formalities/to save time
translation: 1. If you get rid of the formalities now, you will save a lot of time.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Gdybyś nie dała kosza swojemu dziwnemu koledze z pracy, byłabyś teraz w toksycznej relacji.
english: If you hadn't turned your weird colleague down, you would be in a toxic relationship now.
glossary: to turn sb down/to be in a toxic relationship
translation: 2. If you didn't reject your weird work colleague, you would be in a toxic relationship right now.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Kiedyś skarżyłem na moich kolegów za każdym razem, kiedy zrobili coś złego, ale wyluzowałem.
english: I used to tell on my friends every time they did something wrong, but I chilled out.
glossary: to tell on sb/to chill out/to do sth wrong/a friend
translation: 3. I used to complain about my colleagues every time they did something wrong, but I relaxed.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Gdzie jest dokument, o który cię prosiłem? Powiedziałeś, że go wydrukujesz.
english: Where's the document I asked you for? You said you'd print it out.
glossary: to print sth out/to ask sb for sth/a document
translation: 4. Where are the documents, which I asked you for? You told you'd print it

name: Alexandra King
polish: Jeśli wszystkie moje plany się udadzą, w końcu będę mógł rzucić tę pracę.
english: If all my plans work out, I'll finally be able to give up the job.
glossary: to work out/to be able to do sth/to give up the job
translation: 5. If all my plans go right, I could finally quit my job

name: Alexandra King
polish: Już wyniosłem śmieci, więc nie musisz mi o tym znów przypominać.
english: I've already taken out the garbage, so you don't have to remind me of it again.
glossary: to take out the garbage/to remind sb of sth
translation: 6. I've thrown away garbage, so you don't have to remind me again.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Gdybyś się tyle nie wygłupiała, byłabyś traktowana poważniej.
english: If you didn't mess around so much, you would be treated more seriously.
glossary: to mess around/to treat sb seriously
translation: 7. If you didn't fool around so much, you would be taken more seriously.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Kiedy wróciłem ze Stanów, zorientowałem się, że podłapałem amerykański akcent.
english: When I came back from the US, I realized I'd picked up the American accent.
glossary: to pick up the American accent/to come back from the US/to realize that...
translation: 8. When I came back from the States, I realized that I had picked up an American accent.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Ostatni pacjent wiercił się, podczas gdy przeglądałam jego dokumentację.
english: The last patient was fidgeting while I was going through his documentation.
glossary: to go through documentation/to fidget/a patient
translation: 9. The last patient was fidgeting while I was looking at his records.

name: Alexandra King
polish: Szef wyszedł z pokoju, kiedy wciąż kończyliśmy spotkanie.
english: The boss left the room when we were still wrapping up the meeting.
glossary: a boss/to leave a room/to wrap up a meeting
translation: 10. The boss left the room while we were still finishing the meeting.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Czy są w tym mieście jakieś miejsca, które powinienem odwiedzić?
english: Are there any places in the city I should visit?
glossary: in the city; in town/to visit a place
translation: Are there any places in the town which I should visit?

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Gdzie jedziesz w tym roku na wakacje?
english: Where are you going on vacation this year?
glossary: to go on vacation/this year
translation: Where are you go on vacation this year?

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Mamy czas. Nie ma potrzeby się spieszyć.
english: We have time. There's no need to hurry up.
glossary: to have time/a need/to hurry up
translation: We have a time. There no need to hurry up.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że wrócę do domu dzisiaj, ale uciekł mi pociąg.
english: I hoped I'd come back home today, but I missed the train.
glossary: to hope/to come back home/today/to miss the train
translation: I hoped that I would come back home but it messed a train.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Dlaczego tak zareagowałaś? Możesz mi to wytłumaczyć?
english: Why did you react like that? Can you explain it to me?
glossary: to react to sth/like that/to explain sth to sb
translation: Why did you react that? Can you explain it to me?

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Mogłeś wcześniej zadzwonić. Powiedziałabym Ci, że nie ma mnie w domu.
english: You could've called before. I would've told you I wasn't at home.
glossary: to be at home/to call sb
translation: You could call early. I would tell you that I’m not home.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Z kim wczoraj rozmawiałeś przez telefon?
english: Who did you talk to on the phone yesterday?
glossary: to talk to sb over the phone
translation: Who did you talk over a phone?

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Idziemy dziś wieczorem na drinka. Pamiętasz?
english: We're going for a drink tonight. Do you remember?
glossary: to remember/to go for a drink/tonight
translation: We’re going to drink tonight. Do you remember?

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Obawiam się, że nie dostanę tej pracy.
english: I'm afraid I won't get the job.
glossary: to be afraid of sth/to get a job
translation: I’m consider that I don’t get the job.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Z kim chcesz spędzić resztę swojego życia?
english: Who do you want to spend the rest of your life with?
glossary: to spend time with sb/the rest of your life
translation: Who do you want to spend the rest of your life?

name: Jack Russell
polish: Jak znalazłeś tę pracę?
english: How did you find the job?
glossary: to find a job
translation: How did you find this job?

name: Jack Russell
polish: Ile pokoi jest w tym mieszkaniu?
english: How many rooms are there in the apartment?

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Nie mogę wejść do pokoju. Jest zamknięty.
english: I can't enter the room. It's locked.
glossary: to be locked/to enter the room
translation: I can’t enter to the room. It is closed.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Będę bardziej surowy następnym razem. Obiecuję.
english: I'll be more strict next time. I promise.
glossary: to be strict/next time/to promise sth
translation: I’ll be more strict next time. I promise.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Chciałabym pracować jako sędzia w przyszłości.
english: I'd like to work as a judge in the future.
glossary: to work as a judge/a judge/in the future
translation: I would like to work as judge in future.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Nie martw się. Nie wystawię cię.
english: Don't worry. I won't stand you up.
glossary: to worry/to stand sb up
translation: Don't worry. I'm not standing you up.

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Na co się patrzysz?
english: What are you looking at?
glossary: to look at sth
translation: What are you looking at?

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Nudziło mi się wczoraj w pracy, bo nie było nic do roboty.
english: I was bored at work yesterday because there was nothing to do.
glossary: to be bored/at work/to have nothing to do
translation: I was bored at work yesterday because there was nothing to do.

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Mogłaś mnie wczoraj odwiedzić, skoro byłaś w mieście.
english: You could've visited me yesterday since you were in town.
glossary: to visit sb/to be in town
translation: You could have visited me yesterday since you were in town

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Obiecałaś, że zrobisz mi dzisiaj włosy.
english: You promised you'd do my hair today.
glossary: to promise sb sth; to promise to sb/to do your hair/today
translation: YOu  promised to make me hair today

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Z kogo się śmiejesz?
english: Who are you laughing at?
glossary: to laugh at sb
translation: From whom are you laughing ?

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Miałam nadzieję, że nie będę miała dzisiaj kaca.
english: I hoped I wouldn't have a hangover today.
glossary: to hope/to have a hangover/today
translation: I hoped I wouldn't had a handover  today

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Nie miałem tego na myśli. Nie powinnaś była brać tego osobiście.
english: I didn't mean it. You shouldn't have taken it personally.
glossary: to mean sth/to take sth personally
translation: I didn't mean that. You shouldn't have taken it personally.

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Jestem pewien, że schudnę do lata.
english: I'm sure I'll lose weight by summer.
glossary: to be sure/to lose weight/by summer
translation: I’m sure  I’ll lose my weight  until the summer

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Nie powinniśmy byli się kłócić. To nie miało sensu.
english: We shouldn't have argued. It didn't make sense.
glossary: to argue with sb/to make sense
translation: We shouldn't have argued .It didn’t make sense

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Stresuję się, bo w przyszłym tygodniu jadę za granicę, a nie mówię dobrze po angielsku.
english: I'm stressed out because I'm going abroad next week and I don't speak English well.
glossary: to speak English well/to go abroad/next week
translation: I'm stressed because I'm going abroad next week and I don't speak English well.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Nie będziesz musiała mnie odbierać jutro ze szkoły, bo śpię u koleżanki.
english: You won't have to pick me up from school tomorrow because I'm sleeping at my friend's.
glossary: to pick sb up from school/to sleep at your friend's
translation: 1. You will not have to pick me up from school tomorrow, because I sleep at my friend's.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Myślałem, że zjemy dzisiaj na mieście.
english: I thought we'd eat out today.
glossary: to eat out
translation: 2. I thought that we were going to eat out today.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Mogłem wczoraj wydać mniej pieniędzy.
english: I could've spent less money yesterday.
glossary: to spend money on sth
translation: 3. I could have spent less money yesterday.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Nie ma nikogo w domu. Dlatego jest tak cicho.
english: There's no one at home. That's why it's so silent.
glossary: to be at home/to be silent
translation: 4. There is nobody home. That's why it's so quiet.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Nie wiem, co powinienem odpowiedzieć.
english: I don't know what I should answer.
glossary: to answer a question
translation: 5. I don't know what I should answer.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Byłem pewny, że zrobisz swoją pracę domową.
english: I was sure you'd do your homework.
glossary: to do your homework
translation: 6. I was sure that you were going to do your homework.

name: Paul Cook
polish: W zeszłym roku nie pojechałem na wakacje, ponieważ nie miałem pieniędzy.
english: I didn't go on vacation last year because I didn't have any money.
glossary: to go on vacation/to have no money
translation: 7. Last year I did not go on vacation because I had no money.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Zawsze znajdę dla ciebie czas, bo jesteś dla mnie ważna.
english: I'll always find time for you because you're important to me.
glossary: to find time for sb/to be important to sb
translation: 8. I will always find time for you because you are important to me.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Nie mogę się skupić, gdy jest tak głośno.
english: I can't focus when it's so loud.
glossary: to focus on sth/to be loud
translation: 9. I can't concentrate when it's so loud.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Gramy jutro mecz. Dołączysz do nas?
english: We're playing a match tomorrow. Will you join us?
glossary: to play a match/to join sb
translation: 10. We're playing a game tomorrow. Will you join us?

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Kogo chcesz, żebym zaprosił na imprezę?
english: Who do you want me to invite to the party?
glossary: to invite sb to a party
translation: 1. Who do you want me to invite to the party?

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Wpadaj. Mój mąż gotuje w ten piątek.
english: Drop by. My husband's cooking this Friday.
glossary: to cook/this Friday
translation: 2. Drop by. My husband is cooking this Friday.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Nie ma różnicy. Bierz, co chcesz.
english: There's no difference. Take what you want.
glossary: a difference/to take sth
translation: 3. There is no difference. Take what you want.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Mogłeś mi od razu powiedzieć prawdę. Nie zdenerwowałbym się.
english: You could've told me the truth at the beginning. I wouldn't have gotten mad.
glossary: to tell sb the truth/at the beginning/to get mad
translation: 4. You could tell me the truth at once. I wouldn't be mad.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Co mi chciałaś powiedzieć na imprezie?
english: What did you want to tell me at the party?
glossary: to tell sb sth/at the party
translation: 5. What did you want to tell me at the party?

name: Martina Ruby
polish: W artykule jest błąd. Popraw go.
english: There's a mistake in the article. Correct it.
glossary: in the article/to correct a mistake
translation: 6. There is a mistakie in the article. Fix it.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Może pojadę taksówką. Zaoszczędzę czas.
english: Maybe I'll take a cab. I'll save time.
glossary: to take a cab/to save money
translation: 7. Maybe I'll get a taxi. I'll save time.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Co chcesz dostać na urodziny?
english: What do you want to get for your birthday?
glossary: to get sth for your birthday
translation: 8. What do you want for your birthday?

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Gdzie Ty wczoraj spałeś?
english: Where did you sleep yesterday?
glossary: to sleep
translation: 9. Where did you sleep yesterady?

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Stresowałem się, bo bałem się, że coś pójdzie źle.
english: I was stressed out because I was afraid something would go wrong.
glossary: to be stressed out/to be afraid of sth/to go wrong
translation: 10. I was stressed beacuse I was afraid that something go wrong.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Klient dodzwoniłby się do nas, gdyby szefowa uaktualniła nasze dane kontaktowe.
english: The client would've called us back if boss had updated our contact details.
glossary: a client/to call sb back/a boss/to update contact details
translation: The client would have call to us if our boss had actualized our contact data.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Co twoi rodzice próbują wskórać?
english: What are your parents trying to accomplish?
glossary: to try to accomplish sth
translation: What your parents try to get?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Na szczęście łatwo było ofierze zidentyfikować napastnika.
english: Luckily, it was easy for the victim to identify the assaulter.
glossary: to identify sb/an assaulter
translation: Fortunately, it was easy for victim to identify the assaulter.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Byłbyś bardziej zaangażowany w swoje obowiązki, gdybyś był na prowizji.
english: You'd be more engaged in your duties if you were on commission.
glossary: to be engaged in sth/to be on commission
translation: You would be more engage in your duties if you had a provision income.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Trudno ci będzie zaangażować wszystkich w rozmowę.
english: It'll be hard for you to engage everybody in the conversation.
glossary: to engage sb in the conversation
translation: It will be difficult to you to engage everybody in conversation.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Kto mnie zastąpi, kiedy wezmę tydzień wolnego?
english: Who's going to replace me when I take a week off?
glossary: to replace sb/to take a week off
translation: Who would replaced me, when I had a one week holiday?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Będzie późno, kiedy dojedziemy do domu.
english: It'll be late when we get home.
glossary: to be late/to drive back home
translation: It would be late, when we came back home.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Trudno mi wyciągnąć moje dziecko z łóżka.
english: It's hard for me to get my child out of bed.
glossary: to get your child out of bed
translation: It’s difficult for me to pick up my kid from the bed.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Jakie teksty zazwyczaj musisz tłumaczyć?
english: What texts do you usually have to translate?
glossary: to translate a text
translation: What stories do you have to translate usually?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Trudno mi się przeprasza za swoje błędy.
english: It's hard for me to apologize for my mistakes.
glossary: to apologize for your mistakes
translation: It’s difficult for me to apologize for my mistakes.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Czy są w tym mieście jakieś miejsca, które powinienem odwiedzić?
english: Are there any places in the city I should visit?
glossary: in the city; in town/to visit a place
translation: 1. Are there any places in the city that I should visit?

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Gdzie jedziesz w tym roku na wakacje?
english: Where are you going on vacation this year?
glossary: to go on vacation/this year
translation: 2. Where are you going on vacation this year?

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Mamy czas. Nie ma potrzeby się spieszyć.
english: We have time. There's no need to hurry up.
glossary: to have time/a need/to hurry up
translation: 3. We have time. It's no need to hurry.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że wrócę do domu dzisiaj, ale uciekł mi pociąg.
english: I hoped I'd come back home today, but I missed the train.
glossary: to hope/to come back home/today/to miss the train
translation: 4. I hoped I came back home today but I missed the rain.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Dlaczego tak zareagowałaś? Możesz mi to wytłumaczyć?
english: Why did you react like that? Can you explain it to me?
glossary: to react to sth/like that/to explain sth to sb
translation: 5. Why did you react like that? Can you explain this to me?

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Mogłeś wcześniej zadzwonić. Powiedziałabym Ci, że nie ma mnie w domu.
english: You could've called before. I would've told you I wasn't at home.
glossary: to be at home/to call sb
translation: 6. You could have called earlier. I would have told you I wasn't home.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Z kim wczoraj rozmawiałeś przez telefon?
english: Who did you talk to on the phone yesterday?
glossary: to talk to sb over the phone
translation: 7. Who did you were on the phone yesterday?

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Idziemy dziś wieczorem na drinka. Pamiętasz?
english: We're going for a drink tonight. Do you remember?
glossary: to remember/to go for a drink/tonight
translation: 8. We are going for a drink tonight. Do you remeber?

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Obawiam się, że nie dostanę tej pracy.
english: I'm afraid I won't get the job.
glossary: to be afraid of sth/to get a job
translation: 9. I'm afraid I won't get the job.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Z kim chcesz spędzić resztę swojego życia?
english: Who do you want to spend the rest of your life with?
glossary: to spend time with sb/the rest of your life
translation: 10. Who do you want to spend the rest of your life with?

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Dam ci znać, jak już skończę pracę. Będziemy w kontakcie.
english: I'll let you know once I finish work. We'll be in touch.
glossary: to let sb know/to finish work/to be in touch
translation: 1. I'll let you know when I finish work. We'll bein touch.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Mam dość tego projektu, bo pracuję nad nim od kilku miesięcy.
english: I'm fed up with the project because I've been working on it for a few months.
glossary: to be fed up with sth/to work on a project
translation: 2. I'm fed up with this project because I habe been working on it for few months.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Ostrzegałam cię, że będzie korek na autostradzie, ale nie chciałeś mnie słuchać.
english: I warned you there would be a traffic jam on the highway, but you didn't want to listen to me.
glossary: to warn sb that.../I've warned you that.../an accident/on the highway/to listen to sb
translation: 3. I warned you there would be a traffic jam on the highway but you wouldn't listen to me.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Myślę, że będziemy częściej wychodzić razem na miasto, bo przyszłym miesiącu przeprowadzam się do Warszawy.
english: I think we'll hang out together more often because I'm moving to Warsaw next month.
glossary: to go out; to hang out/to move to Warsaw/next month
translation: 4. I think we will go out together more often because I'm moving to Warsaw next month.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Nie powinnam była na ciebie krzyczeć. Musiałeś czuć się rozczarowany.
english: I shouldn't have shouted at you. You must've felt disappointed.
glossary: to scream at sb; to shout at sb/to feel disappointed
translation: 5. I shouldn't have yelled at you. You had to feel disappointed.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Przez trzy miesiące w liceum pracowałam jako kelnerka.
english: I worked as a waitress for three months in high school.
glossary: to work as a waitress/in high school
translation: 6. For three months in highschool I worked as a waitress.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: W pewnym momencie wierzyłem, że wrócimy do siebie.
english: At some point, I believed we'd get back together.
glossary: At some point.../to get back together
translation: 7. At some point I belived that we would get back together.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Jakie problemy są w twojej firmie?
english: What problems are there in your company?
glossary: a problem; an issue
translation: 8. What are the problems in your company?

name: Martina Ruby
polish: O kim rozmawiacie?
english: Who are you talking about?
glossary: to talk about sb
translation: 9. Who are you talking about?

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Gdzie zostawiłeś kurtkę?
english: Where did you leave your jacket?
glossary: a jacket/to leave sth
translation: 10. Where did you leave the jacket?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Czułbym się teraz źle, gdybym wyrzucił te stare ubrania, zamiast oddać je na cele dobroczynne.
english: I'd feel bad now if I'd thrown out the old clothes instead of giving them to charity.
glossary: to feel bad/to throw away your clothes/to give sth to charity
translation: I would feel bad now if I threw out the old clothes instead to give them for …

name: Anette Gray
polish: Gdybyś rzeczywiście miał odrę, miałbyś również wysypkę.
english: If you really had measles, you'd also have a rash.
glossary: to have measles/to have a rash
translation: If you have … you would have a ….

name: Anette Gray
polish: Miałaś w zeszłym tygodniu lekcję angielskiego?
english: Did you have the English class last week?
glossary: to have an English class/last week
translation: Did you have an English lesson last week?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Rzuciłabyś mnie, gdybym cię nie przeprosił?
english: Would you have broken up with me if I hadn't apologized to you?
glossary: to break up with sb/to apologize to sb for sth
translation: Would you break up with me if I didn’t apologize to you?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie uderzyłbym cię w twarz, gdybyś mnie nie sprowokował.
english: I wouldn't have punched you in the face if you hadn't provoked me.
glossary: to punch sb in the face/to provoke sb
translation: I wouldn’t have slapped you in your face if you hadn’t …

name: Anette Gray
polish: Co chcesz, żebym ci powiedział?
english: What do you want me to tell you?
glossary: to tell sb sth
translation: What do you want I tell you?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Gdybym pościelił dziś rano łóżko, mama by się na mnie nie wkurzyła.
english: If I'd made the bed this morning, my mom wouldn't have gotten mad at me.
glossary: to make the bed/this morning/to get mad at sb
translation: If I had done my bed, my mom wouldn’t have gotten mad at me.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nigdy nie ćpałem i nie pochwalam tego.
english: I've never done drugs and I don't approve of it.
glossary: to do drugs/to approve of sth
translation: I’ve never taken drugs and don’t aprove of that.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Zwykle ćwiczę, słuchając jednocześnie muzyki.
english: I usually exercise listening to music at the same time.
glossary: to exercise/to listen to music/at the same time
translation: I usually work out while listening to music.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Gdybyśmy przestali używać konserwantów, mielibyśmy więcej klientów.
english: If we stopped using preservatives, we'd have more customers.
glossary: a preservative/a customer
translation: If we stopped using … we would have more clients.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Do czego odnosi się artykuł?
english: What does the article refer to?
glossary: to refer to sth/an article
translation: What does the article refer to?

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Dlaczego pozwoliłeś rodzicom rozpieszczać swoje dzieci?
english: Why did you let your parents spoil your kids?
glossary: to let sb do sth/to spoil your kids
translation: Why did you let your parents get spoil your children?

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Miałeś przećwiczyć scenariusz. Jak zamierzasz teraz wyjść na scenę?
english: You were supposed to rehearse the script. How are you going to go on stage now?
glossary: to rehearse the script/to go on stage
translation: You were supposed to examine…. How are you going to on stage?

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Zbyt często wychodzisz. To nie jest hotel.
english: You're going out way too often. It's not a hotel.
glossary: to go out/to do sth way too often
translation: You go out to often. It’s not a hotel.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Mój tata miał rozebrać te stare meble, ale nie miał czasu.
english: My dad was supposed to take this old furniture apart, but he had no time.
glossary: to take sth apart/to have no time
translation: My father…………… but he didn’t have time.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Jak długo bronisz przestępców? Nie czujesz się z tym źle?
english: How long have you been defending criminals? Don't you feel bad about it?
glossary: to defend sb/to feel bad about sth
translation: How long have you been ……….. criminals? Don’t you feel bad about it?

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Jak długo zlew jest zatkany? Powinniśmy coś z tym zrobić.
english: How long has the sink been stuck? We should do something about it.
glossary: to be stuck/to do sth about sth
translation: How long…………  We should do something with it.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Po południu miałam ściąć włosy, ale okazało się, że muszę odebrać syna ze szkoły.
english: I was supposed to have my hair cut in the afternoon, but it's turned out I have to pick my son from school.
glossary: to have your hair cut/to pick sb from school
translation: I was supposed to cut my hair in the afternoon, but it turned out that I have to pick up my son from school.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Co sprawiło, że wyprowadziłeś się z miasta? Myślałem, że lubisz swoją okolicę.
english: What made you move out of town? I thought you liked your neighborhood.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to like your neighborhood
translation: What happened that you move out from the city? I thought that you like your area?

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Miałeś kosić trawnik. Kiedy zamierzasz to zrobić?
english: You were supposed to mow the lawn. When are you going to do it?
glossary: to mow the lawn
translation: You were supposed mow the lawn. When will you do it?

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Myślę, że dzisiaj będę pracował po godzinach. Co powiesz na czwartek?
english: I think I'll work overtime today. What about Thursday?
glossary: to work overtime/to meet/today/Thursday/What about.../to think
translation: 1.	I think I will be working after hours today. How about Thursday?

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Myśłałem, że zawieziesz mnie do domu. Nie chcę brać taksówki.
english: I thought you'd take me home. I don't want to take a cab.
glossary: to think/to take sb home/to take a cab
translation: 2.	I thought you would take me home. I don’t want to take a cab.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Idę jutro do banku, żeby założyć konto.
english: I'm going to the bank tomorrow to open an account.
glossary: to go to the bank/to open an account/tomorrow
translation: 3.	I’m going to the bank tomorrow to open an account.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Skup się na sprzątaniu pokoju.
english: Focus on cleaning the room.
glossary: to focus on sth/to clean a room
translation: 4.	Focus on clinging the room.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Musisz pamiętać, że jest wyjątek do tej zasady.
english: You have to remember that there's an exception to the rule.
glossary: to remember sth/an exception to the rule
translation: 5.	You must remember that there is an exception to this rule.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Chciałabym, żebyś wygłosił przemowę na konferencji.
english: I'd like you to give a speech at the conference.
glossary: to give a speech/at the conference
translation: 6.	I would like you to give a speech at the conference.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: W tej grupie jest za dużo ludzi. Znajdę inną.
english: There are too many people in the group. I have to find a different one.
glossary: in the group/to find sth/different
translation: 7.	There are too many people in this group. I will find another.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Powinienem był od razu cię zwolnić. Nie zasługujesz, żeby tu być.
english: I should've fired you right away. You don't deserve to be here.
glossary: to fire sb/right away/to deserve sth
translation: 8.	I should have fired you right now. You don’t deserve to be here.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Kiedy zaczynasz nową pracę?
english: When are you starting the new job?
glossary: to start a new job
translation: 9.	When do you start a new job?

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Interesuję się gotowaniem.
english: I'm interested in cooking.
glossary: to be interested in sth/to cook sth
translation: 10.	I’m interested in cooking.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Mam nadzięję, że wrócisz do pracy do końca miesiąca.
english: I hope you'll come back to work by the end of the month.
glossary: to come back to work/by the end of the month/I hope that...
translation: 1. I hope you will be back to work by the end of the month.

name: Matt Xander

english: How long have you been diminishing my accomplishments? I won't put up with it anymore.
glossary: to diminish sth/to put up with sth
translation: 2. How long are you playing my successes down? I won’t put up with it.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Jak długo żujesz tę gumę? Weź nową.
english: How long have you been chewing this gum? Take a new one.
glossary: to chew a gum/to take a new one
translation: 3. How long have you been chewing gum? Take a new one.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Słyszałem dziś, jak moja córka mówi po angielsku, i to skłoniło mnie do myślenia. Może też powinienem zapisać się na taki kurs.
english: I heard my daughter speaking English today, and it made me think. Maybe I should sign up for such a course as well.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to hear sb doing sth/to sign up for a course
translation: 4. I had heard today how my daughter speaks English, and it made me think. Maybe I should sign up for that course.

name: Martin Hale
polish: O co prokurator okręgowy chce cię oskarżyć?
english: What does the district attorney want to charge you with?
glossary: a district attorney/to charge sb with sth
translation: 5. What does the regional prosecutor want you to accuse of?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Powinniśmy teraz nosić maseczki w sklepach.
english: We are supposed to wear face masks in stores now.
glossary: to wear face masks
translation: 6. We should wear the mask in shops now.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Jak długo tyle bierzesz? Ostatnim razem, kiedy się spotkaliśmy, było taniej.
english: How long have you been charging this much? The last time we met it was cheaper.
glossary: to charge sb
translation: 7. How long have you been getting as much? Last time we met it was cheaper.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Od jak dawna chwalisz się swoim nowym samochodem? Czy nie widzisz, że wszyscy mają dość?
english: How long have you been bragging about your new car? Can't you see everyone's fed up?
glossary: to brag about sth/to be fed up with sth
translation: 8. How long have you been boasting about your new car? Can’t you see that everybody is fed up with it?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Dlaczego akcje Twojej firmy spadły? Czy coś się stało?
english: Why did your company's shares drop? Did anything happen?
glossary: to drop/a share
translation: 9. Why did your company stock go down? Did something happen?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Mieliśmy się zmieniać, nieprawdaż?
english: We were supposed to take turns, weren't we?
glossary: to take turns
translation: 10. We were supposed to change. Weren’t we?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Przygotuję się na spotkanie, jeśli będę mieć czas.
english: I'll get prepared for the meeting if I have time.
glossary: to get prepared for a meeting
translation: I'll prepare for the meeting once I have time.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Na twoim miejscu nie chodziłbym spać tak późno.
english: If I were you, I wouldn't go to sleep so late.
glossary: to go to sleep late
translation: If I were you, I wouldn't go to bed so late.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Gdybyś nie popełnił tego przestępstwa, policja by cię teraz nie szukała.
english: If you hadn't committed the crime, the police wouldn't be looking for you now.
glossary: to look for sb/to commit a crime
translation: If you hadn't commited the crime, the police wouldn't have looked for you.

name: Anna Patton
polish: O czym musimy porozmawiać?
english: What do we have to talk about?
glossary: to talk about sth
translation: What do we have to talk about?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Dlaczego jest tyle głosów przeciwko temu kandydatowi?
english: Why are there so many votes against the candidate?
glossary: a vote against sb/a candidate
translation: Why are there so many votes against the candidate?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Kogo spotkałeś, kiedy wychodziłeś z budynku?
english: Who did you meet when you were leaving the building?
glossary: to meet sb/to leave the building
translation: Who did you meet where you were leaving the building?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Zrobiłaś test ciążowy?
english: Did you do a pregnancy test?
glossary: to do a pregnancy test/a pregnancy test
translation: Have you done the pregnancy test?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Dowiedziałem się wczoraj, że mój szef pracował wcześniej w agencji nieruchomości.
english: I found out yesterday that my boss had worked at a real estate agency before.
glossary: a real estate agency/to find out that.../a boss
translation: I found out yesterday my boss had worked in a property agency earlier.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Wszyscy się mnie wczoraj pytali, czy jestem zły. Nie wiem dlaczego.
english: Everybody asked me yesterday if I was mad. I don't know why.
glossary: to be mad at sb
translation: Everyone asked me yesterday if I was angry. I don't know why.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Często podróżowaliśmy z mężem, zanim urodziło się nasze pierwsze dziecko.
english: My husband and I had often traveled before our first kid was born.
glossary: to be born/a kid/to travel/a husband
translation: We traveled often with our husband before I gave a birth to our first child.

name: Kate Long
polish: Jest możliwość, że zostanę zwolniony.
english: There's a possibility that I'll be fired.
glossary: a possibility/to fire sb
translation: 1.	There is a possibility that I’ll get fired.

name: Kate Long
polish: Byłem pewien, że przytyję, ale za mało jadłem.
english: I was sure I'd gain weight, but I ate too little.
glossary: to be sure/to gain weight/to eat too little
translation: 2.	I was sure I would gain weight, but I ate too little.

name: Kate Long
polish: Jest jeszcze tyle rzeczy, których muszę się nauczyć na test.
english: There are still so many things I have to study for the test.
glossary: to study sth for a test
translation: 3.	There is a lot things already which I have to study for the test.

name: Kate Long
polish: Nie powinienem był cię słuchać. Nie miałeś racji.
english: I shouldn't have listened to you. You weren't right.
glossary: to listen to sb/to be right
translation: 4.	I shouldn’t have listened to you. You were wrong.

name: Kate Long
polish: Obiecuję, że odwiedzę was w przyszłym miesiącu.
english: I promise I'll visit you next month.
glossary: to visit sb/next month/to promise
translation: 5.	I promise I’ll visit you next month.

name: Kate Long
polish: Nie powinnaś była dzwonić do mnie tak późno. Moja żona była w domu.
english: You shouldn't have called me so late. My wife was at home.
glossary: to call sb/a wife/to be at home
translation: 6.	You shouldn’t have called me so late. My wife was at home.

name: Kate Long
polish: Byłam w szoku, gdy zauważyłam, że na moim koncie nie ma pieniędzy.
english: I was in shock when I noticed there was no money in my bank account.
glossary: to be in shock/to notice sth/in the bank account/money
translation: 7.	I was surprised when I noticed at my bank account no money.

name: Kate Long
polish: Nie ma takiej zasady.
english: There's no such rule.
glossary: a rule
translation: 8.	There isn’t this rule.

name: Kate Long
polish: Spotykam się dzisiaj z jednym z moich klientów, żeby wyjaśnić sytuację.
english: I'm meeting one of my clients today to explain the situation.
glossary: to explain the situation/to meet sb/one of your clients/today
translation: 9.	 I’m seeing with one of my clients today to explain the situation.

name: Kate Long
polish: Powinienem był się ciebie pozbyć, zanim narobiłeś problemów.
english: I should've gotten rid of you before you made trouble.
glossary: to get rid of sb/to make trouble
translation: 10.	I should’ve got rid of you since you made problems.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Nie będziesz musiała mnie odbierać jutro ze szkoły, bo śpię u koleżanki.
english: You won't have to pick me up from school tomorrow because I'm sleeping at my friend's.
glossary: to pick sb up from school/to sleep at your friend's
translation: You don't have to pick me up from school tomorrow because I'm sleeping at my friend’s.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Myślałem, że zjemy dzisiaj na mieście.
english: I thought we'd eat out today.
glossary: to eat out
translation: I thought we would eat out today.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Mogłem wczoraj wydać mniej pieniędzy.
english: I could've spent less money yesterday.
glossary: to spend money on sth
translation: I could have spent less money yesterday.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Nie ma nikogo w domu. Dlatego jest tak cicho.
english: There's no one at home. That's why it's so silent.
glossary: to be at home/to be silent
translation: There is no one at home. That’s why it’s so quiet.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Nie wiem, co powinienem odpowiedzieć.
english: I don't know what I should answer.
glossary: to answer a question
translation: I don’t know what I should answer.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Byłem pewny, że zrobisz swoją pracę domową.
english: I was sure you'd do your homework.
glossary: to do your homework
translation: I was sure you would do your homework.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: W zeszłym roku nie pojechałem na wakacje, ponieważ nie miałem pieniędzy.
english: I didn't go on vacation last year because I didn't have any money.
glossary: to go on vacation/to have no money
translation: Last year I didn’t go on vacation because I had no money.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Zawsze znajdę dla ciebie czas, bo jesteś dla mnie ważna.
english: I'll always find time for you because you're important to me.
glossary: to find time for sb/to be important to sb
translation: I’ll always find time for you, because you’re important to me.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Nie mogę się skupić, gdy jest tak głośno.
english: I can't focus when it's so loud.
glossary: to focus on sth/to be loud
translation: I can’t focus when it’s so loud.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Gramy jutro mecz. Dołączysz do nas?
english: We're playing a match tomorrow. Will you join us?
glossary: to play a match/to join sb
translation: We are playing a match tomorrow. Will you join us

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Mam nadzięję, że wrócisz do pracy do końca miesiąca.
english: I hope you'll come back to work by the end of the month.
glossary: to come back to work/by the end of the month/I hope that...
translation: 1. I hope you’ll come back to work at the end of the month.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: W pewnym momencie zauważyłam błąd.
english: At some point, I noticed a mistake.
glossary: At some point.../to notice a mistake
translation: 2. At some point I saw a mistake.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Muszę dowiedzieć się prawdy.
english: I have to find out the truth.
glossary: to find out the truth
translation: 3. I need to find out the truth.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Obiecuję, że pójdę jutro do szkoły.
english: I promise I'll go to school tomorrow.
glossary: to promise sth/to go to school
translation: 4. I promise I will go to the school tomorrow.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Pójdę na siłownię, kiedy wyzdrowieję.
english: I'll go to the gym when I get better.
glossary: to get better/to go to the gym
translation: 5. I will go to the gym when I get well.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Przeprowadzam się w przyszłym miesiącu.
english: I'm moving next month.
glossary: to move
translation: 6. I’m moving out next month.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Nie mam czasu. Idę jutro do lekarza.
english: I don't have time. I'm going to the doctor tomorrow.
glossary: to go to the doctor
translation: 7. I don’t have a time. I’m going to the doctor tomorrow.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Byłem wściekły, kiedy żona mnie okłamała.
english: I was furious when my wife lied to me.
glossary: to be furious/to lie to sb
translation: 8. I was mad when my wife lied to me.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Od roku chodzę na siłownię.
english: I've been going to the gym for a year.
glossary: to go to the gym
translation: 9. I have been going to the gym for year.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Nie możesz wychodzić z łóżka. Masz grypę.
english: You can't get out of bed. You have the flu.
glossary: to have the flu/to get out of bed
translation: 10. You can’t get out of bed. You have a flu.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Wynajmowałem mieszkanie z kolegą, zanim kupiłem własny dom.
english: I'd been renting an apartment with a friend before I bought my own house.
glossary: to rent an apartment/your own house/to buy a house
translation: I rented an apartment with a friend before I bought my own house.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Do kogo się uśmiechasz?
english: Who are you smiling at?
glossary: to smile at sb
translation: Who are you smiling at?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Jeszcze tego nie przemyślałem.
english: I haven't thought it over yet.
glossary: to think sth over
translation: I haven't think it through yet.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Może nie byłbyś marudny, gdybyś nie siedział codziennie przed telewizorem.
english: Maybe you wouldn't be moody if you didn't sit in front of the TV every day.
glossary: to be moody/to sit in front of the TV/every day
translation: Maybe you wouldn't be grouchy if you didn't sit in front of the TV every day.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Żona się pytała, czy zrobię kolację.
english: My wife asked me if I'd make dinner.
glossary: to make dinner
translation: My wife asked if I would make dinner.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Rodzice się mnie pytali, czy wziąłem w końcu kredyt.
english: My parents asked me if I'd finally taken out a loan.
glossary: to take out a loan/finally
translation: My parents asked me did I finally take a loan.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Gdybyś mnie posłuchał, nie skończyłbyś w szpitalu.
english: If you'd listened to me, you wouldn't have ended up in the hospital.
glossary: to listen to sb/to end up in the hospital
translation: If you had listened to me, you wouldn't have ended up in the hospital.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Dlaczego jest tylu ludzi, którzy żyją w ubóstwie?
english: Why are there so many people who live in poverty?
glossary: to live in poverty
translation: Why are there so many people who live in poverty?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Kiedy się zaręczyliście?
english: When did you get engaged?
glossary: to get engaged
translation: When did you get engaged?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Nie wygramy sprawy, jeśli nie będziesz zeznawał.
english: We won't win the case if you don't testify.
glossary: to win a case/to testify
translation: We will not win the case if you don't testify.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Co byś zrobił, gdybyś wygrał na loterii?
english: What would you do if you won the lottery?
glossary: to win the lottery
translation: What would you do if you won the lottery?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Jak usłyszałeś o roli?
english: How did you hear about the role?
glossary: to hear about sth
translation: How did you hear about the role?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Co myślisz o swoim poprzednim szefie?
english: What do you think of your previous boss?
glossary: to think of sb
translation: What do you think of your previous boss?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Co przyciągnęło Cię do tej firmy?
english: What attracted you to this company?
glossary: to attract sb/a company
translation: What attracted you to this company?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Jakie byłoby Twoje idealne środowisko pracy?
english: What would be your ideal working environment?
glossary: a working environment/to be ideal
translation: What would be your ideal work environment?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: W czym jesteś naprawdę dobry?
english: What are you really good at?
glossary: to be good at sth
translation: What are you really good at?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Jak radzisz sobie ze stresem?
english: How do you handle stress?
glossary: to handle sth
translation: How do you work with stress?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Dlaczego chcesz tą pracę?
english: Why do you want this job?
glossary: to want sth
translation: Why do you want this job?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Podaj przykłady pomysłów, które wdrożyłeś.
english: Give examples of ideas you've implemented.
glossary: to give an example/to implement sth
translation: Give examples of ideas you have implemented.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Wśród ludzi, z którymi pracowałeś, kogo podziwiasz?
english: Among the people you've worked with, who do you admire?
glossary: among people/to admire sb/to work with sb
translation: Among the people you have worked with, who do you most admire?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Masz do nas jakieś pytania?
english: Do you have any questions for us?
glossary: to have questions for sb
translation: Do you have any questions for us?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Co wiesz o firmie?
english: What do you know about the company?
glossary: to know sth about sth/a company
translation: What do you know about our company?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Jakie są Twoje życiowe marzenia?
english: What are your lifelong dreams?
glossary: a lifelong dream
translation: What are your dreams in life?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Co Ci się najmniej podobało w swojej ostatniej pracy?
english: What did you like least about your last job?
glossary: to like sth least about sth
translation: What did you like least about your last job?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Jaki był najtrudniejszy okres w Twoim życiu?
english: What was the most difficult period in your life?
glossary: to have a difficult period in your life
translation: What was the most difficult time in your life?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Jaki jest najlepszy film, jaki widziałeś w zeszłym roku?
english: What's the best movie you've seen in the past year?
glossary: in the past year
translation: What is the best movie you watched last year?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Opowiedz mi o czasie, kiedy musiałeś radzić sobie z konfliktem w pracy.
english: Tell me about a time when you had to deal with conflict on the job.
glossary: to deal with sth/to have to do sth
translation: Tell me about a time when you had to deal with conflict at work.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Dlaczego złożyłeś podanie?
english: Why did you apply?
glossary: to apply for sth
translation: Why did you apply?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Jakie czasopisma prenumerujesz?
english: What magazines do you subscribe to?
glossary: to subscribe to sth
translation: What magazines do you subscribe to?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Jak Twoje doświadczenie przygotowało Cię do tej pracy?
english: How has your experience prepared you for this job?
glossary: to prepare sb for sth
translation: How did your experience prepare you for the job?

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Jest możliwość, że zostanę zwolniony.
english: There's a possibility that I'll be fired.
glossary: a possibility/to fire sb
translation: There is possibility I would be fire

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Byłem pewien, że przytyję, ale za mało jadłem.
english: I was sure I'd gain weight, but I ate too little.
glossary: to be sure/to gain weight/to eat too little
translation: I was sure I was getting fat, but I didn't eat enough.

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Jest jeszcze tyle rzeczy, których muszę się nauczyć na test.
english: There are still so many things I have to study for the test.
glossary: to study sth for a test
translation: There are still so many things I have to learn for the test.

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Nie powinienem był cię słuchać. Nie miałeś racji.
english: I shouldn't have listened to you. You weren't right.
glossary: to listen to sb/to be right
translation: I shouldn't  listened to you. You were wrong.

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Obiecuję, że odwiedzę was w przyszłym miesiącu.
english: I promise I'll visit you next month.
glossary: to visit sb/next month/to promise
translation: I promise I’ll visit you next month

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Nie powinnaś była dzwonić do mnie tak późno. Moja żona była w domu.
english: You shouldn't have called me so late. My wife was at home.
glossary: to call sb/a wife/to be at home
translation: You shouldn't have called me so late. My wife was at home

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Byłam w szoku, gdy zauważyłam, że na moim koncie nie ma pieniędzy.
english: I was in shock when I noticed there was no money in my bank account.
glossary: to be in shock/to notice sth/in the bank account/money
translation: I was shocked to notice that there was no money in my account.

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Nie ma takiej zasady.
english: There's no such rule.
glossary: a rule
translation: There is no such role

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Spotykam się dzisiaj z jednym z moich klientów, żeby wyjaśnić sytuację.
english: I'm meeting one of my clients today to explain the situation.
glossary: to explain the situation/to meet sb/one of your clients/today
translation: I met with one of my clients today to explain the situation.

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Powinienem był się ciebie pozbyć, zanim narobiłeś problemów.
english: I should've gotten rid of you before you made trouble.
glossary: to get rid of sb/to make trouble
translation: I should have kicked you off  before you got into trouble.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Ilu wspólników było na spotkaniu w zeszłym tygodniu?
english: How many business partners were there at the meeting last week?
glossary: a participant/a meeting/last week
translation: 1. How many shareholders were at the meeting last week?

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Do czego masz słabość?
english: What do you have a weakness for?
glossary: to have a weakness for sth
translation: 2. What do you have a weakness for?

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Jutro jem obiad z moim szefem.
english: I'm having lunch with my boss tomorrow.
glossary: to have lunch with sb/a boss
translation: 3. Tomorrow  I’m having dinner with my boss.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Jeśli zostanie przyznany mi ten kredyt, w końcu będę mógł przeprowadzić badanie.
english: If I'm granted the loan, I'll be finally able to conduct the study.
glossary: to be granted a loan/to be able to do sth/to conduct a study/finally
translation: 4. If I’m granted this credit I’ll finally be able to do the research.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Piłbym częściej herbatę, gdybym lubił moich sąsiadów.
english: I'd have tea more often if I liked my neighbors.
glossary: to have tea/often/a neighbor/to like sb
translation: 5. I would drink tea more often if I liked my neighbors.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Trzymałbym się pierwotnego planu, gdyby sprawy nie wymknęły się spod kontroli.
english: I would've stuck to the initial plan if the things hadn't gotten out of control.
glossary: to stick to the plan/the initial plan/to get out of control
translation: 6. I would have stuck to my initial  plan if the issues hadn’t been out of control.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Nie rozumiem, dlaczego jesteś na mnie wściekły.
english: I don't understand why you're mad at me.
glossary: to understand sb/to be mad at sb
translation: 7. I don’t understand  why you are mad at me.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Powinienem był dotrzeć na spotkanie z klientem na czas.
english: I should've gotten to the meeting with a client on time.
glossary: to get to a meeting/a meeting/a client/on time
translation: 8. I should have arrived at the meeting with client on time.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Kiedy się widzieliśmy ostatnim razem, myślałem, że powiesz mi prawdę.
english: The last time we met, I thought you'd tell me the truth.
glossary: to meet sb/finally/to tell the truth
translation: 9. When we saw last time each other I thought you would tell me the truth.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Gratulacje. Właśnie usłyszałem wieści.
english: Congratulations. I've just heard the news.
glossary: congratulations/to hear the news
translation: 10. Congratulations. I’ve just heard the news.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Dlaczego skłamałeś, gdy cię kilka dni temu pytałam, czy spałeś z moją kumpelą?
english: Why did you lie when I asked you the other day if you'd slept with my friend?
glossary: to lie to sb/the other day/to sleep with sb

name: Margaret Morgan

polish: Obiecuję, że odwiedzę was w przyszłym miesiącu.

name: Eve Miles

name: Eve Miles

name: Eve Miles
polish: Nie ma takiej zasady.

name: Eve Miles

name: Eve Miles

name: Eve Miles

glossary: to try to do sth/to set sb up

name: Eve Miles
polish: Jest wiele miejsc, które chciałbym odwiedzić.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Myślisz, że ci uwierzę?

glossary: to believe sb

name: Eve Miles
polish: Czy ty myślisz, że ze mną wygrasz?

name: Eve Miles
polish: Wkurzyłeś się, kiedy zostałeś zwolniony?

glossary: to get mad/to be fired

glossary: to eat dinner with sb

name: Eve Miles

name: Eve Miles

glossary: to stop doing sth/to trust sb/to cheat sb/for the first time

name: Eve Miles
polish: Jestem pewien, że mnie nie zawiedziesz.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Gdzie dorastałeś?

name: Eve Miles
polish: Nie ma w tym artykule nic interesującego.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Do kogo dzwonisz?

glossary: to call sb

name: Eve Miles
polish: O której zwykle zaczynasz pracę?

glossary: to start work/What time...

name: Eve Miles

name: Eve Miles

name: Eve Miles
polish: Wierzę, że mnie nie oszukasz.

translation: 7.	I believe you won’t cheat me.

name: Eve Miles

glossary: to change your mind/a video/to see sth

name: Eve Miles

name: Eve Miles

name: Eve Miles

name: Eve Miles

translation: 3. I broke my mom's phone. I don't know what I should do now.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Chciałem dać ci radę.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Chcę spędzić czas z tobą.

name: Peter Kane

glossary: to take sth with me/a laptop

name: Peter Kane

polish: Mogę pracować jako kelnerka.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Musiałam iść wczoraj do pracy.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Chciałbym usiąść na kanapie.

name: Peter Kane

name: Peter Kane

glossary: to pick up your kids from school/today

name: Peter Kane

name: Peter Kane
polish: Nie chciałem wczoraj zaspać do pracy.

name: Peter Kane

name: Peter Kane

name: Peter Kane

polish: Pojadę na wakacje, jak już oszczędzę pieniądze.

name: Margaret Usher

glossary: to go to sleep early/to give a presentation

name: Margaret Usher
