english: We're watching a match tonight. Drop by.
glossary: to watch a match/to drop by
translation: We are watching the match tonight. Drop by.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Co powiesz na poniedziałek? W weekend zajmuję się psami mojej siostry.
english: What about Monday? I'm taking care of my sister's dogs on the weekend.
glossary: on the weekend/What about.../to take care of sth
translation: What about Monday? I'm taking care of my sister's dogs on the weekend.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Jak długo już nalegasz? Nie rozumiesz, że Ci tego nie dam?
english: How long have you been insisting yet? Don't you understand I won't give it?
glossary: to insist
translation: 1. How long are you insisting? Don’t you understand that I won't give it to you?

name: Martin Hale
polish: O której wylądował samolot? Nie miał przybyć później?
english: What time did the plane land? Wasn't it supposed to arrive later?
glossary: to land/a plane/to arrive later
translation: 2. What time did the airplane land? Isn't it supposed to come later?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Twoja partia miała mnie wesprzeć w następnych wyborach.
english: Your party was supposed to back me during the next election.
glossary: to back sb/a party/an election
translation: 3. Your party is supposed to support me in the next election.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Nigdy nie pozwalasz mi chodzić na imprezy. Nie jestem już dzieckiem.
english: You never let me go to parties. I'm not a kid anymore.
glossary: to let sb do sth
translation: 4. You always aren’t letting me go to a party. I’m not a kid.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Jak długo zaprzeczasz prawdzie? Czy to nie najwyższy czas, żeby się z tym zmierzyć?
english: How long have you been denying the truth? Isn't it high time to face it?
glossary: to deny the truth/to face sth
translation: 5. How long are you denying the truth? ?…???

name: Martin Hale
polish: Nikt nie zmuszał Cię do wybrania tego kursu, więc przestań narzekać.
english: No one made you choose that course, so stop complaining.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to complain about sth
translation: 6. Nobody didn’t force you to choose that course, so stop complaining.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Miałem naładować komórkę, ale zupełnie zapomniałem.
english: I was supposed to charge my cell phone, but I totally forgot.
glossary: to charge your cell phone
translation: 7. I’m supposed to charge the mobile phone but I had forgotten.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Czym zwykle skutkuje takie zachowanie?
english: What does such behavior usually result in?
glossary: behavior/to result in sth
translation: 8. What usually????

name: Martin Hale
polish: Mój mąż miał złożyć łóżeczko do kupy, ale był zbyt leniwy.
english: My husband was supposed to put the crib together, but he was too lazy.
glossary: to put sth together/to be too lazy to do sth
translation: 9. My husband????

name: Martin Hale
polish: Od jak dawna próbujesz wprowadzić swój pierwszy produkt? Chyba minął już rok.
english: How long have you been trying to roll out your first product? I guess it's been a year now.
glossary: to roll sth out
translation: 10. How long have you been trying to introduce your first product? ????

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Nie łatwo mi oprzeć się pokusie, żeby zapalić.
english: It's not easy for me to resist the temptation to smoke.
glossary: to resist the temptation to do sth/to smoke
translation: It’s not simple for me to resist the temptation to smoke.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Nie jestem pewien, czy dobrze cię rozumiem. Co sugerujesz?
english: I'm not sure if I understand you well. What are you suggesting?
glossary: to be sure/to understand sth well/to suggest sth
translation: I’m not sure if I understand you well. What are you suggesting?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Prezes by teraz z panią porozmawiała, gdyby nie była na spotkaniu.
english: The chairman would talk to you right now if she weren't at a meeting.
glossary: a chairman/to talk to sb/to be at a meeting
translation: The president would talk to you now if she didn’t be at the meeting.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Jakiego podejścia wymaga to zadanie?
english: What approach does this task require?
glossary: an approach/to require sth
translation: What approach the task need?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Zachowaj spokój, kiedy klient znowu do ciebie zadzwoni.
english: Stay calm when your client calls you again.
glossary: to stay calm/to call sb again
translation: Keep calm when the client calls you again.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Otwierasz swoją własną firmę? Jestem pod wrażeniem.
english: Are you setting up your own business? I'm impressed.
glossary: to set up your own business/to be impressed
translation: Are you running your own company? I’m impressed.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Do jakiej restauracji chcielibyście dzisiaj iść?
english: What restaurant would you like to go to today?
glossary: to go to a restaurant
translation: What a restaurant are you going to go today?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Jaką masz dla mnie ofertę?
english: What offer do you have for me?
glossary: to have an offer for sb
translation: What offer are you having for me?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Otrzymałaby pani zwrot kosztów, gdyby wysłała nam pani faktury na czas.
english: You would've received the reimbursement if you'd sent us the invoices on time.
glossary: to receive sth/a reimbursement/to send invoices
translation: You would have received the cost returning if you had sent the invoices to us on time.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Wyjeżdżacie z miasta? Co się stało?
english: Are you leaving town? What happened?
glossary: to leave town/to happen
translation: Are you leaving town? What happened?

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Jak znalazłeś tę pracę?
english: How did you find the job?
glossary: to find a job
translation: How did you find this job ?

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Ile pokoi jest w tym mieszkaniu?
english: How many rooms are there in the apartment?
glossary: in the apartment/a room
translation: How many rooms are there  in this apartment?

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Właśnie czytałem o zostawianiu napiwków.
english: I've just read about leaving tips.
glossary: to read about sth/to leave a tip
translation: I’ve just read about  giving the  tipps

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Gdzie byłaś? Byłem pewien, że pojawisz się dzisiaj na spotkaniu.
english: Where were you? I was sure you'd show up at the meeting today.
glossary: to be sure/to show up at the meeting/today
translation: Where have you been ? I was sure you would show up on party today

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Czym się interesujesz?
english: What are you interested in?
glossary: to be interested in sth
translation: What are you interested in ?

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Ile osób jest teraz w kawiarni?
english: How many people are there at the coffee shop now?
glossary: to be at the coffee shop/now
translation: How many people are in the café now?

name: Theresa Fine
polish: W tym miesiącu jest kilkoro nowych klientów.
english: There are a few new clients this month.
glossary: a client/this month
translation: There are some new clients this month

name: Theresa Fine
polish: W czym jesteś dobry?
english: What are you good at?
glossary: to be good at sth
translation: What are you good at?

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Jesteś świetna w wydawaniu pieniędzy.
english: You're great at spending money.
glossary: to be great at sth/to spend money on sth
translation: You are excellent at spending money

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Zrobię pracę domową, jeśli będę miała czas.
english: I'll do my homework if I have time.
glossary: to do your homework/to have time to do sth
translation: I'll do my homework if I have the time

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Możesz być z siebie dumny.
english: You can be proud of yourself.
glossary: to be proud of sb
translation: You can be proud of you.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Kiedy zdałeś sobie z tego sprawę?
english: When did you realize it?
glossary: to realize sth
translation: When did you realize this?

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Myślę, że założę dzisiaj sukienkę.
english: I think I'll put on a dress today.
glossary: to put on a dress
translation: I think I’ll put on a dress today.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Odświężę swój angielski, kiedy będę miał więcej czasu.
english: I'll refresh my English when I have more time.
glossary: to refresh your English/to have more time
translation: I'll fresh my English when I’m having more time.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Spotykam się dzisiaj ze znajomymi. Nie czekaj.
english: I'm meeting my friends today. Don't wait.
glossary: to meet your friends/to wait for sb
translation: I am meeting with friends today. Don’t wait for me.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Może wpadnę po pracy.
english: Maybe I'll drop by after work.
glossary: to drop by/after work
translation: Maybe I’ll drop up after work.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Jak możesz mnie okłamywać?
english: How can you lie to me?
glossary: to lie to sb
translation: How can you lie at me?

name: Agnes Parker
polish: W szkole jest wielu uczniów, którzy mają problemy.
english: There are many students at school who have problems.
glossary: to have problems/at school/a student
translation: At the school are many students who have problems.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Myślałam, że się tym zajmiesz.
english: I thought you'd take care of it.
glossary: to take care of sth
translation: I thought you’d take care it.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Od godziny robię kolację.
english: I've been making dinner for an hour.
glossary: to make dinner
translation: I’m making a dinner from hour.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Składając wniosek, pamiętaj, żeby go podpisać.
english: Filing an application, remember to sign it.
glossary: to file an application/to sign an application
translation: When making an application remember to sign it.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Czy ma pan odpowiednie umiejętności, żeby wykonywać tę pracę?
english: Do you have the necessary skills to do the job?
glossary: to have the necessary skills/to do a job
translation: Do you have the required skills to do the job?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Zawsze chciałem pracować z ludźmi.
english: I've always wanted to work with people.
glossary: to work with people
translation: I always wanted to work with people.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Gdybyś oszczędzał wodę, zmniejszyłbyś swoje miesięczne rachunki.
english: If you saved water, you'd lower your monthly bills.
glossary: to save water/to lower your bills
translation: If you safed water you would drop your monthly bills.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie możesz dzwonić do mnie w nocy, oczekując, że odbiorę.
english: You can't call me at night expecting that I'll pick up the phone.
glossary: to call sb/at night/to expect sb to do sth
translation: You can’t call me at night expecting to pick me up.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie chcę, żeby utrzymywali mnie rodzice.
english: I don't want my parents to provide for me.
glossary: to provide for sb
translation: I don’t want my parents to support me.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Zawsze ci mówiłem, żebyś zaczęła oszczędzać pieniądze.
english: I've always told you to start saving money.
glossary: to save money/to start to do sth; to start doing sth
translation: I always told you to start saving money.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Moja córka nie zaczęłaby palić, gdyby nie była pod presją rówieśników.
english: My daughter wouldn't have started to smoke if she hadn't been under peer pressure.
glossary: to smoke/to be under peer pressure
translation: My daughter wouldn’t have started smoking if she hadn’t been under peer pressure.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Aplikowałem już na kilka stanowisk, ale nikt jeszcze do mnie nie zadzwonił.
english: I've already applied for a few positions, but no one has called me yet.
glossary: to apply for a position/to call sb
translation: I Applied to a few positions but no one called me yet.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Przeczytałem dziś rano wszystkie mejle, pijąc kawę.
english: I read all my emails today, drinking coffee.
glossary: to read emails/to drink coffee
translation: I read all the emails this morning while I was having coffee.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Kilka tygodni temu dowiedziałem się, że moja żona była już raz mężatką.
english: I found out a few weeks ago that my wife had already been married once.
glossary: to be married/to find sth out/a few weeks ago/a wife
translation: I found out a few weeks ago that my wife had already been married once.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Już miałam wychodzić, gdy pojawił się szef i powiedział, że potrzebuje, żebym została godzinę dłużej w pracy.
english: I was about to leave when my boss showed up and said he needed me to stay at work an hour longer.
glossary: to be about to do sth/to leave/to show up/to stay at work longer
translation: I had already left when my boss showed up and told me he needed me to stay one hour longer at work.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Dlaczego znów wydałeś tyle pieniędzy na niepotrzebne rzeczy?
english: Why did you spend so much money on unnecessary things again?
glossary: to spend money on sth/unnecessary things
translation: Why did you spend again so much money on unecessary things?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Moje życie się zmieniło po tym, jak zostałem zwolniony.
english: My life changed after I'd gotten fired.
glossary: a life/to change/to get fired
translation: My life changed after that I had been fired.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Czytałbym więcej książek, gdybym nie był ciągle zmęczony.
english: I would read more books if I weren't constantly tired.
glossary: to read a book/to be tired/to be constantly tired
translation: I’d read more books if I wasn’t tired all the time.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Gdybym w zeszłym roku więcej trenowała, byłabym teraz w formie.
english: If I'd worked out more last year, I'd be in shape now.
glossary: to work out/to be in shape
translation: If I had trained more last year, I’d be in shape now.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Czy jest tu ktoś zainteresowany tym tematem?
english: Is there anyone here interested in the subject?
glossary: to be interested in a subject
translation: Are there anyone interested in the subject?

name: Anna Patton
polish: O czym przeważnie pisze prasa?
english: What does the press mostly write about?
glossary: the press/to write about sth/mostly
translation: What does the press mostly write about?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Jeśli teraz nie opowiesz mi o swoim problemie, nie będę w stanie ci pomóc.
english: If you don't tell me about your problem now, I won't be able to help you.
glossary: to tell about sth/to be able to do sth/to help sb/a problem
translation: If you don’t tell me about your problem now, I won’t be able to help you.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Nieznajomy opluł mnie, kiedy przechodziłem przez ulicę.
english: A stranger spat at me when I was crossing the street.
glossary: to cross the street/a stranger/to spit at sb
translation: The stranger spat at me when I was crossing the street.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Szef zasugerował, żeby nasz zespół został dzisiaj po godzinach.
english: The boss suggested that our team work overtime today.
glossary: to suggest that.../to work overtime
translation: My boss suggested that our team work overtime.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Rodzice zasugerowali, żebym się wyprowadził. Sądzą, że powinienem dorosnąć.
english: My parents suggested that I move out. They think I should grow up.
glossary: to suggest that.../to move out/to grow up
translation: My parents suggested me to move out. They think I should grow up.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Nauczycielka zasugerowała, żebym poszła na studia.
english: My teacher suggested that I go to college.
glossary: to suggest that.../a teacher/to go to college
translation: My teacher suggested me to go to coluage.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Kogo następnie będziemy operować?
english: Who are we going to operate on next?
glossary: to operate on sb
translation: Who are we going to operate next?

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Gdybyście wystawili fakturę na czas, pieniądze byłyby już na waszym koncie.
english: If you'd issued the invoice on time, the money would already be in your bank account.
glossary: to issue an invoice/on time/in your bank account
translation: If you had made out the invoice on time, the money would be in your account.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Boję się stracić pracę.
english: I'm afraid of losing my job.
glossary: to be afraid of sth/to lose your job
translation: I'm afraid about losing my job.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Sugeruję, żebyś zrobił swoją pracę domową dzisiaj. Jutro nie będziesz miał czasu.
english: I suggest that you do your homework today. You won't have time tomorrow.
glossary: to suggest that.../to do your homework/to have time to do sth
translation: I suggest you to make your homework today. Tomorrow you won't have time for this.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Doktor nie odpowiedział, gdy go wczoraj zapytałam, czy zbadał już pacjentkę.
english: The doctor didn't answer when I asked him yesterday if he'd examined the patient yet.
glossary: a doctor/to answer a question/to examine a patient
translation: The doctor did’t reply when I asked him yesterday if he had already examined the patient.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Opowiem ci historię o okłamywaniu ludzi.
english: I'll tell you a story about lying to people.
glossary: to tell sb a story/to lie to sb
translation: I'll tell you a story about lying to people.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Gdyby nasza firma chciała być przyjazna dla środowiska, przestałaby przeprowadzać testy na zwierzętach.
english: If our company wanted to be environment-friendly, it would stop conducting tests on animals.
glossary: a company/to be environment-friendly/to conduct tests on animals
translation: If our company would like to be environmentally friendly it would stop make animal testing.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Obściskiwałeś się z moją koleżanką. Przyznaj to.
english: You made out with my friend. Admit it.
glossary: to make out with sb/to admit sth
translation: You made out with my friend. Admit it.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Muszę chronić swoje dzieci.
english: I have to protect my kids.
glossary: to protect sb/a kid
translation: I have to protect my children.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Moi znajomi jutro wpadają. Kup piwo.
english: My friends are dropping by tomorrow. Buy beer.
glossary: to drop by/a friend/to buy sth/to drink beer
translation: My friends are coming over. Buy a beer.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Nie powinieneś udawać, że mnie słuchasz.
english: You shouldn't pretend that you're listening to me.
glossary: to pretend/to listen to sb
translation: You shouldn’t play that you listen to me.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Ja piję dziś wieczorem. Ty prowadzisz.
english: I'm drinking tonight. You're driving.
glossary: to drink alcohol/to drive a car
translation: I’m drinking tonight. You will drive.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: W zeszłym roku pracowałem jako stażysta. Dużo się wtedy nauczyłem.
english: I worked as an intern last year. I learned a lot back then.
glossary: to work as an intern/to learn sth/back then
translation: I worked as an intern. I learned a lot then.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Nie mogę wejść do pokoju. Jest zamknięty.
english: I can't enter the room. It's locked.
glossary: to be locked/to enter the room
translation: I can’t enter the room. It is closed.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Będę bardziej surowy następnym razem. Obiecuję.
english: I'll be more strict next time. I promise.
glossary: to be strict/next time/to promise sth
translation: I will be more strict next time. I promise.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Chciałabym pracować jako sędzia w przyszłości.
english: I'd like to work as a judge in the future.
glossary: to work as a judge/a judge/in the future
translation: I want to work as a judge in the future.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Nie martw się. Nie wystawię cię.
english: Don't worry. I won't stand you up.
glossary: to worry/to stand sb up
translation: Don’t worry. I will not turn on you

name: Jack Russell
polish: Przygotuję się na spotkanie, jeśli będę mieć czas.
english: I'll get prepared for the meeting if I have time.
glossary: to get prepared for a meeting
translation: I’ll prepare myself for the meeting if I have time.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Na twoim miejscu nie chodziłbym spać tak późno.
english: If I were you, I wouldn't go to sleep so late.
glossary: to go to sleep late
translation: If I were you I wouldn't go to sleep that late.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Gdybyś nie popełnił tego przestępstwa, policja by cię teraz nie szukała.
english: If you hadn't committed the crime, the police wouldn't be looking for you now.
glossary: to look for sb/to commit a crime
translation: If you wouldn't have committed this crime the police aren't looking for you now.

name: Jack Russell
polish: O czym musimy porozmawiać?
english: What do we have to talk about?
glossary: to talk about sth
translation: What do we have to talk about?

name: Jack Russell
polish: Dlaczego jest tyle głosów przeciwko temu kandydatowi?
english: Why are there so many votes against the candidate?
glossary: a vote against sb/a candidate
translation: Why are there so many votes against this candidate?

name: Jack Russell
polish: Kogo spotkałeś, kiedy wychodziłeś z budynku?
english: Who did you meet when you were leaving the building?
glossary: to meet sb/to leave the building
translation: Who did you meet when you left the building?

name: Jack Russell
polish: Zrobiłaś test ciążowy?
english: Did you do a pregnancy test?
glossary: to do a pregnancy test/a pregnancy test
translation: Did you do a pregnancy test?

name: Jack Russell
polish: Dowiedziałem się wczoraj, że mój szef pracował wcześniej w agencji nieruchomości.
english: I found out yesterday that my boss had worked at a real estate agency before.
glossary: a real estate agency/to find out that.../a boss
translation: I found out yesterday that my boss worked before for a real estate agency.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Wszyscy się mnie wczoraj pytali, czy jestem zły. Nie wiem dlaczego.
english: Everybody asked me yesterday if I was mad. I don't know why.
glossary: to be mad at sb
translation: Everyone asked me yesterday if I was angry. I don’t know why.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Często podróżowaliśmy z mężem, zanim urodziło się nasze pierwsze dziecko.
english: My husband and I had often traveled before our first kid was born.
glossary: to be born/a kid/to travel/a husband
translation: My husband traveled frequently before our first child was born.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Przygotuję się na spotkanie, jeśli będę mieć czas.
english: I'll get prepared for the meeting if I have time.
glossary: to get prepared for a meeting
translation: 1.	I’ll prepare for a meeting if I have a time.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Na twoim miejscu nie chodziłbym spać tak późno.
english: If I were you, I wouldn't go to sleep so late.
glossary: to go to sleep late
translation: 2.	If I were you I wouldn’t go to sleep so late.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Gdybyś nie popełnił tego przestępstwa, policja by cię teraz nie szukała.
english: If you hadn't committed the crime, the police wouldn't be looking for you now.
glossary: to look for sb/to commit a crime
translation: 3.	If you didn’t commit a crime, police wouldn’t find you now.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: O czym musimy porozmawiać?
english: What do we have to talk about?
glossary: to talk about sth
translation: 4.	What we have to talk about?

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Dlaczego jest tyle głosów przeciwko temu kandydatowi?
english: Why are there so many votes against the candidate?
glossary: a vote against sb/a candidate
translation: 5.	Why are  there so many votes against this candidate?

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Kogo spotkałeś, kiedy wychodziłeś z budynku?
english: Who did you meet when you were leaving the building?
glossary: to meet sb/to leave the building
translation: 6.	Who did you meet when you left the building?

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Zrobiłaś test ciążowy?
english: Did you do a pregnancy test?
glossary: to do a pregnancy test/a pregnancy test
translation: 7.	Have you done your pregnancy test?

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Dowiedziałem się wczoraj, że mój szef pracował wcześniej w agencji nieruchomości.
english: I found out yesterday that my boss had worked at a real estate agency before.
glossary: a real estate agency/to find out that.../a boss
translation: 8.	I found out yesterday that my boss worked in real estate agency earlier.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Wszyscy się mnie wczoraj pytali, czy jestem zły. Nie wiem dlaczego.
english: Everybody asked me yesterday if I was mad. I don't know why.
glossary: to be mad at sb
translation: 9.	Everyone asked me yesterday if I was angry. I don;t know why.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Często podróżowaliśmy z mężem, zanim urodziło się nasze pierwsze dziecko.
english: My husband and I had often traveled before our first kid was born.
glossary: to be born/a kid/to travel/a husband
translation: 10.	My husband and I traveled frequently, before our first child was born.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Zwolnię cię. Zobaczysz.
english: I'll fire you. You'll see.
glossary: to fire sb/to see sth
translation: 1. I will fire you. You will see.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Dostaniesz awans. Cieszysz się?
english: You'll get promoted. Are you happy?
glossary: to get promoted/to be happy about sth
translation: 2. You will be promoted. Do you enjoy?

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Jutro omawiamy bieżące problemy na spotkaniu.
english: We're discussing the current problems at the meeting tomorrow.
glossary: to discuss sth/the current problems/at the meeting
translation: 3. Tomorrow we are discussing the current issues in a meeting.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Jutro zamawiamy jedzenie.
english: We're ordering food tomorrow.
glossary: to order food
translation: 4. Tomorrow we are ordering a pizza.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Wybrałam właściwego nauczyciela.
english: I chose the right teacher.
glossary: a teacher/to choose sth/the right teacher
translation: 5. I chose the right teacher.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Wczoraj zamówiłam pizzę.
english: I ordered a pizza yesterday.
glossary: to order a pizza
translation: 6. Yesterday I ordered a pizza.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Muszę wyjaśnić sytuację.
english: I have to explain the situation.
glossary: to explain the situation
translation: 7. I have to explain the situation.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Powinnaś zadzwonić do swoich rodziców.
english: You should call your parents.
glossary: a parent/to call sb
translation: 8. You should call to your parents.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Nie możesz mnie okłamywać.
english: You can't lie to me.
glossary: to lie to sb
translation: 9. You can't lie to me.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Nie powinnaś wierzyć swojemu mężowi.
english: You shouldn't believe your husband.
glossary: to believe sb
translation: 10. You shouldn't believe your husband.

name: Martin Riley
polish: Nie będziesz musiała mnie odbierać jutro ze szkoły, bo śpię u koleżanki.
english: You won't have to pick me up from school tomorrow because I'm sleeping at my friend's.
glossary: to pick sb up from school/to sleep at your friend's
translation: 1. You won't have to pick me up from school, because I sleep at my friend's house.

name: Martin Riley
polish: Myślałem, że zjemy dzisiaj na mieście.
english: I thought we'd eat out today.
glossary: to eat out
translation: 2. I thought we're eating out today.

name: Martin Riley
polish: Mogłem wczoraj wydać mniej pieniędzy.
english: I could've spent less money yesterday.
glossary: to spend money on sth
translation: 3. I could spend less money yesterday.

name: Martin Riley
polish: Nie ma nikogo w domu. Dlatego jest tak cicho.
english: There's no one at home. That's why it's so silent.
glossary: to be at home/to be silent
translation: 4. Nobody's home. That's why it's so quiet.

name: Martin Riley
polish: Nie wiem, co powinienem odpowiedzieć.
english: I don't know what I should answer.
glossary: to answer a question
translation: 5.I don't know how I should respond.

name: Martin Riley
polish: Byłem pewny, że zrobisz swoją pracę domową.
english: I was sure you'd do your homework.
glossary: to do your homework
translation: 6. I was sure you're doing your homework.

name: Martin Riley
polish: W zeszłym roku nie pojechałem na wakacje, ponieważ nie miałem pieniędzy.
english: I didn't go on vacation last year because I didn't have any money.
glossary: to go on vacation/to have no money
translation: 7. I didn't go on holidays last year, because I had no money.

name: Martin Riley
polish: Zawsze znajdę dla ciebie czas, bo jesteś dla mnie ważna.
english: I'll always find time for you because you're important to me.
glossary: to find time for sb/to be important to sb
translation: 8. I'll always find some time for you, because you are important to me.

name: Martin Riley
polish: Nie mogę się skupić, gdy jest tak głośno.
english: I can't focus when it's so loud.
glossary: to focus on sth/to be loud
translation: 9.I can't focus when it's so loud.

name: Martin Riley
polish: Gramy jutro mecz. Dołączysz do nas?
english: We're playing a match tomorrow. Will you join us?
glossary: to play a match/to join sb
translation: 10. We play a game tommorow. Will you join us?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Pojawiłabym się, gdybyś potwierdził wcześniej spotkanie.
english: I would've showed up if you'd confirmed the meeting earlier.
glossary: to show up/to confirm a meeting
translation: I would have shown up if you had confirmed the meeting earlier.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Zaoszczędziłbyś trochę pieniędzy, gdybyś pił kranówkę.
english: You'd save some money if you drank tap water.
glossary: to drink tap water/to save some money
translation: You would have saved some money if you had drunk tap water.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Jakie są opcje?
english: What options are there?
glossary: an option
translation: What options are there?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Będziesz miał szlaban, jeśli nie wrócisz na czas do domu.
english: You'll be grounded if you don't come back home on time.
glossary: on time/to come back home/to be grounded
translation: You will be grounded if you don’t come back home on time.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Kiedy zdałaś sobie sprawę, że zostałaś oszukana?
english: When did you realize you'd been cheated?
glossary: to realize sth/to cheat sb
translation: When did you realize that you have been cheated?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Nie zjedliśmy wczoraj kolacji w restauracji, ponieważ mój mąż zapomniał zarezerwować stolik.
english: We didn't have dinner at the restaurant yesterday because my husband had forgotten to book a table.
glossary: to forget to do sth/to book a table/a husband/to eat dinner; to have dinner/at the restaurant
translation: We didn’t eat dinner at the restaurant yesterday because my husband had forgotten to book a table.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Dlaczego jeszcze nie zrobiłeś przelewu?
english: Why haven't you made the transfer yet?
glossary: to make a transfer
translation: Why haven’t you made a money transfer yet?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Na kogo masz zamiar głosować?
english: Who are you going to vote for?
glossary: to vote for sb/to be going to do sth
translation: Who are you going to vote for?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Kiedy zgłosił pan zdarzenie?
english: When did you report the incident?
glossary: an incident/to report sth
translation: When did you report an event?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Wczoraj marzyłam tylko o zrobieniu sobie drzemki.
english: I only dreamed of taking a nap yesterday.
glossary: to take a nap/to dream of sth
translation: Yesterday, I was dreaming about taking a nap only.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Słyszałam wczoraj, że wygrałeś zawody.
english: I heard yesterday that you'd won a competition.
glossary: to win a competition
translation: I heard yesterday that you won the competition.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Jest jeszcze kilka wiadomości, na które muszę odpowiedzieć.
english: There are still a few messages I have to reply to.
glossary: to reply to a message
translation: There are a few messages yet that I have to reply to.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Kiedy dotarłem do domu, żona już wyszła.
english: When I got home, my wife had already left.
glossary: to leave/to get home/a wife
translation: When I got home, my wife had left already.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Czy jest coś, co powinienem wiedzieć, zanim wykonam ten telefon?
english: Is there anything I should know before making the call?
glossary: to make a call/to know sth
translation: Is there anything that I should know before I make a call?

name: Martin Vance
polish: O czym była twoje ostatnia książka?
english: What was your last book about?
glossary: a book about sth
translation: What your last book was about?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Policja by nas nie aresztowała, gdybyś nie zachowywał się podejrzanie.
english: The police wouldn't have arrested us if you hadn't behaved suspiciously.
glossary: to behave suspiciously/to arrest sb/the police
translation: The police haven’t would arrest us if you hadn’t behaved suspiciously.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Będzie mi przykro, jeśli ze mną nie zatańczysz.
english: I'll be sorry if you don't dance with me.
glossary: to dance with sb/to be sorry
translation: I will be upset if you don’t dance with me.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Chciałbym porozmawiać z tobą o odchudzaniu się.
english: I'd like to talk to you about losing weight.
glossary: to lose weight/I'd like to.../to talk about sth
translation: I would like to talk with you about losing weight.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Jeszcze nie potwierdziłem spotkania.
english: I haven't confirmed the meeting yet.
glossary: to confirm a meeting
translation: I haven’t confirmed the meeting yet.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Moi rodzice nie mieliby nic przeciwko naszemu związkowi, gdybyś miał stały dochód.
english: My parents wouldn't have anything against our relationship if you had a steady income.
glossary: to have a steady income/to have nothing against sth/a parent/a relationship
translation: My parents would have nothing against our relationship if you had a steady income.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Kiedy ostatnio się widziałyśmy, moja najlepsza przyjaciółka powiedziała mi, że zerwie ze swoim chłopakiem
english: The last time we met, my best friend told me she'd break up with her boyfriend.
glossary: your best friend/to break up with sb/a boyfriend
translation: When we met last time, my best friend told me that she would break up with her boyfriend.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Nie sądzę, że przyzwyczaję się do noszenia sukienek. Czuję, że za bardzo się wyróżniam.
english: I don't think I'll get used to wearing dresses. I feel I stand out too much.
glossary: to stand out/to wear a dress
translation: I don’t think that I will get used to wearing dresses. I feel that I stand out too much.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Może podjęłabyś lepszą decyzję, gdybyś rozważyła wszystkie czynniki.
english: Maybe you would've made a better decision if you'd weighed up all the factors.
glossary: to weigh up factors/to make a decision
translation: Perhaps you would have made a better decision if you had weighed up all the factors.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Obudź się! Nie słyszysz, że właśnie zadzwonił budzik?
english: Wake up! Can't you hear the alarm has just gone off?
glossary: to go off/to set an alarm/to wake up/to hear sth
translation: Wake up! Aren’t you hearing that the alarm has gone off already?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Spotkanie ciągnęło się jeszcze przez godzinę po tym, jak wyszedłeś.
english: The meeting still dragged on for an hour after you'd left.
glossary: to drag on/to leave
translation: The meeting had been dragging on an hour after you left.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Już cię raz kryłem. Nie zrobię tego ponownie.
english: I've covered up for you once. I won't do it again.
glossary: to cover up for sb
translation: I had covered up for you once already. I won’t do it again.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Przyzwyczaiłem się, że żona narzeka na pracę, kiedy poruszam ten temat.
english: I got used to my wife complaining about her job every time I bring up the subject.
glossary: to bring up a subject/to complain about your job/a wife
translation: I got used to my wife’s complaining about work when I bring up this subject.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Gdybyś ograniczył palenie, byłbyś zdrowszy.
english: If you cut down on smoking, you'd be more healthy.
glossary: to cut down on smoking/to be healthy
translation: If you cut down on smoking you would be more healthy.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Zmieniłaś się. Kiedyś stawałaś w obronie swoich zasad.
english: You've changed. You used to stand up for your principles.
glossary: to stand up for your principles/to change
translation: You changed. You used to stand up for your principles.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Ostatnio musiałem odwołać tyle spotkań, że moi klienci zaczynają narzekać.
english: I've recently had to call off so many meetings that my clients are starting to complain.
glossary: to call off a meeting/to complain about sth/to start to do sth; to begin to do sth/a client
translation: Recently, I had to call off so many meetings that my clients are starting to complain.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Jeśli teraz pozbędziesz się formalności, zaoszczędzisz dużo czasu.
english: If you do away with formalities now, you'll save a lot of time.
glossary: to do away with formalities/to save time
translation: If you do away with formalities now, you will save a lot of time.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Gdybyś nie dała kosza swojemu dziwnemu koledze z pracy, byłabyś teraz w toksycznej relacji.
english: If you hadn't turned your weird colleague down, you would be in a toxic relationship now.
glossary: to turn sb down/to be in a toxic relationship
translation: If you hadn’t turned down your weird colleague, you would have been in a toxic relationship now.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Kiedyś skarżyłem na moich kolegów za każdym razem, kiedy zrobili coś złego, ale wyluzowałem.
english: I used to tell on my friends every time they did something wrong, but I chilled out.
glossary: to tell on sb/to chill out/to do sth wrong/a friend
translation: I used to tell on my friends every time when they did something wrong, but I chilled out.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Gdzie jest dokument, o który cię prosiłem? Powiedziałeś, że go wydrukujesz.
english: Where's the document I asked you for? You said you'd print it out.
glossary: to print sth out/to ask sb for sth/a document
translation: Where is the document I was asking you for? You told me that you would print it out.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Jeśli wszystkie moje plany się udadzą, w końcu będę mógł rzucić tę pracę.
english: If all my plans work out, I'll finally be able to give up the job.
glossary: to work out/to be able to do sth/to give up the job
translation: If all my plans meet, I will leave the job finally.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Już wyniosłem śmieci, więc nie musisz mi o tym znów przypominać.
english: I've already taken out the garbage, so you don't have to remind me of it again.
glossary: to take out the garbage/to remind sb of sth
translation: I have taken out the garbage already, so you don’t have to remind me about it again.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Gdybyś się tyle nie wygłupiała, byłabyś traktowana poważniej.
english: If you didn't mess around so much, you would be treated more seriously.
glossary: to mess around/to treat sb seriously
translation: If you hadn’t been fooling around so much, you would have been taken more seriously.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Kiedy wróciłem ze Stanów, zorientowałem się, że podłapałem amerykański akcent.
english: When I came back from the US, I realized I'd picked up the American accent.
glossary: to pick up the American accent/to come back from the US/to realize that...
translation: When I came back from the USA, I realized that I picked up the American accent.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Ostatni pacjent wiercił się, podczas gdy przeglądałam jego dokumentację.
english: The last patient was fidgeting while I was going through his documentation.
glossary: to go through documentation/to fidget/a patient
translation: The last patient was wriggling while I was going through the documentation.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Szef wyszedł z pokoju, kiedy wciąż kończyliśmy spotkanie.
english: The boss left the room when we were still wrapping up the meeting.
glossary: a boss/to leave a room/to wrap up a meeting
translation: The boss left the room when we were still finishing the meeting.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Dam ci znać, jak już skończę pracę. Będziemy w kontakcie.
english: I'll let you know once I finish work. We'll be in touch.
glossary: to let sb know/to finish work/to be in touch
translation: I’ll let you know once I finish work. We’ll in touch.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Mam dość tego projektu, bo pracuję nad nim od kilku miesięcy.
english: I'm fed up with the project because I've been working on it for a few months.
glossary: to be fed up with sth/to work on a project
translation: I have enough of the project because I’ve been working of it for a few months.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Ostrzegałam cię, że będzie korek na autostradzie, ale nie chciałeś mnie słuchać.
english: I warned you there would be a traffic jam on the highway, but you didn't want to listen to me.
glossary: to warn sb that.../I've warned you that.../an accident/on the highway/to listen to sb
translation: I warned you there would be a traffic jam but you didn’t listen to me.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Myślę, że będziemy częściej wychodzić razem na miasto, bo przyszłym miesiącu przeprowadzam się do Warszawy.
english: I think we'll hang out together more often because I'm moving to Warsaw next month.
glossary: to go out; to hang out/to move to Warsaw/next month
translation: I think that we’ll go out more often because I’m moving Warsaw next month.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Nie powinnam była na ciebie krzyczeć. Musiałeś czuć się rozczarowany.
english: I shouldn't have shouted at you. You must've felt disappointed.
glossary: to scream at sb; to shout at sb/to feel disappointed
translation: I shouldn’t have been shout at you. You had to fell disappointed.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Przez trzy miesiące w liceum pracowałam jako kelnerka.
english: I worked as a waitress for three months in high school.
glossary: to work as a waitress/in high school
translation: I’ve been working in hight school as waitress for three months.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: W pewnym momencie wierzyłem, że wrócimy do siebie.
english: At some point, I believed we'd get back together.
glossary: At some point.../to get back together
translation: At some point I believed that we would be back together.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Jakie problemy są w twojej firmie?
english: What problems are there in your company?
glossary: a problem; an issue
translation: What problems are in your company?

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: O kim rozmawiacie?
english: Who are you talking about?
glossary: to talk about sb
translation: Who are you talking about?

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Gdzie zostawiłeś kurtkę?
english: Where did you leave your jacket?
glossary: a jacket/to leave sth
translation: Where did you leave a jacket?

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Na co się patrzysz?
english: What are you looking at?
glossary: to look at sth
translation: What are you looking at?

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Nudziło mi się wczoraj w pracy, bo nie było nic do roboty.
english: I was bored at work yesterday because there was nothing to do.
glossary: to be bored/at work/to have nothing to do
translation: I was bored at work yesterday because there was nothing to do.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Mogłaś mnie wczoraj odwiedzić, skoro byłaś w mieście.
english: You could've visited me yesterday since you were in town.
glossary: to visit sb/to be in town
translation: You could visit me yesterday if you were in town.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Obiecałaś, że zrobisz mi dzisiaj włosy.
english: You promised you'd do my hair today.
glossary: to promise sb sth; to promise to sb/to do your hair/today
translation: You promised that you would make my hair today.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Z kogo się śmiejesz?
english: Who are you laughing at?
glossary: to laugh at sb
translation: Who are you laughing at?

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Miałam nadzieję, że nie będę miała dzisiaj kaca.
english: I hoped I wouldn't have a hangover today.
glossary: to hope/to have a hangover/today
translation: I hoped that I wouldn’t have a hangover today.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Nie miałem tego na myśli. Nie powinnaś była brać tego osobiście.
english: I didn't mean it. You shouldn't have taken it personally.
glossary: to mean sth/to take sth personally
translation: I didn’t mean it. You shouldn’t take it personally.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Jestem pewien, że schudnę do lata.
english: I'm sure I'll lose weight by summer.
glossary: to be sure/to lose weight/by summer
translation: I’m sure that I’ll lose weight by summer.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Nie powinniśmy byli się kłócić. To nie miało sensu.
english: We shouldn't have argued. It didn't make sense.
glossary: to argue with sb/to make sense
translation: We shouldn’t have argued. It didn’t make sense.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Stresuję się, bo w przyszłym tygodniu jadę za granicę, a nie mówię dobrze po angielsku.
english: I'm stressed out because I'm going abroad next week and I don't speak English well.
glossary: to speak English well/to go abroad/next week
translation: I’m stressed because I’m going abroad next week and I don’t know English.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Muszę się skupić na szukaniu lepszej pracy.
english: I have to focus on looking for a better job.
glossary: to look for a job/to focus on sth
translation: I have to focus on finding a better job.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Dostaniesz grzywnę, jeśli nie zapłacisz podatku na czas.
english: You'll get a fine if you don't pay your tax on time.
glossary: to pay your tax/to get a fine
translation: You'll get a fine if you don't pay your taxes on time.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Rzuciłbym pracę, gdybym musiał pracować po godzinach.
english: I'd leave my job if I had to work overtime.
glossary: to leave your job/to work overtime
translation: I would quit my job if I have to work overtime.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Ostatnim razem, kiedy rozmawiałyśmy, mówiłaś, że potrzebujesz mojej porady.
english: The last time we talked, you said you needed my advice.
glossary: to need sb's advice/The last time we talked.../to say sth
translation: The last time we spoke, you said you needed my advice.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Kiedy ostatni raz widział pan ofiarę żywą?
english: When was the last time you saw the victim alive?
glossary: to be alive/a victim/to see sb/When was the last time...
translation: When was the last time you saw the victim alive?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Policja nie zatrzymałaby cię, gdybyś włączył światła.
english: The police wouldn't have pulled you over if you'd turned on the headlights.
glossary: to turn on the headlights/to pull sb over/the police
translation: The police wouldn't have stopped you if you had turned on the lights.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Nie spaliłam jeszcze twoich rzeczy, ale za chwilę to zrobię.
english: I haven't burned your stuff yet, but I'll do it in a moment.
glossary: to burn sth/your stuff/in a moment
translation: I haven't burned your stuff yet, but I will in a moment.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Czy jest możliwość zaparkowania samochodu przed budynkiem?
english: Is there the possibility to park a car in front of the building?
glossary: to park a car/in front of the building/a possibility to do sth
translation: Is it possible to park your car in front of the building?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Dowiedziałem się o tym fakcie po tym, jak się rozstaliśmy.
english: I found out about the fact after we'd broken up.
glossary: to find out about sth/a fact/to break up
translation: I found out about this fact after we separated.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Powiedz mi, w czym się specjalizujesz.
english: Tell me what you specialize in.
glossary: to specialize in sth
translation: Tell me what do you specialize in.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Nie powinienem był robić takiego bałaganu. Przepraszam.
english: I shouldn't have made such a mess. I'm sorry.
glossary: to make a mess
translation: 1. I shouldn't have done such a mess. I am sorry

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Jestem głodny. Mogłem zjeść śniadanie.
english: I'm hungry. I could've eaten breakfast.
glossary: to be hungry/to eat breakfast

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Mogłem biec szybciej. Zdążyłbym na pociąg.
english: I could've run faster. I would've caught the train.
glossary: to run fast/to catch the train
translation: 3. I could run faster. I would have caught the train

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Jechałeś bardzo szybko. Bałem się, że będziemy mieli wypadek.
english: You drove very fast. I was afraid we'd have an accident.
glossary: to drive/to be afraid/to have an accident
translation: 4. You were driving so fast. I was worried that we would have an accident

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Jutro jedziemy do centrum na zakupy. Chcesz coś?
english: We're going shopping downtown tomorrow. Do you want anything?
glossary: to go shopping/to go downtown
translation: 5. We are going shopping to the center tomorrow. Do you want something?

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Co się stało? Byłem pewien, że będziesz się trzymać planu.

glossary: to happen/to be sure/to stick to the plan
translation: 6. What happened? I was sure that you would stick to the plan

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Moja najlepsza przyjaciółka wychodzi za mąż w przyszłym tygodniu.
english: My best friend's getting married next week.
glossary: to get married/next week
translation: 7. My best friend is getting married next week.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Nie pracuję jutro, więc możemy jechać nad jezioro.
english: I'm not working tomorrow, so we can go to the lake.
glossary: to work/to go to the lake/tomorrow
translation: 8. I don't work tomorrow so we can go to the lake

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że się zaprzyjaźnimy.
english: I hoped we'd make friends.
glossary: to hope/to make friends
translation: 9. I hoped that we would make friends.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Ile osób jest w Twoim zespole?
english: How many people are there on your team?
glossary: on the team

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Miałeś pozbyć się wszystkich dowodów. Czy to naprawdę było takie trudne?
english: You were supposed to get rid of all the evidence. Was it really that hard?
glossary: to get rid of sth/evidence

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Na co ostatecznie zgodził się twój zespół?

glossary: to agree on sth

name: Adam Hunt

glossary: to do your homework/to end up like sb

name: Adam Hunt

english: The book makes me sleep. I need to read something more suspenseful.

name: Adam Hunt

name: Adam Hunt

glossary: to pull an all-nighter

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Moja dziewczyna zmusiła mnie do uczenia się angielskiego. Jestem jej za to wdzięczny.
english: My girlfriend made me learn English. I'm grateful to her for that.
glossary: to make sb learn English/to be grateful to sb for sth

name: Adam Hunt

english: My husband makes me feel special. He always makes sure I get what I want.
glossary: to make sb do sth

name: Adam Hunt

glossary: to care about sth/to discover sth/to motivate sb

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Za co nauczyciel cię ochrzanił?

glossary: to tell sb off/a teacher

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Policja miała się upewnić, że zostanę skazany za przestępstwo.
english: The police were supposed to make sure that I'd be convicted of the crime.
glossary: to make sure that.../to be convicted of sth

name: Adam Hunt

glossary: to learn how to do sth/to express your feelings

glossary: to change the subject/to try to do sth/to hide sth from sb

english: What issues does a victim of domestic violence have to deal with? Do you know?

english: Why did my hoodie shrink? What temperature did you wash it at?
glossary: a hoodie/to shrink/to wash sth at a temperature

glossary: to make sb do sth

name: Adam Hunt

glossary: to drink way too much/to think about your family
translation: 7.	You’re drinking too much. Think about your family.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Jak długo czekasz, aż lekarz znajdzie dla Ciebie wolne miejsce?
english: How long have you been waiting for the doctor to find a free slot for you?
glossary: to find a free slot/to wait for sb to do sth
translation: 8.	How long have you been waiting for the doctor to find a free place for you?

name: Adam Hunt

english: Why did the former president step down? Was it related to the company's financial problems?
glossary: a former president/to step down from a position/to be related to sth/to have financial problems

name: Adam Hunt

english: How do you do it? What makes you feel strong?
glossary: to make sb feel strong

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Do czego odnosi się artykuł?

glossary: to refer to sth/an article

english: Why did you let your parents spoil your kids?
glossary: to let sb do sth/to spoil your kids

glossary: to rehearse the script/to go on stage

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Zbyt często wychodzisz. To nie jest hotel.

english: How long have you been defending criminals? Don't you feel bad about it?
glossary: to defend sb/to feel bad about sth

english: I was supposed to have my hair cut in the afternoon, but it's turned out I have to pick my son from school.

english: Who do you want me to invite to the party?

glossary: to tell sb sth/at the party

name: Camille Tyner

glossary: to get sth for your birthday

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Gdzie Ty wczoraj spałeś?

glossary: to sleep

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Stresowałem się, bo bałem się, że coś pójdzie źle.

name: Monica Grimm

name: Monica Grimm

name: Monica Grimm

name: Monica Grimm

name: Monica Grimm

polish: Pasażerowie nie skończyliby w szpitalu, gdyby kierowca nie musiał ostro hamować.

name: Matt Carpenter

translation: 10. You wouldn’t have torbiel right now if you tooke your parnets serious time to time.

glossary: to graduate in Finance/to graduate in Economics/to graduate in sth

name: Matt Carpenter

english: What are you arresting me for?
glossary: to arrest sb for sth

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Moja córka nie miałaby teraz niskiej samooceny, gdyby nie była dręczona w szkole jako nastolatka.

glossary: to have low self-esteem/to be bullied/to bully sb/at school/as a teenager

english: Who should you listen to? Your friends or me?

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Na co czekasz?

glossary: to be outraged/last month/to take a bribe

name: Matt Carpenter

english: Who did our parents warn us of? Did you forget?

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Jestem słaby w słuchaniu innych.

english: The management board asked me yesterday why we'd gone over budget.
glossary: the management board/to go over budget
translation: 3. The management asked me yesterday why we get thourght the budget.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Byłbym wdzięczny, gdybyś wyświadczyła mi przysługę.
english: I'd be grateful if you did me a favor.
glossary: I'd be grateful if.../to be grateful/to do sb a favor

name: Matt Carpenter

glossary: to rely on sb/on the team

glossary: to demand that.../the school principal/to step down

name: Matt Carpenter

english: You wouldn't be in trouble now if you hadn't tried to bribe a police officer.
glossary: to be in trouble/to try to do sh/a police officer/to bribe sb
translation: 8. You wouldn't be in trouble now if you didn't try to bribe the policeman.

name: Matt Carpenter

english: I asked my attorney yesterday if he'd appealed the court's decision yet.
glossary: an attorney/to appeal the court's decision

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Z kim wczoraj wygrałeś?

glossary: to win against sb

name: Agnes Chapman

glossary: to get rid of sth/evidence

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Na co ostatecznie zgodził się twój zespół?

glossary: to agree on sth

name: Agnes Chapman

glossary: to do your homework/to end up like sb

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Książka mnie usypia. Muszę przeczytać coś bardziej trzymającego w napięciu.
english: The book makes me sleep. I need to read something more suspenseful.
glossary: to make sb sleep/to be suspenseful
translation: The book ….. me. I have to read something more……….

name: Agnes Chapman

glossary: to leak/to get your car fixed
translation: How long the oil……? You have to …….. your car to repaire.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Dlaczego zarwałeś noc? Nie mogłeś uczyć się rano?

glossary: to pull an all-nighter
translation: Why did you ….. the night? Couldn’t you study in the morning?

name: Agnes Chapman

english: My girlfriend made me learn English. I'm grateful to her for that.
glossary: to make sb learn English/to be grateful to sb for sth
translation: My girlfiend made me learn English. I’m grateful to her for that.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Mój mąż sprawia, że ​​czuję się wyjątkowo. Zawsze upewnia się, że dostaję to, czego chcę.

glossary: to make sb do sth

glossary: to care about sth/to discover sth/to motivate sb

name: Agnes Chapman

glossary: to tell sb off/a teacher

polish: Co jadłeś wczoraj na obiad?

glossary: to eat sth for lunch

glossary: to take a shower/to come up with sth/to come up with an idea

glossary: to be persistent/to prove your point/to prove sth

glossary: to remind sb sth; to remind sth to sb/to feel relieved

glossary: to be grateful/to warn sb about sth/to get a ticket

glossary: to get surprised/to move out/a wife

glossary: to stay away from sth
translation: 7.	If I don’t like something I will just stay away from it.

polish: Jeszcze nigdy nie byłam na innym kontynencie.

glossary: a continent

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Dlaczego na świecie jest tyle głodu?

name: Agnes Banks

glossary: to come back/to want sb to do sth/to make dinner

translation: 6. When did you sign up for the lecture?

english: What lectures would you like to attend?

glossary: to be done/to study for an exam/to meet sb

polish: Nie pojechałem nad jezioro, bo obawiałem się, że się przeziębię.

glossary: to go to the lake/to catch a cold/to be afraid of sth

name: Maya Cook

name: Maya Cook

name: Maya Cook

glossary: to ask for a pay-raise/to be back in the office

translation: 7.	I am starting an English course next week. I am looking forward.

name: Maya Cook

translation: 1. Today evening we are eating out.

english: You'll get promoted. Are you happy?
glossary: to get promoted/to be happy about sth

translation: 3. You should be proud of me.

glossary: to order food
translation: 4. You shouldn't forgot yourself.

name: Maddie Lin
polish: Wybrałam właściwego nauczyciela.

translation: 5 We can't to start from the beginning because we haven't time.

polish: Wczoraj zamówiłam pizzę.

glossary: to order a pizza
translation: 6. I have hope that you will do your homework.
