translation: 7. I promise that you will get a promotion next year.

name: Maddie Lin
polish: Powinnaś zadzwonić do swoich rodziców.
english: You should call your parents.
glossary: a parent/to call sb
translation: 8 We have to explain this situation.

name: Maddie Lin
polish: Nie możesz mnie okłamywać.
english: You can't lie to me.
glossary: to lie to sb
translation: 9. Tomorrow I will go shopping. Do you want to join me?

name: Maddie Lin
polish: Nie powinnaś wierzyć swojemu mężowi.
english: You shouldn't believe your husband.
glossary: to believe sb
translation: 10 My mother in law called to me yesterday.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Przepraszam. Musiałem coś pomieszać, kiedy wystawiałem dla pana fakturę.
english: I'm sorry. I must've mixed something up when making out the invoice for you.
glossary: to make out an invoice/to mix sth up/to be sorry
translation: I apologize. I had to mix something up when I was making out an invoice.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Powinnam była zwrócić się do ciebie o pomoc, kiedy jeszcze nie było za późno.
english: I should've turned to you for help when it wasn't too late yet.
glossary: to turn to sb for help
translation: I should have turned to you for help when there wasn’t too late yet.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Kiedy dotarłam na imprezę, koleżanki spytały mnie, dlaczego się nie przebrałam.
english: When I got to the party, my friends asked me why I hadn't dressed up.
glossary: to dress up/to get to a party
translation: When I had arrived at the party, my friends asked me why I didn’t get changed.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Czy ty musisz zagadywać do każdej dziewczyny, którą spotykasz?
english: Do you have to chat up every girl you meet?
glossary: to chat up a girl
translation: Do you have to chat up each girl you meet?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Chcę, żebyś w końcu przezwyciężył stres i skoncentrował się na projekcie.
english: I want you to finally get over the stress and concentrate on the project.
glossary: to get over a difficulty/to concentrate on sth/to want sb to do sth
translation: I want you to get over the stress finally and concentrate on the project.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Dlaczego znalazłeś wymówkę, zamiast powiedzieć mi, że jesteś zmęczony?
english: Why did you come up with an excuse instead of telling me you were tired?
glossary: to come up with an excuse/instead of sth/to do sth simply
translation: Why did you come up with an excuse instead of telling mi that you were tired?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Kiedy byliśmy dziećmi, mój młodszy brat mówił, że patrzę na niego z góry.
english: When we were kids, my younger brother said I looked down on him.
glossary: to look down on sb/a younger brother
translation: When we were kids, my younger brother was telling me that I looked down on him.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Dlaczego wszystko, co robisz, zawsze wychodzi?
english: Why does everything you do always work out?
glossary: to work out
translation: Why is everything you do always succeed?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Wypiłaś już herbatę? Naprawdę musimy się spieszyć.
english: Have you drunk up your tea yet? We really need to hurry up.
glossary: to drink sth up/to hurry up
translation: Have you drunk up your tea already? We really have to hurry up.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Za każdym razem, gdy czuję, że jestem obserwowana, panikuję.
english: Every time I feel that I'm being watched, I freak out.
glossary: to freak out/Every time.../to be watched
translation: Every time when I feel that I am observed I freak out.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Przebrnę przez całą tę papierkową robotę, jak tylko będę w odpowiednim nastroju.
english: I'll go through all the paperwork once I'm in the right mood.
glossary: to go through paperwork
translation: I will go through the whole paperwork once I’m in a good mood.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Kim jest ta dziewczyna, która dziś zastępuje sekretarkę menedżera? Nigdy wcześniej jej nie widziałam.
english: Who's the girl that's covering for the manager's secretary today? I've never seen her before.
glossary: to cover for sb/a secretary/a manager/to see sb
translation: Who is the girl that is covering for the manager’s secretary for today? I’ve never seen her before.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Wiem, że jesteś bombardowana nowymi informacjami, ale wyluzuj. To nie aż tak skomplikowane.
english: I know you're being bombarded with new information, but chill out. It's not that complicated.
glossary: to chill out/to be bombarded with information/to be complicated
translation: I know that you are bombarded with the news, but chill out. It’s not too complicated.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Powiedziałam szefowi, że to szkoda, że umniejszył znaczeniu moich wysiłków.
english: I told my boss it was a shame he'd played down the significance of my efforts.
glossary: to play down the significance of sth/It's a shame that.../a boss/an effort
translation: I told my boss it wasn’t good that he had played down the significance of my efforts.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Wiem, że jest późno. Dlatego postaram się zakończyć spotkanie najszybciej, jak to możliwe.
english: I know it's late. That's why I'll try to wrap the meeting up as quickly as possible.
glossary: to wrap up a meeting/to be late/as quickly as possible
translation: I know that it’s late. This is why I will try to finish the meeting as soon as possible.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Kiedy rozglądałam się po sklepie, sprzedawczyni spytała mnie, czy potrzebuję pomocy.
english: When I was looking around in the shop, the assistant asked me if I needed help.
glossary: to look around/an assistant/to need help
translation: When I was looking around the store, the seller asked me whether I needed help.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Czy wydrukowałeś wszystkie strony? Myślę, że niektórych brakuje.
english: Did you print all of the pages out? I think some of them are missing.
glossary: to print sth out/a page/to be missing
translation: Did you print out all the pages? I think some are missing.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Nie bądź tak pesymistyczna. Rozważyłaś już wszystkie możliwe opcje?
english: Don't be so pessimistic. Have you weighed up all the possible options yet?
glossary: to weigh up the options/to be pessimistic/an option/to be possible
translation: Don’t be so pessimistic. Have you weighed up all the possible options already?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Poczujesz się lepiej po treningu, kiedy się odświeżysz.
english: You'll feel better after the workout when you freshen up.
glossary: to freshen up/to feel better/a workout
translation: You will feel better after working out once you freshen up.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Mimo że mój szef wie, że nie znoszę papierkowej roboty, chce, żebym przeglądała dokumenty.
english: Although my boss knows I hate paperwork, he wants me to go over documents.
glossary: to go over a document/Although.../to hate paperwork
translation: Despite my boss knowing that I hate paperwork, he wants me to look over documents.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Nie będziesz musiała mnie odbierać jutro ze szkoły, bo śpię u koleżanki.
english: You won't have to pick me up from school tomorrow because I'm sleeping at my friend's.
glossary: to pick sb up from school/to sleep at your friend's
translation: You don't need to pick me up from school tomorrow, because I have a sleepover at my friend's house.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Myślałem, że zjemy dzisiaj na mieście.
english: I thought we'd eat out today.
glossary: to eat out
translation: I thought we would eat outside today.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Mogłem wczoraj wydać mniej pieniędzy.
english: I could've spent less money yesterday.
glossary: to spend money on sth
translation: I could spend less money yesterday.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Nie ma nikogo w domu. Dlatego jest tak cicho.
english: There's no one at home. That's why it's so silent.
glossary: to be at home/to be silent
translation: No one is home, that is why it is so quiet.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Nie wiem, co powinienem odpowiedzieć.
english: I don't know what I should answer.
glossary: to answer a question
translation: I do not know, how you should respond.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Byłem pewny, że zrobisz swoją pracę domową.
english: I was sure you'd do your homework.
glossary: to do your homework
translation: I was certain, you are doing your homework.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: W zeszłym roku nie pojechałem na wakacje, ponieważ nie miałem pieniędzy.
english: I didn't go on vacation last year because I didn't have any money.
glossary: to go on vacation/to have no money
translation: Last year I did not go on holiday, because I had been broken.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Zawsze znajdę dla ciebie czas, bo jesteś dla mnie ważna.
english: I'll always find time for you because you're important to me.
glossary: to find time for sb/to be important to sb
translation: I will always find time for you, you are important to me.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Nie mogę się skupić, gdy jest tak głośno.
english: I can't focus when it's so loud.
glossary: to focus on sth/to be loud
translation: I can not focus, when it is so noisy.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Gramy jutro mecz. Dołączysz do nas?
english: We're playing a match tomorrow. Will you join us?
glossary: to play a match/to join sb
translation: We have a game tomorrow, you should join us.

name: Nina Glover
polish: Nie będziesz musiała mnie odbierać jutro ze szkoły, bo śpię u koleżanki.
english: You won't have to pick me up from school tomorrow because I'm sleeping at my friend's.
glossary: to pick sb up from school/to sleep at your friend's
translation: 1. Nie będziesz musiała mnie odbierać jutro ze szkoły, bo śpię u koleżanki. - You won’t have to pick me up from school tomorrow because I'm sleeping at my friend’s.

name: Nina Glover
polish: Myślałem, że zjemy dzisiaj na mieście.
english: I thought we'd eat out today.
glossary: to eat out
translation: 2. Myślałem, że zjemy dzisiaj na mieście. - I thought that we will eat out today.

name: Nina Glover
polish: Mogłem wczoraj wydać mniej pieniędzy.
english: I could've spent less money yesterday.
glossary: to spend money on sth
translation: 3. Mogłem wczoraj wydać mniej pieniędzy. - I could spend less money yesterday.

name: Nina Glover
polish: Nie ma nikogo w domu. Dlatego jest tak cicho.
english: There's no one at home. That's why it's so silent.
glossary: to be at home/to be silent
translation: 4. Nie ma nikogo w domu. Dlatego jest tak cicho. - There’s nobody at home. This is why it is so quiet.

name: Nina Glover
polish: Nie wiem, co powinienem odpowiedzieć.
english: I don't know what I should answer.
glossary: to answer a question
translation: 5. Nie wiem, co powinienem odpowiedzieć. - I don’t know what I should answer.

name: Nina Glover
polish: Byłem pewny, że zrobisz swoją pracę domową.
english: I was sure you'd do your homework.
glossary: to do your homework
translation: 6. Byłem pewny, że zrobisz swoją pracę domową. - I was sure that you would do your homework.

name: Nina Glover
polish: W zeszłym roku nie pojechałem na wakacje, ponieważ nie miałem pieniędzy.
english: I didn't go on vacation last year because I didn't have any money.
glossary: to go on vacation/to have no money
translation: 7. W zeszłym roku nie pojechałem na wakacje, ponieważ nie miałem pieniędzy. - I didn’t go on vacation last year because I had no money.

name: Nina Glover
polish: Zawsze znajdę dla ciebie czas, bo jesteś dla mnie ważna.
english: I'll always find time for you because you're important to me.
glossary: to find time for sb/to be important to sb
translation: 8. Zawsze znajdę dla ciebie czas, bo jesteś dla mnie ważna. - I will always find time for you, because you are important to me.

name: Nina Glover
polish: Nie mogę się skupić, gdy jest tak głośno.
english: I can't focus when it's so loud.
glossary: to focus on sth/to be loud
translation: 9. Nie mogę się skupić, gdy jest tak głośno. - I can’t focus when it is so loud.

name: Nina Glover
polish: Gramy jutro mecz. Dołączysz do nas?
english: We're playing a match tomorrow. Will you join us?
glossary: to play a match/to join sb
translation: 10. Gramy jutro mecz. Dołączysz do nas? - We are playing a match tomorrow. Will you join us?

name: Maya Cook
polish: Co się stało? Byłam pewna, że się pobierzecie.
english: What happened? I was sure you'd get married.
glossary: to happen/to be sure/to get married
translation: 1.What happened? I was sure that you’d get married.

name: Maya Cook
polish: Mogłem napisać ten test z angielskiego w zeszłym tygodniu. Teraz nic nie pamiętam.
english: I could've taken the English test last week. I don't remember anything now.
glossary: to take an English test/to remember sth/last week
translation: 2. I could’ve done the English test last week. I remember nothing now.

name: Maya Cook
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że żona będzie w dobrym humorze.
english: I hoped my wife would be in a good mood.
glossary: to hope/a wife/to be in a good mood
translation: 3. I hoped that the wife would be in a good mood.

name: Maya Cook
polish: Chciałem powiedzieć Ci prawdę, ale bałem się, że się zdenerwujesz.
english: I wanted to tell you the truth, but I was afraid you'd get mad.
glossary: to tell sb the truth/to be afraid of sth/to get mad
translation: 4. I wanted to tell you the truth but I was afraid that you’d get angry.

name: Maya Cook
polish: Mogłam wydawać mniej pieniędzy na ubrania, bo muszę jeszcze zapłacić rachunki.
english: I could've spent less money on clothes because I still have to pay the bills.
glossary: to spend money on clothes/still/to pay the bills
translation: 5. I could’ve spent less money on clothes because I also have to pay the bills.

name: Maya Cook
polish: Nie powinieneś był tyle pić na imprezie.
english: You shouldn't have drunk so much at the party.
glossary: to drink/at the party
translation: 6. You shouldn’t have drunk so much at the party.

name: Maya Cook
polish: Nie mogę zasnąć. Nie powinienem był pić kawy tak późno.
english: I can't fall asleep. I shouldn't have drunk coffee so late.
glossary: to fall asleep/to drink coffee/late
translation: 7. I can’t fall asleep. I shouldn’t have had any coffee so late.

name: Maya Cook
polish: Pójdziemy na kawę, jak już będzie ładna pogoda.
english: We'll go for a coffee once the weather is good.
glossary: to go for a coffee/the weather
translation: 8. We’ll go for a coffee once the weather is nice.

name: Maya Cook
polish: Pójdę spać, jak już skończę czytać książkę.
english: I'll go to sleep once I finish reading the book.
glossary: to go to sleep/to finish doing sth
translation: 9. I’ll go to sleep once I finish reading the book.

name: Maya Cook
polish: Następny weekend spędzam w moim rodzinnym mieście.
english: I'm spending next weekend in my hometown.
glossary: in your hometown/to spend next weekend
translation: 10. I’m spending time in my family city next weekend.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Mam nadzięję, że wrócisz do pracy do końca miesiąca.
english: I hope you'll come back to work by the end of the month.
glossary: to come back to work/by the end of the month/I hope that...
translation: I hope you will come back to work by the end of the month.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: W pewnym momencie zauważyłam błąd.
english: At some point, I noticed a mistake.
glossary: At some point.../to notice a mistake
translation: I’ve noticed a mistake at some point.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Muszę dowiedzieć się prawdy.
english: I have to find out the truth.
glossary: to find out the truth
translation: I have to get to know the truth.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Obiecuję, że pójdę jutro do szkoły.
english: I promise I'll go to school tomorrow.
glossary: to promise sth/to go to school
translation: I promise, I will go to school tomorrow.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Pójdę na siłownię, kiedy wyzdrowieję.
english: I'll go to the gym when I get better.
glossary: to get better/to go to the gym
translation: I will go to the gym when I get well.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Przeprowadzam się w przyszłym miesiącu.
english: I'm moving next month.
glossary: to move
translation: I’m moving next month.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Nie mam czasu. Idę jutro do lekarza.
english: I don't have time. I'm going to the doctor tomorrow.
glossary: to go to the doctor
translation: I have no time. I’m going to the doctor tomorrow.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Byłem wściekły, kiedy żona mnie okłamała.
english: I was furious when my wife lied to me.
glossary: to be furious/to lie to sb
translation: I was mad when my wife lied to me.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Od roku chodzę na siłownię.
english: I've been going to the gym for a year.
glossary: to go to the gym
translation: I’ve been going to the gym for one year.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Nie możesz wychodzić z łóżka. Masz grypę.
english: You can't get out of bed. You have the flu.
glossary: to have the flu/to get out of bed
translation: You can’t get out of bed. You have the flu.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Obiecuję, że w przyszłym tygodniu odbiorę dzieci ze szkoły o czasie.
english: I promise I'll pick up the kids from school on time next week.
glossary: to promise/to pick up the kids from school/on time/next week
translation: 1. I promise to pick up the kids from school on time next week.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Jestem naprawdę zajęty, więc nie sądzę, że uda mi się spotkać z tobą po pracy.
english: I'm really busy, so I don't think I'll manage to meet you after work.
glossary: to be busy/really/to manage to do sth/to meet sb/after work
translation: 2. I’m really busy, so I don’t think I’ll be able to meet you after work.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Jesteś zazdrosny, bo ja jadę na ten wyjazd, a ty nie możesz.
english: You're jealous because I'm going on the trip and you can't.
glossary: to be jealous of sb/to go on a trip
translation: 3. You’re jealous, because I’m going on this trip and you can’t.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Spotykam się jutro z nowym klientem, więc muszę się przygotować.
english: I'm meeting a new client tomorrow, so I have to get prepared.
glossary: to meet sb/a client/to get prepared
translation: 4. I’m meeting with a new client tomorrow so I have to get prepare.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Wczoraj przypadkowo skasowałam z komputera wszystkie pliki.
english: I accidentally deleted all my files from the computer yesterday.
glossary: to do sth accidentally/to delete a file from the computer
translation: 5. I deleted accidentally all the files from a computer yesterday.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Poczułam się rozczarowana, kiedy nowy menedżer powiedział mi, że jest żonaty.
english: I felt disappointed when the new manager told me he was married.
glossary: to feel disappointed/a manager/to be married
translation: 6. I felt disappointed when the new manager told me he was married.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Myślę, że powinieneś być bardziej cierpliwy wobec swoich dzieci.
english: I think you should be more patient with your children.
glossary: to be patient with sb
translation: 7. I think you should be more patient with your kids.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Znów boli mnie głowa. Muszę iść do lekarza.
english: I have a headache again. I have to go to the doctor.
glossary: to have a headache/to go to the doctor
translation: 8. My head hurts again. I have to go to the doctor.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Nie musisz iść na randkę z tym gościem, jeśli nie chcesz.
english: You don't have to go on a date with the guy if you don't want to.
glossary: to go on a date with sb
translation: 9. You don’t have to go on a date with this guy, if you don’t want to.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Nie powinieneś jeść słodyczy. Są niezdrowe.
english: You shouldn't eat candy. It's unhealthy.
glossary: to eat candy/to be unhealthy
translation: 10. You shouldn’t eat sweets. They’re unhealthy.

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Ilu wspólników było na spotkaniu w zeszłym tygodniu?
english: How many business partners were there at the meeting last week?
glossary: a participant/a meeting/last week
translation: How many business partners were at the meeting last week?

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Do czego masz słabość?
english: What do you have a weakness for?
glossary: to have a weakness for sth
translation: What do you have a weakness for?

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Jutro jem obiad z moim szefem.
english: I'm having lunch with my boss tomorrow.
glossary: to have lunch with sb/a boss
translation: I have dinner with my boss tomorrow

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Jeśli zostanie przyznany mi ten kredyt, w końcu będę mógł przeprowadzić badanie.
english: If I'm granted the loan, I'll be finally able to conduct the study.
glossary: to be granted a loan/to be able to do sth/to conduct a study/finally
translation: If I am granted this credit, I will  be able to do the research at least.

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Piłbym częściej herbatę, gdybym lubił moich sąsiadów.
english: I'd have tea more often if I liked my neighbors.
glossary: to have tea/often/a neighbor/to like sb
translation: I would drink tea more often if I liked my neighbors.

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Trzymałbym się pierwotnego planu, gdyby sprawy nie wymknęły się spod kontroli.
english: I would've stuck to the initial plan if the things hadn't gotten out of control.
glossary: to stick to the plan/the initial plan/to get out of control
translation: I would stick the  original  plan if  things got out of control

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Nie rozumiem, dlaczego jesteś na mnie wściekły.
english: I don't understand why you're mad at me.
glossary: to understand sb/to be mad at sb
translation: I don’t understand why are you  mad on me

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Powinienem był dotrzeć na spotkanie z klientem na czas.
english: I should've gotten to the meeting with a client on time.
glossary: to get to a meeting/a meeting/a client/on time
translation: I should have arrived at the client meeting on time.

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Kiedy się widzieliśmy ostatnim razem, myślałem, że powiesz mi prawdę.
english: The last time we met, I thought you'd tell me the truth.
glossary: to meet sb/finally/to tell the truth
translation: The last time we saw each other, I thought you would tell me the truth.

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Gratulacje. Właśnie usłyszałem wieści.
english: Congratulations. I've just heard the news.
glossary: congratulations/to hear the news
translation: Congratulations. I just heard the news

name: Martin Vance
polish: Próbuję uciec od picia kawy.
english: I'm trying to escape from drinking coffee.
glossary: to drink coffee/to escape from sth
translation: I try to escape from drinking coffee.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Przed czym próbujesz mnie uchronić?
english: What are you trying to save me from?
glossary: to save sb from sth
translation: What do you try to protect me before?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Gdybym kupił te meble tydzień temu, dostałbym zniżkę.
english: If I'd bought the furniture a week ago, I would've gotten a discount.
glossary: to get a discount/to buy furniture
translation: If I had bought that furniture week ago, I would have got a discount.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Nigdy nie zamykałem drzwi na klucz, dopóki ktoś nie włamał się do mojego domu.
english: I'd never locked the door until someone broke into my house.
glossary: to break into a house/to lock the door
translation: I had never locked the door until somebody broke into my home.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Może bym ci uwierzyła, gdybyś miał dowody.
english: Maybe I'd believe you if you had evidence.
glossary: to have evidence/to believe sb
translation: Maybe I would believe you if you had evidence.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Zauważyłem wczoraj, że pracownik mnie okradł.
english: I noticed yesterday that my employee had robbed me.
glossary: to rob sb/to notice sth
translation: Yesterday, I noticed that an employee robbed me.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Dlaczego jeszcze nie dostałem podwyżki?
english: Why haven't I gotten a pay-raise yet?
glossary: to get a pay-raise
translation: Why haven’t I got a pay-raise yet?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Gdzie zaparkowałeś samochód?
english: Where did you park your car?
glossary: to park a car
translation: Where did you park your car?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Czy w okolicy jest bankomat?
english: Is there an ATM nearby?
glossary: nearby/an ATM
translation: Is there an ATM nearby?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Przeziębisz się, jeśli nie założysz czapki.
english: You'll catch a cold if you don't put on a cap.
glossary: to put on a cap/to catch a cold
translation: You will catch a cold if you don’t put on a cap.

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Co się stało? Byłam pewna, że się pobierzecie.
english: What happened? I was sure you'd get married.
glossary: to happen/to be sure/to get married

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Mogłem napisać ten test z angielskiego w zeszłym tygodniu. Teraz nic nie pamiętam.
english: I could've taken the English test last week. I don't remember anything now.
glossary: to take an English test/to remember sth/last week
translation: 2. I could write this English test last week. Now, I don’t remember anything

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że żona będzie w dobrym humorze.
english: I hoped my wife would be in a good mood.
glossary: to hope/a wife/to be in a good mood
translation: 3. I hoped that a wife will be in a good mood.

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Chciałem powiedzieć Ci prawdę, ale bałem się, że się zdenerwujesz.
english: I wanted to tell you the truth, but I was afraid you'd get mad.
glossary: to tell sb the truth/to be afraid of sth/to get mad
translation: 4. I wanted to tell you the truth, but I was afraid that you’ll get mad.

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Mogłam wydawać mniej pieniędzy na ubrania, bo muszę jeszcze zapłacić rachunki.
english: I could've spent less money on clothes because I still have to pay the bills.
glossary: to spend money on clothes/still/to pay the bills
translation: 5. I could spend less money on clothes, I have to pay the bills.

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Nie powinieneś był tyle pić na imprezie.
english: You shouldn't have drunk so much at the party.
glossary: to drink/at the party
translation: 6. You shouldn’t drink that much as the party.

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Nie mogę zasnąć. Nie powinienem był pić kawy tak późno.
english: I can't fall asleep. I shouldn't have drunk coffee so late.
glossary: to fall asleep/to drink coffee/late
translation: 7. I can’t fall asleep. I shouldn’t have coffee that late.

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Pójdziemy na kawę, jak już będzie ładna pogoda.
english: We'll go for a coffee once the weather is good.
glossary: to go for a coffee/the weather
translation: 8. We’ll go for a coffee, once the weather will be nicer.

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Pójdę spać, jak już skończę czytać książkę.
english: I'll go to sleep once I finish reading the book.
glossary: to go to sleep/to finish doing sth
translation: 9.  I’ll go to sleep as soon as I’ll finish reading the book.

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Następny weekend spędzam w moim rodzinnym mieście.
english: I'm spending next weekend in my hometown.
glossary: in your hometown/to spend next weekend
translation: 10. I’ll spend next weekend in my hometown.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Dlaczego zalegacie z czynszem? Macie problemy finansowe?
english: Why are you falling behind with the rent? Do you have financial problems?
glossary: to fall behind with the rent/to have financial problems
translation: Why do you fall behind with the rent? Do you have financial problems?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Nie chciałbym, żeby mój szef opieprzał mnie, gdy inni są wokół.
english: I wouldn't like my boss to tell me off when others are around.
glossary: a boss/to tell sb off/others/to be around
translation: I don’t want my boss to tell me off if there are other people around us.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Nie mogę się przyzwyczaić do zapinania pasów.
english: I can't get used to fastening up.
glossary: to fasten up
translation: I can’t get used to fasten your seatbelt.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Ostatnim razem, gdy rozmawialiśmy, wspominałeś, że chcesz wstąpić do wojska.
english: The last time we talked, you mentioned you wanted to go into the army.
glossary: to go into the army/to mention sth
translation: Last time, when we spoke, you mentioned that you would like to join the army.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Czy twój asystent wykonuje zadania na czas?
english: Does your assistant carry out tasks on time?
glossary: an assistant/to carry out a task/on time
translation: Does your assistant carry out tasks on time?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Gdybyś przejrzał dokumenty przed spotkaniem, nie spieprzyłbyś prezentacji.
english: If you'd looked over the documents before the meeting, you wouldn't have screwed up the presentation.
glossary: to look over documents/to screw sth up/to screw up a presentation
translation: If you had gone through the documents before the meeting, you wouldn’t have screwed up the presentation.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Kiedyś patrzyłem na ludzi z góry, ale się zmieniłem.
english: I used to look down on people, but I changed.
glossary: to look down on sb/to change
translation: I used to look down on people, but I changed.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Odświeżyłem się już. Możemy wychodzić.
english: I've already freshened up. We can leave.
glossary: to freshen up/to leave
translation: I’ve freshened up already. We can go out.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Zapytałem się szefa, dlaczego nie poruszliśmy tematu podwyżki na spotkaniu zespołu.
english: I asked my boss why we hadn't brought up the subject of a pay-raise at the team meeting.
glossary: a boss/to bring up a subject/a pay-raise/a team meeting
translation: I asked my boss why we didn’t bring up the subject of pay-raise at the team meeting.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Wiele dokumentów zebrało się na moim biurku, zanim się zorientowałam.
english: Many documents had piled up on my desk before I realized it.
glossary: to pile up/to realize sth/a document/on your desk
translation: A lot of documents were collected on my desk before I realized it.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Podejmiemy się nowego projektu, jak ten będzie gotowy.
english: We'll take on a new project once the one is ready.
glossary: to take on a project/to be ready
translation: We will take on a new project once this one is ready.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Zauważyłem błąd, kiedy przeglądałem wczoraj dane.
english: I noticed a mistake when I was going through the data.
glossary: to notice a mistake/to go through data/I've noticed that...
translation: I noticed a mistake when I was going through data yesterday.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Czy policja wytropiła już przestępcę?
english: Have the police tracked down the criminal yet?
glossary: to track down a criminal/the police
translation: Have the police tracked down the criminal already?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Powiedziałem ci, że nie będę cię krył.
english: I told you I wouldn't cover up for you.
glossary: to cover for sb
translation: I told you that I wouldn’t cover up for you.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Na twoim miejscu nie rzucałbym szkoły.
english: If I were you, I wouldn't drop out of school.
glossary: to drop out of school
translation: If I were you, I wouldn’t drop out of school.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Dlaczego zacząłeś zajmować się polityką?
english: Why did you go into politics?
glossary: to go into politics
translation: Why did you go into politics?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Jeśli nie wystawisz mi rachunku, zgłoszę to.
english: If you don't make out a bill for me, I'll report it.
glossary: to make out a bill/to report sth
translation: If you don’t make me out the bill, I will report it.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Kiedy ten pomysł został zaproponowany?
english: When was the idea put forward?
glossary: to put forward an idea
translation: When was the idea put forward?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Jestem zmęczona, bo właśnie ćwiczyłam.
english: I'm tired because I've just worked out.
glossary: to be tired/to work out
translation: I’m tired because I was just working out.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Powinnaś była odrzucić zaproszenie na ślub swojego byłego męża.
english: You should've turned down the invitation to your ex-husband's wedding.
glossary: an invitation to a wedding/to turn down an invitation/an ex-husband
translation: You should have turned down the invitation to your ex-husband's wedding.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Co się stało? Byłam pewna, że się pobierzecie.
english: What happened? I was sure you'd get married.
glossary: to happen/to be sure/to get married
translation: 1.	What happened? I was sure that you would get married.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Mogłem napisać ten test z angielskiego w zeszłym tygodniu. Teraz nic nie pamiętam.
english: I could've taken the English test last week. I don't remember anything now.
glossary: to take an English test/to remember sth/last week
translation: 2.	I could write this English test last week.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że żona będzie w dobrym humorze.
english: I hoped my wife would be in a good mood.
glossary: to hope/a wife/to be in a good mood
translation: 3.	I hoped my wife would be in a good mood.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Chciałem powiedzieć Ci prawdę, ale bałem się, że się zdenerwujesz.
english: I wanted to tell you the truth, but I was afraid you'd get mad.
glossary: to tell sb the truth/to be afraid of sth/to get mad
translation: 4.	I wanted to tell you the truth, but I was afraid that you would get mad.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Mogłam wydawać mniej pieniędzy na ubrania, bo muszę jeszcze zapłacić rachunki.
english: I could've spent less money on clothes because I still have to pay the bills.
glossary: to spend money on clothes/still/to pay the bills
translation: 5.	I could spend less money on clothes because I have to pay the bills.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Nie powinieneś był tyle pić na imprezie.
english: You shouldn't have drunk so much at the party.
glossary: to drink/at the party
translation: 6.	You shouldn’t drink so much at the party.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Nie mogę zasnąć. Nie powinienem był pić kawy tak późno.
english: I can't fall asleep. I shouldn't have drunk coffee so late.
glossary: to fall asleep/to drink coffee/late
translation: 7.	I can’t sleep. I shouldn’t drink coffee so late.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Pójdziemy na kawę, jak już będzie ładna pogoda.
english: We'll go for a coffee once the weather is good.
glossary: to go for a coffee/the weather
translation: 8.	We’ll go for a coffee, when it’s sunny.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Pójdę spać, jak już skończę czytać książkę.
english: I'll go to sleep once I finish reading the book.
glossary: to go to sleep/to finish doing sth
translation: 9.	I’ll go to sleep, when I finish reading a book.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Następny weekend spędzam w moim rodzinnym mieście.
english: I'm spending next weekend in my hometown.
glossary: in your hometown/to spend next weekend
translation: 10.	I spend next weekend at my family town.

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Jutro uczę się na egzamin, ale możemy się spotkać, jak już skończę.
english: I'm studying for an exam tomorrow, but we can meet once I'm done.
glossary: to be done/to study for an exam/to meet sb
translation: 1.	I’m study for an exam tomorrow, but we can meet once I finished.

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Nie pojechałem nad jezioro, bo obawiałem się, że się przeziębię.
english: I didn't go to the lake because I was afraid I'd catch a cold.
glossary: to go to the lake/to catch a cold/to be afraid of sth
translation: 2.	I didn’t go to the lake because I was afraid to catch a cold.

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Przeprowadzę się, jak już znajdę nową pracę.
english: I'll move once I find a new job.
glossary: to move/to find a new job
translation: 3.	I’ll move as soon as I’ll find a new job.

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Będę mieć więcej energii, jak już napiję się kawy.
english: I'll have more energy once I have some coffee.
glossary: to have energy/to have some coffee
translation: 4.	I’ll have more energy once I have coffee.

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Poproszę o podwyżkę, jak już szef będzie z powrotem w biurze.
english: I'll ask for a pay-raise once my boss is back in the office.
glossary: to ask for a pay-raise/to be back in the office
translation: 5.	I’ll ask for a pay raise once the boss will back in the office.

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Jestem podekscytowana, bo jutro widzę się ze starą znajomą.
english: I'm excited because I'm seeing an old friend of mine tomorrow.
glossary: to see sb/to be excited
translation: 6.	I’m excited, because I will see my old friend tomorrow.

name: Matthias Weber
polish: W przyszłym tygodniu zaczynam kurs angielskiego. Nie mogę się doczekać.
english: I'm starting an English course next week. I can't wait.
glossary: can't wait/to start an English course
translation: 7.	I going to start an English course next week. I can’t wait.

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Porozmawiamy, jak już będziesz gotowa.
english: We'll talk once you're ready.
glossary: to talk to sb/to be ready
translation: 8.	We will have a conversation when you’ll be ready.

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Bałem się, że przegramy sprawę przez mój błąd.
english: I was afraid we'd lose the case because of my mistake.
glossary: to be afraid of sth/to lose a case/because of you/a mistake
translation: 9.	I was afraid, that we’ll lose the case because of my mistake.

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Możemy przełożyć nasze spotkanie? Jutro przyjeżdżają moi rodzice w odwiedziny.
english: Can we put off our meeting? My parents are visiting me tomorrow.
glossary: to visit sb/to put off a meeting
translation: 10.	Can we put off our meeting? My parents coming for a visit tomorrow.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Nie mogę ci pomóc.
english: I can't help you.
glossary: to help sb to do sth
translation: I can`t help you.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Nie chciałbym przygotowywać raportów.
english: I wouldn't like to prepare reports.
glossary: to prepare a report
translation: I wouldn`t like to prepare raports.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Może spotkam się ze znajomymi po pracy.
english: Maybe I'll meet my friends after work.
glossary: to meet your friend/maybe/after work
translation: Maybe I meet friends after work.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Dam ci radę.
english: I'll give you advice.
glossary: to give sb advice
translation: I give you advice.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Nie muszę nastawiać budzika.
english: I don't have to set an alarm.
glossary: to set an alarm
translation: I don`t have to set the alarm.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Nie musiałem iść wczoraj do pracy.
english: I didn't have to go to work yesterday.
glossary: to go to work/yesterday
translation: I didn`t have to go to work yesterday.

name: Peter Kane
polish: W zeszłym tygodniu nie chciałam jechać w delegację.
english: I didn't want to go on a business trip last week.
glossary: to go on a business trip/last week
translation: I didn`t want to go to a business trip last week.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Nie powinnam pracować w międzynarodowej firmie.
english: I shouldn't work in an international company.
glossary: to work in an international company
translation: I shouldn`t work in an international company.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Może później zadzwonię do szefa.
english: Maybe I'll call my boss later.
glossary: to call your boss/later/maybe
translation: Maybe I`ll call my boss later.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Nie chcę iść teraz spać.
english: I don't want to go to sleep now.
glossary: to go to sleep/now
translation: I don`t want to go to sleep now.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Myślę, że dzisiaj będę pracował po godzinach. Co powiesz na czwartek?
english: I think I'll work overtime today. What about Thursday?
glossary: to work overtime/to meet/today/Thursday/What about.../to think
translation: I think I’ll work overtime today. What about Thursday?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Myśłałem, że zawieziesz mnie do domu. Nie chcę brać taksówki.
english: I thought you'd take me home. I don't want to take a cab.
glossary: to think/to take sb home/to take a cab
translation: I thought you took me home. I don’t want to take a cab.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Idę jutro do banku, żeby założyć konto.
english: I'm going to the bank tomorrow to open an account.
glossary: to go to the bank/to open an account/tomorrow
translation: I’m going to the bank tomorrow to set up an account.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Skup się na sprzątaniu pokoju.
english: Focus on cleaning the room.
glossary: to focus on sth/to clean a room
translation: Focus on a cleaning room.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Musisz pamiętać, że jest wyjątek do tej zasady.
english: You have to remember that there's an exception to the rule.
glossary: to remember sth/an exception to the rule
translation: You need to remember that there is an exception to the rule.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Chciałabym, żebyś wygłosił przemowę na konferencji.
english: I'd like you to give a speech at the conference.
glossary: to give a speech/at the conference
translation: I’d like you to give a speech at the conference.

name: Anna Patton
polish: W tej grupie jest za dużo ludzi. Znajdę inną.
english: There are too many people in the group. I have to find a different one.
glossary: in the group/to find sth/different
translation: There are to much people in the group. I’ll find another one.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Powinienem był od razu cię zwolnić. Nie zasługujesz, żeby tu być.
english: I should've fired you right away. You don't deserve to be here.
glossary: to fire sb/right away/to deserve sth
translation: I should’ve inmediately fired you. You don’t deserve to be here.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Kiedy zaczynasz nową pracę?
english: When are you starting the new job?
glossary: to start a new job
translation: When will you start new job?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Interesuję się gotowaniem.
english: I'm interested in cooking.
glossary: to be interested in sth/to cook sth
translation: I interested in cooking.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Kilka tygodni temu dowiedziałem się, że moja żona była już raz mężatką.
english: I found out a few weeks ago that my wife had already been married once.
glossary: to be married/to find sth out/a few weeks ago/a wife
translation: I found out a few weeks ago that my wife had been married once.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Już miałam wychodzić, gdy pojawił się szef i powiedział, że potrzebuje, żebym została godzinę dłużej w pracy.
english: I was about to leave when my boss showed up and said he needed me to stay at work an hour longer.
glossary: to be about to do sth/to leave/to show up/to stay at work longer
translation: I was about to leave when my boss showed up and said he needed me to stay an hour longer at work.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Dlaczego znów wydałeś tyle pieniędzy na niepotrzebne rzeczy?
english: Why did you spend so much money on unnecessary things again?
glossary: to spend money on sth/unnecessary things
translation: Why did you spend so much money on unnecessary things again?

name: Jack Russell
polish: Moje życie się zmieniło po tym, jak zostałem zwolniony.
english: My life changed after I'd gotten fired.
glossary: a life/to change/to get fired
translation: My life changed after I got fired.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Czytałbym więcej książek, gdybym nie był ciągle zmęczony.
english: I would read more books if I weren't constantly tired.
glossary: to read a book/to be tired/to be constantly tired
translation: I would read more books if I wasn't always tired.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Gdybym w zeszłym roku więcej trenowała, byłabym teraz w formie.
english: If I'd worked out more last year, I'd be in shape now.
glossary: to work out/to be in shape
translation: If I worded out more last year I would be in shape right now.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Czy jest tu ktoś zainteresowany tym tematem?
english: Is there anyone here interested in the subject?
glossary: to be interested in a subject
translation: Is there someone interested in this subject?

name: Jack Russell
polish: O czym przeważnie pisze prasa?
english: What does the press mostly write about?
glossary: the press/to write about sth/mostly
translation: What does the press write mostly?

name: Jack Russell
polish: Jeśli teraz nie opowiesz mi o swoim problemie, nie będę w stanie ci pomóc.
english: If you don't tell me about your problem now, I won't be able to help you.
glossary: to tell about sth/to be able to do sth/to help sb/a problem
translation: If you aren’t talking to me about your problem right now I couldn't help you.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Nieznajomy opluł mnie, kiedy przechodziłem przez ulicę.
english: A stranger spat at me when I was crossing the street.
glossary: to cross the street/a stranger/to spit at sb
translation: A stranger spat on me when I crossed the street.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Do czego odnosi się artykuł?
english: What does the article refer to?
glossary: to refer to sth/an article
translation: 1. What does the article refer to?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Dlaczego pozwoliłeś rodzicom rozpieszczać swoje dzieci?
english: Why did you let your parents spoil your kids?
glossary: to let sb do sth/to spoil your kids
translation: 2. Why are you????

name: Martin Hale
polish: Miałeś przećwiczyć scenariusz. Jak zamierzasz teraz wyjść na scenę?
english: You were supposed to rehearse the script. How are you going to go on stage now?
glossary: to rehearse the script/to go on stage
translation: 3. You are supposed to work out the script. How are you going to go on stage now?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Zbyt często wychodzisz. To nie jest hotel.
english: You're going out way too often. It's not a hotel.
glossary: to go out/to do sth way too often
translation: 4. You are leaving too often. It’s not a hotel.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Mój tata miał rozebrać te stare meble, ale nie miał czasu.
english: My dad was supposed to take this old furniture apart, but he had no time.
glossary: to take sth apart/to have no time
translation: 5. My father was supposed to take these old furniture apart but he didn’t have time.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Jak długo bronisz przestępców? Nie czujesz się z tym źle?
english: How long have you been defending criminals? Don't you feel bad about it?
glossary: to defend sb/to feel bad about sth
translation: 6. How long are you defending criminals? Don’t you feel bad about it?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Jak długo zlew jest zatkany? Powinniśmy coś z tym zrobić.
english: How long has the sink been stuck? We should do something about it.
glossary: to be stuck/to do sth about sth
translation: 7. How long ???. We should do something about it.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Po południu miałam ściąć włosy, ale okazało się, że muszę odebrać syna ze szkoły.
english: I was supposed to have my hair cut in the afternoon, but it's turned out I have to pick my son from school.
glossary: to have your hair cut/to pick sb from school
translation: 8. I was supposed to cut my hair this afternoon but it turned out that I had picked up my son from school.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Co sprawiło, że wyprowadziłeś się z miasta? Myślałem, że lubisz swoją okolicę.
english: What made you move out of town? I thought you liked your neighborhood.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to like your neighborhood
translation: 9. What made you move out of the town? I thought that you like your neighborhood.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Miałeś kosić trawnik. Kiedy zamierzasz to zrobić?

glossary: to mow the lawn

name: Adrianne Nelson

english: There's a possibility that I'll be fired.
glossary: a possibility/to fire sb

name: Adrianne Nelson

glossary: to be sure/to gain weight/to eat too little

name: Adrianne Nelson

glossary: to study sth for a test

name: Adrianne Nelson

glossary: to listen to sb/to be right

name: Adrianne Nelson

glossary: to visit sb/next month/to promise

name: Adrianne Nelson

glossary: to call sb/a wife/to be at home

name: Adrianne Nelson

glossary: to be in shock/to notice sth/in the bank account/money

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Nie ma takiej zasady.

glossary: a rule

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Spotykam się dzisiaj z jednym z moich klientów, żeby wyjaśnić sytuację.
english: I'm meeting one of my clients today to explain the situation.
glossary: to explain the situation/to meet sb/one of your clients/today

name: Adrianne Nelson

glossary: to get rid of sb/to make trouble

glossary: to call sb/many times

name: Justina Stanley

glossary: to go to a party with sb

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Nie powinnaś była składać obietnicy, jeśli wiedziałaś, że jej nie dotrzymasz.

glossary: to make a promise/to keep a promise

name: Justina Stanley

name: Justina Stanley

glossary: to trust sb/for a long time

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Możemy porozmawiać, bo nie ma tu nikogo.

name: Justina Stanley

name: Justina Stanley

name: Justina Stanley

polish: Ilu wspólników było na spotkaniu w zeszłym tygodniu?

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Do czego masz słabość?

glossary: to have a weakness for sth

polish: Jutro jem obiad z moim szefem.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Jeśli zostanie przyznany mi ten kredyt, w końcu będę mógł przeprowadzić badanie.

glossary: to be granted a loan/to be able to do sth/to conduct a study/finally

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Piłbym częściej herbatę, gdybym lubił moich sąsiadów.

glossary: to have tea/often/a neighbor/to like sb

name: Alexandra Lee

glossary: to understand sb/to be mad at sb

name: Alexandra Lee

name: Alexandra Lee

glossary: to meet sb/finally/to tell the truth

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Gratulacje. Właśnie usłyszałem wieści.

glossary: congratulations/to hear the news

name: Anette Gray
polish: Zasnąłbyś wczoraj bez problemu, gdybyś nie oglądał wcześniej horroru.

glossary: to fall asleep/without a problem/to watch a horror
translation: You would’ve felt asleep if you hadn’t watched a horror movie before.

name: Anette Gray

name: Anette Gray

glossary: to come up with an idea/to help sb do sth

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie kłócilibyście się codziennie, gdyby twój mąż nie był taki uparty.

name: Anette Gray

glossary: to get promoted/to be happy about sth

glossary: to discuss sth/the current problems/at the meeting

name: Monica Grimm

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Wybrałam właściwego nauczyciela.

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Wczoraj zamówiłam pizzę.

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Muszę wyjaśnić sytuację.

glossary: to explain the situation
translation: 7. I have to explain the situation

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Powinnaś zadzwonić do swoich rodziców.

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Nie możesz mnie okłamywać.

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Nie powinnaś wierzyć swojemu mężowi.

glossary: to react to sth/like that/to explain sth to sb

glossary: to talk to sb over the phone

glossary: to spend time with sb/the rest of your life

glossary: to hold a grudge against sb/to ridicule sb/in front of your friends

glossary: the company's owner/to do time; to serve a sentence

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Nie byłbyś teraz przepracowany, gdybyś odpoczywał w weekendy.
english: You wouldn't be overworked now if you took a rest on weekends.
glossary: to be overworked/to take a rest/on weekends

english: The landlord asked me yesterday if I'd made the transfer yet.

glossary: to suffer from sth/an aunt

glossary: a professor/the other day/to write an essay

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Gdyby tylko nie było dzisiaj korków.
english: I wish there was no traffic jam today.
glossary: I wish that...; If only.../a traffic jam
translation: 9. If only would’t be a trafic Jam today.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Ciotka się mnie pytała, czy skończyłam już studia.
english: My aunt asked me if I'd graduated from college yet.
glossary: an aunt/to graduate from college
translation: 10. My aount asked me if I finished my college.

name: Kate Long
polish: Ilu wspólników było na spotkaniu w zeszłym tygodniu?
english: How many business partners were there at the meeting last week?
glossary: a participant/a meeting/last week
translation: 1.	How many business partners were there at the meeting last time?

name: Kate Long
polish: Do czego masz słabość?
english: What do you have a weakness for?
glossary: to have a weakness for sth
translation: 2.	What do you have a weakness for?

name: Kate Long
polish: Jutro jem obiad z moim szefem.
english: I'm having lunch with my boss tomorrow.
glossary: to have lunch with sb/a boss
translation: 3.	I’m eating lunch with my boss tomorrow.

name: Kate Long
polish: Jeśli zostanie przyznany mi ten kredyt, w końcu będę mógł przeprowadzić badanie.
english: If I'm granted the loan, I'll be finally able to conduct the study.
glossary: to be granted a loan/to be able to do sth/to conduct a study/finally
translation: 4.	If I granted a loan, I’ll conduct a study finally.

name: Kate Long
polish: Piłbym częściej herbatę, gdybym lubił moich sąsiadów.
english: I'd have tea more often if I liked my neighbors.
glossary: to have tea/often/a neighbor/to like sb
translation: 5.	If I like my neighbors, I’ll drink more often tea.

name: Kate Long
polish: Trzymałbym się pierwotnego planu, gdyby sprawy nie wymknęły się spod kontroli.
english: I would've stuck to the initial plan if the things hadn't gotten out of control.
glossary: to stick to the plan/the initial plan/to get out of control
translation: 6.	If cases don’t get out of my control, I’ll stick to the initial plan.

name: Kate Long
polish: Nie rozumiem, dlaczego jesteś na mnie wściekły.
english: I don't understand why you're mad at me.
glossary: to understand sb/to be mad at sb
translation: 7.	I don’t understand why you’re mad at me.

name: Kate Long
polish: Powinienem był dotrzeć na spotkanie z klientem na czas.
english: I should've gotten to the meeting with a client on time.
glossary: to get to a meeting/a meeting/a client/on time
translation: 8.	I should’ve gotten to a meeting with a client on time.

name: Kate Long
polish: Kiedy się widzieliśmy ostatnim razem, myślałem, że powiesz mi prawdę.
english: The last time we met, I thought you'd tell me the truth.
glossary: to meet sb/finally/to tell the truth
translation: 9.	When we saw last time, I thought you’d tell me the truth.

name: Kate Long
polish: Gratulacje. Właśnie usłyszałem wieści.
english: Congratulations. I've just heard the news.
glossary: congratulations/to hear the news
translation: 10.	Congratulations. I’ve just heard the news.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Masz czas, żeby porozmawiać?
english: Do you have time to talk?
glossary: to talk/to have time
translation: 1. Do you have time to talk?

name: Eve Miles
polish: Gdzie gracie jutro mecz?
english: Where are you playing the match tomorrow?
glossary: to play a match
translation: 2. Where are you playing the match tomorrow?

name: Eve Miles
polish: Spotykamy się w weekend?
english: Are we meeting on the weekend?
glossary: to meet/on the weekend
translation: 3. Are we meeting at the weekend?

name: Eve Miles
polish: Jest wiele opcji, które możesz wybrać.
english: There are many options you can choose.
glossary: an option/to choose an option
translation: 4. There are many options that you can choose.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Dlaczego ty śpisz? Jest tyle do zrobienia.
english: Why are you sleeping? There's so much to do.
glossary: to sleep
translation: 5. Why are you sleeping? There is so much to do.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Miałem wczoraj kaca.
english: I had a hangover yesterday.
glossary: to have a hangover
translation: 6. I had a hangover yesterday.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Myślę, że zostanę dzisiaj w domu.
english: I think I'll stay at home today.
glossary: to stay at home
translation: 7. I think I'll stay home today.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Kiedy zmieniłeś zdanie?
english: When did you change your mind?
glossary: to change your mind
translation: 8. When did you change your mind?

name: Eve Miles
polish: Co planujesz jutro robić?
english: What are you planning to do tomorrow?
glossary: to plan to do sth
translation: 9. What are you planning to do tomorrow?

name: Eve Miles
polish: Często byłem nawalony, kiedy byłem młodszy.
english: I was often wasted when I was younger.
glossary: to be wasted/...when I was younger
translation: 10. I was often wasted when I was younger.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Obiecuję, że w przyszłym tygodniu odbiorę dzieci ze szkoły o czasie.
english: I promise I'll pick up the kids from school on time next week.
glossary: to promise/to pick up the kids from school/on time/next week
translation: 1. I promise, I will pick up children from school next week.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Jestem naprawdę zajęty, więc nie sądzę, że uda mi się spotkać z tobą po pracy.
english: I'm really busy, so I don't think I'll manage to meet you after work.
glossary: to be busy/really/to manage to do sth/to meet sb/after work
translation: 2. I'm really busy so I don't think I'll be able to meet you after work.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Jesteś zazdrosny, bo ja jadę na ten wyjazd, a ty nie możesz.
english: You're jealous because I'm going on the trip and you can't.
glossary: to be jealous of sb/to go on a trip
translation: 3. You're jealous because I go on this trip and you can't.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Spotykam się jutro z nowym klientem, więc muszę się przygotować.
english: I'm meeting a new client tomorrow, so I have to get prepared.
glossary: to meet sb/a client/to get prepared
translation: 4. I'm meeting with a new Client tomorrow, so I need to prepare.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Wczoraj przypadkowo skasowałam z komputera wszystkie pliki.
english: I accidentally deleted all my files from the computer yesterday.
glossary: to do sth accidentally/to delete a file from the computer
translation: 5. Yesterday I accidentally deleted all files from my computer.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Poczułam się rozczarowana, kiedy nowy menedżer powiedział mi, że jest żonaty.
english: I felt disappointed when the new manager told me he was married.
glossary: to feel disappointed/a manager/to be married
translation: 6. I felt disappointed when the new manager told me he was married.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Myślę, że powinieneś być bardziej cierpliwy wobec swoich dzieci.
english: I think you should be more patient with your children.
glossary: to be patient with sb
translation: 7. I think you should be more patient with your children.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Znów boli mnie głowa. Muszę iść do lekarza.
english: I have a headache again. I have to go to the doctor.
glossary: to have a headache/to go to the doctor
translation: 8. My head hurts me again. I have to go to a doctor.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Nie musisz iść na randkę z tym gościem, jeśli nie chcesz.
english: You don't have to go on a date with the guy if you don't want to.
glossary: to go on a date with sb
translation: 9. You don't have to date with this guy if you don't want to.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Nie powinieneś jeść słodyczy. Są niezdrowe.
english: You shouldn't eat candy. It's unhealthy.
glossary: to eat candy/to be unhealthy
translation: 10. You shouldn't eat sweets. They are unhealthy.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Dziś wieczorem jemy na mieście.
english: We're eating out tonight.
glossary: to eat out/tonight
translation: 1. We're eating out tonight.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Napisała wczoraj do mnie stara znajoma.
english: An old friend of mine texted me yesterday.
glossary: to text sb/an old friend of mine
translation: 2. The old friend wrote me yesterday.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Powinnaś być ze mnie dumna.
english: You should be proud of me.
glossary: to be proud of sb
translation: 3. You should be proud of me.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Nie powinieneś się zapominać.
english: You shouldn't forget yourself.
glossary: to forget yourself
translation: 4. You shouldn't forget yourself.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Nie możemy zacząć od początku, bo nie mamy czasu.
english: We can't start over because we don't have time.
glossary: to start over/to have time
translation: 5. We can't start all over again because we don't have time.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Mam nadzieję, że nadrobisz pracę domową.
english: I hope you'll catch up on your homework.
glossary: to catch up on your homework
translation: 6. I hope, you make up your homework.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Obiecuję, że awansujesz w przyszłym roku.
english: I promise you'll get promoted next year.
glossary: to get promoted/next year
translation: 7. I promise you will be promoted next year.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Musimy wyjśnić sytuację.
english: We have to explain the situation.
glossary: to explain the situation
translation: 8. We have to explain the situation.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Jutro idę na zakupy. Chcesz do mnie dołączyć?
english: I'm going shopping tomorrow. Do you want to join me?
glossary: to go shopping/to join sb
translation: 9. I'm going shopping tomorrow. Do you want to join me?

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Dzwoniła wczoraj do mnie teściowa.
english: My mother-in-law called me yesterday.
glossary: to call sb
translation: 10. My mother-in-law called me yesterday.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Masz zapalniczkę?
english: Do you have a lighter?
glossary: a lighter
translation: 1. Do you have a lighter?

name: Eve Miles
polish: Rozważasz inne możliwości?
english: Are you considering other options?
glossary: to consider other options
translation: 2. Are you considering other options?

name: Eve Miles
polish: Obiecuję, że jutro oddam ci pieniądze.
english: I promise I'll give the money back to you tomorrow.
glossary: to give sb back the money; to give the money back to sb
translation: 3. I promise I’ll give you the money back tomorrow.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Dużo podróżowałem, kiedy byłem młodszy.
english: I traveled a lot when I was younger.
glossary: to travel/to be young/...when I was younger
translation: 4. I traveled a lot when I was younger.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Kiedy trafiłeś do szpitala?
english: When did you end up in the hospital?
glossary: to end up in the hospital
translation: 5. When did you end up in the hospital?

name: Eve Miles
polish: Pracujesz jutro z domu czy musisz iść do biura?
english: Are you working from home tomorrow or do you have to go to the office?
glossary: to work from home/to go to the office
translation: 6. Are you working from home tomorrow, or do you have to go to the office?

name: Eve Miles
polish: Od razu zadzwoniłam na policję, kiedy zauważyłam złodzieja.
english: I immediately called the police when I noticed the thief.
glossary: immediately/to call the police/to notice sth/a thief
translation: 7. I immediately called the police when I noticed the thief.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Rozstaliśmy się rok temu, a ja wciąż jestem zdruzgotany.
english: We broke up a year ago and I'm still depressed.
glossary: to break up/last year/to be depressed/still
translation: 8. We broke up a year ago and I'm still devastated.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Nie ma nic do jedzenia. Pójdziesz do sklepu?
english: There's nothing to eat. Will you go to the store?
glossary: sth to eat/to go to the store
translation: 9. There is nothing to eat. Will you go to the store?

name: Eve Miles
polish: Z kim dzisiaj wychodzisz na miasto? Znam tych ludzi?
english: Who are you going out today with? Do I know those people?
glossary: to go out/to know sb
translation: 10. Who are you going out with today? Do I know these people?

name: Eve Miles
polish: Rok temu zacząłem uczyć się angielskiego.
english: I started learning English a year ago.
glossary: to start learning English/last year
translation: 1. I started learning English a year ago.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Nie pracowałem, kiedy byłem studentem.
english: I didn't work when I was a student.
glossary: to work/a student/...when I was a student
translation: 2. I didn't work when I was a student.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Przeziębiłem się w weekend.
english: I caught a cold on the weekend.
glossary: to catch a cold/on the weekend
translation: 3. I caught a cold on the weekend.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Dlaczego nie dałeś mi znać, kiedy aresztowała cię policja?
english: Why didn't you let me know when the police arrested you?
glossary: to let sb know/the police/to arrest sb
translation: 4. Why didn't you let me know when the police arrested you?

name: Eve Miles
polish: Na biurku są jakieś dokumenty. Potrzebujesz ich?
english: There are some documents on the desk. Do you need them?
glossary: a document/on the desk/to need sth
translation: 5. There are some documents on the desk. Do you need them?

name: Eve Miles
polish: Dlaczego wyjeżdżasz? Czy coś się stało?
english: Why are you leaving? Has anything happened?
glossary: to happen/to leave
translation: 6. Why are you leaving? Did something happen?

name: Eve Miles
polish: W zeszłym roku sprzedaliśmy nasz dom i kupiliśmy mieszkanie.
english: We sold our house last year and bought an apartment.
glossary: to sell a house/to buy an apartment/last year
translation: 7. Last year we sold our house and bought an apartment.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Masz papierosa?
english: Do you have a cigarette?
glossary: a cigarette
translation: 8. Do you have a cigarette?

name: Eve Miles
polish: Gdzie jedziesz w tym roku na wakacje?
english: Where are you going on vacation this year?
glossary: to go on vacation/this year
translation: 9. Where are you going on vacation this year?

name: Eve Miles
polish: Mam nadzieję, że zrobisz dzisiaj zakupy
english: I hope you'll do the shopping today.
glossary: to do the shopping
translation: 10. I hope you will doing the shoping today.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Wynajmowałem mieszkanie z kolegą, zanim kupiłem własny dom.
english: I'd been renting an apartment with a friend before I bought my own house.
glossary: to rent an apartment/your own house/to buy a house
translation: 1.	I was renting an apartment with friend before I bought my own house.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Do kogo się uśmiechasz?
english: Who are you smiling at?
glossary: to smile at sb
translation: 2.	Who are you smiling at?

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Jeszcze tego nie przemyślałem.
english: I haven't thought it over yet.
glossary: to think sth over
translation: 3.	I haven’t thought it out yet.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Może nie byłbyś marudny, gdybyś nie siedział codziennie przed telewizorem.
english: Maybe you wouldn't be moody if you didn't sit in front of the TV every day.
glossary: to be moody/to sit in front of the TV/every day
translation: 4.	Maybe you wouldn’t be tedious if you didn’t sit in front of the TV every day.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Żona się pytała, czy zrobię kolację.
english: My wife asked me if I'd make dinner.
glossary: to make dinner
translation: 5.	My wife asked if I would make dinner?

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Rodzice się mnie pytali, czy wziąłem w końcu kredyt.
english: My parents asked me if I'd finally taken out a loan.
glossary: to take out a loan/finally
translation: 6.	My parents asked me If I had finally taken out a loan?

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Gdybyś mnie posłuchał, nie skończyłbyś w szpitalu.
english: If you'd listened to me, you wouldn't have ended up in the hospital.
glossary: to listen to sb/to end up in the hospital
translation: 7.	If you had listened to me, you wouldn’t have ended up in the hospital.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Dlaczego jest tylu ludzi, którzy żyją w ubóstwie?
english: Why are there so many people who live in poverty?
glossary: to live in poverty
translation: 8.	Why are there so many people who live in poverty?

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Kiedy się zaręczyliście?
english: When did you get engaged?
glossary: to get engaged
translation: 9.	When did you get engaged?

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Nie wygramy sprawy, jeśli nie będziesz zeznawał.
english: We won't win the case if you don't testify.
glossary: to win a case/to testify
translation: 10.	We won’t win the case if you don’t testify.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Czy nie mieliśmy wczoraj zapłacić pierwszej raty?
english: Weren't we supposed to pay the first installment yesterday?
glossary: to pay an installment
translation: Weren’t we supposed to pay the first installment yesterday?

name: Yvonne West
polish: Czy rozwiązanie sprawdziło się na dłuższą metę?
english: Did the solution work out in the long run?
glossary: to work out/in the long run
translation: Did the sollution in the long run?

name: Yvonne West
polish: Z czego wynika Twoja pasja do języków?
english: What does your passion for languages stem from?
glossary: to have a passion for sth/to stem from sth
translation: What does your passion for languages steam from?

name: Yvonne West
polish: Mój mąż zawsze chrapie. Rozważam spanie osobno.
english: My husband is always snoring. I'm considering sleeping separately.
glossary: to snore/to consider doing sth/to sleep separately
translation: My husband always snores. I’m considering sleeping separately.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Zawsze siedzisz do późna. Nie możemy pójść razem spać?
english: You're always sitting up late. Can't we go to sleep together?
glossary: to sit up late/to go to sleep together
translation: You’re always sitting up late. Can’t we go to sleep together?

name: Yvonne West
polish: Od jak dawna wynajmujesz mieszkanie swoim znajomym? Znasz ich dobrze?
english: How long have you been renting out the apartment to your friends? Do you know them well?
glossary: to rent out an apartment to sb
translation: How long have you been renting out the apartment to your friends? Do you know them well?

name: Yvonne West
polish: Nigdy nie bierzesz pod uwagę moich sugestii. Czy w ogóle zależy Ci na mojej opinii?
english: You never consider my suggestions. Do you even care about my opinion?
glossary: to consider sth/a suggestion/to care about sth
translation: You never take my suggestions into consideration. Do you even care about my opinion?

name: Yvonne West
polish: Na kogo zawsze głosuje Twoja matka?
english: Who does your mother always vote for?
glossary: to vote for sb
translation: Who does your mother always vote for?

name: Yvonne West
polish: Co sprawiło, że pomyślałeś, że kiedykolwiek mógłbym Cię zdradzić?
english: What made you think that I could ever cheat on you?
glossary: to make sb do sth/to cheat on sb
translation: What made you thought I could ever cheat on you?

name: Yvonne West
polish: Zawsze pędzisz. Może powinieneś nauczyć się jeździć.
english: You're always speeding. Maybe you should learn how to drive.
glossary: to speed/to learn how to do sth
translation: You’re always speeding. You should learn how to drive.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Nie odkryłem jeszcze swojego powołania.
english: I haven't found my vocation yet.
glossary: to find your vocation
translation: I haven't found my calling yet.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Nie musiałbyś teraz płacić za to badanie, gdybyś miał ubezpieczenie.
english: You wouldn't have to pay for the examination now if you had insurance.
glossary: to have insurance/to pay for sth/an examination
translation: You wouldn't have to pay for this test now if you had insurance.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Zauważyłem wczoraj, że sąsiedzi kupili nowy samochód.
english: I noticed yesterday that my neighbors had bought a new car.
glossary: to buy a new car/to notice sth/a neighbor
translation: I noticed yesterday that the neighbors bought a new car.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Do kogo należy ta komórka?
english: Who does the cell belong to?
glossary: to belong to sb/a cell phone
translation: Who owns this mobile phone?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Kiedy postanowiłeś, że będziesz mieszkał za granicą?
english: When did you decide you'd live abroad?
glossary: to decide that.../to live abroad
translation: When did you decide to live abroad?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Mama będzie zła, jeśli nie posprzątam pokoju.
english: My mom will be mad if I don't clean up my room.
glossary: to clean up your room/to be mad at sb/a mom
translation: Mom will be angry if I don't clean my room.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Wyszedłem już ze sklepu, kiedy zadzwoniłaś.
english: I'd already left the store when you called me.
glossary: to call sb/a store/to leave a store
translation: I had already left the store when you called.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Ile osadzonych jest obecnie w tym więzieniu?
english: How many inmates are there currently in the jail?
glossary: a jail; a prison/an inmate/currently
translation: How many prisoners are currently in this prison?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Wujek by nie utonął, gdyby nagle nie dostał skurczu.
english: My uncle wouldn't have drowned if he hadn't suddenly gotten a cramp.
glossary: to get a cramp/to drown/suddenly/an uncle
translation: Uncle wouldn't have drowned if he didn't suddenly get a cramp.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Dzięki za skończenie zadania na czas.
english: Thanks for completing the task on time.
glossary: to complete a task
translation: Thanks for finishing the task on time.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Jakich technik i narzędzi używasz, aby pozostawać zorganizowanym?
english: What techniques and tools do you use to stay organized?
glossary: to stay organized/a technique/a tool/to use sth
translation: What types of techniques and tools do you use to stay organized?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Jakie zadanie było dla ciebie zbyt trudne?
english: What assignment was too difficult for you?
glossary: to be too difficult for sb
translation: What task was to difficult for you?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Co wiesz o tej branży?
english: What do you know about this industry?
glossary: to know sth about sth
translation: What do you know about the business?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Co jest twoją największą obawą?
english: What is your greatest fear?
glossary: your greatest fear
translation: What is your biggest worry?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Dlaczego powinniśmy cie zatrudnić?
english: Why should we hire you?
glossary: to hire sb
translation: Why should we hire you?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Jaki jest Twój styl zarządzania?
english: What’s your management style?
glossary: a management style
translation: What is your management style?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Jaka jest twoje ulubione zajęcie niezwiązane z zawodem?
english: What’s your favorite non-professional activity?
glossary: a non-professional activity
translation: What is your favorite non-work activity?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Jaki był ostatni projekt, który prowadziłeś?
english: What was the last project you led?
glossary: to lead a project
translation: What was the last project you managed?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Dlaczego jesteś najlepszą osobą do tej pracy?
english: Why are you the best person for the job?
glossary: to be the best person for the job
translation: Why are you the best person for the job?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Kto wpłynął na ciebie najbardziej w twojej karierze?
english: Who has impacted you most in your career?
glossary: to impact sb
translation: Who has impacted you the most in your career?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Jaka jest różnica między kimś, kto jest świetny w swojej roli, a kimś, kto jest wybitny?
english: What’s the difference between someone who’s great in your role versus someone who’s outstanding?
glossary: to find a difference between sth and sth/to be outstanding
translation: What is the difference between someone who is fantastic in their role and someone who is excellent?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Czy jesteś skłonny się przenieść?
english: Are you willing to relocate?
glossary: to be willing to do sth/to relocate
translation: Are you willing to move?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Z czego jesteś najbardziej dumny?
english: What are you most proud of?
glossary: to be proud of sth
translation: What are you most proud of?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Czego szukasz w zakresie rozwoju kariery?
english: What are you looking for in terms of career development?
glossary: to look for sth/In terms of.../career development
translation: What are you looking for in career development?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Dlaczego odchodzisz ze swojej obecnej pracy?
english: Why are you leaving your current job?
glossary: to leave sth/your current job
translation: Why are you leaving your current job?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Jakie są cechy dobrego lidera?
english: What are the qualities of a good leader?
glossary: to be a good leader/quality
translation: What are the traits of a good leader?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Gdzie widzisz siebie za pięć lat?
english: Where do you see yourself in five years?
glossary: to see yourself in a few years
translation: Where do you see yourself in five years?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Czy możesz opisać raz, w którym twoja praca była krytykowana?
english: Can you describe a time when your work was criticized?
glossary: to describe sth/to be criticized
translation: Can you describe a time when your work was criticized?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Jakie są Twoje oczekiwania dotyczące wynagrodzenia?
english: What are your salary expectations?
glossary: salary expectations
translation: What are your salary expectations?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Jak radzisz sobie z pracą z ludźmi, którzy cię denerwują?
english: How do you handle working with people that annoy you?
glossary: to handle sth/to annoy sb
translation: How do you go about working with people who annoy you?

name: Martin Riley
polish: Pojadę na wakacje, jak już oszczędzę pieniądze.
english: I'll go on vacation once I save some money.
glossary: to go on vacation/to save some money
translation: 1. I will go on holidays, when I save some money.

name: Martin Riley
polish: Dam Ci znać, jak już skończę pracę.
english: I'll let you know once I finish work.
glossary: to let sb know/to finish work
translation: 2. I will let you know, when I finish working.

name: Martin Riley
polish: Muszę iść wcześnie spać, bo jutro robię prezentację.
english: I have to go to sleep early because I'm giving a presentation tomorrow.
glossary: to go to sleep early/to give a presentation
translation: 3. I have to go to sleep early, because I am giving a presentation tommorow.

name: Martin Riley
polish: Myślałem, że będziesz tęsknić za domem.
english: I thought you'd feel homesick.
glossary: to feel homesick
translation: 4. I thought you would miss home.

name: Martin Riley
polish: Zadzwonię do ciebie, jak już będę w domu.
english: I'll call you once I'm at home.
glossary: to call sb/to be at home
translation: 5. I will call you, when I am home.

name: Martin Riley
polish: Wyjeżdżam jutro z miasta. Zadzwonię do ciebie, jak już wrócę.
english: I'm leaving town tomorrow. I'll call you once I'm back.
glossary: once/to leave town/to call sb
translation: 6. I am leaving the city tommorow. I will call you when I am back.

name: Martin Riley
polish: Mogłem się nauczyć na test.
english: I could've studied for the test.
glossary: to study for a test
translation: 7. I could learn for a test.

name: Martin Riley
polish: Odwiozę cię do domu, jak już zjemy kolację.
english: I'll take you home once we eat dinner.
glossary: to take sb home/to eat dinner
translation: 8. I will take you home, when we finish dinner.

name: Martin Riley
polish: Oglądamy dzisiaj wieczorem mecz. Wpadnij.
english: We're watching a match tonight. Drop by.
glossary: to watch a match/to drop by
translation: 9. We are watching a match tonight. Come by.

name: Martin Riley
polish: Co powiesz na poniedziałek? W weekend zajmuję się psami mojej siostry.
english: What about Monday? I'm taking care of my sister's dogs on the weekend.
glossary: on the weekend/What about.../to take care of sth
translation: 10. What a.bout Monday? I am taking care of my sister's dogs on the weekend.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Dlaczego utrudniasz mi życie? Czy nie powinniśmy sobie pomagać?
english: Why are you making my life harder? Shouldn't we help each other?
glossary: to make sb's life harder/to help each other
translation: Why are you making my life difficult? Shouldn’t we help each other?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Wkurzyłeś mnie rano. Myślałem, że wyrzucę cię z domu.
