english: You made me mad in the morning. I thought I'd throw you out of the house.
glossary: to make sb mad/to throw sb out of the house
translation: 2.	You pissed me off in the morning. I thought that I’d through you out of my home.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Moi rodzice zmusili mnie do chodzenia na treningi piłkarskie, kiedy byłem dzieckiem. Dlatego teraz tego nienawidzę.
english: My parents made me go to soccer practice when I was a kid. That's why I hate it now.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to go to soccer practice
translation: 3.	My parents forced me to go for football trainings when I was a child. That’s why I hate it now.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Jak długo próbujesz usunąć tę plamę? Czy myślisz, że zejdzie?
english: How long have you been trying to remove the stain? Do you think it will come out?
glossary: to remove a stain/to come out
translation: 4.	Ho long have you been trying to ger rid of… Do you think it’ll come off?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Z czego zazwyczaj śmieje się twoja córka?
english: What does your daughter usually laugh at?
glossary: to laugh at sth
translation: 5.	What does your daughter usually laugh at?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Jak rzeczniczka skomentowała incydent?
english: How did the spokeswoman comment on the incident?
glossary: a spokeswoman/to comment on sth/an incident
translation: 6.	How did the spokesperson comment on the incident?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Kierownik zmusił mnie do podpisania dokumentów.
english: The director made me sign the documents.
glossary: to make sb do sth/a director
translation: 7.	The manager forced me to sign the documents.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Miałeś skomentować mój post. Zapomniałeś?
english: You were supposed to comment on my post. Did you forget?
glossary: to comment on sth/to forget about sth
translation: 8.	You were supposed to comment on my post. Did you forget?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Jakie środki podjął rząd, aby zapobiec epidemii?
english: What measures did the government take to prevent the epidemic?
glossary: to take measures to do sth/to prevent sth
translation: 9.	What did the government do to prevent the epidemic?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Zawsze się lenisz. Zabieraj swój tyłek do pracy!
english: You're always lazing around. Get your ass to work!
glossary: to laze around/to get your ass to work
translation: 10.	You’re always being lazy. Get your ass to work!

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Myślę, że odwiedzę cię w weekend, bo jutro wracam późno do domu.
english: I think I'll visit you on the weekend because I'm coming back home late tomorrow.
glossary: to visit sb/to come back home late
translation: I think I will visit you next week because I come back home tomorrow late.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Nie wychodź teraz z domu, bo jest zbyt gorąco.
english: Don't leave the house now because it's too hot.
glossary: to leave the house
translation: Do not go out right now, it is to hot outside.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Zepsułam telefon mojej mamy. Nie wiem, co powinnam teraz zrobić.
english: I broke my mom's cell phone. I don't know what I should do now.
glossary: to break a cell phone
translation: I broke my mom's cell phone, what should I do now.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Nie mogę teraz rozmawiać, bo nie mam czasu.
english: I can't talk now because I don't have time.
glossary: to talk to sb
translation: I can't talk right now, I am busy.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Kiedy wyjeżdżasz?
english: When are you leaving?
glossary: to leave
translation: When do you leave?

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Mogłem zostać w domu, bo nie ma tu nic do roboty.
english: I could've stayed at home because there's nothing to do here.
glossary: to stay at home/to have nothing to do
translation: I could stay home, there is nothing to do here?

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Gdzie byłeś? Nie mogłem cię znaleźć.
english: Where were you? I couldn't find you.
translation: Where were you, I couldn't find you.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Nie zapłaciłam rachunków w zeszłym miesiącu, bo nie miałam żadnych pieniędzy.
english: I didn't pay the bills last month because I didn't have any money.
glossary: to pay the bills
translation: I did not pay the bills last month, because I was broke.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Zawsze ci pomogę, bo jesteś siostrą mojej żony.
english: I'll always help you because you're my wife's sister.
glossary: to help sb
translation: I will always help, you are my wife's sister.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Byłam pewna, że spędzimy razem więcej czasu.
english: I was sure we'd spend more time together.
glossary: to be sure that.../to spend time with sb
translation: I was certain, that we will spend more time together.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Zwolnię cię. Zobaczysz.
english: I'll fire you. You'll see.
glossary: to fire sb/to see sth
translation: 1. I’ll fire you. You’ll see.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Dostaniesz awans. Cieszysz się?
english: You'll get promoted. Are you happy?
glossary: to get promoted/to be happy about sth
translation: 2. You’ll get a promotion. Are you happy?

name: Anna Forney
polish: Jutro omawiamy bieżące problemy na spotkaniu.
english: We're discussing the current problems at the meeting tomorrow.
glossary: to discuss sth/the current problems/at the meeting
translation: 3. Tomorrow we’re discussing a current problems in a meeting.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Jutro zamawiamy jedzenie.
english: We're ordering food tomorrow.
glossary: to order food
translation: 4. We’re ordering food tomorrow.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Wybrałam właściwego nauczyciela.
english: I chose the right teacher.
glossary: a teacher/to choose sth/the right teacher
translation: 5. I’ve chosen the right teacher.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Wczoraj zamówiłam pizzę.
english: I ordered a pizza yesterday.
glossary: to order a pizza
translation: 6. Yesterday I ordered a pizza.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Muszę wyjaśnić sytuację.
english: I have to explain the situation.
glossary: to explain the situation
translation: 7. I have to explain the situation.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Powinnaś zadzwonić do swoich rodziców.
english: You should call your parents.
glossary: a parent/to call sb
translation: 8. You should call your parents.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Nie możesz mnie okłamywać.
english: You can't lie to me.
glossary: to lie to sb
translation: 9. You can’t lie to me.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Nie powinnaś wierzyć swojemu mężowi.
english: You shouldn't believe your husband.
glossary: to believe sb
translation: 10. You shouldn’t believe your husband.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Przygotuję się na spotkanie, jeśli będę mieć czas.
english: I'll get prepared for the meeting if I have time.
glossary: to get prepared for a meeting
translation: 1. I will prepare for the meeting if I have a time.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Na twoim miejscu nie chodziłbym spać tak późno.
english: If I were you, I wouldn't go to sleep so late.
glossary: to go to sleep late
translation: 2. I I were you, I wouldn't go to sleep as late.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Gdybyś nie popełnił tego przestępstwa, policja by cię teraz nie szukała.
english: If you hadn't committed the crime, the police wouldn't be looking for you now.
glossary: to look for sb/to commit a crime
translation: 3. If you couldn't have committed this crime the police wouldn't looking for you now.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: O czym musimy porozmawiać?
english: What do we have to talk about?
glossary: to talk about sth
translation: 4. What do we have to talk about?

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Dlaczego jest tyle głosów przeciwko temu kandydatowi?
english: Why are there so many votes against the candidate?
glossary: a vote against sb/a candidate
translation: 5. Why are so many votes against the candidate?

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Kogo spotkałeś, kiedy wychodziłeś z budynku?
english: Who did you meet when you were leaving the building?
glossary: to meet sb/to leave the building
translation: 6.  Who did you meet when you left a building?

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Zrobiłaś test ciążowy?
english: Did you do a pregnancy test?
glossary: to do a pregnancy test/a pregnancy test
translation: 7. Did you do a pregnancy test?

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Dowiedziałem się wczoraj, że mój szef pracował wcześniej w agencji nieruchomości.
english: I found out yesterday that my boss had worked at a real estate agency before.
glossary: a real estate agency/to find out that.../a boss
translation: 8. I found out yesterday that my boss had previously worked in a real estate agency.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Wszyscy się mnie wczoraj pytali, czy jestem zły. Nie wiem dlaczego.
english: Everybody asked me yesterday if I was mad. I don't know why.
glossary: to be mad at sb
translation: 9. Everyone asked me yesterday if I was angry. I don't know why.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Często podróżowaliśmy z mężem, zanim urodziło się nasze pierwsze dziecko.
english: My husband and I had often traveled before our first kid was born.
glossary: to be born/a kid/to travel/a husband
translation: 10. I with my husband traveled often before the baby was born.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: W ten weekend robimy z przyjacielem parapetówkę.
english: My friend and I are throwing a housewarming party this weekend.
glossary: to throw a housewarming party/a housewarming party/a friend/this weekend
translation: 1. My friend and I are doing a housewarming party this weekend.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Nie martw się. Pomogę ci z problemem.
english: Don't worry. I'll help you with the problem.
glossary: to worry/to help sb with a problem
translation: 2. Don't worry. I will help you with the problem.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Jest ciepło na zewnątrz, więc nie musisz zakładać kurtki.
english: It's warm outside, so you don't have to put on a jacket.
glossary: warm/outside/to put on a jacket
translation: 3. It's warm outside so you don't need to wear a jacket.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: W zeszłym tygodniu poprosiłam mamę, żeby poszła ze mną na zakupy.
english: I asked my mom to go shopping with me last week.
glossary: to go shopping/last week
translation: 4. Last week, I asked my mother to go shopping with me.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Niedługo poznam dziewczynę mojego syna.
english: I'm meeting my son's girlfriend soon.
glossary: soon/to meet sb {2}/a son/a girlfriend
translation: 5. I will meet my son's girlfriend soon.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Wczoraj znalazłam korepetytora dla moich dzieci.
english: I found a private tutor for my children yesterday.
glossary: to find a private tutor/a private tutor/children
translation: 6. Yesterday I found a tutor for my children.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Obiecuję, że tym razem będę miła dla twojego męża.
english: I promise I'll be nice to your husband this time.
glossary: to be nice to sb/to promise that.../this time/a husband
translation: 7. I promise to be nice to your husband this time.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Niestety nie mogę ci polecić żadnego interesującego filmu.
english: Unfortunately, I can't recommend any interesting movie to you.
glossary: Unfortunately.../to recommend sth to sb/an interesting movie
translation: 8. Unfortunately, I can't recommend any interesting movie for you.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Musisz spróbować być mniej zazdrosna.
english: You have to try to be less jealous.
glossary: to be jealous/more or less
translation: 9. You have to try to be less jealous.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Powinieneś trenować więcej, żeby być w formie.
english: You should work out more to be in shape.
glossary: to work out/to be in shape
translation: 10. You should train more to stay in shape.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Dam ci znać, jak już skończę pracę. Będziemy w kontakcie.
english: I'll let you know once I finish work. We'll be in touch.
glossary: to let sb know/to finish work/to be in touch
translation: I will let you know once I finish my job. We will be in touch.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Mam dość tego projektu, bo pracuję nad nim od kilku miesięcy.
english: I'm fed up with the project because I've been working on it for a few months.
glossary: to be fed up with sth/to work on a project
translation: I am fed up with this project because I’ve been working on it for a few months.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Ostrzegałam cię, że będzie korek na autostradzie, ale nie chciałeś mnie słuchać.
english: I warned you there would be a traffic jam on the highway, but you didn't want to listen to me.
glossary: to warn sb that.../I've warned you that.../an accident/on the highway/to listen to sb
translation: I warned you that it would be a traffic jam on the road but you didn’t want to listen to me.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Myślę, że będziemy częściej wychodzić razem na miasto, bo przyszłym miesiącu przeprowadzam się do Warszawy.
english: I think we'll hang out together more often because I'm moving to Warsaw next month.
glossary: to go out; to hang out/to move to Warsaw/next month
translation: I think we will go out together more often because I am moving into Warsaw next month.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Nie powinnam była na ciebie krzyczeć. Musiałeś czuć się rozczarowany.
english: I shouldn't have shouted at you. You must've felt disappointed.
glossary: to scream at sb; to shout at sb/to feel disappointed
translation: I shouldn’t have shouted at you. I had to feel disappointed.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Przez trzy miesiące w liceum pracowałam jako kelnerka.
english: I worked as a waitress for three months in high school.
glossary: to work as a waitress/in high school
translation: I worked as a waitress in high school for three weeks.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: W pewnym momencie wierzyłem, że wrócimy do siebie.
english: At some point, I believed we'd get back together.
glossary: At some point.../to get back together
translation: At some point I believed that we come back to each other.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Jakie problemy są w twojej firmie?
english: What problems are there in your company?
glossary: a problem; an issue
translation: What problems are in your company ?

name: Camille Tyner
polish: O kim rozmawiacie?
english: Who are you talking about?
glossary: to talk about sb
translation: Who are you talking about.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Gdzie zostawiłeś kurtkę?
english: Where did you leave your jacket?
glossary: a jacket/to leave sth
translation: Where did you leave your jacket.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Mam nadzieję, że omówimy twoje zachowanie.
english: I hope we'll discuss your behavior.
glossary: to discuss sth/behavior
translation: 1. I hope to discuss your behavior.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Zajmuję się jutro młodszym bratem. Spotkajmy się w weekend.
english: I'm taking care of my younger brother tomorrow. Let's meet on the weekend.
glossary: to meet sb/on the weekend/to take care of sb/a younger brother
translation: 2. I am taking care of my younger brother tomorrow. Let's meet at the weekend.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Są rodzice, którzy pozwalają swoim dzieciom palić.
english: There are parents who let their kids smoke.
glossary: to smoke/a kid/to let sb do sth/a parent
translation: 3. There are some parents who let their children smoke.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Zrobiłeś wczoraj kopię zapasową plików?
english: Did you back up the files yesterday?
glossary: to back up files
translation: 4. Did you make up your files yesterday?

name: Matt Xander
polish: Dlaczego powinienem cię posłuchać?
english: Why should I listen to you?
glossary: to listen to sb
translation: 5. Why should I listen to you?

name: Matt Xander
polish: Będę zmęczona, kiedy skończę pracę.
english: I'll be tired when I finish work.
glossary: to finish work/to be tired
translation: 6. I'll be tired when I finish work.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Od zbyt dawna udajesz szczęśliwego.
english: You've been pretending to be happy for too long.
glossary: to pretend to be happy/for too long
translation: 7. You've been acting to be happy for too long.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Byłam pewna, że wyjaśnimy sytuację.
english: I was sure we'd explain the situation.
glossary: to explain the situation
translation: 8. I was sure we would clarify the situation.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Musimy się lepiej poznać.
english: We have to get to know each other better.
glossary: to get to know each other better
translation: 9. We need to get to know each other better.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Mam nadzieję, że będziesz spędzał ze mną więcej czasu.
english: I hope you'll spend more time with me.
glossary: to spend time with sb
translation: 10. I hope you will spend more time with me.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Od wczoraj czytam tę książkę.
english: I've been reading the book since yesterday.
glossary: to read a book/since yesterday
translation: 1. I have been reading this book since yesterday.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Jak możesz być tak naiwny?
english: How can you be so naive?
glossary: to be naive
translation: 2. How can you be so naive?

name: Matt Xander
polish: Miałam nadzieję, że przemyślisz swoje zachowanie.
english: I hoped you'd think over your behavior.
glossary: to think over your behavior
translation: 3. I was hoping you would rethink your behavior.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Jestem pewien, że skończysz studia.
english: I'm sure you'll graduate from college.
glossary: to graduate from college/to be sure
translation: 4. I'm sure you will graduate.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Kiedy wróciłaś do miasta?
english: When did you get back to town?
glossary: to get back to town
translation: 5. When did you return to the city?

name: Matt Xander
polish: Mam nadzieję, że mnie nie zarazisz.
english: I hope you won't infect me.
glossary: to infect sb
translation: 6. I hope you won't infect me.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Powinieneś przeczytać przynajmniej jedną książkę w miesiącu.
english: You should read at least one book a month.
glossary: to read a book/once a month/at least
translation: 7. You should read at least one book a month.

name: Matt Xander
polish: W moim biurze jest osoba, która naprawia komputery.
english: There's a person in my office who repairs computers.
glossary: to repair a computer/in your office/a person
translation: 8. There is a person in my office who fixes computers.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Twój ojciec gotuje dziś wieczorem.
english: Your dad's cooking tonight.
glossary: to cook/a dad
translation: 9. Your father is cooking tonight.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Nauczę się angielskiego, jak już zatrudnię profesjonalnego nauczyciela.
english: I'll learn English once I hire a professional teacher.
glossary: to hire sb/a professional teacher/once {2}
translation: 10. I will learn English once I hire a professional teacher.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Kilka tygodni temu dowiedziałem się, że moja żona była już raz mężatką.
english: I found out a few weeks ago that my wife had already been married once.
glossary: to be married/to find sth out/a few weeks ago/a wife
translation: 1.	A few weeks ago I found out that my wife had already been married once.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Już miałam wychodzić, gdy pojawił się szef i powiedział, że potrzebuje, żebym została godzinę dłużej w pracy.
english: I was about to leave when my boss showed up and said he needed me to stay at work an hour longer.
glossary: to be about to do sth/to leave/to show up/to stay at work longer
translation: 2.	I was about to leave when my boss appeard and said that he needed me to stay one hour longer at work.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Dlaczego znów wydałeś tyle pieniędzy na niepotrzebne rzeczy?
english: Why did you spend so much money on unnecessary things again?
glossary: to spend money on sth/unnecessary things
translation: 3.	Why did you spend so much money on unnecesary thing again?

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Moje życie się zmieniło po tym, jak zostałem zwolniony.
english: My life changed after I'd gotten fired.
glossary: a life/to change/to get fired
translation: 4.	My life changed after I had been fired.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Czytałbym więcej książek, gdybym nie był ciągle zmęczony.
english: I would read more books if I weren't constantly tired.
glossary: to read a book/to be tired/to be constantly tired
translation: 5.	I would read more books If I wasn’t constantly tired.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Gdybym w zeszłym roku więcej trenowała, byłabym teraz w formie.
english: If I'd worked out more last year, I'd be in shape now.
glossary: to work out/to be in shape
translation: 6.	If I had trained more last year I would have been in shape now.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Czy jest tu ktoś zainteresowany tym tematem?
english: Is there anyone here interested in the subject?
glossary: to be interested in a subject
translation: 7.	Is there anybody here who is interested in the topic?

name: Maddie Yates
polish: O czym przeważnie pisze prasa?
english: What does the press mostly write about?
glossary: the press/to write about sth/mostly
translation: 8.	What does the press usually write?

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Jeśli teraz nie opowiesz mi o swoim problemie, nie będę w stanie ci pomóc.
english: If you don't tell me about your problem now, I won't be able to help you.
glossary: to tell about sth/to be able to do sth/to help sb/a problem
translation: 9.	If you don’t tell me about your problem now, I won’t be able to help you.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Nieznajomy opluł mnie, kiedy przechodziłem przez ulicę.
english: A stranger spat at me when I was crossing the street.
glossary: to cross the street/a stranger/to spit at sb
translation: 10.	The stranger spat on me when I crossed the street.

name: Nina Glover
polish: Pojadę na wakacje, jak już oszczędzę pieniądze.
english: I'll go on vacation once I save some money.
glossary: to go on vacation/to save some money
translation: 1.  I’ll go on vacation when I’ve saved money.

name: Nina Glover
polish: Dam Ci znać, jak już skończę pracę.
english: I'll let you know once I finish work.
glossary: to let sb know/to finish work
translation: 2. . I’ll let you know when I’ve finished my work.

name: Nina Glover
polish: Muszę iść wcześnie spać, bo jutro robię prezentację.
english: I have to go to sleep early because I'm giving a presentation tomorrow.
glossary: to go to sleep early/to give a presentation
translation: 3. I have to go to bed early because I’m doing a presentation tomorrow.

name: Nina Glover
polish: Myślałem, że będziesz tęsknić za domem.
english: I thought you'd feel homesick.
glossary: to feel homesick
translation: 4. I thought you would be missing home

name: Nina Glover
polish: Zadzwonię do ciebie, jak już będę w domu.
english: I'll call you once I'm at home.
glossary: to call sb/to be at home
translation: 5.  I’ ll call you when I’m at home.

name: Nina Glover
polish: Wyjeżdżam jutro z miasta. Zadzwonię do ciebie, jak już wrócę.
english: I'm leaving town tomorrow. I'll call you once I'm back.
glossary: once/to leave town/to call sb
translation: 6.  I’m leaving town tomorrow. I’ll call you when I come back.

name: Nina Glover
polish: Mogłem się nauczyć na test.
english: I could've studied for the test.
glossary: to study for a test
translation: 7. I could heave learned for a test.

name: Nina Glover
polish: Odwiozę cię do domu, jak już zjemy kolację.
english: I'll take you home once we eat dinner.
glossary: to take sb home/to eat dinner
translation: 8.  I’ll drive you home after we eat dinner.

name: Nina Glover
polish: Oglądamy dzisiaj wieczorem mecz. Wpadnij.
english: We're watching a match tonight. Drop by.
glossary: to watch a match/to drop by
translation: 9. We’re watching a match tonight. Come in.

name: Nina Glover
polish: Co powiesz na poniedziałek? W weekend zajmuję się psami mojej siostry.
english: What about Monday? I'm taking care of my sister's dogs on the weekend.
glossary: on the weekend/What about.../to take care of sth
translation: 10. How about Monday? I’m taking care of my sisters dogs on the weekend.

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Możesz być z siebie dumny.
english: You can be proud of yourself.
glossary: to be proud of sb
translation: 1. You can be proud of yourself.

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Kiedy zdałeś sobie z tego sprawę?
english: When did you realize it?
glossary: to realize sth
translation: 2. When did you realize it?

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Myślę, że założę dzisiaj sukienkę.
english: I think I'll put on a dress today.
glossary: to put on a dress
translation: 3. I think I'm wearing a dress today.

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Odświężę swój angielski, kiedy będę miał więcej czasu.
english: I'll refresh my English when I have more time.
glossary: to refresh your English/to have more time
translation: 4. I will catch up my English when I have more time.

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Spotykam się dzisiaj ze znajomymi. Nie czekaj.
english: I'm meeting my friends today. Don't wait.
glossary: to meet your friends/to wait for sb
translation: 5. I'm meeting my friends today. Don't wait.

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Może wpadnę po pracy.
english: Maybe I'll drop by after work.
glossary: to drop by/after work
translation: 6. Maybe I come after work.

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Jak możesz mnie okłamywać?
english: How can you lie to me?
glossary: to lie to sb
translation: 7. How can you lie to me?

name: Sergius Birch
polish: W szkole jest wielu uczniów, którzy mają problemy.
english: There are many students at school who have problems.
glossary: to have problems/at school/a student
translation: 8. There are many students at school who have problems.

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Myślałam, że się tym zajmiesz.
english: I thought you'd take care of it.
glossary: to take care of sth
translation: 9. I thought you could in charge it.

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Od godziny robię kolację.
english: I've been making dinner for an hour.
glossary: to make dinner
translation: 10. I've been doing supper for an hour.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Co się stało? Byłam pewna, że się pobierzecie.
english: What happened? I was sure you'd get married.
glossary: to happen/to be sure/to get married
translation: What happened? I was sure you would get married.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Mogłem napisać ten test z angielskiego w zeszłym tygodniu. Teraz nic nie pamiętam.
english: I could've taken the English test last week. I don't remember anything now.
glossary: to take an English test/to remember sth/last week
translation: I could have written this English test last week. Now I don't remember anything.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że żona będzie w dobrym humorze.
english: I hoped my wife would be in a good mood.
glossary: to hope/a wife/to be in a good mood
translation: I hoped my wife would be in a good mood.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Chciałem powiedzieć Ci prawdę, ale bałem się, że się zdenerwujesz.
english: I wanted to tell you the truth, but I was afraid you'd get mad.
glossary: to tell sb the truth/to be afraid of sth/to get mad
translation: I wanted to tell you the truth, but I was afraid you would get angry.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Mogłam wydawać mniej pieniędzy na ubrania, bo muszę jeszcze zapłacić rachunki.
english: I could've spent less money on clothes because I still have to pay the bills.
glossary: to spend money on clothes/still/to pay the bills
translation: I could have spent less money on clothes, because I still have to pay the bills.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Nie powinieneś był tyle pić na imprezie.
english: You shouldn't have drunk so much at the party.
glossary: to drink/at the party
translation: You shouldn't have drunk so much at the party.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Nie mogę zasnąć. Nie powinienem był pić kawy tak późno.
english: I can't fall asleep. I shouldn't have drunk coffee so late.
glossary: to fall asleep/to drink coffee/late
translation: I can't fall asleep. I shouldn't have been drinking coffee so late.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Pójdziemy na kawę, jak już będzie ładna pogoda.
english: We'll go for a coffee once the weather is good.
glossary: to go for a coffee/the weather
translation: We will go for coffee once the weather is nice.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Pójdę spać, jak już skończę czytać książkę.
english: I'll go to sleep once I finish reading the book.
glossary: to go to sleep/to finish doing sth
translation: I'll go to bed once I finish reading the book.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Następny weekend spędzam w moim rodzinnym mieście.
english: I'm spending next weekend in my hometown.
glossary: in your hometown/to spend next weekend
translation: I'm spending the next weekend in my hometown.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Co jadłeś wczoraj na obiad?
english: What did you eat for lunch yesterday?
glossary: to eat sth for lunch
translation: What did you eat for lunch yesterday?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Dostałbym w zeszłym roku stypendium, gdybym miał lepsze oceny.
english: I would've gotten a scholarship last year if I'd had better grades.
glossary: to get a scholarship/to have good grades
translation: I would have gotten a scholarship last year if I had had better grades.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Ile jest artykułów na ten temat?
english: How many articles on the subject are there?
glossary: an article on sth
translation: How many articles are there on this subject?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Będzie cię bolał brzuch, jeśli będziesz dalej jeść tak szybko.
english: You'll have a stomachache if you keep eating so quickly.
glossary: to keep doing sth/to eat quickly/to have a stomachache
translation: You will have stomachache if you still eat such fast.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Jeden z moich uczniów powiedział mi wczoraj, że pies zjadł mu pracę domową.
english: One of my students told me yesterday that his dog had eaten his homework.
glossary: a dog/to do your homework
translation: Yesterday, one of my students told me that a dog had eaten his homework.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Wczoraj napisałem artykuł o jedzeniu na mieście.
english: I wrote an article about eating out yesterday.
glossary: to eat out/to write an article about sth
translation: Yesterday, I wrote an article about eating out.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Dzwoniłbym do ciebie częściej, gdybyś nie była taka drażliwa.
english: I'd call you more often if you weren't so touchy.
glossary: to be touchy/to call sb
translation: I would call you often if you wasn’t so irritable.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Czy jest coś, co powinienem szczegółowo omówić?
english: Is there anything I should elaborate on?
glossary: to elaborate on sth
translation: Is there anything I should elaborate in detail?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Dlaczego się jeszcze nie wyprowadziłeś? Na co czekasz?
english: Why haven't you moved out yet? What are you waiting for?
glossary: to wait for sth/to move out
translation: Why haven’t you moved out yet? What are you waiting for?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Nigdy nie płaciłem żadnych rachunków, dopóki nie wyprowadziłem się z domu rodziców.
english: I'd never paid any bills before I moved out of my parents' house.
glossary: to pay your bills/to move out of your parents' house
translation: I had never paid any bills until I moved out of my parent’s house.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Przanalizowałem już raport, ale nie natknąłem się na nic interesującego.
english: I've already looked into the report, but I haven't come across anything interesting.
glossary: to come across sth/to look into sth/to look into a report
translation: I have already looked into the report, but I didn’t come across anything interesting.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Czy ostatnie dochodzenie zostało odpowiednio przeprowadzone?
english: Was the last investigation carried out properly?
glossary: to carry out an investigation/to do sth properly
translation: Was the last investigation carried out properly?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Podgrzałeś już jedzenie?
english: Have you heated up the food yet?
glossary: to heat up the food
translation: Have you already heated your food?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Dlaczego znowu mnie wkurzasz?
english: Why are you pissing me off again?
glossary: to piss sb off
translation: Why are you pissing me off again?

name: Martin Vance
polish: W zeszłym tygodniu nauczycielka powiedziała, że musimy wydrukować swoje prace.
english: The teacher said last week that we had to print out our assignment.
glossary: an assignment/to print sth out/a teacher
translation: Last week, the teacher told us that we would have to print out our work.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Na twoim miejscu zgasiłbym tu papierosa.
english: If I were you I'd put out the cigarette here.
glossary: to put out a cigarette
translation: If I were you, I would put the cigarette out here.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Nie mogę się przyzwyczaić do wynoszenia śmieci. Kiedyś robiła to moja mama.
english: I can't get used to taking out the garbage. My mom used to do it.
glossary: to take out the garbage
translation: I can’t get used to taking out the garbage. My mother used to do it.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Mogłem to zapisać, bo teraz nic nie pamiętam.
english: I could've written it down because I don't remember anything now.
glossary: to remember sth/to write sth down; to take sth down
translation: I could write it down because I don’t remember anything now.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Klient by nie zrezygnował, gdybyśmy spełnili jego oczekiwania.
english: The client wouldn't have resigned if we'd lived up to his expectations.
glossary: to live up to sb's expectations/a client/to resign from sth
translation: The client wouldn’t have resigned if we had lived up to his expectations.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Powiedziałam ci ostatnim razem, że nie będę cię więcej znosić.
english: I told you last time I wouldn't put up with you anymore.
glossary: to put up with sb/last time
translation: I told you last time that I wouldn’t put up with you anymore.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Terroryści próbowali zdetonować bombę kilka razy, zanim powstrzymała ich policja.
english: The terrorists had tried to let off the bomb a few times before the police stopped them.
glossary: the police/to let off a bomb/to stop sb/a few times
translation: Terrorists tried to let off a bomb couple of times before the police stopped them.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Nie mam siły. Dzieciaki mnie już wykończyły.
english: I don't have energy. The kids have already worn me down.
glossary: to wear sb down/a kid/to have energy
translation: I don’t have more power. The kids have already worn me down.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Będę czytać dalej, jak już przestaniecie gadać.
english: I'll keep reading once you stop talking.
glossary: to stop talking/to keep reading/last week
translation: I will keep on reading if you stop speaking.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Kiedyś nie zapinałem pasów, ale to się zmieniło po tym, jak miałem wypadek.
english: I didn't use to fasten up, but it changed after I'd had an accident.
glossary: to have an accident/to fasten up
translation: I used not to fasten my seatbelt, but it changed when I had an accident.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Naprawdę byś chciała, żeby ten gość zaprosił cię na randkę?
english: Would you really like the guy to ask you out?
glossary: to ask sb out/a guy
translation: Will you really want this guy to invite you for a date?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Jeśli nie przełożymy spotkania, nie uda mi się dotrzeć.
english: If you don't put off the meeting, I won't make it.
glossary: to put off a meeting/to make it to a meeting
translation: If we don’t put off the meeting, I won’t manage to arrive.

name: Martin Vance
polish: O której zadzwonił budzik?
english: What time did the alarm go off?
glossary: to go off {2}
translation: What time did the alarm clock go off?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Szef się pytał w zeszłym tygodniu, czy przebrnęliśmy już przez wszystkie procedury.
english: The boss asked last week if we'd already gone through all the procedures.
glossary: to go through a procedure
translation: Last week, the boss asked if we had already gone through all the procedures.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Dlaczego chcesz odrzucić tę ofertę?
english: Why do you want to turn down the offer?
glossary: to turn down an offer
translation: Why will you want to turn down this offer?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Dzieciaki się wygłupiały, kiedy weszliśmy do domu.
english: The kids were fooling around when we entered the house.
glossary: to enter the house/a kid/to fool around
translation: The kids were fooling around when we came back home.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Policja miała się upewnić, że zostanę skazany za przestępstwo.
english: The police were supposed to make sure that I'd be convicted of the crime.
glossary: to make sure that.../to be convicted of sth
translation: 1. The police were supposed to make sure that I’d be sentenced for a crime.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Kiedy nauczyłeś się wyrażać swoje uczucia?
english: When did you learn how to express your feelings?
glossary: to learn how to do sth/to express your feelings
translation: 2. When have you learned to express your feelings ?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Dlaczego zmieniłeś temat? Próbujesz coś przede mną ukryć?
english: Why did you change the subject? Are you trying to hide something from me?
glossary: to change the subject/to try to do sth/to hide sth from sb
translation: 3. Why have you changed the topic? Are you trying to hide something from me?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Z jakimi problemami musi się zmierzyć ofiara przemocy domowej? Czy wiesz?
english: What issues does a victim of domestic violence have to deal with? Do you know?
glossary: to deal with an issue/a victim of sth/domestic violence
translation: 4. What problems does a domestic violence victim have? Do you know?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Dlaczego moja bluza z kapturem się skurczyła? W jakiej temperaturze ją prałeś?
english: Why did my hoodie shrink? What temperature did you wash it at?
glossary: a hoodie/to shrink/to wash sth at a temperature
translation: 5. Why had my hoodie contracted? What temperature have you washed it?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Co skłoniło cię do dołączenia do klubu? Dlaczego tu jesteś?
english: What made you join the club? Why are you here?
glossary: to make sb do sth
translation: 6. What made you join the club? Why are you here?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Zbyt dużo pijesz. Pomyśl o swojej rodzinie.
english: You're drinking way too much. Think about your family.
glossary: to drink way too much/to think about your family
translation: 7. You are drinking too much. Think about your family.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Jak długo czekasz, aż lekarz znajdzie dla Ciebie wolne miejsce?
english: How long have you been waiting for the doctor to find a free slot for you?
glossary: to find a free slot/to wait for sb to do sth
translation: 8. How long have you been waiting until the doctor does find a free slot for you?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Dlaczego były prezydent ustąpił? Czy było to związane z problemami finansowymi firmy?
english: Why did the former president step down? Was it related to the company's financial problems?
glossary: a former president/to step down from a position/to be related to sth/to have financial problems
translation: 9. Why did the former president step down? Was it connected with the company's financial problems ?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Jak ty to robisz? Co sprawia, że ​​czujesz się silny?
english: How do you do it? What makes you feel strong?
glossary: to make sb feel strong
translation: 10. How do you do it? What made you feel strong?

name: Maya Cook
polish: Miałem w zeszłym tygodniu dużo pracy i bałem się, że nie wyrobię się z terminem.
english: I had a lot of work last week and I was afraid I wouldn't meet the deadline.
glossary: to have a lot of work/last week/to be afraid of sth/to meet the deadline
translation: 1.	I had a lot of work last week, and I was afraid that I wouldn’t meet the deadline.

name: Maya Cook
polish: Nie powinieneś był wspominać o naszych problemach na spotkaniu z szefem.
english: You shouldn't have mentioned our problems at the meeting with the boss.
glossary: at the meeting/to mention sth
translation: 2.	You shouldn’t have mentioned our problems at the meeting with the boss.

name: Maya Cook
polish: Przyjeżdżam jutro do Warszawy i zatrzymuję się u mojej koleżanki.
english: I'm coming to Warsaw tomorrow and staying at my friend's.
glossary: to come to Warsaw
translation: 3.	I am coming to Warsaw tomorrow and I am staying at my friend’s.

name: Maya Cook
polish: Nie powinieneś był opowiadać tego żartu. Był niegrzeczny.
english: You shouldn't have told the joke. It was rude.
glossary: to be rude to sb/to tell sb a joke
translation: 4.	You shouldn’t have told that joke. It was rude.

name: Maya Cook
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że nic nie będę musiał dzisiaj robić.
english: I hoped I wouldn't have to do anything today.
glossary: to hope/today
translation: 5.	I’ve hoped I wouldn’t have to do anything today.

name: Maya Cook
polish: Powinienem był spędzić zeszły weekend z rodziną.
english: I should've spent my last weekend with my family.
glossary: to spend time with sb/last weekend/a family
translation: 6.	I should have spent time with my family last weekend.

name: Maya Cook
polish: Nie powinienem był Ci opowiadać tej historii, bo jest zbyt prywatna.
english: I shouldn't have told you the story because it's too private.
glossary: to tell sb a story/to be private
translation: 7.	I shouldn’t have told you that story, because it is too private.

name: Maya Cook
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że ci klienci zostawią większy napiwek.
english: I hoped the customers would leave a bigger tip.
glossary: to leave a tip/a customer/to hope
translation: 8.	I hoped these clients would leave a bigger tip.

name: Maya Cook
polish: Nie powinieneś był mnie okłamywać.
english: You shouldn't have lied to me.
glossary: to lie to sb
translation: 9.	You shouldn’t have lied to me.

name: Maya Cook
polish: Co robisz dziś wieczorem?
english: What are you doing tonight?
translation: 10.	What are you doing tonight?

name: Damien Bean
polish: Obiecuję, że w przyszłym tygodniu odbiorę dzieci ze szkoły o czasie.
english: I promise I'll pick up the kids from school on time next week.
glossary: to promise/to pick up the kids from school/on time/next week
translation: 1.	I promise that on the next week I will take childen from school on time.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Jestem naprawdę zajęty, więc nie sądzę, że uda mi się spotkać z tobą po pracy.
english: I'm really busy, so I don't think I'll manage to meet you after work.
glossary: to be busy/really/to manage to do sth/to meet sb/after work
translation: 2.	I am really busy, so I don’t think that I can meet with you after work

name: Damien Bean
polish: Jesteś zazdrosny, bo ja jadę na ten wyjazd, a ty nie możesz.
english: You're jealous because I'm going on the trip and you can't.
glossary: to be jealous of sb/to go on a trip
translation: 3.	You are jealous, because I’m going on the trip and you can’t.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Spotykam się jutro z nowym klientem, więc muszę się przygotować.
english: I'm meeting a new client tomorrow, so I have to get prepared.
glossary: to meet sb/a client/to get prepared
translation: 4.	I meet with a new customer tommorow, so I have to prepare.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Wczoraj przypadkowo skasowałam z komputera wszystkie pliki.
english: I accidentally deleted all my files from the computer yesterday.
glossary: to do sth accidentally/to delete a file from the computer
translation: 5.	Yesterday I accidentally deleted all files from the computer.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Poczułam się rozczarowana, kiedy nowy menedżer powiedział mi, że jest żonaty.
english: I felt disappointed when the new manager told me he was married.
glossary: to feel disappointed/a manager/to be married
translation: 6.	I felt disappointend when the new manager told me that he is married.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Myślę, że powinieneś być bardziej cierpliwy wobec swoich dzieci.
english: I think you should be more patient with your children.
glossary: to be patient with sb
translation: 7.	I think that you should be more patient for your children.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Znów boli mnie głowa. Muszę iść do lekarza.
english: I have a headache again. I have to go to the doctor.
glossary: to have a headache/to go to the doctor
translation: 8.	My head hurts me again. I have to go to the doctor.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Nie musisz iść na randkę z tym gościem, jeśli nie chcesz.
english: You don't have to go on a date with the guy if you don't want to.
glossary: to go on a date with sb
translation: 9.	You don’t have to go on a date with this guy if you don’t want.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Nie powinieneś jeść słodyczy. Są niezdrowe.
english: You shouldn't eat candy. It's unhealthy.
glossary: to eat candy/to be unhealthy
translation: 10.	You shouldn’t eat sweet. They are unhealty.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Kogo chcesz, żebym zaprosił na imprezę?
english: Who do you want me to invite to the party?
glossary: to invite sb to a party
translation: 1. Who do you want me to invite to the party?

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Wpadaj. Mój mąż gotuje w ten piątek.
english: Drop by. My husband's cooking this Friday.
glossary: to cook/this Friday
translation: 2. Come in! My husband is cooking this Friday.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Nie ma różnicy. Bierz, co chcesz.
english: There's no difference. Take what you want.
glossary: a difference/to take sth
translation: 3. There is no difference. Take what you want.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Mogłeś mi od razu powiedzieć prawdę. Nie zdenerwowałbym się.
english: You could've told me the truth at the beginning. I wouldn't have gotten mad.
glossary: to tell sb the truth/at the beginning/to get mad
translation: 4. You should've told me the truth immediately. I wouldn't have been mad.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Co mi chciałaś powiedzieć na imprezie?
english: What did you want to tell me at the party?
glossary: to tell sb sth/at the party
translation: 5. What did you want to tell me at the party?

name: Justina Stanley
polish: W artykule jest błąd. Popraw go.
english: There's a mistake in the article. Correct it.
glossary: in the article/to correct a mistake
translation: 6. There is a mistake in the article. Correct it!

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Może pojadę taksówką. Zaoszczędzę czas.
english: Maybe I'll take a cab. I'll save time.
glossary: to take a cab/to save money
translation: 7. Maybe I will take a cab. I will save time.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Co chcesz dostać na urodziny?
english: What do you want to get for your birthday?
glossary: to get sth for your birthday
translation: 8. What do you want to get for your birthday?

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Gdzie Ty wczoraj spałeś?
english: Where did you sleep yesterday?
glossary: to sleep
translation: 9. Where did you sleep last night?

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Stresowałem się, bo bałem się, że coś pójdzie źle.
english: I was stressed out because I was afraid something would go wrong.
glossary: to be stressed out/to be afraid of sth/to go wrong
translation: 10. I was stressed because I was worried that something would go wrong.

name: Maddie Lin
polish: Dziś wieczorem jemy na mieście.
english: We're eating out tonight.
glossary: to eat out/tonight
translation: Today evening we are eating out

name: Maddie Lin
polish: Napisała wczoraj do mnie stara znajoma.
english: An old friend of mine texted me yesterday.
glossary: to text sb/an old friend of mine
translation: My old friend wrote to me yesterday.

name: Maddie Lin
polish: Powinnaś być ze mnie dumna.
english: You should be proud of me.
glossary: to be proud of sb
translation: You should be proud of yourself.

name: Maddie Lin
polish: Nie powinieneś się zapominać.
english: You shouldn't forget yourself.
glossary: to forget yourself
translation: You shouldn't forget yourself.

name: Maddie Lin
polish: Nie możemy zacząć od początku, bo nie mamy czasu.
english: We can't start over because we don't have time.
glossary: to start over/to have time
translation: We can’t start from the beginning because we don't have enough time.

name: Maddie Lin
polish: Mam nadzieję, że nadrobisz pracę domową.
english: I hope you'll catch up on your homework.
glossary: to catch up on your homework
translation: I hope that you will work your homework.

name: Maddie Lin
polish: Obiecuję, że awansujesz w przyszłym roku.
english: I promise you'll get promoted next year.
glossary: to get promoted/next year
translation: I promise that you will have promotion next year.

name: Maddie Lin
polish: Musimy wyjśnić sytuację.
english: We have to explain the situation.
glossary: to explain the situation
translation: We have to explain the situation.

name: Maddie Lin
polish: Jutro idę na zakupy. Chcesz do mnie dołączyć?
english: I'm going shopping tomorrow. Do you want to join me?
glossary: to go shopping/to join sb
translation: I will go to the market tomorrow. Will you join me?

name: Maddie Lin
polish: Dzwoniła wczoraj do mnie teściowa.
english: My mother-in-law called me yesterday.
glossary: to call sb
translation: My mother in low called me yesterday .

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Czy nie mieliśmy wczoraj zapłacić pierwszej raty?
english: Weren't we supposed to pay the first installment yesterday?
glossary: to pay an installment
translation: Weren’t we paid the first rate yesterday?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Czy rozwiązanie sprawdziło się na dłuższą metę?
english: Did the solution work out in the long run?
glossary: to work out/in the long run
translation: Has the solution been successful in the long run?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Z czego wynika Twoja pasja do języków?
english: What does your passion for languages stem from?
glossary: to have a passion for sth/to stem from sth
translation: What does your passion for languages come from?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Mój mąż zawsze chrapie. Rozważam spanie osobno.
english: My husband is always snoring. I'm considering sleeping separately.
glossary: to snore/to consider doing sth/to sleep separately
translation: My husband always snore. I am considering sleeping separately.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Zawsze siedzisz do późna. Nie możemy pójść razem spać?
english: You're always sitting up late. Can't we go to sleep together?
glossary: to sit up late/to go to sleep together
translation: You always stay up late. Can't we go to sleep together?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Od jak dawna wynajmujesz mieszkanie swoim znajomym? Znasz ich dobrze?
english: How long have you been renting out the apartment to your friends? Do you know them well?
glossary: to rent out an apartment to sb
translation: How long have you rent an apartment to your friends? Do you know them well?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Nigdy nie bierzesz pod uwagę moich sugestii. Czy w ogóle zależy Ci na mojej opinii?
english: You never consider my suggestions. Do you even care about my opinion?
glossary: to consider sth/a suggestion/to care about sth
translation: You’ve never taken my suggestions into account. Do you generally care about my opinion?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Na kogo zawsze głosuje Twoja matka?
english: Who does your mother always vote for?
glossary: to vote for sb
translation: Who does your mother always vote for?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Co sprawiło, że pomyślałeś, że kiedykolwiek mógłbym Cię zdradzić?
english: What made you think that I could ever cheat on you?
glossary: to make sb do sth/to cheat on sb
translation: What made you think that I could ever cheat on you?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Zawsze pędzisz. Może powinieneś nauczyć się jeździć.
english: You're always speeding. Maybe you should learn how to drive.
glossary: to speed/to learn how to do sth
translation: You always run. Maybe you should learn to drive.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Jak znalazłeś tę pracę?
english: How did you find the job?
glossary: to find a job
translation: How did you found out this job?

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Ile pokoi jest w tym mieszkaniu?
english: How many rooms are there in the apartment?
glossary: in the apartment/a room
translation: How many rooms are in this apartment?

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Właśnie czytałem o zostawianiu napiwków.
english: I've just read about leaving tips.
glossary: to read about sth/to leave a tip
translation: I’ve been just reading about tips.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Gdzie byłaś? Byłem pewien, że pojawisz się dzisiaj na spotkaniu.
english: Where were you? I was sure you'd show up at the meeting today.
glossary: to be sure/to show up at the meeting/today
translation: When you were? I was sure that you’ll show up at the meeting today.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Czym się interesujesz?
english: What are you interested in?
glossary: to be interested in sth
translation: What you’re interested ?

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Ile osób jest teraz w kawiarni?
english: How many people are there at the coffee shop now?
glossary: to be at the coffee shop/now
translation: How many person are being in the restaurant now.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: W tym miesiącu jest kilkoro nowych klientów.
english: There are a few new clients this month.
glossary: a client/this month
translation: There are a few new clients in this month.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: W czym jesteś dobry?
english: What are you good at?
glossary: to be good at sth
translation: What are you good at?

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Jesteś świetna w wydawaniu pieniędzy.
english: You're great at spending money.
glossary: to be great at sth/to spend money on sth
translation: You are great at spending money.

name: Adrianne Nelson
polish: Zrobię pracę domową, jeśli będę miała czas.
english: I'll do my homework if I have time.
glossary: to do your homework/to have time to do sth
translation: I’ll do my homework if I’ll have time.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Miałem w zeszłym tygodniu dużo pracy i bałem się, że nie wyrobię się z terminem.
english: I had a lot of work last week and I was afraid I wouldn't meet the deadline.
glossary: to have a lot of work/last week/to be afraid of sth/to meet the deadline
translation: 1.	I had a lot of work last week and I was afraid of not finishing before the deadline.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Nie powinieneś był wspominać o naszych problemach na spotkaniu z szefem.
english: You shouldn't have mentioned our problems at the meeting with the boss.
glossary: at the meeting/to mention sth
translation: 2.	You shouldn’t have talked about our problems during the meeting with the boss.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Przyjeżdżam jutro do Warszawy i zatrzymuję się u mojej koleżanki.
english: I'm coming to Warsaw tomorrow and staying at my friend's.
glossary: to come to Warsaw
translation: 3.	I’m going to Warsaw tomorrow and I’m sleeping at my friend’s.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Nie powinieneś był opowiadać tego żartu. Był niegrzeczny.
english: You shouldn't have told the joke. It was rude.
glossary: to be rude to sb/to tell sb a joke
translation: 4.	 You shouldn’t have told that joke. It was impolite.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że nic nie będę musiał dzisiaj robić.
english: I hoped I wouldn't have to do anything today.
glossary: to hope/today
translation: 5.	I hoped, I wouldn’t have to do anything today.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Powinienem był spędzić zeszły weekend z rodziną.
english: I should've spent my last weekend with my family.
glossary: to spend time with sb/last weekend/a family
translation: 6.	I should have spent last week with my family.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Nie powinienem był Ci opowiadać tej historii, bo jest zbyt prywatna.
english: I shouldn't have told you the story because it's too private.
glossary: to tell sb a story/to be private
translation: 7.	I shouldn’t have told you that story because it’s too private.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że ci klienci zostawią większy napiwek.
english: I hoped the customers would leave a bigger tip.
glossary: to leave a tip/a customer/to hope
translation: 8.	I hoped the clients would leave more tips.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Nie powinieneś był mnie okłamywać.
english: You shouldn't have lied to me.
glossary: to lie to sb
translation: 9.	You shouldn’t have lied to me.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Co robisz dziś wieczorem?
english: What are you doing tonight?
translation: 10.	What will you do tonight?

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Nasz zespół wygrał jak dotąd jedną nagrodę, ale pracujemy nad tym.
english: Our team has won one prize so far, but we're working on it.
glossary: to win a prize/so far/to work on sth/a team
translation: Our team have won one prise so far, but we are working on it.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Śnił ci się wczoraj koszmar?
english: Did you have a bad dream yesterday?
glossary: to have a bad dream
translation: Did you have a nightmare yesterday?

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Nie byłbym w stanie teraz nic ugotować, gdyby ciocia mnie nie nauczyła, jak to się robi.
english: I wouldn't be able to cook anything now if my aunt hadn't taught me how to do it.
glossary: to cook/to teach sb how to do sth/an aunt
translation: I wouldn't be able to cook anything now if my ount didn't teach me how to do it.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Nie bolałyby cię plecy, gdybyś nie siedział codziennie przed telewizorem.
english: You wouldn't have back pain if you didn't sit in front of the TV every day.
glossary: to have back pain/to sit in front of the TV/every day
translation: You wouldn't have a backache if you didn't sit in front of the TV every day.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Płacilibyśmy mniej, gdybyśmy wynajęli mieszkanie razem.
english: We'd pay less if we rented an apartment together.
glossary: to rent an apartment
translation: We would pay less if we would rent an apartment together.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Ryzykujesz swoją pracę, kłócąc się ze swoim szefem.
english: You're risking your job arguing with your boss.
glossary: to risk your job/to argue with sb/a boss
translation: You risk that you lost your job argue with your boss.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Gdybym przeszła teraz na emeryturę, musiałabym codziennie siedzieć sama w domu.
english: If I retired now, I'd have to sit at home alone every day.
glossary: to retire/to sit at home
translation: If I retired now, I would have to sit alone at home every day.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Dołączyłbym do was, gdybym nie zapomniał kąpielówek.
english: I'd join you if I hadn't forgotten my swim trunks.
glossary: to join sb/to forget sth/swim trunks
translation: I would have joindes you if I hadn't forget my swiming trunks.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Z kim chcesz, żebym porozmawiał?
english: Who do you want me to talk to?
glossary: to talk to sb
translation: Who do you want me to talk with?

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Gdybyś prowadził własną firmę, miałbyś więcej problemów.
english: If you ran your own company, you would have more problems.
glossary: to run your own company/to have a problem
translation: If you ran your own business, you would have more pro

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Zmarnowałem godzinę, czekając na ciebie na zewnątrz.
english: I wasted an hour waiting for you outside.
glossary: to waste your time/to wait for sb/outside
translation: I wasted one hour waiting for you outside.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Leżelibyśmy teraz na plaży, gdyby nasz lot nie został odwołany.
english: We'd be lying on the beach now if our flight hadn't been canceled.
glossary: to lie on the beach/to cancel a flight
translation: We would be lying on the beach now if our flight had not been cancelled.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Dobrze się wczoraj bawiłaś ze znajomymi?
english: Did you have a good time with your friends yesterday?
glossary: to have a good time
translation: Did you have a good time with your friend yestarday?

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Jak dotąd policja zatrzymała jedną osobę podejrzaną o dokonanie kradzieży.
english: So far the police have detained one person suspected of committing the theft.
glossary: the police/to detain sb/to be suspected of sth/to commit theft
translation: So far, police have detained one person suspected of committing the theft.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Nie byłbyś teraz spłukany, gdybyś nie imprezował w zeszły weekend.
english: You wouldn't be broke now if you hadn't partied last weekend.
glossary: to be broke/to party/last weekend
translation: You wouldn't be broke right now if you weren't partying last weekend.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Łatwiej byłoby mi dojeżdżać do pracy, gdybym mieszkał w mieście.
english: It would be easier for me to commute to work if I lived in the city.
glossary: to commute to work/to live in the city
translation: It would be easier for me to commute to work if I lived in the city.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Mogłybyśmy ćwiczyć razem, gdybyś też się zapisała na zajęcia z jogi.
english: We could exercise together if you signed up for yoga classes too.
glossary: to exercise/to sign up for yoga classes
translation: We could practice together if you also signed up for a yoga class.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Dlaczego nie chcesz, żeby twoje dzieci uczyły się angielskiego?
english: Why don't you want your kids to learn English?
glossary: to learn English
translation: Why don't you want your children to learn English?

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Zrobiłabym panu teraz zastrzyk, gdyby się pan tak nie trząsł.
english: I'd give you an injection now if you didn't tremble so much.
glossary: to give sb an injection/to tremble
translation: I would have given you an injection now if you hadn't been shaking like that.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Nie dostalibyśmy zatrucia pokarmowego, gdybyś umiał gotować.
english: We wouldn't have gotten food poisoning if you could cook.
glossary: to get food poisoning/to cook
translation: We wouldn't get food poisoning if you could cook.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Obiecuję, że w przyszłym tygodniu odbiorę dzieci ze szkoły o czasie.
english: I promise I'll pick up the kids from school on time next week.
glossary: to promise/to pick up the kids from school/on time/next week
translation: I promise that I'll pick up the kids from school on time, next week.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Jestem naprawdę zajęty, więc nie sądzę, że uda mi się spotkać z tobą po pracy.
english: I'm really busy, so I don't think I'll manage to meet you after work.
glossary: to be busy/really/to manage to do sth/to meet sb/after work
translation: I'm really busy, so I'm not sure that I will manage to meet you after work.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Jesteś zazdrosny, bo ja jadę na ten wyjazd, a ty nie możesz.
english: You're jealous because I'm going on the trip and you can't.
glossary: to be jealous of sb/to go on a trip
translation: You're jeleaus because I'm going to that trip and you can't.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Spotykam się jutro z nowym klientem, więc muszę się przygotować.
english: I'm meeting a new client tomorrow, so I have to get prepared.
glossary: to meet sb/a client/to get prepared
translation: I have a meeting with the new client, so I have to prepare.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Wczoraj przypadkowo skasowałam z komputera wszystkie pliki.
english: I accidentally deleted all my files from the computer yesterday.
glossary: to do sth accidentally/to delete a file from the computer
translation: Yesterday, I removed at random all files from my computer.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Poczułam się rozczarowana, kiedy nowy menedżer powiedział mi, że jest żonaty.
english: I felt disappointed when the new manager told me he was married.
glossary: to feel disappointed/a manager/to be married
translation: I felt disappointed when the new manager told me that he was married.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Myślę, że powinieneś być bardziej cierpliwy wobec swoich dzieci.
english: I think you should be more patient with your children.
glossary: to be patient with sb
translation: I think you should be more patient with your children.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Znów boli mnie głowa. Muszę iść do lekarza.
english: I have a headache again. I have to go to the doctor.
glossary: to have a headache/to go to the doctor
translation: I have a headache again. I have to go to the doctor.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Nie musisz iść na randkę z tym gościem, jeśli nie chcesz.
english: You don't have to go on a date with the guy if you don't want to.
glossary: to go on a date with sb
translation: You don't have to go to a date with this guy if you don't want to.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Nie powinieneś jeść słodyczy. Są niezdrowe.
english: You shouldn't eat candy. It's unhealthy.
glossary: to eat candy/to be unhealthy
translation: You shouldn't eat sweets. These are unhealthy.

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Przygotuję się na spotkanie, jeśli będę mieć czas.
english: I'll get prepared for the meeting if I have time.
glossary: to get prepared for a meeting
translation: I’ll prepare for  the meeting if I’ve time

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Na twoim miejscu nie chodziłbym spać tak późno.
english: If I were you, I wouldn't go to sleep so late.
glossary: to go to sleep late
translation: If I were you I  wouldn't go to bed so late.

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Gdybyś nie popełnił tego przestępstwa, policja by cię teraz nie szukała.
english: If you hadn't committed the crime, the police wouldn't be looking for you now.
glossary: to look for sb/to commit a crime
translation: If you hadn't committed this crime, the police wouldn't be looking for you now.

name: Theresa Fine
polish: O czym musimy porozmawiać?
english: What do we have to talk about?
glossary: to talk about sth
translation: What do we need to talk about?

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Dlaczego jest tyle głosów przeciwko temu kandydatowi?
english: Why are there so many votes against the candidate?
glossary: a vote against sb/a candidate
translation: Why are there so many voices against this candidate ?

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Kogo spotkałeś, kiedy wychodziłeś z budynku?
english: Who did you meet when you were leaving the building?
glossary: to meet sb/to leave the building
translation: Who did you meet when you left the building?

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Zrobiłaś test ciążowy?
english: Did you do a pregnancy test?
glossary: to do a pregnancy test/a pregnancy test
translation: Did you take a pregnancy test?

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Dowiedziałem się wczoraj, że mój szef pracował wcześniej w agencji nieruchomości.
english: I found out yesterday that my boss had worked at a real estate agency before.
glossary: a real estate agency/to find out that.../a boss
translation: I found out yesterday that my boss had previously worked in a real estate agency.

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Wszyscy się mnie wczoraj pytali, czy jestem zły. Nie wiem dlaczego.
english: Everybody asked me yesterday if I was mad. I don't know why.
glossary: to be mad at sb
translation: Everybody asked me yesterday if I was angry. I don’t know why .

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Często podróżowaliśmy z mężem, zanim urodziło się nasze pierwsze dziecko.
english: My husband and I had often traveled before our first kid was born.
glossary: to be born/a kid/to travel/a husband
translation: My husband and I often traveled before our first child was born.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Nie miałbyś teraz problemów, gdybyś nie stracił panowania nad sobą.
english: You wouldn't be in trouble now if you hadn't lost your temper.
glossary: to lose your temper/to be in trouble
translation: You wouldn't have problems now if you hadn't lost your temper.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Dlaczego winisz mnie za utratę pracy?
english: Why are you blaming me for losing your job?
glossary: to lose your job
translation: Why do you blame me for losing your job?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: O czym rozmawialiście, kiedy byłam w łazience?
english: What did you talk about when I was in the bathroom?
glossary: to talk about sth/in the bathroom
translation: What were you talking about when I was in the bathroom?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Niestety mój szef został zwolniony, zanim zdążył mi dać podwyżkę.
english: Unfortunately, my boss had been fired before he managed to give me a pay-raise.
glossary: to give sb a pay-raise/a boss/to be fired/Unfortunately...
translation: Unfortunately, my boss was fired before he had time to give me a raise.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Nie miałbym nic przeciwko, gdybyś wyraziła swoje zdanie.
english: I wouldn't mind if you expressed your opinion.
glossary: to mind/to express your opinion
translation: I wouldn't mind if you expressed your opinion.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Jeden z moich pracowników poinformował mnie wczoraj, że trafił do szpitala.
english: One of my employees informed me yesterday that he'd ended up in the hospital.
glossary: to end up in the hospital/to inform sb

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Czy jest osoba w twoim życiu, na której możesz polegać?
english: Is there a person in your life you can rely on?
glossary: to rely on sb
translation: Is there a person in your life you can depend on?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Ile produktów jest na magazynie?
english: How many products are there in stock?
glossary: a product/in stock
translation: How many products are in stock?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Nigdy nie wziąłem łapówki.
english: I've never taken a bribe.
glossary: to take a bribe
translation: I have never taken a bribe.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Stracisz prawo jazdy, jeśli będziesz prowadzić po pijaku.
english: You'll lose your driver's license if you drive drunk.
glossary: to lose your driver's license/to drive drunk
translation: You will lose your license if you drive drunk.

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Miałem w zeszłym tygodniu dużo pracy i bałem się, że nie wyrobię się z terminem.
english: I had a lot of work last week and I was afraid I wouldn't meet the deadline.
glossary: to have a lot of work/last week/to be afraid of sth/to meet the deadline
translation: 1. I had lot of work last week and I was afraid that I didn’t finish before the deadline.

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Nie powinieneś był wspominać o naszych problemach na spotkaniu z szefem.
english: You shouldn't have mentioned our problems at the meeting with the boss.
glossary: at the meeting/to mention sth
translation: 2. You shouldn’t have mentioned about our problems on the meeting with your boss.

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Przyjeżdżam jutro do Warszawy i zatrzymuję się u mojej koleżanki.
english: I'm coming to Warsaw tomorrow and staying at my friend's.
glossary: to come to Warsaw
translation: 3. I’m coming to Warsaw tomorrow and I’ll stay at my friend’s.

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Nie powinieneś był opowiadać tego żartu. Był niegrzeczny.
english: You shouldn't have told the joke. It was rude.
glossary: to be rude to sb/to tell sb a joke
translation: 4. You shouldn’t have told the joke. It was rude.

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że nic nie będę musiał dzisiaj robić.
english: I hoped I wouldn't have to do anything today.
glossary: to hope/today
translation: 5. I was hoped I wouldn’t have to do anything today.

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Powinienem był spędzić zeszły weekend z rodziną.
english: I should've spent my last weekend with my family.
glossary: to spend time with sb/last weekend/a family
translation: 6. I should have spent more time with my family last weekend.

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Nie powinienem był Ci opowiadać tej historii, bo jest zbyt prywatna.
english: I shouldn't have told you the story because it's too private.
glossary: to tell sb a story/to be private
translation: 7. I shouldn’t have told you the story, it’s too privet.

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że ci klienci zostawią większy napiwek.
english: I hoped the customers would leave a bigger tip.
glossary: to leave a tip/a customer/to hope
translation: 8. I was hope that clients would leave a higher tip.

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Nie powinieneś był mnie okłamywać.

glossary: to lie to sb
translation: 9. You shouldn’t have lied to me

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Co robisz dziś wieczorem?
english: What are you doing tonight?
translation: 10. What are you doing tonight?

name: Martin Riley
polish: Jutro uczę się na egzamin, ale możemy się spotkać, jak już skończę.
english: I'm studying for an exam tomorrow, but we can meet once I'm done.
glossary: to be done/to study for an exam/to meet sb
translation: 1. What happened? I was sure that you get married.

name: Martin Riley
polish: Nie pojechałem nad jezioro, bo obawiałem się, że się przeziębię.
english: I didn't go to the lake because I was afraid I'd catch a cold.
glossary: to go to the lake/to catch a cold/to be afraid of sth

name: Martin Riley
polish: Przeprowadzę się, jak już znajdę nową pracę.
english: I'll move once I find a new job.
glossary: to move/to find a new job
translation: 3. I hoped that your wife was in a good mood.

name: Martin Riley
polish: Będę mieć więcej energii, jak już napiję się kawy.
english: I'll have more energy once I have some coffee.
glossary: to have energy/to have some coffee
translation: 4. I wanted to tell you the thuth, but I was afraid you get nervous.

name: Martin Riley
polish: Poproszę o podwyżkę, jak już szef będzie z powrotem w biurze.
english: I'll ask for a pay-raise once my boss is back in the office.
glossary: to ask for a pay-raise/to be back in the office
translation: 5. I could spend less money on clothes, because I still need to pay the bills.

name: Martin Riley
polish: Jestem podekscytowana, bo jutro widzę się ze starą znajomą.
english: I'm excited because I'm seeing an old friend of mine tomorrow.
glossary: to see sb/to be excited
translation: 6. You shouldn't have drank so much at the party.

name: Martin Riley
polish: W przyszłym tygodniu zaczynam kurs angielskiego. Nie mogę się doczekać.
english: I'm starting an English course next week. I can't wait.
glossary: can't wait/to start an English course
translation: . I can't sleep. I shouldn't have drank a coffee so late.

name: Martin Riley
polish: Porozmawiamy, jak już będziesz gotowa.
english: We'll talk once you're ready.
glossary: to talk to sb/to be ready
translation: 8. We will go for a coffee, when the weater is nice.

name: Martin Riley
polish: Bałem się, że przegramy sprawę przez mój błąd.
english: I was afraid we'd lose the case because of my mistake.
glossary: to be afraid of sth/to lose a case/because of you/a mistake
translation: 9. I will go to sleep, when I finish to read a book.

name: Martin Riley
polish: Możemy przełożyć nasze spotkanie? Jutro przyjeżdżają moi rodzice w odwiedziny.
english: Can we put off our meeting? My parents are visiting me tomorrow.
glossary: to visit sb/to put off a meeting
translation: 10. Next weekend I am spending in my home town.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Pobraliśmy już próbki krwi i jesteśmy gotowi, żeby je zbadać.
english: We've already taken blood samples and we're ready to examine them.
glossary: to take blood samples/to examine samples
translation: We took blood samples already and we are ready to examine them.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Ta sytuacja nie wywarła na mnie żadnego wpływu.
english: The situation didn't have any influence on me.
glossary: to have no influence on sb/a situation
translation: The situation didn’t have any impact on me.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie mam dostępu do pliku. Możesz to sprawdzić?
english: I don't have access to the file. Can you check that?
glossary: to have access to a file/to check sth
translation: I don’t have access to the file. Can you check this?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nasz syn nie pobiłby rekordu szkoły, gdyby pan go nie wspierał.
english: Our son wouldn't have beaten the school record if you hadn't supported him.
glossary: to beat the school record/to beat the record/to support sb
translation: Our son wouldn’t have broken the school’s record if you hadn’t supported him.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie miałeś prawa, żeby przeglądać mój telefon.
english: You didn't have the right to look through my phone.
glossary: to have the right to do sth/to look through sb's phone
translation: You didn’t have a  …. to view my phone.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Włóż zupę do lodówki. Nie chcesz, żeby się popsuła.
english: Put the soup in the fridge. You don't want it to go bad.
glossary: soup/to put sth in the fridge/to go bad
translation: Put the soup in the fridge. You don’t want it to go bad.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie musiałbym teraz zwracać tych butów, gdyby na mnie pasowały.
english: I wouldn't have to return the shoes now if they fit me.
glossary: to return a product/shoes/to fit sb
translation: I wouldn’t have to return these shoes if they fit me.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Dlaczego włączyłeś wczoraj muzykę, wiedząc, że śpię?
english: Why did you turn on the music yesterday knowing that I was asleep?
glossary: to turn on the music/to know sth/to be asleep

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie zamieniłem wczoraj z rodzicami ani słowa, bo nie miałem czasu.
english: I didn't have a word with my parents yesterday because I didn't have time.
glossary: to have a word with sb/to have time

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie chciałbym, żeby zarząd zrobił się podejrzliwy.
english: I wouldn't like the management board to get suspicious.
glossary: the management board/to get suspicious
translation: I wouldn’t like the management board to stay suspicious.

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Dziś wieczorem jemy na mieście.
english: We're eating out tonight.
glossary: to eat out/tonight
translation: 1. Tonight we are eating out.

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Napisała wczoraj do mnie stara znajoma.
english: An old friend of mine texted me yesterday.
glossary: to text sb/an old friend of mine
translation: 2. My old friend has written to me yesterday.

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Powinnaś być ze mnie dumna.
english: You should be proud of me.
glossary: to be proud of sb
translation: 3. You should be proud of me.

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Nie powinieneś się zapominać.
english: You shouldn't forget yourself.
glossary: to forget yourself
translation: 4. You shouldn't forget your self.

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Nie możemy zacząć od początku, bo nie mamy czasu.
english: We can't start over because we don't have time.
glossary: to start over/to have time
translation: 5. We can't start from beginning, because we don't have time

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Mam nadzieję, że nadrobisz pracę domową.
english: I hope you'll catch up on your homework.
glossary: to catch up on your homework
translation: 6. I hope you will make up your homework

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Obiecuję, że awansujesz w przyszłym roku.
english: I promise you'll get promoted next year.
glossary: to get promoted/next year
translation: 7. I promise, you will get promoted next year.

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Musimy wyjśnić sytuację.
english: We have to explain the situation.
glossary: to explain the situation
translation: 8. We have to explain the situation.

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Jutro idę na zakupy. Chcesz do mnie dołączyć?
english: I'm going shopping tomorrow. Do you want to join me?
glossary: to go shopping/to join sb
translation: 9.Tomorrow I will go shopping. Do you want to join me?

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Dzwoniła wczoraj do mnie teściowa.
english: My mother-in-law called me yesterday.
glossary: to call sb
translation: 10.  My mother in-law call me yesterday.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Nasz zespół wygrał jak dotąd jedną nagrodę, ale pracujemy nad tym.
english: Our team has won one prize so far, but we're working on it.
glossary: to win a prize/so far/to work on sth/a team
