name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Śnił ci się wczoraj koszmar?
english: Did you have a bad dream yesterday?
glossary: to have a bad dream
translation: Did you have a nightmare yesterday?

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Nie byłbym w stanie teraz nic ugotować, gdyby ciocia mnie nie nauczyła, jak to się robi.
english: I wouldn't be able to cook anything now if my aunt hadn't taught me how to do it.
glossary: to cook/to teach sb how to do sth/an aunt

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Nie bolałyby cię plecy, gdybyś nie siedział codziennie przed telewizorem.
english: You wouldn't have back pain if you didn't sit in front of the TV every day.
glossary: to have back pain/to sit in front of the TV/every day
translation: You wouldn’t have backpain if you didn’t sit in front of the TV every day.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Płacilibyśmy mniej, gdybyśmy wynajęli mieszkanie razem.
english: We'd pay less if we rented an apartment together.
glossary: to rent an apartment
translation: We would pay less if we rented a flat together.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Ryzykujesz swoją pracę, kłócąc się ze swoim szefem.
english: You're risking your job arguing with your boss.
glossary: to risk your job/to argue with sb/a boss
translation: You risk your job having an argument with your boss.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Gdybym przeszła teraz na emeryturę, musiałabym codziennie siedzieć sama w domu.
english: If I retired now, I'd have to sit at home alone every day.
glossary: to retire/to sit at home
translation: If I had retired now, I would have to sit at home alone every day.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Dołączyłbym do was, gdybym nie zapomniał kąpielówek.
english: I'd join you if I hadn't forgotten my swim trunks.
glossary: to join sb/to forget sth/swim trunks

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Z kim chcesz, żebym porozmawiał?
english: Who do you want me to talk to?
glossary: to talk to sb
translation: Who would you like me to talk to?

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Gdybyś prowadził własną firmę, miałbyś więcej problemów.
english: If you ran your own company, you would have more problems.
glossary: to run your own company/to have a problem

polish: W ten weekend robimy z przyjacielem parapetówkę.
english: My friend and I are throwing a housewarming party this weekend.
glossary: to throw a housewarming party/a housewarming party/a friend/this weekend
translation: We make a housewarming party with my friend this weekend.

name: Maddie Lin
polish: Nie martw się. Pomogę ci z problemem.
english: Don't worry. I'll help you with the problem.
glossary: to worry/to help sb with a problem

name: Maddie Lin
polish: Jest ciepło na zewnątrz, więc nie musisz zakładać kurtki.
english: It's warm outside, so you don't have to put on a jacket.
glossary: warm/outside/to put on a jacket
translation: It is warm outside so you can’t put on your jacket.

name: Maddie Lin
polish: W zeszłym tygodniu poprosiłam mamę, żeby poszła ze mną na zakupy.
english: I asked my mom to go shopping with me last week.
glossary: to go shopping/last week

name: Maddie Lin
polish: Niedługo poznam dziewczynę mojego syna.
english: I'm meeting my son's girlfriend soon.
glossary: soon/to meet sb {2}/a son/a girlfriend

name: Maddie Lin
polish: Wczoraj znalazłam korepetytora dla moich dzieci.
english: I found a private tutor for my children yesterday.
glossary: to find a private tutor/a private tutor/children
translation: Yesterday I found a tutor for my kids.

name: Maddie Lin
polish: Obiecuję, że tym razem będę miła dla twojego męża.
english: I promise I'll be nice to your husband this time.
glossary: to be nice to sb/to promise that.../this time/a husband
translation: I promise that I will be nice for your husband this time.

name: Maddie Lin
polish: Niestety nie mogę ci polecić żadnego interesującego filmu.
english: Unfortunately, I can't recommend any interesting movie to you.
glossary: Unfortunately.../to recommend sth to sb/an interesting movie

name: Maddie Lin
polish: Musisz spróbować być mniej zazdrosna.

glossary: to be jealous/more or less

name: Maddie Lin
polish: Powinieneś trenować więcej, żeby być w formie.
english: You should work out more to be in shape.
glossary: to work out/to be in shape

name: Anna Patton
polish: Po tym, jak zrobiłeś zupę, wszyscy rzygaliśmy.
english: After you'd made the soup, we all threw up.
glossary: to make soup/to throw up
translation: After you made a soup, all of us were vomiting up.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Czy jest coś, co mogę polepszyć, żeby być bardziej wydajnym, gdy się uczę?
english: Is there anything I can improve to be more efficient while studying?
glossary: to improve sth/to be efficient/to study sth

name: Anna Patton
polish: Zjadłabym dużo więcej na weselu, gdybym nie przeszła na dietę parę dni wcześniej,

glossary: a wedding party/to go on a diet/a couple of days

name: Anna Patton
polish: Mimo że kolega powiedział, że jego pies nie jest niebezpieczny, bałam się go pogłaskać.
english: Even though my friend said his dog wasn't dangerous, I was afraid to pet it.
glossary: even though/a friend/a dangerous dog/to pet a dog
translation: Even if my friend told his dog isn’t dangerous, I was afraid of petting it.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Gdybyś nie był zapominalski, cały zespół nie musiałby teraz pracować.
english: If you weren't forgetful, the whole team wouldn't have to work now.
glossary: to be forgetful/the whole team/to work

name: Anna Patton
polish: Jeśli nasza firma otworzy nową filię, wszyscy zrobimy się zajęci.
english: If our company opens a new branch, we'll all get busy.
glossary: to open a new branch/a branch/to get busy

name: Anna Patton
polish: Dlaczego zaparkowałeś tak daleko od galerii?
english: Why did you park so far away from the mall?
glossary: to park your car/to be far away from sth/a mall

name: Anna Patton
polish: Tak szybko jechałem na rowerze, że nie zorientowałem się, że przejechałem znak stop.
english: I was riding a bike so fast that I didn't realize I had run a stop sign.
glossary: to ride a bike/to realize that.../to run a stop sign

name: Anna Patton
polish: Widzę, że restauracja ci się nie podoba. Z czym masz problem?
english: I see that you don't like the restaurant. What do you have a problem with?
glossary: to have a problem with sth/a restaurant
translation: I see you don’t like the restaurant. What do you have problem with?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Powiedziałem mamie, że poszedłem do lekarza, bo chciałem ją uspokoić.
english: I told my mom I'd gone to the doctor because I wanted to calm her down.
glossary: to go to the doctor/to calm sb down
translation: I told my mom I went to the doctor because I want her to make calmer.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Jak długo wkuwasz do egzaminu? Ja nawet jeszcze nie zacząłem.
english: How long have you been cramming for the exam? I haven't even started yet.
glossary: to cram for the exam
translation: How long have you been craming for the exam? I haven’t started yet.

name: Yvonne West

english: What rules does my company have to comply with to receive the subsidy?
glossary: to comply with sth/a subsidy

name: Yvonne West
polish: Jaki wpływ miał na Ciebie wypadek?
english: What impact did the accident have on you?
glossary: to have an impact on sb/an accident
translation: What impact has the accident has on you?

name: Yvonne West
polish: Nauczyciel miał kupić płótno. Jak mam teraz malować?
english: The teacher was supposed to buy canvas. How am I supposed to paint now?
glossary: canvas/to paint

name: Yvonne West
polish: Od czego zależy sukces?
english: What does success depend on?
glossary: to depend on sth/a success
translation: What does success depend on?

name: Yvonne West
polish: Nigdy mnie nie słuchasz. Jak mamy się komunikować?
english: You never listen to me. How are we supposed to communicate?
glossary: to listen to sb/to communicate
translation: You never listen to me. How are we supposed to communicate?

name: Yvonne West
polish: Zawsze pracujesz do późna. Nie zależy ci na swojej rodzinie?
english: You're always working late. Don't you care about your family?
glossary: to work late/to care about your family
translation: You’re always working late. Don’t you care about your family?

name: Yvonne West
polish: Mamy nadzieję, że nasz film pomoże społeczeństwu uświadomić sobie problem przemocy domowej.
english: We hope that our movie will help society realize the problem of domestic violence.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to realize sth/domestic violence
translation: We hope our move will help the citizens to realize a problem of domestic violence.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Zawsze przeceniasz swoje umiejętności i później wpadamy w kłopoty.
english: You're always overestimating your abilities, and then we get in trouble.
glossary: to overestimate sth/to get in trouble
translation: You’re always overestimating your abilities and we get in trouble later.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Czego Twój ojciec nie pochwala?
english: What doesn't your father approve of?
glossary: to approve of sth
translation: What doesn’t your father approve of?

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Muszę się skupić na szukaniu lepszej pracy.
english: I have to focus on looking for a better job.
glossary: to look for a job/to focus on sth
translation: 1.	I need to focus on searching for a better job.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Dostaniesz grzywnę, jeśli nie zapłacisz podatku na czas.
english: You'll get a fine if you don't pay your tax on time.
glossary: to pay your tax/to get a fine
translation: 2.	You will get a fine if you don’t pay your tax on time.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Rzuciłbym pracę, gdybym musiał pracować po godzinach.
english: I'd leave my job if I had to work overtime.
glossary: to leave your job/to work overtime
translation: 3.	I would quit my job if I had to work overtime.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Ostatnim razem, kiedy rozmawiałyśmy, mówiłaś, że potrzebujesz mojej porady.
english: The last time we talked, you said you needed my advice.
glossary: to need sb's advice/The last time we talked.../to say sth
translation: 4.	Last time we spoke, you said you needed my advice.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Kiedy ostatni raz widział pan ofiarę żywą?
english: When was the last time you saw the victim alive?
glossary: to be alive/a victim/to see sb/When was the last time...
translation: 5.	When was the last time you saw the victim alive?

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Policja nie zatrzymałaby cię, gdybyś włączył światła.
english: The police wouldn't have pulled you over if you'd turned on the headlights.
glossary: to turn on the headlights/to pull sb over/the police
translation: 6.	The police wouldn’t have stopped you if you had turned on the lights

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Nie spaliłam jeszcze twoich rzeczy, ale za chwilę to zrobię.
english: I haven't burned your stuff yet, but I'll do it in a moment.
glossary: to burn sth/your stuff/in a moment
translation: 7.	I haven’t burnt your stuff, yet I will do it in a moment.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Czy jest możliwość zaparkowania samochodu przed budynkiem?
english: Is there the possibility to park a car in front of the building?
glossary: to park a car/in front of the building/a possibility to do sth
translation: 8.	Is it possible to park a car in front of the building?

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Dowiedziałem się o tym fakcie po tym, jak się rozstaliśmy.
english: I found out about the fact after we'd broken up.
glossary: to find out about sth/a fact/to break up
translation: 9.	I found out about this after we broke up.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Powiedz mi, w czym się specjalizujesz.
english: Tell me what you specialize in.
glossary: to specialize in sth
translation: 10.	Tell me what you specialize in?

name: Jack Russell
polish: Myślę, że dzisiaj będę pracował po godzinach. Co powiesz na czwartek?
english: I think I'll work overtime today. What about Thursday?
glossary: to work overtime/to meet/today/Thursday/What about.../to think
translation: I think I’ll work over hours. What do you think about thursday?

name: Jack Russell
polish: Myśłałem, że zawieziesz mnie do domu. Nie chcę brać taksówki.
english: I thought you'd take me home. I don't want to take a cab.
glossary: to think/to take sb home/to take a cab
translation: I thought you would drop me home. I don’t want to take a cab.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Idę jutro do banku, żeby założyć konto.
english: I'm going to the bank tomorrow to open an account.
glossary: to go to the bank/to open an account/tomorrow
translation: I’m going to the bank to create an account.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Skup się na sprzątaniu pokoju.
english: Focus on cleaning the room.
glossary: to focus on sth/to clean a room
translation: You do focus on cleaning the room.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Musisz pamiętać, że jest wyjątek do tej zasady.
english: You have to remember that there's an exception to the rule.
glossary: to remember sth/an exception to the rule
translation: You must remember that there is an exception to this rule.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Chciałabym, żebyś wygłosił przemowę na konferencji.
english: I'd like you to give a speech at the conference.
glossary: to give a speech/at the conference
translation: I would like you to give a speech at the conference.

name: Jack Russell
polish: W tej grupie jest za dużo ludzi. Znajdę inną.
english: There are too many people in the group. I have to find a different one.
glossary: in the group/to find sth/different
translation: There are too many people in this group. I'll find another.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Powinienem był od razu cię zwolnić. Nie zasługujesz, żeby tu być.
english: I should've fired you right away. You don't deserve to be here.
glossary: to fire sb/right away/to deserve sth
translation: I should have fired you right now. You don’t deserve to be here.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Kiedy zaczynasz nową pracę?
english: When are you starting the new job?
glossary: to start a new job
translation: When will you start a new job?

name: Jack Russell
polish: Interesuję się gotowaniem.
english: I'm interested in cooking.
glossary: to be interested in sth/to cook sth
translation: I’m interested in cooking.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Jutro uczę się na egzamin, ale możemy się spotkać, jak już skończę.
english: I'm studying for an exam tomorrow, but we can meet once I'm done.
glossary: to be done/to study for an exam/to meet sb
translation: 1. Tomorrow I'm learning for the exam but we can meet when I'm finished.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Nie pojechałem nad jezioro, bo obawiałem się, że się przeziębię.
english: I didn't go to the lake because I was afraid I'd catch a cold.
glossary: to go to the lake/to catch a cold/to be afraid of sth
translation: 2. I didn't go to a lake, because I was worried I would catch a cold.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Przeprowadzę się, jak już znajdę nową pracę.
english: I'll move once I find a new job.
glossary: to move/to find a new job
translation: 3. I'll move out when I find a new job.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Będę mieć więcej energii, jak już napiję się kawy.
english: I'll have more energy once I have some coffee.
glossary: to have energy/to have some coffee
translation: 4. I'll have more energy when I finally drink coffee.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Poproszę o podwyżkę, jak już szef będzie z powrotem w biurze.
english: I'll ask for a pay-raise once my boss is back in the office.
glossary: to ask for a pay-raise/to be back in the office
translation: 5. I'll ask for a raise when the boss is back in the office.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Jestem podekscytowana, bo jutro widzę się ze starą znajomą.
english: I'm excited because I'm seeing an old friend of mine tomorrow.
glossary: to see sb/to be excited
translation: 6. I'm excited because I meet with my old friend tomorrow.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: W przyszłym tygodniu zaczynam kurs angielskiego. Nie mogę się doczekać.
english: I'm starting an English course next week. I can't wait.
glossary: can't wait/to start an English course
translation: 7. Next week I start English course. I can't wait.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Porozmawiamy, jak już będziesz gotowa.
english: We'll talk once you're ready.
glossary: to talk to sb/to be ready
translation: 8. We'll talk when you're ready.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Bałem się, że przegramy sprawę przez mój błąd.
english: I was afraid we'd lose the case because of my mistake.
glossary: to be afraid of sth/to lose a case/because of you/a mistake
translation: 9. I was scared that we're going to lose our case, due to my mistake.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Możemy przełożyć nasze spotkanie? Jutro przyjeżdżają moi rodzice w odwiedziny.
english: Can we put off our meeting? My parents are visiting me tomorrow.
glossary: to visit sb/to put off a meeting
translation: 10. Can we reschedule our meeting? My parents come for a visit tomorrow.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Dziś wieczorem jemy na mieście.
english: We're eating out tonight.
glossary: to eat out/tonight
translation: 1. We’re eating out tonight.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Napisała wczoraj do mnie stara znajoma.
english: An old friend of mine texted me yesterday.
glossary: to text sb/an old friend of mine
translation: 2. My old friend wrote to me yesterday.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Powinnaś być ze mnie dumna.
english: You should be proud of me.
glossary: to be proud of sb
translation: 3. You should be proud of me.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Nie powinieneś się zapominać.
english: You shouldn't forget yourself.
glossary: to forget yourself
translation: 4. You shouldn’t forget yourself.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Nie możemy zacząć od początku, bo nie mamy czasu.
english: We can't start over because we don't have time.
glossary: to start over/to have time
translation: 5. We can’t start from beginning, because we don’t have time.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Mam nadzieję, że nadrobisz pracę domową.
english: I hope you'll catch up on your homework.
glossary: to catch up on your homework
translation: 6. I hope, you’ll do your homework.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Obiecuję, że awansujesz w przyszłym roku.
english: I promise you'll get promoted next year.
glossary: to get promoted/next year
translation: 7. I promise, you’ll be promoted next year.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Musimy wyjśnić sytuację.
english: We have to explain the situation.
glossary: to explain the situation
translation: 8. We have to explain the situation.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Jutro idę na zakupy. Chcesz do mnie dołączyć?
english: I'm going shopping tomorrow. Do you want to join me?
glossary: to go shopping/to join sb
translation: 9. I’m going shopping tomorrow. Do you want to join me?

name: Anna Forney
polish: Dzwoniła wczoraj do mnie teściowa.
english: My mother-in-law called me yesterday.
glossary: to call sb
translation: 10. My mother-in-low called me yesterday.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Kiedy się dowiedziałaś, że nie będziesz się kwalifikować do ubezpieczenia?
english: When did you find out that you wouldn't be eligible for insurance?
glossary: to find out about sth/to be eligible for sth/to be eligible for insurance
translation: When did you realize you won't be eligible for the insurance?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Kiedy brałem prysznic, wpadłem na świetny pomysł.
english: When I was taking a shower, I came up with a great idea.
glossary: to take a shower/to come up with sth/to come up with an idea
translation: When I was taking a shower, I came up an excellent idea.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Gdybyś była bardziej nieustępliwa, byłabyś w stanie udowodnić swoje racje.
english: If you were more persistent, you'd be able to prove your point.
glossary: to be persistent/to prove your point/to prove sth
translation: If you were more ... , you would be able to prove your point.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Kiedy przypomniałaś mi, że zostawiłam klucze w samochodzie, poczułam ulgę.
english: When you reminded me I'd left the keys in the car, I felt relieved.
glossary: to remind sb sth; to remind sth to sb/to feel relieved
translation: When you remembered me I had left key in the car, I felt release.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Powinieneś być wdzięczny. Gdybym cię nie ostrzegł, dostałbyś mandat.
english: You should be grateful. If I hadn't warned you, you would've gotten a ticket.
glossary: to be grateful/to warn sb about sth/to get a ticket
translation: I should've been greatful. If I hadn't warned you, you would gotten a fine.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Zdziwiłem się, kiedy żona mi powiedziała, że chce się wyprowadzić.
english: I got surprised when my wife told me she wanted to move out.
glossary: to get surprised/to move out/a wife
translation: I was surprised when my wife told me she would move out.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Jeśli coś mi się nie spodoba, po prostu będę się trzymać od tego z daleka.
english: If I don't like anything, I'll simply stay away from it.
glossary: to stay away from sth
translation: If I won't like something, I would be far away from it.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Jeszcze nigdy nie byłam na innym kontynencie.
english: I haven't been to a different continent yet.
glossary: a continent
translation: I haven't been in a different continent yet.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Dlaczego na świecie jest tyle głodu?
english: Why is there so much hunger in the world?
glossary: hunger/in the world
translation: Why are there so many hunger in the world?

name: Anna Patton
polish: O co walczysz?
english: What are you fighting for?
glossary: to fight for sth
translation: What are you fighting for?

name: Maya Cook
polish: Nie powinienem był robić takiego bałaganu. Przepraszam.
english: I shouldn't have made such a mess. I'm sorry.
glossary: to make a mess
translation: 1.	I shouldn’t have made such a mess. I’m sorry.

name: Maya Cook
polish: Jestem głodny. Mogłem zjeść śniadanie.
english: I'm hungry. I could've eaten breakfast.
glossary: to be hungry/to eat breakfast
translation: 2.	I’m hungry. I could have breakfast.

name: Maya Cook
polish: Mogłem biec szybciej. Zdążyłbym na pociąg.
english: I could've run faster. I would've caught the train.
glossary: to run fast/to catch the train
translation: 3.	I could run faster. I would catch the train.

name: Maya Cook
polish: Jechałeś bardzo szybko. Bałem się, że będziemy mieli wypadek.
english: You drove very fast. I was afraid we'd have an accident.
glossary: to drive/to be afraid/to have an accident
translation: 4.	You were driving very fast. I was afraid that we would have an accident.

name: Maya Cook
polish: Jutro jedziemy do centrum na zakupy. Chcesz coś?
english: We're going shopping downtown tomorrow. Do you want anything?
glossary: to go shopping/to go downtown
translation: 5.	We’re going shopping downtown tomorrow. Do you want something?

name: Maya Cook
polish: Co się stało? Byłem pewien, że będziesz się trzymać planu.
english: What happened? I was sure you'd stick to the plan.
glossary: to happen/to be sure/to stick to the plan
translation: 6.	What had happened? I was sure you’d stick to the plan.

name: Maya Cook
polish: Moja najlepsza przyjaciółka wychodzi za mąż w przyszłym tygodniu.
english: My best friend's getting married next week.
glossary: to get married/next week
translation: 7.	The best friend of mine is getting married next week.

name: Maya Cook
polish: Nie pracuję jutro, więc możemy jechać nad jezioro.
english: I'm not working tomorrow, so we can go to the lake.
glossary: to work/to go to the lake/tomorrow
translation: 8.	I’m not working tomorrow, so we could go to the lake.

name: Maya Cook
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że się zaprzyjaźnimy.
english: I hoped we'd make friends.
glossary: to hope/to make friends
translation: 9.	I hoped we would become friends.

name: Maya Cook
polish: Ile osób jest w Twoim zespole?
english: How many people are there on your team?
glossary: on the team
translation: 10.	How many people are in your team?

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Możesz być z siebie dumny.
english: You can be proud of yourself.
glossary: to be proud of sb
translation: 1. You can be proud of yourself.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Kiedy zdałeś sobie z tego sprawę?
english: When did you realize it?
glossary: to realize sth
translation: 2. When did you realize that?

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Myślę, że założę dzisiaj sukienkę.
english: I think I'll put on a dress today.
glossary: to put on a dress
translation: 3. I think I’ll wear a dress today.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Odświężę swój angielski, kiedy będę miał więcej czasu.
english: I'll refresh my English when I have more time.
glossary: to refresh your English/to have more time
translation: 4. I’ll refresh my English when I will have more time.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Spotykam się dzisiaj ze znajomymi. Nie czekaj.
english: I'm meeting my friends today. Don't wait.
glossary: to meet your friends/to wait for sb
translation: 5. My friend and I are meeting tonight. Don’t wait.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Może wpadnę po pracy.
english: Maybe I'll drop by after work.
glossary: to drop by/after work
translation: 6. Mayby, I’ll come over after work.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Jak możesz mnie okłamywać?
english: How can you lie to me?
glossary: to lie to sb
translation: 7. How can you lie to me?

name: Isabel Cain
polish: W szkole jest wielu uczniów, którzy mają problemy.
english: There are many students at school who have problems.
glossary: to have problems/at school/a student
translation: 8. There are a lot of students at school, who have problems.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Myślałam, że się tym zajmiesz.
english: I thought you'd take care of it.
glossary: to take care of sth
translation: 9. I thought, you would get on that.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Od godziny robię kolację.
english: I've been making dinner for an hour.
glossary: to make dinner
translation: 10. I’ve been doing dinner for an hour.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Od wczoraj czytam tę książkę.
english: I've been reading the book since yesterday.
glossary: to read a book/since yesterday
translation: 1.  I read this book for month.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Jak możesz być tak naiwny?
english: How can you be so naive?
glossary: to be naive
translation: 2. How can you be so naive.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Miałam nadzieję, że przemyślisz swoje zachowanie.
english: I hoped you'd think over your behavior.
glossary: to think over your behavior
translation: 3. I hoped you’ll think over your behavior.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Jestem pewien, że skończysz studia.
english: I'm sure you'll graduate from college.
glossary: to graduate from college/to be sure
translation: 4. I’m sure you’ll finish the college.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Kiedy wróciłaś do miasta?
english: When did you get back to town?
glossary: to get back to town
translation: 5. When you came back the town.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Mam nadzieję, że mnie nie zarazisz.
english: I hope you won't infect me.
glossary: to infect sb
translation: 6. I hope you don’t infect me.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Powinieneś przeczytać przynajmniej jedną książkę w miesiącu.
english: You should read at least one book a month.
glossary: to read a book/once a month/at least
translation: 7. You should read at least one book in month.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: W moim biurze jest osoba, która naprawia komputery.
english: There's a person in my office who repairs computers.
glossary: to repair a computer/in your office/a person
translation: 8. In my office is a person who repairs computers.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Twój ojciec gotuje dziś wieczorem.
english: Your dad's cooking tonight.
glossary: to cook/a dad
translation: 9. Your father cooking tonight.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Nauczę się angielskiego, jak już zatrudnię profesjonalnego nauczyciela.
english: I'll learn English once I hire a professional teacher.
glossary: to hire sb/a professional teacher/once {2}
translation: 10. I’ll learn English once I hire a profesional teacher.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Myślę, że dzisiaj będę pracował po godzinach. Co powiesz na czwartek?
english: I think I'll work overtime today. What about Thursday?
glossary: to work overtime/to meet/today/Thursday/What about.../to think
translation: 1. I think I’ll be working overtime today. How about Thursday?

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Myśłałem, że zawieziesz mnie do domu. Nie chcę brać taksówki.
english: I thought you'd take me home. I don't want to take a cab.
glossary: to think/to take sb home/to take a cab
translation: 2. I thought you would give me a home ride. I don’t want to take a cab.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Idę jutro do banku, żeby założyć konto.
english: I'm going to the bank tomorrow to open an account.
glossary: to go to the bank/to open an account/tomorrow
translation: 3. I’m going to the bank tomorrow to set up a bank account.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Skup się na sprzątaniu pokoju.
english: Focus on cleaning the room.
glossary: to focus on sth/to clean a room
translation: 4. Focus on cleaning the room.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Musisz pamiętać, że jest wyjątek do tej zasady.
english: You have to remember that there's an exception to the rule.
glossary: to remember sth/an exception to the rule
translation: 5. You have to remember that there is an exception to this rule.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Chciałabym, żebyś wygłosił przemowę na konferencji.
english: I'd like you to give a speech at the conference.
glossary: to give a speech/at the conference
translation: 6. I would like you to give a speach at  the conference.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: W tej grupie jest za dużo ludzi. Znajdę inną.
english: There are too many people in the group. I have to find a different one.
glossary: in the group/to find sth/different
translation: 7. There are too many people in this group. I’ll find another.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Powinienem był od razu cię zwolnić. Nie zasługujesz, żeby tu być.
english: I should've fired you right away. You don't deserve to be here.
glossary: to fire sb/right away/to deserve sth
translation: 8. I should have fired you right now. You don’t deserve to be here.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Kiedy zaczynasz nową pracę?
english: When are you starting the new job?
glossary: to start a new job
translation: 9. When do you start a new job?

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Interesuję się gotowaniem.
english: I'm interested in cooking.
glossary: to be interested in sth/to cook sth
translation: 10. I’m interested in cooking.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Zwolnię cię. Zobaczysz.
english: I'll fire you. You'll see.
glossary: to fire sb/to see sth
translation: 1.	I will fire you. You will see.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Dostaniesz awans. Cieszysz się?
english: You'll get promoted. Are you happy?
glossary: to get promoted/to be happy about sth
translation: 2.	You will get a promotion. Are you happy?

name: Damien Bean
polish: Jutro omawiamy bieżące problemy na spotkaniu.
english: We're discussing the current problems at the meeting tomorrow.
glossary: to discuss sth/the current problems/at the meeting
translation: 3.	Tomorrow we discuss current problems at a meeting.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Jutro zamawiamy jedzenie.
english: We're ordering food tomorrow.
glossary: to order food
translation: 4.	Tomorrow we order food.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Wybrałam właściwego nauczyciela.
english: I chose the right teacher.
glossary: a teacher/to choose sth/the right teacher
translation: 5.	I chose the right teacher.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Wczoraj zamówiłam pizzę.
english: I ordered a pizza yesterday.
glossary: to order a pizza
translation: 6.	Yesterday I ordered a pizza.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Muszę wyjaśnić sytuację.
english: I have to explain the situation.
glossary: to explain the situation
translation: 7.	I have to explain the situation.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Powinnaś zadzwonić do swoich rodziców.
english: You should call your parents.
glossary: a parent/to call sb
translation: 8.	You should call your parents.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Nie możesz mnie okłamywać.
english: You can't lie to me.
glossary: to lie to sb
translation: 9.	You can’t lie to me.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Nie powinnaś wierzyć swojemu mężowi.
english: You shouldn't believe your husband.
glossary: to believe sb
translation: 10.	You shouldn’t believe your husband.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Gdzie spałeś zeszłej nocy?
english: Where did you sleep last night?
glossary: last night/to sleep
translation: Where did you sleep last night?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Zupa się popsuje, jeśli nie wstawisz jej do lodówki.
english: The soup will go bad if you don't put it in the fridge.
glossary: to go bad/to put sth in the fridge
translation: The soup will go bad if you don’t put it in the fridge.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Oblałeś ostatni test, bo się w ogóle na niego nie uczyłeś.
english: You failed the last test because you hadn't studied for it at all.
glossary: to study for a test/to fail a test/at all
translation: You failed the last test because you hadn’t studied for it.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Rodzice się mnie wczoraj pytali, czy zdałem wszystkie egzaminy.
english: My parents asked me yesterday if I'd passed all the exams.
glossary: to pass an exam/a parent
translation: Yesterday, my parents asked me if I had passed all exams.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Chciałbym przeprosić za spóźnienie.
english: I'd like to apologize for being late.
glossary: to be late/to apologize for sth/I'd like to...
translation: I would like to apologize for being late.

name: Martin Vance
polish: O co jesteś oskarżony?
english: What are you accused of?
glossary: to be accused of sth
translation: What are you accused of?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Nie miałbyś nieświeżego oddechu, gdybyś palił mniej.
english: You wouldn't have bad breath if you smoked less.
glossary: to have bad breath/to smoke
translation: You wouldn’t have bad breath if you smoked less.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Nie załatwiłem jeszcze wszystkich swoich spraw.
english: I haven't done all my errands yet.
glossary: to do errands
translation: I haven’t done all my errands yet.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Są jakieś listy do mnie?
english: Are there any letters for me?
glossary: a letter for sb
translation: Are there any letters for me?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Dobilibyśmy targu, gdybyś się nie odezwał.
english: We would've closed the deal if you hadn't spoken up.
glossary: to speak up/to close a deal
translation: We would have closed the deal if you hadn’t spoken.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Policja przyjechała na miejsce zbrodni po tym, jak właściciel sklepu zastrzelił złodzieja.
english: The police came to the crime scene after the store owner had shot down a thief.
glossary: to come to a crime scene/to shoot sb down/a store owner/a thief
translation: The police came to the crime scene after store’s owner had shot a thief dead.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Na szczęscie syn przyzwyczaił się do wynoszenia śmieci.
english: Fortunately, my son got used to taking out the garbage.
glossary: Fortunately.../a son/to take out the garbage
translation: Fortunately, the son got used to taking out the garbage.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Rodzice pytali mnie, dlaczego chcesz rzucić studia.
english: My parents asked me why you wanted to drop out of college.
glossary: to drop out of college
translation: The parents asked me why you would want to drop out of college.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Powiedziałem ci, że przyprawy uwydatnią smak potrawy.
english: I told you the spices would bring out the flavor of the dish.
glossary: to bring out the flavor/a dish/spices
translation: I told you that the spices would bring out the flavor of the dish.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Dlaczego bierzesz pożyczkę?
english: Why are you taking out a loan?
glossary: to take out a loan
translation: Why are you taking out a loan?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Wykład by się nie ciągnął, gdybyś nie zadawał głupich pytań.
english: The lecture wouldn't have dragged on if you hadn't asked stupid questions.
glossary: to ask stupid questions/to drag on/a lecture
translation: The lecture wouldn’t drag on if you didn’t ask stupid questions.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Samolot odlatywał, kiedy pojawiliśmy się na lotnisku.
english: The plane was taking off when we showed up at the airport.
glossary: to take off/to show up at the airport
translation: The airplane was taking off when we showed up at the airport.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Nie chciałbym, żebyś popadł w uzależnienie.
english: I wouldn't like you to fall into addiction.
glossary: to fall into addiction
translation: I wouldn’t like you to fall into addiction.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Zarząd mnie pytał, dlaczego zmiany nie przyniosły sukcesu.
english: The management board asked me why the changes hadn't brought about success.
glossary: to bring about success/the management board/a change
translation: The board asked me why the changes hadn’t brought about success.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Wydrukowałem już wypracowanie.
english: I've already printed out the essay.
glossary: to print out an essay
translation: I have already printed out the essay.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Jak ty znosisz swojego chłopaka?
english: How do you put up with your boyfriend?
glossary: to put up with sb
translation: How do you put up with your boyfriend?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Muszę wychodzić. Mogłam nałożyć wcześniej krem.
english: I have to leave. I could've put on the cream earlier.
glossary: to put on cream/to leave
translation: I have to go out. I could apply the cream earlier.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Zapomniałeś już o swojej byłej?
english: Have you gotten over your ex yet?
glossary: to get over sb/an ex
translation: Have you already forgotten about your ex?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Dzięki za podgrzanie jedzenia.
english: Thanks for heating up the food.
glossary: to heat up the food
translation: Thanks for heating up the food.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Nie dostanę stypendium, jeśli uczelnia odrzuci mój wniosek.
english: I won't get the scholarship if the university turns down my application.
glossary: to get a scholarship/to turn down an application
translation: I won’t get a scholarship if the college turns down my application.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Moje rzeczy zajmowały niegdyś więcej miejsca.
english: My stuff used to take up more space.
glossary: to take up space/your stuff
translation: My stuff used to take up more space.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Dlaczego pogodziłaś się ze swoim byłym?
english: Why did you make up with your ex?
glossary: to make up with sb
translation: Why did you make up with your ex?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Właśnie odjechaliśmy.
english: We've just driven off.
glossary: to drive off
translation: We have just driven off.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Dalej czytałbym książkę, gdybym nie był zmęczony.
english: I'd keep on reading if I weren't tired.
glossary: to be tired/to keep on reading a book
translation: I would have kept on reading a book if I hadn’t been tired.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Nadrobimy stracony czas, jak już weźmiesz się do pracy.
english: We'll make up for lost time once you get down to work.
glossary: to make up for lost time/to get down to work
translation: We will make up for lost time once you get down to work.

name: Monica Grimm
polish: W ten weekend robimy z przyjacielem parapetówkę.
english: My friend and I are throwing a housewarming party this weekend.
glossary: to throw a housewarming party/a housewarming party/a friend/this weekend
translation: 1. In this weekend, we are doing a housewarming

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Nie martw się. Pomogę ci z problemem.
english: Don't worry. I'll help you with the problem.
glossary: to worry/to help sb with a problem
translation: 2. Don’t worry. I will help you with your problem.

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Jest ciepło na zewnątrz, więc nie musisz zakładać kurtki.
english: It's warm outside, so you don't have to put on a jacket.
glossary: warm/outside/to put on a jacket
translation: 3. It’s warm outside, so you don’t have to put the jacket on.

name: Monica Grimm
polish: W zeszłym tygodniu poprosiłam mamę, żeby poszła ze mną na zakupy.
english: I asked my mom to go shopping with me last week.
glossary: to go shopping/last week
translation: 4. Last week, I asked my mother to go with me for shopping

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Niedługo poznam dziewczynę mojego syna.
english: I'm meeting my son's girlfriend soon.
glossary: soon/to meet sb {2}/a son/a girlfriend
translation: 5. I will met my son soon

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Wczoraj znalazłam korepetytora dla moich dzieci.
english: I found a private tutor for my children yesterday.
glossary: to find a private tutor/a private tutor/children
translation: 6. Yesterday, I found a tutor for my kids.

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Obiecuję, że tym razem będę miła dla twojego męża.
english: I promise I'll be nice to your husband this time.
glossary: to be nice to sb/to promise that.../this time/a husband
translation: 7. I promise that this time I will be nice for you husband

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Niestety nie mogę ci polecić żadnego interesującego filmu.
english: Unfortunately, I can't recommend any interesting movie to you.
glossary: Unfortunately.../to recommend sth to sb/an interesting movie
translation: 8. Unfortunately, I can’t recommend you any intrested movie.

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Musisz spróbować być mniej zazdrosna.
english: You have to try to be less jealous.
glossary: to be jealous/more or less
translation: 9. I should try to be less yeaolus.

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Powinieneś trenować więcej, żeby być w formie.
english: You should work out more to be in shape.
glossary: to work out/to be in shape
translation: 10. You should train more to be in good condition.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Otrzymałaby pani zwrot kosztów, gdyby wysłała nam pani faktury na czas.
english: You would've received the reimbursement if you'd sent us the invoices on time.
glossary: to receive sth/a reimbursement/to send invoices
translation: 1. You would've a reimbursement if you'd sent invoices on time.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: O której zwykle zaczynasz pracę?
english: What time do you usually start work?
glossary: to start work/What time...
translation: 2. What time do you usually start working?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Czy twój mąż często pracuje po godzinach?
english: Does your husband often work overtime?
glossary: to work overtime/a husband
translation: 3. Does your husband usually work overtime?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Do czego masz słabość?
english: What do you have a weakness for?
glossary: to have a weakness for sth
translation: 4. What do you have a weakness for?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Od jak dawna chwalisz się swoim nowym samochodem? Czy nie widzisz, że wszyscy mają dość?
english: How long have you been bragging about your new car? Can't you see everyone's fed up?
glossary: to brag about sth/to be fed up with sth
translation: 5. How long have you been bragging about your new car? Don't you see that everyone has had enough?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Jak znalazłeś tę pracę?
english: How did you find the job?
glossary: to find a job
translation: 6. How did you find this job?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Ostrzegałam cię, że będzie korek na autostradzie, ale nie chciałeś mnie słuchać.
english: I warned you there would be a traffic jam on the highway, but you didn't want to listen to me.
glossary: to warn sb that.../I've warned you that.../an accident/on the highway/to listen to sb
translation: 7. I warned you that there would be a traffic jam on the highway, but you did not want to listen to me.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Z kogo się śmiejesz?
english: Who are you laughing at?
glossary: to laugh at sb
translation: 8. Who are you laughing at?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Jakich ludzi cenisz sobie najbardziej?
english: What people do you value the most?
glossary: to value sb
translation: 9. What kind of people do you value the most?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Trudno mi było udowodnić swoją rację.
english: It was hard for me to prove my point.
glossary: to prove your point
translation: 10. It was difficult for me to prove my point.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Moi znajomi jutro wpadają. Kup piwo.
english: My friends are dropping by tomorrow. Buy beer.
glossary: to drop by/a friend/to buy sth/to drink beer
translation: 1. My friends are dropping by me tomorrow.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Pana dokumenty nie zostałyby odrzucone, gdyby złożył je Pan na czas.
english: Your documents wouldn't have gotten rejected if you had handed them in on time.
glossary: a document/to get rejected/to hand sth in on time
translation: 2. Your documents would not have been rejected if you had submitted them on time.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Niełatwo nam zrobić wrażenie na naszej szefowej.
english: It's not easy for us to make a good impression on our boss.
glossary: to make a good impression on sb/a boss
translation: 3. It is not easy for us to impress our boss.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Znów boli mnie głowa. Muszę iść do lekarza.
english: I have a headache again. I have to go to the doctor.
glossary: to have a headache/to go to the doctor
translation: 4. My head hurts again. I have to go to the doctor.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Niestety nie mogę ci polecić żadnego interesującego filmu.
english: Unfortunately, I can't recommend any interesting movie to you.
glossary: Unfortunately.../to recommend sth to sb/an interesting movie
translation: 5. Unfortunately, I cannot recommend you any interesting video.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Gratulacje. Właśnie usłyszałem wieści.
english: Congratulations. I've just heard the news.
glossary: congratulations/to hear the news
translation: 6. Congratulations. I just heard the news.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Jakiego rozwiązania szukasz? Może będę w stanie ci pomóc.
english: What solution are you looking for? Maybe I'll be able to help.
glossary: a solution for sth/to be able to help
translation: 7. What solution are you looking for? Maybe I'll be able to help you.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Jeśli coś mi się nie spodoba, po prostu będę się trzymać od tego z daleka.
english: If I don't like anything, I'll simply stay away from it.
glossary: to stay away from sth
translation: 8. If I don't like something, I'll just stay away from it.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Nie martw się. Nie wystawię cię.
english: Don't worry. I won't stand you up.
glossary: to worry/to stand sb up
translation: 9. Don't worry. I'm not going to expose you.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Jakie środki podjął rząd, aby zapobiec epidemii?
english: What measures did the government take to prevent the epidemic?
glossary: to take measures to do sth/to prevent sth
translation: 10. What measures has the government taken to prevent the epidemic?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Co się stało? Byłam pewna, że się pobierzecie.
english: What happened? I was sure you'd get married.
glossary: to happen/to be sure/to get married
translation: 1. What happened? I was sure you were going to get married.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Miałeś pozbyć się wszystkich dowodów. Czy to naprawdę było takie trudne?
english: You were supposed to get rid of all the evidence. Was it really that hard?
glossary: to get rid of sth/evidence
translation: 2. You had to get rid of all the evidence. Was it really that hard?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Muszę zacząć jeszcze raz.
english: I have to start over.
glossary: to start over
translation: 3. I have to start again.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Nie powinienem był robić takiego bałaganu. Przepraszam.
english: I shouldn't have made such a mess. I'm sorry.
glossary: to make a mess
translation: 4. I should not have made such a mess. Excuse me.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Dlaczego były prezydent ustąpił? Czy było to związane z problemami finansowymi firmy?
english: Why did the former president step down? Was it related to the company's financial problems?
glossary: a former president/to step down from a position/to be related to sth/to have financial problems
translation: 5. Why did the former president step down? Was it related to the company's financial problems?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Powinnaś zachęcać dzieciaki, żeby się rozwijały.
english: You should encourage your kids to develop.
glossary: to develop/to encourage sb to do sth
translation: 6. You should encourage kids to grow.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Dlaczego powinienem cię posłuchać?
english: Why should I listen to you?
glossary: to listen to sb
translation: 7. Why should I listen to you?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Na co ostatecznie zgodził się twój zespół?
english: What did your team eventually agree on?
glossary: to agree on sth
translation: 8. What did your team ultimately agree to?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Mogłeś wcześniej zadzwonić. Powiedziałabym Ci, że nie ma mnie w domu.
english: You could've called before. I would've told you I wasn't at home.
glossary: to be at home/to call sb
translation: 9. You may have called earlier. I would tell you I'm not home.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Byłbyś bardziej zaangażowany w swoje obowiązki, gdybyś był na prowizji.
english: You'd be more engaged in your duties if you were on commission.
glossary: to be engaged in sth/to be on commission
translation: 10. You would be more involved in your responsibilities if you were on commission.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Miałeś pozbyć się wszystkich dowodów. Czy to naprawdę było takie trudne?
english: You were supposed to get rid of all the evidence. Was it really that hard?
glossary: to get rid of sth/evidence
translation: 1. You were supposed to get rid of all the evidence. Was it really so difficult?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Na co ostatecznie zgodził się twój zespół?
english: What did your team eventually agree on?
glossary: to agree on sth
translation: 2. What did your team finally agree for?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Nigdy nie odrabiasz pracy domowej. Chcesz skończyć jak twój ojciec?
english: You never do your homework. Do you want to end up like your father?
glossary: to do your homework/to end up like sb
translation: 3. You’re never doing your homework. Do you want to end up like your father?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Książka mnie usypia. Muszę przeczytać coś bardziej trzymającego w napięciu.
english: The book makes me sleep. I need to read something more suspenseful.
glossary: to make sb sleep/to be suspenseful
translation: 4. The book made me sleepy. I have to read something more gripping.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Od jak dawna wycieka olej? Musisz oddać swój samochód do naprawy.
english: How long has the oil been leaking? You need to get your car fixed.
glossary: to leak/to get your car fixed
translation: 5. How long is the oil leaking? You have to service your car.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Dlaczego zarwałeś noc? Nie mogłeś uczyć się rano?
english: Why did you pull an all-nighter? Couldn't you study in the morning?
glossary: to pull an all-nighter
translation: 6. Why did you..?… Did you not learn in the morning?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Moja dziewczyna zmusiła mnie do uczenia się angielskiego. Jestem jej za to wdzięczny.
english: My girlfriend made me learn English. I'm grateful to her for that.
glossary: to make sb learn English/to be grateful to sb for sth
translation: 7. My girlfriend made me learn English. I’m grateful to her for that.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Mój mąż sprawia, że ​​czuję się wyjątkowo. Zawsze upewnia się, że dostaję to, czego chcę.
english: My husband makes me feel special. He always makes sure I get what I want.
glossary: to make sb do sth
translation: 8. My husband makes me feel…?.. He always makes sure that I get what I want.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Na czym zależy twojemu synowi? Jeśli to odkryjesz, będziesz mógł go zmotywować.
english: What does your son care about? If you discover it, you'll be able to motivate him.
glossary: to care about sth/to discover sth/to motivate sb
translation: 9. What does your son care about? If you discover it you will be able to motivate him.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Za co nauczyciel cię ochrzanił?
english: What for did the teacher tell you off?
glossary: to tell sb off/a teacher
translation: 10. What does your teacher tell you off for?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Słyszałam wczoraj, że wygrałeś zawody.
english: I heard yesterday that you'd won a competition.
glossary: to win a competition
translation: I heard yesterday that you won the race.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Jest jeszcze kilka wiadomości, na które muszę odpowiedzieć.
english: There are still a few messages I have to reply to.
glossary: to reply to a message
translation: There is still some messages I need to answer.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Kiedy dotarłem do domu, żona już wyszła.
english: When I got home, my wife had already left.
glossary: to leave/to get home/a wife
translation: When I got home, my wife had already left.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Czy jest coś, co powinienem wiedzieć, zanim wykonam ten telefon?
english: Is there anything I should know before making the call?
glossary: to make a call/to know sth
translation: Is there anything I should know before I make this phone call?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: O czym była twoje ostatnia książka?
english: What was your last book about?
glossary: a book about sth
translation: What was your last book about?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Policja by nas nie aresztowała, gdybyś nie zachowywał się podejrzanie.
english: The police wouldn't have arrested us if you hadn't behaved suspiciously.
glossary: to behave suspiciously/to arrest sb/the police
translation: The police wouldn't have arrested us if you hadn't been acting suspiciously.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Będzie mi przykro, jeśli ze mną nie zatańczysz.
english: I'll be sorry if you don't dance with me.
glossary: to dance with sb/to be sorry
translation: I'll be sorry if you don't dance with me.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Chciałbym porozmawiać z tobą o odchudzaniu się.
english: I'd like to talk to you about losing weight.
glossary: to lose weight/I'd like to.../to talk about sth
translation: I would like to talk to you about losing weight.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Jeszcze nie potwierdziłem spotkania.
english: I haven't confirmed the meeting yet.
glossary: to confirm a meeting
translation: I haven't confirmed the meeting yet.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Moi rodzice nie mieliby nic przeciwko naszemu związkowi, gdybyś miał stały dochód.
english: My parents wouldn't have anything against our relationship if you had a steady income.
glossary: to have a steady income/to have nothing against sth/a parent/a relationship
translation: My parents wouldn't mind our relationship if you had a regular budget.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Jak długo wkuwasz do egzaminu? Ja nawet jeszcze nie zacząłem.
english: How long have you been cramming for the exam? I haven't even started yet.
glossary: to cram for the exam
translation: How long have you been studying for an exam? I haven’t started it over yet.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Jakich zasad musi przestrzegać moja firma, aby otrzymać dotację?
english: What rules does my company have to comply with to receive the subsidy?
glossary: to comply with sth/a subsidy
translation: What rules my company should meet to achieve a donation?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Jaki wpływ miał na Ciebie wypadek?
english: What impact did the accident have on you?
glossary: to have an impact on sb/an accident
translation: What influence the accident was on you?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Nauczyciel miał kupić płótno. Jak mam teraz malować?
english: The teacher was supposed to buy canvas. How am I supposed to paint now?
glossary: canvas/to paint
translation: The teacher should’ve bought a paper. How can I painting now?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Od czego zależy sukces?
english: What does success depend on?
glossary: to depend on sth/a success
translation: What the success depends on?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Nigdy mnie nie słuchasz. Jak mamy się komunikować?
english: You never listen to me. How are we supposed to communicate?
glossary: to listen to sb/to communicate
translation: You never listen to me. How can we communicate to each other?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Zawsze pracujesz do późna. Nie zależy ci na swojej rodzinie?
english: You're always working late. Don't you care about your family?
glossary: to work late/to care about your family
translation: You always work late. Don’t you care about your family?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Mamy nadzieję, że nasz film pomoże społeczeństwu uświadomić sobie problem przemocy domowej.
english: We hope that our movie will help society realize the problem of domestic violence.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to realize sth/domestic violence
translation: We hope that our movie help society to realize the home violence problem.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Zawsze przeceniasz swoje umiejętności i później wpadamy w kłopoty.
english: You're always overestimating your abilities, and then we get in trouble.
glossary: to overestimate sth/to get in trouble
translation: You always overestimate your skills and we will be in trouble later.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Czego Twój ojciec nie pochwala?
english: What doesn't your father approve of?
glossary: to approve of sth
translation: What your father doesn’t appreciate?

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Czułbym się teraz źle, gdybym wyrzucił te stare ubrania, zamiast oddać je na cele dobroczynne.
english: I'd feel bad now if I'd thrown out the old clothes instead of giving them to charity.
glossary: to feel bad/to throw away your clothes/to give sth to charity
translation: I would feel bad now if I would throw away these old clothes instead of donating them to a charity.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Gdybyś rzeczywiście miał odrę, miałbyś również wysypkę.
english: If you really had measles, you'd also have a rash.
glossary: to have measles/to have a rash
translation: If you did have measles, you would also have a rash.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Miałaś w zeszłym tygodniu lekcję angielskiego?
english: Did you have the English class last week?
glossary: to have an English class/last week
translation: Did you have an English lesson last week?

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Rzuciłabyś mnie, gdybym cię nie przeprosił?
english: Would you have broken up with me if I hadn't apologized to you?
glossary: to break up with sb/to apologize to sb for sth
translation: Would you break up with me if i didn't apologize to you.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Nie uderzyłbym cię w twarz, gdybyś mnie nie sprowokował.
english: I wouldn't have punched you in the face if you hadn't provoked me.
glossary: to punch sb in the face/to provoke sb
translation: I wouldn't have hit you in the face if you hadn't provoked me.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Co chcesz, żebym ci powiedział?
english: What do you want me to tell you?
glossary: to tell sb sth
translation: What would you like me to tell you?

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Gdybym pościelił dziś rano łóżko, mama by się na mnie nie wkurzyła.
english: If I'd made the bed this morning, my mom wouldn't have gotten mad at me.
glossary: to make the bed/this morning/to get mad at sb
translation: If I made my bed this morning, my mom wouldn't be pissed at me.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Nigdy nie ćpałem i nie pochwalam tego.
english: I've never done drugs and I don't approve of it.
glossary: to do drugs/to approve of sth
translation: I’ve never taken drugs, and I don’t approve of it.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Zwykle ćwiczę, słuchając jednocześnie muzyki.
english: I usually exercise listening to music at the same time.
glossary: to exercise/to listen to music/at the same time
translation: I usually exercise listening to the music

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Gdybyśmy przestali używać konserwantów, mielibyśmy więcej klientów.
english: If we stopped using preservatives, we'd have more customers.
glossary: a preservative/a customer
translation: If we stopped use preservatives we would have more clients.

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Nie powinienem był robić takiego bałaganu. Przepraszam.
english: I shouldn't have made such a mess. I'm sorry.
glossary: to make a mess
translation: 1. I’ve shouldn’t done such a mess. I’m sorry.

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Jestem głodny. Mogłem zjeść śniadanie.
english: I'm hungry. I could've eaten breakfast.
glossary: to be hungry/to eat breakfast
translation: 2. I’m hungry. I could’ve had breakfast.

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Mogłem biec szybciej. Zdążyłbym na pociąg.
english: I could've run faster. I would've caught the train.
glossary: to run fast/to catch the train
translation: 3. I could’ve run faster. I would catch the trian.

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Jechałeś bardzo szybko. Bałem się, że będziemy mieli wypadek.
english: You drove very fast. I was afraid we'd have an accident.
glossary: to drive/to be afraid/to have an accident
translation: 4. You droved very fast. I was afraid that we’ve had a car accident.

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Jutro jedziemy do centrum na zakupy. Chcesz coś?
english: We're going shopping downtown tomorrow. Do you want anything?
glossary: to go shopping/to go downtown
translation: 5. We’re going to shopping downtown tomorrow. Would you like anything?

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Co się stało? Byłem pewien, że będziesz się trzymać planu.
english: What happened? I was sure you'd stick to the plan.
glossary: to happen/to be sure/to stick to the plan
translation: 6. What happend? I was sure that you would stick to the plan.

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Moja najlepsza przyjaciółka wychodzi za mąż w przyszłym tygodniu.
english: My best friend's getting married next week.
glossary: to get married/next week
translation: 7. My best friend is getting married next week.

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Nie pracuję jutro, więc możemy jechać nad jezioro.
english: I'm not working tomorrow, so we can go to the lake.
glossary: to work/to go to the lake/tomorrow
translation: 8. I’m not working tomorrow so we could go to the lake.

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że się zaprzyjaźnimy.
english: I hoped we'd make friends.
glossary: to hope/to make friends
translation: 9.I was right, that we’ve become friends.

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Ile osób jest w Twoim zespole?
english: How many people are there on your team?
glossary: on the team
translation: 10. How many people are in your team?

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Kilka tygodni temu dowiedziałem się, że moja żona była już raz mężatką.
english: I found out a few weeks ago that my wife had already been married once.
glossary: to be married/to find sth out/a few weeks ago/a wife
translation: 1. A few weeks ago I found out that my wife had already been married once.

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Już miałam wychodzić, gdy pojawił się szef i powiedział, że potrzebuje, żebym została godzinę dłużej w pracy.
english: I was about to leave when my boss showed up and said he needed me to stay at work an hour longer.
glossary: to be about to do sth/to leave/to show up/to stay at work longer
translation: 2. I was  to leave when the boss showed up and said he needed me to stay an hour longer at work.

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Dlaczego znów wydałeś tyle pieniędzy na niepotrzebne rzeczy?
english: Why did you spend so much money on unnecessary things again?
glossary: to spend money on sth/unnecessary things
translation: 3.  Why did you spend so much money on unnecessary things again?

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Moje życie się zmieniło po tym, jak zostałem zwolniony.
english: My life changed after I'd gotten fired.
glossary: a life/to change/to get fired
translation: 4. My life  changed after  I was fired

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Czytałbym więcej książek, gdybym nie był ciągle zmęczony.
english: I would read more books if I weren't constantly tired.
glossary: to read a book/to be tired/to be constantly tired
translation: 5. I would  read more books if I wasn’t still  tired

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Gdybym w zeszłym roku więcej trenowała, byłabym teraz w formie.
english: If I'd worked out more last year, I'd be in shape now.
glossary: to work out/to be in shape
translation: 6. If I trained more last year, I would be in shape now.

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Czy jest tu ktoś zainteresowany tym tematem?
english: Is there anyone here interested in the subject?
glossary: to be interested in a subject
translation: 7. Is there anyone here interested in this topic?

name: Theresa Fine
polish: O czym przeważnie pisze prasa?
english: What does the press mostly write about?
glossary: the press/to write about sth/mostly
translation: 8. What does the press mostly write about?

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Jeśli teraz nie opowiesz mi o swoim problemie, nie będę w stanie ci pomóc.
english: If you don't tell me about your problem now, I won't be able to help you.
glossary: to tell about sth/to be able to do sth/to help sb/a problem
translation: 9. If don’t tell me about your problem now I won’t be able help you

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Nieznajomy opluł mnie, kiedy przechodziłem przez ulicę.
english: A stranger spat at me when I was crossing the street.
glossary: to cross the street/a stranger/to spit at sb
translation: 10. A stranger spat on me as I crossed the street.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Kilka tygodni temu dowiedziałem się, że moja żona była już raz mężatką.

polish: Dlaczego znów wydałeś tyle pieniędzy na niepotrzebne rzeczy?

polish: Moje życie się zmieniło po tym, jak zostałem zwolniony.

translation: 5. I would read more books if I wasn't still tired.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Gdybym w zeszłym roku więcej trenowała, byłabym teraz w formie.

polish: Czy jest tu ktoś zainteresowany tym tematem?

polish: O czym przeważnie pisze prasa?

english: If you don't tell me about your problem now, I won't be able to help you.

english: A stranger spat at me when I was crossing the street.
