translation: 10. A stranger spat on me when I crossed the street.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Na co się patrzysz?
english: What are you looking at?
glossary: to look at sth
translation: What are you looking at?

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Nudziło mi się wczoraj w pracy, bo nie było nic do roboty.
english: I was bored at work yesterday because there was nothing to do.
glossary: to be bored/at work/to have nothing to do
translation: I was bored in my work yesterday, because there was nothing to do

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Mogłaś mnie wczoraj odwiedzić, skoro byłaś w mieście.
english: You could've visited me yesterday since you were in town.
glossary: to visit sb/to be in town
translation: You could have visited me yesterday when you were in town

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Obiecałaś, że zrobisz mi dzisiaj włosy.
english: You promised you'd do my hair today.
glossary: to promise sb sth; to promise to sb/to do your hair/today
translation: I promised you did my hair today

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Z kogo się śmiejesz?
english: Who are you laughing at?
glossary: to laugh at sb
translation: Who are you laughing from?

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Miałam nadzieję, że nie będę miała dzisiaj kaca.
english: I hoped I wouldn't have a hangover today.
glossary: to hope/to have a hangover/today
translation: I hoped I wouldn’t have a hangover today.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Nie miałem tego na myśli. Nie powinnaś była brać tego osobiście.
english: I didn't mean it. You shouldn't have taken it personally.
glossary: to mean sth/to take sth personally
translation: I didn’t mean that. You shouldn’t have took it personally.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Jestem pewien, że schudnę do lata.
english: I'm sure I'll lose weight by summer.
glossary: to be sure/to lose weight/by summer
translation: I’m sure I’ll lose weight by summer.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Nie powinniśmy byli się kłócić. To nie miało sensu.
english: We shouldn't have argued. It didn't make sense.
glossary: to argue with sb/to make sense
translation: We shouldn’t have had an argument. It didn’t make sense.

name: Camille Tyner
polish: Stresuję się, bo w przyszłym tygodniu jadę za granicę, a nie mówię dobrze po angielsku.
english: I'm stressed out because I'm going abroad next week and I don't speak English well.
glossary: to speak English well/to go abroad/next week
translation: I’m stressed out  because next month I’m going abroad, but I don’t speak English well.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Nie musisz mieć wyrzutów sumienia.
english: You don't need to have remorse.
glossary: to have remorse
translation: You don't need to feel guilty.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Zerzygałam się na ostatniej imprezie. Żenada.
english: I threw up at the last party. Pathetic.
glossary: to throw up/at the party/to be pathetic
translation: I threw up at the last party. Embarrassment.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Obiecuję, że następnym razem będę się lepiej zachowywał.
english: I promise I'll behave better next time.
glossary: to behave/next time/to promise sb sth; to promise sth to sb
translation: I promise to behave better next time.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Nie możesz się tak gapić na ludzi.
english: You can't stare at people like that.
glossary: to stare at sb
translation: You can't stare at people like that.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Wczoraj lekarz przepisał mi leki przeciwbólowe.
english: The doctor prescribed me painkillers yesterday.
glossary: a doctor/to prescribe sb painkillers
translation: The doctor prescribed me some painkillers yesterday.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: W przyszłym roku kończę studia. Nie mogę się doczekać.
english: I'm graduating from college next year. I can't wait.
glossary: to graduate from college/can't wait
translation: I'm  finishing my studies next year. I can't wait.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Powinnaś mnie lepiej traktować.
english: You should treat me better.
glossary: to treat sb well
translation: You should treat me better.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Dziś wieczorem nie ćwiczę. Muszę odpocząć.
english: I'm not working out tonight. I have to rest.
glossary: to work out/to rest
translation: I'm not working out tonight. I need to rest.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Musisz przyznać, że mam rację.
english: You have to admit that I'm right.
glossary: to admit sth/to be right
translation: You have to admit I'm right.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Jestem pewien, że się pojawię na imprezie.
english: I'm sure I'll show up at the party.
glossary: to be sure about sth/to show up/at the party/I'm sure that.../to show up at the party
translation: I'm sure I'll be at the party.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Jest kilka osób, które chcą zapisać się na kurs.
english: There are a few people who want to sign up for the course.
glossary: to sign up for a course
translation: There are a few people who want to sign in the course.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Napiszę do ciebie, jak już będę mieć wolne.
english: I'll text you once I have a day off.
glossary: to have a day off/to text sb/once {2}
translation: I will text you when I'm free.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Od dawna tu pracuję.
english: I've been working here for a long time.
glossary: to work
translation: I've been working here for long time.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Poprosiłeś rodziców o pomoc?
english: Did you ask your parents for help?
glossary: to ask sb for help
translation: Did you ask your parents for help?

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Mogę porozmawiać z odpowiednią osobą, jeśli chcesz.
english: I can talk to the right person if you want.
glossary: to want sth/to talk to sb/the right person
translation: I can speak with the right person if you want.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Wieczorem idę na zakupy. Chcesz coś?
english: I'm going shopping in the evening. Do you want anything?
glossary: to go shopping
translation: I’m going to shopping tonight. Do you need something?

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Może nie będę mieć w następnym tygodniu dużo pracy.
english: Maybe I won't have much work next week.
glossary: to have much work/Maybe.../next week
translation: Maybe I won't have a lot of work next week.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Byłem pewien, że będę zmotywowany do nauki angielskiego.
english: I was sure I'd be motivated to learn English.
glossary: to be sure/to learn English/to be motivated to do sth
translation: I was sure that I would be motivated to lern English.

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Dlaczego rzuciłaś angielski?
english: Why did you give up English?
glossary: to give up English
translation: Why did you quit English?

name: Agnes Parker
polish: Obiecuję, że podrzucę dzieci jutro do szkoły.
english: I promise I'll drop off the kids at school tomorrow.
glossary: to drop off the kids at school
translation: I promise to drop off the children to school tomorrow.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie martw się. Nic nie poszło jeszcze źle.
english: Don't worry. Nothing has gone wrong yet.
glossary: to go wrong/to worry
translation: Don’t worry. Nothing went wrong.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie mamy wystarczająco jedzenia dla wszystkich gości. Musisz iść do sklepu.
english: We don't have enough food for all the guests. You have to go to the store.
glossary: food/a guest/to go to the store
translation: We don’t have enough food for all guests. You have to go to the store.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Byłabyś dobrze poinformowana, gdybyś regularnie oglądała wiadomości.
english: You'd be well-informed if you regularly watched the news.
glossary: to be well-informed/to watch the news/to do sth regularly
translation: You would be informed enough if you watch the news regularly.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie chcę, żeby moi uczniowie ściągali na teście.
english: I don't want my students to cheat on the test.
glossary: to cheat on the test
translation: I don’t want my students to cheat on the test.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Zmarnowałam rok życia, płacząc po ostatnim zerwaniu.
english: I wasted a year of my life crying after the last breakup.
glossary: to waste your time/life/to cry/a breakup
translation: I wasted a year of my life crying after the last break up.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Na szczęście wujek nie miał udaru. Tylko zemdlał.
english: Fortunately, my uncle didn't have a stroke. He only fainted.
glossary: Fortunately.../an uncle/to have a stroke/to faint
translation: Fortunetly the uncle didn’t have  … He only passed out.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Chciałabym, żeby moje dzieci poszły na studia.
english: I'd like my kids to go to college.
glossary: to go to college
translation: I’d like my children to go to college.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Chciałbym, żeby mój szef mi ufał.
english: I'd like my boss to trust me.
glossary: to trust sb/a boss
translation: I’d like my boss to trust me.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie zasnęłabym wczoraj, gdybym nie wzięła tych tabletek.
english: I wouldn't have fallen asleep yesterday if I hadn't taken the pills.
glossary: to fall asleep/to take pills
translation: I wouldn't have fallen asleep yesterday if I hadn’t taken these drugs.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Możemy porozmawiać? Nie miałem wczoraj szansy, żeby cię przeprosić.
english: Can we talk? I didn't have a chance yesterday to apologize to you.
glossary: to talk/to have the chance to do sth/to apologize to sb
translation: Can we talk? I couldn't have a chance to apologize to you.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Nie powinienem był robić takiego bałaganu. Przepraszam.
english: I shouldn't have made such a mess. I'm sorry.
glossary: to make a mess
translation: 1.	I shouldn’t do such a mess. I’m sorry.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Jestem głodny. Mogłem zjeść śniadanie.
english: I'm hungry. I could've eaten breakfast.
glossary: to be hungry/to eat breakfast
translation: 2.	I’m hungry. I could ‘ve had breakfast.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Mogłem biec szybciej. Zdążyłbym na pociąg.
english: I could've run faster. I would've caught the train.
glossary: to run fast/to catch the train
translation: 3.	I could run faster. I would catch the train.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Jechałeś bardzo szybko. Bałem się, że będziemy mieli wypadek.
english: You drove very fast. I was afraid we'd have an accident.
glossary: to drive/to be afraid/to have an accident
translation: 4.	You drove very fast. I was afraid we would have an accident.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Jutro jedziemy do centrum na zakupy. Chcesz coś?
english: We're going shopping downtown tomorrow. Do you want anything?
glossary: to go shopping/to go downtown
translation: 5.	We are going downtown for shopping tomorrow. Do you want anything?

name: Paul Cook
polish: Co się stało? Byłem pewien, że będziesz się trzymać planu.
english: What happened? I was sure you'd stick to the plan.
glossary: to happen/to be sure/to stick to the plan
translation: 6.	What happened? I was sure you would catch the plan.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Moja najlepsza przyjaciółka wychodzi za mąż w przyszłym tygodniu.
english: My best friend's getting married next week.
glossary: to get married/next week
translation: 7.	My best friend is getting married next week.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Nie pracuję jutro, więc możemy jechać nad jezioro.
english: I'm not working tomorrow, so we can go to the lake.
glossary: to work/to go to the lake/tomorrow
translation: 8.	I’m not working tomorrow so we can go to the lake.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że się zaprzyjaźnimy.
english: I hoped we'd make friends.
glossary: to hope/to make friends
translation: 9.	I hoped we would make friends.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Ile osób jest w Twoim zespole?
english: How many people are there on your team?
glossary: on the team
translation: 10.	How many people are there in your team?

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Zmarnowałem godzinę, czekając na ciebie na zewnątrz.
english: I wasted an hour waiting for you outside.
glossary: to waste your time/to wait for sb/outside
translation: I wasted an hour waiting for you outside.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Leżelibyśmy teraz na plaży, gdyby nasz lot nie został odwołany.
english: We'd be lying on the beach now if our flight hadn't been canceled.
glossary: to lie on the beach/to cancel a flight
translation: We would lay on the beach now if our flight hadn’t been canceled.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Dobrze się wczoraj bawiłaś ze znajomymi?
english: Did you have a good time with your friends yesterday?
glossary: to have a good time
translation: Did you you have a good time with your friends yesterday?

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Jak dotąd policja zatrzymała jedną osobę podejrzaną o dokonanie kradzieży.
english: So far the police have detained one person suspected of committing the theft.
glossary: the police/to detain sb/to be suspected of sth/to commit theft
translation: The police have detained one person suspected ………… so far.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Nie byłbyś teraz spłukany, gdybyś nie imprezował w zeszły weekend.
english: You wouldn't be broke now if you hadn't partied last weekend.
glossary: to be broke/to party/last weekend
translation: You wouldn’t be broken know if you hadn’t been ….. last weekend.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Łatwiej byłoby mi dojeżdżać do pracy, gdybym mieszkał w mieście.
english: It would be easier for me to commute to work if I lived in the city.
glossary: to commute to work/to live in the city
translation: It would be easier for me to commute to work if I lived in town.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Mogłybyśmy ćwiczyć razem, gdybyś też się zapisała na zajęcia z jogi.
english: We could exercise together if you signed up for yoga classes too.
glossary: to exercise/to sign up for yoga classes
translation: We could ……..together if you singed up for yoga classes too.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Dlaczego nie chcesz, żeby twoje dzieci uczyły się angielskiego?
english: Why don't you want your kids to learn English?
glossary: to learn English
translation: Why don’t you want your kids to learn English?

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Zrobiłabym panu teraz zastrzyk, gdyby się pan tak nie trząsł.
english: I'd give you an injection now if you didn't tremble so much.
glossary: to give sb an injection/to tremble

name: Peter Kane

name: Peter Kane

name: Peter Kane

name: Peter Kane
polish: Nie możesz mnie okłamywać.

name: Peter Kane

english: I hope I'll save some money this month.

name: Matt Xander

name: Matt Xander

glossary: to get painkillers

name: Matt Xander

glossary: a jail; a prison/an inmate/currently

name: Sergius Birch

polish: Byłam pewna, że wyjaśnimy sytuację.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że się zaprzyjaźnimy.

glossary: to hope/to make friends

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Mama nie byłaby teraz zła, gdybyś nie rozlał kawy na obrus.

glossary: to be mad/to spill coffee/a tablecloth

polish: Nie wychodź teraz z domu, bo jest zbyt gorąco.

glossary: to leave the house

english: I broke my mom's cell phone. I don't know what I should do now.

name: Michael Stewart

glossary: to leave

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Mogłem zostać w domu, bo nie ma tu nic do roboty.

glossary: to stay at home/to have nothing to do

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Gdzie byłeś? Nie mogłem cię znaleźć.
english: Where were you? I couldn't find you.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Nie zapłaciłam rachunków w zeszłym miesiącu, bo nie miałam żadnych pieniędzy.

glossary: to pay the bills

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Zawsze ci pomogę, bo jesteś siostrą mojej żony.
english: I'll always help you because you're my wife's sister.
glossary: to help sb
translation: 9. I'll always help you because you're my wife's sister.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Byłam pewna, że spędzimy razem więcej czasu.

glossary: to be sure that.../to spend time with sb

name: Anna Forney

glossary: to worry/to help sb with a problem

english: I asked my mom to go shopping with me last week.

english: I found a private tutor for my children yesterday.

name: Anna Forney

english: I promise I'll be nice to your husband this time.
glossary: to be nice to sb/to promise that.../this time/a husband
translation: 7. I promise, I’ll be nice to your husband this time.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Niestety nie mogę ci polecić żadnego interesującego filmu.
english: Unfortunately, I can't recommend any interesting movie to you.
glossary: Unfortunately.../to recommend sth to sb/an interesting movie
translation: 8. Unfortunately, I can’t recommend any interesting movie to you.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Musisz spróbować być mniej zazdrosna.
english: You have to try to be less jealous.
glossary: to be jealous/more or less
translation: 9. You have to try to be less jealous.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Powinieneś trenować więcej, żeby być w formie.
english: You should work out more to be in shape.
glossary: to work out/to be in shape
translation: 10. You should work out more to be in shape.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Jakiej muzyki zwykle słucha twój mąż?
english: What music does your husband usually listen to?
glossary: to listen to music
translation: 1. What music does your husband usually listen to?

name: Yvonne West
polish: Zawsze przeglądasz Facebooka, kiedy chcę z tobą porozmawiać.
english: You're always scrolling Facebook when I want to talk to you.
glossary: to scroll Facebook/to want to do sth/to talk to sb
translation: 2. You’re always scrolling Facebook whan I want to talk with you.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Jaki temat omawialiście dzisiaj w klasie?
english: What subject did you cover in class today?
glossary: to cover a subject/to do sth in class
translation: 3. What subject were you discussing in class today?

name: Yvonne West
polish: O czym zarząd nie wie?
english: What doesn't the management board know about?
glossary: to know about sth/a management board
translation: 4. What the management doesn’t know about?

name: Yvonne West
polish: W czym specjalizuje się uczelnia?
english: What does the university specialize in?
glossary: to specialize in sth
translation: 5. What does the university specialize in?

name: Yvonne West
polish: Film był niesamowity. Był taki wzruszający. Dosłownie sprawił, że się rozpłakałem.
english: The movie was amazing. It was so touching. It literally made me cry.
glossary: to make sb do sth/literally/to be touching
translation: 6. The move was amazing. It was so moving. It made my cry.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Na co zwykle narzeka zarząd?
english: What does the board usually complain about?
glossary: to complain about sth
translation: 7. What the management does complain about?

name: Yvonne West
polish: Mój biznes miał prosperować. Przynajmniej taki był plan.
english: My business was supposed to thrive. At least, that was the plan.
glossary: to thrive
translation: 8. My business was supposed to prosper. At least, that was the plan.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Jak długo wątpisz w nasz projekt? Myślałem, że w niego wierzysz.
english: How long have you been doubting our project? I thought you believed in it.
glossary: to doubt sth/to believe in sth
translation: 9. Why are you doubting our project? I thought, you belived in it.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Nigdy nie zabierasz mnie do restauracji. Czy w ogóle mnie lubisz?
english: You never take me to any restaurants. Do you even like me?
glossary: to take sb to a restaurant/to like sb
translation: 10. You never take me to the restaurant. Do you like me at all?

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Po tym, jak zrobiłeś zupę, wszyscy rzygaliśmy.
english: After you'd made the soup, we all threw up.
glossary: to make soup/to throw up
translation: 1. After you made a soup, we all threw up.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Czy jest coś, co mogę polepszyć, żeby być bardziej wydajnym, gdy się uczę?
english: Is there anything I can improve to be more efficient while studying?
glossary: to improve sth/to be efficient/to study sth
translation: 2. Is there anything what I can improve to be more efficient when I’m learning.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Zjadłabym dużo więcej na weselu, gdybym nie przeszła na dietę parę dni wcześniej,
english: I would've eaten much more at the wedding party if I hadn't gone on a diet a couple of days before.
glossary: a wedding party/to go on a diet/a couple of days
translation: 3. I would have eaten much more during the wedding reception if I hadn’t gone on a diet a few days earlier.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Mimo że kolega powiedział, że jego pies nie jest niebezpieczny, bałam się go pogłaskać.
english: Even though my friend said his dog wasn't dangerous, I was afraid to pet it.
glossary: even though/a friend/a dangerous dog/to pet a dog
translation: 4. Although my friend said that his dog wasn’t dangerous, I was afraid to stroke him.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Gdybyś nie był zapominalski, cały zespół nie musiałby teraz pracować.
english: If you weren't forgetful, the whole team wouldn't have to work now.
glossary: to be forgetful/the whole team/to work
translation: 5. If you weren’t forgetful, the whole team wouldn’t have to work now.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Jeśli nasza firma otworzy nową filię, wszyscy zrobimy się zajęci.
english: If our company opens a new branch, we'll all get busy.
glossary: to open a new branch/a branch/to get busy
translation: 6. If our company opens a new subsidiary , we’ll all be busy.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Dlaczego zaparkowałeś tak daleko od galerii?
english: Why did you park so far away from the mall?
glossary: to park your car/to be far away from sth/a mall
translation: 7. Why did you park so far from gallery?

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Tak szybko jechałem na rowerze, że nie zorientowałem się, że przejechałem znak stop.
english: I was riding a bike so fast that I didn't realize I had run a stop sign.
glossary: to ride a bike/to realize that.../to run a stop sign
translation: 8. I was riding my bike so fast that I didn’t realize that I had crossed a stop sign.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Widzę, że restauracja ci się nie podoba. Z czym masz problem?
english: I see that you don't like the restaurant. What do you have a problem with?
glossary: to have a problem with sth/a restaurant
translation: 9. I can see  that you don’t like the restaurant. What is the problem with?

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Powiedziałem mamie, że poszedłem do lekarza, bo chciałem ją uspokoić.
english: I told my mom I'd gone to the doctor because I wanted to calm her down.
glossary: to go to the doctor/to calm sb down
translation: 10. I told my mother that I went to the doctor because I wanted to calm her down.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Dlaczego utrudniasz mi życie? Czy nie powinniśmy sobie pomagać?
english: Why are you making my life harder? Shouldn't we help each other?
glossary: to make sb's life harder/to help each other
translation: 1. Why are you making my life difficult? Shouldn’t we help each other?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Wkurzyłeś mnie rano. Myślałem, że wyrzucę cię z domu.
english: You made me mad in the morning. I thought I'd throw you out of the house.
glossary: to make sb mad/to throw sb out of the house
translation: 2. You pissed me off this morning. I thought that I….?…

name: Martin Hale
polish: Moi rodzice zmusili mnie do chodzenia na treningi piłkarskie, kiedy byłem dzieckiem. Dlatego teraz tego nienawidzę.
english: My parents made me go to soccer practice when I was a kid. That's why I hate it now.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to go to soccer practice
translation: 3. My parents had made me go to soccer workouts when I was a child.That’s why I hate them now.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Jak długo próbujesz usunąć tę plamę? Czy myślisz, że zejdzie?
english: How long have you been trying to remove the stain? Do you think it will come out?
glossary: to remove a stain/to come out
translation: 4. How long are you trying to remove this stain? Do you think that it go off?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Z czego zazwyczaj śmieje się twoja córka?
english: What does your daughter usually laugh at?
glossary: to laugh at sth
translation: 5. What does your daughter usually laugh at?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Jak rzeczniczka skomentowała incydent?
english: How did the spokeswoman comment on the incident?
glossary: a spokeswoman/to comment on sth/an incident
translation: 6. How did the spokesperson comment on the incident?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Kierownik zmusił mnie do podpisania dokumentów.
english: The director made me sign the documents.
glossary: to make sb do sth/a director
translation: 7. The manager made me sign up for the documents.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Miałeś skomentować mój post. Zapomniałeś?
english: You were supposed to comment on my post. Did you forget?
glossary: to comment on sth/to forget about sth
translation: 8. You were supposed to comment on my post. Did you forget?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Jakie środki podjął rząd, aby zapobiec epidemii?
english: What measures did the government take to prevent the epidemic?
glossary: to take measures to do sth/to prevent sth
translation: 9. What steps the government made to prevent the epidemic?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Zawsze się lenisz. Zabieraj swój tyłek do pracy!
english: You're always lazing around. Get your ass to work!
glossary: to laze around/to get your ass to work
translation: 10. You are always slacking off. Get your ass to work!

name: Damien Bean
polish: Dziś wieczorem jemy na mieście.
english: We're eating out tonight.
glossary: to eat out/tonight
translation: 1.	Tonight we eat out.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Napisała wczoraj do mnie stara znajoma.
english: An old friend of mine texted me yesterday.
glossary: to text sb/an old friend of mine
translation: 2.	An old friend wrote me yesterday.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Powinnaś być ze mnie dumna.
english: You should be proud of me.
glossary: to be proud of sb
translation: 3.	You should be proud of me.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Nie powinieneś się zapominać.
english: You shouldn't forget yourself.
glossary: to forget yourself
translation: 4.	You shouldn’t forget yourself

name: Damien Bean
polish: Nie możemy zacząć od początku, bo nie mamy czasu.
english: We can't start over because we don't have time.
glossary: to start over/to have time
translation: 5.	We can’t start over because we don’t have a time.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Mam nadzieję, że nadrobisz pracę domową.
english: I hope you'll catch up on your homework.
glossary: to catch up on your homework
translation: 6.	I hope you catch up on your homework.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Obiecuję, że awansujesz w przyszłym roku.
english: I promise you'll get promoted next year.
glossary: to get promoted/next year
translation: 7.	I promise that you will be promoted  next year.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Musimy wyjśnić sytuację.
english: We have to explain the situation.
glossary: to explain the situation
translation: 8.	We have to explain the situation.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Jutro idę na zakupy. Chcesz do mnie dołączyć?
english: I'm going shopping tomorrow. Do you want to join me?
glossary: to go shopping/to join sb
translation: 9.	Tommorow I go shopping. Do you want join me?

name: Damien Bean
polish: Dzwoniła wczoraj do mnie teściowa.
english: My mother-in-law called me yesterday.
glossary: to call sb
translation: 10.	My mother-in-law called me yesterday.

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Od wczoraj czytam tę książkę.
english: I've been reading the book since yesterday.
glossary: to read a book/since yesterday
translation: 1. I' ve been reading this book from yesterday.

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Jak możesz być tak naiwny?
english: How can you be so naive?
glossary: to be naive
translation: 2. How can you be so naive?

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Miałam nadzieję, że przemyślisz swoje zachowanie.
english: I hoped you'd think over your behavior.
glossary: to think over your behavior
translation: 3. I was hoping you would thing over your behavior.

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Jestem pewien, że skończysz studia.
english: I'm sure you'll graduate from college.
glossary: to graduate from college/to be sure
translation: 4. I'm sure you'll graduate from college.

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Kiedy wróciłaś do miasta?
english: When did you get back to town?
glossary: to get back to town
translation: 5. When did you came back to the city?

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Mam nadzieję, że mnie nie zarazisz.
english: I hope you won't infect me.
glossary: to infect sb
translation: 6. I hope you won't infect me.

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Powinieneś przeczytać przynajmniej jedną książkę w miesiącu.
english: You should read at least one book a month.
glossary: to read a book/once a month/at least
translation: 7. You should read at least one book a month.

name: Sergius Birch
polish: W moim biurze jest osoba, która naprawia komputery.
english: There's a person in my office who repairs computers.
glossary: to repair a computer/in your office/a person
translation: 8. There is a person in my office who repairs  the computers.

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Twój ojciec gotuje dziś wieczorem.
english: Your dad's cooking tonight.
glossary: to cook/a dad
translation: 9. Your father is cooking tonight.

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Nauczę się angielskiego, jak już zatrudnię profesjonalnego nauczyciela.
english: I'll learn English once I hire a professional teacher.
glossary: to hire sb/a professional teacher/once {2}
translation: 10. I'll learn English when I employ a professional teacher.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Wynajmowałem mieszkanie z kolegą, zanim kupiłem własny dom.
english: I'd been renting an apartment with a friend before I bought my own house.
glossary: to rent an apartment/your own house/to buy a house
translation: I'd rented an apartment with my friend before I bought an own house.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Do kogo się uśmiechasz?
english: Who are you smiling at?
glossary: to smile at sb
translation: Who are you smiling at?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Jeszcze tego nie przemyślałem.
english: I haven't thought it over yet.
glossary: to think sth over
translation: I haven't thought it over yet.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Może nie byłbyś marudny, gdybyś nie siedział codziennie przed telewizorem.
english: Maybe you wouldn't be moody if you didn't sit in front of the TV every day.
glossary: to be moody/to sit in front of the TV/every day
translation: Maybe you wouldn't be moody if you hadn't sit in front of TV every day.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Żona się pytała, czy zrobię kolację.
english: My wife asked me if I'd make dinner.
glossary: to make dinner
translation: My wife asked me if I'd made dinner.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Rodzice się mnie pytali, czy wziąłem w końcu kredyt.
english: My parents asked me if I'd finally taken out a loan.
glossary: to take out a loan/finally
translation: My parents asked me if I had finally taken a loan.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Gdybyś mnie posłuchał, nie skończyłbyś w szpitalu.
english: If you'd listened to me, you wouldn't have ended up in the hospital.
glossary: to listen to sb/to end up in the hospital
translation: If you had listened to me, you wouldn't have ended up in the hospital.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Dlaczego jest tylu ludzi, którzy żyją w ubóstwie?
english: Why are there so many people who live in poverty?
glossary: to live in poverty
translation: Why are there so many people living in poverty?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Kiedy się zaręczyliście?
english: When did you get engaged?
glossary: to get engaged
translation: Whe did you get engaged?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Nie wygramy sprawy, jeśli nie będziesz zeznawał.
english: We won't win the case if you don't testify.
glossary: to win a case/to testify
translation: We won't win a case if you didn't testify in.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Myślę, że dzisiaj będę pracował po godzinach. Co powiesz na czwartek?
english: I think I'll work overtime today. What about Thursday?
glossary: to work overtime/to meet/today/Thursday/What about.../to think
translation: 1. I think that today I will work overtime. How about Thursday?

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Myśłałem, że zawieziesz mnie do domu. Nie chcę brać taksówki.
english: I thought you'd take me home. I don't want to take a cab.
glossary: to think/to take sb home/to take a cab
translation: 2. I thought you would take me home. I don't want to take a cub.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Idę jutro do banku, żeby założyć konto.
english: I'm going to the bank tomorrow to open an account.
glossary: to go to the bank/to open an account/tomorrow
translation: 3. I'm going to the bank tomorrow to open an account.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Skup się na sprzątaniu pokoju.
english: Focus on cleaning the room.
glossary: to focus on sth/to clean a room
translation: 4. Focus on cleaning the room.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Musisz pamiętać, że jest wyjątek do tej zasady.
english: You have to remember that there's an exception to the rule.
glossary: to remember sth/an exception to the rule
translation: 5. You have to remember that there is exception to this rule.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Chciałabym, żebyś wygłosił przemowę na konferencji.
english: I'd like you to give a speech at the conference.
glossary: to give a speech/at the conference
translation: 6. I would like you to give a speech at the conference.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: W tej grupie jest za dużo ludzi. Znajdę inną.
english: There are too many people in the group. I have to find a different one.
glossary: in the group/to find sth/different
translation: 7. There are too many people in the group. I'm finding another.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Powinienem był od razu cię zwolnić. Nie zasługujesz, żeby tu być.
english: I should've fired you right away. You don't deserve to be here.
glossary: to fire sb/right away/to deserve sth
translation: 8. I should've fired you right away. You don't deserve to be here.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Kiedy zaczynasz nową pracę?
english: When are you starting the new job?
glossary: to start a new job
translation: 9. When you're starting a new job?

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Interesuję się gotowaniem.
english: I'm interested in cooking.
glossary: to be interested in sth/to cook sth
translation: 10. I'm interesed in cooking.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Miałem w zeszłym tygodniu dużo pracy i bałem się, że nie wyrobię się z terminem.
english: I had a lot of work last week and I was afraid I wouldn't meet the deadline.
glossary: to have a lot of work/last week/to be afraid of sth/to meet the deadline
translation: 1. I had a lot of work last week and I was afraid that I wouldn’t meet the deadline.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Nie powinieneś był wspominać o naszych problemach na spotkaniu z szefem.
english: You shouldn't have mentioned our problems at the meeting with the boss.
glossary: at the meeting/to mention sth
translation: 2. You shouldn't have mentioned our problems in your meeting with your boss.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Przyjeżdżam jutro do Warszawy i zatrzymuję się u mojej koleżanki.
english: I'm coming to Warsaw tomorrow and staying at my friend's.
glossary: to come to Warsaw
translation: 3. I am coming to Warsaw tomorrow and I staying with my friend.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Nie powinieneś był opowiadać tego żartu. Był niegrzeczny.
english: You shouldn't have told the joke. It was rude.
glossary: to be rude to sb/to tell sb a joke
translation: 4. You shouldn't have told this joke. He was rude.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że nic nie będę musiał dzisiaj robić.
english: I hoped I wouldn't have to do anything today.
glossary: to hope/today
translation: 5. I was hoping I wouldn't have to do anything today.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Powinienem był spędzić zeszły weekend z rodziną.
english: I should've spent my last weekend with my family.
glossary: to spend time with sb/last weekend/a family
translation: 6. I should have spent last weekend with my family.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Nie powinienem był Ci opowiadać tej historii, bo jest zbyt prywatna.
english: I shouldn't have told you the story because it's too private.
glossary: to tell sb a story/to be private
translation: 7. I shouldn't have told you this story because it's too private.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że ci klienci zostawią większy napiwek.
english: I hoped the customers would leave a bigger tip.
glossary: to leave a tip/a customer/to hope
translation: 8. I was hoping these clients would leave a bigger tip.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Nie powinieneś był mnie okłamywać.
english: You shouldn't have lied to me.
glossary: to lie to sb
translation: 9. You shouldn't have lied to me.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Co robisz dziś wieczorem?
english: What are you doing tonight?
translation: 10. What are you doing tonight?

name: Paul Cook
polish: Dlaczego dzwoniłeś wczoraj do mnie tyle razy?
english: Why did you call me so many times yesterday?
glossary: to call sb/many times
translation: 1.	Why did you call me such many times yesterday?

name: Paul Cook
polish: Z kim wczoraj poszedłeś na imprezę?
english: Who did you go to the party with yesterday?
glossary: to go to a party with sb
translation: 2.	With whom you went to a party yesterday?

name: Paul Cook
polish: Nie powinnaś była składać obietnicy, jeśli wiedziałaś, że jej nie dotrzymasz.
english: You shouldn't have made the promise if you knew you wouldn't keep it.
glossary: to make a promise/to keep a promise
translation: 3.	You shouldn’t make a promise if you knew that you wouldn’t keep it.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Jestem rozczarowana. Byłam pewna, że nie złamiesz obietnicy.
english: I'm disappointed. I was sure you wouldn't break the promise.
glossary: to be disappointed with sth/to be sure/to break a promise
translation: 4.	I’m disappointed. I was sure you wouldn’t break a promise.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Ufam ci, bo od dawna razem pracujemy.
english: I trust you because we've been working together for a long time.
glossary: to trust sb/for a long time
translation: 5.	I trust you because we’ve worked for a long time.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Możemy porozmawiać, bo nie ma tu nikogo.
english: We can talk because there's nobody here.
glossary: to talk about sth
translation: 6.	We can have a conversation because there is nobody here.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Przeprowadzam się w przyszłym miesiącu na wieś. Nie mogę się doczekać.
english: I'm moving to the countryside next month. I can't wait.
glossary: can't wait/to move to the countryside
translation: 7.	I’m moving last month to the countryside. I can’t wait.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Jest kilka książek, które chciałbym przeczytać do końca roku.
english: There are a few books I'd like to read by the end of the year.
glossary: a few/to read a book/by the end of the year
translation: 8.	There are a few books I’d like to read by the end.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Mam nadzieję, że zdążę na pociąg. To ostatni.
english: I hope I'll catch the train. It's the last one.
glossary: to catch the train/to catch the last train
translation: 9.	I hope I’ll catch the train. It’s last one.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Od miesiąca szukam pracy, ale nie ma interesujących ofert.
english: I've been looking for a job for a month, but there are no interesting offers.
glossary: to look for a job/an offer
translation: 10.	I’ve looked for a job for month, but there weren’t any interesting offers.

name: Maya Cook
polish: Dlaczego dzwoniłeś wczoraj do mnie tyle razy?
english: Why did you call me so many times yesterday?
glossary: to call sb/many times
translation: 1.	Why did you call me so many times yesterday?

name: Maya Cook
polish: Z kim wczoraj poszedłeś na imprezę?
english: Who did you go to the party with yesterday?
glossary: to go to a party with sb
translation: 2.	Who did you go to the party with yesterday?

name: Maya Cook
polish: Nie powinnaś była składać obietnicy, jeśli wiedziałaś, że jej nie dotrzymasz.
english: You shouldn't have made the promise if you knew you wouldn't keep it.
glossary: to make a promise/to keep a promise

name: Maya Cook

polish: Jestem głodny. Mogłem zjeść śniadanie.

name: Michael Stewart

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Przeprowadzam się w przyszłym miesiącu na wieś. Nie mogę się doczekać.

english: My husband's picking up the kids from school tomorrow.

translation: 10. My husband is picking up the kids from school tomorrow.

name: Margaret Ford

glossary: to know about sth/a management board

name: Margaret Ford
polish: W czym specjalizuje się uczelnia?

glossary: to specialize in sth

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Film był niesamowity. Był taki wzruszający. Dosłownie sprawił, że się rozpłakałem.

glossary: to make sb do sth/literally/to be touching

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Na co zwykle narzeka zarząd?
english: What does the board usually complain about?
glossary: to complain about sth

name: Margaret Ford

glossary: to thrive

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Jak długo wątpisz w nasz projekt? Myślałem, że w niego wierzysz.
english: How long have you been doubting our project? I thought you believed in it.
glossary: to doubt sth/to believe in sth

name: Margaret Ford

english: You never take me to any restaurants. Do you even like me?
glossary: to take sb to a restaurant/to like sb

name: Agnes Chapman

glossary: to feel bad/to throw away your clothes/to give sth to charity

glossary: to have measles/to have a rash

name: Agnes Chapman

english: Did you have the English class last week?
glossary: to have an English class/last week

glossary: to break up with sb/to apologize to sb for sth

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Gdybym pościelił dziś rano łóżko, mama by się na mnie nie wkurzyła.
english: If I'd made the bed this morning, my mom wouldn't have gotten mad at me.
glossary: to make the bed/this morning/to get mad at sb

name: Agnes Chapman

glossary: to do drugs/to approve of sth

name: Anette Gray

english: If our company hadn't increased its productivity last quarter, it would've gone bankrupt.

glossary: to have good grades/to watch cartoons/all the time

name: Peter Kane

english: Are there any places in the city I should visit?

glossary: to go on vacation/this year

english: I hoped I'd come back home today, but I missed the train.
glossary: to hope/to come back home/today/to miss the train

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Dlaczego tak zareagowałaś? Możesz mi to wytłumaczyć?
english: Why did you react like that? Can you explain it to me?
glossary: to react to sth/like that/to explain sth to sb
translation: 5. Why did you react like that? Can you explain it to me?

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Mogłeś wcześniej zadzwonić. Powiedziałabym Ci, że nie ma mnie w domu.
english: You could've called before. I would've told you I wasn't at home.
glossary: to be at home/to call sb
translation: 6. I could've called earlier. I would've told you I wasn't at home.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Z kim wczoraj rozmawiałeś przez telefon?
english: Who did you talk to on the phone yesterday?
glossary: to talk to sb over the phone
translation: 7. Who did you talk over the phone earlier?

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Idziemy dziś wieczorem na drinka. Pamiętasz?
english: We're going for a drink tonight. Do you remember?
glossary: to remember/to go for a drink/tonight
translation: 8. We are going for a drink this evening. Do you remember?

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Obawiam się, że nie dostanę tej pracy.
english: I'm afraid I won't get the job.
glossary: to be afraid of sth/to get a job
translation: 9. I'm afraid I won't get this job.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Z kim chcesz spędzić resztę swojego życia?
english: Who do you want to spend the rest of your life with?
glossary: to spend time with sb/the rest of your life
translation: 10. Who do you want to spend the rest of your life?

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Dam ci znać, jak już skończę pracę. Będziemy w kontakcie.
english: I'll let you know once I finish work. We'll be in touch.
glossary: to let sb know/to finish work/to be in touch
translation: 1. I let you know when I finish work. We'll be in touch.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Mam dość tego projektu, bo pracuję nad nim od kilku miesięcy.
english: I'm fed up with the project because I've been working on it for a few months.
glossary: to be fed up with sth/to work on a project
translation: 2. I have had enough of this project because I'm working on it for few months.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Ostrzegałam cię, że będzie korek na autostradzie, ale nie chciałeś mnie słuchać.
english: I warned you there would be a traffic jam on the highway, but you didn't want to listen to me.
glossary: to warn sb that.../I've warned you that.../an accident/on the highway/to listen to sb
translation: 3. I've warned you it would be trafić jam on a highway but you wouldn't listened.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Myślę, że będziemy częściej wychodzić razem na miasto, bo przyszłym miesiącu przeprowadzam się do Warszawy.
english: I think we'll hang out together more often because I'm moving to Warsaw next month.
glossary: to go out; to hang out/to move to Warsaw/next month
translation: 4. I think, we'll be going out together because I'm moving to Warsaw next week.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Nie powinnam była na ciebie krzyczeć. Musiałeś czuć się rozczarowany.
english: I shouldn't have shouted at you. You must've felt disappointed.
glossary: to scream at sb; to shout at sb/to feel disappointed
translation: 5. I shouldn't have screamed at you. You must have felt dissapointed.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Przez trzy miesiące w liceum pracowałam jako kelnerka.
english: I worked as a waitress for three months in high school.
glossary: to work as a waitress/in high school
translation: 6.I worked as a waitress for three months in a highschool.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: W pewnym momencie wierzyłem, że wrócimy do siebie.
english: At some point, I believed we'd get back together.
glossary: At some point.../to get back together
translation: 7. At some point I believed we would get back together.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Jakie problemy są w twojej firmie?
english: What problems are there in your company?
glossary: a problem; an issue
translation: 8. What problems are there in your company?

name: Justina Stanley
polish: O kim rozmawiacie?
english: Who are you talking about?
glossary: to talk about sb
translation: 9. Who are you talking about?

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Gdzie zostawiłeś kurtkę?
english: Where did you leave your jacket?
glossary: a jacket/to leave sth
translation: 10. Where did you leave the jacket?

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Moja mama przeszła w zeszłym roku na emeryturę.
english: My mom retired last year.
glossary: to retire/last year
translation: My mother retired last year.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Nie wierzę. Znajomi znowu mnie wystawili.
english: I can't believe it. My friends stood me up again.
glossary: to believe sb/to stand sb up/a friend
translation: I don't believe it. My friends put me up again.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Dawno cię nie widziałam. Musisz wpaść w tym tygodniu.
english: I haven't seen you for a long time. You have to drop by this week.
glossary: to drop by/for a long time/this week
translation: I haven't seen you for a long time. You must come this week.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Nie możesz unikać odpowiedzialności.
english: You can't avoid responsibility.
glossary: to avoid responsibility
translation: You can't avoid responsibility.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Nie możesz się tak zachowywać.
english: You can't behave like that.
glossary: to behave
translation: You can't behave like this.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Nie idę z wami jutro na imprezę. Pracuję na nocną zmianę.
english: I'm not going to the party with you tomorrow. I'm working the night shift.
glossary: to go to a party with sb/to work the night shift
translation: I'm not going to the party with you tomorrow. I work at the night shift.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Nie będę w stanie pojawić się w weekend, bo pracuję.
english: I won't be able to show up on the weekend because I'm working.
glossary: to show up/to work on the weekend/to be able to do sth
translation: I won't be able to show up at the weekend because I'm working.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Mam nadzieję, że nie będę mieć jutro kaca.
english: I hope I won't have a hangover tomorrow.
glossary: to have a hangover
translation: I hope that I don't have a hangover tomorrow.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Musisz mnie przeprosić.
english: You have to apologize to me.
glossary: to apologize to sb
translation: You have to apologize to me.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Pozwę cię. Zobaczysz.
english: I'll sue you. You'll see.
glossary: to sue sb/to see sth
translation: I'll sue you. You will see.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Myślę, że odwiedzę cię w weekend, bo jutro wracam późno do domu.
english: I think I'll visit you on the weekend because I'm coming back home late tomorrow.
glossary: to visit sb/to come back home late
translation: 1.	I think I'll visit you on the weekend, because I'm coming back home late tomorrow.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Nie wychodź teraz z domu, bo jest zbyt gorąco.
english: Don't leave the house now because it's too hot.
glossary: to leave the house
translation: 2.	Don't leave the house now, because it's too hot.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Zepsułam telefon mojej mamy. Nie wiem, co powinnam teraz zrobić.
english: I broke my mom's cell phone. I don't know what I should do now.
glossary: to break a cell phone
translation: 3.	I broke my mother's phone. I don't know what I should do now.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Nie mogę teraz rozmawiać, bo nie mam czasu.
english: I can't talk now because I don't have time.
glossary: to talk to sb
translation: 4.	I can't talk now because I don't have time.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Kiedy wyjeżdżasz?
english: When are you leaving?
glossary: to leave
translation: 5.	When are you leaving?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Mogłem zostać w domu, bo nie ma tu nic do roboty.
english: I could've stayed at home because there's nothing to do here.
glossary: to stay at home/to have nothing to do
translation: 6.	I could have stayed at home because there is nothing to do here.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Gdzie byłeś? Nie mogłem cię znaleźć.
english: Where were you? I couldn't find you.
translation: 7.	Where were you? I couldn't find you.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Nie zapłaciłam rachunków w zeszłym miesiącu, bo nie miałam żadnych pieniędzy.
english: I didn't pay the bills last month because I didn't have any money.
glossary: to pay the bills
translation: 8.	I didn't pay my bills last month because I didn't have any money.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Zawsze ci pomogę, bo jesteś siostrą mojej żony.
english: I'll always help you because you're my wife's sister.
glossary: to help sb
translation: 9.	I’ll always help you, because you are my wife's sister.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Byłam pewna, że spędzimy razem więcej czasu.
english: I was sure we'd spend more time together.
glossary: to be sure that.../to spend time with sb
translation: 10.	I was sure we would spend more time together.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Od wczoraj czytam tę książkę.
english: I've been reading the book since yesterday.
glossary: to read a book/since yesterday
translation: 1. I’ve been reading this book since yesterday.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Jak możesz być tak naiwny?
english: How can you be so naive?
glossary: to be naive
translation: 2. How can you be so naive?

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Miałam nadzieję, że przemyślisz swoje zachowanie.
english: I hoped you'd think over your behavior.
glossary: to think over your behavior
translation: 3. I hoped you would go over your behavior.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Jestem pewien, że skończysz studia.
english: I'm sure you'll graduate from college.
glossary: to graduate from college/to be sure
translation: 4. I’m sure that you will finish your programm.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Kiedy wróciłaś do miasta?
english: When did you get back to town?
glossary: to get back to town
translation: 5. When did you come back to town?

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Mam nadzieję, że mnie nie zarazisz.
english: I hope you won't infect me.
glossary: to infect sb
translation: 6. I hope you won’t get me infected.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Powinieneś przeczytać przynajmniej jedną książkę w miesiącu.
english: You should read at least one book a month.
glossary: to read a book/once a month/at least
translation: 7. You should read at least one book this month.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: W moim biurze jest osoba, która naprawia komputery.
english: There's a person in my office who repairs computers.
glossary: to repair a computer/in your office/a person
translation: 8. There is a person who fixes computers in my office.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Twój ojciec gotuje dziś wieczorem.
english: Your dad's cooking tonight.
glossary: to cook/a dad
translation: 9. Your Dad is cooking tonight.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Nauczę się angielskiego, jak już zatrudnię profesjonalnego nauczyciela.
english: I'll learn English once I hire a professional teacher.
glossary: to hire sb/a professional teacher/once {2}
translation: 10. I will learn English If I hire a professional teacher.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Nie będziesz musiała mnie odbierać jutro ze szkoły, bo śpię u koleżanki.
english: You won't have to pick me up from school tomorrow because I'm sleeping at my friend's.
glossary: to pick sb up from school/to sleep at your friend's
translation: 1. You won't have to pick me up from school tomorrow because I'm sleeping at a friend's house.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Myślałem, że zjemy dzisiaj na mieście.
english: I thought we'd eat out today.
glossary: to eat out
translation: 2. I thought we would eat out today.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Mogłem wczoraj wydać mniej pieniędzy.
english: I could've spent less money yesterday.
glossary: to spend money on sth
translation: 3. I could've spent less money yesterday.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Nie ma nikogo w domu. Dlatego jest tak cicho.
english: There's no one at home. That's why it's so silent.
glossary: to be at home/to be silent
translation: 4. There's no one in the house. That's why it's so quiet.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Nie wiem, co powinienem odpowiedzieć.
english: I don't know what I should answer.
glossary: to answer a question
translation: 5. I don't know what I should answer.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Byłem pewny, że zrobisz swoją pracę domową.
english: I was sure you'd do your homework.
glossary: to do your homework
translation: 6. I was sure you would do your homework.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: W zeszłym roku nie pojechałem na wakacje, ponieważ nie miałem pieniędzy.
english: I didn't go on vacation last year because I didn't have any money.
glossary: to go on vacation/to have no money
translation: 7. I didn't go on vacation last year because I didn't have money.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Zawsze znajdę dla ciebie czas, bo jesteś dla mnie ważna.
english: I'll always find time for you because you're important to me.
glossary: to find time for sb/to be important to sb
translation: 8. I'll always find time for you, because you're important to me.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Nie mogę się skupić, gdy jest tak głośno.
english: I can't focus when it's so loud.
glossary: to focus on sth/to be loud
translation: 9. I can't focus when it's so loud.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Gramy jutro mecz. Dołączysz do nas?
english: We're playing a match tomorrow. Will you join us?
glossary: to play a match/to join sb
translation: 10. We're playing a match tomorrow. Will you join us?

polish: Słyszałam wczoraj, że wygrałeś zawody.

glossary: to win a competition

polish: Jest jeszcze kilka wiadomości, na które muszę odpowiedzieć.
english: There are still a few messages I have to reply to.
glossary: to reply to a message

name: Anna Patton
polish: Kiedy dotarłem do domu, żona już wyszła.
english: When I got home, my wife had already left.
glossary: to leave/to get home/a wife

name: Anna Patton
polish: Czy jest coś, co powinienem wiedzieć, zanim wykonam ten telefon?
english: Is there anything I should know before making the call?
glossary: to make a call/to know sth

name: Anna Patton
polish: O czym była twoje ostatnia książka?
english: What was your last book about?
glossary: a book about sth

name: Anna Patton
polish: Policja by nas nie aresztowała, gdybyś nie zachowywał się podejrzanie.
english: The police wouldn't have arrested us if you hadn't behaved suspiciously.
glossary: to behave suspiciously/to arrest sb/the police

name: Anna Patton
polish: Będzie mi przykro, jeśli ze mną nie zatańczysz.
english: I'll be sorry if you don't dance with me.
glossary: to dance with sb/to be sorry
translation: I’ll be sorry if you won’t dance with me.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Chciałbym porozmawiać z tobą o odchudzaniu się.
english: I'd like to talk to you about losing weight.
glossary: to lose weight/I'd like to.../to talk about sth

name: Anna Patton
polish: Jeszcze nie potwierdziłem spotkania.

glossary: to confirm a meeting

name: Anna Patton
polish: Moi rodzice nie mieliby nic przeciwko naszemu związkowi, gdybyś miał stały dochód.

glossary: to have a steady income/to have nothing against sth/a parent/a relationship

name: Anna Patton
polish: Muszę się skupić na szukaniu lepszej pracy.

glossary: to look for a job/to focus on sth

glossary: to pay your tax/to get a fine

name: Anna Patton
polish: Rzuciłbym pracę, gdybym musiał pracować po godzinach.

glossary: to leave your job/to work overtime
translation: I’d quit my job  if I had to work overtime.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Ostatnim razem, kiedy rozmawiałyśmy, mówiłaś, że potrzebujesz mojej porady.
english: The last time we talked, you said you needed my advice.
glossary: to need sb's advice/The last time we talked.../to say sth

name: Anna Patton
polish: Kiedy ostatni raz widział pan ofiarę żywą?
english: When was the last time you saw the victim alive?
glossary: to be alive/a victim/to see sb/When was the last time...

name: Anna Patton
polish: Policja nie zatrzymałaby cię, gdybyś włączył światła.
english: The police wouldn't have pulled you over if you'd turned on the headlights.
glossary: to turn on the headlights/to pull sb over/the police
translation: The police wouldn’t have detained you if you had switched on the lights.

polish: Nie spaliłam jeszcze twoich rzeczy, ale za chwilę to zrobię.
english: I haven't burned your stuff yet, but I'll do it in a moment.
glossary: to burn sth/your stuff/in a moment

english: Is there the possibility to park a car in front of the building?
glossary: to park a car/in front of the building/a possibility to do sth

name: Anna Patton
polish: Dowiedziałem się o tym fakcie po tym, jak się rozstaliśmy.
english: I found out about the fact after we'd broken up.
glossary: to find out about sth/a fact/to break up
translation: I found out the fact after we had braken up.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Powiedz mi, w czym się specjalizujesz.
english: Tell me what you specialize in.
glossary: to specialize in sth
translation: Tell me what you’re specializing in.

polish: Moja mama przeszła w zeszłym roku na emeryturę.
english: My mom retired last year.
glossary: to retire/last year
translation: 1. My mother retired last year.

polish: Nie wierzę. Znajomi znowu mnie wystawili.
english: I can't believe it. My friends stood me up again.

polish: Dawno cię nie widziałam. Musisz wpaść w tym tygodniu.

glossary: to drop by/for a long time/this week

name: Maddie Lin
polish: Nie możesz unikać odpowiedzialności.

name: Maddie Lin
polish: Nie możesz się tak zachowywać.

name: Maddie Lin
polish: Nie idę z wami jutro na imprezę. Pracuję na nocną zmianę.

translation: 6. I won't go to the party tomorrow with you. I work the night shift.

polish: Nie będę w stanie pojawić się w weekend, bo pracuję.

name: Maddie Lin
polish: Mam nadzieję, że nie będę mieć jutro kaca.

translation: 8.I hope that I will not have a hangover.

name: Maddie Lin
polish: Musisz mnie przeprosić.

translation: 9. You have to apologise to me.

name: Maddie Lin
polish: Pozwę cię. Zobaczysz.

translation: 10.I will cite you. You’ll see.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Myślę, że odwiedzę cię w weekend, bo jutro wracam późno do domu.
english: I think I'll visit you on the weekend because I'm coming back home late tomorrow.
glossary: to visit sb/to come back home late

name: Paul Baker
polish: Nie wychodź teraz z domu, bo jest zbyt gorąco.
english: Don't leave the house now because it's too hot.

polish: Zepsułam telefon mojej mamy. Nie wiem, co powinnam teraz zrobić.
english: I broke my mom's cell phone. I don't know what I should do now.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Nie mogę teraz rozmawiać, bo nie mam czasu.

translation: 4. I can't talk right now because I don't have time.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Kiedy wyjeżdżasz?
english: When are you leaving?
glossary: to leave

name: Paul Baker
polish: Mogłem zostać w domu, bo nie ma tu nic do roboty.
english: I could've stayed at home because there's nothing to do here.

translation: 6. I could have stayed home because there is nothing to do here.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Gdzie byłeś? Nie mogłem cię znaleźć.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Nie zapłaciłam rachunków w zeszłym miesiącu, bo nie miałam żadnych pieniędzy.
english: I didn't pay the bills last month because I didn't have any money.
glossary: to pay the bills

name: Paul Baker
polish: Zawsze ci pomogę, bo jesteś siostrą mojej żony.
english: I'll always help you because you're my wife's sister.

translation: 9. I will always help you because you are my wife's sister.

polish: Byłam pewna, że spędzimy razem więcej czasu.

polish: Obściskiwałeś się z moją koleżanką. Przyznaj to.

name: Maddie Lin
polish: Moi znajomi jutro wpadają. Kup piwo.

polish: Nie ma różnicy. Bierz, co chcesz.

glossary: a difference/to take sth
translation: 3.	There is no difference. Take, what you want.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Mogłeś mi od razu powiedzieć prawdę. Nie zdenerwowałbym się.
english: You could've told me the truth at the beginning. I wouldn't have gotten mad.
glossary: to tell sb the truth/at the beginning/to get mad
translation: 4.	You could’ve told me the truth immediately. I wouldn’t have gotten mad.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Co mi chciałaś powiedzieć na imprezie?
english: What did you want to tell me at the party?
glossary: to tell sb sth/at the party
translation: 5.	What would you like to tell me at the party?

name: Paul Cook
polish: W artykule jest błąd. Popraw go.
english: There's a mistake in the article. Correct it.
glossary: in the article/to correct a mistake
translation: 6.	There is a mistake in the article. Correct it.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Może pojadę taksówką. Zaoszczędzę czas.
english: Maybe I'll take a cab. I'll save time.
glossary: to take a cab/to save money
translation: 7.	Maybe, I’ll take a cab. I save some time.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Co chcesz dostać na urodziny?
english: What do you want to get for your birthday?
glossary: to get sth for your birthday
translation: 8.	What do you want to get for your birthday?

name: Paul Cook
polish: Gdzie Ty wczoraj spałeś?
english: Where did you sleep yesterday?
glossary: to sleep
translation: 9.	Where did you sleep yesterday?

name: Paul Cook
polish: Stresowałem się, bo bałem się, że coś pójdzie źle.
english: I was stressed out because I was afraid something would go wrong.
glossary: to be stressed out/to be afraid of sth/to go wrong
translation: 10.	I stressed out because I was afraid of something would be bad.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nasz zespół wygrał jak dotąd jedną nagrodę, ale pracujemy nad tym.
english: Our team has won one prize so far, but we're working on it.
glossary: to win a prize/so far/to work on sth/a team
translation: Our team has been winning one award so far but we’re working on it.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Śnił ci się wczoraj koszmar?
english: Did you have a bad dream yesterday?
glossary: to have a bad dream

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie byłbym w stanie teraz nic ugotować, gdyby ciocia mnie nie nauczyła, jak to się robi.
english: I wouldn't be able to cook anything now if my aunt hadn't taught me how to do it.
glossary: to cook/to teach sb how to do sth/an aunt
translation: I couldn’t have cooked anything if my aunt hadn’t teached me how to do it.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie bolałyby cię plecy, gdybyś nie siedział codziennie przed telewizorem.
english: You wouldn't have back pain if you didn't sit in front of the TV every day.
glossary: to have back pain/to sit in front of the TV/every day
translation: You wouldn’t have had back pain if you hadn’t sat in front of TV every day.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Płacilibyśmy mniej, gdybyśmy wynajęli mieszkanie razem.
english: We'd pay less if we rented an apartment together.
glossary: to rent an apartment

name: Anette Gray
polish: Ryzykujesz swoją pracę, kłócąc się ze swoim szefem.
english: You're risking your job arguing with your boss.
glossary: to risk your job/to argue with sb/a boss

name: Anette Gray
polish: Gdybym przeszła teraz na emeryturę, musiałabym codziennie siedzieć sama w domu.
english: If I retired now, I'd have to sit at home alone every day.
glossary: to retire/to sit at home

name: Anette Gray
polish: Dołączyłbym do was, gdybym nie zapomniał kąpielówek.

glossary: to join sb/to forget sth/swim trunks

name: Anette Gray
polish: Z kim chcesz, żebym porozmawiał?
english: Who do you want me to talk to?
glossary: to talk to sb

name: Anette Gray
polish: Gdybyś prowadził własną firmę, miałbyś więcej problemów.
english: If you ran your own company, you would have more problems.
glossary: to run your own company/to have a problem

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Gdybyś naprawdę chciał schudnąć, jadłbyś mniej słodyczy.
english: If you really wanted to lose weight, you'd eat less candy.

name: Agnes Chapman

glossary: to take a look at sth/once again/to take a look at a document

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Nie wyrzuciłabym tej bluzki, gdyby nie wyblakła.
english: I wouldn't have thrown out the blouse if it hadn't faded.
glossary: to throw sth out/a blouse/to fade

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Nigdy wcześniej nie badałam pacjenta sama.
english: I've never examined a patient alone before.
glossary: to examine a patient
translation: I’ve never examined a patient alone.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Wyglądając przez okno, zauważyłam, że twój syn pali papierosa.
english: Looking out the window, I noticed your son smoking a cigarette.
glossary: to look out the window/to notice sb doing sth/to smoke a cigarette

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Biegnąc wzdłuż ulicy, zauważyłem bezpańskiego psa.
english: Running down the street, I noticed a stray dog.
glossary: to run down the street/to notice sth/a stray dog

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Nigdy nie wierzyłam, że twoja siostra będzie dobrą nauczycielką.
english: I've never believed your sister will make a good teacher.
glossary: to make a good teacher

polish: Nie powinienem był robić takiego bałaganu. Przepraszam.
english: I shouldn't have made such a mess. I'm sorry.
glossary: to make a mess

name: Eve Miles
polish: Jestem głodny. Mogłem zjeść śniadanie.
english: I'm hungry. I could've eaten breakfast.
glossary: to be hungry/to eat breakfast

name: Eve Miles
polish: Mogłem biec szybciej. Zdążyłbym na pociąg.
english: I could've run faster. I would've caught the train.
glossary: to run fast/to catch the train

name: Eve Miles
polish: Jechałeś bardzo szybko. Bałem się, że będziemy mieli wypadek.
english: You drove very fast. I was afraid we'd have an accident.
glossary: to drive/to be afraid/to have an accident

name: Eve Miles
polish: Jutro jedziemy do centrum na zakupy. Chcesz coś?
english: We're going shopping downtown tomorrow. Do you want anything?
glossary: to go shopping/to go downtown

polish: Co się stało? Byłem pewien, że będziesz się trzymać planu.

glossary: to happen/to be sure/to stick to the plan

name: Eve Miles
polish: Moja najlepsza przyjaciółka wychodzi za mąż w przyszłym tygodniu.
english: My best friend's getting married next week.
glossary: to get married/next week
translation: 7. My best friend is getting married next week.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Nie pracuję jutro, więc możemy jechać nad jezioro.
english: I'm not working tomorrow, so we can go to the lake.
glossary: to work/to go to the lake/tomorrow
translation: 8. I'm not working tomorrow, so we can go to the lake.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że się zaprzyjaźnimy.
english: I hoped we'd make friends.
glossary: to hope/to make friends

name: Eve Miles
polish: Ile osób jest w Twoim zespole?

glossary: on the team

glossary: to wear face masks

glossary: to brag about sth/to be fed up with sth

name: Margaret Ford

name: Matt Xander

name: Matt Xander

name: Anna Forney

glossary: even though/a friend/a dangerous dog/to pet a dog

polish: Gdybyś nie był zapominalski, cały zespół nie musiałby teraz pracować.

glossary: to have a problem with sth/a restaurant

polish: Powiedziałem mamie, że poszedłem do lekarza, bo chciałem ją uspokoić.

name: Damien Bean
polish: W ten weekend robimy z przyjacielem parapetówkę.
english: My friend and I are throwing a housewarming party this weekend.
glossary: to throw a housewarming party/a housewarming party/a friend/this weekend
translation: 1.	This weekend I and my friend doing a housewarming

name: Damien Bean
polish: Nie martw się. Pomogę ci z problemem.
english: Don't worry. I'll help you with the problem.
