translation: 2. I'll text to you once I am free.

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Od dawna tu pracuję.
english: I've been working here for a long time.
glossary: to work
translation: 3. I've been working here for a long time.

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Poprosiłeś rodziców o pomoc?
english: Did you ask your parents for help?
glossary: to ask sb for help
translation: 4. Did you ask your parents for help?

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Mogę porozmawiać z odpowiednią osobą, jeśli chcesz.
english: I can talk to the right person if you want.
glossary: to want sth/to talk to sb/the right person
translation: 5. I can talk to the right person if you want.

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Wieczorem idę na zakupy. Chcesz coś?
english: I'm going shopping in the evening. Do you want anything?
glossary: to go shopping
translation: 6. I go shopping in the evening. Do you want something?

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Może nie będę mieć w następnym tygodniu dużo pracy.
english: Maybe I won't have much work next week.
glossary: to have much work/Maybe.../next week
translation: 7. Maybe I won't have much work next week.

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Byłem pewien, że będę zmotywowany do nauki angielskiego.
english: I was sure I'd be motivated to learn English.
glossary: to be sure/to learn English/to be motivated to do sth
translation: 8. I was sure I would be motivated to study English.

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Dlaczego rzuciłaś angielski?
english: Why did you give up English?
glossary: to give up English
translation: 9. Why did you quit English?

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Obiecuję, że podrzucę dzieci jutro do szkoły.
english: I promise I'll drop off the kids at school tomorrow.
glossary: to drop off the kids at school
translation: 10. I promise I'll pick up kids to school tomorrow.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Słyszałam wczoraj, że wygrałeś zawody.
english: I heard yesterday that you'd won a competition.
glossary: to win a competition
translation: 1.	I heard yesterday that you won the competition.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Jest jeszcze kilka wiadomości, na które muszę odpowiedzieć.
english: There are still a few messages I have to reply to.
glossary: to reply to a message
translation: 2.	There are a few more messages I have to response to.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Kiedy dotarłem do domu, żona już wyszła.
english: When I got home, my wife had already left.
glossary: to leave/to get home/a wife
translation: 3.	When I got back home, my wife had already left.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Czy jest coś, co powinienem wiedzieć, zanim wykonam ten telefon?
english: Is there anything I should know before making the call?
glossary: to make a call/to know sth
translation: 4.	Is there anything I should know before I make this call?

name: Agnes Banks
polish: O czym była twoje ostatnia książka?
english: What was your last book about?
glossary: a book about sth
translation: 5.	what was your last book about?

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Policja by nas nie aresztowała, gdybyś nie zachowywał się podejrzanie.
english: The police wouldn't have arrested us if you hadn't behaved suspiciously.
glossary: to behave suspiciously/to arrest sb/the police
translation: 6.	The police wouldn’t have arrested us if you hadn’t been acting suspicious.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Będzie mi przykro, jeśli ze mną nie zatańczysz.
english: I'll be sorry if you don't dance with me.
glossary: to dance with sb/to be sorry
translation: 7.	I’ll be sorry if you don’t dance with me.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Chciałbym porozmawiać z tobą o odchudzaniu się.
english: I'd like to talk to you about losing weight.
glossary: to lose weight/I'd like to.../to talk about sth
translation: 8.	I’d like to talk to you about losing weight.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Jeszcze nie potwierdziłem spotkania.
english: I haven't confirmed the meeting yet.
glossary: to confirm a meeting
translation: 9.	I haven’t confirmed the meeting yet.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Moi rodzice nie mieliby nic przeciwko naszemu związkowi, gdybyś miał stały dochód.
english: My parents wouldn't have anything against our relationship if you had a steady income.
glossary: to have a steady income/to have nothing against sth/a parent/a relationship
translation: 10.	My parents wouldn’t mind our relationship if you had a steady income.

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Moja mama przeszła w zeszłym roku na emeryturę.
english: My mom retired last year.
glossary: to retire/last year
translation: 1.My Mom has been retired last year.

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Nie wierzę. Znajomi znowu mnie wystawili.
english: I can't believe it. My friends stood me up again.
glossary: to believe sb/to stand sb up/a friend
translation: 2.I can't believe. My friends... again.

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Dawno cię nie widziałam. Musisz wpaść w tym tygodniu.
english: I haven't seen you for a long time. You have to drop by this week.
glossary: to drop by/for a long time/this week
translation: 3. I haven't seen you for a long time. You have to come over to me this week.

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Nie możesz unikać odpowiedzialności.
english: You can't avoid responsibility.
glossary: to avoid responsibility
translation: 4. You can't avoid a responsibility.

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Nie możesz się tak zachowywać.
english: You can't behave like that.
glossary: to behave
translation: 5. You can't behave like that.

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Nie idę z wami jutro na imprezę. Pracuję na nocną zmianę.
english: I'm not going to the party with you tomorrow. I'm working the night shift.
glossary: to go to a party with sb/to work the night shift
translation: 6.I won't go with you at the party tomorrow. I'm working on the night shift.

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Nie będę w stanie pojawić się w weekend, bo pracuję.
english: I won't be able to show up on the weekend because I'm working.
glossary: to show up/to work on the weekend/to be able to do sth
translation: 7. I'm not able to show up at the party on the weekend because  I'm working.

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Mam nadzieję, że nie będę mieć jutro kaca.
english: I hope I won't have a hangover tomorrow.
glossary: to have a hangover
translation: 8. I hope, I won't have a hangover tomorrow.

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Musisz mnie przeprosić.
english: You have to apologize to me.
glossary: to apologize to sb
translation: 9. You must apologize to me.

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Pozwę cię. Zobaczysz.
english: I'll sue you. You'll see.
glossary: to sue sb/to see sth
translation: 10. I'll sue you. You will see.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Kogo chcesz, żebym zaprosił na imprezę?
english: Who do you want me to invite to the party?
glossary: to invite sb to a party
translation: 1.	Who do you want to invite at the party?

name: Paul Cook
polish: Wpadaj. Mój mąż gotuje w ten piątek.
english: Drop by. My husband's cooking this Friday.
glossary: to cook/this Friday
translation: 2.	Drop by. My husband’s cooking this Friday.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Nie ma różnicy. Bierz, co chcesz.
english: There's no difference. Take what you want.
glossary: a difference/to take sth
translation: 3.	There is no difference. Take, what you want.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Mogłeś mi od razu powiedzieć prawdę. Nie zdenerwowałbym się.
english: You could've told me the truth at the beginning. I wouldn't have gotten mad.
glossary: to tell sb the truth/at the beginning/to get mad
translation: 4.	You could’ve told me the truth immediately. I wouldn’t have gotten mad.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Co mi chciałaś powiedzieć na imprezie?
english: What did you want to tell me at the party?
glossary: to tell sb sth/at the party
translation: 5.	What would you like to tell me at the party?

name: Paul Cook
polish: W artykule jest błąd. Popraw go.
english: There's a mistake in the article. Correct it.
glossary: in the article/to correct a mistake
translation: 6.	There is a mistake in the article. Correct it.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Może pojadę taksówką. Zaoszczędzę czas.
english: Maybe I'll take a cab. I'll save time.
glossary: to take a cab/to save money
translation: 7.	Maybe, I’ll take a cab. I save some time.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Co chcesz dostać na urodziny?
english: What do you want to get for your birthday?
glossary: to get sth for your birthday
translation: 8.	What do you want to get for your birthday?

name: Paul Cook
polish: Gdzie Ty wczoraj spałeś?
english: Where did you sleep yesterday?
glossary: to sleep
translation: 9.	Where did you sleep yesterday?

name: Paul Cook
polish: Stresowałem się, bo bałem się, że coś pójdzie źle.
english: I was stressed out because I was afraid something would go wrong.
glossary: to be stressed out/to be afraid of sth/to go wrong
translation: 10.	I stressed out because I was afraid of something would be bad.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nasz zespół wygrał jak dotąd jedną nagrodę, ale pracujemy nad tym.
english: Our team has won one prize so far, but we're working on it.
glossary: to win a prize/so far/to work on sth/a team
translation: Our team has been winning one award so far but we’re working on it.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Śnił ci się wczoraj koszmar?
english: Did you have a bad dream yesterday?
glossary: to have a bad dream
translation: Did you have a nightmare yesterday?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie byłbym w stanie teraz nic ugotować, gdyby ciocia mnie nie nauczyła, jak to się robi.
english: I wouldn't be able to cook anything now if my aunt hadn't taught me how to do it.
glossary: to cook/to teach sb how to do sth/an aunt
translation: I couldn’t have cooked anything if my aunt hadn’t teached me how to do it.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie bolałyby cię plecy, gdybyś nie siedział codziennie przed telewizorem.
english: You wouldn't have back pain if you didn't sit in front of the TV every day.
glossary: to have back pain/to sit in front of the TV/every day
translation: You wouldn’t have had back pain if you hadn’t sat in front of TV every day.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Płacilibyśmy mniej, gdybyśmy wynajęli mieszkanie razem.
english: We'd pay less if we rented an apartment together.
glossary: to rent an apartment
translation: We would pay less if we rent out an apartment together.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Ryzykujesz swoją pracę, kłócąc się ze swoim szefem.
english: You're risking your job arguing with your boss.
glossary: to risk your job/to argue with sb/a boss
translation: You risk your job by arguing with your boss.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Gdybym przeszła teraz na emeryturę, musiałabym codziennie siedzieć sama w domu.
english: If I retired now, I'd have to sit at home alone every day.
glossary: to retire/to sit at home
translation: If I retire right now, I would have to stay at home alone.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Dołączyłbym do was, gdybym nie zapomniał kąpielówek.
english: I'd join you if I hadn't forgotten my swim trunks.
glossary: to join sb/to forget sth/swim trunks
translation: I would join you guys if I didn’t forget swimming trunks.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Z kim chcesz, żebym porozmawiał?
english: Who do you want me to talk to?
glossary: to talk to sb
translation: Who do you want I’ll talk to?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Gdybyś prowadził własną firmę, miałbyś więcej problemów.
english: If you ran your own company, you would have more problems.
glossary: to run your own company/to have a problem
translation: If you run your own company, you would have more problems.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Gdybyś naprawdę chciał schudnąć, jadłbyś mniej słodyczy.
english: If you really wanted to lose weight, you'd eat less candy.
glossary: to lose weight/to eat candy
translation: If you really wanted to lose weight, you would eat less candys.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Możesz mieć problemy z sercem, pijąc kawę kilka razy dziennie.
english: You can have heart problems drinking coffee a few times a day.
glossary: to have heart problems/to drink coffee/a few times a day
translation: You could have heart problems drinking coffee a few times a day.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Płacąc podatki, możesz spać spokojnie.
english: Paying your taxes, you can sleep peacefully.
glossary: to pay your taxes/to sleep peacefully
translation: Paying taxes, you can sleep safely.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Chcesz, żebym jeszcze raz spojrzał na te dokumenty?
english: Do you want me to take a look at the documents once again?
glossary: to take a look at sth/once again/to take a look at a document
translation: Would you like me to look at the documents again?

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Nie wyrzuciłabym tej bluzki, gdyby nie wyblakła.
english: I wouldn't have thrown out the blouse if it hadn't faded.
glossary: to throw sth out/a blouse/to fade
translation: I wouldn’t have thrown away this blouse If it hadn’t ………….

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Nigdy wcześniej nie badałam pacjenta sama.
english: I've never examined a patient alone before.
glossary: to examine a patient
translation: I’ve never examined a patient alone.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Wyglądając przez okno, zauważyłam, że twój syn pali papierosa.
english: Looking out the window, I noticed your son smoking a cigarette.
glossary: to look out the window/to notice sb doing sth/to smoke a cigarette
translation: Looking out the window, I notice that your son was smoking a cigarette.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Biegnąc wzdłuż ulicy, zauważyłem bezpańskiego psa.
english: Running down the street, I noticed a stray dog.
glossary: to run down the street/to notice sth/a stray dog
translation: Running down the street, I notice a stray dog.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Czy wy uprawialiście wczoraj seks? Wydawało mi się, że was słyszę.
english: Did you have sex yesterday? I thought I heard you.
glossary: to have sex/to hear sb
translation: Did you have sex yesterday? I thought I heard you.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Nigdy nie wierzyłam, że twoja siostra będzie dobrą nauczycielką.
english: I've never believed your sister will make a good teacher.
glossary: to make a good teacher
translation: I’ve never believed, that my sister would make a good teacher.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Nie powinienem był robić takiego bałaganu. Przepraszam.
english: I shouldn't have made such a mess. I'm sorry.
glossary: to make a mess
translation: 1. I shouldn't have made such a mess. Sorry.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Jestem głodny. Mogłem zjeść śniadanie.
english: I'm hungry. I could've eaten breakfast.
glossary: to be hungry/to eat breakfast
translation: 2. I’m hungry. I could eat breakfast.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Mogłem biec szybciej. Zdążyłbym na pociąg.
english: I could've run faster. I would've caught the train.
glossary: to run fast/to catch the train
translation: 3. I could run faster. I would catch the train.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Jechałeś bardzo szybko. Bałem się, że będziemy mieli wypadek.
english: You drove very fast. I was afraid we'd have an accident.
glossary: to drive/to be afraid/to have an accident
translation: 4. You were driving very fast. I was afraid we would have an accident.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Jutro jedziemy do centrum na zakupy. Chcesz coś?
english: We're going shopping downtown tomorrow. Do you want anything?
glossary: to go shopping/to go downtown
translation: 5. We are going to the shopping center tomorrow. You want something?

name: Eve Miles
polish: Co się stało? Byłem pewien, że będziesz się trzymać planu.
english: What happened? I was sure you'd stick to the plan.
glossary: to happen/to be sure/to stick to the plan
translation: 6. What happened? I was sure you would stick to the plan.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Moja najlepsza przyjaciółka wychodzi za mąż w przyszłym tygodniu.
english: My best friend's getting married next week.
glossary: to get married/next week
translation: 7. My best friend is getting married next week.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Nie pracuję jutro, więc możemy jechać nad jezioro.
english: I'm not working tomorrow, so we can go to the lake.
glossary: to work/to go to the lake/tomorrow
translation: 8. I'm not working tomorrow, so we can go to the lake.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że się zaprzyjaźnimy.
english: I hoped we'd make friends.
glossary: to hope/to make friends
translation: 9. I was hoping we would make friends.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Ile osób jest w Twoim zespole?
english: How many people are there on your team?
glossary: on the team
translation: 10. How many people are there on your team?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Mój współpracownik nigdy nie zwraca uwagi na szczegóły. Zawsze muszę poprawiać jego zadania.
english: My coworker never pays attention to detail. I always have to correct his tasks.
glossary: to pay attention to detail/to correct sth
translation: My colleague never have been focusing on details. I always have been having to correct his job.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Jak długo umniejszasz moje osiągnięcia? Nie będę już tego znosić.
english: How long have you been diminishing my accomplishments? I won't put up with it anymore.
glossary: to diminish sth/to put up with sth
translation: How long have you been decreasing my achievements? I haven’t stood you any more.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Jak długo żujesz tę gumę? Weź nową.
english: How long have you been chewing this gum? Take a new one.
glossary: to chew a gum/to take a new one
translation: How long have you been chewing the gum? Take the new one.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Słyszałem dziś, jak moja córka mówi po angielsku, i to skłoniło mnie do myślenia. Może też powinienem zapisać się na taki kurs.
english: I heard my daughter speaking English today, and it made me think. Maybe I should sign up for such a course as well.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to hear sb doing sth/to sign up for a course
translation: Today, I heard, how my daughter speaks English and it was thought-provoking to me. Maybe I should sign up for the course too.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: O co prokurator okręgowy chce cię oskarżyć?
english: What does the district attorney want to charge you with?
glossary: a district attorney/to charge sb with sth
translation: What the … prosecutor want to accuse you?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Powinniśmy teraz nosić maseczki w sklepach.
english: We are supposed to wear face masks in stores now.
glossary: to wear face masks
translation: We should wearing the face masks in stores now.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Jak długo tyle bierzesz? Ostatnim razem, kiedy się spotkaliśmy, było taniej.
english: How long have you been charging this much? The last time we met it was cheaper.
glossary: to charge sb
translation: How long have you been taking so much? There was cheaper when we met last time.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Od jak dawna chwalisz się swoim nowym samochodem? Czy nie widzisz, że wszyscy mają dość?
english: How long have you been bragging about your new car? Can't you see everyone's fed up?
glossary: to brag about sth/to be fed up with sth
translation: How long have you been talking about the new car? Can’t you see that everybody is fed up with it?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Dlaczego akcje Twojej firmy spadły? Czy coś się stało?
english: Why did your company's shares drop? Did anything happen?
glossary: to drop/a share
translation: Why you company actions dropped down? If something was happened?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Mieliśmy się zmieniać, nieprawdaż?
english: We were supposed to take turns, weren't we?
glossary: to take turns
translation: We were going to change, isn’t it?

name: Peter Kane
polish: W ten weekend robimy z przyjacielem parapetówkę.
english: My friend and I are throwing a housewarming party this weekend.
glossary: to throw a housewarming party/a housewarming party/a friend/this weekend
translation: I and a friend of mine throwing a house warming party this weekend.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Nie martw się. Pomogę ci z problemem.
english: Don't worry. I'll help you with the problem.
glossary: to worry/to help sb with a problem
translation: Don't worry. I'll help you with the problem.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Jest ciepło na zewnątrz, więc nie musisz zakładać kurtki.
english: It's warm outside, so you don't have to put on a jacket.
glossary: warm/outside/to put on a jacket
translation: It's warm outside so you don't have to put on a jacket.

name: Peter Kane
polish: W zeszłym tygodniu poprosiłam mamę, żeby poszła ze mną na zakupy.
english: I asked my mom to go shopping with me last week.
glossary: to go shopping/last week
translation: I asked my mum she went shopping with me last week.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Niedługo poznam dziewczynę mojego syna.
english: I'm meeting my son's girlfriend soon.
glossary: soon/to meet sb {2}/a son/a girlfriend
translation: I'll meet a girlfriend of my son soon.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Wczoraj znalazłam korepetytora dla moich dzieci.
english: I found a private tutor for my children yesterday.
glossary: to find a private tutor/a private tutor/children
translation: I found a private tutor for my kids yesterday.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Obiecuję, że tym razem będę miła dla twojego męża.
english: I promise I'll be nice to your husband this time.
glossary: to be nice to sb/to promise that.../this time/a husband
translation: I promise I'll be nice to your husband this time.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Niestety nie mogę ci polecić żadnego interesującego filmu.
english: Unfortunately, I can't recommend any interesting movie to you.
glossary: Unfortunately.../to recommend sth to sb/an interesting movie
translation: Unfortunatelly, I can't recommend you any interesting movie.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Musisz spróbować być mniej zazdrosna.
english: You have to try to be less jealous.
glossary: to be jealous/more or less
translation: You have to try to be less jeleaus.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Powinieneś trenować więcej, żeby być w formie.
english: You should work out more to be in shape.
glossary: to work out/to be in shape
translation: You should train more to be in shape.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Posprzątam, kiedy wrócę do domu.
english: I'll clean up when I come back home.
glossary: to clean up/to come back home
translation: 1. I'll clean up when I get home.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Jestem pewna, że będziesz żałować tej decyzji.
english: I'm sure you'll regret the decision.
glossary: to regret sth/a decision
translation: 2. I am sure you will regret this decision.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Od dłuższego czasu mnie unikasz. Widzę to.
english: You've been avoiding me for a long time. I see it.
glossary: to avoid sb
translation: 3. You have been avoiding me for a long time. I can see that.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Jak zapłaciłeś za kurs?
english: How did you pay for the course?
glossary: to pay for a course
translation: 4. How did you pay for the course?

name: Matt Xander
polish: Obiecaj, że nigdy więcej mnie nie wystawisz.
english: Promise you'll never stand me up again.
glossary: to stand sb up
translation: 5. Promise never to expose me again.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Nie wchodź. W pokoju jest bałagan.
english: Don't enter. There's a mess in the room.
glossary: a mess/to enter the room
translation: 6. Don't come in. The room is a mess.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Kiedy ukończyłeś studia?
english: When did you graduate from college?
glossary: to graduate from college
translation: 7. When did you graduate?

name: Matt Xander
polish: Powinnaś zachęcać dzieciaki, żeby się rozwijały.
english: You should encourage your kids to develop.
glossary: to develop/to encourage sb to do sth
translation: 8. You should encourage kids to develop.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Myślałem, że przejdę w tym roku na emeryturę.
english: I thought I'd retire this year.
glossary: to retire/this year
translation: 9. I thought I was going to retire this year.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Idziemy dzisiaj wieczorem na imprezę. Szykuj się.
english: We're going to a party tonight. Get ready.
glossary: to get ready/to go to a party
translation: 10. We're going to a party tonight. Get ready.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Składając wniosek, pamiętaj, żeby go podpisać.
english: Filing an application, remember to sign it.
glossary: to file an application/to sign an application
translation: Do you have propelly skills to do this job?

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Czy ma pan odpowiednie umiejętności, żeby wykonywać tę pracę?
english: Do you have the necessary skills to do the job?
glossary: to have the necessary skills/to do a job
translation: I've always wanted to work with people.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Zawsze chciałem pracować z ludźmi.
english: I've always wanted to work with people.
glossary: to work with people
translation: If you had saved water, you would reduce your monthly bills.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Gdybyś oszczędzał wodę, zmniejszyłbyś swoje miesięczne rachunki.
english: If you saved water, you'd lower your monthly bills.
glossary: to save water/to lower your bills
translation: If you have saved wather You would cut down on the month bills

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Nie możesz dzwonić do mnie w nocy, oczekując, że odbiorę.
english: You can't call me at night expecting that I'll pick up the phone.
glossary: to call sb/at night/to expect sb to do sth
translation: You can't call me at night expecting me to get the call.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Nie chcę, żeby utrzymywali mnie rodzice.
english: I don't want my parents to provide for me.
glossary: to provide for sb
translation: I don't want my parents to support me.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Zawsze ci mówiłem, żebyś zaczęła oszczędzać pieniądze.
english: I've always told you to start saving money.
glossary: to save money/to start to do sth; to start doing sth
translation: I've always told you that you have to start saving money.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Moja córka nie zaczęłaby palić, gdyby nie była pod presją rówieśników.
english: My daughter wouldn't have started to smoke if she hadn't been under peer pressure.
glossary: to smoke/to be under peer pressure
translation: My daughter would’t have started smoking if she had not been under pression of her …..

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Aplikowałem już na kilka stanowisk, ale nikt jeszcze do mnie nie zadzwonił.
english: I've already applied for a few positions, but no one has called me yet.
glossary: to apply for a position/to call sb
translation: I’ve applicated to a few position but nobody has called me yet.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Przeczytałem dziś rano wszystkie mejle, pijąc kawę.
english: I read all my emails today, drinking coffee.
glossary: to read emails/to drink coffee
translation: I read all my emails this morning while I was drinking my coffee.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Myślę, że odwiedzę cię w weekend, bo jutro wracam późno do domu.
english: I think I'll visit you on the weekend because I'm coming back home late tomorrow.
glossary: to visit sb/to come back home late
translation: I think I will visit you this weekend because tomorrow I will be home very late.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Nie wychodź teraz z domu, bo jest zbyt gorąco.
english: Don't leave the house now because it's too hot.
glossary: to leave the house
translation: Don't leave the house because it's too hot.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Zepsułam telefon mojej mamy. Nie wiem, co powinnam teraz zrobić.
english: I broke my mom's cell phone. I don't know what I should do now.
glossary: to break a cell phone
translation: I broke my mom's phone. I don't know what to do now.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Nie mogę teraz rozmawiać, bo nie mam czasu.
english: I can't talk now because I don't have time.
glossary: to talk to sb
translation: I can't talk right now because I don't have time

name: Paul Baker
polish: Kiedy wyjeżdżasz?
english: When are you leaving?
glossary: to leave
translation: When do you leave ?

name: Paul Baker
polish: Mogłem zostać w domu, bo nie ma tu nic do roboty.
english: I could've stayed at home because there's nothing to do here.
glossary: to stay at home/to have nothing to do
translation: I could have stayed home because there is nothing to do here.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Gdzie byłeś? Nie mogłem cię znaleźć.
english: Where were you? I couldn't find you.
translation: Where have you been? I couldn't find you.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Nie zapłaciłam rachunków w zeszłym miesiącu, bo nie miałam żadnych pieniędzy.
english: I didn't pay the bills last month because I didn't have any money.
glossary: to pay the bills
translation: I didn't pay my bills last month because I didn't have any money.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Zawsze ci pomogę, bo jesteś siostrą mojej żony.
english: I'll always help you because you're my wife's sister.
glossary: to help sb
translation: I will always help you because you are my wife's sister.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Byłam pewna, że spędzimy razem więcej czasu.
english: I was sure we'd spend more time together.
glossary: to be sure that.../to spend time with sb
translation: I was sure we would spend more time together."

name: Martin Hale
polish: Gdybyś nie poruszył tematu, szef nie zauważyłby, że jest problem.
english: If you hadn't brought up the subject, the boss wouldn't notice that there was a problem.
glossary: to bring up a subject/to notice that.../a problem
translation: 1. If you didn’t bring the subject up, the boss wouldn’t notice that there is a problem.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Dlaczego schrzaniłeś to zadanie?
english: Why did you screw up the task?
glossary: to screw up a task
translation: 2. Why have you screwed this task up?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Szefowa powiedziała, że przejmę ważny projekt.
english: The boss told me I'd take on an important project.
glossary: to take on a project
translation: 3. The boss told me that I would take on an important project.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Zbyt długo rozważam opcje. Czas działać.
english: I've been weighing up the options for too long. It's time to act.
glossary: to weigh up the options/to act
translation: 4. I weigh up the options too long. It’s time to act.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Klient twierdził, że product nie spełnia jego oczekiwań.
english: The client claimed the product didn't live up to his expectations.
glossary: to live up to sb's expectations/a client/a product
translation: 5. The customer claimed that the product didn’t live up to his expectations.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Czy zawsze zapinasz pasy, kiedy prowadzisz?
english: Do you always fasten up when driving?
glossary: to fasten up/to drive
translation: 6. Have you ever fastened up when you drive?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Zakończyłeś już spotkanie?
english: Have you wrapped up the meeting yet?
glossary: to wrap up a meeting
translation: 7. Have you finished the meeting yet?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Chcesz, żebym przejrzał te dokumenty?
english: Do you want me to go through the documents?
glossary: to go through documents
translation: 8. Do you want me to look through the documents?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Profesor pytał się mnie kilka dni temu, dlaczego jeszcze nie wykonałem tych badań.
english: The professor asked me a few days ago why I hadn't carried out the research yet.
glossary: to carry out research
translation: 9. The professor asked me a few days ago why I hadn’t done the research yet.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Szybko przyzwyczaiłam się do krycia brata.
english: I quickly got used to covering for my brother.
glossary: to cover up for sb/to get used to doing sth
translation: 10. I got used to covering up for my brother quickly.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Moja mama przeszła w zeszłym roku na emeryturę.
english: My mom retired last year.
glossary: to retire/last year
translation: 1. My mother retired last year.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Nie wierzę. Znajomi znowu mnie wystawili.
english: I can't believe it. My friends stood me up again.
glossary: to believe sb/to stand sb up/a friend
translation: 2. I don’t believe. My friends put me up again.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Dawno cię nie widziałam. Musisz wpaść w tym tygodniu.
english: I haven't seen you for a long time. You have to drop by this week.
glossary: to drop by/for a long time/this week
translation: 3. I haven’t seen you for a long time. You have to come this week.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Nie możesz unikać odpowiedzialności.
english: You can't avoid responsibility.
glossary: to avoid responsibility
translation: 4. You can’t avoid responsibility.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Nie możesz się tak zachowywać.
english: You can't behave like that.
glossary: to behave
translation: 5. You can’t behave like this.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Nie idę z wami jutro na imprezę. Pracuję na nocną zmianę.
english: I'm not going to the party with you tomorrow. I'm working the night shift.
glossary: to go to a party with sb/to work the night shift
translation: 6. I’m not going to the party with you tomorrow. I work the night shift.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Nie będę w stanie pojawić się w weekend, bo pracuję.
english: I won't be able to show up on the weekend because I'm working.
glossary: to show up/to work on the weekend/to be able to do sth
translation: 7. I won’t be able to show up at the weekend, because I’m working.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Mam nadzieję, że nie będę mieć jutro kaca.
english: I hope I won't have a hangover tomorrow.
glossary: to have a hangover
translation: 8. I hope, I won’t have a hangover tomorrow.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Musisz mnie przeprosić.
english: You have to apologize to me.
glossary: to apologize to sb
translation: 9. You have to apologize to me.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Pozwę cię. Zobaczysz.
english: I'll sue you. You'll see.
glossary: to sue sb/to see sth
translation: 10. I’ll  sue you. You’ll see.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Nie musisz mieć wyrzutów sumienia.
english: You don't need to have remorse.
glossary: to have remorse
translation: 1.	You don’t have to feel remorse

name: Damien Bean
polish: Zerzygałam się na ostatniej imprezie. Żenada.
english: I threw up at the last party. Pathetic.
glossary: to throw up/at the party/to be pathetic
translation: 2.	I threw up at the last party. It’s embarrassing.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Obiecuję, że następnym razem będę się lepiej zachowywał.
english: I promise I'll behave better next time.
glossary: to behave/next time/to promise sb sth; to promise sth to sb
translation: 3.	I promise that next time I’ll behave better.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Nie możesz się tak gapić na ludzi.
english: You can't stare at people like that.
glossary: to stare at sb
translation: 4.	You can’t stare at people like that.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Wczoraj lekarz przepisał mi leki przeciwbólowe.
english: The doctor prescribed me painkillers yesterday.
glossary: a doctor/to prescribe sb painkillers
translation: 5.	The doctor assigned me drugs yesterday.

name: Damien Bean
polish: W przyszłym roku kończę studia. Nie mogę się doczekać.
english: I'm graduating from college next year. I can't wait.
glossary: to graduate from college/can't wait
translation: 6.	I’m finishing a college next year. I can’t wait.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Powinnaś mnie lepiej traktować.
english: You should treat me better.
glossary: to treat sb well
translation: 7.	You should treat me better.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Dziś wieczorem nie ćwiczę. Muszę odpocząć.
english: I'm not working out tonight. I have to rest.
glossary: to work out/to rest
translation: 8.	I’m not training tonight. I have to rest.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Musisz przyznać, że mam rację.
english: You have to admit that I'm right.
glossary: to admit sth/to be right
translation: 9.	You have to admit that I’m right.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Jestem pewien, że się pojawię na imprezie.
english: I'm sure I'll show up at the party.
glossary: to be sure about sth/to show up/at the party/I'm sure that.../to show up at the party
translation: 10.	I’m sure that I’ll appear at the party.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Dlaczego do mnie zagadujesz?
english: Why are you chatting me up?
glossary: to chat sb up
translation: Why are you chatting me up?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Czy naprawdę chcesz, żeby ten gatunek wyginął?
english: Do you really want the species to die out?
glossary: to die out/a species
translation: Do you really want this species to die out?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Nie kupimy mieszkania, dopóki nie weźmiemy kredytu.
english: We won't buy an apartment until we get a mortgage.
glossary: to get a mortgage/to buy an apartment
translation: We won’t buy a flat until we don’t out a loan.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Na ostatnim spotkaniu szef mi powiedział, że mój projekt się wyróżnia.
english: My boss told me at the last meeting that my project stood out.
glossary: to stand out/a project/at the meeting
translation: My boss told me at the last meeting that my project stood out.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Mogłem zacząć grać na pianinie jako dziecko. Byłbym teraz bardziej wprawiony.
english: I could've taken up the piano as a kid. I'd be more skillful now.
glossary: to be skillful/to take up the piano
translation: I could have taken up the piano as a kid. I would be better at it now.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Czy w końcu się odezwałeś, gdy przezwyciężyłeś strach?
english: Did you finally speak up when you got over your fear?
glossary: to get over your fear/to speak up
translation: Have you finally spoken up once you had gotten over your fear?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Dlaczego nie załozyłeś jeszcze kurtki?
english: Why haven't you put on a jacket yet?
glossary: to put on a jacket
translation: Why haven’t you put on a jacket yet?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Szef się mnie wczoraj zapytał, dlaczego nie zaproponowałem żadnego pomysłu na ostatnim spotkaniu.
english: My boss asked me yesterday why I hadn't put forward any idea at the last meeting.
glossary: to put forward an idea/at the meeting
translation: The boss asked me yesterday why I hadn’t put forward any idea at the last meeting.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Jakie obowiązki musisz przekazać?
english: What responsibilities do you have to hand over?
glossary: to hand over responsibilities
translation: What responsibilities do you have to hand over?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Powiedziałem ci, że nie będę cię więcej znosił.
english: I told you I wouldn't put up with you anymore.
glossary: to put up with sb
translation: I told you that I wouldn’t put up with you anymore.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Zbyt długo zadzierasz ze mną.
english: You've been messing with me for too long.
glossary: to mess with sb
translation: You have been messing with me too long.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Nigdy nie przyzwyczaję się do zwalniania pracowników.
english: I'll never get used to laying off employees.
glossary: to lay sb off/an employee/to get used to doing sth
translation: I will never get used to firing employees.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Powiedz szefowi, co zrobiłeś, bo jestem już zmęczona kryciem ciebie.
english: Tell the boss what you've done because I'm already tired of covering up for you.
glossary: a boss/to be tired of sth/to cover for sb
translation: Tell the boss what you did because I am tired of covering up for you.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Twój wniosek nie zostałby odrzucony, gdybyś złożył go na czas.
english: Your application wouldn't have been turned down if you'd submitted it on time.
glossary: on time/to submit an application/to turn down an application
translation: Your application wouldn't have been turned down if you had submitted it on time.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Szybciej znajdziesz nowego pracownika, jeśli zawęzisz listę kandydatów.
english: You'll find a new employee more quickly if you narrow down the pool of candidates.
glossary: a pool of candidates/to narrow sth down/to narrow down a pool of candidates/an employee
translation: You will find a new employee faster if you narrow down a pool of candidates.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Ten hotel spełniał kiedyś wszystkie standardy.
english: The hotel used to live up to all the standards.
glossary: to live up to sb's standards/a hotel
translation: This hotel used to meet all the standards.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Nie musiałbym tak często sprzątać, gdybyś codziennie nie gościł swoich znajomych.
english: You wouldn't have to clean up so often if you didn't have your friends over every day.
glossary: to have sb over/to have your friends over/to clean up
translation: You wouldn't clean such often if you didn’t have your friends over everyday.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Spełniłem już wszystkie twoje oczekiwania. Czego jeszcze chcesz?
english: I've already lived up to all your expectations. What else do you want?
glossary: to live up to sb's expectations
translation: I have already met all your expectations. What more do you want?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Zginęła wczoraj jedna osoba po tym, jak na ulicy wybuchła bomba.
english: One person died yesterday after a bomb had gone off on the street.
glossary: on the street/to go off/a bomb
translation: Yesterday, one person died after a bomb went off on the street.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Analizowałem raport, gdy mi przeszkodziłaś.
english: I was looking into a report when you interrupted me.
glossary: to interrupt sb/to look into a report
translation: I was looking into a report when you disturbed me.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Pojawiłabym się, gdybyś potwierdził wcześniej spotkanie.
english: I would've showed up if you'd confirmed the meeting earlier.
glossary: to show up/to confirm a meeting
translation: I would’ve come up if you had confirmed the Meeting earlier.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Zaoszczędziłbyś trochę pieniędzy, gdybyś pił kranówkę.
english: You'd save some money if you drank tap water.
glossary: to drink tap water/to save some money
translation: You would save a little money if you drunk tap water.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Jakie są opcje?
english: What options are there?
glossary: an option
translation: What are the options?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Będziesz miał szlaban, jeśli nie wrócisz na czas do domu.
english: You'll be grounded if you don't come back home on time.
glossary: on time/to come back home/to be grounded
translation: You will be grounded if you won’t come back home on time.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Kiedy zdałaś sobie sprawę, że zostałaś oszukana?
english: When did you realize you'd been cheated?
glossary: to realize sth/to cheat sb
translation: When did you realize you had been cheated.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Nie zjedliśmy wczoraj kolacji w restauracji, ponieważ mój mąż zapomniał zarezerwować stolik.
english: We didn't have dinner at the restaurant yesterday because my husband had forgotten to book a table.
glossary: to forget to do sth/to book a table/a husband/to eat dinner; to have dinner/at the restaurant
translation: We didn’t eat dinner yesterday because my husband had forgotten to book a table.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Dlaczego jeszcze nie zrobiłeś przelewu?
english: Why haven't you made the transfer yet?
glossary: to make a transfer
translation: Why haven’t made a transfer yet?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Na kogo masz zamiar głosować?
english: Who are you going to vote for?
glossary: to vote for sb/to be going to do sth
translation: Who are you going to vote for?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Kiedy zgłosił pan zdarzenie?
english: When did you report the incident?
glossary: an incident/to report sth
translation: When did you report the accident?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Wczoraj marzyłam tylko o zrobieniu sobie drzemki.
english: I only dreamed of taking a nap yesterday.
glossary: to take a nap/to dream of sth
translation: I dreamed about doing a nap yesterday.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Nie odkryłem jeszcze swojego powołania.
english: I haven't found my vocation yet.
glossary: to find your vocation
translation: I haven’t discovered my vocation yet.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Nie musiałbyś teraz płacić za to badanie, gdybyś miał ubezpieczenie.
english: You wouldn't have to pay for the examination now if you had insurance.
glossary: to have insurance/to pay for sth/an examination
translation: You wouldn’t have to pay for the examination if you had an insurance.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Zauważyłem wczoraj, że sąsiedzi kupili nowy samochód.
english: I noticed yesterday that my neighbors had bought a new car.
glossary: to buy a new car/to notice sth/a neighbor
translation: I noticed yesterday that my neighbors had bouht a new car.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Do kogo należy ta komórka?
english: Who does the cell belong to?
glossary: to belong to sb/a cell phone
translation: Who does the cel belong to?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Kiedy postanowiłeś, że będziesz mieszkał za granicą?
english: When did you decide you'd live abroad?
glossary: to decide that.../to live abroad
translation: When did you choose you would live abroad?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Mama będzie zła, jeśli nie posprzątam pokoju.
english: My mom will be mad if I don't clean up my room.
glossary: to clean up your room/to be mad at sb/a mom
translation: My mom would be angry if I won’t clean up my room.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Wyszedłem już ze sklepu, kiedy zadzwoniłaś.
english: I'd already left the store when you called me.
glossary: to call sb/a store/to leave a store
translation: I’ve already left the store once you call.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Ile osadzonych jest obecnie w tym więzieniu?
english: How many inmates are there currently in the jail?
glossary: a jail; a prison/an inmate/currently
translation: How many inmates are there currently in the jail?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Wujek by nie utonął, gdyby nagle nie dostał skurczu.
english: My uncle wouldn't have drowned if he hadn't suddenly gotten a cramp.
glossary: to get a cramp/to drown/suddenly/an uncle
translation: My uncle wouldn’t have drown if he hadn’t gotten … suddenly.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Dzięki za skończenie zadania na czas.
english: Thanks for completing the task on time.
glossary: to complete a task
translation: Thanks for doing the task on time.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Mam nadzięję, że wrócisz do pracy do końca miesiąca.
english: I hope you'll come back to work by the end of the month.
glossary: to come back to work/by the end of the month/I hope that...
translation: I hope you will come back to work at the and of month.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: W pewnym momencie zauważyłam błąd.
english: At some point, I noticed a mistake.
glossary: At some point.../to notice a mistake
translation: At some point, I noticed a mistake.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Muszę dowiedzieć się prawdy.
english: I have to find out the truth.
glossary: to find out the truth
translation: I have to find out the truth.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Obiecuję, że pójdę jutro do szkoły.
english: I promise I'll go to school tomorrow.
glossary: to promise sth/to go to school
translation: I promise I'll go to school tomorrow.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Pójdę na siłownię, kiedy wyzdrowieję.
english: I'll go to the gym when I get better.
glossary: to get better/to go to the gym
translation: I'll go to the gym when I get over better.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Przeprowadzam się w przyszłym miesiącu.
english: I'm moving next month.
glossary: to move
translation: I'm moving in next month.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Nie mam czasu. Idę jutro do lekarza.
english: I don't have time. I'm going to the doctor tomorrow.
glossary: to go to the doctor
translation: I have no time. I'm going to the doctor tomorrow.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Byłem wściekły, kiedy żona mnie okłamała.
english: I was furious when my wife lied to me.
glossary: to be furious/to lie to sb
translation: I was furious when my wife lied to me.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Od roku chodzę na siłownię.
english: I've been going to the gym for a year.
glossary: to go to the gym
translation: I go to the gym for a year.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Nie możesz wychodzić z łóżka. Masz grypę.
english: You can't get out of bed. You have the flu.
glossary: to have the flu/to get out of bed
translation: You can't get out of bed. You have a flu.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Pojadę na wakacje, jak już oszczędzę pieniądze.
english: I'll go on vacation once I save some money.
glossary: to go on vacation/to save some money
translation: 1.	I’ll go on vacation once I’ve saved money.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Dam Ci znać, jak już skończę pracę.
english: I'll let you know once I finish work.
glossary: to let sb know/to finish work
translation: 2.	I’ll let you know once I’ve finished my work.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Muszę iść wcześnie spać, bo jutro robię prezentację.
english: I have to go to sleep early because I'm giving a presentation tomorrow.
glossary: to go to sleep early/to give a presentation
translation: 3.	I have to go to sleep early because I'm doing a presentation tomorrow.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Myślałem, że będziesz tęsknić za domem.
english: I thought you'd feel homesick.
glossary: to feel homesick
translation: 4.	I thought you were going to miss home.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Zadzwonię do ciebie, jak już będę w domu.
english: I'll call you once I'm at home.
glossary: to call sb/to be at home
translation: 5.	I’ll call you once I’m home.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Wyjeżdżam jutro z miasta. Zadzwonię do ciebie, jak już wrócę.
english: I'm leaving town tomorrow. I'll call you once I'm back.
glossary: once/to leave town/to call sb
translation: 6.	I’m leaving town tomorrow. I’ll call you when I get back.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Mogłem się nauczyć na test.
english: I could've studied for the test.
glossary: to study for a test
translation: 7.	I could have studied for the test.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Odwiozę cię do domu, jak już zjemy kolację.
english: I'll take you home once we eat dinner.
glossary: to take sb home/to eat dinner
translation: 8.	I’ll drive you home once we eat dinner.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Oglądamy dzisiaj wieczorem mecz. Wpadnij.
english: We're watching a match tonight. Drop by.
glossary: to watch a match/to drop by
translation: 9.	We are watching the match tonight. Let’s drop by.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Co powiesz na poniedziałek? W weekend zajmuję się psami mojej siostry.
english: What about Monday? I'm taking care of my sister's dogs on the weekend.
glossary: on the weekend/What about.../to take care of sth
translation: 10.	How about Monday? I'm taking care of my sister's dogs on the weekend.

name: Maya Cook
polish: Czy są w tym mieście jakieś miejsca, które powinienem odwiedzić?
english: Are there any places in the city I should visit?
glossary: in the city; in town/to visit a place
translation: 1.	Are there any places I should visit in this city?

name: Maya Cook
polish: Gdzie jedziesz w tym roku na wakacje?
english: Where are you going on vacation this year?
glossary: to go on vacation/this year
translation: 2.	Where are you going on vacation this year?

name: Maya Cook
polish: Mamy czas. Nie ma potrzeby się spieszyć.
english: We have time. There's no need to hurry up.
glossary: to have time/a need/to hurry up
translation: 3.	We have time. We don’t have to hurry.

name: Maya Cook
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że wrócę do domu dzisiaj, ale uciekł mi pociąg.
english: I hoped I'd come back home today, but I missed the train.
glossary: to hope/to come back home/today/to miss the train
translation: 4.	I had hoped to come back home today, but I didn’t catch the train.

name: Maya Cook
polish: Dlaczego tak zareagowałaś? Możesz mi to wytłumaczyć?
english: Why did you react like that? Can you explain it to me?
glossary: to react to sth/like that/to explain sth to sb
translation: 5.	Why did you react that way? Can you explain it to me?

name: Maya Cook
polish: Mogłeś wcześniej zadzwonić. Powiedziałabym Ci, że nie ma mnie w domu.
english: You could've called before. I would've told you I wasn't at home.
glossary: to be at home/to call sb
translation: 6.	You could have called me earlier. I would have told you I wasn’t at home.

name: Maya Cook
polish: Z kim wczoraj rozmawiałeś przez telefon?
english: Who did you talk to on the phone yesterday?
glossary: to talk to sb over the phone
translation: 7.	Who did you talk on the phone with yesterday?

name: Maya Cook
polish: Idziemy dziś wieczorem na drinka. Pamiętasz?
english: We're going for a drink tonight. Do you remember?
glossary: to remember/to go for a drink/tonight
translation: 8.	We are going for a drink tonight. Do you remember it?

name: Maya Cook
polish: Obawiam się, że nie dostanę tej pracy.
english: I'm afraid I won't get the job.
glossary: to be afraid of sth/to get a job
translation: 9.	I am afraid I wouldn’t get this job.

name: Maya Cook
polish: Z kim chcesz spędzić resztę swojego życia?
english: Who do you want to spend the rest of your life with?
glossary: to spend time with sb/the rest of your life
translation: 10.	Who do you want to spend the rest of your life with?

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Zasnąłbyś wczoraj bez problemu, gdybyś nie oglądał wcześniej horroru.
english: You would've fallen asleep without a problem yesterday if you hadn't watched a horror before.
glossary: to fall asleep/without a problem/to watch a horror
translation: You would have fallen asleep early yesterday if you hadn't watched a horror movie earlier

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Nie miałem w zeszłym tygodniu rozmowy o pracę, bo rekruter miał grypę.
english: I didn't have the job interview last week because the recruiter had the flu.
glossary: to have a job interview/a recruiter/to have the flu
translation: I didn't have a job interview last week because the recruiter had a flu.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Nie wpadłem jak dotąd na żaden pomysł. Chcesz mi pomóc?
english: I haven't come up with an idea so far. Do you want to help me?
glossary: to come up with an idea/to help sb do sth
translation: So far I have had no idea. Do you want to help me

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Nie kłócilibyście się codziennie, gdyby twój mąż nie był taki uparty.
english: You wouldn't have an argument every day if your husband weren't so stubborn.
glossary: to have an argument/every day/to be stubborn
translation: We wouldn't argue every day if your husband wasn’t so stubborn.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: W tym roku daliśmy już trzy koncerty. Następny jest za tydzień.
english: We've already given three concerts this year. The next one is in a week.
glossary: to give a concert/this year/in a week
translation: We've given three concerts. Next is going to be next week.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Robiłem wczoraj pracę domową, popijając drinka.
english: I was doing my homework yesterday, sipping a drink.
glossary: to do your homework/to sip a drink
translation: I was doing my homework yesterday, while drinking a drink.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Nie wydawałbym pieniędzy na niepotrzebne rzeczy, będąc spłukanym.
english: I wouldn't spend money on unnecessary things, being broke.
glossary: to spend money on unnecessary things/to be broke
translation: I wouldn't spend money on unnecessary things if I was broke.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Zdecydowałem się już i to się nie zmieni.
english: I've already made up my mind and it won't change.
glossary: to make your mind/to change
translation: I have already made up my mind and it will not change.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Nie chcę, żebyś mi mówił, jak żyć.
english: I don't want you to tell me how to live.
glossary: to live/to tell sb sth
translation: I don't want you to tell me how to live.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Wygrałem już przedtem podobną sprawę, więc może się pani czuć bezpiecznie.
english: I've already won a similar case before, so you can feel safe.
glossary: to win a case/a similar case/to feel safe
translation: I've won a case like this before, so you can feel safe.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Mój współpracownik nigdy nie zwraca uwagi na szczegóły. Zawsze muszę poprawiać jego zadania.
english: My coworker never pays attention to detail. I always have to correct his tasks.
glossary: to pay attention to detail/to correct sth
translation: My coworker never pays attention to detail. I always have to correct his tasks.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Jak długo umniejszasz moje osiągnięcia? Nie będę już tego znosić.
english: How long have you been diminishing my accomplishments? I won't put up with it anymore.
glossary: to diminish sth/to put up with sth
translation: How long have you been diminishing my achievements? I won’t put up with it anymore.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Jak długo żujesz tę gumę? Weź nową.
english: How long have you been chewing this gum? Take a new one.
glossary: to chew a gum/to take a new one
translation: How long have you been chewing the gum?Take a new one.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Słyszałem dziś, jak moja córka mówi po angielsku, i to skłoniło mnie do myślenia. Może też powinienem zapisać się na taki kurs.
english: I heard my daughter speaking English today, and it made me think. Maybe I should sign up for such a course as well.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to hear sb doing sth/to sign up for a course
translation: I heard today my daughter speaking English and it made me think.  Maybe I should sign up for a such course too.

name: Yvonne West
polish: O co prokurator okręgowy chce cię oskarżyć?
english: What does the district attorney want to charge you with?
glossary: a district attorney/to charge sb with sth
translation: What does the district attorney want to accuse you of?

name: Yvonne West
polish: Powinniśmy teraz nosić maseczki w sklepach.
english: We are supposed to wear face masks in stores now.
glossary: to wear face masks
translation: We should wear face masks in the stores now.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Jak długo tyle bierzesz? Ostatnim razem, kiedy się spotkaliśmy, było taniej.
english: How long have you been charging this much? The last time we met it was cheaper.
glossary: to charge sb
translation: How long have you been taking so much? Last time we met it was cheaper.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Od jak dawna chwalisz się swoim nowym samochodem? Czy nie widzisz, że wszyscy mają dość?
english: How long have you been bragging about your new car? Can't you see everyone's fed up?
glossary: to brag about sth/to be fed up with sth
translation: How long have you been  braging about your new car? Don’t you see everyone has enough?

name: Yvonne West
polish: Dlaczego akcje Twojej firmy spadły? Czy coś się stało?
english: Why did your company's shares drop? Did anything happen?
glossary: to drop/a share
translation: Why did shares of your company fall down? Did something happen?

name: Yvonne West
polish: Mieliśmy się zmieniać, nieprawdaż?
english: We were supposed to take turns, weren't we?
glossary: to take turns
translation: We were supposed to change, isn’t it?

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Kiedy się dowiedziałaś, że nie będziesz się kwalifikować do ubezpieczenia?
english: When did you find out that you wouldn't be eligible for insurance?
glossary: to find out about sth/to be eligible for sth/to be eligible for insurance
translation: 1. When did you find out that you wouldn't be eligible for insurance?

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Kiedy brałem prysznic, wpadłem na świetny pomysł.
english: When I was taking a shower, I came up with a great idea.
glossary: to take a shower/to come up with sth/to come up with an idea
translation: 2. When I was teaking a shower, I came up with an great idea.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Gdybyś była bardziej nieustępliwa, byłabyś w stanie udowodnić swoje racje.
english: If you were more persistent, you'd be able to prove your point.
glossary: to be persistent/to prove your point/to prove sth
translation: 3. If you were more tenacious, you would be able to prove your point.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Kiedy przypomniałaś mi, że zostawiłam klucze w samochodzie, poczułam ulgę.
english: When you reminded me I'd left the keys in the car, I felt relieved.
glossary: to remind sb sth; to remind sth to sb/to feel relieved
translation: 4. When you reminded me that I had left keys in a car, I felt relieved.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Powinieneś być wdzięczny. Gdybym cię nie ostrzegł, dostałbyś mandat.
english: You should be grateful. If I hadn't warned you, you would've gotten a ticket.
glossary: to be grateful/to warn sb about sth/to get a ticket
translation: 5. You should be grateful. If I didn't warn you, you would get a ticket.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Zdziwiłem się, kiedy żona mi powiedziała, że chce się wyprowadzić.
english: I got surprised when my wife told me she wanted to move out.
glossary: to get surprised/to move out/a wife
translation: 6. I was surprised when my wife told me that she wanted to move out.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Jeśli coś mi się nie spodoba, po prostu będę się trzymać od tego z daleka.
english: If I don't like anything, I'll simply stay away from it.
glossary: to stay away from sth
translation: 7. If I don't like something, I will just stay away from it.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Jeszcze nigdy nie byłam na innym kontynencie.
english: I haven't been to a different continent yet.
glossary: a continent
translation: 8. Never I wasn't to another continent before.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Dlaczego na świecie jest tyle głodu?
english: Why is there so much hunger in the world?
glossary: hunger/in the world
translation: 9. Why is there so much hunger in the world?

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: O co walczysz?
english: What are you fighting for?
glossary: to fight for sth
translation: 10. What do you fight for?

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Wynajmowałem mieszkanie z kolegą, zanim kupiłem własny dom.
english: I'd been renting an apartment with a friend before I bought my own house.
glossary: to rent an apartment/your own house/to buy a house
translation: 1. I had been renting an appartment with a friend, before I bought my own house.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Do kogo się uśmiechasz?
english: Who are you smiling at?
glossary: to smile at sb
translation: 2. Who are you smiling at?

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Jeszcze tego nie przemyślałem.
english: I haven't thought it over yet.
glossary: to think sth over
translation: 3. I haven’t thought it over yet.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Może nie byłbyś marudny, gdybyś nie siedział codziennie przed telewizorem.
english: Maybe you wouldn't be moody if you didn't sit in front of the TV every day.
glossary: to be moody/to sit in front of the TV/every day
translation: 4. Maybe you wouldn’t be grumpy if you didn’t seat in front of the TV every day.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Żona się pytała, czy zrobię kolację.
english: My wife asked me if I'd make dinner.
glossary: to make dinner
translation: 5. My wife asked if I would prepare the dinner.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Rodzice się mnie pytali, czy wziąłem w końcu kredyt.
english: My parents asked me if I'd finally taken out a loan.
glossary: to take out a loan/finally
translation: 6. My parents asked me if I had finally take out a loan.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Gdybyś mnie posłuchał, nie skończyłbyś w szpitalu.
english: If you'd listened to me, you wouldn't have ended up in the hospital.
glossary: to listen to sb/to end up in the hospital
translation: 7. If you had listened to me, you wouldn’t have ended up in the hospital.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Dlaczego jest tylu ludzi, którzy żyją w ubóstwie?
english: Why are there so many people who live in poverty?
glossary: to live in poverty
translation: 8. Why are there so many people who live in poverty?

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Kiedy się zaręczyliście?
english: When did you get engaged?
glossary: to get engaged
translation: 9. When did you get engaged?

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Nie wygramy sprawy, jeśli nie będziesz zeznawał.
english: We won't win the case if you don't testify.
glossary: to win a case/to testify
translation: 10. We won’t win the case if you don’t testify.

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Po tym, jak zrobiłeś zupę, wszyscy rzygaliśmy.
english: After you'd made the soup, we all threw up.
glossary: to make soup/to throw up
translation: 1.After you made the soup, we all vomited .

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Czy jest coś, co mogę polepszyć, żeby być bardziej wydajnym, gdy się uczę?
english: Is there anything I can improve to be more efficient while studying?
glossary: to improve sth/to be efficient/to study sth
translation: 2.Is there  something that I can improve to be more efficient  when I learn?

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Zjadłabym dużo więcej na weselu, gdybym nie przeszła na dietę parę dni wcześniej,
english: I would've eaten much more at the wedding party if I hadn't gone on a diet a couple of days before.
glossary: a wedding party/to go on a diet/a couple of days
translation: 3.I would have eaten more at the wedding if I hadn't gone on a diet a few days earlier.

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Mimo że kolega powiedział, że jego pies nie jest niebezpieczny, bałam się go pogłaskać.
english: Even though my friend said his dog wasn't dangerous, I was afraid to pet it.
glossary: even though/a friend/a dangerous dog/to pet a dog
translation: 4.Even though a friend said his dog wasn't dangerous, I was afraid to touch him.

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Gdybyś nie był zapominalski, cały zespół nie musiałby teraz pracować.
english: If you weren't forgetful, the whole team wouldn't have to work now.
glossary: to be forgetful/the whole team/to work
translation: 5.If you weren't forgetful, the whole team wouldn't have to work now.

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Jeśli nasza firma otworzy nową filię, wszyscy zrobimy się zajęci.
english: If our company opens a new branch, we'll all get busy.
glossary: to open a new branch/a branch/to get busy
translation: 6.If our company opens a new branch, everybody7. Dlaczego zaparkowałeś tak daleko od galerii?

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Dlaczego zaparkowałeś tak daleko od galerii?
english: Why did you park so far away from the mall?
glossary: to park your car/to be far away from sth/a mall
translation: 7.Why did you park so far from the gallery ?

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Tak szybko jechałem na rowerze, że nie zorientowałem się, że przejechałem znak stop.
english: I was riding a bike so fast that I didn't realize I had run a stop sign.
glossary: to ride a bike/to realize that.../to run a stop sign
translation: 8. I  rode my bike so fast that I didn't realize I had run over a stop sign.

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Widzę, że restauracja ci się nie podoba. Z czym masz problem?
english: I see that you don't like the restaurant. What do you have a problem with?
glossary: to have a problem with sth/a restaurant
translation: 9.I see you don’t like the restaurant .What is your problem?

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Powiedziałem mamie, że poszedłem do lekarza, bo chciałem ją uspokoić.
english: I told my mom I'd gone to the doctor because I wanted to calm her down.
glossary: to go to the doctor/to calm sb down
translation: 10. I told my mom that I went to the doctor because I wanted to calm her down.

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Kiedy się dowiedziałaś, że nie będziesz się kwalifikować do ubezpieczenia?
english: When did you find out that you wouldn't be eligible for insurance?
glossary: to find out about sth/to be eligible for sth/to be eligible for insurance
translation: 1.When did you find out you wouldn't be eligible for insurance?

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Kiedy brałem prysznic, wpadłem na świetny pomysł.
english: When I was taking a shower, I came up with a great idea.
glossary: to take a shower/to come up with sth/to come up with an idea
translation: 2. When I was taking a shower, I found   a great idea.

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Gdybyś była bardziej nieustępliwa, byłabyś w stanie udowodnić swoje racje.
english: If you were more persistent, you'd be able to prove your point.
glossary: to be persistent/to prove your point/to prove sth
translation: 3.   If you were more relentless, you would be able to prove your point.

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Kiedy przypomniałaś mi, że zostawiłam klucze w samochodzie, poczułam ulgę.
english: When you reminded me I'd left the keys in the car, I felt relieved.
glossary: to remind sb sth; to remind sth to sb/to feel relieved
translation: 4. When you reminded me that I had left my keys in the car, I was relieved.

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Powinieneś być wdzięczny. Gdybym cię nie ostrzegł, dostałbyś mandat.
english: You should be grateful. If I hadn't warned you, you would've gotten a ticket.
glossary: to be grateful/to warn sb about sth/to get a ticket
translation: 5. You should be grateful. If I hadn't warned you, you would have given  a ticket.

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Zdziwiłem się, kiedy żona mi powiedziała, że chce się wyprowadzić.
english: I got surprised when my wife told me she wanted to move out.
glossary: to get surprised/to move out/a wife
translation: 6. I was surprised when my wife told me she wanted to move out.

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Jeśli coś mi się nie spodoba, po prostu będę się trzymać od tego z daleka.
english: If I don't like anything, I'll simply stay away from it.
glossary: to stay away from sth
translation: 7. If I don't like something, I'll just stay away from it.

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Jeszcze nigdy nie byłam na innym kontynencie.
english: I haven't been to a different continent yet.
glossary: a continent
translation: 8.  I've never been to another continent

name: Theresa Fine
polish: Dlaczego na świecie jest tyle głodu?
english: Why is there so much hunger in the world?
glossary: hunger/in the world
translation: 9.  Why is there so much hunger in the world?

name: Theresa Fine
polish: O co walczysz?
english: What are you fighting for?
glossary: to fight for sth
translation: 10.  What are you fighting for?

name: Paul Cook
polish: Czy są w tym mieście jakieś miejsca, które powinienem odwiedzić?
english: Are there any places in the city I should visit?
glossary: in the city; in town/to visit a place
translation: 1.	Are there any places in that town which I should visit?

name: Paul Cook
polish: Gdzie jedziesz w tym roku na wakacje?
english: Where are you going on vacation this year?
glossary: to go on vacation/this year
translation: 2.	Where are you going on vacation this year?

name: Paul Cook
polish: Mamy czas. Nie ma potrzeby się spieszyć.
english: We have time. There's no need to hurry up.
glossary: to have time/a need/to hurry up
translation: 3.	We have time. There’s no need to hurry up.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że wrócę do domu dzisiaj, ale uciekł mi pociąg.
english: I hoped I'd come back home today, but I missed the train.
glossary: to hope/to come back home/today/to miss the train
translation: 4.	I hoped I would come back home today, but I didn’t catch the train.

name: Paul Cook
polish: Dlaczego tak zareagowałaś? Możesz mi to wytłumaczyć?
english: Why did you react like that? Can you explain it to me?
glossary: to react to sth/like that/to explain sth to sb
translation: 5.	Why did you react like that? Can you explain me that?

name: Paul Cook
polish: Mogłeś wcześniej zadzwonić. Powiedziałabym Ci, że nie ma mnie w domu.
