english: What does the article refer to?
glossary: to refer to sth/an article
translation: What does the article refer to?

name: Yvonne West
polish: Dlaczego pozwoliłeś rodzicom rozpieszczać swoje dzieci?
english: Why did you let your parents spoil your kids?
glossary: to let sb do sth/to spoil your kids
translation: Why did you allow parents to spoil your kids?

name: Yvonne West
polish: Miałeś przećwiczyć scenariusz. Jak zamierzasz teraz wyjść na scenę?
english: You were supposed to rehearse the script. How are you going to go on stage now?
glossary: to rehearse the script/to go on stage
translation: You were supposed to practise the script. How are you going to go on stage?

name: Yvonne West
polish: Zbyt często wychodzisz. To nie jest hotel.
english: You're going out way too often. It's not a hotel.
glossary: to go out/to do sth way too often
translation: You’re going out too often. It’s not a hotel.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Mój tata miał rozebrać te stare meble, ale nie miał czasu.
english: My dad was supposed to take this old furniture apart, but he had no time.
glossary: to take sth apart/to have no time
translation: My father was supposed to  these old furniture, but he didn’t have time.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Jak długo bronisz przestępców? Nie czujesz się z tym źle?
english: How long have you been defending criminals? Don't you feel bad about it?
glossary: to defend sb/to feel bad about sth
translation: How long have you defending criminals? Don’t you feel bed with it?

name: Yvonne West
polish: Jak długo zlew jest zatkany? Powinniśmy coś z tym zrobić.
english: How long has the sink been stuck? We should do something about it.
glossary: to be stuck/to do sth about sth
translation: How long has the sink been clogged? We should do something with it.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Po południu miałam ściąć włosy, ale okazało się, że muszę odebrać syna ze szkoły.
english: I was supposed to have my hair cut in the afternoon, but it's turned out I have to pick my son from school.
glossary: to have your hair cut/to pick sb from school
translation: In the afternoon, I was supposed to cut my hair, but it turned out I had to pick up my son from school.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Co sprawiło, że wyprowadziłeś się z miasta? Myślałem, że lubisz swoją okolicę.
english: What made you move out of town? I thought you liked your neighborhood.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to like your neighborhood
translation: What made you move out from the city? I thought you liked your area.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Miałeś kosić trawnik. Kiedy zamierzasz to zrobić?
english: You were supposed to mow the lawn. When are you going to do it?
glossary: to mow the lawn
translation: You were supposed to mow the lawn. When are you going to do this?

name: Eve Miles
polish: Dlaczego dzwoniłeś wczoraj do mnie tyle razy?
english: Why did you call me so many times yesterday?
glossary: to call sb/many times
translation: 1.	Why did you call me so many times yesterday?

name: Eve Miles
polish: Z kim wczoraj poszedłeś na imprezę?
english: Who did you go to the party with yesterday?
glossary: to go to a party with sb
translation: 2.	Who did you go to the party with yesterday?

name: Eve Miles
polish: Nie powinnaś była składać obietnicy, jeśli wiedziałaś, że jej nie dotrzymasz.
english: You shouldn't have made the promise if you knew you wouldn't keep it.
glossary: to make a promise/to keep a promise
translation: 3.	You shouldn’t have kept the promise if you knew you wouldn’t keep it.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Jestem rozczarowana. Byłam pewna, że nie złamiesz obietnicy.
english: I'm disappointed. I was sure you wouldn't break the promise.
glossary: to be disappointed with sth/to be sure/to break a promise
translation: 4.	I’m disappointed. I was sure you wouldn’t break your promise.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Ufam ci, bo od dawna razem pracujemy.
english: I trust you because we've been working together for a long time.
glossary: to trust sb/for a long time
translation: 5.	I trust you because we have been working together for a long time.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Możemy porozmawiać, bo nie ma tu nikogo.
english: We can talk because there's nobody here.
glossary: to talk about sth
translation: 6.	We can talk because there is nobody here.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Przeprowadzam się w przyszłym miesiącu na wieś. Nie mogę się doczekać.
english: I'm moving to the countryside next month. I can't wait.
glossary: can't wait/to move to the countryside
translation: 7.	I’m moving to the countryside next month. I can wait for it.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Jest kilka książek, które chciałbym przeczytać do końca roku.
english: There are a few books I'd like to read by the end of the year.
glossary: a few/to read a book/by the end of the year
translation: 8.	There are a few books which I would like to read by the end of the year.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Mam nadzieję, że zdążę na pociąg. To ostatni.
english: I hope I'll catch the train. It's the last one.
glossary: to catch the train/to catch the last train
translation: 9.	I hope I will catch the train. It’s the last one.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Od miesiąca szukam pracy, ale nie ma interesujących ofert.
english: I've been looking for a job for a month, but there are no interesting offers.
glossary: to look for a job/an offer
translation: 10.	I have been looking for a job for a month, but there aren’t interesting offers.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Pojawiłabym się, gdybyś potwierdził wcześniej spotkanie.
english: I would've showed up if you'd confirmed the meeting earlier.
glossary: to show up/to confirm a meeting
translation: 1.	I would have shown up if you had confirmed the meeting earlier.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Zaoszczędziłbyś trochę pieniędzy, gdybyś pił kranówkę.
english: You'd save some money if you drank tap water.
glossary: to drink tap water/to save some money
translation: 2.	You would save some money if you drank tap water.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Jakie są opcje?
english: What options are there?
glossary: an option
translation: 3.	What are the options?

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Będziesz miał szlaban, jeśli nie wrócisz na czas do domu.
english: You'll be grounded if you don't come back home on time.
glossary: on time/to come back home/to be grounded
translation: 4.	You will have punishment if you don’t get home on time home.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Kiedy zdałaś sobie sprawę, że zostałaś oszukana?
english: When did you realize you'd been cheated?
glossary: to realize sth/to cheat sb
translation: 5.	When did you realize that you were cheated?

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Nie zjedliśmy wczoraj kolacji w restauracji, ponieważ mój mąż zapomniał zarezerwować stolik.
english: We didn't have dinner at the restaurant yesterday because my husband had forgotten to book a table.
glossary: to forget to do sth/to book a table/a husband/to eat dinner; to have dinner/at the restaurant
translation: 6.	We didn’t eat dinner in the restaurant yesterday because my husband forgot to book a table.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Dlaczego jeszcze nie zrobiłeś przelewu?
english: Why haven't you made the transfer yet?
glossary: to make a transfer
translation: 7.	Why haven’t you made the transfer yet?

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Na kogo masz zamiar głosować?
english: Who are you going to vote for?
glossary: to vote for sb/to be going to do sth
translation: 8.	Who are you going to vote for?

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Kiedy zgłosił pan zdarzenie?
english: When did you report the incident?
glossary: an incident/to report sth
translation: 9.	When did you report the incident?

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Wczoraj marzyłam tylko o zrobieniu sobie drzemki.
english: I only dreamed of taking a nap yesterday.
glossary: to take a nap/to dream of sth
translation: 10.	I was just dreaming about having a nap yesterday.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Składając wniosek, pamiętaj, żeby go podpisać.
english: Filing an application, remember to sign it.
glossary: to file an application/to sign an application
translation: When submiting an aplication, remember to sing up it.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Czy ma pan odpowiednie umiejętności, żeby wykonywać tę pracę?
english: Do you have the necessary skills to do the job?
glossary: to have the necessary skills/to do a job
translation: Do you have right skills to do this job?

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Zawsze chciałem pracować z ludźmi.
english: I've always wanted to work with people.
glossary: to work with people
translation: I’ve always wanted to work with people.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Gdybyś oszczędzał wodę, zmniejszyłbyś swoje miesięczne rachunki.
english: If you saved water, you'd lower your monthly bills.
glossary: to save water/to lower your bills
translation: If you saved water, You would reduce your monthly bills.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Nie możesz dzwonić do mnie w nocy, oczekując, że odbiorę.
english: You can't call me at night expecting that I'll pick up the phone.
glossary: to call sb/at night/to expect sb to do sth
translation: You can’t call me at night expecting that I pick up.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Nie chcę, żeby utrzymywali mnie rodzice.
english: I don't want my parents to provide for me.
glossary: to provide for sb
translation: I won’t my parents to provide me for.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Zawsze ci mówiłem, żebyś zaczęła oszczędzać pieniądze.
english: I've always told you to start saving money.
glossary: to save money/to start to do sth; to start doing sth
translation: I’ve always told you that you to start save money.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Moja córka nie zaczęłaby palić, gdyby nie była pod presją rówieśników.
english: My daughter wouldn't have started to smoke if she hadn't been under peer pressure.
glossary: to smoke/to be under peer pressure
translation: My daughter wouldn’t have started smoking if she hadn’t been under peer presser.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Aplikowałem już na kilka stanowisk, ale nikt jeszcze do mnie nie zadzwonił.
english: I've already applied for a few positions, but no one has called me yet.
glossary: to apply for a position/to call sb
translation: I applied for a few position, but no one has called me yet.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Przeczytałem dziś rano wszystkie mejle, pijąc kawę.
english: I read all my emails today, drinking coffee.
glossary: to read emails/to drink coffee
translation: I read all my emails this morning while I was drinking coffee.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Zmarnowałem godzinę, czekając na ciebie na zewnątrz.
english: I wasted an hour waiting for you outside.
glossary: to waste your time/to wait for sb/outside
translation: I wasted an hour waiting for you outdoors.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Leżelibyśmy teraz na plaży, gdyby nasz lot nie został odwołany.
english: We'd be lying on the beach now if our flight hadn't been canceled.
glossary: to lie on the beach/to cancel a flight
translation: We would’ve laid on the beach if our flait hadn’t canceled.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Dobrze się wczoraj bawiłaś ze znajomymi?
english: Did you have a good time with your friends yesterday?
glossary: to have a good time
translation: Did you have a good time with your friends?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jak dotąd policja zatrzymała jedną osobę podejrzaną o dokonanie kradzieży.
english: So far the police have detained one person suspected of committing the theft.
glossary: the police/to detain sb/to be suspected of sth/to commit theft
translation: The police detained one person suspected of committing theft so far.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie byłbyś teraz spłukany, gdybyś nie imprezował w zeszły weekend.
english: You wouldn't be broke now if you hadn't partied last weekend.
glossary: to be broke/to party/last weekend
translation: You wouldn’t be broke now if you didn’t party last weekend.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Łatwiej byłoby mi dojeżdżać do pracy, gdybym mieszkał w mieście.
english: It would be easier for me to commute to work if I lived in the city.
glossary: to commute to work/to live in the city
translation: It would be easier for me to commute to work if I live in the city.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Mogłybyśmy ćwiczyć razem, gdybyś też się zapisała na zajęcia z jogi.
english: We could exercise together if you signed up for yoga classes too.
glossary: to exercise/to sign up for yoga classes
translation: We could exercise together if you sign up for yoga classes.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Dlaczego nie chcesz, żeby twoje dzieci uczyły się angielskiego?
english: Why don't you want your kids to learn English?
glossary: to learn English
translation: Why didn’t you want your children to learn English?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Zrobiłabym panu teraz zastrzyk, gdyby się pan tak nie trząsł.
english: I'd give you an injection now if you didn't tremble so much.
glossary: to give sb an injection/to tremble
translation: I would do an injection to you if you didn’t tremble as much.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie dostalibyśmy zatrucia pokarmowego, gdybyś umiał gotować.
english: We wouldn't have gotten food poisoning if you could cook.
glossary: to get food poisoning/to cook
translation: We wouldn’t have gotten food poisoning if you had known how to cook.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Jak długo już nalegasz? Nie rozumiesz, że Ci tego nie dam?
english: How long have you been insisting yet? Don't you understand I won't give it?
glossary: to insist
translation: 1. How long have you insisted me? Don’t you understand that I won’t give you it?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: O której wylądował samolot? Nie miał przybyć później?
english: What time did the plane land? Wasn't it supposed to arrive later?
glossary: to land/a plane/to arrive later
translation: 2. What hour did the plane arrive? Wasn't it suppose to come later?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Twoja partia miała mnie wesprzeć w następnych wyborach.
english: Your party was supposed to back me during the next election.
glossary: to back sb/a party/an election
translation: 3. Your party would supported me in the next election.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Nigdy nie pozwalasz mi chodzić na imprezy. Nie jestem już dzieckiem.
english: You never let me go to parties. I'm not a kid anymore.
glossary: to let sb do sth
translation: 4. You never let me go parties. I’m not a child any more.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Jak długo zaprzeczasz prawdzie? Czy to nie najwyższy czas, żeby się z tym zmierzyć?
english: How long have you been denying the truth? Isn't it high time to face it?
glossary: to deny the truth/to face sth
translation: 5. How long have you been denying the truth? Isn’t the highest time to face it?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Nikt nie zmuszał Cię do wybrania tego kursu, więc przestań narzekać.
english: No one made you choose that course, so stop complaining.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to complain about sth
translation: 6. Nobody was forcing you to choose this course, so stop complaining.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Miałem naładować komórkę, ale zupełnie zapomniałem.
english: I was supposed to charge my cell phone, but I totally forgot.
glossary: to charge your cell phone
translation: 7. I had to charge my phone, but I forget about it at all.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Czym zwykle skutkuje takie zachowanie?
english: What does such behavior usually result in?
glossary: behavior/to result in sth
translation: 8. What is usually the effect of the behavior like this?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Mój mąż miał złożyć łóżeczko do kupy, ale był zbyt leniwy.
english: My husband was supposed to put the crib together, but he was too lazy.
glossary: to put sth together/to be too lazy to do sth
translation: 9. My husband had to put the child bed together, but he was so lazy.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Od jak dawna próbujesz wprowadzić swój pierwszy produkt? Chyba minął już rok.
english: How long have you been trying to roll out your first product? I guess it's been a year now.
glossary: to roll sth out
translation: 10. How long have you been trying to launch your first product on the market? Probably a year have passed already.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Czy to ma dla ciebie znaczenie?
english: Does it matter to you?
glossary: to matter
translation: 1. Does it matter to you?

name: Matt Xander
polish: Dlaczego próbujesz mnie wrobić?
english: Why are you trying to set me up?
glossary: to try to do sth/to set sb up
translation: 2. Why are you trying to set me up?

name: Matt Xander
polish: Jest wiele miejsc, które chciałbym odwiedzić.
english: There are many places I'd like to visit.
glossary: to visit a place
translation: 3. There are many places I would like to visit.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Myślisz, że ci uwierzę?
english: Do you think I'll believe you?
glossary: to believe sb
translation: 4. Do you think I'll believe you?

name: Matt Xander
polish: Czy ty myślisz, że ze mną wygrasz?
english: Do you think you'll win against me?
glossary: to win against sb
translation: 5. Do you think you will win with me?

name: Matt Xander
polish: Wkurzyłeś się, kiedy zostałeś zwolniony?
english: Did you get mad when you were fired?
glossary: to get mad/to be fired
translation: 6. Were you pissed off when you were fired?

name: Matt Xander
polish: Może zjesz z nami jutro kolację?
english: Maybe you'll eat dinner with us tomorrow?
glossary: to eat dinner with sb
translation: 7. Why don't you have dinner with us tomorrow?

name: Matt Xander
polish: Jest wiele kursów, na które możesz się zapisać.
english: There are many courses you can sign up for.
glossary: to sign up for a course
translation: 8. There are many courses you can take.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Przestałem ci ufać, kiedy mnie po raz pierwszy oszukałaś.
english: I stopped trusting you when you cheated on me for the first time.
glossary: to stop doing sth/to trust sb/to cheat sb/for the first time
translation: 9. I stopped trusting you when you cheated me for the first time.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Jestem pewien, że mnie nie zawiedziesz.
english: I'm sure you won't let me down.
glossary: to let sb down
translation: 10. I'm sure you won't let me down.

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Czy są w tym mieście jakieś miejsca, które powinienem odwiedzić?
english: Are there any places in the city I should visit?
glossary: in the city; in town/to visit a place
translation: 1. Are there any places I should visit in this town?

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Gdzie jedziesz w tym roku na wakacje?
english: Where are you going on vacation this year?
glossary: to go on vacation/this year
translation: 2. Where are you going for a vacation this year?

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Mamy czas. Nie ma potrzeby się spieszyć.
english: We have time. There's no need to hurry up.
glossary: to have time/a need/to hurry up
translation: 3. I got time. There is no need to hurry up.

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że wrócę do domu dzisiaj, ale uciekł mi pociąg.
english: I hoped I'd come back home today, but I missed the train.
glossary: to hope/to come back home/today/to miss the train
translation: 4. I hoped to come back home today but I missed the train.

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Dlaczego tak zareagowałaś? Możesz mi to wytłumaczyć?
english: Why did you react like that? Can you explain it to me?
glossary: to react to sth/like that/to explain sth to sb
translation: 5. Why you reacted like that? Could you explain it to me?

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Mogłeś wcześniej zadzwonić. Powiedziałabym Ci, że nie ma mnie w domu.
english: You could've called before. I would've told you I wasn't at home.
glossary: to be at home/to call sb
translation: 6. You could’ve called earlier. I’d told you I wasn’t home.

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Z kim wczoraj rozmawiałeś przez telefon?
english: Who did you talk to on the phone yesterday?
glossary: to talk to sb over the phone
translation: 7. Who with did you talk on the phone yesterday?

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Idziemy dziś wieczorem na drinka. Pamiętasz?
english: We're going for a drink tonight. Do you remember?
glossary: to remember/to go for a drink/tonight
translation: 8. We’re going for a dring toning. Do you remeber?

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Obawiam się, że nie dostanę tej pracy.
english: I'm afraid I won't get the job.
glossary: to be afraid of sth/to get a job
translation: 9. I’m affriand that I won’t get this job.

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Z kim chcesz spędzić resztę swojego życia?
english: Who do you want to spend the rest of your life with?
glossary: to spend time with sb/the rest of your life
translation: 10. With who would you like to spend rest of your live?

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Kogo chcesz, żebym zaprosił na imprezę?
english: Who do you want me to invite to the party?
glossary: to invite sb to a party
translation: 1. Who would you like me to invite to a party?

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Wpadaj. Mój mąż gotuje w ten piątek.
english: Drop by. My husband's cooking this Friday.
glossary: to cook/this Friday
translation: 2. Drop by. My husband’s cooking this Friday.

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Nie ma różnicy. Bierz, co chcesz.
english: There's no difference. Take what you want.
glossary: a difference/to take sth
translation: 3. There’s no difference. Take whatever you want.

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Mogłeś mi od razu powiedzieć prawdę. Nie zdenerwowałbym się.
english: You could've told me the truth at the beginning. I wouldn't have gotten mad.
glossary: to tell sb the truth/at the beginning/to get mad
translation: 4. You could’ve told the truth straight away. I wouldn’t got mad.

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Co mi chciałaś powiedzieć na imprezie?
english: What did you want to tell me at the party?
glossary: to tell sb sth/at the party
translation: 5. What did you wanted to tell me at the party?

name: Matthias Weber
polish: W artykule jest błąd. Popraw go.
english: There's a mistake in the article. Correct it.
glossary: in the article/to correct a mistake
translation: 6. There is a mistake in the article. Correct it.

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Może pojadę taksówką. Zaoszczędzę czas.
english: Maybe I'll take a cab. I'll save time.
glossary: to take a cab/to save money
translation: 7. Maybe, I’ll take a cab. I’ll save some time.

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Co chcesz dostać na urodziny?
english: What do you want to get for your birthday?
glossary: to get sth for your birthday
translation: 8. What do you want to get for your birthday?

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Gdzie Ty wczoraj spałeś?
english: Where did you sleep yesterday?
glossary: to sleep
translation: 9. Where did you sleep last night?

name: Matthias Weber
polish: Stresowałem się, bo bałem się, że coś pójdzie źle.
english: I was stressed out because I was afraid something would go wrong.
glossary: to be stressed out/to be afraid of sth/to go wrong
translation: 10. I’ve been stressed out because I was afraid that something would go wrong.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Jest kilka osób, które chcą zapisać się na kurs.
english: There are a few people who want to sign up for the course.
glossary: to sign up for a course
translation: 1. There are a few people who want to sign up for the course.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Napiszę do ciebie, jak już będę mieć wolne.
english: I'll text you once I have a day off.
glossary: to have a day off/to text sb/once {2}
translation: 2. I will text you if I have a free day.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Od dawna tu pracuję.
english: I've been working here for a long time.
glossary: to work
translation: 3. I’ve been working here for a long time.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Poprosiłeś rodziców o pomoc?
english: Did you ask your parents for help?
glossary: to ask sb for help
translation: 4. Did you ask your parents for help?

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Mogę porozmawiać z odpowiednią osobą, jeśli chcesz.
english: I can talk to the right person if you want.
glossary: to want sth/to talk to sb/the right person
translation: 5. I can talk to the right person if you want.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Wieczorem idę na zakupy. Chcesz coś?
english: I'm going shopping in the evening. Do you want anything?
glossary: to go shopping
translation: 6. I’m going shopping tonight. Do you want something?

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Może nie będę mieć w następnym tygodniu dużo pracy.
english: Maybe I won't have much work next week.
glossary: to have much work/Maybe.../next week
translation: 7. Maybe, I won’t have so much work next week.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Byłem pewien, że będę zmotywowany do nauki angielskiego.
english: I was sure I'd be motivated to learn English.
glossary: to be sure/to learn English/to be motivated to do sth
translation: 8. I was certain that I would be motivated to learn English.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Dlaczego rzuciłaś angielski?
english: Why did you give up English?
glossary: to give up English
translation: 9. Why did you quit your English classes?

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Obiecuję, że podrzucę dzieci jutro do szkoły.
english: I promise I'll drop off the kids at school tomorrow.
glossary: to drop off the kids at school
translation: 10. I promise, I will pick children to school tomorrow.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Miałem w zeszłym tygodniu dużo pracy i bałem się, że nie wyrobię się z terminem.
english: I had a lot of work last week and I was afraid I wouldn't meet the deadline.
glossary: to have a lot of work/last week/to be afraid of sth/to meet the deadline
translation: I had a lot of work last week and I was afraid that I would miss the deadline.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Nie powinieneś był wspominać o naszych problemach na spotkaniu z szefem.
english: You shouldn't have mentioned our problems at the meeting with the boss.
glossary: at the meeting/to mention sth
translation: You shouldn't have mentioned about our issues at the meeting with your boss.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Przyjeżdżam jutro do Warszawy i zatrzymuję się u mojej koleżanki.
english: I'm coming to Warsaw tomorrow and staying at my friend's.
glossary: to come to Warsaw
translation: I'm coming to Warsaw tomorrow and I'm staying at my friend's.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Nie powinieneś był opowiadać tego żartu. Był niegrzeczny.
english: You shouldn't have told the joke. It was rude.
glossary: to be rude to sb/to tell sb a joke
translation: You shouldn't have told this joke. It was rude.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że nic nie będę musiał dzisiaj robić.
english: I hoped I wouldn't have to do anything today.
glossary: to hope/today
translation: I hoped I won't have to do anything today.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Powinienem był spędzić zeszły weekend z rodziną.
english: I should've spent my last weekend with my family.
glossary: to spend time with sb/last weekend/a family
translation: I should have spent last week with my family.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Nie powinienem był Ci opowiadać tej historii, bo jest zbyt prywatna.
english: I shouldn't have told you the story because it's too private.
glossary: to tell sb a story/to be private
translation: I shouldn't have told you this story because it is too private.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że ci klienci zostawią większy napiwek.
english: I hoped the customers would leave a bigger tip.
glossary: to leave a tip/a customer/to hope
translation: I hoped that customers would leave a bigger tip.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Nie powinieneś był mnie okłamywać.
english: You shouldn't have lied to me.
glossary: to lie to sb
translation: You shouldn't have lied to me.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Co robisz dziś wieczorem?
english: What are you doing tonight?
translation: What are you doing in the evening?

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Nie powinienem był robić takiego bałaganu. Przepraszam.
english: I shouldn't have made such a mess. I'm sorry.
glossary: to make a mess
translation: I shouldn't have done such a mess. I'm sorry.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Jestem głodny. Mogłem zjeść śniadanie.
english: I'm hungry. I could've eaten breakfast.
glossary: to be hungry/to eat breakfast
translation: I am hungry. I could eat breakfast.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Mogłem biec szybciej. Zdążyłbym na pociąg.
english: I could've run faster. I would've caught the train.
glossary: to run fast/to catch the train
translation: I could run faster. I would catch the train.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Jechałeś bardzo szybko. Bałem się, że będziemy mieli wypadek.
english: You drove very fast. I was afraid we'd have an accident.
glossary: to drive/to be afraid/to have an accident
translation: You drove very fast. I was afraid that we would have a crash.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Jutro jedziemy do centrum na zakupy. Chcesz coś?
english: We're going shopping downtown tomorrow. Do you want anything?
glossary: to go shopping/to go downtown
translation: We are going downtown shopping tomorrow. You want something.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Co się stało? Byłem pewien, że będziesz się trzymać planu.
english: What happened? I was sure you'd stick to the plan.
glossary: to happen/to be sure/to stick to the plan
translation: What happened? I was certain you would stick to the plan.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Moja najlepsza przyjaciółka wychodzi za mąż w przyszłym tygodniu.
english: My best friend's getting married next week.
glossary: to get married/next week
translation: My best friend is getting married next week.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Nie pracuję jutro, więc możemy jechać nad jezioro.
english: I'm not working tomorrow, so we can go to the lake.
glossary: to work/to go to the lake/tomorrow
translation: I am not working tomorrow, so we can go to the lake.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że się zaprzyjaźnimy.
english: I hoped we'd make friends.
glossary: to hope/to make friends
translation: I hopped that we are friends.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Ile osób jest w Twoim zespole?
english: How many people are there on your team?
glossary: on the team
translation: How many people is your team.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Co się stało? Byłam pewna, że się pobierzecie.
english: What happened? I was sure you'd get married.
glossary: to happen/to be sure/to get married
translation: What happened? I was certain that you would get married.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Mogłem napisać ten test z angielskiego w zeszłym tygodniu. Teraz nic nie pamiętam.
english: I could've taken the English test last week. I don't remember anything now.
glossary: to take an English test/to remember sth/last week
translation: I could write this English test last week. I don't remember anything now.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że żona będzie w dobrym humorze.
english: I hoped my wife would be in a good mood.
glossary: to hope/a wife/to be in a good mood
translation: I hoped, that my wife would be in good humour.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Chciałem powiedzieć Ci prawdę, ale bałem się, że się zdenerwujesz.
english: I wanted to tell you the truth, but I was afraid you'd get mad.
glossary: to tell sb the truth/to be afraid of sth/to get mad
translation: I wanted to tell you the truth but I was afraid you would get angry.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Mogłam wydawać mniej pieniędzy na ubrania, bo muszę jeszcze zapłacić rachunki.
english: I could've spent less money on clothes because I still have to pay the bills.
glossary: to spend money on clothes/still/to pay the bills
translation: I could spend less money on clothes because I have to still pay the bills.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Nie powinieneś był tyle pić na imprezie.
english: You shouldn't have drunk so much at the party.
glossary: to drink/at the party
translation: You shouldn't drink as much at the party.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Nie mogę zasnąć. Nie powinienem był pić kawy tak późno.
english: I can't fall asleep. I shouldn't have drunk coffee so late.
glossary: to fall asleep/to drink coffee/late
translation: I can't go to sleep. I shouldn't have drunk coffee so late.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Pójdziemy na kawę, jak już będzie ładna pogoda.
english: We'll go for a coffee once the weather is good.
glossary: to go for a coffee/the weather
translation: We will go for coffee once the weather will be nice.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Pójdę spać, jak już skończę czytać książkę.
english: I'll go to sleep once I finish reading the book.
glossary: to go to sleep/to finish doing sth
translation: I am going to go to sleep once I finished reading a book.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Następny weekend spędzam w moim rodzinnym mieście.
english: I'm spending next weekend in my hometown.
glossary: in your hometown/to spend next weekend
translation: I spend next week in my family town.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Obściskiwałeś się z moją koleżanką. Przyznaj to.
english: You made out with my friend. Admit it.
glossary: to make out with sb/to admit sth
translation: 1. You were making out with my friend. Admit it.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Muszę chronić swoje dzieci.
english: I have to protect my kids.
glossary: to protect sb/a kid
translation: 2. I have to protect my children.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Moi znajomi jutro wpadają. Kup piwo.
english: My friends are dropping by tomorrow. Buy beer.
glossary: to drop by/a friend/to buy sth/to drink beer
translation: 3. My friends are dropping by tomorrow. Buy a beer.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Nie powinieneś udawać, że mnie słuchasz.
english: You shouldn't pretend that you're listening to me.
glossary: to pretend/to listen to sb
translation: 4. You shouldn’t pretend you were listening to me.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Ja piję dziś wieczorem. Ty prowadzisz.
english: I'm drinking tonight. You're driving.
glossary: to drink alcohol/to drive a car
translation: 5. I’m drinking tonight. You’re driving.

name: Anna Forney
polish: W zeszłym roku pracowałem jako stażysta. Dużo się wtedy nauczyłem.
english: I worked as an intern last year. I learned a lot back then.
glossary: to work as an intern/to learn sth/back then
translation: 6. I worked as an intern last year. I learned a lot then.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Nie mogę wejść do pokoju. Jest zamknięty.
english: I can't enter the room. It's locked.
glossary: to be locked/to enter the room
translation: 7. I can’t enter the room. It’s locked.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Będę bardziej surowy następnym razem. Obiecuję.
english: I'll be more strict next time. I promise.
glossary: to be strict/next time/to promise sth
translation: 8. I’ll be more strict next time. I promise.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Chciałabym pracować jako sędzia w przyszłości.
english: I'd like to work as a judge in the future.
glossary: to work as a judge/a judge/in the future
translation: 9. I would like to work as a judge in the future.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Nie martw się. Nie wystawię cię.
english: Don't worry. I won't stand you up.
glossary: to worry/to stand sb up
translation: 10. Don’t worry. I’ll not set you up.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Pojadę na wakacje, jak już oszczędzę pieniądze.
english: I'll go on vacation once I save some money.
glossary: to go on vacation/to save some money
translation: I will go on vacation when I have saved my money.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Dam Ci znać, jak już skończę pracę.
english: I'll let you know once I finish work.
glossary: to let sb know/to finish work
translation: I will give you a sign when I have done my job.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Muszę iść wcześnie spać, bo jutro robię prezentację.
english: I have to go to sleep early because I'm giving a presentation tomorrow.
glossary: to go to sleep early/to give a presentation
translation: I have to go to bed early because I'm giving a presentation tomorrow.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Myślałem, że będziesz tęsknić za domem.
english: I thought you'd feel homesick.
glossary: to feel homesick
translation: I thought you were going to miss your home.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Zadzwonię do ciebie, jak już będę w domu.
english: I'll call you once I'm at home.
glossary: to call sb/to be at home
translation: I'll call you when I'm home.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Wyjeżdżam jutro z miasta. Zadzwonię do ciebie, jak już wrócę.
english: I'm leaving town tomorrow. I'll call you once I'm back.
glossary: once/to leave town/to call sb
translation: We leave town tomorrow. I call you when I’m back.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Mogłem się nauczyć na test.
english: I could've studied for the test.
glossary: to study for a test
translation: I could learned for a test.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Odwiozę cię do domu, jak już zjemy kolację.
english: I'll take you home once we eat dinner.
glossary: to take sb home/to eat dinner
translation: I will drive you home when we will eat dinner.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Oglądamy dzisiaj wieczorem mecz. Wpadnij.
english: We're watching a match tonight. Drop by.
glossary: to watch a match/to drop by
translation: We are watching game this evening, come on visit us.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Co powiesz na poniedziałek? W weekend zajmuję się psami mojej siostry.
english: What about Monday? I'm taking care of my sister's dogs on the weekend.
glossary: on the weekend/What about.../to take care of sth
translation: What do you say about Monday ? At the weekend I’ll take care of my sister’s dogs.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Nie będziesz musiała mnie odbierać jutro ze szkoły, bo śpię u koleżanki.
english: You won't have to pick me up from school tomorrow because I'm sleeping at my friend's.
glossary: to pick sb up from school/to sleep at your friend's
translation: You will not have to bring me back from school tomorrow, because I'll sleep at my friend.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Myślałem, że zjemy dzisiaj na mieście.
english: I thought we'd eat out today.
glossary: to eat out
translation: I was think that we will eat on the city.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Mogłem wczoraj wydać mniej pieniędzy.
english: I could've spent less money yesterday.
glossary: to spend money on sth
translation: Yesterday I could spend less money.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Nie ma nikogo w domu. Dlatego jest tak cicho.
english: There's no one at home. That's why it's so silent.
glossary: to be at home/to be silent
translation: There is no one at home. That's why it's so quiet.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Nie wiem, co powinienem odpowiedzieć.
english: I don't know what I should answer.
glossary: to answer a question
translation: I don’t know what I have to say.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Byłem pewny, że zrobisz swoją pracę domową.
english: I was sure you'd do your homework.
glossary: to do your homework
translation: I was sure that you are will do your homework.

name: Paul Baker
polish: W zeszłym roku nie pojechałem na wakacje, ponieważ nie miałem pieniędzy.
english: I didn't go on vacation last year because I didn't have any money.
glossary: to go on vacation/to have no money
translation: Last year i didn’t go on a vacation because I didn’t have enough money.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Zawsze znajdę dla ciebie czas, bo jesteś dla mnie ważna.
english: I'll always find time for you because you're important to me.
glossary: to find time for sb/to be important to sb
translation: I will always find time to you because you are very important to me.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Nie mogę się skupić, gdy jest tak głośno.
english: I can't focus when it's so loud.
glossary: to focus on sth/to be loud
translation: I can not focus when it is so loud.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Gramy jutro mecz. Dołączysz do nas?
english: We're playing a match tomorrow. Will you join us?
glossary: to play a match/to join sb
translation: We are playing match tomorrow. Will you join us ?

name: Damien Bean
polish: Moja mama przeszła w zeszłym roku na emeryturę.
english: My mom retired last year.
glossary: to retire/last year
translation: 1.	My mom retired last year.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Nie wierzę. Znajomi znowu mnie wystawili.
english: I can't believe it. My friends stood me up again.
glossary: to believe sb/to stand sb up/a friend
translation: 2.	I don’t believe. My friends stand me up again.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Dawno cię nie widziałam. Musisz wpaść w tym tygodniu.
english: I haven't seen you for a long time. You have to drop by this week.
glossary: to drop by/for a long time/this week
translation: 3.	I haven’t seen you a long time. You have to drop by to me this week.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Nie możesz unikać odpowiedzialności.
english: You can't avoid responsibility.
glossary: to avoid responsibility
translation: 4.	You can’t to avoid responsibility

name: Damien Bean
polish: Nie możesz się tak zachowywać.
english: You can't behave like that.
glossary: to behave
translation: 5.	You can’t to behave like this.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Nie idę z wami jutro na imprezę. Pracuję na nocną zmianę.
english: I'm not going to the party with you tomorrow. I'm working the night shift.
glossary: to go to a party with sb/to work the night shift
translation: 6.	I won’t go to the party with you tomorrow. I’m working the night shift.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Nie będę w stanie pojawić się w weekend, bo pracuję.
english: I won't be able to show up on the weekend because I'm working.
glossary: to show up/to work on the weekend/to be able to do sth
translation: 7.	I won’t be able to show up on the weekend because I’m working.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Mam nadzieję, że nie będę mieć jutro kaca.
english: I hope I won't have a hangover tomorrow.
glossary: to have a hangover
translation: 8.	I hope I won’t have a hangover tomorrow.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Musisz mnie przeprosić.
english: You have to apologize to me.
glossary: to apologize to sb
translation: 9.	You have to apologize to me.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Pozwę cię. Zobaczysz.
english: I'll sue you. You'll see.
glossary: to sue sb/to see sth
translation: 10.	I’ll sue you. You’ll see.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Nie musielibyśmy przekładać spotkań, gdyby szef się częściej pojawiał w pracy.
english: We wouldn't have to put off meetings if the boss showed up at work more often.
glossary: to show up at work/to put off a meeting/a boss
translation: We wouldn’t have to postpone the meetings if the boss showed up at work more often.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Wrócisz do więzienia, jeśli będziesz zamieszany w narkotyki.
english: You'll go back to jail if you're mixed up in drugs.
glossary: to be mixed up in sth/to be mixed up in drugs/to go back to jail
translation: You will come back to prison if you are mixed up in drugs.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Kiedyś z każdym wchodziłem w konflikt, bo byłem głupi.
english: I used to come into conflict with everybody because I was stupid.
glossary: to be stupid/to come into conflict with sb
translation: I used to come into conflict with anybody because I was stupid.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Przestępca trafił do szpitala po tym, jak postrzeliła go policja.
english: The criminal ended up in the hospital after the police had shot him.
glossary: to shoot sb/the police/a criminal/to end up in the hospital
translation: The criminal ended up in the hospital after the police had shot him.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Od dawna mnie wkurzasz. To koniec.
english: You've been pissing me off for a long time. It's over.
glossary: to piss sb off/to be over
translation: You have pissed me off for a long time. It’s over.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Wykonałem jak dotąd dwa z trzech zadań.
english: I've carried out two out of three tasks so far.
glossary: so far/to carry out a task/one out of two
translation: I have done two of three tasks until now.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Kiedy wychodziłem z biura, zadzwonił do mnie klient i odwołał spotkanie.
english: When I was leaving the office, my client called me and called off the meeting.
glossary: to call off a meeting/to call sb/to leave the office
translation: When I was leaving the office, the client called me and called off the meeting.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Przyzwyczaiłem się już do zagadywania do dziewczyn.
english: I've already gotten used to chatting up girls.
glossary: to chat sb up/a girl/to get used to doing sth
translation: I got used to chatting girls up.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Policja nie zastrzeliłaby podejrzanego, gdyby nie wyjął broni.
english: The police wouldn't have shot down the suspect if he hadn't pulled out a gun.
glossary: to pull out a gun/to shoot sb down/the police
translation: The police wouldn’t have shot the suspect dead if he hadn’t pulled a gun out.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Myślę o odrzuceniu zaproszenia na ten ślub. Jakie jest twoje zdanie?
english: I'm thinking about turning down the invitation to the wedding. What's your opinion?
glossary: to turn down an invitation to the wedding/an opinion/to think about sth
translation: I think about turning down an invitation to the wedding. What is your opinion?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Fabryka rozpcznie produkcje, jak już zarząd na to pozwoli.
english: The factory will go ahead with the production once the board allows it.
glossary: to allow sth/to go ahead with the production/a factory/the board
translation: The factory will go ahead with the production once the board just allows it.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Zawsze chcesz, żeby wszyscy ci współczuli.
english: You always want everyone to feel for you.
glossary: to feel for sb
translation: You always want everyone to feel for you.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Dopiłeś już swoją kawę do końca?
english: Have you drunk up your coffee yet?
glossary: to drink up your coffee
translation: Have you already drunk up your coffee?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Mój lekarz rodzinny obiecał, że wciśnie mnie w grafik.
english: My GP promised he'd fit me in to his schedule.
glossary: to fit sb in to your schedule/a GP
translation: My family doctor promised that he would fit me into the schedule.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Zapisujesz to? Nie mam zamiaru się powtarzać.
english: Are you taking it down? I'm not going to repeat myself.
glossary: to repeat yourself/to write sth down; to take sth down
translation: Are you writing it down? I am not going to repeat myself.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Kiedy pogodziłaś się z rodziną?
english: When did you make up with your family?
glossary: to make up with sb/a family
translation: When did you make up with your family?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Dlaczego twoim zdaniem ten raport wymaga analizy?
english: Why does the report call for an analysis in your opinion?
glossary: to call for an analysis/In my opinion...
translation: Why does this report call for analysis, in your opinion?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Mogłem podjąć się tej roli. Zarabiałbym teraz więcej.
english: I could've taken on the role. I'd earn more now.
glossary: to make money; to earn money/to take on a role
translation: I could have taken on this role. I would be earning more now.

name: Martin Vance
polish: W zeszłym miesiącu mi powiedziałaś, że ta praca cię wykańcza.
english: You told me last month that the job was wearing you down
glossary: to wear sb down/a job
translation: Last week, you told me that this work was wearing you down.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Jeszcze rok temu bank utrzymywał, że wziąłem tę pożyczkę.
english: Only a year ago, the bank insisted that I'd taken out the loan.
glossary: to take out a loan/to insist that...
translation: One year ago, the bank still claimed that I had taken out this loan.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Jutro uczę się na egzamin, ale możemy się spotkać, jak już skończę.
english: I'm studying for an exam tomorrow, but we can meet once I'm done.
glossary: to be done/to study for an exam/to meet sb
translation: 1.	I’m studying for an exam tomorrow, but we can meet when I’m done.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Nie pojechałem nad jezioro, bo obawiałem się, że się przeziębię.
english: I didn't go to the lake because I was afraid I'd catch a cold.
glossary: to go to the lake/to catch a cold/to be afraid of sth
translation: 2.	I didn’t go to the lake because I was afraid I would catch a cold.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Przeprowadzę się, jak już znajdę nową pracę.
english: I'll move once I find a new job.
glossary: to move/to find a new job
translation: 3.	I’ll move once I find a new job.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Będę mieć więcej energii, jak już napiję się kawy.
english: I'll have more energy once I have some coffee.
glossary: to have energy/to have some coffee
translation: 4.	I’ll have more energy once I drink coffee.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Poproszę o podwyżkę, jak już szef będzie z powrotem w biurze.
english: I'll ask for a pay-raise once my boss is back in the office.
glossary: to ask for a pay-raise/to be back in the office
translation: 5.	I’ll ask for a pay-raise once the boss is back in the office.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Jestem podekscytowana, bo jutro widzę się ze starą znajomą.
english: I'm excited because I'm seeing an old friend of mine tomorrow.
glossary: to see sb/to be excited
translation: 6.	I’m excited because I’m seeing an old friend tomorrow.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: W przyszłym tygodniu zaczynam kurs angielskiego. Nie mogę się doczekać.
english: I'm starting an English course next week. I can't wait.
glossary: can't wait/to start an English course
translation: 7.	Next week I’m starting an English course. I can’t wait.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Porozmawiamy, jak już będziesz gotowa.
english: We'll talk once you're ready.
glossary: to talk to sb/to be ready
translation: 8.	We’ll talk once you’re ready.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Bałem się, że przegramy sprawę przez mój błąd.
english: I was afraid we'd lose the case because of my mistake.
glossary: to be afraid of sth/to lose a case/because of you/a mistake
translation: 9.	I was afraid we would lose the case because of my mistake.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Możemy przełożyć nasze spotkanie? Jutro przyjeżdżają moi rodzice w odwiedziny.
english: Can we put off our meeting? My parents are visiting me tomorrow.
glossary: to visit sb/to put off a meeting
translation: 10.	Can we put off our meeting? Tomorrow my parents are coming to visit.

name: Joanna Day
polish: Ile osób jest w Twoim zespole?
english: How many people are there on your team?
glossary: on the team
translation: 1. znów many people are in your team ?

name: Joanna Day
polish: Możemy porozmawiać, bo nie ma tu nikogo.
english: We can talk because there's nobody here.
glossary: to talk about sth
translation: 2. We can talk because there is not no one.

name: Joanna Day
polish: Jest kilka książek, które chciałbym przeczytać do końca roku.
english: There are a few books I'd like to read by the end of the year.
glossary: a few/to read a book/by the end of the year
translation: 3. There is a few books which I will have write to the end year.

name: Joanna Day
polish: W artykule jest błąd. Popraw go.
english: There's a mistake in the article. Correct it.
glossary: in the article/to correct a mistake
translation: 4. There is a mistake on articule.

name: Joanna Day
polish: Jest jeszcze tyle rzeczy, których muszę się nauczyć na test.
english: There are still so many things I have to study for the test.
glossary: to study sth for a test
translation: 5. There is a lot of things, that I have to lern to test.

name: Joanna Day
polish: W tej grupie jest za dużo ludzi. Znajdę inną.
english: There are too many people in the group. I'll find a different one.
glossary: in the group/to find sth/different
translation: 6. There is to many people in group. I will find different

name: Joanna Day
polish: Jest kilka osób, które nie wierzą w moją historię.
english: There are a few people that don't believe in my story.
glossary: a few/to believe in sb's story
translation: 7. There is a few people which they don’t belive in my history.

name: Joanna Day
polish: Martwię się, bo nie ma na to stanowisko dobrych kandydatów.
english: I'm worried because there are no good candidates for the position.
glossary: to be worried/a candidate for the position
translation: 8. I’m worry because there isn’t good candidate on this

name: Joanna Day
polish: Nie ma wątpliwości, że znajdziesz lepszą pracę.
english: There are no doubts that you'll find a better job.
glossary: a doubt/to find a job
translation: 9. I don’t worry, You will find better job.

name: Joanna Day
polish: Na spotkaniu było kilka osób, które nie miały nic do powiedzenia.
english: There were a few people at the meeting that had nothing to say.
glossary: a few/at the meeting/to have nothing to say
translation: 10. There were a few people, They doesn’t have nothing to told.

name: Joanna Day
polish: Zwolnię cię. Zobaczysz.
english: I'll fire you. You'll see.
glossary: to fire sb/to see sth
translation: 1. I will fire you. You will see.

name: Joanna Day
polish: Dostaniesz awans. Cieszysz się?
english: You'll get promoted. Are you happy?
glossary: to get promoted/to be happy about sth
translation: 2. You will get promoted. Arę You happy?

name: Joanna Day
polish: Jutro omawiamy bieżące problemy na spotkaniu.
english: We're discussing the current problems at the meeting tomorrow.
glossary: to discuss sth/the current problems/at the meeting
translation: 3. We will talk about problems tommorow at the meeting.

name: Joanna Day
polish: Jutro zamawiamy jedzenie.
english: We're ordering food tomorrow.
glossary: to order food
translation: 4.We will order food tommorow.

name: Joanna Day
polish: Wybrałam właściwego nauczyciela.
english: I chose the right teacher.
glossary: a teacher/to choose sth/the right teacher
translation: 5. I chose good teacher.

name: Joanna Day
polish: Wczoraj zamówiłam pizzę.
english: I ordered a pizza yesterday.
glossary: to order a pizza
translation: 6. Yesturday I ordered a pizza.

name: Joanna Day
polish: Muszę wyjaśnić sytuację.
english: I have to explain the situation.
glossary: to explain the situation
translation: 7.I have to explain the situations.

name: Joanna Day
polish: Powinnaś zadzwonić do swoich rodziców.
english: You should call your parents.
glossary: a parent/to call sb
translation: 8. You have to call to your parents.

name: Joanna Day
polish: Nie możesz mnie okłamywać.
english: You can't lie to me.
glossary: to lie to sb
translation: 9. You can’t lie to me.

name: Joanna Day
polish: Nie powinnaś wierzyć swojemu mężowi.
english: You shouldn't believe your husband.
glossary: to believe sb
translation: 10. You shouldn’t belive your husband.

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Mam nadzieję, że oszczędzę trochę pieniędzy w tym miesiącu.
english: I hope I'll save some money this month.
glossary: to save money/this month
translation: 1. I hope I'll save some money this month.

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Na imprezie było dużo pijanych nastolatków.
english: There were many drunk teens at the party.
glossary: a teen/to be drunk
translation: 2. There were a lot of drunk teens at the party.

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Zrobię pracę domową, jak już będę mieć dostęp do internetu.
english: I'll do my homework once I have access to the internet.
glossary: to have access to the internet/to do your homework/once {2}
translation: 3. I'll do my homework once I have the Internet access.

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Grałeś w weekend w gry?
english: Did you play games on the weekend?
glossary: to play games/on the weekend
translation: 4. Did you play the games on the weekend?

name: Sergius Birch
polish: W przyszłym tygodniu jadę za granicę. Podlejesz kwiatki?
english: I'm going abroad next week. Will you water the plants?
glossary: to water plants/to go abroad/next week
translation: 5. I'm going abroad next week. Will you water the plants?

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Myślałem, że wpadniesz jutro i napijemy się piwa.
english: I thought you'd drop by tomorrow and we'd drink beer.
glossary: to drop by/to drink beer
translation: 6. I thought you would come over tomorrow and we would drink some beer. [not sure with double would]

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Jak dowiedziałeś się prawdy?
english: How did you find out the truth?
glossary: to find out the truth
translation: 7. How did you find our the truth?

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Przykro mi. Nie dostaniesz więcej środków przeciwbólowych.
english: I'm sorry. You won't get more painkillers.
glossary: to get painkillers
translation: 8. I'm sorry. You won't get more painkillers.

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Muszę zacząć jeszcze raz.
english: I have to start over.
glossary: to start over
translation: 9. I have to start over / I have to start again.

name: Sergius Birch
polish: Zamknij się. Cały dzień gadasz.
english: Shut up. You've been talking all day.
glossary: all day/to talk/to shut up
translation: 10. Shut up. You're talking all day.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Pojadę na wakacje, jak już oszczędzę pieniądze.
english: I'll go on vacation once I save some money.
glossary: to go on vacation/to save some money
translation: 1. I'll go on vacation if I saved money.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Dam Ci znać, jak już skończę pracę.
english: I'll let you know once I finish work.
glossary: to let sb know/to finish work
translation: 2. I'll let you know  once I finish work.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Muszę iść wcześnie spać, bo jutro robię prezentację.
english: I have to go to sleep early because I'm giving a presentation tomorrow.
glossary: to go to sleep early/to give a presentation
translation: 3. I have to go sleep early because I'm giving a presentation.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Myślałem, że będziesz tęsknić za domem.
english: I thought you'd feel homesick.
glossary: to feel homesick
translation: 4. I thought you'd feel homesick.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Zadzwonię do ciebie, jak już będę w domu.
english: I'll call you once I'm at home.
glossary: to call sb/to be at home
translation: 5. I'll call you once I'm at home.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Wyjeżdżam jutro z miasta. Zadzwonię do ciebie, jak już wrócę.
english: I'm leaving town tomorrow. I'll call you once I'm back.
glossary: once/to leave town/to call sb
translation: 6. I'm leaving the city tomorrow. I'll call you once I come back.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Mogłem się nauczyć na test.
english: I could've studied for the test.
glossary: to study for a test
translation: 7. I could learn for the test.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Odwiozę cię do domu, jak już zjemy kolację.
english: I'll take you home once we eat dinner.
glossary: to take sb home/to eat dinner
translation: 8. I'll drive you home once we have dinner.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Oglądamy dzisiaj wieczorem mecz. Wpadnij.
english: We're watching a match tonight. Drop by.
glossary: to watch a match/to drop by
translation: 9. We're watching the match tonight. Drop in.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Co powiesz na poniedziałek? W weekend zajmuję się psami mojej siostry.
english: What about Monday? I'm taking care of my sister's dogs on the weekend.
glossary: on the weekend/What about.../to take care of sth
translation: 10. How about Monday? On the weekend, I take care of my sister's dogs.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Jutro uczę się na egzamin, ale możemy się spotkać, jak już skończę.
english: I'm studying for an exam tomorrow, but we can meet once I'm done.
glossary: to be done/to study for an exam/to meet sb
translation: 1. I am studying for the exam tomorrow, but we can meet when I am finished.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Nie pojechałem nad jezioro, bo obawiałem się, że się przeziębię.
english: I didn't go to the lake because I was afraid I'd catch a cold.
glossary: to go to the lake/to catch a cold/to be afraid of sth
translation: 2. I didn't go to the lake because I was afraid that I'd catch a cold.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Przeprowadzę się, jak już znajdę nową pracę.
english: I'll move once I find a new job.
glossary: to move/to find a new job
translation: 3. I'll move once I find a new job.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Będę mieć więcej energii, jak już napiję się kawy.
english: I'll have more energy once I have some coffee.
glossary: to have energy/to have some coffee
translation: 4. I'll have more energy once I have a cup of coffee.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Poproszę o podwyżkę, jak już szef będzie z powrotem w biurze.
english: I'll ask for a pay-raise once my boss is back in the office.
glossary: to ask for a pay-raise/to be back in the office
translation: 5. I'll ask for a raise once the boss is back in the office.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Jestem podekscytowana, bo jutro widzę się ze starą znajomą.
english: I'm excited because I'm seeing an old friend of mine tomorrow.
glossary: to see sb/to be excited
translation: 6. I'm excited because tomorrow I see an old friend.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: W przyszłym tygodniu zaczynam kurs angielskiego. Nie mogę się doczekać.
english: I'm starting an English course next week. I can't wait.
glossary: can't wait/to start an English course
translation: 7. I start my English course next week. I can't wait.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Porozmawiamy, jak już będziesz gotowa.
english: We'll talk once you're ready.
glossary: to talk to sb/to be ready
translation: 8. We'll talk when you are ready.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Bałem się, że przegramy sprawę przez mój błąd.
english: I was afraid we'd lose the case because of my mistake.
glossary: to be afraid of sth/to lose a case/because of you/a mistake
translation: 9. I was afraid that we would lose the case because of my mistake.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Możemy przełożyć nasze spotkanie? Jutro przyjeżdżają moi rodzice w odwiedziny.
english: Can we put off our meeting? My parents are visiting me tomorrow.
glossary: to visit sb/to put off a meeting
translation: 10. Can we postpone our meeting? My parents are coming to visit. tomorrow.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Muszę się skupić na szukaniu lepszej pracy.
english: I have to focus on looking for a better job.
glossary: to look for a job/to focus on sth
translation: 1. I need to focus on finding a better job.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Dostaniesz grzywnę, jeśli nie zapłacisz podatku na czas.
english: You'll get a fine if you don't pay your tax on time.
glossary: to pay your tax/to get a fine
translation: 2. You’ll get a fine if you don’t pay your tax on time.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Rzuciłbym pracę, gdybym musiał pracować po godzinach.
english: I'd leave my job if I had to work overtime.
glossary: to leave your job/to work overtime
translation: 3. I would quit a job if I had to work overtime.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Ostatnim razem, kiedy rozmawiałyśmy, mówiłaś, że potrzebujesz mojej porady.
english: The last time we talked, you said you needed my advice.
glossary: to need sb's advice/The last time we talked.../to say sth
translation: 4. The last time we spoke, you said that you needed my advice.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Kiedy ostatni raz widział pan ofiarę żywą?
english: When was the last time you saw the victim alive?
glossary: to be alive/a victim/to see sb/When was the last time...
translation: 5. When was the last time you saw a victim alive?

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Policja nie zatrzymałaby cię, gdybyś włączył światła.
english: The police wouldn't have pulled you over if you'd turned on the headlights.
glossary: to turn on the headlights/to pull sb over/the police
translation: 6. The police wouldn’t have pulled you over if you had turned on the headlights.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Nie spaliłam jeszcze twoich rzeczy, ale za chwilę to zrobię.
english: I haven't burned your stuff yet, but I'll do it in a moment.
glossary: to burn sth/your stuff/in a moment
translation: 7. I haven’t burnt your staff yet, but I’ll do it in a minute.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Czy jest możliwość zaparkowania samochodu przed budynkiem?
english: Is there the possibility to park a car in front of the building?
glossary: to park a car/in front of the building/a possibility to do sth
translation: 8. Is it possible to park a car in front of the building?

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Dowiedziałem się o tym fakcie po tym, jak się rozstaliśmy.
english: I found out about the fact after we'd broken up.
glossary: to find out about sth/a fact/to break up
translation: 9. I found out about this fact after that we had splitted up.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Powiedz mi, w czym się specjalizujesz.
english: Tell me what you specialize in.
glossary: to specialize in sth
translation: 10. Tell me what you specialize in.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Kiedy ostatnio się widziałyśmy, moja najlepsza przyjaciółka powiedziała mi, że zerwie ze swoim chłopakiem
english: The last time we met, my best friend told me she'd break up with her boyfriend.
glossary: your best friend/to break up with sb/a boyfriend
translation: 1. When was the last time we saw each other, my best friend told me that she would break up with her boyfriend.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Nie sądzę, że przyzwyczaję się do noszenia sukienek. Czuję, że za bardzo się wyróżniam.
english: I don't think I'll get used to wearing dresses. I feel I stand out too much.
glossary: to stand out/to wear a dress
translation: 2. I don’t think that I will get used to wearing dresses. I feel that I stand out too much.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Może podjęłabyś lepszą decyzję, gdybyś rozważyła wszystkie czynniki.
english: Maybe you would've made a better decision if you'd weighed up all the factors.
glossary: to weigh up factors/to make a decision
translation: 3. Maybe you would have made the better decision if you had weighed up all the factors.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Obudź się! Nie słyszysz, że właśnie zadzwonił budzik?
english: Wake up! Can't you hear the alarm has just gone off?
glossary: to go off/to set an alarm/to wake up/to hear sth
translation: 4. Wake up! Can’t you hear that the alarm clock has already rang?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Spotkanie ciągnęło się jeszcze przez godzinę po tym, jak wyszedłeś.
english: The meeting still dragged on for an hour after you'd left.
glossary: to drag on/to leave
translation: 5. The meeting was still dragging on one hour after you had left.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Już cię raz kryłem. Nie zrobię tego ponownie.
english: I've covered up for you once. I won't do it again.
glossary: to cover up for sb
translation: 6. I covered up for you once. I won’t do it again.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Przyzwyczaiłem się, że żona narzeka na pracę, kiedy poruszam ten temat.
english: I got used to my wife complaining about her job every time I bring up the subject.
glossary: to bring up a subject/to complain about your job/a wife
translation: 7. I got used to my wife complaining about work when I brought up that subject.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Gdybyś ograniczył palenie, byłbyś zdrowszy.
english: If you cut down on smoking, you'd be more healthy.
glossary: to cut down on smoking/to be healthy
translation: 8. If you cut back on smoking you’ll be healthier.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Zmieniłaś się. Kiedyś stawałaś w obronie swoich zasad.
english: You've changed. You used to stand up for your principles.
glossary: to stand up for your principles/to change
translation: 9. You’ve changed. You used to stand up for your principles.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Ostatnio musiałem odwołać tyle spotkań, że moi klienci zaczynają narzekać.
english: I've recently had to call off so many meetings that my clients are starting to complain.
glossary: to call off a meeting/to complain about sth/to start to do sth; to begin to do sth/a client
translation: 10. Recently, I had to call off so many meetings that my clients are starting to complain.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Po tym, jak zrobiłeś zupę, wszyscy rzygaliśmy.
english: After you'd made the soup, we all threw up.
glossary: to make soup/to throw up
translation: When did you find out that you wouldn’t qualify for insurance?

name: Jack Russell
polish: Czy jest coś, co mogę polepszyć, żeby być bardziej wydajnym, gdy się uczę?
english: Is there anything I can improve to be more efficient while studying?
glossary: to improve sth/to be efficient/to study sth
translation: When I was taking a shower I came up with a great idea.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Zjadłabym dużo więcej na weselu, gdybym nie przeszła na dietę parę dni wcześniej,
english: I would've eaten much more at the wedding party if I hadn't gone on a diet a couple of days before.
glossary: a wedding party/to go on a diet/a couple of days
translation: If you were more unyielding you would be able to prove your point.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Mimo że kolega powiedział, że jego pies nie jest niebezpieczny, bałam się go pogłaskać.
english: Even though my friend said his dog wasn't dangerous, I was afraid to pet it.
glossary: even though/a friend/a dangerous dog/to pet a dog
translation: When you reminded me that I had left keys in the car I felt relieved.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Gdybyś nie był zapominalski, cały zespół nie musiałby teraz pracować.
english: If you weren't forgetful, the whole team wouldn't have to work now.
glossary: to be forgetful/the whole team/to work
translation: You should be grateful. If I didn’t warn you, you would get a mandate.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Jeśli nasza firma otworzy nową filię, wszyscy zrobimy się zajęci.
english: If our company opens a new branch, we'll all get busy.
glossary: to open a new branch/a branch/to get busy
translation: I was shocked when my wife had told me she would like to move out.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Dlaczego zaparkowałeś tak daleko od galerii?
english: Why did you park so far away from the mall?
glossary: to park your car/to be far away from sth/a mall
translation: If I don't like something, I'll just stay away from it.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Tak szybko jechałem na rowerze, że nie zorientowałem się, że przejechałem znak stop.
english: I was riding a bike so fast that I didn't realize I had run a stop sign.
glossary: to ride a bike/to realize that.../to run a stop sign
translation: I've never been on another continent before.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Widzę, że restauracja ci się nie podoba. Z czym masz problem?
english: I see that you don't like the restaurant. What do you have a problem with?
glossary: to have a problem with sth/a restaurant
translation: Why is there so much hunger in the world?

name: Jack Russell
polish: Powiedziałem mamie, że poszedłem do lekarza, bo chciałem ją uspokoić.
english: I told my mom I'd gone to the doctor because I wanted to calm her down.
glossary: to go to the doctor/to calm sb down
translation: What are fighting about?

name: Jack Russell
polish: Kiedy się dowiedziałaś, że nie będziesz się kwalifikować do ubezpieczenia?
english: When did you find out that you wouldn't be eligible for insurance?
glossary: to find out about sth/to be eligible for sth/to be eligible for insurance
translation: When did you find out that you wouldn’t qualify for insurance?

name: Jack Russell
polish: Kiedy brałem prysznic, wpadłem na świetny pomysł.
english: When I was taking a shower, I came up with a great idea.
glossary: to take a shower/to come up with sth/to come up with an idea
