translation: 5.	When did you realize that you were cheated?

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Nie zjedliśmy wczoraj kolacji w restauracji, ponieważ mój mąż zapomniał zarezerwować stolik.
english: We didn't have dinner at the restaurant yesterday because my husband had forgotten to book a table.
glossary: to forget to do sth/to book a table/a husband/to eat dinner; to have dinner/at the restaurant
translation: 6.	We didn’t eat dinner in the restaurant yesterday because my husband forgot to book a table.

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Dlaczego jeszcze nie zrobiłeś przelewu?
english: Why haven't you made the transfer yet?
glossary: to make a transfer
translation: 7.	Why haven’t you made the transfer yet?

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Na kogo masz zamiar głosować?
english: Who are you going to vote for?
glossary: to vote for sb/to be going to do sth
translation: 8.	Who are you going to vote for?

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Kiedy zgłosił pan zdarzenie?
english: When did you report the incident?
glossary: an incident/to report sth
translation: 9.	When did you report the incident?

name: Agnes Banks
polish: Wczoraj marzyłam tylko o zrobieniu sobie drzemki.
english: I only dreamed of taking a nap yesterday.
glossary: to take a nap/to dream of sth
translation: 10.	I was just dreaming about having a nap yesterday.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Składając wniosek, pamiętaj, żeby go podpisać.
english: Filing an application, remember to sign it.
glossary: to file an application/to sign an application
translation: When submiting an aplication, remember to sing up it.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Czy ma pan odpowiednie umiejętności, żeby wykonywać tę pracę?
english: Do you have the necessary skills to do the job?
glossary: to have the necessary skills/to do a job
translation: Do you have right skills to do this job?

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Zawsze chciałem pracować z ludźmi.
english: I've always wanted to work with people.
glossary: to work with people
translation: I’ve always wanted to work with people.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Gdybyś oszczędzał wodę, zmniejszyłbyś swoje miesięczne rachunki.
english: If you saved water, you'd lower your monthly bills.
glossary: to save water/to lower your bills
translation: If you saved water, You would reduce your monthly bills.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Nie możesz dzwonić do mnie w nocy, oczekując, że odbiorę.
english: You can't call me at night expecting that I'll pick up the phone.
glossary: to call sb/at night/to expect sb to do sth
translation: You can’t call me at night expecting that I pick up.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Nie chcę, żeby utrzymywali mnie rodzice.
english: I don't want my parents to provide for me.
glossary: to provide for sb
translation: I won’t my parents to provide me for.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Zawsze ci mówiłem, żebyś zaczęła oszczędzać pieniądze.
english: I've always told you to start saving money.
glossary: to save money/to start to do sth; to start doing sth
translation: I’ve always told you that you to start save money.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Moja córka nie zaczęłaby palić, gdyby nie była pod presją rówieśników.
english: My daughter wouldn't have started to smoke if she hadn't been under peer pressure.
glossary: to smoke/to be under peer pressure
translation: My daughter wouldn’t have started smoking if she hadn’t been under peer presser.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Aplikowałem już na kilka stanowisk, ale nikt jeszcze do mnie nie zadzwonił.
english: I've already applied for a few positions, but no one has called me yet.
glossary: to apply for a position/to call sb
translation: I applied for a few position, but no one has called me yet.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Przeczytałem dziś rano wszystkie mejle, pijąc kawę.
english: I read all my emails today, drinking coffee.
glossary: to read emails/to drink coffee
translation: I read all my emails this morning while I was drinking coffee.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Zmarnowałem godzinę, czekając na ciebie na zewnątrz.
english: I wasted an hour waiting for you outside.
glossary: to waste your time/to wait for sb/outside
translation: I wasted an hour waiting for you outdoors.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Leżelibyśmy teraz na plaży, gdyby nasz lot nie został odwołany.
english: We'd be lying on the beach now if our flight hadn't been canceled.
glossary: to lie on the beach/to cancel a flight
translation: We would’ve laid on the beach if our flait hadn’t canceled.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Dobrze się wczoraj bawiłaś ze znajomymi?
english: Did you have a good time with your friends yesterday?
glossary: to have a good time
translation: Did you have a good time with your friends?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jak dotąd policja zatrzymała jedną osobę podejrzaną o dokonanie kradzieży.
english: So far the police have detained one person suspected of committing the theft.
glossary: the police/to detain sb/to be suspected of sth/to commit theft
translation: The police detained one person suspected of committing theft so far.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie byłbyś teraz spłukany, gdybyś nie imprezował w zeszły weekend.
english: You wouldn't be broke now if you hadn't partied last weekend.
glossary: to be broke/to party/last weekend
translation: You wouldn’t be broke now if you didn’t party last weekend.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Łatwiej byłoby mi dojeżdżać do pracy, gdybym mieszkał w mieście.
english: It would be easier for me to commute to work if I lived in the city.
glossary: to commute to work/to live in the city
translation: It would be easier for me to commute to work if I live in the city.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Mogłybyśmy ćwiczyć razem, gdybyś też się zapisała na zajęcia z jogi.
english: We could exercise together if you signed up for yoga classes too.
glossary: to exercise/to sign up for yoga classes
translation: We could exercise together if you sign up for yoga classes.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Dlaczego nie chcesz, żeby twoje dzieci uczyły się angielskiego?
english: Why don't you want your kids to learn English?
glossary: to learn English
translation: Why didn’t you want your children to learn English?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Zrobiłabym panu teraz zastrzyk, gdyby się pan tak nie trząsł.
english: I'd give you an injection now if you didn't tremble so much.
glossary: to give sb an injection/to tremble
translation: I would do an injection to you if you didn’t tremble as much.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie dostalibyśmy zatrucia pokarmowego, gdybyś umiał gotować.
english: We wouldn't have gotten food poisoning if you could cook.
glossary: to get food poisoning/to cook
translation: We wouldn’t have gotten food poisoning if you had known how to cook.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Jak długo już nalegasz? Nie rozumiesz, że Ci tego nie dam?
english: How long have you been insisting yet? Don't you understand I won't give it?
glossary: to insist
translation: 1. How long have you insisted me? Don’t you understand that I won’t give you it?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: O której wylądował samolot? Nie miał przybyć później?
english: What time did the plane land? Wasn't it supposed to arrive later?
glossary: to land/a plane/to arrive later
translation: 2. What hour did the plane arrive? Wasn't it suppose to come later?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Twoja partia miała mnie wesprzeć w następnych wyborach.
english: Your party was supposed to back me during the next election.
glossary: to back sb/a party/an election
translation: 3. Your party would supported me in the next election.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Nigdy nie pozwalasz mi chodzić na imprezy. Nie jestem już dzieckiem.
english: You never let me go to parties. I'm not a kid anymore.
glossary: to let sb do sth
translation: 4. You never let me go parties. I’m not a child any more.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Jak długo zaprzeczasz prawdzie? Czy to nie najwyższy czas, żeby się z tym zmierzyć?
english: How long have you been denying the truth? Isn't it high time to face it?
glossary: to deny the truth/to face sth
translation: 5. How long have you been denying the truth? Isn’t the highest time to face it?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Nikt nie zmuszał Cię do wybrania tego kursu, więc przestań narzekać.
english: No one made you choose that course, so stop complaining.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to complain about sth
translation: 6. Nobody was forcing you to choose this course, so stop complaining.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Miałem naładować komórkę, ale zupełnie zapomniałem.
english: I was supposed to charge my cell phone, but I totally forgot.
glossary: to charge your cell phone
translation: 7. I had to charge my phone, but I forget about it at all.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Czym zwykle skutkuje takie zachowanie?
english: What does such behavior usually result in?
glossary: behavior/to result in sth
translation: 8. What is usually the effect of the behavior like this?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Mój mąż miał złożyć łóżeczko do kupy, ale był zbyt leniwy.
english: My husband was supposed to put the crib together, but he was too lazy.
glossary: to put sth together/to be too lazy to do sth
translation: 9. My husband had to put the child bed together, but he was so lazy.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Od jak dawna próbujesz wprowadzić swój pierwszy produkt? Chyba minął już rok.
english: How long have you been trying to roll out your first product? I guess it's been a year now.
glossary: to roll sth out
translation: 10. How long have you been trying to launch your first product on the market? Probably a year have passed already.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Czy to ma dla ciebie znaczenie?
english: Does it matter to you?
glossary: to matter
translation: 1. Does it matter to you?

name: Matt Xander
polish: Dlaczego próbujesz mnie wrobić?
english: Why are you trying to set me up?
glossary: to try to do sth/to set sb up
translation: 2. Why are you trying to set me up?

name: Matt Xander
polish: Jest wiele miejsc, które chciałbym odwiedzić.
english: There are many places I'd like to visit.
glossary: to visit a place
translation: 3. There are many places I would like to visit.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Myślisz, że ci uwierzę?
english: Do you think I'll believe you?
glossary: to believe sb
translation: 4. Do you think I'll believe you?

name: Matt Xander
polish: Czy ty myślisz, że ze mną wygrasz?
english: Do you think you'll win against me?
glossary: to win against sb
translation: 5. Do you think you will win with me?

name: Matt Xander
polish: Wkurzyłeś się, kiedy zostałeś zwolniony?
english: Did you get mad when you were fired?
glossary: to get mad/to be fired
translation: 6. Were you pissed off when you were fired?

name: Matt Xander
polish: Może zjesz z nami jutro kolację?
english: Maybe you'll eat dinner with us tomorrow?
glossary: to eat dinner with sb
translation: 7. Why don't you have dinner with us tomorrow?

name: Matt Xander
polish: Jest wiele kursów, na które możesz się zapisać.
english: There are many courses you can sign up for.
glossary: to sign up for a course
translation: 8. There are many courses you can take.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Przestałem ci ufać, kiedy mnie po raz pierwszy oszukałaś.
english: I stopped trusting you when you cheated on me for the first time.
glossary: to stop doing sth/to trust sb/to cheat sb/for the first time
translation: 9. I stopped trusting you when you cheated me for the first time.

name: Matt Xander
polish: Jestem pewien, że mnie nie zawiedziesz.
english: I'm sure you won't let me down.
glossary: to let sb down
translation: 10. I'm sure you won't let me down.

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Mam nadzięję, że wrócisz do pracy do końca miesiąca.
english: I hope you'll come back to work by the end of the month.
glossary: to come back to work/by the end of the month/I hope that...
translation: 1. I hope you will come back to work by the end of the month

name: Monica Grimm
polish: W pewnym momencie zauważyłam błąd.
english: At some point, I noticed a mistake.
glossary: At some point.../to notice a mistake
translation: 2. At some point I notice a mistake.

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Muszę dowiedzieć się prawdy.
english: I have to find out the truth.
glossary: to find out the truth
translation: 3. I have to know the truth.

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Obiecuję, że pójdę jutro do szkoły.
english: I promise I'll go to school tomorrow.
glossary: to promise sth/to go to school
translation: 4. I promise I will go to school tomorow

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Pójdę na siłownię, kiedy wyzdrowieję.
english: I'll go to the gym when I get better.
glossary: to get better/to go to the gym
translation: 5. I'll go to the gym when I get well.

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Przeprowadzam się w przyszłym miesiącu.
english: I'm moving next month.
glossary: to move
translation: 6. I'm moving next month

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Nie mam czasu. Idę jutro do lekarza.
english: I don't have time. I'm going to the doctor tomorrow.
glossary: to go to the doctor
translation: 7. I don't have a time. I'm going to the doctor tomorrow

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Byłem wściekły, kiedy żona mnie okłamała.
english: I was furious when my wife lied to me.
glossary: to be furious/to lie to sb
translation: 8. I was furious when my wife to lied to me

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Od roku chodzę na siłownię.
english: I've been going to the gym for a year.
glossary: to go to the gym
translation: 9. I go to the gym in one year

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Nie możesz wychodzić z łóżka. Masz grypę.
english: You can't get out of bed. You have the flu.
glossary: to have the flu/to get out of bed
translation: 10. You can't get out of the bed. You've the flu

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Dlaczego dzwoniłeś wczoraj do mnie tyle razy?
english: Why did you call me so many times yesterday?
glossary: to call sb/many times
translation: 1. Are any places in this city I should visit?

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Z kim wczoraj poszedłeś na imprezę?
english: Who did you go to the party with yesterday?
glossary: to go to a party with sb
translation: 2. Where are you going on vacation this year?

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Nie powinnaś była składać obietnicy, jeśli wiedziałaś, że jej nie dotrzymasz.
english: You shouldn't have made the promise if you knew you wouldn't keep it.
glossary: to make a promise/to keep a promise
translation: 3. I have time. There is no need to hurry.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Jestem rozczarowana. Byłam pewna, że nie złamiesz obietnicy.
english: I'm disappointed. I was sure you wouldn't break the promise.
glossary: to be disappointed with sth/to be sure/to break a promise
translation: 4. I had hoped to come back home today but I missed the train.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Ufam ci, bo od dawna razem pracujemy.
english: I trust you because we've been working together for a long time.
glossary: to trust sb/for a long time
translation: 5. Why did you react this way? Can you explain it to me?

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Możemy porozmawiać, bo nie ma tu nikogo.
english: We can talk because there's nobody here.
glossary: to talk about sth
translation: 6. You could have called earlier. I would tell you I am not at home.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Przeprowadzam się w przyszłym miesiącu na wieś. Nie mogę się doczekać.
english: I'm moving to the countryside next month. I can't wait.
glossary: can't wait/to move to the countryside
translation: 7. With whom did you speak yesterday?

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Jest kilka książek, które chciałbym przeczytać do końca roku.
english: There are a few books I'd like to read by the end of the year.
glossary: a few/to read a book/by the end of the year
translation: 8. This evening we are going for a drink. Do you remember?

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Mam nadzieję, że zdążę na pociąg. To ostatni.
english: I hope I'll catch the train. It's the last one.
glossary: to catch the train/to catch the last train
translation: 9. I'm afraid I won't get this job.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Od miesiąca szukam pracy, ale nie ma interesujących ofert.
english: I've been looking for a job for a month, but there are no interesting offers.
glossary: to look for a job/an offer
translation: 10. With who do you want to spend the rest of your life?

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Muszę się skupić na szukaniu lepszej pracy.
english: I have to focus on looking for a better job.
glossary: to look for a job/to focus on sth
translation: 1. I have to focus on looking for new job.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Dostaniesz grzywnę, jeśli nie zapłacisz podatku na czas.
english: You'll get a fine if you don't pay your tax on time.
glossary: to pay your tax/to get a fine
translation: 2. You will get a fine if you don't pay your tax.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Rzuciłbym pracę, gdybym musiał pracować po godzinach.
english: I'd leave my job if I had to work overtime.
glossary: to leave your job/to work overtime
translation: 3. I would leave my job if I had to work overtime.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Ostatnim razem, kiedy rozmawiałyśmy, mówiłaś, że potrzebujesz mojej porady.
english: The last time we talked, you said you needed my advice.
glossary: to need sb's advice/The last time we talked.../to say sth
translation: 4. Last time we spoke, you said you needed my advice.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Kiedy ostatni raz widział pan ofiarę żywą?
english: When was the last time you saw the victim alive?
glossary: to be alive/a victim/to see sb/When was the last time...
translation: 5. When was the last time you have saw the victim alive?

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Policja nie zatrzymałaby cię, gdybyś włączył światła.
english: The police wouldn't have pulled you over if you'd turned on the headlights.
glossary: to turn on the headlights/to pull sb over/the police
translation: 6. The police wouldn't pull you over if you turned on the headlights.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Nie spaliłam jeszcze twoich rzeczy, ale za chwilę to zrobię.
english: I haven't burned your stuff yet, but I'll do it in a moment.
glossary: to burn sth/your stuff/in a moment
translation: 7. I haven't burned your stuff yet, but I will do it in a moment.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Czy jest możliwość zaparkowania samochodu przed budynkiem?
english: Is there the possibility to park a car in front of the building?
glossary: to park a car/in front of the building/a possibility to do sth
translation: 8. Is it a possibility to park a car in front of the building?

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Dowiedziałem się o tym fakcie po tym, jak się rozstaliśmy.
english: I found out about the fact after we'd broken up.
glossary: to find out about sth/a fact/to break up
translation: 9. I found out about the fact after we broke up.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Powiedz mi, w czym się specjalizujesz.
english: Tell me what you specialize in.
glossary: to specialize in sth
translation: 10. Tell me what do you specialize in?

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Kogo chcesz, żebym zaprosił na imprezę?
english: Who do you want me to invite to the party?
glossary: to invite sb to a party
translation: 1. Who do you want me to invite to a party?

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Wpadaj. Mój mąż gotuje w ten piątek.
english: Drop by. My husband's cooking this Friday.
glossary: to cook/this Friday
translation: 2. Stop by. My husband is cooking this Friday.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Nie ma różnicy. Bierz, co chcesz.
english: There's no difference. Take what you want.
glossary: a difference/to take sth
translation: 3. There is no difference. Take whatever you want.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Mogłeś mi od razu powiedzieć prawdę. Nie zdenerwowałbym się.
english: You could've told me the truth at the beginning. I wouldn't have gotten mad.
glossary: to tell sb the truth/at the beginning/to get mad
translation: 4. You could have told me the truth already. I would not get mad.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Co mi chciałaś powiedzieć na imprezie?
english: What did you want to tell me at the party?
glossary: to tell sb sth/at the party
translation: 5. What did you want to tell me at the party?

name: Michael Edwards
polish: W artykule jest błąd. Popraw go.
english: There's a mistake in the article. Correct it.
glossary: in the article/to correct a mistake
translation: 6. There is a mistake in the article. Correct it.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Może pojadę taksówką. Zaoszczędzę czas.
english: Maybe I'll take a cab. I'll save time.
glossary: to take a cab/to save money
translation: 7. Maybe I will take a cab. I will save some time.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Co chcesz dostać na urodziny?
english: What do you want to get for your birthday?
glossary: to get sth for your birthday
translation: 8. What do you want for your birthday?

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Gdzie Ty wczoraj spałeś?
english: Where did you sleep yesterday?
glossary: to sleep
translation: 9. Where did you sleep last night?

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Stresowałem się, bo bałem się, że coś pójdzie źle.
english: I was stressed out because I was afraid something would go wrong.
glossary: to be stressed out/to be afraid of sth/to go wrong
translation: 10. I was stressed because I was afraid something would have gone wrong.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Obściskiwałeś się z moją koleżanką. Przyznaj to.
english: You made out with my friend. Admit it.
glossary: to make out with sb/to admit sth
translation: 1.	You made out with me friend. Admit it.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Muszę chronić swoje dzieci.
english: I have to protect my kids.
glossary: to protect sb/a kid
translation: 2.	I have to protect my children.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Moi znajomi jutro wpadają. Kup piwo.
english: My friends are dropping by tomorrow. Buy beer.
glossary: to drop by/a friend/to buy sth/to drink beer
translation: 3.	My friends drop by tomorrow. You buy beer.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Nie powinieneś udawać, że mnie słuchasz.
english: You shouldn't pretend that you're listening to me.
glossary: to pretend/to listen to sb
translation: 4.	You shouldn’t pretend  that you listen to me.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Ja piję dziś wieczorem. Ty prowadzisz.
english: I'm drinking tonight. You're driving.
glossary: to drink alcohol/to drive a car
translation: 5.	I’m drinking tonight. You are driving.

name: Damien Bean
polish: W zeszłym roku pracowałem jako stażysta. Dużo się wtedy nauczyłem.
english: I worked as an intern last year. I learned a lot back then.
glossary: to work as an intern/to learn sth/back then
translation: 6.	I worked as an intern last year. I learned a lot.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Nie mogę wejść do pokoju. Jest zamknięty.
english: I can't enter the room. It's locked.
glossary: to be locked/to enter the room
translation: 7.	I can’t enter the room. It is locked.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Będę bardziej surowy następnym razem. Obiecuję.
english: I'll be more strict next time. I promise.
glossary: to be strict/next time/to promise sth
translation: 8.	I’ll be a more strict next time. I promise.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Chciałabym pracować jako sędzia w przyszłości.
english: I'd like to work as a judge in the future.
glossary: to work as a judge/a judge/in the future
translation: 9.	I want to work as a judge in the future.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Nie martw się. Nie wystawię cię.
english: Don't worry. I won't stand you up.
glossary: to worry/to stand sb up
translation: 10.	Don’t worry. I won’t stand you up.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Co się stało? Byłam pewna, że się pobierzecie.
english: What happened? I was sure you'd get married.
glossary: to happen/to be sure/to get married
translation: 1.	What happened? I was sure you would get married.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Mogłem napisać ten test z angielskiego w zeszłym tygodniu. Teraz nic nie pamiętam.
english: I could've taken the English test last week. I don't remember anything now.
glossary: to take an English test/to remember sth/last week
translation: 2. I could have written this English test last week. I don’t remember anything now.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że żona będzie w dobrym humorze.
english: I hoped my wife would be in a good mood.
glossary: to hope/a wife/to be in a good mood
translation: 3. I hoped my wife would be in a good mood.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Chciałem powiedzieć Ci prawdę, ale bałem się, że się zdenerwujesz.
english: I wanted to tell you the truth, but I was afraid you'd get mad.
glossary: to tell sb the truth/to be afraid of sth/to get mad
translation: 4. I wanted to tell you the truth but I was afraid you would get nervous.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Mogłam wydawać mniej pieniędzy na ubrania, bo muszę jeszcze zapłacić rachunki.
english: I could've spent less money on clothes because I still have to pay the bills.
glossary: to spend money on clothes/still/to pay the bills
translation: 5. I could have spent less money on clothes because I have to pay the bills.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Nie powinieneś był tyle pić na imprezie.
english: You shouldn't have drunk so much at the party.
glossary: to drink/at the party
translation: 6. You shouldn’t have drunk that much at the party.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Nie mogę zasnąć. Nie powinienem był pić kawy tak późno.
english: I can't fall asleep. I shouldn't have drunk coffee so late.
glossary: to fall asleep/to drink coffee/late
translation: 7. I can’t fall asleep. I shouldn’t have drunk coffee so late.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Pójdziemy na kawę, jak już będzie ładna pogoda.
english: We'll go for a coffee once the weather is good.
glossary: to go for a coffee/the weather
translation: 8. We will go for coffee once the weather is nice.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Pójdę spać, jak już skończę czytać książkę.
english: I'll go to sleep once I finish reading the book.
glossary: to go to sleep/to finish doing sth
translation: 9. I’ll go to sleep once I finish reading the book.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Następny weekend spędzam w moim rodzinnym mieście.
english: I'm spending next weekend in my hometown.
glossary: in your hometown/to spend next weekend
translation: 10. Next weekend I’m spending in my hometown.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Mam nadzięję, że wrócisz do pracy do końca miesiąca.
english: I hope you'll come back to work by the end of the month.
glossary: to come back to work/by the end of the month/I hope that...
translation: 1. I hope, you’ll come back to work by the end of the month.

name: Anna Forney
polish: W pewnym momencie zauważyłam błąd.
english: At some point, I noticed a mistake.
glossary: At some point.../to notice a mistake
translation: 2. At some point, I noticed a mistake.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Muszę dowiedzieć się prawdy.
english: I have to find out the truth.
glossary: to find out the truth
translation: 3. I have to find out the truth.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Obiecuję, że pójdę jutro do szkoły.
english: I promise I'll go to school tomorrow.
glossary: to promise sth/to go to school
translation: 4. I promise I’ll go to school tomorrow.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Pójdę na siłownię, kiedy wyzdrowieję.
english: I'll go to the gym when I get better.
glossary: to get better/to go to the gym
translation: 5. I’ll go to the gym when I get better.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Przeprowadzam się w przyszłym miesiącu.
english: I'm moving next month.
glossary: to move
translation: 6. I’m moving next month.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Nie mam czasu. Idę jutro do lekarza.
english: I don't have time. I'm going to the doctor tomorrow.
glossary: to go to the doctor
translation: 7. I don’t have time. I’m going to the doctor tomorrow.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Byłem wściekły, kiedy żona mnie okłamała.
english: I was furious when my wife lied to me.
glossary: to be furious/to lie to sb
translation: 8. I was furious when my wife lied to me.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Od roku chodzę na siłownię.
english: I've been going to the gym for a year.
glossary: to go to the gym
translation: 9. I’ve been going to the gym for a year.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Nie możesz wychodzić z łóżka. Masz grypę.
english: You can't get out of bed. You have the flu.
glossary: to have the flu/to get out of bed
translation: 10. You can’t get out of bed. You have the flu.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Jutro uczę się na egzamin, ale możemy się spotkać, jak już skończę.
english: I'm studying for an exam tomorrow, but we can meet once I'm done.
glossary: to be done/to study for an exam/to meet sb
translation: Tomorrow I will be learning to exam, but later, when I will end we can meet each other.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Nie pojechałem nad jezioro, bo obawiałem się, że się przeziębię.
english: I didn't go to the lake because I was afraid I'd catch a cold.
glossary: to go to the lake/to catch a cold/to be afraid of sth
translation: I didn't go to a lake because I was afraid that I will catch a cold.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Przeprowadzę się, jak już znajdę nową pracę.
english: I'll move once I find a new job.
glossary: to move/to find a new job
translation: I will move out when I find a new job.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Będę mieć więcej energii, jak już napiję się kawy.
english: I'll have more energy once I have some coffee.
glossary: to have energy/to have some coffee
translation: I will have more energy, once I will drink coffee.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Poproszę o podwyżkę, jak już szef będzie z powrotem w biurze.
english: I'll ask for a pay-raise once my boss is back in the office.
glossary: to ask for a pay-raise/to be back in the office
translation: I will ask for a raise once the boss is in the office.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Jestem podekscytowana, bo jutro widzę się ze starą znajomą.
english: I'm excited because I'm seeing an old friend of mine tomorrow.
glossary: to see sb/to be excited
translation: I'm excited because tomorrow i will see with my old friend.

name: Paul Baker
polish: W przyszłym tygodniu zaczynam kurs angielskiego. Nie mogę się doczekać.
english: I'm starting an English course next week. I can't wait.
glossary: can't wait/to start an English course
translation: I'm starting an English course next week, I can't wait.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Porozmawiamy, jak już będziesz gotowa.
english: We'll talk once you're ready.
glossary: to talk to sb/to be ready
translation: We will talk when you will be ready.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Bałem się, że przegramy sprawę przez mój błąd.
english: I was afraid we'd lose the case because of my mistake.
glossary: to be afraid of sth/to lose a case/because of you/a mistake
translation: I was afraid that we would lose the case because of my mistake.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Możemy przełożyć nasze spotkanie? Jutro przyjeżdżają moi rodzice w odwiedziny.
english: Can we put off our meeting? My parents are visiting me tomorrow.
glossary: to visit sb/to put off a meeting
translation: Can we rearrange our meeting, because my parents are coming to visit tomorrow.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Klient dodzwoniłby się do nas, gdyby szefowa uaktualniła nasze dane kontaktowe.
english: The client would've called us back if boss had updated our contact details.
glossary: a client/to call sb back/a boss/to update contact details
translation: 1 The customer would have reached us if the boss had updated our contact information.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Co twoi rodzice próbują wskórać?
english: What are your parents trying to accomplish?
glossary: to try to accomplish sth
translation: 2) What are your parents trying to get up to?

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Na szczęście łatwo było ofierze zidentyfikować napastnika.
english: Luckily, it was easy for the victim to identify the assaulter.
glossary: to identify sb/an assaulter
translation: 3. Fortunately, it was easy for the victim to identify the attacker.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Byłbyś bardziej zaangażowany w swoje obowiązki, gdybyś był na prowizji.
english: You'd be more engaged in your duties if you were on commission.
glossary: to be engaged in sth/to be on commission
translation: 4) You would be more engaged in your duties if you were on commission.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Trudno ci będzie zaangażować wszystkich w rozmowę.
english: It'll be hard for you to engage everybody in the conversation.
glossary: to engage sb in the conversation
translation: 5. You will find it difficult to engage everyone in conversation.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Kto mnie zastąpi, kiedy wezmę tydzień wolnego?
english: Who's going to replace me when I take a week off?
glossary: to replace sb/to take a week off
translation: 6. Who will replace me when I take a week off?

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Będzie późno, kiedy dojedziemy do domu.
english: It'll be late when we get home.
glossary: to be late/to drive back home
translation: 7. It will be late when we get home.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Trudno mi wyciągnąć moje dziecko z łóżka.
english: It's hard for me to get my child out of bed.
glossary: to get your child out of bed
translation: 8. It will be difficult for me to get my child out of bed.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Jakie teksty zazwyczaj musisz tłumaczyć?
english: What texts do you usually have to translate?
glossary: to translate a text
translation: 9. What texts do you usually have to translate?

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Trudno mi się przeprasza za swoje błędy.
english: It's hard for me to apologize for my mistakes.
glossary: to apologize for your mistakes
translation: 10. I find it hard to apologize for my mistakes.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Trudno mi było stanąć na nogi po rozwodzie.
english: It was hard for me to get back on my feet after my divorce.
glossary: to get back on your feet/a divorce
translation: 1. it was difficult for me to get back on my feet after the divorce.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Na co narzeka tym razem nasza córka?
english: What's our daughter complaining about this time?
glossary: to complain about sth/a daughter
translation: 2. what is our daughter complaining about this time?

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Czy ty mnie sprawdzasz? Myślałem, że mi ufasz.
english: Are you testing me? I thought you trusted me.
glossary: to test sb/to think that.../to trust sb
translation: 3. are you checking up on me? I thought you trusted me.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Nie zostałbyś pozwany, gdybyś bez pozwolenia nie ujawnił poufnych informacji.
english: You wouldn't have been sued if you hadn't disclosed confidential information without permission.
glossary: to be sued/to disclose confidential information/to do sth without permission
translation: 4. You wouldn't be sued if you didn't disclose confidential information without permission.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Grozisz mi? Mam nadzieję, że nie.
english: Are you threatening me? I hope not.
glossary: to threaten sb/to hope
translation: 5. are you threatening me? I hope not.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Jakie auta są tu zwykle kradzione?
english: What cars are usually stolen here?
glossary: to steal sth
translation: 6. what cars are usually stolen here?

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Nie obijałbyś się cały dzień, gdybyś podlegał mnie.
english: You wouldn't coast for the entire day if you reported to me.
glossary: to coast/to report to sb
translation: 7. You wouldn't be dabbling all day if you were subject to me.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Kiedy skończysz poprawiać tę deklarację podatkową, przejrzyj dokumenty, które leżą na biurku.
english: Once you're finished with correcting this tax declaration, go through the documents that are lying on the desk.
glossary: to correct sth/a tax declaration/to go through documents/to lie on the desk
translation: 8) When you're done correcting that tax return, go through the documents that are lying on your desk.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Widzę, co się dzieje. Kogo unikasz?
english: I see what's happening. Who are you avoiding?
glossary: to see sth/to happen/to avoid sb
translation: 9. I see what's going on. Who are you avoiding?

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Jakie sukienki zwykle szyjesz?
english: What dresses do you usually sew?
glossary: to sew sth/a dress
translation: 10. what kind of dresses do you usually sew?

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Nie łatwo mi oprzeć się pokusie, żeby zapalić.
english: It's not easy for me to resist the temptation to smoke.
glossary: to resist the temptation to do sth/to smoke
translation: 1.I don't easily resist the temptation to light up.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Nie jestem pewien, czy dobrze cię rozumiem. Co sugerujesz?
english: I'm not sure if I understand you well. What are you suggesting?
glossary: to be sure/to understand sth well/to suggest sth
translation: 2. I'm not sure I understand you correctly. What are you suggesting?

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Prezes by teraz z panią porozmawiała, gdyby nie była na spotkaniu.
english: The chairman would talk to you right now if she weren't at a meeting.
glossary: a chairman/to talk to sb/to be at a meeting
translation: 3) The chairman would talk to you now if she was not at the meeting.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Jakiego podejścia wymaga to zadanie?
english: What approach does this task require?
glossary: an approach/to require sth
translation: 4. What ….. does this task require?

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Zachowaj spokój, kiedy klient znowu do ciebie zadzwoni.
english: Stay calm when your client calls you again.
glossary: to stay calm/to call sb again
translation: 5. Stay calm down when the customer calls you again.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Otwierasz swoją własną firmę? Jestem pod wrażeniem.
english: Are you setting up your own business? I'm impressed.
glossary: to set up your own business/to be impressed
translation: 6. are you opening your own company? I'm impressed.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Do jakiej restauracji chcielibyście dzisiaj iść?
english: What restaurant would you like to go to today?
glossary: to go to a restaurant
translation: 7. What restaurant would you like to go to today?

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Jaką masz dla mnie ofertę?
english: What offer do you have for me?
glossary: to have an offer for sb
translation: 8. what offer do you have for me?

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Otrzymałaby pani zwrot kosztów, gdyby wysłała nam pani faktury na czas.
english: You would've received the reimbursement if you'd sent us the invoices on time.
glossary: to receive sth/a reimbursement/to send invoices
translation: 9. You would have received a refund if you had sent us the invoices on time.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Wyjeżdżacie z miasta? Co się stało?
english: Are you leaving town? What happened?
glossary: to leave town/to happen
translation: 10. Are you leaving town? What happened to you?

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Obiecałeś, że zajmiesz się problemem.
english: You promised you'd handle the problem.
glossary: to handle a problem
translation: 1. You promised, you would take care of this problem.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: W moim biurze jest wiele osób, które plotkują.
english: There are many people in my office who gossip.
glossary: to gossip/in your office
translation: 2. There are few people in my office who gossip.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Myślę, że wezmę udział w kursie.
english: I think I'll take part in the course.
glossary: to take part in a course
translation: 3. I think I will join the course

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Dlaczego mnie spoliczkowałaś?
english: Why did you slap me?
glossary: to slap sb
translation: 4. Why did you slap me?

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Od miesiąca szukam nowej pracy.
english: I've been looking for a new job for a month.
glossary: to look for a new job
translation: 5. I’ve been looking for a new job for month.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Dlaczego nauczycielka cię opieprzyła?
english: Why did the teacher tell you off?
glossary: to tell sb off/a teacher
translation: 6. Why did your teacher tell you off?

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Zaproszę twoją siostrę na randkę, jak już wróci do miasta.
english: I'll ask out your sister once she gets back to town.
glossary: to get back to town/to ask sb out/a sister
translation: 7. I will invite your sister on a date, when she comes back to town.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Nie pojawię się dzisiaj na spotkaniu, bo jestem chory.
english: I won't show up at the meeting today because I'm sick.
glossary: to be sick/to show up at the meeting
translation: 8. I won’t show up at the meeting today, because I’m sick.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Powinieneś zrobić to sam.
english: You should do it on your own.
glossary: by yourself; on your own
translation: 9. You should do it by yourself.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Mąż odbiera jutro dzieci ze szkoły.
english: My husband's picking up the kids from school tomorrow.
glossary: to pick up the kids from school
translation: 10. My husband is picking children from school tomorrow.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Jeśli teraz pozbędziesz się formalności, zaoszczędzisz dużo czasu.
english: If you do away with formalities now, you'll save a lot of time.
glossary: to do away with formalities/to save time
translation: 1. If you get rid of the formalities now, you’ll save a lot of time.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Gdybyś nie dała kosza swojemu dziwnemu koledze z pracy, byłabyś teraz w toksycznej relacji.
english: If you hadn't turned your weird colleague down, you would be in a toxic relationship now.
glossary: to turn sb down/to be in a toxic relationship
translation: 2. If you hadn’t turned your weird coworker down, you would have been in a toxic relationship now.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Kiedyś skarżyłem na moich kolegów za każdym razem, kiedy zrobili coś złego, ale wyluzowałem.
english: I used to tell on my friends every time they did something wrong, but I chilled out.
glossary: to tell on sb/to chill out/to do sth wrong/a friend
translation: 3. I used to tell on my colleagues every time when they did something wrong but I chilled out.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Gdzie jest dokument, o który cię prosiłem? Powiedziałeś, że go wydrukujesz.
english: Where's the document I asked you for? You said you'd print it out.
glossary: to print sth out/to ask sb for sth/a document
translation: 4. Where is the document which I had asked you for? You said that you would print it out.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Jeśli wszystkie moje plany się udadzą, w końcu będę mógł rzucić tę pracę.
english: If all my plans work out, I'll finally be able to give up the job.
glossary: to work out/to be able to do sth/to give up the job
translation: 5. If all my plans work out I'll be able to quit the job finally.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Już wyniosłem śmieci, więc nie musisz mi o tym znów przypominać.
english: I've already taken out the garbage, so you don't have to remind me of it again.
glossary: to take out the garbage/to remind sb of sth
translation: 6. I’ve already taken the garbage out so you don’t have to remind me about it again.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Gdybyś się tyle nie wygłupiała, byłabyś traktowana poważniej.
english: If you didn't mess around so much, you would be treated more seriously.
glossary: to mess around/to treat sb seriously
translation: 7. If you hadn’t messed around so much you would've been treated more seriously.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Kiedy wróciłem ze Stanów, zorientowałem się, że podłapałem amerykański akcent.
english: When I came back from the US, I realized I'd picked up the American accent.
glossary: to pick up the American accent/to come back from the US/to realize that...
translation: 8. When I had gone back from the USA I found out that I picked up the American accent.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Ostatni pacjent wiercił się, podczas gdy przeglądałam jego dokumentację.
english: The last patient was fidgeting while I was going through his documentation.
glossary: to go through documentation/to fidget/a patient
translation: 9. The last patient fidget while I was going through his documentation.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Szef wyszedł z pokoju, kiedy wciąż kończyliśmy spotkanie.
english: The boss left the room when we were still wrapping up the meeting.
glossary: a boss/to leave a room/to wrap up a meeting
translation: 10. The boss left the room when we were still finishing the meeting.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Muszę się skupić na szukaniu lepszej pracy.
english: I have to focus on looking for a better job.
glossary: to look for a job/to focus on sth
translation: I have to focus on looking for a better job.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Dostaniesz grzywnę, jeśli nie zapłacisz podatku na czas.
english: You'll get a fine if you don't pay your tax on time.
glossary: to pay your tax/to get a fine
translation: You’ll get a fine If you don’t pay your tax on time.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Rzuciłbym pracę, gdybym musiał pracować po godzinach.
english: I'd leave my job if I had to work overtime.
glossary: to leave your job/to work overtime
translation: I would quit my job If I had to work overtime.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Ostatnim razem, kiedy rozmawiałyśmy, mówiłaś, że potrzebujesz mojej porady.
english: The last time we talked, you said you needed my advice.
glossary: to need sb's advice/The last time we talked.../to say sth
translation: Last time when we spoke you had said that you would need my advice.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Kiedy ostatni raz widział pan ofiarę żywą?
english: When was the last time you saw the victim alive?
glossary: to be alive/a victim/to see sb/When was the last time...
translation: When was the last time you saw a victim alive?

name: Jack Russell
polish: Policja nie zatrzymałaby cię, gdybyś włączył światła.
english: The police wouldn't have pulled you over if you'd turned on the headlights.
glossary: to turn on the headlights/to pull sb over/the police
translation: The police wouldn't have stopped you If you had turned on the headlight.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Nie spaliłam jeszcze twoich rzeczy, ale za chwilę to zrobię.
english: I haven't burned your stuff yet, but I'll do it in a moment.
glossary: to burn sth/your stuff/in a moment
translation: I haven’t fired your stuff yet but I’ll do it in a moment.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Czy jest możliwość zaparkowania samochodu przed budynkiem?
english: Is there the possibility to park a car in front of the building?
glossary: to park a car/in front of the building/a possibility to do sth
translation: Is it possible to park the car in front of the building?

name: Jack Russell
polish: Dowiedziałem się o tym fakcie po tym, jak się rozstaliśmy.
english: I found out about the fact after we'd broken up.
glossary: to find out about sth/a fact/to break up
translation: I found out about this fact after we had broken up.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Powiedz mi, w czym się specjalizujesz.
english: Tell me what you specialize in.
glossary: to specialize in sth
translation: Tell me what you specialize in?

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Myślę, że dzisiaj będę pracował po godzinach. Co powiesz na czwartek?
english: I think I'll work overtime today. What about Thursday?
glossary: to work overtime/to meet/today/Thursday/What about.../to think
translation: 1. I think I'll work overtime. What about Thursday?

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Myśłałem, że zawieziesz mnie do domu. Nie chcę brać taksówki.
english: I thought you'd take me home. I don't want to take a cab.
glossary: to think/to take sb home/to take a cab
translation: 2. I thought you would take me home

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Idę jutro do banku, żeby założyć konto.
english: I'm going to the bank tomorrow to open an account.
glossary: to go to the bank/to open an account/tomorrow
translation: 3. I'm going to the bank tomorrow to create an account.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Skup się na sprzątaniu pokoju.
english: Focus on cleaning the room.
glossary: to focus on sth/to clean a room
translation: 4. Focus on cleaning up the room

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Musisz pamiętać, że jest wyjątek do tej zasady.
english: You have to remember that there's an exception to the rule.
glossary: to remember sth/an exception to the rule
translation: 5. You should remember that there is an exception on this rule

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Chciałabym, żebyś wygłosił przemowę na konferencji.
english: I'd like you to give a speech at the conference.
glossary: to give a speech/at the conference
translation: 6. I would like you to give a speach

name: Justina Stanley
polish: W tej grupie jest za dużo ludzi. Znajdę inną.
english: There are too many people in the group. I have to find a different one.
glossary: in the group/to find sth/different
translation: 7. There are too mamy people in this group. I'll find different one.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Powinienem był od razu cię zwolnić. Nie zasługujesz, żeby tu być.
english: I should've fired you right away. You don't deserve to be here.
glossary: to fire sb/right away/to deserve sth
translation: 8. I should have fired you at once. You don't deserve to be here.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Kiedy zaczynasz nową pracę?
english: When are you starting the new job?
glossary: to start a new job
translation: 9. When do you start

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Interesuję się gotowaniem.
english: I'm interested in cooking.
glossary: to be interested in sth/to cook sth
translation: 10. I'm interesting in cooking

name: Martin Vance
polish: Nie wkurzyłbyś mnie, gdybyś ze mną nie zadzierał.
english: You wouldn't have pissed me off if you hadn't messed with me.
glossary: to mess with sb/to piss sb off
translation: You wouldn’t have pissed me off if you hadn’t messed with me.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Gdybyś tak często się nie wkurzał, dzeciaki by się ciebie nie bały.
english: If you weren't pissed off so often, the kids wouldn't be afraid of you.
glossary: to be afraid of sb/to be pissed off/a kid
translation: If you didn’t piss yourself off such often, the kids wouldn’t be afraid of you.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Nie jesteśmy zainteresowani przejęciem tej firmy.
english: We're not interested in taking over the company.
glossary: to take over a company
translation: We aren’t interested in taking over this company.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Kiedyś moje dzieciaki lubiły się przebierać, ale dorosły.
english: My kids used to like dressing up, but they grew up.
glossary: to dress up/to like doing sth/a kid/to grow up
translation: My kids used to like dressing up, but they had grown up.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Mój zespół musi przyzwyczaić się do kończenia spotkań szybciej.
english: My team has to get used to wrapping up meetings more quickly.
glossary: to wrap sth up/to wrap up a meeting/to get used to doing sth/a meeting
translation: My team has to get used to finishing meetings faster.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Od dłuższego czasu ograniczam picie. Dlatego czuję się lepiej.
english: I've been cutting down on drinking for a long time. That's why I feel better.
glossary: to feel good/to cut down on drinking
translation: I have been cutting down on drinking for a long time. This is why I feel better.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Jeśli ból nie ustąpi, pójdę do lekarza.
english: If the pain doesn't go away, I'll go to the doctor.
glossary: to go away {2}/to go to the doctor
translation: If the pain doesn’t go away, I will go to the doctor.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Wystawiłeś jak dotąd trzy faktury. Musisz się pospieszyć.
english: You've made out three invoices so far. You have to hurry up.
glossary: to hurry up/to make out an invoice
translation: You have made out three invoices so far. You must speed up.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Kiedy zaproponowałem lepszy plan, poprzedni został już zaakceptowany.
english: When I put forward a better plan, the previous one had already been accepted.
glossary: to accept sth/to put forward a plan
translation: When I put forward the better plan, the previous one had already been accepted.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Moja ciotka sporządzała testament, kiedy zmarła.
english: My aunt was making her will when she died.
glossary: to carry out your will/to make your will/to die
translation: My aunt was carrying out her will when she died.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Policja twierdziła wczoraj, że wytropiła złodzieja.
english: The police stated yesterday that they'd tracked down the thief.
glossary: to track down a thief
translation: The police were claiming yesterday that they had tracked down a thief.

name: Martin Vance
polish: W zeszłym roku mówiłaś, że musisz ograniczyć palenie, ale tego nie zrobiłaś.
english: You said last year that you had to cut down on smoking, but you didn't.
glossary: to cut down on smoking/last year
translation: You talked last year that you needed to cut down on smoking, but you hadn’t done it.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Nadrobimy opóźnienie, jak już dostaniemy wszystkie niezbędne materiały.
english: We'll make up for the delay once we get all the necessary materials.
glossary: the necessary materials/to make up for a delay
translation: We will make up for the delay once we get all the necessary materials.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Chciałbym, żebyś rozważył wszystkie za i przeciw.
english: I'd like you to weigh up all the pros and cons.
glossary: to weigh up the pros and cons
translation: I would like you to weigh up all the pros and cons.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Córka obiecała, że nie będzie panikować, kiedy rozpęta się kolejna burza.
english: My daughter promised she wouldn't freak out when the next storm breaks out.
glossary: to break out/to freak out/a daughter
translation: My daughter promised that you wouldn’t freak out when another storm will come.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Dlaczego nie broniłeś swoich interesów, gdy właściel mieszkania próbował cię orżnąć?
english: Why didn't you stand up for your interests when the apartment owner was trying to rip you off?
glossary: to rip sb off/an apartment owner/to stand up for your interests
translation: Why didn’t you stand up for your interests when the apartment owner was trying to rip you off?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Nie powinnaś była wchodzić mi w drogę.
english: You should've stayed out of my way.
glossary: to stay out of sb's way
translation: You should have stayed out of my way.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Czy sędzia rozważył już dowody?
english: Has the judge weighed up the evidence yet?
glossary: to weigh up evidence
translation: Has the judge already weighed up the evidence?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Z ilu części składa się projekt?
english: How many parts is the project made up of?
glossary: to be made up of two parts/a project
translation: How many parts the project is made up of?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Dlaczego ograniczasz mięso? Jest zdrowe.
english: Why are you cutting down on meat? It's healthy.
glossary: to be healthy/to cut down on meat
translation: Why are you cutting down on meat? It’s healthy.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Co się stało? Byłam pewna, że się pobierzecie.
english: What happened? I was sure you'd get married.
glossary: to happen/to be sure/to get married
translation: 1. What happened? I was sure we would get merried.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Mogłem napisać ten test z angielskiego w zeszłym tygodniu. Teraz nic nie pamiętam.
english: I could've taken the English test last week. I don't remember anything now.
glossary: to take an English test/to remember sth/last week
translation: 2. I coulde've written the test from english last week. I don't remember anything right now.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że żona będzie w dobrym humorze.
english: I hoped my wife would be in a good mood.
glossary: to hope/a wife/to be in a good mood
translation: 3. I hoped my wife would be in a good mood.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Chciałem powiedzieć Ci prawdę, ale bałem się, że się zdenerwujesz.
english: I wanted to tell you the truth, but I was afraid you'd get mad.
glossary: to tell sb the truth/to be afraid of sth/to get mad
translation: 4. I wanted to tell you the truth, but I was afraid you would get angry.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Mogłam wydawać mniej pieniędzy na ubrania, bo muszę jeszcze zapłacić rachunki.
english: I could've spent less money on clothes because I still have to pay the bills.
glossary: to spend money on clothes/still/to pay the bills
translation: 5. I coulde've spent less money on clothes because I have to pay my bills yet.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Nie powinieneś był tyle pić na imprezie.
english: You shouldn't have drunk so much at the party.
glossary: to drink/at the party
translation: 6. You shouldn't have drunk so much at the party.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Nie mogę zasnąć. Nie powinienem był pić kawy tak późno.
english: I can't fall asleep. I shouldn't have drunk coffee so late.
glossary: to fall asleep/to drink coffee/late
translation: 7. I can't sleep. I shouldn't have drunk the coffee so late.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Pójdziemy na kawę, jak już będzie ładna pogoda.
english: We'll go for a coffee once the weather is good.
glossary: to go for a coffee/the weather
translation: 8. We'll go for coffee once the weather be nice.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Pójdę spać, jak już skończę czytać książkę.
english: I'll go to sleep once I finish reading the book.
glossary: to go to sleep/to finish doing sth
translation: 9. I'll go to sleep once I finish read the book.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Następny weekend spędzam w moim rodzinnym mieście.
english: I'm spending next weekend in my hometown.
glossary: in your hometown/to spend next weekend
translation: 10. I'm spending next week in my family's town.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Nie martw się. Nic nie poszło jeszcze źle.
english: Don't worry. Nothing has gone wrong yet.
glossary: to go wrong/to worry
translation: Don't worry. Nothing has gone wrong yet.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Nie mamy wystarczająco jedzenia dla wszystkich gości. Musisz iść do sklepu.
english: We don't have enough food for all the guests. You have to go to the store.
glossary: food/a guest/to go to the store
translation: I don’t have enough food for all guests. You have to go to a store.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Byłabyś dobrze poinformowana, gdybyś regularnie oglądała wiadomości.
english: You'd be well-informed if you regularly watched the news.
glossary: to be well-informed/to watch the news/to do sth regularly
translation: You would be well informed if you watched the news regularly.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Nie chcę, żeby moi uczniowie ściągali na teście.
english: I don't want my students to cheat on the test.
glossary: to cheat on the test
translation: I don’t want my students cheating on the test.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Zmarnowałam rok życia, płacząc po ostatnim zerwaniu.
english: I wasted a year of my life crying after the last breakup.
glossary: to waste your time/life/to cry/a breakup
translation: I wasted one year of life crying after breakup.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Na szczęście wujek nie miał udaru. Tylko zemdlał.
english: Fortunately, my uncle didn't have a stroke. He only fainted.
glossary: Fortunately.../an uncle/to have a stroke/to faint
translation: Fortunately, my uncle doesn’t have a stroke. He just fainted.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Chciałabym, żeby moje dzieci poszły na studia.
english: I'd like my kids to go to college.
glossary: to go to college
translation: I would like my children to go to college.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Chciałbym, żeby mój szef mi ufał.
english: I'd like my boss to trust me.
glossary: to trust sb/a boss
translation: I wish my boss would trust me.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Nie zasnęłabym wczoraj, gdybym nie wzięła tych tabletek.
english: I wouldn't have fallen asleep yesterday if I hadn't taken the pills.
glossary: to fall asleep/to take pills
translation: I would’t have fallen asleep yestarday if I hadn’t taken these pills.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Możemy porozmawiać? Nie miałem wczoraj szansy, żeby cię przeprosić.
english: Can we talk? I didn't have a chance yesterday to apologize to you.
glossary: to talk/to have the chance to do sth/to apologize to sb
translation: Can we talk? I didn't have a chance yesterday to apology you.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Nie odkryłem jeszcze swojego powołania.
english: I haven't found my vocation yet.
glossary: to find your vocation
translation: 1. I haven’t discovered my vocation yet.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Nie musiałbyś teraz płacić za to badanie, gdybyś miał ubezpieczenie.
english: You wouldn't have to pay for the examination now if you had insurance.
glossary: to have insurance/to pay for sth/an examination
translation: 2. You wouldn’t have to pay for this examination now if you had insurance.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Zauważyłem wczoraj, że sąsiedzi kupili nowy samochód.
english: I noticed yesterday that my neighbors had bought a new car.
glossary: to buy a new car/to notice sth/a neighbor
translation: 3. I noticed yesterday that my neighbors had bought a new car.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Do kogo należy ta komórka?
english: Who does the cell belong to?
glossary: to belong to sb/a cell phone
translation: 4. Who does this cell phone belong to?

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Kiedy postanowiłeś, że będziesz mieszkał za granicą?
english: When did you decide you'd live abroad?
glossary: to decide that.../to live abroad
translation: 5. When did you decide that you would live abroad?

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Mama będzie zła, jeśli nie posprzątam pokoju.
english: My mom will be mad if I don't clean up my room.
glossary: to clean up your room/to be mad at sb/a mom
translation: 6. My mum will be angry if I don’t clean up my room.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Wyszedłem już ze sklepu, kiedy zadzwoniłaś.
english: I'd already left the store when you called me.
glossary: to call sb/a store/to leave a store
translation: 7. I’ ve already left the shop when you called.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Ile osadzonych jest obecnie w tym więzieniu?
english: How many inmates are there currently in the jail?
glossary: a jail; a prison/an inmate/currently
translation: 8. How many inmates are there currently in this prison?

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Wujek by nie utonął, gdyby nagle nie dostał skurczu.
english: My uncle wouldn't have drowned if he hadn't suddenly gotten a cramp.
glossary: to get a cramp/to drown/suddenly/an uncle
translation: 9. The uncle wouldn’t be drown if he hadn’t suddenly had a crump.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Dzięki za skończenie zadania na czas.
english: Thanks for completing the task on time.
glossary: to complete a task
translation: 10. Thanks for finishing the task on time.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Mam nadzieję, że omówimy twoje zachowanie.
english: I hope we'll discuss your behavior.
glossary: to discuss sth/behavior
translation: I hope that we discuss your behavior.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Zajmuję się jutro młodszym bratem. Spotkajmy się w weekend.
english: I'm taking care of my younger brother tomorrow. Let's meet on the weekend.
glossary: to meet sb/on the weekend/to take care of sb/a younger brother
translation: I'm looking after my little brother tomorrow. Let's meet at the weekend.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Są rodzice, którzy pozwalają swoim dzieciom palić.
english: There are parents who let their kids smoke.
glossary: to smoke/a kid/to let sb do sth/a parent
translation: There are parents who allow their children to smoke.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Zrobiłeś wczoraj kopię zapasową plików?
english: Did you back up the files yesterday?
glossary: to back up files
translation: Did you back up your files yesterday?

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Dlaczego powinienem cię posłuchać?
english: Why should I listen to you?
glossary: to listen to sb
translation: Why should I listen to you?

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Będę zmęczona, kiedy skończę pracę.
english: I'll be tired when I finish work.
glossary: to finish work/to be tired
translation: I'll be tired when I finish my work.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Od zbyt dawna udajesz szczęśliwego.
english: You've been pretending to be happy for too long.
glossary: to pretend to be happy/for too long
translation: You've been pretending to be happy for too long.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Byłam pewna, że wyjaśnimy sytuację.
english: I was sure we'd explain the situation.
glossary: to explain the situation
translation: I was sure that we would explain the situation.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Musimy się lepiej poznać.
english: We have to get to know each other better.
glossary: to get to know each other better
translation: We have to get to know each other better.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Mam nadzieję, że będziesz spędzał ze mną więcej czasu.
english: I hope you'll spend more time with me.
glossary: to spend time with sb
translation: I hope that you will spend more time with me.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Nie oblałbym testu na prawo jazdy, gdybym nie próbował wyprzedzać innego auta.
english: I wouldn't have failed the driving test if I hadn't tried to overtake a different car.
glossary: to overtake a car/to fail a driving test
translation: I wouldn't have failed my driving test if I hadn't tried to pass another car.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Będziesz zdrowszy, jeśli rzucisz palenie.
english: You'll be healthier if you quit smoking.
glossary: to quit smoking/to be healthy
translation: You'll be more healthy if you quit smoking.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Jakie są kierunki na tej uczelni?
english: What programs are there at the university?
glossary: a program/at the university
translation: What are the courses/program at this university?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Dzięki za upieczenie ciasta na moją imprezę urodzinową.
english: Thanks for baking the cake for my birthday party.
glossary: to bake a cake/Thanks for sth/a birthday party
translation: Thanks for baking a cake for my birthday party.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Możesz dalej spać. Nie dzwonił jeszcze budzik.
english: You can keep sleeping. The alarm hasn't gone off yet.
glossary: to go off {2}/to keep doing sth
translation: You can sleep further. The alarm clock hasn't gone off yet.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Zaspałem wczoraj do pracy, bo budzik nie zadzwonił.
english: I overslept for work yesterday because the alarm hadn't gone off.
glossary: to go off {2}/to oversleep for work/an alarm
translation: I fell asleep for work yesterday because the alarm clock didn't go off.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Byłbyś w formie, gdybyś zaczął uprawiać jakiś sport.
english: You'd be fit if you took up a sport.
glossary: to be fit; to be in shape/to take up a sport
translation: You would be in a fit state if you started doing some sports.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Kogo zaprosiłaś na ostatnią imprezę?
english: Who did you invite to the last party?
glossary: to invite sb to a party
translation: Who did you invite to the last party?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Rzecznik policji potwierdził, że złodziej został zatrzymany.
english: A police spokesperson confirmed that the thief had been detained.
glossary: a police spokesperson/to confirm sth/a thief/to detain sb
translation: A police spokesman confirmed that the robber has been arrested.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Nad czym pracujesz?
english: What are you working on?
glossary: to work on sth
translation: What are you working on?

name: Peter Kane
polish: Obściskiwałeś się z moją koleżanką. Przyznaj to.
english: You made out with my friend. Admit it.
glossary: to make out with sb/to admit sth
translation: You made out with my friend. Admit it.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Muszę chronić swoje dzieci.
english: I have to protect my kids.
glossary: to protect sb/a kid
translation: I have to protect my children.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Moi znajomi jutro wpadają. Kup piwo.
english: My friends are dropping by tomorrow. Buy beer.
glossary: to drop by/a friend/to buy sth/to drink beer
translation: My friend are dropping by tomorrow. Buy a beer.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Nie powinieneś udawać, że mnie słuchasz.
english: You shouldn't pretend that you're listening to me.
glossary: to pretend/to listen to sb
translation: You shouldn't pretend that you listen to me.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Ja piję dziś wieczorem. Ty prowadzisz.
english: I'm drinking tonight. You're driving.
glossary: to drink alcohol/to drive a car
translation: I'm drinking tonight. You're driving.

name: Peter Kane
polish: W zeszłym roku pracowałem jako stażysta. Dużo się wtedy nauczyłem.
english: I worked as an intern last year. I learned a lot back then.
glossary: to work as an intern/to learn sth/back then
translation: I worked as an intern last year. I learned a lot then.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Nie mogę wejść do pokoju. Jest zamknięty.
english: I can't enter the room. It's locked.
glossary: to be locked/to enter the room
translation: I can't come into the room. I'm locked.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Będę bardziej surowy następnym razem. Obiecuję.
english: I'll be more strict next time. I promise.
glossary: to be strict/next time/to promise sth
translation: I'll be more strict next time. I promise.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Chciałabym pracować jako sędzia w przyszłości.
english: I'd like to work as a judge in the future.
glossary: to work as a judge/a judge/in the future
translation: I'd like to work as a judge in the future.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Nie martw się. Nie wystawię cię.
english: Don't worry. I won't stand you up.
glossary: to worry/to stand sb up
translation: Don't worry. I won't stand up you.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Pobraliśmy już próbki krwi i jesteśmy gotowi, żeby je zbadać.
english: We've already taken blood samples and we're ready to examine them.
glossary: to take blood samples/to examine samples
translation: We’ve already taken blood samples and we are ready to examine them.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Ta sytuacja nie wywarła na mnie żadnego wpływu.
english: The situation didn't have any influence on me.
glossary: to have no influence on sb/a situation
translation: The situation didn’t have any influence on me.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Nie mam dostępu do pliku. Możesz to sprawdzić?
english: I don't have access to the file. Can you check that?
glossary: to have access to a file/to check sth
translation: I don’t have an access to the file. Could you check it?

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Nasz syn nie pobiłby rekordu szkoły, gdyby pan go nie wspierał.
english: Our son wouldn't have beaten the school record if you hadn't supported him.
glossary: to beat the school record/to beat the record/to support sb
translation: Our son wouldn’t have beat the school record if you hadn’t supported him.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Nie miałeś prawa, żeby przeglądać mój telefon.
english: You didn't have the right to look through my phone.
glossary: to have the right to do sth/to look through sb's phone
translation: You didn’t have right to look through my phone.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Włóż zupę do lodówki. Nie chcesz, żeby się popsuła.
english: Put the soup in the fridge. You don't want it to go bad.
glossary: soup/to put sth in the fridge/to go bad
translation: Put soup to the freeze. You don’t want to it go off.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Nie musiałbym teraz zwracać tych butów, gdyby na mnie pasowały.
english: I wouldn't have to return the shoes now if they fit me.
glossary: to return a product/shoes/to fit sb
translation: You wouldn’t return these shoes now if it ……  on me.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Dlaczego włączyłeś wczoraj muzykę, wiedząc, że śpię?
english: Why did you turn on the music yesterday knowing that I was asleep?
glossary: to turn on the music/to know sth/to be asleep
translation: Why did you turn on the music yesterday…….. that I slept?

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Nie zamieniłem wczoraj z rodzicami ani słowa, bo nie miałem czasu.
english: I didn't have a word with my parents yesterday because I didn't have time.
glossary: to have a word with sb/to have time
