glossary: to take care of sth
translation: 9. I thought you would take care of this.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Od godziny robię kolację.
english: I've been making dinner for an hour.
glossary: to make dinner
translation: 10. I’ve been making dinner for an hour.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Co się stało? Byłam pewna, że się pobierzecie.
english: What happened? I was sure you'd get married.
glossary: to happen/to be sure/to get married
translation: What happened ? I was sure you would get married.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Mogłem napisać ten test z angielskiego w zeszłym tygodniu. Teraz nic nie pamiętam.
english: I could've taken the English test last week. I don't remember anything now.
glossary: to take an English test/to remember sth/last week
translation: I should have taken this English test last week. I don't remember anything now.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że żona będzie w dobrym humorze.
english: I hoped my wife would be in a good mood.
glossary: to hope/a wife/to be in a good mood
translation: I was hoping my wife would be in a good mood.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Chciałem powiedzieć Ci prawdę, ale bałem się, że się zdenerwujesz.
english: I wanted to tell you the truth, but I was afraid you'd get mad.
glossary: to tell sb the truth/to be afraid of sth/to get mad
translation: I wanted to tell you the truth, but I was afraid you would be angry.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Mogłam wydawać mniej pieniędzy na ubrania, bo muszę jeszcze zapłacić rachunki.
english: I could've spent less money on clothes because I still have to pay the bills.
glossary: to spend money on clothes/still/to pay the bills
translation: I could spend less money on clothes because I have to pay the bills.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Nie powinieneś był tyle pić na imprezie.
english: You shouldn't have drunk so much at the party.
glossary: to drink/at the party
translation: You shouldn’t drink on a party.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Nie mogę zasnąć. Nie powinienem był pić kawy tak późno.
english: I can't fall asleep. I shouldn't have drunk coffee so late.
glossary: to fall asleep/to drink coffee/late
translation: I can not fall asleep. I shouldn't have taken my coffee to take it late.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Pójdziemy na kawę, jak już będzie ładna pogoda.
english: We'll go for a coffee once the weather is good.
glossary: to go for a coffee/the weather
translation: We'll go for coffee when the weather is nice.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Pójdę spać, jak już skończę czytać książkę.
english: I'll go to sleep once I finish reading the book.
glossary: to go to sleep/to finish doing sth
translation: I'll go to sleep when I'm done reading the book.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Następny weekend spędzam w moim rodzinnym mieście.
english: I'm spending next weekend in my hometown.
glossary: in your hometown/to spend next weekend
translation: Next week I’ll spend in my hometown.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Posprzątam, kiedy wrócę do domu.
english: I'll clean up when I come back home.
glossary: to clean up/to come back home
translation: 1. I will clean up when I come home.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Jestem pewna, że będziesz żałować tej decyzji.
english: I'm sure you'll regret the decision.
glossary: to regret sth/a decision
translation: 2. I’m sure that you will regret this decision.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Od dłuższego czasu mnie unikasz. Widzę to.
english: You've been avoiding me for a long time. I see it.
glossary: to avoid sb
translation: 3. You’ve been avoiding me for some time. I see this.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Jak zapłaciłeś za kurs?
english: How did you pay for the course?
glossary: to pay for a course
translation: 4. How did you pay for this course?

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Obiecaj, że nigdy więcej mnie nie wystawisz.
english: Promise you'll never stand me up again.
glossary: to stand sb up
translation: 5. Promise me you will never again turn on me.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Nie wchodź. W pokoju jest bałagan.
english: Don't enter. There's a mess in the room.
glossary: a mess/to enter the room
translation: 6. Don’t come in. There is mess in the room.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Kiedy ukończyłeś studia?
english: When did you graduate from college?
glossary: to graduate from college
translation: 7. When did you graduate?

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Powinnaś zachęcać dzieciaki, żeby się rozwijały.
english: You should encourage your kids to develop.
glossary: to develop/to encourage sb to do sth
translation: 8. You should make children progress in their skills.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Myślałem, że przejdę w tym roku na emeryturę.
english: I thought I'd retire this year.
glossary: to retire/this year
translation: 9. I thought I would retire this year.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Idziemy dzisiaj wieczorem na imprezę. Szykuj się.
english: We're going to a party tonight. Get ready.
glossary: to get ready/to go to a party
translation: 10. We are going to the party tonight. Get dressed.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Nie odkryłem jeszcze swojego powołania.
english: I haven't found my vocation yet.
glossary: to find your vocation
translation: 1. I haven't found my vocation yet.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Nie musiałbyś teraz płacić za to badanie, gdybyś miał ubezpieczenie.
english: You wouldn't have to pay for the examination now if you had insurance.
glossary: to have insurance/to pay for sth/an examination
translation: 2. You wouldn't have to pay for the examination if you had insurance.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Zauważyłem wczoraj, że sąsiedzi kupili nowy samochód.
english: I noticed yesterday that my neighbors had bought a new car.
glossary: to buy a new car/to notice sth/a neighbor
translation: 3. I noticed yesterday that the neighbors bought a new car.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Do kogo należy ta komórka?
english: Who does the cell belong to?
glossary: to belong to sb/a cell phone
translation: 4. Who owns this cell phone?

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Kiedy postanowiłeś, że będziesz mieszkał za granicą?
english: When did you decide you'd live abroad?
glossary: to decide that.../to live abroad
translation: 5. When did you decide that you would live abroad?

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Mama będzie zła, jeśli nie posprzątam pokoju.
english: My mom will be mad if I don't clean up my room.
glossary: to clean up your room/to be mad at sb/a mom
translation: 6. My mom will be angry if I don't clean my room.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Wyszedłem już ze sklepu, kiedy zadzwoniłaś.
english: I'd already left the store when you called me.
glossary: to call sb/a store/to leave a store
translation: 7. I had already left the store when you called.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Ile osadzonych jest obecnie w tym więzieniu?
english: How many inmates are there currently in the jail?
glossary: a jail; a prison/an inmate/currently
translation: 8. How many inmate are currently in the prison?

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Wujek by nie utonął, gdyby nagle nie dostał skurczu.
english: My uncle wouldn't have drowned if he hadn't suddenly gotten a cramp.
glossary: to get a cramp/to drown/suddenly/an uncle
translation: 9. Uncle wouldn't have drowned if he hadn't suddenly gotten a cramp.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Dzięki za skończenie zadania na czas.
english: Thanks for completing the task on time.
glossary: to complete a task
translation: 10. Thanks for finishing a task for today.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Od godziny rozważasz wszystkie za i przeciw. Zdecyduj się.
english: You've been weighing up all the pros and cons for an hour. Make up your mind.
glossary: to make up your mind/to weigh up the pros and cons
translation: You have been weighing up all the pros and cons since 1 hour. Make a decision.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Zapomniałam już o tobie.
english: I've already gotten over you.
glossary: to get over sb
translation: I got you over already.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Gdybyś założyła tę czarną kieckę, to by uwydatniło co w tobie najlepsze.
english: If you put on the black dress, it would bring out the best in you.
glossary: to bring out the best in sb/to put on a dress
translation: If you put up this black dress, it would bring out the best in you.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Podgrzewałem jedzenie, kiedy wysiadł prąd.
english: I was heating up the food when the power went off.
glossary: to go off {4}/to heat up the food
translation: I was heating up the food when the electricity went off.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Bomba by nie wybuchła, gdyby policja nie schrzaniła roboty.
english: The bomb wouldn't have gone off if the police hadn't screwed up the job.
glossary: to screw up a job/to go off {3}
translation: The bomb wouldn’t have gone off if the police hadn't screwed up the job.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Czy możesz skupić się na wykonywaniu zadania?
english: Can you focus on carrying out the task?
glossary: to carry out a task/to focus on sth
translation: Can you focus on carrying out the task?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Kiedy przezwyciężyłem swój strach, dziewczyna wyszła już z baru.
english: When I got over my fear, the girl had already left the bar.
glossary: to leave the bar/to get over your fear

name: Martin Vance
polish: Przyzwyczaiłem się do sprawdzania słów w słowniku, kiedy pisałem artykły po angielsku.
english: I got used to looking up words in the dictionary when I wrote articles in English.
glossary: to write an article in English/to look up a word in the dictionary/to get used to doing sth

name: Martin Vance
polish: Jeśli dostanę wypłatę na czas, wybiorę droższą opcję.
english: If I get paid on time, I'll go for the more expensive option.
glossary: to go for sth/to get paid/on time
translation: If I get paid on time, I will choose the more expensive option.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Kiedyś chodziłem do łóżka z każdą dziewczyną, którą poznałem, ale się ogarnąłem.
english: I used to hook up with every girl I met, but I got a grip on myself.
glossary: to hook up/to meet sb {2}/to get a grip on yourself
translation: I used to hook up with every girl I met, but I changed.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Profesor stwierdził wtedy, że moje wypracowanie wymaga świeżego spojrzenia.
english: The professor stated back then that my essay called for a fresh look.
glossary: an essay/to call for a fresh look/a professor
translation: The professor claimed then that my essay called for a fresh look.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Klient się mnie pytał, czy wciśniesz go w grafik.
english: A client asked me if you'd fit him in to your schedule.
glossary: to fit sb in to your schedule/a client
translation: The client asked me if you would fit him in to the schedule.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Dlaczego twoja firma chce ograniczyć inwestycje?
english: Why does your company want to cut down on investments?
glossary: to cut back on investments
translation: Why does your company want to cut down back on investments?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Kiedy to słowo wyszło z użytku?
english: When did the word drop out of use?
glossary: to drop out of use
translation: When did this word drop out of use?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Szef chce, żebym przejrzał tę umowę i ją poprawił.
english: My boss wants me to look over the contract and correct it.
glossary: to correct sth/to look over a contract
translation: The boss wants me to look over this contract and correct it.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Nie powinieneś był wymyślać tych historyjek.
english: You shouldn't have made up the stories.
glossary: to make sth up
translation: You shouldn’t have made up those stories.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Twoje dzieciaki nabiorą złych nawyków, zanim sobie zdasz z tego sprawę.
english: Your kids will pick up bad habits before you realize it.
glossary: to pick up bad habits/to realize sth

name: Martin Vance
polish: Czy ty znowu szukasz wymówek?
english: Are you making up excuses again?
glossary: to make up an excuse

name: Martin Vance
polish: Czy wykorzystałeś już wszystkie środki?
english: Have you used up all the resources yet?
glossary: to use up resources

name: Martin Vance
polish: Powiedziałam ci kilka dni temu, że zajmę się tą sprawą.
english: I told you the other day that I'd look into the matter.
glossary: to look into a matter/the other day
translation: I told you a few days ago that I would look into the matter.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Mam nadzięję, że wrócisz do pracy do końca miesiąca.
english: I hope you'll come back to work by the end of the month.
glossary: to come back to work/by the end of the month/I hope that...
translation: 1.	I hope you’ll come back to work by the end of the month.

name: Damien Bean
polish: W pewnym momencie zauważyłam błąd.
english: At some point, I noticed a mistake.
glossary: At some point.../to notice a mistake
translation: 2.	I noticed a mistake at some point.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Muszę dowiedzieć się prawdy.
english: I have to find out the truth.
glossary: to find out the truth
translation: 3.	I have to find out the truth.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Obiecuję, że pójdę jutro do szkoły.
english: I promise I'll go to school tomorrow.
glossary: to promise sth/to go to school
translation: 4.	I promise I’ll go to school tomorrow.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Pójdę na siłownię, kiedy wyzdrowieję.
english: I'll go to the gym when I get better.
glossary: to get better/to go to the gym
translation: 5.	I’ll go to the gym when I get better.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Przeprowadzam się w przyszłym miesiącu.
english: I'm moving next month.
glossary: to move
translation: 6.	I’m moving next month.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Nie mam czasu. Idę jutro do lekarza.
english: I don't have time. I'm going to the doctor tomorrow.
glossary: to go to the doctor
translation: 7.	I don’t have a time. I’m going to the doctor tomorrow.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Byłem wściekły, kiedy żona mnie okłamała.
english: I was furious when my wife lied to me.
glossary: to be furious/to lie to sb
translation: 8.	I was furious when my wife lied to me.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Od roku chodzę na siłownię.
english: I've been going to the gym for a year.
glossary: to go to the gym
translation: 9.	I’ve been going to the gym for a year.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Nie możesz wychodzić z łóżka. Masz grypę.
english: You can't get out of bed. You have the flu.
glossary: to have the flu/to get out of bed
translation: 10.	You can’t get out of bed. You have the flu.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Od czego to zależy?
english: What does it depend on?
glossary: to depend on sth

name: Lucas Doe

glossary: to get a bonus/to meet a deadline

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Czy są jacyś inny ochotnicy?
english: Are there any other volunteers?
glossary: a volunteer

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Zerwałabym z tobą, gdybyś mnie zdradził.
english: I'd break up with you if you cheated on me.
glossary: to cheat on sb/to break up with sb

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Nie mogłem wczoraj spać, bo wypiłem filiżankę kawy przed pójściem do łóżka.
english: I couldn't sleep yesterday because I'd drunk a cup of coffee before going to bed.
glossary: to sleep/to go to bed/to drink a cup of coffee

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Kilka tygodni temu siostra przyznała się, że straciła wszystkie oszczędności.
english: My sister admitted a few weeks ago that she'd lost all her savings.
glossary: to lose your savings/to admit that...

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Kiedy zwróciła pani produkt?
english: When did you return the product?
glossary: to return a product

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Jeszcze nie zabrałem się do pracy.
english: I haven't gotten down to work yet.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Nie spóźniłbym się do pracy, gdybym nie utknął w korku.

glossary: to get stuck in a traffic jam/to be late for work

polish: Myślałem, że zjemy dzisiaj na mieście.
english: I thought we'd eat out today.
glossary: to eat out
translation: 1.I thought we would eat out today.

name: Camille Dew
polish: Obiecałaś, że zrobisz mi dzisiaj włosy.
english: You promised you'd do my hair today.
glossary: to promise sb sth; to promise to sb/to do your hair/today
translation: 2. You promised to do my hair today.

name: Camille Dew
polish: W zeszłym roku mówiłaś, że musisz ograniczyć palenie, ale tego nie zrobiłaś.
english: You said last year that you had to cut down on smoking, but you didn't.
glossary: to cut down on smoking/last year
translation: 3. Last year you said you had to cut out smoking,but you didn’t.

name: Camille Dew
polish: Powiedziałem mamie, że poszedłem do lekarza, bo chciałem ją uspokoić.
english: I told my mom I'd gone to the doctor because I wanted to calm her down.
glossary: to go to the doctor/to calm sb down
translation: 4. I told to my mum that I visited a doctor, because I wanted to calm her down

name: Camille Dew
polish: Myślałem, że będziesz tęsknić za domem.
english: I thought you'd feel homesick.
glossary: to feel homesick
translation: 5.I thought you would miss home

name: Camille Dew
polish: Kiedy byliśmy dziećmi, mój młodszy brat mówił, że patrzę na niego z góry.
english: When we were kids, my younger brother said I looked down on him.
glossary: to look down on sb/a younger brother
translation: 6.When we were kids, my younger brother said that I had looked down on him ( said mówił czy powiedział)

name: Camille Dew
polish: Ostatnim razem, kiedy rozmawiałyśmy, mówiłaś, że potrzebujesz mojej porady.
english: The last time we talked, you said you needed my advice.
glossary: to need sb's advice/The last time we talked.../to say sth
translation: 7.Last time we spoke, you said you needed my help.

name: Camille Dew
polish: Obiecałeś, że zajmiesz się problemem.
english: You promised you'd handle the problem.
glossary: to handle a problem
translation: 8. You promised you would take care of a problem.

name: Camille Dew
polish: Powiedziałam szefowi, że to szkoda, że umniejszył znaczeniu moich wysiłków.

glossary: to play down the significance of sth/It's a shame that.../a boss/an effort
translation: 9. I told my boss that it was such a pity that he had diminished my efforts.

name: Camille Dew
polish: Myślałem, że wpadniesz jutro i napijemy się piwa.
english: I thought you'd drop by tomorrow and we'd drink beer.
glossary: to drop by/to drink beer
translation: 10.I thought you would drop in and we drink a beer tomorrow.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Myślałem, że zjemy dzisiaj na mieście.
english: I thought we'd eat out today.
glossary: to eat out
translation: 1. I thought we would eat out today.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Obiecałaś, że zrobisz mi dzisiaj włosy.
english: You promised you'd do my hair today.
glossary: to promise sb sth; to promise to sb/to do your hair/today
translation: 2. You promised you would do my hair today.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: W zeszłym roku mówiłaś, że musisz ograniczyć palenie, ale tego nie zrobiłaś.

translation: 3. You said last year you had to cut down on smoking but you didn't do it.

polish: Powiedziałem mamie, że poszedłem do lekarza, bo chciałem ją uspokoić.
english: I told my mom I'd gone to the doctor because I wanted to calm her down.
glossary: to go to the doctor/to calm sb down
translation: 4. I told my mother I went to the doctor because I wanted calm her down.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Myślałem, że będziesz tęsknić za domem.
english: I thought you'd feel homesick.
glossary: to feel homesick
translation: 5. I thought you would miss home.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Kiedy byliśmy dziećmi, mój młodszy brat mówił, że patrzę na niego z góry.
english: When we were kids, my younger brother said I looked down on him.
glossary: to look down on sb/a younger brother
translation: 6. When we were children my younger brother was talking I looked down on him.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Ostatnim razem, kiedy rozmawiałyśmy, mówiłaś, że potrzebujesz mojej porady.
english: The last time we talked, you said you needed my advice.
glossary: to need sb's advice/The last time we talked.../to say sth
translation: 7. The last time we talked you told me you needed mine advice.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Obiecałeś, że zajmiesz się problemem.
english: You promised you'd handle the problem.
glossary: to handle a problem
translation: 8. You promised you would take care of the problem.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Powiedziałam szefowi, że to szkoda, że umniejszył znaczeniu moich wysiłków.
english: I told my boss it was a shame he'd played down the significance of my efforts.
glossary: to play down the significance of sth/It's a shame that.../a boss/an effort
translation: 9. I told my boss it was a shame he had played down the significance of my efforts.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Myślałem, że wpadniesz jutro i napijemy się piwa.
english: I thought you'd drop by tomorrow and we'd drink beer.
glossary: to drop by/to drink beer
translation: 10. I thought you would drop by and drink beer tomorrow.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Przepraszam. Musiałem coś pomieszać, kiedy wystawiałem dla pana fakturę.
english: I'm sorry. I must've mixed something up when making out the invoice for you.
glossary: to make out an invoice/to mix sth up/to be sorry

name: Martin Hale
polish: Powinnam była zwrócić się do ciebie o pomoc, kiedy jeszcze nie było za późno.
english: I should've turned to you for help when it wasn't too late yet.
glossary: to turn to sb for help

name: Martin Hale
polish: Kiedy dotarłam na imprezę, koleżanki spytały mnie, dlaczego się nie przebrałam.
english: When I got to the party, my friends asked me why I hadn't dressed up.
glossary: to dress up/to get to a party

name: Martin Hale
polish: Czy ty musisz zagadywać do każdej dziewczyny, którą spotykasz?
english: Do you have to chat up every girl you meet?
glossary: to chat up a girl
translation: 4. Are you having to chat up every girl who you meet?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Chcę, żebyś w końcu przezwyciężył stres i skoncentrował się na projekcie.
english: I want you to finally get over the stress and concentrate on the project.
glossary: to get over a difficulty/to concentrate on sth/to want sb to do sth
translation: 5. I want you…….?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Dlaczego znalazłeś wymówkę, zamiast powiedzieć mi, że jesteś zmęczony?
english: Why did you come up with an excuse instead of telling me you were tired?
glossary: to come up with an excuse/instead of sth/to do sth simply
translation: 6. Why did you come up with an excuse instead of telling me that you are tired?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Kiedy byliśmy dziećmi, mój młodszy brat mówił, że patrzę na niego z góry.
english: When we were kids, my younger brother said I looked down on him.
glossary: to look down on sb/a younger brother
translation: 7. When we were kids my younger brother was saying that I’m looking down on him.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Dlaczego wszystko, co robisz, zawsze wychodzi?
english: Why does everything you do always work out?
glossary: to work out
translation: 8. Why is everything that you are doing always working out?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Wypiłaś już herbatę? Naprawdę musimy się spieszyć.
english: Have you drunk up your tea yet? We really need to hurry up.
glossary: to drink sth up/to hurry up
translation: 9. Did you drink tea? We really have to  hurry up.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Za każdym razem, gdy czuję, że jestem obserwowana, panikuję.
english: Every time I feel that I'm being watched, I freak out.
glossary: to freak out/Every time.../to be watched
translation: 10. Every time when I feel that I’m observed I freak out.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Nie chcę, żebyś na mnie czekał.
english: I don't want you to wait for me.
glossary: to wait for sb
translation: I don’t want you to wait for me.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Chcę, żebyś wiedziała, że mi na tobie zależy.
english: I want you to know that I care about you.
glossary: to know sth/to care about sb
translation: I want you to know I care about you

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Nie chcę, żebyś kiedykolwiek jeszcze rozpowiadała plotki na mój temat.
english: I don't want you to spread rumors about me anymore.
glossary: to spread rumors about sb
translation: I don’t want you to ever spread gossip about me again.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Byłam w szoku, kiedy córka weszła do pokoju, płacząc.
english: I was in shock when my daughter came into the room crying.
glossary: to be in shock/to come into the room/to cry
translation: I was shocked when my daughter entered the room crying.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Gdyby nasza firma nie zwiększyła swojej produktywności w zeszłym kwartale, zbankrutowałaby.
english: If our company hadn't increased its productivity last quarter, it would've gone bankrupt.
glossary: to increase your productivity/last quarter/to go bankrupt
translation: If our comany hadn’t increased its productivity last quarter, it would have gone bankrupt.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Nie miałem wczoraj żadnej przerwy, bo było tyle do zrobienia.
english: I didn't have any break yesterday because there was so much to do.
glossary: to have a break
translation: I didn’t have any break yesterday because there were so much to do.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Rodzice chcą, żebym się wreszcie wyprowadził.
english: My parents want me to finally move out.
glossary: to move out/to finally do sth
translation: My parents want me to finally move out.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Skontaktowałem się jak dotąd z dziesięcioma klientami. Zostało kolejnych dziesięciu.
english: I've contacted ten clients so far. There are another ten left.
glossary: to contact a client/so far
translation: I’ve contacted 10 clients so far. 10 more left.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Udało mi się wczoraj skończyć wszystkie zadania, bo nie miałem żadnych spotkań.
english: I managed to complete all the tasks yesterday because I didn't have any meetings.
glossary: to manage to do sth/to complete a task/to have a meeting
translation: I comleted all tasks yesterday because I didn't have any appointments.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Twój syn miałby lepsze oceny, gdy ciągle nie oglądał bajek.
english: Your son would have better grades if he didn't watch cartoons all the time.
glossary: to have good grades/to watch cartoons/all the time
translation: Your san would have better grades if he doesn't watch stories all the time

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Czy są w tym mieście jakieś miejsca, które powinienem odwiedzić?
english: Are there any places in the city I should visit?
glossary: in the city; in town/to visit a place
translation: 1. Are in this city some places I should visit?

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Gdzie jedziesz w tym roku na wakacje?
english: Where are you going on vacation this year?
glossary: to go on vacation/this year
translation: 2. Where are you going on vacation this year?

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Mamy czas. Nie ma potrzeby się spieszyć.
english: We have time. There's no need to hurry up.
glossary: to have time/a need/to hurry up
translation: 3. We have time. There is no need to hurry.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że wrócę do domu dzisiaj, ale uciekł mi pociąg.
english: I hoped I'd come back home today, but I missed the train.
glossary: to hope/to come back home/today/to miss the train
translation: 4. I had hope, that I got back home today, but I missed my train.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Dlaczego tak zareagowałaś? Możesz mi to wytłumaczyć?
english: Why did you react like that? Can you explain it to me?
glossary: to react to sth/like that/to explain sth to sb
translation: 5. Why did you react this way? Can you explain it to me?

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Mogłeś wcześniej zadzwonić. Powiedziałabym Ci, że nie ma mnie w domu.
english: You could've called before. I would've told you I wasn't at home.
glossary: to be at home/to call sb
translation: 6. You could call earlier. I would say you that I wasn't at home.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Z kim wczoraj rozmawiałeś przez telefon?
english: Who did you talk to on the phone yesterday?
glossary: to talk to sb over the phone
translation: 7. With who did you speak on the phone yesterday?

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Idziemy dziś wieczorem na drinka. Pamiętasz?
english: We're going for a drink tonight. Do you remember?
glossary: to remember/to go for a drink/tonight
translation: 8. We are going for a drink today's evening. Do you remember?

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Obawiam się, że nie dostanę tej pracy.
english: I'm afraid I won't get the job.
glossary: to be afraid of sth/to get a job
translation: 9. I'm afraid I won't get the job.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Z kim chcesz spędzić resztę swojego życia?
english: Who do you want to spend the rest of your life with?
glossary: to spend time with sb/the rest of your life
translation: 10. With who do you want to spend the rest of your life?

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Od wczoraj czytam tę książkę.
english: I've been reading the book since yesterday.
glossary: to read a book/since yesterday
translation: I have been reading this book since yesterday.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Jak możesz być tak naiwny?
english: How can you be so naive?
glossary: to be naive
translation: How can you be so naive?

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Miałam nadzieję, że przemyślisz swoje zachowanie.
english: I hoped you'd think over your behavior.
glossary: to think over your behavior
translation: I hoped that you would rethink your behavior.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Jestem pewien, że skończysz studia.
english: I'm sure you'll graduate from college.
glossary: to graduate from college/to be sure
translation: I'm sure you'll finish your studies.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Kiedy wróciłaś do miasta?
english: When did you get back to town?
glossary: to get back to town
translation: When did you get back to town?

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Mam nadzieję, że mnie nie zarazisz.
english: I hope you won't infect me.
glossary: to infect sb
translation: I hope that you don't infect me.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Powinieneś przeczytać przynajmniej jedną książkę w miesiącu.
english: You should read at least one book a month.
glossary: to read a book/once a month/at least
translation: You should read at least one book a month.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: W moim biurze jest osoba, która naprawia komputery.
english: There's a person in my office who repairs computers.
glossary: to repair a computer/in your office/a person
translation: There is a person in my office who repairs computers.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Twój ojciec gotuje dziś wieczorem.
english: Your dad's cooking tonight.
glossary: to cook/a dad
translation: Your father is cooking tonight.

name: Dorothy Smith
polish: Nauczę się angielskiego, jak już zatrudnię profesjonalnego nauczyciela.
english: I'll learn English once I hire a professional teacher.
glossary: to hire sb/a professional teacher/once {2}
translation: I will learn English when I hire a professional teacher.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Na co się patrzysz?
english: What are you looking at?
glossary: to look at sth
translation: 1. What are you looking for?

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Nudziło mi się wczoraj w pracy, bo nie było nic do roboty.
english: I was bored at work yesterday because there was nothing to do.
glossary: to be bored/at work/to have nothing to do
translation: 2. I was bored at work yesterday because there was nothing to do.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Mogłaś mnie wczoraj odwiedzić, skoro byłaś w mieście.
english: You could've visited me yesterday since you were in town.
glossary: to visit sb/to be in town
translation: 3. You could have visited me yesterday while you were in town.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Obiecałaś, że zrobisz mi dzisiaj włosy.
english: You promised you'd do my hair today.
glossary: to promise sb sth; to promise to sb/to do your hair/today
translation: 4. You promised you would do my hair today.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Z kogo się śmiejesz?
english: Who are you laughing at?
glossary: to laugh at sb
translation: 5. Who are you laughing at?

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Miałam nadzieję, że nie będę miała dzisiaj kaca.
english: I hoped I wouldn't have a hangover today.
glossary: to hope/to have a hangover/today
translation: 6. I hoped I wouldn't have a hangover today.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Nie miałem tego na myśli. Nie powinnaś była brać tego osobiście.
english: I didn't mean it. You shouldn't have taken it personally.
glossary: to mean sth/to take sth personally
translation: 7. I didn't mean it. You shouldn't have taken this personally.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Jestem pewien, że schudnę do lata.
english: I'm sure I'll lose weight by summer.
glossary: to be sure/to lose weight/by summer
translation: 8. I'm sure I will lose weight by summer.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Nie powinniśmy byli się kłócić. To nie miało sensu.
english: We shouldn't have argued. It didn't make sense.
glossary: to argue with sb/to make sense
translation: 9. We shouldn't have argued. This didn't make sense.

name: Martina Ruby
polish: Stresuję się, bo w przyszłym tygodniu jadę za granicę, a nie mówię dobrze po angielsku.
english: I'm stressed out because I'm going abroad next week and I don't speak English well.
glossary: to speak English well/to go abroad/next week
translation: 10. I am stressed because I am going abroad next week and I don't speak English well.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Nie miałbyś teraz problemów, gdybyś nie stracił panowania nad sobą.
english: You wouldn't be in trouble now if you hadn't lost your temper.
glossary: to lose your temper/to be in trouble
translation: 1. You wouldn’t have problems now if you hadn’t lost your temper.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Dlaczego winisz mnie za utratę pracy?
english: Why are you blaming me for losing your job?
glossary: to lose your job
translation: 2. Why do you blame me for loosing my job?

name: Maddie Yates
polish: O czym rozmawialiście, kiedy byłam w łazience?
english: What did you talk about when I was in the bathroom?
glossary: to talk about sth/in the bathroom
translation: 3. What were you talking about wneh I was in the bathroom?

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Niestety mój szef został zwolniony, zanim zdążył mi dać podwyżkę.
english: Unfortunately, my boss had been fired before he managed to give me a pay-raise.
glossary: to give sb a pay-raise/a boss/to be fired/Unfortunately...
translation: 4. Unfortunately my boss was fired before he could give me a payrise.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Nie miałbym nic przeciwko, gdybyś wyraziła swoje zdanie.
english: I wouldn't mind if you expressed your opinion.
glossary: to mind/to express your opinion
translation: 5. I wouldn’t mind if you expressed your opinion.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Jeden z moich pracowników poinformował mnie wczoraj, że trafił do szpitala.
english: One of my employees informed me yesterday that he'd ended up in the hospital.
glossary: to end up in the hospital/to inform sb
translation: 6. One of my employees informed me yesterday that he ended in the hospital.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Czy jest osoba w twoim życiu, na której możesz polegać?
english: Is there a person in your life you can rely on?
glossary: to rely on sb
translation: 7. Is there any person in your life you can rely on?

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Ile produktów jest na magazynie?
english: How many products are there in stock?
glossary: a product/in stock
translation: 8. How many products are in stock?

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Nigdy nie wziąłem łapówki.
english: I've never taken a bribe.
glossary: to take a bribe
translation: 9. I’ve never taken a bribe.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Stracisz prawo jazdy, jeśli będziesz prowadzić po pijaku.
english: You'll lose your driver's license if you drive drunk.
glossary: to lose your driver's license/to drive drunk
translation: 10. You’ll lose your driver’s licence if you drive drunk.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Mam nadzięję, że wrócisz do pracy do końca miesiąca.
english: I hope you'll come back to work by the end of the month.
glossary: to come back to work/by the end of the month/I hope that...
translation: I hope, you'll come back to work by the end of the month.

name: Peter Kane
polish: W pewnym momencie zauważyłam błąd.
english: At some point, I noticed a mistake.
glossary: At some point.../to notice a mistake
translation: I noticed a mistake at some point.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Muszę dowiedzieć się prawdy.
english: I have to find out the truth.
glossary: to find out the truth
translation: I have to find out the truth.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Obiecuję, że pójdę jutro do szkoły.
english: I promise I'll go to school tomorrow.
glossary: to promise sth/to go to school
translation: I promise I'll go to school tommorrow.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Pójdę na siłownię, kiedy wyzdrowieję.
english: I'll go to the gym when I get better.
glossary: to get better/to go to the gym
translation: I'll go to the gym when I feel better.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Przeprowadzam się w przyszłym miesiącu.
english: I'm moving next month.
glossary: to move
translation: I'm moving next month.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Nie mam czasu. Idę jutro do lekarza.
english: I don't have time. I'm going to the doctor tomorrow.
glossary: to go to the doctor
translation: I don't have time. I'm going to the doctor tommorrow.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Byłem wściekły, kiedy żona mnie okłamała.
english: I was furious when my wife lied to me.
glossary: to be furious/to lie to sb
translation: I was furious when my wife lied to me.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Od roku chodzę na siłownię.
english: I've been going to the gym for a year.
glossary: to go to the gym
translation: I've been going to the gym for a year.

name: Peter Kane
polish: Nie możesz wychodzić z łóżka. Masz grypę.
english: You can't get out of bed. You have the flu.
glossary: to have the flu/to get out of bed
translation: You can't get out of bed. You have the flu.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Po tym, jak zrobiłeś zupę, wszyscy rzygaliśmy.
english: After you'd made the soup, we all threw up.
glossary: to make soup/to throw up
translation: 1. We all throwed up after you made a soup

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Czy jest coś, co mogę polepszyć, żeby być bardziej wydajnym, gdy się uczę?
english: Is there anything I can improve to be more efficient while studying?
glossary: to improve sth/to be efficient/to study sth
translation: 2. Is there anything I can improve to be more efficient when I learn?

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Zjadłabym dużo więcej na weselu, gdybym nie przeszła na dietę parę dni wcześniej,
english: I would've eaten much more at the wedding party if I hadn't gone on a diet a couple of days before.
glossary: a wedding party/to go on a diet/a couple of days
translation: 3. I would have eaten so much more if I wouldn't go on a diet couple days earlier

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Mimo że kolega powiedział, że jego pies nie jest niebezpieczny, bałam się go pogłaskać.
english: Even though my friend said his dog wasn't dangerous, I was afraid to pet it.
glossary: even though/a friend/a dangerous dog/to pet a dog
translation: 4. Even though, my friend said his dog wasn't dangerous I was afraid to pet him

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Gdybyś nie był zapominalski, cały zespół nie musiałby teraz pracować.
english: If you weren't forgetful, the whole team wouldn't have to work now.
glossary: to be forgetful/the whole team/to work
translation: 5. If you weren't forgetful the whole team wouldn't have to work right now

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Jeśli nasza firma otworzy nową filię, wszyscy zrobimy się zajęci.
english: If our company opens a new branch, we'll all get busy.
glossary: to open a new branch/a branch/to get busy
translation: 6. If our company opens a new line, we will all get busy

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Dlaczego zaparkowałeś tak daleko od galerii?
english: Why did you park so far away from the mall?
glossary: to park your car/to be far away from sth/a mall
translation: 7. Why did you park so far from the galery?

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Tak szybko jechałem na rowerze, że nie zorientowałem się, że przejechałem znak stop.
english: I was riding a bike so fast that I didn't realize I had run a stop sign.
glossary: to ride a bike/to realize that.../to run a stop sign
translation: 8. I was riding a bike so fast that I didn't realize I run the stop sign

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Widzę, że restauracja ci się nie podoba. Z czym masz problem?
english: I see that you don't like the restaurant. What do you have a problem with?
glossary: to have a problem with sth/a restaurant
translation: 9. I see you don't like the restaurant. What is the problem?

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Powiedziałem mamie, że poszedłem do lekarza, bo chciałem ją uspokoić.
english: I told my mom I'd gone to the doctor because I wanted to calm her down.
glossary: to go to the doctor/to calm sb down
translation: 10. I told my mum I went to the doctor because I wanted to calm her down.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Składając wniosek, pamiętaj, żeby go podpisać.
english: Filing an application, remember to sign it.
glossary: to file an application/to sign an application
translation: When you’re making the application, be sure to sign it.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Czy ma pan odpowiednie umiejętności, żeby wykonywać tę pracę?
english: Do you have the necessary skills to do the job?
glossary: to have the necessary skills/to do a job
translation: Do you have the right skills to do this job?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Zawsze chciałem pracować z ludźmi.
english: I've always wanted to work with people.
glossary: to work with people
translation: I always wanted to work with people.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Gdybyś oszczędzał wodę, zmniejszyłbyś swoje miesięczne rachunki.
english: If you saved water, you'd lower your monthly bills.
glossary: to save water/to lower your bills
translation: If you had saved water, you would decrease your monthly bills.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie możesz dzwonić do mnie w nocy, oczekując, że odbiorę.
english: You can't call me at night expecting that I'll pick up the phone.
glossary: to call sb/at night/to expect sb to do sth
translation: You can’t call me at night expecting to call me up.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie chcę, żeby utrzymywali mnie rodzice.
english: I don't want my parents to provide for me.
glossary: to provide for sb
translation: I don’t want my parents to support me.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Zawsze ci mówiłem, żebyś zaczęła oszczędzać pieniądze.
english: I've always told you to start saving money.
glossary: to save money/to start to do sth; to start doing sth
translation: I always told you you should start to save money.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Moja córka nie zaczęłaby palić, gdyby nie była pod presją rówieśników.
english: My daughter wouldn't have started to smoke if she hadn't been under peer pressure.
glossary: to smoke/to be under peer pressure
translation: My daughter wouldn’t  have started smoking if she hadn’t been under presure peers.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Aplikowałem już na kilka stanowisk, ale nikt jeszcze do mnie nie zadzwonił.
english: I've already applied for a few positions, but no one has called me yet.
glossary: to apply for a position/to call sb
translation: I had applied for several positions before, but nobody called me yet.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Przeczytałem dziś rano wszystkie mejle, pijąc kawę.
english: I read all my emails today, drinking coffee.
glossary: to read emails/to drink coffee
translation: I read all the emails in the morning while drinking coffee.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Nie martw się. Nic nie poszło jeszcze źle.
english: Don't worry. Nothing has gone wrong yet.
glossary: to go wrong/to worry
translation: Don’t worry. Nothing has gone wrong yet.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Nie mamy wystarczająco jedzenia dla wszystkich gości. Musisz iść do sklepu.
english: We don't have enough food for all the guests. You have to go to the store.
glossary: food/a guest/to go to the store
translation: We don’t have enough food for all the guests.  You have to go to the store.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Byłabyś dobrze poinformowana, gdybyś regularnie oglądała wiadomości.
english: You'd be well-informed if you regularly watched the news.
glossary: to be well-informed/to watch the news/to do sth regularly
translation: You would be informed well if you watched the news regularly.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Nie chcę, żeby moi uczniowie ściągali na teście.
english: I don't want my students to cheat on the test.
glossary: to cheat on the test
translation: I don’t want my students to cheat on the test.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Zmarnowałam rok życia, płacząc po ostatnim zerwaniu.
english: I wasted a year of my life crying after the last breakup.
glossary: to waste your time/life/to cry/a breakup
translation: I wasted a year of my life crying after my last breake up.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Na szczęście wujek nie miał udaru. Tylko zemdlał.
english: Fortunately, my uncle didn't have a stroke. He only fainted.
glossary: Fortunately.../an uncle/to have a stroke/to faint
translation: Fortunatelly, my uncel  didn’t have sroke. He only fainted.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Chciałabym, żeby moje dzieci poszły na studia.
english: I'd like my kids to go to college.
glossary: to go to college
translation: I would like my kids to go to college.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Chciałbym, żeby mój szef mi ufał.
english: I'd like my boss to trust me.
glossary: to trust sb/a boss
translation: I would like my boss to trust me.

polish: Twoja firma by się rozwijała, gdyby twoi pracownicy nie byli cały czas bezczynni.

glossary: to thrive/to be idle/all the time
translation: 3. Your business would grow if your employees weren't idle all the time.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Następny weekend spędzam w moim rodzinnym mieście.

glossary: in your hometown/to spend next weekend
translation: 4. Next weekend I spend in my hometown.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Muszę wyjaśnić sytuację.
english: I have to explain the situation.
glossary: to explain the situation
translation: 5. I need to clarify the situation.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Nie będę w stanie pojawić się w weekend, bo pracuję.
english: I won't be able to show up on the weekend because I'm working.
glossary: to show up/to work on the weekend/to be able to do sth

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Ja piję dziś wieczorem. Ty prowadzisz.

glossary: to drink alcohol/to drive a car

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Czy to się często zdarza?

glossary: to happen

name: Michael Stewart

glossary: to go out/to know sb

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Nie powinnaś była składać obietnicy, jeśli wiedziałaś, że jej nie dotrzymasz.

glossary: to make a promise/to keep a promise

name: Michael Stewart
polish: O co prokurator okręgowy chce cię oskarżyć?
english: What does the district attorney want to charge you with?
glossary: a district attorney/to charge sb with sth

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Mój mąż sprawia, że ​​czuję się wyjątkowo. Zawsze upewnia się, że dostaję to, czego chcę.
english: My husband makes me feel special. He always makes sure I get what I want.
glossary: to make sb do sth
translation: 2. My husband makes me feel special. He always makes sure I get what I want.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Z kim wczoraj rozmawiałeś przez telefon?

glossary: to talk to sb over the phone

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Gdzie zostawiłeś kurtkę?
english: Where did you leave your jacket?
glossary: a jacket/to leave sth
translation: 4. Where did you leave your jacket?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Poczułam się rozczarowana, kiedy nowy menedżer powiedział mi, że jest żonaty.
english: I felt disappointed when the new manager told me he was married.
glossary: to feel disappointed/a manager/to be married
translation: 5. I felt disappointed when the new manager told me he was married.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Nie było wczoraj w sklepie żadnego klienta.
english: There was no customer in the store yesterday.
glossary: a customer/in the store

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Mamy nadzieję, że nasz film pomoże społeczeństwu uświadomić sobie problem przemocy domowej.
english: We hope that our movie will help society realize the problem of domestic violence.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to realize sth/domestic violence

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Zbyt dużo pijesz. Pomyśl o swojej rodzinie.
english: You're drinking way too much. Think about your family.
glossary: to drink way too much/to think about your family

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Zrobię pracę domową, jeśli będę miała czas.
english: I'll do my homework if I have time.
glossary: to do your homework/to have time to do sth

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Wszyscy się mnie wczoraj pytali, czy jestem zły. Nie wiem dlaczego.
english: Everybody asked me yesterday if I was mad. I don't know why.
glossary: to be mad at sb
translation: 10. Everyone asked me yesterday if I was angry. I don't know why.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Myślałem, że zjemy dzisiaj na mieście.
english: I thought we'd eat out today.
glossary: to eat out

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Poproszę o podwyżkę, jak już szef będzie z powrotem w biurze.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Musisz spróbować być mniej zazdrosna.

glossary: to be jealous/more or less

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Jestem pewien, że wkrótce wyzdrowiejesz.

glossary: to get better/soon

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Na kogo zawsze głosuje Twoja matka?
english: Who does your mother always vote for?
glossary: to vote for sb

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Obiecuję, że tym razem będę miła dla twojego męża.
english: I promise I'll be nice to your husband this time.
glossary: to be nice to sb/to promise that.../this time/a husband
translation: 6. I promise that this time I will be kind to your husband.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: W zeszłym roku nie pojechałem na wakacje, ponieważ nie miałem pieniędzy.
english: I didn't go on vacation last year because I didn't have any money.
glossary: to go on vacation/to have no money

name: Michael Stewart
polish: W czym specjalizuje się uczelnia?
english: What does the university specialize in?
glossary: to specialize in sth

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Myśłałem, że zawieziesz mnie do domu. Nie chcę brać taksówki.

glossary: to think/to take sb home/to take a cab

name: Michael Stewart

glossary: even though/a friend/a dangerous dog/to pet a dog

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Może nie będę mieć w następnym tygodniu dużo pracy.
english: Maybe I won't have much work next week.
glossary: to have much work/Maybe.../next week
translation: 1. Maybe I won't have a lot of work next week.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Widzę, że restauracja ci się nie podoba. Z czym masz problem?

glossary: to have a problem with sth/a restaurant
translation: 2. I see that you don't like the restaurant. What do you have a problem with?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Jestem pewien, że mnie nie zawiedziesz.
english: I'm sure you won't let me down.
glossary: to let sb down
translation: 3. I am sure that you will not disappoint me.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Dlaczego rzuciłaś angielski?
english: Why did you give up English?
glossary: to give up English

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Miałem naładować komórkę, ale zupełnie zapomniałem.
english: I was supposed to charge my cell phone, but I totally forgot.
glossary: to charge your cell phone
translation: 5. I was supposed to charge my cell phone, but I completely forgot.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Odświężę swój angielski, kiedy będę miał więcej czasu.
english: I'll refresh my English when I have more time.
glossary: to refresh your English/to have more time
translation: 6. I will refresh my English when I have more time.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Nikt nie zmuszał Cię do wybrania tego kursu, więc przestań narzekać.
english: No one made you choose that course, so stop complaining.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to complain about sth
translation: 7. No one forced you to choose this course, so stop complaining.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Zrobię pracę domową, jak już będę mieć dostęp do internetu.
english: I'll do my homework once I have access to the internet.
glossary: to have access to the internet/to do your homework/once {2}
translation: 8. I'll do my homework once I have access to the internet.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Dostaniesz grzywnę, jeśli nie zapłacisz podatku na czas.
english: You'll get a fine if you don't pay your tax on time.
glossary: to pay your tax/to get a fine
translation: 9. You'll get a fine if you do not pay the tax on time.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Od roku chodzę na siłownię.
english: I've been going to the gym for a year.
glossary: to go to the gym
translation: 10. I've been going to the gym for a year.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Dlaczego utrudniasz mi życie? Czy nie powinniśmy sobie pomagać?
english: Why are you making my life harder? Shouldn't we help each other?
glossary: to make sb's life harder/to help each other

name: Yvonne West
polish: Wkurzyłeś mnie rano. Myślałem, że wyrzucę cię z domu.

glossary: to make sb mad/to throw sb out of the house

name: Yvonne West
polish: Moi rodzice zmusili mnie do chodzenia na treningi piłkarskie, kiedy byłem dzieckiem. Dlatego teraz tego nienawidzę.
english: My parents made me go to soccer practice when I was a kid. That's why I hate it now.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to go to soccer practice
translation: My parents forced me to go to soccer practice when I was a kid. That’s why I hate it now.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Jak długo próbujesz usunąć tę plamę? Czy myślisz, że zejdzie?
english: How long have you been trying to remove the stain? Do you think it will come out?
glossary: to remove a stain/to come out
translation: How long have you been trying to remove the stain? Do you think it will

name: Yvonne West
polish: Z czego zazwyczaj śmieje się twoja córka?
english: What does your daughter usually laugh at?
glossary: to laugh at sth
translation: What does your daughter usually laugh at?

name: Yvonne West
polish: Jak rzeczniczka skomentowała incydent?
english: How did the spokeswoman comment on the incident?
glossary: a spokeswoman/to comment on sth/an incident

name: Yvonne West

glossary: to comment on sth/to forget about sth

name: Yvonne West
polish: Jakie środki podjął rząd, aby zapobiec epidemii?

glossary: to take measures to do sth/to prevent sth

name: Yvonne West
polish: Zawsze się lenisz. Zabieraj swój tyłek do pracy!

glossary: to laze around/to get your ass to work
translation: You’re always lazing. Get your ass to work.

polish: Możemy iść na kawę, ale najpierw muszę zrobić pracę domową.
english: We can go for a coffee, but I have to do my homework first.
glossary: to go for a coffee/to do your homework/first
translation: We can to go a coffe, but fist a have to make my homework.

name: Gabriel Ryan
polish: Chcę spędzać więcej czasu z Tobą.
english: I want to spend more time with you.
glossary: to spend time with sb
translation: I want to ...more time with You.

name: Gabriel Ryan
polish: Nie kocham cię już. Musimy się rozwieść.

glossary: to love sb/to get divorced
translation: I don't love you. We have to divorce

name: Gabriel Ryan
polish: Musisz dotrzymać terminu, bo projekt jest ważny.

glossary: to meet a deadline/a project/to be important to sb
translation: You have to deadline term, becauose project is importent.

name: Gabriel Ryan

glossary: to make a mistake/to start from scratch

polish: Musisz zrobić mi kilka zdjęć.
english: You have to take a few pictures of me.
glossary: to take a picture of sb
translation: Yuo have to make me some fotos.

name: Gabriel Ryan
polish: Mamo, chcemy się pobrać w to lato.
english: Mom, we want to get married in summer.
glossary: to get married to sb/in summer
translation: Mom, we want to maried in this summer.

name: Gabriel Ryan
polish: Pozbądź się tego. Musimy zaoszczędzić miejsce.
english: Get rid of it. We have to save space.
glossary: to get rid of sth/to save space
translation: Get rid of it. We need to save a place.

name: Gabriel Ryan
polish: Muszę zapłacić kartą. Nie mam przy sobie gotówki.
english: I have to pay by credit card. I have no cash on me.
glossary: to pay by credit card/to have no cash on you
translation: I have to pay by cart. I don't have cash with me.

name: Gabriel Ryan
polish: Musisz opowiedzieć mi tę historię, kiedy się spotkamy.
english: You have to tell me the story when we meet up.
glossary: to tell sb a story/to meet up
translation: You have to tell me this story, when we will be meet

name: Jack Russell
polish: Nie odkryłem jeszcze swojego powołania.
english: I haven't found my vocation yet.
glossary: to find your vocation
translation: I haven’t found my vocation yet.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Nie musiałbyś teraz płacić za to badanie, gdybyś miał ubezpieczenie.
english: You wouldn't have to pay for the examination now if you had insurance.
glossary: to have insurance/to pay for sth/an examination
translation: You wouldn’t pay now for this examination If you had insurance.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Zauważyłem wczoraj, że sąsiedzi kupili nowy samochód.
english: I noticed yesterday that my neighbors had bought a new car.
glossary: to buy a new car/to notice sth/a neighbor

name: Jack Russell
polish: Do kogo należy ta komórka?
english: Who does the cell belong to?
glossary: to belong to sb/a cell phone

name: Jack Russell
polish: Kiedy postanowiłeś, że będziesz mieszkał za granicą?
english: When did you decide you'd live abroad?
glossary: to decide that.../to live abroad

name: Jack Russell
polish: Mama będzie zła, jeśli nie posprzątam pokoju.
english: My mom will be mad if I don't clean up my room.
glossary: to clean up your room/to be mad at sb/a mom
translation: Mom will be mad If I don’t clean up the room.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Wyszedłem już ze sklepu, kiedy zadzwoniłaś.
english: I'd already left the store when you called me.
glossary: to call sb/a store/to leave a store

name: Jack Russell

english: How many inmates are there currently in the jail?
glossary: a jail; a prison/an inmate/currently

name: Jack Russell
polish: Wujek by nie utonął, gdyby nagle nie dostał skurczu.
english: My uncle wouldn't have drowned if he hadn't suddenly gotten a cramp.
glossary: to get a cramp/to drown/suddenly/an uncle
translation: The uncle wouldn’t have been stuck If he hadn’t gotten a cramp.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Dzięki za skończenie zadania na czas.

glossary: to complete a task

name: Kate Roberts
polish: W jakie przedsięwzięcie powinienem zainwestować?
english: What project should I invest in?
glossary: to invest in a project

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Jakie doświadczenie ostatnie przeprowadziliście?
english: What experiment did you last run?
glossary: to run an experiment

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Jakich ludzi nie lubisz?

glossary: to dislike sb

name: Kate Roberts

name: Kate Roberts

glossary: to consult with sb/a case/to be in an office

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Rozmawiasz przez telefon?
english: Are you talking on the phone?
glossary: to talk on the phone

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Na jakie wykłady chciałbyś uczęszczać?
english: What lectures would you like to attend?
glossary: a lecture/to attend sth

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Jakie zespoły łatwo ci się prowadzi?
english: What teams are easy for you to lead?
glossary: to lead a team
translation: 8. what teams are ….

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Co pieczesz? Ładnie pachnie.
english: What are you baking? It smells nice.
glossary: to bake/to smell
translation: 9. What are baking? It smells nice.

name: Kate Roberts
polish: Twój zespół byłby bardziej efektywny, gdybyś wiedział, jak motywować ludzi.
english: Your team would be more effective if you knew how to motivate people.
glossary: to be efficient/to motivate sb/a team
translation: 10. Your team would be more effective if you knew how to motivate people.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Przebrnę przez całą tę papierkową robotę, jak tylko będę w odpowiednim nastroju.
english: I'll go through all the paperwork once I'm in the right mood.
glossary: to go through paperwork
translation: 1. I’ll go through the whole paperwork once I’m in a good mood.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Kim jest ta dziewczyna, która dziś zastępuje sekretarkę menedżera? Nigdy wcześniej jej nie widziałam.
english: Who's the girl that's covering for the manager's secretary today? I've never seen her before.
glossary: to cover for sb/a secretary/a manager/to see sb
translation: 2. Who is this girl who covers for the manager’s secretary today? I’ve never seen her before.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Wiem, że jesteś bombardowana nowymi informacjami, ale wyluzuj. To nie aż tak skomplikowane.
english: I know you're being bombarded with new information, but chill out. It's not that complicated.
glossary: to chill out/to be bombarded with information/to be complicated
translation: 3. I know that you are bombarded with new information, but chill out. It isn't too complicated.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Powiedziałam szefowi, że to szkoda, że umniejszył znaczeniu moich wysiłków.
english: I told my boss it was a shame he'd played down the significance of my efforts.
glossary: to play down the significance of sth/It's a shame that.../a boss/an effort
translation: 4. I told my boss that it’s a shame that he had played down the significance of  my efforts.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Wiem, że jest późno. Dlatego postaram się zakończyć spotkanie najszybciej, jak to możliwe.
english: I know it's late. That's why I'll try to wrap the meeting up as quickly as possible.
glossary: to wrap up a meeting/to be late/as quickly as possible

name: Martin Hale

english: When I was looking around in the shop, the assistant asked me if I needed help.
glossary: to look around/an assistant/to need help
translation: 6. When I was looking around the shop, the saleswoman asked me if I didn’t need help.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Czy wydrukowałeś wszystkie strony? Myślę, że niektórych brakuje.
english: Did you print all of the pages out? I think some of them are missing.
glossary: to print sth out/a page/to be missing

name: Martin Hale
polish: Nie bądź tak pesymistyczna. Rozważyłaś już wszystkie możliwe opcje?
english: Don't be so pessimistic. Have you weighed up all the possible options yet?
glossary: to weigh up the options/to be pessimistic/an option/to be possible
translation: 8. Don’t be so pessimistic. Did you weigh up all the possible options?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Poczujesz się lepiej po treningu, kiedy się odświeżysz.
english: You'll feel better after the workout when you freshen up.
glossary: to freshen up/to feel better/a workout
translation: 9. You’ll feel better after the practice once you freshen up.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Mimo że mój szef wie, że nie znoszę papierkowej roboty, chce, żebym przeglądała dokumenty.
english: Although my boss knows I hate paperwork, he wants me to go over documents.
glossary: to go over a document/Although.../to hate paperwork
translation: 10. Despite my boss knowing that I don’t stand for paperwork, he wants me to go through that.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Możesz być z siebie dumny.
english: You can be proud of yourself.
glossary: to be proud of sb
translation: 1.	You can be proud of yourself.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Kiedy zdałeś sobie z tego sprawę?
english: When did you realize it?
glossary: to realize sth
translation: 2.	When did you realize it.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Myślę, że założę dzisiaj sukienkę.
english: I think I'll put on a dress today.
glossary: to put on a dress
translation: 3.	I think I’ll wear a dress today.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Odświężę swój angielski, kiedy będę miał więcej czasu.
english: I'll refresh my English when I have more time.
glossary: to refresh your English/to have more time
translation: 4.	I’ll refresh my English when I’ll have more time

name: Damien Bean
polish: Spotykam się dzisiaj ze znajomymi. Nie czekaj.
english: I'm meeting my friends today. Don't wait.
glossary: to meet your friends/to wait for sb
translation: 5.	I’m meeting my friends today. Don’t wait.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Może wpadnę po pracy.
english: Maybe I'll drop by after work.
glossary: to drop by/after work
translation: 6.	Maybe I’ll drop by after work.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Jak możesz mnie okłamywać?
english: How can you lie to me?
glossary: to lie to sb
translation: 7.	How can you lie to me?

name: Damien Bean

name: Maddie Mayer
polish: Nie mogę teraz rozmawiać, bo nie mam czasu.
english: I can't talk now because I don't have time.

translation: 4.	I can’t talk now, because I have no time.

name: Maddie Mayer
polish: Kiedy wyjeżdżasz?

glossary: to leave

name: Maddie Mayer
polish: Mogłem zostać w domu, bo nie ma tu nic do roboty.

glossary: to stay at home/to have nothing to do
translation: 6.	I could stay at home, because there is nothing to do here.

name: Maddie Mayer
polish: Gdzie byłeś? Nie mogłem cię znaleźć.
english: Where were you? I couldn't find you.

name: Maddie Mayer

name: Maddie Mayer
polish: Zawsze ci pomogę, bo jesteś siostrą mojej żony.
english: I'll always help you because you're my wife's sister.
glossary: to help sb
translation: 9.	I will always help you, because you’re my wife’s sister.

name: Maddie Mayer
polish: Byłam pewna, że spędzimy razem więcej czasu.
english: I was sure we'd spend more time together.
glossary: to be sure that.../to spend time with sb
translation: 10.	I was sure that we would spend more time together.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Myślałem, że zjemy dzisiaj na mieście.
english: I thought we'd eat out today.
glossary: to eat out
translation: I thought we would eat out tonight.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Obiecałaś, że zrobisz mi dzisiaj włosy.
english: You promised you'd do my hair today.
glossary: to promise sb sth; to promise to sb/to do your hair/today

name: Chris Mayer
polish: W zeszłym roku mówiłaś, że musisz ograniczyć palenie, ale tego nie zrobiłaś.
english: You said last year that you had to cut down on smoking, but you didn't.
glossary: to cut down on smoking/last year
translation: Last year you said you must reduce smoking, but you did not.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Powiedziałem mamie, że poszedłem do lekarza, bo chciałem ją uspokoić.
english: I told my mom I'd gone to the doctor because I wanted to calm her down.
glossary: to go to the doctor/to calm sb down

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Myślałem, że będziesz tęsknić za domem.

glossary: to feel homesick
translation: I though you would be missing home.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Kiedy byliśmy dziećmi, mój młodszy brat mówił, że patrzę na niego z góry.

glossary: to look down on sb/a younger brother

name: Chris Mayer

glossary: to need sb's advice/The last time we talked.../to say sth

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Obiecałeś, że zajmiesz się problemem.

glossary: to handle a problem

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Powiedziałam szefowi, że to szkoda, że umniejszył znaczeniu moich wysiłków.

glossary: to play down the significance of sth/It's a shame that.../a boss/an effort

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Myślałem, że wpadniesz jutro i napijemy się piwa.

glossary: to talk about sth/in the bathroom

glossary: to mind/to express your opinion

glossary: a product/in stock

name: Jack Russell
polish: Nigdy nie wziąłem łapówki.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Stracisz prawo jazdy, jeśli będziesz prowadzić po pijaku.

glossary: to lose your driver's license/to drive drunk

polish: Czy to ma dla ciebie znaczenie?

glossary: to matter

polish: Dlaczego próbujesz mnie wrobić?

glossary: to try to do sth/to set sb up

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Myślisz, że ci uwierzę?

glossary: to believe sb

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Czy ty myślisz, że ze mną wygrasz?

glossary: to win against sb

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Wkurzyłeś się, kiedy zostałeś zwolniony?

glossary: to get mad/to be fired

name: Isabel Cain

glossary: to eat dinner with sb

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Jest wiele kursów, na które możesz się zapisać.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Przestałem ci ufać, kiedy mnie po raz pierwszy oszukałaś.

glossary: to stop doing sth/to trust sb/to cheat sb/for the first time
translation: 9. I stopped trusting you when you cheated on me for the first time.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Jestem pewien, że mnie nie zawiedziesz.
english: I'm sure you won't let me down.
glossary: to let sb down
translation: 10. I’m sure you won’t let me down.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Na co się patrzysz?
english: What are you looking at?
glossary: to look at sth

name: Eve Miles
polish: Nudziło mi się wczoraj w pracy, bo nie było nic do roboty.
english: I was bored at work yesterday because there was nothing to do.
glossary: to be bored/at work/to have nothing to do
translation: 2. I was bored at work yesterday because there was nothing to do.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Mogłaś mnie wczoraj odwiedzić, skoro byłaś w mieście.

glossary: to visit sb/to be in town
translation: 3. You could’ve visited me yesterday since you were in town.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Obiecałaś, że zrobisz mi dzisiaj włosy.

glossary: to promise sb sth; to promise to sb/to do your hair/today

name: Eve Miles
polish: Z kogo się śmiejesz?

glossary: to laugh at sb

name: Eve Miles
polish: Miałam nadzieję, że nie będę miała dzisiaj kaca.

name: Eve Miles

name: Eve Miles
polish: Powiedziałam szefowi, że to szkoda, że umniejszył znaczeniu moich wysiłków.

polish: Jak długo wątpisz w nasz projekt? Myślałem, że w niego wierzysz.

glossary: to doubt sth/to believe in sth
translation: 10. How long do you doubt our project? I thought you believed in its.

name: Dorothy Smith

english: There are a few people who want to sign up for the course.

translation: There are few people who want to sign up for the course.

translation: 4. Nie kłócilibyście się codziennie, gdyby twój mąż nie był taki uparty. You wouldn”t have an argument with your husband if he weren”t sonsubborn.

translation: 7. Nie wydawałbym pieniędzy na niepotrzebne rzeczy, będąc spłukanym. I wouldn”t spiny money on unnesesery things if I was broke.

polish: Zdecydowałem się już i to się nie zmieni.

polish: Nie chcę, żebyś mi mówił, jak żyć.

glossary: to live/to tell sb sth
translation: 9. Nie chcę, żebyś mi mówił, jak żyć. I don”t want to tell you how you ahould live.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Zasnąłbyś wczoraj bez problemu, gdybyś nie oglądał wcześniej horroru.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie miałem w zeszłym tygodniu rozmowy o pracę, bo rekruter miał grypę.
english: I didn't have the job interview last week because the recruiter had the flu.
glossary: to have a job interview/a recruiter/to have the flu
translation: I wouldn't have a job interview last week because the recruiter had the flu.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie wpadłem jak dotąd na żaden pomysł. Chcesz mi pomóc?
english: I haven't come up with an idea so far. Do you want to help me?
