translation: I couldn’t come up with an idea so far. Do you want to help me?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie kłócilibyście się codziennie, gdyby twój mąż nie był taki uparty.
english: You wouldn't have an argument every day if your husband weren't so stubborn.
glossary: to have an argument/every day/to be stubborn
translation: You wouldn’t argue every day if your husband isn’t so stuborn.

name: Anette Gray
polish: W tym roku daliśmy już trzy koncerty. Następny jest za tydzień.
english: We've already given three concerts this year. The next one is in a week.
glossary: to give a concert/this year/in a week
translation: We gave three concerts this year. The next one in a week.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Robiłem wczoraj pracę domową, popijając drinka.
english: I was doing my homework yesterday, sipping a drink.
glossary: to do your homework/to sip a drink
translation: I was doing my homework yesterday while sipping a drink.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie wydawałbym pieniędzy na niepotrzebne rzeczy, będąc spłukanym.
english: I wouldn't spend money on unnecessary things, being broke.
glossary: to spend money on unnecessary things/to be broke
translation: I wouldn’t spend money on unnessery things being broken.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Zdecydowałem się już i to się nie zmieni.
english: I've already made up my mind and it won't change.
glossary: to make your mind/to change
translation: I’ve decided already and it won’t change.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie chcę, żebyś mi mówił, jak żyć.
english: I don't want you to tell me how to live.
glossary: to live/to tell sb sth
translation: I don’t want you to tell me how to live.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Wygrałem już przedtem podobną sprawę, więc może się pani czuć bezpiecznie.
english: I've already won a similar case before, so you can feel safe.
glossary: to win a case/a similar case/to feel safe
translation: I had won a similar case before so you can feel safe.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Dlaczego utrudniasz mi życie? Czy nie powinniśmy sobie pomagać?
english: Why are you making my life harder? Shouldn't we help each other?
glossary: to make sb's life harder/to help each other
translation: 1. Why are you making my life difficult? Shouldn't we help to each other?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Wkurzyłeś mnie rano. Myślałem, że wyrzucę cię z domu.
english: You made me mad in the morning. I thought I'd throw you out of the house.
glossary: to make sb mad/to throw sb out of the house
translation: 2. You pissed me off this morning. I thought I was kick you out of the house.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Moi rodzice zmusili mnie do chodzenia na treningi piłkarskie, kiedy byłem dzieckiem. Dlatego teraz tego nienawidzę.
english: My parents made me go to soccer practice when I was a kid. That's why I hate it now.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to go to soccer practice
translation: 3. My parents forced me go to soccer training when I was a child. That's why I hate it now.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Jak długo próbujesz usunąć tę plamę? Czy myślisz, że zejdzie?
english: How long have you been trying to remove the stain? Do you think it will come out?
glossary: to remove a stain/to come out
translation: 4. How long have you been trying to remove this stain? Do you think it will come off?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Z czego zazwyczaj śmieje się twoja córka?
english: What does your daughter usually laugh at?
glossary: to laugh at sth
translation: 5. What does your daughter usually laugh at?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Jak rzeczniczka skomentowała incydent?
english: How did the spokeswoman comment on the incident?
glossary: a spokeswoman/to comment on sth/an incident
translation: 6. How did the spokeswoman comment the incident?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Kierownik zmusił mnie do podpisania dokumentów.
english: The director made me sign the documents.
glossary: to make sb do sth/a director
translation: 7. The manager forced me to sign the documents.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Miałeś skomentować mój post. Zapomniałeś?
english: You were supposed to comment on my post. Did you forget?
glossary: to comment on sth/to forget about sth
translation: 8. You were to comment my post. You forgot

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Jakie środki podjął rząd, aby zapobiec epidemii?
english: What measures did the government take to prevent the epidemic?
glossary: to take measures to do sth/to prevent sth
translation: 9. What solutions the government taken to prevent an epidemic?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Zawsze się lenisz. Zabieraj swój tyłek do pracy!
english: You're always lazing around. Get your ass to work!
glossary: to laze around/to get your ass to work
translation: 10. You are always lazy. Get your ass to work!

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Nie przytyłbyś, gdybyś tyle nie jadł.
english: You wouldn't have gained weight if you hadn't eaten so much.
translation: 1. You wouldn't put on weight if you ate so much.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Nie byłabyś w ciąży, gdybyś użyła prezerwatywy.
english: You wouldn't be pregnant if you'd used a condom.
translation: 2. You wouldn't be pregnant if you used a condom.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Wyjdę, jeśli przyjdą wredne dziewczyny.
english: I'll leave if the mean girls arrive.
translation: 3. I will leave if mean girls come.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Gdybyś nie poszedł późno spać, nie byłbyś tak zmęczony.
english: If you hadn't gone to sleep late, you wouldn't be so tired.
translation: 4. If you didn't go to sleep late, you didn't be so tired.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Twoja żona wsparłaby cię wczoraj, gdyby cię kochała.
english: Your wife would've supported you yesterday if she loved you.
translation: 5. Your wife would have support you yesterday if she had loved you.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Jeśli urządzisz przyjęcie, sąsiedzi będą źli.
english: If you throw a party, the neighbors will be upset.
translation: 6. If you have a party, the neighbours will be angry.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Pójdę z tobą, jeśli obiecasz, że dobrze się ubierzesz.
english: I'll go with you if you promise to dress well.
translation: 7. I will go with you if you promise to dress well.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Gdybym był bogaty, kupiłbym drogi samochód.
english: If I were rich, I'd buy an expensive car.
translation: 8. If I were riche, I would boy an expensive car.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Ten piosenkarz byłby sławny, gdyby miał dobrego menedżera.
english: This singer would be famous if he had a good manager.
translation: 9. The singer would be famous if he had a good manager.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Gdybyś nie jechał tak szybko, nie dostałbyś mandatu.
english: If you hadn't been driving so fast, you wouldn't have gotten a ticket.
translation: 10. If you didn't drive so fast, you wouldn't get a ticket.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Mój szef byłby bardziej sympatyczny, gdyby nie był tak pesymistyczny.
english: My boss would be more likable if she weren't so pessimistic.
translation: 1. My boss would be more nice if he wasn't be so pessimistic.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Gdybyś wczoraj tyle nie wypił, nie czułbyś się teraz źle.
english: If you hadn't drunk that much yesterday, you wouldn't feel sick now.
translation: 2. If you hadn't drunk so much yesterday, you wouldn't felling bad now.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Nie spóźniłbym się na pociąg, gdybym wyszedł wcześniej.
english: I wouldn't have missed the train if I'd left earlier.
translation: 3. I wouldn't be late for the train if I went earlier.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Na twoim miejscu nie wybaczyłbym mu.
english: If I were you, I wouldn't have forgiven him.
translation: 4. If I were you, I would forgive him.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Jeśli on nie odbierze telefonu, pojedziemy bez niego.
english: If he doesn't answer his phone, we'll go without him.
translation: 5. If he doesn't pick up the phone, we will go without him.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Nie adoptowałbym psa, gdybym wiedział, że mam alergię.
english: I wouldn't have adopted a dog if I'd known I was allergic.
translation: 6. I wouldn't adopt a dog if I knew that I was allergy.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Gdyby mnie nie zdradzał, nie zerwałabym z nim.
english: If he hadn't cheated on me, I wouldn't have broken up with him.
translation: 7. If he hadn't cheated on me, I wouldn't have broken up with him.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Gdybym był na twoim miejscu, powiedziałbym prawdę.
english: If I were you, I'd tell the truth.
translation: 8. If I were you, I would tell the truth.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Gdybyś mnie rozumiał, nie kłócilibyśmy się teraz.
english: If you understood me, we wouldn't be having this argument now.
translation: 9. If you understand me, we don't arguing now.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Zaprosiłbym ją, gdyby nie była dla mnie taką suką.
english: I would've invited her if she hadn't been such a bitch to me.
translation: 10. I would invite her is she didn't be such a bitch for me.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Mój tata odebrałby mnie wczoraj, gdyby miał samochód.
english: My dad would've picked me up yesterday if he had a car.
translation: 1. My father would pick me up from school yesterday if he had a car.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Czułbym się lepiej, gdybym wypił moją poranną kawę.
english: I'd feel better if I'd drunk my morning coffee.
translation: 2. I would feel better if I had my morning coffee.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Zdałbym egzaminy, gdybym więcej się uczył.
english: I would've passed the exams if I'd studied more.
translation: 3. I would pass the exam if I study more.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Gdybym miał wybierać, wolałbym mieć tylko koty.
english: If I had to choose, I'd prefer to only have cats.
translation: 4. If I had to choose, I would prefer to have only cats.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Ta drużyna miałaby lepsze wyniki, gdyby więcej trenowała.
english: This team would have better results if they'd trained more.
translation: 5. The team would had better results if they trained more.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Gdybym znał prawdę, powiedziałbym ją.
english: If I knew the truth, I would've told it.
translation: 6. If I knew the truth, I would tell it.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Co byś zrobił, gdybyś był niewidzialny?
english: What would you do if you were invisible?
translation: 7. What do you would have done if you had  been invisible?

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Nie byłbym teraz smutny, gdybym nie stracił pieniędzy.
english: I wouldn't be sad now if I hadn't lost my money.
translation: 8. I wouldn't be sad now if I didn't loss money.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Moja mama nie krzyczałaby na mnie, gdybym odrobił lekcje.
english: My mom wouldn't have shouted at me if I had done my homework.
translation: 9. My mother wouldn't shout at me if I did my homework.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Nie pracowałbym teraz w nadgodzinach, gdybym wcześniej skończył swoje zadania.
english: I wouldn't be working overtime now if I had finished my tasks earlier.
translation: 10. I wouldn't work overtime now if I finished my tasks early.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Nie chcę, żebyś na mnie czekał.
english: I don't want you to wait for me.
glossary: to wait for sb
translation: I don’t want you to wait for me.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Chcę, żebyś wiedziała, że mi na tobie zależy.
english: I want you to know that I care about you.
glossary: to know sth/to care about sb
translation: I want you to know that I care about you.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Nie chcę, żebyś kiedykolwiek jeszcze rozpowiadała plotki na mój temat.
english: I don't want you to spread rumors about me anymore.
glossary: to spread rumors about sb
translation: I don’t want you to ever spread rumors about me again.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Byłam w szoku, kiedy córka weszła do pokoju, płacząc.
english: I was in shock when my daughter came into the room crying.
glossary: to be in shock/to come into the room/to cry
translation: I was shocked when my daughter entered the room crying.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Gdyby nasza firma nie zwiększyła swojej produktywności w zeszłym kwartale, zbankrutowałaby.
english: If our company hadn't increased its productivity last quarter, it would've gone bankrupt.
glossary: to increase your productivity/last quarter/to go bankrupt
translation: If our company hadn’t increased its productivity last quarter, it would have gone bankrupt.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Nie miałem wczoraj żadnej przerwy, bo było tyle do zrobienia.
english: I didn't have any break yesterday because there was so much to do.
glossary: to have a break
translation: I didn’t have any break yesterday because there was a lot to do.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Rodzice chcą, żebym się wreszcie wyprowadził.
english: My parents want me to finally move out.
glossary: to move out/to finally do sth
translation: My parents want me to move out finally.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Skontaktowałem się jak dotąd z dziesięcioma klientami. Zostało kolejnych dziesięciu.
english: I've contacted ten clients so far. There are another ten left.
glossary: to contact a client/so far
translation: I have contacted 10 clients so far. There left others 10.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Udało mi się wczoraj skończyć wszystkie zadania, bo nie miałem żadnych spotkań.
english: I managed to complete all the tasks yesterday because I didn't have any meetings.
glossary: to manage to do sth/to complete a task/to have a meeting
translation: I managed to finish all the tasks yesterday because I didn’t have any meetings.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Twój syn miałby lepsze oceny, gdy ciągle nie oglądał bajek.
english: Your son would have better grades if he didn't watch cartoons all the time.
glossary: to have good grades/to watch cartoons/all the time
translation: My son would have better grades if he hadn’t watched cartoons all the time.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Myślałem, że zjemy dzisiaj na mieście.
english: I thought we'd eat out today.
glossary: to eat out
translation: I thought we were going to eat out in town today.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Obiecałaś, że zrobisz mi dzisiaj włosy.
english: You promised you'd do my hair today.
glossary: to promise sb sth; to promise to sb/to do your hair/today
translation: You promised you would do my hair tonight.

name: Paul Baker
polish: W zeszłym roku mówiłaś, że musisz ograniczyć palenie, ale tego nie zrobiłaś.
english: You said last year that you had to cut down on smoking, but you didn't.
glossary: to cut down on smoking/last year
translation: Last year you said you had to cut down on smoking, but you didn't.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Powiedziałem mamie, że poszedłem do lekarza, bo chciałem ją uspokoić.
english: I told my mom I'd gone to the doctor because I wanted to calm her down.
glossary: to go to the doctor/to calm sb down
translation: I told my mother that I went to the doctor because I wanted to calm her down.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Myślałem, że będziesz tęsknić za domem.
english: I thought you'd feel homesick.
glossary: to feel homesick
translation: I thought you were going to miss home.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Kiedy byliśmy dziećmi, mój młodszy brat mówił, że patrzę na niego z góry.
english: When we were kids, my younger brother said I looked down on him.
glossary: to look down on sb/a younger brother
translation: When we were kids, my younger brother said I looked down on him.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Ostatnim razem, kiedy rozmawiałyśmy, mówiłaś, że potrzebujesz mojej porady.
english: The last time we talked, you said you needed my advice.
glossary: to need sb's advice/The last time we talked.../to say sth
translation: Last time we spoke, you said you needed my advice.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Obiecałeś, że zajmiesz się problemem.
english: You promised you'd handle the problem.
glossary: to handle a problem
translation: You promised you would take care of the problem.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Powiedziałam szefowi, że to szkoda, że umniejszył znaczeniu moich wysiłków.
english: I told my boss it was a shame he'd played down the significance of my efforts.
glossary: to play down the significance of sth/It's a shame that.../a boss/an effort
translation: I told my boss it was a shame he had minimized the importance of my efforts.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Myślałem, że wpadniesz jutro i napijemy się piwa.
english: I thought you'd drop by tomorrow and we'd drink beer.
glossary: to drop by/to drink beer
translation: I thought you will come by tomorrow and we have a beer.

english: Your wife would've supported you yesterday if she loved you.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Jeśli urządzisz przyjęcie, sąsiedzi będą źli.
english: If you throw a party, the neighbors will be upset.
translation: If you make a party your neighbors will be angry.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Pójdę z tobą, jeśli obiecasz, że dobrze się ubierzesz.
english: I'll go with you if you promise to dress well.
translation: I’ll go with you if you promise me to dress well.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Gdybym był bogaty, kupiłbym drogi samochód.
english: If I were rich, I'd buy an expensive car.
translation: If I were rich I would buy an expensive car.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Ten piosenkarz byłby sławny, gdyby miał dobrego menedżera.
english: This singer would be famous if he had a good manager.
translation: This singer would be famous if he had a good menager.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Gdybyś nie jechał tak szybko, nie dostałbyś mandatu.
english: If you hadn't been driving so fast, you wouldn't have gotten a ticket.
translation: If you hadn’t driven so fast you wouldn’t have got a ticket.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Mój szef byłby bardziej sympatyczny, gdyby nie był tak pesymistyczny.
english: My boss would be more likable if she weren't so pessimistic.
translation: My boss would be more sympathetic if he weren’t so pessimistic.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Gdybyś wczoraj tyle nie wypił, nie czułbyś się teraz źle.
english: If you hadn't drunk that much yesterday, you wouldn't feel sick now.
translation: If you hadn’t drunk so much yesterday you wouldn’t feel bad now.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Nie spóźniłbym się na pociąg, gdybym wyszedł wcześniej.
english: I wouldn't have missed the train if I'd left earlier.
translation: I wouldn’t been late for a trian if I had left earlier.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Na twoim miejscu nie wybaczyłbym mu.
english: If I were you, I wouldn't have forgiven him.
translation: If I were you I wouldn’t forgive him.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Jeśli on nie odbierze telefonu, pojedziemy bez niego.
english: If he doesn't answer his phone, we'll go without him.
translation: If he doesn’t answer the phone we’ll go without him.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Nie adoptowałbym psa, gdybym wiedział, że mam alergię.
english: I wouldn't have adopted a dog if I'd known I was allergic.
translation: I wouldn’t adopt a dog if I knew I was allergic. .

name: Yvonne West
polish: Gdyby mnie nie zdradzał, nie zerwałabym z nim.
english: If he hadn't cheated on me, I wouldn't have broken up with him.
translation: If she hadn’t cheated on me I wouldn’t have broken up with him.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Gdybym był na twoim miejscu, powiedziałbym prawdę.
english: If I were you, I'd tell the truth.
translation: If I were you I’d tell him the truth.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Gdybyś mnie rozumiał, nie kłócilibyśmy się teraz.
english: If you understood me, we wouldn't be having this argument now.
translation: If you understood me we wouldn’t arguee now.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Zaprosiłbym ją, gdyby nie była dla mnie taką suką.
english: I would've invited her if she hadn't been such a bitch to me.
translation: I’d invited her if she wouldn’t be such a bitch.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Od wczoraj czytam tę książkę.
english: I've been reading the book since yesterday.
glossary: to read a book/since yesterday
translation: 1. I’ve been reading this book since yesterday.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Jak możesz być tak naiwny?
english: How can you be so naive?
glossary: to be naive
translation: 2. How can you be so naive?

name: Anna Forney
polish: Miałam nadzieję, że przemyślisz swoje zachowanie.
english: I hoped you'd think over your behavior.
glossary: to think over your behavior
translation: 3. I was hoping, you would think your behavior over.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Jestem pewien, że skończysz studia.
english: I'm sure you'll graduate from college.
glossary: to graduate from college/to be sure
translation: 4. I’m sure you’ll finish college.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Kiedy wróciłaś do miasta?
english: When did you get back to town?
glossary: to get back to town
translation: 5. When did you come back to town?

name: Anna Forney
polish: Mam nadzieję, że mnie nie zarazisz.
english: I hope you won't infect me.
glossary: to infect sb
translation: 6. I hope, you won’t infect me.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Powinieneś przeczytać przynajmniej jedną książkę w miesiącu.
english: You should read at least one book a month.
glossary: to read a book/once a month/at least
translation: 7. You should read at least one book a month.

name: Anna Forney
polish: W moim biurze jest osoba, która naprawia komputery.
english: There's a person in my office who repairs computers.
glossary: to repair a computer/in your office/a person
translation: 8. There is a person in my office who repairs computers.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Twój ojciec gotuje dziś wieczorem.
english: Your dad's cooking tonight.
glossary: to cook/a dad
translation: 9. Your father is cooking tonight.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Nauczę się angielskiego, jak już zatrudnię profesjonalnego nauczyciela.
english: I'll learn English once I hire a professional teacher.
glossary: to hire sb/a professional teacher/once {2}
translation: 10. I’ll learn English once I hire the professional teacher.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Mój tata odebrałby mnie wczoraj, gdyby miał samochód.
english: My dad would've picked me up yesterday if he had a car.
translation: My father would have picked me up from school if he had a car.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Czułbym się lepiej, gdybym wypił moją poranną kawę.
english: I'd feel better if I'd drunk my morning coffee.
translation: I felt better if I would drink my morning coffee.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Zdałbym egzaminy, gdybym więcej się uczył.
english: I would've passed the exams if I'd studied more.
translation: I’d have passed exams if I had learned more.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Gdybym miał wybierać, wolałbym mieć tylko koty.
english: If I had to choose, I'd prefer to only have cats.
translation: If I had to choose I’d prefer to take only cats.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Ta drużyna miałaby lepsze wyniki, gdyby więcej trenowała.
english: This team would have better results if they'd trained more.
translation: This team would have better results if it had trained more.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Gdybym znał prawdę, powiedziałbym ją.
english: If I knew the truth, I would've told it.
translation: If I knew the truth I’d tell it.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Co byś zrobił, gdybyś był niewidzialny?
english: What would you do if you were invisible?
translation: What would you do if you were invisible?

name: Yvonne West
polish: Nie byłbym teraz smutny, gdybym nie stracił pieniędzy.
english: I wouldn't be sad now if I hadn't lost my money.
translation: I wouldn’t be sad now if I hadn’t lost my money.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Moja mama nie krzyczałaby na mnie, gdybym odrobił lekcje.
english: My mom wouldn't have shouted at me if I had done my homework.
translation: My mother wouldn’t be screaming on me if I had done me homework.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Nie pracowałbym teraz w nadgodzinach, gdybym wcześniej skończył swoje zadania.
english: I wouldn't be working overtime now if I had finished my tasks earlier.
translation: I wouldn’t work overtime time if I had finished my task earlier.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Pojawiłabym się, gdybyś potwierdził wcześniej spotkanie.
english: I would've showed up if you'd confirmed the meeting earlier.
glossary: to show up/to confirm a meeting
translation: 1. I would have showed up if you had confirmed the meeting earlier.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Zaoszczędziłbyś trochę pieniędzy, gdybyś pił kranówkę.
english: You'd save some money if you drank tap water.
glossary: to drink tap water/to save some money
translation: 2. You would save some money if you drunk tap water.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Jakie są opcje?
english: What options are there?
glossary: an option
translation: 3. What are the options?

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Będziesz miał szlaban, jeśli nie wrócisz na czas do domu.
english: You'll be grounded if you don't come back home on time.
glossary: on time/to come back home/to be grounded
translation: 4. You will be grounded if you don’t get home on time.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Kiedy zdałaś sobie sprawę, że zostałaś oszukana?
english: When did you realize you'd been cheated?
glossary: to realize sth/to cheat sb
translation: 5. When did you realize that you had been chetaed?

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Nie zjedliśmy wczoraj kolacji w restauracji, ponieważ mój mąż zapomniał zarezerwować stolik.
english: We didn't have dinner at the restaurant yesterday because my husband had forgotten to book a table.
glossary: to forget to do sth/to book a table/a husband/to eat dinner; to have dinner/at the restaurant
translation: 6. We didn’t eat a dinner at the restaurant yesterday since my husband had forgotten to booked a table.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Dlaczego jeszcze nie zrobiłeś przelewu?
english: Why haven't you made the transfer yet?
glossary: to make a transfer
translation: 7. Why haven’t you made a wire transfer yet?

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Na kogo masz zamiar głosować?
english: Who are you going to vote for?
glossary: to vote for sb/to be going to do sth
translation: 8. Who are you going to vote for?

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Kiedy zgłosił pan zdarzenie?
english: When did you report the incident?
glossary: an incident/to report sth
translation: 9. When did you report the incident?

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Wczoraj marzyłam tylko o zrobieniu sobie drzemki.
english: I only dreamed of taking a nap yesterday.
glossary: to take a nap/to dream of sth
translation: 10. I dreamed only about taking a nap yesterday.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Wynajmowałem mieszkanie z kolegą, zanim kupiłem własny dom.
english: I'd been renting an apartment with a friend before I bought my own house.
glossary: to rent an apartment/your own house/to buy a house
translation: 1. I've rent a flat with my colleague before I bought my own house.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Do kogo się uśmiechasz?
english: Who are you smiling at?
glossary: to smile at sb
translation: 2. Who are you smiling at?

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Jeszcze tego nie przemyślałem.
english: I haven't thought it over yet.
glossary: to think sth over
translation: 3. I haven't thought about it yet.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Może nie byłbyś marudny, gdybyś nie siedział codziennie przed telewizorem.
english: Maybe you wouldn't be moody if you didn't sit in front of the TV every day.
glossary: to be moody/to sit in front of the TV/every day
translation: 4. Maybe you wouldn't have been so grumpy, If you hadn't sit in front of the TV every day.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Żona się pytała, czy zrobię kolację.
english: My wife asked me if I'd make dinner.
glossary: to make dinner
translation: 5. My wife asked me if I would make a dinner.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Rodzice się mnie pytali, czy wziąłem w końcu kredyt.
english: My parents asked me if I'd finally taken out a loan.
glossary: to take out a loan/finally
translation: 6. My parents asked me if I had finally taken a loan.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Gdybyś mnie posłuchał, nie skończyłbyś w szpitalu.
english: If you'd listened to me, you wouldn't have ended up in the hospital.
glossary: to listen to sb/to end up in the hospital
translation: 7. If you had listened to me, you wouldn't have ended up in the hospital.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Dlaczego jest tylu ludzi, którzy żyją w ubóstwie?
english: Why are there so many people who live in poverty?
glossary: to live in poverty
translation: 8. Why are there so many people who live in poverty?

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Kiedy się zaręczyliście?
english: When did you get engaged?
glossary: to get engaged
translation: 9. When did you get engaged?

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Nie wygramy sprawy, jeśli nie będziesz zeznawał.
english: We won't win the case if you don't testify.
glossary: to win a case/to testify
translation: 10. We won't win the case if you don't testify.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Mam nadzieję, że omówimy twoje zachowanie.
english: I hope we'll discuss your behavior.
glossary: to discuss sth/behavior
translation: 1.	I hope we’ll discuss your behavior.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Zajmuję się jutro młodszym bratem. Spotkajmy się w weekend.
english: I'm taking care of my younger brother tomorrow. Let's meet on the weekend.
glossary: to meet sb/on the weekend/to take care of sb/a younger brother
translation: 2.	I’m taking care of my younger brother tomorrow. Let’s meet on the weekend.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Są rodzice, którzy pozwalają swoim dzieciom palić.
english: There are parents who let their kids smoke.
glossary: to smoke/a kid/to let sb do sth/a parent
translation: 3.	There are parents that let their children smoke.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Zrobiłeś wczoraj kopię zapasową plików?
english: Did you back up the files yesterday?
glossary: to back up files
translation: 4.	Did you make backup of the files yesterday?

name: Damien Bean
polish: Dlaczego powinienem cię posłuchać?
english: Why should I listen to you?
glossary: to listen to sb
translation: 5.	Why I should listen to you?

name: Damien Bean
polish: Będę zmęczona, kiedy skończę pracę.
english: I'll be tired when I finish work.
glossary: to finish work/to be tired
translation: 6.	I’ll be tired when I finish work.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Od zbyt dawna udajesz szczęśliwego.
english: You've been pretending to be happy for too long.
glossary: to pretend to be happy/for too long
translation: 7.	You’ve been pretending to be happy for too long.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Byłam pewna, że wyjaśnimy sytuację.
english: I was sure we'd explain the situation.
glossary: to explain the situation
translation: 8.	I was sure we would explain the situation.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Musimy się lepiej poznać.
english: We have to get to know each other better.
glossary: to get to know each other better
translation: 9.	We have to know each other better.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Mam nadzieję, że będziesz spędzał ze mną więcej czasu.
english: I hope you'll spend more time with me.
glossary: to spend time with sb
translation: 10.	I hope you’ll spend more time with me.

name: Gabriel Ryan
polish: Musimy pozbyć się dowodów.
english: We have to get rid of the evidence.
glossary: to get rid of sth/evidence
translation: 1. We need to get …..of proof..

name: Gabriel Ryan
polish: Chciałem wyjaśnić Ci sytuację, ale Ty nie chciałeś mnie słuchać.
english: I wanted to explain the situation to you, but you didn't want to listen to me.
glossary: to explain the situation to sb/to listen to sb
translation: 2. I wanted to explain the situation to you, but you didn't want to listen to me.

name: Gabriel Ryan
polish: Powinieneś założyć kurtkę, bo jest zimno.
english: You should put on a jacket because it's cold.
glossary: to put on a jacket/cold
translation: 3. You  schould wears a jacket because it is cold.

name: Gabriel Ryan
polish: Powinienem zaoszczędzić trochę pieniędzy, jeśli chcę kupić nowy komputer.
english: I should save some money if I want to buy a new computer.
glossary: to save some money/to buy a computer/a new computer
translation: 4. I should …. some money if I want to will buy a new computer.

name: Gabriel Ryan
polish: Nie chcę dzisiaj nic robić. Chcę odpocząć.
english: I want to do nothing today. I want to take a rest.
glossary: to do nothing/today/to take a rest
translation: 5. I don't want to make anything today. I want ...

name: Gabriel Ryan
polish: Chciałem pouczyć się do testu, ale nie mogłem się skupić.
english: I wanted to study for a test, but I couldn't focus.
glossary: to study for a test/to focus on sth
translation: 6. I wanted to study for the test, but …...

name: Gabriel Ryan
polish: Możemy iść na spacer, ale najpierw musimy zjeść obiad.
english: We can go for a walk, but we have to eat lunch first.
glossary: to go for a walk/to eat lunch/first
translation: 7. We can go for a walk, but we must eat lunch first.

name: Gabriel Ryan
polish: Chcę jechać do centrum, żeby spotkać się ze znajomymi.
english: I want to go downtown to meet my friends.
glossary: to go downtown/to meet your friends
translation: 8. I want to go downtown to meet my friends.

name: Gabriel Ryan
polish: Idę dzisiaj na imprezę. Muszę zrobić sobie włosy.
english: I'm going to a party today. I have to do my hair.
glossary: to go to a party/to do your hair/today
translation: 9. I'm going to a party today. I have to make my hair.

name: Gabriel Ryan
polish: Musisz dzisiaj zapłacić rachunki.
english: You have to pay the bills today.
glossary: to pay the bills/today
translation: 10. You have to pay the bills today.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Myślałem, że zjemy dzisiaj na mieście.
english: I thought we'd eat out today.
glossary: to eat out
translation: I thought we go to eat out today.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Obiecałaś, że zrobisz mi dzisiaj włosy.
english: You promised you'd do my hair today.
glossary: to promise sb sth; to promise to sb/to do your hair/today
translation: You promised you would do my hair today.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: W zeszłym roku mówiłaś, że musisz ograniczyć palenie, ale tego nie zrobiłaś.
english: You said last year that you had to cut down on smoking, but you didn't.
glossary: to cut down on smoking/last year
translation: Last year you said you had to cut down on smoking, but you didn't.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Powiedziałem mamie, że poszedłem do lekarza, bo chciałem ją uspokoić.
english: I told my mom I'd gone to the doctor because I wanted to calm her down.
glossary: to go to the doctor/to calm sb down
translation: I told my mother that I went to the doctor because I wanted to calm her down.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Myślałem, że będziesz tęsknić za domem.
english: I thought you'd feel homesick.
glossary: to feel homesick
translation: I thought you would feel homesick.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Kiedy byliśmy dziećmi, mój młodszy brat mówił, że patrzę na niego z góry.
english: When we were kids, my younger brother said I looked down on him.
glossary: to look down on sb/a younger brother
translation: When we were kids my youngest brother were saying that I look down on him.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Ostatnim razem, kiedy rozmawiałyśmy, mówiłaś, że potrzebujesz mojej porady.
english: The last time we talked, you said you needed my advice.
glossary: to need sb's advice/The last time we talked.../to say sth
translation: Last time when we talked you told me that you need my advice

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Obiecałeś, że zajmiesz się problemem.
english: You promised you'd handle the problem.
glossary: to handle a problem
translation: You promised you would take care about the problem.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Powiedziałam szefowi, że to szkoda, że umniejszył znaczeniu moich wysiłków.
english: I told my boss it was a shame he'd played down the significance of my efforts.
glossary: to play down the significance of sth/It's a shame that.../a boss/an effort
translation: I told my boss it was a shame that he had diminished the importance of my efforts.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Myślałem, że wpadniesz jutro i napijemy się piwa.
english: I thought you'd drop by tomorrow and we'd drink beer.
glossary: to drop by/to drink beer
translation: I thought you'd drop by tomorrow and we have a beer.

name: Paul Baker
polish: W zeszłym tygodniu nauczycielka powiedziała, że musimy wydrukować swoje prace.
english: The teacher said last week that we had to print out our assignment.
glossary: an assignment/to print sth out/a teacher
translation: Last week, a teacher said we had to print our papers.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Czy wy uprawialiście wczoraj seks? Wydawało mi się, że was słyszę.
english: Did you have sex yesterday? I thought I heard you.
glossary: to have sex/to hear sb
translation: Did you have sex yesterday? I thought I heard you.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Mimo że kolega powiedział, że jego pies nie jest niebezpieczny, bałam się go pogłaskać.
english: Even though my friend said his dog wasn't dangerous, I was afraid to pet it.
glossary: even though/a friend/a dangerous dog/to pet a dog
translation: Even though my friend said his dog was not dangerous, I was afraid to pet him.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Kiedy się widzieliśmy ostatnim razem, myślałem, że powiesz mi prawdę.
english: The last time we met, I thought you'd tell me the truth.
glossary: to meet sb/finally/to tell the truth
translation: The last time we saw each other, I thought you would tell me the truth.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Gdzie jest dokument, o który cię prosiłem? Powiedziałeś, że go wydrukujesz.
english: Where's the document I asked you for? You said you'd print it out.
glossary: to print sth out/to ask sb for sth/a document
translation: Where is the document I asked for? You said you'd print it.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Poczułam się rozczarowana, kiedy nowy menedżer powiedział mi, że jest żonaty.
english: I felt disappointed when the new manager told me he was married.
glossary: to feel disappointed/a manager/to be married
translation: I felt disappointed when the new manager told me he was married.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Szefowa powiedziała, że przejmę ważny projekt.
english: The boss told me I'd take on an important project.
glossary: to take on a project
translation: The boss said I would take over an important project.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Myślałam, że się tym zajmiesz.
english: I thought you'd take care of it.
glossary: to take care of sth
translation: I thought that you would take care of this.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Mój lekarz rodzinny obiecał, że wciśnie mnie w grafik.
english: My GP promised he'd fit me in to his schedule.
glossary: to fit sb in to your schedule/a GP
translation: My family doctor promised to me that he would put me in his schedule.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Już miałam wychodzić, gdy pojawił się szef i powiedział, że potrzebuje, żebym została godzinę dłużej w pracy.
english: I was about to leave when my boss showed up and said he needed me to stay at work an hour longer.
glossary: to be about to do sth/to leave/to show up/to stay at work longer
translation: I was to leaved when the boss appeared and he said that he needed that I had to stay one more hour at work.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Dlaczego zalegacie z czynszem? Macie problemy finansowe?
english: Why are you falling behind with the rent? Do you have financial problems?
glossary: to fall behind with the rent/to have financial problems
translation: 1. Why are you falling behind with the rent? Do you have financial problems?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Nie chciałbym, żeby mój szef opieprzał mnie, gdy inni są wokół.
english: I wouldn't like my boss to tell me off when others are around.
glossary: a boss/to tell sb off/others/to be around
translation: 2. I wouldn’t that my boss tells me of, when others are around.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Nie mogę się przyzwyczaić do zapinania pasów.
english: I can't get used to fastening up.
glossary: to fasten up
translation: 3. I can't get used to fasten up.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Ostatnim razem, gdy rozmawialiśmy, wspominałeś, że chcesz wstąpić do wojska.
english: The last time we talked, you mentioned you wanted to go into the army.

english: I'll always find time for you because you're important to me.
glossary: to find time for sb/to be important to sb
translation: 8.	I will always find time for you, because you are important to me.

name: Maddie Mayer
polish: Nie mogę się skupić, gdy jest tak głośno.
english: I can't focus when it's so loud.
glossary: to focus on sth/to be loud
translation: 9.	I can't focus, when it is so loud.

name: Maddie Mayer
polish: Gramy jutro mecz. Dołączysz do nas?
english: We're playing a match tomorrow. Will you join us?
glossary: to play a match/to join sb
translation: 10.	We are playing a match tomorrow. Will you join us?

name: Chris Mayer
polish: W zeszłym tygodniu nauczycielka powiedziała, że musimy wydrukować swoje prace.
english: The teacher said last week that we had to print out our assignment.
glossary: an assignment/to print sth out/a teacher
translation: 1. The teacher said last week, we must print our work out.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Czy wy uprawialiście wczoraj seks? Wydawało mi się, że was słyszę.
english: Did you have sex yesterday? I thought I heard you.
glossary: to have sex/to hear sb
translation: 2. Did you have sex yesterday? It thought I heard you.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Mimo że kolega powiedział, że jego pies nie jest niebezpieczny, bałam się go pogłaskać.
english: Even though my friend said his dog wasn't dangerous, I was afraid to pet it.
glossary: even though/a friend/a dangerous dog/to pet a dog
translation: 3. Even though my friend said that his dog was not dangerous, I was afraid to pet him.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Kiedy się widzieliśmy ostatnim razem, myślałem, że powiesz mi prawdę.
english: The last time we met, I thought you'd tell me the truth.
glossary: to meet sb/finally/to tell the truth
translation: 4. When we saw each other last time I thought you told me the truth

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Gdzie jest dokument, o który cię prosiłem? Powiedziałeś, że go wydrukujesz.

glossary: to print sth out/to ask sb for sth/a document
translation: 5. Where is the document, I asked you for? You told you would print it out.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Poczułam się rozczarowana, kiedy nowy menedżer powiedział mi, że jest żonaty.
english: I felt disappointed when the new manager told me he was married.
glossary: to feel disappointed/a manager/to be married
translation: 6. I felt disappointed when my new manager said he was married.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Szefowa powiedziała, że przejmę ważny projekt.
english: The boss told me I'd take on an important project.
glossary: to take on a project
translation: 7. The boss said I would take over an important project.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Myślałam, że się tym zajmiesz.
english: I thought you'd take care of it.
glossary: to take care of sth
translation: 8. I thought you would take care of it.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Mój lekarz rodzinny obiecał, że wciśnie mnie w grafik.

glossary: to fit sb in to your schedule/a GP

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Już miałam wychodzić, gdy pojawił się szef i powiedział, że potrzebuje, żebym została godzinę dłużej w pracy.

glossary: to be about to do sth/to leave/to show up/to stay at work longer

name: Anette Gray
polish: Pobraliśmy już próbki krwi i jesteśmy gotowi, żeby je zbadać.
english: We've already taken blood samples and we're ready to examine them.
glossary: to take blood samples/to examine samples
translation: We already took blood samples, and we are ready to examine them.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Ta sytuacja nie wywarła na mnie żadnego wpływu.
english: The situation didn't have any influence on me.
glossary: to have no influence on sb/a situation
translation: This situation didn't have any impact on me.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie mam dostępu do pliku. Możesz to sprawdzić?

glossary: to have access to a file/to check sth

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nasz syn nie pobiłby rekordu szkoły, gdyby pan go nie wspierał.
english: Our son wouldn't have beaten the school record if you hadn't supported him.
glossary: to beat the school record/to beat the record/to support sb

name: Anette Gray

glossary: soup/to put sth in the fridge/to go bad

glossary: to return a product/shoes/to fit sb

name: Anette Gray
polish: Dlaczego włączyłeś wczoraj muzykę, wiedząc, że śpię?
english: Why did you turn on the music yesterday knowing that I was asleep?
glossary: to turn on the music/to know sth/to be asleep

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie zamieniłem wczoraj z rodzicami ani słowa, bo nie miałem czasu.

name: Anette Gray

glossary: to go for a coffee/to do your homework/first

polish: Nie ma w tym artykule nic interesującego.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Obiecuję, że nie zrobię nic głupiego.

glossary: to be sure/to gain weight/to eat too little

name: Lucas Doe

glossary: to cut down on smoking/last year

glossary: to need sb's advice/The last time we talked.../to say sth

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Powiedziałam szefowi, że to szkoda, że umniejszył znaczeniu moich wysiłków.
english: I told my boss it was a shame he'd played down the significance of my efforts.
glossary: to play down the significance of sth/It's a shame that.../a boss/an effort
translation: I told my boss that it was a shame that he belittled my efforts.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Myślałem, że wpadniesz jutro i napijemy się piwa.
english: I thought you'd drop by tomorrow and we'd drink beer.
glossary: to drop by/to drink beer
translation: I thought you would drop by tomorrow and we would drink beer.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Myślałem, że zjemy dzisiaj na mieście.
english: I thought we'd eat out today.
glossary: to eat out
translation: I thought we’d eat out today.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Obiecałaś, że zrobisz mi dzisiaj włosy.
english: You promised you'd do my hair today.
glossary: to promise sb sth; to promise to sb/to do your hair/today
translation: You promised you’d do my hair today.

name: Yvonne West
polish: W zeszłym roku mówiłaś, że musisz ograniczyć palenie, ale tego nie zrobiłaś.
english: You said last year that you had to cut down on smoking, but you didn't.
glossary: to cut down on smoking/last year
translation: Last year you said you had to cut down on smoking but you didn’t do that.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Powiedziałem mamie, że poszedłem do lekarza, bo chciałem ją uspokoić.
english: I told my mom I'd gone to the doctor because I wanted to calm her down.
glossary: to go to the doctor/to calm sb down
translation: I told my mother I’d gone to the doctor, but I wanted to calm her down.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Myślałem, że będziesz tęsknić za domem.
english: I thought you'd feel homesick.
glossary: to feel homesick
translation: I thought you’d feel homesick.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Kiedy byliśmy dziećmi, mój młodszy brat mówił, że patrzę na niego z góry.
english: When we were kids, my younger brother said I looked down on him.
glossary: to look down on sb/a younger brother
translation: When we were children my younger brother said I looked down on him.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Ostatnim razem, kiedy rozmawiałyśmy, mówiłaś, że potrzebujesz mojej porady.
english: The last time we talked, you said you needed my advice.
glossary: to need sb's advice/The last time we talked.../to say sth
translation: Last time we talked you said you needed my  advice.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Obiecałeś, że zajmiesz się problemem.
english: You promised you'd handle the problem.
glossary: to handle a problem
translation: You promised you take care of the problem.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Powiedziałam szefowi, że to szkoda, że umniejszył znaczeniu moich wysiłków.
english: I told my boss it was a shame he'd played down the significance of my efforts.
glossary: to play down the significance of sth/It's a shame that.../a boss/an effort
translation: I talked my boss it was a shame he’d diminished my efforts.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Myślałem, że wpadniesz jutro i napijemy się piwa.
english: I thought you'd drop by tomorrow and we'd drink beer.
glossary: to drop by/to drink beer
translation: I thought you’d drop by tomorrow and we drink beer.

glossary: to promise sb sth; to promise to sb/to do your hair/today

translation: I thought that you would feel homesick.

name: Agnes Chapman

translation: When we were kids, my older brother told me that I looked at him…..

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Ostatnim razem, kiedy rozmawiałyśmy, mówiłaś, że potrzebujesz mojej porady.
english: The last time we talked, you said you needed my advice.
glossary: to need sb's advice/The last time we talked.../to say sth

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Obiecałeś, że zajmiesz się problemem.

translation: You promised that you would take care of the problem

name: Agnes Chapman

glossary: to play down the significance of sth/It's a shame that.../a boss/an effort

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Myślałem, że wpadniesz jutro i napijemy się piwa.
english: I thought you'd drop by tomorrow and we'd drink beer.
glossary: to drop by/to drink beer
translation: I thought you would come tomorrow and we drink beer.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Nie chcę, żebyś na mnie czekał.
english: I don't want you to wait for me.
glossary: to wait for sb
translation: I don’t want you to wait for me.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Chcę, żebyś wiedziała, że mi na tobie zależy.
english: I want you to know that I care about you.
glossary: to know sth/to care about sb
translation: I want you to know I care about you.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Nie chcę, żebyś kiedykolwiek jeszcze rozpowiadała plotki na mój temat.
english: I don't want you to spread rumors about me anymore.
glossary: to spread rumors about sb
translation: I don’t want you to ever spread rumors about me.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Byłam w szoku, kiedy córka weszła do pokoju, płacząc.
english: I was in shock when my daughter came into the room crying.
glossary: to be in shock/to come into the room/to cry
translation: I was shock when my daughter entered the room crying.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Gdyby nasza firma nie zwiększyła swojej produktywności w zeszłym kwartale, zbankrutowałaby.
english: If our company hadn't increased its productivity last quarter, it would've gone bankrupt.
glossary: to increase your productivity/last quarter/to go bankrupt
translation: If our company hand’t increased its productivity in the last quarter, it would go bankrupt.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Nie miałem wczoraj żadnej przerwy, bo było tyle do zrobienia.
english: I didn't have any break yesterday because there was so much to do.
glossary: to have a break
translation: I didn’t have any breake yesterday because there was a lot to do.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Rodzice chcą, żebym się wreszcie wyprowadził.
english: My parents want me to finally move out.
glossary: to move out/to finally do sth
translation: My parents want me to move out finally.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Skontaktowałem się jak dotąd z dziesięcioma klientami. Zostało kolejnych dziesięciu.
english: I've contacted ten clients so far. There are another ten left.
glossary: to contact a client/so far
translation: I’ve contacted ten clinets so far. There left other 10.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Udało mi się wczoraj skończyć wszystkie zadania, bo nie miałem żadnych spotkań.
english: I managed to complete all the tasks yesterday because I didn't have any meetings.
glossary: to manage to do sth/to complete a task/to have a meeting
translation: I manager to finish all the tasks because I didn’t have any meetings.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Twój syn miałby lepsze oceny, gdy ciągle nie oglądał bajek.
english: Your son would have better grades if he didn't watch cartoons all the time.
glossary: to have good grades/to watch cartoons/all the time
translation: Your son would have better grades if he hadn’t watched cartoons all the time.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Muszę się skupić na szukaniu lepszej pracy.
english: I have to focus on looking for a better job.
glossary: to look for a job/to focus on sth
translation: 1. I have to focus on looking for a better job.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Dostaniesz grzywnę, jeśli nie zapłacisz podatku na czas.
english: You'll get a fine if you don't pay your tax on time.
glossary: to pay your tax/to get a fine
translation: 2. You'll get a fine if you don't pay your taxes on time.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Rzuciłbym pracę, gdybym musiał pracować po godzinach.
english: I'd leave my job if I had to work overtime.
glossary: to leave your job/to work overtime
translation: 3. I would quit my job if I had to work overtime

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Ostatnim razem, kiedy rozmawiałyśmy, mówiłaś, że potrzebujesz mojej porady.
english: The last time we talked, you said you needed my advice.
glossary: to need sb's advice/The last time we talked.../to say sth
translation: 4. Last time we spoke you said you needed the advice.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Kiedy ostatni raz widział pan ofiarę żywą?
english: When was the last time you saw the victim alive?
glossary: to be alive/a victim/to see sb/When was the last time...
translation: 5. When was the last time when you saw a victim alive?

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Policja nie zatrzymałaby cię, gdybyś włączył światła.
english: The police wouldn't have pulled you over if you'd turned on the headlights.
glossary: to turn on the headlights/to pull sb over/the police
translation: 6. The police wouldn't catch you if you turned on the light.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Nie spaliłam jeszcze twoich rzeczy, ale za chwilę to zrobię.
english: I haven't burned your stuff yet, but I'll do it in a moment.
glossary: to burn sth/your stuff/in a moment
translation: 7.I haven't burnt your stuff yet but I'll do it in a moment.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Czy jest możliwość zaparkowania samochodu przed budynkiem?
english: Is there the possibility to park a car in front of the building?
glossary: to park a car/in front of the building/a possibility to do sth
translation: 8. Is there a possibility to park my car in front of the building?

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Dowiedziałem się o tym fakcie po tym, jak się rozstaliśmy.
english: I found out about the fact after we'd broken up.
glossary: to find out about sth/a fact/to break up
translation: 9. I found out about it after we broke up.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Powiedz mi, w czym się specjalizujesz.
english: Tell me what you specialize in.
glossary: to specialize in sth
translation: 10. Tell me what you specialize in.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Od wczoraj czytam tę książkę.
english: I've been reading the book since yesterday.
glossary: to read a book/since yesterday
translation: 1.	I’ve been reading the book since yesterday.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Jak możesz być tak naiwny?
english: How can you be so naive?
glossary: to be naive
translation: 2.	How can you be so naive.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Miałam nadzieję, że przemyślisz swoje zachowanie.
english: I hoped you'd think over your behavior.
glossary: to think over your behavior
translation: 3.	I hoped you would thing over your behavior.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Jestem pewien, że skończysz studia.
english: I'm sure you'll graduate from college.
glossary: to graduate from college/to be sure
translation: 4.	I’m sure that you’ll finish college.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Kiedy wróciłaś do miasta?
english: When did you get back to town?
glossary: to get back to town
translation: 5.	When did you come back to the city.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Mam nadzieję, że mnie nie zarazisz.
english: I hope you won't infect me.
glossary: to infect sb
translation: 6.	I hope you don’t infect me.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Powinieneś przeczytać przynajmniej jedną książkę w miesiącu.
english: You should read at least one book a month.
glossary: to read a book/once a month/at least
translation: 7.	You should read at least one book a month.

name: Damien Bean
polish: W moim biurze jest osoba, która naprawia komputery.
english: There's a person in my office who repairs computers.
glossary: to repair a computer/in your office/a person
translation: 8.	There is a person in my office who repair computers.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Twój ojciec gotuje dziś wieczorem.
english: Your dad's cooking tonight.
glossary: to cook/a dad
translation: 9.	Your father is cooking tonight.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Nauczę się angielskiego, jak już zatrudnię profesjonalnego nauczyciela.
english: I'll learn English once I hire a professional teacher.
glossary: to hire sb/a professional teacher/once {2}
translation: 10.	I’ll learn English once I hire a professional teacher.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Pojawiłabym się, gdybyś potwierdził wcześniej spotkanie.
english: I would've showed up if you'd confirmed the meeting earlier.
glossary: to show up/to confirm a meeting
translation: 1. I’m trying to get away from drinking coffee.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Zaoszczędziłbyś trochę pieniędzy, gdybyś pił kranówkę.
english: You'd save some money if you drank tap water.
glossary: to drink tap water/to save some money
translation: 2. What are you trying to protect me from?

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Jakie są opcje?
english: What options are there?
glossary: an option
translation: 3. If I had bought this furniture a week ago I would have gotten a discount.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Będziesz miał szlaban, jeśli nie wrócisz na czas do domu.
english: You'll be grounded if you don't come back home on time.
glossary: on time/to come back home/to be grounded
translation: 4. I’ve never locked the door until somebody broke my house.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Kiedy zdałaś sobie sprawę, że zostałaś oszukana?
english: When did you realize you'd been cheated?
glossary: to realize sth/to cheat sb
translation: 5. Maybe I would believe you if you had the evidence.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Nie zjedliśmy wczoraj kolacji w restauracji, ponieważ mój mąż zapomniał zarezerwować stolik.
english: We didn't have dinner at the restaurant yesterday because my husband had forgotten to book a table.
glossary: to forget to do sth/to book a table/a husband/to eat dinner; to have dinner/at the restaurant
translation: 6. I noticed yesterday that an employee robbed me.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Dlaczego jeszcze nie zrobiłeś przelewu?
english: Why haven't you made the transfer yet?
glossary: to make a transfer
translation: 7. Why haven’t I got a payraise yet?

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Na kogo masz zamiar głosować?
english: Who are you going to vote for?
glossary: to vote for sb/to be going to do sth
translation: 8. Where did you park your car?

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Kiedy zgłosił pan zdarzenie?
english: When did you report the incident?
glossary: an incident/to report sth
translation: 9. Is there an automated teller machine nearby?

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Wczoraj marzyłam tylko o zrobieniu sobie drzemki.
english: I only dreamed of taking a nap yesterday.
glossary: to take a nap/to dream of sth
translation: 10. You’ll catch a cold if you don’t wear a cap.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Pojawiłabym się, gdybyś potwierdził wcześniej spotkanie.
english: I would've showed up if you'd confirmed the meeting earlier.
glossary: to show up/to confirm a meeting
translation: 1. I would've showed up if you had confirmed the meeting earlier.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Zaoszczędziłbyś trochę pieniędzy, gdybyś pił kranówkę.
english: You'd save some money if you drank tap water.
glossary: to drink tap water/to save some money
translation: 2. You would save some money if you drank tap water.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Jakie są opcje?
english: What options are there?
glossary: an option
translation: 3. What are the options?

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Będziesz miał szlaban, jeśli nie wrócisz na czas do domu.
english: You'll be grounded if you don't come back home on time.
glossary: on time/to come back home/to be grounded
translation: 4. You will be grounded if you don't come back home on time.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Kiedy zdałaś sobie sprawę, że zostałaś oszukana?
english: When did you realize you'd been cheated?
glossary: to realize sth/to cheat sb
translation: 5. When did you realize that you was tricked?

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Nie zjedliśmy wczoraj kolacji w restauracji, ponieważ mój mąż zapomniał zarezerwować stolik.
english: We didn't have dinner at the restaurant yesterday because my husband had forgotten to book a table.
glossary: to forget to do sth/to book a table/a husband/to eat dinner; to have dinner/at the restaurant
translation: 6. We didn't have dinner in the restaurant yesterday because my husband forgot to book a table.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Dlaczego jeszcze nie zrobiłeś przelewu?
english: Why haven't you made the transfer yet?
glossary: to make a transfer
translation: 7. Why haven't you made the transfer yet?

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Na kogo masz zamiar głosować?
english: Who are you going to vote for?
glossary: to vote for sb/to be going to do sth
translation: 8. Who are you going to do vote for?

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Kiedy zgłosił pan zdarzenie?
english: When did you report the incident?
glossary: an incident/to report sth
translation: 9. When did you report the incident?

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Wczoraj marzyłam tylko o zrobieniu sobie drzemki.
english: I only dreamed of taking a nap yesterday.
glossary: to take a nap/to dream of sth
translation: 10. I just dreamed of taking a nap yesterday.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Jest kilka osób, które chcą zapisać się na kurs.
english: There are a few people who want to sign up for the course.
glossary: to sign up for a course
translation: 1. There are a few people who want to sign up for a course.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Napiszę do ciebie, jak już będę mieć wolne.
english: I'll text you once I have a day off.
glossary: to have a day off/to text sb/once {2}
translation: 2. I’ll text you when I have a day off.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Od dawna tu pracuję.
english: I've been working here for a long time.
glossary: to work
translation: 3. I’ve been working here for a long time.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Poprosiłeś rodziców o pomoc?
english: Did you ask your parents for help?
glossary: to ask sb for help
translation: 4. Did you ask your parents for help?

name: Anna Forney
polish: Mogę porozmawiać z odpowiednią osobą, jeśli chcesz.
english: I can talk to the right person if you want.
glossary: to want sth/to talk to sb/the right person
translation: 5. I can talk to the right person if you want.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Wieczorem idę na zakupy. Chcesz coś?
english: I'm going shopping in the evening. Do you want anything?
glossary: to go shopping
translation: 6. I’m going shopping in the evening. Do you want something?

name: Anna Forney
polish: Może nie będę mieć w następnym tygodniu dużo pracy.
english: Maybe I won't have much work next week.
glossary: to have much work/Maybe.../next week
translation: 7. Maybe I won’t have much work next week.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Byłem pewien, że będę zmotywowany do nauki angielskiego.
english: I was sure I'd be motivated to learn English.
glossary: to be sure/to learn English/to be motivated to do sth
translation: 8. I was sure, I would be motivated to learn English.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Dlaczego rzuciłaś angielski?
english: Why did you give up English?
glossary: to give up English
translation: 9. Why did you give up English?

name: Anna Forney
polish: Obiecuję, że podrzucę dzieci jutro do szkoły.
english: I promise I'll drop off the kids at school tomorrow.
glossary: to drop off the kids at school
translation: 10. I promise I’ll drop off  the kids at school tomorrow.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: W zeszłym tygodniu nauczycielka powiedziała, że musimy wydrukować swoje prace.
english: The teacher said last week that we had to print out our assignment.
glossary: an assignment/to print sth out/a teacher
translation: Last week a teacher said that we had to print out our works.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Czy wy uprawialiście wczoraj seks? Wydawało mi się, że was słyszę.
english: Did you have sex yesterday? I thought I heard you.
glossary: to have sex/to hear sb
translation: Did you have sex yesterday? I thought I heard you.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Mimo że kolega powiedział, że jego pies nie jest niebezpieczny, bałam się go pogłaskać.
english: Even though my friend said his dog wasn't dangerous, I was afraid to pet it.
glossary: even though/a friend/a dangerous dog/to pet a dog
translation: Although my friend told me that his dog isn't dangerous I was afraid to pet him.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Kiedy się widzieliśmy ostatnim razem, myślałem, że powiesz mi prawdę.
english: The last time we met, I thought you'd tell me the truth.
glossary: to meet sb/finally/to tell the truth
translation: When we saw each other last time I thought you would tell me the truth.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Gdzie jest dokument, o który cię prosiłem? Powiedziałeś, że go wydrukujesz.
english: Where's the document I asked you for? You said you'd print it out.
glossary: to print sth out/to ask sb for sth/a document
translation: Where is the document that I asked you for? You told me you would print it out.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Poczułam się rozczarowana, kiedy nowy menedżer powiedział mi, że jest żonaty.
english: I felt disappointed when the new manager told me he was married.
glossary: to feel disappointed/a manager/to be married
translation: I was disappointed when the new manager told me he was married.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Szefowa powiedziała, że przejmę ważny projekt.
english: The boss told me I'd take on an important project.
glossary: to take on a project
translation: My boss said I would take over an important project.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Myślałam, że się tym zajmiesz.
english: I thought you'd take care of it.
glossary: to take care of sth
translation: I thought you would take care of it.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Mój lekarz rodzinny obiecał, że wciśnie mnie w grafik.
english: My GP promised he'd fit me in to his schedule.
glossary: to fit sb in to your schedule/a GP
translation: My GP promised me that he would fit me into the schedule.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Już miałam wychodzić, gdy pojawił się szef i powiedział, że potrzebuje, żebym została godzinę dłużej w pracy.
english: I was about to leave when my boss showed up and said he needed me to stay at work an hour longer.
glossary: to be about to do sth/to leave/to show up/to stay at work longer
translation: I was about to leave when my boss showed up and said he needed me to stay an hour longer at work.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Podejmiemy się nowego projektu, jak ten będzie gotowy.
english: We'll take on a new project once the one is ready.
glossary: to take on a project/to be ready
translation: 1. We will take on a new project once it’s ready.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Zauważyłem błąd, kiedy przeglądałem wczoraj dane.

name: Martin Hale

name: Paul Baker

polish: Muszę iść wcześnie spać, bo jutro robię prezentację.

name: Maddie Mayer
polish: Myślałem, że będziesz tęsknić za domem.

name: Maddie Mayer

name: Maddie Mayer

name: Maddie Mayer

name: Maddie Mayer

name: Maddie Mayer

name: Maddie Mayer

glossary: on the weekend/What about.../to take care of sth

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Kiedy ostatnio się widziałyśmy, moja najlepsza przyjaciółka powiedziała mi, że zerwie ze swoim chłopakiem
english: The last time we met, my best friend told me she'd break up with her boyfriend.
glossary: your best friend/to break up with sb/a boyfriend
translation: 1. The last time we met my best friend said she would break up with her boyfriend.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Myśłałem, że zawieziesz mnie do domu. Nie chcę brać taksówki.

name: Chris Mayer

glossary: to play down the significance of sth/It's a shame that.../a boss/an effort

name: Chris Mayer

name: Chris Mayer

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Córka obiecała, że nie będzie panikować, kiedy rozpęta się kolejna burza.

glossary: to break out/to freak out/a daughter

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Powiedziałem ci, że nie będę cię krył.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Powiedziałam ci ostatnim razem, że nie będę cię więcej znosić.

name: Chris Mayer

glossary: to cheat on the test

name: Joanna Day
polish: Muszę dowiedzieć się prawdy.

polish: Przeprowadzam się w przyszłym miesiącu.

name: Joanna Day
polish: Nie mam czasu. Idę jutro do lekarza.

translation: 7. I don”t have time. I will go to doctor tommorow.

polish: Byłem wściekły, kiedy żona mnie okłamała.

translation: 8.  I was angry when my wife lie to me.

name: Joanna Day

name: Joanna Day
polish: Nie możesz wychodzić z łóżka. Masz grypę.
english: You can't get out of bed. You have the flu.
glossary: to have the flu/to get out of bed
translation: 10. You can’t get up in bed. You have a

name: Margaret Usher

english: Weren't we supposed to pay the first installment yesterday?
glossary: to pay an installment

english: Did the solution work out in the long run?

glossary: to have a passion for sth/to stem from sth

glossary: to snore/to consider doing sth/to sleep separately

glossary: to consider sth/a suggestion/to care about sth

glossary: to vote for sb

glossary: to make sb do sth/to cheat on sb

name: John Connell

name: John Connell
polish: Córka obiecała, że nie będzie panikować, kiedy rozpęta się kolejna burza.

name: John Connell
polish: Powiedziałam ci ostatnim razem, że nie będę cię więcej znosić.

translation: 8. I told you last time, that I wouldn’t stand you.

name: John Connell
polish: Powiedziałem ci, że przyprawy uwydatnią smak potrawy.
english: I told you the spices would bring out the flavor of the dish.
glossary: to bring out the flavor/a dish/spices

name: John Connell
polish: Jak długo wątpisz w nasz projekt? Myślałem, że w niego wierzysz.
english: How long have you been doubting our project? I thought you believed in it.
glossary: to doubt sth/to believe in sth

english: How many business partners were there at the meeting last week?
glossary: a participant/a meeting/last week

name: Martin Vance

glossary: to have a weakness for sth

name: Martin Vance

glossary: to have tea/often/a neighbor/to like sb

name: Martin Vance

glossary: to stick to the plan/the initial plan/to get out of control

translation: I don’t understand why you are mad at me.

name: Martin Vance

glossary: to meet sb/finally/to tell the truth

name: Martin Vance

name: Adam Hunt

english: Weren't we supposed to pay the first installment yesterday?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Czy rozwiązanie sprawdziło się na dłuższą metę?
english: Did the solution work out in the long run?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Z czego wynika Twoja pasja do języków?

name: Adam Hunt
