english: I'd never locked the door until someone broke into my house.
glossary: to break into a house/to lock the door
translation: I've never locked the door until someone's broken into my house.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Może bym ci uwierzyła, gdybyś miał dowody.
english: Maybe I'd believe you if you had evidence.
glossary: to have evidence/to believe sb
translation: Maybe I would believe you If you had evidence.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Zauważyłem wczoraj, że pracownik mnie okradł.
english: I noticed yesterday that my employee had robbed me.
glossary: to rob sb/to notice sth
translation: I noticed yesterday that the employee had robbed me.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Dlaczego jeszcze nie dostałem podwyżki?
english: Why haven't I gotten a pay-raise yet?
glossary: to get a pay-raise
translation: Why haven't I got a pay raise yet?

name: Jack Russell
polish: Gdzie zaparkowałeś samochód?
english: Where did you park your car?
glossary: to park a car
translation: Where did you park the car?

name: Jack Russell
polish: Czy w okolicy jest bankomat?
english: Is there an ATM nearby?
glossary: nearby/an ATM
translation: Is there an ATM in this area?

name: Jack Russell
polish: Przeziębisz się, jeśli nie założysz czapki.
english: You'll catch a cold if you don't put on a cap.
glossary: to put on a cap/to catch a cold
translation: You’ll catch a cold if you don’t put on the heat.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Jest kilka osób, które chcą zapisać się na kurs.
english: There are a few people who want to sign up for the course.
glossary: to sign up for a course
translation: 1.	There are a few people that they want to sign up for a course.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Napiszę do ciebie, jak już będę mieć wolne.
english: I'll text you once I have a day off.
glossary: to have a day off/to text sb/once {2}
translation: 2.	I’ll write you once I’m off.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Od dawna tu pracuję.
english: I've been working here for a long time.
glossary: to work
translation: 3.	I’ve been working here for a long time.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Poprosiłeś rodziców o pomoc?
english: Did you ask your parents for help?
glossary: to ask sb for help
translation: 4.	Did you ask your parents for help?

name: Damien Bean
polish: Mogę porozmawiać z odpowiednią osobą, jeśli chcesz.
english: I can talk to the right person if you want.
glossary: to want sth/to talk to sb/the right person
translation: 5.	I can talk to the right person if you want.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Wieczorem idę na zakupy. Chcesz coś?
english: I'm going shopping in the evening. Do you want anything?
glossary: to go shopping
translation: 6.	I’m going shopping in the evening. Do you want something?

name: Damien Bean
polish: Może nie będę mieć w następnym tygodniu dużo pracy.
english: Maybe I won't have much work next week.
glossary: to have much work/Maybe.../next week
translation: 7.	Maybe I won’t have a lot of work next week.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Byłem pewien, że będę zmotywowany do nauki angielskiego.
english: I was sure I'd be motivated to learn English.
glossary: to be sure/to learn English/to be motivated to do sth
translation: 8.	I was sure that I would be motivated to learn English.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Dlaczego rzuciłaś angielski?
english: Why did you give up English?
glossary: to give up English
translation: 9.	Why did you give up English?

name: Damien Bean
polish: Obiecuję, że podrzucę dzieci jutro do szkoły.
english: I promise I'll drop off the kids at school tomorrow.
glossary: to drop off the kids at school
translation: 10.	I promise I’ll drop off the kids at school tomorrow.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Nie przytyłbyś, gdybyś tyle nie jadł.
english: You wouldn't have gained weight if you hadn't eaten so much.
translation: You wouldn't lose weight if you hadn't eaten so much.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Nie byłabyś w ciąży, gdybyś użyła prezerwatywy.
english: You wouldn't be pregnant if you'd used a condom.
translation: You wouldn't be pregnant if you had use preservatives.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Wyjdę, jeśli przyjdą wredne dziewczyny.
english: I'll leave if the mean girls arrive.
translation: I'll leave if mean girls come.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Gdybyś nie poszedł późno spać, nie byłbyś tak zmęczony.
english: If you hadn't gone to sleep late, you wouldn't be so tired.
translation: If you hadn't gone sleep late, you wouldn't be so tired.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Twoja żona wsparłaby cię wczoraj, gdyby cię kochała.
english: Your wife would've supported you yesterday if she loved you.
translation: Your wife would support you yesterday if she loved you.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Jeśli urządzisz przyjęcie, sąsiedzi będą źli.
english: If you throw a party, the neighbors will be upset.
translation: If you throw a party, the neighbors will be angry.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Pójdę z tobą, jeśli obiecasz, że dobrze się ubierzesz.
english: I'll go with you if you promise to dress well.
translation: I'll go with you if you promise me you will dress up nice.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Gdybym był bogaty, kupiłbym drogi samochód.
english: If I were rich, I'd buy an expensive car.
translation: If I were rich, I would buy an expensive car.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Ten piosenkarz byłby sławny, gdyby miał dobrego menedżera.
english: This singer would be famous if he had a good manager.
translation: The singer would be famous if he had a good manager.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Gdybyś nie jechał tak szybko, nie dostałbyś mandatu.
english: If you hadn't been driving so fast, you wouldn't have gotten a ticket.
translation: If you hadn't driven so fast, you wouldn't have gotten a fine.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Mój szef byłby bardziej sympatyczny, gdyby nie był tak pesymistyczny.
english: My boss would be more likable if she weren't so pessimistic.
translation: My boss would be more symphatic if he wasn't be so pesimistic.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Gdybyś wczoraj tyle nie wypił, nie czułbyś się teraz źle.
english: If you hadn't drunk that much yesterday, you wouldn't feel sick now.
translation: If you didn't drink so much yesterday, you wouldn't feel bad now.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Nie spóźniłbym się na pociąg, gdybym wyszedł wcześniej.
english: I wouldn't have missed the train if I'd left earlier.
translation: I wouldn't have missed the train if I had left earlier.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Na twoim miejscu nie wybaczyłbym mu.
english: If I were you, I wouldn't have forgiven him.
translation: If I were you, I didn't forgive him.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Jeśli on nie odbierze telefonu, pojedziemy bez niego.
english: If he doesn't answer his phone, we'll go without him.
translation: If he don't pick up the phone, we'll go out without him.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Nie adoptowałbym psa, gdybym wiedział, że mam alergię.
english: I wouldn't have adopted a dog if I'd known I was allergic.
translation: I wouldn't have adopted a dog if I had known I had an allergy.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Gdyby mnie nie zdradzał, nie zerwałabym z nim.
english: If he hadn't cheated on me, I wouldn't have broken up with him.
translation: If you hadn't cheated on me, I wouldn't have broken up with you.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Gdybym był na twoim miejscu, powiedziałbym prawdę.
english: If I were you, I'd tell the truth.
translation: If I were you, I'd tell the truth.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Gdybyś mnie rozumiał, nie kłócilibyśmy się teraz.
english: If you understood me, we wouldn't be having this argument now.
translation: If you understood me, we wouldn't have an argument now.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Zaprosiłbym ją, gdyby nie była dla mnie taką suką.
english: I would've invited her if she hadn't been such a bitch to me.
translation: I would've invite her if she hadn't been such a bitch to me.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Mój tata odebrałby mnie wczoraj, gdyby miał samochód.
english: My dad would've picked me up yesterday if he had a car.
translation: My dad would have picked me up if he had had a car.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Czułbym się lepiej, gdybym wypił moją poranną kawę.
english: I'd feel better if I'd drunk my morning coffee.
translation: I'd feel better if I had drank my morning coffee.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Zdałbym egzaminy, gdybym więcej się uczył.
english: I would've passed the exams if I'd studied more.
translation: I would've passed the exams if I had studied more.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Gdybym miał wybierać, wolałbym mieć tylko koty.
english: If I had to choose, I'd prefer to only have cats.
translation: If I had to choose, I'd prefer to have cats only.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Ta drużyna miałaby lepsze wyniki, gdyby więcej trenowała.
english: This team would have better results if they'd trained more.
translation: The team would've the better score if he had trained more.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Gdybym znał prawdę, powiedziałbym ją.
english: If I knew the truth, I would've told it.
translation: If I had known the truth, I would've told it.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Co byś zrobił, gdybyś był niewidzialny?
english: What would you do if you were invisible?
translation: what would you do if you were unvisible?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Nie byłbym teraz smutny, gdybym nie stracił pieniędzy.
english: I wouldn't be sad now if I hadn't lost my money.
translation: I wouldn't be sad now if I hadn't lost my money.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Moja mama nie krzyczałaby na mnie, gdybym odrobił lekcje.
english: My mom wouldn't have shouted at me if I had done my homework.
translation: My mom wouldn't shout at me now if I had done my homework.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Nie pracowałbym teraz w nadgodzinach, gdybym wcześniej skończył swoje zadania.
english: I wouldn't be working overtime now if I had finished my tasks earlier.
translation: I wouldn't worked overtime now if I had finished my tasks earlier.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: W zeszłym tygodniu nauczycielka powiedziała, że musimy wydrukować swoje prace.
english: The teacher said last week that we had to print out our assignment.
glossary: an assignment/to print sth out/a teacher
translation: The teacher said last week that we had to print our homeworks.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Czy wy uprawialiście wczoraj seks? Wydawało mi się, że was słyszę.
english: Did you have sex yesterday? I thought I heard you.
glossary: to have sex/to hear sb
translation: Did you have sex yesterday? I thought I hear you.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Mimo że kolega powiedział, że jego pies nie jest niebezpieczny, bałam się go pogłaskać.
english: Even though my friend said his dog wasn't dangerous, I was afraid to pet it.
glossary: even though/a friend/a dangerous dog/to pet a dog
translation: Even though my friend said his dog wasn’t dangerous, I was afraid to pet him.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Kiedy się widzieliśmy ostatnim razem, myślałem, że powiesz mi prawdę.
english: The last time we met, I thought you'd tell me the truth.
glossary: to meet sb/finally/to tell the truth
translation: When we met last time, I thought you told me the truth.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Gdzie jest dokument, o który cię prosiłem? Powiedziałeś, że go wydrukujesz.
english: Where's the document I asked you for? You said you'd print it out.
glossary: to print sth out/to ask sb for sth/a document
translation: Where is the document I asked you for? You said that you printed it.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Poczułam się rozczarowana, kiedy nowy menedżer powiedział mi, że jest żonaty.
english: I felt disappointed when the new manager told me he was married.
glossary: to feel disappointed/a manager/to be married
translation: I felt disappointed when new teacher told me that he was married

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Szefowa powiedziała, że przejmę ważny projekt.
english: The boss told me I'd take on an important project.
glossary: to take on a project
translation: My boss said that I took an important project.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Myślałam, że się tym zajmiesz.
english: I thought you'd take care of it.
glossary: to take care of sth
translation: I thought that you would take care of it.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Mój lekarz rodzinny obiecał, że wciśnie mnie w grafik.
english: My GP promised he'd fit me in to his schedule.
glossary: to fit sb in to your schedule/a GP
translation: My ….. doctor promised that ……………..

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Już miałam wychodzić, gdy pojawił się szef i powiedział, że potrzebuje, żebym została godzinę dłużej w pracy.
english: I was about to leave when my boss showed up and said he needed me to stay at work an hour longer.
glossary: to be about to do sth/to leave/to show up/to stay at work longer
translation: I was about to leave when the boss appeared and said that I needed to stay an hour longer at work.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Miałem w zeszłym tygodniu dużo pracy i bałem się, że nie wyrobię się z terminem.
english: I had a lot of work last week and I was afraid I wouldn't meet the deadline.
glossary: to have a lot of work/last week/to be afraid of sth/to meet the deadline
translation: 1. I had a lot of work last week and I was afraid I wouldn't meet a deadline.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Nie powinieneś był wspominać o naszych problemach na spotkaniu z szefem.
english: You shouldn't have mentioned our problems at the meeting with the boss.
glossary: at the meeting/to mention sth
translation: 2. You shouldn't have mentioned our problems at the meeting with your boss.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Przyjeżdżam jutro do Warszawy i zatrzymuję się u mojej koleżanki.
english: I'm coming to Warsaw tomorrow and staying at my friend's.
glossary: to come to Warsaw
translation: 3. I'm coming Warsaw tomorrow and I'm going to stay at my friend.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Nie powinieneś był opowiadać tego żartu. Był niegrzeczny.
english: You shouldn't have told the joke. It was rude.
glossary: to be rude to sb/to tell sb a joke
translation: 4. You shouldn't have told the joke. It was rude.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że nic nie będę musiał dzisiaj robić.
english: I hoped I wouldn't have to do anything today.
glossary: to hope/today
translation: 5. I hoped I wouldn't have to do anything today.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Powinienem był spędzić zeszły weekend z rodziną.
english: I should've spent my last weekend with my family.
glossary: to spend time with sb/last weekend/a family
translation: 6. I should've spent last weekend with my family.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Nie powinienem był Ci opowiadać tej historii, bo jest zbyt prywatna.
english: I shouldn't have told you the story because it's too private.
glossary: to tell sb a story/to be private
translation: 7. I shouldn't have told you the story because it's too private.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że ci klienci zostawią większy napiwek.
english: I hoped the customers would leave a bigger tip.
glossary: to leave a tip/a customer/to hope
translation: 8. I hoped the clients would leave a bigger tip.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Nie powinieneś był mnie okłamywać.
english: You shouldn't have lied to me.
glossary: to lie to sb
translation: 9. You shouldn't have lied to me.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Co robisz dziś wieczorem?
english: What are you doing tonight?
translation: 10. What are you going to do tonight?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Nasz zespół wygrał jak dotąd jedną nagrodę, ale pracujemy nad tym.
english: Our team has won one prize so far, but we're working on it.
glossary: to win a prize/so far/to work on sth/a team
translation: 1. Our team have won a one prize so far, but we are working on it.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Śnił ci się wczoraj koszmar?
english: Did you have a bad dream yesterday?
glossary: to have a bad dream
translation: 2. Did you have a nightmare yesterday ?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Nie byłbym w stanie teraz nic ugotować, gdyby ciocia mnie nie nauczyła, jak to się robi.
english: I wouldn't be able to cook anything now if my aunt hadn't taught me how to do it.
glossary: to cook/to teach sb how to do sth/an aunt
translation: 3. I wouldn’t be able to cook anything if my aunt hadn’t taught me how to do it.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Nie bolałyby cię plecy, gdybyś nie siedział codziennie przed telewizorem.
english: You wouldn't have back pain if you didn't sit in front of the TV every day.
glossary: to have back pain/to sit in front of the TV/every day
translation: 4. You wouldn’t have a backpain if you haven’t sit in front od the tv every day.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Płacilibyśmy mniej, gdybyśmy wynajęli mieszkanie razem.
english: We'd pay less if we rented an apartment together.
glossary: to rent an apartment
translation: 5. We would’ve pay less if we rented an apartment together.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Ryzykujesz swoją pracę, kłócąc się ze swoim szefem.
english: You're risking your job arguing with your boss.
glossary: to risk your job/to argue with sb/a boss
translation: 6. You risk your job arguing with your boss.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Gdybym przeszła teraz na emeryturę, musiałabym codziennie siedzieć sama w domu.
english: If I retired now, I'd have to sit at home alone every day.
glossary: to retire/to sit at home
translation: 7. If I retired now I would stay at home alone every day.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Dołączyłbym do was, gdybym nie zapomniał kąpielówek.
english: I'd join you if I hadn't forgotten my swim trunks.
glossary: to join sb/to forget sth/swim trunks
translation: 8. I’d join to you if I hadn’t forgotten a swim trunks.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Z kim chcesz, żebym porozmawiał?
english: Who do you want me to talk to?
glossary: to talk to sb
translation: 9. Who do you want me to talk to?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Gdybyś prowadził własną firmę, miałbyś więcej problemów.
english: If you ran your own company, you would have more problems.
glossary: to run your own company/to have a problem
translation: 10. If you ran your own company you’d have more problems.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Jak długo wkuwasz do egzaminu? Ja nawet jeszcze nie zacząłem.
english: How long have you been cramming for the exam? I haven't even started yet.
glossary: to cram for the exam
translation: 1. How long have you been studying for the exam? I haven't even started yet.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Jakich zasad musi przestrzegać moja firma, aby otrzymać dotację?
english: What rules does my company have to comply with to receive the subsidy?
glossary: to comply with sth/a subsidy
translation: 2. What rules does my company have to comply with to receive a donation?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Jaki wpływ miał na Ciebie wypadek?
english: What impact did the accident have on you?
glossary: to have an impact on sb/an accident
translation: 3. What impact did the accident have on you?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Nauczyciel miał kupić płótno. Jak mam teraz malować?
english: The teacher was supposed to buy canvas. How am I supposed to paint now?
glossary: canvas/to paint
translation: 4. The teacher had to buy a canvas. How am I supposed to paint now?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Od czego zależy sukces?
english: What does success depend on?
glossary: to depend on sth/a success
translation: 5. What does success depend on?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Nigdy mnie nie słuchasz. Jak mamy się komunikować?
english: You never listen to me. How are we supposed to communicate?
glossary: to listen to sb/to communicate
translation: 6. You are never listening to me. How are we supposed to communicate?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Zawsze pracujesz do późna. Nie zależy ci na swojej rodzinie?
english: You're always working late. Don't you care about your family?
glossary: to work late/to care about your family
translation: 7. You are always working late. Don't you care about your family?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Mamy nadzieję, że nasz film pomoże społeczeństwu uświadomić sobie problem przemocy domowej.
english: We hope that our movie will help society realize the problem of domestic violence.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to realize sth/domestic violence
translation: 8. We hope that our film will help the community become aware of the problem of domestic violence.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Zawsze przeceniasz swoje umiejętności i później wpadamy w kłopoty.
english: You're always overestimating your abilities, and then we get in trouble.
glossary: to overestimate sth/to get in trouble
translation: 9. You’re always overestimating your skills and we get into trouble later.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Czego Twój ojciec nie pochwala?
english: What doesn't your father approve of?
glossary: to approve of sth
translation: 10. What doesn't your father approve of?

name: Anna Forney
polish: Mam nadzieję, że oszczędzę trochę pieniędzy w tym miesiącu.
english: I hope I'll save some money this month.
glossary: to save money/this month
translation: 1. I hope I’ll save some money this month.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Na imprezie było dużo pijanych nastolatków.
english: There were many drunk teens at the party.
glossary: a teen/to be drunk
translation: 2. There were a lot of drunk teenagers at the party.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Zrobię pracę domową, jak już będę mieć dostęp do internetu.
english: I'll do my homework once I have access to the internet.
glossary: to have access to the internet/to do your homework/once {2}
translation: 3. I’ll do my homework when I have access to the internet.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Grałeś w weekend w gry?
english: Did you play games on the weekend?
glossary: to play games/on the weekend
translation: 4. Did you play games on the weekend.

name: Anna Forney
polish: W przyszłym tygodniu jadę za granicę. Podlejesz kwiatki?
english: I'm going abroad next week. Will you water the plants?
glossary: to water plants/to go abroad/next week
translation: 5. I’m going abroad next week. Will you water plants?

name: Anna Forney
polish: Myślałem, że wpadniesz jutro i napijemy się piwa.
english: I thought you'd drop by tomorrow and we'd drink beer.
glossary: to drop by/to drink beer
translation: 6. I thought you would drop by tomorrow and have a beer.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Jak dowiedziałeś się prawdy?
english: How did you find out the truth?
glossary: to find out the truth
translation: 7. How did you find out the truth?

name: Anna Forney
polish: Przykro mi. Nie dostaniesz więcej środków przeciwbólowych.
english: I'm sorry. You won't get more painkillers.
glossary: to get painkillers
translation: 8. I’m sorry. You won’t get more painkillers.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Muszę zacząć jeszcze raz.
english: I have to start over.
glossary: to start over
translation: 9. I have to start over.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Zamknij się. Cały dzień gadasz.
english: Shut up. You've been talking all day.
glossary: all day/to talk/to shut up
translation: 10. Shut up. You’re talking all day.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Nie odkryłem jeszcze swojego powołania.
english: I haven't found my vocation yet.
glossary: to find your vocation
translation: 1. I haven't found my vocation yet.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Nie musiałbyś teraz płacić za to badanie, gdybyś miał ubezpieczenie.
english: You wouldn't have to pay for the examination now if you had insurance.
glossary: to have insurance/to pay for sth/an examination
translation: 2. You wouldn't have to pay for this examination if you had insurance.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Zauważyłem wczoraj, że sąsiedzi kupili nowy samochód.
english: I noticed yesterday that my neighbors had bought a new car.
glossary: to buy a new car/to notice sth/a neighbor
translation: 3. Yesterday I found out that our neighbours bought new car.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Do kogo należy ta komórka?
english: Who does the cell belong to?
glossary: to belong to sb/a cell phone
translation: 4. Who does the cellar belong to?

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Kiedy postanowiłeś, że będziesz mieszkał za granicą?
english: When did you decide you'd live abroad?
glossary: to decide that.../to live abroad
translation: 5. When did you decide that you would live abroad?

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Mama będzie zła, jeśli nie posprzątam pokoju.
english: My mom will be mad if I don't clean up my room.
glossary: to clean up your room/to be mad at sb/a mom
translation: 6. Mum will get mad if I don't clean up my room.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Wyszedłem już ze sklepu, kiedy zadzwoniłaś.
english: I'd already left the store when you called me.
glossary: to call sb/a store/to leave a store
translation: 7. I already left the store when you called me.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Ile osadzonych jest obecnie w tym więzieniu?
english: How many inmates are there currently in the jail?
glossary: a jail; a prison/an inmate/currently
translation: 8. How many inmates are there currently in this prisión?

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Wujek by nie utonął, gdyby nagle nie dostał skurczu.
english: My uncle wouldn't have drowned if he hadn't suddenly gotten a cramp.
glossary: to get a cramp/to drown/suddenly/an uncle
translation: 9. Uncle wouldn't drown if he suddenly didn't get a cramp.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Dzięki za skończenie zadania na czas.
english: Thanks for completing the task on time.
glossary: to complete a task
translation: 10. Thank you for ending the task on time.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Co jadłeś wczoraj na obiad?
english: What did you eat for lunch yesterday?
glossary: to eat sth for lunch
translation: 1. What did you eat for dinner yesterday?

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Dostałbym w zeszłym roku stypendium, gdybym miał lepsze oceny.
english: I would've gotten a scholarship last year if I'd had better grades.
glossary: to get a scholarship/to have good grades
translation: 2. I would have gotten a scholarship last year if I had had better grades.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Ile jest artykułów na ten temat?
english: How many articles on the subject are there?
glossary: an article on sth
translation: 3. How many articles are there on this topic?

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Będzie cię bolał brzuch, jeśli będziesz dalej jeść tak szybko.
english: You'll have a stomachache if you keep eating so quickly.
glossary: to keep doing sth/to eat quickly/to have a stomachache
translation: 4. You will have a stomach ache if you keep eating so fast.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Jeden z moich uczniów powiedział mi wczoraj, że pies zjadł mu pracę domową.
english: One of my students told me yesterday that his dog had eaten his homework.
glossary: a dog/to do your homework
translation: 5. One of my students told me yesterday that the dog ate his homework assignments.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Wczoraj napisałem artykuł o jedzeniu na mieście.
english: I wrote an article about eating out yesterday.
glossary: to eat out/to write an article about sth
translation: 6. Yesterday I wrote the article about eating out.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Dzwoniłbym do ciebie częściej, gdybyś nie była taka drażliwa.
english: I'd call you more often if you weren't so touchy.
glossary: to be touchy/to call sb
translation: 7. I would have called you more frequently if you hadn’t been so irritable.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Czy jest coś, co powinienem szczegółowo omówić?
english: Is there anything I should elaborate on?
glossary: to elaborate on sth
translation: 8. Is there anything what I should discuss in detail?

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Dlaczego się jeszcze nie wyprowadziłeś? Na co czekasz?
english: Why haven't you moved out yet? What are you waiting for?
glossary: to wait for sth/to move out
translation: 9. Why haven’t you moved out yet? What are you waiting for?

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Nigdy nie płaciłem żadnych rachunków, dopóki nie wyprowadziłem się z domu rodziców.
english: I'd never paid any bills before I moved out of my parents' house.
glossary: to pay your bills/to move out of your parents' house
translation: 10. I never paid any bills until I moved out of my parent’s house.

name: Camille Dew
polish: Ilu wspólników było na spotkaniu w zeszłym tygodniu?
english: How many business partners were there at the meeting last week?
glossary: a participant/a meeting/last week
translation: How many shareholders were at the meeting last week?

name: Camille Dew
polish: Do czego masz słabość?
english: What do you have a weakness for?
glossary: to have a weakness for sth
translation: What weakness do you have for?

name: Camille Dew
polish: Jutro jem obiad z moim szefem.
english: I'm having lunch with my boss tomorrow.
glossary: to have lunch with sb/a boss
translation: I’m having lunch with my boss tomorrow.

name: Camille Dew
polish: Jeśli zostanie przyznany mi ten kredyt, w końcu będę mógł przeprowadzić badanie.
english: If I'm granted the loan, I'll be finally able to conduct the study.
glossary: to be granted a loan/to be able to do sth/to conduct a study/finally
translation: If this loan is granted to me, finally I will be able to conduct the research.

name: Camille Dew
polish: Piłbym częściej herbatę, gdybym lubił moich sąsiadów.
english: I'd have tea more often if I liked my neighbors.
glossary: to have tea/often/a neighbor/to like sb
translation: I would drink tea more often, if I liked my neighbours.

name: Camille Dew
polish: Trzymałbym się pierwotnego planu, gdyby sprawy nie wymknęły się spod kontroli.
english: I would've stuck to the initial plan if the things hadn't gotten out of control.
glossary: to stick to the plan/the initial plan/to get out of control
translation: I would keep the original plan, if things weren’t under control.

name: Camille Dew
polish: Nie rozumiem, dlaczego jesteś na mnie wściekły.
english: I don't understand why you're mad at me.
glossary: to understand sb/to be mad at sb
translation: I don’t understand why are you mad at me.

name: Camille Dew
polish: Powinienem był dotrzeć na spotkanie z klientem na czas.
english: I should've gotten to the meeting with a client on time.
glossary: to get to a meeting/a meeting/a client/on time
translation: I should have reached the meeting on time.

name: Camille Dew
polish: Kiedy się widzieliśmy ostatnim razem, myślałem, że powiesz mi prawdę.
english: The last time we met, I thought you'd tell me the truth.
glossary: to meet sb/finally/to tell the truth
translation: When we saw each other last time, I thought you would tell me the truth.

name: Camille Dew
polish: Gratulacje. Właśnie usłyszałem wieści.
english: Congratulations. I've just heard the news.
glossary: congratulations/to hear the news
translation: Congratulations. I’ve just heard the news.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Przygotuję się na spotkanie, jeśli będę mieć czas.
english: I'll get prepared for the meeting if I have time.
glossary: to get prepared for a meeting
translation: I will prepare for the meeting if I have time.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Na twoim miejscu nie chodziłbym spać tak późno.
english: If I were you, I wouldn't go to sleep so late.
glossary: to go to sleep late
translation: If I were you, I wouldn’t go to sleep so late.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Gdybyś nie popełnił tego przestępstwa, policja by cię teraz nie szukała.
english: If you hadn't committed the crime, the police wouldn't be looking for you now.
glossary: to look for sb/to commit a crime
translation: If you hadn’t committed the crime, the police wouldn’t look for you now.

name: Martin Vance
polish: O czym musimy porozmawiać?
english: What do we have to talk about?
glossary: to talk about sth
translation: What do we have to talk about?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Dlaczego jest tyle głosów przeciwko temu kandydatowi?
english: Why are there so many votes against the candidate?
glossary: a vote against sb/a candidate
translation: Why there are so many votes against this candidate?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Kogo spotkałeś, kiedy wychodziłeś z budynku?
english: Who did you meet when you were leaving the building?
glossary: to meet sb/to leave the building
translation: Who did you meet when you were leaving the building?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Zrobiłaś test ciążowy?
english: Did you do a pregnancy test?
glossary: to do a pregnancy test/a pregnancy test
translation: Did you do a pregnancy test?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Dowiedziałem się wczoraj, że mój szef pracował wcześniej w agencji nieruchomości.
english: I found out yesterday that my boss had worked at a real estate agency before.
glossary: a real estate agency/to find out that.../a boss
translation: I found out yesterday that my boss had worked in a real estate agency before.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Wszyscy się mnie wczoraj pytali, czy jestem zły. Nie wiem dlaczego.
english: Everybody asked me yesterday if I was mad. I don't know why.
glossary: to be mad at sb
translation: Everyone asked me yesterday if I was angry. I don’t know why.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Często podróżowaliśmy z mężem, zanim urodziło się nasze pierwsze dziecko.
english: My husband and I had often traveled before our first kid was born.
glossary: to be born/a kid/to travel/a husband
translation: My husband and I traveled a lot before our first kid was born.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Kiedy ostatnio się widziałyśmy, moja najlepsza przyjaciółka powiedziała mi, że zerwie ze swoim chłopakiem
english: The last time we met, my best friend told me she'd break up with her boyfriend.
glossary: your best friend/to break up with sb/a boyfriend
translation: When we met last time, my friend told me that she break up with her boyfriend.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Myśłałem, że zawieziesz mnie do domu. Nie chcę brać taksówki.
english: I thought you'd take me home. I don't want to take a cab.
glossary: to think/to take sb home/to take a cab
translation: I thought you take me home. I don’t want to take a cub.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Powiedziałam szefowi, że to szkoda, że umniejszył znaczeniu moich wysiłków.
english: I told my boss it was a shame he'd played down the significance of my efforts.
glossary: to play down the significance of sth/It's a shame that.../a boss/an effort
translation: I told the boss that ………. he …………..my efforts.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Zdziwiłem się, kiedy żona mi powiedziała, że chce się wyprowadzić.
english: I got surprised when my wife told me she wanted to move out.
glossary: to get surprised/to move out/a wife
translation: I was suprised when my wife told me that she want to move out.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Myślałem, że przejdę w tym roku na emeryturę.
english: I thought I'd retire this year.
glossary: to retire/this year
translation: I thought that I retire this year.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Córka obiecała, że nie będzie panikować, kiedy rozpęta się kolejna burza.
english: My daughter promised she wouldn't freak out when the next storm breaks out.
glossary: to break out/to freak out/a daughter
translation: My daughter promised me she wouldn’t panic when another storm broke out.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Powiedziałem ci, że nie będę cię krył.
english: I told you I wouldn't cover up for you.
glossary: to cover for sb
translation: I told you I wouldn’t cover you.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Powiedziałam ci ostatnim razem, że nie będę cię więcej znosić.
english: I told you last time I wouldn't put up with you anymore.
glossary: to put up with sb/last time
translation: I told you last time that I wouldn’t ……you anymore.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Powiedziałem ci, że przyprawy uwydatnią smak potrawy.
english: I told you the spices would bring out the flavor of the dish.
glossary: to bring out the flavor/a dish/spices
translation: I told you that ……………..

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Jak długo wątpisz w nasz projekt? Myślałem, że w niego wierzysz.
english: How long have you been doubting our project? I thought you believed in it.
glossary: to doubt sth/to believe in sth
translation: How long have you been doubting our project? I though you believe in its.

name: Kate Sweet
polish: Możemy iść na kawę, ale najpierw muszę zrobić pracę domową.
english: We can go for a coffee, but I have to do my homework first.
glossary: to go for a coffee/to do your homework/first
translation: 1.	We could go for a coffee, but I have to do my homework first.

name: Kate Sweet
polish: Chcę spędzać więcej czasu z Tobą.
english: I want to spend more time with you.
glossary: to spend time with sb
translation: 2.	I want to spent more time with you.

name: Kate Sweet
polish: Nie kocham cię już. Musimy się rozwieść.
english: I don't love you anymore. We have to get divorced.
glossary: to love sb/to get divorced
translation: 3.	I don’t love you anymore. We must get a divorce.

name: Kate Sweet
polish: Musisz dotrzymać terminu, bo projekt jest ważny.
english: You have to meet the deadline because the project is important.
glossary: to meet a deadline/a project/to be important to sb
translation: 4.	You have to meet the deadline, because the project is important.

name: Kate Sweet
polish: Popełniłem błąd. Muszę zacząć od początku.
english: I made a mistake. I have to start from scratch.
glossary: to make a mistake/to start from scratch
translation: 5.	I made a mistake. I have to start all over again.

name: Kate Sweet
polish: Musisz zrobić mi kilka zdjęć.
english: You have to take a few pictures of me.
glossary: to take a picture of sb
translation: 6.	You  must take a few photos of me.

name: Kate Sweet
polish: Mamo, chcemy się pobrać w to lato.
english: Mom, we want to get married in summer.
glossary: to get married to sb/in summer
translation: 7.	Mum, we want to get married in this summer.

name: Kate Sweet
polish: Pozbądź się tego. Musimy zaoszczędzić miejsce.
english: Get rid of it. We have to save space.
glossary: to get rid of sth/to save space
translation: 8.	Get rid of it! We have to save space.

name: Kate Sweet
polish: Muszę zapłacić kartą. Nie mam przy sobie gotówki.
english: I have to pay by credit card. I have no cash on me.
glossary: to pay by credit card/to have no cash on you
translation: 9.	I have to pay by credit card. I have no money with me.

name: Kate Sweet
polish: Musisz opowiedzieć mi tę historię, kiedy się spotkamy.
english: You have to tell me the story when we meet up.
glossary: to tell sb a story/to meet up
translation: 10.	You must tell me these stories when we will meet.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Kiedy ostatnio się widziałyśmy, moja najlepsza przyjaciółka powiedziała mi, że zerwie ze swoim chłopakiem
english: The last time we met, my best friend told me she'd break up with her boyfriend.
glossary: your best friend/to break up with sb/a boyfriend
translation: The last time we saw each other, my best friend told me she will break up with her boyfriend

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Myśłałem, że zawieziesz mnie do domu. Nie chcę brać taksówki.
english: I thought you'd take me home. I don't want to take a cab.
glossary: to think/to take sb home/to take a cab
translation: I thought you would drive me home. I don't want to take a cab.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Powiedziałam szefowi, że to szkoda, że umniejszył znaczeniu moich wysiłków.
english: I told my boss it was a shame he'd played down the significance of my efforts.
glossary: to play down the significance of sth/It's a shame that.../a boss/an effort
translation: I told my boss that it was a regret that he belittled the importance of my efforts.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Zdziwiłem się, kiedy żona mi powiedziała, że chce się wyprowadzić.
english: I got surprised when my wife told me she wanted to move out.
glossary: to get surprised/to move out/a wife
translation: I was shocked when my wife told me she wanted to move out.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Myślałem, że przejdę w tym roku na emeryturę.
english: I thought I'd retire this year.
glossary: to retire/this year
translation: I thought I would retire this year.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Córka obiecała, że nie będzie panikować, kiedy rozpęta się kolejna burza.
english: My daughter promised she wouldn't freak out when the next storm breaks out.
glossary: to break out/to freak out/a daughter
translation: My daughter promised not to freak out if the next storm breaks.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Powiedziałem ci, że nie będę cię krył.
english: I told you I wouldn't cover up for you.
glossary: to cover for sb
translation: I told you I wouldn't hide you.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Powiedziałam ci ostatnim razem, że nie będę cię więcej znosić.
english: I told you last time I wouldn't put up with you anymore.
glossary: to put up with sb/last time
translation: I told you last time that I would not put up with you again.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Powiedziałem ci, że przyprawy uwydatnią smak potrawy.
english: I told you the spices would bring out the flavor of the dish.
glossary: to bring out the flavor/a dish/spices
translation: I told you that the flavor of the dish will be enhanced by the spices.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Jak długo wątpisz w nasz projekt? Myślałem, że w niego wierzysz.
english: How long have you been doubting our project? I thought you believed in it.
glossary: to doubt sth/to believe in sth
translation: How long have you doubted our project? I thought you believed in it.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Przanalizowałem już raport, ale nie natknąłem się na nic interesującego.
english: I've already looked into the report, but I haven't come across anything interesting.
glossary: to come across sth/to look into sth/to look into a report
translation: 1. I’ve already looked into the report, but I didn’t come across anything interesting.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Czy ostatnie dochodzenie zostało odpowiednio przeprowadzone?
english: Was the last investigation carried out properly?
glossary: to carry out an investigation/to do sth properly
translation: 2. Was it the last investigation ????

name: Martin Hale
polish: Podgrzałeś już jedzenie?
english: Have you heated up the food yet?
glossary: to heat up the food
translation: 3. Have you already heated up the food?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Dlaczego znowu mnie wkurzasz?
english: Why are you pissing me off again?
glossary: to piss sb off
translation: 4. Why are you pissing me off again?

name: Martin Hale
polish: W zeszłym tygodniu nauczycielka powiedziała, że musimy wydrukować swoje prace.
english: The teacher said last week that we had to print out our assignment.
glossary: an assignment/to print sth out/a teacher
translation: 5. Last week our teacher told us that we had to print out our works.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Na twoim miejscu zgasiłbym tu papierosa.
english: If I were you I'd put out the cigarette here.
glossary: to put out a cigarette
translation: 6. If I were you I would put out a cigarette here.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Nie mogę się przyzwyczaić do wynoszenia śmieci. Kiedyś robiła to moja mama.
english: I can't get used to taking out the garbage. My mom used to do it.
glossary: to take out the garbage

name: Martin Hale
polish: Mogłem to zapisać, bo teraz nic nie pamiętam.
english: I could've written it down because I don't remember anything now.
glossary: to remember sth/to write sth down; to take sth down
translation: 8. I should’ve written it down because I remember nothing now.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Klient by nie zrezygnował, gdybyśmy spełnili jego oczekiwania.
english: The client wouldn't have resigned if we'd lived up to his expectations.
glossary: to live up to sb's expectations/a client/to resign from sth
translation: 9. A client wouldn’t have resigned if we had met his needs.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Powiedziałam ci ostatnim razem, że nie będę cię więcej znosić.
english: I told you last time I wouldn't put up with you anymore.
glossary: to put up with sb/last time
translation: 10. I told you last time that I wouldn’t be able to stand you anymore.

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Obiecałeś, że zajmiesz się problemem.
english: You promised you'd handle the problem.
glossary: to handle a problem
translation: 1. You promise that you handle a problem.

name: Monica Grimm
polish: W moim biurze jest wiele osób, które plotkują.
english: There are many people in my office who gossip.
glossary: to gossip/in your office
translation: 2. It's a lot of people in my office who gossip.

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Myślę, że wezmę udział w kursie.
english: I think I'll take part in the course.
glossary: to take part in a course
translation: 3. I think I will take part in a course.

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Dlaczego mnie spoliczkowałaś?
english: Why did you slap me?
glossary: to slap sb
translation: 4. Why did you slap me?

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Od miesiąca szukam nowej pracy.
english: I've been looking for a new job for a month.
glossary: to look for a new job
translation: 5. I'm looking for a new job since month.

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Dlaczego nauczycielka cię opieprzyła?
english: Why did the teacher tell you off?
glossary: to tell sb off/a teacher
translation: 6. Why the teacher told you off?

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Zaproszę twoją siostrę na randkę, jak już wróci do miasta.
english: I'll ask out your sister once she gets back to town.
glossary: to get back to town/to ask sb out/a sister
translation: 7. I'll ask your sister out once she get back to town

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Nie pojawię się dzisiaj na spotkaniu, bo jestem chory.
english: I won't show up at the meeting today because I'm sick.
glossary: to be sick/to show up at the meeting
translation: 8. I won't show up at the meeting because I'm sick

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Powinieneś zrobić to sam.
english: You should do it on your own.
glossary: by yourself; on your own
translation: 9. You should do it by yourself.

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Mąż odbiera jutro dzieci ze szkoły.
english: My husband's picking up the kids from school tomorrow.
glossary: to pick up the kids from school
translation: 10. My husbend is picking up the kids from school

name: Damien Bean
polish: Myślałem, że zjemy dzisiaj na mieście.
english: I thought we'd eat out today.
glossary: to eat out
translation: 1.	I thought we would eat out today.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Obiecałaś, że zrobisz mi dzisiaj włosy.
english: You promised you'd do my hair today.
glossary: to promise sb sth; to promise to sb/to do your hair/today
translation: 2.	You promised you would do my hair today.

name: Damien Bean
polish: W zeszłym roku mówiłaś, że musisz ograniczyć palenie, ale tego nie zrobiłaś.
english: You said last year that you had to cut down on smoking, but you didn't.
glossary: to cut down on smoking/last year
translation: 3.	You said last year that you had to cut down smoking but you didn’t.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Powiedziałem mamie, że poszedłem do lekarza, bo chciałem ją uspokoić.
english: I told my mom I'd gone to the doctor because I wanted to calm her down.
glossary: to go to the doctor/to calm sb down
translation: 4.	I told my mom that I went to the doctor because I had wanted to reassure her.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Myślałem, że będziesz tęsknić za domem.
english: I thought you'd feel homesick.
glossary: to feel homesick
translation: 5.	I thought you would have homesick.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Kiedy byliśmy dziećmi, mój młodszy brat mówił, że patrzę na niego z góry.
english: When we were kids, my younger brother said I looked down on him.
glossary: to look down on sb/a younger brother
translation: 6.	When we were child my younger brother used to say that I looked down on him.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Ostatnim razem, kiedy rozmawiałyśmy, mówiłaś, że potrzebujesz mojej porady.
english: The last time we talked, you said you needed my advice.
glossary: to need sb's advice/The last time we talked.../to say sth
translation: 7.	The last time when we talked you said you needed my advice.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Obiecałeś, że zajmiesz się problemem.
english: You promised you'd handle the problem.
glossary: to handle a problem
translation: 8.	You promised you would take care of the problem.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Powiedziałam szefowi, że to szkoda, że umniejszył znaczeniu moich wysiłków.
english: I told my boss it was a shame he'd played down the significance of my efforts.
glossary: to play down the significance of sth/It's a shame that.../a boss/an effort
translation: 9.	I told the boss that it was a shame that he belittled the importance of my efforts.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Myślałem, że wpadniesz jutro i napijemy się piwa.
english: I thought you'd drop by tomorrow and we'd drink beer.
glossary: to drop by/to drink beer
translation: 10.	I thought you would drop by tomorrow and we would have beer.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Ilu wspólników było na spotkaniu w zeszłym tygodniu?
english: How many business partners were there at the meeting last week?
glossary: a participant/a meeting/last week
translation: 1. How many partners were at the meeting last week?

name: Eve Miles
polish: Do czego masz słabość?
english: What do you have a weakness for?
glossary: to have a weakness for sth
translation: 2. What do you have weakness for?

name: Eve Miles
polish: Jutro jem obiad z moim szefem.
english: I'm having lunch with my boss tomorrow.
glossary: to have lunch with sb/a boss
translation: 3. I am eating dinner with my boss tomorrow.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Jeśli zostanie przyznany mi ten kredyt, w końcu będę mógł przeprowadzić badanie.
english: If I'm granted the loan, I'll be finally able to conduct the study.
glossary: to be granted a loan/to be able to do sth/to conduct a study/finally
translation: 4. If I am granted this loan, finally I will be able to conduct a study.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Piłbym częściej herbatę, gdybym lubił moich sąsiadów.
english: I'd have tea more often if I liked my neighbors.
glossary: to have tea/often/a neighbor/to like sb
translation: 5. I would drink more tea if I liked my neighbors.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Trzymałbym się pierwotnego planu, gdyby sprawy nie wymknęły się spod kontroli.
english: I would've stuck to the initial plan if the things hadn't gotten out of control.
glossary: to stick to the plan/the initial plan/to get out of control
translation: 6. I would stick to the initial plan if things hadn’t gotten out of control.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Nie rozumiem, dlaczego jesteś na mnie wściekły.
english: I don't understand why you're mad at me.
glossary: to understand sb/to be mad at sb
translation: 7. I don't understand why you're mad at me.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Powinienem był dotrzeć na spotkanie z klientem na czas.
english: I should've gotten to the meeting with a client on time.
glossary: to get to a meeting/a meeting/a client/on time
translation: 8. I should’ve made it to a meeting with a client on time.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Kiedy się widzieliśmy ostatnim razem, myślałem, że powiesz mi prawdę.
english: The last time we met, I thought you'd tell me the truth.
glossary: to meet sb/finally/to tell the truth
translation: 9. When we saw each other the last time, I thought you would tell me the truth.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Gratulacje. Właśnie usłyszałem wieści.
english: Congratulations. I've just heard the news.
glossary: congratulations/to hear the news
translation: 10. Congratulations. I just heard the news.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Próbuję uciec od picia kawy.
english: I'm trying to escape from drinking coffee.
glossary: to drink coffee/to escape from sth
translation: 1.	I’m trying escape from drinking coffee.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Przed czym próbujesz mnie uchronić?
english: What are you trying to save me from?
glossary: to save sb from sth
translation: 2.	What are you trying to save me from?

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Gdybym kupił te meble tydzień temu, dostałbym zniżkę.
english: If I'd bought the furniture a week ago, I would've gotten a discount.
glossary: to get a discount/to buy furniture
translation: 3.	If I had bought the furniture a week ago, I’d have gotten a discount.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Nigdy nie zamykałem drzwi na klucz, dopóki ktoś nie włamał się do mojego domu.
english: I'd never locked the door until someone broke into my house.
glossary: to break into a house/to lock the door
translation: 4.	I never locked the door until someone broke into my house.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Może bym ci uwierzyła, gdybyś miał dowody.
english: Maybe I'd believe you if you had evidence.
glossary: to have evidence/to believe sb
translation: 5.	Maybe I’d believe you if you had the evidence.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Zauważyłem wczoraj, że pracownik mnie okradł.
english: I noticed yesterday that my employee had robbed me.
glossary: to rob sb/to notice sth
translation: 6.	I noticed yesterday that a worker robbed me.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Dlaczego jeszcze nie dostałem podwyżki?
english: Why haven't I gotten a pay-raise yet?
glossary: to get a pay-raise
translation: 7.	Why haven’t I got a pay-raise yet?

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Gdzie zaparkowałeś samochód?
english: Where did you park your car?
glossary: to park a car
translation: 8.	Where are you parked the car?

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Czy w okolicy jest bankomat?
english: Is there an ATM nearby?
glossary: nearby/an ATM
translation: 9.	Is there an ATM in this area?

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Przeziębisz się, jeśli nie założysz czapki.
english: You'll catch a cold if you don't put on a cap.
glossary: to put on a cap/to catch a cold
translation: 10.	You’ll catch a cold if you don’t put a hat.

name: Susanne Sutton
polish: Myślę, że odwiedzę cię w weekend, bo jutro wracam późno do domu.
english: I think I'll visit you on the weekend because I'm coming back home late tomorrow.
glossary: to visit sb/to come back home late
translation: I think, I'll visit you on the weekend, because I back home late tomorrow.

name: Susanne Sutton
polish: Nie wychodź teraz z domu, bo jest zbyt gorąco.
english: Don't leave the house now because it's too hot.
glossary: to leave the house
translation: Don't go out because it's too hot. .

name: Susanne Sutton
polish: Zepsułam telefon mojej mamy. Nie wiem, co powinnam teraz zrobić.
english: I broke my mom's cell phone. I don't know what I should do now.
glossary: to break a cell phone
translation: I had broken my mom's phone. I don't know, what should I do now.

name: Susanne Sutton
polish: Nie mogę teraz rozmawiać, bo nie mam czasu.
english: I can't talk now because I don't have time.
glossary: to talk to sb
translation: I can't talk right now, because I don't have time.

name: Susanne Sutton
polish: Kiedy wyjeżdżasz?
english: When are you leaving?
glossary: to leave
translation: When do you leave?

name: Susanne Sutton
polish: Mogłem zostać w domu, bo nie ma tu nic do roboty.
english: I could've stayed at home because there's nothing to do here.
glossary: to stay at home/to have nothing to do
translation: I would stay at home, because I don't have anything to do here.

name: Susanne Sutton
polish: Gdzie byłeś? Nie mogłem cię znaleźć.
english: Where were you? I couldn't find you.
translation: Where were you? I couldn't find you.

name: Susanne Sutton
polish: Nie zapłaciłam rachunków w zeszłym miesiącu, bo nie miałam żadnych pieniędzy.
english: I didn't pay the bills last month because I didn't have any money.
glossary: to pay the bills
translation: I haven't paid the bill last month, because I didn' have any money.

name: Susanne Sutton
polish: Zawsze ci pomogę, bo jesteś siostrą mojej żony.
english: I'll always help you because you're my wife's sister.
glossary: to help sb
translation: I'll always help you, because you are my wife's sister.

name: Susanne Sutton
polish: Byłam pewna, że spędzimy razem więcej czasu.
english: I was sure we'd spend more time together.
glossary: to be sure that.../to spend time with sb
translation: I was sure that we'll spend more time together.

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Jak długo wkuwasz do egzaminu? Ja nawet jeszcze nie zacząłem.
english: How long have you been cramming for the exam? I haven't even started yet.
glossary: to cram for the exam
translation: How long have you been craming for the exam? I haven't even started yet.

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Jakich zasad musi przestrzegać moja firma, aby otrzymać dotację?
english: What rules does my company have to comply with to receive the subsidy?
glossary: to comply with sth/a subsidy
translation: What rules does my company have to follow to get a subsidy?

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Jaki wpływ miał na Ciebie wypadek?
english: What impact did the accident have on you?
glossary: to have an impact on sb/an accident
translation: What effect has the accident had on you?

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Nauczyciel miał kupić płótno. Jak mam teraz malować?
english: The teacher was supposed to buy canvas. How am I supposed to paint now?
glossary: canvas/to paint
translation: The teacher was supposed to buy a .... How am I supposed to paint now?

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Od czego zależy sukces?
english: What does success depend on?
glossary: to depend on sth/a success
translation: What does the success depened on?

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Nigdy mnie nie słuchasz. Jak mamy się komunikować?
english: You never listen to me. How are we supposed to communicate?
glossary: to listen to sb/to communicate
translation: You never listen to me. How are we supposed to communicate?

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Zawsze pracujesz do późna. Nie zależy ci na swojej rodzinie?
english: You're always working late. Don't you care about your family?
glossary: to work late/to care about your family
translation: You're always working late. Don't you care about your family?

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Mamy nadzieję, że nasz film pomoże społeczeństwu uświadomić sobie problem przemocy domowej.
english: We hope that our movie will help society realize the problem of domestic violence.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to realize sth/domestic violence
translation: I hope our movie will help the society to realize the problem of the domestic violence.

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Zawsze przeceniasz swoje umiejętności i później wpadamy w kłopoty.
english: You're always overestimating your abilities, and then we get in trouble.
glossary: to overestimate sth/to get in trouble
translation: You're always overestimating your skills and we get in trouble then.

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Czego Twój ojciec nie pochwala?
english: What doesn't your father approve of?
glossary: to approve of sth
translation: What does your father ...?

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Jeden z moich uczniów powiedział mi wczoraj, że pies zjadł mu pracę domową.
english: One of my students told me yesterday that his dog had eaten his homework.
glossary: a dog/to do your homework
translation: 1.	One of my students told me yesterday that his dog had eaten his homework.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Uwierzyłem ci, kiedy mi powiedziałaś, że nie jesteś w nic zamieszana.
english: I believed you when you told me that you weren't mixed up in anything.
glossary: to be mixed up in sth
translation: 2.	I trusted you when you told me that you’re not mixed up in nothing,

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Czy ty mnie sprawdzasz? Myślałem, że mi ufasz.
english: Are you testing me? I thought you trusted me.
glossary: to test sb/to think that.../to trust sb
translation: 3.	Are you testing me? I thought you trusted me.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Na ostatnim spotkaniu szef mi powiedział, że mój projekt się wyróżnia.
english: My boss told me at the last meeting that my project stood out.
glossary: to stand out/a project/at the meeting
translation: 4.	At the last meeting my boss told me that my project stood out.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Wkurzyłeś mnie rano. Myślałem, że wyrzucę cię z domu.
english: You made me mad in the morning. I thought I'd throw you out of the house.
glossary: to make sb mad/to throw sb out of the house
translation: 5.	You pissed me off this morning. I thought I was going to throw you out of the house.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Powiedziałem ci, że nie będę cię więcej znosił.
english: I told you I wouldn't put up with you anymore.
glossary: to put up with sb
translation: 6.	I told you I wouldn’t stood you anymore.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: W zeszłym miesiącu mi powiedziałaś, że ta praca cię wykańcza.
english: You told me last month that the job was wearing you down
glossary: to wear sb down/a job
translation: 7.	You told me last month that this job was exhausting you.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Co sprawiło, że wyprowadziłeś się z miasta? Myślałem, że lubisz swoją okolicę.
english: What made you move out of town? I thought you liked your neighborhood.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to like your neighborhood
translation: 8.	What made you moved out the city? I though you liked your neighborhood.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Powiedziałam ci kilka dni temu, że zajmę się tą sprawą.
english: I told you the other day that I'd look into the matter.
glossary: to look into a matter/the other day
translation: 9.	I told you few days ago I would look into the matter.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Obiecuję, że nie zrobię nic głupiego.
english: I promise I won't do anything stupid.
glossary: to do sth stupid
translation: 10.	 I promise I won’t do anything stupid.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Nie przytyłbyś, gdybyś tyle nie jadł.
english: You wouldn't have gained weight if you hadn't eaten so much.
translation: 1.	My boss would have been nicer if he hadn’t been so pessimistic.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Nie byłabyś w ciąży, gdybyś użyła prezerwatywy.
english: You wouldn't be pregnant if you'd used a condom.
translation: 2.	If you hadn’t drank so much yesterday, you wouldn’t feel bad now.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Wyjdę, jeśli przyjdą wredne dziewczyny.
english: I'll leave if the mean girls arrive.
translation: 3.	I wouldn’t have been late on a train if I had been left earlier.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Gdybyś nie poszedł późno spać, nie byłbyś tak zmęczony.
english: If you hadn't gone to sleep late, you wouldn't be so tired.
translation: 4.	If I were you, I wouldn’t forgive him.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Twoja żona wsparłaby cię wczoraj, gdyby cię kochała.
english: Your wife would've supported you yesterday if she loved you.
translation: 5.	If he doesn’t answer the call, we will go without him.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Jeśli urządzisz przyjęcie, sąsiedzi będą źli.
english: If you throw a party, the neighbors will be upset.
translation: 6.	I wouldn’t have adopted a dog If I had known I was allergic.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Pójdę z tobą, jeśli obiecasz, że dobrze się ubierzesz.
english: I'll go with you if you promise to dress well.
translation: 7.	If he hadn’t cheated on me, I wouldn’t have broken up with him.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Gdybym był bogaty, kupiłbym drogi samochód.
english: If I were rich, I'd buy an expensive car.
translation: 8.	If I were you, I would say the truth.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Ten piosenkarz byłby sławny, gdyby miał dobrego menedżera.
english: This singer would be famous if he had a good manager.
translation: 9.	If you understand me, we won’t be arguing now.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Gdybyś nie jechał tak szybko, nie dostałbyś mandatu.
english: If you hadn't been driving so fast, you wouldn't have gotten a ticket.
translation: 10.	I would have invited her if she hadn’t been such a bitch to me

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Nasz zespół wygrał jak dotąd jedną nagrodę, ale pracujemy nad tym.
english: Our team has won one prize so far, but we're working on it.
glossary: to win a prize/so far/to work on sth/a team
translation: 1. Nasz zespół wygrał jak dotąd jedną nagrodę, ale pracujemy nad tym. Our team already had won only one reword but we are working on this.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Śnił ci się wczoraj koszmar?
english: Did you have a bad dream yesterday?
glossary: to have a bad dream
translation: 2. Śnił ci się wczoraj koszmar? Did you have nightmares yesterday?

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Nie byłbym w stanie teraz nic ugotować, gdyby ciocia mnie nie nauczyła, jak to się robi.
english: I wouldn't be able to cook anything now if my aunt hadn't taught me how to do it.
glossary: to cook/to teach sb how to do sth/an aunt
translation: 3. Nie byłbym w stanie teraz nic ugotować, gdyby ciocia mnie nie nauczyła, jak to się robi. I wouldn’t be able to cook if my uncle didn’t learn me this.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Nie bolałyby cię plecy, gdybyś nie siedział codziennie przed telewizorem.
english: You wouldn't have back pain if you didn't sit in front of the TV every day.
glossary: to have back pain/to sit in front of the TV/every day
translation: 4. Nie bolałyby cię plecy, gdybyś nie siedział codziennie przed telewizorem. You would’t have pain in the beck if you didn”t sin in front of tv everyday.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Płacilibyśmy mniej, gdybyśmy wynajęli mieszkanie razem.
english: We'd pay less if we rented an apartment together.
glossary: to rent an apartment
translation: 5. Płacilibyśmy mniej, gdybyśmy wynajęli mieszkanie razem. We would pay more if we rent apartament together.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Ryzykujesz swoją pracę, kłócąc się ze swoim szefem.
english: You're risking your job arguing with your boss.
glossary: to risk your job/to argue with sb/a boss
translation: 6. Ryzykujesz swoją pracę, kłócąc się ze swoim szefem. You risk your job when you argue with bos.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Gdybym przeszła teraz na emeryturę, musiałabym codziennie siedzieć sama w domu.
english: If I retired now, I'd have to sit at home alone every day.
glossary: to retire/to sit at home
translation: 7. Gdybym przeszła teraz na emeryturę, musiałabym codziennie siedzieć sama w domu. If I reteire I would have to be at home all the time.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Dołączyłbym do was, gdybym nie zapomniał kąpielówek.
english: I'd join you if I hadn't forgotten my swim trunks.
glossary: to join sb/to forget sth/swim trunks
translation: 8. Dołączyłbym do was, gdybym nie zapomniał kąpielówek. I would join If i Wouldn’t forgot my swiming clothes.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Z kim chcesz, żebym porozmawiał?
english: Who do you want me to talk to?
glossary: to talk to sb
translation: 9. Z kim chcesz, żebym porozmawiał? With who do you want me to talk to?

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Gdybyś prowadził własną firmę, miałbyś więcej problemów.
english: If you ran your own company, you would have more problems.
glossary: to run your own company/to have a problem
translation: 10. Gdybyś prowadził własną firmę, miałbyś więcej problemów If i would run my own comapny i would have more problems.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Kiedy ostatnio się widziałyśmy, moja najlepsza przyjaciółka powiedziała mi, że zerwie ze swoim chłopakiem
english: The last time we met, my best friend told me she'd break up with her boyfriend.
glossary: your best friend/to break up with sb/a boyfriend
translation: When we saw last time, my best friend told me she’d break up with her boyfriend.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Myśłałem, że zawieziesz mnie do domu. Nie chcę brać taksówki.
english: I thought you'd take me home. I don't want to take a cab.
glossary: to think/to take sb home/to take a cab
translation: I thought you’d drive me home. I want’t take a taxi.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Powiedziałam szefowi, że to szkoda, że umniejszył znaczeniu moich wysiłków.
english: I told my boss it was a shame he'd played down the significance of my efforts.
glossary: to play down the significance of sth/It's a shame that.../a boss/an effort
translation: I told my boss, it’s a shame he’d diminished my efforts.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Zdziwiłem się, kiedy żona mi powiedziała, że chce się wyprowadzić.
english: I got surprised when my wife told me she wanted to move out.
glossary: to get surprised/to move out/a wife
translation: I was surprised when my wife said she wanted to move out.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Myślałem, że przejdę w tym roku na emeryturę.
english: I thought I'd retire this year.
glossary: to retire/this year
translation: I thought I’d retire this year.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Córka obiecała, że nie będzie panikować, kiedy rozpęta się kolejna burza.
english: My daughter promised she wouldn't freak out when the next storm breaks out.
glossary: to break out/to freak out/a daughter
translation: My daughter promised she wouldn’t freak out when the next storm breaks out.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Powiedziałem ci, że nie będę cię krył.
english: I told you I wouldn't cover up for you.
glossary: to cover for sb
translation: I told you I wouldn’t cover up for you.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Powiedziałam ci ostatnim razem, że nie będę cię więcej znosić.
english: I told you last time I wouldn't put up with you anymore.
glossary: to put up with sb/last time
translation: I told you last time I wouldn’t put up with you.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Powiedziałem ci, że przyprawy uwydatnią smak potrawy.
english: I told you the spices would bring out the flavor of the dish.
glossary: to bring out the flavor/a dish/spices
translation: I told you spices would bring out the flavor.

name: Yvonne West
polish: Jak długo wątpisz w nasz projekt? Myślałem, że w niego wierzysz.
english: How long have you been doubting our project? I thought you believed in it.
glossary: to doubt sth/to believe in sth
translation: How long have you beed doubting in our project. I thought you believe in it.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Nie będziesz musiała mnie odbierać jutro ze szkoły, bo śpię u koleżanki.
english: You won't have to pick me up from school tomorrow because I'm sleeping at my friend's.
glossary: to pick sb up from school/to sleep at your friend's
translation: 1. Last week my teacher said we have to print our homework.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Myślałem, że zjemy dzisiaj na mieście.
english: I thought we'd eat out today.
glossary: to eat out
translation: 2. Did you have sex last night? I thought I hear you.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Mogłem wczoraj wydać mniej pieniędzy.
english: I could've spent less money yesterday.
glossary: to spend money on sth
translation: 3. Although my friend said his dog is not dangerous, I was afraid to pet him.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Nie ma nikogo w domu. Dlatego jest tak cicho.
english: There's no one at home. That's why it's so silent.
glossary: to be at home/to be silent
translation: 4. When we saw eachother last time, I thought you'd tell me the truth.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Nie wiem, co powinienem odpowiedzieć.
english: I don't know what I should answer.
glossary: to answer a question
translation: 5. Where is the document I asked you for? You said that you'd print it.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Byłem pewny, że zrobisz swoją pracę domową.
english: I was sure you'd do your homework.
glossary: to do your homework
translation: 6. I felt dissapointed when the new manager told me that he was married.

name: Greg Hardy
