polish: Gdybym był bogaty, kupiłbym drogi samochód.
english: If I were rich, I'd buy an expensive car.
translation: If I was a richman, I would buy a expensive car.

name: John Connell
polish: Ten piosenkarz byłby sławny, gdyby miał dobrego menedżera.
english: This singer would be famous if he had a good manager.
translation: This singer would be famous if he had a good manager.

name: John Connell
polish: Gdybyś nie jechał tak szybko, nie dostałbyś mandatu.
english: If you hadn't been driving so fast, you wouldn't have gotten a ticket.
translation: If you haven’t driven so fast, you wouldn't had gotten a ticket.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Jak długo wkuwasz do egzaminu? Ja nawet jeszcze nie zacząłem.
english: How long have you been cramming for the exam? I haven't even started yet.
glossary: to cram for the exam
translation: 1.	How long have you been cramming the exam? I haven’t even started yet.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Jakich zasad musi przestrzegać moja firma, aby otrzymać dotację?
english: What rules does my company have to comply with to receive the subsidy?
glossary: to comply with sth/a subsidy
translation: 2.	What rules does your company have to follow to receive the subsidy?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Jaki wpływ miał na Ciebie wypadek?
english: What impact did the accident have on you?
glossary: to have an impact on sb/an accident
translation: 3.	What influence did the accident have on you?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Nauczyciel miał kupić płótno. Jak mam teraz malować?
english: The teacher was supposed to buy canvas. How am I supposed to paint now?
glossary: canvas/to paint
translation: 4.	The teacher was supposed to buy a canvas? How am I supposed to paint now?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Od czego zależy sukces?
english: What does success depend on?
glossary: to depend on sth/a success
translation: 5.	What does success depend on?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Nigdy mnie nie słuchasz. Jak mamy się komunikować?
english: You never listen to me. How are we supposed to communicate?
glossary: to listen to sb/to communicate
translation: 6.	You’re never listening to me. How are we supposed to communicate?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Zawsze pracujesz do późna. Nie zależy ci na swojej rodzinie?
english: You're always working late. Don't you care about your family?
glossary: to work late/to care about your family
translation: 7.	You’re always working late. Don’t you care about your family?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Mamy nadzieję, że nasz film pomoże społeczeństwu uświadomić sobie problem przemocy domowej.
english: We hope that our movie will help society realize the problem of domestic violence.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to realize sth/domestic violence
translation: 8.	We hope that our movie will help the society to become aware of the problem of domestic violence.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Zawsze przeceniasz swoje umiejętności i później wpadamy w kłopoty.
english: You're always overestimating your abilities, and then we get in trouble.
glossary: to overestimate sth/to get in trouble
translation: 9.	You’re always overestimating your skills, and we’re getting in trouble later.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Czego Twój ojciec nie pochwala?
english: What doesn't your father approve of?
glossary: to approve of sth
translation: 10.	What does your father disapprove of?

name: Paul Baker
polish: Kiedy ostatnio się widziałyśmy, moja najlepsza przyjaciółka powiedziała mi, że zerwie ze swoim chłopakiem
english: The last time we met, my best friend told me she'd break up with her boyfriend.
glossary: your best friend/to break up with sb/a boyfriend
translation: When we last time saw each other, my best friend told me that she will broke with her boyfriend.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Myśłałem, że zawieziesz mnie do domu. Nie chcę brać taksówki.
english: I thought you'd take me home. I don't want to take a cab.
glossary: to think/to take sb home/to take a cab
translation: I thought you were gonna take me home. I don't want to take a cab.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Powiedziałam szefowi, że to szkoda, że umniejszył znaczeniu moich wysiłków.
english: I told my boss it was a shame he'd played down the significance of my efforts.
glossary: to play down the significance of sth/It's a shame that.../a boss/an effort
translation: I said to my boss it was a shame he play down a signification of my efforts.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Zdziwiłem się, kiedy żona mi powiedziała, że chce się wyprowadzić.
english: I got surprised when my wife told me she wanted to move out.
glossary: to get surprised/to move out/a wife
translation: I was surprised when my wife told me she wonted to move house.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Myślałem, że przejdę w tym roku na emeryturę.
english: I thought I'd retire this year.
glossary: to retire/this year
translation: I thought I would retire this year.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Córka obiecała, że nie będzie panikować, kiedy rozpęta się kolejna burza.
english: My daughter promised she wouldn't freak out when the next storm breaks out.
glossary: to break out/to freak out/a daughter
translation: My daughter promised me she wouldn't panic when the next storm hit.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Powiedziałem ci, że nie będę cię krył.
english: I told you I wouldn't cover up for you.
glossary: to cover for sb
translation: I told you I would not cover you.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Powiedziałam ci ostatnim razem, że nie będę cię więcej znosić.
english: I told you last time I wouldn't put up with you anymore.
glossary: to put up with sb/last time
translation: I told you last time I would not put up with you anymore.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Powiedziałem ci, że przyprawy uwydatnią smak potrawy.
english: I told you the spices would bring out the flavor of the dish.
glossary: to bring out the flavor/a dish/spices
translation: I told you that spices bringed up the flavor of dishes.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Jak długo wątpisz w nasz projekt? Myślałem, że w niego wierzysz.
english: How long have you been doubting our project? I thought you believed in it.
glossary: to doubt sth/to believe in sth
translation: How long do you doubt of our project? I thought you believed in him.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Obiecałeś, że zajmiesz się problemem.
english: You promised you'd handle the problem.
glossary: to handle a problem
translation: 1. You promised you would take care of a problem.

name: Anna Forney
polish: W moim biurze jest wiele osób, które plotkują.
english: There are many people in my office who gossip.
glossary: to gossip/in your office
translation: 2. There are many people in my office who gossip.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Myślę, że wezmę udział w kursie.
english: I think I'll take part in the course.
glossary: to take part in a course
translation: 3. I think I’ll take part in a course.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Dlaczego mnie spoliczkowałaś?
english: Why did you slap me?
glossary: to slap sb
translation: 4. Why did you slap me?

name: Anna Forney
polish: Od miesiąca szukam nowej pracy.
english: I've been looking for a new job for a month.
glossary: to look for a new job
translation: 5. I’ve been looking for a new job for a month.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Dlaczego nauczycielka cię opieprzyła?
english: Why did the teacher tell you off?
glossary: to tell sb off/a teacher
translation: 6. Why did the teacher tell you off?

name: Anna Forney
polish: Zaproszę twoją siostrę na randkę, jak już wróci do miasta.
english: I'll ask out your sister once she gets back to town.
glossary: to get back to town/to ask sb out/a sister
translation: 7. I’ll ask your sister out when she gets back to town.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Nie pojawię się dzisiaj na spotkaniu, bo jestem chory.
english: I won't show up at the meeting today because I'm sick.
glossary: to be sick/to show up at the meeting
translation: 8. I won’t show up at the meeting today because I’m sick.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Powinieneś zrobić to sam.
english: You should do it on your own.
glossary: by yourself; on your own
translation: 9. You should do it by yourself.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Mąż odbiera jutro dzieci ze szkoły.
english: My husband's picking up the kids from school tomorrow.
glossary: to pick up the kids from school
translation: 10. My husband is picking up the kids from school tomorrow.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Kilka tygodni temu dowiedziałem się, że moja żona była już raz mężatką.
english: I found out a few weeks ago that my wife had already been married once.
glossary: to be married/to find sth out/a few weeks ago/a wife
translation: A few weeks ago I found out that my wife was already married once.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Już miałam wychodzić, gdy pojawił się szef i powiedział, że potrzebuje, żebym została godzinę dłużej w pracy.
english: I was about to leave when my boss showed up and said he needed me to stay at work an hour longer.
glossary: to be about to do sth/to leave/to show up/to stay at work longer
translation: I was about to leave when my boss showed up and said that he needed me to stay one hour longer at work.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Dlaczego znów wydałeś tyle pieniędzy na niepotrzebne rzeczy?
english: Why did you spend so much money on unnecessary things again?
glossary: to spend money on sth/unnecessary things
translation: Why did you again spend so much money on unnecessary things?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Moje życie się zmieniło po tym, jak zostałem zwolniony.
english: My life changed after I'd gotten fired.
glossary: a life/to change/to get fired
translation: My life changed once I had been fired.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Czytałbym więcej książek, gdybym nie był ciągle zmęczony.
english: I would read more books if I weren't constantly tired.
glossary: to read a book/to be tired/to be constantly tired
translation: I would read more books if I wasn’t constantly tired.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Gdybym w zeszłym roku więcej trenowała, byłabym teraz w formie.
english: If I'd worked out more last year, I'd be in shape now.
glossary: to work out/to be in shape
translation: If I had worked out more last year, I would have been in shape now.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Czy jest tu ktoś zainteresowany tym tematem?
english: Is there anyone here interested in the subject?
glossary: to be interested in a subject
translation: Is there anybody interested in this subject?

name: Martin Vance
polish: O czym przeważnie pisze prasa?
english: What does the press mostly write about?
glossary: the press/to write about sth/mostly
translation: What mostly does the press write about?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Jeśli teraz nie opowiesz mi o swoim problemie, nie będę w stanie ci pomóc.
english: If you don't tell me about your problem now, I won't be able to help you.
glossary: to tell about sth/to be able to do sth/to help sb/a problem
translation: If you don’t tell me about your problem now, I won’t be able to help you.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Nieznajomy opluł mnie, kiedy przechodziłem przez ulicę.
english: A stranger spat at me when I was crossing the street.
glossary: to cross the street/a stranger/to spit at sb
translation: The stranger spitted at me when I was crossing a street.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Terroryści próbowali zdetonować bombę kilka razy, zanim powstrzymała ich policja.
english: The terrorists had tried to let off the bomb a few times before the police stopped them.
glossary: the police/to let off a bomb/to stop sb/a few times
translation: 1. The terrorists had tried a few times to detonate a bomb before the police prevented them.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Nie mam siły. Dzieciaki mnie już wykończyły.
english: I don't have energy. The kids have already worn me down.
glossary: to wear sb down/a kid/to have energy
translation: 2. I don’t have energy. The kids had just exhausted me.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Będę czytać dalej, jak już przestaniecie gadać.
english: I'll keep reading once you stop talking.
glossary: to stop talking/to keep reading/last week
translation: 3. I’ll keep on reading once you stop talking.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Kiedyś nie zapinałem pasów, ale to się zmieniło po tym, jak miałem wypadek.
english: I didn't use to fasten up, but it changed after I'd had an accident.
glossary: to have an accident/to fasten up
translation: 4. I used to not fasten up, but it changed after I had had an accident.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Naprawdę byś chciała, żeby ten gość zaprosił cię na randkę?
english: Would you really like the guy to ask you out?
glossary: to ask sb out/a guy
translation: 5. Would you really want this guy to invite you on a date?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Jeśli nie przełożymy spotkania, nie uda mi się dotrzeć.
english: If you don't put off the meeting, I won't make it.
glossary: to put off a meeting/to make it to a meeting
translation: 6. If we don’t put the meeting off I can’t make it.

name: Martin Hale
polish: O której zadzwonił budzik?
english: What time did the alarm go off?
glossary: to go off {2}
translation: 7. What time did the alarm clock go off?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Szef się pytał w zeszłym tygodniu, czy przebrnęliśmy już przez wszystkie procedury.
english: The boss asked last week if we'd already gone through all the procedures.
glossary: to go through a procedure
translation: 8. The boss asked last week if we already went through all the procedures.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Dlaczego chcesz odrzucić tę ofertę?
english: Why do you want to turn down the offer?
glossary: to turn down an offer
translation: 9. Why do you want to turn down the offer?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Dzieciaki się wygłupiały, kiedy weszliśmy do domu.
english: The kids were fooling around when we entered the house.
glossary: to enter the house/a kid/to fool around
translation: 10. The kids were messing around when we entered home.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Jeden z moich uczniów powiedział mi wczoraj, że pies zjadł mu pracę domową.
english: One of my students told me yesterday that his dog had eaten his homework.
glossary: a dog/to do your homework
translation: One of my students told me yesterday that a dog ate his homework.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Uwierzyłem ci, kiedy mi powiedziałaś, że nie jesteś w nic zamieszana.
english: I believed you when you told me that you weren't mixed up in anything.
glossary: to be mixed up in sth
translation: I believed you when you had told me that you aren’t mixed in anything.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Czy ty mnie sprawdzasz? Myślałem, że mi ufasz.
english: Are you testing me? I thought you trusted me.
glossary: to test sb/to think that.../to trust sb
translation: Are you checking me out? I thought that you trust me.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Na ostatnim spotkaniu szef mi powiedział, że mój projekt się wyróżnia.
english: My boss told me at the last meeting that my project stood out.
glossary: to stand out/a project/at the meeting
translation: At the last meeting, my boss told me that the project stood out.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Wkurzyłeś mnie rano. Myślałem, że wyrzucę cię z domu.
english: You made me mad in the morning. I thought I'd throw you out of the house.
glossary: to make sb mad/to throw sb out of the house
translation: You pissed me off this morning. I thought I'd throw you out of the house.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Powiedziałem ci, że nie będę cię więcej znosił.
english: I told you I wouldn't put up with you anymore.
glossary: to put up with sb
translation: I told you I won't stand you anymore.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: W zeszłym miesiącu mi powiedziałaś, że ta praca cię wykańcza.
english: You told me last month that the job was wearing you down
glossary: to wear sb down/a job
translation: Last month you told me that the job was wearing you down.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Co sprawiło, że wyprowadziłeś się z miasta? Myślałem, że lubisz swoją okolicę.
english: What made you move out of town? I thought you liked your neighborhood.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to like your neighborhood
translation: What made you move out of town? I thought you liked your neighborhood.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Powiedziałam ci kilka dni temu, że zajmę się tą sprawą.
english: I told you the other day that I'd look into the matter.
glossary: to look into a matter/the other day
translation: I told you a few days ago that I would look into this.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Obiecuję, że nie zrobię nic głupiego.
english: I promise I won't do anything stupid.
glossary: to do sth stupid
translation: I promise I won't do anything stupid.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Nie powinienem był robić takiego bałaganu. Przepraszam.
english: I shouldn't have made such a mess. I'm sorry.
glossary: to make a mess
translation: 1. I shouldn't have made such a mess. I'm sorry.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Jestem głodny. Mogłem zjeść śniadanie.
english: I'm hungry. I could've eaten breakfast.
glossary: to be hungry/to eat breakfast
translation: 2. I'm hungry. I could eat breakfest.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Mogłem biec szybciej. Zdążyłbym na pociąg.
english: I could've run faster. I would've caught the train.
glossary: to run fast/to catch the train
translation: 3. I could run faster. I'd catch the train.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Jechałeś bardzo szybko. Bałem się, że będziemy mieli wypadek.
english: You drove very fast. I was afraid we'd have an accident.
glossary: to drive/to be afraid/to have an accident
translation: 4. I drove really fast. I was afraid we would have an accident.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Jutro jedziemy do centrum na zakupy. Chcesz coś?
english: We're going shopping downtown tomorrow. Do you want anything?
glossary: to go shopping/to go downtown
translation: 5. We're going to the center tomorrow. Do you want anything?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Co się stało? Byłem pewien, że będziesz się trzymać planu.
english: What happened? I was sure you'd stick to the plan.
glossary: to happen/to be sure/to stick to the plan
translation: 6. What happened? I was sure you'd stick to the plan.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Moja najlepsza przyjaciółka wychodzi za mąż w przyszłym tygodniu.
english: My best friend's getting married next week.
glossary: to get married/next week
translation: 7. My best friend is getting merried next week.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Nie pracuję jutro, więc możemy jechać nad jezioro.
english: I'm not working tomorrow, so we can go to the lake.
glossary: to work/to go to the lake/tomorrow
translation: 8. I have a day off tomorrow so we can go to the lake.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że się zaprzyjaźnimy.
english: I hoped we'd make friends.
glossary: to hope/to make friends
translation: 9. I hoped we'd make friends.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Ile osób jest w Twoim zespole?
english: How many people are there on your team?
glossary: on the team
translation: 10. How many people is there on your team?

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Co jadłeś wczoraj na obiad?
english: What did you eat for lunch yesterday?
glossary: to eat sth for lunch
translation: 1. What did you eat for lunch yesterday?

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Dostałbym w zeszłym roku stypendium, gdybym miał lepsze oceny.
english: I would've gotten a scholarship last year if I'd had better grades.
glossary: to get a scholarship/to have good grades
translation: 2. I'd have gotten a scholarship last year if I had better degrees.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Ile jest artykułów na ten temat?
english: How many articles on the subject are there?
glossary: an article on sth
translation: 3. How many articles are on this topic?

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Będzie cię bolał brzuch, jeśli będziesz dalej jeść tak szybko.
english: You'll have a stomachache if you keep eating so quickly.
glossary: to keep doing sth/to eat quickly/to have a stomachache
translation: 4. You'll have a stomach ache if you eat still so fast.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Jeden z moich uczniów powiedział mi wczoraj, że pies zjadł mu pracę domową.
english: One of my students told me yesterday that his dog had eaten his homework.
glossary: a dog/to do your homework
translation: 5. One of my students told me yesterday that the dog ate his homework.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Wczoraj napisałem artykuł o jedzeniu na mieście.
english: I wrote an article about eating out yesterday.
glossary: to eat out/to write an article about sth
translation: 6.  I wrotte the article about eating out yesterday.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Dzwoniłbym do ciebie częściej, gdybyś nie była taka drażliwa.
english: I'd call you more often if you weren't so touchy.
glossary: to be touchy/to call sb
translation: 7. I'd call you more often if you weren't so touchy.

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Czy jest coś, co powinienem szczegółowo omówić?
english: Is there anything I should elaborate on?
glossary: to elaborate on sth
translation: 8. Is there anything what I should in detail discuss?

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Dlaczego się jeszcze nie wyprowadziłeś? Na co czekasz?
english: Why haven't you moved out yet? What are you waiting for?
glossary: to wait for sth/to move out
translation: 9. Why haven't you moved out yet? What are you waiting for?

name: Alexandra Lee
polish: Nigdy nie płaciłem żadnych rachunków, dopóki nie wyprowadziłem się z domu rodziców.
english: I'd never paid any bills before I moved out of my parents' house.
glossary: to pay your bills/to move out of your parents' house
translation: 10. I never paid any bills until I moved out of my parents' house.

name: Joanna Day
polish: Możesz być z siebie dumny.
english: You can be proud of yourself.
glossary: to be proud of sb
translation: 1. You can be proud of me

name: Joanna Day
polish: Kiedy zdałeś sobie z tego sprawę?
english: When did you realize it?
glossary: to realize sth
translation: 2. When did You realize this

name: Joanna Day
polish: Myślę, że założę dzisiaj sukienkę.
english: I think I'll put on a dress today.
glossary: to put on a dress
translation: 3. I Think I ‚m geting dress today

name: Joanna Day
polish: Odświężę swój angielski, kiedy będę miał więcej czasu.
english: I'll refresh my English when I have more time.
glossary: to refresh your English/to have more time
translation: 4. I will refresh my english when I have more time.

name: Joanna Day
polish: Spotykam się dzisiaj ze znajomymi. Nie czekaj.
english: I'm meeting my friends today. Don't wait.
glossary: to meet your friends/to wait for sb
translation: 5. I’m meeting my friends today. don’t wait.

name: Joanna Day
polish: Może wpadnę po pracy.
english: Maybe I'll drop by after work.
glossary: to drop by/after work
translation: 6. Mayby I’m coming after work

name: Joanna Day
polish: Jak możesz mnie okłamywać?
english: How can you lie to me?
glossary: to lie to sb
translation: 7. How can You lie of me

name: Joanna Day
polish: W szkole jest wielu uczniów, którzy mają problemy.
english: There are many students at school who have problems.
glossary: to have problems/at school/a student
translation: 8. There are many students in school who have problems.

name: Joanna Day
polish: Myślałam, że się tym zajmiesz.
english: I thought you'd take care of it.
glossary: to take care of sth
translation: 9. i thought you would take of this

name: Joanna Day
polish: Od godziny robię kolację.
english: I've been making dinner for an hour.
glossary: to make dinner
translation: 10. I’m makeing dinner an hour.

name: Joanna Day
polish: Mam nadzieję, że omówimy twoje zachowanie.
english: I hope we'll discuss your behavior.
glossary: to discuss sth/behavior
translation: 1. I hope we will discuss your

name: Joanna Day
polish: Zajmuję się jutro młodszym bratem. Spotkajmy się w weekend.
english: I'm taking care of my younger brother tomorrow. Let's meet on the weekend.
glossary: to meet sb/on the weekend/to take care of sb/a younger brother
translation: 2. I’m taking care little brother. Let’s meet on the weekend.

name: Joanna Day
polish: Są rodzice, którzy pozwalają swoim dzieciom palić.
english: There are parents who let their kids smoke.
glossary: to smoke/a kid/to let sb do sth/a parent
translation: 3. There are parents who let their children smoke.

name: Joanna Day
polish: Zrobiłeś wczoraj kopię zapasową plików?
english: Did you back up the files yesterday?
glossary: to back up files
translation: 4. Did You back up your filet yesterday?

name: Joanna Day
polish: Dlaczego powinienem cię posłuchać?
english: Why should I listen to you?
glossary: to listen to sb
translation: 5. Why I have to hear You ?

name: Joanna Day
polish: Będę zmęczona, kiedy skończę pracę.
english: I'll be tired when I finish work.
glossary: to finish work/to be tired
translation: 6. I will tired when I finish work

name: Joanna Day
polish: Od zbyt dawna udajesz szczęśliwego.
english: You've been pretending to be happy for too long.
glossary: to pretend to be happy/for too long

name: Joanna Day
polish: Byłam pewna, że wyjaśnimy sytuację.
english: I was sure we'd explain the situation.
glossary: to explain the situation
translation: 8. I was sure we would clear this situation

name: Joanna Day
polish: Musimy się lepiej poznać.
english: We have to get to know each other better.
glossary: to get to know each other better
translation: 9. We must get to know each other better

name: Joanna Day
polish: Mam nadzieję, że będziesz spędzał ze mną więcej czasu.
english: I hope you'll spend more time with me.
glossary: to spend time with sb
translation: 10. I hope You will spend more time with me

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Zmarnowałem godzinę, czekając na ciebie na zewnątrz.
english: I wasted an hour waiting for you outside.
glossary: to waste your time/to wait for sb/outside
translation: I wasted an hour waiting for you outside.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Leżelibyśmy teraz na plaży, gdyby nasz lot nie został odwołany.
english: We'd be lying on the beach now if our flight hadn't been canceled.
glossary: to lie on the beach/to cancel a flight
translation: We’d be lying on the beach if our flight hadn’t been cancelled.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Dobrze się wczoraj bawiłaś ze znajomymi?
english: Did you have a good time with your friends yesterday?
glossary: to have a good time
translation: Did you have fun with your friends yesterday?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Jak dotąd policja zatrzymała jedną osobę podejrzaną o dokonanie kradzieży.
english: So far the police have detained one person suspected of committing the theft.
glossary: the police/to detain sb/to be suspected of sth/to commit theft
translation: The police have detained one person suspected of committing theft so far.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Nie byłbyś teraz spłukany, gdybyś nie imprezował w zeszły weekend.
english: You wouldn't be broke now if you hadn't partied last weekend.
glossary: to be broke/to party/last weekend
translation: You wouldn’t be broke now if you hadn’t partied last weekend.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Łatwiej byłoby mi dojeżdżać do pracy, gdybym mieszkał w mieście.
english: It would be easier for me to commute to work if I lived in the city.
glossary: to commute to work/to live in the city
translation: It would be easier for me to commute to work if  I lived in town.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Mogłybyśmy ćwiczyć razem, gdybyś też się zapisała na zajęcia z jogi.
english: We could exercise together if you signed up for yoga classes too.
glossary: to exercise/to sign up for yoga classes
translation: We could exercise together if you signed up for yoga classes too.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Dlaczego nie chcesz, żeby twoje dzieci uczyły się angielskiego?
english: Why don't you want your kids to learn English?
glossary: to learn English
translation: Why don’t you want your children to study English?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Zrobiłabym panu teraz zastrzyk, gdyby się pan tak nie trząsł.
english: I'd give you an injection now if you didn't tremble so much.
glossary: to give sb an injection/to tremble
translation: I’d give you an injection now if you didn’t tremble like that.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Nie dostalibyśmy zatrucia pokarmowego, gdybyś umiał gotować.
english: We wouldn't have gotten food poisoning if you could cook.
glossary: to get food poisoning/to cook
translation: We wouldn’t have gotten food poisoning if you could cook.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Jeden z moich uczniów powiedział mi wczoraj, że pies zjadł mu pracę domową.
english: One of my students told me yesterday that his dog had eaten his homework.
glossary: a dog/to do your homework
translation: One of my students told me yesterday that his dog ate his homework.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Uwierzyłem ci, kiedy mi powiedziałaś, że nie jesteś w nic zamieszana.
english: I believed you when you told me that you weren't mixed up in anything.
glossary: to be mixed up in sth
translation: I believed you when you told me you are not involved in anything.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Czy ty mnie sprawdzasz? Myślałem, że mi ufasz.
english: Are you testing me? I thought you trusted me.
glossary: to test sb/to think that.../to trust sb
translation: Are you testing me? I thought you trust me.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Na ostatnim spotkaniu szef mi powiedział, że mój projekt się wyróżnia.
english: My boss told me at the last meeting that my project stood out.
glossary: to stand out/a project/at the meeting
translation: At the last meeting, my boss told me that my project stands out.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Wkurzyłeś mnie rano. Myślałem, że wyrzucę cię z domu.
english: You made me mad in the morning. I thought I'd throw you out of the house.
glossary: to make sb mad/to throw sb out of the house
translation: You pissed me off this morning. I thought I was going to kick you out.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Powiedziałem ci, że nie będę cię więcej znosił.
english: I told you I wouldn't put up with you anymore.
glossary: to put up with sb
translation: I told you I wouldn't stand for you anymore.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: W zeszłym miesiącu mi powiedziałaś, że ta praca cię wykańcza.
english: You told me last month that the job was wearing you down
glossary: to wear sb down/a job
translation: Last month you said that this job is killing you.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Co sprawiło, że wyprowadziłeś się z miasta? Myślałem, że lubisz swoją okolicę.
english: What made you move out of town? I thought you liked your neighborhood.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to like your neighborhood
translation: What made you move out of town? I thought you liked your neighborhood.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Powiedziałam ci kilka dni temu, że zajmę się tą sprawą.
english: I told you the other day that I'd look into the matter.
glossary: to look into a matter/the other day
translation: I told you a few days ago that I would take care of this issue.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Obiecuję, że nie zrobię nic głupiego.
english: I promise I won't do anything stupid.
glossary: to do sth stupid
translation: I promise not to make anything stupid.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Co jadłeś wczoraj na obiad?
english: What did you eat for lunch yesterday?
glossary: to eat sth for lunch
translation: What did you eat for dinner yesterday?

name: Jack Russell
polish: Dostałbym w zeszłym roku stypendium, gdybym miał lepsze oceny.
english: I would've gotten a scholarship last year if I'd had better grades.
glossary: to get a scholarship/to have good grades
translation: I would have gotten a scholarship if I had better grades.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Ile jest artykułów na ten temat?
english: How many articles on the subject are there?
glossary: an article on sth
translation: How many articles are there about this subject?

name: Jack Russell
polish: Będzie cię bolał brzuch, jeśli będziesz dalej jeść tak szybko.
english: You'll have a stomachache if you keep eating so quickly.
glossary: to keep doing sth/to eat quickly/to have a stomachache
translation: You’ll have a stomachache if you eat so fast.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Jeden z moich uczniów powiedział mi wczoraj, że pies zjadł mu pracę domową.
english: One of my students told me yesterday that his dog had eaten his homework.
glossary: a dog/to do your homework
translation: One of my students told me yesterday that a dog had eaten his homework.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Wczoraj napisałem artykuł o jedzeniu na mieście.
english: I wrote an article about eating out yesterday.
glossary: to eat out/to write an article about sth
translation: I wrote an article yesterday about eating out.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Dzwoniłbym do ciebie częściej, gdybyś nie była taka drażliwa.
english: I'd call you more often if you weren't so touchy.
glossary: to be touchy/to call sb
translation: I would have called you more often if you hadn’t been so touchy.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Czy jest coś, co powinienem szczegółowo omówić?
english: Is there anything I should elaborate on?
glossary: to elaborate on sth
translation: Is there something which I should discuss in detail?

name: Jack Russell
polish: Dlaczego się jeszcze nie wyprowadziłeś? Na co czekasz?
english: Why haven't you moved out yet? What are you waiting for?
glossary: to wait for sth/to move out
translation: Why haven’t you moved out yet? What are you waiting for?

name: Jack Russell
polish: Nigdy nie płaciłem żadnych rachunków, dopóki nie wyprowadziłem się z domu rodziców.
english: I'd never paid any bills before I moved out of my parents' house.
glossary: to pay your bills/to move out of your parents' house
translation: I've never paid any bills, until I moved out of my parent’s house.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Mój szef byłby bardziej sympatyczny, gdyby nie był tak pesymistyczny.
english: My boss would be more likable if she weren't so pessimistic.
translation: 1.	I hope I will save some money this month.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Gdybyś wczoraj tyle nie wypił, nie czułbyś się teraz źle.
english: If you hadn't drunk that much yesterday, you wouldn't feel sick now.
translation: 2.	There are a lof of drunk teens at the party.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Nie spóźniłbym się na pociąg, gdybym wyszedł wcześniej.
english: I wouldn't have missed the train if I'd left earlier.
translation: 3.	I’ll do my homework once I have access to the Internet.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Na twoim miejscu nie wybaczyłbym mu.
english: If I were you, I wouldn't have forgiven him.
translation: 4.	Did you play games on the weekend?

name: Damien Bean
polish: Jeśli on nie odbierze telefonu, pojedziemy bez niego.
english: If he doesn't answer his phone, we'll go without him.
translation: 5.	I’m going abroad next week. Will you water the flowers?

name: Damien Bean
polish: Nie adoptowałbym psa, gdybym wiedział, że mam alergię.
english: I wouldn't have adopted a dog if I'd known I was allergic.
translation: 6.	I thought you would drop by tomorrow and we would have beer.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Gdyby mnie nie zdradzał, nie zerwałabym z nim.
english: If he hadn't cheated on me, I wouldn't have broken up with him.
translation: 7.	How did you find out the truth?

name: Damien Bean
polish: Gdybym był na twoim miejscu, powiedziałbym prawdę.
english: If I were you, I'd tell the truth.
translation: 8.	Sorry. You won’t get more painkillers.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Gdybyś mnie rozumiał, nie kłócilibyśmy się teraz.
english: If you understood me, we wouldn't be having this argument now.
translation: 9.	I have to start over.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Zaprosiłbym ją, gdyby nie była dla mnie taką suką.
english: I would've invited her if she hadn't been such a bitch to me.
translation: 10.	Shut up. You’ve been talking all day.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Jakiej muzyki zwykle słucha twój mąż?
english: What music does your husband usually listen to?
glossary: to listen to music
translation: 1.	What kind of music does your husband usually listen to?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Zawsze przeglądasz Facebooka, kiedy chcę z tobą porozmawiać.
english: You're always scrolling Facebook when I want to talk to you.
glossary: to scroll Facebook/to want to do sth/to talk to sb
translation: 2.	You’re always scrolling Facebook when I want to talk to you.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Jaki temat omawialiście dzisiaj w klasie?
english: What subject did you cover in class today?
glossary: to cover a subject/to do sth in class
translation: 3.	What subject did you discuss in class today?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: O czym zarząd nie wie?
english: What doesn't the management board know about?
glossary: to know about sth/a management board
translation: 4. What does the board not know about?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: W czym specjalizuje się uczelnia?
english: What does the university specialize in?
glossary: to specialize in sth
translation: 5. What does the university specialize in?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Film był niesamowity. Był taki wzruszający. Dosłownie sprawił, że się rozpłakałem.
english: The movie was amazing. It was so touching. It literally made me cry.
glossary: to make sb do sth/literally/to be touching
translation: 6. The movie was amazing. It was so touching. It literally made me cry.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Na co zwykle narzeka zarząd?
english: What does the board usually complain about?
glossary: to complain about sth
translation: 7. What does the board usually complain about?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Mój biznes miał prosperować. Przynajmniej taki był plan.
english: My business was supposed to thrive. At least, that was the plan.
glossary: to thrive
translation: 8. My business was supposed to thrive. At least that was the plan.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Jak długo wątpisz w nasz projekt? Myślałem, że w niego wierzysz.
english: How long have you been doubting our project? I thought you believed in it.
glossary: to doubt sth/to believe in sth
translation: 9. How long have you been doubting our project? I thought you believed in it.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Nigdy nie zabierasz mnie do restauracji. Czy w ogóle mnie lubisz?
english: You never take me to any restaurants. Do you even like me?
glossary: to take sb to a restaurant/to like sb
translation: 10. You’re never taking me to a restaurant. Do you even like me?

name: Eve Miles
polish: Przygotuję się na spotkanie, jeśli będę mieć czas.
english: I'll get prepared for the meeting if I have time.
glossary: to get prepared for a meeting
translation: 1. I will prepare for the meeting if I have time.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Na twoim miejscu nie chodziłbym spać tak późno.
english: If I were you, I wouldn't go to sleep so late.
glossary: to go to sleep late
translation: 2. If I were you, I wouldn't go to bed so late.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Gdybyś nie popełnił tego przestępstwa, policja by cię teraz nie szukała.
english: If you hadn't committed the crime, the police wouldn't be looking for you now.
glossary: to look for sb/to commit a crime
translation: 3. If you hadn't committed this crime, the police wouldn't be looking for you now.

name: Eve Miles
polish: O czym musimy porozmawiać?
english: What do we have to talk about?
glossary: to talk about sth
translation: 4. What do we have to talk about?

name: Eve Miles
polish: Dlaczego jest tyle głosów przeciwko temu kandydatowi?
english: Why are there so many votes against the candidate?
glossary: a vote against sb/a candidate
translation: 5. Why are there so many votes against this candidate?

name: Eve Miles
polish: Kogo spotkałeś, kiedy wychodziłeś z budynku?
english: Who did you meet when you were leaving the building?
glossary: to meet sb/to leave the building
translation: 6. Who did you meet when you left the building?

name: Eve Miles
polish: Zrobiłaś test ciążowy?
english: Did you do a pregnancy test?
glossary: to do a pregnancy test/a pregnancy test
translation: 7. Did you take a pregnancy test?

name: Eve Miles
polish: Dowiedziałem się wczoraj, że mój szef pracował wcześniej w agencji nieruchomości.
english: I found out yesterday that my boss had worked at a real estate agency before.
glossary: a real estate agency/to find out that.../a boss
translation: 8. I found out yesterday that my boss worked in a real estate agency.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Wszyscy się mnie wczoraj pytali, czy jestem zły. Nie wiem dlaczego.
english: Everybody asked me yesterday if I was mad. I don't know why.
glossary: to be mad at sb
translation: 9. Everyone asked me yesterday if I was angry. I don’t know why.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Często podróżowaliśmy z mężem, zanim urodziło się nasze pierwsze dziecko.
english: My husband and I had often traveled before our first kid was born.
glossary: to be born/a kid/to travel/a husband
translation: 10. My husband and I had been traveling often before our first child was born.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Nie miałbyś teraz problemów, gdybyś nie stracił panowania nad sobą.
english: You wouldn't be in trouble now if you hadn't lost your temper.
glossary: to lose your temper/to be in trouble
translation: 1. You wouldn't have any problems of you didn't lose your temper.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Dlaczego winisz mnie za utratę pracy?
english: Why are you blaming me for losing your job?
glossary: to lose your job
translation: 2. Why do you blame me for loosing your job

name: Justina Stanley
polish: O czym rozmawialiście, kiedy byłam w łazience?
english: What did you talk about when I was in the bathroom?
glossary: to talk about sth/in the bathroom
translation: 3. What were you talking about when I was in the bathroom.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Niestety mój szef został zwolniony, zanim zdążył mi dać podwyżkę.
english: Unfortunately, my boss had been fired before he managed to give me a pay-raise.
glossary: to give sb a pay-raise/a boss/to be fired/Unfortunately...
translation: 4. Unfortunatelly, my boss had been fired until he gave me a pay rise

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Nie miałbym nic przeciwko, gdybyś wyraziła swoje zdanie.
english: I wouldn't mind if you expressed your opinion.
glossary: to mind/to express your opinion
translation: 5. I wouldn't mind if you tell your opinion

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Jeden z moich pracowników poinformował mnie wczoraj, że trafił do szpitala.
english: One of my employees informed me yesterday that he'd ended up in the hospital.
glossary: to end up in the hospital/to inform sb
translation: 6. Yesterday, one of my employees informed me that he went to the hospital

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Czy jest osoba w twoim życiu, na której możesz polegać?
english: Is there a person in your life you can rely on?
glossary: to rely on sb
translation: 7. Is there someone in your life who you can rely on?

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Ile produktów jest na magazynie?
english: How many products are there in stock?
glossary: a product/in stock
translation: 8. How many productos are at the warehouse?

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Nigdy nie wziąłem łapówki.
english: I've never taken a bribe.
glossary: to take a bribe
translation: 9. I have never took a bribe

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Stracisz prawo jazdy, jeśli będziesz prowadzić po pijaku.
english: You'll lose your driver's license if you drive drunk.
glossary: to lose your driver's license/to drive drunk
translation: 10. You'll loose your driving licence if you drive drunk

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Dlaczego nie skończyłeś ostatniego projektu?
english: Why didn't you finish the last project?
glossary: to finish a project
translation: 1. Why didn't you finish your last project?

name: Isabel Cain
polish: O której wracasz? Chcesz, żebym zrobił kolację?
english: What time are you coming back? Do you want me to make dinner?
glossary: to come back/to want sb to do sth/to make dinner
translation: 2. What time are you coming  back? Do you want me to make dinner?

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Jak zwykle dojeżdżasz do pracy?
english: How do you usually get to work?
glossary: to get to work
translation: 3. How do you usually commit to work?

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Jestem pewna, że kiedyś mnie zrozumiesz.
english: I'm sure you'll understand me one day.
glossary: to understand sb/one day
translation: 4. I’m sure you will understand me someday.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Gdzie spędziłeś ostatnią noc?
english: Where did you spend your last night?
glossary: to spend your night with sb
translation: 5. Where did you spend last night?

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Zapisałem się w zeszłym tygodniu na zajęcia z hiszpańskiego.
english: I signed up for Spanish classes last week.
glossary: to sign up for Spanish classes/last week
translation: 6. I signed up for a Spanish course last week.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Gdzie zwykle parkujesz samochód?
english: Where do you usually park your car?
glossary: to park your car
translation: 7. Where do you usually park your car?

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Są rzeczy, których nie mogę ci powiedzieć.
english: There are things I can't tell you.
glossary: to tell sb sth
translation: 8. There are things which I can’t tell you.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Czy to ma sens?
english: Does it make sense?
glossary: to make sense
translation: 9. Does it make sense?

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Dlaczego nie było cię wczoraj na zajęciach?
english: Why did you skip classes yesterday?
glossary: to skip classes
translation: 10. Why weren't you in classes yesterday?

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Gdzie spałeś zeszłej nocy?
english: Where did you sleep last night?
glossary: last night/to sleep
translation: 1. Where did you sleep last night?

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Zupa się popsuje, jeśli nie wstawisz jej do lodówki.
english: The soup will go bad if you don't put it in the fridge.
glossary: to go bad/to put sth in the fridge
translation: 2. The soup will broke down if you don’t put it to the fridge.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Oblałeś ostatni test, bo się w ogóle na niego nie uczyłeś.
english: You failed the last test because you hadn't studied for it at all.
glossary: to study for a test/to fail a test/at all
translation: 3. You failed your last test becuase you hadn’t studied for it at all.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Rodzice się mnie wczoraj pytali, czy zdałem wszystkie egzaminy.
english: My parents asked me yesterday if I'd passed all the exams.
glossary: to pass an exam/a parent
translation: 4. My parents asked me yesterday if I passed all the exams.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Chciałbym przeprosić za spóźnienie.
english: I'd like to apologize for being late.
glossary: to be late/to apologize for sth/I'd like to...
translation: 5. I would like to apologize for being late.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: O co jesteś oskarżony?
english: What are you accused of?
glossary: to be accused of sth
translation: 6. What are you accused of?

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Nie miałbyś nieświeżego oddechu, gdybyś palił mniej.
english: You wouldn't have bad breath if you smoked less.
glossary: to have bad breath/to smoke
translation: 7. You wouldn’t have bad breath if you smoked less.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Nie załatwiłem jeszcze wszystkich swoich spraw.
english: I haven't done all my errands yet.
glossary: to do errands
translation: 8. I haven’t done all my business yet.

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Są jakieś listy do mnie?
english: Are there any letters for me?
glossary: a letter for sb
translation: 9. Are there any letters for me?

name: Maddie Yates
polish: Dobilibyśmy targu, gdybyś się nie odezwał.
english: We would've closed the deal if you hadn't spoken up.
glossary: to speak up/to close a deal
translation: 10. We would have made a deal if you hadn’t spoken.

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Posprzątam, kiedy wrócę do domu.
english: I'll clean up when I come back home.
glossary: to clean up/to come back home
translation: 1. I'm going to clean up when I come back home.//

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Jestem pewna, że będziesz żałować tej decyzji.
english: I'm sure you'll regret the decision.
glossary: to regret sth/a decision

name: Monica Grimm

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Powinienem był się ciebie pozbyć, zanim narobiłeś problemów.
english: I should've gotten rid of you before you made trouble.
glossary: to get rid of sb/to make trouble
translation: 10. I should've gotten rid of you before you caused so many problems.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Jak znalazłeś tę pracę?
english: How did you find the job?
glossary: to find a job
translation: 1. How did you find this job?

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Ile pokoi jest w tym mieszkaniu?
english: How many rooms are there in the apartment?
glossary: in the apartment/a room
translation: 2. How many rooms are in this flat?

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Właśnie czytałem o zostawianiu napiwków.
english: I've just read about leaving tips.
glossary: to read about sth/to leave a tip
translation: 3. I was just reading about the tipping.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Gdzie byłaś? Byłem pewien, że pojawisz się dzisiaj na spotkaniu.
english: Where were you? I was sure you'd show up at the meeting today.
glossary: to be sure/to show up at the meeting/today
translation: 4. Where were you? I was sure, you would appear on today's meeting.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Czym się interesujesz?
english: What are you interested in?
glossary: to be interested in sth
translation: 5. What things are you interested in?

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Ile osób jest teraz w kawiarni?
english: How many people are there at the coffee shop now?
glossary: to be at the coffee shop/now
translation: 6. How many people are in the cafe right now?

name: Michael Edwards
polish: W tym miesiącu jest kilkoro nowych klientów.
english: There are a few new clients this month.
glossary: a client/this month
translation: 7. There are a few new customers in this month.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: W czym jesteś dobry?
english: What are you good at?
glossary: to be good at sth
translation: 8. What are you good at?

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Jesteś świetna w wydawaniu pieniędzy.
english: You're great at spending money.
glossary: to be great at sth/to spend money on sth
translation: 9. You're great at money spending.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Zrobię pracę domową, jeśli będę miała czas.
english: I'll do my homework if I have time.
glossary: to do your homework/to have time to do sth
translation: 10. I'll do homework, if I have time.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Myślę, że odwiedzę cię w weekend, bo jutro wracam późno do domu.
english: I think I'll visit you on the weekend because I'm coming back home late tomorrow.
glossary: to visit sb/to come back home late
translation: 1. I think I'm going to visit you on the weekend because I going to come home late tomorrow.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Nie wychodź teraz z domu, bo jest zbyt gorąco.
english: Don't leave the house now because it's too hot.
glossary: to leave the house
translation: 2. Don't come out of the house right now because it's too hot outside.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Zepsułam telefon mojej mamy. Nie wiem, co powinnam teraz zrobić.
english: I broke my mom's cell phone. I don't know what I should do now.
glossary: to break a cell phone
translation: 3. I broke my mom's cell phone. I don't know what should I do now.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Nie mogę teraz rozmawiać, bo nie mam czasu.
english: I can't talk now because I don't have time.
glossary: to talk to sb
translation: 4. I can't talk right now because I have no time.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Kiedy wyjeżdżasz?
english: When are you leaving?
glossary: to leave
translation: 5. When do you leave?

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Mogłem zostać w domu, bo nie ma tu nic do roboty.
english: I could've stayed at home because there's nothing to do here.
glossary: to stay at home/to have nothing to do
translation: 6. I could've stayed at home because there is nothing to do here.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Gdzie byłeś? Nie mogłem cię znaleźć.
english: Where were you? I couldn't find you.
translation: 7. Where were you? I couldn't find you.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Nie zapłaciłam rachunków w zeszłym miesiącu, bo nie miałam żadnych pieniędzy.
english: I didn't pay the bills last month because I didn't have any money.
glossary: to pay the bills
translation: 8. I didn't pay the bills last month because I had no money.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Zawsze ci pomogę, bo jesteś siostrą mojej żony.
english: I'll always help you because you're my wife's sister.
glossary: to help sb
translation: 9. I'll always help you because you are my wife's sister.

name: Michael Edwards
polish: Byłam pewna, że spędzimy razem więcej czasu.
english: I was sure we'd spend more time together.
glossary: to be sure that.../to spend time with sb
translation: 10. She was sure that we would spend more time together.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: W zeszłym tygodniu nauczycielka powiedziała, że musimy wydrukować swoje prace.
english: The teacher said last week that we had to print out our assignment.
glossary: an assignment/to print sth out/a teacher
translation: 1. Last week my teacher said we have to print our homework.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Czy wy uprawialiście wczoraj seks? Wydawało mi się, że was słyszę.
english: Did you have sex yesterday? I thought I heard you.
glossary: to have sex/to hear sb
translation: 2. Did you have sex last night? I thought I hear you.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Mimo że kolega powiedział, że jego pies nie jest niebezpieczny, bałam się go pogłaskać.
english: Even though my friend said his dog wasn't dangerous, I was afraid to pet it.
glossary: even though/a friend/a dangerous dog/to pet a dog
translation: 3. Although my friend said his dog is not dangerous, I was afraid to pet him.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Kiedy się widzieliśmy ostatnim razem, myślałem, że powiesz mi prawdę.
english: The last time we met, I thought you'd tell me the truth.
glossary: to meet sb/finally/to tell the truth
translation: 4. When we saw eachother last time, I thought you'd tell me the truth.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Gdzie jest dokument, o który cię prosiłem? Powiedziałeś, że go wydrukujesz.
english: Where's the document I asked you for? You said you'd print it out.
glossary: to print sth out/to ask sb for sth/a document
translation: 5. Where is the document I asked you for? You said that you'd print it.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Poczułam się rozczarowana, kiedy nowy menedżer powiedział mi, że jest żonaty.
english: I felt disappointed when the new manager told me he was married.
glossary: to feel disappointed/a manager/to be married
translation: 6. I felt dissapointed when the new manager told me that he was married.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Szefowa powiedziała, że przejmę ważny projekt.
english: The boss told me I'd take on an important project.
glossary: to take on a project
translation: 7. My boss said I'd take over an important project.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Myślałam, że się tym zajmiesz.
english: I thought you'd take care of it.
glossary: to take care of sth
translation: 8. I thought you'd take care of it.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Mój lekarz rodzinny obiecał, że wciśnie mnie w grafik.
english: My GP promised he'd fit me in to his schedule.
glossary: to fit sb in to your schedule/a GP
translation: 9. My family doctor promised to put me on the schedule.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Już miałam wychodzić, gdy pojawił się szef i powiedział, że potrzebuje, żebym została godzinę dłużej w pracy.
english: I was about to leave when my boss showed up and said he needed me to stay at work an hour longer.
glossary: to be about to do sth/to leave/to show up/to stay at work longer
translation: 10. I was about to leave when my boss shawed up and said that he need to stay an hour longer at work.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Kiedy ostatnio się widziałyśmy, moja najlepsza przyjaciółka powiedziała mi, że zerwie ze swoim chłopakiem
english: The last time we met, my best friend told me she'd break up with her boyfriend.
glossary: your best friend/to break up with sb/a boyfriend
translation: 1. When we saw each other last my best friend told me she was going to braek up with her boyfriend

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Myśłałem, że zawieziesz mnie do domu. Nie chcę brać taksówki.
english: I thought you'd take me home. I don't want to take a cab.
glossary: to think/to take sb home/to take a cab
translation: 2. I thought you would drive me home. I don't want to take a cab.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Powiedziałam szefowi, że to szkoda, że umniejszył znaczeniu moich wysiłków.
english: I told my boss it was a shame he'd played down the significance of my efforts.
glossary: to play down the significance of sth/It's a shame that.../a boss/an effort
translation: 3. I told my boss that it was ….... that he …............... of my efforts.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Zdziwiłem się, kiedy żona mi powiedziała, że chce się wyprowadzić.
english: I got surprised when my wife told me she wanted to move out.
glossary: to get surprised/to move out/a wife
translation: 4. I was surprised when my wife told me she wonted to move out.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Myślałem, że przejdę w tym roku na emeryturę.
english: I thought I'd retire this year.
glossary: to retire/this year
translation: 5. I thought I'd retire this year.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Córka obiecała, że nie będzie panikować, kiedy rozpęta się kolejna burza.
english: My daughter promised she wouldn't freak out when the next storm breaks out.
glossary: to break out/to freak out/a daughter
translation: 6. My daughter promised she wouldn't panic when anather storm broke up.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Powiedziałem ci, że nie będę cię krył.
english: I told you I wouldn't cover up for you.
glossary: to cover for sb
translation: 7. I told you I wouldn't cover you.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Powiedziałam ci ostatnim razem, że nie będę cię więcej znosić.
english: I told you last time I wouldn't put up with you anymore.
glossary: to put up with sb/last time
translation: 8. I told you last time that I wouldn't stend up with you again.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Powiedziałem ci, że przyprawy uwydatnią smak potrawy.
english: I told you the spices would bring out the flavor of the dish.
glossary: to bring out the flavor/a dish/spices
translation: 9. I told you that spices will make a taste dish stronger.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Jak długo wątpisz w nasz projekt? Myślałem, że w niego wierzysz.
english: How long have you been doubting our project? I thought you believed in it.
glossary: to doubt sth/to believe in sth
translation: 10. How long have you doubted in our project? I thought you believe in it.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Jeden z moich uczniów powiedział mi wczoraj, że pies zjadł mu pracę domową.
english: One of my students told me yesterday that his dog had eaten his homework.
glossary: a dog/to do your homework
translation: 1. One of my studnts told me yesterday that his dog ate his homework.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Uwierzyłem ci, kiedy mi powiedziałaś, że nie jesteś w nic zamieszana.
english: I believed you when you told me that you weren't mixed up in anything.
glossary: to be mixed up in sth
translation: 2. I believed you when you said to me that you were not mixed in anything.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Czy ty mnie sprawdzasz? Myślałem, że mi ufasz.
english: Are you testing me? I thought you trusted me.
glossary: to test sb/to think that.../to trust sb
translation: 3. Are you checking me up? I thought you trusted me.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Na ostatnim spotkaniu szef mi powiedział, że mój projekt się wyróżnia.
english: My boss told me at the last meeting that my project stood out.
glossary: to stand out/a project/at the meeting
translation: 4. At the last meeting, my boss told me that my project stand out.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Wkurzyłeś mnie rano. Myślałem, że wyrzucę cię z domu.
english: You made me mad in the morning. I thought I'd throw you out of the house.
glossary: to make sb mad/to throw sb out of the house
translation: 5. You made me angry this morning. I thought I'd kick you out of the house.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Powiedziałem ci, że nie będę cię więcej znosił.
english: I told you I wouldn't put up with you anymore.
glossary: to put up with sb
translation: 6. I told you, I wouldn't put up with you anymore.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: W zeszłym miesiącu mi powiedziałaś, że ta praca cię wykańcza.
english: You told me last month that the job was wearing you down
glossary: to wear sb down/a job
translation: 7. Last mont you told me that this job is exousting you.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Co sprawiło, że wyprowadziłeś się z miasta? Myślałem, że lubisz swoją okolicę.
english: What made you move out of town? I thought you liked your neighborhood.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to like your neighborhood
translation: 8. What made you move out of town? I thought you liked your neighborhood.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Powiedziałam ci kilka dni temu, że zajmę się tą sprawą.
english: I told you the other day that I'd look into the matter.
glossary: to look into a matter/the other day
translation: 9. I told you a few days ago that l would take care of this case.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Obiecuję, że nie zrobię nic głupiego.
english: I promise I won't do anything stupid.
glossary: to do sth stupid
translation: 10. I promise not to do anything stupid.

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Jakiej muzyki zwykle słucha twój mąż?
english: What music does your husband usually listen to?
glossary: to listen to music
translation: What music does your husband usually listen to?

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Zawsze przeglądasz Facebooka, kiedy chcę z tobą porozmawiać.
english: You're always scrolling Facebook when I want to talk to you.
glossary: to scroll Facebook/to want to do sth/to talk to sb
translation: You're always scrolling Facebook when I want to talk to you.

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Jaki temat omawialiście dzisiaj w klasie?
english: What subject did you cover in class today?
glossary: to cover a subject/to do sth in class
translation: What subject did you elaborate on in class today?

name: Claudine Gross
polish: O czym zarząd nie wie?
english: What doesn't the management board know about?
glossary: to know about sth/a management board
translation: What doesn't the managment board know about?

name: Claudine Gross
polish: W czym specjalizuje się uczelnia?
english: What does the university specialize in?
glossary: to specialize in sth
translation: What does the university specialize in?

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Film był niesamowity. Był taki wzruszający. Dosłownie sprawił, że się rozpłakałem.
english: The movie was amazing. It was so touching. It literally made me cry.
glossary: to make sb do sth/literally/to be touching
translation: The movie was amazing. It was so moving. Literally, it made me cry.

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Na co zwykle narzeka zarząd?
english: What does the board usually complain about?
glossary: to complain about sth
translation: What does the management board usually complain at?

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Mój biznes miał prosperować. Przynajmniej taki był plan.
english: My business was supposed to thrive. At least, that was the plan.
glossary: to thrive
translation: My bussiness was supposed to work. At least, it was the plan.

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Jak długo wątpisz w nasz projekt? Myślałem, że w niego wierzysz.
english: How long have you been doubting our project? I thought you believed in it.
glossary: to doubt sth/to believe in sth
translation: How long have you been doubting our project? I thought you belived in it.

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Nigdy nie zabierasz mnie do restauracji. Czy w ogóle mnie lubisz?
english: You never take me to any restaurants. Do you even like me?
glossary: to take sb to a restaurant/to like sb
translation: You never take me to restaurant. Do you like me at all?

name: Kate Long
polish: Próbuję uciec od picia kawy.
english: I'm trying to escape from drinking coffee.
glossary: to drink coffee/to escape from sth
translation: 1. I tried to escape from drinking coffee.

name: Kate Long
polish: Przed czym próbujesz mnie uchronić?
english: What are you trying to save me from?
glossary: to save sb from sth
translation: 2. What do you try to protect me from?

name: Kate Long
polish: Gdybym kupił te meble tydzień temu, dostałbym zniżkę.
english: If I'd bought the furniture a week ago, I would've gotten a discount.
glossary: to get a discount/to buy furniture
translation: 3. If I had bought the furniture last week I’d have gotten a discount.

name: Kate Long
polish: Nigdy nie zamykałem drzwi na klucz, dopóki ktoś nie włamał się do mojego domu.
english: I'd never locked the door until someone broke into my house.
glossary: to break into a house/to lock the door
translation: 4. I have never closed the door until someone broken in my apartment.

name: Kate Long
polish: Może bym ci uwierzyła, gdybyś miał dowody.
english: Maybe I'd believe you if you had evidence.
glossary: to have evidence/to believe sb
translation: 5. Maybe, I”ll believe you if you have evidences.

name: Kate Long
polish: Zauważyłem wczoraj, że pracownik mnie okradł.
english: I noticed yesterday that my employee had robbed me.
glossary: to rob sb/to notice sth
translation: 6. I noticed yesterday the worker robbed me.

name: Kate Long
polish: Dlaczego jeszcze nie dostałem podwyżki?
english: Why haven't I gotten a pay-raise yet?
glossary: to get a pay-raise
translation: 7. Why have I not get a paid-rise yet?

name: Kate Long
polish: Gdzie zaparkowałeś samochód?
english: Where did you park your car?
glossary: to park a car
translation: 8. Where did you park a car?

name: Kate Long
polish: Czy w okolicy jest bankomat?
english: Is there an ATM nearby?
glossary: nearby/an ATM
translation: 9. Is there the cash machine around?

name: Kate Long
polish: Przeziębisz się, jeśli nie założysz czapki.
english: You'll catch a cold if you don't put on a cap.
glossary: to put on a cap/to catch a cold
translation: 10. You’ll get a cold if you don’t put a hat.

name: Kate Long
polish: Co jadłeś wczoraj na obiad?
english: What did you eat for lunch yesterday?
glossary: to eat sth for lunch
translation: 1. What did you eat for dinner yesterday?

name: Kate Long
polish: Dostałbym w zeszłym roku stypendium, gdybym miał lepsze oceny.
english: I would've gotten a scholarship last year if I'd had better grades.
glossary: to get a scholarship/to have good grades
translation: 2. I’d have gotten a scholarship if I had better grades.

name: Kate Long
polish: Ile jest artykułów na ten temat?
english: How many articles on the subject are there?
glossary: an article on sth
translation: 3. How many articles are there on the subject?

name: Kate Long
polish: Będzie cię bolał brzuch, jeśli będziesz dalej jeść tak szybko.
english: You'll have a stomachache if you keep eating so quickly.
glossary: to keep doing sth/to eat quickly/to have a stomachache
translation: 4. You’d have a stomachache if you still ate so fast.

name: Kate Long
polish: Jeden z moich uczniów powiedział mi wczoraj, że pies zjadł mu pracę domową.
english: One of my students told me yesterday that his dog had eaten his homework.
glossary: a dog/to do your homework
translation: 5. One of my students told me yesterday that the dog had eaten his homework.

name: Kate Long
polish: Wczoraj napisałem artykuł o jedzeniu na mieście.
english: I wrote an article about eating out yesterday.
glossary: to eat out/to write an article about sth
translation: 6. I wrote the article about eating out yesterday.

name: Kate Long
polish: Dzwoniłbym do ciebie częściej, gdybyś nie była taka drażliwa.
english: I'd call you more often if you weren't so touchy.
glossary: to be touchy/to call sb
translation: 7. I’d call you more often if you didn’t be so touchy.

name: Kate Long
polish: Czy jest coś, co powinienem szczegółowo omówić?
english: Is there anything I should elaborate on?
glossary: to elaborate on sth
translation: 8. Is there something that I should cover a subject in details?

name: Kate Long
polish: Dlaczego się jeszcze nie wyprowadziłeś? Na co czekasz?
english: Why haven't you moved out yet? What are you waiting for?
glossary: to wait for sth/to move out
translation: 9. Why have you not move out? What do you wait for?

name: Kate Long
polish: Nigdy nie płaciłem żadnych rachunków, dopóki nie wyprowadziłem się z domu rodziców.
english: I'd never paid any bills before I moved out of my parents' house.
glossary: to pay your bills/to move out of your parents' house
translation: 10.  I’ve never pay some bills until I moved out from my parents’ house.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Mój szef byłby bardziej sympatyczny, gdyby nie był tak pesymistyczny.
english: My boss would be more likable if she weren't so pessimistic.
translation: 1.	My boss would have been nicer if he hadn’t been so pessimistic.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Gdybyś wczoraj tyle nie wypił, nie czułbyś się teraz źle.
english: If you hadn't drunk that much yesterday, you wouldn't feel sick now.
translation: 2.	If you hadn’t drank so much yesterday, you wouldn’t feel bad now.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Nie spóźniłbym się na pociąg, gdybym wyszedł wcześniej.
english: I wouldn't have missed the train if I'd left earlier.
translation: 3.	I wouldn’t have been late on a train if I had been left earlier.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Na twoim miejscu nie wybaczyłbym mu.
english: If I were you, I wouldn't have forgiven him.
translation: 4.	If I were you, I wouldn’t forgive him.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Jeśli on nie odbierze telefonu, pojedziemy bez niego.
english: If he doesn't answer his phone, we'll go without him.
translation: 5.	If he doesn’t answer the call, we will go without him.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Nie adoptowałbym psa, gdybym wiedział, że mam alergię.
english: I wouldn't have adopted a dog if I'd known I was allergic.
translation: 6.	I wouldn’t have adopted a dog If I had known I was allergic.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Gdyby mnie nie zdradzał, nie zerwałabym z nim.
english: If he hadn't cheated on me, I wouldn't have broken up with him.
translation: 7.	If he hadn’t cheated on me, I wouldn’t have broken up with him.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Gdybym był na twoim miejscu, powiedziałbym prawdę.
english: If I were you, I'd tell the truth.
translation: 8.	If I were you, I would say the truth.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Gdybyś mnie rozumiał, nie kłócilibyśmy się teraz.
english: If you understood me, we wouldn't be having this argument now.
translation: 9.	If you understand me, we won’t be arguing now.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Zaprosiłbym ją, gdyby nie była dla mnie taką suką.
english: I would've invited her if she hadn't been such a bitch to me.
translation: 10.	I would have invited her if she hadn’t been such a bitch to me

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Mój tata odebrałby mnie wczoraj, gdyby miał samochód.
english: My dad would've picked me up yesterday if he had a car.
translation: 1. My dad would have picked me up yesterday if he had had a car.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Czułbym się lepiej, gdybym wypił moją poranną kawę.
english: I'd feel better if I'd drunk my morning coffee.
translation: 2. I’d feel better if I drank my morning coffee.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Zdałbym egzaminy, gdybym więcej się uczył.
english: I would've passed the exams if I'd studied more.
translation: 3. I would have passed the exams if I had learned more.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Gdybym miał wybierać, wolałbym mieć tylko koty.
english: If I had to choose, I'd prefer to only have cats.
translation: 4. If I had to choose, I would prefer to have cats only.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Ta drużyna miałaby lepsze wyniki, gdyby więcej trenowała.
english: This team would have better results if they'd trained more.
translation: 5. The team would have better results if they had trained more.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Gdybym znał prawdę, powiedziałbym ją.
