name: Martin Hale
polish: Powiedziałem ci, że przyprawy uwydatnią smak potrawy.
english: I told you the spices would bring out the flavor of the dish.
glossary: to bring out the flavor/a dish/spices
translation: 4. I told you that spices brought out a dish's flavor.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Dlaczego bierzesz pożyczkę?
english: Why are you taking out a loan?
glossary: to take out a loan
translation: 5. Why do you take out a loan?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Wykład by się nie ciągnął, gdybyś nie zadawał głupich pytań.
english: The lecture wouldn't have dragged on if you hadn't asked stupid questions.
glossary: to ask stupid questions/to drag on/a lecture
translation: 6. The lecture wouldn’t have dragged on if you hadn’t asked silly questions.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Samolot odlatywał, kiedy pojawiliśmy się na lotnisku.
english: The plane was taking off when we showed up at the airport.
glossary: to take off/to show up at the airport
translation: 7. The airplane was taking off when we showed up at the airport.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Nie chciałbym, żebyś popadł w uzależnienie.
english: I wouldn't like you to fall into addiction.
glossary: to fall into addiction
translation: 8. I wouldn’t like you to fall into addiction.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Zarząd mnie pytał, dlaczego zmiany nie przyniosły sukcesu.
english: The management board asked me why the changes hadn't brought about success.
glossary: to bring about success/the management board/a change
translation: 9. The management board asked me why changes hadn’t brought success.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Wydrukowałem już wypracowanie.
english: I've already printed out the essay.
glossary: to print out an essay
translation: 10. I’ve already printed out an essay.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Gdzie spałeś zeszłej nocy?
english: Where did you sleep last night?
glossary: last night/to sleep
translation: Where did you sleep last night?

name: Jack Russell
polish: Zupa się popsuje, jeśli nie wstawisz jej do lodówki.
english: The soup will go bad if you don't put it in the fridge.
glossary: to go bad/to put sth in the fridge
translation: The soup gets off If you don’t put it in the fridge.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Oblałeś ostatni test, bo się w ogóle na niego nie uczyłeś.
english: You failed the last test because you hadn't studied for it at all.
glossary: to study for a test/to fail a test/at all
translation: You failed the last test because you hadn’t studied at all.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Rodzice się mnie wczoraj pytali, czy zdałem wszystkie egzaminy.
english: My parents asked me yesterday if I'd passed all the exams.
glossary: to pass an exam/a parent
translation: The parents asked me yesterday if I had passed all the exams.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Chciałbym przeprosić za spóźnienie.
english: I'd like to apologize for being late.
glossary: to be late/to apologize for sth/I'd like to...
translation: I’d like to apologize for being late.

name: Jack Russell
polish: O co jesteś oskarżony?
english: What are you accused of?
glossary: to be accused of sth
translation: What are you accused of?

name: Jack Russell
polish: Nie miałbyś nieświeżego oddechu, gdybyś palił mniej.
english: You wouldn't have bad breath if you smoked less.
glossary: to have bad breath/to smoke
translation: You wouldn’t have bad breath if you would smoke less.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Nie załatwiłem jeszcze wszystkich swoich spraw.
english: I haven't done all my errands yet.
glossary: to do errands
translation: I haven’t done all my errands yet.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Są jakieś listy do mnie?
english: Are there any letters for me?
glossary: a letter for sb
translation: There are some letters for me?

name: Jack Russell
polish: Dobilibyśmy targu, gdybyś się nie odezwał.
english: We would've closed the deal if you hadn't spoken up.
glossary: to speak up/to close a deal
translation: We would have closed a deal, if you hadn’t spoken up.

name: John Connell
polish: Mój tata odebrałby mnie wczoraj, gdyby miał samochód.
english: My dad would've picked me up yesterday if he had a car.
translation: My dad would have taken me yesterday if he had had a car;

name: John Connell
polish: Czułbym się lepiej, gdybym wypił moją poranną kawę.
english: I'd feel better if I'd drunk my morning coffee.
translation: I would feel better if I drunk a morning coffe;

name: John Connell
polish: Zdałbym egzaminy, gdybym więcej się uczył.
english: I would've passed the exams if I'd studied more.
translation: I would have passed the exams if I had studied morel

name: John Connell
polish: Gdybym miał wybierać, wolałbym mieć tylko koty.
english: If I had to choose, I'd prefer to only have cats.
translation: If I have to chose I would have cats;

name: John Connell
polish: Ta drużyna miałaby lepsze wyniki, gdyby więcej trenowała.
english: This team would have better results if they'd trained more.
translation: This team would have better results if they trained more;

name: John Connell
polish: Gdybym znał prawdę, powiedziałbym ją.
english: If I knew the truth, I would've told it.
translation: If I knew the truth I would tell you;

name: John Connell
polish: Co byś zrobił, gdybyś był niewidzialny?
english: What would you do if you were invisible?
translation: What would you do if you were invisible;

name: John Connell
polish: Nie byłbym teraz smutny, gdybym nie stracił pieniędzy.
english: I wouldn't be sad now if I hadn't lost my money.
translation: I wouldn’t were sad now If I hadn’t lost my money;

name: John Connell
polish: Moja mama nie krzyczałaby na mnie, gdybym odrobił lekcje.
english: My mom wouldn't have shouted at me if I had done my homework.
translation: My mother wouldn’t shouted at me If I had done my homework

name: John Connell
polish: Nie pracowałbym teraz w nadgodzinach, gdybym wcześniej skończył swoje zadania.
english: I wouldn't be working overtime now if I had finished my tasks earlier.
translation: I wouldn’t do overhours now if I finished my assignments earlier.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Słyszałam wczoraj, że wygrałeś zawody.
english: I heard yesterday that you'd won a competition.
glossary: to win a competition
translation: 1. Yesterday I heard that you had won the competition

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Jest jeszcze kilka wiadomości, na które muszę odpowiedzieć.
english: There are still a few messages I have to reply to.
glossary: to reply to a message
translation: 2. There are a few messages I need to anwer / reply to?

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Kiedy dotarłem do domu, żona już wyszła.
english: When I got home, my wife had already left.
glossary: to leave/to get home/a wife
translation: 3. When I got home my wife had already left.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Czy jest coś, co powinienem wiedzieć, zanim wykonam ten telefon?
english: Is there anything I should know before making the call?
glossary: to make a call/to know sth
translation: 4. Is there anything I need to know before I make the phone call?

name: Justina Stanley
polish: O czym była twoje ostatnia książka?
english: What was your last book about?
glossary: a book about sth
translation: 5. What was your last book about?

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Policja by nas nie aresztowała, gdybyś nie zachowywał się podejrzanie.
english: The police wouldn't have arrested us if you hadn't behaved suspiciously.
glossary: to behave suspiciously/to arrest sb/the police
translation: 6. The police wouldn't have arrested us if you weren't acting suspiciously

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Będzie mi przykro, jeśli ze mną nie zatańczysz.
english: I'll be sorry if you don't dance with me.
glossary: to dance with sb/to be sorry
translation: 7. I'll be sorry if you don't dance with me.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Chciałbym porozmawiać z tobą o odchudzaniu się.
english: I'd like to talk to you about losing weight.
glossary: to lose weight/I'd like to.../to talk about sth
translation: 8. I would like to talk to you about losing weight

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Jeszcze nie potwierdziłem spotkania.
english: I haven't confirmed the meeting yet.
glossary: to confirm a meeting
translation: 9. I haven't confirmed the meeting yet

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Moi rodzice nie mieliby nic przeciwko naszemu związkowi, gdybyś miał stały dochód.
english: My parents wouldn't have anything against our relationship if you had a steady income.
glossary: to have a steady income/to have nothing against sth/a parent/a relationship
translation: 10. My parents wouldn't have had anything against our relationship if you had a steady income.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Nie przytyłbyś, gdybyś tyle nie jadł.
english: You wouldn't have gained weight if you hadn't eaten so much.
translation: 1. You wouldn't have gained weight if you hadn't eaten too much.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Nie byłabyś w ciąży, gdybyś użyła prezerwatywy.
english: You wouldn't be pregnant if you'd used a condom.
translation: 2. You wouldn't have been pregnant if you had used a condom.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Wyjdę, jeśli przyjdą wredne dziewczyny.
english: I'll leave if the mean girls arrive.
translation: 3. I'll leave if the mean girls come.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Gdybyś nie poszedł późno spać, nie byłbyś tak zmęczony.
english: If you hadn't gone to sleep late, you wouldn't be so tired.
translation: 4. If you hadn't gone to sleep late you wouldn't have been so tired.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Twoja żona wsparłaby cię wczoraj, gdyby cię kochała.
english: Your wife would've supported you yesterday if she loved you.
translation: 5. Your wife would support you yesterday if she loved you

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Jeśli urządzisz przyjęcie, sąsiedzi będą źli.
english: If you throw a party, the neighbors will be upset.
translation: 6. If you organize a party your neighbours will be angry

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Pójdę z tobą, jeśli obiecasz, że dobrze się ubierzesz.
english: I'll go with you if you promise to dress well.
translation: 7. I'll go with you if you promise me you dress up well.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Gdybym był bogaty, kupiłbym drogi samochód.
english: If I were rich, I'd buy an expensive car.
translation: 8. If I were rich, I would buy an expensive car.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Ten piosenkarz byłby sławny, gdyby miał dobrego menedżera.
english: This singer would be famous if he had a good manager.
translation: 9. This singer would be famous if he had a good manager.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Gdybyś nie jechał tak szybko, nie dostałbyś mandatu.
english: If you hadn't been driving so fast, you wouldn't have gotten a ticket.
translation: 10. If you hadn't been driven so fast, you wouldn't have gotten a ticket

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Jest wiele problemów, które nasz zespół musi rozwiązać.
english: There are many problems our team has to solve.
glossary: to solve a problem
translation: 1. There are many problems which our team has to solve.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Gdzie koncertujecie w weekend?
english: Where are you giving a concert on the weekend?
glossary: to give a concert
translation: 2. Where are you giving a concert at the weekend?

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Czy twój mąż często pracuje po godzinach?
english: Does your husband often work overtime?
glossary: to work overtime/a husband
translation: 3. Does your husband often work overtime?

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Jestem pewien, że wkrótce wyzdrowiejesz.
english: I'm sure you'll get better soon.
glossary: to get better/soon
translation: 4.I’m sure you will get better soon.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Czy to się często zdarza?
english: Does it often happen?
glossary: to happen
translation: 5. Does it happen often?

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Kiedy zapisałeś się na wykłady?
english: When did you sign up for the lectures?
glossary: to sign up for sth/a lecture

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Kiedy zrezygnowałeś ze szkolenia?
english: When did you resign from the training course?
glossary: to resign from sth/a training course

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Czy twój komputer działa poprawnie?
english: Does your computer work properly?
glossary: to work properly/a computer
translation: 8. Is your computer working properly?

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Zadzwoniłem do rodziców, kiedy dostałem nagrodę.
english: I called my parents when I got the award.
glossary: to call your parents/to get an award
translation: 9. I called my parents when I had won an award.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Musimy działać. Masz jakiś pomysł?
english: We have to act. Do you have any idea?
glossary: to act/to have an idea
translation: 10. We have to do something. Have you got any ideas?

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Nie przytyłbyś, gdybyś tyle nie jadł.
english: You wouldn't have gained weight if you hadn't eaten so much.
translation: 1. You wouldn’t have gained weight if you hadn’t eaten so much.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Nie byłabyś w ciąży, gdybyś użyła prezerwatywy.
english: You wouldn't be pregnant if you'd used a condom.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Wyjdę, jeśli przyjdą wredne dziewczyny.
english: I'll leave if the mean girls arrive.
translation: 3. I will leave if the mean girls come

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Gdybyś nie poszedł późno spać, nie byłbyś tak zmęczony.

translation: 4. If you hadn’t gone to sleep too late, you wouldn’t be so tired.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Twoja żona wsparłaby cię wczoraj, gdyby cię kochała.
english: Your wife would've supported you yesterday if she loved you.
translation: 5. Your wife would have supported you yesterday if she had loved you.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Jeśli urządzisz przyjęcie, sąsiedzi będą źli.
english: If you throw a party, the neighbors will be upset.
translation: 6. If you organize a party, your neighbors will be angry.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Pójdę z tobą, jeśli obiecasz, że dobrze się ubierzesz.
english: I'll go with you if you promise to dress well.
translation: 7. I will go with you if you dress well.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Gdybym był bogaty, kupiłbym drogi samochód.
english: If I were rich, I'd buy an expensive car.
translation: 8. If I were rich, I would buy an expensive car.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Ten piosenkarz byłby sławny, gdyby miał dobrego menedżera.
english: This singer would be famous if he had a good manager.
translation: 9. This singer will be famous if he has a good manager.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Gdybyś nie jechał tak szybko, nie dostałbyś mandatu.
english: If you hadn't been driving so fast, you wouldn't have gotten a ticket.
translation: 10. If you hadn’t been driving so fast, you wouldn’t have gotten a ticket.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Mój szef byłby bardziej sympatyczny, gdyby nie był tak pesymistyczny.
english: My boss would be more likable if she weren't so pessimistic.
translation: 1. My boss would be nicer if he wasn’t so pessimistic.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Gdybyś wczoraj tyle nie wypił, nie czułbyś się teraz źle.
english: If you hadn't drunk that much yesterday, you wouldn't feel sick now.
translation: 2. If you hadn’t drunk too much yesterday, you wouldn’t be feeling so bad now.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Nie spóźniłbym się na pociąg, gdybym wyszedł wcześniej.
english: I wouldn't have missed the train if I'd left earlier.
translation: 3. I wouldn’t have missed the train, if I had gone earlier.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Na twoim miejscu nie wybaczyłbym mu.
english: If I were you, I wouldn't have forgiven him.
translation: 4. If I were you, I wouldn’t forgive him.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Jeśli on nie odbierze telefonu, pojedziemy bez niego.
english: If he doesn't answer his phone, we'll go without him.
translation: 5. If he doesn’t answer the phone, we will go without him.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Nie adoptowałbym psa, gdybym wiedział, że mam alergię.
english: I wouldn't have adopted a dog if I'd known I was allergic.
translation: 6. If I knew that I have an allergy, I wouldn’t have adopted a dog.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Gdyby mnie nie zdradzał, nie zerwałabym z nim.
english: If he hadn't cheated on me, I wouldn't have broken up with him.
translation: 7. If he hadn’t cheated on me, I wouldn’t have broken up with him..

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Gdybym był na twoim miejscu, powiedziałbym prawdę.
english: If I were you, I'd tell the truth.
translation: 8. If I were you, I would tell the truth.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Gdybyś mnie rozumiał, nie kłócilibyśmy się teraz.
english: If you understood me, we wouldn't be having this argument now.
translation: 9. If you had understood me, we wouldn’t argue now.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Zaprosiłbym ją, gdyby nie była dla mnie taką suką.
english: I would've invited her if she hadn't been such a bitch to me.
translation: 10. I would invite her if she wasn’t such a bitch to me.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Mój tata odebrałby mnie wczoraj, gdyby miał samochód.
english: My dad would've picked me up yesterday if he had a car.
translation: 1. My dad would have picked me yesterday if he had a car.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Czułbym się lepiej, gdybym wypił moją poranną kawę.
english: I'd feel better if I'd drunk my morning coffee.
translation: 2. I would feel better if I had drunk my morning coffee.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Zdałbym egzaminy, gdybym więcej się uczył.
english: I would've passed the exams if I'd studied more.
translation: 3. I would have passed the exam if I had studied more.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Gdybym miał wybierać, wolałbym mieć tylko koty.
english: If I had to choose, I'd prefer to only have cats.
translation: 4. If I had to choose, I would only have cats.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Ta drużyna miałaby lepsze wyniki, gdyby więcej trenowała.
english: This team would have better results if they'd trained more.
translation: 5. This team would have better scores if it trained more.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Gdybym znał prawdę, powiedziałbym ją.
english: If I knew the truth, I would've told it.
translation: 6. If I know the truth, I will tell them.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Co byś zrobił, gdybyś był niewidzialny?
english: What would you do if you were invisible?
translation: 7. What would you do if you were invisible?

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Nie byłbym teraz smutny, gdybym nie stracił pieniędzy.
english: I wouldn't be sad now if I hadn't lost my money.
translation: 8. I wouldn’t be sad now, if I hadn’t lost my money.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Moja mama nie krzyczałaby na mnie, gdybym odrobił lekcje.
english: My mom wouldn't have shouted at me if I had done my homework.
translation: 9. My mom wouldn’t scream at me, if I had done my homework.

name: Isabel Cain
polish: Nie pracowałbym teraz w nadgodzinach, gdybym wcześniej skończył swoje zadania.
english: I wouldn't be working overtime now if I had finished my tasks earlier.
translation: 10. I wouldn’t work overtime if I had finished my tasks earlier.

name: Camille Dew
polish: Kilka tygodni temu dowiedziałem się, że moja żona była już raz mężatką.
english: I found out a few weeks ago that my wife had already been married once.
glossary: to be married/to find sth out/a few weeks ago/a wife
translation: 1 A few weeks ago I found out that my wife had been already married. ?

name: Camille Dew
polish: Już miałam wychodzić, gdy pojawił się szef i powiedział, że potrzebuje, żebym została godzinę dłużej w pracy.
english: I was about to leave when my boss showed up and said he needed me to stay at work an hour longer.
glossary: to be about to do sth/to leave/to show up/to stay at work longer
translation: 2. I was about to leave when my boss appeared and said he needed me to stay at work one hour  longer.

name: Camille Dew
polish: Dlaczego znów wydałeś tyle pieniędzy na niepotrzebne rzeczy?
english: Why did you spend so much money on unnecessary things again?
glossary: to spend money on sth/unnecessary things
translation: 3.Why did you spend the money again for unuseful things?

name: Camille Dew
polish: Moje życie się zmieniło po tym, jak zostałem zwolniony.
english: My life changed after I'd gotten fired.
glossary: a life/to change/to get fired
translation: 4.My life changed after I had been fired.

name: Camille Dew
polish: Czytałbym więcej książek, gdybym nie był ciągle zmęczony.
english: I would read more books if I weren't constantly tired.
glossary: to read a book/to be tired/to be constantly tired
translation: 5. I would read more books if I wasn’t be constantly tired.

name: Camille Dew
polish: Gdybym w zeszłym roku więcej trenowała, byłabym teraz w formie.
english: If I'd worked out more last year, I'd be in shape now.
glossary: to work out/to be in shape
translation: 6. If I had trained more last year, I would be in shape now.

name: Camille Dew
polish: Czy jest tu ktoś zainteresowany tym tematem?
english: Is there anyone here interested in the subject?
glossary: to be interested in a subject
translation: 7.There is anybody here interested in this topic?

name: Camille Dew
polish: O czym przeważnie pisze prasa?
english: What does the press mostly write about?
glossary: the press/to write about sth/mostly
translation: 8.What does the press usually writing about?

name: Camille Dew
polish: Jeśli teraz nie opowiesz mi o swoim problemie, nie będę w stanie ci pomóc.
english: If you don't tell me about your problem now, I won't be able to help you.
glossary: to tell about sth/to be able to do sth/to help sb/a problem
translation: 9. If you don’t tell me about your problem I will not be able to help you.

name: Camille Dew
polish: Nieznajomy opluł mnie, kiedy przechodziłem przez ulicę.
english: A stranger spat at me when I was crossing the street.
glossary: to cross the street/a stranger/to spit at sb
translation: 10. A stranger split on me when I was passing across the street.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Myślę, że dzisiaj będę pracował po godzinach. Co powiesz na czwartek?
english: I think I'll work overtime today. What about Thursday?
glossary: to work overtime/to meet/today/Thursday/What about.../to think
translation: I think I will be working after hours today. What about Thursday?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Myśłałem, że zawieziesz mnie do domu. Nie chcę brać taksówki.
english: I thought you'd take me home. I don't want to take a cab.
glossary: to think/to take sb home/to take a cab
translation: I thought you would take me home. I don’t want to take a cab.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Idę jutro do banku, żeby założyć konto.
english: I'm going to the bank tomorrow to open an account.
glossary: to go to the bank/to open an account/tomorrow
translation: I am going to the bank tomorrow to set up an account.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Skup się na sprzątaniu pokoju.
english: Focus on cleaning the room.
glossary: to focus on sth/to clean a room
translation: Focus on cleaning your room.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Musisz pamiętać, że jest wyjątek do tej zasady.
english: You have to remember that there's an exception to the rule.
glossary: to remember sth/an exception to the rule
translation: You have to remember that there is an exception to this principle.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Chciałabym, żebyś wygłosił przemowę na konferencji.
english: I'd like you to give a speech at the conference.
glossary: to give a speech/at the conference
translation: I would like you to give a speech at the conference.

name: Martin Vance
polish: W tej grupie jest za dużo ludzi. Znajdę inną.
english: There are too many people in the group. I have to find a different one.
glossary: in the group/to find sth/different
translation: There are too many people in this group. I will find different.

name: Martin Vance

name: Claudine Gross

glossary: to chew a gum/to take a new one

name: Claudine Gross

glossary: to brag about sth/to be fed up with sth

polish: Na spotkaniu było kilka osób, które nie miały nic do powiedzenia.
english: There were a few people at the meeting that had nothing to say.
glossary: a few/at the meeting/to have nothing to say
translation: There were a few people at the meeting who had nothing to say.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Miałem w zeszłym tygodniu dużo pracy i bałem się, że nie wyrobię się z terminem.
english: I had a lot of work last week and I was afraid I wouldn't meet the deadline.
glossary: to have a lot of work/last week/to be afraid of sth/to meet the deadline
translation: 1. I had a lot of work last week, and I was afraid I wouldn’t meet the deadline.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Nie powinieneś był wspominać o naszych problemach na spotkaniu z szefem.
english: You shouldn't have mentioned our problems at the meeting with the boss.
glossary: at the meeting/to mention sth
translation: 2. You shouldn’t have mentioned our problems at the meeting with your boss.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Przyjeżdżam jutro do Warszawy i zatrzymuję się u mojej koleżanki.
english: I'm coming to Warsaw tomorrow and staying at my friend's.
glossary: to come to Warsaw
translation: 3. I’m coming Warsaw tomorrow and I’ll stay at my friend’s.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Nie powinieneś był opowiadać tego żartu. Był niegrzeczny.
english: You shouldn't have told the joke. It was rude.
glossary: to be rude to sb/to tell sb a joke
translation: 4. You shouldn’t have told that joke. It was rude.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że nic nie będę musiał dzisiaj robić.
english: I hoped I wouldn't have to do anything today.
glossary: to hope/today
translation: 5. I hoped I wouldn’t have to do anything today.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Powinienem był spędzić zeszły weekend z rodziną.
english: I should've spent my last weekend with my family.
glossary: to spend time with sb/last weekend/a family
translation: 6. I should have spent last weekend with family.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Nie powinienem był Ci opowiadać tej historii, bo jest zbyt prywatna.
english: I shouldn't have told you the story because it's too private.
glossary: to tell sb a story/to be private
translation: 7. I shouldn’t have told you this story, because it’s too private.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że ci klienci zostawią większy napiwek.
english: I hoped the customers would leave a bigger tip.
glossary: to leave a tip/a customer/to hope
translation: 8. I hoped that those customers would leave a bigger tip.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Nie powinieneś był mnie okłamywać.
english: You shouldn't have lied to me.
glossary: to lie to sb
translation: 9. I shouldn’t have lied to me.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Co robisz dziś wieczorem?
english: What are you doing tonight?
translation: 10. What are you doing tonight?

name: John Connell
polish: Miałem w zeszłym tygodniu dużo pracy i bałem się, że nie wyrobię się z terminem.
english: I had a lot of work last week and I was afraid I wouldn't meet the deadline.
glossary: to have a lot of work/last week/to be afraid of sth/to meet the deadline
translation: I had a lot of work last weak, and I was afraid that I didn’t meet the deadline;

name: John Connell
polish: Nie powinieneś był wspominać o naszych problemach na spotkaniu z szefem.

glossary: at the meeting/to mention sth

polish: Przyjeżdżam jutro do Warszawy i zatrzymuję się u mojej koleżanki.
english: I'm coming to Warsaw tomorrow and staying at my friend's.
glossary: to come to Warsaw
translation: I will arrive in Warsaw tomorrow and I will stay at my fńriend’s.

name: John Connell
polish: Nie powinieneś był opowiadać tego żartu. Był niegrzeczny.
english: You shouldn't have told the joke. It was rude.
glossary: to be rude to sb/to tell sb a joke
translation: You shouldn’t tell this joke. It was rude.

name: John Connell
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że nic nie będę musiał dzisiaj robić.
english: I hoped I wouldn't have to do anything today.
glossary: to hope/today
translation: I’ve hoped that I want do anything today;

name: John Connell
polish: Powinienem był spędzić zeszły weekend z rodziną.
english: I should've spent my last weekend with my family.
glossary: to spend time with sb/last weekend/a family
translation: I should spent last weekend with my family;

name: John Connell
polish: Nie powinienem był Ci opowiadać tej historii, bo jest zbyt prywatna.
english: I shouldn't have told you the story because it's too private.
glossary: to tell sb a story/to be private
translation: I shoudln’t told you this story because it’s too personal;

name: John Connell
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że ci klienci zostawią większy napiwek.
english: I hoped the customers would leave a bigger tip.
glossary: to leave a tip/a customer/to hope
translation: I hopend that this customers leave grater tip;

name: John Connell
polish: Nie powinieneś był mnie okłamywać.
english: You shouldn't have lied to me.
glossary: to lie to sb
translation: You shouldn’t lied to me;

name: John Connell
polish: Co robisz dziś wieczorem?
english: What are you doing tonight?
translation: What are you doing tonight?

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Mój szef byłby bardziej sympatyczny, gdyby nie był tak pesymistyczny.
english: My boss would be more likable if she weren't so pessimistic.
translation: 1. My boss would be more friendly if he wasn't so pessimistic.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Gdybyś wczoraj tyle nie wypił, nie czułbyś się teraz źle.
english: If you hadn't drunk that much yesterday, you wouldn't feel sick now.
translation: 2. If you hadn't drunk so much yesterday you wouldn't have felt bad right now

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Nie spóźniłbym się na pociąg, gdybym wyszedł wcześniej.
english: I wouldn't have missed the train if I'd left earlier.
translation: 3. I wouldn't have missed the train if I had left earlier

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Na twoim miejscu nie wybaczyłbym mu.
english: If I were you, I wouldn't have forgiven him.
translation: 4. If I were you I wouldn't forgive him

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Jeśli on nie odbierze telefonu, pojedziemy bez niego.
english: If he doesn't answer his phone, we'll go without him.
translation: 5. If he don't answer the phone he will go without him

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Nie adoptowałbym psa, gdybym wiedział, że mam alergię.
english: I wouldn't have adopted a dog if I'd known I was allergic.
translation: 6. I wouldn't have adopted a dog if I had known, I had an allergy.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Gdyby mnie nie zdradzał, nie zerwałabym z nim.
english: If he hadn't cheated on me, I wouldn't have broken up with him.
translation: 7. If he hadn't cheated on me I wouldn't have broken up with him

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Gdybym był na twoim miejscu, powiedziałbym prawdę.
english: If I were you, I'd tell the truth.
translation: 8. If I were you I would tell him the truth

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Gdybyś mnie rozumiał, nie kłócilibyśmy się teraz.
english: If you understood me, we wouldn't be having this argument now.
translation: 9. If you understood me, we wouldn't argue right now

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Zaprosiłbym ją, gdyby nie była dla mnie taką suką.
english: I would've invited her if she hadn't been such a bitch to me.
translation: 10. I would invite her if she hadn't been a bitch to me.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Mój tata odebrałby mnie wczoraj, gdyby miał samochód.
english: My dad would've picked me up yesterday if he had a car.
translation: 1. My father would picked me up if he had had a car.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Czułbym się lepiej, gdybym wypił moją poranną kawę.
english: I'd feel better if I'd drunk my morning coffee.
translation: 2. I would felt better if I drink my morning coffee

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Zdałbym egzaminy, gdybym więcej się uczył.
english: I would've passed the exams if I'd studied more.
translation: 3. I would passed exams if I have learnt more

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Gdybym miał wybierać, wolałbym mieć tylko koty.
english: If I had to choose, I'd prefer to only have cats.
translation: 4. If I had to choose I would have cats only

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Ta drużyna miałaby lepsze wyniki, gdyby więcej trenowała.
english: This team would have better results if they'd trained more.
translation: 5. This team would have had better results if they had trained more

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Gdybym znał prawdę, powiedziałbym ją.
english: If I knew the truth, I would've told it.
translation: 6. If I had knew the truth I would told you

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Co byś zrobił, gdybyś był niewidzialny?
english: What would you do if you were invisible?
translation: 7. What would you do if you were invisible?

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Nie byłbym teraz smutny, gdybym nie stracił pieniędzy.
english: I wouldn't be sad now if I hadn't lost my money.
translation: 8. I wouldn't be sad now if I hadn't lost the money

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Moja mama nie krzyczałaby na mnie, gdybym odrobił lekcje.
english: My mom wouldn't have shouted at me if I had done my homework.
translation: 9. My mom wouldn't shout at me If I had finished my homework

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Nie pracowałbym teraz w nadgodzinach, gdybym wcześniej skończył swoje zadania.
english: I wouldn't be working overtime now if I had finished my tasks earlier.
translation: 10. I wouldn't have worked overtime now if I had finished my tasks earlier

name: Michael Cain
polish: Pojadę na wakacje, jak już oszczędzę pieniądze.
english: I'll go on vacation once I save some money.
glossary: to go on vacation/to save some money
translation: 1. I will go on vacation, when I save money.

name: Michael Cain
polish: Dam Ci znać, jak już skończę pracę.
english: I'll let you know once I finish work.
glossary: to let sb know/to finish work
translation: 2. I tell you, when I finish work.

name: Michael Cain
polish: Muszę iść wcześnie spać, bo jutro robię prezentację.
english: I have to go to sleep early because I'm giving a presentation tomorrow.
glossary: to go to sleep early/to give a presentation
translation: 3. I have to go sleep early, because tomorrow I make a presentation.

name: Michael Cain
polish: Myślałem, że będziesz tęsknić za domem.
english: I thought you'd feel homesick.
glossary: to feel homesick
translation: 4. I thought, you will missing home.

name: Michael Cain
polish: Zadzwonię do ciebie, jak już będę w domu.
english: I'll call you once I'm at home.
glossary: to call sb/to be at home
translation: 5. I will call to you, when i will be at home.

name: Michael Cain
polish: Wyjeżdżam jutro z miasta. Zadzwonię do ciebie, jak już wrócę.
english: I'm leaving town tomorrow. I'll call you once I'm back.
glossary: once/to leave town/to call sb
translation: 6. Tomorrow I leave the city. I will call to you when i’m back.

name: Michael Cain
polish: Mogłem się nauczyć na test.
english: I could've studied for the test.
glossary: to study for a test
translation: 7. I could prapare for the test.

name: Michael Cain
polish: Odwiozę cię do domu, jak już zjemy kolację.
english: I'll take you home once we eat dinner.
glossary: to take sb home/to eat dinner
translation: 8. I will drive you home, after we eat dinner.

name: Michael Cain
polish: Oglądamy dzisiaj wieczorem mecz. Wpadnij.
english: We're watching a match tonight. Drop by.
glossary: to watch a match/to drop by
translation: 9. We will watch match today evening. Come to us.

name: Michael Cain
polish: Co powiesz na poniedziałek? W weekend zajmuję się psami mojej siostry.
english: What about Monday? I'm taking care of my sister's dogs on the weekend.
glossary: on the weekend/What about.../to take care of sth
translation: 10. What you think about Monday? On the weekend I am with my sister dog’s.

name: Dorothy Slone
polish: Dziś wieczorem jemy na mieście.
english: We're eating out tonight.
glossary: to eat out/tonight
translation: 1.	We’re eating out tonight.

name: Dorothy Slone
polish: Napisała wczoraj do mnie stara znajoma.
english: An old friend of mine texted me yesterday.
glossary: to text sb/an old friend of mine
translation: 2.	An old friend wrote to me yesterday.

name: Dorothy Slone
polish: Powinnaś być ze mnie dumna.
english: You should be proud of me.
glossary: to be proud of sb
translation: 3.	You should be proud of me.

name: Dorothy Slone
polish: Nie powinieneś się zapominać.
english: You shouldn't forget yourself.
glossary: to forget yourself
translation: 4.	You shouldn’t forget.

name: Dorothy Slone
polish: Nie możemy zacząć od początku, bo nie mamy czasu.
english: We can't start over because we don't have time.
glossary: to start over/to have time
translation: 5.	We can’t start from the beginning, we don’t have time.

name: Dorothy Slone
polish: Mam nadzieję, że nadrobisz pracę domową.
english: I hope you'll catch up on your homework.
glossary: to catch up on your homework
translation: 6.	I hope, you can catch up your homework.

name: Dorothy Slone
polish: Obiecuję, że awansujesz w przyszłym roku.
english: I promise you'll get promoted next year.
glossary: to get promoted/next year
translation: 7.	I promise, you will get promoted next year.

name: Dorothy Slone
polish: Musimy wyjśnić sytuację.
english: We have to explain the situation.
glossary: to explain the situation
translation: 8.	We need to explain the situation.

name: Dorothy Slone
polish: Jutro idę na zakupy. Chcesz do mnie dołączyć?
english: I'm going shopping tomorrow. Do you want to join me?
glossary: to go shopping/to join sb
translation: 9.	I’m shopping tomorrow. Would you like to join me?

name: Dorothy Slone
polish: Dzwoniła wczoraj do mnie teściowa.
english: My mother-in-law called me yesterday.
glossary: to call sb
translation: 10.	My mother-in-low called me yesterday.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Po tym, jak zrobiłeś zupę, wszyscy rzygaliśmy.
english: After you'd made the soup, we all threw up.
glossary: to make soup/to throw up
translation: After you did the soup, we all were throwing up.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Czy jest coś, co mogę polepszyć, żeby być bardziej wydajnym, gdy się uczę?
english: Is there anything I can improve to be more efficient while studying?
glossary: to improve sth/to be efficient/to study sth
translation: Is there anything I can improve to be more efficient while studying?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Zjadłabym dużo więcej na weselu, gdybym nie przeszła na dietę parę dni wcześniej,
english: I would've eaten much more at the wedding party if I hadn't gone on a diet a couple of days before.
glossary: a wedding party/to go on a diet/a couple of days
translation: I would have eaten much more at the wedding if I hadn’t gone on a diet a few days before.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Mimo że kolega powiedział, że jego pies nie jest niebezpieczny, bałam się go pogłaskać.
english: Even though my friend said his dog wasn't dangerous, I was afraid to pet it.
glossary: even though/a friend/a dangerous dog/to pet a dog
translation: Although my friend told me that his dog wasn't dangerous, I was afraid of petting him.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Gdybyś nie był zapominalski, cały zespół nie musiałby teraz pracować.
english: If you weren't forgetful, the whole team wouldn't have to work now.
glossary: to be forgetful/the whole team/to work
translation: If you weren't forgetful, the whole team wouldn’t have to work now.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Jeśli nasza firma otworzy nową filię, wszyscy zrobimy się zajęci.
english: If our company opens a new branch, we'll all get busy.
glossary: to open a new branch/a branch/to get busy
translation: If our company opens a new branch, we all will be busy.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Dlaczego zaparkowałeś tak daleko od galerii?
english: Why did you park so far away from the mall?
glossary: to park your car/to be far away from sth/a mall
translation: Why did you park so far from the mall?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Tak szybko jechałem na rowerze, że nie zorientowałem się, że przejechałem znak stop.
english: I was riding a bike so fast that I didn't realize I had run a stop sign.
glossary: to ride a bike/to realize that.../to run a stop sign
translation: I was cycling so fast, that I didn’t realize that I skipped the stop sign.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Widzę, że restauracja ci się nie podoba. Z czym masz problem?
english: I see that you don't like the restaurant. What do you have a problem with?
glossary: to have a problem with sth/a restaurant
translation: I can see that you don’t like the restaurant. What is the problem?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Powiedziałem mamie, że poszedłem do lekarza, bo chciałem ją uspokoić.
english: I told my mom I'd gone to the doctor because I wanted to calm her down.
glossary: to go to the doctor/to calm sb down
translation: I told my mom that I went to the doctor because I wanted to calm her down.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Czy to ma dla ciebie znaczenie?
english: Does it matter to you?
glossary: to matter
translation: 1. Does it matter to you?

name: Anna Forney
polish: Dlaczego próbujesz mnie wrobić?
english: Why are you trying to set me up?
glossary: to try to do sth/to set sb up
translation: 2. Why are you trying to set me up?

name: Anna Forney
polish: Jest wiele miejsc, które chciałbym odwiedzić.
english: There are many places I'd like to visit.
glossary: to visit a place
translation: 3. There are many places which I’d like to visit.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Myślisz, że ci uwierzę?
english: Do you think I'll believe you?
glossary: to believe sb
translation: 4. Do you think I’ll believe you?

name: Anna Forney
polish: Czy ty myślisz, że ze mną wygrasz?
english: Do you think you'll win against me?
glossary: to win against sb
translation: 5. Do you think you will win against me?

name: Anna Forney
polish: Wkurzyłeś się, kiedy zostałeś zwolniony?
english: Did you get mad when you were fired?
glossary: to get mad/to be fired
translation: 6. Were you mad when you got fired?

name: Anna Forney
polish: Może zjesz z nami jutro kolację?
english: Maybe you'll eat dinner with us tomorrow?
glossary: to eat dinner with sb
translation: 7. Maybe you will eat dinner with us tomorrow.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Jest wiele kursów, na które możesz się zapisać.
english: There are many courses you can sign up for.
glossary: to sign up for a course
translation: 8. There are many courses you can sign up.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Przestałem ci ufać, kiedy mnie po raz pierwszy oszukałaś.
english: I stopped trusting you when you cheated on me for the first time.
glossary: to stop doing sth/to trust sb/to cheat sb/for the first time
translation: 9. I stopped trusting you when you’d first cheated me.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Jestem pewien, że mnie nie zawiedziesz.
english: I'm sure you won't let me down.
glossary: to let sb down
translation: 10. I’m sure you won’t let me down.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Mój współpracownik nigdy nie zwraca uwagi na szczegóły. Zawsze muszę poprawiać jego zadania.
english: My coworker never pays attention to detail. I always have to correct his tasks.
glossary: to pay attention to detail/to correct sth
translation: 1.	My colleague has never paid attention to details. I always have to correct his tasks.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Jak długo umniejszasz moje osiągnięcia? Nie będę już tego znosić.
english: How long have you been diminishing my accomplishments? I won't put up with it anymore.
glossary: to diminish sth/to put up with sth
translation: 2.	How long have you been depreciating my achievements? I won’t fed it up anymore.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Jak długo żujesz tę gumę? Weź nową.
english: How long have you been chewing this gum? Take a new one.
glossary: to chew a gum/to take a new one
translation: 3.	How long have you been chewing the gum? Take the new one.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Słyszałem dziś, jak moja córka mówi po angielsku, i to skłoniło mnie do myślenia. Może też powinienem zapisać się na taki kurs.
english: I heard my daughter speaking English today, and it made me think. Maybe I should sign up for such a course as well.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to hear sb doing sth/to sign up for a course
translation: 4.	I heard today how my daughter was speaking English, and it made me think. Maybe, I should sign up for such course too.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: O co prokurator okręgowy chce cię oskarżyć?
english: What does the district attorney want to charge you with?
glossary: a district attorney/to charge sb with sth
translation: 5.	What does the district prosecutor want to charge you with?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Powinniśmy teraz nosić maseczki w sklepach.
english: We are supposed to wear face masks in stores now.
glossary: to wear face masks
translation: 6.	We should wear masks in stores now.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Jak długo tyle bierzesz? Ostatnim razem, kiedy się spotkaliśmy, było taniej.
english: How long have you been charging this much? The last time we met it was cheaper.
glossary: to charge sb
translation: 7.	How long have you been taking that much? Last time when we met it was cheaper.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Od jak dawna chwalisz się swoim nowym samochodem? Czy nie widzisz, że wszyscy mają dość?
english: How long have you been bragging about your new car? Can't you see everyone's fed up?
glossary: to brag about sth/to be fed up with sth
translation: 8.	How long have you been bragging about your new car? Can’t you see that everyone is fed up

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Dlaczego akcje Twojej firmy spadły? Czy coś się stało?
english: Why did your company's shares drop? Did anything happen?
glossary: to drop/a share
translation: 9.	Why did your company’s stock fall? Did something happen?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Mieliśmy się zmieniać, nieprawdaż?
english: We were supposed to take turns, weren't we?
glossary: to take turns
translation: 10.	We’re supposed to change, weren’t we?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Jak długo już nalegasz? Nie rozumiesz, że Ci tego nie dam?
english: How long have you been insisting yet? Don't you understand I won't give it?
glossary: to insist
translation: 1.	How long have you been insisting? Don’t you understand that I won’t give it to you?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: O której wylądował samolot? Nie miał przybyć później?
english: What time did the plane land? Wasn't it supposed to arrive later?
glossary: to land/a plane/to arrive later
translation: 2.	What time did the plane land? Wasn’t it supposed to arrive later?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Twoja partia miała mnie wesprzeć w następnych wyborach.
english: Your party was supposed to back me during the next election.
glossary: to back sb/a party/an election
translation: 3.	Your party was supposed to support me in the next election.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Nigdy nie pozwalasz mi chodzić na imprezy. Nie jestem już dzieckiem.
english: You never let me go to parties. I'm not a kid anymore.
glossary: to let sb do sth
translation: 4.	You never let me go to parties. I’m not a kid anymore.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Jak długo zaprzeczasz prawdzie? Czy to nie najwyższy czas, żeby się z tym zmierzyć?
english: How long have you been denying the truth? Isn't it high time to face it?
glossary: to deny the truth/to face sth
translation: 5.	How long have you been denying the truth? Isn’t the high time to face it?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Nikt nie zmuszał Cię do wybrania tego kursu, więc przestań narzekać.
english: No one made you choose that course, so stop complaining.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to complain about sth
translation: 6.	Nobody forced you to choose this course, so stop complaining.

name: Adam Hunt

glossary: to take a look at sth/once again/to take a look at a document

glossary: to examine a patient

polish: Biegnąc wzdłuż ulicy, zauważyłem bezpańskiego psa.

glossary: to run down the street/to notice sth/a stray dog

glossary: to insist

glossary: to land/a plane/to arrive later

glossary: to deny the truth/to face sth

glossary: behavior/to result in sth

glossary: to have a good time

english: Why don't you want your kids to learn English?
glossary: to learn English

glossary: to be done/to study for an exam/to meet sb

glossary: to go to the lake/to catch a cold/to be afraid of sth

english: I'll move once I find a new job.
glossary: to move/to find a new job
translation: I'll move as son as I find a new job.

name: Susanne Sutton

english: I'll have more energy once I have some coffee.
glossary: to have energy/to have some coffee
translation: I'll have more energy after I have some coffe.

name: Susanne Sutton

english: I'll ask for a pay-raise once my boss is back in the office.
glossary: to ask for a pay-raise/to be back in the office

polish: Jestem podekscytowana, bo jutro widzę się ze starą znajomą.
english: I'm excited because I'm seeing an old friend of mine tomorrow.
glossary: to see sb/to be excited

english: I'm starting an English course next week. I can't wait.
glossary: can't wait/to start an English course

name: Susanne Sutton
polish: Porozmawiamy, jak już będziesz gotowa.

name: Susanne Sutton

english: I was afraid we'd lose the case because of my mistake.

polish: Możemy przełożyć nasze spotkanie? Jutro przyjeżdżają moi rodzice w odwiedziny.
english: Can we put off our meeting? My parents are visiting me tomorrow.
glossary: to visit sb/to put off a meeting

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Nie powinienem był robić takiego bałaganu. Przepraszam.
english: I shouldn't have made such a mess. I'm sorry.

polish: Jestem głodny. Mogłem zjeść śniadanie.
english: I'm hungry. I could've eaten breakfast.
glossary: to be hungry/to eat breakfast

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Mogłem biec szybciej. Zdążyłbym na pociąg.

glossary: to run fast/to catch the train

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Jechałeś bardzo szybko. Bałem się, że będziemy mieli wypadek.
english: You drove very fast. I was afraid we'd have an accident.
glossary: to drive/to be afraid/to have an accident
translation: 4. You drove very fast. I was afraid we would have an accident.

english: We're going shopping downtown tomorrow. Do you want anything?
glossary: to go shopping/to go downtown

glossary: to happen/to be sure/to stick to the plan

polish: Moja najlepsza przyjaciółka wychodzi za mąż w przyszłym tygodniu.
english: My best friend's getting married next week.
glossary: to get married/next week
translation: 7. My best friend is getting married next week.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Nie pracuję jutro, więc możemy jechać nad jezioro.
english: I'm not working tomorrow, so we can go to the lake.
glossary: to work/to go to the lake/tomorrow
translation: 8. I’m not working tomorrow, so we can go to the lake.

name: Chris Mayer

english: Our company laid off a few employees last week because they'd made out fake invoices.

translation: 7. Our company dismissed a few employees last week because they made out fake invoices.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Zrelaksujesz się, jeśli weźmiesz kąpiel.
english: You'll wind down if you take a bath.
glossary: to take a bath/to wind down
translation: 8. You will relax if you take a bath.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Na szczęście przeszliśmy już przez formalności.
english: Fortunately, we've already gone through formalities.
glossary: to go through formalities/Fortunately...
translation: 9. Fortunately, we already went through the formalities.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Wyglądałabym młodziej, gdybym codziennie nakładała krem.
english: I'd look younger if I put on cream every day.
glossary: to look young/to put on cream
translation: 10. I would look younger if I put on a cream every day.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Pojawiłabym się, gdybyś potwierdził wcześniej spotkanie.
english: I would've showed up if you'd confirmed the meeting earlier.
glossary: to show up/to confirm a meeting
translation: Iwould've showed up if had confirmed the meeting earlier.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Zaoszczędziłbyś trochę pieniędzy, gdybyś pił kranówkę.
english: You'd save some money if you drank tap water.
glossary: to drink tap water/to save some money
translation: You would save more money if you drank tap water.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Jakie są opcje?
english: What options are there?
glossary: an option
translation: What are the options?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Będziesz miał szlaban, jeśli nie wrócisz na czas do domu.
english: You'll be grounded if you don't come back home on time.
glossary: on time/to come back home/to be grounded
translation: You'll be grounded if you don't come back home on time.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Kiedy zdałaś sobie sprawę, że zostałaś oszukana?
english: When did you realize you'd been cheated?
glossary: to realize sth/to cheat sb
translation: When did you realize you had been cheaten?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Nie zjedliśmy wczoraj kolacji w restauracji, ponieważ mój mąż zapomniał zarezerwować stolik.
english: We didn't have dinner at the restaurant yesterday because my husband had forgotten to book a table.
glossary: to forget to do sth/to book a table/a husband/to eat dinner; to have dinner/at the restaurant
translation: We didn't eat dinner yesterday because my husband had forgotten to book the table.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Dlaczego jeszcze nie zrobiłeś przelewu?
english: Why haven't you made the transfer yet?
glossary: to make a transfer
translation: Why haven't you made the transfer yet?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Na kogo masz zamiar głosować?
english: Who are you going to vote for?
glossary: to vote for sb/to be going to do sth
translation: Who do you want to vote?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Kiedy zgłosił pan zdarzenie?
english: When did you report the incident?
glossary: an incident/to report sth
translation: When did you report the accident?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Wczoraj marzyłam tylko o zrobieniu sobie drzemki.
english: I only dreamed of taking a nap yesterday.
glossary: to take a nap/to dream of sth
translation: I dreamed only about making a nap yesterday.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Kilka tygodni temu dowiedziałem się, że moja żona była już raz mężatką.
english: I found out a few weeks ago that my wife had already been married once.
glossary: to be married/to find sth out/a few weeks ago/a wife
translation: I found out a few weeks ago that my wife had been married before.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Już miałam wychodzić, gdy pojawił się szef i powiedział, że potrzebuje, żebym została godzinę dłużej w pracy.
english: I was about to leave when my boss showed up and said he needed me to stay at work an hour longer.
glossary: to be about to do sth/to leave/to show up/to stay at work longer
translation: I was about to leave when my boss showed up and said that he need me to stay an hour longer at work.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Dlaczego znów wydałeś tyle pieniędzy na niepotrzebne rzeczy?
english: Why did you spend so much money on unnecessary things again?
glossary: to spend money on sth/unnecessary things
translation: Why did you spend so much money for unnecessary things.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Moje życie się zmieniło po tym, jak zostałem zwolniony.
english: My life changed after I'd gotten fired.
glossary: a life/to change/to get fired
translation: My life was changed right after I had been released.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Czytałbym więcej książek, gdybym nie był ciągle zmęczony.
english: I would read more books if I weren't constantly tired.
glossary: to read a book/to be tired/to be constantly tired
translation: I would read more books if I wasn’t constantly tired.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Gdybym w zeszłym roku więcej trenowała, byłabym teraz w formie.
english: If I'd worked out more last year, I'd be in shape now.
glossary: to work out/to be in shape
translation: If I had treinded more last year I would be in shape now.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Czy jest tu ktoś zainteresowany tym tematem?
english: Is there anyone here interested in the subject?
glossary: to be interested in a subject
translation: Is there anybody interested in a subject?

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: O czym przeważnie pisze prasa?
english: What does the press mostly write about?
glossary: the press/to write about sth/mostly
translation: What do the press mostly write about?

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Jeśli teraz nie opowiesz mi o swoim problemie, nie będę w stanie ci pomóc.
english: If you don't tell me about your problem now, I won't be able to help you.
glossary: to tell about sth/to be able to do sth/to help sb/a problem
translation: If you don’t tell me about your problem now I won’t be able to help you.

name: Agnes Chapman
polish: Nieznajomy opluł mnie, kiedy przechodziłem przez ulicę.
english: A stranger spat at me when I was crossing the street.
glossary: to cross the street/a stranger/to spit at sb
translation: A stranger sp…. me when I crossed the street.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Kiedy się dowiedziałaś, że nie będziesz się kwalifikować do ubezpieczenia?
english: When did you find out that you wouldn't be eligible for insurance?
glossary: to find out about sth/to be eligible for sth/to be eligible for insurance
translation: When did you find out that you won’t be qualified for the insurance?

name: Martin Vance
polish: Kiedy brałem prysznic, wpadłem na świetny pomysł.
english: When I was taking a shower, I came up with a great idea.
glossary: to take a shower/to come up with sth/to come up with an idea
translation: When I was taking a shower, I made up a great idea.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Gdybyś była bardziej nieustępliwa, byłabyś w stanie udowodnić swoje racje.
english: If you were more persistent, you'd be able to prove your point.
glossary: to be persistent/to prove your point/to prove sth
translation: If you were more relentless, you would be able to prove your point.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Kiedy przypomniałaś mi, że zostawiłam klucze w samochodzie, poczułam ulgę.
english: When you reminded me I'd left the keys in the car, I felt relieved.
glossary: to remind sb sth; to remind sth to sb/to feel relieved
translation: When you reminded me that I had left the keys in the car, I felt relieved.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Powinieneś być wdzięczny. Gdybym cię nie ostrzegł, dostałbyś mandat.
english: You should be grateful. If I hadn't warned you, you would've gotten a ticket.
glossary: to be grateful/to warn sb about sth/to get a ticket
translation: You should be grateful to me. If I hadn’t warned you, you would have gotten a ticket.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Zdziwiłem się, kiedy żona mi powiedziała, że chce się wyprowadzić.
english: I got surprised when my wife told me she wanted to move out.
glossary: to get surprised/to move out/a wife
translation: I was surprised when my wife told me that she wanted to move out.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Jeśli coś mi się nie spodoba, po prostu będę się trzymać od tego z daleka.
english: If I don't like anything, I'll simply stay away from it.
glossary: to stay away from sth
translation: If I don’t like something, I just will stay away from it.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Jeszcze nigdy nie byłam na innym kontynencie.
english: I haven't been to a different continent yet.
glossary: a continent
translation: I have never been to a different continent yet.

name: Martin Vance
polish: Dlaczego na świecie jest tyle głodu?
english: Why is there so much hunger in the world?
glossary: hunger/in the world
translation: Why there is so much hunger in the world?

name: Martin Vance
polish: O co walczysz?
english: What are you fighting for?
glossary: to fight for sth
translation: What are you fighting for?

name: Paul Baker
polish: Miałem w zeszłym tygodniu dużo pracy i bałem się, że nie wyrobię się z terminem.
english: I had a lot of work last week and I was afraid I wouldn't meet the deadline.
glossary: to have a lot of work/last week/to be afraid of sth/to meet the deadline
translation: 1. We can go for coffee but I have to do my homework first.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Nie powinieneś był wspominać o naszych problemach na spotkaniu z szefem.
english: You shouldn't have mentioned our problems at the meeting with the boss.
glossary: at the meeting/to mention sth
translation: 2. I want to speed more time with you.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Przyjeżdżam jutro do Warszawy i zatrzymuję się u mojej koleżanki.
english: I'm coming to Warsaw tomorrow and staying at my friend's.
glossary: to come to Warsaw
translation: 3. I don't love you anymore. We have to divorce.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Nie powinieneś był opowiadać tego żartu. Był niegrzeczny.
english: You shouldn't have told the joke. It was rude.
glossary: to be rude to sb/to tell sb a joke
translation: 4. You must keep the deadline because the project is important.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że nic nie będę musiał dzisiaj robić.
english: I hoped I wouldn't have to do anything today.
glossary: to hope/today
translation: 5. I made a mistake, I have to start from the beginning.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Powinienem był spędzić zeszły weekend z rodziną.
english: I should've spent my last weekend with my family.
glossary: to spend time with sb/last weekend/a family
translation: 6. You have to take me some of pictures.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Nie powinienem był Ci opowiadać tej historii, bo jest zbyt prywatna.
english: I shouldn't have told you the story because it's too private.
glossary: to tell sb a story/to be private
translation: 7. Mom, We want to get married this summer.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że ci klienci zostawią większy napiwek.
english: I hoped the customers would leave a bigger tip.
glossary: to leave a tip/a customer/to hope
translation: 8. I don't know ;)

name: Paul Baker
polish: Nie powinieneś był mnie okłamywać.
english: You shouldn't have lied to me.
glossary: to lie to sb
translation: 9. I have to paid a card. I don't have money.

name: Paul Baker
polish: Co robisz dziś wieczorem?
english: What are you doing tonight?
translation: 10. You must tell me this story when we meet.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Próbuję uciec od picia kawy.
english: I'm trying to escape from drinking coffee.
glossary: to drink coffee/to escape from sth
translation: 1. I try to avoid drinking coffe.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Przed czym próbujesz mnie uchronić?
english: What are you trying to save me from?
glossary: to save sb from sth
translation: 2. What you trying to protect me from?

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Gdybym kupił te meble tydzień temu, dostałbym zniżkę.
english: If I'd bought the furniture a week ago, I would've gotten a discount.
glossary: to get a discount/to buy furniture
translation: 3. If I had bought this furniture a week ago, I would have gotten a discount.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Nigdy nie zamykałem drzwi na klucz, dopóki ktoś nie włamał się do mojego domu.
english: I'd never locked the door until someone broke into my house.
glossary: to break into a house/to lock the door
translation: 4. I've never locked the door until someone broke into my house.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Może bym ci uwierzyła, gdybyś miał dowody.
english: Maybe I'd believe you if you had evidence.
glossary: to have evidence/to believe sb
translation: 5. Maybe I will believe you if you had proofs.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Zauważyłem wczoraj, że pracownik mnie okradł.
english: I noticed yesterday that my employee had robbed me.
glossary: to rob sb/to notice sth
translation: 6. I noticed yesterday that my employee had stolen me.

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Dlaczego jeszcze nie dostałem podwyżki?
english: Why haven't I gotten a pay-raise yet?
glossary: to get a pay-raise
translation: 7. Why haven't I gotten a raise yet?

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Gdzie zaparkowałeś samochód?
english: Where did you park your car?
glossary: to park a car
translation: 8. Where did you park your car?

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Czy w okolicy jest bankomat?
english: Is there an ATM nearby?
glossary: nearby/an ATM
translation: 9. Is there an ATM near here?

name: Justina Stanley
polish: Przeziębisz się, jeśli nie założysz czapki.
english: You'll catch a cold if you don't put on a cap.
glossary: to put on a cap/to catch a cold
translation: 10. You get cold if you don't wear a hat

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Łatwo nam było zaspokoić potrzeby tego klienta, bo mieliśmy wszystko, czego chciał.
english: It was easy for us to meet this client's needs because we had everything he wanted.
glossary: to meet your client's needs
translation: It was easy for us to meet this client's needs because we had everything he wanted.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Dlaczego udajesz, że płaczesz?
english: Why are you pretending that you're crying?
glossary: to pretend that.../to cry
translation: Why are you pretending that you cry?

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Mama nie byłaby teraz zła, gdybyś nie rozlał kawy na obrus.
english: Mom wouldn't be mad now if you hadn't spilled coffee on the tablecloth.
glossary: to be mad/to spill coffee/a tablecloth
translation: Your mam would’t be angry now if you hadn't spilled coffee on the tablecloth.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Byłbym wdzięczny, gdybyś powstrzymał się od robienia komentarzy.
english: I would appreciate it if you refrained from making comments.
glossary: to appreciate sth/to refrain from sth/to make comments
translation: I’d be grateful if you refrain from commenting.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Nie kłóciłbyś się teraz ze mną, gdybyś był trzeźwy.
english: You wouldn't be arguing with me now if you were sober.
glossary: to argue with sb/to be sober
translation: You wouldn't be arguing with me now if you were sober. / You wouldn’t argue with me nowi f you were not drunk.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Poczekaj, aż będziesz miał wszystkie potrzebne informacje.
english: Wait until you have all the information needed.
glossary: to have all the information needed
translation: Wait until you'll have all necessary information.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Na twoim miejscu bym się nie czepiał. To może się obrócić przeciwko tobie.
english: I wouldn't nitpick if I were you. It can backfire on you.
glossary: to nitpick/to turn against sb
translation: If I were you I wouldn’t... It can turns against to you.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Mógłbyś teraz pracować, gdybyś naładował wcześniej laptopa.
english: You would be able to work now if you had charged your laptop earlier.
glossary: to be able to do sth/to charge a laptop
translation: You could working now if you had charged your laptop earlier.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Jakich narzędzi potrzebujesz, aby ukończyć zadanie?
english: What tools do you need to finish your task?
glossary: to finish a task/a tool
translation: What kind of tools do you need to finish this task?

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Byłbyś idealnym kandydatem na to stanowisko, gdybyś umiał angielski.
english: You 'd be a perfect match for this position if you knew English.
glossary: to be a perfect candidate for sth/to know English
translation: You’d be the perfect candidate for this position if you had knew English

name: Jack Russell
polish: Od czego to zależy?
english: What does it depend on?
glossary: to depend on sth
translation: What it depends on?

name: Jack Russell
polish: Nie dostanę tej premii, jeśli nie wyrobię się w terminie.
english: I won't get the bonus if I don't meet the deadline.
glossary: to get a bonus/to meet a deadline
translation: I won’t get a bonus If I don’t meet a deadline.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Czy są jacyś inny ochotnicy?
english: Are there any other volunteers?
glossary: a volunteer
translation: Are there any volunteers here?

name: Jack Russell
polish: Zerwałabym z tobą, gdybyś mnie zdradził.
english: I'd break up with you if you cheated on me.
glossary: to cheat on sb/to break up with sb
translation: I would broke up with you If you had cheated on me.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Nie mogłem wczoraj spać, bo wypiłem filiżankę kawy przed pójściem do łóżka.
english: I couldn't sleep yesterday because I'd drunk a cup of coffee before going to bed.
glossary: to sleep/to go to bed/to drink a cup of coffee
translation: I couldn’t sleep yesterday because I had drunk a cup of coffee before going to bed.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Kilka tygodni temu siostra przyznała się, że straciła wszystkie oszczędności.
english: My sister admitted a few weeks ago that she'd lost all her savings.
glossary: to lose your savings/to admit that...
translation: A few weeks ago my sister admit that she had lost all savings.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Kiedy zwróciła pani produkt?
english: When did you return the product?
glossary: to return a product
translation: When did you return the product?

name: Jack Russell
polish: Jeszcze nie zabrałem się do pracy.
english: I haven't gotten down to work yet.
glossary: to get down to work
translation: I haven’t gotten down to work yet.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Nie spóźniłbym się do pracy, gdybym nie utknął w korku.
english: I wouldn't have been late for work if I hadn't gotten stuck in a traffic jam.
glossary: to get stuck in a traffic jam/to be late for work
translation: I wouldn't have been late for work If I hadn't gotten stuck in a traffic jam.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Nie zapłaciłeś mi jeszcze za zajmowanie się twoimi dziećmi.
english: You haven't paid me for taking care of your kids yet.
glossary: to take care of the kids/to pay for sth
translation: You haven’t paid me for looking after your kids yet.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Do czego odnosi się artykuł?
english: What does the article refer to?
glossary: to refer to sth/an article
translation: 1.	What does the article refer to?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Dlaczego pozwoliłeś rodzicom rozpieszczać swoje dzieci?
english: Why did you let your parents spoil your kids?
glossary: to let sb do sth/to spoil your kids
translation: 2.	Why did you let parents spoil their kids?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Miałeś przećwiczyć scenariusz. Jak zamierzasz teraz wyjść na scenę?
english: You were supposed to rehearse the script. How are you going to go on stage now?
glossary: to rehearse the script/to go on stage
translation: 3.	You were supposed to rehearse the scenario. How are you going to go on stage now?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Zbyt często wychodzisz. To nie jest hotel.
english: You're going out way too often. It's not a hotel.
glossary: to go out/to do sth way too often
translation: 4.	You are going out way too often. It’s not a hotel.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Mój tata miał rozebrać te stare meble, ale nie miał czasu.
english: My dad was supposed to take this old furniture apart, but he had no time.
glossary: to take sth apart/to have no time
translation: 5.	My dad was supposed to take the old furniture apart but he had no time.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Jak długo bronisz przestępców? Nie czujesz się z tym źle?
english: How long have you been defending criminals? Don't you feel bad about it?
glossary: to defend sb/to feel bad about sth
translation: 6.	How long have you been defending the criminals? Don’t you feel bad about it?

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Jak długo zlew jest zatkany? Powinniśmy coś z tym zrobić.
english: How long has the sink been stuck? We should do something about it.
glossary: to be stuck/to do sth about sth
translation: 7.	How long has the sink been plugged? We should do something about it.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Po południu miałam ściąć włosy, ale okazało się, że muszę odebrać syna ze szkoły.
english: I was supposed to have my hair cut in the afternoon, but it's turned out I have to pick my son from school.
glossary: to have your hair cut/to pick sb from school
translation: 8.	I was supposed to have my hair cut in the afternoon, but it turned out that I had to pick up my son from school.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Co sprawiło, że wyprowadziłeś się z miasta? Myślałem, że lubisz swoją okolicę.
english: What made you move out of town? I thought you liked your neighborhood.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to like your neighborhood
translation: 9.	What made you move out the city? I thought you liked your surroundings.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Miałeś kosić trawnik. Kiedy zamierzasz to zrobić?
english: You were supposed to mow the lawn. When are you going to do it?
glossary: to mow the lawn
translation: 10.	You were supposed to mow the lawn. When are you going to do it?

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Nie było wczoraj w sklepie żadnego klienta.
english: There was no customer in the store yesterday.
glossary: a customer/in the store
translation: 1. There was no client in the store yesterday.

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Może dołączę do was później.
english: Maybe I'll join you later.
glossary: to join sb/later
translation: 2. Maybe I'll join you later.

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Czy ty mnie okłamujesz?
english: Are you lying to me?
glossary: to lie to sb
translation: 3. Do you lie to me?

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Na ten projekt nie ma pieniędzy.
english: There's no money for the project.
glossary: money for a project/a project
translation: 4. There is no money on that project.

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Jest niewiele osób, które lubię.
english: There are few people I like.
glossary: to like sb
translation: 5. There is no many people which I like.

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Zgubiłem telefon, kiedy poszedłem z psem na spacer.
english: I lost my phone when I went for a walk with my dog.
glossary: to lose your phone/to go for a walk with your dog
translation: 6. I lost my phone  when I was going for a walk with a dog.

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Nie ma powodu, dla którego powinieneś rzucać pracę.
english: There's no reason why you should quit your job.
glossary: It's the reason why.../a reason why.../to quit your job
translation: 7. There is no reason for whom you should quit your work.

name: Monica Grimm
polish: O której masz spotkanie?
english: What time do you have the meeting?
glossary: to have a meeting/What time...
translation: 8. What time you have a metting?

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Robiłeś pracę domową, kiedy chodziłeś do szkoły?
english: Did you do your homework when you went to school?
glossary: to do your homework/to go to school
translation: 9. Did you do your homework when you were going to school?

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Obiecuję, że przestanę plotkować.
english: I promise I'll stop gossiping.
glossary: to stop doing sth/to gossip
translation: 10. I promis I'll stop gossip

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Składając wniosek, pamiętaj, żeby go podpisać.
english: Filing an application, remember to sign it.
glossary: to file an application/to sign an application
translation: 1. When you submit your application, remember to sign it.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Czy ma pan odpowiednie umiejętności, żeby wykonywać tę pracę?
english: Do you have the necessary skills to do the job?
glossary: to have the necessary skills/to do a job
translation: 2. Do you have the right skills to do this job?

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Zawsze chciałem pracować z ludźmi.
english: I've always wanted to work with people.
glossary: to work with people
translation: 3. I've always wanted to work with people.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Gdybyś oszczędzał wodę, zmniejszyłbyś swoje miesięczne rachunki.
english: If you saved water, you'd lower your monthly bills.
glossary: to save water/to lower your bills
translation: 4. If you save water, you would reduce your monthly bills.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Nie możesz dzwonić do mnie w nocy, oczekując, że odbiorę.
english: You can't call me at night expecting that I'll pick up the phone.
glossary: to call sb/at night/to expect sb to do sth
translation: 5. You can't call me at night expecting to answer.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Nie chcę, żeby utrzymywali mnie rodzice.
english: I don't want my parents to provide for me.
glossary: to provide for sb
translation: 6. I don't want my parents to support me.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Zawsze ci mówiłem, żebyś zaczęła oszczędzać pieniądze.
english: I've always told you to start saving money.
glossary: to save money/to start to do sth; to start doing sth
translation: 7. I always told you to start save money.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Moja córka nie zaczęłaby palić, gdyby nie była pod presją rówieśników.
english: My daughter wouldn't have started to smoke if she hadn't been under peer pressure.
glossary: to smoke/to be under peer pressure
translation: 8. My daughter wouldn't have started smoking if she wasn't under peer pressure.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Aplikowałem już na kilka stanowisk, ale nikt jeszcze do mnie nie zadzwonił.
english: I've already applied for a few positions, but no one has called me yet.
glossary: to apply for a position/to call sb
translation: 9. I have already applied for several positions, but no one has called me yet.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Przeczytałem dziś rano wszystkie mejle, pijąc kawę.
english: I read all my emails today, drinking coffee.
glossary: to read emails/to drink coffee
translation: 10. I read all my emails this morning while drinking my coffee.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Czułbym się teraz źle, gdybym wyrzucił te stare ubrania, zamiast oddać je na cele dobroczynne.
english: I'd feel bad now if I'd thrown out the old clothes instead of giving them to charity.
glossary: to feel bad/to throw away your clothes/to give sth to charity
translation: I would feel bad now if I threw out the old clothes instead to get there for charity.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Gdybyś rzeczywiście miał odrę, miałbyś również wysypkę.
english: If you really had measles, you'd also have a rash.
glossary: to have measles/to have a rash
translation: If you really had measles, you would also have a rash.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Miałaś w zeszłym tygodniu lekcję angielskiego?
english: Did you have the English class last week?
glossary: to have an English class/last week

name: Anette Gray
polish: Rzuciłabyś mnie, gdybym cię nie przeprosił?
english: Would you have broken up with me if I hadn't apologized to you?
glossary: to break up with sb/to apologize to sb for sth
translation: Would you have broken up with me If I hadn’t apologized to you?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie uderzyłbym cię w twarz, gdybyś mnie nie sprowokował.
english: I wouldn't have punched you in the face if you hadn't provoked me.
glossary: to punch sb in the face/to provoke sb

name: Anette Gray
polish: Co chcesz, żebym ci powiedział?
english: What do you want me to tell you?
glossary: to tell sb sth
translation: What do you want me to tell you?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Gdybym pościelił dziś rano łóżko, mama by się na mnie nie wkurzyła.
english: If I'd made the bed this morning, my mom wouldn't have gotten mad at me.
glossary: to make the bed/this morning/to get mad at sb
translation: If I had made my bed this morning, mom wouldn’t have gotten mad at me.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nigdy nie ćpałem i nie pochwalam tego.
english: I've never done drugs and I don't approve of it.
glossary: to do drugs/to approve of sth
translation: I’ve never done drugs. I don’t approve of that.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Zwykle ćwiczę, słuchając jednocześnie muzyki.
english: I usually exercise listening to music at the same time.
glossary: to exercise/to listen to music/at the same time

name: Anette Gray
polish: Gdybyśmy przestali używać konserwantów, mielibyśmy więcej klientów.
english: If we stopped using preservatives, we'd have more customers.
glossary: a preservative/a customer
translation: If we stopped using preservatives we would have more clients.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie przytyłbyś, gdybyś tyle nie jadł.
english: You wouldn't have gained weight if you hadn't eaten so much.
translation: You wouldn’t have gained weight if you hadn’t eaten so much.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie byłabyś w ciąży, gdybyś użyła prezerwatywy.
english: You wouldn't be pregnant if you'd used a condom.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Wyjdę, jeśli przyjdą wredne dziewczyny.
english: I'll leave if the mean girls arrive.
