name: Anette Gray
polish: Gdybyś nie poszedł późno spać, nie byłbyś tak zmęczony.
english: If you hadn't gone to sleep late, you wouldn't be so tired.
translation: If you hadn’t gone to sleep late, you wouldn’t be so tired.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Twoja żona wsparłaby cię wczoraj, gdyby cię kochała.
english: Your wife would've supported you yesterday if she loved you.
translation: Your wife would have supported you yesterday if she loved you.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jeśli urządzisz przyjęcie, sąsiedzi będą źli.
english: If you throw a party, the neighbors will be upset.
translation: If you throw a party, the neighbors will be angry.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Pójdę z tobą, jeśli obiecasz, że dobrze się ubierzesz.
english: I'll go with you if you promise to dress well.
translation: I’ll go with you if you promise that you will wear well.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Gdybym był bogaty, kupiłbym drogi samochód.
english: If I were rich, I'd buy an expensive car.
translation: If I were rich I’d buy an expensive car.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Ten piosenkarz byłby sławny, gdyby miał dobrego menedżera.
english: This singer would be famous if he had a good manager.
translation: The singer would be famous if he had a good manager.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Gdybyś nie jechał tak szybko, nie dostałbyś mandatu.
english: If you hadn't been driving so fast, you wouldn't have gotten a ticket.
translation: If you hadn’t been spending, you wouldn’t have gotten a ticket.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Po tym, jak zrobiłeś zupę, wszyscy rzygaliśmy.
english: After you'd made the soup, we all threw up.
glossary: to make soup/to throw up
translation: 1. After that you made the soup, we all threw up.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Czy jest coś, co mogę polepszyć, żeby być bardziej wydajnym, gdy się uczę?
english: Is there anything I can improve to be more efficient while studying?
glossary: to improve sth/to be efficient/to study sth
translation: 2. Is there anything I can improve to be more efficient when I study?

name: Eve Miles
polish: Zjadłabym dużo więcej na weselu, gdybym nie przeszła na dietę parę dni wcześniej,
english: I would've eaten much more at the wedding party if I hadn't gone on a diet a couple of days before.
glossary: a wedding party/to go on a diet/a couple of days
translation: 3. I would have eaten a lot more at the wedding if I hadn't gone on a diet a few days earlier.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Mimo że kolega powiedział, że jego pies nie jest niebezpieczny, bałam się go pogłaskać.
english: Even though my friend said his dog wasn't dangerous, I was afraid to pet it.
glossary: even though/a friend/a dangerous dog/to pet a dog
translation: 4. Even though my friend said his dog wasn't dangerous, I was afraid to pet it.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Gdybyś nie był zapominalski, cały zespół nie musiałby teraz pracować.
english: If you weren't forgetful, the whole team wouldn't have to work now.
glossary: to be forgetful/the whole team/to work
translation: 5. If you weren't forgetful, the whole team wouldn't have to work now.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Jeśli nasza firma otworzy nową filię, wszyscy zrobimy się zajęci.
english: If our company opens a new branch, we'll all get busy.
glossary: to open a new branch/a branch/to get busy
translation: 6. If our company opens a new branch, we will all get busy.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Dlaczego zaparkowałeś tak daleko od galerii?
english: Why did you park so far away from the mall?
glossary: to park your car/to be far away from sth/a mall

name: Eve Miles
polish: Tak szybko jechałem na rowerze, że nie zorientowałem się, że przejechałem znak stop.
english: I was riding a bike so fast that I didn't realize I had run a stop sign.
glossary: to ride a bike/to realize that.../to run a stop sign
translation: 8. I rode a bike so fast that I didn't realize I ran a stop sign.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Widzę, że restauracja ci się nie podoba. Z czym masz problem?
english: I see that you don't like the restaurant. What do you have a problem with?
glossary: to have a problem with sth/a restaurant
translation: 9. I see you don't like the restaurant. What do you have a problem with?

name: Eve Miles
polish: Powiedziałem mamie, że poszedłem do lekarza, bo chciałem ją uspokoić.

glossary: to go to the doctor/to calm sb down

translation: 1.	The last time we saw my best friend told me, that she’d break up with her boyfriend.

polish: Myśłałem, że zawieziesz mnie do domu. Nie chcę brać taksówki.

glossary: to think/to take sb home/to take a cab
translation: 2.	I thought you’d drive me home. I don’t want to get a taxi.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Powiedziałam szefowi, że to szkoda, że umniejszył znaczeniu moich wysiłków.

glossary: to play down the significance of sth/It's a shame that.../a boss/an effort
translation: 3.	I told me boss that I felt sorry for it, that he’d ?????

name: Damien Bean
polish: Zdziwiłem się, kiedy żona mi powiedziała, że chce się wyprowadzić.

glossary: to get surprised/to move out/a wife
translation: 4.	I suprised when my wife told me, that she wanted to move out.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Myślałem, że przejdę w tym roku na emeryturę.

glossary: to retire/this year

name: Damien Bean
polish: Córka obiecała, że nie będzie panikować, kiedy rozpęta się kolejna burza.

glossary: to break out/to freak out/a daughter

name: Damien Bean
polish: Powiedziałem ci, że nie będę cię krył.
english: I told you I wouldn't cover up for you.
glossary: to cover for sb
translation: 7.	I told you I wouldn’t ?????

name: Damien Bean
polish: Powiedziałam ci ostatnim razem, że nie będę cię więcej znosić.

glossary: to put up with sb/last time
translation: 8.	I told you the other day I wouldn’t put up with you anymore.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Powiedziałem ci, że przyprawy uwydatnią smak potrawy.
english: I told you the spices would bring out the flavor of the dish.
glossary: to bring out the flavor/a dish/spices
translation: 9.	I told you that spices ????

name: Damien Bean
polish: Jak długo wątpisz w nasz projekt? Myślałem, że w niego wierzysz.
english: How long have you been doubting our project? I thought you believed in it.
glossary: to doubt sth/to believe in sth
translation: 10.	How long you ???? in our project. I thought you believe in it.

name: Lucas Doe

english: I promise I'll pick up the kids from school on time next week.
glossary: to promise/to pick up the kids from school/on time/next week
translation: I will promise to pick up the kids from school on time next week.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Jestem naprawdę zajęty, więc nie sądzę, że uda mi się spotkać z tobą po pracy.

glossary: to be busy/really/to manage to do sth/to meet sb/after work

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Jesteś zazdrosny, bo ja jadę na ten wyjazd, a ty nie możesz.
english: You're jealous because I'm going on the trip and you can't.
glossary: to be jealous of sb/to go on a trip
translation: You're jealous because I'm going on this trip and you can't.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Spotykam się jutro z nowym klientem, więc muszę się przygotować.
english: I'm meeting a new client tomorrow, so I have to get prepared.
glossary: to meet sb/a client/to get prepared
translation: I'm meeting with a new client tomorrow, so I have to prepare.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Wczoraj przypadkowo skasowałam z komputera wszystkie pliki.
english: I accidentally deleted all my files from the computer yesterday.
glossary: to do sth accidentally/to delete a file from the computer
translation: Yesterday I accidentally deleted all my files from my computer.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Poczułam się rozczarowana, kiedy nowy menedżer powiedział mi, że jest żonaty.
english: I felt disappointed when the new manager told me he was married.
glossary: to feel disappointed/a manager/to be married
translation: I was feeling disappointed when the new manager told me he was married.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Myślę, że powinieneś być bardziej cierpliwy wobec swoich dzieci.
english: I think you should be more patient with your children.
glossary: to be patient with sb
translation: I think you should be more patient with your children.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Znów boli mnie głowa. Muszę iść do lekarza.
english: I have a headache again. I have to go to the doctor.
glossary: to have a headache/to go to the doctor
translation: I get a headache again. I need to go to the doctor.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Nie musisz iść na randkę z tym gościem, jeśli nie chcesz.
english: You don't have to go on a date with the guy if you don't want to.
glossary: to go on a date with sb
translation: You don't have to go on a date with this guy if you don't want to.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Nie powinieneś jeść słodyczy. Są niezdrowe.
english: You shouldn't eat candy. It's unhealthy.
glossary: to eat candy/to be unhealthy
translation: You shouldn't eat sweets. They are unhealthy.

name: Maddie Mills
polish: Ile osób jest w Twoim zespole?
english: How many people are there on your team?
glossary: on the team
translation: 1.How many people are in the team.

name: Maddie Mills
polish: Możemy porozmawiać, bo nie ma tu nikogo.
english: We can talk because there's nobody here.
glossary: to talk about sth
translation: 2.We can talk because nobady is here.

name: Maddie Mills
polish: Jest kilka książek, które chciałbym przeczytać do końca roku.
english: There are a few books I'd like to read by the end of the year.
glossary: a few/to read a book/by the end of the year

name: Maddie Mills
polish: W artykule jest błąd. Popraw go.
english: There's a mistake in the article. Correct it.

english: There are still so many things I have to study for the test.
glossary: to study sth for a test

glossary: in the group/to find sth/different

name: Maddie Mills
polish: Jest kilka osób, które nie wierzą w moją historię.
english: There are a few people that don't believe in my story.
glossary: a few/to believe in sb's story
translation: 7.There are a few people who don't believe in my story.

name: Maddie Mills
polish: Martwię się, bo nie ma na to stanowisko dobrych kandydatów.
english: I'm worried because there are no good candidates for the position.
glossary: to be worried/a candidate for the position
translation: 8.I worry because there are no good candidates for this position.

name: Maddie Mills
polish: Nie ma wątpliwości, że znajdziesz lepszą pracę.

glossary: a doubt/to find a job
translation: 9.There is no doubt that you will find a better job.

name: Maddie Mills
polish: Na spotkaniu było kilka osób, które nie miały nic do powiedzenia.
english: There were a few people at the meeting that had nothing to say.
glossary: a few/at the meeting/to have nothing to say
translation: 10.There are some people at the meeting who had nothing to say.

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Do czego odnosi się artykuł?
english: What does the article refer to?
glossary: to refer to sth/an article
translation: 1. What does the article refer to?

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Dlaczego pozwoliłeś rodzicom rozpieszczać swoje dzieci?
english: Why did you let your parents spoil your kids?
glossary: to let sb do sth/to spoil your kids
translation: 2. Why did you let your parents to spoil the kids?

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Miałeś przećwiczyć scenariusz. Jak zamierzasz teraz wyjść na scenę?
english: You were supposed to rehearse the script. How are you going to go on stage now?
glossary: to rehearse the script/to go on stage
translation: 3. You were supposed to practice the scenario. How do you suppose to go on the scene?

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Zbyt często wychodzisz. To nie jest hotel.
english: You're going out way too often. It's not a hotel.
glossary: to go out/to do sth way too often
translation: 4. You're leaving too often. That's not a hotel.

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Mój tata miał rozebrać te stare meble, ale nie miał czasu.
english: My dad was supposed to take this old furniture apart, but he had no time.
glossary: to take sth apart/to have no time
translation: 5. My dad was supposed to ... those old furnitures, but he didn't have time.

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Jak długo bronisz przestępców? Nie czujesz się z tym źle?
english: How long have you been defending criminals? Don't you feel bad about it?
glossary: to defend sb/to feel bad about sth
translation: 6. How long have you been defending criminals? Don't you feel bad about it?

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Jak długo zlew jest zatkany? Powinniśmy coś z tym zrobić.
english: How long has the sink been stuck? We should do something about it.
glossary: to be stuck/to do sth about sth
translation: 7. How long the sink is ...? We should do someting about it.

polish: Po południu miałam ściąć włosy, ale okazało się, że muszę odebrać syna ze szkoły.
english: I was supposed to have my hair cut in the afternoon, but it's turned out I have to pick my son from school.
glossary: to have your hair cut/to pick sb from school
translation: 8. I was supposed to have my hair done this afternoon, but it turned out that I had to pick my soon up from the school.

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Co sprawiło, że wyprowadziłeś się z miasta? Myślałem, że lubisz swoją okolicę.
english: What made you move out of town? I thought you liked your neighborhood.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to like your neighborhood
translation: 9. What made you move out the city? I thought you liked your neighbourhood.

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Miałeś kosić trawnik. Kiedy zamierzasz to zrobić?
english: You were supposed to mow the lawn. When are you going to do it?
glossary: to mow the lawn
translation: 10. You were supposed to mown a lown. When do you plan to do it?

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Jak długo już nalegasz? Nie rozumiesz, że Ci tego nie dam?
english: How long have you been insisting yet? Don't you understand I won't give it?
glossary: to insist
translation: 1. How long have you been insisting? Don't you understand I won't give it to you?

name: Claudine Gross
polish: O której wylądował samolot? Nie miał przybyć później?
english: What time did the plane land? Wasn't it supposed to arrive later?
glossary: to land/a plane/to arrive later
translation: 2. What time did the plane land? Wasn't it supposed to arrive later?

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Twoja partia miała mnie wesprzeć w następnych wyborach.
english: Your party was supposed to back me during the next election.
glossary: to back sb/a party/an election
translation: 3. Your party was supposed to support me in the next election.

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Nigdy nie pozwalasz mi chodzić na imprezy. Nie jestem już dzieckiem.
english: You never let me go to parties. I'm not a kid anymore.
glossary: to let sb do sth
translation: 4. You never let me go to parties. I'm not a child anymore.

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Jak długo zaprzeczasz prawdzie? Czy to nie najwyższy czas, żeby się z tym zmierzyć?
english: How long have you been denying the truth? Isn't it high time to face it?
glossary: to deny the truth/to face sth
translation: 5. How long you been denying the truth? Isn't it the high time to face it?

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Nikt nie zmuszał Cię do wybrania tego kursu, więc przestań narzekać.
english: No one made you choose that course, so stop complaining.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to complain about sth
translation: 6. Nobody forced you to take this course, so stop complaining.

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Miałem naładować komórkę, ale zupełnie zapomniałem.
english: I was supposed to charge my cell phone, but I totally forgot.
glossary: to charge your cell phone
translation: 7. I was supposed to charge my mobile, but I totally forgot.

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Czym zwykle skutkuje takie zachowanie?
english: What does such behavior usually result in?
glossary: behavior/to result in sth
translation: 8. What does such a behavior result in?

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Mój mąż miał złożyć łóżeczko do kupy, ale był zbyt leniwy.
english: My husband was supposed to put the crib together, but he was too lazy.
glossary: to put sth together/to be too lazy to do sth
translation: 9. My husband was supposed to ..., but he was to lazy.

name: Claudine Gross
polish: Od jak dawna próbujesz wprowadzić swój pierwszy produkt? Chyba minął już rok.
english: How long have you been trying to roll out your first product? I guess it's been a year now.
glossary: to roll sth out
translation: 10. How long have you been trying to launch your first product? One year passed probably.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Dlaczego dzwoniłeś wczoraj do mnie tyle razy?
english: Why did you call me so many times yesterday?
glossary: to call sb/many times
translation: Why did you call me so many times yesterday?

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Z kim wczoraj poszedłeś na imprezę?
english: Who did you go to the party with yesterday?
glossary: to go to a party with sb
translation: Who did you go with to the party yesterday?

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Nie powinnaś była składać obietnicy, jeśli wiedziałaś, że jej nie dotrzymasz.
english: You shouldn't have made the promise if you knew you wouldn't keep it.
glossary: to make a promise/to keep a promise
translation: You shouldn’t have made a promise if you knew you wouldn’t keep it.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Jestem rozczarowana. Byłam pewna, że nie złamiesz obietnicy.
english: I'm disappointed. I was sure you wouldn't break the promise.
glossary: to be disappointed with sth/to be sure/to break a promise
translation: I’m disappointed. I was sure you would’t break your promise.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Ufam ci, bo od dawna razem pracujemy.
english: I trust you because we've been working together for a long time.
glossary: to trust sb/for a long time
translation: I trust you, because we have worked together for a long time.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Możemy porozmawiać, bo nie ma tu nikogo.
english: We can talk because there's nobody here.
glossary: to talk about sth
translation: We can talk, because there is nobody here.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Przeprowadzam się w przyszłym miesiącu na wieś. Nie mogę się doczekać.
english: I'm moving to the countryside next month. I can't wait.
glossary: can't wait/to move to the countryside
translation: I’m moving out to the countryside next month. I can’t wait.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Jest kilka książek, które chciałbym przeczytać do końca roku.
english: There are a few books I'd like to read by the end of the year.
glossary: a few/to read a book/by the end of the year
translation: There are a few books I would like to read by the end of the year.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Mam nadzieję, że zdążę na pociąg. To ostatni.
english: I hope I'll catch the train. It's the last one.
glossary: to catch the train/to catch the last train
translation: I hope to be in time for the train. It’s the last one.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Od miesiąca szukam pracy, ale nie ma interesujących ofert.
english: I've been looking for a job for a month, but there are no interesting offers.
glossary: to look for a job/an offer
translation: I’ve been looking for a job for a month, but there are no interesting offers.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Gdzie dorastałeś?
english: Where did you grow up?
glossary: to grow up
translation: 1.	Where did you grow up?

name: Damien Bean
polish: Nie ma w tym artykule nic interesującego.
english: There's nothing interesting in the article.
glossary: in the article/an interesting article
translation: 2.	There is nothing interesting in the articule.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Do kogo dzwonisz?
english: Who are you calling?
glossary: to call sb
translation: 3.	Who do you call?

name: Damien Bean
polish: O której zwykle zaczynasz pracę?
english: What time do you usually start work?
glossary: to start work/What time...
translation: 4.	What time do you usually start your work?

name: Damien Bean
polish: Było kilka osób, które mi pomogły, gdy byłem w potrzebie.
english: There were a few people that helped me when I was in need.
glossary: to be in need/to help sb
translation: 5.	There were a several people who helped me, when I was in need.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Obiecuję, że nie zrobię nic głupiego.
english: I promise I won't do anything stupid.
glossary: to do sth stupid
translation: 6.	I promise I won’t do anything stupid.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Wierzę, że mnie nie oszukasz.
english: I believe you won't cheat me.
glossary: to cheat sb
translation: 7.	I believe you won’t cheat me.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Przeprowadziłem się kilka lat temu.
english: I moved a few years ago.
glossary: to move/a few years ago
translation: 8.	I moved a few years ago.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Może zmienisz zdanie, kiedy zobaczysz filmik.
english: Maybe you'll change your mind when you see the video.
glossary: to change your mind/a video/to see sth
translation: 9.	Maybe you’ll change when you see a video.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Jest książka, którą musisz przeczytać.
english: There's a book you have to read.
glossary: to read a book
translation: 10.	There’s a book that you have to read.

name: Michael Cain
polish: Co się stało? Byłam pewna, że się pobierzecie.
english: What happened? I was sure you'd get married.
glossary: to happen/to be sure/to get married
translation: 1 What was happened? I’m sure you will married.

name: Michael Cain
polish: Mogłem napisać ten test z angielskiego w zeszłym tygodniu. Teraz nic nie pamiętam.
english: I could've taken the English test last week. I don't remember anything now.
glossary: to take an English test/to remember sth/last week
translation: 2 I could written this english test last week. Now I remember nothing.

name: Michael Cain
polish: Miałem nadzieję, że żona będzie w dobrym humorze.
english: I hoped my wife would be in a good mood.
glossary: to hope/a wife/to be in a good mood
translation: 3 I had hope that wife will be in good humor.

name: Michael Cain
polish: Chciałem powiedzieć Ci prawdę, ale bałem się, że się zdenerwujesz.
english: I wanted to tell you the truth, but I was afraid you'd get mad.
glossary: to tell sb the truth/to be afraid of sth/to get mad
translation: 4 I wanted to say you truth, but I was afraid you will be anger.

name: Michael Cain
polish: Mogłam wydawać mniej pieniędzy na ubrania, bo muszę jeszcze zapłacić rachunki.
english: I could've spent less money on clothes because I still have to pay the bills.
glossary: to spend money on clothes/still/to pay the bills
translation: 5 I could pay less money for clothes because I have to pay the taxes.

name: Michael Cain
polish: Nie powinieneś był tyle pić na imprezie.
english: You shouldn't have drunk so much at the party.
glossary: to drink/at the party
translation: 6 You shuld’t drink to much alcohol on the party.

name: Michael Cain
polish: Nie mogę zasnąć. Nie powinienem był pić kawy tak późno.
english: I can't fall asleep. I shouldn't have drunk coffee so late.
glossary: to fall asleep/to drink coffee/late
translation: 7 I can’t to go to sleep. I shuld’t drink a coffe so late.

name: Michael Cain
polish: Pójdziemy na kawę, jak już będzie ładna pogoda.
english: We'll go for a coffee once the weather is good.
glossary: to go for a coffee/the weather
translation: 8 We will go to coffe when the weather will be good.

name: Michael Cain
polish: Pójdę spać, jak już skończę czytać książkę.
english: I'll go to sleep once I finish reading the book.
glossary: to go to sleep/to finish doing sth
translation: 9 I will go sleep wehn I finish book reading.

name: Michael Cain
polish: Następny weekend spędzam w moim rodzinnym mieście.
english: I'm spending next weekend in my hometown.
glossary: in your hometown/to spend next weekend
translation: 10 Next weekend I spend in my hometown.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Kiedyś spotkania w firmie się ciągnęły, ale znaleźliśmy na to rozwiązanie.
english: Meetings in our company used to drag on, but we found a solution to that.
glossary: to drag on/a meeting/in our company/a solution to sth
translation: 1. Company meetings …......, but we found a solution for that.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Jeśli wciśniesz mnie w swój grafik w tym tygodniu, zapłacę ci więcej.
english: If you fit me in to your schedule this week, I'll pay you more.
glossary: to fit sb in to the schedule/to pay sb
translation: 2. If you push me into your schedule this week I'll pay you more.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Kiedy wszedłem do biura, koleżanka wystawiała faktury.
english: When I entered the office, my colleague was making out invoices.
glossary: to make out an invoice/to enter the office
translation: 3. When I entered into the office, my  coleague was meking invoices.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Kogo jutro zastępujesz?
english: Who are you covering for tomorrow?
glossary: to cover for sb
translation: 4. Who are you …....... tomorrow?

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Na twoim miejscu podjąłbym się tego zadania.
english: If I were you, I would take on the task.
glossary: to take on a task
translation: 5. If I were you, I'd take up the task.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Ta historia jest zmyślona.
english: The story's made up.
glossary: to make up a story
translation: 6. This story is fiction.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Zostałem zwolniony po tym, jak wybuchła pandemia.
english: I was laid off after the pandemic had broken out.
glossary: to break out/to be laid off
translation: 7. I was fired after the pandemic broke out.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Nie powinienem był zalegać z rachunkami. Przepraszam.
english: I shouldn't have fallen behind with the bills. I'm sorry
glossary: to fall behind with the bills
translation: 8. I shouldn't have …........ on my bills. I'm sorry.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Już się rozgrzałem. Możemy iść biegać.
english: I've already warmed up. We can go running.
glossary: to warm up/to go running
translation: 9. I've already warmed up. We can go jogging.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Damy ci znać, jak już wyśledzimy złodzieja.
english: We'll let you know once we track down the thief.
glossary: to track down a thief/to let sb down
translation: 10. We let you know once we've ….............the thief.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Nie było wczoraj w sklepie żadnego klienta.
english: There was no customer in the store yesterday.
glossary: a customer/in the store
translation: 1. There was no client in the store yesterday.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Może dołączę do was później.
english: Maybe I'll join you later.
glossary: to join sb/later
translation: 2. Maybe I’ll join you later.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Czy ty mnie okłamujesz?
english: Are you lying to me?
glossary: to lie to sb
translation: 3. Are you lying to me?

name: Anna Forney
polish: Na ten projekt nie ma pieniędzy.
english: There's no money for the project.
glossary: money for a project/a project
translation: 4. There is no money for this project.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Jest niewiele osób, które lubię.
english: There are few people I like.
glossary: to like sb
translation: 5. There are few people I like.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Zgubiłem telefon, kiedy poszedłem z psem na spacer.
english: I lost my phone when I went for a walk with my dog.
glossary: to lose your phone/to go for a walk with your dog
translation: 6. I lost my phone when I went for a walk with my dog.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Nie ma powodu, dla którego powinieneś rzucać pracę.
english: There's no reason why you should quit your job.
glossary: It's the reason why.../a reason why.../to quit your job
translation: 7. There is no reason why you should quit your job.

name: Anna Forney
polish: O której masz spotkanie?
english: What time do you have the meeting?
glossary: to have a meeting/What time...
translation: 8. What time do you have a meeting?

name: Anna Forney
polish: Robiłeś pracę domową, kiedy chodziłeś do szkoły?
english: Did you do your homework when you went to school?
glossary: to do your homework/to go to school
translation: 9. Did you do your homework when you had been going to school?

name: Anna Forney
polish: Obiecuję, że przestanę plotkować.
english: I promise I'll stop gossiping.
glossary: to stop doing sth/to gossip
translation: 10. I promise I’ll stop gossip.

name: Kate Long
polish: Nie oblałbym testu na prawo jazdy, gdybym nie próbował wyprzedzać innego auta.
english: I wouldn't have failed the driving test if I hadn't tried to overtake a different car.
glossary: to overtake a car/to fail a driving test
translation: 1.I wouldn't have failed a driving test if hadn't tried to overtake a car.

name: Kate Long
polish: Będziesz zdrowszy, jeśli rzucisz palenie.
english: You'll be healthier if you quit smoking.
glossary: to quit smoking/to be healthy
translation: 2. You would be healthy if you suited smoking.

name: Kate Long
polish: Jakie są kierunki na tej uczelni?
english: What programs are there at the university?
glossary: a program/at the university
translation: 3. What are there courses at you university?

name: Kate Long
polish: Dzięki za upieczenie ciasta na moją imprezę urodzinową.
english: Thanks for baking the cake for my birthday party.
glossary: to bake a cake/Thanks for sth/a birthday party
translation: 4. Thanks for bake a cake on my birthday party.

name: Kate Long
polish: Możesz dalej spać. Nie dzwonił jeszcze budzik.
english: You can keep sleeping. The alarm hasn't gone off yet.
glossary: to go off {2}/to keep doing sth
translation: 5. You can still sleep. The alarm hasn't rang yet.

name: Kate Long
polish: Zaspałem wczoraj do pracy, bo budzik nie zadzwonił.
english: I overslept for work yesterday because the alarm hadn't gone off.
glossary: to go off {2}/to oversleep for work/an alarm
translation: 6. I overslept for work yesterday because the alarm hadn't rang.

name: Kate Long
polish: Byłbyś w formie, gdybyś zaczął uprawiać jakiś sport.
english: You'd be fit if you took up a sport.
glossary: to be fit; to be in shape/to take up a sport
translation: 7. You would be in shape if you had do some sports.

name: Kate Long
polish: Kogo zaprosiłaś na ostatnią imprezę?
english: Who did you invite to the last party?
glossary: to invite sb to a party
translation: 8. Who did you invite on the last party?

name: Kate Long
polish: Rzecznik policji potwierdził, że złodziej został zatrzymany.
english: A police spokesperson confirmed that the thief had been detained.
glossary: a police spokesperson/to confirm sth/a thief/to detain sb
translation: 9. A police spokesperson confirmed that the thief had been detained.

name: Kate Long
polish: Nad czym pracujesz?
english: What are you working on?
glossary: to work on sth
translation: 10. What do you work for?

name: Maddie Mayer
polish: Nie przytyłbyś, gdybyś tyle nie jadł.
english: You wouldn't have gained weight if you hadn't eaten so much.
translation: 1. You wouldn’t have get weight, if you hadn’t eaten so much.

name: Maddie Mayer
polish: Nie byłabyś w ciąży, gdybyś użyła prezerwatywy.
english: You wouldn't be pregnant if you'd used a condom.
translation: 2. You wouldn’t have been pregnant, if you had used a condom.

name: Maddie Mayer
polish: Wyjdę, jeśli przyjdą wredne dziewczyny.
english: I'll leave if the mean girls arrive.
translation: 3. I will leave, if the mean girls come.

name: Maddie Mayer
polish: Gdybyś nie poszedł późno spać, nie byłbyś tak zmęczony.
english: If you hadn't gone to sleep late, you wouldn't be so tired.
translation: 4. If you hadn’t gone to sleep late, you wouldn’t be so tired.

name: Maddie Mayer
polish: Twoja żona wsparłaby cię wczoraj, gdyby cię kochała.
english: Your wife would've supported you yesterday if she loved you.
translation: 5. Your wife would have supported you yesterday, if she were love you.

name: Maddie Mayer
polish: Jeśli urządzisz przyjęcie, sąsiedzi będą źli.
english: If you throw a party, the neighbors will be upset.
translation: 6.  If you organize a party, the neighbors will be angry.

name: Maddie Mayer
polish: Pójdę z tobą, jeśli obiecasz, że dobrze się ubierzesz.
english: I'll go with you if you promise to dress well.
translation: 7. I will go with you, if you promise that you dress up well.

name: Maddie Mayer
polish: Gdybym był bogaty, kupiłbym drogi samochód.
english: If I were rich, I'd buy an expensive car.
translation: 8. If I were rich, I would buy an expensive car.

name: Maddie Mayer
polish: Ten piosenkarz byłby sławny, gdyby miał dobrego menedżera.
english: This singer would be famous if he had a good manager.
translation: 9. This singer will be famous, if he has a good manager.

name: Maddie Mayer
polish: Gdybyś nie jechał tak szybko, nie dostałbyś mandatu.
english: If you hadn't been driving so fast, you wouldn't have gotten a ticket.
translation: 10. If you weren’t drive so fast, you wouldn’t get a ticket.

name: Maddie Mayer
polish: Dlaczego dzwoniłeś wczoraj do mnie tyle razy?
english: Why did you call me so many times yesterday?
glossary: to call sb/many times
translation: 1.	Why did you call me so many times yesterday?

name: Maddie Mayer
polish: Z kim wczoraj poszedłeś na imprezę?
english: Who did you go to the party with yesterday?
glossary: to go to a party with sb
translation: 2.	With whom did you go for a party yesterday?

name: Maddie Mayer
polish: Nie powinnaś była składać obietnicy, jeśli wiedziałaś, że jej nie dotrzymasz.
english: You shouldn't have made the promise if you knew you wouldn't keep it.
glossary: to make a promise/to keep a promise
translation: 3.	You shouldn’t have made a promise, if you had known you wouldn’t have kept it.

name: Maddie Mayer
polish: Jestem rozczarowana. Byłam pewna, że nie złamiesz obietnicy.
english: I'm disappointed. I was sure you wouldn't break the promise.
glossary: to be disappointed with sth/to be sure/to break a promise
translation: 4.	I am disappointed. I was sure, you wouldn’t break a promise.

name: Maddie Mayer
polish: Ufam ci, bo od dawna razem pracujemy.
english: I trust you because we've been working together for a long time.
glossary: to trust sb/for a long time
translation: 5.	I trust you because we have been working together for a long time.

name: Maddie Mayer
polish: Możemy porozmawiać, bo nie ma tu nikogo.
english: We can talk because there's nobody here.
glossary: to talk about sth
translation: 6.	We can talk because nobody is here.

name: Maddie Mayer
polish: Przeprowadzam się w przyszłym miesiącu na wieś. Nie mogę się doczekać.
english: I'm moving to the countryside next month. I can't wait.
glossary: can't wait/to move to the countryside
translation: 7.	I am moving to the village next month. Can’t wait.

name: Maddie Mayer
polish: Jest kilka książek, które chciałbym przeczytać do końca roku.
english: There are a few books I'd like to read by the end of the year.
glossary: a few/to read a book/by the end of the year
translation: 8.	There are a few books, which I would like to read by the end of the year.

name: Maddie Mayer
polish: Mam nadzieję, że zdążę na pociąg. To ostatni.
english: I hope I'll catch the train. It's the last one.
glossary: to catch the train/to catch the last train
translation: 9.	I hope I will catch the train. It’s the last.

name: Maddie Mayer
polish: Od miesiąca szukam pracy, ale nie ma interesujących ofert.
english: I've been looking for a job for a month, but there are no interesting offers.
glossary: to look for a job/an offer
translation: 10.	I have been looking for a job for a month, but there is no interesting offers.

name: Maddie Mayer
polish: Mój szef byłby bardziej sympatyczny, gdyby nie był tak pesymistyczny.
english: My boss would be more likable if she weren't so pessimistic.
translation: 1.	My boss would be more sympathetic, if he wasn’t so pessimistic.

name: Maddie Mayer
polish: Gdybyś wczoraj tyle nie wypił, nie czułbyś się teraz źle.
english: If you hadn't drunk that much yesterday, you wouldn't feel sick now.
translation: 2.	If you hadn’t drunk so much yesterday, you wouldn’t feel so bad now.

name: Maddie Mayer
polish: Nie spóźniłbym się na pociąg, gdybym wyszedł wcześniej.
english: I wouldn't have missed the train if I'd left earlier.
translation: 3.	I hadn’t been late for a train, if I would have left earlier.

name: Maddie Mayer
polish: Na twoim miejscu nie wybaczyłbym mu.
english: If I were you, I wouldn't have forgiven him.
translation: 4.	If I were you, I wouldn’t forgive him.

name: Maddie Mayer
polish: Jeśli on nie odbierze telefonu, pojedziemy bez niego.
english: If he doesn't answer his phone, we'll go without him.
translation: 5.	If he won’t pick up a phone, we will go without him.

name: Maddie Mayer
polish: Nie adoptowałbym psa, gdybym wiedział, że mam alergię.
english: I wouldn't have adopted a dog if I'd known I was allergic.
translation: 6.	I wouldn’t have adopted a dog, if I had known I had an allergy.

name: Maddie Mayer
polish: Gdyby mnie nie zdradzał, nie zerwałabym z nim.
english: If he hadn't cheated on me, I wouldn't have broken up with him.
translation: 7.	If he hadn’t cheated on me, I wouldn’t have broken up with him.

name: Maddie Mayer
polish: Gdybym był na twoim miejscu, powiedziałbym prawdę.
english: If I were you, I'd tell the truth.
translation: 8.	If I were you, I would tell the truth.

name: Maddie Mayer
polish: Gdybyś mnie rozumiał, nie kłócilibyśmy się teraz.
english: If you understood me, we wouldn't be having this argument now.
translation: 9.	If you were understand me, we wouldn’t have a fight now.

name: Maddie Mayer
polish: Zaprosiłbym ją, gdyby nie była dla mnie taką suką.
english: I would've invited her if she hadn't been such a bitch to me.
translation: 10.	I would have invited her, if she weren’t such a bitch for me.

name: Maddie Mayer
polish: Mój tata odebrałby mnie wczoraj, gdyby miał samochód.
english: My dad would've picked me up yesterday if he had a car.
translation: 1.	My dad would have picked me up yesterday, if he had a car.

name: Maddie Mayer
polish: Czułbym się lepiej, gdybym wypił moją poranną kawę.
english: I'd feel better if I'd drunk my morning coffee.
translation: 2.	I would feel better, if I had drunk my morning coffee.

name: Maddie Mayer
polish: Zdałbym egzaminy, gdybym więcej się uczył.
english: I would've passed the exams if I'd studied more.
translation: 3.	I would have passed the exams, if I had studied more.

name: Maddie Mayer
polish: Gdybym miał wybierać, wolałbym mieć tylko koty.
english: If I had to choose, I'd prefer to only have cats.
translation: 4.	If I had to choose, I would prefer to have cats only.

name: Maddie Mayer
polish: Ta drużyna miałaby lepsze wyniki, gdyby więcej trenowała.
english: This team would have better results if they'd trained more.
translation: 5.	The team would have better results, if it had trained more.

name: Maddie Mayer
polish: Gdybym znał prawdę, powiedziałbym ją.
english: If I knew the truth, I would've told it.
translation: 6.	I had known the truth, I would tell it.

name: Maddie Mayer
polish: Co byś zrobił, gdybyś był niewidzialny?
english: What would you do if you were invisible?
translation: 7.	What would you do, if you were invisible?

name: Maddie Mayer
polish: Nie byłbym teraz smutny, gdybym nie stracił pieniędzy.
english: I wouldn't be sad now if I hadn't lost my money.
translation: 8.	I wouldn’t be sad, if I hadn’t lost money.

name: Maddie Mayer
polish: Moja mama nie krzyczałaby na mnie, gdybym odrobił lekcje.
english: My mom wouldn't have shouted at me if I had done my homework.
translation: 9.	My mom wouldn’t have yelled at me, if I had done my homework.

name: Maddie Mayer
polish: Nie pracowałbym teraz w nadgodzinach, gdybym wcześniej skończył swoje zadania.
english: I wouldn't be working overtime now if I had finished my tasks earlier.
translation: 10.	I wouldn’t work overtime, if I had done my tasks earlier.

name: Dorothy Slone
polish: Nie musisz mieć wyrzutów sumienia.
english: You don't need to have remorse.
glossary: to have remorse
translation: 1.	You don’t have to feel remorse.

name: Dorothy Slone

name: Justina Stanley

translation: 10. I never paid any bills, until I moved out of my parents house.

english: I started learning English a year ago.
glossary: to start learning English/last year

name: Isabel Cain

name: Isabel Cain

name: Isabel Cain

glossary: to let sb know/the police/to arrest sb

glossary: a document/on the desk/to need sth

name: Isabel Cain

glossary: to find out about sth/to be eligible for sth/to be eligible for insurance

english: I don't want you to tell me how to live.
glossary: to live/to tell sb sth
translation: 9. Nie chcę, żebyś mi mówił, jak żyć.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Wygrałem już przedtem podobną sprawę, więc może się pani czuć bezpiecznie.
english: I've already won a similar case before, so you can feel safe.
glossary: to win a case/a similar case/to feel safe
translation: 10. Wygrałem już przedtem podobną sprawę, więc może się pani czuć bezpiecznie.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Mój szef byłby bardziej sympatyczny, gdyby nie był tak pesymistyczny.
english: My boss would be more likable if she weren't so pessimistic.
translation: My boss would be nicer if you weren’t so pessimistic.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Gdybyś wczoraj tyle nie wypił, nie czułbyś się teraz źle.
english: If you hadn't drunk that much yesterday, you wouldn't feel sick now.
translation: If you didn't drink so much yesterday, you wouldn’t feel bad now.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie spóźniłbym się na pociąg, gdybym wyszedł wcześniej.
english: I wouldn't have missed the train if I'd left earlier.
translation: I wouldn’t have missed the train if I had left earlier.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Na twoim miejscu nie wybaczyłbym mu.
english: If I were you, I wouldn't have forgiven him.
translation: If I were you, I wouldn’t forgive him.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Jeśli on nie odbierze telefonu, pojedziemy bez niego.
english: If he doesn't answer his phone, we'll go without him.
translation: If he doesn't pick up the phone, we’ll go without him.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie adoptowałbym psa, gdybym wiedział, że mam alergię.
english: I wouldn't have adopted a dog if I'd known I was allergic.
translation: I wouldn’t have adopted a dog if I had known that it is allergic.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Gdyby mnie nie zdradzał, nie zerwałabym z nim.
english: If he hadn't cheated on me, I wouldn't have broken up with him.
translation: If he hadn’t cheated me, I wouldn’t have broken him.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Gdybym był na twoim miejscu, powiedziałbym prawdę.
english: If I were you, I'd tell the truth.
translation: If I were you I’d tell the truth.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Gdybyś mnie rozumiał, nie kłócilibyśmy się teraz.
english: If you understood me, we wouldn't be having this argument now.
translation: If you were understanding me, we wouldn’t argue now.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Zaprosiłbym ją, gdyby nie była dla mnie taką suką.
english: I would've invited her if she hadn't been such a bitch to me.
translation: I would invite her if she wasn’t such a bitch to me.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Zwolnię cię. Zobaczysz.
english: I'll fire you. You'll see.
glossary: to fire sb/to see sth
translation: I will fire you. You'll see.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Dostaniesz awans. Cieszysz się?
english: You'll get promoted. Are you happy?
glossary: to get promoted/to be happy about sth
translation: You'll get a promotion. Are you happy?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Jutro omawiamy bieżące problemy na spotkaniu.
english: We're discussing the current problems at the meeting tomorrow.
glossary: to discuss sth/the current problems/at the meeting
translation: We discuss current problems at a meeting tomorrow.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Jutro zamawiamy jedzenie.
english: We're ordering food tomorrow.
glossary: to order food
translation: We order food tomorrow.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Wybrałam właściwego nauczyciela.
english: I chose the right teacher.
glossary: a teacher/to choose sth/the right teacher
translation: I chose the right teacher.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Wczoraj zamówiłam pizzę.
english: I ordered a pizza yesterday.
glossary: to order a pizza
translation: I ordered pizza yesterday.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Muszę wyjaśnić sytuację.
english: I have to explain the situation.
glossary: to explain the situation
translation: I have to explain the situation.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Powinnaś zadzwonić do swoich rodziców.
english: You should call your parents.
glossary: a parent/to call sb
translation: You should call your parents.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Nie możesz mnie okłamywać.
english: You can't lie to me.
glossary: to lie to sb
translation: You can't lie to me.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Nie powinnaś wierzyć swojemu mężowi.
english: You shouldn't believe your husband.
glossary: to believe sb
translation: You shouldn't believe your husband.

name: John Connell
polish: Myślę, że odwiedzę cię w weekend, bo jutro wracam późno do domu.
english: I think I'll visit you on the weekend because I'm coming back home late tomorrow.
glossary: to visit sb/to come back home late
translation: You don't have to pick me up from school tomorrow because I sleep at friend’s.

name: John Connell
polish: Nie wychodź teraz z domu, bo jest zbyt gorąco.
english: Don't leave the house now because it's too hot.
glossary: to leave the house
translation: I thought we would eat downtown today

name: John Connell
polish: Zepsułam telefon mojej mamy. Nie wiem, co powinnam teraz zrobić.
english: I broke my mom's cell phone. I don't know what I should do now.
glossary: to break a cell phone
translation: I could’ve spent less money yesterday.

name: John Connell
polish: Nie mogę teraz rozmawiać, bo nie mam czasu.
english: I can't talk now because I don't have time.
glossary: to talk to sb
translation: There is no one at home. That's why it's so quiet.

name: John Connell
polish: Kiedy wyjeżdżasz?
english: When are you leaving?
glossary: to leave
translation: I don’t know what I should answer.

name: John Connell
polish: Mogłem zostać w domu, bo nie ma tu nic do roboty.
english: I could've stayed at home because there's nothing to do here.
glossary: to stay at home/to have nothing to do
translation: I was sure you would do your homework.

name: John Connell
polish: Gdzie byłeś? Nie mogłem cię znaleźć.
english: Where were you? I couldn't find you.
translation: I didn’t go on vacation last year because I didn't have money.

name: John Connell
polish: Nie zapłaciłam rachunków w zeszłym miesiącu, bo nie miałam żadnych pieniędzy.
english: I didn't pay the bills last month because I didn't have any money.
glossary: to pay the bills
translation: I’ll always find time for you because you’re important to me.

name: John Connell
polish: Zawsze ci pomogę, bo jesteś siostrą mojej żony.
english: I'll always help you because you're my wife's sister.
glossary: to help sb
translation: I can’t concentrate when it’s so loud;

name: John Connell
polish: Byłam pewna, że spędzimy razem więcej czasu.
english: I was sure we'd spend more time together.
glossary: to be sure that.../to spend time with sb
translation: We’re playing a match tomorrow. Will you join us?

name: John Connell
polish: Nie będziesz musiała mnie odbierać jutro ze szkoły, bo śpię u koleżanki.
english: You won't have to pick me up from school tomorrow because I'm sleeping at my friend's.
glossary: to pick sb up from school/to sleep at your friend's
translation: I think I'll visit you at the weekend because I'm coming home late tomorrow.

name: John Connell
polish: Myślałem, że zjemy dzisiaj na mieście.
english: I thought we'd eat out today.
glossary: to eat out
translation: Don't leave the house now because it's too hot.

name: John Connell
polish: Mogłem wczoraj wydać mniej pieniędzy.
english: I could've spent less money yesterday.
glossary: to spend money on sth
translation: I broke my mother's phone. I don't know what I should do now.

name: John Connell
polish: Nie ma nikogo w domu. Dlatego jest tak cicho.
english: There's no one at home. That's why it's so silent.
glossary: to be at home/to be silent
translation: I can't talk now because I don't have time.

name: John Connell
polish: Nie wiem, co powinienem odpowiedzieć.
english: I don't know what I should answer.
glossary: to answer a question
translation: When are you leaving?

name: John Connell
polish: Byłem pewny, że zrobisz swoją pracę domową.
english: I was sure you'd do your homework.
glossary: to do your homework
translation: I could stay at home because there is nothing to do here.

name: John Connell
polish: W zeszłym roku nie pojechałem na wakacje, ponieważ nie miałem pieniędzy.
english: I didn't go on vacation last year because I didn't have any money.
glossary: to go on vacation/to have no money
translation: Where have you been? I couldn't find you.

name: John Connell
polish: Zawsze znajdę dla ciebie czas, bo jesteś dla mnie ważna.
english: I'll always find time for you because you're important to me.
glossary: to find time for sb/to be important to sb
translation: I didn't pay my bills last month because I didn't have any money.

name: John Connell
polish: Nie mogę się skupić, gdy jest tak głośno.
english: I can't focus when it's so loud.
glossary: to focus on sth/to be loud
translation: I will always help you because you are my wife's sister.

name: John Connell
polish: Gramy jutro mecz. Dołączysz do nas?
english: We're playing a match tomorrow. Will you join us?
glossary: to play a match/to join sb
translation: I was sure we would spend more time together.

name: Dorothy Slone
polish: Moja mama przeszła w zeszłym roku na emeryturę.
english: My mom retired last year.
glossary: to retire/last year
translation: 1.	My mother retired last year.

name: Dorothy Slone
polish: Nie wierzę. Znajomi znowu mnie wystawili.
english: I can't believe it. My friends stood me up again.
glossary: to believe sb/to stand sb up/a friend
translation: 2.	I don’t believe. My friends stood me up again.

name: Dorothy Slone
polish: Dawno cię nie widziałam. Musisz wpaść w tym tygodniu.
english: I haven't seen you for a long time. You have to drop by this week.
glossary: to drop by/for a long time/this week
translation: 3.	I haven’t see you for a long time. You must come around this week.

name: Dorothy Slone
polish: Nie możesz unikać odpowiedzialności.
english: You can't avoid responsibility.
glossary: to avoid responsibility
translation: 4.	You can’t avoid responsibility.

name: Dorothy Slone
polish: Nie możesz się tak zachowywać.
english: You can't behave like that.
glossary: to behave
translation: 5.	You can’t behave like that.

name: Dorothy Slone
polish: Nie idę z wami jutro na imprezę. Pracuję na nocną zmianę.
english: I'm not going to the party with you tomorrow. I'm working the night shift.
glossary: to go to a party with sb/to work the night shift
translation: 6.	I’m not going with you at the party tomorrow. I’m working the night shift.

name: Dorothy Slone
polish: Nie będę w stanie pojawić się w weekend, bo pracuję.
english: I won't be able to show up on the weekend because I'm working.
glossary: to show up/to work on the weekend/to be able to do sth
translation: 7.	I won't be able to show up on the weekend because I'm working.

name: Dorothy Slone
polish: Mam nadzieję, że nie będę mieć jutro kaca.
english: I hope I won't have a hangover tomorrow.
glossary: to have a hangover
translation: 8.	I hope I won’t have a hangover tomorrow.

name: Dorothy Slone
polish: Musisz mnie przeprosić.
english: You have to apologize to me.
glossary: to apologize to sb
translation: 9.	You must apologize to me.

name: Dorothy Slone
polish: Pozwę cię. Zobaczysz.
english: I'll sue you. You'll see.
glossary: to sue sb/to see sth
translation: 10.	 I’ll sue you. You’ll see.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Nasz zespół wygrał jak dotąd jedną nagrodę, ale pracujemy nad tym.
english: Our team has won one prize so far, but we're working on it.
glossary: to win a prize/so far/to work on sth/a team
translation: 1. Our team has won one award so far, but we are working on it.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Śnił ci się wczoraj koszmar?
english: Did you have a bad dream yesterday?
glossary: to have a bad dream
translation: 2. Did you have a nightmare yesterday?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Nie byłbym w stanie teraz nic ugotować, gdyby ciocia mnie nie nauczyła, jak to się robi.
english: I wouldn't be able to cook anything now if my aunt hadn't taught me how to do it.
glossary: to cook/to teach sb how to do sth/an aunt
translation: 3. I wouldn't be able to cook anything now if my aunt didn't teach me how to do it.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Nie bolałyby cię plecy, gdybyś nie siedział codziennie przed telewizorem.
english: You wouldn't have back pain if you didn't sit in front of the TV every day.
glossary: to have back pain/to sit in front of the TV/every day
translation: 4. Your back wouldn't hurt if you didn't sit in front of the TV every day.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Płacilibyśmy mniej, gdybyśmy wynajęli mieszkanie razem.
english: We'd pay less if we rented an apartment together.
glossary: to rent an apartment
translation: 5. We would pay less if we rented an apartment together.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Ryzykujesz swoją pracę, kłócąc się ze swoim szefem.
english: You're risking your job arguing with your boss.
glossary: to risk your job/to argue with sb/a boss
translation: 6. You risk your job arguing with your boss.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Gdybym przeszła teraz na emeryturę, musiałabym codziennie siedzieć sama w domu.
english: If I retired now, I'd have to sit at home alone every day.
glossary: to retire/to sit at home
translation: 7. If I retired now, I would have to sit alone at home every day.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Dołączyłbym do was, gdybym nie zapomniał kąpielówek.
english: I'd join you if I hadn't forgotten my swim trunks.
glossary: to join sb/to forget sth/swim trunks
translation: 8. I would join you if I hadn't forgotten my swimming trunks.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Z kim chcesz, żebym porozmawiał?
english: Who do you want me to talk to?
glossary: to talk to sb
translation: 9. Who do you want me to talk to?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Gdybyś prowadził własną firmę, miałbyś więcej problemów.
english: If you ran your own company, you would have more problems.
glossary: to run your own company/to have a problem
translation: 10. If you ran your own business, you would have more problems.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Zmarnowałem godzinę, czekając na ciebie na zewnątrz.
english: I wasted an hour waiting for you outside.
glossary: to waste your time/to wait for sb/outside
translation: 1. I wasted an hour waiting for you outside.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Leżelibyśmy teraz na plaży, gdyby nasz lot nie został odwołany.
english: We'd be lying on the beach now if our flight hadn't been canceled.
glossary: to lie on the beach/to cancel a flight
translation: 2. We would be lying on the beach right now if our flight hadn't been cancelled.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Dobrze się wczoraj bawiłaś ze znajomymi?
english: Did you have a good time with your friends yesterday?
glossary: to have a good time
translation: 3. Did you have fun with your friends yesterday?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Jak dotąd policja zatrzymała jedną osobę podejrzaną o dokonanie kradzieży.
english: So far the police have detained one person suspected of committing the theft.
glossary: the police/to detain sb/to be suspected of sth/to commit theft
translation: 4. So far, the police have detained one person suspected of committing the theft.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Nie byłbyś teraz spłukany, gdybyś nie imprezował w zeszły weekend.
english: You wouldn't be broke now if you hadn't partied last weekend.
glossary: to be broke/to party/last weekend
translation: 5. You wouldn't be broke right now if you didn't party last weekend.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Łatwiej byłoby mi dojeżdżać do pracy, gdybym mieszkał w mieście.
english: It would be easier for me to commute to work if I lived in the city.
glossary: to commute to work/to live in the city
translation: 6. It would be easier for me to commute to work if I lived in the city.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Mogłybyśmy ćwiczyć razem, gdybyś też się zapisała na zajęcia z jogi.
english: We could exercise together if you signed up for yoga classes too.
glossary: to exercise/to sign up for yoga classes
translation: 7. We could exercise together if you also signed up for a yoga class.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Dlaczego nie chcesz, żeby twoje dzieci uczyły się angielskiego?
english: Why don't you want your kids to learn English?
glossary: to learn English
translation: 8. Why don't you want your children to learn English?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Zrobiłabym panu teraz zastrzyk, gdyby się pan tak nie trząsł.
english: I'd give you an injection now if you didn't tremble so much.
glossary: to give sb an injection/to tremble
translation: 9. I would give you an injection now if you didn't shake like that.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Nie dostalibyśmy zatrucia pokarmowego, gdybyś umiał gotować.
english: We wouldn't have gotten food poisoning if you could cook.
glossary: to get food poisoning/to cook
translation: 10. We wouldn't get food poisoning if you knew how to cook.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Czułbym się teraz źle, gdybym wyrzucił te stare ubrania, zamiast oddać je na cele dobroczynne.
english: I'd feel bad now if I'd thrown out the old clothes instead of giving them to charity.
glossary: to feel bad/to throw away your clothes/to give sth to charity
translation: 1. I would feel bad now if I threw away those old clothes instead of giving them away to charity.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Gdybyś rzeczywiście miał odrę, miałbyś również wysypkę.
english: If you really had measles, you'd also have a rash.
glossary: to have measles/to have a rash
translation: 2. If you actually had measles, you would also have a rash.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Miałaś w zeszłym tygodniu lekcję angielskiego?
english: Did you have the English class last week?
glossary: to have an English class/last week
translation: 3. Did you have an English class last week?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Rzuciłabyś mnie, gdybym cię nie przeprosił?
english: Would you have broken up with me if I hadn't apologized to you?
glossary: to break up with sb/to apologize to sb for sth
translation: 4. Would you dump me if I didn't apologize to you?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Nie uderzyłbym cię w twarz, gdybyś mnie nie sprowokował.
english: I wouldn't have punched you in the face if you hadn't provoked me.
glossary: to punch sb in the face/to provoke sb
translation: 5. I wouldn't punch you in the face if you didn't provoke me.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Co chcesz, żebym ci powiedział?
english: What do you want me to tell you?
glossary: to tell sb sth
translation: 6. What do you want me to tell you?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Gdybym pościelił dziś rano łóżko, mama by się na mnie nie wkurzyła.
english: If I'd made the bed this morning, my mom wouldn't have gotten mad at me.
glossary: to make the bed/this morning/to get mad at sb
translation: 7. If I made my bed this morning, Mom wouldn't be at me.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Nigdy nie ćpałem i nie pochwalam tego.
english: I've never done drugs and I don't approve of it.
glossary: to do drugs/to approve of sth
translation: 8. I have never drugged and do not approve of it.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Zwykle ćwiczę, słuchając jednocześnie muzyki.
english: I usually exercise listening to music at the same time.
glossary: to exercise/to listen to music/at the same time
translation: 9. I usually exercise while listening to music.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Gdybyśmy przestali używać konserwantów, mielibyśmy więcej klientów.
english: If we stopped using preservatives, we'd have more customers.
glossary: a preservative/a customer
translation: 10. If we stopped using preservatives, we would have more customers.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Gdybyś nie poruszył tematu, szef nie zauważyłby, że jest problem.
english: If you hadn't brought up the subject, the boss wouldn't notice that there was a problem.
glossary: to bring up a subject/to notice that.../a problem
translation: 1.If you hadn't …........... the problem, the boss wouldn't have noticed that there was a problem.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Dlaczego schrzaniłeś to zadanie?
english: Why did you screw up the task?
glossary: to screw up a task
translation: 2. Why did you screw up the task?

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Szefowa powiedziała, że przejmę ważny projekt.
english: The boss told me I'd take on an important project.
glossary: to take on a project
translation: 3. The boss said I'd take on an important project.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Zbyt długo rozważam opcje. Czas działać.
english: I've been weighing up the options for too long. It's time to act.
glossary: to weigh up the options/to act
translation: 4. I've been considering options for too long. It's time to act.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Klient twierdził, że product nie spełnia jego oczekiwań.
english: The client claimed the product didn't live up to his expectations.
glossary: to live up to sb's expectations/a client/a product
translation: 5. The costomer said the product didn't …..... his expectations.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Czy zawsze zapinasz pasy, kiedy prowadzisz?
english: Do you always fasten up when driving?
glossary: to fasten up/to drive
translation: 6. Do you always fasten your seatbelt when you drive?

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Zakończyłeś już spotkanie?
english: Have you wrapped up the meeting yet?
glossary: to wrap up a meeting
translation: 7. Have you finished the meeting yet?

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Chcesz, żebym przejrzał te dokumenty?
english: Do you want me to go through the documents?
glossary: to go through documents
translation: 8. Would you like that I check the documents?

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Profesor pytał się mnie kilka dni temu, dlaczego jeszcze nie wykonałem tych badań.
english: The professor asked me a few days ago why I hadn't carried out the research yet.
glossary: to carry out research
translation: 9. The professor asked me a few days ago why I hadn't done the reserch yet.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Szybko przyzwyczaiłam się do krycia brata.
english: I quickly got used to covering for my brother.
glossary: to cover up for sb/to get used to doing sth
translation: 10. I quickly .................. to covering my brother.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Kogo chcesz, żebym zaprosił na imprezę?
english: Who do you want me to invite to the party?
glossary: to invite sb to a party
translation: Who do you want me to invite to the party?

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Wpadaj. Mój mąż gotuje w ten piątek.
english: Drop by. My husband's cooking this Friday.
glossary: to cook/this Friday
translation: Drop by. My husband is cooking on Friday.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Nie ma różnicy. Bierz, co chcesz.
english: There's no difference. Take what you want.
glossary: a difference/to take sth
translation: It doesn’t matter. Take what you want.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Mogłeś mi od razu powiedzieć prawdę. Nie zdenerwowałbym się.
english: You could've told me the truth right away. I wouldn't have gotten mad.
glossary: to tell sb the truth/at the beginning/to get mad
translation: You could have told me the truth at the first time. You wouldn’t get nervous.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Co mi chciałaś powiedzieć na imprezie?
english: What did you want to tell me at the party?
glossary: to tell sb sth/at the party
translation: What did you want to tell me at the party?

name: Chris Mayer
polish: W artykule jest błąd. Popraw go.
english: There's a mistake in the article. Correct it.
glossary: in the article/to correct a mistake
translation: There is a mistake in the article. Correct it.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Może pojadę taksówką. Zaoszczędzę czas.
english: Maybe I'll take a cab. I'll save time.
glossary: to take a cab/to save money
translation: I may take a cab. I’ll save the time.

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Co chcesz dostać na urodziny?
english: What do you want to get for your birthday?
glossary: to get sth for your birthday

name: Chris Mayer

name: Chris Mayer

glossary: to hope/to come back home/today/to miss the train

name: Chris Mayer
polish: Mogłeś wcześniej zadzwonić. Powiedziałabym Ci, że nie ma mnie w domu.

name: Chris Mayer

name: Chris Mayer

glossary: to remember/to go for a drink/tonight

name: Chris Mayer

glossary: to be afraid of sth/to get a job

name: Martin Hale

name: Martin Hale

name: Martin Hale

glossary: on the street/to go off/a bomb

name: Martin Hale

polish: Obiecuję, że przestanę plotkować.

translation: 6.	I told you I won’t put up with you anymore.

name: Damien Bean
polish: W zeszłym miesiącu mi powiedziałaś, że ta praca cię wykańcza.

glossary: to wear sb down/a job
translation: 7.	You told me last month that your job ??? you

name: Damien Bean

translation: 10.	I promise that I won’t do anything stupid.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Co jadłeś wczoraj na obiad?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Dostałbym w zeszłym roku stypendium, gdybym miał lepsze oceny.

glossary: to get a scholarship/to have good grades

name: Anna Patton

name: Anna Patton
polish: Będzie cię bolał brzuch, jeśli będziesz dalej jeść tak szybko.

name: Anna Patton

glossary: to eat out/to write an article about sth

glossary: to wait for sth/to move out

polish: Nigdy nie płaciłem żadnych rachunków, dopóki nie wyprowadziłem się z domu rodziców.

glossary: to get rid of sth/evidence

glossary: to agree on sth

glossary: to do your homework/to end up like sb

english: The book makes me sleep. I need to read something more suspenseful.

glossary: to pull an all-nighter

glossary: to make sb learn English/to be grateful to sb for sth
translation: 7.	My girlfriend forced me to learn English. I’m grateful to her for that.

polish: Mój mąż sprawia, że ​​czuję się wyjątkowo. Zawsze upewnia się, że dostaję to, czego chcę.

glossary: to make sb do sth
translation: 8.	My husband makes me feel special. He always makes sure I get what I want.

polish: Na czym zależy twojemu synowi? Jeśli to odkryjesz, będziesz mógł go zmotywować.

glossary: to care about sth/to discover sth/to motivate sb
translation: 9.	What does your son care about? If you discover this, you can motivate him.

name: Margaret Usher
polish: Za co nauczyciel cię ochrzanił?

glossary: to tell sb off/a teacher
translation: 10.	What did the teacher tell you off?

name: Margaret Morgan

english: We wouldn't have to pay interest now if you hadn't forgotten about the last installment.
glossary: to pay interest/to forget about sth/an installment

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Byłbym w stanie rozebrać to na części, gdybym miał klucz.

glossary: to be able to do sth/to take sth apart/a wrench
translation: I'd be able to take it apart if I had a key. / I would be able to tak it apart if I had a key

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Co próbujesz wynegocjować?
english: What are you trying to negotiate?
glossary: to negotiate
translation: What are you trying to negotiate?

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Pana dokumenty nie zostałyby odrzucone, gdyby złożył je Pan na czas.
english: Your documents wouldn't have gotten rejected if you had handed them in on time.
glossary: a document/to get rejected/to hand sth in on time

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Nie musielibyśmy płacić za ten miesiąc, gdybyśmy rozwiązali umowę na czas.
english: You wouldn't have to pay for this month if we'd terminated the contract on time.
glossary: to pay for sth/to terminate a contract/to do sth on time

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Jakich ludzi cenisz sobie najbardziej?

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Nie musiałbyś mi teraz przeszkadzać, gdybyś zapisał tę informację.

polish: Trudno mi było udowodnić swoją rację.

english: You won't be given a pay raise until you start treating your job seriously.
glossary: a pay rise/to treat sth seriously

glossary: to thrive/to be idle/all the time

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Dziś wieczorem jemy na mieście.
english: We're eating out tonight.

translation: We eat out tonight.

name: Lucas Doe

name: Lucas Doe

name: Lucas Doe

name: Lucas Doe
