translation: I don’t know what I should answer.

name: John Connell
polish: Byłem pewny, że zrobisz swoją pracę domową.
english: I was sure you'd do your homework.
glossary: to do your homework
translation: I was sure you would do your homework.

name: John Connell
polish: W zeszłym roku nie pojechałem na wakacje, ponieważ nie miałem pieniędzy.
english: I didn't go on vacation last year because I didn't have any money.
glossary: to go on vacation/to have no money
translation: I didn’t go on vacation last year because I didn't have money.

name: John Connell
polish: Zawsze znajdę dla ciebie czas, bo jesteś dla mnie ważna.
english: I'll always find time for you because you're important to me.
glossary: to find time for sb/to be important to sb
translation: I’ll always find time for you because you’re important to me.

name: John Connell
polish: Nie mogę się skupić, gdy jest tak głośno.
english: I can't focus when it's so loud.
glossary: to focus on sth/to be loud
translation: I can’t concentrate when it’s so loud;

name: John Connell
polish: Gramy jutro mecz. Dołączysz do nas?
english: We're playing a match tomorrow. Will you join us?
glossary: to play a match/to join sb
translation: We’re playing a match tomorrow. Will you join us?

name: John Connell
polish: Myślę, że odwiedzę cię w weekend, bo jutro wracam późno do domu.
english: I think I'll visit you on the weekend because I'm coming back home late tomorrow.
glossary: to visit sb/to come back home late
translation: I think I'll visit you at the weekend because I'm coming home late tomorrow.

name: John Connell
polish: Nie wychodź teraz z domu, bo jest zbyt gorąco.
english: Don't leave the house now because it's too hot.
glossary: to leave the house
translation: Don't leave the house now because it's too hot.

name: John Connell
polish: Zepsułam telefon mojej mamy. Nie wiem, co powinnam teraz zrobić.
english: I broke my mom's cell phone. I don't know what I should do now.
glossary: to break a cell phone
translation: I broke my mother's phone. I don't know what I should do now.

name: John Connell
polish: Nie mogę teraz rozmawiać, bo nie mam czasu.
english: I can't talk now because I don't have time.
glossary: to talk to sb
translation: I can't talk now because I don't have time.

name: John Connell
polish: Kiedy wyjeżdżasz?
english: When are you leaving?
glossary: to leave
translation: When are you leaving?

name: John Connell
polish: Mogłem zostać w domu, bo nie ma tu nic do roboty.
english: I could've stayed at home because there's nothing to do here.
glossary: to stay at home/to have nothing to do
translation: I could stay at home because there is nothing to do here.

name: John Connell
polish: Gdzie byłeś? Nie mogłem cię znaleźć.
english: Where were you? I couldn't find you.
translation: Where have you been? I couldn't find you.

name: John Connell
polish: Nie zapłaciłam rachunków w zeszłym miesiącu, bo nie miałam żadnych pieniędzy.
english: I didn't pay the bills last month because I didn't have any money.
glossary: to pay the bills
translation: I didn't pay my bills last month because I didn't have any money.

name: John Connell
polish: Zawsze ci pomogę, bo jesteś siostrą mojej żony.
english: I'll always help you because you're my wife's sister.
glossary: to help sb
translation: I will always help you because you are my wife's sister.

name: John Connell
polish: Byłam pewna, że spędzimy razem więcej czasu.
english: I was sure we'd spend more time together.
glossary: to be sure that.../to spend time with sb
translation: I was sure we would spend more time together.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Składając wniosek, pamiętaj, żeby go podpisać.
english: Filing an application, remember to sign it.
glossary: to file an application/to sign an application
translation: Making the application remember to sign it.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Czy ma pan odpowiednie umiejętności, żeby wykonywać tę pracę?
english: Do you have the necessary skills to do the job?
glossary: to have the necessary skills/to do a job
translation: Do you have the right skills to do this job?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Zawsze chciałem pracować z ludźmi.
english: I've always wanted to work with people.
glossary: to work with people
translation: I’ve always wanted to work with people.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Gdybyś oszczędzał wodę, zmniejszyłbyś swoje miesięczne rachunki.
english: If you saved water, you'd lower your monthly bills.
glossary: to save water/to lower your bills
translation: If you saved water, you would decrease your monthly bills.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie możesz dzwonić do mnie w nocy, oczekując, że odbiorę.
english: You can't call me at night expecting that I'll pick up the phone.
glossary: to call sb/at night/to expect sb to do sth
translation: You can't call me at night waiting I'll pick up.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie chcę, żeby utrzymywali mnie rodzice.
english: I don't want my parents to provide for me.
glossary: to provide for sb
translation: I don’t want my parents to support me.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Zawsze ci mówiłem, żebyś zaczęła oszczędzać pieniądze.
english: I've always told you to start saving money.
glossary: to save money/to start to do sth; to start doing sth
translation: I’m always telling you that you should start saving money.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Moja córka nie zaczęłaby palić, gdyby nie była pod presją rówieśników.
english: My daughter wouldn't have started to smoke if she hadn't been under peer pressure.
glossary: to smoke/to be under peer pressure
translation: My daughter wouldn’t have started smoking if she hadn’t been under peer pressure.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Aplikowałem już na kilka stanowisk, ale nikt jeszcze do mnie nie zadzwonił.
english: I've already applied for a few positions, but no one has called me yet.
glossary: to apply for a position/to call sb
translation: I’ve applied for a few positions, but nobody calls me yet.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Przeczytałem dziś rano wszystkie mejle, pijąc kawę.
english: I read all my emails today, drinking coffee.
glossary: to read emails/to drink coffee
translation: I read all the emails this morning while drinking coffee.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Mój tata odebrałby mnie wczoraj, gdyby miał samochód.
english: My dad would've picked me up yesterday if he had a car.
translation: My father would’ve picked us up yesterday if he’d had a car.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Czułbym się lepiej, gdybym wypił moją poranną kawę.
english: I'd feel better if I'd drunk my morning coffee.
translation: I would feel better if I drank my morning coffee.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Zdałbym egzaminy, gdybym więcej się uczył.
english: I would've passed the exams if I'd studied more.
translation: I would’ve passed the exam if I had studied more.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Gdybym miał wybierać, wolałbym mieć tylko koty.
english: If I had to choose, I'd prefer to only have cats.
translation: If I had a choice I would have only cats.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Ta drużyna miałaby lepsze wyniki, gdyby więcej trenowała.
english: This team would have better results if they'd trained more.
translation: This team would have a better score if they trained more.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Gdybym znał prawdę, powiedziałbym ją.
english: If I knew the truth, I would've told it.
translation: If I knew the truth I would say it.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Co byś zrobił, gdybyś był niewidzialny?
english: What would you do if you were invisible?
translation: What would you do If you were invisible?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie byłbym teraz smutny, gdybym nie stracił pieniędzy.
english: I wouldn't be sad now if I hadn't lost my money.
translation: I wouldn’t be sad now If I hadn’t lost money.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Moja mama nie krzyczałaby na mnie, gdybym odrobił lekcje.
english: My mom wouldn't have shouted at me if I had done my homework.
translation: My mom wouldn’t scream at me if I did my homework.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie pracowałbym teraz w nadgodzinach, gdybym wcześniej skończył swoje zadania.
english: I wouldn't be working overtime now if I had finished my tasks earlier.
translation: I wouldn’t work overtime now if I had finished my task earlier.

name: Dorothy Slone
polish: Obściskiwałeś się z moją koleżanką. Przyznaj to.
english: You made out with my friend. Admit it.
glossary: to make out with sb/to admit sth
translation: 1.	You hugged with my friend. …… it.

name: Dorothy Slone
polish: Muszę chronić swoje dzieci.
english: I have to protect my kids.
glossary: to protect sb/a kid
translation: 2.	I must protect my kids.

name: Dorothy Slone
polish: Moi znajomi jutro wpadają. Kup piwo.
english: My friends are dropping by tomorrow. Buy beer.
glossary: to drop by/a friend/to buy sth/to drink beer
translation: 3.	My friends are coming over tomorrow. Buy a beer.

name: Dorothy Slone
polish: Nie powinieneś udawać, że mnie słuchasz.
english: You shouldn't pretend that you're listening to me.
glossary: to pretend/to listen to sb
translation: 4.	You shouldn’t pretend to listen to me.

name: Dorothy Slone
polish: Ja piję dziś wieczorem. Ty prowadzisz.
english: I'm drinking tonight. You're driving.
glossary: to drink alcohol/to drive a car
translation: 5.	I’m drinking tonight. You’re driving.

name: Dorothy Slone
polish: W zeszłym roku pracowałem jako stażysta. Dużo się wtedy nauczyłem.
english: I worked as an intern last year. I learned a lot back then.
glossary: to work as an intern/to learn sth/back then
translation: 6.	Last year I worked like a …. I learned a lot then.

name: Dorothy Slone
polish: Nie mogę wejść do pokoju. Jest zamknięty.
english: I can't enter the room. It's locked.
glossary: to be locked/to enter the room
translation: 7.	I can’t …. the room. It’s locked.

name: Dorothy Slone
polish: Będę bardziej surowy następnym razem. Obiecuję.
english: I'll be more strict next time. I promise.
glossary: to be strict/next time/to promise sth
translation: 8.	I’ll be more ….. next time. I promise.

name: Dorothy Slone
polish: Chciałabym pracować jako sędzia w przyszłości.
english: I'd like to work as a judge in the future.
glossary: to work as a judge/a judge/in the future
translation: 9.	I would like to work like a judge in the future.

name: Dorothy Slone
polish: Nie martw się. Nie wystawię cię.
english: Don't worry. I won't stand you up.
glossary: to worry/to stand sb up
translation: 10.	Don’t worry. I won’t …. you.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Myślę, że wkrótce zmienię pracę.
english: I think I'll change my job soon.
glossary: to change your job/soon
translation: 1.	I think that I’ll change my job soon.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Słuchałaś się rodziców, kiedy byłaś dzieckiem?
english: Did you listen to your parents when you were a kid?
glossary: to listen to your parents/a kid; a child
translation: 2.	Did you listen to your parents when you were a child?

name: Damien Bean
polish: Dlaczego krzyczałeś wczoraj na siostrę?
english: Why did you shout at your sister yesterday?
glossary: to shout at sb/a sister
translation: 3.	Why did you scream on your sister yesterday?

name: Damien Bean
polish: W ogóle się nie uczyłem, kiedy byłem dzieckiem.
english: I didn't study at all when I was a kid.
glossary: to study/at all/...when I was a kid
translation: 4.	I didn’t study at all when I was a child.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Nie ma powodu, dla którego powinieneś być na mnie zły.
english: There's no reason why you should be mad at me.
glossary: It's the reason why.../a reason why.../to be mad at sb
translation: 5.	There’s no reason why you should be mad at me.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Dlaczego chcesz zrezygnować z kursu?
english: Why do you want to resign from the course?
glossary: to resign from sth/a course
translation: 6.	Why do you want to resign from the course?

name: Damien Bean
polish: Dlaczego nie pojawiłeś się na ostatnim spotkaniu?
english: Why didn't you show up at the last meeting?
glossary: to show up at a meeting
translation: 7.	Why didn’t you show up at the last meeting.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Dlaczego mnie wczoraj zignorowałeś?
english: Why did you ignore me yesterday?
glossary: to ignore sb
translation: 8.	Why did you ignore me yesterday?

name: Damien Bean
polish: Dlaczego mnie o to prosisz?
english: Why are you asking me for it?
glossary: to ask for sth
translation: 9.	Why do you ask me for it?

name: Damien Bean
polish: Do kogo zwykle dzwonisz, kiedy masz problem?
english: Who do you usually call when you have a problem?
glossary: to have a problem/to call sb
translation: 10.	Who do you usually call when you have a problem?

name: Damien Bean
polish: Chciałbym obejrzeć film z rodziną.
english: I'd like to watch a movie with my family.
glossary: to watch a movie/with your family
translation: 1.	I’d like to watch a movie with my family.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Chciałbym zmienić wkrótce pracę.
english: I'd like to change my job soon.
glossary: to change your job
translation: 2.	I’d like to change my job soon.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Chciałbym wyjść na miasto i napić się drinka.
english: I'd like to go out and have a drink.
glossary: to go out/to have a drink
translation: 3.	I’d like to go out to town and have a drink.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Chciałbym przeczytać w ciszy książkę.
english: I'd like to read a book in silence.
glossary: to read a book/in silence/
translation: 4.	I’d like to read a book in silence.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Chciałbym za rok mówić płynnie po angielsku.
english: I'd like to speak English fluently in a year.
glossary: to speak English fluently/in a year
translation: 5.	I’d like to speak a fluently English after a year.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Chciałbym pojechać na wakacje samochodem.
english: I'd like to go on vacation by car.
glossary: to go on vacation/by car
translation: 6.	I’d like to go on vacation by a car.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Chciałbym dostać nowy telefon na święta.
english: I'd like to get a new cell phone for Christmas.
glossary: to get a new cell phone/for Christmas
translation: 7.	I’d like to get a new phone on Christmas.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Chciałbym cię zrozumieć, ale nie umiem.
english: I'd like to understand you, but I can't.
glossary: to understand sb
translation: 8.	I’d like to understand you but I can’t it.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Chciałbym w tym miesiącu zaoszczędzić trochę pieniędzy.
english: I'd like to save some money this month.
glossary: to save some money
translation: 9.	I’d like to save some money this month.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Chciałbym założyć swój własny biznes.
english: I'd like to set up my own business.
glossary: to set up your own business
translation: 10.	I’d like to start my own business.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Pobraliśmy już próbki krwi i jesteśmy gotowi, żeby je zbadać.
english: We've already taken blood samples and we're ready to examine them.
glossary: to take blood samples/to examine samples
translation: 1. Pobraliśmy już próbki krwi i jesteśmy gotowi, żeby je zbadać. We got a blood sample. We are ready to tested in.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Ta sytuacja nie wywarła na mnie żadnego wpływu.
english: The situation didn't have any influence on me.
glossary: to have no influence on sb/a situation
translation: 2. Ta sytuacja nie wywarła na mnie żadnego wpływu. That situation didn’t influencer me at all.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Nie mam dostępu do pliku. Możesz to sprawdzić?
english: I don't have access to the file. Can you check that?
glossary: to have access to a file/to check sth
translation: 3. Nie mam dostępu do pliku. Możesz to sprawdzić? I don’t have acces to the file. Could you check it?

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Nasz syn nie pobiłby rekordu szkoły, gdyby pan go nie wspierał.
english: Our son wouldn't have beaten the school record if you hadn't supported him.
glossary: to beat the school record/to beat the record/to support sb
translation: 4. Nasz syn nie pobiłby rekordu szkoły, gdyby pan go nie wspierał. Our son wouldn’t break the school record if you didn’t support him.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Nie miałeś prawa, żeby przeglądać mój telefon.
english: You didn't have the right to look through my phone.
glossary: to have the right to do sth/to look through sb's phone
translation: 5. Nie miałeś prawa, żeby przeglądać mój telefon. You didn’t have right to look into my phone.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Włóż zupę do lodówki. Nie chcesz, żeby się popsuła.
english: Put the soup in the fridge. You don't want it to go bad.
glossary: soup/to put sth in the fridge/to go bad
translation: 6. Włóż zupę do lodówki. Nie chcesz, żeby się popsuła. You should put Soup to the fridge. You don’t want to waste it.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Nie musiałbym teraz zwracać tych butów, gdyby na mnie pasowały.
english: I wouldn't have to return the shoes now if they fit me.
glossary: to return a product/shoes/to fit sb
translation: 7. Nie musiałbym teraz zwracać tych butów, gdyby na mnie pasowały. You would’t have to give the shooes Beck if they fit.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Dlaczego włączyłeś wczoraj muzykę, wiedząc, że śpię?
english: Why did you turn on the music yesterday knowing that I was asleep?
glossary: to turn on the music/to know sth/to be asleep
translation: 8. Dlaczego włączyłeś wczoraj muzykę, wiedząc, że śpię? Why did you turn on music? You knew that I was slepp.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Nie zamieniłem wczoraj z rodzicami ani słowa, bo nie miałem czasu.
english: I didn't have a word with my parents yesterday because I didn't have time.
glossary: to have a word with sb/to have time
translation: 9. Nie zamieniłem wczoraj z rodzicami ani słowa, bo nie miałem czasu. I didn’t talk to my parents yesterday because I didn’t have time.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Nie chciałbym, żeby zarząd zrobił się podejrzliwy.
english: I wouldn't like the management board to get suspicious.
glossary: the management board/to get suspicious
translation: 10. Nie chciałbym, żeby zarząd zrobił się podejrzliwy. I didn’t want that the board would be suspiciues.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Gdzie spałeś zeszłej nocy?
english: Where did you sleep last night?
glossary: last night/to sleep
translation: Where did you sleep last night?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Zupa się popsuje, jeśli nie wstawisz jej do lodówki.
english: The soup will go bad if you don't put it in the fridge.
glossary: to go bad/to put sth in the fridge
translation: Soup will go bad if you don't put it to the frizeer.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Oblałeś ostatni test, bo się w ogóle na niego nie uczyłeś.
english: You failed the last test because you hadn't studied for it at all.
glossary: to study for a test/to fail a test/at all
translation: You passed the last exam becuase you didn't study for it at all.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Rodzice się mnie wczoraj pytali, czy zdałem wszystkie egzaminy.
english: My parents asked me yesterday if I'd passed all the exams.
glossary: to pass an exam/a parent
translation: My parents asked me yesterday if I had passed all the exams.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Chciałbym przeprosić za spóźnienie.
english: I'd like to apologize for being late.
glossary: to be late/to apologize for sth/I'd like to...
translation: I'd like to apologize for my delay.

name: Anna Patton
polish: O co jesteś oskarżony?
english: What are you accused of?
glossary: to be accused of sth
translation: What are you accuse for?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Nie miałbyś nieświeżego oddechu, gdybyś palił mniej.
english: You wouldn't have bad breath if you smoked less.
glossary: to have bad breath/to smoke
translation: You wouldn't have a bad breath if you smoked less.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Nie załatwiłem jeszcze wszystkich swoich spraw.
english: I haven't done all my errands yet.
glossary: to do errands
translation: I haven't done my errands yet.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Są jakieś listy do mnie?
english: Are there any letters for me?
glossary: a letter for sb
translation: Are there any letters for me?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Dobilibyśmy targu, gdybyś się nie odezwał.
english: We would've closed the deal if you hadn't spoken up.
glossary: to speak up/to close a deal
translation: We would've closed the deal if you hadn't spoken up.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Dlaczego do mnie zagadujesz?
english: Why are you chatting me up?
glossary: to chat sb up
translation: 1. Why are you chatting me up?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Czy naprawdę chcesz, żeby ten gatunek wyginął?
english: Do you really want the species to die out?
glossary: to die out/a species
translation: 2. Do you really want this genre to die off?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Nie kupimy mieszkania, dopóki nie weźmiemy kredytu.
english: We won't buy an apartment until we get a mortgage.
glossary: to get a mortgage/to buy an apartment
translation: 3. We won’t buy an apartment until we don’t get a mortgage.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Na ostatnim spotkaniu szef mi powiedział, że mój projekt się wyróżnia.
english: My boss told me at the last meeting that my project stood out.
glossary: to stand out/a project/at the meeting
translation: 4. At the last meeting the boss told me that my project is standing out.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Mogłem zacząć grać na pianinie jako dziecko. Byłbym teraz bardziej wprawiony.
english: I could've taken up the piano as a kid. I'd be more skillful now.
glossary: to be skillful/to take up the piano
translation: 5. I could start playing piano as a child. I would be more skilled now.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Czy w końcu się odezwałeś, gdy przezwyciężyłeś strach?
english: Did you finally speak up when you got over your fear?
glossary: to get over your fear/to speak up
translation: 6. Did you finally speak up when you defeated your fear?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Dlaczego nie załozyłeś jeszcze kurtki?
english: Why haven't you put on a jacket yet?
glossary: to put on a jacket
translation: 7. Why haven’t you put on a jacket yet?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Szef się mnie wczoraj zapytał, dlaczego nie zaproponowałem żadnego pomysłu na ostatnim spotkaniu.
english: My boss asked me yesterday why I hadn't put forward any idea at the last meeting.
glossary: to put forward an idea/at the meeting
translation: 8. The boss asked me yesterday why I hadn’t put forward any idea at the last meeting.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Jakie obowiązki musisz przekazać?
english: What responsibilities do you have to hand over?
glossary: to hand over responsibilities
translation: 9. What obligations have you to hand on?

name: Martin Hale
polish: Powiedziałem ci, że nie będę cię więcej znosił.
english: I told you I wouldn't put up with you anymore.
glossary: to put up with sb
translation: 10. I told you that I won't put up with you anymore.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Dlaczego nie skończyłeś ostatniego projektu?
english: Why didn't you finish the last project?
glossary: to finish a project
translation: 1. Why didn’t you finish the last project?

name: Anna Forney

english: What time are you coming back? Do you want me to make dinner?
glossary: to come back/to want sb to do sth/to make dinner

name: Anna Forney
polish: Jak zwykle dojeżdżasz do pracy?
english: How do you usually get to work?
glossary: to get to work

name: Anna Forney
polish: Jestem pewna, że kiedyś mnie zrozumiesz.
english: I'm sure you'll understand me one day.
glossary: to understand sb/one day
translation: 4. I’m sure you’ll understand me someday.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Gdzie spędziłeś ostatnią noc?

glossary: to spend your night with sb

name: Anna Forney

english: I signed up for Spanish classes last week.
glossary: to sign up for Spanish classes/last week
translation: 6. I signed up for Spanish classes last week.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Gdzie zwykle parkujesz samochód?
english: Where do you usually park your car?
glossary: to park your car

name: Anna Forney
polish: Są rzeczy, których nie mogę ci powiedzieć.
english: There are things I can't tell you.

translation: 8. There are things I can’t tell you.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Czy to ma sens?
english: Does it make sense?
glossary: to make sense

name: Anna Forney
polish: Dlaczego nie było cię wczoraj na zajęciach?
english: Why did you skip classes yesterday?
glossary: to skip classes

name: Jack Russell
polish: Detektyw pytał się mnie podczas przesłuchania, czy coś widziałem.
english: The detective asked me during questioning if I'd seen anything.
glossary: a detective/during questioning/to see sth
translation: The detective asked me during the questioning if I had seen anything.

name: Jack Russell
polish: Znudziło mi się jedzenie codziennie pizzy na obiad.
english: I'm bored with eating a pizza for lunch every day.
glossary: to be bored with sth/to eat a pizza/for lunch/every day

name: Jack Russell

english: We wouldn't have managed to put out the fire if you hadn't immediately called the emergency services.
glossary: to manage to do sth/to put out the fire/to call the emergency services/to immediately do sth

name: Jack Russell
polish: Gdybyś zawsze dotrzymywał obietnic, dzieci by ci ufały.

glossary: to keep your promises/to trust sb

english: If I spoke English fluently, I'd move abroad.

name: Jack Russell
polish: O czym chciałbyś porozmawiać?

glossary: to talk about sth

name: Jack Russell

name: Jack Russell

english: I wouldn't have to do time now if my attorney had appealed the court's decision.
glossary: to do time; to serve a sentence/an attorney/to appeal the court's decision

name: Jack Russell

glossary: to demand that.../to dismiss a case

name: Jack Russell

glossary: to drive sb crazy/an aunt/to be quiet
translation: You wouldn't always drive an aunt crazy if you had been quiet.

name: Jack Russell

glossary: to focus on sth

name: Jack Russell
polish: Nie byłbyś wrakiem, gdybyś nie ćpał przez ostatni rok.

polish: Przygotuj się na wstawanie wcześnie rano.
english: Get prepared for getting up early in the morning.
glossary: to get prepared for sth/tp get up early

name: Jack Russell

glossary: to take care of the environment/the environment/on a daily basis/a species/to die out

name: Jack Russell
polish: Zamówiłbym teraz frytki, gdybym nie był najedzony.

glossary: to order French fries/to be full

name: Jack Russell

english: Do you think citizens would mind if the prime minister stepped down?
glossary: a citizen/to mind/the prime minister/to step down

name: Jack Russell

glossary: to demand that.../the president {2}/to be held responsible

name: Jack Russell
polish: Gdybyś umiał czytać między wierszami, wiedziałbyś, co twoja dziewczyna ma na myśli.
english: If you could read between the lines, you'd know what your girlfriend meant.
glossary: to read between the lines/to mean sth/a girlfriend

name: Jack Russell
polish: Nie dostałbyś mandatu, gdybyś nie przekroczył dozwolonej prędkości.

polish: Ludzie by cię lubili, gdybyś przestał wyciągać pochopne wnioski na ich temat.

glossary: to jump to conclusions about sth

glossary: to be focused on sth/a conversation/to explain the situation

name: Jack Russell
polish: Zaoszczędzilibyśmy pieniądze, gdybyśmy zarezerwowali bilety z wyprzedzeniem.

glossary: to save money/to book tickets in advance

name: Jack Russell
polish: Ojciec by cię nie opieprzył, gdybyś nie podsłuchiwał jego rozmów.

glossary: to tell sb off/to eavesdrop on a conversation; to listen in on a conversation

name: Jack Russell

glossary: to demand that.../to take appropriate steps/to take steps

polish: Może kolega nie skopałby ci tyłka, gdybyś nie rozsiewał plotek.

glossary: a wife/the other day/to cheat on sb

name: Jack Russell

name: Jack Russell
polish: Nie miałbyś teraz kłopotów, gdybyś od czasu do czasu brał swoich rodziców na poważnie.

glossary: to be in trouble/to take sb seriously/from time to time

glossary: to make sb's life harder/to help each other

glossary: to make sb mad/to throw sb out of the house

polish: Moi rodzice zmusili mnie do chodzenia na treningi piłkarskie, kiedy byłem dzieckiem. Dlatego teraz tego nienawidzę.

polish: Jak długo próbujesz usunąć tę plamę? Czy myślisz, że zejdzie?

glossary: to remove a stain/to come out

polish: Z czego zazwyczaj śmieje się twoja córka?

glossary: to take measures to do sth/to prevent sth

polish: Chciałabym, żeby moje dzieci poszły na studia.

english: Can we talk? I didn't have a chance yesterday to apologize to you.

glossary: to overtake a car/to fail a driving test

name: Justina Stanley

name: Justina Stanley

glossary: to work overtime/a husband

translation: 4. I'm sure, you will get well soon.

name: Monica Grimm

glossary: to sign up for sth/a lecture

english: When did you find out that you wouldn't be eligible for insurance?
glossary: to find out about sth/to be eligible for sth/to be eligible for insurance

glossary: to take a shower/to come up with sth/to come up with an idea

name: Agnes Chapman

glossary: to be persistent/to prove your point/to prove sth
translation: If you were more……….. you would be able to prove your point.

polish: Kiedy przypomniałaś mi, że zostawiłam klucze w samochodzie, poczułam ulgę.

name: Agnes Chapman

english: If you cut down on smoking, you'd be more healthy.

translation: 8. If you cut down on smoking, you'd be healthier.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Zmieniłaś się. Kiedyś stawałaś w obronie swoich zasad.
english: You've changed. You used to stand up for your principles.
glossary: to stand up for your principles/to change
translation: 9. You changed. Before, you had to stand up for your rules.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Ostatnio musiałem odwołać tyle spotkań, że moi klienci zaczynają narzekać.
english: I've recently had to call off so many meetings that my clients are starting to complain.
glossary: to call off a meeting/to complain about sth/to start to do sth; to begin to do sth/a client
translation: 10. Recently I've had to cancel so many meetings that my clients are starting to complain.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Jeśli teraz pozbędziesz się formalności, zaoszczędzisz dużo czasu.
english: If you do away with formalities now, you'll save a lot of time.
glossary: to do away with formalities/to save time
translation: 1. If you get rid of the formalities right now, you will save a lot of time.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Gdybyś nie dała kosza swojemu dziwnemu koledze z pracy, byłabyś teraz w toksycznej relacji.
english: If you hadn't turned your weird colleague down, you would be in a toxic relationship now.
glossary: to turn sb down/to be in a toxic relationship
translation: 2. If you hadn't given ......... your strange colleague, you'd be in a toxic relationship now.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Kiedyś skarżyłem na moich kolegów za każdym razem, kiedy zrobili coś złego, ale wyluzowałem.
english: I used to tell on my friends every time they did something wrong, but I chilled out.
glossary: to tell on sb/to chill out/to do sth wrong/a friend
translation: 3. I used to complain about my colleagues every time when they did something wrong, but I've chilled out.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Gdzie jest dokument, o który cię prosiłem? Powiedziałeś, że go wydrukujesz.
english: Where's the document I asked you for? You said you'd print it out.
glossary: to print sth out/to ask sb for sth/a document
translation: 4. Where is the document I asked you for? You said you are printing it.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Jeśli wszystkie moje plany się udadzą, w końcu będę mógł rzucić tę pracę.
english: If all my plans work out, I'll finally be able to give up the job.
glossary: to work out/to be able to do sth/to give up the job
translation: 5. If all my plans are successful, I'll finally be able to quit this job.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Już wyniosłem śmieci, więc nie musisz mi o tym znów przypominać.
english: I've already taken out the garbage, so you don't have to remind me of it again.
glossary: to take out the garbage/to remind sb of sth
translation: 6. I've already taken out the garbage, so you don't have to remind me again.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Gdybyś się tyle nie wygłupiała, byłabyś traktowana poważniej.
english: If you didn't mess around so much, you would be treated more seriously.
glossary: to mess around/to treat sb seriously
translation: 7. If you didn't ................, you would be taken more seriously.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Kiedy wróciłem ze Stanów, zorientowałem się, że podłapałem amerykański akcent.
english: When I came back from the US, I realized I'd picked up the American accent.
glossary: to pick up the American accent/to come back from the US/to realize that...
translation: 8) When I came back from the US, I realized I had caught an American accent.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Ostatni pacjent wiercił się, podczas gdy przeglądałam jego dokumentację.
english: The last patient was fidgeting while I was going through his documentation.
glossary: to go through documentation/to fidget/a patient
translation: 9. The last patient ........ when I reviewed his documentation.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Szef wyszedł z pokoju, kiedy wciąż kończyliśmy spotkanie.
english: The boss left the room when we were still wrapping up the meeting.
glossary: a boss/to leave a room/to wrap up a meeting
translation: 10. The boss left the room while we were still finishing the meeting.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Przepraszam. Musiałem coś pomieszać, kiedy wystawiałem dla pana fakturę.
english: I'm sorry. I must've mixed something up when making out the invoice for you.
glossary: to make out an invoice/to mix sth up/to be sorry
translation: 1. Sorry. I had to mix something up when I invoiced you.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Powinnam była zwrócić się do ciebie o pomoc, kiedy jeszcze nie było za późno.
english: I should've turned to you for help when it wasn't too late yet.
glossary: to turn to sb for help
translation: 2. I should have asked you for help when it wasn't too late.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Kiedy dotarłam na imprezę, koleżanki spytały mnie, dlaczego się nie przebrałam.
english: When I got to the party, my friends asked me why I hadn't dressed up.
glossary: to dress up/to get to a party
translation: 3. When I got to the party my friends asked me why I didn't …......

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Czy ty musisz zagadywać do każdej dziewczyny, którą spotykasz?
english: Do you have to chat up every girl you meet?
glossary: to chat up a girl
translation: 4. Do you have to talk to every girl you meet?

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Chcę, żebyś w końcu przezwyciężył stres i skoncentrował się na projekcie.
english: I want you to finally get over the stress and concentrate on the project.
glossary: to get over a difficulty/to concentrate on sth/to want sb to do sth
translation: 5. I want you to finally get over your stress and concentrate on the project.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Dlaczego znalazłeś wymówkę, zamiast powiedzieć mi, że jesteś zmęczony?
english: Why did you come up with an excuse instead of telling me you were tired?
glossary: to come up with an excuse/instead of sth/to do sth simply
translation: 6. Why did you find an excuse instead of telling me that you are tired?

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Kiedy byliśmy dziećmi, mój młodszy brat mówił, że patrzę na niego z góry.
english: When we were kids, my younger brother said I looked down on him.
glossary: to look down on sb/a younger brother
translation: 7. When we were kids, my little brother say that I look down to him.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Dlaczego wszystko, co robisz, zawsze wychodzi?
english: Why does everything you do always work out?
glossary: to work out
translation: 8. Why does everything you do always …....?

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Wypiłaś już herbatę? Naprawdę musimy się spieszyć.
english: Have you drunk up your tea yet? We really need to hurry up.
glossary: to drink sth up/to hurry up
translation: 9. Did you drink your tea yet? We really need to hurry up.

name: Greg Hardy
polish: Za każdym razem, gdy czuję, że jestem obserwowana, panikuję.
english: Every time I feel that I'm being watched, I freak out.
glossary: to freak out/Every time.../to be watched
translation: 10. Every time I feel that I'm observed, I panic.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Gdybyś naprawdę chciał schudnąć, jadłbyś mniej słodyczy.
english: If you really wanted to lose weight, you'd eat less candy.
glossary: to lose weight/to eat candy
translation: 1. If you really wanted to lose your weight you'd eat less candys.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Możesz mieć problemy z sercem, pijąc kawę kilka razy dziennie.
english: You can have heart problems drinking coffee a few times a day.
glossary: to have heart problems/to drink coffee/a few times a day
translation: 2. You can have heart problems drinking coffee two times a day.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Płacąc podatki, możesz spać spokojnie.
english: Paying your taxes, you can sleep peacefully.
glossary: to pay your taxes/to sleep peacefully
translation: 3. Paying taxes you can sleep peacefuly.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Chcesz, żebym jeszcze raz spojrzał na te dokumenty?
english: Do you want me to take a look at the documents once again?
glossary: to take a look at sth/once again/to take a look at a document
translation: 4. Would you like me to take a look at the documents again?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Nie wyrzuciłabym tej bluzki, gdyby nie wyblakła.
english: I wouldn't have thrown out the blouse if it hadn't faded.
glossary: to throw sth out/a blouse/to fade
translation: 5. I wouldn't have thrown the shirt out if it hadn't been fade.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Nigdy wcześniej nie badałam pacjenta sama.
english: I've never examined a patient alone before.
glossary: to examine a patient
translation: 6. I've never examinated a patient alone.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Wyglądając przez okno, zauważyłam, że twój syn pali papierosa.
english: Looking out the window, I noticed your son smoking a cigarette.
glossary: to look out the window/to notice sb doing sth/to smoke a cigarette
translation: 7. When I was looking out the window I saw your son somked a cigarette.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Biegnąc wzdłuż ulicy, zauważyłem bezpańskiego psa.
english: Running down the street, I noticed a stray dog.
glossary: to run down the street/to notice sth/a stray dog
translation: 8. When I was running down the street I noticed a stray dog.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Czy wy uprawialiście wczoraj seks? Wydawało mi się, że was słyszę.
english: Did you have sex yesterday? I thought I heard you.
glossary: to have sex/to hear sb
translation: 9. Did you have sex yesterday?  It seemed to me I heard you.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Nigdy nie wierzyłam, że twoja siostra będzie dobrą nauczycielką.
english: I've never believed your sister will make a good teacher.
glossary: to make a good teacher
translation: 10. I've never believed your sister would be a good teacher.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Zatrudnilibyśmy pana, gdyby miał pan więcej doświadczenia w tym obszarze.
english: We'd hire you if you had more experience in this area.
glossary: to hire sb/to have experience in sth
translation: We would have hired you if you had more experience in this area.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Nie będę w stanie się skupić na tym zadaniu, dopóki nie ściszysz muzyki.
english: I won't be able to focus on this task until you turn the music down.
glossary: to focus on sth/ to turn the music down
translation: I won’t be able to focus on this task until you turn the music down.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Nie będę z tobą rozmawiała, dopóki mnie nie przeprosisz.
english: I won't be speaking with you until you apologize to me.
glossary: to speak with sb/to apologize to sb
translation: I won't talk to you until you apologize to me.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Jaką zabawkę chcesz dostać na urodziny?
english: What toy would you like to get for your birthday?
glossary: to get sth for your birthday/a toy
translation: What toy do you want for your birthday?

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Nie zapomniałbyś o spotkaniu, gdybyś dodała je do swojego kalendarza.
english: You wouldn't have forgotten about the meeting if you had added it to your calendar.
glossary: to forget about sth/a meeting/to add sth to your calendar
translation: You wouldn’t have forgotten about the meeting if you had added it to your calendar.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Niełatwo było mi namówić żonę na wzięcie kilku dni wolnego.
english: It wasn't easy for me to persuade my wife to take a few days off.
glossary: to persuade sb to do sth/a day off
translation: It was hard for me to convince my wife to take a few days off.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Nie będziesz grał w żadne gry, dopóki nie posprzątasz.
english: I won't be playing any games until you clean up.
glossary: to play games/to clean sth up
translation: You won't play any games until you clean.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Nie będę taki przepracowany, kiedy skończy się sezon.
english: I won't be this overworked when this season ends.
glossary: to be overworked/to end
translation: I won't be so overworked when the season end.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Dlaczego nalegasz? Wiesz, że się nie zgodzę.
english: Why are you insisting? You know I won't agree.
glossary: to insist/to agree
translation: Why do you insist? You know I disagree.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Trudno nam będzie to zmierzyć, bo nie mamy odpowiednich narzędzi.
english: It'll be hard for us to measure it, because we don't have the right tools.
glossary: to measure sth/to have the right tools
translation: It will be difficult to measure, because we don’t have the right tools.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Nie będziesz zadowolona, kiedy przeczytasz tę wiadomość.
english: You won't be happy when you read the message.
glossary: to be happy/to read a message
translation: You won’t be happy when you read this message.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Gdzie planujecie jechać tym razem?
english: Where are you planning to go this time?
glossary: to plan to go somewhere
translation: Where are you planning to go this time.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Widzę, że trudno ci utrzymać kontakt wzrokowy.
english: I see that it's hard for you to keep eye contact.
glossary: to keep eye contact
translation: I see it is hard to you to keep eye contact.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Gdybym ja tu rządziła, mielibyśmy rozsądne godziny pracy.
english: If I ruled here, we'd have more reasonable working hours.
glossary: to rule/to be reasonable/working hours
translation: If I was in charge, we'd have reasonable working hours.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Wasze akcje marketingowe będą bardziej wydajne, kiedy zrozumiecie swoją grupę docelową.
english: Your marketing actions will be more efficient when you understand your target audience.
glossary: to be efficient/marketing actions/a target audience
translation: Your marketing actions will be more effective when you understand your target group.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Jakiego rozwiązania szukasz? Może będę w stanie ci pomóc.
english: What solution are you looking for? Maybe I'll be able to help.
glossary: a solution for sth/to be able to help
translation: What kind of solution are you looking for. Maybe I'll be able to help you.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Łatwo ci to mówić, bo nie masz dzieci.
english: It's easy for you to say this because you don't have kids.
glossary: to have kids
translation: It’s easy for you to tell this because you don't have children.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Nie musiałbym tu teraz siedzieć, gdybym złożył wypowiedzenie na koniec miesiąca.
english: I wouldn't have to sit here now if I had given my notice at the end of the month.
glossary: to sit/to give notice
translation: You wouldn't have to sit here now if I give notice in the end off the month.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Niełatwo nam zrobić wrażenie na naszej szefowej.
english: It's not easy for us to make a good impression on our boss.
glossary: to make a good impression on sb/a boss
translation: It's not easy for us to impress our new boss.

name: Margaret Morgan
polish: Kiedy będziesz mieć czas, wytłumaczysz mi, jak to działa?
english: When you have time, will you explain to me how it works?
glossary: to explain sth to sb
translation: When will you have time to explain to me how it works?

name: Anna Forney
polish: Jest wiele problemów, które nasz zespół musi rozwiązać.
english: There are many problems our team has to solve.
glossary: to solve a problem
translation: 1. There are many problems that our team has to solve.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Gdzie koncertujecie w weekend?
english: Where are you giving a concert on the weekend?
glossary: to give a concert
translation: 2. Where are you giving a concert on the weekend?

name: Anna Forney
polish: Czy twój mąż często pracuje po godzinach?
english: Does your husband often work overtime?
glossary: to work overtime/a husband
translation: 3. Does your husband often work overtime?

name: Anna Forney
polish: Jestem pewien, że wkrótce wyzdrowiejesz.
english: I'm sure you'll get better soon.
glossary: to get better/soon
translation: 4. I’m sure you’ll get better soon.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Czy to się często zdarza?
english: Does it often happen?
glossary: to happen
translation: 5. Does this happen often?

name: Anna Forney
polish: Kiedy zapisałeś się na wykłady?
english: When did you sign up for the lectures?
glossary: to sign up for sth/a lecture
translation: 6. When did you sign up for the lectures?

name: Anna Forney
polish: Kiedy zrezygnowałeś ze szkolenia?
english: When did you resign from the training course?
glossary: to resign from sth/a training course
translation: 7. When did you resign from the training course?

name: Anna Forney
polish: Czy twój komputer działa poprawnie?
english: Does your computer work properly?
glossary: to work properly/a computer
translation: 8. Is your computer working properly?

name: Anna Forney
polish: Zadzwoniłem do rodziców, kiedy dostałem nagrodę.
english: I called my parents when I got the award.
glossary: to call your parents/to get an award
translation: 9. I called my parents when I got an award.

name: Anna Forney
polish: Musimy działać. Masz jakiś pomysł?
english: We have to act. Do you have any idea?
glossary: to act/to have an idea
translation: 10. We have to act. Do you have any idea?

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Nie musisz mieć wyrzutów sumienia.
english: You don't need to have remorse.
glossary: to have remorse
translation: You don't have to feel remorse.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Zerzygałam się na ostatniej imprezie. Żenada.
english: I threw up at the last party. Pathetic.
glossary: to throw up/at the party/to be pathetic
translation: I threw up at the last event. Embarrassment.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Obiecuję, że następnym razem będę się lepiej zachowywał.
english: I promise I'll behave better next time.
glossary: to behave/next time/to promise sb sth; to promise sth to sb
translation: I promise to behave better next time.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Nie możesz się tak gapić na ludzi.
english: You can't stare at people like that.
glossary: to stare at sb
translation: You can't stare at people like that.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Wczoraj lekarz przepisał mi leki przeciwbólowe.
english: The doctor prescribed me painkillers yesterday.
glossary: a doctor/to prescribe sb painkillers
translation: The doctor prescribed me painkillers yesterday.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: W przyszłym roku kończę studia. Nie mogę się doczekać.
english: I'm graduating from college next year. I can't wait.
glossary: to graduate from college/can't wait
translation: I'll be graduating next year. I'm really looking forward to it.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Powinnaś mnie lepiej traktować.
english: You should treat me better.
glossary: to treat sb well
translation: You should treat me better.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Dziś wieczorem nie ćwiczę. Muszę odpocząć.
english: I'm not working out tonight. I have to rest.
glossary: to work out/to rest
translation: I'm not working out tonight.  I need to rest.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Musisz przyznać, że mam rację.
english: You have to admit that I'm right.
glossary: to admit sth/to be right
translation: You have to admit that I'm right.

name: Lucas Doe
polish: Jestem pewien, że się pojawię na imprezie.
english: I'm sure I'll show up at the party.
glossary: to be sure about sth/to show up/at the party/I'm sure that.../to show up at the party
translation: I'm sure I'll show up at the party.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Dlaczego utrudniasz mi życie? Czy nie powinniśmy sobie pomagać?
english: Why are you making my life harder? Shouldn't we help each other?
glossary: to make sb's life harder/to help each other
translation: 1.	Why are you making my life difficult? Shouldn’t we help each other?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Wkurzyłeś mnie rano. Myślałem, że wyrzucę cię z domu.
english: You made me mad in the morning. I thought I'd throw you out of the house.
glossary: to make sb mad/to throw sb out of the house
translation: 2.	You pissed me off in the morning. I thought I would throw you out of my house.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Moi rodzice zmusili mnie do chodzenia na treningi piłkarskie, kiedy byłem dzieckiem. Dlatego teraz tego nienawidzę.
english: My parents made me go to soccer practice when I was a kid. That's why I hate it now.
glossary: to make sb do sth/to go to soccer practice
translation: 3.	My parents forced me to attending the soccer trainings when I was young. That’s why I hate it now.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Jak długo próbujesz usunąć tę plamę? Czy myślisz, że zejdzie?
english: How long have you been trying to remove the stain? Do you think it will come out?
glossary: to remove a stain/to come out
translation: 4.	How long have you been trying to remove the stain? Do you think it will go away?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Z czego zazwyczaj śmieje się twoja córka?
english: What does your daughter usually laugh at?
glossary: to laugh at sth
translation: 5.	What does your daughter usually laugh at?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Jak rzeczniczka skomentowała incydent?
english: How did the spokeswoman comment on the incident?
glossary: a spokeswoman/to comment on sth/an incident
translation: 6.	What did the spokeswoman comment the incident?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Kierownik zmusił mnie do podpisania dokumentów.
english: The director made me sign the documents.
glossary: to make sb do sth/a director
translation: 7.	The manager forced me to sign the documents.

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Miałeś skomentować mój post. Zapomniałeś?
english: You were supposed to comment on my post. Did you forget?
glossary: to comment on sth/to forget about sth
translation: 8.	You were supposed to comment my post. Did you forget?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Jakie środki podjął rząd, aby zapobiec epidemii?
english: What measures did the government take to prevent the epidemic?
glossary: to take measures to do sth/to prevent sth
translation: 9.	What sources did the government take to prevent the epidemic?

name: Adam Hunt
polish: Zawsze się lenisz. Zabieraj swój tyłek do pracy!
english: You're always lazing around. Get your ass to work!
glossary: to laze around/to get your ass to work
translation: 10.	You’re always being lazy. Get your ass down to work!

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Składając wniosek, pamiętaj, żeby go podpisać.
english: Filing an application, remember to sign it.
glossary: to file an application/to sign an application
translation: 1. When submiting an application, remember to sign it.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Czy ma pan odpowiednie umiejętności, żeby wykonywać tę pracę?
english: Do you have the necessary skills to do the job?
glossary: to have the necessary skills/to do a job
translation: 2. Do you have right skills to do the job?

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Zawsze chciałem pracować z ludźmi.
english: I've always wanted to work with people.
glossary: to work with people
translation: 3. I've always wanted to work with people.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Gdybyś oszczędzał wodę, zmniejszyłbyś swoje miesięczne rachunki.
english: If you saved water, you'd lower your monthly bills.
glossary: to save water/to lower your bills
translation: 4. If you saved water you'd reduce your bills.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Nie możesz dzwonić do mnie w nocy, oczekując, że odbiorę.
english: You can't call me at night expecting that I'll pick up the phone.
glossary: to call sb/at night/to expect sb to do sth
translation: 5. You can't call me at night and expecting that I answear.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Nie chcę, żeby utrzymywali mnie rodzice.
english: I don't want my parents to provide for me.
glossary: to provide for sb
translation: 6. I don't want live off my parents.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Zawsze ci mówiłem, żebyś zaczęła oszczędzać pieniądze.
english: I've always told you to start saving money.
glossary: to save money/to start to do sth; to start doing sth
translation: 7. I've always told you to start saving money.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Moja córka nie zaczęłaby palić, gdyby nie była pod presją rówieśników.
english: My daughter wouldn't have started to smoke if she hadn't been under peer pressure.
glossary: to smoke/to be under peer pressure
translation: 8. My daughter wouldn't have started smoking if she hadn't been peers uder pressure.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Aplikowałem już na kilka stanowisk, ale nikt jeszcze do mnie nie zadzwonił.
english: I've already applied for a few positions, but no one has called me yet.
glossary: to apply for a position/to call sb
translation: 9. I've applied for several positions, but no one has called me yet.

name: Michael Stewart
polish: Przeczytałem dziś rano wszystkie mejle, pijąc kawę.
english: I read all my emails today, drinking coffee.
glossary: to read emails/to drink coffee
translation: 10. I read all the emails this morning while drinking coffee.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Nie musielibyśmy przekładać spotkań, gdyby szef się częściej pojawiał w pracy.
english: We wouldn't have to put off meetings if the boss showed up at work more often.
glossary: to show up at work/to put off a meeting/a boss
translation: 1. We wouldn’t have put off meetings if the boss had shown up more often at work.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Wrócisz do więzienia, jeśli będziesz zamieszany w narkotyki.
english: You'll go back to jail if you're mixed up in drugs.
glossary: to be mixed up in sth/to be mixed up in drugs/to go back to jail
translation: 2. You’ll get back to jail if you are mixed up in drugs.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Kiedyś z każdym wchodziłem w konflikt, bo byłem głupi.
english: I used to come into conflict with everybody because I was stupid.
glossary: to be stupid/to come into conflict with sb
translation: 3. I used to join the fray with everyone because I was stupid.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Przestępca trafił do szpitala po tym, jak postrzeliła go policja.
english: The criminal ended up in the hospital after the police had shot him.
glossary: to shoot sb/the police/a criminal/to end up in the hospital
translation: 4. The criminal ended up in the hospital after the police had shot him up.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Od dawna mnie wkurzasz. To koniec.
english: You've been pissing me off for a long time. It's over.
glossary: to piss sb off/to be over
translation: 5. You pissed me off for a long time. It’s the end.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Wykonałem jak dotąd dwa z trzech zadań.
english: I've carried out two out of three tasks so far.
glossary: so far/to carry out a task/one out of two
translation: 6. I have carried two tasks out of three so far.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Kiedy wychodziłem z biura, zadzwonił do mnie klient i odwołał spotkanie.
english: When I was leaving the office, my client called me and called off the meeting.
glossary: to call off a meeting/to call sb/to leave the office
translation: 7. When I was leaving the office my client called me and canceled the meeting.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Przyzwyczaiłem się już do zagadywania do dziewczyn.
english: I've already gotten used to chatting up girls.
glossary: to chat sb up/a girl/to get used to doing sth
translation: 8. I got used to chatting up girls.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Policja nie zastrzeliłaby podejrzanego, gdyby nie wyjął broni.
english: The police wouldn't have shot down the suspect if he hadn't pulled out a gun.
glossary: to pull out a gun/to shoot sb down/the police
translation: 9. The police wouldn’t have shot down the suspect if he hadn’t pulled a gun out.

name: Martin Hale
polish: Myślę o odrzuceniu zaproszenia na ten ślub. Jakie jest twoje zdanie?
english: I'm thinking about turning down the invitation to the wedding. What's your opinion?
glossary: to turn down an invitation to the wedding/an opinion/to think about sth
translation: 10. I think about turning down the invitation for the wedding. What’s your opinion?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Nie oblałbym testu na prawo jazdy, gdybym nie próbował wyprzedzać innego auta.
english: I wouldn't have failed the driving test if I hadn't tried to overtake a different car.
glossary: to overtake a car/to fail a driving test
translation: You wouldn't have failed the driving license if you hadn't overtaken a car.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Będziesz zdrowszy, jeśli rzucisz palenie.
english: You'll be healthier if you quit smoking.
glossary: to quit smoking/to be healthy
translation: You'll be healthier if you give up smoking.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Jakie są kierunki na tej uczelni?
english: What programs are there at the university?
glossary: a program/at the university
translation: What programmes are there in your university?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Dzięki za upieczenie ciasta na moją imprezę urodzinową.
english: Thanks for baking the cake for my birthday party.
glossary: to bake a cake/Thanks for sth/a birthday party
translation: Thanks for baking the cake for my birthday party.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Możesz dalej spać. Nie dzwonił jeszcze budzik.
english: You can keep sleeping. The alarm hasn't gone off yet.
glossary: to go off {2}/to keep doing sth
translation: You can sleep further. The alarm hadn't gone off yet.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Zaspałem wczoraj do pracy, bo budzik nie zadzwonił.
english: I overslept for work yesterday because the alarm hadn't gone off.
glossary: to go off {2}/to oversleep for work/an alarm
translation: I was fast asleep yesterday because the alarm didn't go off.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Byłbyś w formie, gdybyś zaczął uprawiać jakiś sport.
english: You'd be fit if you took up a sport.
glossary: to be fit; to be in shape/to take up a sport
translation: I'd be in shape if you take up a sport.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Kogo zaprosiłaś na ostatnią imprezę?
english: Who did you invite to the last party?
glossary: to invite sb to a party
translation: Who did you invite for the last party?

name: Anna Patton
polish: Rzecznik policji potwierdził, że złodziej został zatrzymany.
english: A police spokesperson confirmed that the thief had been detained.
glossary: a police spokesperson/to confirm sth/a thief/to detain sb
translation: The spokesperson confirmed that the thief had been arrested.

name: Anna Patton
polish: Nad czym pracujesz?
english: What are you working on?
glossary: to work on sth
translation: What are you working on?

name: Damien Bean
polish: Dlaczego nie skończyłeś ostatniego projektu?
english: Why didn't you finish the last project?
glossary: to finish a project
translation: 1.	Why didn’t you finish the last project?

name: Damien Bean
polish: O której wracasz? Chcesz, żebym zrobił kolację?
english: What time are you coming back? Do you want me to make dinner?
glossary: to come back/to want sb to do sth/to make dinner
translation: 2.	What time do you come back? Do you want me to make dinner?

name: Damien Bean
polish: Jak zwykle dojeżdżasz do pracy?
english: How do you usually get to work?
glossary: to get to work
translation: 3.	How do you usually get to work?

name: Damien Bean
polish: Jestem pewna, że kiedyś mnie zrozumiesz.
english: I'm sure you'll understand me one day.
glossary: to understand sb/one day
translation: 4.	I’m sure that you’ll undestand me some day.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Gdzie spędziłeś ostatnią noc?
english: Where did you spend your last night?
glossary: to spend your night with sb
translation: 5.	When did you spend last night?

name: Damien Bean
polish: Zapisałem się w zeszłym tygodniu na zajęcia z hiszpańskiego.
english: I signed up for Spanish classes last week.
glossary: to sign up for Spanish classes/last week
translation: 6.	I signed up for Spanish classes last week.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Gdzie zwykle parkujesz samochód?
english: Where do you usually park your car?
glossary: to park your car
translation: 7.	Where do you usually park your car?

name: Damien Bean
polish: Są rzeczy, których nie mogę ci powiedzieć.
english: There are things I can't tell you.
glossary: to tell sb sth
translation: 8.	There are things that I can’t tell you.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Czy to ma sens?
english: Does it make sense?
glossary: to make sense
translation: 9.	Does it make sense?

name: Damien Bean
polish: Dlaczego nie było cię wczoraj na zajęciach?
english: Why did you skip classes yesterday?
glossary: to skip classes
translation: 10.	Why weren’t you in class yesterday?

name: Damien Bean
polish: Musimy pozbyć się dowodów.
english: We have to get rid of the evidence.
glossary: to get rid of sth/evidence
translation: 1.	We have to get rid of evidence.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Chciałem wyjaśnić Ci sytuację, ale Ty nie chciałeś mnie słuchać.
english: I wanted to explain the situation to you, but you didn't want to listen to me.
glossary: to explain the situation to sb/to listen to sb
translation: 2.	I wanted to explain you the situation but you didn’t want to listen to me.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Powinieneś założyć kurtkę, bo jest zimno.
english: You should put on a jacket because it's cold.
glossary: to put on a jacket/cold
translation: 3.	You should put on a jacket because it’s cold.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Powinienem zaoszczędzić trochę pieniędzy, jeśli chcę kupić nowy komputer.
english: I should save some money if I want to buy a new computer.
glossary: to save some money/to buy a computer/a new computer
translation: 4.	I should save some money If I want to buy a new computer.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Nie chcę dzisiaj nic robić. Chcę odpocząć.
english: I want to do nothing today. I want to take a rest.
glossary: to do nothing/today/to take a rest
translation: 5.	I don’t want to do anything today. I want to rest.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Chciałem pouczyć się do testu, ale nie mogłem się skupić.
english: I wanted to study for a test, but I couldn't focus.
glossary: to study for a test/to focus on sth
translation: 6.	I wanted to study for a test but I couldn’t focus on it.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Możemy iść na spacer, ale najpierw musimy zjeść obiad.
english: We can go for a walk, but we have to eat lunch first.
glossary: to go for a walk/to eat lunch/first
translation: 7.	We can go for a walk but first we have to eat lunch.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Chcę jechać do centrum, żeby spotkać się ze znajomymi.
english: I want to go downtown to meet my friends.
glossary: to go downtown/to meet your friends
translation: 8.	I want to go downtown to meet my friends.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Idę dzisiaj na imprezę. Muszę zrobić sobie włosy.
english: I'm going to a party today. I have to do my hair.
glossary: to go to a party/to do your hair/today
translation: 9.	I’m going at the party today. I’ve to make my hair.

name: Damien Bean
polish: Musisz dzisiaj zapłacić rachunki.
english: You have to pay the bills today.
glossary: to pay the bills/today
translation: 10.	You have to pay for your bills today.

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Masz czas, żeby porozmawiać?
english: Do you have time to talk?
glossary: to talk/to have time
translation: 1. Do you have time to talk?

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Gdzie gracie jutro mecz?
english: Where are you playing the match tomorrow?
glossary: to play a match
translation: 2. Where will you play a match tomorrow?

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Spotykamy się w weekend?
english: Are we meeting on the weekend?
glossary: to meet/on the weekend
translation: 3. Will we meet on the weekend?

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Jest wiele opcji, które możesz wybrać.
english: There are many options you can choose.
glossary: an option/to choose an option
translation: 4. There’s many options which you can choose?

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Dlaczego ty śpisz? Jest tyle do zrobienia.
english: Why are you sleeping? There's so much to do.
glossary: to sleep
translation: 5. Why are you sleep? There’s a lot of things to do

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Miałem wczoraj kaca.
english: I had a hangover yesterday.
glossary: to have a hangover
translation: 6. I had a handover yesterday

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Myślę, że zostanę dzisiaj w domu.
english: I think I'll stay at home today.
glossary: to stay at home
translation: 7. I think, I’ll stay at home tomorrow

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Kiedy zmieniłeś zdanie?
english: When did you change your mind?
glossary: to change your mind
translation: 8. When did you change your mind?

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Co planujesz jutro robić?
english: What are you planning to do tomorrow?
glossary: to plan to do sth
translation: 9. What are you planning tomorrow ?

name: Monica Grimm
polish: Często byłem nawalony, kiedy byłem młodszy.
english: I was often wasted when I was younger.
glossary: to be wasted/...when I was younger
translation: 10. I was wasted often when I was younger

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Nie chcę, żebyś na mnie czekał.
english: I don't want you to wait for me.
glossary: to wait for sb
translation: 1. I don’t want you to wait for me.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Chcę, żebyś wiedziała, że mi na tobie zależy.
english: I want you to know that I care about you.
glossary: to know sth/to care about sb
translation: 2. I’d like you to know I care about you.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Nie chcę, żebyś kiedykolwiek jeszcze rozpowiadała plotki na mój temat.
english: I don't want you to spread rumors about me anymore.
glossary: to spread rumors about sb
translation: 3. I don’t want you to never spread rumors about me.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Byłam w szoku, kiedy córka weszła do pokoju, płacząc.
english: I was in shock when my daughter came into the room crying.
glossary: to be in shock/to come into the room/to cry
translation: 4. I was in shock when my daughter came to the room crying.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Gdyby nasza firma nie zwiększyła swojej produktywności w zeszłym kwartale, zbankrutowałaby.
english: If our company hadn't increased its productivity last quarter, it would've gone bankrupt.
glossary: to increase your productivity/last quarter/to go bankrupt
translation: 5. If our company hadn’t improved its productivity, it would have been a bancrupt.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Nie miałem wczoraj żadnej przerwy, bo było tyle do zrobienia.
english: I didn't have any break yesterday because there was so much to do.
glossary: to have a break
translation: 6. I didn’t have any break yesterday because there were so much to do.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Rodzice chcą, żebym się wreszcie wyprowadził.
english: My parents want me to finally move out.
glossary: to move out/to finally do sth
translation: 7. My parents want me to move out of their house.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Skontaktowałem się jak dotąd z dziesięcioma klientami. Zostało kolejnych dziesięciu.
english: I've contacted ten clients so far. There are another ten left.
glossary: to contact a client/so far
translation: 8. I have been contacted with ten clients so far. There were ten more.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Udało mi się wczoraj skończyć wszystkie zadania, bo nie miałem żadnych spotkań.
english: I managed to complete all the tasks yesterday because I didn't have any meetings.
glossary: to manage to do sth/to complete a task/to have a meeting
translation: 9. I had been finishing all the meetings yesterday because I didn’t have any meetings.

name: Margaret Ford
polish: Twój syn miałby lepsze oceny, gdy ciągle nie oglądał bajek.
english: Your son would have better grades if he didn't watch cartoons all the time.
glossary: to have good grades/to watch cartoons/all the time
translation: 10. Your son would have better appraisals if he hadn’t been watching cartoons all the time.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Pobraliśmy już próbki krwi i jesteśmy gotowi, żeby je zbadać.
english: We've already taken blood samples and we're ready to examine them.
glossary: to take blood samples/to examine samples
translation: We already took blood samples, and we are ready to examine them.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Ta sytuacja nie wywarła na mnie żadnego wpływu.
english: The situation didn't have any influence on me.
glossary: to have no influence on sb/a situation
translation: The situation didn't have any impact on me.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie mam dostępu do pliku. Możesz to sprawdzić?
english: I don't have access to the file. Can you check that?
glossary: to have access to a file/to check sth
translation: I don’t have access to the file. Can you check it?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nasz syn nie pobiłby rekordu szkoły, gdyby pan go nie wspierał.
english: Our son wouldn't have beaten the school record if you hadn't supported him.
glossary: to beat the school record/to beat the record/to support sb
translation: Our son wouldn’t have broken the school record if you hadn’t supported him.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie miałeś prawa, żeby przeglądać mój telefon.
english: You didn't have the right to look through my phone.
glossary: to have the right to do sth/to look through sb's phone
translation: You didn’t have the right to throw away my phone.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Włóż zupę do lodówki. Nie chcesz, żeby się popsuła.
english: Put the soup in the fridge. You don't want it to go bad.
glossary: soup/to put sth in the fridge/to go bad
translation: Put the soup in the fridge. You don’t want it to go bad.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie musiałbym teraz zwracać tych butów, gdyby na mnie pasowały.
english: I wouldn't have to return the shoes now if they fit me.
glossary: to return a product/shoes/to fit sb
translation: I wouldn’t have to return the shoes if they fit me.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Dlaczego włączyłeś wczoraj muzykę, wiedząc, że śpię?
english: Why did you turn on the music yesterday knowing that I was asleep?
glossary: to turn on the music/to know sth/to be asleep
translation: Why did you turn on the music yesterday knowing I slept?

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie zamieniłem wczoraj z rodzicami ani słowa, bo nie miałem czasu.
english: I didn't have a word with my parents yesterday because I didn't have time.
glossary: to have a word with sb/to have time
translation: I didn’t have a word with my parents because I didn’t have time.

name: Anette Gray
polish: Nie chciałbym, żeby zarząd zrobił się podejrzliwy.
english: I wouldn't like the management board to get suspicious.
glossary: the management board/to get suspicious
translation: I didn't want the management board to become suspicious.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Nie chcę, żebyś na mnie czekał.
english: I don't want you to wait for me.
glossary: to wait for sb
translation: 1. Nie chcę, żebyś na mnie czekał. I don't want to that you are waiting for me.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Chcę, żebyś wiedziała, że mi na tobie zależy.
english: I want you to know that I care about you.
glossary: to know sth/to care about sb
translation: 2. Chcę, żebyś wiedziała, że mi na tobie zależy. I want you to know that I care about you.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Nie chcę, żebyś kiedykolwiek jeszcze rozpowiadała plotki na mój temat.
english: I don't want you to spread rumors about me anymore.
glossary: to spread rumors about sb
translation: 3. Nie chcę, żebyś kiedykolwiek jeszcze rozpowiadała plotki na mój temat. I don't want that you spreed gossip about me anytime.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Byłam w szoku, kiedy córka weszła do pokoju, płacząc.
english: I was in shock when my daughter came into the room crying.
glossary: to be in shock/to come into the room/to cry
translation: 4. Byłam w szoku, kiedy córka weszła do pokoju, płacząc. I was shocked when my duoghter came to the room ane she was crying.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Gdyby nasza firma nie zwiększyła swojej produktywności w zeszłym kwartale, zbankrutowałaby.
english: If our company hadn't increased its productivity last quarter, it would've gone bankrupt.
glossary: to increase your productivity/last quarter/to go bankrupt
translation: 5. Gdyby nasza firma nie zwiększyła swojej produktywności w zeszłym kwartale, zbankrutowałaby. If our company didn't increse productivity in the las quater we would go bancrupt.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Nie miałem wczoraj żadnej przerwy, bo było tyle do zrobienia.
english: I didn't have any break yesterday because there was so much to do.
glossary: to have a break
translation: 6. Nie miałem wczoraj żadnej przerwy, bo było tyle do zrobienia. I didn't have a break yesterday because there was so many to do.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Rodzice chcą, żebym się wreszcie wyprowadził.
english: My parents want me to finally move out.
glossary: to move out/to finally do sth
translation: 7. Rodzice chcą, żebym się wreszcie wyprowadził. My parents want me to move out finally.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Skontaktowałem się jak dotąd z dziesięcioma klientami. Zostało kolejnych dziesięciu.
english: I've contacted ten clients so far. There are another ten left.
glossary: to contact a client/so far
translation: 8. Skontaktowałem się jak dotąd z dziesięcioma klientami. Zostało kolejnych dziesięciu. I conntacted already with ten clients. Ten left to contact.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Udało mi się wczoraj skończyć wszystkie zadania, bo nie miałem żadnych spotkań.
english: I managed to complete all the tasks yesterday because I didn't have any meetings.
glossary: to manage to do sth/to complete a task/to have a meeting
translation: 9. Udało mi się wczoraj skończyć wszystkie zadania, bo nie miałem żadnych spotkań. I finished all my tasks yesterday because I didn't have any meetings.

name: Matt Carpenter
polish: Twój syn miałby lepsze oceny, gdy ciągle nie oglądał bajek.
english: Your son would have better grades if he didn't watch cartoons all the time.
glossary: to have good grades/to watch cartoons/all the time
translation: 10. Twój syn miałby lepsze oceny, gdy ciągle nie oglądał bajek. Your son would have better grades if he didn't watch cartons all the time.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Nie odkryłem jeszcze swojego powołania.
english: I haven't found my vocation yet.
glossary: to find your vocation
translation: 1. I have not yet discovered my vocation.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Nie musiałbyś teraz płacić za to badanie, gdybyś miał ubezpieczenie.
english: You wouldn't have to pay for the examination now if you had insurance.
glossary: to have insurance/to pay for sth/an examination
translation: 2. You wouldn't have to pay for this test now if you had insurance.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Zauważyłem wczoraj, że sąsiedzi kupili nowy samochód.
english: I noticed yesterday that my neighbors had bought a new car.
glossary: to buy a new car/to notice sth/a neighbor
translation: 3. I noticed yesterday that the neighbors bought a new car.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Do kogo należy ta komórka?
english: Who does the cell belong to?
glossary: to belong to sb/a cell phone
translation: 4. Who does this cell phone belong to?

name: Eve Miles
polish: Kiedy postanowiłeś, że będziesz mieszkał za granicą?
english: When did you decide you'd live abroad?
glossary: to decide that.../to live abroad
translation: 5. When did you decide to live abroad?

name: Eve Miles
polish: Mama będzie zła, jeśli nie posprzątam pokoju.
english: My mom will be mad if I don't clean up my room.
glossary: to clean up your room/to be mad at sb/a mom
translation: 6. Mom will be angry if I don't clean my room.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Wyszedłem już ze sklepu, kiedy zadzwoniłaś.
english: I'd already left the store when you called me.
glossary: to call sb/a store/to leave a store
translation: 7. I had already left the store when you called.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Ile osadzonych jest obecnie w tym więzieniu?
english: How many inmates are there currently in the jail?
glossary: a jail; a prison/an inmate/currently
translation: 8. How many inmates are currently in this prison?

name: Eve Miles
polish: Wujek by nie utonął, gdyby nagle nie dostał skurczu.
english: My uncle wouldn't have drowned if he hadn't suddenly gotten a cramp.
glossary: to get a cramp/to drown/suddenly/an uncle
translation: 9. Uncle wouldn't have drowned if he hadn't suddenly got a cramp.

name: Eve Miles
polish: Dzięki za skończenie zadania na czas.
